word.name: words
word.lx: lx

word.name: a.m.
word.mean:
上午
abbr. (ante meridiem的缩写)上午,午前
ad. 上午,由午夜至中午

word.name: abacus
word.lx: I can use abacus skillfully./r/n 我会熟练地打算盘。/r/n The clerk reckoned the expenditure last week with an abacus./r/n 那位职员用算盘将上周的花销计算出来。/r/n

word.name: abandon
word.lx: The cruel man abandoned his wife and child./r/n 那个狠心的男人抛弃了他的妻儿。/r/n They had abandoned all hope./r/n 他们已经放弃了一切希望。/r/n

word.name: abatement
word.lx: A noise abatement notice is served on the club./r/n 向俱乐部发停止大声喧哗的通知。/r/n

word.name: ABC
word.mean:
n. 基本要素,字母表
abbr. 美国广播公司
abbr. 澳大利亚广播公司

word.name: abdomen
word.lx: The spider has a bulgy abdomen./r/n 蜘蛛长着凸出的腹部。/r/n He always feels pain in his abdomen./r/n 他的腹部经常疼痛。/r/n

word.name: able
word.lx: He is an able man./r/n 他是一个能人。/r/n As I had plenty of money I was able to help her./r/n 我钱很宽裕，能帮助她。/r/n

word.name: abnormal
word.mean: a. 反常的,不正常的,不规则的
word.lx: The weather is abnormal this year./r/n 今年的气候不正常。/r/n An abnormal fear of high places./r/n 恐高症对于高处的一种不正常的恐惧/r/n

word.name: abolish
word.lx:
Abraham Lincoln abolished slavery in the United States.
亚伯拉罕·林肯在美国废除了奴隶制/n There are many bad customs and laws that ought to be abolished 有许多不良的习俗和法规应予以废

word.name: abort
word.lx: Some suspicious looking men were loitering abort near the house/r/n 几个形迹可疑的人在屋子附近荡来荡去。/r/n An aborted organism./r/n 流产的生物体/r/n

word.name: abortion
word.lx: Abortion is illegal in this country./r/n 人工流产在这个国家是不合法的。/r/n They are discussing the morality of abortion./r/n 他们正在讨论堕胎的道德性。/r/n

word.name: abound
word.lx: Tropical plants abound in the jungle. 丛林中有大量的热带植物。 He abounds in courage. 他很有胆量。

word.name: above
word.mean:
a. 上面的
ad. 在上面
n. 上面
prep. 在...上面
word.lx: The sun rose above the horizon./r/n 太阳升到地平线上。/r/n My bedroom is just above./r/n 我的卧室就在上面。/r/n

word.name: aboveboard
word.mean:
ad. 光明正大地,率直地
a. 光明正大的,率直的

word.name: abrasion
word.mean: n. 磨减,磨损,磨损之处

word.name: abrasive
word.mean:
n. 研磨剂
a. 磨平的

word.name: abridge
word.lx: It was abridged from the original work./r/n 这是原书的节录本。/r/n This is an abridged edition of war and peace"./r/n 这是“战争与和平”的节略版。/r/n"

word.name: abroad
word.mean:
a. 在国外,海外(一般作表语)
ad. 到国外,在国外
word.lx: He lived abroad for many years./r/n 他在国外居住了许多年。/r/n She is hungry for news of her husband working abroad./r/n 她渴望得到国外工作的丈夫的消息。/r/n

word.name: abrupt
word.lx: That young man has an abrupt manner./r/n 那个年轻人态度很无礼。/r/n The meeting came to an abrupt end./r/n 会议突然结束了。/r/n

word.name: abscess
word.lx: The tip of an abscess, a boil, or a pimple, in which pus forms./r/n 脓头中间有脓液的脓疮、疖或丘疹的顶端/r/n I think I have an abscess on my gums. This could be serious./r/n 我想我的牙床上有个脓疮，这可能是严重的。/r/n

word.name: absence
word.mean:
a. 不在,缺席
n. 缺乏,缺少,缺席
word.lx: Please look after my house during my absence./r/n 我不在时，请帮我看房子。/r/n We must invent an excuse for our absence./r/n 我们必须为缺席编造一个藉口。/r/n

word.name: absent
word.mean:
a. 缺席的
vt. 使缺席
word.lx: How many students are absent today?/r/n 今天有多少学生缺席？/r/n Why was it that he was absent?/r/n 他为什么缺席呢？/r/n

word.name: absentminded
word.mean: a. 心不在焉的,茫然的,恍惚的

word.name: absorb
word.mean: v. 吸收,吸引...的注意,使全神贯注
word.lx: His business absorbs him./r/n 他的业务使他全神贯注。/r/n The clever boy absorbed all the knowledge his teacher could give him./r/n 那个聪明的男孩把他老师所能教他的所有的知识都吸收了。/r/n

word.name: absorption
word.lx: I really appreciate his complete absorption in his work./r/n 我很欣赏他对工作的极端专注。/r/n A medicine or an agent that induces absorption./r/n 吸收剂导致吸收的药品或药剂/r/n

word.name: abstract
word.mean:
n. 摘要
a. 抽象的
v. 摘要,抽炼
word.lx: He has some abstract notion of wanting to change the world./r/n 他有一种要改造世界的空想。/r/n We may talk of beautiful things, but beauty itself is abstract./r/n 我们尽可谈论美的事物，然而美本身却是抽象的。/r/n

word.name: absurd
word.lx: What an absurd suggestion!/r/n 多荒谬的建议啊！/r/n It was absurd of you to suggest such a thing./r/n 你居然建议这样的事，太可笑了。/r/n

word.name: abundance
word.lx: There was an abundance of corn last year./r/n 去年玉米丰收。/r/n The state of being profuse; abundance./r/n 丰富极其丰富的状态；充沛/r/n

word.name: abundant
word.lx: There is abundant firewood in the forest./r/n 森林里有充裕的薪柴可用。/r/n Our abundant resources and stable policy provide foreigners with the advantages they invest here./r/n 我们丰富的资源和稳定的政策为外商投资提供了有利条件。/r/n

word.name: academic
word.mean: a. 学院的,理论的,学术性的
word.lx: The new academic year is coming./r/n 新学年就要来了。/r/n The question is purely academic./r/n 这是一个纯学术性的问题。/r/n

word.name: academy
word.lx: He is a student in an academy of music./r/n 他是一所音乐学院的学生。/r/n A member of an art, literary, or scientific academy or society./r/n 学会会员艺术、文学、科学学会或团体的成员/r/n

word.name: accelerate
word.lx: The car accelerated as it overtook me./r/n 那辆汽车一加速就超越了我./r/n The leader is losing ground as the rest of the runners accelerate./r/n 领先者在其余赛跑者加速时就逐渐失去了优势。/r/n

word.name: accelerator
word.mean: n. 加速者,加速器,油门
word.lx: I pressed the accelerator until the engine screamed./r/n 我猛踩油门踏板，发动机发出了尖利的声音。/r/n The brake (pedal) is between the clutch and the accelerator./r/n 制动器（踏板）在离合器和加速器之间./r/n

word.name: accentuate
word.mean: v. 以重音念,强调,重读
word.lx: The tight jumper only accentuated his fat stomach./r/n 那件紧身套头毛衣反更突出了他那肥胖的肚子./r/n

word.name: accept
word.lx: It is generally accepted that smoking is harmful to our health./r/n 吸烟有害健康，这是大家公认的。/r/n The police are not allowed to accept rewards./r/n 警察是不允许接受酬金的。/r/n

word.name: acceptable
word.mean: a. 合意的,受欢迎的,可接受的
word.lx: The solution to this problem is acceptable./r/n 这个问题的解决方案是可接受的。/r/n Do you think the proposal is acceptable?/r/n 你认为这个建议可接受吗？/r/n

word.name: acceptance
word.mean: n. 接受,容纳,承诺,验证
word.lx: Within two days I received a letter of acceptance from the manager./r/n 不到两天，我就收到了经理写来的录取信。/r/n The proposal was met with general acceptance./r/n 这建议得到普遍的赞同。/r/n

word.name: access
word.mean:
n. 通路,进入,使用之权
v. 存取
word.lx: Citizens may have free access to the library./r/n 市民可以免费使用这个图书馆。/r/n He is a man of easy access./r/n 他是一个很好接近的人。/r/n

word.name: accessible
word.mean: a. 可得到的,易接近的,可进入的
word.lx: A manager should be accessible to his staff./r/n 一个管理人员应该让职员感到平易近人。/r/n This island is accessible only by boat./r/n 这个小岛只能坐小船去。/r/n

word.name: accident
word.lx: We got back without accident./r/n 我们平安无事地回来了。/r/n She was injured badly in the accident./r/n 她在事故中受重伤。/r/n

word.name: accidental
word.lx: Our meeting was quite accidental./r/n 我们的相遇是很偶然的。/r/n A sequence of events that although accidental seems to have been planned or arranged./r/n 巧合，凑巧虽是偶然的，但似乎是经计划或安排的一系列事件/r/n

word.name: acclaim
word.mean:
n. 喝采,欢呼,赞同
v. 欢呼,喝采,称赞

word.name: accommodate
word.lx: The cottage could accommodate up to five people./r/n 这间小屋最多能容纳5个人。/r/n The bank is accommodating its customers more than it used to./r/n 这家银行现在给客户贷款比以前多了。/r/n

word.name: accompany
word.lx: The text is accompanied by illustration./r/n 正文附有插图。/r/n Lightning usually accompanies thunder./r/n 闪电通常伴有雷声。/r/n

word.name: accomplish
word.lx: The prediction was literally accomplished./r/n 这个预言确实实现了。/r/n I have accomplished a great deal in the last few months./r/n 在过去几个月里，我完成了相当多的工作。/r/n

word.name: accord
word.mean:
n. 一致,调和,协议，自愿
vi. (与)一致（accord with）
vt.使一致，调解；给予，赠予
word.lx: He was accorded a warm welcome./r/n 他受到热烈的欢迎。/r/n He joined the army of his own accord./r/n 他自愿参军。/r/n

word.name: accordance
word.lx: I sold the house in accordance with your orders./r/n 我按照你的指示售出了这所房子。/r/n The mayor must make policies in accordance with the bill passed in the Congress./r/n 市长要根据议会的议案来制定政策。/r/n

word.name: according
word.lx: According to these figures, our company is doing well./r/n 从这些数字来看，我们的公司经营得不错。/r/n The books in the library were distributed according to subjects./r/n 图书馆里的藏书按科目分类。/r/n

word.name: accordingly
word.mean: ad. 因此,于是,如前所说 照着 相应地
word.lx: I have told you the circumstances, so you must act accordingly./r/n 我已将情况告诉你，所以你必须酌情处理。/r/n He was asked to leave the city and accordingly he went./r/n 有人叫他离开该城市，所以他就走了。/r/n

word.name: account
word.mean:
n. 帐目,报告,估计
v. 叙述,解释
n. 利益,好处
word.lx: I have an account with Midland Bank./r/n 我在米德兰银行开有户头。/r/n He has been asked to account for his conduct./r/n 他被要求解释他的行为。/r/n

word.name: accountant
word.lx: She was defrauded of her money by a dishonest accountant./r/n 她的钱被一个奸诈的会计骗去了。/r/n He was deep in conversation with his accountant./r/n 他与会计深入交谈./r/n

word.name: accuracy
word.lx: It is impossible to say with any accuracy how many are affected./r/n 无论如何也说不准受影响的有多少。/r/n I can predict something with great accuracy./r/n 我能很准确地预测某事。/r/n

word.name: accurate
word.lx: His report of the event was accurate in every detail./r/n 他对事件的报道，其全部细节都是准确的。/r/n Is the station clock accurate?/r/n 火车站的表准吗？/r/n

word.name: accurately
word.mean:
a. 准确地
ad. 精确地,准确地
word.lx: He can speak English fluently and accurately./r/n 他能准确流利地说英语。/r/n The engineer in particular must be able to communicate his ideas to others rapidly and accurately./r/n 工程技术人员尤其必须能够迅速而准确地将自己的想法传达给别人。/r/n

word.name: accusation
word.lx: The accusation was that he had murdered his wife./r/n 罪名是他谋杀了他的妻子。/r/n The prosecutor brought an accusation of theft against him./r/n 检察官指控他偷窃。/r/n

word.name: accuse
word.lx: He was accused of incompetence./r/n 他被指责为不称职。/r/n

word.name: accuser
word.mean: n. 原告,控诉者,非难者
word.lx: The accuser brought an accusation against the accused./r/n 原告起诉了被告。/r/n They confronted the prisoner with his accusers./r/n 他们让犯人与原告对质。/r/n

word.name: accustom
word.lx: You must accustom yourself to getting up early./r/n 你必须使自己习惯于早起。/r/n He had to accustom himself to the cold weather./r/n 他不得不使自己习惯于寒冷的天气。/r/n

word.name: accustomed
word.lx: You will soon get accustomed to the climate here./r/n 你会很快习惯这里的气候的。/r/n I am accustomed to hard work./r/n 我已经习惯努力工作了。/r/n

word.name: ache
word.mean:
n. 痛
v. 痛,渴望
word.lx: I ache all over./r/n 我浑身疼痛。/r/n He felt a dull ache in his shoulder./r/n 他感到肩膀隐隐作痛。/r/n

word.name: achievement
word.mean: n. 成就,成绩,完成,达到
word.lx: Flying across the Atlantic for the first time was a great achievement./r/n 首次飞跃大西洋是一项了不起的业绩。/r/n I felt a great sense of achievement when I reached the top of the mountain./r/n 当我到达山顶的时候，我有一种巨大的成就感。/r/n

word.name: acid
word.lx: The acid burnt a hole in the carpet./r/n 酸把地毯烧了个洞。/r/n Acids react with bases to form salts./r/n 酸与碱反应生成盐。/r/n

word.name: acidity
word.lx: Some freshwater fish such as pike can withstand levels of acidity./r/n 一些诸如梭鱼等淡水鱼可以抵御相当程度的酸性。/r/n Abnormal acidity of the blood./r/n 酸血症血液中不正常的酸度/r/n

word.name: acknowledge
word.mean: v. 承认,答谢,告知收到,确认,报偿

word.name: acoustic
word.mean: a. 美声的，听觉的,音感教育,音响学的
word.lx: Opened the show with an acoustic set./r/n 不用电子乐器开始演出/r/n An acoustic instrument./r/n 非电传音乐器/r/n

word.name: acoustics
word.mean: n. 音响学,音响效果,声学

word.name: acquaint
word.lx: I am acquainted with her./r/n 我认识她./r/n Please acquaint him with my arrival./r/n 请通知他我到了。/r/n

word.name: acquaintance
word.lx: I have a slight acquaintance with Japanese./r/n 我略通日文。/r/n He is my acquaintance./r/n 他是我的熟人。/r/n

word.name: acquire
word.lx: The collector has acquired a fine collection of impressionist paintings./r/n 这位收藏家收集到大量印象派绘画。/r/n We admired his intellectual providence to acquire vast stores of dry information./r/n 我们钦佩他收集大量原始资料的远见卓识。/r/n

word.name: acre
word.lx: We own 100 acres of farmland./r/n 我们拥有一百英亩农田。/r/n The house has half an acre of lawn./r/n 这座房子有半英亩草坪./r/n

word.name: acrobat
word.lx: The audience held its/their breath as the acrobat walked along the tightrope./r/n 杂技演员在钢丝绳上表演时，观众们屏息观看。/r/n One that tumbles, especially an acrobat or a gymnast./r/n 翻筋斗者翻滚者，尤指杂技演员或体操运动员/r/n

word.name: across
word.mean:
ad. 横过
prep. 穿过,横过
word.lx: The two lines cut across each other./r/n 两条线相交。/r/n Can you swim across the river?/r/n 你能游到河的对岸吗？/r/n

word.name: act
word.mean:
n. 行为,行动,法案
v. 行动,扮演,下判决
word.lx: Parliament has passed an Act forbidding the killing of rare animals./r/n 国会通过了一项法令, 禁止捕杀珍稀动物。/r/n Think well before you act./r/n 要三思而后行。/r/n

word.name: action
word.mean: n. 行动,情节,表现,战斗
word.lx: Actions speak louder than words./r/n 行动胜于空谈。/r/n The action lasted three hours./r/n 战斗持续了三个小时。/r/n

word.name: activated
word.lx: The burglar alarm was activated by mistake./r/n 防盗铃误响了./r/n

word.name: active
word.lx: Vesuvius is an active volcano./r/n 维苏威山是一座活火山。/r/n She has an active imagination./r/n 她有灵活的想象力。/r/n

word.name: activist
word.mean: n. 活动分子,积极分子

word.name: activity
word.lx: The center provides facilities for a whole range of leisure activities./r/n 这个中心提供各种娱乐活动设施。/r/n There has been a lot of activity in the town today./r/n 今天市中心相当热闹。/r/n

word.name: actress
word.lx: The actress won overnight fame with her first film./r/n 这个女演员的第一部电影使她一举成名。/r/n The actress wore a black wig over her blond hair./r/n 女演员的金发上戴着黑色的假发。/r/n

word.name: actually
word.lx: Believe it or not, he actually won!/r/n 信不信由你，他真地胜利了！/r/n What did he actually say?/r/n 他实际上说了些什么?/r/n

word.name: actuals
word.lx: The actual labour force numbered20820./r/n 实际劳动力有20820人。/r/n He told the newspapermen about the conversation, but would not play them the actual tape of it./r/n 他向新闻记者讲了这次谈话的情况，却不愿把实况录音磁带放给他们听。/r/n

word.name: acupuncture
word.mean:
n. 针灸,针治
v. 施以针灸

word.name: acute
word.mean: a. 敏锐的,激烈的,尖锐的
word.lx: This area has an acute shortage of water./r/n 这个地方缺水严重。/r/n We agreed with his acute analysis of the political situation./r/n 我们都同意他对政治形势的深刻分析。/r/n

word.name: AD
word.mean:
abbr. (advertisement的缩写)广告
n. (缩)广告

word.name: adapt
word.lx: This novel has been adapted for radio from the Russian original./r/n 这部小说已由俄文原著改编成无线电广播节目。/r/n She adapted herself quickly to the new climate./r/n 她很快就适应了这种新气候。/r/n

word.name: adaptation
word.mean: n. 改编,适应,改编成的作品

word.name: adaptive
word.mean: a. 适合的,适应的,能适应的
word.lx: Created adaptive clothing for children and young adults with special needs./r/n 为有特殊要求的儿童或年轻人创造适应的布匹/r/n

word.name: add
word.lx: He added some wood to increase the fire./r/n 他加了一些木柴，使火旺些。/r/n If you add 4 to 5, you get 9./r/n 四加五等于九。/r/n

word.name: adder
word.mean: n. 欧洲产的小毒蛇,北美产的无毒小蛇,加算器
word.lx: An adder attacked my father./r/n 一条小毒蛇攻击了我父亲。/r/n

word.name: addict
word.mean:
v. 使...耽溺,使...上瘾
n. 耽溺者,上瘾者
word.lx: He was addicted to cocaine./r/n 他吸可卡因上瘾/r/n There are no lengths to which an addict will not go to obtain his drug./r/n 瘾君子为了得到毒品什麽事都做得出来./r/n

word.name: addiction
word.lx: An addiction, especially to a narcotic drug./r/n 上瘾上瘾，特别是对毒品上瘾/r/n His addiction to drugs propelled him towards a life of crime./r/n 他吸毒成瘾使他走上了犯罪的道路。/r/n

word.name: addition
word.mean: n. 增加,附加物,加,加法

word.name: additional
word.lx: He had to pay some additional charges./r/n 他不得不付些附加费。/r/n You should know the additional responsibilities that are incidental to the job./r/n 你该知道做这项工作要承担额外责任。/r/n

word.name: additive
word.mean:
n. 附加物(加法)
a. 加添的

word.name: address
word.mean:
n. 住址
n. 致词,讲话
vt. 发表演说，写地址，（图书、文章等）讨论（某主题）
word.lx: He addressed the audience in an eloquent speech./r/n 他向听众发表了雄辩的演说。/r/n There is a letter addressed to you./r/n 有封写给你收的信。/r/n

word.name: addressing
word.lx: A larger computer storage area, usually used for virtual storage addressing./r/n 一大段计算机存储区，常用于虚拟存储器寻址。/r/n I was rather daunted by the thought of addressing such an audience./r/n 我一想到要对这样的听众讲话，就有些胆小。/r/n

word.name: adept
word.mean:
a. 熟练的,老练的
n. 名手,专家
word.lx: My teacher is adept at designing robots./r/n 我的老师对设计机器人是个内行。/r/n Helen is adept in music and her husband is adept in drawing./r/n 海伦精通音乐，而她的丈夫擅长绘画。/r/n

word.name: adequate
word.mean: a. 足够的,充足的,适当的,能胜任的
word.lx: Their earnings are adequate to their needs./r/n 他们挣的钱够用了。/r/n Our accommodation is barely adequate./r/n 我们的住房不太够用。/r/n

word.name: adhere
word.lx: We should adhere to our opinions./r/n 我们应当坚持我们的意见。/r/n Paste is used to make one surface adhere to another./r/n 糨糊是用于使一个接触面粘住另一个接触面的。/r/n

word.name: adjacent
word.mean: a. 毗连的,邻近的,接近的
word.lx: His house is adjacent to mine./r/n 他的寓所与我的相毗连。/r/n An edge and the area immediately adjacent to it; a border./r/n 边缘，边界边和邻近的区域；边界/r/n

word.name: adjective
word.mean:
n. 形容词
a. 形容词的,似形容词的
word.lx: This is an adjective phrase./r/n 这是个形容词短语。/r/n There are more than 5,000 adjectives in that dictionary./r/n 那本词典中有5000多个形容词。/r/n

word.name: adjoin
word.lx: Our house adjoins theirs./r/n 我们的房屋与他们的毗连。/r/n Property that adjoins ours./r/n 与我们的地产相毗连的地产/r/n

word.name: adjust
word.lx: He adjusted himself very quickly to the heat of the country./r/n 他很快使自己适应了这个国家炎热的天气。/r/n This kind of desk can be adjusted to the height you need./r/n 这种书桌的高低可以按照你的需要调节。/r/n

word.name: administer
word.lx: The priest administered the last rites./r/n 神父为人举行临终圣礼。/r/n The courts administer the law./r/n 法院执行法律。/r/n

word.name: administrate
word.mean: v. 给予,投(药),经营,实施,掌管,料理

word.name: administration
word.mean: n. 行政,管理,中央政府
word.lx: The company developed rapidly under his administration./r/n 在他的管理下，公司发展得很快。/r/n She has been looking after the ,day-to-day administration./r/n 她一直在照管日常的行政工作./r/n

word.name: administrative
word.lx: This job is mainly administrative./r/n 这份工作主要是行政性的。/r/n A division of an area, as for administrative purposes./r/n 地区，行政区一个地域的分支，如为了管理的目的/r/n

word.name: administrator
word.lx: She is an excellent administrator./r/n 她是个优秀的管理人员。/r/n The person was appointed administrator to manage the property of others./r/n 这个人被指定管理他人的财产。/r/n

word.name: admiration
word.lx: She speaks English so well that her friends are filled with admiration./r/n 她的英语说得好极了，她的朋友都赞美不已。/r/n She was ardent in her admiration of the artist./r/n 她非常倾慕那位艺术家。/r/n

word.name: admire
word.lx: She has many admirers./r/n 她有许多追求者。/r/n I am not a great admirer of her work./r/n 我对她的工作不太欣赏。/r/n

word.name: admission
word.lx: He gained admission into this university./r/n 他获准进入这所大学。/r/n Do they charge for admission?/r/n 入场要收费吗?/r/n

word.name: admit
word.lx: He was admitted to the hospital suffering from burns./r/n 他由于烧伤，被送入医院治疗。/r/n This sentence admits of several interpretations./r/n 这个句子可以有多种解释。/r/n

word.name: Adobe
word.mean:
n. 泥砖,土坯
美国Adobe公司

word.name: adolescent
word.mean:
a. 青春期的,青少年的
n. 青少年
word.lx: My adolescent life./r/n 我的青少年时期/r/n Overgrowth is common in adolescents./r/n 青少年成长过快是普遍现象./r/n

word.name: adopt
word.lx: As they had no children of their own, they adopted an orphan./r/n 他们没有亲生儿女，就收养了一个孤儿。/r/n Most countries adopt metric system./r/n 大多数国家采用米制。/r/n

word.name: adoption
word.lx: He was pleased by the adoption of a little girl./r/n 他对收养了一个女孩感到高兴。/r/n The list of bill to be consider is headed by the bill on the adoption service./r/n 要考虑的议案一览表上第一项就是关于收养服务的议案。/r/n

word.name: adore
word.lx: The boys adore their mothers./r/n 男孩们敬慕他们的母亲。/r/n All the girls in our school adore the handsome mathematics teacher who happens to be a bachelor./r/n 我们学校里所有女孩子都崇拜那个恰巧是单身汉的英俊数学老师。/r/n

word.name: adrenal
word.mean:
a. 肾上腺的
n. 肾上腺

word.name: adrenalin
word.lx: He kept the adrenalin flowing with off-and-on feuds with his critics./r/n 他断断续续地同评论家们口诛笔伐，使得肝火旺盛。/r/n

word.name: adult
word.mean:
a. 成年的,成熟的
n. 成年人
word.lx: These films are suitable for adults only./r/n 这些电影只适宜成人观看。/r/n His behavior is not particularly adult./r/n 他的举止行为还不太成熟。/r/n

word.name: adulteration
word.mean: n. 搀杂,搀假的东西,冒充货
word.lx: Characterized by adulteration; spurious./r/n 掺假的以掺假为特征的；伪造的/r/n

word.name: advance
word.mean:
n. 前进,进步,预支
v. 前进,增加,上涨
word.lx: The report advances the suggestion that safety standards should be improved./r/n 该报告建议安全标准应该改进。/r/n It is a popular show, so advance booking is essential./r/n 这是个很受欢迎的演出，所以一定要提前订票。/r/n

word.name: advanced
word.lx: The professor is engaged in advanced studies./r/n 该教授正进行高深的学术研究。/r/n The regent carried out an advanced system in his country./r/n 摄政者在他的国家推行了一套先进的制度。/r/n

word.name: advantage
word.lx: Earthenware has an advantage over wood in being more easily kept clean./r/n 陶器的优点在于比木器更容易保持清洁。/r/n Rich has an advantage over you since he can speak German./r/n 理奇比你占优势, 因为他会讲德语。/r/n

word.name: advantageous
word.lx: For the best; advantageous./r/n 有好处的；有利的/r/n It will be advantageous if steps are taken to resume our business relationship on the basis of mutual benefit./r/n 如果我们采取措施在互利的基础上恢复业务关系，对我们都是有利的。/r/n

word.name: adventure
word.mean:
n. 冒险,奇遇
v. 大胆进行
word.lx: The explorer told the boys about his adventures in the Arctic./r/n 那位探险家把他在北极的冒险活动讲给男孩子 们听。/r/n An adventure in dining./r/n 进餐中的奇遇/r/n

word.name: adverb
word.mean:
a. 副词的
n. 副词
word.lx: It is an adverb./r/n 它是副词。/r/n Adverb is used to modify verb, such asquickly" in"she runs quickly"./r/n 副词用来修饰动词，例如：“她快快地跑”中的“快快地”。/r/n"

word.name: adverse
word.lx: An allergy is an adverse reaction of the body to certain substances./r/n 过敏是身体对某些物质的不良反应。/r/n The judge gave us an adverse decision./r/n 法官作出对我们不利的判决。/r/n

word.name: advertise
word.mean:
vi. 登广告
v. 为...做广告
word.lx: I advertised him of my plan./r/n 我告知他我的计划。/r/n We decided to advertise our new product./r/n 我们决定为我们的新产品做广告。/r/n

word.name: advertisement
word.lx: There are too many TV advertisements in between the program./r/n 这个电视节目中的广告太多了。/r/n There are many insertions of advertisement in the newspapers./r/n 报纸上有很多插入的广告。/r/n

word.name: advice
word.lx: I asked the teacher for her advice./r/n 我征求这位老师的意见。/r/n He gave me some good advice./r/n 他向我提了一些很好的意见。/r/n

word.name: advisable
word.lx: It is deemed advisable./r/n 这认为是可取的./r/n It will not be advisable so pack this course into your already busy schedule./r/n 把这门课硬排进你本来已经很紧的计划是不明智的。/r/n

word.name: advise
word.lx: The doctor advised (me to take) a complete rest./r/n 医生让（我）完全休息./r/n They advised her against marrying quickly./r/n 他们劝她不要太快结婚./r/n

word.name: adviser
word.mean: n. 顾问,指导教授,劝告者
word.lx: Professor Smith served as special adviser to the President./r/n 史密斯教授曾做过总统的特别顾问。/r/n He became her senior adviser her deputy, if you will./r/n 他成了她的高级顾问--你要说是她的副手也未尝不可./r/n

word.name: advisory
word.mean: a. 劝告的,顾问的,谘询的

word.name: advocate
word.mean:
n. 提倡者,拥护者
v. 主张,提倡
word.lx: He advocates reducing military spending./r/n 他主张削减军费开支。/r/n This judge is a strong advocate of prison reform./r/n 这位法官是监狱改革的坚决拥护者。/r/n

word.name: aerial
word.mean: a. 空中的,航空的,空想的
word.lx: He showed me some aerial photographs./r/n 他给我看了一些空中拍摄的照片。/r/n The birds perched on the television aerial./r/n 鸟停在电视天线上./r/n

word.name: aeroplane
word.lx: An aeroplane droned overhead./r/n 一架飞机在头上嗡嗡飞过。/r/n To ride in an aeroplane you have to book in advance./r/n 要乘飞机必须提前定位子。/r/n

word.name: aesthetic
word.mean: a. 美学的,审美的,有美感

word.name: affair
word.lx: Mind your own affairs!/r/n 别管闲事！/r/n The party was a dull affair./r/n 这次聚会单调乏味。/r/n

word.name: affect
word.lx: He affected not to hear me./r/n 他假装没有听见我。/r/n He was much affected by the sad news./r/n 这个悲惨的消息使他非常难过。/r/n

word.name: affected
word.lx: The climate affected his health./r/n 气候影响了他的健康。/r/n It is said that the rhythm of tides is affected by the moon./r/n 据说潮汐的涨落受月亮的影响。/r/n

word.name: affection
word.mean: n. 慈爱,爱,感情,作用,影响
word.lx: Every mother has affection for her children./r/n 每个母亲都爱她的孩子。/r/n He is held in affection./r/n 他极为大家所爱戴。/r/n

word.name: affiliate
word.mean:
n. 联号(联播台,同伙),附属机构,分公司
vt 合并(使...加入,追源)

word.name: affirm
word.lx: I affirm that what he said is true./r/n 我断言他所说的是实情。/r/n They affirmed that the girl did quite a bit of reading./r/n 他们断言这个女孩子读了不少书。/r/n

word.name: affirmative
word.mean:
a. 肯定的,正面的
n. 肯定语,赞成方面

word.name: affix
word.lx: Affix a label to a package./r/n 在包裹上贴张标签/r/n Please affix a stamp./r/n 请贴上邮票。/r/n

word.name: afflict
word.lx: She was afflicted with conscience./r/n 她受良心责备。/r/n He was afflicted with cancer./r/n 他患了癌症。/r/n

word.name: affluent
word.mean:
a. 富裕的
n. 支流

word.name: African
word.mean:
a. 非洲的,非洲人的
n. 非洲人
word.lx: Most African people are black people./r/n 大多数非洲人是黑人。/r/n He is an African./r/n 他是非洲人。/r/n

word.name: after
word.mean:
a. 以后的
ad. 以后,后来
conj. 在...以后
prep. 在...之后
word.lx: I found your coat after you had left the house./r/n 你离开房子之后，我发现了你的外衣。/r/n He grew weak in after years./r/n 在以后的几年里，他变得衰弱了。/r/n

word.name: afternoon
word.lx: Good afternoon!/r/n 下午好！/r/n Scattered showers are expected this afternoon./r/n 预料今天下午有零星阵雨。/r/n

word.name: afterward
word.lx: Soon afterward they left./r/n 他们不久以后就离开了。/r/n Three days afterward they met at the station./r/n 三天后，他们在车站见面了。/r/n

word.name: afterwards
word.lx: We saw the play separately and compared notes afterwards./r/n 我们各自看了那出戏, 後来交换了意见./r/n Soon afterwards he made his first public statement about the affair./r/n 不久以后，他第一次就这一事件发表了公开声明。/r/n

word.name: again
word.lx: Please say that again./r/n 请再说一次。/r/n Say that again, please./r/n 请再说一遍。/r/n

word.name: against
word.lx: There are 26 votes for him and 8 against him./r/n 有26票赞成他，8票反对他。/r/n We have saved some money against our old age./r/n 我们存了一些钱，以备老年之用。/r/n

word.name: age
word.mean:
n. 年龄
v. (使)变老
vi. 变老
word.lx: Anxiety ages us./r/n 忧虑催人老。/r/n The period in which man learnt to make tools of iron is called the Iron Age./r/n 人类学会用铁制造工具的时代称为铁器时代。/r/n

word.name: aged
word.lx: The heroine of the film is an aged woman./r/n 影片的女主角是一位老妇人。/r/n She is a teacher aged only twenty./r/n 她是一位年仅二十岁的教师。/r/n

word.name: agency
word.lx: I got this job through an employment agency./r/n 我通过职业介绍所找到了这份工作。/r/n The agency places about 2000 secretaries per annum./r/n 该代理机构每年可为约2000名秘书安排工作./r/n

word.name: agenda
word.lx: Could you run (me) off twenty copies of the agenda?/r/n 你把议事日程表给（我）复印二十份好吗?/r/n This agenda will form the basis of our next meeting./r/n 本议程将成为下次会议的中心议题./r/n

word.name: agent
word.mean: n. 代理人,代理商,特工人员
word.lx: He used to be a literary agent./r/n 他曾是一位著作经纪人。/r/n The agent spoke on behalf of his principal./r/n 代理人代表他的委托人说话。/r/n

word.name: aggregate
word.mean:
n. 合计,总计,集合体
a. 合计的,集合的,聚合的
v. 聚集,集合,合计
word.lx: The television audience aggregated 30 millions./r/n 电视观众合计达3000万人./r/n Our team scored the most goals on aggregate./r/n 整个来说, 我们队得分最多./r/n

word.name: aggression
word.mean: n. 进攻,侵犯,侵害,侵略

word.name: aggressive
word.mean: a. 侵犯的,攻击性的,有进取心的
word.lx: He is an aggressive man./r/n 他是一个好斗的人。/r/n A successful businessman must be aggressive./r/n 一个成功的商人必须有进取心。/r/n

word.name: agitation
word.lx: He was in a state of great agitation./r/n 他处于异常焦虑的状态。/r/n The agitation of the strike arose repeatedly./r/n 罢工风潮迭起。/r/n

word.name: ago
word.lx: He came here two years ago./r/n 他两年前来到这里。/r/n He joined the army a year ago./r/n 一年以前，他参军了。/r/n

word.name: agony
word.lx: He was in an agony of remorse./r/n 他处于悔恨的海洋中。/r/n The boxer folded up in agony./r/n 那拳击手痛苦地倒下了./r/n

word.name: agreeable
word.mean: a. 愉快的,和蔼可亲的
word.lx: Are you agreeable to the proposal?/r/n 你能同意这项建议吗？/r/n She has an agreeable voice./r/n 她的声音悦耳。/r/n

word.name: agreement
word.lx: We are in agreement with their decision./r/n 我们同意他们的决定。/r/n Finally we reached an agreement./r/n 我们最终达成了协议。/r/n

word.name: agriculture
word.lx: I know nothing about agriculture./r/n 我对农业一窍不通。/r/n Modern agriculture is spoiling our beautiful countryside./r/n 现代农业正在破坏我们美丽的农村。/r/n

word.name: ahead
word.mean: ad. 向前地,胜于,在...前面
word.lx: He ran on ahead./r/n 他跑在前面。/r/n He will be ahead of others in English./r/n 他在英语方面将超过别人。/r/n

word.name: aid
word.mean:
n. 帮助,有帮助的事物
v. 援助,帮助
abbr.=Agency for International Development 国际开发署[美]
word.lx: A dictionary is an invaluable aid in learning a new language./r/n 在学习一种新语言时，词典是非常有用的工具。/r/n We were greatly aided in our investigation by the cooperation of the police./r/n 我们在调查的过程中得到警方的大力协助。/r/n

word.name: aim
word.mean:
n. 目标,对准
v. 对准目标,打算
word.lx: He aims to be a successful writer./r/n 他的目标是成为一个成功的作家。/r/n What is your aim in life?/r/n 你的生活目标是什么？/r/n

word.name: air
word.mean:
n. 空气,旋律
v. 晾干,使通风
word.lx: We aired the room by opening the window./r/n 我们打开窗户，使房间通风。/r/n I shall travel to New York by air this weekend./r/n 这个周末我将要乘飞机去纽约旅行。/r/n

word.name: aircraft
word.lx: The speed of this aircraft is very high./r/n 这架飞机的速度非常快。/r/n The new aircraft is undergoing safety tests./r/n 这种新飞机正在接受安全性能检验。/r/n

word.name: airfield
word.lx: A large passenger aircraft will land on the airfield./r/n 一架大型民航班机将降落在这个飞机场。/r/n The airfield is bounded by woods on all sides./r/n 飞机场的四周都是树林./r/n

word.name: airline
word.mean:
a. (飞机)航线的
n. (飞机的)航线,航空公司
word.lx: Mr. Wang is a staff of France airline./r/n 王先生是法国航空公司的一名职员。/r/n With several of their planes temporarily out of commission, the airline is losing money./r/n 航空公司因有几架飞机暂时不能使用而正在赔钱./r/n

word.name: airliner
word.lx: This is a large passenger airliner./r/n 这是一架大型客机。/r/n The airliner flew at an altitude of 20000ft./r/n 客机在两万英尺的高度飞行。/r/n

word.name: airmail
word.lx: Surface mail takes longer than airmail./r/n 普通邮件比航空邮件慢。/r/n An airmail letter to china normally cost50 cents, but this letter seem a bit thick./r/n 寄往中国的航空信一般是50美分，不过这封信好像厚一点。/r/n

word.name: airplane
word.lx: The airplane is airworthy./r/n 这架飞机是适于飞行的。/r/n The airplane was attacked by dropping bombs./r/n 这架飞机遭到炸弹的袭击。/r/n

word.name: airport
word.lx: You must arrive at the airport two hours early./r/n 你必须提前两小时到达机场。/r/n I have arranged that one of my staff will meet you at the airport./r/n 我已经安排好派一个职员到飞机场接你。/r/n

word.name: alarm
word.mean:
n. 警报,惊慌,警告,报警器
v. 使...惊慌,警告
word.lx: I gave the alarm as soon as I saw the smoke./r/n 我一看见冒烟，就发出了警报。/r/n The news of the radiation leak caused widespread public alarm./r/n 辐射泄露的消息引起了公众的普遍恐慌。/r/n

word.name: album
word.mean: n. 集邮本,照相簿,唱片簿
word.lx: My album of boyhood photographs often reminds me of the past happiness./r/n 童年时的相册经常让我想起儿时的欢乐。 /r/n This is one of the songs from her latest album./r/n 这是她最新歌集里的一首歌。/r/n

word.name: alcohol
word.lx: This substance is soluble in alcohol./r/n 这种物质能够溶解在酒精中。/r/n He never touches alcohol./r/n 他从不沾酒。/r/n

word.name: alcoholic
word.mean:
n. 酒鬼,酒精中毒的人
a. 酒精性的
word.lx: Home-made wine can be very alcoholic./r/n 自制的酒酒性很烈。/r/n He was in an alcoholic stupor./r/n 他醉得不省人事。/r/n

word.name: alert
word.mean: a. 警觉的,灵敏的,留心的
word.lx: An alert listener will have noticed the error./r/n 耳朵尖的人能听出这个错。/r/n Troops are on the alert against any possible aggression./r/n 军队戒备着可能的来犯。/r/n

word.name: alga
word.lx: Algae grow in water./r/n 水藻生长在水中。/r/n Some of the algae are edible./r/n 有些藻类是可以吃的。/r/n

word.name: alias
word.mean:
n. 别名,化名
ad. 别名,化名
word.lx: Mick Clark, alias Sid Brown, is wanted for questioning by the police./r/n 米克·克拉克, 又名锡德·布朗, 被警方通缉审问./r/n The criminal Mick Clark has/uses several aliases./r/n 那个叫米克·克拉克的罪犯有[使用]好几个化名./r/n

word.name: alien
word.mean:
n. 外侨;外星人
a. 外国的,相异的
word.lx: Their ideas are quite alien to our ways of thinking./r/n 他们的观点同我们看问题的方法格格不入。/r/n Cruelty is quite alien to his nature./r/n 残忍完全不合他的本性。/r/n

word.name: align
word.mean: v. 排列,调整,定中心,校直,使结盟, 使成一行
word.lx: Could you align this table with those?/r/n 你能把这张桌子同那些桌子排成一行吗？/r/n Our company should align ourselves with theirs./r/n 我们的公司必须与他们的公司合作。/r/n

word.name: aligned
word.lx: The Communist Party has aligned itself with the Socialists./r/n 共产党与社会党结成了联盟./r/n The troops aligned./r/n 士兵们列队了。/r/n

word.name: alignment
word.mean: n. 调整(成直线,准线,定向,直线性,结盟)

word.name: alike
word.mean:
a. 相似的,同样的
ad. 一样,以同样的方式
word.lx: We are much alike in character./r/n 我们的性格很相似。/r/n The two brothers are very much alike./r/n 这两兄弟非常相像。/r/n

word.name: alive
word.lx: Are your grandparents still alive?/r/n 你的祖父母还在世吗？/r/n The city was all alive when he arrived./r/n 当他到达时，城里非常热闹。/r/n

word.name: all
word.mean:
a. 所有的,全部的
ad. 全部,全然
int. 全部,全体,一切
word.lx: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy./r/n （谚）只工作不玩耍，聪明杰克也变傻。/r/n The party was all but over when we arrived./r/n 我们到的时候，晚会几乎要结束了。/r/n

word.name: allege
word.lx: The police alleged that the man was murdered but they have given no proof./r/n 警方声称这男子是被谋杀的，但未提出任何证据。/r/n So they alleged, but have they any proof?/r/n 他们是这样宣称的，但他们有证据吗？/r/n

word.name: alleged
word.mean: a. 被说成的,被指称的
word.lx: The police alleged that the man was murdered but they have given no proof./r/n 警方声称这男子是被谋杀的，但未提出任何证据。/r/n So they alleged, but have they any proof?/r/n 他们是这样宣称的，但他们有证据吗？/r/n

word.name: allergic
word.lx: Allergic children; highly allergic to penicillin./r/n 过敏的儿童；对青霉素高度过敏/r/n Ben is allergic to pollen./r/n 班对花粉过敏。/r/n

word.name: allergy
word.lx: An allergy to cocktail parties./r/n 对鸡尾酒会的厌恶/r/n Constantly blowing his nose in allergy season./r/n 在过敏的季节不断地擤他的鼻子/r/n

word.name: alleviate
word.lx: The doctor gave her an injection to alleviate the pain./r/n 医生给她注射以减轻疼痛./r/n They alleviated the boredom of waiting by singing songs./r/n 他们以唱歌来减轻等候的厌烦./r/n

word.name: alley
word.lx: We tried one idea after the other, but they all seemed to be leading to blind alleys./r/n 我们想了一个又一个主意，但它们似乎都行不通。/r/n This business is right up my alley./r/n 这种事情正是我熟悉的。/r/n

word.name: alliance
word.lx: They made an alliance against the common enemy./r/n 他们联合起来抵御共同的敌人。/r/n Which country is the predominant member of the alliance?/r/n 哪个国家在联盟中居于支配地位？/r/n

word.name: allied
word.lx: The English language is allied to the German language./r/n 英语和德语属于同一语系。/r/n The allied warplanes bombed the country by the hundred./r/n 盟军数以百计的飞机轰炸了那个国家。/r/n

word.name: allot
word.lx: How much cash has been allotted?/r/n 拨给多少现款?/r/n Who will she allot the easy jobs to?/r/n 她要把轻活儿分给谁?/r/n

word.name: allow
word.mean:
v. 允许,准许
vi. (for)考虑到
vt. 允许
word.lx: You are not allowed to smoke here./r/n 这里不许吸烟。/r/n The patient was allowed up (ie permitted to get out of bed) after 10 days./r/n 病人十天以後才允许起来（准予离床下地）./r/n

word.name: allowance
word.mean:
n. 限额，定量
n. 津贴,零用钱

word.name: allowed
word.lx: Imports will be allowed in proportion to exports./r/n 容许的进口量将按照出口的多少而定。/r/n Smoking is not allowed here./r/n 这里不许吸烟。/r/n

word.name: alloy
word.mean:
n. 合金
v. 使...成合金,搀以劣质,减低成色
word.lx: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc./r/n 黄铜是铜和锌的合金。/r/n Ornaments, objects, or utensils made of this alloy./r/n 黄铜制品用这种合金制的装饰品、物件或器皿/r/n

word.name: ally
word.mean:
n. 盟友,同盟国
v. 联盟,联合,与...有关系
word.lx: That football team is our ally./r/n 那个足球队是我们的同盟者。/r/n Britain was an ally of America in the World War I./r/n 英国在第一次世界大战中是美国的同盟国。/r/n

word.name: almost
word.lx: She said almost nothing./r/n 她几乎什么都没说。/r/n Almost anything will do./r/n 几乎什么都行./r/n

word.name: along
word.mean:
ad. 向前
prep. 沿着
word.lx: We walked along the road./r/n 我们沿着路走。/r/n We bicycled along, singing loudly./r/n 我们骑着脚踏车前进，大声歌唱着。/r/n

word.name: alongside
word.mean:
ad. 在旁边
prep. 在...旁边
word.lx: The car drew up alongside the road./r/n 小汽车在路边停下来。/r/n He is the master of the boat moored alongside./r/n 他是那条靠着码头停泊的船的主人。/r/n

word.name: aloud
word.lx: Please read aloud so that I can hear you./r/n 请大声朗读，好让我能听到。/r/n Read (the letter) aloud, please./r/n 请大声念（这封信）./r/n

word.name: alpha
word.mean: n. 希腊字母的第一个字母,最初,开端
word.lx: The researches are concerned with alpha rays./r/n 这些研究是关于阿尔法射线的。/r/n

word.name: alphabet
word.lx: There are 26 letters in the English alphabet./r/n 英语字母表中有26个字母。/r/n Many letters in the alphabet such as b, c, d,etc are consonants./r/n 字母表中的许多字母像b，c，d，等等都是辅音字母。/r/n

word.name: alphabetic
word.mean: a. 照字母次序的,字母的

word.name: alphabetical
word.lx: The index is arranged in alphabetical order./r/n 这索引是按字母顺序排列的。/r/n The words in the dictionary are arranged in alphabetical order./r/n 词典中的词是按字母顺序排列的./r/n

word.name: alphabetically
word.lx: The books are listed alphabetically./r/n 这些书是按字母顺序编入目录的./r/n Being arranged alphabetically./r/n 按字母顺序排列的/r/n

word.name: alphanumeric
word.lx: A terminal containing less than a full alphanumeric keyboard; for example, one containing ten numeric keys plus control keys./r/n 一种终端，它的键盘不包括全套的字母数字字符键；例如，只包括十个数字键以及若干控制键。/r/n

word.name: also
word.lx: Tom has been to Japan, I have also been there./r/n 汤姆曾去过日本，我也曾去过。/r/n London was also called the modern Babylon./r/n 伦敦也被称为现代巴比伦。/r/n

word.name: alter
word.lx: He altered one of the rooms into a bedroom./r/n 他把一间屋子改建成了卧室。/r/n Circumstances alter cases./r/n 【谚】具体情况具体分析。/r/n

word.name: alteration
word.lx: There have been a few alterations to the timetable./r/n 时间表上有一些变动。/r/n My coat needs alteration./r/n 我的上衣需要改改。/r/n

word.name: alternate
word.mean:
a. 交替的,轮流的
v. 交替,轮流
word.lx: Sunny weather alternated with rain./r/n 天气晴雨相间。/r/n Meetings are held on alternate Thursdays./r/n 每隔一个星期的星期四举行一次会议。/r/n

word.name: alternative
word.mean:
a. 两者择一的
n. 替换物,取舍
v. 两者取一
word.lx: Have you got an alternative suggestion?/r/n 你有没有其他建议？/r/n Please find alternative means of transport./r/n 请另外找一个运输方法。/r/n

word.name: alternatively
word.mean: ad. 二者择一地,做为选择
word.lx: We could take the train or alternatively go by car./r/n 我们可以坐火车去, 也可以坐汽车去./r/n Come with us, alternatively, meet us there./r/n 同我们一道去，或者在那儿兴我们会合。/r/n

word.name: although
word.lx: Although my uncle is old, he looks very strong and healthy./r/n 我的叔叔虽然老了，但他看上去还是很健壮。/r/n She seemed a babe although she was already thirty./r/n 尽管她已经三十岁了，看上去还象个小孩。/r/n

word.name: altitude
word.lx: The airliner flew at an altitude of 20000ft./r/n 客机在两万英尺的高度飞行。/r/n In these altitudes snow never melts./r/n 在这样的高度，雪永不融化。/r/n

word.name: aluminum
word.lx: Aluminum foil can be used for wrapping food./r/n 铝箔用于包装食物。/r/n She put some noodles in the aluminum saucepan./r/n 她在铝锅里下了些面条。/r/n

word.name: amass
word.lx: That which is gathered or amassed; a collection or an accumulation./r/n 收集物被收集或聚集的东西；一种收集物或获得物/r/n He is planed to amass a fortune for a rainy day./r/n 他正打算积蓄财富以备不时之需。/r/n

word.name: amateur
word.mean:
a. 业余的
n. 业余爱好者
word.lx: You are a professional, but I am an amateur./r/n 你是专职的，我是业余的。/r/n He is an amateur photographer./r/n 他是个业余摄影爱好者。/r/n

word.name: amaze
word.lx: He amazed me by his audacity./r/n 他的无理让我惊骇。/r/n I was amazed to find her there./r/n 发现她在那，我感到很吃惊。/r/n

word.name: amazing
word.lx: It was amazing that he knew nothing about the event./r/n 他对这个事件毫不知情，真让人感到诧异。/r/n What an amazing painting!/r/n 多么了不起的一幅画啊！/r/n

word.name: ambassador
word.lx: He was appointed ambassador to the United States./r/n 他被任命为驻美国大使。/r/n His Excellency the French ambassador will be present at the meeting./r/n 法国大使阁下将出席本次会议。/r/n

word.name: ambiguity
word.mean: n. 不明确,含糊,暧昧,模棱两可
word.lx: A state of ambiguity or obscurity./r/n 含糊不清或者晦涩的状态/r/n Signal which prevents accidental operation by spurious signals or avoids possible ambiguity./r/n 防止假信号的意外作用或者避免二义性而设置的信号。/r/n

word.name: ambiguous
word.lx: He give us an ambiguous answer./r/n 他给了我们一个模棱两可的答复。/r/n An intentionally noncommittal or ambiguous statement./r/n 暧昧的回答，故意的不信任故意说得模棱两可的话，不明确的话/r/n

word.name: ambition
word.mean:
n. 雄心,野心
vt. 有...野心,追求
word.lx: In his youth he had the ambition of being a pianist./r/n 他在青年时代曾经有过想当钢琴家的雄心。/r/n The naked facts; naked ambition./r/n 明明白白的事实；明显的野心/r/n

word.name: ambitious
word.mean: a. 热望的,有雄心的,有抱负的
word.lx: An ambitious boy usually works hard./r/n 一个充满雄心的男孩通常会努力工作。/r/n He ventured on an ambitious project./r/n 他冒险从事一项富有雄心的计画。/r/n

word.name: ambulance
word.lx: An ambulance was racing along with its sirens wailing./r/n 救护车响着警报急驰而过。/r/n The ambulance reached the collapsed building in due time./r/n 救护车及时赶到了那座倒塌的大厦。/r/n

word.name: amenable
word.mean: a. 应服从的,会接纳的,肯服从的
word.lx: This case is not amenable to the normal rules./r/n 这件事经不起常规的检验./r/n

word.name: amend
word.lx: They decided to amend the bill./r/n 他们决定修正这条议案。/r/n Please amend your copy of the contract accordingly./r/n 请将你的合同文本作相应的修正。/r/n

word.name: amendment
word.mean:
n. 改善,改良,改正
修正案
word.lx: That representative brought forth an amendment to the press law./r/n 那位代表提出了一项对新闻法的修正案。/r/n The amendment is an appendage of that contract./r/n 这个修改是那个合同的附件。/r/n

word.name: amends
word.lx: Did you make amends to Tom for his loss?/r/n 你赔偿汤姆的损失了吗？/r/n I want to make amends to my friend for breaking her precious vase./r/n 我打破了朋友的贵重花瓶，想赔偿她的损失。/r/n

word.name: America
word.lx: Have you been to America?/r/n 你去过美国吗？/r/n Maize is widely planted in the America./r/n 玉米在美洲广泛种植。/r/n

word.name: American
word.mean:
a. 美国的
n. 美国人
word.lx: Bill Gates is an American citizen./r/n 比尔·盖茨是美国公民。/r/n The painting was knocked down (to an American dealer) for 5000./r/n 那幅画拍卖时以5000英镑售出（给一个美国商人）./r/n

word.name: amiable
word.lx: He is an amiable person./r/n 他是个可亲的人。/r/n Do you really want to go or are you merely being amiable?/r/n 你是真想去呢，还是仅仅为了表示友好？/r/n

word.name: amid
word.lx: We groped amid the darkness./r/n 我们在黑暗中摸索。/r/n He stood firm amid temptations./r/n 他不被种种引诱所动摇。/r/n

word.name: amidst
word.lx: The tower stood amidst the ruins./r/n 塔矗立在废墟中。/r/n He is amidst his enemies./r/n 他被敌人包围。/r/n

word.name: ammonia
word.lx: Ammonia is a chemical substance./r/n 氨是种化学物质。/r/n Ammonia is a colorless gas with strong smell./r/n 氨是无色并有强烈气味的气体。/r/n

word.name: among
word.lx: I live among the mountains./r/n 我住在群山之中。/r/n New York is among the largest cities in the world./r/n 纽约是世界上最大的几座城市之一。/r/n

word.name: amongst
word.lx: He lives in a house amongst the trees./r/n 他住在一栋树木环绕的房子里。/r/n They quarreled amongst themselves./r/n 他们互相争吵。/r/n

word.name: amount
word.mean:
n. 数量,总额
v. 总计,等于
word.lx: My savings amount to $2000./r/n 我的储蓄共达2000美元。/r/n It all amounts to a lot of hard work./r/n 那一切意味看大量艰苦工作。/r/n

word.name: amphibian
word.mean:
a. 两栖类的,水陆两用的
n. 两栖动物,水陆两用飞机,水陆两用车
word.lx: Frogs and newts are amphibians./r/n 青蛙和蝾螈都是两栖动物./r/n The excretory opening of the digestive tract in animals such as birds, reptiles, amphibians, and fish./r/n 肛门鸟、爬行动物、两栖动物以及鱼等动物的消化道的排泄口/r/n

word.name: ample
word.lx: We have ample time./r/n 我们有充足的时间。/r/n The house has an ample parlor./r/n 这座房子有宽敞的客厅。/r/n

word.name: amplification
word.mean:
n. 扩大, 扩充，膨胀
n. 详述, 引伸，推广
n. 增幅, 放大(率), 放大倍数[系数]

word.name: amplifier
word.lx: This is an amplifier./r/n 这是一个放大器。/r/n I bought an amplifier yesterday./r/n 我昨天买了一个扩音器。/r/n

word.name: amplitude
word.mean:
n. 广阔,充足,增幅
n. 振幅、波幅（物理）

word.name: amputate
word.lx: Her arm is so badly injured they will have to amputate (it)./r/n 她的胳膊伤势严重, 他们不得不锯掉（它）./r/n Her leg was so badly damaged that the doctors had to amputate./r/n 她的那条腿伤得很厉害，医师只得将其截除。/r/n

word.name: amputation
word.lx: A prosthesis was fitted after the amputation./r/n 截肢之後安装了义肢./r/n

word.name: amuse
word.lx: The boys amuse themselves by drawing caricatures of their teacher./r/n 男孩子们以画老师的漫画取乐。/r/n The actors were really hamming it up to amuse the audience./r/n 这些演员为博观众一粲, 表演得实在太过火了./r/n

word.name: amused
word.lx: She has an amused twinkle in her eye(s)./r/n 她高兴得双目熠熠发亮./r/n His amusing performance caused a roar of laughter in the audience./r/n 他那有趣的表演引起了观众的哄堂大笑。/r/n

word.name: amusement
word.lx: I find amusement in collecting stamps./r/n 我发现了集邮的乐趣。/r/n She watched their fumbling efforts with wry amusement./r/n 她看著他们手忙脚乱地瞎使劲, 不觉莞尔./r/n

word.name: an
word.lx: Australia is an English speaking nation./r/n 澳大利亚是一个讲英语的国家。/r/n The city is at an elevation of 2000 metres./r/n 这座城市海拔2000米./r/n

word.name: analgesic
word.mean:
a. 止痛的
n. 镇痛剂
word.lx: Aspirin is a mild analgesic./r/n 阿司匹林是药性平和的止痛药./r/n An agent, such as an analgesic drug, that relieves pain./r/n 镇痛剂一种药剂，如止痛药，减轻疼痛/r/n

word.name: analogue
word.lx: A vegetarian gets protein not from meat but from its analogues./r/n 素食者所摄取的蛋白质不是来自肉类而是来自近似肉类的食物./r/n A slide-rule is a simple analogue computer./r/n 计算尺是简单的模拟计算机./r/n

word.name: analysis
word.lx: Close analysis of sales figures showed clear regional variations./r/n 对销售额的仔细分析显示出明显的地区差别。/r/n In the final analysis I think our sympathy lies with the heroine of the play./r/n 总之，我们认为我们都同情剧中的女主人公。/r/n

word.name: analyst
word.mean: n. 分析家,分解者,分析者

word.name: analytic
word.lx: An analytic mind; an analytic approach./r/n 善于分析的头脑；分析方法/r/n

word.name: anatomy
word.lx: Do you remember the lesson on the anatomy of a frog?/r/n 你还记得我们解剖青蛙的那堂课吗？/r/n The branch of anatomy that deals with the structure and function of bones./r/n 骨骼学研究骨的结构和功能的解剖学的分支/r/n

word.name: anchor
word.mean:
n. 铁锚
v. 停泊,抛锚,用锚系住
v. 担任（广播，电视新闻节目）的主持人
word.lx: Hope is his only anchor./r/n 希望是他唯一的依靠。/r/n He anchored the winning team./r/n 他担任胜了那一队的最后一棒。/r/n

word.name: ancient
word.mean:
a. 古代的,古老的
n. 古人
word.lx: We will all have a course in ancient history this term./r/n 这个学期我们都有一门古代史课程。/r/n This ancient parchment was discovered in a delicate iron box./r/n 这张古老的羊皮纸是在一个精致的铁盒子里发现的。/r/n

word.name: and
word.lx: My father and mother went for a walk./r/n 爸爸妈妈去散步了。/r/n Work hard and you will be successful./r/n 努力工作，你就会成功。/r/n

word.name: anecdote
word.lx: He told me some anecdote about our English teacher./r/n 他告诉我几个关于英语老师的掌故。/r/n

word.name: anesthetic
word.mean:
n. 麻醉剂,麻药
a. 麻醉的
word.lx: A gaseous anesthetic, such as nitrous oxide./r/n 气体麻醉剂一种气态的麻醉剂，如二氧化氮/r/n

word.name: angel
word.lx: My little daughter is as lovely as an angel./r/n 我的小女儿像天使一样可爱。/r/n She is lovely -- as much so as an angel./r/n 她可爱得像个天使。/r/n

word.name: anger
word.mean:
n. 忿怒
v. 激怒,使...发怒
word.lx: He could hardly contain his anger./r/n 他怒不可遏。/r/n The words drew down his anger./r/n 言语激怒了他。/r/n

word.name: angle
word.mean:
n. 角度
n. 盎格鲁人
word.lx: Try looking at the affair from a different angle./r/n 试从不同的角度来看这件事。/r/n Angular distance is the distance between two objects measured as an angle from a given point./r/n 角距离，是由一定点到两物体之间所量度的夹角。/r/n

word.name: angry
word.lx: I was angry with him for keeping me waiting./r/n 我对他很生气，因为他让我等了好久。/r/n His rudeness made me really angry./r/n 他的粗鲁让我生气。/r/n

word.name: anguish
word.mean:
n. 苦闷,痛苦
v. 使...极苦闷,使...极痛苦
word.lx: The child was badly hurt and was in anguish all the evening./r/n 这个孩子受了重伤，整夜都在痛苦之中。/r/n Physical disability causes mental anguish./r/n 生理伤残会引起心理苦闷./r/n

word.name: animal
word.mean:
a. 动物的,野兽的
n. 动物
word.lx: The camel is a herbivorous animal./r/n 骆驼是一种食草动物。/r/n A pig is a domestic animal./r/n 猪是一种家畜。/r/n

word.name: animation
word.mean: n. 活泼,生气,卡通制作
word.lx: We could see how excited he was by the animation in his face./r/n 我们从他脸上的神气就能看出他多麽兴奋。/r/n Lacking animation, variety, or distinction; dull./r/n 无精打彩的，乏味的缺少生气、变化或差别的；乏味的/r/n

word.name: annihilate
word.lx: Radio communication has annihilated space./r/n 无线电通讯已消除了空间的阻隔。/r/n The invasion force was annihilated./r/n 侵略军被消灭了。/r/n

word.name: annotate
word.lx: Some people annotate as they read./r/n 有的人一面读书一面做注解。/r/n

word.name: announce
word.mean:
v. 发表,广播（电台节目）,通告,正式宣布
vi. 当电台的播音员
vt. 宣布,宣告
word.lx: The news was announced by Radio Beijing./r/n 这条消息是由北京广播电台播发的。/r/n Everyone was silent as he announced the winner of the competition./r/n 当他宣布竞赛的优胜者时，大家都静静地倾听。/r/n

word.name: announcer
word.lx: She is an announcer in TV broadcast./r/n 她是电视台的一名主持人。/r/n The news announcer is standing by for the broadcast program at8./r/n 新闻广播员正在为八点钟的播音节目作好准备。/r/n

word.name: annoy
word.lx: I was annoyed at his intrusion./r/n 我对他的闯入感到生气。/r/n We can annoy the enemy by raids./r/n 我们可用袭击骚扰敌人。/r/n

word.name: annual
word.mean:
a. 每年的,年度的
n. 年刊,年鉴
word.lx: Many garden plants are annuals./r/n 许多观赏植物都是一年生的。/r/n How much is his annual salary?/r/n 他的年薪是多少？/r/n

word.name: anode
word.lx: An electron tube having a cathode and an anode./r/n 电子二极管有一个阳极和一个阴极的电子管/r/n The body or plate to which the electrons are attracted is called the anode./r/n 电子被吸引到其上面去的物体或薄板称为阳极。/r/n

word.name: anonymous
word.lx: An anonymous poet who flourished in the tenth century; painted when Impressionism was flourishing./r/n 一位活跃在10世纪的无名诗人；在印象主义最蓬勃的时期作画/r/n The author chooses to remain anonymous./r/n 作者愿不署名./r/n

word.name: answer
word.mean:
n. 答案,回答
v. 回答,符合
word.lx: Do you know the answer to this question?/r/n 你知道这道题的答案吗？/r/n He answered that he knew nothing about it./r/n 他答复说关于此事他一无所知。/r/n

word.name: antagonism
word.lx: You could sense the antagonism between them./r/n 你能觉察出他们之间有对立情绪./r/n The antagonism he felt towards his old enemy was still very strong./r/n 他对旧冤家的敌对情绪仍然很大./r/n

word.name: antarctic
word.mean:
a. 南极的
n. (the A-)南极洲,南极圈
word.lx: The scientist has spent six months in the solitudes of the Antarctic./r/n 这位科学家已经在人迹罕至的南极待了六个月了。/r/n Holidays in the Antarctic are a niche market./r/n 南极假日游是一个利基市场。/r/n

word.name: antecedent
word.mean:
n. 前情,先行词
a. 在...之前的,居先的

word.name: antenna
word.lx: You should fix the television antenna before receiving programs./r/n 接收节目前，你应该先装天线。/r/n Extended the radio antenna./r/n 把收音机的天线拉到最长/r/n

word.name: anthem
word.lx: Anthems are often with words taken from the Bible./r/n 圣歌的歌词多取自于《圣经》。/r/n The town band led off by playing the national anthem./r/n 市乐队以国歌开始他们的演奏。/r/n

word.name: anthology
word.lx: The anthology reveals a prejudice in favour of lyric poets./r/n 这部选集显示出对抒情诗人有所偏爱./r/n Something, such as a set of data, a report, or an anthology, that is compiled./r/n 汇编指编辑好的一套数据、一篇报道或一部选集/r/n

word.name: antibacterial
word.mean:
a. 抗菌的
n. 抗菌剂

word.name: antibiotic
word.mean:
a. 抗菌的
n. 抗生素
word.lx: Antibiotic can be used against infection./r/n 抗菌素可以用来防止感染。/r/n

word.name: antidote
word.lx: Do you have any antidote for a snakebite?/r/n 你有治疗毒蛇咬伤的解毒药吗？/r/n An antidote against poison, especially a confection formerly held to be an antidote to all poisons./r/n 解毒药解除毒性的解毒剂，尤指用来对付一切毒药的解毒膏/r/n

word.name: antique
word.mean:
a. 古代的
n. 古物,古董
word.lx: This jade dragon is a genuine antique./r/n 这件玉龙是真正的古玩。/r/n She wore an antique gown to the costume party./r/n 她穿着一件过时的长袍参加化妆舞会。/r/n

word.name: antiseptic
word.mean:
n. 杀菌剂,防腐剂
a. 杀菌的,防腐的
word.lx: Carbolic acid can be used to make antiseptic./r/n 石炭酸可用来做防腐剂。/r/n She gargle with an antiseptic mouthwash./r/n 她用具有消毒灭菌作用的漱口剂来清洁口腔。/r/n

word.name: antitoxin
word.lx: Antitoxin is substance that acts against a poisonous substance and prevents it from having a harmful effect./r/n 抗毒素是抵抗有毒物质并防止其产生有害作用的物质。/r/n

word.name: anus
word.lx: The absence or closure of a normal body orifice or tubular passage such as the anus, intestine, or external ear canal./r/n （先天性）闭锁，无孔正常的身体孔或管道，如肛门、肠或外耳道的缺失或闭合/r/n

word.name: anxiety
word.mean: n. 焦虑,挂念,担心,渴望,热望
word.lx: The anxieties of the past week had left her exhausted./r/n 上星期把她愁得没精打采。/r/n We waited for news with a growing sense of anxiety./r/n 我们等待着消息，越来越着急。/r/n

word.name: any
word.mean:
a. 任何的
ad. 稍
det. 一些
prep. 无论哪个
pron. 任何
word.lx: Any is better than none./r/n 有总胜于无。/r/n Take any book you like./r/n 你喜欢哪本书就拿哪本。/r/n

word.name: anybody
word.mean:
n. 重要人物
pron. 任何人
word.lx: He doubts if the officer is anybody./r/n 他怀疑这官员是个要人。/r/n Hardly anybody came./r/n 几乎没有人来./r/n

word.name: anything
word.lx: Is there anything for me?/r/n 有东西给我吗？/r/n If you remember anything at all, please let us know./r/n 你要是想起什么来，就告诉我们。/r/n

word.name: anyway
word.lx: The house was locked and I cannot get in anyway./r/n 屋子锁着，我无论如何也进不去。/r/n He reflected that the quality of the instruments was good anyway./r/n 他寻思，不管怎样，这些乐器的质量还是不错的。/r/n

word.name: apartment
word.lx: He lives in this apartment building./r/n 他住在这座公寓大楼内。/r/n They scouted around for some antiques to furnish their new apartment./r/n 他们到处搜罗一些古董来装饰新居。/r/n

word.name: ape
word.lx: The ape imitated our behavior./r/n 猿猴模仿我们的行为。/r/n Early man shows certain affinities with the ape./r/n 早期的人类和猿有某些相似之处./r/n

word.name: aperture
word.lx: The aperture in the door is so wide./r/n 门上的孔隙太大了。/r/n What aperture are you using?/r/n 你使用多大的光圈?/r/n

word.name: apologetic
word.mean: a. 道歉的,认错的,赔罪的

word.name: apologize
word.mean:
v. 道歉
vi. 道歉,谢罪
vt. 道歉,谢罪,辩白
word.lx: Apologize to your sister!/r/n 给你姐姐赔个不是!/r/n I must apologize for not being able to meet you./r/n 我因为没能接你而向你道歉./r/n

word.name: apology
word.mean: n. 道歉；勉强的替代物

word.name: appal
word.mean: v. 使...惊骇,使...惊恐,使...吓坏
word.lx: The prospect of another war appalled us./r/n 想到有可能发生另一场战争，我们不寒而栗。/r/n We were appalled when we heard that the chairman had been murdered./r/n 听说主席被谋杀，我们都吓坏了。/r/n

word.name: appalling
word.lx: Nothing can extenuate such appalling behavior./r/n 这种骇人听闻的行径罪不可恕。/r/n Nothing can extenuate such appalling behaviour./r/n 这种骇人听闻的行径罪无可恕./r/n

word.name: apparatus
word.lx: The television men have set up their apparatus./r/n 电视工作人员已经安装好了他们的器材。/r/n The astronauts have special breathing apparatus./r/n 宇航员有特殊的呼吸装置。/r/n

word.name: apparent
word.lx: It was apparent to all that he was guilty./r/n 众所周知，他是有罪的。/r/n She had many good qualities despite her apparent rudeness./r/n 她粗鲁是粗鲁, 但还有许多优秀品质./r/n

word.name: appeal
word.mean:
n. 恳求,上诉,吸引力
v. 求助,诉请,呼吁
word.lx: He was appealing for funds to build a new school./r/n 他在恳求拨款修建一所新学校。/r/n She appealed to the high court against her sentence./r/n 她不服判决而向高等法院上诉。/r/n

word.name: appear
word.lx: A truck appeared over the hill./r/n 一辆卡车在山丘上出现。/r/n Mr. Green had to appear before the committee to explain his behavior ./r/n 格林先生必须在委员会上出面解释他的行为。/r/n

word.name: appearance
word.lx: We should not judge a person by his appearance./r/n 我们不应该以貌取人。/r/n The journal makes its appearance once two months./r/n 这本刊物两个月出版一次。/r/n

word.name: append
word.mean:
v. 附加,添加,悬挂
n.[计算机] DOS 命令建立数据文件的子目录搜索路经
word.lx: Additional information appended to the manuscript, as of a book or an article./r/n 附言，续篇如一本书或一篇文章正文后的附加信息/r/n I append a list of those shops which sell our products./r/n 我附上一张出售我们产品的商店名单。/r/n

word.name: appendix
word.lx: This dictionary has several appendices./r/n 这本词典有几项附录。/r/n The doctor said the appendix is not important for us./r/n 那个大夫说阑尾对我们来说并不重要。/r/n

word.name: appetite
word.mean: n. 爱好,嗜好,食欲,胃口,欲望
word.lx: She is suffering from lack of appetite./r/n 她食欲不振。/r/n The long walk gave him a good appetite./r/n 长时间的走路使他食欲旺盛。/r/n

word.name: applaud
word.mean: v. 拍手喝采,称赞,赞同
word.lx: We all applaud you for your decision./r/n 我们一致赞成你的决定。/r/n He was loudly applauded./r/n 他受到热烈的掌声欢迎。/r/n

word.name: apple
word.lx: An apple is a kind of fruit./r/n 苹果是一种水果。/r/n The apple trees are blossoming./r/n 苹果树正在开花。/r/n

word.name: appliance
word.lx: These appliances are made of stainless iron./r/n 这些器具是用不锈钢制成的。/r/n There are many household appliances in this shop./r/n 这个商店有许多家用用具。/r/n

word.name: applicable
word.lx: Applicable to or characteristic of attorneys or their profession./r/n 律师的适用于律师或律师行业的，律师或律师行业的特点的/r/n Above rate applicable until further notice./r/n 除非另有通知，上述运费率适用。/r/n

word.name: applicant
word.lx: The enterprise is an applicant of this credit./r/n 这家企业是信用证的申请者。/r/n As the wages were low, there were few applicants for the job./r/n 因为工资低，没有什么人申请这份工作。/r/n

word.name: application
word.mean:
n. 申请
n. 应用软件程序
word.lx: The manager received twenty applications for the post./r/n 经理收到了二十份求职申请书。/r/n We made an application to the court for an inquiry./r/n 我们曾请求法院调查。/r/n

word.name: applied
word.mean:
a. 应用的
v. 应用,适用
vbl. 应用

word.name: apply
word.lx: In this way they can better apply theory to practice./r/n 这样他们就能更好地把理论运用到实践中去。/r/n I advise that they apply to the council for a home improvement grant./r/n 我建议他们向市政会申请改善住房的贷款。/r/n

word.name: appointment
word.lx: I have an appointment with my dentist this afternoon./r/n 我已约好今天下午去看牙医。/r/n He wants to change his appointment from Monday to Wednesday./r/n 他想把他的约会从星期一改到星期三。/r/n

word.name: apportion
word.lx: The department manager apportioned his men the duties for the week./r/n 部门经理把一星期的工作任务分配给他的下属。/r/n I apportioned half the property to each of them./r/n 我把财产的一半分配给他们各人。/r/n

word.name: appreciable
word.mean: a. 可感知的,可评估的
word.lx: A fracture or crack in a rock mass along which no appreciable movement has occurred./r/n 裂缝，裂口岩石块中的碎片或缝隙，在其周围未发生过可被觉察到的运动/r/n Appreciable changes in temperature./r/n 可察觉到的温度上的变化/r/n

word.name: appreciate
word.mean:
v. 欣赏,感激,赏识
v.　增值
v. 领会，充分意识
word.lx: We appreciate your helping us./r/n 我们感谢你们的帮助。/r/n We all appreciate a holiday after a year of hard working./r/n 经过一年辛苦工作之后，大家都能领略假期的乐趣。/r/n

word.name: apprehension
word.lx: He felt some apprehension over the result./r/n 他对结果有点担心。/r/n We waited for their decision with a great deal of apprehension./r/n 我们怀着极其焦虑的心情等待他们作出决定。/r/n

word.name: apprentice
word.mean:
n. 学徒
v. 使当学徒
word.lx: He is an apprentice plumber./r/n 他是个见习水管工人。/r/n The boy was apprenticed to a carpenter./r/n 这个男孩被送去学木匠./r/n

word.name: appropriate
word.mean:
a. 适当的
v. 拨出（款项）
word.lx: Plain, simple clothes are appropriate for school wear./r/n 简单朴素的衣服适合在学校里穿。/r/n The minister was found to have appropriated government money./r/n 部长被查出挪用了公款。/r/n

word.name: approve
word.lx: The city council approved the building plan./r/n 市议会批准了这项建筑计划。/r/n The equipment must be bought from a supplier approved by the company./r/n 设备必须从公司认可的供应商那里购买。/r/n

word.name: approximate
word.mean:
a. 大约的,近似的
v. 接近,约等于
word.lx: Your guess only approximates to the facts./r/n 你的猜测仅仅是接近事实。/r/n The color of the curtains approximates that of the rug./r/n 窗帘的颜色和地毯相近。/r/n

word.name: approximately
word.lx: The plane will be taking off in approximately five minutes./r/n 飞机大约五分钟后就起飞。/r/n At a time near to; at approximately/r/n 将近。。。的时候；大约在。。。/r/n

word.name: April
word.lx: He moved into this house in April./r/n 他是四月份搬进这所房子的。/r/n The manuscript bears the date 10 April 1937./r/n 手稿上注著1937年4月10日./r/n

word.name: apron
word.lx: My apron is so dirty that I have to wash it./r/n 我的围裙太脏了，我不得不洗它。/r/n Could you tie this apron round me?/r/n 你受累把围裙给我系上行吗?/r/n

word.name: aptitude
word.lx: He has an aptitude for languages./r/n 他具有学习语言的才能。/r/n Edison had a remarkable aptitude for inventing new things./r/n 爱迪生具有发明创造的非凡才能。/r/n

word.name: aquarium
word.mean: n. 水族馆,养鱼池,玻璃缸
word.lx: A large aquarium for the study or display of marine life./r/n 海洋水族馆研究或陈列海洋生物的巨大水族馆/r/n

word.name: aquatic
word.mean:
n. 水生动物,水草
a. 水生的,水中的,水上的

word.name: Arab
word.mean:
n. 阿拉伯人,阿拉伯马
a. 阿拉伯人的,阿拉伯的

word.name: Arabian
word.mean:
a. 阿拉伯(人)的
n. 阿拉伯人

word.name: Arabic
word.mean:
n. 阿拉伯语
a. 阿拉伯语的,阿拉伯人的,阿拉伯式的
word.lx: He demonstrated a mastery of Arabic./r/n 他显示了对阿拉伯语的精通。/r/n She needs to perfect her Arabic before going to work in Cairo./r/n 她需要把阿拉伯语学好才能到开罗工作./r/n

word.name: arbitrage
word.mean: n. 仲裁,套利交易,套汇

word.name: arbitrary
word.mean: a. 任意的,恣意的,专制的
word.lx: The choice of players for the team seems completely arbitrary./r/n 对队员的挑选似乎完全是主观决定的。/r/n Most presidents in this African country are arbitrary rulers./r/n 这个非洲国家的总统大多数是专横的统治者。/r/n

word.name: arch
word.mean:
n. 拱门,弓形
v. 成弓形弯曲,成弓形
word.lx: The cat arched its back in anger./r/n 那只猫气得拱起了腰。/r/n The bridge has three arches./r/n 这座桥有三座拱洞。/r/n

word.name: archaic
word.mean: a. 已废的,古老的,古代的
word.lx: An archaic word, phrase, idiom, or other expression./r/n 古词，古语古词、古短语、古习语或其它表达（形式）/r/n

word.name: architect
word.lx: Everyone is the architect of his own fortune./r/n 每个人都是自己命运的创造者。/r/n The boy made up his mind to become an excellent architect./r/n 这个男孩下定决心成为一个优秀的建筑师。/r/n

word.name: architecture
word.mean:
n. 建筑学, 建筑业
[总称]建筑物, 建筑风格
word.lx: The architecture of this house is very substantial./r/n 这座房子的结构很牢固。/r/n He obtained a diploma in architecture./r/n 他获得了建筑学的学位证书。/r/n

word.name: archive
word.mean:
n. 档案文件
n.（计算机压缩类软件的）压缩包
vt. 归档(编档保存)
word.lx: Place for permanent or long-term storage of data, from which retrieval is infrequent. A computer archive, for instance, may be on magnetic tape./r/n 用于永久或长期存储不常检索的数据的地点（介质）。例如，计算机的档案文件可放在磁带上。/r/n

word.name: ardent
word.mean: a. 热心的,激烈的,燃烧般的
word.lx: I am an ardent supporter of the local football team./r/n 我是本地足球队的球迷。/r/n She was ardent in her admiration of the artist./r/n 她非常倾慕那位艺术家。/r/n

word.name: area
word.mean: n. 地区,区域,面积,方面
word.lx: The farm is about 50 or 60 square kilometers in the area./r/n 这个农场的面积约为50 或60 平方公里。/r/n His special interest lies in the area of literature./r/n 他对文学领域特别感兴趣。/r/n

word.name: argue
word.mean: v. 争论,辩论,争吵,劝说
word.lx: The United States should, he argues, attempt to remain aloof./r/n 他认为，美国应保持超然态度。/r/n They argued the case for hours./r/n 他们就这个案子辩论了几个小时。/r/n

word.name: argument
word.mean: n. 辩论,争论,论据,理由
word.lx: We accepted the agreement without argument./r/n 我们毫无异议地接受了这一协议。/r/n There are strong arguments against these measures./r/n 有一些有力的论据反对这些措施。/r/n

word.name: arm
word.mean:
n. 手臂,袖子
v. 武装,装备
word.lx: Justice has long arms./r/n 天网恢恢，疏而不漏。/r/n They were not allowed to use arms./r/n 不许他们使用武器。/r/n

word.name: armchair
word.lx: This armchair is made of bamboo./r/n 这个扶手椅是用竹子做成的。/r/n The old man often sits in an armchair./r/n 这个老人经常坐在扶手椅子上。/r/n

word.name: armour
word.lx: His body was encased in shining armour./r/n 他全身披着明幌幌的甲胄。/r/n A hog in armour is still a hog./r/n 猪穿甲胄仍是猪。/r/n

word.name: arms
word.lx: The government intends to cut expenditure on arms./r/n 政府打算削减军备开支。/r/n They were not allowed to use arms./r/n 不许他们使用武器。/r/n

word.name: army
word.lx: He joined the army a year ago./r/n 一年以前，他参军了。/r/n The increasing army of the unemployed has attracted the attention of the economist./r/n 不断增长的失业大军引起了这名经济学家的关注。/r/n

word.name: around
word.mean:
ad. 大约,到处,在周围
prep. 在...周围
word.lx: My sister is around your age./r/n 我妹妹和你年龄相仿。/r/n He looked around but could see nobody./r/n 他四处望了一下，看不到什么人。/r/n

word.name: arouse
word.lx: Diana aroused them just before dawn./r/n 戴安娜在黎明前唤醒了他们。/r/n His sufferings aroused our sympathy./r/n 他的痛苦引起了我们的同情。/r/n

word.name: arrange
word.mean:
v. 安排,整理,排列
n. 安排,排列
word.lx: I have arranged that one of my staff will meet you at the airport./r/n 我已经安排好派一个职员到飞机场接你。/r/n I have arranged with him to meet at the restaurant./r/n 我和他约好在饭馆见面。/r/n

word.name: arrangement
word.lx: We have made all the arrangements for the conference./r/n 我们已做好会议的全部筹备工作。/r/n There was an arrangement of books in the window./r/n 窗口摆了一些书。/r/n

word.name: array
word.mean:
n. 数组,排列,陈列,大批,一系列
v. 排列,布署,打扮
word.lx: Banners are arrayed on the wall./r/n 墙上张挂着锦旗。/r/n People are all in holiday array./r/n 人们都穿着节日盛装。/r/n

word.name: arrest
word.mean:
n. 逮捕,监禁
v. 拘捕,妨碍,吸引
word.lx: The treatment arrested the growth of the disease./r/n 治疗抑制了病情的发展。/r/n The riot led to the arrest of three young men./r/n 暴乱导致3 个年轻人被捕。/r/n

word.name: arrival
word.lx: The secretary informed me of his arrival./r/n 秘书通知我他来了。/r/n Their unexpected arrival threw our plan into confusion./r/n 他们的突然到来打乱了我们的计划。/r/n

word.name: arrive
word.lx: Finally, they arrived at an agreement./r/n 他们最后终于达成了协议。/r/n We arrived home late./r/n 我们到家时晚了。/r/n

word.name: arrogant
word.lx: He is an arrogant man./r/n 他是一个自高自大的人。/r/n He often speaks in an arrogant tone./r/n 他经常以一种傲慢的口气说话。/r/n

word.name: arrow
word.mean:
n. 箭
v. 箭(头),射箭
word.lx: The airport is arrowed on the map./r/n 飞机场在地图上用箭头标出。/r/n He shot arrows one by one, but each missed./r/n 他射了一箭又一箭，但都未射中。/r/n

word.name: arsenal
word.mean:
n. 兵工厂, 军械库
n. 音译阿森那（英国－足球队名）
word.lx: Arsenals are factories that produce weapons./r/n 军工厂是生产武器的工厂。/r/n There is an arsenal in this city./r/n 这座城市有一个军工厂。/r/n

word.name: art
word.mean:
a. 美术(品)的,艺术(品)的
n. 艺术
word.lx: He had devoted his whole life to the study of contemporary art./r/n 他把他的一生都献给了当代艺术研究。/r/n He has a bent for art./r/n 他生性爱好艺术。/r/n

word.name: arthritis
word.lx: Gout is a form of arthritis./r/n 痛风是关节炎的一种。/r/n She was plagued with arthritis./r/n 她患关节炎十分痛苦./r/n

word.name: article
word.mean: n. 文章,物品,条款,冠词
word.lx: I am articled to a firm of lawyers./r/n 我受雇在一家律师公司做见习生。/r/n The newspaper article gave a graphic description of the earthquake./r/n 报纸文章生动地描述了地震的情况。/r/n

word.name: articulation
word.mean: n. 关节,接合,清晰发音
word.lx: As he drank more wine his articulation became worse./r/n 他又多喝了些酒, 口齿也就更不清楚了./r/n

word.name: artifacts
word.lx: Found echoes of past civilizations while examining artifacts in the Middle East./r/n 在调查中东的史前古器物时，发现了旧时文明的遗迹/r/n Fixed the date of the ancient artifacts./r/n 确定这件古代文化遗物的时间/r/n

word.name: artificially
word.mean: ad. 人工地,人为地,不自然地
word.lx: A naturally occurring or artificially produced radioactive element./r/n 放射性元素自然产生或人为制造的放射性元素/r/n

word.name: artillery
word.lx: Artillery fire caused heavy loss./r/n 炮火造成重大损失。/r/n The artillery did great execution./r/n 这种大炮的威力很大。/r/n

word.name: artist
word.lx: His dream of becoming an artist has been fulfilled./r/n 他成为一个艺术家的梦想实现了。/r/n She is a consummate artist./r/n 她是个技艺高超的艺术家。/r/n

word.name: artistic
word.lx: She is very artistic./r/n 她酷爱艺术。/r/n I talked to many artistic people: writers, dancers and filmmakers./r/n 我同许多艺术界的人们谈过话，其中有作家、 舞蹈家、电影制片人。/r/n

word.name: as
word.mean:
ad. 同样地,像
prep. 当做
conj. 当...之时,像...一样,因为
word.lx: It is just as you like./r/n 事情就如你喜欢的那样。/r/n He can run as fast as I can./r/n 他能跑得和我一样快。/r/n

word.name: ascend
word.lx: The airplane ascended higher and higher./r/n 飞机渐渐升高。/r/n The point of greatest intensity or force in an ascending series or progression; a culmination./r/n 顶点，最高点在上升的序列或过程中达到的最大强度或力量；极点/r/n

word.name: ascending
word.lx: Rising in the sky; ascending./r/n 上升的升到天空中的；上升的/r/n We watched the mists ascending from the valley below./r/n 我们看著薄雾从下面的山谷中升起./r/n

word.name: ascent
word.lx: Who was the first man to make an ascent in a balloon?/r/n 第一个乘气球升空的人是谁?/r/n The last part of the ascent is very steep./r/n 最后一段上坡路很陡。/r/n

word.name: ascertain
word.lx: The detective was trying to ascertain exactly who was at the party./r/n 这个侦探试图查明都有谁参加了聚会。/r/n I ascertain that he was murdered./r/n 我确定他是被谋杀的。/r/n

word.name: ASCII
word.lx: An ASCII control character, end of medium./r/n 一种ASCII码控制字符，媒体结束符。/r/n

word.name: ascribe
word.lx: This song is often ascribed to Bach./r/n 这首歌曲常被说成是巴赫做的。/r/n He ascribes his success to good luck./r/n 他把他的成功归功于幸运。/r/n

word.name: aseptic
word.lx: An aseptic smile./r/n 漠然的微笑/r/n

word.name: ashamed
word.lx: I was too ashamed to tell her that I had failed./r/n 我不好意思告诉她我不及格。/r/n He was ashamed that he had lied./r/n 他很惭愧他说了谎。/r/n

word.name: ashore
word.lx: He managed to swim ashore./r/n 他设法向岸边游过去。/r/n They have been ashore for two hours./r/n 他们上岸已经两个小时了。/r/n

word.name: Asia
word.lx: China is a developing country in Asia./r/n 中国是亚洲的发展中国家。/r/n This country used to be a British colony in Asia./r/n 这个国家曾是英国在亚洲的殖民地。/r/n

word.name: Asian
word.mean:
a. 亚洲的
n. 亚洲人
word.lx: That Asian stopped me and asked if I was Chinese./r/n 那个亚洲人拦住我，问我是不是中国人。/r/n How many Asian countries have taken part in the sport meeting?/r/n 有多少亚洲国家参加这次运动会？/r/n

word.name: aside
word.mean:
n. 旁白
ad. 在一边,另外
word.lx: The decision was set aside./r/n 决议被搁置。/r/n Please double up the chair and put it aside./r/n 请把椅子折起来放在一边。/r/n

word.name: ask
word.lx: May I ask a question?/r/n 我可以问一个问题吗？/r/n I have asked some friends for tea./r/n 我请了一些朋友来喝茶。/r/n

word.name: asleep
word.mean:
a. 睡熟了的,麻木的
ad. 熟睡地
word.lx: Her husband was sound asleep./r/n 她丈夫睡得很熟。/r/n The lion lay asleep in its den./r/n 狮子躺在洞里睡觉。/r/n

word.name: aspect
word.lx: The most terrifying aspect of nuclear bombing is radiation./r/n 核弹轰炸最可怕的一面是辐射。/r/n A young woman, of sullen aspect, was sitting alone on the bench./r/n 一个面色忧郁的年轻女人独自坐在长凳上。/r/n

word.name: aspiration
word.lx: She was filled with the aspiration to succeed in life./r/n 她渴望有所成就。/r/n The generalship was his aspiration./r/n 将官之职位是他梦寐以求的目标。/r/n

word.name: aspire
word.lx: He aspired to leadership even in his childhood./r/n 童年时代他就渴望当领袖。/r/n The young girl aspired to be a scientist./r/n 小女孩立志要做一名科学家。/r/n

word.name: aspirin
word.lx: He fought off the cold by taking aspirin./r/n 他服阿斯匹林来治疗感冒。/r/n The doctor told him to take two tablets of aspirin before every meal./r/n 医生告诉他每天饭前吃两片阿斯匹林。/r/n

word.name: assassination
word.lx: The assassination was successful./r/n 暗杀成功了。/r/n I saw the assassination and it got under my skin./r/n 我亲眼看见暗杀的情景，真令我毛骨悚然。/r/n

word.name: assemble
word.lx: The students assembled in the school garden./r/n 学生们在校园集合。/r/n The processing and assemble business is a component part of our foreign trade./r/n 加工和装配贸易是我国对外贸易的一个组成部分。/r/n

word.name: assembled
word.lx: The solider are all assembled with gaiters./r/n 士兵们全都绑着绑腿。/r/n The students assembled in the school garden./r/n 学生们在校园集合。/r/n

word.name: assembler
word.lx: In assembler programming, one or more operation represented by a combination of terms and paired parentheses./r/n 汇编程序设计中，用项和括号对的组合所代表的一个或多个操作。/r/n The output of an assembler./r/n 汇编程序的输出。/r/n

word.name: assembly
word.lx: People have the rights of assembly and expression./r/n 人们有集会和发表言论的权利。/r/n The production is greatly increased due to a new assembly line installed./r/n 由于安装了新装配线, 生产量大大提高。/r/n

word.name: assert
word.lx: She asserted that he was innocent./r/n 她断言，他是无罪的。/r/n We encouraged him to assert his view of the matter./r/n 我们鼓励他坚持自己对此事的看法。/r/n

word.name: assertion
word.lx: He spoke with assertion./r/n 他坚定地说。/r/n Such a questionable assertion is sure to provoke criticism./r/n 这种有问题的主张肯定会招致非议。/r/n

word.name: assessor
word.mean: n. 估计财产的人,确定税款的人

word.name: assign
word.mean:
v. 分配,指派
n.[计算机] DOS 命令将驱动器符重指向第二个驱动器符
word.lx: All the students are assigned to suitable jobs./r/n 所有的学生都分到了合适的工作。/r/n They assigned his odd behavior to his ill health./r/n 他们把他的古怪行为归因于健康不佳。/r/n

word.name: assigned
word.mean:
v. 分配(转让,把...归因于)
a. 给定的(赋予的,已知的)
word.lx: They assigned his odd behavior to his ill health./r/n 他们把他的古怪行为归因于健康不佳。/r/n The two large classrooms have been assigned to us./r/n 这两间大教室已经分配给我们了./r/n

word.name: assignment
word.mean: n. 分配,功课,任务,被指定的(课外)作业;(分派的)任务,委派
word.lx: He is the best man who can finish the assignment./r/n 他是能完成这项任务的最佳人选。/r/n He finished the assignment completely./r/n 他全面完成了分配的任务。/r/n

word.name: assimilate
word.lx: The USA has assimilated people from many different countries./r/n 美国已经同化了许多来自不同国家的人。/r/n Some foods are assimilated more easily than others./r/n 有些食物比另一些食物容易吸收。/r/n

word.name: assimilation
word.mean: n. 同化,同化作用,消化
word.lx: The assimilation of people in USA is common./r/n 在美国，人的同化很普遍。/r/n The assimilation of some foods is more easily than that of others./r/n 有些食物的吸收比另一些更容易。/r/n

word.name: assist
word.mean:
n. 帮助,协助
v. 协助
word.lx: A team of nurses assisted the doctor in performing the operation./r/n 一组护士协助医生施行手术。/r/n Relating to, assisting, or intended to assist the memory./r/n 帮助记忆的有关，帮助，或试图帮助记忆的/r/n

word.name: assistance
word.lx: Could you give us some assistance with this work?/r/n 你能就这项工作给我们一些帮助吗？/r/n Despite his cries no one came to his assistance./r/n 尽管他大声喊叫，却没有人来帮助他。/r/n

word.name: assistant
word.mean: 形：助理的；辅助的。名：助手助理；助教，店员
word.lx: The teacher said that he would like to choose an assistant among us./r/n 老师说他将要从我们中选一个人作他的助手。/r/n He deputed the running of the department to an assistant./r/n 他把部门的管理工作委托给助手了。/r/n

word.name: associate
word.mean:
n. 同伴,伙伴
v. 联合,联想
a. 副的
word.lx: She associated happiness with having money./r/n 她把幸福和有钱联想到一起。/r/n I got a new job and a new set of work associations./r/n 我有了新工作和一班新同事。/r/n

word.name: association
word.mean: n. 联合,结合,交往,协会,社团
word.lx: He is a member of the Association of University Teachers./r/n 他是大学教师联合会的一名成员。/r/n I benefited a lot from my association with him./r/n 我与他交往获益良多。/r/n

word.name: associative
word.mean: a. 联合的(相关的,协会的)

word.name: assorted
word.mean: a. 配合的,组合的,各色俱备的
word.lx: Demonstrators attacked the police, using sticks and assorted missiles./r/n 示威者用棍棒和各种投掷物攻击警察。/r/n He has always assorted with men of his age./r/n 他总是与和他年令相仿的人交往。/r/n

word.name: assortment
word.mean: n. 分类,配合,各色俱备之物
word.lx: There are wide assortments of gifts to choose from./r/n 那儿有各式各样的礼品可供选择。/r/n The shop has a rich assortment of goods./r/n 这个商店有各种各样的货品。/r/n

word.name: assume
word.lx: The problem has assumed a new form./r/n 这个问题又以新的形式出现。/r/n I assumed you can speak French fluently./r/n 我以为你能讲流利的法语。/r/n

word.name: assumed
word.lx: Taken for granted; assumed./r/n 想当然的；假定的/r/n The problem has assumed a new form./r/n 这个问题又以新的形式出现。/r/n

word.name: assumption
word.lx: The theory is based on a series of wrong assumptions./r/n 这一理论是以一系列错误的设想为依据的。/r/n Their assumptions of an air of confidence fooled nobody./r/n 他们装出信心十足的样子却欺骗不了任何人。/r/n

word.name: assurance
word.lx: They were waiting with assurance for me to discover the truth for myself./r/n 他们自信地等待我自己发现事实真相。/r/n Marked by assurance, as of success./r/n 以确信为特征的，如对成功的确信/r/n

word.name: assure
word.lx: I can assure you that your son will be happy here./r/n 我可以向你保证，你儿子在这里会很快乐的。/r/n We book early to assure ourselves of seats./r/n 我们及早订票以确保有座。/r/n

word.name: assured
word.mean:
a. 确实的,确定的
v. 保证,确实
vbl. 保证,确实
word.lx: She positively assured me that it was true./r/n 她向我明确地保证那是事实./r/n Having or showing confidence; assured./r/n 有信心的，显示信心的；确定的/r/n

word.name: asterisk
word.lx: The asterisked questions may be omitted./r/n 带星号的问题可以略去./r/n

word.name: astonish
word.lx: I was astonished at the news of his escape./r/n 听到他逃之夭夭的消息，我感到惊讶。/r/n She astonished me with her beautiful handwriting./r/n 她以其秀丽的书法而使我惊异。/r/n

word.name: astonishing
word.lx: The car rushed at the bridge at astonishing speed./r/n 汽车以惊人的速度向桥冲过去。/r/n How astonishing!/r/n 真惊人!/r/n

word.name: astound
word.lx: We were astounded to read your letter./r/n 我们看了你的信大吃一惊。/r/n The figures in that report astounded everyone./r/n 那份报告中的数字让每个人大吃一惊。/r/n

word.name: astute
word.lx: It is an astute move to sell just before price goes down./r/n 正好在价格下跌前脱手，真是精明之举。/r/n He is astute in business./r/n 他做生意精明。/r/n

word.name: asylum
word.lx: Here is an asylum for the care of mentally ill or destitute people./r/n 这儿是一家精神病院。/r/n The people ask for political asylum./r/n 人们请求政治避难。/r/n

word.name: athlete
word.lx: Most first-class footballers are natural athletes./r/n 多数一流的足球运动员都是天生的健将。/r/n She looks like an athlete./r/n 她看起来像运动员。/r/n

word.name: athletic
word.lx: He is an athletic-looking young man./r/n 他是一个体格健美的年轻人。/r/n The boy got in to the athletic school after a special test./r/n 男孩经过一次专门测验后进了体育学校。/r/n

word.name: Atlantic
word.mean:
a. 大西洋的
n. 大西洋
word.lx: It took them several days to cross the Atlantic Ocean./r/n 他们花了好几天的时间穿越大西洋。/r/n Who first navigated the Atlantic?/r/n 是谁首先横渡大西洋的?/r/n

word.name: atlas
word.lx: The atlas contains forty maps./r/n 这个地图集有四十幅地图。/r/n The atlas was published by our company./r/n 这个地图集是由我们公司出版的。/r/n

word.name: atom
word.lx: The tower was blown to atoms by the force of the explosion./r/n 爆炸的力量把塔炸得粉碎。/r/n Two atoms of hydrogen combine with one atom of oxygen to form a molecule of water./r/n 两个氢原子和一个氧原子结合而成一个水分子。/r/n

word.name: atomic
word.lx: The ship was sunk by an atomic submarine./r/n 这艘船是被一艘核潜艇击沉的。/r/n The atomic center is the nucleus, and the electronics winds revolve it./r/n 原子的中央是原子核，电子绕着它旋转。/r/n

word.name: attach
word.mean: v. 附上,系上,贴上,使依恋
word.lx: We are much attached to each other./r/n 我们之间感情深厚。/r/n He attached a label to his baggage./r/n 他往行李上贴了一个标签。/r/n

word.name: attack
word.mean:
n. 攻击,评击
v. 攻击,动手,疾病发作
word.lx: The enemy attacked us at night./r/n 敌人在夜里向我们进攻。/r/n It is reported that this disease attacks the central nervous system./r/n 据报道说这种疾病破坏中枢神经系统。/r/n

word.name: attain
word.lx: The country attained its independence in 1972./r/n 这个国家在1972年获得了独立。/r/n She pulls every string to attain the end./r/n 她想尽一切办法来达到目的。/r/n

word.name: attend
word.lx: Danger attended everything he did./r/n 他所做的每一件事都有危险。/r/n I shall be attending the meeting./r/n 我会参加会议。/r/n

word.name: attendance
word.lx: Attendance at school is demanded by law./r/n 法律规定儿童必须上学。/r/n At Easter, attendances at church rose./r/n 复活节期间，到教堂做礼拜的人多了。/r/n

word.name: attendant
word.mean:
a. 伴随的
n. 服务员
word.lx: The president gave the Prince and his attendants a farewell banquet./r/n 总统为王子和他的随员举行了告别宴会。/r/n I asked the attendant to conduct him to the door/conduct him out./r/n 我让服务员领他们到门口[领他出去]./r/n

word.name: attention
word.lx: She soon becomes the centre of attention./r/n 她很快成为大家注意的人物。/r/n You must pay attention to your teacher in the class./r/n 上课的时候必须专心听老师讲课。/r/n

word.name: attentive
word.lx: He is attentive to his little brother./r/n 他很关心他的小弟弟。/r/n You should be attentive to what your parents have said./r/n 你应该注意倾听父母所说的话。/r/n

word.name: attitude
word.lx: They sat around in easy attitude./r/n 他们以舒适的姿势围坐在一起。/r/n We must maintain a firm attitude./r/n 我们必须采取坚定的态度。/r/n

word.name: attorney
word.lx: He was selected as the district attorney./r/n 他被选为地方检察官。/r/n The attorney argue that the decision involve prejudice to his client./r/n 律师论辨说这一裁决侵害了他的委托人。/r/n

word.name: attract
word.lx: The flower show attracted large crowds this year./r/n 今年的花展吸引了大批观众。/r/n The government is trying to attract more investment into the shipbuilding industry./r/n 政府正在试图吸引更多资金投资到造船业方面来。/r/n

word.name: attraction
word.mean:
a. 有吸引力的
n. 吸引,吸引力
word.lx: The attraction of the moon for the earth causes the tides./r/n 月球对地球的吸引力造成潮汐。/r/n She felt a strong attraction to him./r/n 她感到他对她有强烈的吸引力。/r/n

word.name: attractive
word.mean: a. 有吸引力的,引起注意的
word.lx: The photo made him quite attractive./r/n 照片把他拍得相当英俊。/r/n She is pretty rather than attractive./r/n 她是漂亮，而不吸引人。/r/n

word.name: attributable
word.lx: His illness is attributable to overwork./r/n 他的病可归因于劳累过度。/r/n A failure in a device attributable to burning, excessive heat, or friction./r/n 烧毁，烧坏由于燃烧、超高热或摩擦引起的设备故障/r/n

word.name: auction
word.lx: We will put the car up for auction./r/n 我们将把这辆小车拍卖。/r/n The car is sold by auction./r/n 这辆小车被拍卖了。/r/n

word.name: audible
word.lx: Her voice was scarcely audible above the noise of the wind./r/n 在风中她的声音几乎听不见。/r/n Both audible and visible./r/n 视听的听觉的和视觉的/r/n

word.name: audience
word.lx: Someone in the audience began to laugh./r/n 观众中有人开始笑起来。/r/n He delighted the audience with his performance./r/n 他用他的表演使观众喜悦。/r/n

word.name: audio
word.mean: a. 成音频率的,声音的

word.name: audit
word.mean:
n. 查帐,审计
v. 审计,旁听

word.name: auditing
word.lx: The book has not yet been audited./r/n 这些帐册还未被审计。/r/n One that audits accounts./r/n 审计者审计帐务的人/r/n

word.name: auditorium
word.lx: The crowd overflowed the auditorium./r/n 人群挤得礼堂无法容纳。/r/n The auditorium was packed that night./r/n 这天晚上，礼堂里挤满了人。/r/n

word.name: augment
word.lx: He augments his income by teaching in the evenings./r/n 他晚上去教书以增加收入。/r/n Having the ability or tendency to augment./r/n 有增加或扩大作用的具有增加的能力或趋势的/r/n

word.name: August
word.mean:
n. 八月
a. 威严的,尊严的
word.lx: His summer vacation will end in the late August./r/n 他的暑假将于八月底结束。/r/n Tourism is at its peak in August./r/n 旅游业在八月份达到高峰。/r/n

word.name: aunt
word.lx: I often go to visit my aunt at weekends./r/n 我常在周末去看望我姑母。/r/n My elder sister had a baby last month, so I am an aunt now./r/n 我姐姐上个月生了孩子，所以我现在是阿姨了。/r/n

word.name: aural
word.lx: You can use these tapes as aural material./r/n 你可以把这些磁带当作听力材料。/r/n

word.name: Australia
word.lx: My foreign teacher came from Australia./r/n 我的外籍教师来自澳大利亚。/r/n He went to Australia and soon made a fortune./r/n 他去了澳洲, 很快就发了大财。/r/n

word.name: Australian
word.mean:
a. 澳大利亚的
n. 澳大利亚人

word.name: authentic
word.mean: a. 可靠的,可信的,真的,真正的
word.lx: Is that an authentic painting or a copy?/r/n 那幅画是原作还是复制品？/r/n Not genuine or authentic./r/n 不真的，不可靠的/r/n

word.name: author
word.mean:
n. 作者
vt. 创造,写作
word.lx: Dickens is his favorite author./r/n 狄更斯是他最喜欢的作家、/r/n The author seems to strain after novelty./r/n 作者似乎在力图标新立异。/r/n

word.name: authoritarian
word.mean: a. 独裁的,独裁主义的
word.lx: An authoritarian regime./r/n 独裁主义的政府/r/n An official or authoritarian declaration; a proclamation or an edict./r/n 宣言，公告官方或权威性的宣布；公告或法令/r/n

word.name: authority
word.lx: My parents think that the contemporary young people have no respect for authority./r/n 我父母认为现在的年轻人不尊重权威。/r/n The government is the highest authority in the country./r/n 政府是国家的最高权力机构。/r/n

word.name: automatic
word.mean:
n. 自动的机器
a. 自动的,无意识的
word.lx: We get an automatic increase in pay every year./r/n 我们的薪金每年会自动增长。/r/n This heating system has an automatic temperature control./r/n 这个暖气系统有自动化的温度调节系统。/r/n

word.name: automatically
word.mean:
a. 不经思索的
ad. 自动地
word.lx: Once installed, this heater operates automatically./r/n 一旦安装好以后，这加热器就会自动地运行。/r/n The supermarket doors shut automatically./r/n 超级市场的门是自动关的./r/n

word.name: automation
word.lx: Automation by means of computers./r/n 借助计算机而实现自动化。/r/n Semiconductors are going to play an important part in automation and signalling./r/n 半导体在自动化和信号上面即将起着重要作用。/r/n

word.name: automaton
word.lx: One who looks or behaves like an automaton./r/n 木讷呆板的人长相和行为象机器人一样的人/r/n

word.name: automobile
word.lx: There will be an exhibition of the development of automobile industry in our country next week./r/n 下星期将举办一个关于我国汽车工业发展的展览。/r/n He huddled the children into the automobile./r/n 他急急忙忙地把孩子们推进汽车。/r/n

word.name: autonomy
word.lx: The separatist is demanding full autonomy for their state./r/n 分裂主义者在要求他们的州完全自治。/r/n If we decentralize, the provinces will have more autonomy./r/n 我们把权力下放, 各省就有更多的自主权./r/n

word.name: autumn
word.lx: I think autumn is the most beautiful season in a year./r/n 我认为秋天是一年中最美的季节。/r/n You are invited to view our autumn collection./r/n 您被邀请参观我们的秋季时装展览。/r/n

word.name: auxiliary
word.mean:
n. 帮助者,辅助物,助动词
a. 附加的,辅助的
word.lx: We have an auxiliary generator in case of power cuts./r/n 我们有一台万一断电时使用的备用发电机。/r/n She is an auxiliary nurse./r/n 她是一名助理护士。/r/n

word.name: avail
word.lx: Such a statement will not avail./r/n 这样的声明没有什么用。/r/n This medicine is of no avail./r/n 这药无效。/r/n

word.name: availability
word.lx: Pertaining to the availability of a resource for more than one user at the same time./r/n 用于修饰或说明一种资源在同一时刻可供给多个用户使用的可用性。/r/n

word.name: available
word.lx: The Prime Minister was not available for comment./r/n 首相无暇作出评论。/r/n This was the only available room./r/n 只剩下那个房间可用了。/r/n
