word.name: avalanche
word.lx: What a precarious situation we were in when the avalanche started!/r/n 雪崩发生的时候我们的处境多么危险啊！/r/n He was buried by an avalanche and had to be dug out./r/n 他遇雪崩被埋住了，得把他挖出来。/r/n

word.name: avenue
word.lx: The avenues of the area were crowded with visitors./r/n 这个地区的大街上挤满了参观的人群。/r/n They exploded every avenue but could not find a solution./r/n 他们探索过各种途径，但是没有找到解决的办法。/r/n

word.name: avert
word.lx: She averted her eyes from the terrible sight./r/n 她转移目光不看那可怕的情景。/r/n He managed to avert suspicion./r/n 他设法避嫌。/r/n

word.name: avoid
word.mean:
v. 避免
vt. 避免,逃避
word.lx: The boy avoided punishment by running away./r/n 那个男孩逃跑来逃避惩罚。/r/n She tried to avoid answering my questions./r/n 她试图避而不答我的问题。/r/n

word.name: await
word.lx: A warm welcome awaits you./r/n 你将受到热烈的欢迎。/r/n I am awaiting their reply./r/n 我正在等待他们的答复。/r/n

word.name: aware
word.lx: We are fully aware of the gravity of the situation./r/n 我们十分清楚形势的严峻性。/r/n Are you aware that you are sitting on my hat?/r/n 你知道你坐在我的帽子上了吗？/r/n

word.name: away
word.lx: I hope to get away early in the morning./r/n 我希望一早就动身离开。/r/n He lives 3 miles away from here./r/n 他住在离这里三哩的地方。/r/n

word.name: awe
word.lx: The children stared at the teacher with awe./r/n 孩子很敬畏地凝视着老师。/r/n The silence awed the boy./r/n 寂静使这个小男孩害怕了。/r/n

word.name: awful
word.lx: It was awful to see him in such pain./r/n 看到他这样痛苦真叫人难过。/r/n It would be awful if he found out the truth./r/n 如果他发现了真相，那就糟了。/r/n

word.name: awkward
word.mean:
a. 笨拙的
a. 尴尬的
word.lx: At the formal party I felt very awkward and out of place./r/n 在正式的舞会上，我感到局促不安，很不自在。/r/n Your refusal puts me in an awkward predicament./r/n 你的拒绝让我感到十分为难。/r/n

word.name: ax
word.mean:
n. 斧子
vt. 用斧砍
word.lx: Five hundred jobs were axed as a result of government spending cuts./r/n 由于政府缩减经费的缘故，有五百人被突然解雇了。/r/n Several of our plans got the ax when the new government came in./r/n 新政府上台后，我们有几个计划被砍掉了。/r/n

word.name: axe
word.mean:
n. 斧
vt. 用斧砍
word.lx: Five hundred jobs were axed as a result of government spending cuts./r/n 由于政府缩减经费的缘故，有五百人被突然解雇了。/r/n Several of our plans got the axe when the new government came in./r/n 新政府上台后，我们有几个计划被砍掉了。/r/n

word.name: bachelor
word.lx: I have a bachelor degree./r/n 我有学士学位。/r/n He is still a bachelor./r/n 他还是一个单身汉。/r/n

word.name: back
word.mean:
a. 后面的
v. 后退
ad. 向后地
n.后背,背脊
word.lx: John plays back in the team./r/n 约翰在这个队打后卫。/r/n Three people can sit in the back of this car./r/n 这车的后座可坐3个人。/r/n

word.name: backbone
word.lx: These men are the backbone of the country./r/n 这些人是国家的中坚力量。/r/n He has no backbone./r/n 他没有骨气。/r/n

word.name: backdrop
word.lx: The movable screen or drape in a theater or hall that separates the stage from the auditorium or that serves as a backdrop./r/n 幕布在剧院或大厅内隔开舞台和观众或作为背景幕的可移动遮蔽物或帷幕/r/n

word.name: background
word.lx: He stayed in the background to escape from the public attention./r/n 他呆在幕后为了避开公众的注意。/r/n He has a working-class background./r/n 他是工人阶级出身。/r/n

word.name: backlog
word.mean:
n. 积累(积压待办事项)
vi. 把...积压起来

word.name: backup
word.mean:
n. 后援
v. 把...做备份
n.[计算机] DOS命令 : 备份, 将文件从一个磁盘复制到另一个磁盘上

word.name: backward
word.mean:
a. 向后的
ad. 向后
word.lx: He looked backward over his shoulder./r/n 他回头向后看。/r/n Although he is clever, he is backward in giving his views./r/n 他虽然很聪明，却不善发表他的意见。/r/n

word.name: backwards
word.mean:
a. 落后的,向后的
ad. 向后
word.lx: Things are going backwards./r/n 凡事都在退步。/r/n She drove the car backwards carefully./r/n 她小心地向后倒车。/r/n

word.name: bacon
word.lx: I saved my bacon by arriving just in time for the meeting./r/n 我刚好及时到会，才算没受责备。/r/n The bacon is all frizzled up!/r/n 腌肉都煎糊了!/r/n

word.name: bacteria
word.lx: Many diseases are caused by bacteria./r/n 许多疾病是由细菌引起的。/r/n Bacteria are too small to see with the naked eye./r/n 细菌太小，肉眼看不见。/r/n

word.name: badge
word.lx: He was awarded a merit badge for his bravery in the battle./r/n 他因为在战斗中的勇猛被授予一枚奖章。/r/n What is that badge on your lapel?/r/n 你翻领上的是什麽徽章?/r/n

word.name: badly
word.mean: ad. 严重地,恶劣地,极度地
word.lx: He was wounded badly./r/n 他伤得很厉害。/r/n She wants the doll badly./r/n 她非常想要这个洋娃娃。/r/n

word.name: badminton
word.lx: I like to play badminton in my spare time./r/n 我喜欢在闲暇时打羽毛球。/r/n We go to play badminton in the nearest gym every Sunday./r/n 每个星期天我们都去最近的体育馆打羽毛球。/r/n

word.name: baffle
word.lx: The beautiful scenery baffles description./r/n 这美丽的景色难以形容。/r/n The question baffled me completely and I could not answer./r/n 这个问题把我彻底难倒了，我答不出来。/r/n

word.name: bag
word.mean:
n. 包
v. 把...装入袋中,猎杀,占有
vt. 把...装进袋子
word.lx: We had a good bag that day./r/n 那天我们猎获甚多。/r/n He lost his travelling bag when he crossed the desert./r/n 他在穿越沙漠的时候丢失了他的旅行袋。/r/n

word.name: baggage
word.lx: The baggage will be delivered to you at the station./r/n 行李将在车站交给你。/r/n Our baggage has cleared customs./r/n 我们的行李已通过海关检查./r/n

word.name: bail
word.mean:
n. 保释,把手,杓
v. 保释,汲水
word.lx: The boat will sink unless we bail out./r/n 我们要不把积水清除掉，船就要沉了。/r/n The magistrate refused his bail./r/n 地方法官不准他保释。/r/n

word.name: bait
word.mean:
n. 饵
v. 以饵引诱
word.lx: Earth worms are often used as bait./r/n 蚯蚓常用作鱼饵。/r/n The steaming cake was a bait for the hungry boy./r/n 那热气腾腾的蛋糕对这个饥饿的男孩是个诱惑。/r/n

word.name: bake
word.lx: In some places, bricks are still baked in the sun./r/n 有些地方仍使用在太阳下晒干砖块的方法。/r/n The bread is baking in the oven./r/n 烤箱里正在烤面包。/r/n

word.name: baker
word.lx: The baker gave the little girl one more bread to please her./r/n 面包师多给了小女孩一个面包来取悦她。/r/n The baker empty several bags of flour into a bin./r/n 面包师把几袋面粉倒入贮藏箱里。/r/n

word.name: bakery
word.lx: I must go to the bakery and pick up some rolls and cake./r/n 我必须到面包店买些面包和蛋糕。/r/n A bakery specializing in French pastry./r/n 专制法国点心的面包店/r/n

word.name: balance
word.mean:
n. 天平,平衡,差额
v. 平衡
word.lx: The girl lost her balance and fell off the balance beam./r/n 小女孩失去了平衡，从平衡木上摔了下来。/r/n The dolphin balanced the ball on its nose./r/n 海豚用鼻子顶着球，使其保持平衡。/r/n

word.name: balcony
word.lx: A balcony is a platform with a wall./r/n 阳台是有墙的平台。/r/n I always do some exercise on the balcony./r/n 我经常在阳台上做些锻炼。/r/n

word.name: bald
word.lx: He took off the hat and revealed his bald head./r/n 他脱下帽子，露出秃头。/r/n We planted some trees on the bald hill./r/n 我们在一座秃山上种了些树。/r/n

word.name: ball
word.mean:
n. 球,舞会
vt. 把...捏成球状
word.lx: She rolled the socks into a ball./r/n 她把袜子卷成一团。/r/n How did you enjoy the ball?/r/n 你们在舞会上玩得高兴吗？/r/n

word.name: ballet
word.lx: She invited us to see the ballet./r/n 她邀请我们去看芭蕾舞。/r/n His wife is a ballet dancer./r/n 他妻子是一位芭蕾舞演员。/r/n

word.name: ballooning
word.lx: They like to go ballooning at weekends./r/n 他们周末喜欢乘气球玩./r/n Who was the first man to make an ascent in a balloon?/r/n 第一个乘气球升空的人是谁?/r/n

word.name: ballot
word.lx: He was elected by ballot./r/n 他是由无记名投票选举的。/r/n We should put it to a ballot./r/n 我们应该对此进行无记名投票。/r/n

word.name: bamboo
word.mean:
a. 用竹子制的
n. 竹
word.lx: New buildings sprang up like bamboo shoots after a spring rain./r/n 新的建筑物如雨后春笋般大批出现。/r/n This armchair is made of bamboo./r/n 这个扶手椅是用竹子做成的。/r/n

word.name: ban
word.mean:
n. 禁令
v. 禁止
vt. 禁止,取缔
word.lx: The people ask for a ban-the-bomb./r/n 人门要求禁止使用核武器。/r/n The government has banned the use of chemical weapons./r/n 政府已经禁止使用化学武器。/r/n

word.name: banana
word.lx: The banana is her favorite fruit./r/n 香蕉是她最喜欢的水果。/r/n A banana is mainly pulp, except for its skin./r/n 香蕉除了果皮之外，主要是果肉。/r/n

word.name: band
word.mean:
n. 带子,队,乐队
v. 联合,结合
word.lx: The children banded together to buy a present for their teacher./r/n 孩子们合起来为他们的老师买了一件礼物。/r/n A band of robbers held up the train./r/n 一群强盗抢劫了火车。/r/n

word.name: bandage
word.lx: The wound was bound up by bandage./r/n 伤口用绷带包扎着。/r/n The nurse eased the bandage off from the wound./r/n 护士轻轻地把绷带从伤口上取下来。/r/n

word.name: bandit
word.lx: People hate bandits greatly./r/n 人们非常痛恨盗匪。/r/n These bandits were arrested several days ago./r/n 几天前，这些歹徒被逮捕了。/r/n

word.name: bandwidth
word.mean: n. 频带宽度(通带宽度)

word.name: bang
word.mean:
n. 重击,突然巨响,刘海
v. 发巨响,重击,剪成刘海
ad. 砰然地,突然巨响地,直接地
word.lx: The door shut with a bang./r/n 门砰的一声关上了。/r/n He fell and banged his knee./r/n 他跌倒了，膝盖重重撞了一下。/r/n

word.name: banish
word.lx: He was banished from the realm./r/n 他被驱逐出境。/r/n The spy was dishonourably banished from, the land./r/n 那个间谍被不光彩地驱逐出境。/r/n

word.name: bank
word.lx: I bank with Bank of Communications./r/n 我在交通银行存款。/r/n The organ has two banks of keys./r/n 那架风琴有两排键盘。/r/n

word.name: banker
word.lx: He abhors this banker./r/n 他厌恶这个银行家。/r/n The hard-fisted banker refused to lend Mr Jackson more money for his business./r/n 那位小气的银行家拒绝为杰克逊先生的生意贷更多地款。/r/n

word.name: banking
word.lx: Banking faces much competition nowadays./r/n 如今，银行业面临许多竞争。/r/n He will choose banking as his career./r/n 他将选择银行业做为职业。/r/n

word.name: bankrupt
word.mean:
a. 破产的
n. 破产者
v. 使破产
word.lx: I was bankrupt and unable to pay his debts./r/n 我破产了，不能偿还他的债务。/r/n That company made him bankrupt./r/n 是那家公司让他破产的。/r/n

word.name: bankruptcy
word.lx: The bank of bankruptcy is investigated by the court./r/n 那家破产的银行正被法院调查。/r/n Ten bankruptcies were recorded in this town last year./r/n 去年这个镇已有十起破产事件。/r/n

word.name: banner
word.lx: The patriots fought under the banner of freedom./r/n 爱国者在自由的旗帜下战斗。/r/n The banner lent color to the streets./r/n 旗帜给街道增添了色彩。/r/n

word.name: banquet
word.mean:
n. 宴会
vi. 宴请
vt. 宴会,设宴
word.lx: We gave him a farewell banquet yesterday./r/n 我们昨天为他举行了告别宴会。/r/n He met the foreign friends and gave a banquet in their honour./r/n 他会见了外国朋友，并设宴招待了他们。/r/n

word.name: bar
word.mean:
n. 条,棒,横木,酒吧
v. 禁止,阻挠
word.lx: After the bombing, the whole area was barred to the public./r/n 轰炸后，整个地区禁止公众通行。/r/n There are several bars in the hotel./r/n 这家旅馆里有好几个酒吧。/r/n

word.name: barbecue
word.mean:
n. 烤肉
v. 烤肉
word.lx: The sunshine bodes well for our barbecue./r/n 明媚的阳光对我们的烤肉野餐是个吉兆。/r/n Want to join us for a barbecue?/r/n 想同我们一起去烧烤野餐吗?/r/n

word.name: bare
word.mean:
a. 赤裸的,极少的
v. 使赤裸,露出
word.lx: The dog bared its teeth./r/n 狗露出了牙齿。/r/n Just give us the bare facts of the case./r/n 你只要向我们提供案件最低限度的事实真相就行。/r/n

word.name: barely
word.lx: The room was furnished barely./r/n 这房间陈设简陋。/r/n We had barely enough money to last through the weekend./r/n 我们的钱只能勉强维持到周末。/r/n

word.name: bargain
word.mean:
n. 交易,买卖,物美价廉的东西
v. 议价,交易,讨价还价
word.lx: He made a satisfactory bargain with them./r/n 他和他们做了一笔满意的交易。/r/n He bargained with them for the property./r/n 他就财产与他们进行商议。/r/n

word.name: bark
word.mean:
n. 树皮
v. 吠,叫
word.lx: Those trees have very beautiful white bark./r/n 那些树长着非常漂亮的白色树皮。/r/n The dog barked when the stranger came near./r/n 当陌生人走近时，狗叫了起来。/r/n

word.name: barn
word.lx: The wind unroofed the barn./r/n 风掀掉了谷仓的顶。/r/n The cows were feeding on hay in the barn./r/n 母牛正在牲口棚里吃乾草呢./r/n

word.name: barometer
word.lx: The barometer began to fall./r/n 气压计的读数开始下降。/r/n A recording barometer./r/n 自动记录的气压计/r/n

word.name: barrel
word.mean:
n. 枪管,炮管,桶
vi. 快速移动
vt. 把...装桶
word.lx: He bought a barrel of beer./r/n 他买了一桶啤酒。/r/n Tilt the barrel forward to empty it./r/n 把桶向前倾, 倒出里面的东西./r/n

word.name: barricade
word.lx: The soldiers stormed the barricades erected by the rioting crowd./r/n 士兵们向暴乱分子设置的街垒发起了猛攻./r/n They barricaded themselves in (their rooms)./r/n 他们把自己关在（自己的屋子）里面./r/n

word.name: barrier
word.mean:
n. 界线,屏障,障碍物
v. 以屏障隔开
word.lx: The horse took the barrier easily./r/n 那匹马轻松地越过了障碍。/r/n Heavy duties on imports and exports are a barrier to international trade./r/n 进出口的高关税是国际贸易的障碍。/r/n

word.name: barter
word.mean:
n. 物物交换,实物交易
v. 物物交换,交换
word.lx: The prisoners tried to barter with the guards for their freedom./r/n 囚犯们企图和看守做换取自由的交易。/r/n On these islands a system of barter is used./r/n 在这些岛上仍然实行着物物交换的制度。/r/n

word.name: base
word.mean:
n. 基底,垒
v. 以...作基础
word.lx: Many languages have Latin as their base./r/n 许多语言都以拉丁语为基础。/r/n How many military bases are they maintaining on foreign soil?/r/n 他们在外国保持多少个军事基地？/r/n

word.name: baseball
word.lx: Baseball is the national game of the USA./r/n 棒球是美国全民喜爱的运动。/r/n Rain interrupted our baseball game./r/n 下雨中断了我们的捧球比赛/r/n

word.name: basement
word.lx: In the basement water streams down the walls./r/n 在地下室里，水顺着墙不断地流下来。/r/n Pump out a flooded basement./r/n 把地下室里的水抽干/r/n

word.name: basic
word.mean:
n. 基本,要素
a. 基本的,碱性的
[计] BASIC语言, 基本高级语言
word.lx: These requirements are absolutely basic to a good relationship./r/n 这些条件是良好的关系必不可少的。/r/n A knowledge of her upbringing is basic to an understanding of her books./r/n 知道她成长的背景是理解她著作的基础。/r/n

word.name: basin
word.lx: He washed his hands in a basin./r/n 他在盆里洗了手。/r/n He first poured some water in the basin./r/n 他先在脸盆里倒了一些水。/r/n

word.name: basis
word.lx: On the basis of our sales forecasts, we may begin to make a profit next year./r/n 基于我们销售情况的预测，我们明年将开始赚钱。/r/n We drew this conclusion on the basis of experiments./r/n 我们是在试验的基础上得出这个结论的。/r/n

word.name: basket
word.lx: Several baskets of fruit were eaten at the party./r/n 宴会上，大家吃掉了好几篮水果。/r/n He made 48 baskets in the game last night./r/n 他在昨晚的比赛中独得了48分。/r/n

word.name: basketball
word.lx: Do you like playing basketball?/r/n 你喜欢打篮球吗？/r/n We sat there watching basketball./r/n 我们坐在那看篮球比赛。/r/n

word.name: bass
word.lx: He has formed a new band with his brother on bass./r/n 他组织了一个新乐队，由他弟弟弹低音吉他。/r/n The bass soloist was in excellent voice./r/n 这个男低音独唱演员这次唱出了高水平./r/n

word.name: bat
word.mean:
n. 蝙蝠,球棒
n.[计算机] DOS文件名 : 批文件
word.lx: Bats fly at night and feed on insects./r/n 蝙蝠在夜间飞行，以昆虫为食。/r/n He batted the idea around in his head./r/n 他脑子里反复思考这个想法。/r/n

word.name: batch
word.mean:
n. 一次所烘的面包,一次所制之量,一组
n.批, 成批, 分批
word.lx: In batch or remote batch entry, a job or job step./r/n 在批处理或远程批处理输入中的一个作业或作业步。/r/n The second batch of sugar is better than the first./r/n 第二批制成的糖比第一批好。/r/n

word.name: bath
word.mean:
巴斯(英国城市),洗澡,浴盆
v. 洗澡,给…洗澡
word.lx: He takes a cold bath every day./r/n 他每天洗一个冷水澡。/r/n I shall have a hot bath and go to bed./r/n 我要去洗个热水澡，然後睡觉。/r/n

word.name: bathe
word.lx: The nurses were bathing the babies./r/n 护士正在给婴儿洗澡。/r/n This river is dangerous to bathe in./r/n 在这河里游泳危险。/r/n

word.name: bathroom
word.lx: Every room in the hotel has a private bathroom./r/n 旅馆中的每个房间都有一个单独浴室。/r/n There are two bathrooms in my house./r/n 我们家有两个浴室。/r/n

word.name: batter
word.mean:
n. 打击手
v. 打坏
word.lx: Someone is battering at the door./r/n 有人在使劲敲门。/r/n The ship was battered against the rocks./r/n 船被岩石撞坏了。/r/n

word.name: battery
word.lx: Most torches work on two batteries./r/n 大多数电筒要用两节电池。/r/n They are electrifying the battery./r/n 他们正给电池充电。/r/n

word.name: battle
word.lx: The two fighters battled for half an hour./r/n 两个拳击手战斗了半小时。/r/n They died in the Battle of Waterloo./r/n 他们战死于滑铁卢战役。/r/n

word.name: bay
word.lx: In the library, the books on history are all kept in one bay./r/n 在图书馆里，历史方面的书都放在同一隔间里。/r/n The hounds were baying as they followed the escaped prisoner./r/n 猎狗在追赶逃犯时不时地咆哮着。/r/n

word.name: be
word.lx: He has been there at least twice./r/n 他至少去过那儿两次。/r/n The concert will be in the school hall./r/n 音乐会将在学校的礼堂内举行。/r/n

word.name: beach
word.mean:
n. 海滩
v. 拖(船)上岸
vt. 使船冲上滩
word.lx: They walked along the beach talking and laughing./r/n 他们说说笑笑，沿着海滩散步。/r/n He went down to the beach for a swim./r/n 他去海滩游泳了。/r/n

word.name: beacon
word.lx: These beacons on the coast are to warn and guide ships./r/n 这些海滩上的信号灯是用来提醒和指示船舶的。/r/n This is a beacon to help aircraft discover their position./r/n 这个闪光灯是帮助飞机确定位置的。/r/n

word.name: bead
word.lx: The hat was decorated with colored beads./r/n 那顶帽子上饰有彩色珠子。/r/n He took a bead on the hare and then fired./r/n 他瞄准了野兔，然后开枪。/r/n

word.name: beam
word.mean:
n. 光线,电波,横梁,容光焕发
v. 微笑,闪亮
word.lx: She beamed at me./r/n 她对我微笑。/r/n We enjoy seeing the glorious beams of the rising sun./r/n 我们喜欢观赏初升太阳的灿烂光辉。/r/n

word.name: beans
word.lx: She put some beans into water to germinate./r/n 她把一些豆子放在水中让它们发芽。/r/n Coffee beans are the seeds of coffee plants./r/n 咖啡豆是咖啡树的果实。/r/n

word.name: bear
word.mean:
n. 熊
v. 忍受,负荷
v. 结果实,生子女
word.lx: He was born in May./r/n 他是五月份出生的。/r/n Her husband is such a bear that nobody likes him./r/n 她丈夫很粗暴，没人喜欢他。/r/n

word.name: beard
word.lx: He bearded his boss and demanded an explanation./r/n 他公然蔑视上司，并要求他作出解释。/r/n He has a beard./r/n 他长着胡子。/r/n

word.name: bearing
word.lx: Her dignified bearing throughout the trial made everyone believe she was innocent./r/n 在整个审讯的过程中，她那端庄的举止使得每个人都相信她是无辜的。/r/n We must consider this question in all its bearings./r/n 我们因该考虑到问题的各方面。/r/n

word.name: beast
word.lx: The lion is called the king of beasts./r/n 狮子号称百兽之王。/r/n Stop goading the poor beast!/r/n 别再驱赶那可怜的动物了！/r/n

word.name: beat
word.mean:
n. 打,敲打声,拍子
v. 打,打败
word.lx: His father beat the disobedient boy./r/n 他的父亲打那个不听话的男孩。/r/n We heard the beat of the drum./r/n 我们听到鼓声。/r/n

word.name: beautiful
word.lx: Looking at a beautiful painting always gives one satisfaction./r/n 观赏一幅美丽的图画使人心满意足。/r/n The prince lived in a large and beautiful castle./r/n 王子住在一个美丽的大城堡里。/r/n

word.name: beauty
word.mean: n. 美,美丽,美人,美的东西
word.lx: She is a beauty./r/n 她是一个美人。/r/n We enjoyed the beauty of nature./r/n 我们欣赏大自然的美。/r/n

word.name: because
word.lx: They hurried on because it was getting dark./r/n 因为天色暗下来了，他们匆匆赶路。/r/n I knew she was joking because she had a big grin on her face./r/n 我知道她是在开玩笑，因为她脸上堆满笑容。/r/n

word.name: become
word.mean:
v. 变成,变得
vbl. 变得
word.lx: This new dress becomes you./r/n 这件新衣服很合你身。/r/n The weather became warmer./r/n 天气变暖和了。/r/n

word.name: bed
word.mean:
n. 床
v. 安置,把...栽入苗床
word.lx: Can you give me a bed for the night?/r/n 你能给我安置一个床铺过夜吗？/r/n These young plants will soon be ready for bedding in borders./r/n 这些幼苗不久将栽到花坛中去。/r/n

word.name: bedroom
word.lx: She decorated her bedroom with flowers./r/n 她用鲜花装饰卧室。/r/n My bedroom is just above./r/n 我的卧室就在上面。/r/n

word.name: bee
word.lx: He has a bee in his bonnet about health foods./r/n 他对于保健食品有他自己的一套奇怪的看法。/r/n That bee gave me a nasty sting./r/n 那只蜜蜂狠狠地蜇了我一下./r/n

word.name: beep
word.lx: The computer beeps regularly./r/n 计算机发出有规律的哔哔声./r/n

word.name: beeper
word.mean: n. 导弹遥控员(雷达遥控装置)
word.lx: Do you have a beeper?/r/n 你有呼机吗？/r/n

word.name: beer
word.lx: I like drinking beer./r/n 我喜欢喝啤酒。/r/n Two glasses of cider and a beer, please./r/n 请来两杯苹果酒和一杯啤酒。/r/n

word.name: beetroot
word.lx: Dice the beetroot (up) neatly./r/n 将甜菜根切成整齐的小方块./r/n He went as red as a beetroot when I asked about his new girl-friend./r/n 我问起他那新女友, 他就满脸通红./r/n

word.name: befit
word.lx: It will not befit a priest to act uncharitably./r/n 牧师不以慈悲为怀是不合适的。/r/n You should dress in a way that befits a woman of your position./r/n 你的衣着应与你这种地位的妇女相称。/r/n

word.name: before
word.mean:
a. 以前,在...以前
ad. 以前
prep.&conj. 在...以前
word.lx: I have seen that film before./r/n 那部电影我以前看过。/r/n He always put the interests of others before his own./r/n 他总把他人的利益放在第一位。/r/n

word.name: beforehand
word.lx: He arrived at the meeting place beforehand./r/n 他提前到达会面地点。/r/n It had been arranged beforehand./r/n 那事已提前安排好了。/r/n

word.name: beg
word.lx: I beg your pardon?/r/n 对不起,你说什么？(正式场合用语)/r/n The boy begged me not to tell his parents./r/n 这个男孩请求我不要告诉他的父母。/r/n

word.name: begin
word.lx: When did you begin learning English?/r/n 你何时开始学习英语的？/r/n The new fare will be 1, beginning (from) next month./r/n 从下月起, 新车费为1英镑./r/n

word.name: beginner
word.lx: Beginners will feel it difficult to do this job./r/n 初学者做这件事会感到困难。/r/n I am a beginner in this aspect./r/n 在这方面，我是一个生手。/r/n

word.name: beginning
word.lx: I missed the beginning of the film./r/n 电影的开头部分我没有看到。/r/n You have made a good beginning./r/n 你已经做出了良好的开端。/r/n

word.name: behalf
word.lx: On behalf of my colleagues and myself I thank you./r/n 我代表我的同事和我本人向你表示感谢。/r/n I put up the proposal on your behalf./r/n 我是为你的利益才提出这个建议的。/r/n

word.name: behavior
word.lx: Their behavior towards me shows that they do not like me./r/n 他们对我的举止说明他们不喜欢我。/r/n His behavior was, in a word, shocking./r/n 总之，他的行为是令人震惊的。/r/n

word.name: being
word.mean:
n. 人,生物
art. 在,有,是
word.lx: What is the purpose of our being?/r/n 我们生存的目的是什么？/r/n When did the world come into being?/r/n 世界是什么时候形成的？/r/n

word.name: Belgium
word.lx: Belgium has been called the cockpit of Europe./r/n 比利时被称作欧洲战场。/r/n France knocked Belgium out (of the European Cup)./r/n 法国队将比利时队淘汰（出欧洲杯足球赛）了./r/n

word.name: belief
word.lx: He has lost his belief in God./r/n 他已不相信上帝了。/r/n The story of his miseries is beyond my belief./r/n 他的悲惨身世令人难以置信。/r/n

word.name: believe
word.lx: We believe in his ability./r/n 我们相信他的才干。/r/n I believe it to have been a mistake./r/n 我认为这一直就是错的。/r/n

word.name: bell
word.lx: Can you hear the morning bell ringing?/r/n 你能听到晨钟响吗?/r/n The bell is knelling./r/n 丧钟已经敲响。/r/n

word.name: belly
word.lx: My belly is empty./r/n 我肚子饿了。/r/n A hungry belly has no ears./r/n 人肚子饿了就听不进道理。/r/n

word.name: belong
word.lx: That dictionary belongs to me./r/n 那本字典是属于我的。/r/n What party do you belong to?/r/n 你属于哪一党派？/r/n

word.name: beloved
word.lx: She is my beloved./r/n 她是我的爱人。/r/n He is beloved by all./r/n 他是众人所爱戴的。/r/n

word.name: below
word.mean:
ad. 在下面,向下
prep.&a. 在...下面
word.lx: His income is well below the average./r/n 他的收入大大低于平均水平。/r/n We looked down from the mountain to the valley below./r/n 我们从山上俯瞰下面的山谷。/r/n

word.name: belt
word.mean:
n. 带,腰带
v. 用带系上
vt. 系上腰带
word.lx: The police belted up and went out./r/n 警察系上皮带，走了出去。/r/n He gave the boy a real belting./r/n 他用皮带把那个孩子着实打了一顿。/r/n

word.name: bench
word.lx: An old man sat on the park bench and fed the pigeon./r/n 一位老人坐在公园的长凳上喂鸽子。/r/n The bench read the sentence to the criminal./r/n 法官向罪犯宣读了判决。/r/n

word.name: benchmark
word.mean: n. 水准点(基准点,标准检查程序,测定基准点)

word.name: bend
word.lx: The branches bent in the wind./r/n 树枝被风吹弯了。/r/n The stream takes a sudden bend to the east./r/n 小溪突然转向东流。/r/n

word.name: beneath
word.mean:
ad. 在下方
prep. 在...之下
word.lx: The ship sank beneath the waves./r/n 轮船沉没于波涛下面。/r/n Such behaviour is beneath contempt./r/n 这种行为令人不齿。/r/n

word.name: benefit
word.mean:
n. 利益
v. 获益
word.lx: Are you entitled to unemployment benefit?/r/n 你有资格领取失业救济金吗？/r/n This project is of great benefit to everyone./r/n 这项工程对每个人都大有好处。/r/n

word.name: bent
word.mean:
a. 弯曲的
n. 爱好,癖好
word.lx: He has a bent for art./r/n 他生性爱好艺术。/r/n She has bent on becoming an actress./r/n 她决心成为一名女演员。/r/n

word.name: berth
word.lx: This ship is approved to berth here./r/n 这艘船被允许停泊在这儿。/r/n The liner berthed at midday./r/n 邮轮中午到达停泊地。/r/n

word.name: beset
word.lx: In the swamp we were beset by mosquitoes./r/n 我们在沼泽地受到蚊子的围攻。/r/n The enemy beset the city with a strong army./r/n 敌人以强大的军队围困城市。/r/n

word.name: beside
word.lx: He lived in a town beside the sea./r/n 他住在一个靠海的城镇./r/n The company wished to locate its new factory beside the river./r/n 这家公司希望把新工厂设在河边。/r/n

word.name: Bethune
word.lx: Chairman Mao wroteIn Memory of Norman Bethune" at the end of1939./r/n 1939年底，毛主席写下了《纪念白求恩》一文。/r/n

word.name: betray
word.lx: He betrayed his country./r/n 他背叛了他的国家。/r/n The smoke from cooking betrayed the presence of the enemy./r/n 炊烟暴露了敌人的存在。/r/n

word.name: beverage
word.lx: What beverage would you like?/r/n 你想喝什么饮料？/r/n The beverage prepared from the seeds of this plant./r/n 咖啡饮料用这种植物的种子作出的饮料/r/n

word.name: beware
word.lx: Beware of what you do with this dangerous substance./r/n 你处理这些危险品时，可要当心。/r/n I was told to beware lest I injure him./r/n 有人关照我，要我小心别伤害他。/r/n

word.name: bewilder
word.lx: Big city traffic bewilders me./r/n 大城市的交通使我晕头转向。/r/n You bewildered me./r/n 你把我搞糊涂了。/r/n

word.name: bewildering
word.mean: a. 令人困惑的,使人混乱的

word.name: bias
word.lx: He has a bias against Japanese products./r/n 他讨厌日本的产品。/r/n Her scientific bias showed itself in early childhood./r/n 她在科学方面的倾向性在孩童时代就已显现出来。/r/n

word.name: Bible
word.lx: He reads the Bible everyday./r/n 他每天读圣经。/r/n You can find this psalm in the Bible./r/n 你可以在圣经上找到这篇赞美诗。/r/n

word.name: bibliography
word.mean: n. (有关某一专题的)书目,参考书目
word.lx: Bibliography usually appears at the end of a book./r/n 参考书目通常在书后列出。/r/n The book ought to include a bibliography of the subject./r/n 这本书应包括一份关于这一学科的参考书目。/r/n

word.name: bicycle
word.mean:
n. 自行车
v. 骑自行车
word.lx: He is learning to ride a bicycle./r/n 他正在学习骑自行车。/r/n I taught her to ride a bicycle./r/n 我教她骑自行车。/r/n

word.name: bid
word.mean:
n. 出价
v. 命令,吩咐,投标
word.lx: Have they put in a bid for the contract?/r/n 他们有没有投标争取承包合同？/r/n I bid two hearts./r/n 我叫两红心。/r/n

word.name: bilateral
word.lx: Having or marked by bilateral symmetry./r/n 左右对称的以或表现为左右对称的/r/n

word.name: bilingual
word.lx: He is bilingual (in French and Spanish)./r/n 他操（法语和西班牙语）两种语言./r/n

word.name: bin
word.mean:
n. 箱柜
n.[计算机] DOS文件名 : 二进制目标文件
word.lx: I bought a bread bin for my family./r/n 我给家里买了一个面包箱。/r/n Chuck it in the bin!/r/n 把它扔到垃圾桶里去!/r/n

word.name: binary
word.lx: Do all computers use binary system?/r/n 所有的计算机都使用二进制吗？/r/n In computing and communications, a group of eight binary digits treated as an entity./r/n 在计算技术和通信技术中，作为一个整体来处理的一组8个二进制数字。见octal。/r/n

word.name: bind
word.lx: I am bound by my promise./r/n 我必须遵守自己的诺言。/r/n Their refusal to sign the contract has put us in a bit of a bind./r/n 他们拒绝签约，从而使我们的处境有些困难。/r/n

word.name: binder
word.mean: n. 缚者,用以绑缚之物,夹器

word.name: binding
word.lx: The agreement is binding on both parties./r/n 协议对双方具有约束力。/r/n A short essay or treatise, usually on a current topic, published without a binding./r/n 活页文选小短文或专题论文，常关于一个流行的题目，出版时未经装订/r/n

word.name: biochemistry
word.lx: Her research is breaking new ground in biochemistry./r/n 她的研究正在开辟生物化学的新开地。/r/n I am going to start my doctorate in biochemistry next year./r/n 我准备明年开始攻读生物化学博士学位。/r/n

word.name: biological
word.lx: The school has a large biological laboratory./r/n 这所学校有一个很大的生物实验室。/r/n Biological warfare is terrible./r/n 生物战很可怕。/r/n

word.name: biology
word.lx: We have a biology lesson tomorrow./r/n 明天我们有堂生物学课。/r/n He worked hard at his biology./r/n 他努力学习生物学。/r/n

word.name: biotechnology
word.lx: A biotechnology company is developing a range of new pesticide based on naturally occur toxin./r/n 一家生物工艺开发公司正在根据自然滋生毒素的原理研制新型农药系列产品。/r/n

word.name: bird
word.lx: The early bird catches the worm./r/n 早起的鸟儿有虫吃。（捷足先登。）/r/n The crow is a bird of ill omen./r/n 乌鸦是不祥的预兆。/r/n

word.name: birth
word.mean: n. 出身,血统,出生,诞生,出现,起源
word.lx: She gave birth to a fine healthy baby./r/n 她生了一个健康漂亮的婴儿。/r/n Last year there were many more births than deaths./r/n 去年的出生人数大于死亡人数。/r/n

word.name: birthday
word.lx: Happy birthday to you!/r/n 祝你生日快乐！/r/n Next Monday will be my 21st birthday./r/n 下星期一是我二十一岁的生日。/r/n

word.name: biscuit
word.lx: He had some biscuits before the dinner./r/n 晚饭前，他吃了一些饼干。/r/n A thin, crisp wafer or biscuit, usually made of unsweetened dough./r/n 薄脆饼干一种通常由不含糖的生面团做成的薄脆饼干/r/n

word.name: bishop
word.lx: This priest wants to become a bishop./r/n 这位牧师想成为主教。/r/n The bishop married them./r/n 主教为他们主持婚礼。/r/n

word.name: bit
word.mean:
n. 一点儿,少量
n. 钻头,马嚼子,辅币
n. 位,比特(二进位制信息单位)
v. 控制
word.lx: He read all the interesting bit in the newspaper./r/n 他把报纸上点点滴滴有趣的新闻都读了。/r/n Your article is a bit long for our paper./r/n 你的文章对我们的报纸而言长了一点。/r/n

word.name: bite
word.mean:
n. 咬,一口
v. 咬
word.lx: The little cat gave me a playful bite./r/n 小猫顽皮地轻轻咬了我一下。/r/n Their dog bit a hole in my trousers./r/n 他们的狗把我的裤子咬了个窟窿。/r/n

word.name: bitter
word.lx: The defeat was a bitter pill to swallow./r/n 那次失败是一次难以吞咽的苦果。/r/n Some beer and chocolate taste bitter./r/n 有些啤酒和巧克力有苦味。/r/n

word.name: bitterly
word.mean: ad. 怨恨地,悲痛地,残酷地
word.lx: The drug is wanted bitterly./r/n 这药有人急着要用。/r/n Five cities in the world fought bitterly over the glory of hosting the2000 Olympic Games./r/n 世界上有5座城市为申办2000年奥运会展开激烈的角逐。/r/n

word.name: bitumen
word.lx: Like or containing bitumen./r/n 沥青的，含沥青的/r/n

word.name: black
word.mean:
a. 黑色的
n. 黑人,黑色
v. (使)变黑
word.lx: After her husband died, she dressed in deep black for the rest of her life./r/n 她丈夫去世后，她终生都穿着黑色丧服。/r/n Do you have a black jacket?/r/n 你有一件黑夹克吗？/r/n

word.name: blackboard
word.lx: The teacher wrote down the new words on the blackboard./r/n 老师在黑板上写出新单词。/r/n Please raise your head and look at the blackboard./r/n 请抬起头来，看黑板。/r/n

word.name: blade
word.lx: The blade needs sharpening./r/n 这刀刃需要磨一磨。/r/n The blade is chipped in a few places./r/n 刀锋有几个地方缺口。/r/n

word.name: blame
word.mean:
n. 过失,责备
v. 责备
word.lx: We were ready to take the blame for what had happened./r/n 我们准备对所发生的事承担责任。/r/n The driver was not to blame for the accident./r/n 这次事故怪不着司机。/r/n

word.name: blank
word.mean:
a. 空白的
n. 空白(处)
vi. 消失
vt. 使模糊不清
word.lx: His memory was completely blank on the subject./r/n 关于这个题目，他已完全丧失记忆。/r/n Write your name in the blank./r/n 在空白栏中写上你的名字。/r/n

word.name: blanket
word.lx: The traveler wrapped himself with a blanket./r/n 旅行者用毯子把自己裹上。/r/n He rolled himself (up) in his blanket./r/n 他用毛毯裹住身体./r/n

word.name: blast
word.mean:
n. 爆破,冲击波,一阵,汽笛声
v. 爆破,炸掉
word.lx: Frost blasted the blossoms./r/n 霜使花凋谢了。/r/n Rock music blasted full from the parlor./r/n 摇滚乐声震屋宇，从客厅传来。/r/n

word.name: blaze
word.mean:
n. 火焰,烈火
v. 燃烧
word.lx: They fled from the blazing house./r/n 他们从燃烧的房子里逃了出来。/r/n The firemen were unable to control the blaze./r/n 消防队员无法控制这场大火。/r/n

word.name: bleach
word.mean:
n. 漂白剂
v. 变白, 漂白
word.lx: There were only a few dry bones left, bleached by the sun./r/n 只留下一些被太阳晒得泛白的枯骨。/r/n Not bleached or dyed; unfinished. Used of textiles./r/n 本色的，原色的未经漂白或染色的，未完工的，用于纺织品/r/n

word.name: bleak
word.mean: a. 萧瑟的,严寒的,阴郁的
word.lx: The weather in early December was bleak and unpleasant./r/n 十二月初的天气又阴冷又难受。/r/n The future of this firm will be very bleak indeed if we keep losing money./r/n 要是我们继续亏本的话，这家公司的前途会非常黯淡。/r/n

word.name: bleed
word.lx: All the young soldiers are ready to bleed for the country./r/n 所有的年轻战士都愿意为祖国洒热血。/r/n A page trimmed so as to bleed./r/n 被剪裁的页次经切裁以印成出血版的纸页/r/n

word.name: blend
word.mean:
v. 混合
n. 混合物
word.lx: The poem blends the separate ingredients into a unity./r/n 这首诗把几个分开的部分融合为一体。/r/n Melt the butter and then blend in the flour./r/n 先把黄油融化, 然後加入面粉./r/n

word.name: bless
word.lx: The priest blessed the ship before it left port./r/n 牧师在船离港之前为其祝福。/r/n God bless you!/r/n 愿上帝保佑你！/r/n

word.name: blessed
word.lx: The priest blessed the ship before it left port./r/n 牧师在船离港之前为其祝福。/r/n Blessed are the humble./r/n 谦虚的人有福了。/r/n

word.name: blessing
word.lx: The government has given its blessing to the new plan./r/n 政府已经批准了这项计划。/r/n This rain will be a blessing for the farmers./r/n 对农民来说，这场雨真是一场甘霖。/r/n

word.name: blind
word.mean:
a. 盲目的,瞎的
n. 百叶窗
v. 使失明
word.lx: The soldier was blinded in battle./r/n 那个士兵在战斗中双目失明。/r/n He is blind to the probable results of his behavior./r/n 他无法了解他的行为可能带来什么后果。/r/n

word.name: blindly
word.mean: ad. 轻率地,盲目地,无分别地
word.lx: A person regarded as being foolishly or blindly optimistic./r/n 过分乐观者，盲目乐观者被视为愚蠢地或盲目地乐观的人/r/n One that is adored, often blindly or excessively./r/n 被过度崇拜的人往往是盲目或过分地被别人尊崇的人/r/n

word.name: blindness
word.lx: I felt sorry for his blindness./r/n 我对他的失明深表难过。/r/n Blindness can be a terrible affliction./r/n 失明有时极为痛苦./r/n

word.name: blink
word.lx: How long can you stare without blinking your eyes?/r/n 你能瞪着看多长时间不眨眼?/r/n The lights were blinking on the horizon./r/n 灯光在地平线上闪烁着。/r/n

word.name: blinking
word.mean: a. (英俚)该死的,讨厌的,十足的
word.lx: Harbour lights were blinking on the horizon./r/n 海港的灯火在水平线上闪烁著./r/n How long can you stare without blinking (your eyes)?/r/n 你能瞪著看多长时间不眨眼?/r/n

word.name: blip
word.mean: (缩微胶卷画面上的光点)标志

word.name: bloc
word.lx: A group of parties, factions, or nations united in a common cause; a bloc./r/n 政治联盟一些政党、派别或民族为共同事业而组成的联盟；跨党派议员集团/r/n They left the meeting en bloc./r/n 他们一起离开了会场./r/n

word.name: block
word.mean:
n. 街区,木块,石块
v. 阻塞
word.lx: The road was blocked by a huge rock./r/n 道路被一块大石头堵住了。/r/n The floor was made of wooden blocks./r/n 地板是用木块拼成的。/r/n

word.name: blonde
word.mean: a. 金黄色或淡色的（指人头发）
word.lx: The lovely boy has beautiful blonde curls./r/n 这个可爱的小男孩长着漂亮的金黄色卷发。/r/n She is a luscious blonde./r/n 她是个迷人的金发女郎。/r/n

word.name: bloody
word.mean: a. 血腥的,嗜杀的,非常的
word.lx: Hundreds of soldiers died in this bloody battle./r/n 成百上千的战士在这场血战中牺牲。/r/n This bloody company keeps fucking me about./r/n 这倒霉的公司一直亏待我./r/n

word.name: bloom
word.lx: The roses are in full bloom./r/n 玫瑰花盛开了。/r/n The children are blooming!/r/n 孩子们正在健康成长。/r/n

word.name: blossom
word.mean:
n. 花,花开的状态
v. 开花
word.lx: The apple trees are blossoming./r/n 苹果树正在开花。/r/n There are many pear trees covered in blossom./r/n 那里有许多开满花的梨树。/r/n

word.name: blot
word.lx: His apron was blotted with oil./r/n 他的围裙上满是油点。/r/n The picture was ruined by several blots of ink./r/n 几滴墨水点毁了这幅画。/r/n

word.name: blouse
word.lx: She wears a white blouse today./r/n 今天她穿了一件白色衬衫。/r/n She was wearing a woolen coat, with a cotton blouse underneath./r/n 她外面穿了一件毛外套，里面穿一件棉布衬衫。/r/n

word.name: blueprint
word.mean:
n. 蓝图,设计图,(周详的)计划
v. 制成蓝图,计划
word.lx: He hunted through the files till he found the blueprint./r/n 他把档案翻了一遍，最后才找到图纸。/r/n

word.name: blunt
word.mean:
a. 钝的
a. 直爽的
vt.
使变钝
word.lx: He cut the meat with a blunt knife./r/n 他用一把钝刀子切肉。/r/n Not sharp, pointed, or acute in form; blunt./r/n 钝的不锐利的、不尖的或在形状上不尖锐的；钝的/r/n

word.name: blur
word.lx: A blur on a developed photographic image./r/n 模糊不清洗好的照片图象上的模糊处/r/n The racing cars passed in a blur./r/n 竞赛的汽车影绰不清地飞驰而过。/r/n

word.name: blush
word.lx: She blushed when he scolded her./r/n 他责备她时，她脸红了。/r/n The student murmured the answer with a blush./r/n 那个学生红着脸小声说出了答案。/r/n

word.name: boards
word.lx: A thin, firm board made of sheets of paper pasted together or pressed paper pulp./r/n 纸板由几层纸糊在一起或由压制的纸浆做成的薄而牢固的板子/r/n She usually boards students during the college term./r/n 她经常在学期中给学生提供膳宿./r/n

word.name: boat
word.lx: Are you going to America by boat or by plane?/r/n 你到美国是坐船还是坐飞机？/r/n The boat will sink unless we bail out./r/n 我们要不把积水清除掉，船就要沉了。/r/n

word.name: body
word.mean:
n. 身体,主体,正文
ad. 亲身地
word.lx: The oceans are large bodies of water./r/n 海洋是广大的水域。/r/n The sun, moon and stars are heavenly bodies./r/n 太阳、月亮和星星都是天体。/r/n

word.name: boil
word.mean:
v. 沸腾,煮沸
vi. 沸腾
vt. 煮沸
word.lx: I am boiling the milk./r/n 我正在煮牛奶。/r/n The argument boiled over into open war./r/n 争论演变成了公开的论战。/r/n

word.name: boiler
word.lx: I happened to meet him in the boiler room./r/n 我碰巧在锅炉房碰到他。/r/n She was scalded when the boiler exploded./r/n 锅炉爆炸时她被烫伤了。/r/n

word.name: bold
word.mean: a. 大胆的,粗体的,醒目的
word.lx: May I be so bold as to ask how old you are?/r/n 可否冒昧问一下您多大年纪？/r/n He is a bold thinker, with lots of original ideas./r/n 他是个敢于思考的人，富有创新观点。/r/n

word.name: bolt
word.mean:
n. 门闩,突发,螺钉
vt. 闩住
vi. 冲出去,急逃
word.lx: The frightened boy bolted all the doors and windows./r/n 这个吓坏了的孩子闩上了所有的门窗。/r/n We need an eye bolt to fit this valve./r/n 我们需要一个有眼螺栓来固定这个阀门。/r/n

word.name: bomb
word.mean:
n. 炸弹
v. 轰炸
vt. 投弹,轰炸
word.lx: At that time, China did not yet have the bomb./r/n 那时，中国还未拥有核武器。/r/n The terrorists planted a bomb in the post office./r/n 恐怖分子在邮局安放了一枚炸弹。/r/n

word.name: bombard
word.lx: Reporters bombarded the President with questions about his economic policy./r/n 新闻记者提出许多有关经济政策的问题围攻总统./r/n Enemy positions were bombarded before our infantry attacked./r/n 炮轰敌军阵地之後, 我步兵开始进攻./r/n

word.name: bomber
word.lx: The Air Commodore briefed the bomber crew on their dangerous mission./r/n 空军准将向轰炸机机组下达执行危险任务的各项指示。/r/n Out rushed a missile from under the bomber./r/n 一枚导弹突然从轰炸机下面发射出来。/r/n

word.name: bombshell
word.mean: n. 引起震惊的人或事,出人意料的人或事

word.name: bond
word.mean: n. 结合,债券,粘结剂，粘合剂
word.lx: Common tastes form a bond between the two men./r/n 共同的爱好使两人结交为朋友。/r/n A bond of sympathy developed between members of the group./r/n 该组织成员间产生了志同道合的凝聚力./r/n

word.name: bonded
word.mean: a. 以债券作保证的,有担保的,存入保税仓库的

word.name: bone
word.mean:
n. 骨,骨骼
v. 剔去(鱼等的)骨
word.lx: He broke a bone in his leg./r/n 他摔断了一根腿骨。/r/n I must bone up on my French before we go to Paris./r/n 在我们去巴黎之前，我必须刻苦学习法语－。/r/n

word.name: book
word.mean:
n. 书
v. 登记,预订
word.lx: That student lost his book yesterday./r/n 那个学生昨天丢了书。/r/n He was booked on a charge of speeding./r/n 他因超速开车而被记录在案。/r/n

word.name: bookcase
word.lx: There are many books on the bookcase./r/n 书架上有很多书。/r/n They bought a bookcase to put the books on./r/n 他们买了个书架来放书。/r/n

word.name: booked
word.lx: The order for ceramic tiles has been booked in./r/n 要买瓷砖的订货已登记下来了。/r/n A clerk booked us in quickly when we arrived at the hotel./r/n 我们一到旅馆，一个职员很快就给我们登记好了。/r/n

word.name: bookmark
word.lx: Another time he was seen using a check for$1500 as a bookmark. Then he lost the book!/r/n 另一次，有人看见他把一张一竿千五百美元的支票当作书签用。后来那本书丢了！/r/n

word.name: books
word.lx: He wrote more than30 books and must have earned a bomb./r/n 他写了30多本书，一定挣了一大笔钱。/r/n Nearly30 years ago he bought his first job lot of50 books for$3./r/n 大约三十年前，他花了3美元第一次整批买下50本书。/r/n

word.name: bookstall
word.lx: Perhaps you might chance on the dictionary at some old bookstall./r/n 或许你会碰巧在旧书摊上买到这本辞典。/r/n

word.name: bookstore
word.lx: I spent hours browsing in the bookstore./r/n 我花了几个小时在书店里浏览图书。/r/n He sold a bundle of old magazines to the second hand bookstore./r/n 他把一捆就杂志卖给了旧书店。/r/n

word.name: boost
word.mean:
n. 推进,支援
v. 推进,提高
word.lx: The act or an instance of assisting; a boost./r/n 帮助协助的行为或实例；支援/r/n A big boost in salary./r/n 一次工资大增加/r/n

word.name: boot
word.mean:
n. 靴子,[英]汽车行李箱
vt. 踢
word.lx: I help him to lace up his boots./r/n 我帮他系好靴子的鞋带。/r/n My boot is pressing against a blister on my toe./r/n 我的靴子挤压了我脚趾上的水泡。/r/n

word.name: booth
word.lx: There is a telephone booth near the cinema./r/n 电影院附近有一个电话亭。/r/n A small structure, often open on one or more sides, used as a newsstand or booth./r/n 户外报刊亭或杂货摊经常一面或几面开敞的小建筑物。用作报摊或货摊/r/n

word.name: bootstrap
word.mean: 引导指令(程序),辅助程序
word.lx: Conservatives would defy our efforts at bootstrap improvements./r/n 保守派会蔑视我们从根本上变革的努力。/r/n

word.name: border
word.mean:
n. 边缘
v. 作...之疆界,加边
word.lx: I lost a white handkerchief with a blue border./r/n 我丢了一块带蓝色花边的白手绢。/r/n France borders Germany along parts of the Rhine./r/n 法国沿莱茵河部分河段与德国接壤。/r/n

word.name: bore
word.mean:
n. 令人讨厌的人，枪膛，孔
v. 使烦扰,钻孔
word.lx: She has become an awful bore since she got married to him./r/n 她自从和他结婚后，就变得令人厌烦透了。/r/n Worms have bored into the wood./r/n 虫子已经蛀穿了木料。/r/n

word.name: bored
word.lx: He is a bored student./r/n 他是一位感到厌烦的学生。/r/n The condition of being bored; ennui./r/n 厌烦处于厌烦的状态；无聊/r/n

word.name: boring
word.mean:
a. 令人厌烦的
n. 钻孔
word.lx: It is boring to listen to the same story./r/n 听相同的故事是令人厌烦的。/r/n This is one of the few gratifications of an otherwise boring job./r/n 这是枯燥的工作中少有的一项乐趣。/r/n

word.name: borrow
word.lx: May I borrow your pen?/r/n 我可以借用你的钢笔吗？/r/n They are poor but proud; they never borrow money or ask for help./r/n 他们虽穷但很自重，他们从不向人借钱或求助。/r/n

word.name: borrowing
word.lx: Your proposal will necessitate borrowing more money./r/n 依你的建议就必须增加借款。/r/n On top of borrowing 50, he asked me to lend him my car./r/n 他向我借了50英镑, 此外还向我借汽车./r/n

word.name: bosom
word.lx: The girl was fortunate enough to have her mother as a bosom friend./r/n 这个女孩非常幸运，她的妈妈是她的知心朋友。/r/n The young mother held the baby to her bosom./r/n 那位年轻的母亲把孩子抱在怀里。/r/n

word.name: boss
word.mean:
n. 老板,上司
v. 指挥,控制
word.lx: He was dismissed by his boss./r/n 他被他的老板开除了。/r/n Tom likes to boss younger children./r/n 汤姆喜欢对较年幼的孩子发号施令。/r/n

word.name: both
word.mean:
a. 两者的
ad. 两者都
int. 两者
word.lx: He is both a soldier and a poet./r/n 他既是个战士，又是个诗人。/r/n Both are good./r/n 两者都好。/r/n

word.name: bothersome
word.lx: An obtuse, boring, or bothersome person; a pest./r/n 讨厌的人愚钝的、无聊的或讨厌的人；害人精/r/n

word.name: bottom
word.mean:
n. 底部;屁股，臀部
a. 底部的
word.lx: They sent the enemy ship to the bottom of the sea./r/n 他们把敌舰击沉。/r/n He was always bottom of the class in maths./r/n 他的数学成绩在班上总是垫底。/r/n

word.name: bough
word.lx: The bough was loaded with fruit./r/n 树枝上果实累累。/r/n The bird settled on the topmost bough./r/n 这只鸟儿在最高的权枝上停了下来。/r/n

word.name: bounce
word.mean:
n. 跳,反跃,弹力
v. 弹跳,使...跳
word.lx: I bounced the baby on my knee./r/n 我把婴儿放在膝上上下颠着。/r/n The ball hit the wall and bounced off it./r/n 球打在墙上又反弹回来。/r/n

word.name: boundary
word.lx: They marked the boundaries of the football fields./r/n 他们画出了足球场地的边界。/r/n The ball ran (ie rolled) to the boundary./r/n 球向著边线滚去./r/n

word.name: bounds
word.lx: The exceeding of due bounds or limits./r/n 越界超过正当的界限或限制/r/n Our joy knew no bounds. Your remarks exceed the bounds of reason./r/n 我们快乐无比。你的评论超出了合理界限/r/n

word.name: bounty
word.lx: He was awarded a cash bounty by his boss./r/n 他的上司奖给他一笔现金。/r/n I think we shall drink to the bounty of nature./r/n 我想我们应该为造物主的慷慨赐予而乾杯。/r/n

word.name: bouquet
word.mean:
n. 花束
n. 酒香
word.lx: In his speech there were bouquets for everyone who had helped him./r/n 在他的演讲里，他赞美了每一位帮助他的人。/r/n The characteristic smell of a wine or liqueur; bouquet./r/n 芳香葡萄酒或酒有特点的气味；酒香/r/n

word.name: boutique
word.mean: n. 专卖流行衣服的小商店
word.lx: Chic clothes; a chic boutique./r/n 时髦的服装；一件雅致的饰物/r/n Boutique clothes; boutique food./r/n 小店服装；小店食品/r/n

word.name: bow
word.mean:
n. 弓,船头,鞠躬
v. 鞠躬,弯腰
word.lx: He moved aside for her with a polite bow./r/n 他礼貌地鞠躬，退避一旁让她过去。/r/n Every one bowed as the Queen walked into the room./r/n 女王走进房间时，每个人都鞠躬致敬。/r/n

word.name: bowel
word.lx: What is it like in the bowels of the earth?/r/n 地球内部是什么样子？/r/n Do you have a bowel movement today?/r/n 你今天上过厕所吗？/r/n

word.name: bowl
word.mean:
n. 碗
v. 打保龄球
vt. 把(球)投向球瓶
word.lx: There is a fruit bowl on the table./r/n 桌上有个水果盘。/r/n His grandfather gave her an earthenware bowl./r/n 他的祖父给了她一个陶碗。/r/n

word.name: bowling
word.lx: An opening made to fit a thumb, as in a bowling ball./r/n 拇指孔（保龄球）上供拇指插入的孔/r/n We were bowling along (the motorway) at seventy miles per hour./r/n 我们以每小时七十英里的速度（在高速公路上）飞驰./r/n

word.name: box
word.mean:
n. 盒子,箱
v. 装...入盒中
word.lx: She gave him a box on his ears./r/n 她打了他一耳光。/r/n He has eaten a whole box of chocolates./r/n 他吃了一整盒巧克力。/r/n

word.name: boxing
word.lx: He was done out of the right of boxing./r/n 他被取消了拳击比赛资格。/r/n I enjoyed all the sports with the exception of boxing./r/n 除了拳击, 我喜欢所有的运动。/r/n

word.name: brace
word.mean:
n. 支柱,曲柄,大括号
v. 绷紧,顶住,（为困难或坏事）做准备
word.lx: The struts are firmly braced./r/n 那些支柱上得很牢固。/r/n We braced ourselves for a bumpy landing./r/n 我们已做好准备, 著陆时会很颠簸./r/n

word.name: bracket
word.lx: Put your name in brackets at the top of each page./r/n 把你的名字填写在每页上端的括号内。/r/n The worker fixed a bracket on the wall./r/n 工人在墙上固定了一个支架。/r/n

word.name: brackets
word.lx: Put your name in brackets at the top of each page./r/n 把你的名字填写在每页上端的括号内。/r/n The brackets want an extra screw./r/n 托架需要再加一个螺钉。/r/n

word.name: brain
word.mean:
n. 脑(子)
v. 打...的脑袋
word.lx: She has a good brain./r/n 她很有头脑。/r/n Brains are more than just education./r/n 有头脑不仅指受过教育。/r/n

word.name: brainstorm
word.mean:
v. 集体自由讨论
vi. 动脑筋,出主意,想办法,献计献策
vt. 集思广益以寻找(解决难题的方法等)
word.lx: I do some brainstorm./r/n 我开动脑筋。/r/n The marketing team brainstorm for hour in designing the marketing campaign for the new product./r/n 行销小组脑力激荡多时，集思广益，设计新产品的行销策略。/r/n

word.name: branch
word.mean:
n. 分枝,树枝
v. 分枝
vi. 分支
word.lx: Mr. Smith works in an executive branch of the government./r/n 史密斯先生在政府的行政部门工作。/r/n The road to the village branches off on the right./r/n 通往该村的道路向右转为一条小路。/r/n

word.name: branches
word.lx: She has lopped branches off yesterday./r/n 她昨天已把树枝修剪过了。/r/n Follow the main road until it branches, and then turn to the right./r/n 顺着这条大路走，在路的分岔口向右拐。/r/n

word.name: brand
word.mean:
n. 商标,牌子,烙印
v. 打烙印,铭刻
word.lx: He has his own brand of humor./r/n 他有他独特的幽默感。/r/n These frightful experiences are branded on his memory./r/n 这些可怕的经历深深印入他的记忆。/r/n

word.name: brandy
word.lx: The two are fine brandies./r/n 那是两种优质白兰地。/r/n Two brandies and soda, please./r/n 劳驾，来两杯白兰地加苏打水。/r/n

word.name: brass
word.lx: How do you have the brass to say that?/r/n 你怎么有脸那么说呢？/r/n The brass is too loud./r/n 铜管乐器的声音太响了。/r/n

word.name: bravery
word.lx: His bravery was seen by everyone when he saved the child from the burning house./r/n 他从失火的房子里救出小孩时的那种勇敢，是人人都见到的。/r/n The soldier earned a medal for bravery./r/n 这名战士因作战勇敢而获得了勋章。/r/n

word.name: breach
word.lx: Your action is a breach of our agreement./r/n 你的行动违反了我们的协议。/r/n You are in breach of your contract./r/n 你违反了你签的合同。/r/n

word.name: bread
word.lx: He earned his bread by writing novels./r/n 他靠写小说维生。/r/n The bread is baking in the oven./r/n 烤箱里正在烤面包。/r/n

word.name: breadth
word.lx: She is a woman of great breadth of mind./r/n 她是一个胸怀非常广阔的女子。/r/n The area can easily be worked out if you know the length and the breadth./r/n 如果你知道长度和宽度的话，计算面积就很容易了。/r/n

word.name: break
word.mean:
n. 休息,中断,破裂
v. 打破,弄破,弄坏
word.lx: There is a break during the performance for the audience to take a rest./r/n 演出中有一次中场休息，让听众们稍事休息。/r/n The cold weather at last broke at the end of March./r/n 寒冷的天气终于在三月末结束了。/r/n

word.name: breakfast
word.mean:
n. 早餐
v. (吃早餐
vi. 进早餐
word.lx: Would you like breakfast now?/r/n 你想要现在吃早餐吗？/r/n We breakfasted early./r/n 我们很早吃早餐。/r/n

word.name: breast
word.mean:
n. 胸脯,乳房
vt. 挺胸迎...而上
word.lx: His guilty conscience forced him to make a clean breast of everything./r/n 他的内疚使得他把一切和盘托出。/r/n They had chicken breast for supper./r/n 他们晚饭吃鸡胸肉。/r/n

word.name: breath
word.lx: I was out of breath after running for the bus./r/n 我因为追赶公共汽车，弄得上气不接下气。/r/n There is a breath of autumn in the air today./r/n 今天的天气已露出了一丝秋天的气息。/r/n

word.name: breathe
word.lx: His enthusiasm breathed new life into the company./r/n 他的热情给公司注入了新的生命。/r/n Fish cannot breathe out of water./r/n 鱼离开水就不能呼吸。/r/n

word.name: breed
word.mean:
n. 品种,族类
v. 养育,繁殖,引起
word.lx: I had bred a dozen of chickens./r/n 我饲养了12只小鸡。/r/n The bear bred two cubs./r/n 这只熊生了两只小熊。/r/n

word.name: breeze
word.mean: n. 微风,轻而易举的事
word.lx: She breezed along, smiling at everyone./r/n 她轻盈地向前走去，对每个人都嫣然含笑。/r/n We are enjoying the cool breeze that comes from the lake./r/n 我们享受着湖面上吹来的凉爽微风。/r/n

word.name: brew
word.mean:
n. 酿造酒,蕴酿
v. 酿造,蕴酿
word.lx: They are brewing a plot behind the scenes./r/n 他们正在幕后策划一个阴谋。/r/n The tea is brewing and will be served soon./r/n 茶正在泡，一会儿就送来。/r/n

word.name: bribe
word.mean:
n. 贿赂
v. 贿赂
word.lx: The businessman offers bribes to him./r/n 这个商人向他行贿。/r/n He bribed the police to let him go free./r/n 他贿赂警察把他放了。/r/n

word.name: brick
word.mean:
a. 砖似的
n. 砖
v. 用砖围砌,用砖填补
vt. (up)用砖砌,用砖堵住
word.lx: His new house was built by himself, brick by brick./r/n 他的新房子是他自己一块砖一块砖砌起来的。/r/n All the windows were bricked up./r/n 所有的窗户都用砖堵住了。/r/n

word.name: bride
word.lx: The bride wore a beautiful white dress./r/n 新娘穿了一身美丽的白色礼服。/r/n We must drink to the health of the bride./r/n 我们要为新娘的健康干杯。/r/n

word.name: bridegroom
word.lx: Her bridegroom is a handsome young man./r/n 她的新郎是一个英俊的年轻人。/r/n Good wishes showered (down) on the bride and bridegroom./r/n 大家纷纷向新娘新郎祝福./r/n

word.name: bridge
word.mean:
n. 桥
v. 渡过,架桥
word.lx: They use a bridge to measure the impedance of the transducer./r/n 他们用电桥来测量传感器的阻抗。/r/n Politeness will bridge over many difficulties./r/n 举止文雅会使你渡过许多难关。/r/n

word.name: bridges
word.lx: This city is noted for its various bridges./r/n 这个城市因为各种桥梁而著称。/r/n The river Thames is spanned by many bridges./r/n 泰晤士河上有很多桥./r/n

word.name: brief
word.mean:
n. 摘要,简报,公事包
a. 简短的,简洁的
v. 对...作简报,摘要
word.lx: Please be brief because I am in a hurry./r/n 我有急事，请长话短说。/r/n He drew up a brief for his speech./r/n 他起草了一份讲话的概要。/r/n

word.name: briefcase
word.lx: They knocked him down and robbed him of his briefcase./r/n 他们把他打倒在地，抢走了他的公文包。/r/n He put all the files into his briefcase./r/n 他将所有文件都装进公文包。/r/n

word.name: briefly
word.lx: He was briefly associated with that organization./r/n 他同那个组织有过短时间的联系。/r/n Briefly, I think we should accept his offer./r/n 简而言之，我认为我们应该接受他的提议。/r/n

word.name: bright
word.mean:
a. 明亮的,阳光的
ad. 亮
word.lx: He is not bright, but he always works hard./r/n 他并不聪明，但工作总是勤勤恳恳。/r/n What a nice bright day!/r/n 今天天气多晴朗！/r/n

word.name: brighten
word.lx: These flowers will brighten up your garden./r/n 这些花会使你的花园增色。/r/n The sky/weather is brightening./r/n 天空[天气]转晴./r/n

word.name: brightness
word.lx: The light hurt my eyes with its brightness./r/n 明亮的灯光刺痛了我的眼睛。/r/n Stars vary in brightness./r/n 星星光亮度不同。/r/n

word.name: brilliant
word.mean: a. 灿烂的,有才气的,杰出的
word.lx: Stars are brilliant in the clear night sky./r/n 星星在晴朗的夜空闪亮。/r/n A brilliant sun lit up their rooms./r/n 灿烂的阳光照亮了他们的屋子。/r/n

word.name: brilliantly
word.mean: ad. 辉煌地,光亮地,灿烂地
word.lx: Shining brilliantly; very bright./r/n 光亮的灿烂地闪耀的；非常明亮的/r/n Her article brilliantly demolishes his argument./r/n 她的文章精辟地批驳了他的论点。/r/n

word.name: brim
word.mean:
n. 边,边缘,(河)边
v. 满,使...盈
word.lx: He filled the cup to the brim./r/n 他倒了满满一杯。/r/n He brimmed a cup with wine./r/n 他斟满一杯酒。/r/n

word.name: brink
word.lx: There are many flowers on the brink of the pond./r/n 池塘边有许多花。/r/n He dissipated most of his money and was on the brink of bankruptcy./r/n 他挥霍掉了大部分钱财, 濒于破产。/r/n

word.name: brisk
word.mean:
a. 敏锐的,凛冽的
a.活泼的，活跃的,快的
word.lx: He brisked up his pace at the beautiful sight./r/n 看到那美丽的景色，他加快了脚步。/r/n A brisk walk in cool weather is invigorating./r/n 在凉爽的天气里轻松地散步令人心旷神怡。/r/n

word.name: British
word.mean:
a. 英国的
n. 英国人
word.lx: He speaks British English./r/n 他说英国英语。/r/n British colonies were ruled by governors./r/n 英国的殖民地由总督统治。/r/n

word.name: brittle
word.lx: Constant stress has made our nerves brittle./r/n 我们长期处于紧张状态，神经已经吃不消了。/r/n He has a brittle temper./r/n 他脾气急。/r/n

word.name: broad
word.lx: He is broad-minded./r/n 他是一个心胸宽阔的人。/r/n She has a broad knowledge of computers./r/n 她对计算机有广博的知识。/r/n

word.name: broadcast
word.mean:
n. 广播,广播节目
a. 广播的
v. 广播
word.lx: The BBC broadcasts all over the world./r/n 英国广播公司向全世界播送节目。/r/n She broadcasts on current affairs./r/n 她发表时事广播演说。/r/n

word.name: broken
word.mean:
a. 坏掉的,打破的,断掉的
vbl. 打破,弄坏
word.lx: His broken English showed he was a foreigner./r/n 他的蹩脚的英语说明他是一个外国人。/r/n There is sure to be a fuss when my parents find the window is broken./r/n 我父母发现窗子被打破后，一定会有一番斥责。/r/n

word.name: broker
word.mean:
n. 经纪人
v. 作为中间人来安排
word.lx: The broker buys and sells shares for others./r/n 经纪人替他人买卖股票。/r/n I am an insurance broker./r/n 我是一名保险经纪人。/r/n

word.name: brokerage
word.mean: n. 经纪人(或中间人)业务,佣金,回扣
word.lx: A brokerage house./r/n 经纪人事务所/r/n Money deposited for checking, savings, or brokerage use./r/n 存款为支付，节省，或经纪业而存起来的钱/r/n

word.name: bronchitis
word.lx: My brother has chronic bronchitis./r/n 我的哥哥患有慢性支气管炎。/r/n If you would leave off smoking, your bronchitis would much improve./r/n 如果你戒烟的话，你的支气管炎就会好得多。/r/n

word.name: bronze
word.mean:
a. 青铜色的
n. 青铜
v. 青铜,青铜色,青铜器
vi. 使成青铜色
word.lx: There is a bronze ornament on the wall./r/n 墙上有一件青铜饰品。/r/n There will be a display of bronze statuary in this museum next week./r/n 下星期这个博物馆将举办一个青铜雕塑作品展览。/r/n

word.name: brook
word.mean:
n. 小河,溪
v. 容忍,忍受
vt. [常用于否定句或疑问句]容忍
word.lx: We crossed that brook easily./r/n 我们很容易地跨过了小河。/r/n This important matter brooks no delay. We must talk about it now./r/n 这件要事不容耽搁，我们必须现在谈谈。/r/n

word.name: broom
word.lx: He stopped sweeping and rested on the broom./r/n 他停止扫地，倚着扫帚休息。/r/n He picked up the broom to help me sweep the floor./r/n 他拿起扫帚帮我扫地。/r/n

word.name: brother
word.lx: John and Peter are brothers./r/n 约翰和彼得是兄弟。/r/n The man who captained the home team is my brother./r/n 率领主队的是我的兄弟。/r/n

word.name: brow
word.lx: His brows went up in surprise./r/n 他惊讶地竖起了眉毛。/r/n We reached the brow of the hill./r/n 我们到达了山脊上。/r/n

word.name: brown
word.mean:
a. 褐色的,棕色的
n. 褐色,棕色
(姓)布朗
word.lx: She likes to wear brown./r/n 她喜欢穿褐色的衣服。/r/n This meat takes some time to brown properly when cooking./r/n 这种肉要花点时间才能煮成恰到好处的褐色。/r/n

word.name: browse
word.lx: I had a browse through the books on the shelf./r/n 我浏览了一遍书架上的书。/r/n I spent hours browsing in the bookstore./r/n 我花了几个小时在书店里浏览图书。/r/n

word.name: browser
word.mean: n. 吃嫩叶的动物,浏览书本的人

word.name: bruise
word.mean:
n. 瘀伤,擦伤
v. 受伤,擦伤
word.lx: She fell and bruised her knee./r/n 她摔倒在地，膝盖上起了紫血块。/r/n She had a dilly of a bruise on her arm./r/n 她手臂上有一块显眼的伤痕./r/n

word.name: bubble
word.lx: The gas bubbled to the surface of the water./r/n 气体变成气泡升上水面。/r/n He bubbled questions./r/n 他接二连三地提问题。/r/n

word.name: bucket
word.lx: How many buckets of water will we need to fill this small pond?/r/n 装满这个小池塘需要多少桶水？/r/n Water splashed into the bucket from the tap./r/n 水从龙头里喷溅著注入水桶中./r/n

word.name: buckle
word.lx: They chatted idly for a few moments, then each buckled down to work./r/n 他们闲聊了一会儿；然后各人集中精神干活。/r/n He buckled up his belt tightly./r/n 他把裤带扣得紧紧的。/r/n

word.name: bud
word.mean:
n. 芽,花蕾
v. 发芽,萌芽
word.lx: The roses are in bud./r/n 玫瑰花正含苞待放。/r/n The new buds appear in the spring./r/n 春天嫩芽初绽。/r/n

word.name: Buddha
word.lx: A representation or likeness of Buddha./r/n 佛像佛的象征或替代物/r/n The body of teachings expounded by the Buddha./r/n 佛法佛祖用来说明佛经的正文/r/n

word.name: Buddhism
word.lx: One of the major schools of Buddhism, active in Japan, Korea, Nepal, Mongolia, and China, which teaches social concern and universal salvation./r/n 大乘佛教佛教的主要流派之一，流传于日本、朝鲜、尼泊尔、蒙古和中国，教导人们关心社会和普渡众生。/r/n

word.name: buffalo
word.lx: There were lots of buffaloes in the North America 100 years ago./r/n 100年前，北美有大量的野牛。/r/n He tried to buffalo me at first meeting but I soon caught on to his tricks./r/n 初次见面时他企图欺骗我，但是我很快就明白了他耍的花招。/r/n

word.name: buffering
word.mean: 中间转换(寄存),缓冲记忆装置
word.lx: A protective pier or dock apron used as a buffer against floating ice./r/n 桥墩护槛保护桥椁免受浮冰碰撞的护栏或码头围栏/r/n A buffer in a drum used to temporarily store data./r/n 磁鼓中用来暂时存放数据的一种缓冲区。/r/n

word.name: buffet
word.mean:
n. 自助餐
v. 打击
vt. 连续猛击
word.lx: We had a buffet supper last evening./r/n 昨天晚上，我们吃了一次自助晚餐。/r/n The ship buffeted through the big waves./r/n 这艘船在波涛中奋勇前进。/r/n

word.name: bug
word.mean:
n.小虫, 臭虫
v.装置窃听器, 打扰
word.lx: The police tested the room for bugs./r/n 警察检查房间里是否放有窃听器。/r/n Our test flight was to discover the bugs in the new plane./r/n 试验飞行是为了发现新飞机有何毛病。/r/n

word.name: build
word.lx: That house is built of bricks./r/n 那座房子是砖造的。/r/n We are of the same build./r/n 我们的身材一样。/r/n

word.name: builder
word.lx: He is the builder of the great empire./r/n 他是大帝国的创立者。/r/n The builder cost out the job at$6, 500./r/n 营造商给这活儿估价为6，500美元。/r/n

word.name: building
word.lx: Houses and churches are buildings./r/n 房子和教堂是建筑物。/r/n The building does not conform to safety regulations./r/n 这座建筑物不符合安全条例。/r/n

word.name: bulk
word.mean:
n. 大部分,大多数,大块,大批,容积,体积
vi. 越来越大
vt. (使)更大
word.lx: The cake bulked up./r/n 蛋糕发起来了。/r/n Do they charge carriage by bulk?/r/n 他们是否按体积计算运费？/r/n

word.name: bull
word.mean:
a. 大型(的),公牛(似的),雄性(的)
n. 公牛
word.lx: He likes to throw the bull./r/n 他喜欢吹牛。/r/n The Bull Team is made up of 15 players./r/n 公牛队由十五个运动员组成。/r/n

word.name: bullet
word.lx: He was hurt by a bullet./r/n 他被子弹伤着了。/r/n The bullet hit him in the chest./r/n 子弹击中了他的胸膛。/r/n

word.name: bulletin
word.mean:
n. 公报
vt. 发表
word.lx: He posted a bulletin on the board./r/n 他在布告板上贴了一张公告。/r/n In the November2, 19- issue of the Japan trade bulletin, you advertise fountain pen, pencil, etc./r/n 从19—年11月2日《日本贸易公报》看到贵公司有关钢笔和铅笔等广告。/r/n

word.name: bullets
word.lx: A sergeant went from door to door requisitioning bullets for the men./r/n 一名中士挨家挨户地给战士们征集弹药。/r/n That gun must be loaded with0.22 bullets./r/n 那支枪必须装0。22英寸直径的子弹。/r/n

word.name: bullish
word.mean: a. 似牡牛的,看涨的,上扬的
word.lx: Freight market continue bullish no chance to get same rate presently./r/n 海运市场持续看涨，目前无法获得相同的运费率。/r/n

word.name: bumper
word.lx: A bumper is a part of a motor vehicle./r/n 保险杆是机动车辆的一部分。/r/n Please give me a bumper./r/n 请给我斟一满杯。/r/n

word.name: bunch
word.mean:
n. 一串,一束
v. 使捆成束,挤成一群
vi. 集中
vt. 使成一束(或一群等)
word.lx: I received a bunch of flowers this morning./r/n 今天早晨我收到一束花。/r/n From the drawer Mr Mach took out a chain, with a bunch of keys dangling at its end./r/n 马赫先生从抽屉里拿出一条链子，链子一头挂着一串钥匙。/r/n

word.name: bundle
word.lx: He sold a bundle of old magazines to the second hand bookstore./r/n 他把一捆就杂志卖给了旧书店。/r/n She bundled her son off to school./r/n 她匆匆忙忙把儿子打发到学校去了。/r/n

word.name: bungalow
word.lx: A bungalow does not have an upstairs./r/n 平房没有上层./r/n His country cottage turned out to be an enormous bungalow./r/n 他的“乡下房子”原来是一座大平房。/r/n

word.name: bunk
word.mean:
n. 铺位(座床,床铺)
vt 为...提供卧铺
word.lx: Fully clothed, he fell across his bunk and was instantly asleep./r/n 他衣服也不脱往床铺上横着一躺，很快就睡着了。/r/n A built-in bed or bunk, as on a ship or a train./r/n 舱位，卧铺位卧铺或上下铺位，如船或火车上的/r/n

word.name: buoyant
word.mean: a. 有浮力的,心情愉快的
word.lx: Salt water is more buoyant than fresh water./r/n 盐水比淡水浮力大。/r/n The raft would be more buoyant if it was less heavy./r/n 木筏若轻一点浮起的就更好了。/r/n

word.name: bureau
word.lx: He worked in a travel bureau./r/n 他在一家旅行社工作。/r/n The goods were inspected by the China Commodity Inspection Bureau before shipment./r/n 这批货在装船前由中国商品检验局进行过检验。/r/n

word.name: bureaucracy
word.lx: It was hard to understand all the minute gradations of their bureaucracy./r/n 很难弄清楚他们那套官僚体制全部细微的层次分别。/r/n The dead hand of bureaucracy is slowing our progress./r/n 官僚主义的流毒拖慢了我们的进步./r/n

word.name: burgeon
word.mean:
n. 芽,嫩枝
v. 萌芽,发芽

word.name: burglar
word.lx: The burglar got into the house through the bedroom window./r/n 窃贼是从卧室的窗户潜入这所房子的。/r/n The burglar was sentenced to death./r/n 那个窃贼被判死刑。/r/n

word.name: burial
word.lx: The burial was done early in the morning without a ceremony./r/n 安葬是在大清早进行的，没有举行葬礼。/r/n His body was brought back to England for burial./r/n 他的遗体已运回英国埋葬./r/n

word.name: burn
word.mean:
n. 烧伤,灼伤
v. 燃烧,烧着,烧毁,灼伤
word.lx: She is burning to tell you the news./r/n 她急于要告诉你这消息。/r/n Paper burns easily./r/n 纸容易着火。/r/n

word.name: burst
word.mean:
n. 破裂,阵,爆发
v. 爆裂,突发
word.lx: The square is bursting with tourists./r/n 广场上到处都是游客。/r/n I felt as if my heart would burst with joy./r/n 我觉得自己高兴得心花怒放。/r/n

word.name: bury
word.lx: Both his grandparents were buried here./r/n 他的祖父母都葬在这里。/r/n He walked slowly, his hands buried in his pockets./r/n 他走得很慢，两手插在衣袋里。/r/n

word.name: bus
word.lx: I got up late this morning and missed the bus./r/n 今天早晨我起床晚了，错过了公共汽车。/r/n Here is ten pounds; the extra will cover your bus fares./r/n 这儿是10镑钱，多余可用作公共汽车。/r/n

word.name: buses
word.lx: There were so many people that the company put on extra buses./r/n 人数太多，公司加开了公共汽车。/r/n Five persons died during the collision between two buses./r/n 5个人死于公共汽车相撞。/r/n

word.name: bush
word.lx: There is a rose bush in front of the office./r/n 办公室前有一丛玫瑰。/r/n The juniper is a type of evergreen bush with purple berries./r/n 杜松子是一种生有紫红色浆果的常绿灌木。/r/n

word.name: bust
word.mean: n. 半身像,胸部,萧条,破产,不景气
word.lx: He and his wife busted up a year ago./r/n 他和他的妻子一年前分居了。/r/n He got a bust in the nose./r/n 他鼻子上挨了一拳。/r/n

word.name: bustle
word.mean:
n. 扰嚷
v. 奔忙,催促
word.lx: It seems that he enjoys the hustle and bustle of life in the big city./r/n 看起来他似乎很喜欢大城市的热闹繁忙的生活。/r/n She is always bustling about the house./r/n 她总是为家务忙个没完。/r/n

word.name: butcher
word.lx: They butchered the war prisoners./r/n 他们残杀战俘。/r/n Hitler was as a great a butcher as the world has seen./r/n 希特勒是有史以来最大的杀人狂。/r/n

word.name: button
word.mean:
n. 钮扣,按钮
v. 扣住
word.lx: One of the buttons has come off my coat./r/n 我上衣上的一颗扣子掉了。/r/n My skirt buttons at the back./r/n 我的裙子是背后扣扣子的。/r/n

word.name: buyer
word.lx: He is a buyer of our products./r/n 他是我们产品的买主。/r/n The contract was fulfilled on the part of the buyer./r/n 买方遵守了合同。/r/n

word.name: buzz
word.mean:
n. 嗡嗡声
v. 发出嗡嗡声
word.lx: He buzzed for his secretary to come./r/n 他按蜂鸣器叫秘书进来。/r/n My brain is buzzing./r/n 我的脑袋嗡嗡响。/r/n

word.name: buzzer
word.mean: n. 翁翁作声的东西,蜂音器,信号手
word.lx: The moving part of an electromagnetic device such as a relay, buzzer, or loudspeaker./r/n 电枢电磁装置的移动部分，如继电器，蜂音器或扬声器/r/n The buzzer rang when the meal was ready./r/n 饭做好时蜂呜器发出 兹 兹的响声./r/n

word.name: by
word.lx: He hurried by and disappeared in the wood./r/n 他匆匆走过去，消失在森林里。/r/n The house by the lake is a restaurant./r/n 湖边的那座房子是家饭店。/r/n

word.name: bye
word.lx: Bye for now!/r/n 那就再见了！/r/n Look after yourself, Bye!/r/n 自己当心点。再见!/r/n

word.name: cab
word.mean:
n. 出租汽车
v. 乘出租车
vi. 乘出租马车
word.lx: Shall we walk or take a cab?/r/n 我们走路还是坐出租车？/r/n A cab will be there in ten minutes./r/n 过10分钟会有一辆出租汽车到那儿。/r/n

word.name: cabbage
word.lx: I like to cook dishes with cabbage./r/n 我喜欢用洋白菜做菜。/r/n My mother was a lady, but just the same she ate boiled cabbage with a knife./r/n 我母亲是个淑女，可她还是用餐刀吃煮过的卷心菜。/r/n

word.name: cabinet
word.lx: The question was discussed in cabinet./r/n 在内阁会议上讨论了这个问题。/r/n They have found out the mole in the cabinet./r/n 他们已经发现了内阁中的间谍。/r/n

word.name: cable
word.mean:
n. 电缆,海底电报
v. 打海底电报
word.lx: She cabled the good news about her arrival in Chicago./r/n 她打电报说她已顺利到达芝加哥。/r/n A number of cables are needed in this project./r/n 这项工程需要大量电缆。/r/n

word.name: cache
word.mean:
n. 隐藏所,隐藏的粮食或物资,贮藏物
v. 隐藏

word.name: cadre
word.lx: A cadre must reach out to and be one with the masses./r/n 一个干部必须联系群众，同群众打成一片。/r/n Do you think him a good cadre?/r/n 你们认为他是个好干部吗？/r/n

word.name: cafe
word.lx: We had our lunch in a cafe and hurried back to the car./r/n 我们在一家小餐馆里吃了午饭，就又匆匆回到车上。/r/n The police came and ejected the noisy youths from the cafe room./r/n ＂警察来了，把那些吵吵嚷嚷的青年人从咖啡馆里撵了出去。＂/r/n

word.name: cafeteria
word.lx: A noisy cafeteria./r/n 嘈杂的自助餐厅/r/n A snack bar or small cafeteria, as on a military installation./r/n 随军小卖部小吃店或小自助餐厅，如军事单位中的/r/n

word.name: cage
word.mean:
n. 笼子
v. 关入笼中
vt. 把...关入笼内
word.lx: The old man wants to buy a cage for birds./r/n 老人想买一个鸟笼。/r/n Criminals are kept in the cages on this island./r/n 刑事犯被关在岛上的牢房里。/r/n

word.name: calamity
word.lx: More than 50 people were killed in this calamity./r/n 这次灾难中有五十多人丧生。/r/n The attack on Pearl Harbor was a crushing calamity./r/n 偷袭珍珠港（对美军来说）是一场毁灭性的灾难。/r/n

word.name: calcium
word.lx: We need some calcium everyday./r/n 我们每天需要些钙。/r/n Calcium is beneficial to our bones./r/n 钙对我们的骨骼有益。/r/n

word.name: calculation
word.lx: After much calculation, they offered him the job./r/n 经过慎重考虑，他们把这项工作交给他了。/r/n You are out in your calculation./r/n 你失算了。/r/n

word.name: calendar
word.lx: He put the desk calendar on the shelf./r/n 他把台历放在书架上。/r/n The cup final is an important date in the sporting calendar./r/n 足总杯决赛在运动日程表中是个重要日子。/r/n

word.name: calibrate
word.mean: v. 测定口径,查看刻度,划刻度 校正

word.name: callback
word.lx: The computerized phone has a callback facility./r/n 计算机化的电话有回叫装置。/r/n

word.name: calling
word.mean: n. 职业,行业,邀请 召集
word.lx: By calling, he is a hunter./r/n 他的职业是猎人。/r/n The hen clucked when calling her chickens./r/n 母鸡唤小鸡时，发出咯咯的叫声。/r/n

word.name: callous
word.mean: a. 麻木的,无情的,坚硬的
word.lx: A callous indifference to the suffering of others./r/n 对他人之痛苦漠不关心的铁石心肠的人/r/n

word.name: calm
word.mean:
n. 平稳,风平浪静
a. 平静的,冷静的
v. 平静下来,镇静
word.lx: It was a beautiful morning, calm and serene./r/n 那是一个宁静、明媚的早晨。/r/n You should keep calm even in face of danger./r/n 即使面临危险，你也应当保持镇静。/r/n

word.name: calorie
word.lx: How many calories can an ounce of sugar supply?/r/n 一盎司糖可以供给多少卡热量？/r/n Her diet restricts her to 1500 calories a day./r/n 她的规定饮食限制她每天摄入1500卡的热量。/r/n

word.name: calory
word.lx: How many calories can an ounce of sugar supply?/r/n 一盎司糖可以供给多少卡热量？/r/n The tin of ban have a calorific value of250 calories or have250 calories./r/n 这听蚕豆含２５０卡的热值或２５０个卡里路。/r/n

word.name: camel
word.lx: The merchant decided to use camels to carry his goods across the desert./r/n 商人决定用骆驼载运货物穿过沙漠。/r/n The camel is a herbivorous animal./r/n 骆驼是一种食草动物。/r/n

word.name: camera
word.lx: We have a video camera./r/n 我们有一架摄像机。/r/n We forgot to take our camera when traveling./r/n 我们旅行时忘记带照相机了。/r/n

word.name: camp
word.mean:
n. 露营,帐棚
v. 露营,扎营
word.lx: The boys have decided to go camping next week./r/n 男孩子们已决定下个星期去露营。/r/n You and I belong to different political camps./r/n 你和我属于不同的政治阵营。/r/n

word.name: campaign
word.mean:
n. 战役,运动,活动
v. 参加活动,参加竞选
word.lx: Joan is campaigning for equal rights for women./r/n 琼在从事争取妇女平等权力的活动。/r/n That politician won the presidential election campaign and became the President./r/n 那位政治家赢得了总统选举，成为了总统。/r/n

word.name: campus
word.lx: The new library was built in the centre of the campus./r/n 新图书馆建在校园的中心。/r/n I live on campus./r/n 我住在校园内。/r/n

word.name: can
word.mean:
v. 开罐
conj. 能,可以
n.罐头
word.lx: The fish is canned in the factory./r/n 鱼在这家厂里装成罐头。/r/n There is only one can of meat left./r/n 只剩下一听肉了。/r/n

word.name: Canada
word.lx: People from many countries immigrated to the United States and Canada./r/n 许多国家的人移居到美国和加拿大。/r/n The maple leaf is the emblem of Canada./r/n 枫叶是加拿大的象征。/r/n

word.name: Canadian
word.mean:
a. 加拿大(人)的
n. 加拿大人
word.lx: Her mother is a Canadian./r/n 她母亲是加拿大人。/r/n The expedition suffered all the rigors of a Canadian winter./r/n 这支探险队饱受了加拿大严冬的折磨。/r/n

word.name: canal
word.lx: Many oceangoing ships are sailing on the canal./r/n 许多远洋船只在这条运河上航行。/r/n The canal is navigable all the year./r/n 这条运河全年可通航。/r/n

word.name: cancel
word.mean:
n. 取消,撤消
v. 取消,删去
word.lx: He cancelled his order./r/n 他撤消了定货单。/r/n The match had to be cancelled because of bad weather./r/n 比赛因天气不好只得取消。/r/n

word.name: candidate
word.lx: There are three candidates for the vacancy./r/n 这一空缺有三名候选人。/r/n She had been nominated as candidate for the presidency./r/n 她已被提名为总统候选人。/r/n

word.name: candle
word.lx: If you go on burning the candle at both ends, you will be ill./r/n 你如果再这样起早贪黑地干活，你会病倒的。/r/n These discoveries are not worth the candle./r/n 这些发现毫无价值。/r/n

word.name: candy
word.lx: The baby was given a piece of candy./r/n 这孩子拿到了一块糖。/r/n He bought some candies for me./r/n 他给我买了几种糖果。/r/n

word.name: cane
word.mean:
n. 手杖,细长的茎,藤条
v. 以杖击,以藤编制的
word.lx: The man was so weak that he had to walk with a cane./r/n 那人太虚弱了，不得不拄着拐杖走路。/r/n Cane is pliable when wet./r/n 藤条潮湿时易弯曲./r/n

word.name: cannon
word.mean:
n. 大炮
vi. 开炮

word.name: canoe
word.mean:
n. 独木舟,轻舟
v. 乘独木舟
word.lx: We crossed the lake in a canoe./r/n 我们乘独木舟过河。/r/n They were canoeing in the lake./r/n 他们在湖中划独木舟。/r/n

word.name: canteen
word.lx: The canteen is more than usually busy today./r/n 今天食堂比往常忙得多./r/n He always bring a canteen with him on a hike./r/n 他作徒步旅行时总是带著水壶。/r/n

word.name: canvas
word.lx: The artist showed me his canvases./r/n 画家给我看了他的油画。/r/n The plumber stowed all his gear in a canvas bag./r/n 管子工把他所有的工具都装进一只帆布袋里。/r/n

word.name: canvasser
word.mean: n. 挨户推销商品的推销员

word.name: cap
word.mean:
n. 帽子,盖子
v. 给戴帽,覆盖于…顶端
word.lx: Who is the boy in the official school cap?/r/n 那个戴校帽的男孩是谁？/r/n He capped my story by telling a better one./r/n 他把我讲的故事加以改进，讲出一个更好的故事。/r/n

word.name: capability
word.mean: n. 能力,才能,性能,容量

word.name: capable
word.lx: He is a very capable doctor./r/n 他是一个很高明的医生。/r/n Our position is capable of improvement./r/n 我们的地位可以改善。/r/n

word.name: capacitor
word.lx: Some of the students are welding capacitor; the others resistor./r/n 学生中的一些人在焊接电容，另一些人在焊接电阻。/r/n Some of the students are welding capacitors; the others resistors./r/n 学生中的一些人在焊接电容，另一些人在焊接电阻。/r/n

word.name: capacity
word.lx: The lift has a capacity of 15 persons./r/n 这部电梯的载容量为15 人。/r/n Some people have a greater capacity for happiness than others./r/n 有的人享得起福，有的人享不起福。/r/n

word.name: cape
word.lx: The man has a red cape./r/n 这人有一件红色的斗篷。/r/n A cape or headland./r/n 岬海角或岬/r/n

word.name: capillary
word.mean:
n. 毛细管
a. 毛状的,毛细管的
word.lx: The capillaries can be found everywhere in our body./r/n 毛细血管遍布我们的全身。/r/n

word.name: capital
word.mean:
n. 首都,首府,大写字母,资产
a. 首都的,重要的
word.lx: Beijing is the capital of China./r/n 北京是中国的首都。/r/n Write your initials in capitals./r/n 把你名字的第一个字母写成大写。/r/n

word.name: capitalism
word.lx: He was always preaching the virtues of capitalism./r/n 他总是宣传资本主义的长处。/r/n Some say that capitalism and socialism will eventually converge./r/n 有人说资本主义和社会主义最终会合而为一。/r/n

word.name: capitation
word.mean: n. 人头税,每人均摊费

word.name: capsule
word.lx: The capsule is filled with small soluble cases./r/n 胶囊里充满了可溶的小颗粒。/r/n This capsule is used for animals./r/n 这个太空舱是用来装载动物的。/r/n

word.name: captain
word.mean:
n. 船长
v. 率领,指挥
word.lx: A captain commands a company or battery./r/n 一个上尉指挥一个连队或炮兵连。/r/n The man who captained the home team is my brother./r/n 率领主队的是我的兄弟。/r/n

word.name: caption
word.mean:
n. 说明,字幕,标题
v. 加上标题,加上说明

word.name: captive
word.mean:
n. 俘虏,迷恋者
a. 被俘的,被迷住的
word.lx: She was held captive for almost a month./r/n 她被监禁了将近一个月。/r/n He remained a captive to her beauty./r/n 他始终为她的美貌所迷惑。/r/n

word.name: capture
word.mean:
n. 抓取,战利品,捕获之物
v. 抓取,获得,迷住
word.lx: The novel captured the imagination of thousands of readers./r/n 这部小说引起了千万读者的想象。/r/n The capture of the city shocked everyone in the country./r/n 这座城市被占领使国人大为震惊。/r/n

word.name: car
word.lx: The car drew up alongside the road./r/n 小汽车在路边停下来。/r/n Repairing your car will cost a minimum of 100 dollars./r/n 修理你的汽车最低限度要100美元。/r/n

word.name: caravan
word.mean: n. 旅行队,有篷顶的大车
word.lx: The gipsy traveled in caravans./r/n 吉普赛人坐着大篷车旅行。/r/n The caravan stopped for the night at an oasis./r/n 旅行队在沙漠中的绿洲停下来过夜。/r/n

word.name: carbon
word.lx: The stick of carbon is often used in an electric arc lamp./r/n 碳精棒常用于电弧灯。/r/n I make a carbon copy of my documents./r/n 我用复写纸复写文件。/r/n

word.name: card
word.lx: I have received eleven Christmas cards by now./r/n 到现在为止，我已经收到了十一张圣诞卡片。/r/n They play cards every Friday./r/n 他们每个星期五玩纸牌。/r/n

word.name: cardiac
word.mean:
n. 强心剂,强胃剂
a. 心脏的,(胃的)喷门

word.name: career
word.lx: His early career was not a great success./r/n 他早期的生涯并不很成功。/r/n She is a career woman rather than a housewife./r/n 她是职业妇女而不是家庭主妇。/r/n

word.name: careful
word.lx: He is extremely careful about his appearance./r/n 他十分讲究外表。/r/n He is careful in his speech./r/n 他说话谨慎。/r/n

word.name: carefully
word.lx: She drives carefully up the rocky lane./r/n 她驾车小心地从这条很多石头的小路上驶过去。/r/n You need to structure your arguments more carefully./r/n 你需要更为仔细地组织自己的论点。/r/n

word.name: careless
word.mean:
a. 粗心的,疏忽的
n. 不关心的,粗心的[反]attentive
word.lx: He is careless about his appearance./r/n 他不讲究外表。/r/n It was careless of you to leave the door unlocked./r/n 你没锁门，太粗心了。/r/n

word.name: caress
word.mean:
n. 爱抚,拥抱
v. 爱抚,抱,怜爱
word.lx: The lonely child is longing for the caress of his mother./r/n 这个孤独的孩子渴望母亲的爱抚。/r/n He caressed his wife lovingly./r/n 他爱怜地抚摸着他的妻子。/r/n

word.name: caret
word.mean: n. 脱字符号,( ^ 文章中插字使用)

word.name: cargo
word.lx: The ship is discharging the cargo./r/n 船正在卸货。/r/n A cargo of steel was lost at sea./r/n 有一货轮的钢材在海上遗失了。/r/n

word.name: carpenter
word.mean:
n. 木匠
v. 做木工活
word.lx: His father is a carpenter./r/n 他父亲是一位木匠。/r/n Mr. Jones is a clever carpenter./r/n 琼斯先生是个巧木匠。/r/n

word.name: carriage
word.lx: Her carriage was the most beautiful one in the yard./r/n 她的马车是院子里最漂亮的。/r/n She has a graceful carriage./r/n 她举止优雅。/r/n

word.name: carrier
word.mean: n. 运送者,媒介物,带菌者
word.lx: He used to be a mail carrier./r/n 他曾是个邮递员。/r/n Legal interference with an opposing player to clear the path of the ball carrier./r/n 阻挡干扰对方队员为带球者开道的合乎规定的阻止/r/n

word.name: carrot
word.lx: The dish of boiled beef and carrot tastes good./r/n 那道清炖牛肉胡萝卜的菜味道不错。/r/n Have some more carrot./r/n 再吃点胡萝卜。/r/n

word.name: cart
word.mean:
n. 二轮运货马车
v. 驾运货马车,用车装载
word.lx: The horse pulled a cart loaded with potatoes./r/n 马拉着一辆装满土豆的板车。/r/n The farmer carted his vegetables to the market./r/n 农民用车把蔬菜装运到市场。/r/n

word.name: carton
word.lx: He snipped off the corner of the milk carton./r/n 他剪掉牛奶袋的边角。/r/n The kid drink up a whole big carton of juice after play in the hot sun./r/n 孩子们在烈日下玩耍後，把一整大盒的果汁喝个精光。/r/n

word.name: cartoon
word.mean:
n. 动画片
vt. 为...画漫画
word.lx: The cartoon ended with collapse of stout party./r/n 卡通以一个自以为是的人斗败后目瞪口呆作为结束。/r/n The man looks like a cartoon character with a plaster on his temple./r/n 那人太阳穴上贴了一块膏药，看上去像个卡通人物。/r/n

word.name: cartridge
word.mean:
n. 弹药筒,弹药,一卷软片
墨水筒，笔芯
word.lx: A heavy paper cartridge case./r/n 弹药箱一种沉重的纸板弹药箱/r/n Such a projectile in a metal casing; a cartridge./r/n 弹药（筒）装在金属盒中的射弹。弹药/r/n

word.name: carve
word.lx: He carved me some very nice pieces of chicken./r/n 他为我切了几块很好的鸡肉。/r/n The statue was carved out of marble./r/n 这座雕像是用大理石雕刻的。/r/n

word.name: cascade
word.mean:
n. 小瀑布
v. 瀑布似地落下
vi. 像瀑布般冲下或倾泻
word.lx: The water formed a cascade down the mountain./r/n 水沿山泻下，形成一条瀑布。/r/n Climbing plants with their bright flowers hung in cascades over the garden wall./r/n 开出鲜艳花朵的爬藤植物瀑布般悬挂在花园墙上。/r/n

word.name: cashier
word.lx: The cashier died in harness./r/n 出纳员以身殉职。/r/n The cheques must be signed in front of the cashier at the bank./r/n 必须当著银行出纳员的面签这些支票。/r/n

word.name: cassette
word.lx: He bought a new cassette recorder./r/n 他买了一台新的盒式录音机。/r/n There is a little window in the cassette case so that you can see the tape./r/n 盒式音像带上有个小窗, 能看见里面的磁带./r/n

word.name: cast
word.mean:
n. 演员阵容,投掷
v. 投,掷,抛
word.lx: The old man cast off his prodigal son and disinherited him./r/n 老人断绝了与他的不肖儿子的关系，并剥夺了他的继承权。/r/n She cast her eyes down to avoid direct eye contact./r/n 她垂下双目以避免对视。/r/n

word.name: castle
word.lx: The prince lived in a large and beautiful castle./r/n 王子住在一个美丽的大城堡里。/r/n The castle walls are very thick./r/n 城堡的墙很厚。/r/n

word.name: casualty
word.mean: n. 变故,伤亡者,伤亡人数
word.lx: Heavy casualties were reported (ie It was reported that many people had been killed) in the fighting./r/n 据报战斗中伤亡惨重（很多人被杀）./r/n The cottage was a casualty of the forest fire./r/n 那小屋被森林大火烧毁./r/n

word.name: cat
word.mean:
n. 猫,猫科动物
(CAT) 电子计算机横断层扫描
word.lx: A cat mews./r/n 猫喵喵叫。/r/n The little cat gave me a playful bite./r/n 小猫顽皮地轻轻咬了我一下。/r/n

word.name: catalog
word.mean: n. 目录,型录,大学概况手册
word.lx: You can look for the book in the library catalog./r/n 你可以在图书馆的图书目录上查找这本书。/r/n Can you catalog all these books?/r/n 你能给所有这些书编目录吗？/r/n

word.name: catalogue
word.mean:
n. 目录,总目
v. 编入目录
word.lx: You can look for the book in the library catalogue./r/n 你可以在图书馆的图书目录上查找这本书。/r/n Can you catalogue all these books?/r/n 你能给所有这些书编目录吗？/r/n

word.name: cataract
word.lx: He has developed a cataract./r/n 他患上了白内障。/r/n

word.name: catastrophe
word.lx: The earthquake was a terrible catastrophe./r/n 这次地震是个可怕的灾难。/r/n Because of the failure the catastrophe will be coming./r/n 因为失败，大祸就要来临了。/r/n

word.name: catching
word.mean:
a. 易传染的,有魅力的,迷人的
vbl. 捕捉,接住
word.lx: The children are catching herrings./r/n 那群孩子正在捕捉青鱼。/r/n Her eyes are the most catching I have ever seen./r/n 她的眼睛是我见到过的最迷人的。/r/n

word.name: category
word.lx: A category, especially an overly restrictive one./r/n 分类，类别分类，尤指受过度限制分类/r/n Dealing with a more restricted category./r/n 小（项）的；小前提的与一个更严格的类别有关的/r/n

word.name: cater
word.mean: v. 备办食物,投合,迎合
word.lx: Our politicians should learn to cater for the man in the street./r/n 我们的政治家要学会投合广大普通群众的需要。/r/n He has to cater for his boss./r/n 他得迎合他的老板。/r/n

word.name: cathedral
word.lx: This cathedral was regarded as a miracle in architectural history./r/n 这座大教堂被认为是建筑史上的奇迹。/r/n This Gothic cathedral has attracted visitors from all around the world./r/n 这座哥特式的大教堂吸引了世界各地的游客。/r/n

word.name: Catholic
word.mean:
a. 天主教的
n. 天主教徒
word.lx: The atom bomb is of catholic concern./r/n 原子弹受到普遍的关注。/r/n She was a devout catholic./r/n 她曾是个虔诚的天主教徒。/r/n

word.name: cattle
word.mean:
n. 牛
n. 家畜，马，无价值的人，畜牲
word.lx: Those poor soldiers died like cattle, without a struggle./r/n 那些可怜的士兵未经抵抗，就象畜生一般死了。/r/n The cattle are grazing./r/n 牛在吃草。/r/n

word.name: caution
word.mean:
n. 小心,慎重,警示
v. 警告
word.lx: He told us to proceed with caution./r/n 他要我们谨慎行事。/r/n I must caution you against the danger./r/n 我必须告诫你应谨防危险。/r/n

word.name: cautious
word.mean: a. 十分小心的,谨慎的
word.lx: He is cautious in his choice of words./r/n 他措辞很谨慎。/r/n She is cautious of telling secrets./r/n 她很谨慎，不会泄露秘密。/r/n

word.name: cave
word.mean:
n. 山洞
v. (使)凹陷
vi. (in)塌落,倒坍
word.lx: The roof of the old house caved in./r/n 那栋旧房子的屋顶塌下了。/r/n The cliffs are riddled with caves./r/n 岩壁上布满洞穴。/r/n

word.name: cavity
word.lx: I have a toothache because there is a cavity in one of my teeth./r/n 我牙疼，因为我的一颗牙齿上有个洞。/r/n A cavity or hollowed surface, especially of a bone./r/n 腔尤指骨头的腔或凹陷的表面/r/n

word.name: cease
word.mean:
n. 停止
v. 停止,终了
word.lx: As suddenly as it began, the rain ceased./r/n 雨突然而来，骤然而止。/r/n The old man ceased breathing the night before./r/n 老人前一天晚上停止了呼吸。/r/n

word.name: ceiling
word.lx: My bedroom is a large room with a high ceiling./r/n 我的卧室是一个天花板很高的大房间。/r/n This ceiling has a carved panel./r/n 这块天花板带有刻花镶板。/r/n

word.name: celebrate
word.lx: He read us a sonnet that celebrates love./r/n 他给我们读了一首歌颂爱情的十四行诗。/r/n His victory was celebrated with music and dancing./r/n 以音乐和舞蹈庆祝他的胜利。/r/n

word.name: celebration
word.mean: n. 典礼,宗教仪式,庆祝会
word.lx: I suppose we shall be having some sort of celebration for the bride./r/n 我想我们还是来为新娘庆贺一番吧。/r/n The climax of the celebration was a firework display./r/n 庆祝会的高潮是燃放烟火。/r/n

word.name: celebrity
word.mean: n. 名人, 著名,著名人士, 名声, 名誉, 社会名流
word.lx: The infatuated fan stalked the celebrity./r/n 那位着了迷的崇拜者追踪这位名人。/r/n She became a celebrity overnight./r/n 她一下变成名人了。/r/n

word.name: cell
word.mean: n. 细胞,电池,单人牢房,蜂房
word.lx: I have to buy a new dry cell./r/n 我必须买一节新的干电池了。/r/n The optical system of the eye stimulate cell of the retina./r/n 眼睛的视觉系统刺激视网膜内的细胞。/r/n

word.name: cellar
word.mean:
n. 地窖,地下室
vt. 把...藏入地窑(或酒窑)
word.lx: The plumber went down to the cellar to fix the leaky pipe./r/n 管道工到地下室去修漏水的管子。/r/n The cellar floods whenever it rains heavily./r/n 一下大雨地窖里就灌满了水./r/n

word.name: cellular
word.mean:
a. 细胞的
b. 手机

word.name: Celsius
word.lx: Water freezes at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (32 F) or zero/nought degrees Celsius (0 C)./r/n 水结成冰的温度是32华氏度（32 ）或零摄氏度（0℃）./r/n Water freezes at the temperature of 0 degrees Celsius./r/n 水在摄氏零度结冰。/r/n

word.name: cement
word.mean:
n. 水泥,接合剂
v. 接合,用水泥涂
word.lx: The floor has been cemented over./r/n 地板上铺了一层水泥。/r/n Our object is to further cement trade relations./r/n 我们的目标是进一步加强贸易关系。/r/n

word.name: cemetery
word.lx: He was buried in this cemetery./r/n 他被安葬在这个公墓里。/r/n A vehicle for conveying a coffin to a church or cemetery./r/n 柩车装运棺材去教堂或墓地的车辆/r/n

word.name: censor
word.mean:
n. 检查员, 潜意识的抑制,为Freud学派的术语
v. 检查
word.lx: The censor insisted on excising the passage from the film./r/n 电影审查员坚持剪去影片的这一段./r/n Two scenes were cut by the censor./r/n 有两个镜头被审查员剪掉了./r/n

word.name: census
word.mean:
n. 户口普查
v. 实施统计调查

word.name: centenary
word.mean:
n. 一百年
a. 一百年的
word.lx: The club will celebrate its centenary next year./r/n 该俱乐部明年要庆祝一百周年纪念./r/n The college did us proud at the centenary dinner./r/n 院方在一百周年校庆设宴款待我们。/r/n

word.name: center
word.mean:
n. 中心,中央
v. 集中
vi. 居中
vt. 使集中
word.lx: The topic centers on the crisis in these two countries./r/n 话题以那两个国家的危机为中心。/r/n He moved the table over to the center of the room./r/n 他把桌子移到房间中心。/r/n

word.name: centigrade
word.mean: a. 分为百度的,摄氏的

word.name: centimeter
word.lx: He is 5 centimeters taller than her./r/n 他比她高5公分。/r/n The boy is 150 centimeters tall./r/n 这个男孩有150厘米高。/r/n

word.name: central
word.lx: Such values are central to our way of life./r/n 这些价值对于我们的生活方式是至关重要的。/r/n My house is very central./r/n 我的家非常靠近市中心。/r/n

word.name: century
word.lx: This book was written centuries ago./r/n 这本书是几百年前写的。/r/n We are living in the 21st century./r/n 我们生活在21世纪。/r/n

word.name: ceramic
word.lx: These ceramic tiles are the ultimate in modern kitchen design./r/n 这种瓷砖是现代厨房装修中的极品./r/n The art or technique of making objects of ceramic, especially from fired clay./r/n 陶瓷学制作陶瓷物品的工艺或技术，尤指用耐火粘土制/r/n

word.name: cereal
word.mean:
a. 谷类(的),谷物(的)
n. 谷类食物
word.lx: Cereal products are good for our health./r/n 谷物产品对我们的身体有益。/r/n I have a bowl of cereal every morning./r/n 我每天早晨吃一碗麦片粥。/r/n

word.name: cerebral
word.lx: He had a cerebral palsy./r/n 他得了脑瘫。/r/n Either of the lateral halves of the cerebrum; a cerebral hemisphere./r/n 大脑半球大脑侧面半部分的任何一个；大脑半球/r/n

word.name: ceremony
word.mean: n. 典礼,仪式,礼节,礼仪
word.lx: The queen was crowned with proper ceremony./r/n 女王以传统仪式举行了加冕礼。/r/n They hold a mystic religious ceremony./r/n 他们举行了一个神秘的宗教仪式。/r/n

word.name: certainly
word.lx: He will certainly come./r/n 他一定会来的。/r/n Certainly they must know the probable result of such speeches./r/n 无疑，他们一定知道这样讲话可能产生的后果。/r/n

word.name: certification
word.mean: n. 证明, 保证，鉴定

word.name: certify
word.lx: I certify that he has received your money./r/n 我证明他已经收到了你的钱。/r/n I can certify to her honesty./r/n 我可以证明她是诚实的。/r/n

word.name: chain
word.mean:
n. 链,连锁,束缚
v. 用铁练锁住,束缚,囚禁
word.lx: I bought this loaf of bread in the chain store opposite the street./r/n 我在街道对面的连锁商店里买了这只面包。/r/n He is chained to his work./r/n 他工作忙得不能分身。/r/n

word.name: chained
word.lx: He is chained to his work./r/n 他工作忙得不能分身。/r/n He chained his bicycle to the post./r/n 他把自行车拴到柱子上。/r/n

word.name: chair
word.mean:
n. 椅子,席位,讲座
v. 担任（某事务）的主席
word.lx: The old chair gave a groan when the fat man sat down on it./r/n 那个胖子坐下时，旧椅子发出嘎吱的响声。/r/n Father sits in the same chair every evening./r/n 父亲每晚都坐在同一张椅子上，/r/n

word.name: chairman
word.lx: He was elected chairman of the meeting./r/n 他被选为会议主席。/r/n We were appalled when we heard that the chairman had been murdered./r/n 听说主席被谋杀，我们都吓坏了。/r/n

word.name: challenge
word.mean:
n. 挑战
v. 向...挑战
