word.lx: Nowadays no one will challenge the fact that the earth is round./r/n 现在没有人会对地球是圆的这一事实提出异议。/r/n This career offers a challenge./r/n 这份职业具有挑战性。/r/n

word.name: chamber
word.mean:
n. 室,房间,会所,枪膛
v. 放在枪膛内,关在室内
word.lx: The judge met the two lawyers in his chambers./r/n 法官在他的办公室里会见了两位律师。/r/n In Britain the upper Chamber is the House of Lords, and the lower the House of Commons./r/n 英国上院即贵族院，下院即众议院。/r/n

word.name: champion
word.mean:
n. 冠军,拥护者
v. 保卫,拥护
word.lx: He was the world tennis champion./r/n 他曾是世界网球冠军。/r/n The leader of a cause; a champion./r/n 领导者一项事业的领导；拥护者/r/n

word.name: chance
word.mean:
n. 机会,意外
v. 偶然发生,试试看
word.lx: A chance meeting brought the two old friends together again./r/n 偶然的相遇使两位老朋友重新聚首。/r/n I never miss a chance of playing football./r/n 我从不错过踢足球的机会。/r/n

word.name: chancellor
word.mean: n. 英大臣(使馆秘书,首相)
word.lx: The most important judge in Britain is the Lord Chancellor./r/n 英国最重要的法官是大法官。/r/n The chancellor is the most powerful man in the Austrian government./r/n 首相是奥地利政府最有实权的人。/r/n

word.name: change
word.mean:
n. 变化,零钱
v. 改变
word.lx: If we are to avoid defeat we need a change of leadership./r/n 我们要避免失败的话，就要换掉领导人。/r/n How much have you got in change?/r/n 你有多少零钱？/r/n

word.name: channel
word.mean:
n. 通道,频道,海峡
v. 引导,开导,形成河道
word.lx: Ships must follow the channel into the port./r/n 船只必须沿航道进入港口。/r/n This channel comes on the air every morning at 7 am./r/n 这个频道每天早晨7点钟开始播放./r/n

word.name: chant
word.mean:
n. 圣歌,赞美诗
v. 呤唱,诵扬
word.lx: Chant a prayer./r/n 唱赞美诗/r/n A Gregorian chant./r/n 格列高利圣歌/r/n

word.name: chaos
word.lx: After the failure of the electricity supplies the city was in chaos./r/n 电力供应中断，城市陷于混乱之中。/r/n He sees that human stupidity and greed are about to plunge Europe into chaos./r/n 他看到人间的愚蠢和贪婪即将使欧洲陷入一片混乱。/r/n

word.name: chap
word.mean:
n. 小伙子
v. 皲裂
word.lx: His chapped lips were bleeding./r/n 他干裂的嘴唇流出血来。/r/n Poor chap, his wife has just died./r/n 不幸的小伙子啊, 他刚刚死了妻子./r/n

word.name: chapel
word.lx: They go to chapel every Sunday evening./r/n 他们每个星期天晚上做礼拜。/r/n The ghost of Lady Margaret is supposed to haunt this chapel./r/n 据说玛格丽特女士的鬼魂常在这个礼拜堂出没./r/n

word.name: chapter
word.lx: I had nearly finished chapter 8./r/n 我就要把第8章看完了。/r/n The opening chapter gives a general overview of the subject./r/n 开篇第一章是对主题的概述./r/n

word.name: char
word.mean:
n. 木炭(散工,茶,字符)
vt 烧成炭(做散工)

word.name: character
word.lx: I wish this book was written in bigger character./r/n 我希望这本书的字再大一点儿。/r/n The statements were of political character./r/n 这种声明具有政治性质。/r/n

word.name: characteristic
word.mean:
a. 特有的,典型的
n. 特性,特征,特色
word.lx: Sympathy is the feeling characteristic of mankind./r/n 同情心是人类特有的感情。/r/n Ambition is a characteristic of all successful businessmen./r/n 雄心勃勃是所有成功生意人的共同特点。/r/n

word.name: characterize
word.mean: v. 表示...的特色,赋予...特色
word.lx: Your work is characterized by lack of attention to details./r/n 你的工作特点是缺乏对细节的注意。/r/n He may be characterized as a man of hobbies./r/n 他可以被称作是一个有癖好的人。/r/n

word.name: charity
word.mean:
a. 仁慈的、宽厚的
n. 慈善机关(团体),仁慈,宽厚
word.lx: She was always very generous in her charity./r/n 她行善时总是很慷慨。/r/n She regards his moral faults with charity./r/n 她宽恕他的品行不端。/r/n

word.name: charm
word.mean:
n. 吸引力,魔力,魅力
v. 迷人,使...迷醉,用符咒
word.lx: Her charm of manner made her very popular./r/n 她风度优雅，备受欢迎。/r/n Her graciousness charmed everyone at the party./r/n 她的风采令社交聚会上的每一个人倾倒。/r/n

word.name: charming
word.lx: I found Susan a very charming person./r/n 我发现苏珊是个非常可爱的人。/r/n The picture showed a charming pastoral scene of cows drinking from a stream./r/n 这幅画表现了牛在溪边饮水的迷人的田园风光。/r/n

word.name: charter
word.mean:
n. 特许状,执照,宪章
v. 特许,发给特许执照
word.lx: The holiday-makers chartered a boat to go fishing./r/n 渡假者租了一艘船去钓鱼。/r/n The company was granted a charter trade in the occupied territory./r/n 这家公司被授予特权，可以在被占领地区进行贸易活动。/r/n

word.name: chase
word.mean:
n. 追求,狩猎
v. 追捕,追逐,在金属上打花样
word.lx: We must chase the enemy from our country./r/n 我们必须把敌人赶出我国。/r/n They caught the puppy after a long chase./r/n 他们追了很久才把小狗逮住。/r/n

word.name: chasm
word.lx: There is always a vast chasm between rich and poor./r/n 贫富的鸿沟始终存在。/r/n The chasm between you and he can not be solved by us./r/n 你和他之间的裂痕不是我们能解决的。/r/n

word.name: chaste
word.mean: a. 贞洁的,纯洁的,朴素的
word.lx: She was a holy woman, innocent and chaste./r/n 她是一个圣洁的女人，天真而忠贞。/r/n Not chaste or modest./r/n 不贞洁的，淫荡的/r/n

word.name: chat
word.mean:
聊天,闲谈
v. 谈天，闲谈
word.lx: It is pleasant to chat with friends, and with no chat is it more pleasant than with close friends./r/n 和朋友聊天是愉快的，而这种情形没有比和知己的朋友聊天更为愉快。/r/n Ask him to stop by for a chat./r/n 请他来坐坐, 聊聊天./r/n

word.name: cheap
word.mean:
a. 便宜的
ad. 便宜地
word.lx: I hate this kind of cheap emotion./r/n 我讨厌这种肤浅的感情。/r/n Her shoes look cheap./r/n 她的那双鞋看上去很便宜。/r/n

word.name: cheat
word.mean:
n. 骗子,欺骗行为
v. 欺骗,作弊
word.lx: His father was cheated of his land./r/n 他的父亲被人骗走了地产。/r/n He never cheats to pass examination./r/n 他考试从不作弊。/r/n

word.name: checkout
word.mean: n. 检查(调整,验算,检查输出结果,工时扣除)
word.lx: Be there an express checkout service?/r/n 有没有快速退房手续的服务？/r/n

word.name: checkup
word.mean: n. 审查,检定,健康检查
word.lx: For the present we are made a general checkup./r/n 目前，我们正做总的检查。/r/n I went to see my doctor and had a checkup yesterday./r/n 昨天我去请医生作了一次检查。/r/n

word.name: cheerful
word.lx: She remained cheerful throughout the trip./r/n 旅行中她始终兴致勃勃。/r/n I have a cozy and cheerful room./r/n 我有一个舒适的令人愉快的房间。/r/n

word.name: cheese
word.lx: There are many kinds of cheese./r/n 奶酪有许多种。/r/n We had a homely meal of bread and cheese./r/n 我们吃了一顿面包加乳酪的家常便餐。/r/n

word.name: chemical
word.mean:
a. 化学的
n. 化学制品
word.lx: We are doing a chemical experiment./r/n 我们正在做化学实验。/r/n My major is the subject of chemical engineering./r/n 我的专业是化学工程学。/r/n

word.name: chemistry
word.lx: We have three periods of chemistry a week./r/n 我们一星期三节化学课。/r/n I prefer chemistry to physics./r/n 我喜欢化学甚于物理。/r/n

word.name: cherish
word.lx: One of our cherished privileges is the right of free speech./r/n 我们所珍视的权利之一是言论自由。/r/n A mother cherishes her baby./r/n 母亲疼爱孩子。/r/n

word.name: cherry
word.lx: He went to the cherry orchard to see flowers./r/n 他去樱桃园看花。/r/n We have different pies, such as apple, cherry, and strawberry pies./r/n 我们有不同的派，例如苹果、樱桃和草莓派。/r/n

word.name: chess
word.lx: Chess is played by two people./r/n 国际象棋是两个人玩的。/r/n I like to play chess with my father./r/n 我喜欢和爸爸一起下国际象棋。/r/n

word.name: chest
word.lx: He put some food into the ice chest./r/n 他把一些食物放进冰箱里。/r/n The doctor gave him an examination to see if he had chest trouble./r/n 医生给他做了检查，看他是否有肺病。/r/n

word.name: chestnut
word.mean:
n. 栗子
a. 栗色的
word.lx: These chestnuts are of bright reddish-brown./r/n 这些栗子是鲜亮的红褐色。/r/n Grab yourself a roast chestnut./r/n 你自己拿一只烤栗子吧。/r/n

word.name: chic
word.mean:
n. 别致的款式，流行样式，时尚
a. 别致的
word.lx: She dresses with chic./r/n 她穿着高雅。/r/n Chic clothes; a chic boutique./r/n 时髦的服装；一件雅致的饰物/r/n

word.name: Chicago
word.lx: She cabled the good news about her arrival in Chicago./r/n 她打电报说她已顺利到达芝加哥。/r/n The flight is routed to Chicago via New York./r/n 这个航班被安排经纽约飞往芝加哥。/r/n

word.name: chicken
word.lx: He has a chicken farm./r/n 他有一个养鸡场。/r/n There was fried chicken for dinner./r/n 有炸鸡肉作晚餐。/r/n

word.name: chief
word.mean:
a. 主要的,首席的
n. 首领
word.lx: The chief of the police department demanded severe punishments for criminals./r/n 警察局长要求严惩罪犯。/r/n What is the chief town in Norway?/r/n 挪威的主要城市是哪一个？/r/n

word.name: child
word.lx: My wife lost her first child a month before it should have been born./r/n 我太太在产前一个月流产了第一胎。/r/n Moses led the children of Israel out of the Egypt./r/n 摩西率领以色列的子民离开了埃及。/r/n

word.name: childbirth
word.lx: Epidurals are now often used during childbirth./r/n 现在分娩时常用硬膜外注射./r/n The mother died in childbirth./r/n 那个母亲死於分娩。/r/n

word.name: childhood
word.lx: They spend their childhood in happiness./r/n 他们幸福地度过童年。/r/n Mankind learns its first language in early childhood./r/n 人类是在幼年开始学习第一种语言的。/r/n

word.name: childish
word.lx: The little girl spoke in a high childish voice./r/n 小女孩说话时声音尖尖的，带着童音。/r/n They derided his efforts as childish./r/n 他们嘲笑他的做法很幼稚。/r/n

word.name: chill
word.mean:
n. 寒冷,寒意,失意
a. 寒冷的,冷漠的
v. 使...寒心,冷冻
word.lx: The sight sent a chill to her heart./r/n 这情景使她心寒。/r/n There was a chill in the air this morning./r/n 今天早上有点冷冰冰的。/r/n

word.name: chimney
word.lx: The factory chimneys poured smoke into the air./r/n 工厂的烟囱向空中排烟。/r/n Volumes of black smoke poured fromthe chimney./r/n 烟囱里冒出来团团黑烟./r/n

word.name: chimpanzee
word.lx: Some folks seem to have descend from the chimpanzee much later than others./r/n 有些人，看来像是比其他人晚了好久才从黑猩猩分支而传下来的后裔。/r/n

word.name: chin
word.lx: He was so fat that he had a double chin./r/n 他胖得有双下巴了。/r/n His chin was covered with bristles./r/n 他的下巴上长满了胡子茬。/r/n

word.name: china
word.lx: China is an oriental country with a long history./r/n 中国是一个有着悠久历史的东方国家。/r/n This set of ancient china is invaluable./r/n 这套古瓷器非常珍贵。/r/n

word.name: chip
word.mean:
n. 薄片,芯片
v. 削,切,削成碎片
word.lx: The entire content of a book will be located on a single silicon chip./r/n 整本书的内容只用一片硅芯片就可以装下。/r/n The paint has chipped off where the table touches the wall./r/n 桌子接触墙壁的地方漆皮已剥落。/r/n

word.name: chisel
word.mean:
n. 凿子
v. 用凿子刻,雕,凿
vt. 凿,雕,凿子,錾子
word.lx: He cut the figure of a woman out of that rock with a chisel./r/n 他用凿子把那块石头刻成了一个女人像。/r/n He chiseled that rock into the figure of a woman./r/n 他把那块石头凿成一个女人像。/r/n

word.name: chlorophyll
word.lx: Chlorophyll is a green substance in plants that absorbs energy from sunlight and helps them grow./r/n 叶绿素是生长在植物中的绿色物质，它能吸收阳光，促进植物生长。/r/n

word.name: chocolate
word.lx: Never eat chocolate before dinner./r/n 饭前不要吃巧克力。/r/n Would you like a cup of chocolate?/r/n 你想要杯巧克力饮料吗？/r/n

word.name: choice
word.mean:
a. 上等的,精选的
n. 选择
word.lx: She can exercise little choice./r/n 她几乎没有选择余地。/r/n They are the choice of the men./r/n 他们是队伍中的精英。/r/n

word.name: choir
word.mean: n. 唱诗班,唱诗班的席位
word.lx: He is a member of the choir./r/n 他是唱诗班的一员。/r/n The choir sang the amens beautifully./r/n 唱诗班唱的阿门非常优美./r/n

word.name: choke
word.lx: An old woman was found choked to death./r/n 发现一个老妇人被掐死了。/r/n She choked with emotion./r/n 她激动得说不出话来。/r/n

word.name: choose
word.lx: Have you chosen a coat yet?/r/n 你挑好了上衣没有？/r/n He chose not to go home until later./r/n 他决定晚一点才回家。/r/n

word.name: chop
word.mean:
n. 厚肉片,排骨
v. 剁碎,砍,切
word.lx: He chopped in with a sarcastic remark./r/n 他突然插进一句讽刺的话。/r/n She chopped the block of wood in two with a single blow./r/n 她一斧头把木块劈成两半。/r/n

word.name: chord
word.lx: This story may strike a chord for other women in the same situation./r/n 这个故事会触动其他与她处境相同的妇女的心弦。/r/n He struck a chord on the piano./r/n 他在钢琴上敲出和音。/r/n

word.name: chore
word.lx: She finds shopping a chore./r/n 她认为买东西是烦人的事./r/n All this was done to relieve women of household chores./r/n 这一切都是为了把妇女从家务劳动中解放出来。/r/n

word.name: chorus
word.lx: The papers all chorused the praises of the President./r/n 各报都异口同声地对总统表示赞扬。/r/n The chorus is dressed as fairies./r/n 歌舞队的人都装扮成仙子。/r/n

word.name: Christ
word.mean:
int. 天啊!
n. 基督
word.lx: To Christians, Jesus Christ is the Savior./r/n 对基督徒来说，主耶稣是他们的救世主。/r/n Apostles were sent out by Christ to spread his teachings./r/n 基督派基督十二使徒之一宣传他的教义。/r/n

word.name: Christian
word.mean:
a. 基督教的
n. 基督教徒
word.lx: He is an earnest Christian./r/n 他是一个虔诚的基督教徒。/r/n The man was excommunicated from the Christian Church./r/n 那人被驱逐出基督教会。/r/n

word.name: Christmas
word.lx: Merry Christmas!/r/n 圣诞快乐！/r/n We usually sing carols at Christmas./r/n 圣诞节时，我们一般会唱颂歌。/r/n

word.name: chronic
word.lx: There is a chronic unemployment problem in America./r/n 在美国存在长期失业问题。/r/n My brother has chronic bronchitis./r/n 我的哥哥患有慢性支气管炎。/r/n

word.name: cigar
word.lx: He lit up a cigar./r/n 他点燃了雪茄。/r/n He fired up a cigar./r/n 他点着一支雪茄烟。/r/n

word.name: cigarette
word.lx: In our city, the shops were not allowed to sell cigarettes to students./r/n 在我市，商店不准把香烟卖给学生。/r/n A cigarette thrown into the woods in dry weather may start a fire./r/n 在天气干燥时把点燃的香烟扔进树林可能会引起火灾。/r/n

word.name: cinema
word.lx: The crowd swarmed out of the cinema after the film ended./r/n 电影结束后，人们从电影院蜂拥而出。/r/n There is a telephone booth near the cinema./r/n 电影院附近有一个电话亭。/r/n

word.name: cipher
word.mean:
n. 零,暗号
v. 计算,做算术
word.lx: The cipher took me three weeks before I hit it./r/n 我费了3个多星期才把这密码解释出来。/r/n The army uses a special cipher so that military messages are kept secret./r/n ＂军队使用一种特殊密码，军事电讯因此得以保密。＂/r/n

word.name: circle
word.mean:
n. 圆周,社交圈,循环
v. 包围,盘旋,环绕
word.lx: The plane circled the airport before landing./r/n 飞机在着陆之前在机场上空盘旋。/r/n He has a large circle of friends./r/n 他有一大群朋友。/r/n

word.name: circuit
word.lx: The rocket did one circuit of the earth and returned to base./r/n 火箭绕地球运行一周后返回基地。/r/n There are two breakers in this circuit./r/n 这个电路里面使用了两个断路器。/r/n

word.name: circular
word.mean:
a. 循环的,圆形的
n. 传单,通报
word.lx: The full moon has a circular form./r/n 满月呈圆形。/r/n Stop giving me circular explanations and tell me what really happened./r/n 别拐弯抹角地解释了，告诉我究竟发生了什么。/r/n

word.name: circulate
word.lx: Please open a window to allow the air to circulate./r/n 打开窗子让空气流通。/r/n Blood circulates through the body./r/n 血液在体内循环。/r/n

word.name: circulation
word.lx: This magazine has a large circulation./r/n 这本杂志发行量很大。/r/n These ideas have been in circulation for some time./r/n 这些想法已经流行了一段时间。/r/n

word.name: circumference
word.lx: The circumference of the earth is almost 25,000 miles./r/n 地球的圆周长约为两万五千英里。/r/n The distance around something; the circumference./r/n 周围，四周围绕某物的距离；周围/r/n

word.name: circumstance
word.lx: Due to circumstances beyond our control the lecture was cancelled./r/n 由于无法控制的情况，讲座取消了。/r/n He was forced by the circumstances to do this./r/n 他做此事是为环境所迫。/r/n

word.name: circumstances
word.mean: n. 情况,情形,环境(常用复数)
word.lx: An unusual conjunction of circumstances led to the incident./r/n 各种情况的偶然巧合导致了这件事的发生。/r/n He was forced by the circumstances to do this./r/n 他做此事是为环境所迫。/r/n

word.name: circus
word.lx: The children are trying to persuade their mother to allow them to go to the circus./r/n 孩子们试图说服妈妈让他们去看马戏。/r/n The children watched entranced as the circus animals performed./r/n 马戏团的动物们表演时，孩子们都看得入神。/r/n

word.name: citation
word.lx: Something, especially an official award or citation, that commends./r/n 奖品，奖状称赞的某事，特别是官方的奖品或奖状/r/n Some dictionary writer use citation to show what word mean./r/n 有些辞典的编纂者用引文作例证以解释词义。/r/n

word.name: citizen
word.lx: He is an eminent citizen of China./r/n 他是一个杰出的中国公民。/r/n Bad official is elected by good citizen who do not vote./r/n 坏官员，是由不投票的好市民选出来的。/r/n

word.name: city
word.lx: Beijing is a large city./r/n 北京是一座大城市。/r/n The City reacted sharply to the fall in oil prices./r/n 伦敦商业区对油价下跌反应强烈。/r/n

word.name: civil
word.mean: a. 国内的,公民的,国民的
word.lx: Man is a civil creature./r/n 人是社会动物。/r/n It was a civil case so there was no question of him being sent to prison./r/n 这是一桩民事案件，因此他没有被送进监狱的可能。/r/n

word.name: civilian
word.mean:
a. 平民的
n. 平民
word.lx: People are indignant by their shooting of innocent civilians./r/n 对于他们枪杀无辜平民，人们感到义愤填膺。/r/n He resigned his commission to take up a civilian job./r/n 他辞去军职而从事平民工作./r/n

word.name: civilization
word.lx: Chinese civilization is one of the oldest in the world./r/n 中国文化是世界上最古老的文化之一。/r/n These letters revealed her wit and civilization./r/n 这些信流露出她的教养和才华。/r/n

word.name: civilize
word.lx: Many a rough man has been civilized by his wife./r/n 许多粗野的男人在妻子的开导下变得文雅了。/r/n His wife has had a civilizing influence on him./r/n 他妻子对改进他言谈举止有潜移默化的影响./r/n

word.name: civilized
word.lx: Not civilized; barbarous./r/n 不文明的；野蛮的/r/n Many a rough man has been civilized by his wife./r/n 许多粗野的男人在妻子的开导下变得文雅了。/r/n

word.name: claim
word.mean:
n. 要求,要求权
v. 要求,请求,主张,声称,说明,断言
word.lx: He set up a claim to the throne./r/n 他自称王位是属于他的。/r/n The matter claimed our serious attention./r/n 这件事需要我们认真注意。/r/n

word.name: clamp
word.mean:
n. 螺丝钳,夹子
vt.夹住，固定
word.lx: He clamped the reading lamp onto the edge of the table./r/n 他把台灯夹到桌子的边上。/r/n This clamp is mine./r/n 这个夹子是我的。/r/n

word.name: clan
word.lx: There are many clans in European countries./r/n 欧洲国家有很多党派。/r/n The whole clan is coming to stay with them at Christmas./r/n 他们那一大帮亲戚要在圣诞节期间来他们这里住。/r/n

word.name: clap
word.mean:
n. 拍手,拍手声
v. 鼓掌,轻敲
word.lx: He gave me a clap on the back and invited me for a drink./r/n 他在我背上拍了一下，请我去喝酒。/r/n She clapped her hands in delight./r/n 她高兴地拍手。/r/n

word.name: clarity
word.lx: Being unable to think with clarity or act with understanding and intelligence./r/n 迷惑的不能清楚地思考或不能理智或清晰地行为/r/n Lacking clarity or distinctness; cloudy or obscure./r/n 模糊的不清楚的或者不明显的；含糊的或者朦胧的/r/n

word.name: clash
word.mean:
n. 冲突,撞击声,抵触
v. 冲突,抵触,使...发出撞击声
word.lx: The color of the curtains clashed with the color of the carpet./r/n 窗帘的颜色和地毯的颜色不协调。/r/n She clashed the pan down on the stone floor./r/n 她把炒锅当啷一声掉在石头地板上。/r/n

word.name: clasp
word.mean:
n. 扣子,钩,紧握
v. 扣紧,紧握,密切合作
word.lx: She clasped the baby to her bosom./r/n 她把孩子紧紧抱在怀里。/r/n He held her hand in a firm clasp./r/n 他紧握她的手。/r/n

word.name: class
word.lx: Class distinctions have become less important during the last 50 years./r/n 在过去五十年间，社会等级差别已经变得不那么重要了。/r/n She is attending evening classes in computer studies./r/n 她在夜校上电脑课。/r/n

word.name: classical
word.lx: I prefer classical music to pop music./r/n 我喜欢古典音乐，不太喜欢流行音乐。/r/n He is regarded as one of the classical composers in this century./r/n 他被认为是本世纪第一流的作曲家之一。/r/n

word.name: classification
word.lx: There is a hierarchy in the classification of all living creatures./r/n 一切生物均可按等级分类./r/n One who assigns names, as in scientific classification./r/n 命名者命名的人。如在科学分类中/r/n

word.name: classify
word.lx: The books in the library are classified by subject./r/n 图书馆的书是按科目分类的。/r/n Would you classify her novels as serious literature or other?/r/n 你认为她的小说属于文学类，还是其它类?/r/n

word.name: classmate
word.lx: Be those your classmate?/r/n 那些是你的同班同学吗？/r/n His brother is my classmate./r/n 他哥哥是我的同学。/r/n

word.name: classroom
word.lx: The classroom was turned upside-down./r/n 教室被弄得乱七八糟。/r/n The boys stopped their clatter when the teacher came into the classroom./r/n 老师走进教室时，男孩子们停止喧哗。/r/n

word.name: clause
word.mean: n. 分句,从句,条款,款项
word.lx: This is an attributive clause./r/n 这是一个定语从句。/r/n Please pay attention to this clause in the sentence./r/n 请注意看句中的这个从句。/r/n

word.name: clay
word.lx: Bricks and dishes are made from various kinds of clay./r/n 砖和盘子由各种粘土制成。/r/n It was said that the first man was moulded from clay by some kind of god./r/n 据传，第一个人是某个神用泥土造出来的。/r/n

word.name: clean
word.mean:
a. 干净的
ad. 完全地
n. 清洁
v. 打扫
vi. 打扫,清扫
vt. 把...弄干净
word.lx: The bullet went clean through his arm./r/n 子弹穿过他的手臂。/r/n Please clean the window as I can hardly see out./r/n 请把窗子弄干净，我几乎看不到外面。/r/n

word.name: cleaner
word.lx: I use the floor cleaner to remove grease./r/n 我用地板除垢剂清除油污。/r/n She is an office cleaner./r/n 她是个办公室保洁工。/r/n

word.name: clear
word.mean:
a. 清楚的,明确的,澄清的
v. 澄清,清除障碍,放晴
word.lx: Do I make myself clear?/r/n 我说清楚了吗?/r/n I made it clear to him that I rejected his proposal./r/n 我清楚地告诉他，我拒绝了他的建议。/r/n

word.name: clearance
word.mean: n. 清除,解除,森林开拓
word.lx: Let me tell you some details about clearance./r/n 让我告诉你一些通关的细节。/r/n

word.name: clergy
word.lx: The new proposals affect both clergy and laity./r/n 新的建议与神职人员和俗人都有关系。/r/n All the local clergy attended the ceremony./r/n 当地所有的牧师出席了仪式。/r/n

word.name: clerk
word.lx: She is the filing clerk of our company./r/n 她是我们公司的档案员。/r/n The police suspected that the bank clerk was in league with the rubbers./r/n 警察怀疑银行职员与强盗有勾结。/r/n

word.name: clever
word.lx: He is clever at arithmetic./r/n 他擅长算术。/r/n Mr. Jones is a clever carpenter./r/n 琼斯先生是个巧木匠。/r/n

word.name: cliche
word.lx: Cliche is a feature of bad journalism./r/n 使用套语是拙劣的新闻体的特点./r/n

word.name: client
word.mean:
n. 顾客,委托人
n. 客户
word.lx: If a lawyer has plenty of clients, he grows rich./r/n 律师如果有大量的诉讼委托人，就会财源不断。/r/n The lawyer explained the legal technicalities to his client./r/n 律师给委托人解释法律上的要点./r/n

word.name: cliff
word.lx: The man committed suicide by jumping off the cliff./r/n 那人跳下悬崖自杀。/r/n I scrambled up the cliff for a better look at the sea./r/n 我很快地爬上峭壁，好饱览大海的景色。/r/n

word.name: climate
word.lx: Britain has a temperate climate./r/n 英国气候温和。/r/n In the current critical climate her work is not popular./r/n 在当前评论风气影响下，她的作品不怎么受欢迎。/r/n

word.name: climax
word.lx: The climax of the celebration was a firework display./r/n 庆祝会的高潮是燃放烟火。/r/n The music approached a climax./r/n 乐曲接近高潮。/r/n

word.name: climb
word.lx: I have some climbing plants in the garden./r/n 我的花园里长着一些攀缘植物。/r/n The value of imports has climbed sharply in the last year./r/n 去年进口货物的价值急剧上升。/r/n

word.name: clinic
word.lx: His clinic is near the newly-built railway station./r/n 他的诊所在新建的火车站附近。/r/n The road bears off towards the left when it reaches the brigade clinic./r/n 这条路通到大队卫生站后渐渐转向左边去了。/r/n

word.name: clip
word.mean:
n. 夹子,别针,回形针,修剪,剪下来的东西
v. 修剪,剪报,痛打
word.lx: The bus driver clipped our tickets to show we had used them./r/n 公共汽车司机在我们的车票上打孔，标明使用过了。/r/n We clipped our visit by a week./r/n 我们将访问缩短了一周。/r/n

word.name: clipboard
word.mean:
n. 付有纸夹的笔记板
n. 剪贴板
word.lx: Cut data to the clipboard replace the contents previously stored there./r/n 剪切数据到剪贴板会替代以前存储在那里的内容。/r/n Remove selected data from the document and store it on the clipboard./r/n 从当前文件把数据移开并把它存储在剪贴板上。/r/n

word.name: clipping
word.mean:
n. 剪断,剪裁,剪取物
a. 第一流的,头等的,极好的
word.lx: A clipping, as from a newspaper./r/n 剪辑剪下之物，如从报纸上/r/n The bus driver clipped our tickets to show we had used them./r/n 公共汽车司机在我们的车票上打孔，标明使用过了。/r/n

word.name: cloak
word.mean:
n. 斗蓬,宽大外衣,掩护
v. 遮掩,隐匿
word.lx: His friendly behaviour was a cloak for his evil intentions./r/n 他的友好行为不过是他险恶用心的伪装。/r/n Their negotiations were cloaked in secrecy./r/n 他们的谈判在秘密进行。/r/n

word.name: clock
word.lx: He clocked 9.8 seconds for the 100 metres./r/n 他100米跑了9.8秒。/r/n There must be something wrong with my clock./r/n 我的钟一定是坏了。/r/n

word.name: clockwise
word.mean:
a. 顺时针方向的
ad. 顺时针方向

word.name: clone
word.mean: n. 靠营养生殖而由母体分离繁殖的植物

word.name: closed
word.mean:
a. 关着的
a.封闭的
word.lx: That door is often keeping closed./r/n 那个门常常是关着的。/r/n The inaugural session closed at17:10 local./r/n 开幕式在当地时间下午5点10分结束。/r/n

word.name: closely
word.lx: The situation closely resembles that of Europe in 1940./r/n 这种形势与1940年的欧洲十分相似。/r/n The prisoners closely guarded escaped from the prison last night./r/n 被严密监视的这些囚犯昨夜越狱了。/r/n

word.name: closet
word.mean:
n. 壁橱,小室
a. 秘密的,空论的
word.lx: You may put these books in the closet./r/n 你可以把这些书放在壁橱里。/r/n Please put the coats back into the closet./r/n 请把大衣放回到壁橱里。/r/n

word.name: cloth
word.lx: I need a lot of cloth if I want to make a new dress./r/n 假如我要做新衣服，需要很多布料。/r/n I rubbed the window with a cloth./r/n 我用一块布擦窗子。/r/n

word.name: clothe
word.lx: He had to work hard to feed and clothe the large family./r/n 他必须努力工作才能使全家有饭吃，有衣穿。/r/n He have to work hard to feed and clothe his family./r/n 他必须努力工作以供给全家吃、穿。/r/n

word.name: clothes
word.lx: Old people need warm clothes in winter./r/n 老年人冬季需要暖和的衣服。/r/n Hang the clothes on the line./r/n 把衣服晾在绳子上。/r/n

word.name: clothing
word.lx: We have to put on warm clothing in winter./r/n 冬天的时候，我们不得不穿上温暖的衣服。/r/n He discarded his winter clothing./r/n 他把冬天穿的衣服都脱掉了。/r/n

word.name: clump
word.mean: n. 丛,块,笨重的脚步声
word.lx: He was clumping about in heavy boots that time./r/n 那时他正穿着笨重的靴子走来走去。/r/n Do you hear the clump of boots?/r/n 你听到靴子的咯咯声吗？/r/n

word.name: cluster
word.mean:
n. 串,丛,群
v. 聚合,成串,丛生,使...聚集
word.lx: You can see stars in clusters in the night sky./r/n 你可以看到夜空中的星群。/r/n The men clustered together round the fire and sang songs./r/n 人们聚集在篝火周围唱歌。/r/n

word.name: clutch
word.mean:
n. 抓紧,掌握,离合器
v. 抓牢,踩汽车之离合器,孵小鸡
word.lx: The boy clutched the marbles and ran away./r/n 那男孩一把抢去弹珠便逃之夭夭。/r/n The child clutched his toy./r/n 那个孩子紧抓着他的玩具不放。/r/n

word.name: coach
word.mean:
n. 长途汽车,(火车)客车车厢,教练
v. 训练,指导
word.lx: The football coach was criticized by the local paper./r/n 这位足球教练受到了当地报纸的批评。/r/n I coach people for English exams./r/n 我为准备英语考试的人做辅导。/r/n

word.name: coal
word.lx: A coal fell from the fire and burned the mat./r/n 一块煤炭从火中掉出来，烧坏了地席。/r/n Ships coal at Gibraltar./r/n 船在直布罗陀上煤。/r/n

word.name: coalesce
word.lx: The views of party leaders coalesced to form a coherent policy./r/n 党的领导人的各种观点已统一为一致的政策./r/n

word.name: coalition
word.lx: Some of the parties in Spain formed a coalition government./r/n 西班牙的一些政党组成了一个联合政府。/r/n The two parties have united to form a coalition./r/n 这两个党已结成联盟./r/n

word.name: coarse
word.mean: a. 粗糙的,下等的,粗俗的
word.lx: His coarse manners shocked everyone./r/n 他的粗鲁的举止使每个人震惊。/r/n Gross; coarse. Used of speech or language./r/n 言谈粗俗的粗野的；粗俗的。用语谈话或语言/r/n

word.name: coast
word.lx: Fishing boats were anchored all along the coast./r/n 渔船沿着岸抛锚停泊。/r/n The disabled ship coasted the island, looking for a harbor./r/n 那艘损坏的船只在海岛沿岸航行以寻找港口。/r/n

word.name: coat
word.mean:
n. 外套
v. 外面覆盖
word.lx: Jane bought a fur coat yesterday./r/n 简昨天买了一件裘皮大衣。/r/n The table was coated in dust./r/n 桌子上覆盖了一层灰尘。/r/n

word.name: coating
word.lx: There was a coating of slime on the unwashed sink./r/n 未刷洗的水槽上有一层污垢./r/n The chocolate coating has all been licked off the cream buns./r/n 奶油小面包外面的一层巧克力都被舔光了。/r/n

word.name: coax
word.mean: v. 哄,诱骗,灵巧慢慢的做
word.lx: He coaxed her into letting him take her to the cinema./r/n 他哄她同意带她去看电影。/r/n She coaxed him out of his bad temper./r/n 她循循善诱地劝他改掉坏脾气。/r/n

word.name: cocaine
word.lx: Analysis showed that cocaine was present in the mixture./r/n 分析的结果表明混合物中含有可卡因./r/n He have all the apparatus, including a blowtorch, for freebasing cocaine./r/n 他有加热吸用可卡因的所有器具，包括喷灯都有。/r/n

word.name: cock
word.mean:
n. 公鸡,公鸟
v. 耸立,耸起
word.lx: He cocked his eye at me./r/n 他对我使了个眼色。/r/n The cock crowed at dawn./r/n 公鸡在黎明时啼叫。/r/n

word.name: cocktail
word.mean:
a. 鸡尾酒(的)
n. 鸡尾酒
word.lx: An allergy to cocktail parties./r/n 对鸡尾酒会的厌恶/r/n Found cocktail parties distasteful./r/n 发现鸡尾酒会令人反感/r/n

word.name: cocoa
word.mean: n. 可可粉,可可饮料,可可色
word.lx: He made a mug of cocoa for me./r/n 他给我冲了杯可可饮料。/r/n The seed of this plant, used in making chocolate, cocoa, and cocoa butter./r/n 可可种可可树的种子，用于制造巧克力、可可粉和可可油/r/n

word.name: cocoon
word.lx: A cocoon is a kind of silk covering made by an insect./r/n 蚕茧是由昆虫制造的一种由丝组成的外包层。/r/n Silkworms make cocoons./r/n 蚕做茧。/r/n

word.name: code
word.mean:
n. 码,密码,法规
v. 把...编码,制成法典
word.lx: I can break the code of this box./r/n 我能破译这个箱子的密码。/r/n The Highway Code has been carried./r/n 公路法规已经被执行。/r/n

word.name: coed
word.lx: Is your school coed?/r/n 你们学校是男女合校吗?/r/n A coed dorm; a coed pool./r/n 男女合住的宿舍；男女联营/r/n

word.name: coerce
word.lx: Power or ability to coerce./r/n 强制的权力或能力/r/n

word.name: coexist
word.mean:
v. 共存
vi. 同时存在,共存

word.name: coffee
word.lx: Brazil exports a lot of coffee./r/n 巴西出口大量咖啡。/r/n Would you like a cup of coffee?/r/n 想喝杯咖啡吗？/r/n

word.name: cognitive
word.mean: a. 认知的,认识的,有认识力的

word.name: coherent
word.mean: a. 互相偶合的,清晰的，明了的，凝聚性的,连贯的
word.lx: The combining of separate elements or substances to form a coherent whole./r/n 综合把分别的元素或物质连接成连贯的一个整体/r/n The views of party leaders coalesced to form a coherent policy./r/n 党的领导人的各种观点已统一为一致的政策./r/n

word.name: cohesive
word.mean: a. 粘性的(有结合性的,有粘聚性的)
word.lx: Absence of any cohesive principle, such as a common standard or purpose./r/n 混乱，无秩序无任何凝聚性准则，如共同标准或目标/r/n

word.name: coil
word.mean:
n. 卷,骚动
v. 盘绕,卷
n. 【电】线圈, 绕组
word.lx: He passed me a coil of thread./r/n 他递给我一卷线。/r/n She coiled her hair at the back of her head./r/n 她把头发盘在脑后。/r/n

word.name: coin
word.mean:
n. 硬币,金钱,货币
v. 制造钱币
word.lx: Many hands make light work, to coin a phrase./r/n 常言说，人多好干活。/r/n He paid me in coin./r/n 他付给我的都是硬币。/r/n

word.name: coincidence
word.mean:
a. 同时发生的
n. 巧合
word.lx: What a coincidence!/r/n 多巧的事啊！/r/n By coincidence, we arrived here at the same time./r/n 我们凑巧一同到达这儿。/r/n

word.name: coke
word.lx: The refuse left when coke or charcoal is made./r/n 焦炭渣，煤屑焦炭或木炭做成后剩下的渣滓/r/n Coke consists mainly of carbon./r/n 焦炭的主要成分是碳。/r/n

word.name: coldly
word.lx: His boss looked at him coldly because he made several big mistakes./r/n 他的老板冷漠地看着他因为他犯了几个大错误。/r/n How did Mrs. Lin look at Mr. Lin? She looked at Mr. Lin coldly./r/n 林太太怎样注视林先生？ 她冷漠地注视林先生。/r/n

word.name: collaborate
word.lx: She collaborated with her sister/She and her sister collaborated on a biography of their father./r/n 她和姐姐合作写父亲的传记./r/n He was suspected of collaborating (with the enemy)./r/n 怀疑他（与敌人）勾结./r/n

word.name: collapse
word.mean:
n. 崩溃,倒塌
v. 倒塌,崩溃,瓦解
word.lx: The wind caused the tent to collapse./r/n 风把帐篷吹塌了。/r/n Talks between management and unions have collapsed./r/n 资方和工会的谈判失败了。/r/n

word.name: collateral
word.mean:
a. 并行的,附随的,旁系的
n. 支亲,副保,附属担保物
word.lx: The bank will insist on collateral for a loan of that size./r/n 银行对这样的大笔贷款一定要有抵押物。/r/n Lacking the protection of insurance or collateral security./r/n 未经保险的未发保险的，无附加担保的/r/n

word.name: collect
word.mean:
ad.&a. 对方付费(的)
v. 聚集,堆积,收集
word.lx: This department collects information on political extremists./r/n 这个部门搜集有关政治极端分子的情报。/r/n We are collecting money for the famine victim./r/n 我们在为遭受饥荒的灾民募捐。/r/n

word.name: collection
word.lx: There are two collections a day from this letter box./r/n 这个邮箱每天开两次。/r/n You are invited to view our autumn collection./r/n 您被邀请参观我们的秋季时装展览。/r/n

word.name: collective
word.mean:
a. 集体的,共同的
n. 集体

word.name: collectively
word.mean: ad. 共同的(集体地,总起来说)

word.name: college
word.lx: He is at law college./r/n 他在法学院读书。/r/n She is a member of the Royal College of Nursing./r/n 她是皇家护士协会的会员。/r/n

word.name: collide
word.lx: The ships collided in the fog./r/n 轮船在雾中相撞./r/n The bus and the van collided./r/n 公共汽车与客货车相撞./r/n

word.name: collision
word.lx: The liner is reported to have been in collision with an oil tanker./r/n 据报道，这艘客轮与一艘油轮相撞。/r/n Five persons died during the collision between two buses./r/n 5个人死于公共汽车相撞。/r/n

word.name: colon
word.mean:
n. 冒号
n. 结肠，直肠
word.lx: The old man died from colon cancer./r/n 这位老人死于结肠癌。/r/n There is a colon omitted in this sentence./r/n 这个句子中丢了一个冒号。/r/n

word.name: colonel
word.lx: The colonel ordered their soldiers to gather on the deck./r/n 上校命令士兵们在甲板上集合。/r/n Has he any right to use the style of Colonel?/r/n 他有资格使用上校头衔吗？/r/n

word.name: colonial
word.mean:
a. 殖民地的
n. 殖民地居民
word.lx: The new house he bought was colonial architecture./r/n 他新买的房子是美国初期的建筑。/r/n The resistance movement started a campaign of terror against the colonial rulers./r/n 抵抗运动开展了一场反对殖民统治者的恐怖活动。/r/n

word.name: colonist
word.mean: n. 殖民地居民,殖民者

word.name: colony
word.lx: This country used to be a British colony in Asia./r/n 这个国家曾是英国在亚洲的殖民地。/r/n Britain was mandated to govern the former colony of German East Africa./r/n 英国受权代管德国在东非的前殖民地./r/n

word.name: color
word.mean:
n. 颜色,气色,风格
v. 把...涂颜色,粉饰,脸红
word.lx: She loved the life, noise, and color of the market./r/n 她爱市场上的生趣、喧哗与多姿多彩。/r/n What color did you paint the door?/r/n 你把门漆成什么颜色？/r/n

word.name: colossal
word.lx: It requires government spending on a colossal scale./r/n 这要求政府付出巨额开支。/r/n

word.name: colour
word.mean:
n. 颜色
v. 给...着色,染
vt. 给...着色
word.lx: She loved the life, noise, and colour of the market./r/n 她爱市场上的生趣、喧哗与多姿多彩。/r/n What colour did you paint the door?/r/n 你把门漆成什么颜色？/r/n

word.name: column
word.mean:
n. 柱，圆柱；柱形物,专栏
[计算机] 列
word.lx: He used to write a column for this newspaper./r/n 他过去曾为这家报纸写专栏文章。/r/n His column is syndicated throughout the world./r/n 他的专栏文章通过报业辛迪加在世界许多报刊上发表./r/n

word.name: comb
word.mean:
n. 头梳,鸡冠
v. 梳头发,梳毛
word.lx: She wore a small comb as an ornament./r/n 她佩戴了一把小梳子作为装饰品。/r/n The police have combed the city for the murderer./r/n 警察在全市到处搜查凶手。/r/n

word.name: combat
word.mean:
n. 争斗,战斗
v. 奋斗,争斗
word.lx: The ship is combating the wind and waves./r/n 那只船正与风浪搏斗。/r/n The combat arm that deploys armored vehicles, such as tanks./r/n 装甲部队部署装甲车辆的战斗部队，如坦克/r/n

word.name: combination
word.lx: These players made a very good combination./r/n 这些球员们配合得很好。/r/n We tried it in every conceivable combination./r/n 我们把能想到的各种组合都试了一遍./r/n

word.name: combustible
word.mean:
a. 易燃的,燃烧性的,易动激情的
n. 燃质物,可燃物

word.name: come
word.lx: Your family should always come before your job./r/n 你的家庭应该比你的工作重要。/r/n The train slowly came to the station./r/n 火车缓缓地进站。/r/n

word.name: comedy
word.lx: There is not much comedy in modern war./r/n 现代战争并不是好玩的事。/r/n He prefers comedies to tragedies./r/n 他比较喜欢喜剧而不太喜欢悲剧。/r/n

word.name: comet
word.lx: Comets move around the sun like planets, but in long oval course./r/n 彗星象行星一样绕太阳运转，然而其轨道呈狭长的椭圆形。/r/n If I had binoculars, I could see that comet clearly./r/n 如果我有望远镜，我就可以清楚地看见那颗彗星。/r/n

word.name: comfort
word.mean:
n. 舒适,安慰,安慰者
v. 安慰
word.lx: My husband was a great comfort to me when my son was ill./r/n 我儿子生病时，丈夫给了我极大的安慰。/r/n He spoke a few words of comfort to me before leaving./r/n 走之前，他向我说了几句安慰的话。/r/n

word.name: comic
word.mean:
n. 连环图画,杂耍滑稽演员
a. 滑稽的,有趣的,喜剧的
word.lx: This famous comic actor is loved by the people even after his death./r/n 这位著名的戏剧演员即便是在死后，也仍受到人们的喜爱。/r/n Children like to read comics./r/n 孩子们喜欢看连环漫画。/r/n

word.name: comma
word.lx: Stop quibbling about the use of the comma./r/n 别再争辩逗号的用法了./r/n The two clauses are separated by a comma./r/n 这两个分句由一个逗号分开。/r/n

word.name: commander
word.lx: He is the commander of the expedition./r/n 他是远征军的司令/探险队的队长。/r/n An army commander must be skilled in tactics./r/n 一名军事指挥官必须精通战术。/r/n

word.name: commemorate
word.mean:
v. 纪念,庆祝
vt.&n. 纪念
word.lx: Christmas commemorates the birth of Christ./r/n 圣诞节是为了纪念耶酥的诞生。/r/n A monument was built to commemorate the victory./r/n 为了纪念胜利，建造了一座纪念碑。/r/n

word.name: commence
word.lx: The second term commences in March./r/n 第二学期自三月开始。/r/n I commence from this point./r/n 我从此点开始。/r/n

word.name: commentary
word.lx: I think his commentary on this issue is not correct./r/n 我认为他对这个问题的评论是不正确的。/r/n This commentary was excellently written./r/n 这篇解说词写得非常好。/r/n

word.name: commentator
word.mean: n. 注释者(注释者,解说员,新闻广播员)
word.lx: I prefer soccer commentator to report a match blow by blow./r/n 我宁愿足球比赛广播实况播音员详尽地报导比赛。/r/n Our commentator will now set the scene in the stadium./r/n 讲解员现在就要在体育场向我们报道。/r/n

word.name: commerce
word.lx: He majored in international commerce in college./r/n 他大学时的专业是国际贸易。/r/n The practices, methods, aims, and spirit of commerce or business./r/n 利润第一主义商业或营业的实践、方法、目的和精神/r/n

word.name: commercial
word.mean:
a. 商业的
n. 商业广告
word.lx: New York is a big commercial city./r/n 纽约是一座大的商业城市。/r/n Is commercial correspondence taught at the school?/r/n 学校里是否教授商业函件?/r/n

word.name: commission
word.mean:
n. 委任状,任官令,佣金
v. 委任,委托,使服役
word.lx: He has secured two commissions to design buildings for a local authority./r/n 他已承包两项为当地政府设计建筑物的业务。/r/n He commissioned a statue of his wife./r/n 他请人制作他妻子的雕像。/r/n

word.name: commissioner
word.mean: n. 委员,理事,行政长官

word.name: commit
word.mean:
v. 委托(托付),犯罪,作...事,承诺
[计算机] 委托
word.lx: The girl was committed to the care of an aunt./r/n 这女孩被交给姨母照顾。/r/n She committed herself to philanthropy./r/n 她专心从事慈善事业。/r/n

word.name: committee
word.lx: The committee meets at three today./r/n 委员会今天三点开会。/r/n He was criticized by the committee for failing to report the accident./r/n 他因未对事故进行汇报而受到委员会的批评。/r/n

word.name: common
word.mean:
a. 共同的,平常的,普通的
n. 平民,普通,公地,公园
word.lx: Rabbits and foxes are common in Britain./r/n 兔子和狐狸在英国很常见。/r/n Does the common man oppose the ideas of political union between European countries?/r/n 一般人是不是反对欧洲国家政治联合的构想呢？/r/n

word.name: commonly
word.lx: It was commonly believed that he was an honest man./r/n 一般都认为他是一个诚实的人。/r/n The question is more complicated than(is) commonly supposed./r/n 这问题比一般人想象的更复杂一些。/r/n

word.name: commonplace
word.mean:
n. 常事,老生常谈,普通的东西
a. 平凡的,陈腐的
word.lx: Many movies deal with commonplace themes./r/n 许多电影的主题很平庸。/r/n Soon it will be commonplace for people to travel to the moon./r/n 不用多久，人们到月球旅行会变成常见的事了。/r/n

word.name: commonsense
word.lx: He has no commonsense he always does silly things./r/n 他毫无常识，总是做些傻事。/r/n

word.name: commotion
word.lx: You are making a great commotion about nothing./r/n 你简直是在无理取闹。/r/n The discovery caused a tremendous commotion in the scientific world./r/n 那项发现在科学界引起极大的震动。/r/n

word.name: communication
word.mean:
n. 沟通,交通,沟通
[计算机] 通信
word.lx: Radio and television are important means of communication./r/n 无线电和电视是重要的通信手段。/r/n This area has not been covered by the communication net./r/n 这个地区还不在通讯网的覆盖之内。/r/n

word.name: communism
word.lx: They all believe in communism./r/n 他们都相信共产主义。/r/n All fighters for communism are infidels./r/n 所有的共产主义战士都是不信教者。/r/n

word.name: communist
word.mean:
a. 共产主义的
n. 共产主义者
word.lx: He is a communist./r/n 他是一名共产党员。/r/n Relating to, characteristic of, or held to resemble communism or Communists./r/n 共产主义者的有关、特征为或保持像共产主义或共产主义者的/r/n

word.name: community
word.mean:
n. 社区,团体
群落(生)
word.lx: He worked in community welfare department./r/n 他在社会福利部工作。/r/n His speech was an affront to all members of the community./r/n 他的话对社区所有成员是故意的侮辱。/r/n

word.name: commute
word.mean:
v. 交换,改换支付方法,减轻
v. 交换, 折偿
word.lx: My uncle used to commute ten miles to the city./r/n 我的叔父过去每天要走10英里到城里去。/r/n He commute from Beijing to nanjing every week./r/n 他每周乘车往返北京与南京。/r/n

word.name: compact
word.mean:
a. 紧凑的,紧密的,简洁的
v. 使装满,使简洁
[计算机] 紧凑的
n. 合约，条约
word.lx: He received a compact package./r/n 他收到一个扎得很紧的包裹。/r/n The Commonwealth agreed to make a compact with this country./r/n 英联邦同意和这个国家订约。/r/n

word.name: companion
word.lx: The fear of being discovered was his constant companion./r/n 他总提心吊胆的，担心被人发现。/r/n He had always considered her an ideal companion for his son./r/n 他一直以为她是他儿子的理想伴侣。/r/n

word.name: company
word.lx: I work in a small company./r/n 我在一家小公司工作。/r/n He entertained the company with cigars./r/n 他以雪茄烟招待客人。/r/n

word.name: comparable
word.mean: a. 可比较的,比得上的
word.lx: A comparable car would cost far more abroad./r/n 类似的车子在国外要贵的多。/r/n The achievements of an athlete and a writer are not comparable./r/n 运动员的成就与作家的成就不能相提并论。/r/n

word.name: comparative
word.lx: He majored in comparative literature./r/n 他的专业是比较文学。/r/n To illustrate my point I have done a comparative analysis./r/n 为说明我的观点, 我做了对比分析./r/n

word.name: comparatively
word.mean: ad. 比较地,相当地,多少
word.lx: An overland route is comparatively safe./r/n 陆路相对来说安全些。/r/n The Norwegians live in a comparatively cold zone./r/n 挪威人生活在比较寒冷的地区。/r/n

word.name: compare
word.lx: I compared the copy with the original, but there was not much difference./r/n 我比较了复印件和原件，但是差别不是很大。/r/n She is lovely beyond compare./r/n 她真是可爱得无与伦比。/r/n

word.name: comparison
word.lx: He is rather dull in comparison with others./r/n 和别人比较起来，他相当迟钝。/r/n We can only tell good from bad by comparison./r/n 我们可以通过比较来分辨好坏。/r/n

word.name: compartment
word.lx: The first-class compartments are in the front of the train./r/n 头等车室在列车的前面。/r/n This is a case with separate compartments for shoes, jewelry, etc./r/n 这是一个分格存放鞋、珠宝等的箱子。/r/n

word.name: compassion
word.lx: I had compassion for him./r/n 我怜悯他。/r/n We had compassion for the poor widow./r/n 我们同情这个可怜的寡妇。/r/n

word.name: compatible
word.mean:
a. 能共处的,可并立的,适合
[计算机] 相兼容的

word.name: compel
word.lx: The heavy rain compelled us to stay indoors./r/n 大雨迫使我们呆在户内。/r/n His cleverness and skill compel our admiration./r/n 他的聪明和技巧使我们赞叹不已。/r/n

word.name: compensation
word.lx: My job is hard, but it has its compensation./r/n 我的工作虽苦，但也有所补偿。/r/n Compensation of injured workers has cost the company a lot./r/n 公司花了一大笔钱赔偿受伤的工人。/r/n

word.name: compete
word.lx: Several companies are competing for the contract./r/n 几家公司正为争取一项合同而互相竞争。/r/n We have limited funds and several competing claims./r/n 我们的基金有限而争相申请的却有几处。/r/n

word.name: competence
word.lx: It has beyond the competence of the court./r/n 它已经超出法院的权限。/r/n No one doubts her competence as a teacher./r/n 谁也不怀疑她能胜任教师工作。/r/n

word.name: competent
word.mean: a. 有能力的,胜任的,足够的
word.lx: Is Mary competent as a teacher?/r/n 玛丽胜任教师的工作吗？/r/n We know you are competent in doing this job./r/n 我们知道你可以胜任这项工作。/r/n

word.name: competition
word.lx: Everyone in modern society faces the keen competition./r/n 现代社会的每个人都面临着激烈的竞争。/r/n The team were on excellent form throughout the whole competition./r/n 这个队在整个比赛过程中一直处於极好的竞技状态。/r/n

word.name: competitive
word.lx: America is a competitive society./r/n 美国是一个充满竞争的社会。/r/n Our prices are competitive./r/n 我们的价格是有竞争性的。/r/n

word.name: competitor
word.lx: The firm has better products than its competitors./r/n 这家公司的产品比其对手的好。/r/n That company is a strong competitor of us./r/n 那个公司是我们强有力的竞争对手。/r/n

word.name: compilation
word.lx: Her latest album is a compilation of all her best singles./r/n 她最新的一套唱片是她的最佳单曲唱片的汇集./r/n

word.name: compile
word.mean:
v. 编译,编辑,编纂
[计算机] 编译
word.lx: It take year of hard work to compile a good dictionary./r/n 编纂一部好词典要花多年心血。/r/n It takes years of hard work to compile a good dictionary./r/n 编一部好词典需要多年的艰苦工作。/r/n

word.name: complain
word.lx: They complained bitterly about the injustice of the system./r/n 他们愤恨地抱怨制度不公平。/r/n The tourist complained that the room was too dirty./r/n 游客抱怨说房间太脏了。/r/n

word.name: complaint
word.lx: I have a complaint of the chest./r/n 我胸部不适。/r/n You have no cause for complaint./r/n 你没有理由抱怨。/r/n

word.name: complement
word.mean:
n. 补足物,补语,余角
v. 补助
word.lx: This wine complements the food perfectly./r/n 用这种酒配这种菜肴最妙不过了。/r/n A wine is a complement to a good meal./r/n 美食加美酒才算完备。/r/n

word.name: complete
word.mean:
a. 彻底的,完整的,已完成的
v. 完成,使完整
word.lx: I will complete this task soon./r/n 我很快就要完成这项任务了。/r/n When will the work be complete?/r/n 这项工作什么时候完成？/r/n

word.name: completely
word.mean: ad. 完全地,十分地,全然
word.lx: The army made a completely successful attack on the enemy capital./r/n 军队攻击敌人首都的行动非常成功。/r/n She tried to understand the instructions, but she was completely at sea./r/n 她费尽力气想看懂那些说明文字，却全然不知所云。/r/n

word.name: completion
word.lx: Completion of the building work is taking longer than expected./r/n 建筑工程的竣工比预计时间要长。/r/n The film is on the point of completion./r/n 电影制作即将完成。/r/n

word.name: complex
word.mean:
a. 复杂的
n. 复合体
word.lx: Life is getting more complex and difficult./r/n 生活正在变得越来越复杂和艰难。/r/n He has a complex about his weight./r/n 他过分关心自己的体重。/r/n

word.name: complexion
word.mean:
n. 外观(状态,形势,开色,配容)
vt 染(上色)
word.lx: This great victory changed the complexion of the war./r/n 这次大捷使整个战局为之改观。/r/n He has a dark complexion./r/n 他肤色黝黑。/r/n

word.name: complexity
word.mean: n. 复杂(性),复杂的事物
word.lx: We are facing a problem of great complexity./r/n 我们正面对着一个极复杂的问题。/r/n It is a complexity of higher mathematics./r/n 这是一道高等数学的难题。/r/n

word.name: compliance
word.lx: In compliance with your wishes (ie As you have requested) we have withdrawn our suggestion./r/n 遵照你的要求我们已将建议撤销./r/n Compliance (with the rules) is expected of all members./r/n 要求全体人员都遵守（制度）./r/n

word.name: complicated
word.lx: Chopin aroused very complicated emotions in her./r/n 肖邦的乐曲唤起了她极其复杂的感情。/r/n They have straightened out a very complicated problem./r/n 他们已经把一个非常复杂的问题搞清楚了。/r/n

word.name: complication
word.mean: n. 复杂化,使...复杂的因素
word.lx: Complications set in, and the patient died./r/n 病人因出现并发症而死亡。/r/n A further complication was his refusal to travel by air./r/n 更麻烦的是他不肯坐飞机旅行。/r/n

word.name: compliment
word.mean:
n. 称赞,恭维,致意
v. 称赞,褒扬,恭维
word.lx: Your presence is a great compliment./r/n 承蒙光临，不胜荣幸。/r/n He complimented us with tickets for the football game./r/n 他送给我们足球赛的门票。/r/n

word.name: comply
word.lx: Everyone should comply with the law./r/n 每个人都应该遵守法律。/r/n She was told to pay the fine, but refused to comply./r/n 通知她交纳罚款，但她拒不服从。/r/n

word.name: component
word.mean:
n. 元件,组件,成份
a. 组成的,构成的
word.lx: Those are the components of an engine./r/n 那些是发动机的部件。/r/n Surprise is an essential component of my plan./r/n 我这项计划主要就是想使大家惊喜一下。/r/n

word.name: compose
word.lx: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen./r/n 水由氢和氧组成。/r/n He was composing at the piano at the age of seven./r/n 他7岁时就会钢琴作曲。/r/n

word.name: composer
word.lx: His dual role as a composer and a conductor made him very busy./r/n 他作曲家和指挥家的双重身份使他非常繁忙。/r/n The composer kicked the music around for a while, trying it out./r/n 作曲者把这个曲子随便哼了一会儿，看看行不行。/r/n

word.name: composing
word.lx: The judge or judges composing a court./r/n 法官（们）法官或组成法庭的全体法官/r/n He was composing at the piano at the age of seven./r/n 他7岁时就会钢琴作曲。/r/n

word.name: composite
word.mean:
a. 合成的,复合的
n. 合成物

word.name: composition
word.mean: n. 作文,著作,组织,合成物，成份
word.lx: He played many of his compositions for me./r/n 他为我演奏了他的许多乐曲。/r/n He has a touch of madness in his composition./r/n 他有点疯疯癫癫。/r/n

word.name: compound
word.mean:
n. 混合物,复合字
a. 复合的,混合的,合成的
v. 混合,调合,妥协
word.lx: Medicines are usually compounds./r/n 药品通常是化合物。/r/n Rose is a plant with compound leaves./r/n 玫瑰是复叶植物。/r/n

word.name: comprehend
word.mean: vt. 充分理解(综合,包含)
word.lx: If you can use a word correctly and effectively you comprehend it./r/n 你如果可以正确有效地使用一个词，你就是了解它了。/r/n I cannot comprehend this phrase./r/n 我无法理解这个片语。/r/n

word.name: comprehensive
word.mean: a. 综合的,广泛的,理解的
word.lx: She has a comprehensive grasp of the subject./r/n 她已全面掌握了这一学科。/r/n The reporter has made a comprehensive report./r/n 记者已做了全面的报道。/r/n

word.name: compress
word.mean:
v. 压缩,压榨
[计算机] 压缩
word.lx: The farmers compressed straw into blocks for burning./r/n 农民们将干草压成块用来烧火。/r/n The film compresses several years into half an hour./r/n 这部电影将几年的事压缩于半小时内。/r/n

word.name: compressor
word.mean: n. 压缩物,压缩机,收缩肌

word.name: compromise
word.mean:
n. 妥协,折衷,折衷案
v. 妥协处理,危害
v. 妥协,让步

word.name: compulsory
word.mean: a. 被强制的,强迫的,义务的
word.lx: Is military service compulsory in your country?/r/n 你们国家实行义务兵役制吗？/r/n Is English a compulsory subject?/r/n 英语是必修科目吗？/r/n

word.name: computation
word.lx: A quick computation revealed that we would not make a profit./r/n 粗略计算後可以看出我们无利可图./r/n Addition and division are forms of computation./r/n 加法和除法都是计算方法./r/n

word.name: compute
word.lx: He computed his losses at USD5,000./r/n 他估计自己损失5000美元。/r/n Scientists have computed the probable course of the rocket./r/n 科学家利用计算机计算了火箭可能运行的轨道。/r/n

word.name: computer
word.lx: This computer company was established last year./r/n 这家电脑公司是去年成立的。/r/n We should be watchful of computer viruses./r/n 我们应该警惕计算机病毒。/r/n

word.name: comrade
word.lx: They were comrades in arms./r/n 他们是战友。/r/n They interred their dear comrade in the arms./r/n 他们埋葬了他们亲爱的战友。/r/n

word.name: conceal
word.lx: It is wrong for a man to conceal things from his wife./r/n 一个男人对妻子隐瞒事情是不对的。/r/n He concealed himself behind the tree./r/n 他藏在树后。/r/n

word.name: concede
word.lx: I concede that you are right./r/n 我承认你是对的。/r/n You must concede that I have tried my best./r/n 你必须承认我已经尽力了。/r/n

word.name: concentration
word.lx: Stress and tiredness often result in a lack of concentration./r/n 紧张和疲劳常使人精神不集中。/r/n I found it hard to keep my concentration with such a noise going on./r/n 吵闹声不绝于耳，我很难保持精神集中。/r/n

word.name: concept
word.lx: It is difficult to grasp the concept of infinite space./r/n 掌握无限空间的概念是很难的。/r/n I can not understand the so abstract concept./r/n 我无法理解如此抽象的观念。/r/n

word.name: concern
word.mean:
n. 关心,关系, 关切的事,忧虑
v. 涉及,与...有关,影响;使关心
word.lx: How much money I earn is none of your concern./r/n 我挣多少钱与你无关。/r/n These problems concern all of us./r/n 这些问题影响到我们每一个人。/r/n

word.name: concerning
word.lx: They show great anxiety concerning their retirement allowance./r/n 他们对自己的养老金问题显得十分焦虑。/r/n Concerning each of two or more persons or things./r/n 交互的，相互的关于两个或多个人或物中的每一个的/r/n

word.name: concert
word.lx: The concert will be given on Saturday./r/n 音乐会将于星期六举行。/r/n He refused to concert with his partners./r/n 他拒绝和他的伙伴们合作。/r/n

word.name: concerted
word.mean: a. 商议好的,协定的,预定的
word.lx: A vigorous concerted movement for a cause or against an abuse./r/n 圣战赞成某一事业或反对某一弊病而进行的有力的统一运动/r/n He woke his audience to the need for concerted action./r/n 他使听众意识到有必要采取一致的行动。/r/n

word.name: concession
word.lx: We will make some concession in price./r/n 我们将在价格上做些让步。/r/n I hope you can make some concession./r/n 我希望你能做些让步。/r/n

word.name: concise
word.lx: The act or procedure of giving or receiving concise preparatory instructions, information, or advice./r/n 简介给予或接受简洁的预备性的指令、信息或忠告的行为或步骤/r/n Teaching content should be concise./r/n 教学内容要少而精。/r/n

word.name: conclude
word.lx: From his appearance we may safely conclude that he is a chain smoker./r/n 从他的外表，我们可以有把握地断定他烟抽得很凶。/r/n Once the price had been agreed, a deal was quickly concluded./r/n 价格一经商定，交易很快就达成了。/r/n

word.name: conclusion
word.lx: The conclusion of the movie was anticlimactic./r/n 电影的结局真没劲。/r/n What conclusion did you come to?/r/n 你得出了什么结论？/r/n

word.name: conclusive
word.mean: a. 决定性的,确实的,最后的
word.lx: Having the power to decide; conclusive./r/n 决定性的有权决定的；结论性的/r/n Supplying or being a final settlement or decision; conclusive./r/n 最后的提供或成为最后的解决办法或决定的；决定性的/r/n

word.name: concoct
word.mean: v. 混合而制,调合,捏造

word.name: concrete
word.mean:
n. 水泥,混凝土
a. 具体的,实在的,水泥的
v. 凝结,结合
word.lx: This post is made of concrete./r/n 这根柱子是混凝土做的。/r/n The workman is still busy concreting the road./r/n 工人还在忙着用混凝土铺路。/r/n

word.name: concurrent
word.lx: A brief shot that interrupts the visual continuity of the main action of a film, often to depict related matter or supposedly concurrent action./r/n 切换镜头一种中断电影的主要情节画面的连续性的简短镜头，通常用来描绘相关事件或可能同时发生的情节/r/n

word.name: condemn
word.lx: The criminal was condemned to death./r/n 这个罪犯被判死刑。/r/n We condemned him for his bad conduct./r/n 我们责备他行为不检点。/r/n

word.name: condense
word.lx: Steam condenses into water when cooling down./r/n 蒸汽冷却时凝结成水。/r/n Condense this paragraph into a few sentences./r/n 把这段文字简缩成几个句子。/r/n

word.name: condition
word.mean:
n. 情况,条件
v. 以...为条件,决定,支配,训练
word.lx: The boy was conditioned in English./r/n 这个男孩必须补考英语。/r/n Weather conditions are good./r/n 天气情况良好。/r/n

word.name: conditioner
word.mean: n. 调节器(调料槽,调节剂)
word.lx: This new style of air conditioner is noiseless./r/n 这种新型空调没有噪音。/r/n Lipstick and hair conditioner are cosmetics./r/n 口红和护发素都是化妆品./r/n

word.name: conditioning
word.mean: n. 调节(整理,改善,条件作用)

word.name: conducive
word.lx: Fresh air is conducive to health./r/n 新鲜空气有助于健康。/r/n Regularity ought to be observed, as regularity is very conducive to health./r/n 生活应遵守规律，因为规律对健康有益。/r/n

word.name: conduct
word.mean:
n. 行为,举动,品行
vt. 引导,指挥,管理
vt. 导电，传热
word.lx: The reporter was accused of unprofessional conduct./r/n 那位记者被控有违反职业道德的行为。/r/n Copper conducts electricity better than iron does./r/n 铜的导电性比铁强。/r/n

word.name: conduction
word.lx: Ruin will wait on such conduction./r/n 这样的行为将导致毁灭。/r/n

word.name: conductor
word.lx: She is a bus conductor./r/n 她是一名公共汽车售票员。/r/n The conductor punched his bus ticket./r/n 售票员用剪票夹在他的汽车票上打孔。/r/n

word.name: conference
word.lx: You will see him at the press conference./r/n 你会在记者招待会上见到他的。/r/n He is in conference and cannot come to the telephone./r/n 他在开会，没空来接电话。/r/n

word.name: confess
word.lx: The priest confessed the young man./r/n 神父听取那个青年的忏悔。/r/n He confessed that he had never seen her before./r/n 他承认以前从未见过她。/r/n

word.name: confident
word.lx: We are confident of victory./r/n 我们确信能胜利。/r/n He felt at ease and confident about the future./r/n 他对未来感到轻松自在并且充满信心。/r/n

word.name: configuration
word.mean:
n. 结构,布局,形态
[计算机] 配置

word.name: confine
word.mean:
v. 限制,闭居
[计算机] 限制
word.lx: I wish the speaker would confine himself to the subject./r/n 我希望演说者不要离题。/r/n The thief was confined in a prison./r/n 窃贼被关押在监狱里。/r/n

word.name: confirm
word.lx: The news confirmed my resolution./r/n 这消息加强了我的决心。/r/n He looked around to confirm that he was alone./r/n 他四处张望，要确定周围没人。/r/n

word.name: confirmation
word.lx: Your news was really confirmation for my beliefs./r/n 你带来的消息证实了我的信念。/r/n The price is subject to our confirmation./r/n 所有价格经我们确认后有效。/r/n

word.name: conflict
word.mean:
n. 冲突,矛盾,争执
v. 争执,撞斗,冲突
[计算机] 冲突

word.name: conflicting
word.lx: The conflicting interests of producers and consumers will be everlasting./r/n 生产者与消费者之间的利益冲突将永远存在。/r/n I cannot understand his conflicting philosophy./r/n 我不能理解他那互相矛盾的思想体系。/r/n

word.name: conform
word.mean: v. 使一致,遵守,使顺从
word.lx: His ideas do not conform to mine./r/n 他的想法和我的不一致。/r/n The building does not conform to safety regulations./r/n 这座建筑物不符合安全条例。/r/n

word.name: confront
word.lx: Confronted by an angry crowd the police retreated./r/n 警察面对愤怒的人群只好后撤了。/r/n They confronted the prisoner with his accusers./r/n 他们让犯人与原告对质。/r/n

word.name: confusion
word.lx: The enemy retreated in great confusion./r/n 敌人狼狈撤退。/r/n Their unexpected arrival threw our plan into confusion./r/n 他们的突然到来打乱了我们的计划。/r/n

word.name: congestion
word.mean:
n. 混杂,拥挤,过剩
[计算机] 拥挤
word.lx: He had a serious congestion of the lungs./r/n 他得了严重的肺充血。/r/n There is always traffic congestion in that street./r/n 那条街经常交通阻塞。/r/n

word.name: conglomerate
word.mean:
a. 密集而固结的,砾岩性的
n. 集成物,集块,砾岩
v. 凝聚成一团,使结成,结合
word.lx: An American conglomerate holds a major share in the company./r/n 一家美国的大联合企业持有该公司的大部分股份。/r/n The firm has been taken over by an American conglomerate./r/n 该公司已被美国一企业集团接管。/r/n

word.name: congratulate
word.lx: We congratulated him on his birthday./r/n 我们向他庆祝生日。/r/n I congratulated myself on my narrow escape./r/n 我庆祝自己死里逃生。/r/n

word.name: congratulation
word.lx: Congratulations on your marriage./r/n 恭贺你喜结良缘。/r/n Please give him my congratulations when you see him./r/n 请见到他时转达我的祝贺。/r/n

word.name: congress
word.mean: n. 代表大会,国会,议会；男女性交
word.lx: This matter will be discussed in congress tomorrow./r/n 这个问题将在明天的代表大会上讨论。/r/n Congress has approved the new educational budget./r/n 国会通过了新的教育预算。/r/n

word.name: conjunction
word.lx: The conjunction of workmanship and artistry in making jewelry decides the value of the jewelry./r/n 在珠宝饰物的制造中，手工与艺术的结合决定了珠宝的价值。/r/n The word is a temporal conjunction./r/n 该词是表示时间的连词。/r/n

word.name: connect
word.lx: These terminals are connected to our mainframe computer./r/n 这些终端设备都和我们的计算机主机相连。/r/n Has the phone been connected yet?/r/n 电话接通了吗？/r/n

word.name: connected
word.mean:
v. 连接
vbl. 连接

word.name: connection
word.lx: What is the connection between the two ideas?/r/n 这两个概念之间有何联系？/r/n The train was late and I missed my connection./r/n 列车误点了，我没能赶上联运。/r/n

word.name: connective
word.mean:
a. 连接著,连接的
n. 连接物,连接词

word.name: conquer
word.lx: She conquered her fear and crossed the shaking bridge by herself./r/n 她克服了恐惧，自己走过了摇摇晃晃的桥。/r/n The Zulus conquered all the neighboring tribes./r/n 祖鲁人征服了所有邻近的部落。/r/n

word.name: conquest
word.lx: They succeeded in the conquest of the city./r/n 他们成功地征服了这座城市。/r/n The Normans ruled England by right of conquest./r/n 诺曼人征服了英格兰成了统治者。/r/n

word.name: conscientious
word.mean: a. 审慎正直的,认真的,本着良心的
word.lx: She is a conscientious teacher./r/n 她是一个有责任心的教师。/r/n We should be conscientious to our work./r/n 我们应该对工作负责。/r/n

word.name: conscious
word.mean: a. 神志清醒的,意识到的,自觉的,有意的
word.lx: He was very conscious of his shortcomings./r/n 他对自己的缺点十分清楚。/r/n He was conscious of his guilt./r/n 他自知有罪。/r/n

word.name: consciousness
word.lx: When will the patient regain his consciousness?/r/n 这个病人什么时候恢复知觉？/r/n This experience helped to change her social consciousness./r/n 这次经验有助于帮助她改变社会意识。/r/n

word.name: consecutive
word.lx: We shall have meetings on two consecutive days, Monday and Tuesday./r/n 周一周二连续两天我们都将开会。/r/n The policy of our Party is consecutive./r/n 我党的政策始终如一。/r/n

word.name: consensus
word.lx: There is broad consensus (of opinion) in the country on this issue./r/n 对这一问题举国上下（舆论）普遍一致./r/n The two parties have reached a consensus./r/n 这两个政党达成了一致意见./r/n

word.name: consent
word.mean:
n. 同意,许可
v. 同意,承诺
word.lx: My father will never give his consent to our marriage./r/n 我父亲决不会同意我们的婚姻的。/r/n Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage./r/n 她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚姻。/r/n

word.name: consequence
word.mean:
ad. 因而,所以
n. 结果,后果
word.lx: Such a mistake would perhaps lead to disastrous consequences./r/n 这样一种错误可能导致灾难性的后果。/r/n He studied hard, and in consequence he passed the exam./r/n 他努力学习，因此通过了考试。/r/n

word.name: consequent
word.mean: a. 作为结果的,随之发生的
word.lx: His success was consequent on his hard work./r/n 他的成功是勤奋工作的结果。/r/n The goddess of criminal rashness and consequent punishment./r/n 埃特引人草率行事并受到惩罚的犯罪女神/r/n

word.name: conservation
word.lx: Most people have come to accept the need for conservation of natural resources./r/n 现在大多数人已认识到保护自然资源的必要。/r/n Who discovered the conservation of energy?/r/n 谁发现了能量守恒？/r/n

word.name: conservative
word.mean:
a. 保守的
n. 保守的人
word.lx: Old people are usually more conservative than young people./r/n 老年人通常比年轻人保守。/r/n He was very conservative in the estimate./r/n 他的这一估计很保守。/r/n

word.name: conservatory
word.mean:
a. 保存性的,有保存力的
n. 温室,音乐学院

word.name: conserve
word.mean:
n. 蜜饯,果酱
v. 保存,保全
word.lx: We must conserve our forests and woodlands for future generations./r/n 我们必须为子孙后代保护森林资源。/r/n I was surprised to find that the strong man liked to eat conserves./r/n 我很惊讶地发现这个强壮的男人喜欢吃蜜饯。/r/n

word.name: consider
word.lx: I consider it a great honor to be invited to dinner./r/n 我认为能被邀请参加晚宴是很大的荣幸。/r/n Your suggestion shall be carefully considered./r/n 你的建议会得到仔细考虑的。/r/n

word.name: considerable
word.mean: a. 相当的,可观的,重要的
word.lx: He bought the house at considerable expense./r/n 他花了很多钱买了这所房子。/r/n The mayor is a considerable official./r/n 市长是一位重要的官员。/r/n

word.name: considerate
word.mean: a. 考虑周到的,体谅的
word.lx: Considerate or kindly in disposition; amiable and tender./r/n 友善的，和蔼的性情体谅的或和蔼的；和善的，柔顺的/r/n You are so considerate./r/n 你真有心。/r/n

word.name: consign
word.lx: The goods were consigned to you by railway./r/n 货物已由铁路托运到你处。/r/n The captured criminals were consigned to the dungeons./r/n 抓到的罪犯被送进了地牢。/r/n

word.name: consignment
word.lx: The goods have been sent to Chicago on consignment./r/n 货物已运到芝加哥，托人代销。/r/n Official consignment, as to a prison or mental health facility./r/n 官方拘留官方的授权，给监狱或心理健康机构/r/n

word.name: consist
word.lx: The United Kingdom consists of Great Britain and Northern Ireland./r/n 联合王国由大不列颠和北爱尔兰组成。/r/n The beauty of the plan consists in its simplicity./r/n 该计划的妙处在于简洁明了。/r/n

word.name: consistency
word.mean: n. 稠度(一致性,相容性)
word.lx: His action lacks consistency./r/n 他的行为缺乏一致性。/r/n Please mix the flour and milk to the right consistency./r/n 请把面粉和牛奶调至恰当的浓度。/r/n

word.name: consistent
word.mean: a. 始终如一的,一致的,坚持的

word.name: console
word.mean:
v. 安慰,慰藉
n. 控制台,操纵台
word.lx: There are many lights and electrical instruments on the computer console./r/n 电脑控制板上有许多小灯和电子设备。/r/n Nothing could console him when his pet dog died./r/n 他的爱犬死后，什么事情也不能使他宽慰。/r/n

word.name: consolidate
word.mean:
v. 巩固,联合,统一
[计算机] 使固定
word.lx: He bribes his leader to consolidate his position./r/n 他贿赂他的领导来巩固他的地位。/r/n The two companies consolidated last year./r/n 这两个公司去年合并了。/r/n

word.name: conspicuous
word.mean: a. 显著的,显而易见的
word.lx: Lincoln is a conspicuous example of a poor boy who succeeded./r/n 林肯是一个穷苦孩子而功成名就的出色例子。/r/n A traffic sign should be conspicuous./r/n 交通标志应该明显。/r/n

word.name: conspiracy
word.lx: He revealed their conspiracy to overthrow the government./r/n 他泄露了他们推翻政府的阴谋。/r/n It has recently come to light that a second official was implicated in the conspiracy./r/n 最近有消息披露：又有一名高级官员与这个阴谋有牵连。/r/n

word.name: constant
word.mean:
a. 经常的,不变的
n. 常数,恒量
word.lx: He drove at a constant speed./r/n 他以稳定的速度开车。/r/n The machinery requires constant maintenance./r/n 这些机器需要经常保养维修。/r/n

word.name: constantly
word.lx: He constantly writes articles for the local paper./r/n 他经常给当地报纸写文章。/r/n These desires gnawed away at us constantly./r/n 这些欲望不断地折磨我们。/r/n

word.name: constituent
word.mean:
n. 成份,选民,构成物
a. 构成的,组织的,有提名权的
word.lx: Do you know the constituents of the mixture?/r/n 你知道这种混合物的成份吗？/r/n Analyze the sentence into its constituent parts./r/n 把这条句子的各个成份加以分析。/r/n

word.name: constitute
word.lx: Twelve months constitute one year./r/n 十二个月构成一年。/r/n Laws are constituted to protect individual rights and properties./r/n 法律是为保卫人民的权利和财产而制定的。/r/n

word.name: constitution
word.lx: He has a good constitution./r/n 他体质很好。/r/n The constitution of a primitive society is not necessarily simple./r/n 原始社会的结构并不一定就是简单的。/r/n

word.name: constraint
word.mean:
约束, 强制,约束条件
[计算机] 限制
对感情的压抑
word.lx: Not in confinement or under constraint; free./r/n 自由不受约束的或不受限制的；自由的/r/n Soon tired of the constraint of military life./r/n 很快厌倦了军事生活的约束/r/n

word.name: constrict
word.lx: A constricted throat in the air passage of a carburetor, causing a reduction in pressure that results in fuel vapor being drawn out of the carburetor bowl./r/n 文丘里管汽化器空气通道中的一段喉管，导致压力减小从而把燃料的蒸气抽出汽化器的碗状部分/r/n

word.name: constructing
word.lx: The act or process of constructing./r/n 构筑建筑的行为或过程/r/n A hollow metal cylinder used especially in constructing dams and foundations./r/n 金属筐一种尤其用于筑堤及防御工事的中空的金属筐/r/n

word.name: construction
word.lx: He became a construction worker after he left school./r/n 离开学校后，他成为一名建筑工人。/r/n There was a great outcry about the construction of the new airport./r/n 公众强烈反对修建该机场。/r/n

word.name: constructive
word.mean: a. 建设性的,构造上的,作图的

word.name: constructor
word.lx: Building constructors in Ji Nan and Qingdao have found our product easy to install and very attractive in appearance./r/n 济南与青岛的建筑商，大多认为我公司产品易于安装，且外观颇具吸引力。/r/n

word.name: consult
word.lx: I have consulted a number of law books in the British Museums./r/n 我查阅了大英博物馆里许多法律书籍。/r/n I consulted with a friend on a matter./r/n 我和朋友商量一件事。/r/n

word.name: consumed
word.mean:
v. 耗尽,消费,用光
vbl. 耗尽,消费,用光
word.lx: Alcohol may not be consumed on the premises./r/n （指公债和股票）超过正常或市面的价值；溢价。/r/n The fire quickly consumed the wooden hut./r/n 火焰很快地吞噬了那所小木屋./r/n

word.name: consumerism
word.mean: n. 用户至上主义, 商品的消费和销售性服务
word.lx: Deplored the rampant consumerism of contemporary society./r/n 对当代社会中狂热的拜金思想深感遗憾/r/n

word.name: contact
word.lx: Have the children been in contact with disease?/r/n 孩子们同这种疾病有过接触吗？/r/n We made contact with the ship by radio./r/n 我们通过无线电同那只船保持联系。/r/n

word.name: contagious
word.mean: a. 传染性的,会蔓延的,会传播的
word.lx: He has contagious laughter./r/n 他有着容易感染人的笑声。/r/n Scarlet fever is highly contagious./r/n 猩红热传染性很强。/r/n

word.name: contain
word.lx: The atlas contains forty maps./r/n 这个地图集有四十幅地图。/r/n This book contains all the information you need./r/n 这本书包含你所需的一切资料。/r/n

word.name: container
word.lx: The quantity that a container or apparatus can hold./r/n 最大容量集装箱或容器的装载容量/r/n Shipment to be effected on a container liner of ABC Line./r/n 交由ABC班轮公司的集装箱班轮运载。/r/n

word.name: contaminate
word.lx: Flies contaminate food./r/n 苍蝇可污染食物。/r/n They are contaminating the minds of our young people with these subversive ideas./r/n 他们这些颠覆性的思想是对我们年轻人的精神污染。/r/n

word.name: contemplate
word.lx: The police contemplated various kinds of trouble after the football match./r/n 警方料想足球赛后会发生各种各样的麻烦。/r/n The doctor contemplated the difficult operation he had to perform./r/n 医生细想他要进行的棘手的手术。/r/n

word.name: contemporary
word.mean:
n. 同时代的人
a. 同时代的,同时,属于同一时期的

word.name: contempt
word.lx: Their sense of justice gave them armor against the contempt of others./r/n 他们的正义感保护他们不被别人轻视。/r/n They showed nothing but contempt for him./r/n 他们对他轻蔑已极./r/n

word.name: contend
word.mean: v. 主张,奋斗,斗争,竞争,争论,辩论
word.lx: John has to contend with great difficulties./r/n 约翰得与那些艰难困苦作斗争。/r/n A hundred schools of thought contend./r/n 百家争鸣。/r/n

word.name: contention
word.mean:
n. 争论,争辩,所持的论点
[计算机] 线路争夺

word.name: contest
word.mean:
n. 竞赛,争论
v. 竞赛,争取,争辩
word.lx: The soldiers contested every inch of ground./r/n 士兵们为争夺每一寸土地而斗争。/r/n The contest between France and England for North America ended in victory for England./r/n 法国和英国争夺北美洲的战争以英国的胜利而告终。/r/n

word.name: context
word.mean:
n. 上下文
n. 环境,背景

word.name: contextual
word.mean: a. 文脉上的,以前后关系
word.lx: Contextual clues can help one to find the meaning./r/n 上下文所提供的线索有助於了解其意义。/r/n

word.name: continent
word.lx: There are seven continents in the world./r/n 世界上有七大洲。/r/n The Antarctica is a continent centered roughly on the South Pole./r/n 南极洲是一片大致以南极为中心的大陆。/r/n

word.name: contingency
word.mean: n. 偶然(列联,意外费用,相切)

word.name: continual
word.lx: Are you tired of this continual rain?/r/n 你对于这不停的雨不感到厌烦吗？/r/n Please stop your continual questions./r/n 请不要再接二连三地提问了。/r/n

word.name: continue
word.lx: The fighting around the airport continued for a week before the enemy was defeated./r/n 机场附近的战斗持续了一个星期，敌军才被击溃。/r/n Wet weather may continue for a few more days./r/n 多雨的天气可能还要持续好几天./r/n

word.name: continued
word.mean: a. 继续的, 延续的
word.lx: The state of being continued./r/n 被继续被继续的状态/r/n Edison and his men were watching his light all the night. The light continued to burn for40 hours before it went out./r/n 爱迪生和他的同伴整晚上在观察他的灯，灯连续亮了40个小时才熄灭。/r/n

word.name: continuity
word.lx: We must ensure continuity of fuel supplies./r/n 我们应该确保燃料供给不中断./r/n Continuity is ensured by using the same props in successive scenes./r/n 在连续的场景中使用同样的道具以确保前後衔接./r/n

word.name: contour
word.mean:
n. 轮廓(等高线,周线,电路,概要)
vt 画轮廓(画等高线)
word.lx: The smooth contour of the sculpture is wonderful./r/n 雕塑物平滑的轮廓线简直太美了。/r/n The contour of that mountain looks like a dragon./r/n 那座大山的轮廓看上去像一条龙。/r/n

word.name: contract
word.mean:
n. 合约,婚约,立约
v. 缩短,缩小
v. 订约
word.lx: The city contracted for a library with their firm./r/n 市政当局和他们公司订立了修建图书馆的合同。/r/n Marriage is, first of all, a contract which must be governed by justice./r/n 婚姻首先是一种契约，它必须以公正为制约。/r/n

word.name: contractor
word.mean: n. 立契约的人,承包商
word.lx: Who is the contractor on the new motorway?/r/n 谁是这条新公路的承包商?/r/n The person is a building contractor./r/n 那人是个承建商。/r/n

word.name: contradict
word.lx: The two statements contradict each other./r/n 两种说法相互抵触。/r/n The report contradicts what we heard yesterday./r/n 这个报道与我们昨天听到的有矛盾。/r/n

word.name: contrast
word.mean:
n. 差别,对比,对照物
v. 对比,成对照
[计算机] 反差

word.name: contribute
word.mean: v. 有助于,捐助,投稿,贡献
word.lx: Each worker contributed one dollar to the Red Cross./r/n 每个工人都向红十字会捐献了一美元。/r/n Honesty and hard work contribute to success and happiness./r/n 诚实加苦干有助于成功和幸福。/r/n

word.name: contributor
word.mean: n. 贡献者,捐助者,赠送者

word.name: contrive
word.lx: Can you contrive to be here early?/r/n 你能不能设法早到点？/r/n The prisoner contrived a way to escape./r/n 囚犯图谋越狱。/r/n

word.name: control
word.lx: At that time the Romans controlled a vast empire./r/n 那时罗马人统治着一个很大的帝国。/r/n The government has imposed strict controls over the import of luxury goods./r/n 政府对奢侈品的进口采取了严格的管制。/r/n

word.name: controller
word.mean: n. 控制器,管理者,主计员
word.lx: Another might be used for control purposes; changing the mode of the controller./r/n 另一个则用于控制目的，用来改变控制器的运行模式。/r/n His official designation is Financial Controller./r/n 他的职称是财务总监./r/n

word.name: controversial
word.mean: a. 引起争论的,有争议的
word.lx: Many of the new taxes are controversial./r/n 许多新税收都是有争议的。/r/n Not wanting to make my controversial views known yet, I preferred to follow the crowd for a while./r/n 我还不想公开我那些会引起争论的观点，宁可暂且随大溜。/r/n

word.name: controversy
word.lx: The new government appointments have caused much controversy./r/n 政府在人事上作的新的委任，引起了许多争论。/r/n The mayor will try to accord the controversy over the housing scheme./r/n 市长试图调解在住房建筑规划方面的争议。/r/n

word.name: convalescent
word.lx: At last she was pronounced upon the mend and then convalescent./r/n 她的病情终于宣告有了好转—不久就恢复健康了。/r/n

word.name: convene
word.mean:
v. 集合,召集,召唤
v. 聚集,集合
word.lx: People were convened here for an emergency meeting./r/n 人们被召集到这里举行紧急会议。/r/n The tribunal will convene tomorrow./r/n 法庭将于明日开庭。/r/n

word.name: convenient
word.lx: Will it be convenient for you to come in the morning?/r/n 你上午来方便吗？/r/n We must arrange a convenient time and place for the meeting./r/n 我们必须安排一个合适的时间和地点开会。/r/n

word.name: convention
word.mean:
n. 大会,协定,惯例
[计算机] 约定
word.lx: The convention looms as political battle./r/n 这场大会将是一场政治角斗。/r/n She redeemed her reputation with a powerful speech to the party convention./r/n 她由于向党代表大会做了有力的演说而挽回了自己的声誉。/r/n

word.name: conventional
word.mean: a. 普通的,常见的,习惯的,常规的
word.lx: How are you?" is a conventional greeting./r/n “你好”是一个习惯问候语。/r/n

word.name: converge
word.mean: v. 聚合,集中于一点(或一块)
word.lx: Some say that capitalism and socialism will eventually converge./r/n 有人说资本主义和社会主义最终会合而为一。/r/n The roads converge just before the station./r/n 四面八方的道路会聚在火车站前。/r/n

word.name: converged
word.lx: Angry crowds converged on the speaker./r/n 愤怒的群众涌向演讲者。/r/n In time, our views and our efforts converged./r/n 我们的观点和努力迟早要达成一致/r/n

word.name: convergence
word.lx: Correspondence between parts or organs arising from evolutionary convergence./r/n 异体同功由进化趋同而产生的部分或器官之间的对应现象/r/n A town at the convergence of two rivers./r/n 位于两条河流交点处的城镇/r/n

word.name: conversation
word.lx: The professor invited his students to his home for conversation./r/n 教授邀请学生们到自己家里会晤。/r/n Did you have a conversation with him?/r/n 你和他谈过话了吗？/r/n

word.name: conversational
word.mean: a. 会话的,对话的,健谈的

word.name: conversion
word.mean: n. 转变,改变信仰,换位
word.lx: Conversion to gas central heating will save you a lot of money./r/n 改用煤气集中供暖将节省大笔开支。/r/n When he saw how the theory increased unemployment, he underwent quite a conversion./r/n 当他看到这个理论加重了失业后，他彻底改变了看法。/r/n

word.name: convert
word.mean:
v. 使转变,使...改变信仰,倒置
n. 皈依者,改宗者
word.lx: Coal can be converted to gas./r/n 煤可以转化成煤气。/r/n He is a recent convert to Christianity./r/n 他最近改信基督教了。/r/n

word.name: converted
word.lx: Coal can be converted to gas./r/n 煤可以转化成煤气。/r/n Sugar is converted into alcohol through the process of fermentation./r/n 糖经过发酵变成酒精。/r/n

word.name: convertible
word.mean:
a. 可改变的,可交换,同意义的
n. 有活动摺篷的汽车
word.lx: Dollars convertible into yen./r/n 可兑换成日元的美金/r/n A convertible sofa bed./r/n 可变换的沙发床/r/n

word.name: convey
word.mean:
v. 传达,运输,转移
[计算机] 输送

word.name: conveyance
word.mean: n. 运输,运输工具,财产让与
word.lx: Railroad trains and buses are public conveyances./r/n 火车和公共汽车是公共交通工具。/r/n Fares do not include conveyance between railway stations and steamer piers./r/n 运费中不包括火车站至轮船码头之间的运输费用。/r/n

word.name: convict
word.mean:
n. 囚犯,罪犯
v. 使...确信自己犯错,宣告...有罪,使...知罪
word.lx: The criminal was convicted of murder./r/n 歹徒被判谋杀罪。/r/n The escaped convict has been caught by the police again./r/n 越狱的逃犯已经再次被警方抓获。/r/n

word.name: conviction
word.lx: I have the conviction that he is right./r/n 我深信他是对的。/r/n They have no previous convictions./r/n 他们没有前科。/r/n

word.name: convince
word.lx: He convinced me of his sincerity./r/n 他使我确信他的真诚。/r/n Your argument is too weak to convince me./r/n 你的论点太薄弱了，说服不了我。/r/n

word.name: cool
word.mean:
a. 凉的,凉快的,酷
ad. 冷静地
n. 凉快
v. 使变凉
word.lx: Even when you argue, you should try to keep cool./r/n 即使在争辩时，你也要尽力保持冷静。/r/n As it was a hot day she wore a cool dress./r/n 因为天气热，她穿了一件凉快的衣服。/r/n

word.name: cooperate
word.lx: We want to cooperate with you greatly./r/n 我们非常愿意与你们合作。/r/n Everything cooperated to make our holiday a success./r/n 这一切凑合起来使我们的假期圆满过去。/r/n

word.name: cooperation
word.lx: This sitcom is produced in cooperation with Hong Kong TV./r/n 这部连续剧是同香港电视台联合制作的。/r/n I need your cooperation in this subject./r/n 在这个项目上我需要你的合作。/r/n

word.name: cooperative
word.mean:
a. 合作的
n. 合作社
word.lx: We decided to set up a cooperative./r/n 我们决定开办一家合作社。/r/n The school was very cooperative when we made a film there./r/n 我们到该校拍摄影片时，获得校方的大力协助。/r/n

word.name: coordinate
word.mean:
n. 同等的人物,同位格
a. 同等的,等位的
v. 协调,整合,综合
[计算机] 坐标
word.lx: He is an excellent athlete; all his movements are perfectly coordinated./r/n 他是个优秀的运动员，他所有的动作都非常协调。/r/n This is a coordinate clause./r/n 这是一个并列子句。/r/n

word.name: coordinator
word.mean:
n. 协调者,同等的人或物
[计算机] 协调程序
word.lx: Health Services Coordinator./r/n 健康服务协调员。/r/n

word.name: copper
word.mean:
a. (紫)铜色的,铜(制)的
n. 铜,铜币,铜制品
word.lx: The chemical symbol for copper is Cu"./r/n 铜的化学符号是Cu。/r/n

word.name: copy
word.mean:
n. 副本,幕仿,一册
v. 复印,抄袭
n.[计算机] DOS命令 : 复制或组合文件,拷贝
word.lx: Would you copy this letter for me, please?/r/n 请为我复印一下这封信好吗？/r/n I copied out her notes into my notebook./r/n 我把她的笔记抄在我的笔记本上。/r/n

word.name: copyright
word.mean:
a. 版权(的)
n. 版权,著作权
word.lx: This material is copyright./r/n 本资料享有版权./r/n The poem is still under copyright, so you have to pay to quote it./r/n 该诗仍然享有版权, 因此你必须支付引用费./r/n

word.name: cord
word.lx: He tied the package with a cord./r/n 他用绳子把包裹扎紧。/r/n Material, such as cord or thread, used to lash or bind parts./r/n 用来抽打的绳索用于鞭笞或捆缚部件的材料，如线或绳/r/n

word.name: cordial
word.mean:
n. 兴奋剂,补品
a. 热忱的,诚恳的,兴奋的
word.lx: His friends gave him a cordial welcome./r/n 他的朋友对他表示热诚的欢迎。/r/n A cordial abhorrence of waste./r/n 对浪费的深恶痛绝/r/n

word.name: core
word.mean:
n. 果心,核心,要点
vt. 挖去(水果的)果心
=Congress of Racial Equality 争取种族平等大会
word.lx: He is American to the core./r/n 他是个地地道道的美国人。/r/n The core of our appeal is freedom of speech./r/n 我们的要求的核心是言论自由。/r/n

word.name: cork
word.mean: n. 软木塞,软木树,软木
word.lx: Fill and cork these bottles please./r/n 把这些瓶子灌满并用瓶塞塞紧。/r/n Do you have any tools to draw out the cork?/r/n 你有工具把软木塞拔开吗？/r/n

word.name: corn
word.mean: n. (美)玉米,(英)小麦,谷物(中)包裹
word.lx: The ground was ploughed and planted with corn./r/n 地翻耕后种上了玉米。/r/n The corn is coming on wonderfully./r/n 谷物长势极好。/r/n

word.name: cornea
word.lx: A cloudy spot on the cornea./r/n 角膜翳角膜上微薄遮光点/r/n

word.name: corner
word.mean:
n. 角落,转角,窘境
v. 将…逼入困境,使...陷入绝境,垄断
[计算机] 角点
word.lx: He fell and hit his head on the corner of a box./r/n 他跌倒时,头碰到箱子的一角。/r/n By defeating their main competitor this firm has cornered the wheat market./r/n 这家公司击败了主要的竞争对手而垄断了整个小麦市场。/r/n

word.name: corona
word.mean: n. 电晕(冠状物,日冕,飞檐的上部)
word.lx: A faint glow enveloping the high-field electrode in a corona discharge, often accompanied by streamers directed toward the low-field electrode./r/n 电晕在电晕放电中在高压电极出现的一种微弱光辉，常伴随有朝向低压电极的电流/r/n

word.name: coronary
word.mean: a. 冠的,花冠的,冠状的
word.lx: Coronary artery bypass graft./r/n 冠状动脉旁通接合/r/n

word.name: corporate
word.mean:
adj.社团的, 法人的, 共同的, 全体的
n.法人 ,公司
word.lx: This company is concerned about its corporate image./r/n 这家公司关心它自身的法人形象。/r/n This university is a corporate body formed from several colleges./r/n 这所大学是由几个不同学院组成的。/r/n

word.name: corporation
word.lx: Our corporation was formed in 1994./r/n 我们的公司成立于1994年。/r/n West Coast Corps is a large corporation./r/n 西海岸公司是个大型公司。/r/n

word.name: corps
word.lx: West Coast Corps is a large corporation./r/n 西海岸公司是个大型公司。/r/n A soldier who is a member of a special corps or regiment./r/n 精锐部队，特别部队的士兵属于特殊部队或团队的士兵/r/n

word.name: correct
word.mean:
a. 正确的
v. 改正,纠正
vt. 改正
word.lx: I corrected my watch by the time signal./r/n 我按报时信号校正我的表。/r/n Your answer to the question is correct./r/n 你对这个问题的回答是正确的。/r/n

word.name: correction
word.mean: n. 订正,改正,改正的地方
word.lx: The correction of all my mistakes took nearly an hour./r/n 我用了近一个小时才改完我的全部错误。/r/n I believe these figures are the most recent available but I am open to correction./r/n 我认为这些数据是最近才得到的，但我乐于接受改正。/r/n

word.name: correlate
word.mean:
n. 有相互关系的东西,相关物
v. 使有相互关系,互相有关系
word.lx: We can often correlate age with frequency of illness./r/n 年龄的大小往往与发病率有关./r/n The results of this experiment do not correlate with the results of earlier ones./r/n 这次试验的结果与以往试验的结果毫不相干./r/n

word.name: correspondent
word.lx: They are our Hong Kong correspondents./r/n 他们是我们派驻香港的通讯员。/r/n He is a poor correspondent./r/n 他是个懒于写信的人。/r/n

word.name: corresponding
word.mean: a. 符合的,一致的,相同的,相应的,相当的
word.lx: A device that enables a user entity to log in, for example, to identify itself, its purpose and the time of entry; and to log out with the corresponding data so that the appropriate accounting procedures may be carried out in accordance with the operatin

word.name: corridor
word.lx: The corridor opens into his office./r/n 这走廊通到他的办公室。/r/n My room is at the end of the corridor./r/n 我的房间在走廊的尽头。/r/n

word.name: corrode
word.mean:
v. 使腐蚀,侵蚀,破害
v. 腐蚀,被侵蚀
word.lx: Iron corrodes easily./r/n 铁易锈损。/r/n This acid may corrode iron./r/n 这种酸能腐蚀铁。/r/n

word.name: corrupt
word.mean:
a. 腐败的,贪污的,败德的
v. 使...腐烂,使...恶化

word.name: corrupted
word.lx: Incapable of being morally corrupted./r/n 正直的道德不会堕落的/r/n In his sight the world had become corrupted, for all men had lived corrupt lives on earth./r/n 他认为世界充斥着罪恶，因为所有世上的人都过着邪恶的生活。/r/n

word.name: cosmetic
word.mean:
n. 化妆品
a. 化妆用的
word.lx: A cosmetic or medicinal liquid, such as a mouthwash./r/n 洗药，液体化妆品化妆用的或药用的液体，如漱口剂/r/n A cosmetic, such as rouge, that is used to give color to the face; makeup./r/n 化妆品一种用来给皮肤上色的化妆品，如胭脂；化妆品/r/n

word.name: cosmic
word.lx: Physics is governed by cosmic laws./r/n 物理学受宇宙法则的制约./r/n

word.name: cosmopolitan
word.mean: a. 世界性的,久经世故的
word.lx: The United Nations assembly is a cosmopolitan gathering./r/n 联合国大会是一种世界性的集会。/r/n The rose is a cosmopolitan plant./r/n 玫瑰是遍生于世界各地的植物。/r/n

word.name: cost
word.mean:
n. 代价,价值,费用
v. 花费,值,需要
[计算机] 费用
word.lx: He saved his daughter from the fire but at the cost of his own life./r/n 他牺牲了生命，把女儿从大火中救出来。/r/n Your crime will cost you your life./r/n 你的罪行将使你失去生命。/r/n

word.name: costing
word.lx: He was walking to and fro swearing at the delay which was costing him so much money every minute./r/n 他来回走动着，大骂这场延误事故，因为每耽误一分钟都在消耗他的钱财。/r/n The shoes alone cost 100./r/n 光是鞋就花了100英镑./r/n

word.name: costs
word.lx: As a result, costs will be reduced by as much as 90%./r/n 因此，成本将会降低90%之多。/r/n That hotel probably costs no less than 20 dollars a night./r/n 那间旅馆的住宿费大约要20元一晚呢。/r/n

word.name: costume
word.lx: The kimono is part of the national costume of Japan./r/n 和服是日本民族服装的一部分。/r/n She wore an antique gown to the costume party./r/n 她穿着一件过时的长袍参加化妆舞会。/r/n

word.name: cosy
word.mean:
a. 舒适的
n. 保温套
word.lx: The room has a nice cosy feel./r/n 这房间给人非常温暖舒适的感觉。/r/n He lives in a cosy little room./r/n 他住在一个舒适的小屋里。/r/n

word.name: cottage
word.lx: We dreamed of buying a little cottage in the country./r/n 我们梦想在乡间买一所小别墅。/r/n His cottage is on the gentle slope of the hill./r/n 他的小屋在山的缓坡上。/r/n

word.name: cotton
word.mean:
a. 棉花(的)
n. 棉花
word.lx: Cotton is more comfortable to wear than nylon./r/n 棉布比尼龙穿着舒服。/r/n This district grew cotton on a large scale./r/n 这个地区过去大量种棉花。/r/n

word.name: couch
word.mean:
n. 长椅,睡椅,卧榻
v. 横躺,睡,暗示
word.lx: His black leather couch looks expensive./r/n 他的黑色皮沙发看上去很昂贵。/r/n Dad is sleeping on the couch./r/n 爸爸在长椅上睡觉。/r/n

word.name: could
word.mean:
can 的过去式
conj. 能够

word.name: council
word.lx: The Council of Ministers is the real power in the EEC./r/n 部长理事会是欧洲经济共同体的真正权力机关。/r/n The council have told us to cut down the trees./r/n 地方议会通知我们砍掉这些树。/r/n

word.name: councilor
word.mean: n. 议员(理事,顾问,参赞)

word.name: counsel
word.mean:
n. 商议,忠告,法律顾问
v. 商议,劝告
word.lx: Each side of a case in court has its own counsel./r/n 法庭上原告和被告双方都有各自的律师。/r/n Good counsel has no price./r/n 【谚】忠言无价。/r/n

word.name: counseling
word.lx: Credit counseling helped us get out from under./r/n 信用咨询使我们免除了忧虑/r/n Each side of a case in court has its own counsel./r/n 法庭上原告和被告双方都有各自的律师。/r/n

word.name: count
word.mean:
v. 计算,视为,依赖
n. 计数
word.lx: Jane was counted among the greatest dancers of the century./r/n 简被视为本世纪最伟大的舞蹈家之一。/r/n Have the votes been counted yet?/r/n 选票算好了没有？/r/n

word.name: counter
word.mean:
n. 计算器,计算者,柜台
[计算机] 计数器
a. 相反的
ad. 与…相反地
vt. 反对,反击
vi. 反对,反击
word.lx: There was an enormous cat crouching on the counter./r/n 柜台上蜷伏着一只硕大的猫。/r/n Shoppers got into a scrum round the bargain counter./r/n 顾客在廉价品柜台周围你争我夺./r/n

word.name: counteract
word.lx: They will counteract the effects of his bad influence./r/n 他们要清除他的不良影响。/r/n We must counteract extremism in the party./r/n 我们应该抵制党内的极端主义。/r/n

word.name: counterbalance
word.mean:
n. 平衡,平衡力
v. 抵销
vt. 使平衡,抵销

word.name: counterfeit
word.mean:
n. 膺品,伪造品
a. 假冒的,假装的
v. 仿造,伪装,假装
word.lx: Counterfeit or fake./r/n 假冒的，伪造的/r/n She counterfeited alarm when he confessed his love./r/n 当他向她示爱时她假装惊讶的样子。/r/n

word.name: counterfoil
word.mean: n. 支票存根,存根,票根

word.name: counterpart
word.mean: n. 相似之物(正副二份中之一,对应物)

word.name: countless
word.lx: There are countless stars in the sky./r/n 天上有无数的星星。/r/n Countless washer women have rubbed the stone away./r/n 无数洗衣妇的搓洗将那块石头磨掉了。/r/n

word.name: country
word.mean:
a. 国家(的),农村(的)
n. 国家

word.name: countryside
word.lx: Modern agriculture is spoiling our beautiful countryside./r/n 现代农业正在破坏我们美丽的农村。/r/n The expressway mars the beauty of the countryside./r/n 这条高速公路破坏了农村的田园美景。/r/n

word.name: county
word.lx: He lives in a solitary county./r/n 他住在一个偏远的县里。/r/n The county town is a hundred li or so away from here./r/n 县城离这有百儿八十里。/r/n

word.name: coupon
word.mean: n. 试样(配给票,息票,附单)
word.lx: This coupon can be redeemed at any of our branches./r/n 这种息票可在我们的任何分行兑现./r/n I have a coupon for ten pence off a packet of soap./r/n 我有一张优惠券，买一盒肥皂可以便宜十便士。/r/n

word.name: courier
word.mean: 送快信的,急差,旅行服务员
word.lx: A courier delivered the parcels (to our office)./r/n 送急件的人将包裹送来（送到我们办公室）了./r/n The courier escort the group into the hotel./r/n 导游陪同这个团队来到饭店。/r/n

word.name: course
word.mean: n. 课程,讲座,过程,路线,一道(菜)
word.lx: Our course was straight to the north./r/n 我们是朝正北方向航行。/r/n Events took their natural course./r/n 事态依自然进程发展。/r/n

word.name: court
word.mean:
n. 法院,庭院,奉承,球场
v. 献殷勤,追求,招致危险
