word.lx: The court found him guilty./r/n 法官判他有罪。/r/n The court of King Solomon was noted for its splendor./r/n 所罗门国王的宫廷以其华丽著称。/r/n

word.name: courtesy
word.lx: They showed us every courtesy./r/n 他们对我们彬彬有礼。/r/n There is always enough time for courtesy./r/n 现在不必在这里说客气话。/r/n

word.name: courtyard
word.lx: The hotel is built round a courtyard, with fountain and palm tree./r/n 这家饭店围绕一庭院而建，辅以泉水和棕榈树。/r/n A courtyard in front of a building./r/n 前院建筑物前面的庭院/r/n

word.name: cousin
word.lx: He is a distant cousin of mine./r/n 他是我的一位远房表亲。/r/n Later they may muddle up your name with those of your cousin/r/n 以后他们可能会把你的名字跟你堂兄弟们的名字相混淆。/r/n

word.name: cover
word.mean:
n. 封面,盖子,表面
v. 覆盖,涉及,包含
word.lx: We tried to find cover from the storm./r/n 我们设法寻找遮蔽暴风雨的地方。/r/n Do not try to cover a mistake./r/n 不要试图掩盖错误。/r/n

word.name: coverage
word.mean: n. 涉及范围(作用距离,覆盖厚度,涂层)
word.lx: The wedding got massive media coverage./r/n 婚礼得到大众传播媒介的广泛报道。/r/n The television coverage of the event was rather sparse./r/n 电视上对这件事报道很少。/r/n

word.name: covering
word.mean:
n. 覆盖物,遮避物
a. 掩护的,掩盖的
word.lx: A covering resembling a cloak or mantle./r/n 斗篷状覆盖物一种类似长袍或斗蓬的遮盖物/r/n The piece of oilcloth is used as a covering for a table./r/n 这块油布是用来铺桌子的。/r/n

word.name: cow
word.lx: Do you know how to milk a cow?/r/n 你知道怎么挤牛奶吗？/r/n The generals tried to cow opposition to their military rule by imprisoning their leaders./r/n 这些将军通过监禁领导人来威吓反对军事统治的人。/r/n

word.name: cowboy
word.lx: I have watched many cowboy movies./r/n 我看过许多牛仔片。/r/n The cowboy lives an idle life./r/n 牛仔过着悠闲的生活。/r/n

word.name: cozy
word.lx: The room has a nice cozy feel./r/n 这房间给人非常温暖舒适的感觉。/r/n He lives in a cozy little room./r/n 他住在一个舒适的小屋里。/r/n

word.name: crab
word.lx: It was his misfortune to catch a crab in the last spurt./r/n 他真倒霉，到了最后一刹那竟有一桨没划好。/r/n A crab burger, a tofu burger./r/n 蟹肉三明治；豆腐三明治/r/n

word.name: cradle
word.mean:
n. 摇篮,发祥地,摇篮时代
v. 放在摇篮内,抚育,刈割
word.lx: The sea is thought to have been the cradle of life./r/n 人们认为海洋曾经是生命的发源地。/r/n The baby slumbered in his cradle./r/n 婴儿安睡在摇篮里。/r/n

word.name: craft
word.lx: By crafts the gambler tricked them out of all their money./r/n 那个赌徒用诡计赢去了他们所有的钱。/r/n He graduated from a school of crafts and arts./r/n 他毕业于一所工艺美术学校。/r/n

word.name: crane
word.mean:
n. 鹤,起重机
v. 引颈,伸长(脖子)
vt. 伸长(脖子等)
word.lx: We used a crane to lift the huge box into the backyard./r/n 我们使用起重机将这个大箱子搬进了后院。/r/n Jane craned her neck to look for her mother in the crowd./r/n 简伸长脖子张望，在人群中找她的母亲。/r/n

word.name: crank
word.mean:
n. 曲柄
v.用曲柄启动或转动
word.lx: The pedals of a cycle are attached to the crank./r/n 自行车的踏板与曲柄相连。/r/n He started to crank the engine./r/n 他开始用曲柄启动发动机。/r/n

word.name: crash
word.mean:
n. 轰隆声,猛撞,崩溃,破产,垮台
v. 撞碎,猛使...破碎,迫降
word.lx: The dishes crashed to the floor./r/n 碗碟哗啦一声掉在地板上./r/n Mind if I crash (out) on your floor tonight?/r/n 今晚我在你家打地铺行吗?/r/n

word.name: crater
word.lx: A large crater formed by volcanic explosion or by collapse of a volcanic cone./r/n 火山口火山爆发而形成的环形山或大山核心部分的崩塌而形成的环形山/r/n Flames blazed out from the crater of the volcano./r/n 火焰从火山口猛烈地喷出来。/r/n

word.name: crawl
word.mean:
n. 爬行,匍匐而行
v. 爬行
word.lx: The heavy traffic crawled through the narrow tunnel./r/n 拥挤的车辆慢吞吞地穿过狭窄的隧道。/r/n The baby often crawls on all fours./r/n 婴儿经常匍匐而行。/r/n

word.name: craze
word.mean:
n. 狂热,大流行
v. 发狂,开裂

word.name: crazy
word.lx: She is crazy to go out in this weather./r/n 她简直疯了，这种天气还到外面去。/r/n The mother of the kidnapped child was crazy with worry./r/n 那个被绑架的孩子的母亲担心得几乎发狂了。/r/n

word.name: cream
word.lx: Have some cream in your coffee./r/n 在你的咖啡里加点奶油吧。/r/n He put some of the cream on his burn./r/n 他在烫伤处擦了些药膏。/r/n

word.name: crease
word.mean:
n. 折痕
vt 使...起折痕
word.lx: The flaps of his jacket pocket were sewn down so that they did not crease or wrinkle./r/n 他的夹克口袋上的口袋盖给缝上了，这样就不会打皱。/r/n A crease in the skin, especially on the face; a wrinkle./r/n 皱纹皮肤褶皱，尤指脸上的；皱纹/r/n

word.name: create
word.lx: Some people believe that God created the world./r/n 有些人相信上帝创造了世界。/r/n This decision creates a dangerous precedent./r/n 这个决定开创了一个危险的先例。/r/n

word.name: creative
word.lx: Painters are creative artists./r/n 画家是具有创造性的艺术家。/r/n The writing of poems, stories or plays is often called creative writing./r/n 诗歌、小说和剧本的写作常常被称作创作。/r/n

word.name: creator
word.lx: Do you know who is the creator of the electric bulb?/r/n 你知道谁是电灯的发明者？/r/n The creator of a new television series; a born creator of trouble./r/n 新的电视系列片的创造者；一个天生多麻烦的人/r/n

word.name: creature
word.lx: He is a creature of habit./r/n 他是个墨守成规的人。/r/n Pandas are precious creatures./r/n 熊猫是珍贵的动物。/r/n

word.name: credential
word.lx: She has the perfect credentials for the job./r/n 她做这工作完全够格./r/n I examined his credentials./r/n 我查验了他的证件./r/n

word.name: credible
word.lx: It seems credible./r/n 这似乎是可信的。/r/n Looks credible./r/n 看来可信。/r/n

word.name: credit
word.mean:
n. 信用,荣誉,贷款,学分
v. 归功于,赞颂,信任
word.lx: No credit is given at this shop./r/n 这家商店概不赊欠。/r/n He is a credit to the family./r/n 他是家族中的光荣。/r/n

word.name: creditor
word.lx: The poor man ran away from his creditors./r/n 这个穷人躲避他的债主。/r/n A homestead cannot be the subject of a sale by court order to satisfy creditor./r/n 宅地不能成为法院命令的满足债权人所要求的销售对象。/r/n

word.name: creep
word.mean:
n. 爬,徐行,蠕动
v. 爬,蔓延
word.lx: We crept upstairs so as not to wake the baby./r/n 为了不吵醒婴儿，我们蹑手蹑脚地上了楼梯。/r/n The cat was creeping silently towards the mouse./r/n 猫悄悄地朝着老鼠爬过去。/r/n

word.name: crevice
word.lx: There is a crevice in the wall./r/n 墙上有个裂缝。/r/n A winding channel, passage, or crevice./r/n 弯曲的沟渠，弯曲的通道，弯曲的裂缝/r/n

word.name: crew
word.mean:
n. 全体船员,全体乘务员
vi. 一起工作
word.lx: The plane crashed, killing all its passengers and crew./r/n 飞机失事了，所有乘客和机组人员都遇难了。/r/n We are a happy crew in our office./r/n 我们办公室的一伙人相处得很愉快。/r/n

word.name: criminal
word.mean:
a. 犯罪的,刑事的
n. 罪犯
word.lx: Murder and stealing are criminal acts./r/n 谋杀和偷盗都是犯罪行为。/r/n The police had to make a forcible entry into the house where the criminal was hiding./r/n 警察不得不强行进入罪犯藏身的那座房子。/r/n

word.name: cripple
word.mean:
n. 跛者,残废
v. 使...跛,使...成残废,削弱

word.name: crisp
word.mean:
a. 脆的,易碎的
n. 油炸马铃薯片
v. (使)发脆
word.lx: I like the delicious salad of crisp lettuce and tomatos./r/n 我喜欢这种脆莴苣和番茄做的沙拉，很好吃。/r/n It tastes sweet and crisp./r/n 吃起来又甜又脆。/r/n

word.name: criteria
word.lx: What are the criteria for deciding (ie How do we decide) who gets the prize?/r/n 评定获奖者以什麽作标准?/r/n An experiment was made to check up on the reliability of certain criteria./r/n 已经进行了一项实验以检查某些标准的可靠性。/r/n

word.name: critic
word.lx: Have you read the article written by that famous critic?/r/n 你读过那个著名的批评家写的这篇文章吗？/r/n She is a very discerning art critic./r/n 她是位眼光敏锐的艺术评论家./r/n

word.name: critical
word.mean:
a. 批评的,决定性的,危险的,挑剔的
a. 临界的
word.lx: In the current critical climate her work is not popular./r/n 在当前评论风气影响下，她的作品不怎么受欢迎。/r/n Why are you always so critical?/r/n 你怎么总是这样吹毛求疵？/r/n

word.name: criticize
word.mean: v. 批评,吹毛求疵,非难
word.lx: He criticized my taking risks./r/n 他批评了我的冒险活动。/r/n Stop criticizing (my work)!/r/n 别再挑剔（我那作品）了!/r/n

word.name: critique
word.lx: Presented us with a dry critique./r/n 向我们表述了不带偏见的观点/r/n A pointed critique./r/n 尖锐的批判/r/n

word.name: crocodile
word.lx: There are crocodiles in this river./r/n 这条河里有鳄鱼。/r/n Leather made from crocodile skin./r/n 鳄鱼皮革用鳄鱼皮做成的皮革/r/n

word.name: crooked
word.mean: a. 弯曲的,歪的,邪恶的
word.lx: The picture on the wall is crooked./r/n 挂在墙壁上的画是歪的。/r/n She crooked her little finger as she drank her tea./r/n 她喝茶时弯起小指头。/r/n

word.name: crop
word.mean:
n. 农作物,产量,平头
v. 收割,修剪,种植
word.lx: The flood did a lot of damage to the crops./r/n 洪水毁坏了大量农作物。/r/n We have had the biggest wheat crop ever this year./r/n 今年我们的小麦收获量是有史以来最好的。/r/n

word.name: crossing
word.mean: n. 人行横道,十字路口
word.lx: The place is marked on the map with a crossing./r/n 那个地方在地图上以十字形记号标出。/r/n We came to a crossing./r/n 我们来到一个十字路口。/r/n

word.name: crouch
word.mean:
n. 蹲伏,蜷缩
v. 蹲下,蜷著,缩著
word.lx: He crouched down among the tangled foliage./r/n 他蹲下把身子藏在紊乱的叶丛中。/r/n They did not crouch under the oppression./r/n 他们受压迫而不屈服。/r/n

word.name: crow
word.mean:
n. 啼叫,乌鸦
v. 啼叫,报晓
word.lx: He gets up at the crow of the rooster every day./r/n 他每天鸡鸣即起。/r/n The crow is a bird of ill omen./r/n 乌鸦是不祥的预兆。/r/n

word.name: crowd
word.lx: A crowd gathered at the scene of the fire./r/n 许多人聚集在火灾现场。/r/n The room was crowded with guests./r/n 房间里挤满了客人。/r/n

word.name: crown
word.mean:
n. 王冠,王权,顶点
v. 使...成王,加冕,居...之顶
word.lx: Land belonging to the crown does not belong to the king personally but to the state./r/n 皇室的领地并非属于国王私人所有，而是属于国家的。/r/n Trees crowned the hill./r/n 树木覆盖着小山。/r/n

word.name: crucial
word.lx: Negotiations were at a crucial stage./r/n 谈判正处于一个关键的阶段。/r/n We have succeeded in one crucial regard: making this scandal public./r/n 我们办成了一件大事: 将这件丑事公之於众./r/n

word.name: crude
word.mean:
a. 粗鲁的,简陋的,天然的,未加工的
n. 原油
word.lx: It was crude of him to say that./r/n 他那样说太粗鲁了。/r/n China is a country rich in crude oil./r/n 中国是一个原油丰富的国家。/r/n

word.name: cruelty
word.mean: n. 残酷,野蛮,残酷的行为
word.lx: His name has becomea byword for cruelty./r/n 他的名字成了残酷无情的别称./r/n He was treated with cruelty./r/n 他受到残酷的对待。/r/n

word.name: cruise
word.mean:
n. 巡航,巡弋,漫游
v. 巡航,巡弋,漫游
word.lx: Several privateer often cruise near the entrance of the channel./r/n 几只武装民船经常在这个海峡的进口附近巡航。/r/n These cruise ships can turn round in two days./r/n 这些游船可用两天的时间装卸完毕./r/n

word.name: crumb
word.mean:
n. 碎屑,面包心,少许
v. 捏碎,弄碎
word.lx: She crumb the bread before feeding it to the birds./r/n 她把面包弄碎，然后喂给鸟吃。/r/n She swept up the crumbs./r/n 她打扫了碎屑。/r/n

word.name: crumble
word.lx: Most of the paint had crumbled off./r/n 油漆大都剥落。/r/n He crumbled the bread in his fingers./r/n 他用手指把面包捏碎了。/r/n

word.name: crumple
word.lx: He put on a crumpled suit./r/n 他穿上一件皱巴巴的西装。/r/n The front of the car crumpled on impact./r/n 汽车的前部被撞扁了。/r/n

word.name: crush
word.mean:
n. 压碎,粉碎,群众
v. 压破,征服,冲入
word.lx: This machine crushes wheat grain to make flour./r/n 这台机器把麦子磨成面粉。/r/n There was such a crush on the train that I could hardly breathe./r/n 火车上挤得我都喘不过气来。/r/n

word.name: crust
word.mean:
n. 外壳,坚硬的外壳,面包皮
v. 盖以硬皮,结硬皮
word.lx: The snow crusted the lake last night./r/n 昨夜的雪使湖面结了冰。/r/n The crust on the snow was thick enough for us to walk on it./r/n 外层的雪已经冻硬，可以在上面行走。/r/n

word.name: crying
word.mean: a. 叫喊的,啼哭的,显著的
word.lx: He dandled the baby to stop it crying./r/n 他逗弄着婴儿，哄他不再哭。/r/n His echoing cry woke the mountain valley./r/n 他叫喊的回声震荡著山谷./r/n

word.name: crystal
word.mean:
a. 清澈透明的,晶体的
n. 水晶
word.lx: This set of crystal wine cups is very expensive./r/n 这套水晶玻璃酒杯非常昂贵。/r/n She made her meaning crystal clear./r/n 她把她的意思解释得清清楚楚。/r/n

word.name: cube
word.lx: Four cubed is sixty-four./r/n 四的立方是六十四。/r/n Please pass me a cube of sugar./r/n 请递给我一块方糖。/r/n

word.name: cuckoo
word.lx: The cuckoo is the herald of the spring./r/n 杜鹃报春。/r/n The cuckoo is a harbinger of spring./r/n 布谷鸟预告春天的来临。/r/n

word.name: cucumber
word.lx: I like to eat cucumber sandwiches./r/n 我喜欢吃有黄瓜的三明治。/r/n Have some cucumber./r/n 吃点黄瓜吧。/r/n

word.name: culling
word.lx: Every year the groups of seals that live off our coasts are culled out because they eat too much fish./r/n 每年居住在我们海岸边的海豹都被人挑选一部分杀死，因为它们吃掉的鱼太多。/r/n Deer are culled by hunters./r/n 猎人把鹿杀掉了一批。/r/n

word.name: culminate
word.mean:
v. 达到顶点或高潮,以...告终
vi. 达到顶点
vt. 使达高潮,使结束
word.lx: Their long struggle finally culminated in success./r/n 他们的长期斗争终于取得了胜利。/r/n Her career culminated in her appointment as director./r/n 她一生事业的顶峰是当上董事。/r/n

word.name: culprit
word.mean: n. 犯人,罪犯,刑事被告,肇事者,罪魁祸首
word.lx: The hunt is on for the culprit./r/n 正在搜捕该罪犯./r/n The police are now on the scent of the culprit./r/n 警方已获得罪犯的线索./r/n

word.name: cultivate
word.lx: John always tries to cultivate people who are useful to him./r/n 约翰经常设法和对他有用的人结交。/r/n We must cultivate our own garden and find the joy of doing it in our own heart./r/n 我们都要做好自己工作，并且要在工作中找到精神上的乐趣。/r/n

word.name: culture
word.lx: Beijing is a good city for anyone who is interested in culture./r/n 对于喜欢文化艺术的人来说，北京是座很吸引人的城市。/r/n He is a man of little culture./r/n 他没多少文化修养。/r/n

word.name: cumbersome
word.lx: An apparatus for lifting heavy or cumbersome objects./r/n 起重机用来提举重物或难处理物体的设备/r/n Clumsy or cumbersome./r/n 不灵活的或妨碍的/r/n

word.name: cumulative
word.lx: It is a cumulative process./r/n 它是一个逐步累积的过程。/r/n Characterized by or showing the effects of accumulation; cumulative./r/n 积累而成的，累积的以积累效果为特征的或者表现出积累效果的；累积的/r/n

word.name: cunning
word.mean: a. 狡猾的,巧妙的,可爱的
word.lx: He is as cunning as a fox./r/n 他象狐狸一样狡猾。/r/n She showed her cunning in the way she avoided answering the question./r/n 她对问题避而不答，显示出她很狡猾。/r/n

word.name: cup
word.mean:
n. 杯子
v. (使)成杯形
vt. 使成杯形
word.lx: Would you like a cup of tea?/r/n 你想喝茶吗?/r/n Please fill the cup with water./r/n 请把这个杯子装满水，/r/n

word.name: cupboard
word.lx: I put the dishes in the cupboard./r/n 我把菜放在碗橱里。/r/n He stored foods in his cupboard./r/n 他把食品存放在碗橱里。/r/n

word.name: curb
word.mean:
n. 抑制,勒马绳,边石,路缘
v. 抑制,束缚,勒住
word.lx: She got rattled when she saw the policeman and drove the car up over the curb./r/n 她一看见警察就紧张起来，结果把车开到马路边上了。/r/n He pulled over to the curb./r/n 他把车子停靠在道路边缘。/r/n

word.name: cure
word.mean:
n. 治疗,治愈,治疗法
v. 治疗,治愈,改正
word.lx: The only way to cure backache is to rest./r/n 治疗背痛的唯一办法是休息。/r/n There is still no cure for the common cold./r/n 目前仍没有治愈感冒的良药。/r/n

word.name: curious
word.lx: A student should always be curious to learn./r/n 学生应该始终具有强烈的求知欲。/r/n She looks rather curious with green hair./r/n 她头发是绿的，样子有点古怪。/r/n

word.name: curl
word.mean:
n. 卷曲,卷发
v. 弄卷,卷曲,弯曲
word.lx: The lovely boy has beautiful blonde curls./r/n 这个可爱的小男孩长着漂亮的金黄色卷发。/r/n The dying leaves became brown and curled up./r/n 快死的叶子发黄而卷曲。/r/n

word.name: currency
word.lx: The word has attained general currency./r/n 这个词已经通用起来了。/r/n Most countries have a decimal currency./r/n 大多数国家使用十进制货币。/r/n

word.name: current
word.mean:
n. (水、气、电)流,趋势
a. 流通的,现在的,最近的
word.lx: This button switches the current on./r/n 这个电钮接通电流。/r/n The current is strongest in the middle of the river./r/n 河中央的水流最急。/r/n

word.name: curse
word.lx: Our tribe is under a curse./r/n 我们的部落正受诅咒。/r/n She cursed him for ruining her life./r/n 她诅咒他，说他毁了她的一生。/r/n

word.name: cursed
word.mean:
a. 该诅咒的(坏透的)
v. 诅咒
word.lx: She cursed him for ruining her life./r/n 她诅咒他，说他毁了她的一生。/r/n He cursed me, using a lot of rude epithets likebloody"./r/n 他用了一大串诸如“该死的”之类的粗俗词语来诅咒我。/r/n"

word.name: curtail
word.lx: The President had to curtail his visit./r/n 总统不得不缩短他的访问日期。/r/n We must try to curtail our spending./r/n 我们必须尽力缩减开支。/r/n

word.name: curtain
word.lx: I drew the curtain as it was getting dark./r/n 天黑了，我把窗帘拉上。/r/n A part of the sitting room was curtained off./r/n 起居室的一部分被帘子隔开了。/r/n

word.name: curtate
word.mean: 水平分界线,卡片横向穿孔区

word.name: curve
word.mean:
n. 曲线,弯曲,曲球
v. 弯,使...弯曲
word.lx: The car made a sharp curve./r/n 汽车拐了一个急弯。/r/n The road curved sharply to the right./r/n 道路有个急转弯拐向右边。/r/n

word.name: cushion
word.mean:
n. 垫子,橡皮软垫
v. 加垫褥
word.lx: He lay on the floor with a cushion under his head./r/n 他躺在地板上，头下枕着一个垫子。/r/n She embroidered the cushion with flowers./r/n 她把垫子绣上了花./r/n

word.name: custodian
word.mean: n. 管理人,保管人,监督人

word.name: custom
word.lx: It took us only a few minutes to get through the Customs./r/n 我们的海关检查只花了几分钟时间。/r/n Custom rules the law./r/n 【谚】风俗左右法律。/r/n

word.name: customer
word.lx: The new store across the road has taken away most of my customers./r/n 路那边的那家新店抢走了我的许多主顾。/r/n My father asked me to see the customer to the door./r/n 我父亲要我送顾客到门口。/r/n

word.name: customize
word.lx: Customize a van./r/n 定做一辆大马车/r/n

word.name: customs
word.mean:
a. 定做的(衣),海关的
n. 海关
word.lx: How long does it take to get through customs?/r/n 海关检查要用多少时间?/r/n The goods are not allowed to be exported without approbation of the customs./r/n 没有海关的许可，这些货物是不允许出口的。/r/n

word.name: cutback
word.mean: n. 重映,减少,剪修新芽
word.lx: Many factories have made cutbacks./r/n 许多工厂已经减产了。/r/n

word.name: cutout
word.mean: n. 挖剪细工,挖剪图画,删除部份
word.lx: The technique of decorating a surface with cutouts, as of paper./r/n 剪贴工艺用从纸上剪下来的图案装饰表面的技艺/r/n

word.name: cutting
word.mean:
vbl. 切
n. 切断,切下,开凿
word.lx: He saved many cuttings from newspaper./r/n 他保存了很多剪报。/r/n He took a cutting from a rose./r/n 他从玫瑰树上剪下一枝插条。/r/n

word.name: cybernate
word.mean: 计算机控制化,使电脑化

word.name: cycle
word.mean:
n. 循环,周期
v. 骑自行车
word.lx: This is the cycle of economic booms and slumps./r/n 这是经济繁荣和经济萧条的周期变化。/r/n He goes to work by cycle./r/n 他骑自行车上班。/r/n

word.name: cyclist
word.lx: The cyclist was run down by a lorry./r/n 卡车把骑自行车的人撞倒了。/r/n The truck nearly ran over cyclist./r/n 那辆卡车差点把一个骑自行车的人压着了。/r/n

word.name: cylinder
word.lx: The cylinder is a crucial part of the washing machine./r/n 滚筒是洗衣机必不可少的部分。/r/n The engine is misfiring badly on one cylinder./r/n 发动机有一个汽缸严重失灵./r/n

word.name: dad
word.lx: His dad snuffed it a couple of years ago./r/n 他爸爸两年前就吹灯了./r/n His dad gave him a good hiding./r/n 他爸爸给他一顿好打./r/n

word.name: daemon
word.mean:
守护进程
如Internet中用于邮件收发的后台程序

word.name: daily
word.mean:
a. 每日的
ad. 每日,天天
n. 日报
word.lx: I go to the university twice daily./r/n 我每天去那所大学两次。/r/n I like to read China Daily on my way home./r/n 我喜欢在回家的途中阅读《中国日报》。/r/n

word.name: dairy
word.mean:
a. 牛奶的
n. 牛奶场,乳品店,乳制品
word.lx: Milk, butter and cheese are brought in here from dairy farms./r/n 牛奶、奶油、奶酪从牛奶场运到这里。/r/n One of a breed of small, black dairy cattle of Irish origin./r/n 克立牛一种产于爱尔兰的黑色小乳牛/r/n

word.name: dam
word.lx: The village was swept away when the dam burst./r/n 村庄在水坝决堤时被冲走了。/r/n The dam gave way; it was not strong enough to hold the flood waters./r/n 水坝坍塌了; 它不够坚固, 挡不住洪水./r/n

word.name: damage
word.mean:
n. (pl.)赔偿金,损坏,毁坏
v. 损害,毁坏
word.lx: The flood did a lot of damage to the crops./r/n 洪水毁坏了大量农作物。/r/n They asked him to pay for the damage but he pleaded poverty./r/n 他们要他付损害赔偿金, 但他藉口贫穷而不偿还./r/n

word.name: dance
word.mean:
n. 舞蹈,舞会
v. 跳舞
word.lx: She loves to dance to music./r/n 她喜欢随着音乐跳舞。/r/n The waves danced in the sunlight./r/n 波浪在阳光下跳舞。/r/n

word.name: danger
word.lx: The operation is a success and now the patient is out of danger./r/n 手术成功了，病人现在已脱离危险。/r/n Violent criminals like that are a danger to society./r/n 那种暴力罪犯对社会是一种危害。/r/n

word.name: dare
word.mean:
n. 挑战,挑动
v. 敢,胆敢
word.lx: How dare you say such a thing?/r/n 你怎敢说出这样的话？/r/n I dare say you are right./r/n 我认为你是对的。/r/n

word.name: daring
word.lx: Never before have they been so inspired and so daring as at present./r/n 从来没有看见他们像现在这样精神振奋，意气风发。/r/n The daring exploits of the parachutists were much admired./r/n 跳伞者大胆的冒险动作令人赞叹不已./r/n

word.name: darling
word.mean:
n. 亲爱的,可爱的人,可爱的物
a. 可爱的,亲爱的
word.lx: She is a little darling./r/n 她是一个极可爱的小孩。/r/n You look simply divine, darling!/r/n 你简直动人极了, 亲爱的!/r/n

word.name: dart
word.mean:
n. 飞镳,投射
v. 投射,疾走,突进
word.lx: The sun darts forth its beams./r/n 阳光四射。/r/n The child made a dart across the road./r/n 这个小孩冲过大路。/r/n

word.name: dash
word.mean:
n. 冲撞,破折号
v. 猛掷,泼溅,冲撞
word.lx: In my fury, I dashed all the dishes to the floor./r/n 气愤之下，我把所有的杯盘都摔到地上去了。/r/n He dashed across the street and ran towards me./r/n 他冲过马路，向我跑过来。/r/n

word.name: dashed
word.lx: In my fury, I dashed all the dishes to the floor./r/n 气愤之下，我把所有的杯盘都摔到地上去了。/r/n He dashed across the street and ran towards me./r/n 他冲过马路，向我跑过来。/r/n

word.name: data
word.lx: Very little data is available./r/n 现有的资料十分不足。/r/n The data is still being analyzed./r/n 资料仍在分析中。/r/n

word.name: database
word.lx: This database is only accessible by the authorized manager./r/n 只有授权的管理员才可以访问此数据库。/r/n Can you set up a database?/r/n 你能建一个数据库吗?/r/n

word.name: datum
word.lx: Very little data is available./r/n 现有的资料十分不足。/r/n The data is still being analyzed./r/n 资料仍在分析中。/r/n

word.name: dawn
word.lx: The morning dawned clear after the rain./r/n 雨后的清晨，天一破晓就晴空万里。/r/n The diligent student gets up before dawn every day./r/n 这个勤奋的学生每天天亮以前就起床了。/r/n

word.name: day
word.lx: He is the man of the day./r/n 他是时下的风云人物。/r/n You can see stars by night, but not by day./r/n 你在夜晚可以看到星星，白天却看不到。/r/n

word.name: daylight
word.lx: He was up at daylight./r/n 他天亮就起来了。/r/n The kidnapping occurred in broad daylight./r/n 在光天化日之下竟发生绑架事件./r/n

word.name: days
word.mean:
n. 天
ad. 每天,在白天
word.lx: After these dry days, everyone hopes for rain./r/n 干燥的天气之后，人人都希望下雨。/r/n We shall have meetings on two consecutive days, Monday and Tuesday./r/n 周一周二连续两天我们都将开会。/r/n

word.name: dazzle
word.lx: She was dazzled by her sudden success./r/n 突然的成功使她感到迷惘。/r/n His eyes dazzled before the strong light./r/n 他面对强光头晕目眩。/r/n

word.name: dead
word.mean:
a. 死的
ad. 完全地
n. 死者
word.lx: His love for you is dead./r/n 他对你的爱情已不复存在。/r/n He was dead asleep./r/n 他酣然大睡。/r/n

word.name: deadlock
word.mean:
n. 僵局,停顿
v. 停顿,相持不下
word.lx: The negotiations have reached a deadlock./r/n 谈判陷入僵局。/r/n We can only make minor concessions, but it might break the deadlock./r/n 我们只能做些较小的让步，但这就可能打破僵局。/r/n

word.name: deadly
word.mean:
a. 致命的,致死的
ad. 非常地,如死一般地
word.lx: The conference was deadly dull./r/n 会议开得死气沉沉的./r/n Cancer is a deadly disease./r/n 癌症是一种致命的疾病。/r/n

word.name: deaf
word.lx: He turned a deaf ear to all requests for help./r/n 他不理会一切求援的呼吁。/r/n She turned a deaf ear to our warnings and got lost./r/n 她对我们的警告充耳不闻，结果迷失了方向。/r/n

word.name: deal
word.mean:
n. 交易,协定,份量
v. (dealt,dealt[delt])处理,应付,分配
word.lx: The meeting will deal with these problems./r/n 本次会议将就这些问题作出处理。/r/n It means a great deal to her./r/n 这对她意义重大。/r/n

word.name: dealer
word.lx: He bought a used car from a car dealer./r/n 他从汽车商那里买了一辆旧汽车。/r/n The dealer was slavering over some precious stones./r/n 那商人对一些宝石垂涎欲滴./r/n

word.name: dear
word.mean:
a. 亲爱的
int. 啊,哎呀
n. 亲爱的人
word.lx: He holds life dear./r/n 他珍视生命。/r/n The accident cost him dear./r/n 这次事故使他损失惨重。/r/n

word.name: dearly
word.lx: She would dearly like to get that job./r/n 她非常想得到那份工作。/r/n She loved him dearly./r/n 她深爱着他。/r/n

word.name: dearth
word.mean: n. 缺乏,粮食不足,饥谨
word.lx: There seems to be a dearth of good young players at the moment./r/n 目前似乎好的年轻选手太少了。/r/n Many soldiers died because of dearth of food./r/n 很多士兵因为缺少粮食死去。/r/n

word.name: death
word.lx: Car accident caused many deaths./r/n 车祸造成很多人死亡。/r/n That defeat meant the death of all my hopes./r/n 那次失败毁灭了我所有的希望。/r/n

word.name: debate
word.mean:
n. 辩论,讨论
v. 辩论
word.lx: He debated carefully before he decided./r/n 他慎重考虑后方做决定。/r/n After a long debate the bill was passed./r/n 经长时间的辩论，议案获得通过。/r/n

word.name: debenture
word.mean: n. 信用债券；公司债,公司债券,退税证明书

word.name: debit
word.mean:
n. 借方,借
v. 记入借方
[计算机] 借方
word.lx: She/Her account was debited with 50./r/n 在她的帐户借方记入了50英镑./r/n My bank account shows two debits of 5 each./r/n 我的银行帐户借方记入了两笔5英镑的款项./r/n

word.name: debris
word.lx: The sea tided the debris ashore./r/n 潮水把碎片杂物冲上海滩。/r/n A heavy woven net of rope or wire cable placed over a blasting site to keep debris from scattering./r/n 防爆毯用于爆炸现场、防止碎片飞散的厚的绳网或电缆网/r/n

word.name: debtor
word.lx: The debtor fell delinquent./r/n 债务人逾期不能偿还债务。/r/n The debtor was summoned (to appear before the magistrates)./r/n （地方法官）已传唤债务人出庭./r/n

word.name: debug
word.mean: 调试，驱除(某处的)害虫 排除...的故障; 消除...的误差, 改正...的缺点, 纠正...的错误; 审查 【无】调整, 调试, 调谐 寻出并拆除...内的窃听器 (用电子仪器)使(窃听器)失效

word.name: decade
word.lx: Prices have risen steadily during the past decade./r/n 在过去十年里，物价一直在上涨。/r/n Several decades have elapsed since I graduated from the college./r/n 我大学毕业已数十年了。/r/n

word.name: decay
word.mean:
n. 衰退,腐败
v. 衰退,腐败
word.lx: The dampness of the climate decayed the books./r/n 气候潮湿，把书都霉坏了。/r/n What made the Roman Empire decay?/r/n 罗马帝国为何衰亡？/r/n

word.name: deceit
word.lx: His deceit is disgusting; he took everybody in!/r/n 他的欺诈手段令人憎恶，弄得人人上当！/r/n He is full of deceit./r/n 他诡计多端。/r/n

word.name: deceive
word.lx: You are deceiving yourself if you still believe that she loves you./r/n 你如果还相信她爱你，你就是在欺骗自己。/r/n He deceived me into signing the papers./r/n 他骗我在文件上签了字。/r/n

word.name: December
word.lx: My little daughter was born in December./r/n 我的小女儿是十二月出生的。/r/n They often go skiing in December./r/n 他们经常在十二月份去滑雪。/r/n

word.name: decent
word.mean: a. 有分寸的,得体的,相当好的
word.lx: It was decent of her to help the homeless./r/n 她帮助无家可归的人，真是可敬。/r/n He dreamed of living in decent conditions./r/n 他梦想着过体面的生活。/r/n

word.name: decided
word.mean:
a. 确定的,坚决的
v. 决定
vbl. 决定
word.lx: I feel decidedly unwell this morning./r/n 我今天上午确实感到不舒服。/r/n The boys have decided to go camping next week./r/n 男孩子们已决定下个星期去露营。/r/n

word.name: decision
word.lx: The judge will give his decision tomorrow./r/n 法官将于明天做出判决。/r/n Who made the decision to go fishing?/r/n 是谁决定去钓鱼的？/r/n

word.name: decisive
word.lx: The injury to their key player could be a decisive factor in the game./r/n 他们主力队员受伤可能是这场比赛胜负的决定性因素。/r/n Be decisive, tell them exactly what you think should be done./r/n 果断些，确切地告诉他们你认为应该怎么做。/r/n

word.name: deck
word.mean:
n. 甲板,露台
v. 装饰
word.lx: The sailor suddenly saw a pirate jumping onto the deck./r/n 那水手忽然看到一名海盗跳上了甲板。/r/n The colonel ordered their soldiers to gather on the deck./r/n 上校命令士兵们在甲板上集合。/r/n

word.name: declaration
word.lx: Please make a written declaration of all the goods you bought abroad./r/n 请书面申报你在国外购买的全部商品。/r/n These events led to the declaration of war./r/n 这些事件导致了宣战。/r/n

word.name: declarative
word.mean: a. 宣言的(布告的,说明的,陈述的,演说的,谴责的)

word.name: declare
word.lx: The customs asked me if I had anything to declare./r/n 海关人员问我是否有要报税的东西。/r/n Britain declared war on Germany in 1914./r/n 英国在1914年向德国宣战。/r/n

word.name: declared
word.lx: The rioting grew worse and the government declared a state of emergency./r/n 骚乱恶化，政府只得宣布进入紧急状态。/r/n Japan declared war on China./r/n 日本向中国宣战。/r/n

word.name: decline
word.mean:
n. 衰微,跌落
v. 降低,婉谢
word.lx: I wish prices would decline./r/n 但愿物价下降。/r/n He spent his declining years in the country./r/n 他在乡间度过晚年。/r/n

word.name: decode
word.mean:
v. 解码,译解
[计算机] 译码

word.name: decompose
word.lx: A prism decomposes light./r/n 棱镜可以分解光线。/r/n There is a decomposing corpse of a deer./r/n 那儿有一具鹿的腐尸。/r/n

word.name: decorate
word.lx: We decorated the house for Christmas./r/n 我们装饰房屋过圣诞节。/r/n Several soldiers were decorated for bravery./r/n 数名士兵因英勇而受嘉奖。/r/n

word.name: decorative
word.lx: A decorative or protective covering or cover./r/n 罩子一个装饰性或保护性的罩或盖/r/n A decorative strip of cloth hung on a garment or wall./r/n 饰带悬挂在衣服或墙上的装饰性的带子或布/r/n

word.name: decrease
word.mean:
n. 减少,减少之量
v. 减少
word.lx: His interest in this subject gradually decreases./r/n 他对这门学科的兴趣逐渐减退。/r/n There has been a steady decrease in population in this city./r/n 这个城市的人口在持续下降。/r/n

word.name: decreasing
word.lx: Interest in the sport is decreasing./r/n 人们对此项运动的兴趣已逐渐淡薄./r/n Toy sales peaked just before Christmas and are now decreasing./r/n 玩具销售额在圣诞节前夕达到最高峰, 现已逐渐下降./r/n

word.name: decree
word.lx: The dictator decreed that his birthday would be a public holiday./r/n 该独裁者发布命令，将其生日定为公众假期。/r/n This decree has the force of law behind it./r/n 这一裁决有法律的力量作後盾./r/n

word.name: decrement
word.mean:
n. 渐减,减少,减少量
[计算机] 递减

word.name: decrepit
word.lx: An old, rickety vehicle, especially a decrepit automobile or aircraft./r/n 破旧汽车，破旧飞机一种用久而破烂的交通工具，尤指破坏了的汽车或飞机/r/n

word.name: dedicate
word.lx: She dedicated her life to science./r/n 她毕生致力于科学。/r/n The ancient Greek dedicated many shrines to Aphrodite./r/n 古希腊人为爱神阿弗罗狄特造了许多神庙。/r/n

word.name: dedicated
word.mean:
a. 专注的,献身的
a. 专用的
word.lx: Having been consecrated; dedicated./r/n 献身的被献祭的；奉献的/r/n The chapel was dedicated in 1880./r/n 这座小教堂於1880年举行献堂礼./r/n

word.name: deduce
word.lx: From seeing a doctor leaving a house, you may deduce that someone in the house is ill./r/n 从看见一个医生从一处住所出来，你就可以推断这一家有人生病了。/r/n From this fact we may deduce that he is sick./r/n 从这个事实我们可推断他生病的事。/r/n

word.name: deduct
word.lx: Tax is deducted from your salary./r/n 税金从你的薪金中扣除。/r/n The remaining assets of a business after all liabilities have been deducted; net worth./r/n 资产净值一个企业在扣除了所有的债务后所余资产；净值/r/n

word.name: deduction
word.mean:
n. 减除,扣除,减除额
n. 推论,推理,演绎
word.lx: Net salary is gross salary minus tax and national insurance deduction./r/n 净公司是工资总额减去税收和扣除国民保险。/r/n Her deduction that he was now dead was correct./r/n 她作出的他此时已经死亡的推论是正确的。/r/n

word.name: deed
word.lx: Deeds are better than words when people are in need of help./r/n 当有人需要救助的时候，行动胜于言语。/r/n His deed claims our respect./r/n 他的行为值得我们尊敬。/r/n

word.name: deem
word.lx: He deems it his duty to help his needy friends./r/n 他认为帮助穷朋友是他的义务。/r/n I deem it proper to refuse./r/n 我看还是拒绝为好。/r/n

word.name: deep
word.mean:
a. 深的
ad. 深深地
word.lx: The ship sank deep into the sea./r/n 船深深地沉入了海底。/r/n The deer escaped to the deep forest./r/n 那鹿逃入了丛林深处。/r/n

word.name: deepen
word.mean: v. 加深,使...加深,使...强烈
word.lx: The night deepened./r/n 夜深了。/r/n His smile deepened, but he made no attempt to answer./r/n 他的微笑加深了，但他没有打算要回答。/r/n

word.name: deeply
word.mean: ad. 深深地,浓浓地,粗粗地
word.lx: We are deeply grateful for your support./r/n 我们深深感谢你的支持。/r/n His remarks were deeply offensive./r/n 他的话非常无礼。/r/n

word.name: deer
word.lx: The white-lipped deer are rare in this area./r/n 白唇鹿在这个地区很罕见。/r/n The moose looks like deer./r/n 驼鹿看上去像鹿。/r/n

word.name: default
word.mean:
n. 假设值,默认(值),不履行责任,缺席
v. 默认,不履行义务,缺席,拖欠
[计算机] 缺省
word.lx: I default on the installment payment./r/n 我没有付分期应付的款。/r/n The team lost a game by default./r/n 那个队因没有出席而输掉比赛。/r/n

word.name: defeat
word.mean:
n. 败北,失败
v. 击败
word.lx: Our men were heavily defeated in the battle./r/n 我军在此战役中受到重创。/r/n The hopes were defeated./r/n 希望落空了。/r/n

word.name: defect
word.lx: A defect in the fuel lines prevented the missile from blasting off./r/n 燃料管路上的一个缺陷妨碍了导弹的发射。/r/n If it were not for this defect, I shall hire him at once./r/n 如果不是因为这个缺点，我会马上雇用他。/r/n

word.name: defective
word.mean:
a. 有缺陷的,欠缺,不完全变化动词
n. 有缺陷的人,不完全变化动词
word.lx: He is mentally defective./r/n 他智力不健全。/r/n He is defective in moral sense./r/n 他不能分辨善恶。/r/n

word.name: defend
word.lx: How can you defend the killing of animals for pleasure?/r/n 你怎么能为杀死动物取乐的行为辩护呢？/r/n Some players are better at defending./r/n 有些运动员较擅长打防卫。/r/n

word.name: defendant
word.lx: The defendant is accused of theft./r/n 被告被控偷窃。/r/n The courtroom buzzed as the defendant was led in./r/n 被告被带进来时, 审判室里发出一阵嘈杂声./r/n

word.name: defer
word.lx: I shall defer replying till I hear from home./r/n 我将等接到家信以后再给你答复。/r/n Deferred benefits; a deferred payment./r/n 迟到的恩惠；延期的付款/r/n

word.name: defiance
word.lx: He shouted defiance words at the enemy./r/n 他大声呼喊着向敌人挑战。/r/n He gave false proof, which set the court at defiance./r/n 他出示假证据，这就是蔑视法庭。/r/n

word.name: deficit
word.lx: The company had a deficit of 5000 dollars./r/n 公司亏空了五千美元。/r/n We have a great deficit this year./r/n 我们今年有很大亏损。/r/n

word.name: defile
word.mean:
v. 弄脏,污损,以纵队前进
n. 隘路,狭谷
word.lx: They that touch pitch will be defiled./r/n 近墨者黑。/r/n They climbed up the mountain through a defile./r/n 他们通过一条小路爬到山上。/r/n

word.name: define
word.lx: The powers of a judge are defined by law./r/n 法官的权限是由法律规定的。/r/n When boundaries between countries are not clearly defined, there is usually trouble./r/n 国与国之间的边界未明确划定时，通常会发生纠纷。/r/n

word.name: definite
word.lx: The workers demand a definite answer./r/n 工人们要求一个明确的答复。/r/n Is it definite that they will sign that contract?/r/n 他们肯定会签署这份合同吗？/r/n

word.name: definitely
word.mean:
a. 明确地,确切地
ad. 肯定地
word.lx: Er views very definitely./r/n 她非常明确地阐述自己的观点。/r/n Yes, definitely./r/n 是的，肯定的。/r/n

word.name: definition
word.lx: The photo lacks definition./r/n 这张照片不够清晰。/r/n To give a definition of a word is more difficult than to give an illustration of its use./r/n 给一个词下定义要比举例说明它的用法困难。/r/n

word.name: deflate
word.mean:
v. 放气，抽出空气
2. v. 打击，使....失去信心，使某人觉得不再重要
word.lx: The Government decided to deflate./r/n 政府决定紧缩通货./r/n I felt quite deflated by your nasty remark./r/n 你那些难听的话使我觉得无地自容./r/n

word.name: deflect
word.lx: The ball hit one of the defenders and was deflected into the net./r/n 球射中一名後卫後反弹进网./r/n The missile deflected from its trajectory./r/n 导弹已偏离轨道./r/n

word.name: deflection
word.lx: The smallest deflection of the missile could bring disaster./r/n 导弹有极微小的偏斜也可能酿出大祸./r/n

word.name: deformation
word.lx: The capacity of a material, such as plastic or metal, to return to a previous shape after deformation./r/n 弹性，恢复能力物质变形后恢复原来形状的能力，如塑料或金属/r/n

word.name: defraud
word.lx: She was defrauded of her money by a dishonest accountant./r/n 她的钱被一个奸诈的会计骗去了。/r/n He defrauded the author of his property./r/n 他把这个作家的财产骗走了。/r/n

word.name: deft
word.mean: a. 敏捷熟练的,灵巧的
word.lx: She is deft at dealing with reporters./r/n 她善於与记者周旋./r/n With deft fingers she untangled the wire./r/n 她用灵巧的手指解开了金属线./r/n

word.name: defy
word.lx: Her beauty defies description./r/n 她的美貌难以形容。/r/n The pine trees defy severe cold./r/n 松树不畏严寒。/r/n

word.name: degenerate
word.mean:
a. 堕落的
v. 退化,堕落
[计算机] 退化
word.lx: This degenerate seduced my daughter!/r/n 这个道德败坏的人勾引我的女儿!/r/n Her commitment to a great cause degenerated from a crusade into an obsession./r/n 她致力於一伟大事业, 但其崇高的奋斗精神已变质成为偏执的狂热./r/n

word.name: degradation
word.lx: Being sent to prison was the final degradation./r/n 堕落到最后地步就是被关进监狱。/r/n He lives in utter degradation./r/n 他生活十分潦倒。/r/n

word.name: degree
word.lx: Water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius./r/n 水在摄氏零度结冰。/r/n To do this job, you must have a degree in English./r/n 从事这个工作你必须具有英语专业的大学学位。/r/n

word.name: delay
word.mean:
n. 耽搁,迟滞
v. 耽搁,延迟
word.lx: After much delay, he finished his paper at last./r/n 拖了那么久，他终于完成了论文。/r/n Our plane was delayed by fog./r/n 我们的飞机因大雾而误点了。/r/n

word.name: delectable
word.mean: a. 快乐的,可喜的,愉快的

word.name: delegate
word.mean:
n. 代表
vt. 派…为代表；委任
word.lx: He was elected as a delegate to the annual conference./r/n 他被选为年会代表。/r/n A boss must know how to delegate (work)./r/n 当老板的要知人善任./r/n

word.name: delegation
word.lx: The Muslim delegation is shortly going on a pilgrimage to Mecca./r/n 这个穆斯林代表团很快就要去麦加朝圣了。/r/n Our cultural delegation met with a hearty welcome./r/n 我们的文化代表团受到热烈欢迎。/r/n

word.name: delete
word.lx: Delete his name from the list./r/n 把他的名字从名单上删去。/r/n The attack is to wipe out data, to delete flies, or to format the hard disk./r/n 常见的攻击方式是消除数据、删除文件或者格式化硬盘。/r/n

word.name: deliberate
word.mean:
a. 故意的,深思熟虑的
v. 仔细考虑
vt. 研讨
word.lx: He entered the room with deliberate steps./r/n 他从容不迫地走进室内。/r/n He told us a deliberate lie./r/n 他存心说谎。/r/n

word.name: deliberately
word.lx: I felt his report was deliberately opaque./r/n 我觉得他的报告故意含糊其词。/r/n The new regulations are deliberately calculated to make cheating impossible./r/n 新的法规旨在杜绝诈骗行为。/r/n

word.name: delicate
word.mean:
a. 细致优雅的,微妙的,美味的
a. 淡色的,淡味的
a. 娇弱的,纤细的
word.lx: The international situation is very delicate at present./r/n 目前的国际形势极其微妙。/r/n Her delicate health needs great care./r/n 她娇弱的身体需要小心照料。/r/n

word.name: delight
word.mean:
n. 快乐,高兴
vi. 给与乐趣,使高兴
vt. 使高兴
word.lx: He delighted the audience with his performance./r/n 他用他的表演使观众喜悦。/r/n He takes great delight in painting./r/n 他爱好绘画。/r/n

word.name: delightful
word.mean: a. 令人愉快的,可喜的
word.lx: Life in the country is rather delightful./r/n 乡村生活确实让人愉快。/r/n Individually the children are delightful; en masse they can be unbearable./r/n 孩子们单独时还讨人喜欢, 一多了就受不了了./r/n

word.name: delimit
word.lx: The first chapter delimits her area of research./r/n 第一章阐明了她的研究领域./r/n

word.name: delinquent
word.mean:
n. 行为不良的人,流氓
a. 怠忽的,有过失的
word.lx: The debtor fell delinquent./r/n 债务人逾期不能偿还债务。/r/n A delinquent account./r/n 一笔拖欠的款项/r/n

word.name: deliver
word.mean: v. 递送,表达,释放,交付,接生
word.lx: Newspapers are delivered every day./r/n 报纸每天都送来。/r/n The doctor delivered her baby./r/n 医生给她接生。/r/n

word.name: delta
word.lx: There are fertile fields in the Nile Delta./r/n 尼罗河三角洲土地肥沃。/r/n Sediment deposited by flowing water, as in a riverbed, flood plain, or delta./r/n 冲积层河床、洪水淹没的平原或三角洲中的流水淤积所产生的沉积层/r/n

word.name: deluge
word.lx: When the snow melts, the mountain stream becomes a deluge./r/n 雪融化时, 山间溪流变成山洪暴发./r/n I got caught in the deluge on the way home./r/n 我在回家的路上遇到倾盆大雨./r/n

word.name: demand
word.mean:
n. 要求,需求
v. 要求,查询
word.lx: This work demands your immediate attention./r/n 这件工作急需你立即处理。/r/n These developments have created a great demand for home computers./r/n 这些发展促使家用电脑的需求量增大。/r/n

word.name: demanding
word.lx: Teaching is a demanding profession./r/n 教学工作是个要求很高的工作。/r/n He prejudiced his claim by demanding too much compensation./r/n 他索赔过高反而使他的要求无法实现。/r/n

word.name: democrat
word.mean: n. 民主政体论者,民主主义者,民主党员
word.lx: The President is a Democrat./r/n 总统是民主党员。/r/n The man is neither fish nor fowl; he votes Democrat or Republican according to which will do him the most good./r/n 这个人在左右摇摆，他投民主党的票还是共和党的票得看哪个党对他更有益处。/r/n

word.name: demographic
word.mean:
人口统计学的
a. 人口的,人口统计的

word.name: demolish
word.lx: They have demolished the slum district./r/n 贫民区已被拆除。/r/n Her article brilliantly demolishes his argument./r/n 她的文章精辟地批驳了他的论点。/r/n

word.name: demon
word.lx: That child is a little demon./r/n 那个孩子是个小捣蛋鬼。/r/n Her husband is a demon for work./r/n 她丈夫工作起来精力过人。/r/n

word.name: demonstrate
word.mean: v. 示范,演示,证明,示威
word.lx: Please demonstrate how the machine works./r/n 请示范机器的使用方法。/r/n She demonstrated that 2 and 2 are four./r/n 她证明2加2等于四。/r/n

word.name: demonstration
word.lx: She gave us a demonstration of the machine to show how it worked./r/n 她给我们作示范，说明怎样操作这部机器。/r/n The police said over 100,000 people had taken part in the demonstration./r/n 警方说参加游行示威的人超过十万。/r/n

word.name: denial
word.lx: The government has issued a denial of an election in May./r/n 政府发表声明否认五月份要进行选举。/r/n The prisoner repeated denials of the charges against him./r/n 囚犯对被控罪名再三否认。/r/n

word.name: denomination
word.lx: The US coin of the lowest denomination is the cent./r/n 美国硬币的最小单位是美分。/r/n Not restricted to or associated with a religious denomination./r/n 非教派的不受宗教派别约束的或与宗教别无联系的/r/n

word.name: denote
word.lx: A smile often denotes pleasure and friendship./r/n 微笑常常表示高兴和友善。/r/n This word denotes a certain kind of animal./r/n 这个词是一种野兽的名称。/r/n

word.name: density
word.lx: The density of population in this city is very high./r/n 这个城市的人口密度非常高。/r/n The density of water is 1./r/n 水的密度是1。/r/n

word.name: dentist
word.lx: The dentist was cleaning and taking out teeth./r/n 牙科医生正在清洁和拔牙。/r/n I was fitted an artificial tooth by the dentist./r/n 牙医给我镶了颗假牙。/r/n

word.name: deny
word.lx: The accused man denies that he has ever met her./r/n 被告否认他曾经遇到过她。/r/n He has denied his country and his principles!/r/n 他已经背弃了自己的国家和原则！/r/n

word.name: depart
word.lx: The war forced us to depart from the old customs./r/n 战争迫使我们不得不违背旧习俗。/r/n The train to Beijing will depart from platform 3 in half an hour./r/n 开往北京的火车将于半小时后从三站台开出。/r/n

word.name: department
word.lx: He graduated from History Department./r/n 他毕业于历史系。/r/n This department collects information on political extremists./r/n 这个部门搜集有关政治极端分子的情报。/r/n

word.name: departure
word.lx: We made our departure in the early morning./r/n 我们一大早就起程了。/r/n Their departure just before the floods was providential./r/n 他们恰在发洪水之前离开, 走得真是时候./r/n

word.name: depend
word.lx: Children depend on their parents for food and clothing./r/n 小孩依赖他们的父母供给衣食。/r/n We are depending on you to finish the paper by Friday./r/n 我们相信你在星期五之前可以完成这篇论文。/r/n

word.name: dependence
word.lx: Find a job and end your dependence on your parents./r/n 找个工作，别再依赖你的父母了。/r/n Are the Hawaiian Islands a dependence of the USA?/r/n 夏威夷群岛是美国的属地吗？/r/n

word.name: dependent
word.lx: The child is dependent on his parents for support./r/n 这个小孩靠他的父母养活。/r/n Please state your name, age, and the number of dependants you have./r/n 请登记你的姓名、年龄以及供养的亲属的人数。/r/n

word.name: dependents
word.lx: He listed four dependents on his income-tax form./r/n 他在所得税申报表上填写家属四人。/r/n The child is dependent on his parents for support./r/n 这个小孩靠他的父母养活。/r/n

word.name: deplete
word.lx: This expense has depleted our funds./r/n 这笔花费已使我们的资金所剩无几./r/n Our stock of food is greatly depleted./r/n 我们的食物储备已消耗殆尽./r/n

word.name: deploy
word.lx: The infantry began to deploy at dawn./r/n 步兵黎明时开始进入战斗位置./r/n Artillery was deployed in the west./r/n 炮兵部署在西边./r/n

word.name: deposit
word.mean:
n. 存款,定金,堆积物
vt. 存放,堆积
vi. 沉淀
word.lx: He deposited the case in the left luggage office./r/n 他把箱子放在行李寄存处。/r/n The Nile floods the fields and deposits mud on them./r/n 尼罗河泛滥，在田野上淤积一层泥。/r/n

word.name: deposition
word.mean: n. 沉积作用(沉积物,矿床)
word.lx: The accused has made a deposition./r/n 被告已宣誓作证./r/n He makes a deposition that he have witness the accident./r/n 他宣誓作证自己目睹了那起事故。/r/n

word.name: depreciation
word.mean:
n. 价值减低,减价,跌落
[计算机] 折旧

word.name: depress
word.mean:
v. 使...沮丧,压低
[计算机] 降低
word.lx: Depress this button to rewind the tape./r/n 按下这个按钮倒带。/r/n The thought of having to take the exam again depressed me./r/n 想到还需重新考试，我就感到沮丧。/r/n

word.name: depression
word.lx: A depression over the Atlantic usually brings bad weather in Britain./r/n 大西洋上空的低气压通常给英国带来恶劣的天气。/r/n He suffers from acute depression./r/n 他患有严重的抑郁症。/r/n

word.name: deprive
word.lx: What will a student do if he were deprived of his books?/r/n 一个学生如果没有了书籍，将怎么办？/r/n The trees outside the windows deprive the house of light./r/n 窗外的树木把房子遮挡得暗然无光。/r/n

word.name: depth
word.lx: I was out of my depth in that class./r/n 在那个班里我跟不上。/r/n The snow is two feet in depth./r/n 雪深两英尺。/r/n

word.name: deputy
word.mean:
a. 代理的,副的
n. 代表
word.lx: I must find someone to act as a deputy for me during my absence./r/n 我必须找一个人，在我离开期间代理我的职务。/r/n He is the deputy mayor of the city./r/n 他是本市的副市长。/r/n

word.name: derail
word.mean:
v. 使出轨
v. 出轨
word.lx: The engine was derailed by a tree lying across the line./r/n 有一棵树横在铁轨上, 造成机车出轨./r/n

word.name: derelict
word.mean:
a. 被抛弃了的,无主的,玩忽职守的
n. 遗弃物,被遗弃的人,玩忽职守者

word.name: derivation
word.lx: A line of descent; derivation./r/n 血缘鉴定血统的联系；来历/r/n Place of origin; derivation./r/n 起源起源的地方；出处/r/n

word.name: descend
word.lx: Armed thieves descended on the helpless travelers./r/n 一群武装盗贼袭击了无依无靠的旅客。/r/n The sun descended behind the hills./r/n 太阳下山了。/r/n

word.name: descended
word.mean: a. 为...后裔的,出身于...的
word.lx: Armed thieves descended on the helpless travelers./r/n 一群武装盗贼袭击了无依无靠的旅客。/r/n The theory that all living organisms are descended from a single cell or organism./r/n 一元发生说认为所有生物都是由一个单细胞或有机体发展而来的理论/r/n

word.name: descent
word.lx: There was a descent of temperature after rain./r/n 雨后气温下降了。/r/n The descent down the mountain took nearly two hours./r/n 下山差不多花了两个小时。/r/n

word.name: describe
word.lx: The police asked me to describe exactly how it happened./r/n 警察让我描述一下这事是怎样发生的。/r/n The falling star described a long curve in the sky./r/n 流星在空中画出了一道长长的弧线。/r/n

word.name: description
word.mean: n. 描写,描述,说明书,作图
word.lx: The supermarket sells goods of all descriptions./r/n 超级市场销售各种货物。/r/n The beauty of the sunrise is beyond description./r/n 日出的美景难以描述。/r/n

word.name: descry
word.lx: Our host descried a gentleman of unusual appearance standing at the far end of the hall./r/n 我们的男主人远远看到有个外表不俗的绅士站在大厅的尽头。/r/n I descry a sail on the horizon./r/n 我看见在天水交接处的轮船./r/n

word.name: deserving
word.lx: The thief was given a milder punishment than he deserved./r/n 这小偷受到的惩罚比他应得的轻。/r/n This is a special case, deserving special treatment./r/n 这是个特殊的案件，应该获得特殊处理。/r/n

word.name: design
word.mean:
n. 设计,图样
v. 设计,计划
word.lx: He designed us a beautiful house./r/n 他为我们设计了一所很美的房子。/r/n This dress is of the latest design./r/n 这件衣服是最新设计。/r/n

word.name: designate
word.lx: The chairman has designated that boy as his successor./r/n 主席已经指定那个男孩作他的继承人。/r/n The town has been designated a development area./r/n 该城市已被定为开发区。/r/n

word.name: designation
word.lx: His official designation is Financial Controller./r/n 他的职称是财务总监./r/n A name or designation, especially for a class or group./r/n 名称，称谓名称或称谓，尤指一个阶层或团体的名称/r/n

word.name: desirable
word.mean:
a. 令人想要的
[计算机] 希望的

word.name: desire
word.mean:
n. 愿望,欲望,情欲
v. 向往,要求,请求
vt. 渴望
word.lx: I am filled with desire to go back home./r/n 我心中充满了回家的渴望。/r/n I desire happiness./r/n 我渴望幸福。/r/n

word.name: desired
word.mean: a. 渴望的, 想得到的

word.name: desolate
word.lx: The rocky, desolate surface of the moon./r/n 月球多石的、荒凉的表面/r/n Bands of outlaws lived in the desolate mountains after breaking the laws./r/n 成群的歹徒犯法后栖身于荒山中。/r/n

word.name: despair
word.lx: He gave up the attempt in despair./r/n 他绝望之下放弃了尝试。/r/n Trying to keep this garden in order is the despair of my life./r/n 把这个花园管理好是我力不能及的事。/r/n

word.name: despatch
word.lx: We soon despatched the chocolate cake./r/n 我们很快就吃完了巧克力蛋糕。/r/n A messenger was despatched to take the news to the soldiers at the front./r/n 一名通讯员被派去给前线士兵送消息。/r/n

word.name: desperate
word.mean: a. 不顾一切的,绝望的
word.lx: The desperate look of hunger; a desperate cry for help./r/n 饥饿者脸上那绝望的样子；绝望的呼救声/r/n They invoked help in the desperate situation./r/n 他们在走投无路的情况下恳求援助。/r/n

word.name: despise
word.lx: I despise his refusing to accept responsibility./r/n 他拒不承担责任，我鄙视他。/r/n A dish of strawberries and cream is not to be despised./r/n 一盘草莓加乳酪应该算不差了。/r/n

word.name: dessert
word.lx: I like to have ice cream for dessert./r/n 我喜欢在正餐后吃冰淇淋当甜点。/r/n He served us brownies as dessert./r/n 他给我们吃核桃仁巧克力饼作为甜点。/r/n

word.name: destination
word.lx: We eventually arrived at our destination./r/n 我们终于到达了目的地。/r/n The parcel was sent to the wrong destination./r/n 包裹送错了地方。/r/n

word.name: destroy
word.mean:
v. 破坏,毁坏
[计算机] 撤消
word.lx: An atom bomb would destroy a city./r/n 一颗原子弹能摧毁一座城市。/r/n We want to nurture the new project, not destroy it./r/n 我们要支持这个新工程, 不要破坏它./r/n

word.name: destructive
word.lx: The destructive force of the storm is huge./r/n 暴风雨的破坏力是巨大的。/r/n Are all small children so destructive?/r/n 是不是儿童都喜欢破坏?/r/n

word.name: detach
word.mean:
v. 分离
[计算机] 脱离
word.lx: He detached a link from a chain./r/n 他从链子上拆下一个链环。/r/n A number of soldiers were detached to guard the building./r/n 许多士兵被派去保护这座建筑物。/r/n

word.name: detached
word.mean:
a. 超然的,分离的
v. 分离
vbl. 分离
word.lx: He detached a link from a chain./r/n 他从链子上拆下一个链环。/r/n A number of soldiers were detached to guard the building./r/n 许多士兵被派去保护这座建筑物。/r/n

word.name: detachment
word.lx: He answered with an air of detachment./r/n 他以超然的神态回答。/r/n He showed detachment in his judgements./r/n 他表现出独到的见解。/r/n

word.name: detailed
word.lx: Please send a detailed resume to our company./r/n 请给我们公司寄一份详细的简历。/r/n Elaborate detailed maps had been prepared for the campaign./r/n 为了这次战役，还准备了详细的地图。/r/n

word.name: details
word.lx: I understood the tenor of their conversation but not the details./r/n 我听懂了他们谈话的大意，但没有听懂其中的细节。/r/n Tell me all the juicy details./r/n 把有趣的细节都讲给我听。/r/n

word.name: detectable
word.mean: a. 可发现的(可察觉的,可探测出的,可检波的)
word.lx: Detectable only by microscopic examination or chemical analysis, as a minute blood sample./r/n 通过显微镜观察测知的只能通过显微镜观察或化学分析才能发现的，如微量的血样/r/n

word.name: detection
word.mean: n. 察觉,发觉,侦查,探测

word.name: detective
word.mean:
a. 侦探的
n. 侦探

word.name: deteriorate
word.lx: Relation between the two countries have deteriorate sharply in recent week./r/n 最近几周那两个国家间的关系严重恶化了。/r/n Food is apt to deteriorate in summer./r/n 食物在夏天容易变质。/r/n

word.name: determinant
word.mean:
n. 行列式(决定因素)
a. 决定性的

word.name: determination
word.lx: The police chief spoke of his determination to catch the killer./r/n 警长谈到他决意要抓获凶手。/r/n He was utterly ruthless in his determination to succeed./r/n 他下定决心争取成功。/r/n

word.name: determine
word.mean:
v. 决定,决心要
[计算机] 确定
word.lx: We determined to go to the railway station at once./r/n 我们决定立刻去火车站。/r/n The court determined that the man was guilty of assault./r/n 法庭裁定那个人犯了侵犯人身罪。/r/n

word.name: determined
word.lx: I am determined to pay him100 dollars./r/n 我决心付给他100美元。/r/n He determined to form a club./r/n 他决心成立一个俱乐部。/r/n

word.name: detest
word.lx: She detests having to talk to people at parties./r/n 她讨厌在宴会上为应酬而和人交谈。/r/n I detest all affectation./r/n 我厌恶一切矫揉造作的行为./r/n

word.name: detriment
word.mean: 名 损害;损伤[的原因]
word.lx: This tax can not be introduced without detriment to the economy./r/n 这一税收制度一旦施行，必定会危害国民经济。/r/n He works long hours to the detriment of his health./r/n 他长时间的工作，有损健康。/r/n

word.name: detrimental
word.lx: Smoking is detrimental to health./r/n 吸烟封健康是有害的。/r/n Something useless, detrimental, or worthless, especially an animal unfit for breeding./r/n 废物无用的、有害的或无价值的东西，尤指不适于配种的动物/r/n

word.name: devastate
word.lx: Our Embassy was devastated by three bombs of NATO./r/n 我们的使馆被北约的三枚炸弹炸毁了。/r/n I was devastated by the news of the wreck./r/n 我获悉失事的消息感到十分震惊。/r/n

word.name: devastating
word.mean: a. 破坏性的, 全然的
word.lx: The area is subject to devastating seasonal winds./r/n 这个地区常遭破坏性季风的袭击。/r/n

word.name: develop
word.mean: v. 发展,发达,进步,开发,冲洗照片
word.lx: The machine developed the same fault again./r/n 这台机器有出现了同样的毛病。/r/n Modern music was first developed in Italy./r/n 现代音乐最初是在意大利发展起来的。/r/n

word.name: developing
word.lx: China is a developing country./r/n 中国是一个发展中国家。/r/n Ours is a developing country./r/n 我们的国家是一个发展中的国家。/r/n

word.name: deviation
word.lx: A deviation from a vertical or horizontal line, plane, position, or direction./r/n 倾角来自垂直或水平线、面、位置或方向的偏差/r/n A systematic deviation of a value from a reference value./r/n 某数值偏离参考值的一种系统偏差。/r/n

word.name: device
word.mean: n. 装置,设计,策略,设备
word.lx: They use television advertising as a device for stimulating demand./r/n 他们利用电视广告作为刺激需求的方法。/r/n The device will be in production by the end of the year./r/n 该装置将於年底投入生产./r/n

word.name: devil
word.lx: There will be the devil to pay./r/n 后果不堪设想。/r/n She found out her husband was a devil soon after her marriage./r/n 结婚后不久她就发现她丈夫是一个邪恶的人。/r/n

word.name: devise
word.lx: The government devised a scheme for redeveloping the city center./r/n 政府制定了市中心重建计划。/r/n He devises a new type of transistor./r/n 他发明了一种新的晶体管。/r/n

word.name: devote
word.lx: He devoted himself entirely to music./r/n 他将一生奉献给了音乐。/r/n Please devote more time to your work./r/n 请把更多的时间用于工作。/r/n

word.name: devotion
word.lx: He works with greater devotion./r/n 他工作得更专心了。/r/n His devotion to music is plain to see./r/n 他对音乐的挚爱是显而易见的。/r/n

word.name: devour
word.lx: The child devours fairy tales./r/n 这孩子专注地听着童话故事。/r/n He sat by the fire, devouring beef and onions./r/n 他坐在火炉旁，狼吞虎咽地吃着牛肉和洋葱。/r/n

word.name: dew
word.lx: The grass was wet with dew./r/n 草被露水打湿了。/r/n The grass was sprinkled with dew./r/n 草上沾满了露珠./r/n

word.name: diagnose
word.mean:
v. 诊断
vi. 判断,诊断(疾病)
vt. 诊断(疾病)
word.lx: The doctor diagnosed measles./r/n 医生诊断出麻疹./r/n

word.name: diagnostics
word.lx: A person who diagnoses, especially a physician specializing in medical diagnostics./r/n 诊断医生做出诊断的人，尤指做出医学诊断的医生/r/n Diagnostic or distinctive./r/n 诊断的诊断或区别的/r/n

word.name: diagonal
word.mean:
a. 对角线的,斜的,斜纹的
n. 对角线,斜线,斜列
word.lx: The wood surface of the furniture is full of diagonal stripes./r/n 这件家具的木头表面上布满了斜纹。/r/n A diagonal line or plane./r/n 对角线或对角面/r/n

word.name: diagram
word.mean:
n. 图解,图表
v. 用图解法表示
word.lx: She gave me a diagram of railway network./r/n 她给了我一张铁路网图解。/r/n The diagram had been copied with great precision./r/n 该图表的复印件很精确。/r/n

word.name: dial
word.mean:
n. 刻度盘,针面,转盘
v. 拨
[计算机] 拨号
word.lx: Put in the money before dialing./r/n 拨电话前先把钱放进去。/r/n Can you read the number on the dial?/r/n 你能读出刻度盘上的读数吗？/r/n

word.name: dialect
word.lx: Do you speak Sichuan dialect?/r/n 你会说四川话吗？/r/n The dialect is spoken principally in the rural areas./r/n 这种方言主要在农村地区使用。/r/n

word.name: dialog
word.lx: The writer is not very good at writing dialogs./r/n 这个作家不太擅长写对白。/r/n At last there can be a reasonable dialog between our two governments./r/n 我们两国最后终于能理智地进行对话了。/r/n

word.name: dialogue
word.lx: At last there can be a reasonable dialogue between our two governments./r/n 我们两国最后终于能理智地进行对话了。/r/n The novel contains more narrative than dialogue./r/n 这部小说里的叙述比对话多./r/n

word.name: diameter
word.lx: This lens can magnify 20 diameter./r/n 这个透镜能放大20倍。/r/n The diameter of the tree-trunk is about 2 meters./r/n 这树干的直径大约是2米。/r/n

word.name: diamond
word.lx: She wears a diamond ring on her left hand./r/n 她左手上戴着一枚钻石戒指。/r/n The diamond ring on her finger glittered in the light./r/n 她手指上的钻石戒指在灯光下闪闪发光。/r/n

word.name: diaphragm
word.lx: The diaphragm is between the chest and the abdomen./r/n 横隔膜位于胸腔与腹部之间。/r/n

word.name: dictate
word.mean:
v. 听写,口述,口授
n. 命令,指挥,指令
word.lx: He was dictating a letter to his secretary./r/n 他在向秘书口授信稿。/r/n I will not be dictated to./r/n 我不愿受人摆布。/r/n

word.name: dictator
word.lx: Hitler is a notorious dictator./r/n 希特勒是一个臭名昭著的独裁者。/r/n They are the dictator and his minions./r/n 他们就是那个独裁者和他的奴仆。/r/n

word.name: dictionary
word.lx: Please pass the dictionary to me./r/n 请把字典递给我。/r/n A dictionary is an invaluable aid in learning a new language./r/n 在学习一种新语言时，词典是非常有用的工具。/r/n

word.name: diesel
word.lx: The steam locomotives were superseded by diesel units./r/n 蒸汽机车已被柴油内燃机车所取代。/r/n Drawing on their practical experience, they designed an air-cooled diesel motor./r/n 他们利用自己的实践经验，设计了一台气冷柴油机。/r/n

word.name: diet
word.mean:
n. 日常饮食
v. 照规定饮食
word.lx: Proper diet and exercise are both important for health./r/n 适当的饮食和运动对身体健康都很重要。/r/n He is on a diet to reduce some weight./r/n 他正在节食以减轻体重。/r/n

word.name: differ
word.lx: We differ about moral standards./r/n 我们对道德标准看法不一致。/r/n Although our looks differ, we are both attractive./r/n 尽管我俩相貌不同，但都讨人喜欢。/r/n

word.name: differentiate
word.lx: Can you differentiate between the two varieties?/r/n 你能辨别这两个品种吗?/r/n It is wrong to differentiate between people according to their family background./r/n 根据出身不同而区别待人是不对的./r/n

word.name: difficult
word.lx: She is just being difficult./r/n 她正在闹别扭呢。/r/n He found it difficult to stop smoking./r/n 他觉得戒烟是件难事。/r/n

word.name: difficulty
word.lx: He finished the work without any difficulty./r/n 他轻而易举地完成了这项工作。/r/n She found great difficulties in understanding him./r/n 她觉得很难理解他。/r/n

word.name: diffuse
word.lx: The light was diffused by the leaves./r/n 树叶使光线漫射。/r/n Fashion trends diffuse themselves rapidly around the globe./r/n 时装新潮很快就在全世界流行起来。/r/n

word.name: dig
word.lx: You are just digging your own grave if you go on smoking so heavily./r/n 你继续这样大量吸烟，就是在自掘坟墓。/r/n We dug up the rose bushes and planted some cabbages./r/n 我们把玫瑰丛挖出来，然后种了一些卷心菜。/r/n

word.name: digestion
word.lx: He has a good digestion./r/n 他消化能力很强。/r/n The pancreas can produce substances which help in the digestion of food./r/n 胰脏能产生助消化的物质。/r/n

word.name: digestive
word.lx: She suffered from digestive trouble./r/n 她患有消化系统疾病。/r/n Although he is thin, he has good digestive power./r/n 尽管他很瘦，他的消化能力挺好。/r/n

word.name: digit
word.lx: In the decimal form of a number, a digit that is not significant./r/n 占位符号在一个数的小数形式中，没有意义的数字/r/n The number represented by the digit or digits in2./r/n 在释文2。中所说的由一位或几位数字表示的数。/r/n

word.name: dilapidated
word.mean: a. 毁坏的,荒废的,要塌似的
word.lx: The house is very dilapidated but it has possibilities./r/n 这房子已破旧不堪, 但还有可利用的价值./r/n

word.name: dilate
word.lx: The cat dilated its eyes in the darkness./r/n 猫在黑暗中睁大眼睛。/r/n The horse dilated its nostrils./r/n 那匹马张大它的鼻孔。/r/n

word.name: dilemma
word.lx: Faced with that dilemma, he was perplexed./r/n 他面对进退两难的局面，不知如何是好。/r/n The bad weather put us in a dilemma./r/n 糟糕的天气使我们进退两难/r/n

word.name: diligent
word.lx: Their students are diligent about their studies./r/n 他们的学生勤奋学习。/r/n The diligent student gets up before dawn every day./r/n 这个勤奋的学生每天天亮以前就起床了。/r/n

word.name: dilute
word.lx: An inert substance used to dilute./r/n 稀释剂一种惰性物质/r/n

word.name: dim
word.mean:
adj. 暗淡的, 模糊的
vt. 使暗淡, 使失去光泽
n. <美俚>笨蛋、傻子
word.lx: The light was too dim for me to read easily./r/n 光线太暗，我看书有困难。/r/n She is rather dim about the importance of keeping records./r/n 她不明白作记录的重要性。/r/n

word.name: dimensional
word.lx: A cube is a three-dimensional object./r/n 立方体是三维物体。/r/n A square is two-dimensional and a cube is three-dimensional./r/n 正方形是二维的（平面的）, 而正六面体则是三维的（立体的）./r/n

word.name: diminish
word.lx: He likes to diminish the skills of others./r/n 他喜欢贬低别人的技能。/r/n As he turned the knob, the sound diminished./r/n 他一转旋钮，声音就变小了。/r/n

word.name: dimmed
word.lx: The lamp threw out a dim light./r/n 灯发出暗淡的光。/r/n The light of a candle is dimmed by sunlight./r/n 烛光在日光下显得很黯淡。/r/n

word.name: din
word.mean:
n. 喧嚣
v. 絮聒不休地说,暄闹
word.lx: They were unable to sleep because of the din coming from the bar./r/n 酒吧里传来的喧闹声吵得他们无法入睡。/r/n The shouts of the boys dinned his ear./r/n 孩子们的吵闹声把他的耳朵都快吵聋了。/r/n

word.name: dine
word.lx: My friend invited me to dine out./r/n 我的朋友邀请我出去吃饭。/r/n Every weekend, we dine at a nice little restaurant in the neighbourhood./r/n 每个周末，我们在附近一家别致的小餐馆进餐。/r/n

word.name: dingy
word.mean:
a. 昏暗的(微黑的)
n. 小船
word.lx: He lives in a dingy room./r/n 他住在一个肮脏的屋子里。/r/n Rooms in cheap hotels are often dingy./r/n 在低级旅馆中全是又黑又脏的房间。/r/n

word.name: dint
word.mean:
n. 凹痕
vt 打出凹痕
word.lx: He succeeded by dint of hard work./r/n 他通过辛勤努力才获得成功。/r/n

word.name: diode
word.lx: A diode is used as a rectifier./r/n 二极管用作整流器。/r/n A device, such as a diode, that converts alternating current to direct current./r/n 整流器；整流管一种将交流电流转化为直流电流的装置，如二极管/r/n

word.name: dioxide
word.lx: Plants can absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen./r/n 植物可以吸收二氧化碳释放氧气。/r/n Soft drinks contain carbon dioxide./r/n 软饮料中含有二氧化碳。/r/n

word.name: dip
word.mean: 蘸;下沉;倾斜;汲出;舀取;翻阅;涉猎
word.lx: The land dips gently to the south./r/n 地面缓缓向南倾斜。/r/n The sun dipped below the horizon./r/n 太阳落到地平线下。/r/n

word.name: diphthong
word.mean: 连元音字,双重元音,双元音字

word.name: diploma
word.lx: He obtained a diploma in architecture./r/n 他获得了建筑学的学位证书。/r/n The diploma is very important for him to get the job./r/n 对他来说，要得到那份工作，文凭是很重要的。/r/n

word.name: diplomat
word.mean:
a. 外交官,外交家
n. 外交家
word.lx: The diplomat solved the international problem by negotiating./r/n 外交官通过谈判解决了那个国际问题。/r/n The diplomat is over weight./r/n 那个外交官很胖。/r/n

word.name: direct
word.mean:
a. 笔直的,直接的,坦白的
v. 指示,指挥,命令
word.lx: He directed the building of the new bridge./r/n 他主持修建这座桥的建筑工程。/r/n The general directed that the prisoners should be set free./r/n 将军下令释放犯人。/r/n

word.name: direction
word.mean: n. 方向,指导,用法说明
word.lx: Which direction does your room face?/r/n 你的房间面向哪个方向？/r/n The investigation was carried out under the direction of a senior police officer./r/n 调查是在一位高级警官的指导下进行的。/r/n

word.name: directive
word.mean:
a. 指导的,指挥的,管理的
n. 指令
[计算机] 指令

word.name: directly
word.lx: He answered me very directly and openly./r/n 他非常直接坦率地回答了我。/r/n They bought the machine directly from the manufacturer./r/n 他们直接从厂商那里购买了这台机器。/r/n

word.name: director
word.mean: n. 董事,经理,主管,指导者,导演
word.lx: The director told the actress to have a rest./r/n 导演叫这名女演员休息一下。/r/n Her career culminated in her appointment as director./r/n 她一生事业的顶峰是当上董事。/r/n

word.name: dirt
word.lx: Wash the dirt off your hands./r/n 把你手上的泥污洗掉。/r/n She cleaned the dirt from her finger-nails./r/n 她从指甲里剔掉污垢./r/n

word.name: dirty
word.lx: They sat drinking and telling dirty stories./r/n 他们坐在那里，边喝酒边讲下流故事。/r/n Repairing cars is a dirty work./r/n 修汽车是一个脏活。/r/n

word.name: disability
word.lx: A physical or mental disability./r/n 身心的缺陷体力或智力上的无能/r/n As a matter of fact, many people have a disability./r/n 事实上，许多人身体都有某种缺陷。/r/n

word.name: disable
word.lx: He was disabled from walking by the accident./r/n 由于车祸，他不能走路了。/r/n Old age disabled him for hard labour./r/n 年迈使他不能干繁重的工作。/r/n

word.name: disabled
word.mean:
a. 残废的
n. 残疾人
word.lx: This book sentimentalizes the suffering of the disabled./r/n 这本书以柔懦的笔调渲染了残疾人的痛苦。/r/n Her latest book discusses the problems of the disabled./r/n 她 的新书论述残疾人的问题./r/n

word.name: disadvantage
word.mean: n. 不利,不利条件,损害,损失

word.name: disagree
word.lx: I disagree with you on this point./r/n 我不同意你的意见。/r/n These two reports of the accident disagree with each other./r/n 这两篇关于事故的报道不太一致。/r/n

word.name: disagreement
word.lx: Divergence or disagreement, as between facts or claims; difference./r/n 矛盾，不相符不符合或不一致，如在事实和宣称之间；差异/r/n A disagreement or quarrel./r/n 争执不一致或争吵/r/n

word.name: disallow
word.lx: The judge disallowed that evidence./r/n 法官驳回那项证据。/r/n Her claim was disallowed on the ground(s) that she had not paid her premium./r/n 她要求赔款遭到拒绝, 原因是她事先没有交纳保险费./r/n

word.name: disappear
word.lx: My wallet has disappeared from the table./r/n 我放在桌子上的钱包不见了。/r/n The sun disappeared behind a cloud./r/n 太阳消失在一片云后面。/r/n

word.name: disappointment
word.lx: He expressed keen disappointment that the hearing had been postponed./r/n 他对听证会延期表示大为沮丧。/r/n That defeat was a surprise and a disappointment./r/n 那次失败令人吃惊，令人失望。/r/n

word.name: disapproval
word.lx: He shook his head in disapproval./r/n 他摇了摇头表示反对。/r/n She gestured her disapproval./r/n 她用姿势表示不赞成./r/n

word.name: disapprove
word.lx: Father disapproved of our marriage./r/n 父亲不同意我们俩人的婚事。/r/n The plan was disapproved/r/n 计划没有被通过。/r/n

word.name: disarray
word.mean:
v. 弄乱,使混乱,使脱去衣服
n. 无秩序,杂乱,不整齐的衣服
word.lx: Changing offices has left my papers in complete disarray./r/n 办公室搬迁, 使我的文件全部乱了套了./r/n The troops fled in disarray./r/n 部队仓皇逃散./r/n

word.name: disassemble
word.mean:
v. 解开,分解
[计算机] 反汇编
word.lx: Disassemble a toaster./r/n 拆卸烤面包炉/r/n

word.name: disaster
word.lx: They had led the country into economic disaster./r/n 他们把国家带入了经济灾难中。/r/n The disaster caused him to waver in his faith./r/n 这件灾难使他对信仰发生了动摇。/r/n

word.name: disastrous
word.lx: The new system has had a disastrous effect on productivity./r/n 新制度已对生产力造成了灾难性的影响。/r/n This environmental effect of this new factory could be disastrous./r/n 这家新工厂给自然环境带来的影响可能是灾难性的。/r/n

word.name: discarded
word.lx: History discarded him./r/n 他被历史所抛弃。/r/n He discarded his winter clothing./r/n 他把冬天穿的衣服都脱掉了。/r/n

word.name: discern
word.lx: He was just able to discern the road from the dark./r/n 他在黑暗中只能勉强辨认出道路。/r/n I soon discerned that the man was lying./r/n 我马上察觉出那人在撒谎。/r/n

word.name: discharge
word.mean: v. 卸下,放出,解雇,放电,解除
word.lx: The judge discharged the prisoner./r/n 法官把囚犯释放了。/r/n How long will the discharge of the cargo take?/r/n 卸货需要多久？/r/n

word.name: disciplinary
word.mean: a. 训练的,规律的,训戒的

word.name: disclose
word.lx: I have no intention of disclosing their names./r/n 我无意泄露他们的姓名。/r/n The authorities finally disclosed the truth to the press./r/n 当局终于向新闻界透露了真相。/r/n

word.name: disco
word.lx: This disco is a magnet for young people./r/n 这家迪斯科舞厅经常吸引大批年轻的顾客./r/n We danced to the disco music./r/n 我们跟著迪斯科乐曲跳舞./r/n

word.name: discolor
word.lx: Discolored, as from a bruise; black-and-blue./r/n 青黑色的尤指由于瘀伤而变色的；青黑色的/r/n

word.name: discomfort
word.lx: She still suffers considerable discomfort from her injury./r/n 她因那次受伤至今仍感不适。/r/n I was unhappy because of the discomforts of travel./r/n 我因为旅行的不适而感到不快。/r/n

word.name: discotheque
word.mean: n. 唱片舞会,迪斯科舞（厅）
word.lx: Mary wore handsome go-go boots to the discotheque last night./r/n 玛丽穿着一双入时的马靴参加昨晚的舞会。/r/n

word.name: discount
word.mean:
n. 折扣,贴现率
v. 打折扣,贴现
word.lx: The discount was very huge./r/n 折扣的幅度非常大。/r/n We give 10 percent discount for cash./r/n 现金付款，我们九折优惠。/r/n

word.name: discourage
word.lx: I was never discouraged against learning English./r/n 我从未对学习英语失去信心。/r/n Inflation discourages saving./r/n 通货膨胀阻碍储蓄的积累。/r/n

word.name: discourse
word.mean:
n. 演讲
vi. 讲述,著述
word.lx: The judges had solemn discourse together./r/n 法官们在一起严肃地交谈。/r/n They listened to his discourse on human relations./r/n 他们听他作关于人际关系的演讲。/r/n

word.name: discover
word.lx: She discovered the joy of writing./r/n 她感到了写作的乐趣。/r/n Columbus is said to have discovered America in 1492./r/n 据说哥伦布于1492年发现了美洲。/r/n

word.name: discovery
word.lx: A collector of rare insects will show us some of his latest discoveries./r/n 一位稀有昆虫采集家将给我们看一些他的最新发现。/r/n The new discovery caused a great sensation./r/n 这项新发现很轰动。/r/n

word.name: discreetly
word.mean: ad. 谨慎地, 小心地

word.name: discrete
word.mean:
a. 不连续的 离散的
[计算机] 分离 离散

word.name: discretion
word.mean:
n. 慎重,辨别力,考虑
[计算机] 判定

word.name: discriminate
word.lx: People should not be discriminated against./r/n 人们不应该被区别对待。/r/n Can you discriminate good books from bad?/r/n 你能区别好书与坏书吗？/r/n

word.name: discrimination
word.lx: We are strongly opposed to racial discrimination./r/n 我们强烈反对种族歧视。/r/n We should not have racial discrimination./r/n 我们不该有种族歧视。/r/n

word.name: discuss
word.lx: They said they had an important matter to discuss with you./r/n 他们说有要事与你相商。/r/n What does the book discuss?/r/n 这本书讲了什么？/r/n

word.name: discussion
word.mean:
n. 讨论
v. 讨论,商议
word.lx: When will the matter come up for discussion?/r/n 这件事什么时候提出来讨论？/r/n Their case is now under discussion./r/n 他们的案件现在正在讨论中。/r/n

word.name: disdain
word.mean:
n. 轻蔑
v. 蔑视
word.lx: He disdained that man for snobbishness and was unwilling to talk to him./r/n 他鄙视那个势利小人，不愿和他说话。/r/n I have nothing but disdain for such a person./r/n 对这样一个人，我只有鄙视。/r/n

word.name: disease
word.lx: Many diseases are caused by bacteria./r/n 许多疾病是由细菌引起的。/r/n The poor man has a serious disease of the liver./r/n 这个可怜的人患有严重的肝病。/r/n

word.name: disgrace
word.mean:
n. 耻辱,不名誉
v. 耻辱,使...失体面
word.lx: He fell into disgrace with his companions./r/n 他的朋友都看不起他。/r/n He quit in disgrace over the bribe./r/n 他因受贿而不光彩地辞职了。/r/n

word.name: disgraceful
word.lx: This newspaper article is a disgraceful intrusion into my private life./r/n 报纸上的这篇文章是对我私生活的侵扰，这种做法很不光彩。/r/n Please account for your disgraceful conduct./r/n 对你的可耻行为请作解释./r/n

word.name: disguise
word.mean:
n. 假面目,假装
v. 假装
word.lx: His illness was a blessing in disguise, because he afterwards married his nurse./r/n 他生病倒是因祸得福，因为后来他和他的护士结了婚。/r/n It proved difficult to disguise his anxiety./r/n 他的焦虑难以掩饰。/r/n

word.name: disgust
word.mean:
n. 厌恶,嫌恶
v. 令人厌恶
word.lx: He returned downstairs in disgust./r/n 他厌恶地转身下楼。/r/n His behavior filled her with disgust./r/n 她对他的行为充满了厌恶。/r/n

word.name: dish
word.mean:
n. 盘子
vt. 上菜
n.一样菜，一道菜
word.lx: His favorite dish is roast duck./r/n 他最喜欢吃的菜是烤鸭。/r/n The careless waiter dropped the dish onto the ground./r/n 那个粗心的侍者把盘子摔到了地上。/r/n

word.name: dishonest
word.lx: He is a dishonest merchant./r/n 他是一个不诚实的商人。/r/n Susceptibility to bribery or corruption, as in the use of a position of trust for dishonest gain./r/n 甘受贿赂，贪污腐化易受贿赂或腐败的影响性，如在使用不诚实的收益的信托状况时/r/n

word.name: dishonor
word.mean:
n. 不名誉
v. 玷辱,使...蒙羞
word.lx: He was a dishonor to his regiment./r/n 他是那个团的耻辱。/r/n His behaviors have brought dishonor onto his family./r/n 他的行为给他的家庭带来了耻辱。/r/n

word.name: dishonorable
word.lx: He is ashamed for his former dishonorable action./r/n 他对他以前不光彩的行为感到羞愧。/r/n He has done many dishonorable things these years/r/n 这些年，他干了许多可耻的事情。/r/n

word.name: disillusion
word.mean:
n. 觉醒,幻减
v. 醒悟,使幻想破减

word.name: disinclined
word.mean: a. 不愿的, 不想的
word.lx: Overloading his stomach with a heavy meal, he was disinclined for any serious work./r/n 吃了不易消化的东西，他不愿去干那些难做的工作。/r/n Be disinclined to do sth./r/n 无意干某事，不愿干某事/r/n

word.name: disinfectant
word.mean:
a. 消毒的
n. 消毒剂
word.lx: Disinfectant kills germs./r/n 消毒剂灭杀细菌。/r/n Dip your injured finger in the disinfectant to soak out the poison./r/n 把你受伤的手指浸在消毒剂里，把毒浸泡出来。/r/n

word.name: disintegration
word.lx: The breakdown and disintegration of organic tissue./r/n 组织溶解器官组织的分解和破坏/r/n Decomposition into fragments or parts; disintegration./r/n 分裂，分解碎片或几部分；分解/r/n

word.name: dislikes
word.lx: He dislikes dogs./r/n 他不喜欢狗。/r/n He dislikes his wide nostrils./r/n 他不喜欢自己的宽大的鼻孔。/r/n

word.name: dislocate
word.lx: Flights have been dislocated by thefog./r/n 大雾将飞机的班次搅乱了./r/n

word.name: disloyal
word.lx: He was disloyal to his country./r/n 他对祖国不忠。/r/n That person is disloyal to his associates./r/n 那人对同事不守信义。/r/n

word.name: dismal
word.mean: a. 阴沉的,凄凉的,暗的
word.lx: We were all depressed by the dismal weather./r/n 阴沉的天气让我们都感到压抑。/r/n Dismal weather; took a dismal view of the economy./r/n 阴沉的天气；对经济抱着不乐观的看法/r/n

word.name: dismay
word.mean:
n. 沮丧
v. 使...灰心,使...害怕
word.lx: To my dismay, he made the same mistakes./r/n 使我惊讶的是，他又犯了同样的错误。/r/n It dismayed us that the project had been canceled./r/n 那个计划取消了，这让我们非常惊讶。/r/n

word.name: dismiss
word.lx: If you are late again, you will be dismissed./r/n 如果你再迟到，你将被解雇。/r/n He dismissed the unpleasant subject and talked about something else./r/n 他不谈论这个令人不愉快的话题，而去谈论别的事情。/r/n

word.name: dismissal
word.lx: His rash dismissal of the offer annoyed me./r/n 他对该提议轻率的拒绝激怒了我。/r/n The dismissals led to a strike./r/n 雇主解雇工人导致了罢工事件。/r/n

word.name: dismount
word.lx: Two soldiers dismounted the gun from the base./r/n 两个战士把炮从底座上卸下来。/r/n One have to dismount from an idea and get into saddle again at every parenthesis./r/n 每当遇上一个括号，就叫人不得不从一种想法下马，然后再次骑上马鞍。/r/n

word.name: disobey
word.lx: He disobeyed his mother and went to the party./r/n 他不听母亲的劝告，参加了那次聚会。/r/n Those who disobey must be punished by law./r/n 违法分子必须受到法律惩罚。/r/n

word.name: disorder
word.mean:
n. 杂乱,混乱
v. 扰乱
word.lx: Anxiety may disorder the stomach./r/n 忧虑可能会引起胃部不适。/r/n The room is in dreadful disorder./r/n 房间里乱七八糟。/r/n

word.name: disparity
word.lx: Rich and poor live side by side but in conditions of extraordinary disparity./r/n 虽然富人和穷人住在一起，但是条件相差极为悬殊。/r/n

word.name: dispatch
word.mean:
v. 派遣
[计算机] 分派
word.lx: We soon dispatched the chocolate cake./r/n 我们很快就吃完了巧克力蛋糕。/r/n A messenger was dispatched to take the news to the soldiers at the front./r/n 一名通讯员被派去给前线士兵送消息。/r/n

word.name: dispatcher
word.mean: 调度器,调度程序,分配器

word.name: dispel
word.lx: The company is trying to dispel rumour about a take-over./r/n 公司力图澄清有关接管的流言。/r/n How can we dispel their doubt?/r/n 我们怎么才能驱散他们的疑虑呢？/r/n

word.name: dispense
word.lx: The doctor dispensed a prescription to his patient./r/n 医生开处方给病人配药。/r/n She cannot dispense with a servant./r/n 她不能没有佣人。/r/n

word.name: disperse
word.lx: The police dispersed the crowd./r/n 警方驱散群众。/r/n The wind dispersed the cloud from the sky./r/n 风吹散了天上的云。/r/n

word.name: displace
word.lx: The indigenous population was soon displaced by the settlers./r/n 没过多久，外来移民就把当地人赶出了家园。/r/n Weeds tend to displace other plants./r/n 杂草越来越多，有取代其他植物之势。/r/n

word.name: displacement
word.mean:
n. 换置,转位,移动
[计算机] 位移

word.name: display
word.mean:
n. 显示,陈列,炫耀
v. 显示,表现,夸示
word.lx: The bestsellers were sold out before they were displayed./r/n 这些畅销书尚未陈列就卖光了。/r/n His paintings are on display at the exhibition./r/n 他的绘画正在展览会上展出。/r/n

word.name: displeasure
word.mean: n. 不愉快(不高兴,生气)
word.lx: I incurred her displeasure by refusing the invitation./r/n 我因拒绝邀请而惹怒了她。/r/n His displeasure were off./r/n 他的不愉快心情逐渐消失了。/r/n

word.name: disposal
word.mean:
n. 处理,消除,销毁,处置
n. 弃菜碾碎器
word.lx: He has a large number of reference books at his disposal./r/n 他有大量的参考书可供使用。/r/n We placed everything at his disposal./r/n 我们把一切事情都交给他处理。/r/n

word.name: disposed
word.mean: a. 有某种健康状态的, 有...倾向的
word.lx: The chance of promotion disposed him to accept the offer./r/n 有晋升的机会使他有意接受该提议。/r/n I disposed of my old magazines./r/n 我把旧杂志卖了。/r/n

word.name: disposition
word.mean:
n. 性情,处置
[计算机] 配置情况
word.lx: They showed a disposition to sign the contract./r/n 他们表示有签订合同的意愿。/r/n The choice is no longer in their disposition./r/n 选择权已不在他们手中了。/r/n

word.name: dispute
word.mean:
n. 争论
v. 争论
word.lx: They are disputing about the rights and wrongs of the case./r/n 他们正在激烈争论这个事件的是非曲直。/r/n His honesty is beyond dispute./r/n 他的诚实是无可争议的。/r/n

word.name: disrupt
word.mean:
a. 分裂的,分散的
v. 使...分裂,使...瓦解
word.lx: His speech disrupted the meeting./r/n 他的讲演使会场陷入混乱。/r/n An accident has disrupted railway services into and out of the city./r/n 一次交通事故使进出这座城市的铁路交通陷于混乱。/r/n

word.name: disruptive
word.mean: a. 捣乱的,破坏性的,制造混乱的

word.name: dissatisfaction
word.lx: Private members voice public dissatisfaction at have to pay higher taxes./r/n 下议院议员道出了公众对增加税收的不满。/r/n The condition or fact of being displeased; dissatisfaction./r/n 不愉快，不满意不高兴的情况或事实；不满/r/n

word.name: disseminate
word.lx: They use the press to disseminate right-wing views./r/n 他们利用报刊来传播右翼观点./r/n

word.name: dissipate
word.lx: He soon dissipated his fortune./r/n 他很快就把财产浪费光了。/r/n The sun dissipated the mist./r/n 太阳驱散了雾。/r/n

word.name: dissolution
word.lx: He obtained the dissolution of his marriage with her./r/n 他解除了和她的婚姻。/r/n The President announced the dissolution of Parliament./r/n 总统宣布了议会解散。/r/n

word.name: dissolve
word.lx: The parliament was dissolved./r/n 议会解散了。/r/n Ice dissolved in the warm weather./r/n 冰在温暖的天气中溶化了。/r/n

word.name: distance
word.lx: My house is four miles distance from the sea./r/n 我家离海四英里。/r/n We can see the mountain from the distance./r/n 我们从远处就可以看到那座山。/r/n

word.name: distant
word.lx: He is a distant cousin of mine./r/n 他是我的一位远房表亲。/r/n My company is five miles distant from my home./r/n 公司距离我家五英里远。/r/n

word.name: distend
word.lx: Having eyes with greatly distended pupils./r/n 眼珠暴突的具有带有膨大的瞳孔的眼睛的/r/n Swollen or distended beyond normal size by fluid or gaseous material./r/n 肿胀的液体或气体材料超过正常尺寸的肿胀或膨胀/r/n

word.name: distil
word.mean: v. 蒸馏, 提取....的精华
word.lx: Water can be made pure by distilling it./r/n 水可以通过蒸馏而提纯。/r/n Tears distilled slowly from her eyes./r/n 泪水从她的眼睛里慢慢地滴下来。/r/n

word.name: distill
word.lx: Water can be made pure by distilling it./r/n 水可以通过蒸馏而提纯。/r/n Tears distilled slowly from her eyes./r/n 泪水从她的眼睛里慢慢地滴下来。/r/n

word.name: distillation
word.lx: Purification of water may be achieved by distillation./r/n 水的净化可由蒸馏获得。/r/n We may purge water by distillation./r/n 我们可以用蒸馏法使水净化。/r/n

word.name: distinction
word.mean: n. 差别,不同,对比,区分,辨别
word.lx: He passed the examination with distinction./r/n 他以优异成绩通过考试。/r/n We should make a distinction between right and wrong./r/n 我们应该分清是非。/r/n

word.name: distinctive
word.lx: Soldiers wear a distinctive uniform./r/n 士兵们穿着特制的制服。/r/n This is a distinctive room./r/n 这是一间独具一格的房间。/r/n

word.name: distinctly
word.mean: ad. 显然地,明显地,清楚地
word.lx: He spoke very distinctly./r/n 他说话十分清晰。/r/n The choir was (singing) distinctly out of tune in places./r/n 合唱团有些地方明显（唱）走调了./r/n

word.name: distinguish
word.mean: v. 区别,辨别,表现突出
word.lx: He distinguished himself by his courage./r/n 他因英勇而扬名。/r/n The twins were so much alike that it was impossible to distinguish one from the other./r/n 这对孪生子像得使人无法分辨。/r/n

word.name: distinguished
word.mean:
a. 卓著的
v. 区别
vbl. 区别
word.lx: Premier Zhou is a distinguished politician./r/n 周总理是一位卓越的政治家。/r/n I think grey hair makes you look rather distinguished./r/n 我觉得你灰白的头发使你看上去很有尊严。/r/n

word.name: distort
word.lx: You have distorted my motives./r/n 你曲解了我的动机。/r/n The reporter distorted the facts./r/n 记者们歪曲了事实。/r/n

word.name: distortion
word.lx: A distortion of shape./r/n 变形形状的扭曲/r/n A distortion or twist, especially in a piece of wood./r/n 弯曲歪曲、变形、尤指某一木头/r/n

word.name: distress
word.mean:
n. 苦恼,贫困
v. 使...苦恼
word.lx: What are you looking so distressed for?/r/n 什么事情使你看起来如此烦恼？/r/n The lifeboat went out to a ship in distress./r/n 救生船去救一艘遇险的船只。/r/n

word.name: distribute
word.lx: The mother distributed candy among children./r/n 母亲给孩子们发糖果。/r/n The books in the library were distributed according to subjects./r/n 图书馆里的藏书按科目分类。/r/n

word.name: distributed
word.lx: The mother distributed candy among children./r/n 母亲给孩子们发糖果。/r/n They distributed leaflets to customers./r/n 他们给客户散发传单。/r/n

word.name: distribution
word.mean: n. 分发,分配,散布,分布
word.lx: The distribution of the magazine is 2000./r/n 该杂志的销售量为2000份。/r/n They could not agree about the distribution of the profits./r/n 他们对于利润的分配意见不一致。/r/n

word.name: district
word.mean:
n. 区,地区,行政区
v. 区,区域,地区
word.lx: He lives in a mountainous district./r/n 他住在山区。/r/n This district grew cotton on a large scale./r/n 这个地区过去大量种棉花。/r/n

word.name: disturb
word.lx: He put his oars in the water and disturbed the smooth surface of the lake./r/n 他把桨放入水中，搅乱了平静的湖面。/r/n They took the phone off the hook so no calls would disturb them./r/n 他们摘下电话听筒，以免电话打扰他们。/r/n

word.name: disturbance
word.lx: The noise of cars passing along the road is a continual disturbance to our quiet at home./r/n 马路上来往的车辆声音不断地破坏我们家的安宁。/r/n Those men were charged by the police with causing a disturbance./r/n 那些人因制造骚乱被警方控诉。/r/n

word.name: disuse
word.lx: Here are some words that have fallen into disuse./r/n 这是一些废弃不用的词。/r/n The spoon has been rusty from disuse./r/n 汤匙因弃置不用而生锈了。/r/n

word.name: ditch
word.mean:
n. 沟渠
v. 坠沟中
word.lx: The frog jumped into the ditch./r/n 青蛙跳进了沟里。/r/n The cart overturned and precipitated us to the ditch./r/n 车子翻了，我们被摔进了沟里。/r/n

word.name: ditto
word.mean:
n. 同上,同上符号,很相似的东西
a. 同样的,前项的
ad. 与前同地
word.lx: I shall act ditto./r/n 我将同样办理。/r/n

word.name: diuretic
word.lx: Coffee is a diuretic./r/n 咖啡是一种利尿剂./r/n

word.name: dive
word.mean:
n. 潜水,跳水
v. 跳水,俯冲
word.lx: The eagle dived down on the rabbit./r/n 那只鹰向兔子猛扑下来。/r/n He dived from the bridge and rescued the drowning child./r/n 他从桥上跳入水中，救起溺水的孩子。/r/n

word.name: diverge
word.lx: Our views diverged so greatly that it was impossible to agree./r/n 我们的观点存在着严重的分歧，绝无调和余地。/r/n The stream diverges here./r/n 小溪在这儿分岔。/r/n

word.name: divergence
word.mean:
n. 分歧
n. 散度（数学用语）
word.lx: A point of divergence, especially one of great moment./r/n 转折点分岔点，尤指需要作出重大决择的时刻/r/n Divergence or disagreement, as between facts or claims; difference./r/n 矛盾，不相符不符合或不一致，如在事实和宣称之间；差异/r/n

word.name: divergent
word.lx: A divergent section of a river, especially near the mouth./r/n 河流分支河流的分岔部分，特别是近河口地区/r/n

word.name: diverse
word.mean: a. 不同的,相异的,多种多样的
word.lx: Her interests are very diverse./r/n 她的兴趣非常广泛。/r/n The program deals with subjects as diverse as pop music and Beijing Opera./r/n 节目涉及从流行音乐到京剧这样形形色色的题材。/r/n

word.name: diversion
word.mean: n. 转向,转移,娱乐活动
word.lx: I think your last argument was a diversion to make us forget the main point./r/n 我认为你最后的那个论点是在转移目标，以便我们忘掉要点。/r/n Chess is his favorite diversion./r/n 象棋是他最喜欢的娱乐活动./r/n

word.name: diversity
word.mean:
n. 差异,多样性
vt. 使不同,使多样化
word.lx: We should get a thorough understanding about the cultural diversity of the United States./r/n 我们应该对美国文化的多样性有一个全面的了解。/r/n A diversity lead to prosperity./r/n 穷则变，变则通。/r/n

word.name: divert
word.lx: I found a computer game to divert the children./r/n 我发现了一种供孩子娱乐的电脑游戏。/r/n They diverted the river to supply water to the town./r/n 他们使河流改道以便向城市供水。/r/n

word.name: divide
word.lx: She divided the food into four equal shares./r/n 她把食物分成相同的四份。/r/n Six divided by two is three./r/n 六除以二得三。/r/n

word.name: dividend
word.mean: n. 红利,股息,彩金,被除数
word.lx: The company declared a large dividend at the end of the year./r/n 公司在年底宣布分发高额股息。/r/n An expression to be divided by another; a dividend./r/n 被除数被另一个数除的表达式；被除数/r/n

word.name: divine
word.lx: My mother asked me to attend divine service./r/n 我妈妈要求我做礼拜。/r/n At last I divined the truth./r/n 我终于看穿了事情的真相。/r/n

word.name: division
word.mean: n. 区分,分开,除法,公司,部门，师（军队里）
word.lx: The divisions between the various classes of society are not so sharply marked as they used to be./r/n 现在社会上各阶级的区分不象过去那样明显了。/r/n Is that a fair division of the money?/r/n 那样分款公平吗？/r/n

word.name: divorce
word.mean:
n. 离婚
v. 与...办离婚
word.lx: She got a divorce after years of unhappiness./r/n 经过多年的不幸之后，她终于离了婚。/r/n He divorced his wife./r/n 他和他妻子离了婚。/r/n

word.name: dizziness
word.lx: A fit of dizziness came over her./r/n 她感到一阵头晕目眩./r/n He had a sensation of dizziness./r/n 他有一种晕眩的感觉。/r/n

word.name: dizzy
word.lx: The room was so hot that she felt dizzy./r/n 房间里热得她头晕目眩。/r/n We were dizzy by the strong wind./r/n 我们被大风刮得头晕目眩。/r/n

word.name: DNA
word.mean: deoxyribonucleic acid 脱氧核糖核酸

word.name: do
word.mean:
aux. 助动词(无词意)
v. 干,做
word.lx: I do miss you./r/n 我真想念你啊！/r/n The firm did badly last year./r/n 公司去年生意不好。/r/n

word.name: dock
word.mean:
n. 码头,船坞
v. 靠码头,入坞
word.lx: They have docked us of two days of our annual leave./r/n 他们已从我们每年的休假里扣除了两天。/r/n The two modules docked in outer space./r/n 两个飞行舱在外层空间对接。/r/n

word.name: doctor
word.mean:
n. 医生
v. 医治
word.lx: He is a Doctor of Philosophy./r/n 他是一位哲学博士。/r/n You should see a doctor./r/n 你应该去看医生。/r/n

word.name: doctrine
word.mean: n. 教义,主义,学说;[古]教学,指导,指令指示;军事战略
word.lx: Christian and Muslim doctrines are very different./r/n 基督教教义和穆斯林教义极为不同。/r/n The doctrine or belief that the evil in the world outweighs the good./r/n 悲观主义认为世界上邪恶远远强于正义的主义和信念/r/n

word.name: document
word.mean:
n. 文件,公文
v. 记载,用文件等证明
[计算机] 文档
word.lx: Let me see all the official documents concerning the sale of this land./r/n 让我看看买卖这块土地的所有官方文件。/r/n The history of this area is very well documented./r/n 这个地区的历史档案保存得很好。/r/n

word.name: documentary
word.mean:
a. 文献的
n. 纪录片
word.lx: There was some marvellous wildlife photography in the documentary./r/n 这部记录片里有些绝妙的野生动物镜头。/r/n It was named the best documentary of the year./r/n 它被选为这一年最优秀的文献记录片。/r/n

word.name: dodge
word.lx: He dodged the falling rock and escaped unhurt./r/n 他闪身躲过了滚落的岩石，安然脱险了。/r/n He dodged past me./r/n 他躲躲闪闪地从我旁边走过。/r/n

word.name: dog
word.mean:
n. 狗,卑鄙的人
v. 尾随,跟踪
word.lx: Love me, love my dog./r/n 爱屋及乌。/r/n Every dog has his day./r/n 人人皆有得意时。/r/n

word.name: doggedly
word.mean: ad. 固执地, 顽强地
word.lx: A freelance photographer who doggedly pursues celebrities to take candid pictures for sale to magazines and newspapers./r/n 猎奇摄影者为了偷拍镜头卖给杂志和报纸的顽强地追踪某些庆祝活动的自由摄影者/r/n

word.name: doing
