word.lx: I would like to quote two extracts from the book./r/n 我很想引用这本书的两段文字。/r/n I had extracted a detailed account from him./r/n 我从他那里打听出了详情。/r/n

word.name: extraction
word.lx: Of Spanish extraction./r/n 西班牙血统的/r/n The refuse of sugar cane after extraction of the juice./r/n 甘蔗渣在汁液被榨完以后剩下的甘蔗废料/r/n

word.name: extraordinary
word.lx: He married a girl of extraordinary beauty./r/n 他娶了一位非常美丽的姑娘。/r/n Remarkable or extraordinary; wonderful./r/n 奇异的不寻常的或特别的；奇妙的/r/n

word.name: extravagance
word.mean: n. 奢侈,浪费,放肆的言行

word.name: extremely
word.lx: This task is extremely difficult./r/n 这项任务极其困难。/r/n The cavalry is extremely majestic-looking./r/n 这支骑兵部队非常威风凛凛。/r/n

word.name: extremes
word.lx: Love and hate are extremes./r/n 爱和恨是两个极端。/r/n Extremes are dangerous./r/n 【谚】凡事走向极端是危险的。/r/n

word.name: extremity
word.lx: He was driven crazy by the extremity of pain./r/n 极度的痛苦使他发狂。/r/n Either extremity of the main axis of a nucleus, a cell, or an organism./r/n 卵细胞的极细胞核、细胞或有机体的主轴两端的任一端/r/n

word.name: exuberant
word.lx: The quality or condition of being exuberant./r/n 充沛，繁茂繁茂的性质或状态/r/n Characterized by coarse humor, exuberant learning, or bold caricature./r/n 文笔粗鄙幽默与讽刺的带有粗野幽默、丰富学识或辛辣讽刺的特征的/r/n

word.name: eye
word.mean:
n. 眼睛
v. 看,注视
word.lx: Her children have blue eyes./r/n 她的孩子的眼睛是蓝色的。/r/n He is blind in one eye./r/n 他一只眼睛失明。/r/n

word.name: eyeball
word.lx: His eyeball is static./r/n 他的眼球一动不动。/r/n We must discuss the situation eyeball to eyeball./r/n 我们要面对面的研究一下这种情况。/r/n

word.name: eyeglass
word.lx: My eyeglass frame is broken!/r/n 我的眼镜框断了！/r/n The old man wore an eyeglass attached to a piece of ribbon./r/n 那老人戴著单片眼镜，上面连结著一条丝带。/r/n

word.name: eyesight
word.lx: He has poor eyesight./r/n 他的视力不好。/r/n Poor eyesight will exempt you from military service./r/n 视力不佳将使你免服兵役。/r/n

word.name: fable
word.lx: Fables often have animals as the main characters./r/n 寓言常以动物为主角。/r/n Children, gather round, and Miss Alice will tell you a fable."/r/n ＂孩子们，大家聚拢点，爱丽丝小姐给你们讲个寓言故事。＂/r/n"

word.name: fabric
word.lx: The cost of repairing the fabric of the church was very high./r/n 修理教堂结构的花费非常大。/r/n The whole fabric of the society was changed by the war./r/n 战争改变了整个社会结构。/r/n

word.name: face
word.mean:
n. 脸,面容
v. 面对,朝,承认
[计算机] 面
word.lx: He faced the difficulty with courage./r/n 他勇敢地面对困难。/r/n The sun was shining in our faces./r/n 太阳光直射在我们脸上。/r/n

word.name: facility
word.mean:
n. 设施,设备
n. 灵巧,容易,熟练
word.lx: A free bus to the airport is a facility offered only by this hotel./r/n 只有这家旅店提供免费乘车去机场的服务。/r/n The computerized phone has a callback facility./r/n 计算机化的电话有回叫装置。/r/n

word.name: facsimile
word.mean:
n. 复写,传真
v. 传真
word.lx: Equipment used to produce such a graph or tracing in facsimile transmission./r/n 传真电报机传真通信中用以制作这样的图表或映描图的设备/r/n A fraudulent imitation or facsimile./r/n 摹本诈骗性的模仿或摹真本/r/n

word.name: faction
word.lx: The party split into petty factions./r/n 该党分裂成若干小派系。/r/n A member of a small governing faction./r/n 寡头政治集团成员一个小的统治集团的成员/r/n

word.name: factory
word.lx: A new factory was established near my home./r/n 我家附近新建了一家工厂。/r/n The factory has built up reserve fund./r/n 这个工厂已积累了后备基金。/r/n

word.name: faculty
word.mean:
n. 才能,能力,全体教员
n. （大学的）系, 科, 院
word.lx: This boy has a faculty of making friends easily./r/n 这个男孩有交友的能力。/r/n There will be a meeting for the English faculty this afternoon./r/n 今天下午英语系的教职员工要开个会。/r/n

word.name: fade
word.lx: The closing music fades out when the hero rides off into the sunset./r/n 当男主角策马向夕阳驰去时，尾声音乐逐渐消失。/r/n Flowers soon faded when they have been cut./r/n 花剪下后很快就会枯萎。/r/n

word.name: Fahrenheit
word.mean:
a. 华氏的
n. 华氏温度计
word.lx: The temperature today is seventy degrees Fahrenheit./r/n 今天气温是华氏七十度。/r/n Water freezes at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (32 F) or zero/nought degrees Celsius (0 C)./r/n 水结成冰的温度是32华氏度（32 ）或零摄氏度（0℃）./r/n

word.name: fail
word.mean: v. 失败,不及格,辜负,缺少
word.lx: I tried to fix the equipment but I failed./r/n 我想把机器修理好，但是失败了。/r/n I fail to see why you find it so amusing./r/n 我不明白你们为什么对这件事感到如此好笑。/r/n

word.name: failing
word.lx: That machine has one big failing./r/n 那台机器有个大缺点。/r/n Failing instructions I did what I thought was best./r/n 没有任何指示，我只能按我认为最好的方法去做了。/r/n

word.name: failure
word.lx: The play was a dead failure./r/n 这场戏完全失败了。/r/n I shall have another chance in the event of failure./r/n 如果失败，我还有另一个机会。/r/n

word.name: faint
word.mean:
n. 昏厥,昏倒
a. 微弱的,无力的,模糊的
v. 昏倒
word.lx: Our chances of victory are very faint now./r/n 现在我们取胜的机会已经微乎其微了。/r/n I heard a faint sound in the distance./r/n 我听到远处有个微弱的声音。/r/n

word.name: fair
word.mean:
a. 公平的,晴朗的,美丽的
n. 展览会,市集
adj.(皮肤，毛发等）浅色的；白皙的
word.lx: You must play fair./r/n 你必须公正处事。/r/n We participated in the spring fair./r/n 我们参加了春季展览会。/r/n

word.name: fairy
word.lx: Their love story sounds like a fairy tale./r/n 他们的爱情故事听起来像童话。/r/n There are many stories about the nymphs in Roman fairy tales./r/n 罗马神话中有许多关于仙女的故事。/r/n

word.name: faith
word.lx: I kept faith with him./r/n 我信守了对他的诺言。/r/n He has great talent, but he has lost his faith./r/n 他很有天赋，但是他已经丧失了信心。/r/n

word.name: faithful
word.mean: a. 如实的,忠诚的,忠实的
word.lx: This newspaper gave a faithful account of the event./r/n 这份报纸对那件事进行了如实的报道。/r/n The dog remained faithful to his master./r/n 这条狗始终忠于它的主人。/r/n

word.name: faithfully
word.mean: ad. 忠实,诚心诚意,深信着
word.lx: They swore an oath to carry out their duties faithfully./r/n 他们发誓要忠实履行自己的职责。/r/n The old nurse have serve the family faithfully for thirty years./r/n 老保姆为这个家庭忠实地服务了三十年。/r/n

word.name: fall
word.mean:
n. 秋天,落下,瀑布
v. 倒下,落下,来临
word.lx: He fell into the lake./r/n 他掉进了湖里。/r/n Six tigers fell to his rifle./r/n 他用步枪射倒了六只老虎。/r/n

word.name: fallback
word.mean:
撤退
后备计划，后备行动

word.name: fallible
word.mean: a. 易错的,可能犯错的
word.lx: Human beings are only fallible./r/n 人类本身易犯错误/r/n Everybody is fallible./r/n 人人都难免有错。/r/n

word.name: false
word.mean: a. 不真实的,错误的,人造的,假的,虚伪的
word.lx: Your answer to this question is false./r/n 你对这个问题的回答是错误的。/r/n They lulled me into a false sense of security./r/n 他们哄骗我，让我产生了一种虚假的安全感。/r/n

word.name: fame
word.lx: His fame as a poet did not come until after his death./r/n 他死后才获得诗人之名。/r/n She won her overnight fame by her first novel./r/n 她的第一部小说一问世，便使她一举成名。/r/n

word.name: familiarity
word.lx: Try to discourage such familiarities from your subordinates./r/n 不要让属下对你这样不拘礼仪。/r/n His familiarity with the local languages surprised me./r/n 他对当地语言如此精通令我吃惊。/r/n

word.name: family
word.mean:
a. 家庭的
n. 家庭
word.lx: He had to work hard to support his family./r/n 他不得不努力工作来养家。/r/n There are five people in my family./r/n 我家里有五口人。/r/n

word.name: famine
word.lx: Thousands of people died of famine./r/n 千千万万的人死于饥荒。/r/n We are collecting money for the famine victim./r/n 我们在为遭受饥荒的灾民募捐。/r/n

word.name: famous
word.lx: He is famous for his fine acting./r/n 他以演技精湛著称。/r/n New York is famous for its skyscrapers./r/n 纽约以其摩天大楼著称。/r/n

word.name: fan
word.mean:
n. 风扇,迷,狂热者
v. 煽,煽动,刺激
word.lx: We have an extractor fan in the kitchen to get rid of the smell of cooking./r/n 我们的厨房里有台排气扇，用来消除油烟。/r/n My boss is a football fan./r/n 我的上司是一位足球迷。/r/n

word.name: fancy
word.mean:
n. 想像力,幻想,喜好
a. 想像的,精美的,新奇的
word.lx: I fancy I have met you before./r/n 我想我以前或许见过你。/r/n The painting took his fancy, so he bought it./r/n 这幅画被他看中了，所以他就把他买了下来。/r/n

word.name: fantastic
word.mean: a. 极好的,难以相信的,奇异的,幻想的
word.lx: We watched a fantastic play yesterday evening./r/n 昨天晚上我们看了一场非常精彩的演出。/r/n My daughter likes to describe her fantastic dreams to me./r/n 我女儿喜欢给我讲她那些奇怪的梦。/r/n

word.name: far
word.mean:
ad.&a. 远的(地)
n. 远处
word.lx: The far side of the moon is difficult for us to observe./r/n 我们很难观察月亮的另一边。/r/n We walked far into the woods./r/n 我们步行深入林中。/r/n

word.name: fare
word.mean:
n. 费用,食物
v. 进展,进步,经营
word.lx: I think I fared quite well in the interview./r/n 我觉得我这次面试考得不错。/r/n I reminded her how much the fare was./r/n 我提醒她车票的价钱./r/n

word.name: farm
word.mean:
n. 农场,农田
v. 耕种
word.lx: We work on the farm./r/n 我们在农场工作。/r/n My friend is farming in Wales./r/n 我的朋友在威尔士的农场种地。/r/n

word.name: farmer
word.lx: That farmer employs many farm laborers./r/n 那位农场主雇佣很多农场工人。/r/n The farmer whistled as he milked./r/n 农夫一边挤奶一边吹口哨。/r/n

word.name: farmhouse
word.lx: The farmhouse was built of wood./r/n 农舍是用木头建造的。/r/n I was farmed out to nannies at an early age in that farmhouse./r/n 小的时候我是在那间农舍由奶妈照看的。/r/n

word.name: farming
word.lx: Beginning in1961 they began to reform their way of farming./r/n 从1961年起他们开始改革耕作方法。/r/n High prices for farm products encouraged farming./r/n 农产品价格的提高有助于农业。/r/n

word.name: fascinate
word.lx: The serpent fascinated its prey./r/n 蛇用目光吓住了它的猎物。/r/n The students were fascinated by his ideas./r/n 学生们都被他的思想吸引住了。/r/n

word.name: fascinating
word.lx: Mary is full of fascinating theories about men and women./r/n 玛丽对男人和女人充满了迷人的想法。/r/n If I had eyes, how happily would I embark upon so fascinating a study!/r/n 如果我有眼睛，我会多么幸福地从事如此迷人的研究！/r/n

word.name: fascination
word.lx: The topic seemed to have a fascination for her./r/n 这个题目似乎对她很有吸引力。/r/n A strong or spellbinding appeal; fascination./r/n 迷人的魅力强烈的或使人沉迷的魅力；魅力/r/n

word.name: fascism
word.lx: I condemn fascism and all it stands for./r/n 我谴责法西斯主义及其代表的一切。/r/n I abominate fascism./r/n 我憎恨法西斯主义./r/n

word.name: fashioned
word.lx: He fashioned the clay into a jar./r/n 他用粘土做成一个陶土罐子。/r/n In a dignified, noble fashion befitting or characteristic of a lord./r/n 高傲的，贵族的以符合老爷或作为老爷的尊贵的、高贵的方式的或具之特点的/r/n

word.name: fast
word.mean:
a. 快速的,耐久的,紧的
ad. 很快地,紧紧地,彻底地
n. vi. 禁食, 绝食, 斋戒
word.lx: I like fast music./r/n 我喜欢节奏快的音乐。/r/n They run faster and faster./r/n 他们跑得越来越快。/r/n

word.name: fasten
word.lx: I fastened the pages together with a paperclip./r/n 我用一个纸夹把那几页纸夹在一起。/r/n She fastened the notice to the board./r/n 她把通知贴到布告板上。/r/n

word.name: fastidious
word.mean:
a. 难取悦的,挑剔的,苛求的
=particular
word.lx: She is so fastidious about her food that I never invite her for dinner./r/n 她对食物过於挑剔，因此我从不请她吃饭/r/n One who is excessively fastidious in dress, manners, or taste./r/n 爱修饰的人过分讲究穿著、举止或嗜好的人/r/n

word.name: fatal
word.lx: His illness was fatal to our plan./r/n 他的患病给我们的计划带来灾难。/r/n This was his fatal defect; he was of feeble will./r/n 这是他致命的弱点，他意志薄弱。/r/n

word.name: fate
word.lx: They met with a terrible fate./r/n 他们的结局十分悲惨。/r/n She wondered what fate had in store for her next./r/n 她不知道以后等待她的将是什么命运。/r/n

word.name: father
word.lx: I have loved her like a father should./r/n 我爱她就像爱自己的女儿一样。/r/n Father sits in the same chair every evening./r/n 父亲每晚都坐在同一张椅子上，/r/n

word.name: fathom
word.mean: n.&v. 测量深度,看穿,彻底了解
word.lx: The ship sank in four fathoms./r/n 这条船沉下四英寻。/r/n I cannot fathom his meaning./r/n 我不能彻底了解他的意思。/r/n

word.name: fatigue
word.mean:
n. 疲乏,疲劳
v. 使...疲劳,使...心智衰弱
word.lx: Finally, her mind gave in to fatigue and she fell asleep./r/n 最后她的心力疲惫不堪，就睡着了。/r/n The patient fatigues easily./r/n 病人容易疲劳。/r/n

word.name: fatuous
word.mean: a. 愚昧的, 昏庸的, 发呆的, 愚笨的, 自满的

word.name: fault
word.mean:
n. 故障,过失,缺点
vt. 挑剔,指责
word.lx: My father is always finding fault with the way I do things./r/n 我父亲总是对我做事的方式百般挑剔。/r/n There are several faults in the page of figures./r/n 那一页的数字中有几个差错。/r/n

word.name: faultless
word.lx: The teacher told us the faultless argumentation after the test./r/n 考试后，老师告诉了我们正确的论证方法。/r/n These musicians gave an absolutely faultless performance./r/n 这些音乐家作了一场绝对完美的演出。/r/n

word.name: faulty
word.mean: a. 有错误的,有缺点的
word.lx: My judgement was frequently faulty, but my loyalty to the nation could not be questioned./r/n 我的判断经常出错，但是我对祖国的忠诚是无可置疑的。/r/n The new TV is faulty in design./r/n 新电视在设计上是有缺点的。/r/n

word.name: favor
word.mean:
n. 好意,喜爱
v. 支持,喜欢,证实
word.lx: He did all he could to win his favor./r/n 他尽其所能去赢得他的好感。/r/n Public opinion was moving strongly in favor of disarmament./r/n 公众舆论正在强烈支持裁军。/r/n

word.name: favorable
word.mean: a. 有利的,赞许的,良好的
word.lx: The conditions are favorable for opening a new business./r/n 各种条件有利于开办新企业。/r/n Most people were favorable to the idea./r/n 大多数人赞成这个主意。/r/n

word.name: favorably
word.mean: ad. 顺利地,亲切地,好意地
word.lx: His speech was favorably received./r/n 他的演讲很受欢迎。/r/n One who is favorably disposed toward Arab concerns and policies./r/n 阿拉伯（民族）主义者非常关注阿拉伯事务及政策的人/r/n

word.name: favorite
word.mean:
a. 最喜爱的
n. 最喜爱的人或物
word.lx: I like all the books on the shelf but this one is my favorite./r/n 我喜欢书架上所有的书，但这本是我最喜欢的。/r/n Who is your favorite writer?/r/n 谁是你最喜欢的作家？/r/n

word.name: favour
word.mean:
n. 帮助(促进,好感,证实,来信,礼物)
vt 促进
word.lx: Cheques should be written in favour of Oxfam./r/n 支票上请写明以牛津饥荒救济委员会为受款人。/r/n Of the two possible plans I favour the first./r/n 在这两种可行方案中我赞成前者./r/n

word.name: fax
word.mean:
n. 传真
v. 传真
word.lx: Reservations can be made by letter or fax./r/n 可以来信或传真预订。/r/n After you think it over, please let me know by fax./r/n 你仔细考虑过之后，请用传真相告。/r/n

word.name: fear
word.mean:
n. 恐怖,害怕,担心
v. 害怕,恐惧,敬畏
word.lx: She has a great fear of fire./r/n 她对火有恐惧感。/r/n Do not fear; I will support you./r/n 别担心，我会支持你的。/r/n

word.name: fearful
word.lx: They were fearful that the river would flood./r/n 他们担心河流会发洪水。/r/n A fearful person is a weak person./r/n 怕这怕那的人是软弱的人。/r/n

word.name: fearless
word.mean: a. 大胆的,勇敢的,无畏的
word.lx: Fearless and daring; courageous./r/n 勇敢的，无畏的；敢作敢为的/r/n The major impregnated the soldiers with his own fearless courage./r/n 少校把他自己那份无所畏惧的勇气灌输给了士兵们。/r/n

word.name: feasibility
word.lx: The department has produced a feasibility report on the development project./r/n 这个部已经拿出了一份开发项目的可行性报告。/r/n Experts were divided on the feasibility of the project./r/n 专家们对该计划的可行性意见不一。/r/n

word.name: feast
word.mean:
n. 宴会,酒席,节会
v. 款宴,享乐,请客
word.lx: He feasted his eye on the beautiful scene./r/n 他尽情欣赏这美丽的景色。/r/n The king held a feast for us./r/n 国王为我们举行了盛大的宴会。/r/n

word.name: feat
word.mean: n. 壮举,功绩,技艺表演
word.lx: Apparently impossible feats are now accomplished by science./r/n 许多看起来不可能的伟大业绩现在已经由科学实现了。/r/n I was amazed to see his dangerous feat./r/n 他的危险技艺让我感到惊讶。/r/n

word.name: feather
word.lx: My daughter asked me to buy her a pillow stuffed with feathers./r/n 我女儿请求我给她买一个羽绒枕头。/r/n Feather is very light, so that we sayas light as a feather"./r/n 羽毛很轻，因此我们说“轻如鸿毛”。/r/n"

word.name: feature
word.mean:
n. 特征,容貌
n. 特点,特色,特性
word.lx: Her mouth is her best feature./r/n 她的嘴是她容貌上最好看的部分。/r/n Wet weather is a feature of life in this area./r/n 天气潮湿是这个地区生活的一个特色。/r/n

word.name: February
word.lx: He left the city last February./r/n 他于去年二月离开这个城市。/r/n In February 1916 the French army made a stand at Verdun./r/n 1916年二月，法国军队在凡尔登奋力抵抗。/r/n

word.name: federal
word.mean:
a. 联邦的
n. 同盟盟友

word.name: feeble
word.lx: A feeble attempt is liable to fail./r/n 愚蠢的尝试多半是要失败的。/r/n He bleated out a feeble excuse./r/n 他以微弱的声音作无力的辩解./r/n

word.name: feed
word.mean:
n. 饲养,饲料,一餐
v. 喂,饲养,靠...为生
word.lx: How many feeds a day does this dog get?/r/n 这只狗每天吃几顿？/r/n Will you feed my cat for me?/r/n 请帮我喂我的猫好吗？/r/n

word.name: feeder
word.mean: n. 饲养者,供给者,奶瓶
word.lx: The little boy is a noisy feeder./r/n 这个小男孩吃东西时发出响声。/r/n

word.name: feel
word.lx: I like the feel of this cloth; it has a warm woolly feel./r/n 我喜欢这块布给我的感觉，它摸上去毛茸茸的很暖和。/r/n The dead cannot feel./r/n 死人没有知觉。/r/n

word.name: feeling
word.lx: I have a feeling that we are being followed./r/n 我有种感觉我们正被人跟踪。/r/n You have no feeling for the beauty of nature./r/n 你对大自然的美缺乏欣赏力。/r/n

word.name: fell
word.lx: The climber fell from a great height./r/n 攀登者从极高的地方坠落下来./r/n I managed to grab hold of the jug before it fell./r/n 我设法抓住了那个罐子才未跌落。/r/n

word.name: fellowship
word.mean: 研究员资格（身份），奖学金，交情
word.lx: They offered him the hand of fellowship when he was in difficulties./r/n 当他身处困境时，他们向他伸出了友谊之手。/r/n He was granted a fellowship./r/n 他被准许入会。/r/n

word.name: female
word.mean:
a. 雌的,女(性)的
n. 雌性的动物,女子
word.lx: All the female workers in this factory got a present on March 8./r/n 这家工厂的所有女职工在三八节都得到了一份礼物。/r/n The male voice is deeper than the female./r/n 男性的嗓音比女性的低沉。/r/n

word.name: feminine
word.lx: Jewelry and lace are mostly feminine belongings./r/n 珠宝和蕾丝大多是女性用品。/r/n There are three genders in German: masculine, feminine and neuter./r/n 德语中有三性: 阳性、 阴性和中性./r/n

word.name: fence
word.mean:
n. 围墙,剑术
v. 用篱笆围住,练习剑术,防护
[计算机] 栅栏
word.lx: Mary talked with me across the garden fence./r/n 玛丽和我隔着花园篱笆交谈。/r/n The tree was fenced around with wire./r/n 那棵树被铁丝网围了起来。/r/n

word.name: fermentation
word.lx: The fermentation of milk causes it to curdle./r/n 牛奶发酵会凝结起来。/r/n Sugar is converted into alcohol through the process of fermentation./r/n 糖经过发酵变成酒精。/r/n

word.name: ferocious
word.lx: A person regarded as ferocious or violent./r/n 被认为是残酷和凶猛的人/r/n The ferocious winds seemed about to tear the ship to pieces./r/n 猛烈的狂风仿佛要把船撕成碎片似的。/r/n

word.name: ferry
word.lx: We ferried the river on a small boat./r/n 我们用小船渡过那条河。/r/n He went down to the ferry but found the boat on the other side./r/n 他到了渡口，却发现渡船在对岸。/r/n

word.name: ferryboat
word.lx: A ferryboat get us across./r/n 一条渡船把我们送到对岸。/r/n The ferryboat in the harbor got op steam for the crossing to the island./r/n 泊在港内的渡轮增强了锅炉的汽压，准备驶向那个岛屿。/r/n

word.name: fertile
word.mean:
a. 肥沃的,能繁殖的
n. 多产,肥沃
word.lx: Fertile soil yields good crops./r/n 肥沃的土地能种出好庄稼。/r/n Producing abundantly; fertile./r/n 多产的，富饶的能大量生产的；肥沃的/r/n

word.name: fertility
word.lx: It will be a fertility of year for much raining./r/n 因为雨水多，今年会是丰产的一年。/r/n The fertility of the soil has been greatly improved by the use of pesticides./r/n 土壤施用杀虫剂後肥力大增./r/n

word.name: fertilizer
word.lx: Crushed bones make one of the best fertilizers./r/n 碎骨是最好的肥料之一。/r/n Get some more fertilizer for the garden./r/n 给花园再多施些肥料./r/n

word.name: fervent
word.mean: a. 热的,炎热的,热心的
word.lx: She had a fervent farewell speech./r/n 她发表了热情的告别演说。/r/n Filled with or motivated by zeal; fervent./r/n 热情的充满热情的或为热情所动的；热烈的/r/n

word.name: fester
word.mean: v. 溃烂,生脓,n. 脓疮,溃烂
word.lx: The resentment festered in his mind./r/n 他心中的愤恨有增无减。/r/n His wound became festering./r/n 他的伤口在溃烂。/r/n

word.name: festival
word.mean:
a. 节日的,喜庆的,快乐的
n. 节日,庆祝及祭祀,欢宴
word.lx: Christmas is a festival of the Chistian Church./r/n 圣诞节是基督教的节日。/r/n This city has a music festival every summer./r/n 本市每年举行一次夏季音乐节。/r/n

word.name: fetch
word.mean:
n. 取得
v. 接来,取来,带来
[计算机] 取
word.lx: This house should fetch a good price./r/n 这所房子应该卖个好价钱。/r/n Could you run and fetch a doctor for me?/r/n 你能跑去给我请一个医生吗？/r/n

word.name: fetter
word.mean:
v. 加脚镣,束缚
vt.&n. 脚镣,束缚
word.lx: He was fettered by his family and could not travel any longer./r/n 他被家庭束缚，不能再到处去旅游了。/r/n The prisoner was put into the jail with fetters./r/n 这个犯人被戴上脚镣投进了监狱。/r/n

word.name: feudal
word.lx: The way some landlords treat their tenants today still seems feudal./r/n 今天有些地主仍以近乎封建的方式对待佃户。/r/n The feudal barons were cruel to the people./r/n 封建贵族对人民很残酷。/r/n

word.name: feudalism
word.lx: Down with feudalism!/r/n 打倒封建主义！/r/n

word.name: fever
word.lx: Football fever gripped the town when the local team reached the cup final./r/n 在当地的足球队打进了优胜杯的决赛圈后，全市掀起一阵足球热。/r/n Her fever passed its crisis./r/n 她发烧已经过了危险期。/r/n

word.name: few
word.mean:
a. 很少的,不多的,少数的
int. 少数的
a. 少数的
word.lx: Few of us have his address./r/n 我们中几乎没有人知道他的地址。/r/n We saw few students there./r/n 我们在那儿几乎没看见学生。/r/n

word.name: fiber
word.lx: Scientists are recommending that people eat more fiber./r/n 科学家建议人们多吃些纤维素。/r/n I love my country with every fiber of my being./r/n 我深爱我的祖国。/r/n

word.name: fibre
word.mean: n. 纤维,纤维组织,织地
word.lx: He is a man of real fibre./r/n 他是一个有骨气的男子。/r/n I love my country with every fibre of my being./r/n 我深爱我的祖国。/r/n

word.name: fiction
word.lx: I like to read science fiction./r/n 我喜欢读科幻小说。/r/n His account of the crime was a complete fiction./r/n 他所讲述的那种罪刑完全是虚构的。/r/n

word.name: fictional
word.mean: a. 虚构的,编造的,小说式的
word.lx: He embellished his account with fictional details./r/n 他以种种虚构的细节来渲染他的叙述。/r/n

word.name: fidelity
word.lx: Fidelity to engagement is a virtue./r/n 信守诺言是一种美德。/r/n Good faith; fidelity./r/n 坚定信念；忠诚/r/n

word.name: field
word.mean:
a. 野外
n. 地,田地
word.lx: Many farmers are working in the fields./r/n 许多农民在田里干活。/r/n He has become famous in his own field./r/n 他在自己的领域里已经出名了。/r/n

word.name: fierce
word.mean: a. 猛烈的,残忍的,狂暴的,强烈的

word.name: fiery
word.mean: a. 炽热的,热烈的,暴躁的
word.lx: No one dare to offend the fiery person./r/n 没人敢惹这个脾气急躁的人。/r/n She gave vent to her indignation in a fiery speech./r/n 她在一篇激烈的演说中发泄怒气。/r/n

word.name: fifteen
word.mean:
num. 十五
pron.&a. 十五(个,只...)
word.lx: She is fifteen./r/n 她十五岁。/r/n After working for fifteen hours I began to tire./r/n 工作了十五个小时之后，我开始感到累了。/r/n

word.name: fifteenth
word.lx: Most students in this class are fifteen./r/n 这个班的大多数孩子都十五岁。/r/n He traces his family back to about the fifteenth century./r/n 他把他的家世追溯到十五世纪前後。/r/n

word.name: fifth
word.lx: He passed me one fifth of the cake./r/n 他递给我五分之一个蛋糕。/r/n The team has chalked up its fifth win in a row./r/n 这队一连五次取得胜利./r/n

word.name: fifty
word.lx: My mother is fifty years old./r/n 我母亲已经五十岁了。/r/n These people who were young fifty years back are now gray haired./r/n 50年前的年轻人，现在已经白发苍苍了。/r/n

word.name: fight
word.mean:
n. 打架,战斗,斗志
v. 对抗,打架
word.lx: He was always fighting with his neighbors about the noise./r/n 他常常为了噪音和邻居们争吵。/r/n The news of defeat took all the fight out of us./r/n 失败的消息夺走了我们所有的斗志。/r/n

word.name: fighting
word.lx: He interposed himself between them to stop them fighting./r/n 他挤进两人中间，阻止他们打架。/r/n The people there are fighting to gain their freedom from foreign control./r/n 那里的人民正在为摆脱外国统治争取自由而战斗。/r/n

word.name: figurative
word.mean: a. 比喻的,形容多的,修饰丰富的

word.name: figure
word.mean:
n. 图形,数字,形状
v. 演算,认为,领会到
word.lx: They figured it was better to stay where they were./r/n 他们断定还是呆在原地好。/r/n Mahatma Gandhi was both a political and a religious figure in Indian history./r/n 甘地在印度历史上是政治和宗教要人。/r/n

word.name: file
word.mean:
n. 档案,公文箱,锉刀
v. 列队行进,归档,申请
[计算机] 文件
word.lx: Put this letter in the main file./r/n 把这封信放在主要文件夹中。/r/n Please file those letters./r/n 请把这些信件存档。/r/n

word.name: filing
word.mean: n. 锉(文件的整理汇集)
word.lx: He filed away at the metal bar./r/n 他不停地锉着金属棒。/r/n She is the filing clerk of our company./r/n 她是我们公司的档案员。/r/n

word.name: fill
word.mean:
v. 装满,填充,弥漫
[计算机] 填充
word.lx: Laughter filled the room./r/n 房间里充满了笑声。/r/n Please fill the cup with water./r/n 请把这个杯子装满水，/r/n

word.name: film
word.mean:
n. 电影
v. 把...拍成电影
word.lx: He bought two rolls of film for the camera./r/n 他给照相机买了两卷胶卷。/r/n Joan ran ahead to film us as we crossed the bridge./r/n 我们过桥时，琼跑到前面为我们拍照。/r/n

word.name: filter
word.mean:
n. 筛选,滤波器,过滤器,滤色镜
v. 过滤,渗透,走漏
[计算机] 过滤
word.lx: The sunlight filtered through the curtains./r/n 阳光透过窗帘映了进来。/r/n The teacher gave each of us a piece of filter paper before doing the experiment./r/n 做试验前，老师给我们每个人发了一张滤纸。/r/n

word.name: final
word.mean:
a. 最后的
n. 决赛
word.lx: This is our final offer./r/n 这是我方的最后报价。/r/n The game is now in its final stages./r/n 这场比赛现在处于最后阶段。/r/n

word.name: finalize
word.lx: Let us finalize tonight./r/n 让我们今天晚上干完。/r/n

word.name: financial
word.lx: His financial affairs are in bad condition./r/n 他的经济状况很糟。/r/n The journalist was probing into several financial scandals./r/n 那记者正在调查几起财务丑闻。/r/n

word.name: financier
word.mean:
n. 财政家, 金融家
vi. 欺骗性地从事金融活动, 欺骗, 骗取
word.lx: Her father is a financier./r/n 她父亲是金融家。/r/n The financier told us not to do business in that way./r/n 金融家告诉我们不要再用那种方法做业务。/r/n

word.name: finder
word.lx: The money was returned intact by its finder./r/n 钱原封未动地被捡拾者送还。/r/n A trademark used for a sonic depth finder./r/n 回音测深仪一种声音测深仪的商标/r/n

word.name: finding
word.mean:
n. 发现,发现物,决定
vbl. 发现

word.name: fine
word.mean:
n. 罚款,罚金
a. 美好的,好的,晴朗的,健康的
v. 罚款
word.lx: He is a very fine musician./r/n 他是个卓越的音乐家。/r/n Have you handed in your fine?/r/n 你交了罚款了吗？/r/n

word.name: finger
word.lx: She fingered the rich silk./r/n 她抚摸着华丽的丝绒。/r/n The pen slips out of my fingers./r/n 钢笔从我指缝中滑下去了。/r/n

word.name: fingers
word.lx: He drummed on the table with his fingers./r/n 他用手指咚咚地敲打着桌子。/r/n She lay at the side of the pool and paddled in the water with her fingers./r/n 她躺在池子边上，用手指玩水。/r/n

word.name: finish
word.mean:
n. 完成,结束
v. 完成,结束,毁掉
[计算机] 终结
word.lx: That was a close finish!/r/n 比赛几乎分不出胜负！/r/n When do you finish your college course?/r/n 你什么时候完成大学课程？/r/n

word.name: finite
word.lx: A finite list of choices; our finite fossil fuel reserves./r/n 为数有限的选择；我们有限的矿物燃料贮量/r/n Going beyond the finite./r/n 无限的超过有限的/r/n

word.name: fire
word.mean:
n. 火,火灾,射击
v. 点燃,解职,开枪
word.lx: He was fired by his boss./r/n 他被他的老板解雇了。/r/n She fired her gun at them./r/n 她用枪向他们射击。/r/n

word.name: fireman
word.lx: Being a fireman sometimes may be dangerous./r/n 做个消防队员有时候会有危险。/r/n The fireman was suffocated by the fumes./r/n 那个消防队员让浓烟憋死了./r/n

word.name: fireplace
word.lx: She felt warm only when she sat before the fireplace./r/n 她只有坐在壁炉前才感觉到暖和。/r/n This fireplace smokes (badly)./r/n 这个壁炉烟冒得（太）厉害./r/n

word.name: firework
word.lx: Just you watch the fireworks when your father catches those boys!/r/n 等你父亲抓住那几个男孩子的时候，你就能看到他的火气有多大了。/r/n The firework exploded in his hand./r/n 那个爆竹在他手里响了。/r/n

word.name: firm
word.mean:
a. 坚定的,坚固的,结实的
ad. 稳固地,坚定地
n. 商行,公司
v. (使)变得坚实
word.lx: The pound stayed firm against dollar in London but fell a little in New York./r/n 在伦敦英镑对美元仍坚挺，但在纽约却跌了一点儿。/r/n The government must act to firm prices up./r/n 政府必须采取行动使物价稳定下来。/r/n

word.name: firmly
word.lx: The envelope was firmly sealed./r/n 这个信封封得很严实。/r/n The struts are firmly braced./r/n 那些支柱上得很牢固。/r/n

word.name: firmness
word.lx: His firmness on his belief supported him in difficulties./r/n 困境中，他坚定的信仰支撑着他。/r/n Firmness of character or action; determination./r/n 果断，决断性格或行动的坚定；坚决/r/n

word.name: first
word.mean:
ad. 首先,第一,优先
a. 第一的
word.lx: Read the text first and then explain the new words./r/n 先读课文，然后解释生词。/r/n He was the first to be there./r/n 他是第一个到达那里的。/r/n

word.name: fish
word.mean:
n. 鱼
v. 捕鱼,钓鱼
word.lx: We caught three little fishes./r/n 我们捉到三条小鱼。/r/n The beach is a good place to fish from./r/n 海滩是钓鱼的好地方。/r/n

word.name: fishery
word.lx: The ship is engaged in pelagic fishery./r/n 这艘船从事远洋渔业。/r/n

word.name: fishes
word.lx: We caught three little fishes./r/n 我们捉到三条小鱼。/r/n He studies in particular the fishes of the Indian Ocean./r/n 他专门研究印度洋的鱼类./r/n

word.name: fishing
word.lx: They would rather go fishing than stay at home./r/n 他们宁愿去钓鱼，也不愿待在家里。/r/n Who made the decision to go fishing?/r/n 是谁决定去钓鱼的？/r/n

word.name: fission
word.lx: A substance, such as water or graphite, that is used in a nuclear reactor to decrease the speed of fast neutrons and increase the likelihood of fission./r/n 慢化剂一种物质，如水或石墨在核反应堆中用来减缓中子运动速度和提高裂变可能性的物质/r/n

word.name: fist
word.mean:
n. 拳头
vt. 紧握,用拳头打
word.lx: He shook his fist at me./r/n 他对我挥舞着拳头。/r/n I clenched my fist and hit him./r/n 我攥紧拳头向他击去。/r/n

word.name: fitness
word.mean:
适合度（生物学术语）
n. 健康
word.lx: Her fitness for the job should not be questioned./r/n 她能胜任这项工作是无庸质疑的。/r/n In many sports physical fitness is not as important as technique./r/n 在许多体育运动中，体能没有技巧重要。/r/n

word.name: fitting
word.mean:
a. 适合的,恰当的
n. 试衣
word.lx: It was, in fine, a fitting end to the story./r/n 总之，这是故事很恰当的结尾。/r/n He expressed his thoughts in clear and fitting language./r/n 他用明白恰当的语言来表达他的思想。/r/n

word.name: fix
word.lx: I must get the radio fixed./r/n 我必须找人把收音机修理好。/r/n We are in a real fix - there is nobody to look after the baby./r/n 我们真的处于困境——没人照顾婴儿。/r/n

word.name: fixing
word.lx: My watch has stopped it needs fixing./r/n 我的表停了－－需要修理了。/r/n The act or process of fixing./r/n 固定固定的动作或程序/r/n

word.name: fixture
word.lx: The price includes all fixtures and fittings./r/n 这个价钱把全部固定装置和设备都打在里面了。/r/n The owner of the house charge us for fixture and fittings./r/n 房主要我们支付使用固定设施的费用。/r/n

word.name: flabby
word.mean: a. 软弱的,没气力的,不稳的

word.name: flag
word.mean:
n. 旗标,旗子,信号旗
[计算机] 标志
v.枯萎,减退
word.lx: After walking for four hours we were beginning to flag./r/n 步行了四个小时以后，我们开始累了。/r/n That plant with purple flowers is flag./r/n 那种开紫花的植物是菖蒲。/r/n

word.name: flagging
word.lx: My strength, interest, enthusiasm, etc is flagging./r/n 我的力气、 兴趣、 热情等正在减退./r/n Flag a parade route; flagging parts of a manuscript for later review./r/n 用旗标出游行路线；为以后再阅读标出手稿的某些部分/r/n

word.name: flame
word.mean:
n. 火焰,火舌,热情
v. 焚烧,面红,激动
word.lx: His anger flamed up./r/n 他勃然大怒。/r/n The candle flame flickered and went out./r/n 烛火摇曳着，随即熄灭了。/r/n

word.name: flames
word.lx: The flames devoured the entire building./r/n 火焰吞没了整栋大楼。/r/n When I saw the flames I acted on instinct and threw a blanket over them./r/n 我看见火焰时便凭直觉把一张毯子扑在火焰上./r/n

word.name: flank
word.mean:
n. 侧面,侧腹,腰窝肉
v. 攻击侧面,面临着,守侧面
word.lx: The road is flanked with trees and flowers./r/n 路的两旁有花草。/r/n The soldiers attacked the left flank of the enemy./r/n 战士们攻击敌人的左翼。/r/n

word.name: flannel
word.lx: The girl looked happy in her new flannel./r/n 女孩穿着新的法兰绒衣服，看上去很高兴。/r/n Stop flannelling and give a straight answer!/r/n 别再兜圈子了，直截了当地回答！/r/n

word.name: flap
word.mean:
n. 拍打,拍打声,副翼
v. 拍打,鼓翼而飞,飘动
word.lx: The curtains were flapping at the open window./r/n 窗帘在敞开的窗户前摆动。/r/n A flap from the tail of the whale upset the boat./r/n 鲸尾轻轻一拍便把小船打翻了。/r/n

word.name: flare
word.mean:
n. 闪光,闪耀,[天]耀斑
v. 闪光,闪耀
word.lx: The fire flared up as I put more logs onto it./r/n 我加了几块木材，火顿时亮了起来。/r/n Her nostrils flared angrily./r/n 她气得鼻孔都鼓了起来。/r/n

word.name: flash
word.mean:
n. 闪光,闪现,一瞬间
v. 闪光,闪现,闪烁
[计算机]Adobe公司的动画技术
word.lx: Flashes of lightning illuminated the scene./r/n 闪电的亮光照亮了现场。/r/n The days seem to flash by./r/n 光阴似箭。/r/n

word.name: flashing
word.mean: n. 决放,遮雨板,卫水板
word.lx: The flashing lights mean that the road is blocked./r/n 那闪动的灯光表示此路不通./r/n A lighthouse was flashing in the distance./r/n 灯塔在远处发出闪烁的光./r/n

word.name: flask
word.mean: n. 细颈瓶,烧瓶,小水瓶
word.lx: I want to drink a flask of wine./r/n 我想喝一瓶酒。/r/n The graduations are marked on the side of the flask./r/n 烧瓶侧面有刻度标志./r/n

word.name: flat
word.mean:
a. 平坦的,单调的,扁平的
ad. 平直地,干脆地
n.[英]公寓
word.lx: I got a flat on my way home./r/n 在我回家的路上，我的车胎跑气了。/r/n My request was met with a flat refusal./r/n 我的要求遭到了断然拒绝。/r/n

word.name: flatten
word.lx: He was totally flattened by her sarcasm./r/n 她说的挖苦话使他无地自容./r/n The land flattens out near the coast./r/n 海岸附近地势变得很平坦./r/n

word.name: flatter
word.mean: v. 过份夸赞,奉承,阿谀
word.lx: This photograph flatters you./r/n 这照片比你本人漂亮。/r/n He flattered her about her cooking./r/n 他恭维她的烹调手艺。/r/n

word.name: flaw
word.lx: Your argument has a fatal flaw./r/n 你的论点有一个致命的错误。/r/n The flaw in this vase makes it less valuable./r/n 这个花瓶因为有点缺陷，不那么值钱了。/r/n

word.name: flee
word.lx: He killed his enemy and fled the country./r/n 他杀了仇人，然后逃往国外。/r/n The frightened people fled from the fire./r/n 人们惊恐万状地逃离了火灾现场。/r/n

word.name: fleet
word.mean:
n. 船队,舰队
v. 飞过,掠过
word.lx: The general ordered the fleet to remain where they were and wait for the further instructions./r/n 将军命令舰队原地待命。/r/n The foremost position in an army or a fleet advancing into battle./r/n 前卫，尖兵进入战斗的部队或船队的最前面的位置/r/n

word.name: fleeting
word.mean: a. 飞逝的(疾驰的,短暂的,急走的)

word.name: fleshy
word.lx: The fleshy underside of the end of a finger or toe./r/n 肉垫手指或脚趾末端多肉的下侧/r/n The fleshy, muscular back part of the human leg between the knee and ankle./r/n 腓，小腿肚人腿部位于膝关节和踝关节之间的多肉的、腿后部的肌肉部分/r/n

word.name: flex
word.mean:
v. 弯曲,伸缩,褶曲
n. 电线,松紧带
word.lx: Capable of being bent or flexed; pliable./r/n 柔软的可弯曲或扭曲的；柔韧的/r/n The gardeners flexed their muscles and began to dig./r/n 园丁们舒腰展臂后才开始挖地。/r/n

word.name: flexibility
word.lx: Flexibility, as in the shaft of a golf club./r/n 弹性，韧性柔韧性，易变性，如高尔夫球棒的柄/r/n

word.name: flexible
word.mean: a. 灵活的,易弯曲的,柔韧的
word.lx: This tube is flexible but tough./r/n 这管子柔软但很坚固。/r/n We need a foreign policy that is more flexible./r/n 我们需要一个更为灵活的外交政策。/r/n

word.name: flicker
word.mean:
n. 闪烁,闪光,颤动
v. 闪动,闪烁,摇动
word.lx: A slender smile still flickered across her face./r/n 她脸上闪过一丝微笑。/r/n All the lights flickered for a moment./r/n 所有的灯都闪了一会儿。/r/n

word.name: flight
word.mean: n. 飞行,飞机的航程,航班,逃跑
word.lx: She photographed the birds in flight./r/n 她拍摄鸟儿飞行的照片。/r/n The old woman fell down a flight of stairs./r/n 那位老太太从一段楼梯上摔了下来。/r/n

word.name: fling
word.mean:
n. 投掷,急冲,嘲弄
v. 投,猛冲,嘲笑
word.lx: He flung himself into his work with renewed vigor./r/n 他又精神抖擞地投入自己的工作。/r/n She flung down her large handbag on the table./r/n 她把那只大手提包扔在桌子上。/r/n

word.name: flip
word.mean:
vt. 掷, 弹, 轻击
a. 无礼的, 冒失的, 轻率的
word.lx: I had a quick flip through the book and it looked very interesting./r/n 我很快翻阅了一下那本书，看来似乎很有趣。/r/n A flip answer to a serious question./r/n 对严肃问题的轻率回答/r/n

word.name: float
word.mean:
n. 漂流物,浮舟,浮萍
v. 浮动,飘,散播
word.lx: Pay attention to your float!/r/n 注意你的浮子！/r/n The logs floated down the river./r/n 木头在河上放流。/r/n

word.name: floating
word.lx: We can see the dust particles floating in the sunlight clearly./r/n 我们可以很清楚地看到阳光下的灰尘颗粒。/r/n Have you seen my keys floating about (anywhere)?/r/n 你在什麽地方见到我的钥匙了吗?/r/n

word.name: flock
word.mean:
n. 群
v. 成群而行,聚集
word.lx: There are many flocks of tourists in the palace./r/n 宫殿里有好几群游客。/r/n People are flocking to the cinema to see the new film./r/n 人们正蜂拥到电影院去看这部新电影。/r/n

word.name: flood
word.mean:
n. 洪水,水灾
v. 淹没,溢出
vi. 大量涌到,泛滥
vt. 灌溉,淹没
word.lx: Every spring the river floods the valley./r/n 每年春天河水把山谷淹没。/r/n Settlers flooded from Europe to America in the 19th century./r/n 十九世纪欧洲移民纷纷涌到了美国。/r/n

word.name: flooding
word.lx: The conjunction of heavy rains and high winds caused flooding./r/n 暴风雨的同时发生引起了洪水泛滥。/r/n Memories of his childhood came flooding back./r/n 他童年的往事涌上心头./r/n

word.name: floor
word.mean:
n. 地板,楼层,底部
v. 铺地板,击倒
word.lx: Our office is on the first floor./r/n 我们的办公室在一楼。/r/n We planned to floor our room with oak./r/n 我们计划用橡木材料给房间铺地板。/r/n

word.name: floppy
word.mean: a. 叭塌叭塌响的,懒散的,邋遢的

word.name: flourish
word.lx: She rushed in flourishing a document./r/n 她急匆匆地走了进来，手里挥舞着一份文件。/r/n The doctor showed us about his hospital with much flourish./r/n 这位医生颇为炫耀地带着我们参观了他的医院。/r/n

word.name: flow
word.mean:
n. 流,水流,流量
v. 流动
vi. 流,流动
vt. 淹没
word.lx: This river flowed southwest to the Atlantic Ocean./r/n 这条河流向西南，汇入大西洋。/r/n The flow of melted snow cascaded down the mountainside and into the river./r/n 溶化的雪水如瀑布般沿着山崖边泻入河里。/r/n

word.name: flower
word.lx: The garden will look very beautiful when all the plants are in flower./r/n 等所有的植物都开花时，花园会显得非常漂亮。/r/n Cherry trees flower in the early spring./r/n 樱桃树在早春开花。/r/n

word.name: fluctuate
word.mean:
vi. 变动,上下,动摇
vt. 使动摇

word.name: fluctuation
word.lx: There are fluctuations in the state of his health./r/n 他的健康状况时好时坏。/r/n The decision was affected by his fluctuation of mood./r/n 这个决定受他情绪的影响。/r/n

word.name: fluent
word.lx: He speaks fluent German./r/n 他操一口流利的德语。/r/n Her fluent movements surprised us./r/n 她那协调优美的动作让我们惊奇。/r/n

word.name: fluff
word.lx: Clinging bits of fiber and fluff; fuzz./r/n 棉绒，软棉布聚在一起的纤维和绒毛；细毛/r/n Courtship will include display in which the male fluff up his feather./r/n 鸟儿求偶的表现包括雄鸟抖松羽毛的炫耀行为。/r/n

word.name: fluffy
word.lx: Having a fluffy or woolly appearance./r/n 絮状的有绒毛状或羊毛状外表的/r/n A long fluffy scarf made of soft material, such as fur or feathers./r/n 长围巾用如毛皮或羽毛等柔软材料制成的长而蓬松的围巾/r/n

word.name: fluid
word.mean:
a. 流体的,流动的
n. 流体,液体
word.lx: Air whether in the gaseous or liquid state is a fluid./r/n 空气，无论是气态的还是液态的，都是一种流体。/r/n The rate of flow of fluid, particles, or energy through a given surface./r/n 流动率流体、微粒或能量通过一设定的表面时流动的速率/r/n

word.name: fluorescent
word.mean:
n. 日光灯
a. 萤光的
word.lx: He shielded his eyes from, the glare of the overhead fluorescent lights/r/n 他遮住头顶上方荧光灯曲目的光以保护眼睹。/r/n

word.name: flush
word.mean:
n. 流溢,面红,旺盛
a. 丰足的,齐平的,满盈的
v. 脸发红,淹没,旺盛
[计算机] 冲洗
word.lx: She shows a flush of joy at his coming./r/n 对他的到来她表现出一阵兴奋。/r/n Mary flushed crimson with embarrassment./r/n 玛丽羞得脸红了。/r/n

word.name: flute
word.mean:
n. 长笛
v. 吹笛
word.lx: Can you play the flute?/r/n 你会吹长笛吗？/r/n The child occupied himself in playing his flute./r/n 那孩子只顾著吹笛子./r/n

word.name: flutter
word.mean:
n. 摆动,鼓翼,烦扰
v. 摆动,鼓翼,烦扰
word.lx: Banners fluttered in the breeze./r/n 旗帜在微风中飘扬。/r/n She fluttered her handkerchief from the train window as a good-bye./r/n 她从火车窗口里伸出手挥动手帕道别。/r/n

word.name: flux
word.mean:
n. 流出,涨潮,变迁
v. 熔化,使泻,涨

word.name: FM
word.mean: n. 磁极(现场干线,现场更改,消防干管,外国使团)

word.name: focus
word.mean:
n. 焦点,焦距
v. 集中,聚集,使集中
word.lx: He always wants to be the focus of attention./r/n 他总想成为注意力的焦点。/r/n You should focus your attention on your work./r/n 你应该把注意力放到工作上。/r/n

word.name: fodder
word.lx: These documents are useless - they are only wastebasket fodder./r/n 这些文件毫无用处，只配扔进废纸篓里。/r/n Timothy can be used as fodder for cattle./r/n 猫尾草可以作为喂牛的牧草。/r/n

word.name: foe
word.lx: The knight was murdered by his foes./r/n 那位骑士被他的敌人谋杀了。/r/n Who goes there friend or foe?/r/n 谁在那里--是自己人还是敌人?/r/n

word.name: fog
word.mean:
n. 雾
v. 以雾笼罩,被雾笼罩
vt. 以雾笼罩
word.lx: I was really in a fog after the exam./r/n 考完试后，我真的感到稀里糊涂。/r/n London used to have bad fogs in winter./r/n 伦敦过去在冬季常有浓雾。/r/n

word.name: foil
word.mean:
n. 箔,烘托,衬托
v. 衬托,阻止,挡开
word.lx: This box of chocolate was wrapped round with foil./r/n 这盒巧克力用箔纸包着。/r/n Wrapping aluminium foil round a joint allows the meat to cook in its own juice/juices./r/n 用铝箔把肉包住使之在原汁中烹制./r/n

word.name: fold
word.mean:
n. 折层,羊栏,折痕
v. 折叠,包,交叉
word.lx: The paper should be folded in half./r/n 这张纸应该对折。/r/n I folded the handkerchief and put it in my pocket./r/n 我折好手绢，放进口袋里。/r/n

word.name: folder
word.lx: A container, such as a cabinet or folder, for keeping papers in order./r/n 文件夹按顺序放置文件的容器，如档案柜或文件夹/r/n God, we look like sheep- we are all carrying the same folder./r/n 天啊！我们都带着同样的文件夹，看起来一模一样。/r/n

word.name: foliage
word.lx: We carried armfuls of foliage to the bonfire./r/n 我们给篝火堆挟来几抱枝叶。/r/n He crouched down among the tangled foliage./r/n 他蹲下把身子藏在紊乱的叶丛中。/r/n

word.name: folio
word.mean: 编页码,对开本,页码,张数
word.lx: There was a folio missing in the book./r/n 这本书中少了一页。/r/n We have several early folios for sale./r/n 我们有几本早期的对开本书出售。/r/n

word.name: follows
word.lx: A fan, especially a young woman, who follows a rock group around on tours./r/n 流行乐团迷跟随摇滚乐队巡回演出的迷恋者，尤指年轻女性/r/n Pain is forgotten where gain follows./r/n 【谚】一朝得了利，痛苦便忘记。/r/n

word.name: fond
word.lx: My little son is fond of playing practical jokes on me./r/n 我的小儿子喜欢对我玩恶作剧。/r/n Volleyball is a sport of which I am very fond./r/n 排球是我很喜欢的运动。/r/n

word.name: foodstuff
word.lx: Rice is our essential foodstuff in life./r/n 大米是我们生活的基本食物。/r/n Nowadays, the foodstuffs in our life are more various./r/n 如今，我们生活中的食品越来越五花八门了。/r/n

word.name: fool
word.mean:
n. 愚人,受骗者
v. 愚弄,欺骗
word.lx: That silly child never does anything; he just fools about all day long./r/n 那个傻孩子从来不做事，只是整天游手好闲。/r/n What a fool I was to believe he is a good man./r/n 我竟然相信他是个好人，我真是个傻瓜。/r/n

word.name: foot
word.lx: He got to his feet when he saw her father came in./r/n 他看到她父亲走进来就站了起来。/r/n He sat on the foot of the bed./r/n 他坐在床脚处。/r/n

word.name: football
word.lx: I like watching football match on TV./r/n 我喜欢在电视上看足球比赛。/r/n Which football team is the leader in the football championship?/r/n 现在哪个队在足球锦标赛中领先？/r/n

word.name: footing
word.lx: The workers want to be on an equal footing with the managers./r/n 工人要求与经理地位平等。/r/n This enterprise is now on a firm footing and should soon get profits./r/n 现在这家企业基础稳固，很快就会赢利。/r/n

word.name: footnote
word.lx: In printing, a term used in footnote meaninghere and there"./r/n 在印刷技术中，一种在脚注中使用的意为“到处”的术语。/r/n

word.name: footstep
word.lx: There are many footsteps in the snow./r/n 雪地上有许多脚印。/r/n I heard his footsteps in the hall./r/n 我听见大厅里有他的脚步声。/r/n

word.name: footsteps
word.lx: The dog cocked its ears at the sound of footsteps./r/n 狗听到脚步声竖起了耳朵。/r/n The thief froze when he heard the footsteps approaching./r/n 小偷听到走近的脚步声，吓得呆住了。/r/n

word.name: for
word.mean:
conj. 因为
prep. 给,为
word.lx: He shook his head, for he thought differently./r/n 他摇摇头，因为他的想法与此不同。/r/n What can I do for you?/r/n 我能帮你什么忙吗?/r/n

word.name: forbid
word.lx: I forbid you to tell anyone./r/n 我不许你告诉任何人。/r/n Lack of time forbids any further discussion at the point./r/n 由于时间不够，现在不能深入讨论这个问题。/r/n

word.name: force
word.mean:
n. 力量,武力,影响力
v. 强迫,强夺,加压力
[计算机] 强制
word.lx: The force of the explosion broke all the windows in the building./r/n 爆炸的力量震碎了这座建筑上的所有窗户。/r/n The rider forced his horse on through the storm./r/n 骑士迫使他的马在暴风雨中前进。/r/n

word.name: forced
word.mean:
a. 被迫的,强迫的,用力的
v. 强迫
vbl. 强迫
word.lx: The boss forced this difficult task upon him./r/n 老板强迫他做此难事。/r/n Upon reaching an appropriate age, children are encouraged, but not forced, to leave the nest"./r/n 一达到适当的年龄，孩子们就被鼓励，而不是被强迫，"离开老窝"。/r/n"

word.name: fore
word.mean:
a. 在前的,以前的
ad. 在前面,在船头
prep. 在前
word.lx: He sat in the fore part of the train./r/n 他坐在火车的前部。/r/n The captain ordered two flags to be placed fore and aft./r/n 船长吩咐在船头和船尾各挂一面旗子。/r/n

word.name: forearm
word.lx: The joint between the hand and the forearm./r/n 腕，腕关节手和前臂之间的关节/r/n The joint or bend of the arm between the forearm and the upper arm./r/n 肘关节上臂与前臂之间的关节或胳膊弯曲处/r/n

word.name: forecast
word.lx: According to the weather forecast it will rain tomorrow./r/n 天气预报说明天有雨。/r/n They tried to forecast the result of the football match./r/n 他们试图预测这场足球比赛的结果。/r/n

word.name: forefinger
word.lx: Our foreman, Mr. Li Ming, met an accident on July6. He crushed his forefinger when operating a machine./r/n 我厂领班李明先生在7月6日遇到意外，李先生开动机器时食指被压。/r/n

word.name: foregoing
word.mean: a. 前面的,先前的,前述的
word.lx: Coming before in place or order; foregoing./r/n 在前的，处在前面的在地点或计划之前的；在前的/r/n Refer to the foregoing figures./r/n 涉及到前面所讲的数字/r/n

word.name: foreground
word.mean:
n. 前景,最显著的位置
n.[计算机]前台
[计算机] 前景
word.lx: The figures of the horses in the foreground are out of proportion./r/n 前景中的马画得不成比例./r/n Try to draw the figures in the foreground in proportion./r/n 要把前景中的人物画得合比例./r/n

word.name: forehead
word.lx: The car bumped and his forehead hit the glass./r/n 汽车颠簸了一下，他的前额撞到了玻璃上。/r/n His forehead was ridged with anxiety./r/n 他的前额因焦虑而布满了皱纹。/r/n

word.name: foreigner
word.lx: He never met a foreigner who spoke such perfect Chinese./r/n 他从未见过中国话讲得这样纯正的外国人。/r/n His broken English showed he was a foreigner./r/n 他的蹩脚的英语说明他是一个外国人。/r/n

word.name: foreman
word.lx: The foreman is supervising their work./r/n 领班正在检查他们的工作。/r/n He was deemed as guilty by the foreman./r/n 陪审长认为他有罪。/r/n

word.name: forerunner
word.lx: Anglo-Saxon is the forerunner of modern English./r/n 盎格鲁撒克逊语是现代英语的先驱。/r/n One that indicates or foreshadows what is to come; a forerunner./r/n 预言者指明或预示即将发生的事的人；先驱/r/n

word.name: foresee
word.lx: He foresaw that his journey would be delayed by bad weather./r/n 他预知自己的旅程会被恶劣天气耽搁。/r/n Do you foresee any problems with the new system?/r/n 对于这种新体制，你看会有什么问题吗？/r/n

word.name: forest
word.lx: He lost his way in the forest./r/n 他在森林中迷路了。/r/n The combustion in the forest generated great damage./r/n 森林火灾造成了巨大的损失。/r/n

word.name: forestry
word.lx: Very little forestry is left unexplored nowadays./r/n 如今未经勘测的森林是少之又少了。/r/n The covering of forestry in our town is 60 percent./r/n 我们镇的森林覆盖率是百分之六十。/r/n

word.name: foretell
word.lx: The Messiah, as foretold by the prophets of the Old Testament./r/n 救世主《旧约》中的先知们预言的救世主/r/n She claims to be psychic and to be able to foretell the future./r/n 她自称有特异功能, 能预知未来./r/n

word.name: forfeit
word.mean:
n. 没收物,罚金,丧失
v. 没收,丧失
word.lx: He who murders pays the forfeit of his life./r/n 杀人者偿命。/r/n If man put his country in danger by helping the enemy, his life and possessions were forfeit to the crown./r/n 任何人如帮助敌人危害本国，他的生命财产便被国家没收。/r/n

word.name: forgery
word.mean: n. 伪造,伪造罪,伪造物
word.lx: He was sent to prison for forgery./r/n 他因犯伪造罪被关进监狱。/r/n He confessed the letter a forgery./r/n 他承认那封信是伪造的。/r/n

word.name: forgetfulness
word.lx: You should forgive him for his forgetfulness; after all, he is over seventy./r/n 你应该原谅他的健忘症，毕竟他已经七十多岁了。/r/n I am really angry about your forgetfulness./r/n 你这么健忘，我的确很生气。/r/n

word.name: forgive
word.lx: I forgave him his crimes./r/n 我饶恕了他的罪行。/r/n He is not a man who forgives easily./r/n 他不是一个肯轻易宽恕人的人。/r/n

word.name: fork
word.mean:
n. 叉
v. 叉起,耙,成叉状
word.lx: He picked up his knife and fork./r/n 他捡起了刀叉。/r/n We came to a fork in the road and could not decide which fork we should take./r/n 我们来到了岔路口，不能决定走哪一条岔路。/r/n

word.name: form
word.mean:
n. 形式,形状,表格
v. 形成,组成,建立
word.lx: A plan began to form in his head./r/n 一项计划在他脑子中形成。/r/n He determined to form a club./r/n 他决心成立一个俱乐部。/r/n

word.name: formality
word.lx: You should go through the legal formality./r/n 你应该办理合法手续。/r/n I found the formality of the occasion irritating./r/n 我觉得这种场合的繁文缛节十分讨厌。/r/n

word.name: format
word.mean:
n. 设计,版式
n.[计算机]格式,DOS命令 : 格式化(磁盘),用于空盘或使用过的磁盘建立新空盘来存储数据
v. vt.使格式化,设计,安排
word.lx: The book has been styled in a modern format./r/n 该书已按照现代版式制作。/r/n It also incorporate new optimization specific to particular server and local database format./r/n 它也把新的优化细节合并到特殊服务器与本地数据库格式中。/r/n

word.name: former
word.mean:
a. 以前的,在前的
pron.&n. 前者
word.lx: Mr. Heath is the former Prime Minister of Britain./r/n 希思先生是英国前任首相。/r/n It was more in sorrow than in anger that he criticized his former colleague./r/n 他批评以前的同事, 并非出於气愤而是为他惋惜./r/n

word.name: formerly
word.lx: Smocks were formerly worn by farm-workers./r/n 这种罩衫是旧时农民穿的./r/n Ether was used formerly to put a patient to sleep before an operation./r/n 从前人们在手术前用乙醚来使病人昏睡。/r/n

word.name: formidable
word.mean: a. 强大的,可怕的,艰难的
word.lx: They climbed up the last part of the mountain in formidable weather conditions./r/n 他们在恶劣的天气条件下登上了山的顶峰。/r/n His mother is a most formidable lady./r/n 他的母亲是个最令人生畏的妇人。/r/n

word.name: formulate
word.mean: v. 用公式表示,明确的叙述
word.lx: The contract was formulated in difficult legal language./r/n 该合同是用深奥的法律术语订立的。/r/n He formulated his thought clearly./r/n 他清楚确切地表达了自己的思想。/r/n

word.name: formulation
word.mean: n. 形成,简洁陈述,公式化

word.name: forsake
word.lx: He has forsaken the bad habit of smoking./r/n 他已改掉了吸烟的坏习惯。/r/n A homeless person, especially a forsaken or orphaned child./r/n 无家可归者一个无家可归的人，尤指一个被遗弃或无父母的孤儿/r/n

word.name: fort
word.lx: There are eight forts in this section of the Great Wall./r/n 这一段长城有八个垛口。/r/n The men in the fort capitulated./r/n 堡垒中的守军投降了。/r/n

word.name: forth
word.mean:
a. 向前的
ad. 向前,向外
word.lx: He went forth into the desert to pray./r/n 他向前走到沙漠中祈祷。/r/n The Forth of July is the National Independence Day of the USA./r/n 七月四日是美国国庆日。/r/n

word.name: forthcoming
word.lx: The forthcoming elections./r/n 即将到来的选举/r/n The forthcoming talks hold out the hope of real arms reductions./r/n 即将举行的会谈给实现真正的裁军带来了希望。/r/n

word.name: fortify
word.lx: Good eating habits help to fortify the body against disease./r/n 好的饮食习惯有助于强身防病。/r/n The medieval town is fortified with a high wall and a deep moat./r/n 这座中世纪的城市用高墙深沟来加强防御。/r/n

word.name: fortitude
word.mean: n. 刚毅,坚毅,不屈不挠
word.lx: He bore the pain with great fortitude./r/n 他以极大的毅力忍受了痛苦。/r/n She was successful for her fortitude character./r/n 因为坚韧不拔的性格她成功了。/r/n

word.name: fortnight
word.lx: I see them about once a fortnight./r/n 我大约两星期见他们一次。/r/n His birthday is Monday fortnight./r/n 他的生日是两星期后的星期一。/r/n

word.name: fortress
word.lx: There are many fortresses in this area./r/n 这片地区有许多堡垒。/r/n The soldier scaled the wall of the fortress by turret./r/n 士兵通过塔车攀登上了要塞的城墙。/r/n

word.name: fortuitous
word.lx: Occurring by chance; fortuitous./r/n 侥幸的碰巧发生的，幸运的/r/n In a other word, verbbe" is the most fortuitous verb of change./r/n 换句话说，动词“be”是个变化最不规则的动词。/r/n"

word.name: fortunate
word.lx: You are fortunate to have such a reasonable father./r/n 你有这样一位通情达理的父亲，真是幸运。/r/n We must help others less fortunate than ourselves./r/n 我们要帮助那些不那麽幸运的人./r/n

word.name: fortunately
word.lx: Fortunately the pilot bailed out before the plane crashed./r/n 飞机坠毁之前，驾驶员幸运地跳伞了。/r/n All we need say is that fortunately we did not listen to him./r/n 我们需要说的只是幸亏我们没有听他的话。/r/n

word.name: fortune
word.lx: These two brothers decided to go to America to try their fortunes./r/n 这兄弟俩决定去美国碰碰运气。/r/n He dreamed of making a fortune./r/n 他梦想发大财。/r/n

word.name: forty
word.mean:
num.&a. 四十
pron. 四十(个,只...)
word.lx: His hair became gray when he was only forty./r/n 他刚刚四十岁时，头发就变得灰白了。/r/n The atlas contains forty maps./r/n 这个地图集有四十幅地图。/r/n

word.name: forward
word.mean:
a. 向前的,早的,迅速的,前锋
v. 转交,促进,运送
ad. 向前地
word.lx: He is forward in his English./r/n 他的英语有进步。/r/n Please forward my mail to my new address./r/n 请把我的信件转到我的新地址。/r/n

word.name: forwards
word.lx: Having all toes pointing forwards. Used of certain birds./r/n 四趾向前的足趾向前方长的。用于某些鸟类/r/n I engaged the clutch and the car moved forwards./r/n 我踩下离合器，汽车便朝前开了。/r/n

word.name: fossil
word.mean:
a. 化石的
n. 化石
word.lx: He found a piece of fossil of an ancient bird./r/n 他发现一块古代鸟类的化石。/r/n Coal is a fossil fuel./r/n 煤是一种矿物燃料。/r/n

word.name: foul
word.mean:
a. 污秽的,邪恶的
v. 弄脏,妨害,污蔑
word.lx: She has a foul temper./r/n 她脾气暴躁。/r/n The ball was foul./r/n 这球犯规了。/r/n

word.name: found
word.mean:
v. 建立,创立, 创办
vbl. (find的过去分词)找到
word.lx: This business company was founded in 1724./r/n 这家商业公司建立于1724年。/r/n We found the lineaments of the situation./r/n 我们找到了情况的关键因素。/r/n

word.name: foundation
word.lx: He laid the foundation of his success by study and hard work./r/n 他通过学习和努力工作为成功打下了基础。/r/n The foundation on which many ancient societies were built was the use of slaves./r/n 许多古代社会都是建立在使役奴隶的基础上的。/r/n

word.name: founder
word.mean:
n. 创立者,建立者
v. 弄摔倒,弄跛,浸水
word.lx: He is the founder of the party./r/n 他是该党的创建者。/r/n Who is the founder of the scientific socialism?/r/n 谁是科学社会主义的奠基人？/r/n

word.name: fountain
word.lx: The parks of this city are famous for their ornate fountains./r/n 这个城市的公园以其华丽的喷泉而著名。/r/n She dabbled her hands in the fountain./r/n 她把手伸到喷泉中玩水。/r/n

word.name: four
word.mean:
num. 四
pron.&a. 四(个,只...)
word.lx: Six minus two equals four./r/n 六减去二等于四。/r/n Our cat has a litter of four kittens./r/n 我们家的猫一窝养了4只小猫。/r/n

word.name: fourscore
word.mean:
a. 八十的,八十个的
n. 八十,八十个,八十岁

word.name: fourteen
word.lx: His daughter is fourteen years old./r/n 他的女儿十四岁了。/r/n The cultivator worked fourteen hours a day, laying by the corn./r/n 中耕机每天工作14小时，给玉米作最后一次中耕。/r/n

word.name: fourth
word.mean:
n. 四分之一
num. 第四
word.lx: After her fourth child she decided to have herself sterilized./r/n 她生了第四个孩子后决定做绝育手术。/r/n One fourth of a ton;500 pounds. Used as a measure of grain./r/n 五百磅四分之一吨；五百磅。用作谷物计量单位/r/n

word.name: fowl
word.lx: There are many kinds of fowl./r/n 家禽的种类很多。/r/n A mixture of ground grain and nutrients fed to livestock and fowl./r/n 麦麸由谷糠和营养物质调成的混合物，用以饲养牲畜和家禽/r/n

word.name: fraction
word.lx: One forth is a proper fraction./r/n 四分之一是一个真分数。/r/n The door opened a fraction./r/n 门稍微开了条缝。/r/n

word.name: fractional
word.mean: a. 微少的,断片的,分数的
word.lx: Speech is fractional; silence is integral./r/n 讲话是分数；沉默是整数。/r/n

word.name: fracture
word.mean:
n. 破碎,骨折
v. 破碎,破裂
word.lx: Her leg fractured in two places./r/n 她的腿有两处骨折。/r/n Fracture of the leg can be very serious in old people./r/n 老年人腿骨骨折有可能成为严重疾患。/r/n

word.name: fragment
word.mean:
n. 碎片,破片,断片
[计算机] 碎片
word.lx: The interruption fragmented his argument./r/n 他的辩论因被打断而显得不完整。/r/n She dropped the vase on the floor and it broke into fragments./r/n 她把花瓶掉在地上，摔成了碎片。/r/n

word.name: fragrance
word.lx: I can smell the fragrance of flowers after showers./r/n 我可以闻到雨后鲜花的清香。/r/n The rose sends out strong fragrance./r/n 玫瑰散发出浓郁的香味。/r/n

word.name: fragrant
word.mean: a. 芬香的,馥郁的,愉快的
word.lx: The air in the garden was warm and fragrant./r/n 花园里的空气一片温馨。/r/n The flowers gave off a fragrant odor./r/n 花发出一阵幽香。/r/n

word.name: frame
word.mean:
n. 框,结构,骨架
v. 构成,设计,陷害
word.lx: The government is framing a new bill to control gambling./r/n 政府在制定新的法案以控制赌博。/r/n This athlete has a powerful frame./r/n 这位运动员有着魁梧的体格。/r/n

word.name: framing
word.lx: The government is framing a new bill to control gambling./r/n 政府在制定新的法案以控制赌博。/r/n In a silver frame on the table there is a photograph of her husband./r/n 在桌上的银相框里有张她丈夫的照片。/r/n

word.name: franchise
word.mean:
n. 特权, 公民权
v. 赋予特权, 赋予公民权
word.lx: He runs his sandwich chain as a franchise operation./r/n 作为一种给予特许专营权业务，他经营三明治连锁店。/r/n That fast food business have expanded through the sale of franchise./r/n 该快餐店通过出售联营经销权而扩大了生意。/r/n

word.name: franchiser
word.mean: n. 给别人经营联营特许权的公司或制造厂

word.name: frank
word.lx: To be very frank, I think you have very little chance of getting the job./r/n 坦白地说，我认为你获得这项工作的机会微乎其微。/r/n He is an extremely frank person./r/n 他是个极其老实的人。/r/n

word.name: fraught
word.lx: The expedition through the jungle was fraught with difficulties and danger./r/n 穿越森林的探险充满了艰辛和危险。/r/n The expedition into the jungle was fraught with danger./r/n 到原始森林去探险充满了危险。/r/n

word.name: freely
word.mean: ad. 自由地(免费地,直率地,大量地)
word.lx: These goods are freely available./r/n 这些商品大量供应。/r/n Let us discuss such things as we can talk it freely./r/n 让我们讨论一些咱们可以自由谈论的事吧。/r/n

word.name: freeze
word.mean:
v. 冻结,冷动,僵硬
[计算机] 冻结
word.lx: Water freezes at the temperature of 0 degrees Celsius./r/n 水在摄氏零度结冰。/r/n The thief froze when he heard the footsteps approaching./r/n 小偷听到走近的脚步声，吓得呆住了。/r/n

word.name: freight
word.mean:
n. 船货,运费,货运
v. 装货,运送
word.lx: This freight must be carefully handled./r/n 这些货物必须小心搬运。/r/n They freighted the boat with bananas./r/n 他们把香蕉装上船。/r/n

word.name: French
word.mean:
a. 法国(人)的,法语的
n. 法语
word.lx: This student is good at French./r/n 这个学生法语好。/r/n Do you like French films?/r/n 你喜欢法国影片吗？/r/n

word.name: Frenchman
word.lx: It is said that Frenchmen are among the most romantic people in the world./r/n 据说法国人是世界上最浪漫的民族之一。/r/n It is said that the Frenchman may be the best gardener in the world./r/n 据说法国人是世界上最好的园丁。/r/n

word.name: frequency
word.lx: Accidents on that highway are happening with increasing frequency./r/n 那条高速公路上车祸发生得越来越频繁。/r/n He varied the transmission frequency./r/n 他变换了无线电传送的频率。/r/n

word.name: frequent
word.mean:
a. 经常的,频繁的
vt. 常到,常去
word.lx: He is a frequent visitor to our house./r/n 他是我们家的常客。/r/n These woods are frequented by all kinds of birds./r/n 这些树林里经常栖息着各种鸟类。/r/n

word.name: frequently
word.lx: He comes to visit me frequently./r/n 他经常来看我。/r/n Many times; frequently./r/n 经常地多次地；频繁地/r/n

word.name: fresh
word.mean: a. 新鲜的,无经验的,淡(水)的
word.lx: Open the window and let in some fresh air./r/n 打开窗户，让新鲜的空气进来。/r/n You can buy fresh vegetables in the market./r/n 你可以在市场上买到新鲜的蔬菜。/r/n

word.name: fret
word.mean:
n. 烦躁,磨损,焦急
v. 烦恼,不满,磨损
word.lx: You are fretting yourself needlessly./r/n 你是在不必要地折磨自己。/r/n Babies often fret (themselves) when their mothers are not near./r/n 婴儿常常因母亲不在身边而哭闹./r/n

word.name: friction
word.lx: Friction against the rock, combined with the weight of the climber, caused his rope to break./r/n 与岩石之间的摩擦加上攀登者的重量，使得绳子断了。/r/n My daughter and son always have frictions./r/n 我女儿和儿子总发生矛盾。/r/n

word.name: friend
word.lx: A friend in need is a friend indeed./r/n 患难之交才是真朋友。/r/n Our friend from china will now tell us about her research./r/n 现在我们的中国朋友要向大家介绍她自己的研究情况。/r/n

word.name: friendly
word.lx: He was not very friendly to us./r/n 他对我们不太友善。/r/n Manchester United beat Celtic in a friendly./r/n 曼彻斯特联队在一场友谊比赛中击败了凯尔特队。/r/n

word.name: friends
word.lx: My friends and I went to the park together on a cloudless day./r/n 在一个晴朗的天气里，我和朋友们一起去公园。/r/n Please hand on the magazine to your friends./r/n 请把这本杂志传给你的朋友们看。/r/n

word.name: friendship
word.lx: Real friendship is more valuable than money./r/n 真正的友谊比金钱更宝贵。/r/n Take this ring as a pledge of our friendship./r/n 请接受这个戒指作为我们友谊的信物。/r/n

word.name: fright
word.lx: He gave me a fright by bursting into a sudden laughter./r/n 他突然大笑起来，吓了我一跳。/r/n The horse took a fright at the sound of the explosion./r/n 马听到爆炸声受了惊。/r/n

word.name: frighten
word.lx: He frightened the old man into giving him all the money./r/n 他恐吓那位老人把所有的钱都给了他。/r/n The little baby was frightened by the fierce dog./r/n 那个小孩被恶狗吓坏了。/r/n

word.name: frightening
word.mean: a. 令人恐惧的, 引起突然惊恐的
word.lx: The magnitude of the epidemic was frightening./r/n 这种流行病传播范围之广令人惶惶不安。/r/n The jet zoomed low over the houses, frightening everyone./r/n 那架喷气式飞机低飞掠过房顶, 隆隆声把大家吓了一跳./r/n

word.name: frightful
word.lx: These frightful experiences are branded on his memory./r/n 这些可怕的经历深深印入他的记忆。/r/n An old woman considered ugly or frightful./r/n 老丑婆一个被认为是丑陋或可怕的老妇人/r/n

word.name: fringe
word.mean:
n. 边缘,端
v. 加饰边于
word.lx: A fringe of trees stood round the pool./r/n 池塘四周耸立着一圈树木。/r/n The estate was fringed with stately elms./r/n 那片地以挺拔的榆树为边界。/r/n

word.name: fro
word.lx: He is walking to and fro in the room./r/n 他在房间内踱来踱去。/r/n Trucks shuttled to and fro on the high ways./r/n 车辆在高速公路上穿梭行驶。/r/n

word.name: frock
word.lx: This monk wears a gray frock./r/n 这个和尚穿着灰色的僧袍。/r/n Her frock came from Paris, but she wears them with a strong English accent./r/n 她的罩袍来自巴黎，可是她简直把它们穿成了英国式（的样子）。/r/n

word.name: frog
word.lx: The frog jumped away./r/n 青蛙跳走了。/r/n The frog in the well knows nothing of the great ocean./r/n 【谚】井底之蛙，所见不广。/r/n

word.name: from
word.lx: The sky slowly changed from blue to red./r/n 天空慢慢由蓝色变为红色。/r/n The train starts from Beijing./r/n 这辆火车从北京开出。/r/n

word.name: front
word.mean:
n. 前面,开头,前线
v. 面对,朝向,对付
word.lx: The front of the postcard shows a picture of our hotel./r/n 明信片正面是我们旅馆的图片。/r/n Write your name on the front cover of the exercise book./r/n 在练习簿的封面上写上你的名字。/r/n

word.name: frontier
word.lx: The frontiers of medical knowledge are being pushed forwards as time goes on./r/n 医学知识的新领域正随着时间向前推进。/r/n Sweden has frontiers with Norway and Finland./r/n 瑞典与挪威和芬兰接壤。/r/n

word.name: frost
word.mean:
n. 霜,冰冻,冷漠
v. 覆着霜,冻结,结霜
word.lx: The cold has frosted the windows./r/n 寒冷的天气使窗子上结满了霜。/r/n The grass was covered with frost in the early morning./r/n 清晨，草上覆盖着一层白霜。/r/n

word.name: frosty
word.mean: a. 下霜的,严寒的,冷淡的
word.lx: Frosty windows make great surfaces for children to draw on./r/n 有霜的窗户是孩子们画画的好地方。/r/n The air was frosty./r/n 天气严寒。/r/n

word.name: frugal
word.lx: I had a frugal meal of bread and cheese last night./r/n 我昨晚吃了只有面包和奶酪的便餐。/r/n They lived a very frugal existence, avoiding all luxuries./r/n 他们生活非常俭朴，力避奢侈。/r/n

word.name: fruit
word.mean:
n. 水果
v. 结果实
word.lx: The potato is a vegetable, not a fruit./r/n 马铃薯是一种蔬菜，不是一种水果。/r/n The apple trees are fruiting early this year./r/n 今年苹果树很早结果。/r/n

word.name: fruitful
word.mean: a. 多产的,富有成效的
word.lx: The apple tree is seldom fruitful./r/n 这棵苹果树很少结果。/r/n Capable of producing offspring or vegetation; fruitful./r/n 多产的能够生产果实或植物的；多果实的/r/n

word.name: fruition
word.lx: Success is the fruition of his years of work./r/n 成功是他多年工作的成果。/r/n At last his efforts were coming to fruition./r/n 他的努力终于逐渐取得了成效。/r/n

word.name: frustration
word.mean:
n. 打破,挫折,顿挫
[计算机] 失败
word.lx: Every job has its frustrations./r/n 每种工作都有让人不称心的地方。/r/n He ground his teeth (together) in frustration./r/n 他因失败而把牙咬得咯咯响./r/n

word.name: fry
word.mean:
n. (美)法式炸薯条
v. 油煎,油炸
word.lx: Shall I fry the fish for dinner?/r/n 晚饭要不要我炸鱼？/r/n The eggs are frying in the pan./r/n 鸡蛋正在平底锅里煎着。/r/n

word.name: fuel
word.mean:
n. 燃料,木炭
v. 加燃料,供以燃料
word.lx: All aircraft must fuel before flight./r/n 所有飞机飞行前都必须加油。/r/n The newspaper article provided him with fuel for his speech./r/n 报纸上的这篇文章为他的演讲提供了启发。/r/n

word.name: fulfill
word.mean:
v. 完成,履行
vt. 履行,完成
word.lx: Does your job fulfill your expectations?/r/n 你的工作符合你的期望吗？/r/n You must fulfill your promise./r/n 你必须履行诺言。/r/n

word.name: fumble
word.mean:
n. 摸索,漏接
v. 摸索,摸弄,笨拙的处理
word.lx: She fumbled about in her handbag for a pen./r/n 她在手提袋中搜寻钢笔。/r/n She is fumbling the light switch./r/n 她正找电灯开关。/r/n

word.name: fume
word.mean:
n. 臭气,烟,激怒
v. 熏,冒烟
word.lx: He fumed at the delay./r/n 他对耽搁感到愤怒。/r/n The burnt heaps of wood were still fuming./r/n 燃烧的木堆仍在冒着烟。/r/n

word.name: function
word.mean:
n. 功能,函数,重大聚会
vi. 运行,起作用
word.lx: The minister has to attend all kinds of functions./r/n 部长必须参加各种集会。/r/n The function of an adjective is to describe or add to the meaning of a noun./r/n 形容词的作用是描述或增加名词的意思。/r/n

word.name: fund
word.mean:
n. 基金
v. 资助
vt. 为...提供资金
word.lx: Now we can do that as we have funds./r/n 现在我们手头有现款就可以办这事了。/r/n The factory has built up reserve fund./r/n 这个工厂已积累了后备基金。/r/n

word.name: fundamental
word.mean:
a. 基本的,根本的
n. 基本原理
word.lx: There is a fundamental difference in attitude between these two politicians./r/n 这两位政治家的态度有着根本的区别。/r/n A knowledge of economics is fundamental to any understanding of this problem./r/n 经济知识对于理解这个问题是至关重要的。/r/n

word.name: funeral
word.mean:
a. 葬礼(的)
n. 葬礼
word.lx: The funeral made its way slowly through the streets./r/n 送葬队伍缓缓地穿过街道。/r/n They held a state funeral in honour of the statesman./r/n 他们为这位政治家举行了国葬。/r/n

word.name: fungus
word.lx: The roses are suffering from fungus./r/n 玫瑰花得了真菌病。/r/n Mildew and mushrooms are fungi./r/n 霉和蘑菇都是真菌。/r/n

word.name: funnel
word.mean: n. 漏斗,漏斗状的东西,烟囱

word.name: funny
word.lx: The story was very funny./r/n 这个故事非常可笑。/r/n He closed his speech with a funny joke./r/n 他用一则有趣的笑话结束了演讲。/r/n

word.name: furious
word.lx: There was a furious knock at the door./r/n 有人在猛烈地敲门。/r/n After receiving the insulting letter, he became furious./r/n 他收到辱骂信后怒不可遏。/r/n

word.name: furnace
word.lx: This room is like a furnace./r/n 这屋子热得象火炉一样。/r/n A furnace that manufactures producer gas./r/n 煤气发生炉制造发生炉煤气的炉子/r/n

word.name: furnish
word.lx: The shop furnishes everything that is needed for camping./r/n 这家商店供应各种野营用品。/r/n They are renting a furnished flat./r/n 他们租用了一套带有家具的公寓房子。/r/n

word.name: furniture
word.lx: We will buy some furniture for our new house./r/n 我们得给我们的新房子买些家具。/r/n This old table is a valuable piece of furniture./r/n 这张旧桌子是一件很珍贵的家具。/r/n

word.name: furrow
word.mean:
n. 犁沟,皱纹
v. 犁,耕,弄绉
word.lx: The country roads were muddy and full of furrows left by farm carts./r/n 乡间道路泥泞不堪，布满了牛车压出的车辙。/r/n A furrow or groove formed by running water./r/n 犁沟由流水形成的槽或小沟/r/n

word.name: further
word.mean:
a. 更远的
ad. 此外,进一步地
v. 促进,推动
vt. 促进
word.lx: I was too tired to walk any further./r/n 我累得再也走不动了。/r/n This house is not large enough for us, and further, it is too far from the town./r/n 这栋房子对我们来说不够大，而且离城太远了。/r/n

word.name: fury
word.mean:
n. 愤怒,狂暴,狂怒的人
n. 复仇女神
word.lx: In a fury, she could not speak./r/n 她气得连话也说不出来。/r/n In my fury, I dashed all the dishes to the floor./r/n 气愤之下，我把所有的杯盘都摔到地上去了。/r/n

word.name: fuse
word.mean:
n. 保险丝
v. 融化,融合
word.lx: The fuse-box is in the kitchen./r/n 保险丝盒子在厨房里。/r/n Lead will fuse at quite a low temperature./r/n 铅会在相当低的温度下熔化。/r/n

word.name: fusing
word.lx: Lead will fuse at quite a low temperature./r/n 铅会在相当低的温度下熔化。/r/n The tube was sealed off by fusing the material together./r/n 管子以熔合管端的方法封闭起来了。/r/n

word.name: fusion
word.lx: Americans are the fusion of many different races./r/n 美国人是各种种族人的熔合体。/r/n Brass is formed by the fusion of copper and zinc./r/n 黄铜是由铜和锌熔合制成的。/r/n

word.name: fussy
word.mean: a. 爱挑剔的,难取悦的,易烦恼的
word.lx: Some girls like fussy dresses./r/n 有些女孩喜欢讲究的衣服。/r/n Are you fussy about what you wear?/r/n 你介意自己的穿着吗？/r/n

word.name: futile
word.lx: What a futile remark!/r/n 纯属废话!/r/n He made a futile exercise./r/n 他做了一次无效的练习。/r/n

word.name: future
word.mean:
a. 将来的
n. 将来,未来
n. 期货
word.lx: I wish you a very happy future./r/n 我祝你有非常幸福的未来。/r/n We will meet in Beijing in the near future./r/n 在不久的将来，我们将在北京见面。/r/n

word.name: gaily
word.lx: They gaily went on talking after the film had started./r/n 电影开演后，他们还在毫无顾忌地讲话。/r/n He rattled away gaily./r/n 他快活地喋喋而言。/r/n

word.name: gain
word.mean:
n. 增益,获得,利润
v. 得到,增进,获利
word.lx: No pain, no gain./r/n 一分耕耘,一分收获。/r/n He has gained rich experience in these years./r/n 这些年来，他取得了丰富的经验。/r/n

word.name: gainful
word.mean: a. 有利益的(唯利是图的)

word.name: gait
word.lx: The man walked along with an unsteady gait./r/n 那人脚步不稳地向前走去。/r/n He is awkward in his gait./r/n 他的步态不雅观。/r/n

word.name: gal
word.mean: n. 重力加速度单位伽(加仑)

word.name: galaxy
word.mean: n. 银河,一群显赫之人
word.lx: A galaxy of film stars attended the premiere./r/n 一群影星参加了首次公演。/r/n There may be millions of worlds in the Milky Way Galaxy./r/n 银河系中也许有几百万个世界。/r/n

word.name: gale
word.lx: The ship lost her masts in the gale./r/n 这船的桅樯被强风吹断了。/r/n The gale blustered all night./r/n 大风刮了一夜。/r/n

word.name: gallant
word.mean: a. 英勇的,壮丽的,华丽的
word.lx: He was very gallant at the ball./r/n 他在舞会上对妇女大献殷勤。/r/n These gallant soldiers will protect our country./r/n 这些勇敢的士兵会保卫我们的国家的。/r/n

word.name: gallantry
word.mean: n. 勇气,豪勇,勇敢的行为
word.lx: He won many hearts by his gallantry./r/n 他以勇敢赢得芳心无数。/r/n He got a medal for his gallantry./r/n 他因勇敢而赢得一枚勋章。/r/n

word.name: galleries
word.lx: The young painter has exhibited (his work) in several galleries./r/n 那年轻画家的作品已在几家美术馆中展出./r/n He seems to spend half his time hanging round art galleries and museums./r/n 他一半的时间似乎是在美术馆和博物馆闲逛掉的。/r/n

word.name: gallery
word.lx: His pictures were showed in the gallery./r/n 他的画在画廊展出。/r/n She loaned her collection of paintings to the gallery./r/n 她把自己收藏的画借给了美术馆。/r/n

word.name: galley
word.lx: The boy was caught and sold to be a galley slave./r/n 这个男孩被抓住，并被卖到战舰上做奴隶。/r/n The stewardess will get you some water from the galley./r/n 空中小姐会从厨房给你拿些水来。/r/n

word.name: gallivant
word.mean: v. 跟着异性,与异性闲荡,闲逛
word.lx: They should spend less time gallivanting about and more with their children./r/n 他们应少到各处游荡, 多用些时间照看子女./r/n

word.name: gallon
word.lx: He added 2 gallons of fuel to his car./r/n 他给汽车加了2加仑油。/r/n The imperial gallon is not the same as the US gallon./r/n 英制的加仑和与美制的容量不同。/r/n

word.name: gallop
word.mean:
n. 疾驰,飞奔
v. 飞驰,急速进行,急急忙忙的说
word.lx: He rode off at a gallop./r/n 他骑马疾驰而去。/r/n He galloped the horse along the track./r/n 他沿跑道策马疾驰。/r/n

word.name: gallows
word.lx: The murderer was sentenced to the gallows./r/n 杀人犯被判处绞刑。/r/n Save a thief from gallows and he will help hang you./r/n 你救盗匪下绞架，盗匪送你上绞架。/r/n

word.name: galore
word.lx: Bargains galore!/r/n 备有丰富之特价品。/r/n

word.name: gambit
word.mean: n. 以取得优势的开局棋法,开始,话题

word.name: gamble
word.mean:
n. 冒险
v. 赌博,孤注一掷
word.lx: He gambled all his winnings on the last race./r/n 他把赢得的钱全都压在最后一场赛马上了。/r/n The company took a gamble by cutting the price of their products./r/n 公司冒险将产品削价出售。/r/n

word.name: gambler
word.lx: By crafts the gambler tricked them out of all their money./r/n 那个赌徒用诡计赢去了他们所有的钱。/r/n Money easily finds its way into other hands, if you are a gambler./r/n 如果你嗜赌，钱财很容易落入他人之手。/r/n

word.name: gambling
word.lx: The government is framing a new bill to control gambling./r/n 政府在制定新的法案以控制赌博。/r/n He spends all his time gambling in the casino./r/n 他把时间都消磨在赌场的赌博上。/r/n

word.name: gambol
word.mean:
n. 跳跃,雀跃,嬉戏
v. 跳跃,雀跃,耍闹
word.lx: There are many children gamboling around./r/n 那儿有很多嬉戏蹦跳的儿童。/r/n

word.name: games
word.lx: The children are addicted to computer games./r/n （喻）孩子们对计算机游戏上了瘾。/r/n Five cities in the world fought bitterly over the glory of hosting the2000 Olympic Games./r/n 世界上有5座城市为申办2000年奥运会展开激烈的角逐。/r/n

word.name: gamester
word.lx: Standers-by see more than gamesters./r/n 【谚】当局者迷，旁观者清。/r/n

word.name: gamut
word.mean: n. 全音阶,长音阶,全音域
word.lx: He runs the whole gamut of dissipation./r/n 他干尽了放荡的事儿。/r/n In his short life he have run the entire gamut of crime, from petty theft to murder./r/n 他在短短的一生中，从小偷小摸到杀人，什么罪都犯过。/r/n

word.name: gander
word.mean:
n. 雄鹅
v. 闲逛

word.name: gang
word.mean:
n. 队,群,帮
v. 一组,联合在一起
word.lx: The gang is being hunted by the police./r/n 这帮人正被警方追捕。/r/n He was done over by a gang of thugs after a football match./r/n 他在足球比赛结束以後受到一帮暴徒的殴打。/r/n

word.name: gangway
word.lx: Please clear the gangway, thanks for your cooperation./r/n 请别堵住通道，谢谢各位合作。/r/n Seeing him out of the plane and down the gangway gave me a lump in my throat./r/n 看着他从飞机中出来，走下舷梯，我激动得哽咽起来。/r/n

word.name: Ganymede
word.mean: [希神]Zeus 带去为众神司酒的美少年

word.name: gaol
word.mean:
n. 监狱
v. 监禁 [=jail]
vt. 使...坐牢

word.name: gap
word.mean:
n. (意见、个性等的)差异,缝隙,漏洞,缺口
嘉普(财富500强公司之一，总部所在地美国,主要经营服装零售)
word.lx: The road goes through a gap in the hills./r/n 这条路穿过两条山脉之间的峡谷。/r/n There is a generation gap between my parents and I./r/n 我父母和我之间有代沟。/r/n

word.name: gape
word.mean:
n. 裂口,张嘴
v. 裂开,张嘴
word.lx: She gaped at the tall man, not believing that he was her younger brother./r/n 她张嘴呆看着那个高个子，不相信他就是她的弟弟。/r/n Dont gape : its rude!/r/n 别张著嘴傻瞪著, 太不礼貌了!/r/n

word.name: garbage
word.lx: She threw the leftovers in the garbage./r/n 她把剩饭倒进垃圾桶。/r/n Please put the garbage in the dustbin./r/n 请把垃圾放在桶里。/r/n

word.name: garden
word.mean:
n. 花园,果园,菜园
v. 栽培花木,造园
word.lx: He is building a greenhouse in his garden./r/n 他正在花园中建温室。/r/n We must cultivate our own garden and find the joy of doing it in our own heart./r/n 我们都要做好自己工作，并且要在工作中找到精神上的乐趣。/r/n

word.name: gardener
word.lx: It is said that the Frenchman may be the best gardener in the world./r/n 据说法国人是世界上最好的园丁。/r/n He got a part-time job as a gardener./r/n 他找到个兼职工作, 当花匠./r/n

word.name: gardening
word.mean:
n. 园艺
n. 打扫
word.lx: I received a set of gardening tools on my birthday./r/n 生日那天，我收到一套园艺工具。/r/n What implements are needed for gardening?/r/n 园艺需要些什么工具？/r/n

word.name: garlic
word.lx: She put several cloves of garlic in the dish./r/n 她在菜里放了几瓣大蒜。/r/n Can you taste the garlic in this stew?/r/n 你尝得出炖肉里有大蒜味儿吗?/r/n

word.name: garment
word.lx: That woman is a garment worker./r/n 那位妇人是一位制衣工人。/r/n The band around the collar of a garment./r/n 领圈一件服装的围绕衣领的圈/r/n

word.name: garrison
word.mean:
n. 守备队,驻军,要塞
v. 守备队,派兵驻守,使当守备队镇守
word.lx: The government will garrison the coastal towns./r/n 政府将派军驻守沿海的城镇。/r/n In the old days this used to be a garrison town./r/n 在过去，这里曾是有驻军的要塞城镇。/r/n

word.name: gas
word.mean:
n. 煤气,气体,汽油
vt. 毒(死),加油
word.lx: Air is a mixture of gases./r/n 空气是气体的混合物。/r/n I was given gas when they pulled my tooth out./r/n 给我拔牙时用了一氧化二氮。/r/n

word.name: gaseous
word.lx: The ball is filled with gaseous mixture./r/n 那个球被充满了气体混合物。/r/n The lamp is full of gaseous nitrogen./r/n 灯里充满了气体氮。/r/n

word.name: gasoline
word.lx: Our gasoline has been used up./r/n 我们的汽油用完了。/r/n The car is short of gasoline./r/n 汽车的汽油不够了。/r/n

word.name: gasp
word.mean:
n. 喘气
v. 喘气,喘息,渴望
word.lx: I gasped with surprise at the unexpected news./r/n 听到意外的消息，我惊讶地吸了一口气。/r/n He gasped out the message./r/n 他喘着气说出了这个消息。/r/n

word.name: gate
word.lx: The carriage passed through the palace gate./r/n 马车进入了宫殿的大门。/r/n The straits of Gibraltar are the gate of the Mediterranean./r/n 直布罗陀海峡是通向地中海的必经之路。/r/n

word.name: gateway
word.mean:
n. 门,通路
[计算机] 网间连接器
word.lx: Hard work is the gateway to success./r/n 辛勤工作是通往成功之路。/r/n A good education can be the gateway to success./r/n 良好的教育是通往成功之路。/r/n

word.name: gathering
word.lx: We are invited to a small social gathering./r/n 我们被邀请参加一个小型社交聚会。/r/n The United Nations assembly is a cosmopolitan gathering./r/n 联合国大会是一种世界性的集会。/r/n

word.name: gaudy
word.lx: These are cheap and gaudy clothes./r/n 这是些廉价而花哨的衣服。/r/n He dislikes gaudy decorations./r/n 他不喜欢俗丽的装饰。/r/n

word.name: gaunt
word.lx: The old house stood gaunt and empty, a complete ruin./r/n 那栋旧房子荒凉空洞地伫立着，像一堆废墟。/r/n Having a lean, gaunt frame with prominent bones./r/n 骨瘦如柴的身材又细又瘦，骨骼突出的/r/n

word.name: gay
word.mean:
a. 欢迎的,放荡的,色彩鲜艳的

b. 同性恋
word.lx: I love the gay colors in the market./r/n 我喜欢市场上缤纷的色彩。/r/n Picnics were popular in the gay nineties./r/n 在1890年至1900年间野餐很流行。/r/n

word.name: gaze
word.lx: She sat gazing out of the window./r/n 她坐着凝视着窗外。/r/n She gazed at me in disbelief when I told her the news./r/n 我告诉她这消息时，她以怀疑的目光注视著我。/r/n

word.name: gel
word.lx: My ideas are beginning to gel./r/n 我的想法逐渐形成了./r/n This liquid gels faster in cold weather./r/n 这种液体天冷时凝结得快些./r/n

word.name: gem
word.lx: My secretary is an absolute gem./r/n 我的秘书真是个难能可贵的人。/r/n The price of this gem is expensive -- as much so as astronomical figures./r/n 这个宝石的价格十分昂贵－－简直是个天文数字。/r/n

word.name: gender
word.lx: German has three genders./r/n 德语中有三性。/r/n The male and female genders are equal./r/n 男性和女性是平等的。/r/n

word.name: general
word.mean:
n. 一般,将军,大体
a. 一般的,普遍的
v. 指挥,作...将军
word.lx: Please give me a general idea of the work./r/n 请告诉我这项工作的梗概。/r/n Napoleon was a great general./r/n 拿破仑是一位伟大的将领。/r/n

word.name: generalization
word.mean: n. 一般化,普遍化,概括

word.name: generally
word.lx: The plan has been generally accepted./r/n 这个计划被普遍地接受了。/r/n Generally, we go to the sea for our holidays./r/n 我们通常到海边度假。/r/n

word.name: generate
word.mean:
v. 产生,发生
[计算机] 产生

word.name: generator
word.lx: We have an auxiliary generator in case of power cuts./r/n 我们有一台万一断电时使用的备用发电机。/r/n The generator shuts off automatically./r/n 这台发动机能自动停止运转。/r/n

word.name: generosity
word.lx: I appreciate your generosity in this matter./r/n 我很欣赏你在这件事上表现出来的宽大胸怀。/r/n His boundless generosity moved us deeply./r/n 他的无限的慷慨深深地感动了我们。/r/n

word.name: generous
word.mean: a. 慷慨的,宽宏大量的
word.lx: Wages here are generous./r/n 这里报酬优厚。/r/n It was generous of her to contribute such a large sum./r/n 她很大方，捐助了这么大笔钱。/r/n

word.name: genetics
word.lx: Genetics is beyond my scope./r/n 遗传学我是外行。/r/n One who specializes in genetics./r/n 遗传学家在遗传学方面从事专门研究的人/r/n

word.name: Geneva
word.lx: There were diplomats of all nationalities in Geneva./r/n 日内瓦有世界各国的外交官。/r/n The premiers of the two countries met in Geneva yesterday./r/n 两国首相昨天在日内瓦会晤。/r/n

word.name: genial
word.mean: a. 和蔼的,亲切的,友善的
word.lx: Her genial smile made every guest feel at home./r/n 她亲切的笑容使每个人都感觉宾至如归。/r/n The man was so genial, so I was drawn to him at once./r/n 这人这么和蔼, 我立刻为他着迷。/r/n

word.name: genius
word.lx: It is rare to find such a genius nowadays./r/n 这样的天才现在很少见。/r/n She has a genius for finding mistakes in my work./r/n 她有一种从我的工作中找错误的本领。/r/n

word.name: gentle
word.lx: My new teacher is a very gentle person./r/n 我的新老师是一个温文尔雅的人。/r/n Gentle persuasion is more effective than force./r/n 温和的说服胜於压服./r/n

word.name: gentleman
word.lx: Please bring this gentleman a glass of beer./r/n 请给这位先生来杯啤酒。/r/n Politeness is an attribute of a gentleman./r/n 彬彬有礼是绅士的本色。/r/n

word.name: gently
word.lx: She always speaks gently to the child./r/n 她对孩子说话总是很温和。/r/n He rotates the handle gently./r/n 他轻轻地转动手柄。/r/n

word.name: genuine
word.mean: a. 真正的,真实的,诚恳的
word.lx: He has a genuine desire to help us./r/n 他真心诚意地愿意帮助我们。/r/n Is this bracelet genuine gold?/r/n 这个手镯是纯金的吗？/r/n

word.name: geographic
word.mean: a. 地理学上的(地区的)
word.lx: Affecting or peculiar to animals of a specific geographic area. Used of a disease./r/n 地方性的影响或特别作用于某一特定地区的动物的，用于疾病/r/n The climate of a large geographic area./r/n 大气候广大地理区域内的气候/r/n

word.name: geographical
word.lx: The professor will give a lecture of geographical features./r/n 教授将要做关于地理特征的讲座。/r/n They are getting to know the geographical house./r/n 他们正在了解房屋的布局。/r/n

word.name: geography
word.lx: He studied physical geography./r/n 他研究自然地理。/r/n The geography paper was difficult./r/n 地理试题很难./r/n

word.name: geological
word.lx: A database supplied by American Geological Institute and dealing with earth sciences./r/n 由美国地质学会提供的一种数据库，用于研究地学。/r/n

word.name: germ
word.lx: Disinfectant kills germs./r/n 消毒剂灭杀细菌。/r/n The prize is a tangible testimony that she has gotten a germ of write ability./r/n 这个奖是一个具体的证明，说明她具有创作才能。/r/n

word.name: German
word.mean:
a. 德国(人)的,德语的
n. 德国人,德语
word.lx: A German scientist interrupted me and asked if I came from China./r/n 一位德国科学家打断了我，并问我是否来自中国。/r/n I know a little German./r/n 我懂一点儿德语。/r/n

word.name: germane
word.mean: a. 有密切关系的,适切的,剀切的
word.lx: The fact is not germane to this issue./r/n 此事实兴此问题无密切关系。/r/n

word.name: Germany
word.lx: Germany is an European country./r/n 德国是一个欧洲国家。/r/n France borders Germany along parts of the Rhine./r/n 法国沿莱茵河部分河段与德国接壤。/r/n

word.name: gesture
word.mean:
n. 手势,姿态
v. 作手势,作姿态

word.name: ghost
word.lx: He was shaking with fright as if he had seen a ghost./r/n 他吓得直哆嗦，就好像看见了鬼一样。/r/n Her gold-medal victory laid the ghost of her shock defeat in the European Championships./r/n 她在欧洲锦标赛中的惨败终因她夺得金牌的胜利而雪耻。/r/n

word.name: giant
word.mean:
a. 巨大的
n. 巨人
word.lx: Shakespeare is a giant among writers./r/n 莎士比亚是作家中的大文豪。/r/n The hero smote the giant with his sword./r/n 英雄用剑猛劈巨人。/r/n

word.name: gifted
word.mean: a. 有天赋的,有才华的
word.lx: She was a distinguished scientist and a gifted painter into the bargain./r/n 她是一位杰出的科学家－－同时还是一位很有才华的画家呢。/r/n A gifted young contralto./r/n 有天赋的年轻女低音歌手./r/n

word.name: gigantic
word.lx: The company has made gigantic losses this year, and will probably be out of business./r/n 这个公司今年亏损巨大，有可能倒闭。/r/n Of immense size, volume, or capacity; gigantic./r/n 庞大的面积、体积、容积很大的；巨大的/r/n

word.name: GIGO
word.mean: (garbage in gabage out)无用输入/无用输出

word.name: ginger
word.mean:
n. 姜,精力,淡赤黄色
a. 淡赤黄色的
v. 使...活泼,使...有生气
word.lx: There is no ginger in him./r/n 他身上没有活力。/r/n Do you like ginger beer?/r/n 你喜欢姜汁啤酒吗？/r/n

word.name: girl
word.lx: His little girl is ill./r/n 他的小女儿病了。/r/n There are more girls than boys in our class./r/n 我们班上女孩比男孩多。/r/n

word.name: give
word.mean:
vi. 让步,塌下,折断,弯曲
vt. 给
word.lx: He gave a bunch of flowers to his girlfriend./r/n 他送给女友一束花。/r/n He gives generously to the poor./r/n 他慷慨地施舍给穷人。/r/n

word.name: glacier
word.lx: He showed me a drawing of the glacier./r/n 他给我看一张冰川图。/r/n Mr Forster and his guide entered upon this portion of the glacier./r/n 福斯特先生和他的向导进入了冰河地区。/r/n

word.name: glamour
word.mean:
n. 魔力,魅力
v. 迷住

word.name: glance
word.mean:
n. 一瞥,闪光,一滑
v. 瞥闪,瞥见,反光
word.lx: The glasses glanced and twinkled in the firelight./r/n 杯子在炉火照耀下闪闪发亮。/r/n He gave her an admiring glance./r/n 他向她投以敬慕的一瞥。/r/n

word.name: glare
word.mean:
n. 闪耀光,刺眼
v. 发眩光,瞪视
word.lx: The sun glared on the sea./r/n 太阳在海上发出令人目眩的光芒。/r/n They stood there, glaring at each other./r/n 他们站在那，互相怒视着对方。/r/n

word.name: glass
word.lx: I cut my hand on some broken glass./r/n 碎玻璃割伤了我的手。/r/n He put down his glass./r/n 他放下杯子。/r/n

word.name: glassware
word.lx: Glazed pottery or glassware bearing a decorative surface network of fine cracks./r/n 裂瓷一种表面饰有细碎裂纹图案的上釉陶器或玻璃制品/r/n Objects made of glass; glassware./r/n 玻璃制品玻璃制成的物体；玻璃制品/r/n

word.name: gleam
word.mean:
n. 微弱的闪光,瞬息的一现
v. 闪烁,隐约地闪现
word.lx: The lighthouse of the island gleamed in the distance./r/n 远处岛上的灯塔在闪耀着。/r/n I could see the faint gleam of light in the distance./r/n 我能看见远处微弱的灯光。/r/n

word.name: glide
word.mean:
n. 滑动,滑过,流水
v. 滑动,滑翔,溜走
word.lx: The figure skater glided gracefully over the ice./r/n 花样滑冰者在冰上优雅地滑行。/r/n Youth glided past without our awareness./r/n 青春在我们不知不觉中逝去。/r/n

word.name: glimmer
word.mean:
n. 一丝光线,微光
v. 发微光
word.lx: He showed no glimmer of interest in what you had offered./r/n 他对你给他的东西没流露出一丝兴趣。/r/n The sky was pink with the first glimmer of the dawn./r/n 天空因第一丝曙光而呈淡红色。/r/n

word.name: glimpse
word.mean:
n. 一瞥,一闪
v. 投以一瞥,闪烁不定

word.name: glisten
word.lx: The street glistened in the rain./r/n 街道在雨水中闪光。/r/n Her eyes glistened with tears./r/n 她眼中的泪水在闪烁。/r/n

word.name: glitter
word.mean:
n. 灿烂,闪烁,辉耀
v. 灿烂,闪烁,辉耀
word.lx: The diamond ring on her finger glittered in the light./r/n 她手指上的钻石戒指在灯光下闪闪发光。/r/n He stared at me with a cruel glitter in his eyes./r/n 他眼露凶光地瞪着我。/r/n

word.name: globe
word.lx: The sun looked like an orange globe./r/n 太阳看上去象只橘黄色的球体。/r/n A terrestrial globe is one that represents the earth./r/n 地球仪是表现地球的器具。/r/n

word.name: gloom
word.lx: The news of defeat cast a gloom over the town./r/n 战败的消息给小城蒙上了一层忧郁。/r/n My eyes slowly grew accustomed to the gloom./r/n 我的眼睛对黑暗慢慢适应了./r/n

word.name: glorify
word.lx: The setting sun glorified the scene./r/n 落日使景色更美。/r/n The newspapers glorified their heroic deeds./r/n 报纸称颂了他们的英雄事迹。/r/n

word.name: glorious
word.lx: We had a glorious time at the seaside./r/n 我们在海边度过了愉快的时光。/r/n The soldiers won the glorious victory./r/n 战士们赢得了光荣的胜利。/r/n

word.name: glory
word.lx: His brave deeds in the battle earned him everlasting glory./r/n 他在那场战斗中的英勇事迹为他赢得了永恒的荣誉。/r/n The bright moonlight showed the Taj Mahal in all its glory./r/n 泰吉·玛哈尔陵在明亮的月光下显得光彩夺目。/r/n

word.name: gloss
word.mean:
n. 光彩,注释
v. 使光彩,注释
word.lx: The minister has put a different gloss on recent developments./r/n 部长就局势的最新发展作了另一番解释。/r/n The gloss and glitter of Hollywood seemed fascinating to the girl./r/n 好莱坞的虚荣与繁华似乎强烈吸引着这个女孩。/r/n

word.name: glossary
word.mean:
n. 字典,辞典
[计算机] 词汇表

word.name: glue
word.mean:
n. 胶,粘性之物
v. 粘,固著
word.lx: He glued a stamp onto the envelope./r/n 他把邮票贴在信封上。/r/n The kids glued their eyes to the TV set, watching a cartoon./r/n 孩子们目不转睛地盯着电视机看卡通片。/r/n

word.name: glut
word.mean:
n. 大量,充斥
v. 使...充满,过多供应

word.name: gnaw
word.lx: These desires gnawed away at us constantly./r/n 这些欲望不断地折磨我们。/r/n The rat gnawed a hole through the wall./r/n 耗子在墙上啃了一个洞。/r/n

word.name: GNP
word.mean: n. 非持久性毒气(国民生产总值)

word.name: go
word.mean:
v. 去,走
[计算机] 执行
word.lx: How are things going?/r/n 事情进行得如何？/r/n I must be going./r/n 我该走了。/r/n

word.name: goad
word.mean:
n. 刺棒,激励物,刺激物
v. 用刺棒驱赶,激励,刺激
word.lx: They are motivated by the twin goads of punishment and reward./r/n 他们受赏与罚的双重因素所激励。/r/n Stop goading the poor beast!/r/n 别再驱赶那可怜的动物了！/r/n

word.name: goat
word.lx: Can you distinguish goat from sheep?/r/n 你能把山羊和绵羊区分开吗？/r/n We saw the tiger pouncing on the goat./r/n 我们看见老虎向那只山羊扑过去。/r/n

word.name: goddess
