word.lx: Diana is the goddess of hunting in Greek and Latin mythology./r/n 戴安娜在希腊罗马神话中是狩猎女神。/r/n The goddess of war./r/n 贝娄娜战争女神/r/n

word.name: gold
word.mean:
a. 含金的,金(制)的
n. 金子
word.lx: All is not gold that glitters./r/n 闪闪发光的未必都是黄金。/r/n The monetary system of some countries used to be based on gold./r/n 过去有些国家的货币制度是金本位制的。/r/n

word.name: golden
word.lx: Your future here is golden./r/n 你在这里的前途是光辉灿烂的。/r/n That fat woman looked ridiculous in her tight golden dress./r/n 那位胖妇人穿着金色的紧身礼服，显得滑稽可笑。/r/n

word.name: good
word.mean:
n. 善行,好处
a. 好的,优良的,上等的
[pl.]商品
word.lx: Smoking is not good for your health./r/n 吸烟对你的健康没有好处。/r/n This is a good place for a picnic./r/n 这是一个野餐的好地方。/r/n

word.name: goodness
word.mean:
int. 天哪
n. 善良,美德
word.lx: Will you have the goodness to show me the way?/r/n 请告诉我怎么走，好吗？/r/n All the goodness has been boiled off the vegetables./r/n 这些蔬菜中的营养部分全都给煮掉了。/r/n

word.name: goods
word.lx: The goods are of poor quality./r/n 这些货物质量不好。/r/n Overcoats are seasonal goods./r/n 大衣是季节性商品。/r/n

word.name: goodwill
word.mean: n. 善意,亲切,友好； 商誉,信誉.

word.name: goose
word.lx: This goose is much larger than the duck./r/n 这只母鹅比那只鸭子大多了。/r/n The goose hissed at me angrily./r/n 那鹅愤怒地向我发出嘶嘶声./r/n

word.name: gorge
word.mean:
n. 峡谷,饱食
v. 狼吞虎咽,塞饱
word.lx: His gorge rose at the sight of gore./r/n 他一看到血污就作呕。/r/n The fat man gorged himself constantly with enormous desserts./r/n 那个胖子经常大吃甜食。/r/n

word.name: gorgeous
word.mean: a. 华丽的,灿烂的,好极了
word.lx: The night sky is now gorgeous with billions of stars./r/n 星斗万千，夜空璀璨。/r/n Children shout when they see the peacock spread his gorgeous tail./r/n 当孔雀展现它华丽的尾巴时，孩子们大声叫着。/r/n

word.name: gorilla
word.lx: The gorilla is something of a paradox in the African scene./r/n 在非洲大舞台上大猩猩有点象似是而非的隽语。/r/n The gorilla had a massive forehead./r/n 猩猩的前额很大./r/n

word.name: gossip
word.mean:
n. 闲聊,随笔
v. 说闲话
word.lx: There has been much gossip in political circles./r/n 政界里有许多流言蜚语。/r/n I never talk about gossip./r/n 我从不传播流言蜚语。/r/n

word.name: gout
word.lx: Gout is a form of arthritis./r/n 痛风是关节炎的一种。/r/n He has been confined two months by gout./r/n 他因痛风病已臣庆两个月了。/r/n

word.name: govern
word.mean:
v. 统治,支配
[计算机] 支配
word.lx: They demand the right to govern themselves./r/n 他们要求自治权。/r/n You must not be governed by the opinions of others./r/n 你决不要受别人意见的支配。/r/n

word.name: government
word.lx: The country has always had fair government./r/n 这个国家一直治理得不错。/r/n The two systems of government are polar opposites./r/n 这两种政体正好相反。/r/n

word.name: governor
word.mean: n. 统治者,管理者,理事
word.lx: He was elected governor of the state of California./r/n 他当选为加利弗尼亚州州长。/r/n British colonies were ruled by governors./r/n 英国的殖民地由总督统治。/r/n

word.name: gown
word.lx: She wore a black silk evening gown./r/n 她穿着一件黑色丝质晚礼服。/r/n The gown a surgeon wears during an operation is usually green./r/n 外科医生在做手术时穿的手术服通常是绿色的。/r/n

word.name: grab
word.mean:
n. 抓握,接应,掠夺
v. 抓取,抢去
word.lx: When I gave him the chance, he grabbed it at once./r/n 我给他这一机会，他立刻抓住不放。/r/n He grabbed my collar and pulled me towards him./r/n 他抓住我的领子把我拉倒他面前。/r/n

word.name: grace
word.mean: n. 优雅,雅致,魅力,恩惠,慈悲
word.lx: We were graced with the presence of the Queen./r/n 女王光临，我们感到不胜荣幸。/r/n She performed on the balance beam with much grace./r/n 她在平衡木上表演得非常优美。/r/n

word.name: graceful
word.lx: She runs up the stairs with a light graceful step./r/n 她以轻快优雅的步子奔上楼去。/r/n She has a graceful carriage./r/n 她举止优雅。/r/n

word.name: gradation
word.lx: It was hard to understand all the minute gradations of their bureaucracy./r/n 很难弄清楚他们那套官僚体制全部细微的层次分别。/r/n I have noticed the subtle gradation in colour in this painting./r/n 我已经注意到这幅画中色彩的层次。/r/n

word.name: gradually
word.lx: Little by little; gradually./r/n 一点一点地；逐渐地/r/n The sea is gradually encroaching on the land./r/n 海水渐渐地侵蚀了陆地。/r/n

word.name: graduate
word.mean:
v.毕业;(在表、计、尺上)刻[分]度 定等级, 分级
n.毕业生
word.lx: He graduated as an M.D. at Edinburgh./r/n 他毕业于爱丁堡大学，获得医学博士学位。/r/n He is a graduate in medicine./r/n 他是医科毕业生。/r/n

word.name: graduation
word.lx: John was asked to deliver a speech on the graduation./r/n 约翰被邀请在毕业典礼上发表演讲。/r/n He worked as a magistrate after graduation./r/n 他毕业后任地方行政长官。/r/n

word.name: graft
word.mean:
n. 接枝,贪污
v. 接枝,使结合
word.lx: He was caught by the police because of the graft and corruption./r/n 他因贿赂贪污被警察抓了起来。/r/n New skin had to be grafted on./r/n 需要移植新皮肤。/r/n

word.name: grain
word.mean: n. 谷物,谷类,颗粒,细粒,纹理
word.lx: Grain is their chief export./r/n 谷物是他们的主要出口物资。/r/n Stores of grain are frequently attacked by pests./r/n 储存的谷物经常受到害虫的破坏。/r/n

word.name: grammar
word.lx: I found German grammar to be very difficult./r/n 我发现德语语法很难学。/r/n You should finish your English grammar drills in the class./r/n 你应该在课堂上完成语法练习。/r/n

word.name: gramophone
word.lx: He must have hit the jackpot with the sales of his last gramophone record./r/n 他卖掉最后的一张留声机唱片，一定赚了大钱。/r/n Mrs Smith hit the jackpot with the sales of his last gramophone record./r/n 史密斯雇到露拉做女佣人，运气太好了。/r/n

word.name: granary
word.mean: n. 谷仓,谷物仓,谷产丰富的地区
word.lx: That remote barren land has blossomed into rich granaries./r/n 过去的穷乡僻壤变成了富饶的谷仓。/r/n But now they have been adapted for use as storehouses or granaries./r/n 不过现在它们已经被改建，用作库房或粮仓了。/r/n

word.name: grandfather
word.lx: His grandfather passed away last year./r/n 他的祖父去年去世了。/r/n My maternal grandfather is coming./r/n 我的外祖父要来了。/r/n

word.name: grandmother
word.lx: I will go to visit my grandmother next week./r/n 下星期我要去看我的外婆。/r/n My grandmother got married at the age of seventeen./r/n 我的祖母十七岁就结婚了。/r/n

word.name: grandson
word.lx: The old man goes to see his grandson twice a week./r/n 这位老人每星期去看他的孙子两次。/r/n The old woman led her grandson by the arm./r/n 那老婆婆牵着外孙的手。/r/n

word.name: granite
word.mean:
a. 花岗岩
n. 花岗石
word.lx: He has a heart of granite./r/n 他有一副铁石心肠。/r/n The valley ended in a perpendicular rim of granite./r/n 那山谷的尽头是花岗石的断崖./r/n

word.name: grant
word.mean:
n.拨款
vt.授予,同意,承认
word.lx: I grant that your explanation is reasonable./r/n 我承认你的解释是合理的。/r/n He was granted his freedom on the condition that he leave the country./r/n 他已获准恢复自由，条件是他离开这个国家。/r/n

word.name: grantee
word.lx: Money, property, a deed, or a bond put into the custody of a third party for delivery to a grantee only after the fulfillment of the conditions specified./r/n 契约，合同指钱、权利、契据或契约等暂交第三者保管，待某种条件实现后再交付受让人或权利人/r/n

word.name: granular
word.mean: a. 由小粒而成的,粒状的

word.name: grape
word.lx: He cut off a bunch of grapes to entertain us./r/n 他剪下一串葡萄招待我们。/r/n Banana, grape, apple, daisy which of these is the odd one out?/r/n 香蕉、葡萄、苹果、雏菊－－这几样东西哪一样与众不同？/r/n

word.name: graph
word.mean:
n. 图表,曲线图
v. 图表,用图表表示
vt. 以(曲线)图表示
word.lx: The graph flattens out gradually after a steep fall./r/n 图表上的曲线突降之後逐渐趋於平稳./r/n The box that appears below a graph, identifying the fields of the graph./r/n 出现在图下部的说明，用以标识图的各区域。/r/n

word.name: graphic
word.lx: The newspaper article gave a graphic description of the earthquake./r/n 报纸文章生动地描述了地震的情况。/r/n The graphic arts include calligraphy and lithography./r/n 平面造型艺术包括书法和平版印刷术。/r/n

word.name: graphically
word.lx: She described the events so graphically that I could almost see them./r/n 她把那些事件描述得活灵活现，我几乎象是能够亲眼目睹了。/r/n

word.name: graphics
word.mean:
n. 制图法,制图学,图表算法
n.[计算机]图形学,DOS命令 : 允许使用Shift-PtrSc键打印屏幕图形
word.lx: A hand-held, button-activated input device that when rolled along a flat surface directs an indicator to move correspondingly about a computer screen, allowing the operator to move the indicator freely, as to select operations or manipulate text or graph

word.name: grasp
word.mean:
n. 把握,抓紧,把
v. 抓住,紧握,领会
word.lx: I kept her hands in my grasp./r/n 我紧握着她的手。/r/n I grasped the main point of the speech./r/n 我领会了这篇演讲的要点。/r/n

word.name: grass
word.lx: We play football on the grass./r/n 我们在草地上踢足球。/r/n Mike must have grassed on us./r/n 麦克一定告发了我们。/r/n

word.name: grasshopper
word.mean: n. 蚱蜢(输送设备,转送装置,小型侦察机)

word.name: grateful
word.lx: Your kindness is grateful./r/n 你的友善令人感激。/r/n He was grateful for all you did./r/n 他对你所做的一切表示感激。/r/n

word.name: gratis
word.lx: We provide gratis service./r/n 我们提供免费服务。/r/n Wine is gratis./r/n 酒水免费。/r/n

word.name: gratitude
word.lx: She showed me her gratitude by inviting me to dinner./r/n 她邀请我吃饭以表示她的感激。/r/n We owe you a debt of gratitude for you help./r/n 承蒙帮助，感恩不尽。/r/n

word.name: gratuity
word.lx: A tip; a gratuity./r/n 小费；赏钱/r/n Money given as a gratuity; a tip./r/n 赏钱，小费出于感激而给的钱；小费/r/n

word.name: grave
word.mean:
a. 严肃的,庄重的,严重的
n. 坟墓
word.lx: The situation poses a grave threat to world peace./r/n 这局势对世界和平构成了严重的威胁。/r/n Is there life beyond the grave?/r/n 人死后有来生吗？/r/n

word.name: gravel
word.mean:
n. 碎石
v. 铺碎石,使困惑
word.lx: They went out for a walk on the gravelled path./r/n 他们在碎石小径上散步。/r/n The wheels crunched the gravel./r/n 车轮碾在碎石上嘎吱嘎吱地响./r/n

word.name: gravy
word.mean: n. 肉汁,肉汤,不法利润
word.lx: I made some gravy soup for my husband./r/n 我给我丈夫做了一些肉汤。/r/n Poultry or meat cut into pieces and stewed in gravy./r/n 炖肉将家禽或肉切成片在肉汁中炖/r/n

word.name: gray
word.mean:
n. 灰色
a. 灰色的,阴沉的
v. 变灰色
[计算机] 灰色
word.lx: He dressed in gray./r/n 他穿灰色衣服。/r/n His face turned gray as he heard the bad news./r/n 听到这个坏消息后，他的脸变得苍白。/r/n

word.name: graze
word.mean:
n. 使吃草,放牧,擦
v. 使吃草,轻擦
word.lx: She fell down and grazed her knee./r/n 她摔倒在地，碰破了膝盖。/r/n We are grazing the sheep in the next field./r/n 我们在旁边的地里放羊。/r/n

word.name: grease
word.mean:
n. 兽脂,油脂
v. 涂脂,贿赂
word.lx: If you grease the lock it will turn more easily./r/n 如果你给这把锁涂上油脂，转动起来就容易了。/r/n He puts grease on his hair to make it shiny./r/n 他给头发擦上发油使它发亮。/r/n

word.name: great
word.mean:
a. 大量的,很好的,美好的,伟大的,重要的
ad. (口语)好极了
word.lx: It was a great loss to us all./r/n 这对我们所有人来说都是一个巨大的损失。/r/n What a great idea!/r/n 好主意！/r/n

word.name: greatly
word.lx: His writing has improved greatly in this semester./r/n 这学期他的写作有了很大进步。/r/n People hate bandits greatly./r/n 人们非常痛恨盗匪。/r/n

word.name: Greece
word.lx: Greece is located in the south of Europe./r/n 希腊位于欧洲南部。/r/n The boys went camping in Greece last year./r/n 那些男孩子去年到希腊去露营度假./r/n

word.name: greedy
word.lx: He looked at the shop window with greedy eyes./r/n 他用贪婪的眼光看着商店的橱窗。/r/n The greedy little boy ate all the candy at the party./r/n 那个贪吃的小男孩把宴会上所有的糖果都吃光了。/r/n

word.name: Greek
word.mean:
a. 希腊(人)的
n. 希腊人,希腊语
word.lx: Her sister married a Greek./r/n 她妹妹嫁给了一个希腊人。/r/n He is a Greek god./r/n 他是一个美男子。/r/n

word.name: green
word.mean:
a. 绿色的
n. 绿色
word.lx: The country is very green in spring./r/n 春天的时候，乡村一片青葱碧绿。/r/n Green apples are sour./r/n 未成熟的苹果是酸的。/r/n

word.name: greenhouse
word.lx: They planted many flowers in their greenhouse./r/n 他们在花房里种了很多花。/r/n He is building a greenhouse in his garden./r/n 他正在花园中建温室。/r/n

word.name: greet
word.mean: v. 致敬,欢迎,映入眼帘
word.lx: I woke up and was greeted by bird song./r/n 我一觉醒来，鸟鸣之声不绝于耳。/r/n His speech was greeted by loud cheers./r/n 他的演讲受到了热烈的欢呼。/r/n

word.name: grey
word.mean:
a. 灰色的
n. 灰色(的)
v. 变成灰色 [=gray]
vi. 变成灰色
word.lx: Today, the canopy of the heavens is grey./r/n 今天的天幕是灰色的。/r/n Have you any grey pullovers in stock?/r/n 你们有灰色套头毛衣的现货吗？/r/n

word.name: grid
word.mean:
n. 格子
[计算机] 网格

word.name: grief
word.lx: The poor woman was buried in grief after her son died./r/n 这个可怜的妇人在儿子死后一直沉浸在悲痛之中。/r/n She was prostrate with grief./r/n 她因悲痛而一蹶不振。/r/n

word.name: grill
word.mean:
n. 烤架,铁格子,烤肉
v. 烧,烤,严加盘问
word.lx: He spent the summer buss table in a downtown grill./r/n 整个夏季，他都在城里一个烧烤店帮助清理餐桌。/r/n A place where grilled foods are served to customers; a grill./r/n 烤肉馆，烧烤店向顾客提供烤菜和烧烤的地方，烤菜餐馆/r/n

word.name: grim
word.mean: a. 冷酷的,残忍的,可怕的
word.lx: What grim weather!/r/n 多讨厌的天气！/r/n His expression was grim when he told them they had lost their job./r/n 当他告诉他们说他们已被解雇时，他的表情十分冷酷。/r/n

word.name: grin
word.mean:
n. 露齿笑,裂口笑
v. 露齿而笑
word.lx: I knew she was joking because she had a big grin on her face./r/n 我知道她是在开玩笑，因为她脸上堆满笑容。/r/n They grinned with pleasure when I gave them the sweets./r/n 当我给他们糖果时，他们高兴地咧开嘴笑了。/r/n

word.name: grind
word.mean:
n. 磨,碾,苦工作
v. 磨擦,磨碎
word.lx: People in this area were ground down by hunger and poverty./r/n 这个地区的人们受着饥饿和贫穷的折磨。/r/n We grind up the wheat to make flour./r/n 我们把小麦磨成面粉。/r/n

word.name: grit
word.mean:
n. 砂砾,粗砂石
v. 覆以砂砾
word.lx: The soldiers are hard grit./r/n 士兵们全都是刚强勇敢的。/r/n Grit is spread on roads to make them less slippery in icy weather./r/n 在结冰的天气，在路上撒上砂砾心免路面太滑。/r/n

word.name: groan
word.lx: The girl groaned in pain./r/n 那女孩在痛苦中呻吟。/r/n The old chair gave a groan when the fat man sat down on it./r/n 那个胖子坐下时，旧椅子发出嘎吱的响声。/r/n

word.name: grocer
word.lx: He has decided to open a grocer store in a small way./r/n 他决定开一间小规模杂货店。/r/n That grocer never overcharges./r/n 那杂货商从不多要价./r/n

word.name: groceries
word.lx: He brought the box of groceries in from the car./r/n 他把一盒食品从汽车上拿进来。/r/n He plonked the groceries on the kitchen floor./r/n 他把买的食物杂货砰的一声扔到厨房的地板上了./r/n

word.name: grocery
word.lx: He brought the box of groceries in from the car./r/n 他把一盒食品从汽车上拿进来。/r/n Build a nation; built a successful business out of their corner grocery store./r/n 建立一个国家；从他们街道拐角的杂货店创办了一家成功的公司/r/n

word.name: groove
word.lx: Wheels leave grooves in dirt roads./r/n 车轮在泥路上留下凹痕。/r/n The sink shelf is grooved so that the water will run off./r/n 洗涤池上开槽是为了让水流走。/r/n

word.name: grope
word.lx: We groped our way through the dark streets./r/n 我们摸索着走过黑暗的街道。/r/n I groped for the door handle in the dark./r/n 我在黑暗中摸索着门把手。/r/n

word.name: gross
word.mean:
n. 总数,总量
a. 总共的,未打折扣的,毛重的
v. 总共赚得
word.lx: You can tell from his gross language that the man was uneducated./r/n 从他那粗俗的语言可以看出，这个人没受过教育。/r/n The gross national product had increased 5 percent last year./r/n 去年的国民生产总值提高了百分之五。/r/n

word.name: ground
word.mean:
n. 土地,战场,场地
a. 土地的,地面上的
v. 放在地上,使...搁浅,打基础
word.lx: The branch broke and fell to the ground./r/n 树枝断了，落在地上。/r/n You have no real grounds for complaint./r/n 你没有真正的理由发牢骚。/r/n

word.name: grounds
word.lx: She had adequate grounds for a divorce./r/n 她离婚有充分的理由。/r/n The prohibition against smoking on school grounds is strictly enforced./r/n 校园内严禁吸烟。/r/n

word.name: group
word.mean:
n. 团体,组,团
v. 聚合,成群
[计算机] 成组
word.lx: He showed me a photo of a family group./r/n 他给我看一张合家欢的照片。/r/n We can group animals into many types./r/n 我们可以把动物分成很多种类。/r/n

word.name: grove
word.lx: Can you show me the road to Legend Grove?/r/n 你能告诉我到传奇路怎么走吗？/r/n The farmer has an orange grove on the hillside./r/n 那位农民在山坡上拥有一片桔子园。/r/n

word.name: growl
word.mean:
n. 吠声,不平,咆哮声
v. 怒吠,咆哮,吼
word.lx: The dog growled at me./r/n 那狗向我咆哮。/r/n We heard the thunder growling in the distance./r/n 我们听见远处隆隆的雷声。/r/n

word.name: grown
word.mean:
a. 长大的,成年的,长满某物的
vbl. 生长,变成,栽培

word.name: growth
word.lx: Childhood is a period of rapid growth./r/n 幼年是生长迅速的时期。/r/n It is hoped the tax cuts will act as a stimulant to further economic growth./r/n 希望降低税率这一措施能刺激经济进一步增长./r/n

word.name: grumble
word.mean:
n. 怨言,满腹牢骚
v. 呻吟,喃喃地说出
word.lx: They will grumble about having to do the work./r/n 他们将为不得不干那项工作而抱怨。/r/n He has everything he needs, but he is still full of grumbles./r/n 他需要的一切都得到了，却还牢骚满腹。/r/n

word.name: grunt
word.mean:
vi. (猪等)作呼噜声, (表示烦恼、反对、疲劳、轻蔑等)发哼声
vt. 咕哝着说出
n. 呼噜声, 咕哝
word.lx: He grunted as the bullet hit him./r/n 子弹击中他时他疼得哼了出来。/r/n He gave a grunt of approval./r/n 他咕噜了一声表示同意。/r/n

word.name: guarantee
word.mean:
v.&n. 保证,担保
vt. 保证
word.lx: South winds in winter are a guarantee of rain in these parts./r/n 在这一带，冬天刮南风是下雨的迹象。/r/n This radio has a two-year guarantee./r/n 这台收音机保修两年。/r/n

word.name: guard
word.mean:
n. 守卫者,警戒
v. 保卫,看守,当心
word.lx: The dog guarded the house against strangers./r/n 狗守卫着房屋，不让陌生人进去。/r/n There are soldiers on guard at the gate./r/n 大门口有士兵在守卫。/r/n

word.name: guardian
word.lx: The legal guardian must act on behalf of the child./r/n 法定监护人应该维护这个孩子的利益./r/n A guardian; a protector./r/n 监护人；保护人/r/n

word.name: guess
word.mean:
n. 猜测,推测,猜想
v. 猜测,推测
word.lx: Make a guess at the answer./r/n 猜一下答案。/r/n I guess her age as 35./r/n 我猜她有35岁。/r/n

word.name: guest
word.mean:
n. 客人
v. 款待
word.lx: She made a guest appearance on his TV show./r/n 她在他的电视节目中出场客串。/r/n They are coming to the party as my guests./r/n 他们作为我的客人出席晚会。/r/n

word.name: guesthouse
word.lx: The car pulled up outside the guesthouse [in front of the hotel]./r/n 汽车在宾馆外面[旅馆前面]停了下来。/r/n

word.name: guidance
word.lx: Under his guidance, we finished the work smoothly./r/n 在他的指导下，我们顺利地完成了工作。/r/n We should not do anything under the guidance of instincts./r/n 我们不应该凭着直觉做事情。/r/n

word.name: guide
word.mean:
n. 引导者,指南,路标
v. 指导,支配,管理
word.lx: These philosophical views serve as a guide in life./r/n 这些哲学观点可以作为处世指南。/r/n He guided the man through the streets to the railway station./r/n 他带这个人走过街道到火车站。/r/n

word.name: guideline
word.lx: One of the reforms allows the local education department to choose their own textbooks based upon the national teaching guideline./r/n 其中之一就是允许地方教委在国家教学大纲的指导下选择合适自身的教材。/r/n

word.name: guilt
word.lx: His face showed guilt though he said he had done nothing wrong./r/n 尽管他说自己没做过错事，他的脸上却显出了内疚的神情。/r/n The lawyer shafted the prisoner into an admission of guilt./r/n 这位律师使得这名罪犯承认了自己的罪行。/r/n

word.name: guilty
word.lx: The man was proved guilty of murder./r/n 这个男子被证实犯了杀人罪。/r/n According to facts in my possession he can not possibly be guilty./r/n 根据我所掌握的事实，他是不可能有罪的。/r/n

word.name: guitar
word.mean:
n. 吉他
vi. 弹吉他
word.lx: I like to play guitar./r/n 我喜欢弹吉他。/r/n Tom is going to buy either a guitar or a piano./r/n 汤母不是要买一把吉他就是要买一架钢琴。/r/n

word.name: gulf
word.lx: I think there is no gulf between my daughter and I./r/n 我认为我和我女儿之间没有隔阂。/r/n He indicated the location of the Persian Gulf with a pen on the map./r/n 他用一支笔在地图上标出了波斯湾的位置。/r/n

word.name: gulp
word.mean:
n.字节组
v. 吞,呛,抑制
[计算机] 字节组
word.lx: She gulped nervously, as if the question bothered her./r/n 她紧张地咽了一下，似乎那问题把她难住了。/r/n He gulped his food./r/n 他狼吞虎咽地吃东西。/r/n

word.name: gum
word.mean:
n. 树胶,橡皮,橡皮糖
v. 涂以树胶,使...有粘性
word.lx: He likes chewing gum./r/n 他喜欢嚼口香糖。/r/n His pocket was all gummed up with candy./r/n 他的口袋全被糖粘住了。/r/n

word.name: gunpowder
word.lx: The rebels were short of gunpowder./r/n 反叛者们缺少弹药。/r/n Sulfur can be used to make gunpowder./r/n 硫磺可以用来制造火药。/r/n

word.name: gush
word.mean:
n. 涌出
v. 使涌出,迸出
word.lx: Oil gashed out from the broken pipe./r/n 油从断裂的管道中喷出来。/r/n His words gashed out./r/n 他的话滔滔不绝。/r/n

word.name: gust
word.lx: A gust of wind blew the door shut./r/n 一阵大风吹来，把门关上了。/r/n A sudden gust of wind wafted the papers off her desk./r/n 一阵突然刮来的风把她桌上的文件吹落到地上。/r/n

word.name: gutter
word.lx: He took the child out of the gutter./r/n 他收养了这个穷苦孩子。/r/n A gutter under the eaves of a roof./r/n 水槽屋檐下的凹槽：/r/n

word.name: guy
word.lx: This ordinary quiet guy just freaked out and shot ten people./r/n 这个平时温和的家伙简直发疯了, 开枪打死了十个人./r/n What a downer that guy is!/r/n 那家伙多让人泄气呀!/r/n

word.name: gym
word.lx: We go to play badminton in the nearest gym every Sunday./r/n 每个星期天我们都去最近的体育馆打羽毛球。/r/n The basketball players are working out at the gym./r/n 篮球运动员们正在体育馆进行训练。/r/n

word.name: gymnasium
word.lx: A new gymnasium has been built on our campus./r/n 我们大学的校园里新建了一座体育馆。/r/n The child somersaulted across the gymnasium./r/n 那孩子翻著跟头从体育馆这头翻到那头./r/n

word.name: gymnast
word.lx: She has the lithe grace of a gymnast./r/n 她有体操运动员轻盈而优美的体态。/r/n The gymnast extended her arms horizontally./r/n 那女子体操运动员双臂平伸./r/n

word.name: habit
word.lx: My colleague has broken off the habit of smoking./r/n 我的同事已经戒掉了吸烟的习惯。/r/n He is in the habit of rising early./r/n 他有早起的习惯。/r/n

word.name: habitual
word.lx: His habitual place at the table was occupied by a stranger./r/n 他惯常坐在桌旁的位置被一个陌生人占据了。/r/n My girlfriend and I are habitual cinema-goers./r/n 我和女友是电影院的常客。/r/n

word.name: hack
word.mean:
n. 劈,砍,出租马车
v. 劈,砍,干咳
word.lx: He was hacking at a tree./r/n 他正在砍树。/r/n The publisher paid his hacks low./r/n 出版商付给他雇佣的文人很低的费用。/r/n

word.name: hacker
word.lx: The police arrested the two hackers./r/n 警察就逮捕了这两名“黑客”。/r/n

word.name: had
word.mean:
v. 有,吃,使
vbl. 有,吃,让
conj. 有
word.lx: Have you had your lunch?/r/n 吃过午饭了吗？/r/n If only I had another chance./r/n 要是我再有一次机会就好了。/r/n

word.name: haggard
word.lx: He looks haggard./r/n 他显得很憔悴。/r/n The old lady has a haggard face./r/n 老太太的脸很枯槁。/r/n

word.name: hair
word.lx: My hair has grown very long./r/n 我的头发长得很长了。/r/n The clothes some young people wear nowadays really make your hair curl./r/n 如今有些年轻人穿的服装真会把你吓一跳。/r/n

word.name: hairpin
word.lx: She has no hairpin because her hair is short./r/n 因为她头发短，所以没有束发夹。/r/n Her hairpin is new./r/n 她的束发夹是新的。/r/n

word.name: hairy
word.mean: a. 多毛的,毛状的,长毛的
word.lx: The newborn baby has a hairy head./r/n 这个新生儿的脑袋上长了很多头发。/r/n A mammoth is a large hairy type of elephant in ancient times./r/n 猛犸是古代一种身体庞大、长着长毛的大象。/r/n

word.name: half
word.mean:
a. 一半的,不完全的
ad. 一半地
n. 半,一半
word.lx: Half the car was damaged./r/n 车子毁了一半。/r/n The girl left her homework half done./r/n 这女孩只做完了一半作业。/r/n

word.name: halfway
word.mean:
a. 中途的,不彻底的,部份的
ad. 半路地,在中途,再半途
word.lx: We had a short intermission halfway through a film./r/n 我们电影放映中途做了短暂的休息。/r/n The key turned halfway and then jammed./r/n 钥匙转了一半就卡住了。/r/n

word.name: hall
word.lx: The lecture is to be delivered at the hall./r/n 演讲将在大厅进行。/r/n Morning assemblage is held in the school hall./r/n 晨会在学校礼堂举行。/r/n

word.name: hallmark
word.mean:
n. 纯度检验证明,品质证明
v. 加盖纯度检验证明,有品质保证的
word.lx: Attention to detail is the hallmark of a fine craftsman./r/n 能工巧匠的特点是一丝不苟./r/n The plan has all the hallmarks of being a total failure./r/n 这个方案具有彻底失败的一切标志。/r/n

word.name: halt
word.mean:
n. 停止,立定,休息
v. 使...停止,使...立定,犹豫
word.lx: The car came to a halt just in time to prevent an accident./r/n 汽车及时停下，避免了一场车祸。/r/n The soldiers halted for a rest./r/n 士兵们停下来休息。/r/n

word.name: halves
word.lx: Never do things by halves./r/n 【谚】凡事不可半途而废。/r/n Let me go halves with you in the taxi fare./r/n 让我和你平均负担车费。/r/n

word.name: hammer
word.mean:
n. 锤,榔头
v. 锤击,敲打
word.lx: He hit the nail into the wall with a hammer./r/n 他用一把锤子把钉子打进墙里去。/r/n The police hammered the door./r/n 警察不停地敲门。/r/n

word.name: hamper
word.mean:
n. 食盒,食篮
v. 阻碍,使...困累,困累
word.lx: Our progress was hampered by the bad weather./r/n 我们前进时受到了恶劣天气的阻碍./r/n

word.name: hand
word.mean:
n. 手,掌握,协助
v. 支持,交给
word.lx: Please hand me that book./r/n 请把那本书递给我。/r/n This clock has three hands./r/n 这块表有三个指针。/r/n

word.name: handful
word.mean: n. 少数,一把,棘手之事
word.lx: That child is quite a handful./r/n 那孩子很难管教。/r/n We invited twenty people, but only a handful of them came./r/n 我们邀请了20 个人，但只来了寥寥数人。/r/n

word.name: handicap
word.mean:
n. 障碍
v. 妨碍
word.lx: Deafness can be a serious handicap./r/n 耳聋算是严重的缺陷。/r/n He was handicapped by lack of education./r/n 他因文化水平低而吃了亏。/r/n

word.name: handicapped
word.mean:
n. 残疾人, 身体有缺陷的人
a. 残废的
word.lx: He was handicapped by lack of education./r/n 他因文化水平低而吃了亏。/r/n The social worker advised them to put their handicapped child into care./r/n 社会工作者建议他们将其残疾儿送到福利院去。/r/n

word.name: handkerchief
word.lx: Please pass me a piece of paper handkerchief./r/n 请递给我一张纸巾。/r/n She embroidered her initials on the handkerchief./r/n 她把她姓名的起首字母绣在手帕上。/r/n

word.name: handler
word.lx: He was returned full of enthusiasm for Handler College./r/n 归来时充满着对汉德勒学院的热情。/r/n

word.name: handling
word.mean:
n. 处理
a. 操作的
vbl. 操作
[计算机] 处理
word.lx: The minister was crucified by the press for his handling of the affair./r/n 部长对此事的处理方法受到新闻界的严厉批评。/r/n The machine was rendered useless by unskillful handling./r/n 由于操作不熟练，机器给弄得没有用了。/r/n

word.name: handout
word.mean: n. 散发材料(免费发给的新闻通报)
word.lx: The act of approaching someone for a loan or handout./r/n 向某人借款，要求施舍接近某人以获得贷款或施舍的行为/r/n

word.name: handsome
word.lx: Her husband is a very handsome young man./r/n 她丈夫是一个非常英俊的年轻人。/r/n Her bridegroom is a handsome young man./r/n 她的新郎是一个英俊的年轻人。/r/n

word.name: handwriting
word.lx: There is need for improvement in your handwriting./r/n 你的书法需要改进。/r/n She astonished me with her beautiful handwriting./r/n 她以其秀丽的书法而使我惊异。/r/n

word.name: hang
word.mean:
n. 悬挂,吊死
v. (hanged,hanged) 悬挂,绞死,逗留
word.lx: You may hang your coat on the hook./r/n 你可以把外套挂在钩子上。/r/n He hanged himself in sorrow after his wife died./r/n 妻子死后，他因悲伤而自缢。/r/n

word.name: hanger
word.mean: n. 挂钩(钩子,悬挂者,悬杆,支架)
word.lx: A fighter plane is revving up on the hanger apron./r/n 飞机库前面停机坪上，一架战斗机正在起动。/r/n One more thing, I also need a couple more of hangers./r/n 还有一件事，我还需要两三个衣架。/r/n

word.name: haphazard
word.mean:
a. 偶然的
ad. 杂乱的(地),任意的(地)
word.lx: It is just a thing done at haphazard./r/n 这只是件偶然为之的事情。/r/n

word.name: happily
word.mean: ad. 幸福地,快乐地,幸好
word.lx: Happily, the accident was prevented./r/n 很幸运，事故得以避免了。/r/n How did you do your work? I did my work happily./r/n 你怎样做你的工作？ 我很快乐地做了我的工作。/r/n

word.name: happy
word.lx: That was not a very happy remark./r/n 那不是很恰当的话。/r/n I wish you a happy birthday./r/n 祝你生日快乐。/r/n

word.name: harass
word.mean: v. 使...困扰,使...烦恼,反复袭击
word.lx: Political dissidents complained that they are harassed by the police./r/n 持有不同政见者申斥他们受到警方的骚扰。/r/n He always looks harassed./r/n 他老是愁眉苦脸。/r/n

word.name: harassment
word.lx: A source of harassment, annoyance, or pain./r/n 使人痛苦的东西骚扰，烦恼或痛苦的来源/r/n There is a report about a sexual harassment in the office on this newspaper./r/n 今天的报纸上有一篇关于办公室里的性骚扰的报道。/r/n

word.name: harbinger
word.lx: The crowing of the cock is a harbinger of dawn./r/n 鸡啼报晓。/r/n The cuckoo is a harbinger of spring./r/n 布谷鸟预告春天的来临。/r/n

word.name: harbor
word.mean:
n. 港,避难所
v. 庇护,隐藏,藏匿
word.lx: This harbor is a natural harbor./r/n 这个港口是天然港。/r/n Harboring criminals is an offence in law./r/n 窝藏罪犯是犯法的。/r/n

word.name: harbour
word.mean:
n. 海港
vt 停泊
word.lx: Harbouring criminals is an offence in law./r/n 窝藏罪犯是犯法的。/r/n He harbours a secret grudge against his father./r/n 他对父亲暗怀不满。/r/n

word.name: harden
word.lx: Life in the camp had hardened him considerably./r/n 军营生活使他变得坚强多了。/r/n His face hardened at the word./r/n 他听到这话，脸沉了下来。/r/n

word.name: hardiness
word.mean: n. 大胆(结实,抵抗力,耐寒性)

word.name: hardware
word.mean:
n. 五金器具
n. (计算机) 硬件
word.lx: I know nothing about computer hardware./r/n 我对计算机硬件一窍不通。/r/n We deal in hardware but not software./r/n 我们只经营硬件而不经营软件./r/n

word.name: hardy
word.mean:
a. 难的,艰苦的,坚硬的
ad. 努力地,辛苦地,坚硬地
word.lx: A few hardy people swam in the icy water./r/n 一些强壮的人在冰冷的水中游泳。/r/n Strawberry is hardy and easy to grow in all soil./r/n 草莓耐寒，各种土壤里都容易生长。/r/n

word.name: hare
word.lx: They went hunting for hares./r/n 他们出去打野兔了。/r/n He took a bead on the hare and then fired./r/n 他瞄准了野兔，然后开枪。/r/n

word.name: harmful
word.lx: It is harmful to your health to drink too much./r/n 过量喝酒对你的身体有害。/r/n The new law was in a measure harmful./r/n 新的法律在某种程度上说是有害的/r/n

word.name: harmless
word.lx: The bomb blast killed several harmless passers-by./r/n 炸弹爆炸使几个无辜行人受伤。/r/n This snake is harmless./r/n 这条蛇是无毒的。/r/n

word.name: harmonic
word.mean:
a. 调和的,音乐般的,和声的
n. 和音,调波
[计算机] 调和的

word.name: harmonious
word.mean: a. 和睦的,调和的,和谐的
word.lx: Relations with our neighbors are very harmonious at the moment./r/n 我们目前同邻居们的关系十分和谐。/r/n The sky and the sea make a harmonious picture./r/n 天空和大海构成了一幅和谐的画面。/r/n

word.name: harmony
word.lx: There was not much harmony in international affairs during those years./r/n 那些年国际事态不很协调。/r/n His tastes are in harmony with mine./r/n 他的爱好和我的相同。/r/n

word.name: harness
word.mean:
n. 马具,系在身上的绳子,甲胄
v. 束以马具,披上甲胄,利用产生动力
word.lx: The farmer harnessed the horse./r/n 农夫给马套上挽具。/r/n The cashier died in harness./r/n 出纳员以身殉职。/r/n

word.name: harsh
word.mean: a. 粗糙的,刺耳的,严厉的
word.lx: The punishment was too harsh for him./r/n 这种惩罚对他来说太严厉了。/r/n Expulsion from school is a harsh form of punishment./r/n 开除学籍是严厉的惩罚./r/n

word.name: harvest
word.mean:
n. 收获,成果,收获物
v. 收割,收获
word.lx: The peasants are harvesting rice in the field./r/n 农民们正在田野里收割稻子。/r/n We all helped the harvest./r/n 我们都帮忙收割。/r/n

word.name: haste
word.mean:
n. 急速,急忙
v. 匆忙,赶快
vi. 赶紧,赶快
word.lx: Haste makes waste./r/n 欲速而不达。/r/n In his haste, he forgot to bring his glasses with him./r/n 匆忙之中，他忘了带眼镜。/r/n

word.name: hat
word.lx: She bought a hat yesterday./r/n 她昨天买了一顶帽子。/r/n Prizes went to the first three out of the hat./r/n 奖品为随意挑选出来的前三人所得。/r/n

word.name: hatch
word.mean:
n. 孵化,舱口
v. 孵,孵出
word.lx: Three of the chickens hatched today./r/n 今天有三只小鸡出壳。/r/n Chicks are hatching from the eggs./r/n 小鸡正从蛋壳里孵出来。/r/n

word.name: hate
word.mean:
n. 憎恨,恨,厌恶
v. 憎恨,憎恶
word.lx: She looked at him with hate in her eyes./r/n 她以憎恨的目光看着他。/r/n They hate each other./r/n 他们彼此憎恨。/r/n

word.name: hateful
word.mean: a. 憎恨的,可恨的,可恶的
word.lx: The sight of food was hateful to the seasick girl./r/n 那个晕船的女孩看到食物就感到厌恶。/r/n Ironing shirts is a hateful job./r/n 熨衬衫是件讨厌的工作。/r/n

word.name: hatred
word.lx: He looked at me with hatred./r/n 他带有敌意地望着我。/r/n Strong dislike or hatred; abhorrence./r/n 憎恶强烈的不喜欢或厌恶；憎恨/r/n

word.name: haunt
word.mean:
n. 常到的地方
v. 常到,出没,萦绕于心
word.lx: The years of the war still haunt me./r/n 战争年代的往事仍常浮现在我的脑海。/r/n A spirit haunts the castle./r/n 幽灵常出没于古堡。/r/n

word.name: have
word.mean:
aux. 已经,曾经
n. 吃,从事,得到,雇用,享有,有,允许
v. 有
word.lx: I had a letter this morning./r/n 我今天收到一封信。/r/n Have you got a pencil?/r/n 你有铅笔吗？/r/n

word.name: haven
word.mean:
n. 港口,避难所,安息所
v. 安置...于港中,庇护
word.lx: They have made their home a haven for the homeless orphans./r/n 他们把自己的家变成了无家可归的孤儿们的避难所。/r/n He came to see us after I have haven my breakfast./r/n 我吃过早饭后，他来看我们了。/r/n

word.name: havoc
word.lx: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city./r/n 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏。/r/n The earthquake has made great havoc of the city./r/n 地震给这个城市造成了巨大的破坏。/r/n

word.name: hay
word.lx: I adviced him to make hay while the sun shone./r/n 我劝他抓紧时机。/r/n The children snuggled down on the hay./r/n 孩子们舒适地蜷伏在干草上。/r/n

word.name: hazard
word.mean:
n. 冒险,危险,危害
v. 冒...的危险,赌运气
word.lx: There are many serious health hazards associated with smoking./r/n 许多危害健康的情况都与吸烟有关。/r/n He hazarded all his money in the attempt to save the business./r/n 他为挽救这家企业，不惜冒险投入他的全部金钱。/r/n

word.name: head
word.mean:
n. 头,头脑,领袖
v. 为首,朝向,前进
word.lx: He arranged his speech under four main heads./r/n 他把发言内容归纳成四个主要方面。/r/n Please raise your head and look at the blackboard./r/n 请抬起头来，看黑板。/r/n

word.name: header
word.mean: 页眉,标题,报头,电子邮件头

word.name: headers
word.lx: A record that follows a header./r/n 跟在标头后面的一个记录。/r/n He stumbled and took a header into the ditch./r/n 他跌了一跤而栽到沟去了。/r/n

word.name: heading
word.lx: What heading do these items fall under?/r/n 这几项应列在哪个标题下面?/r/n What heading does this come under?/r/n 这个编在什麽标题之下?/r/n

word.name: headlong
word.mean:
a. 头向前的,匆促而用力的,轻率的
ad. 头向前地,猛然的用力的

word.name: headmaster
word.lx: The professor was assigned headmaster of the school./r/n 教授被任命为这所学校的校长。/r/n Our headmaster is a despotic person./r/n 我们的校长是个专横的人。/r/n

word.name: headphone
word.mean: n. 戴在头上的收话器,双耳式耳机

word.name: headquarters
word.mean: n. 司令部,指挥部,总部
word.lx: Are their any orders coming from the headquarters?/r/n 有司令部的任何命令吗？/r/n The company wants to situate its headquarters in the north./r/n 公司想把总部设在北方./r/n

word.name: heal
word.lx: The medicine and rest will soon heal your wound./r/n 药物治疗和休息会使你的伤口很快愈合。/r/n Time heals most troubles./r/n 时间会消除痛苦。/r/n

word.name: health
word.lx: Fresh air and exercise are good for the health./r/n 新鲜空气和运动有益于健康。/r/n Smoking is not good for your health./r/n 吸烟对你的健康没有好处。/r/n

word.name: healthy
word.lx: His grandpa is healthy./r/n 他的祖父身体健康。/r/n His inmost thoughts are not healthy./r/n 他心灵深处的思想是不健康的。/r/n

word.name: heap
word.mean:
n. 堆,许多,累积
v. 堆积
[计算机] 堆
word.lx: The books lay in a heap on the floor./r/n 书堆放在地板上。/r/n We have heaps of time./r/n 我们有很多时间。/r/n

word.name: hearing
word.lx: Please keep within hearing distance./r/n 请保持在听得见的距离之内。/r/n Her hearing is poor./r/n 她的听觉不灵。/r/n

word.name: heartbeat
word.lx: An irregularity in the force or rhythm of the heartbeat./r/n 心律失常不规则的心跳强度或节奏/r/n Although there was still a faint heartbeat, he was to all intents and purposes dead./r/n 他虽然仍有隐隐心搏, 但从身体各方面看已经死亡./r/n

word.name: heartfelt
word.mean: a. 衷心的,真心真意的
word.lx: She helps me with heartfelt feeling./r/n 她真心真意的帮助我。/r/n They expressed their heartfelt gratefulness to us./r/n 他们向我们表达了他们衷心的感激。/r/n

word.name: hearth
word.lx: The soldiers swore to fight for the hearth and the altar./r/n 战士们宣誓为保卫家庭和宗教而战。/r/n An open recess for holding a fire at the base of a chimney; a hearth./r/n 壁炉用于在烟囱底部燃火的敞口的凹窝；炉床/r/n

word.name: heartily
word.mean: ad. 衷心地,真实地,热心地
word.lx: I am heartily grateful to your help./r/n 我衷心地感激你的帮助。/r/n Tell him you Aunt Celeste heartily approves and wishes you both happiness forever./r/n 请转告他，Celeste姑妈完全赞成这门婚事，并衷心地祝福你们永远幸福。/r/n

word.name: hearty
word.mean: a. 诚恳的,热烈的,旺盛的
word.lx: They gave him a hearty welcome./r/n 他们衷心欢迎他。/r/n Grandfather will be80 years old, but he is hale and hearty./r/n 祖父就要80高龄了，但仍精神矍铄。/r/n

word.name: heated
word.mean:
a. 热的,激昂的,兴奋的
v. 加热,变热,使变暖
vbl. 加热,变暖,使激昂
word.lx: Metals undergo expansion when heated./r/n 金属加热时会膨胀。/r/n The act or process of pressing clothes with a heated iron./r/n 熨用加过热的熨斗熨压衣物的行为或过程/r/n

word.name: heave
word.mean:
n. 举,抛,起伏
v. 用力举起,抛出,凸起
word.lx: He hove a chair through the window./r/n 他把椅子从窗户中抛出。/r/n Heave ho, my hearties!/r/n 伙伴们, 用力呀!/r/n

word.name: heavenly
word.mean: a. 天上的,神圣的,天国似的
word.lx: We spent a heavenly day at the beach./r/n 我们在海滨痛痛快快地玩了一天。/r/n The sun, moon and stars are heavenly bodies./r/n 太阳、月亮和星星都是天体。/r/n

word.name: heavily
word.mean: ad. 很重地,沉重地,沉闷地
word.lx: The crime lies heavily on his conscience./r/n 那罪行沉重地压在他心上。/r/n The truck was heavily loaded./r/n 这辆卡车装载很重。/r/n

word.name: heaviness
word.lx: A measure of the heaviness of an object./r/n 重量一个物体的重量的度量法/r/n Nobody can lift the heaviness that the sad news have leave with her./r/n 谁也无法减轻这个坏消息给她带来的悲痛。/r/n

word.name: heavy
word.mean:
a. 重的
ad. 沉闷地
word.lx: How heavy is this box?/r/n 这个箱子有多重？/r/n Dont go so heavy on the sauce!/r/n 沙司不要加得太多!/r/n

word.name: hectic
word.lx: The journalist lead a hectic life./r/n 新闻记者过着紧张兴奋的生活。/r/n

word.name: hedge
word.lx: Will the hedge keep the sheep out of the field?/r/n 这篱笆能将羊群挡在田地外面吗？/r/n We had better get under the lee of the hedge until the rain stops./r/n 我们最好在树篱下躲一躲等雨停。/r/n

word.name: hedgehog
word.lx: We found a little hedgehog in the field./r/n 我们在田里发现了一只小刺猬。/r/n The hedgehog rolled up into a spiky ball./r/n 刺 卷起身子成了一个刺球./r/n

word.name: heed
word.mean:
n. 注意,留心
v. 注意到,留心到
word.lx: Now heed what I say./r/n 现在注意听我要说的话。/r/n Storm warnings are clearly displayed on motorways, but many drivers still take no heed of them./r/n 汽车道上醒目地放着有暴风雪的告示，但许多司机们却没留心。/r/n

word.name: heels
word.lx: He saluted with a click of his heels./r/n 他立正敬礼，鞋后跟发出咔嗒一声。/r/n The police were on our heels./r/n 警察紧追着我们。/r/n

word.name: height
word.lx: His height makes him stand out in the crowd./r/n 他身材高大，因此在人群中很突出。/r/n They looked down from a giddy height./r/n 他们从令人眩晕的高度往下看。/r/n

word.name: heir
word.lx: Prince Charles is the legal heir of the crown./r/n 查尔斯王子是王位的合法继承人。/r/n He is the only legal heir of the rich man./r/n 他是这位富翁的唯一法定继承人。/r/n

word.name: heiress
word.lx: He took an heiress to wife and was regarded with suspicion by her family./r/n 他娶了个女继承人为妻子，女方家庭对他的结婚动机抱有怀疑。/r/n The robber abduct the heiress and hold her to ransom./r/n 强盗劫持了女继承人并向她索取赎金。/r/n

word.name: helicopter
word.lx: The criminal escaped by a helicopter./r/n 罪犯乘直升机逃走了。/r/n Three men were lifted by helicopter from the burning ship./r/n 直升飞机把三个男人从燃烧著的船上吊起./r/n

word.name: hell
word.lx: The priest said they would go to hell for their sins./r/n 牧师说，他们将因罪恶而下地狱。/r/n His life has been hell since his wife came back./r/n 他妻子回来以后，他的生活苦不堪言。/r/n

word.name: helmet
word.lx: These policemen wear helmets to protect them./r/n 这些警察戴着头盔保护自己。/r/n Jerry: I never had a beard. I kept my hair inside the helmet./r/n 杰端：我以前是从不留胡子，我头发是在头盔里。/r/n

word.name: help
word.mean:
n. 帮助,援助
v. 帮助
word.lx: Could you help me up the stairs?/r/n 你能扶我上楼梯吗？/r/n Trade helps industry to develop./r/n 贸易促进工业发展。/r/n

word.name: helper
word.lx: He is a good helper./r/n 他是一个好帮手。/r/n One that assists; a helper./r/n 助手（提供）帮助的人；助手/r/n

word.name: helpless
word.lx: He is as helpless as a baby./r/n 他像一个婴儿一样依赖人。/r/n In a situation of great difficulty or perplexity; helpless./r/n 处于一个非常困难或迷惑的境地；无助的/r/n

word.name: hemisphere
word.lx: The Western Hemisphere refers to North and South America./r/n 西半球是指南北美洲。/r/n In the northern hemisphere, spring is in March and April./r/n 在北半球，春季是三月和四月。/r/n

word.name: hemoglobin
word.lx: The presence of hemoglobin in the urine./r/n 血红蛋白尿尿液中出现血红蛋白/r/n The protein that is a constituent of hemoglobin./r/n 球蛋白由血红蛋白构成的蛋白/r/n

word.name: hemorrhage
word.lx: The stoppage of bleeding or hemorrhage./r/n 止血阻止流血或大出血/r/n A hemorrhage of corporate earnings./r/n 公司财产的巨额流失/r/n

word.name: hen
word.lx: The hen has hatched all her chickens./r/n 那只母鸡已经孵出了全部小鸡。/r/n The cock has brighter coloured feathers than the hen./r/n 雄鸟的羽毛比雌鸟的艳丽。/r/n

word.name: hence
word.mean: ad. 今后,从此,因此,所以
word.lx: We have no chance to meet each other a week hence./r/n 我们今后一星期没有见面的机会了。/r/n Handmade and hence expensive./r/n 手工制造，因此很贵/r/n

word.name: henceforth
word.lx: The man said that he would work hard henceforth./r/n 那人说从今以后他要努力工作了。/r/n Henceforth it will be more difficult to avoid customs examination./r/n 从此以后，避免海关检查将会更加困难。/r/n

word.name: hepatic
word.mean:
a. 肝的
n. 保肝药

word.name: herald
word.mean:
n. 使者,传令官,前锋
v. 预报,宣布,传达
word.lx: The cuckoo is the herald of the spring./r/n 杜鹃报春。/r/n In England the cuckoo is the herald of spring./r/n 在英国杜鹃鸟是报春的使者。/r/n

word.name: herd
word.mean:
n. 兽群,人群,牧人
v. 群集,使...成群,放牧
word.lx: The photographer took a photo of a herd of elephants./r/n 这位摄影师拍了一张象群的照片。/r/n The herdsman looks after a herd of animals./r/n 牧人放牧着一群牲畜。/r/n

word.name: hereafter
word.mean:
n. 将来,来世
ad. 此后,将来,来世
word.lx: Do you believe in the hereafter?/r/n 你相信来世吗？/r/n Hope to win salvation hereafter./r/n 希望将来得到灵魂拯救/r/n

word.name: hereby
word.lx: I hereby declare her elected./r/n 我特此宣布她已经当选。/r/n

word.name: hereditary
word.lx: That family is a hereditary ruler./r/n 那个家族是世袭的统治者。/r/n The disease is hereditary./r/n 这种病有遗传性。/r/n

word.name: herein
word.lx: Herein lies the real danger./r/n 这其中含有真正的危险。/r/n Herein lies the keys to the questions./r/n 里面包含着问题的答案。/r/n

word.name: hereof
word.lx: In confirmation hereof we attach a bank statement./r/n 为作这方面的确认我们附上银行结单。/r/n

word.name: herewith
word.lx: I enclose herewith two copies of the contract./r/n 随函寄上合同副本两份。/r/n Requests the acceptance of a fountain pen forwarded herewith./r/n 奉上钢笔一支，聊表敬意，务请笑纳。/r/n

word.name: hero
word.mean: n. 男主角,男主人公,英雄
word.lx: The real hero of the match was our goalkeeper./r/n 这次比赛中真正的英雄是我们的守门员。/r/n The closing music fades out when the hero rides off into the sunset./r/n 当男主角策马向夕阳驰去时，尾声音乐逐渐消失。/r/n

word.name: heroin
word.lx: He was caught pushing heroin to schoolchildren./r/n 他在向小学生贩卖海洛因时被捕./r/n Heroin is a killer./r/n 海洛因是致命的毒品./r/n

word.name: heroine
word.mean:
a. 英雄式的,英勇的
n. 女英雄,女主角
word.lx: She was chosen to play the heroine in this film./r/n 她被选定在这部影片中扮演女主角。/r/n The heroine of the film is an aged woman./r/n 影片的女主角是一位老妇人。/r/n

word.name: hers
word.lx: This book is hers./r/n 这本书是她的。/r/n Your appearance is identical to hers./r/n 你的相貌和她的一模一样。/r/n

word.name: herself
word.lx: She should do her homework herself./r/n 她应该自己做作业。/r/n She cannot have written the letter herself./r/n 这封信不可能是她自己写的。/r/n

word.name: Hertz
word.lx: The difference, expressed in Hertz, between the two limiting frequencies of a band./r/n 一个频带的上下界频率之差，单位用赫兹表示。/r/n

word.name: hesitant
word.mean: a. 迟疑的,踌躇的,犹豫不定的
word.lx: The speaker was rather hesitant and had to be prompted occasionally by the chairman./r/n 那发言者讲话结结巴巴的, 有时得由主席提示./r/n The state or quality of being hesitant./r/n 犹豫迟疑不决的状态或迟疑不决的性质/r/n

word.name: hesitation
word.lx: She agreed without hesitation./r/n 她毫不犹豫地答应了。/r/n There is no room for hesitation./r/n 没有犹豫的余地。/r/n

word.name: hey
word.lx: Hey! You!/r/n 嗨！你！/r/n Hey! For goodness sake./r/n 嗨！看在上帝份上。/r/n

word.name: hi
word.mean: int. 嗨,引人注意时的喊声,打招呼
word.lx: Hi. Long time no see./r/n （嗨，好久不见了。）/r/n Hi, Maxine I need your advice. Got a minute?/r/n 嗨，麦卡西。我想听一下你的建议。有时间吗？/r/n

word.name: hickory
word.mean:
int. (北美产的)山核桃属植物,山核桃木
n. 山核桃(属)
word.lx: That is a hickory walking stick./r/n 那是一根山胡桃木的手仗。/r/n The hams were cured over a hickory fire./r/n 火腿在山核桃树枝燃起的火上薰制。/r/n

word.name: hidden
word.mean:
a. 隐藏的,秘密的
vbl. 藏着,隐藏,躲藏
[计算机] 隐藏的
word.lx: The Customs have found heroin hidden in freight./r/n 海关查出了隐藏在货物中的海洛因./r/n An embassy that was compromised by hidden listening devices./r/n 因隐藏着窃听器而处于险境的大使馆/r/n

word.name: hideous
word.lx: He suffered a hideous torment when the enemy caught him./r/n 敌人抓到他后，他受到可怕的折磨。/r/n She calls the new opera house that hideous erection"./r/n 她把新歌剧院叫作 “那讨厌的庞然大物”。/r/n"

word.name: high
word.mean:
a.&ad. 高，高度的，高级的，高尚的
(=High School) 高中,中学
word.lx: The plane flew high above./r/n 飞机高高地在上空飞。/r/n He likes swimming in high summer./r/n 他喜欢在盛夏游泳。/r/n

word.name: highjack
word.lx: They planned to highjack a plane./r/n 他们计划劫持一架飞机。/r/n

word.name: highland
word.lx: He was born in the Highland./r/n 他出生于苏格兰高地。/r/n The highland chieftain has two daughters./r/n 高地酋长有两个女儿。/r/n

word.name: highlight
word.mean:
n. 加亮区
v. 加亮,强调
[计算机] 醒目
word.lx: It is one of the highlight of the match./r/n 这是比赛中最精彩的项目之一。/r/n Press the setup button to display the setup menu, and move the highlight down to audio./r/n 按Setup键显示Setup菜单，然后移动亮条到Audio选项上。/r/n

word.name: highlighting
word.lx: The ball was the highlight of the London season./r/n 那次舞会是伦敦社交活动时期的高潮。/r/n The highlight of our tour was seeing the palace./r/n 我们旅游中最有意思的活动就是参观宫殿./r/n

word.name: highly
word.mean:
a. 十分敬仰的
ad. 高度地,很,非常
word.lx: Your boss speaks very highly of your work./r/n 你的老板对你的工作称颂备至。/r/n His paintings are highly original./r/n 他的作品很独特。/r/n

word.name: highway
word.lx: The Highway Code has been carried./r/n 公路法规已经被执行。/r/n He was charged obstructing the highway./r/n 他因阻碍公路交通而受控告。/r/n

word.name: hijack
word.lx: They planned to hijack a plane./r/n 他们计划劫持一架飞机。/r/n There is no sign of a let-up in the hijack crisis./r/n 绑架危机毫无缓和迹象./r/n

word.name: hike
word.mean:
n. 徒步旅行,远足,涨价
v. 健行,徒步旅行,使...高涨
word.lx: The storm upset their plans for a hike./r/n 暴风雨破坏了他们的远足计画。/r/n Take a hike!/r/n 哪儿凉快哪儿歇着去吧。/r/n

word.name: hilarious
word.mean: a. 喜不自禁的,欢闹的,愉快的
word.lx: Her book is a hilarious send-up of a conventional spy story./r/n 她写的书用的是取笑传统侦探小说的笔法，令人捧腹。/r/n The party get quite hilarious after they bring more wine./r/n 当他们拿来更多葡萄酒後聚会变得十分热闹起来。/r/n

word.name: hill
word.lx: Their house stands on a hill./r/n 他们的房子座落在小山上。/r/n This hill is grassy./r/n 这座小山上的草长得很茂盛。/r/n

word.name: hillside
word.lx: The hillside is covered by grass and flowers in summer./r/n 夏天时，山坡上长满了花草。/r/n The soldiers fanned out across the hillside in their search for the man./r/n 士兵们在山腰上成扇形散开，搜索那个男人。/r/n

word.name: him
word.lx: Did you see him yesterday?/r/n 你昨天见到他了吗？/r/n Have him return my call./r/n 让他给我回电话。/r/n

word.name: himself
word.lx: He said it himself./r/n 他亲口说的。/r/n His new house was built by himself, brick by brick./r/n 他的新房子是他自己一块砖一块砖砌起来的。/r/n

word.name: hind
word.mean:
n. 雌鹿
a. 后部的,在后的
word.lx: The hind leg of this horse was broken./r/n 这匹马的后腿断了。/r/n The dog was sitting on his hind legs./r/n 那只狗用它的後腿端坐着。/r/n

word.name: hinder
word.mean:
a. 后面的
v. 阻碍,打扰
word.lx: Heavy snow hindered the construction work./r/n 大雪妨碍了这项建筑工程的进行。/r/n The crowd hindered him from leaving./r/n 人群使他无法脱身。/r/n

word.name: hindrance
word.lx: Some kitchen gadgets are more of a hindrance than a help./r/n 有些小炊具非但没有用处反而碍事。/r/n She regarded him as a hindrance./r/n 她认为他是一个障碍。/r/n

word.name: hinge
word.mean:
n. 铰链,关键,枢纽
v. 装铰链,靠铰链移动,依...而移
word.lx: The door opens easily because the hinges were oiled./r/n 这门开起来很容易，因为合页上了油。/r/n A casement is a window that opened by means of hinge at the side./r/n 竖铰链窗是一种用边上的铰链开启的窗户。/r/n

word.name: hinterland
word.mean: n. 海岸的后部地方(穷乡僻壤)

word.name: hip
word.mean:
n. 臀部,屋脊,忧郁
a. 非常时尚的
word.lx: He stood there with his hands on his hips./r/n 他两手叉腰站在那里。/r/n The thigh bone is connected to the hip bone./r/n 股骨连著髋骨./r/n

word.name: hire
word.mean:
n. 租金,租用,雇用
v. 雇请,出租
word.lx: Boats for hire./r/n 有小船出租。/r/n We hired an advertising company for help to sell our product./r/n 我们雇用了一家广告公司来推销我们的产品。/r/n

word.name: his
word.lx: His brother is my classmate./r/n 他哥哥是我的同学。/r/n This book is his, not yours./r/n 这本书是他的，不是你的。/r/n

word.name: hiss
word.mean:
n. 嘘声,嘶嘶声
v. 发出嘘声,发嘶嘶声
[计算机] 嘘声
word.lx: The iron hissed as it pressed the wet cloth./r/n 熨斗压在湿布上时发出嘶嘶声。/r/n Hearing the hiss of gas, he rushed in and turned it off./r/n 听到煤气的嘶嘶声，他冲进来把它关掉。/r/n

word.name: histogram
word.mean:
n. 柱状图
[计算机] 直方图

word.name: historian
word.lx: Historians advise that we should never forget the past./r/n 历史学家们告诫我们，我们不应忘记过去。/r/n The historian search for primary source of information about the past./r/n 历史学家寻找有关过去的原始资料来源。/r/n

word.name: historic
word.lx: This battle is of historic meaning./r/n 这一战具有历史意义。/r/n The small symbols on this map denote historic places and museums./r/n 这个地图上的小记号表示史迹兴博物馆。/r/n

word.name: historical
word.lx: We will deal with events in historical sequence./r/n 我们将按照历史上的先后顺序研究这些事件。/r/n People wore historical costumes for the parade./r/n 人们穿著古装参加游行./r/n

word.name: hit
word.mean:
n. 打击,打,冲撞,偶然发现
v. 打,打击,碰撞
word.lx: The bullet hit him in the chest./r/n 子弹击中了他的胸膛。/r/n The record was a big hit and sold a million copies./r/n 这张唱片非常成功，卖了一百万张。/r/n

word.name: hits
word.lx: In this new book he hits off the American temperament with amazing insight./r/n 在这本新书里，他对美国人性格的描写表现出惊人的洞察力。/r/n The car hits the child and she pitch over backwards./r/n 汽车把那孩子撞了，她重重向後倒下。/r/n

word.name: hoarse
word.mean: a. 沙哑的,嘶哑的,刺耳的
word.lx: We shouted ourselves hoarse at the football match./r/n 足球比赛时我们把嗓子都喊哑了。/r/n She screamed herself hoarse./r/n 她把嗓子喊哑了。/r/n

word.name: hobby
word.lx: One of my hobbies is painting./r/n 我的业余爱好之一是画画。/r/n Some people like horseback ride, but I prefer golf as a hobby./r/n 一些人喜欢马术，但是我宁愿把打高尔夫球作为一种业余爱好。/r/n

word.name: hoist
word.mean:
n. 升高,起重机,推动
v. 升起,升高,举起
word.lx: We need a hoist to lift the concrete blocks./r/n 我们需要一台起重机来吊起混凝土块。/r/n The sailors hoisted the flags in the morning./r/n 水手们早晨把旗子升起来。/r/n

word.name: hold
word.mean:
v. 握住,拿着,持有
n. 把握,控制,船舱
word.lx: The city is held by the enemy./r/n 这座城市已被敌人占领。/r/n Hold yourself still for a moment while I take your photograph./r/n 我给你拍照的那一刹那, 你不要动。/r/n

word.name: holder
word.mean: n. 持有人,所有人,支持物

word.name: hole
word.mean:
n. 孔,洞,穴
v. 挖洞,掘坑,进洞
word.lx: Having lost my money puts me in rather a hole./r/n 丢了钱使我陷于困境。/r/n There is a hole in my sock./r/n 我的袜子上有个洞。/r/n

word.name: hollow
word.mean:
n. 洞,窟窿,山谷
a. 空的,虚伪的,空腹的
v. 形成空洞,挖空
word.lx: This tree looks high and strong but actually its trunk is hollow./r/n 这棵树看起来又高又壮，实际上树干是空的。/r/n His protests on human rights sound hollow./r/n 他就人权问题提出的抗议听来很空洞。/r/n

word.name: holy
word.lx: They led a holy life./r/n 他们过着圣洁的生活。/r/n You can find this sentence in the Holy Bible./r/n 你可以在圣经上找到这句话。/r/n

word.name: home
word.mean:
a. 家(乡)的
ad. 回家,在家
n. 家
word.lx: He struck the nail home./r/n 他将钉子完全打进去。/r/n Is he home from work?/r/n 他下班回家了吗？/r/n

word.name: homeless
word.lx: I have much sympathy with those homeless people./r/n 我很同情那些无家可归的人。/r/n Can I enlist your help in collecting money for the people made homeless by the flood?/r/n 你能帮助我们募集款项，救济因水灾而无家可归的人吗？/r/n

word.name: homemade
word.mean: a. 自制的,国产的,朴素的
word.lx: Some glass-hard steel is homemade./r/n 一些有最高硬度的钢是自制的。/r/n The machines here are all homemade./r/n 这里的机器都是国产的。/r/n

word.name: homesick
word.lx: The students began to feel homesick after they had been here for a month./r/n 到了这里一个月以后，学生们开始想家了。/r/n Now I know where to go when I feel homesick./r/n 现在我知道想家的时候该去哪儿了。/r/n

word.name: hometown
word.lx: July is the hottest month in a year in my hometown./r/n 在我的家乡，七月是一年里最热的一月。/r/n There is a leafy forest in our hometown./r/n 在我们的家乡有一片树叶茂密的森林。/r/n

word.name: homework
word.lx: Have you finished your homework?/r/n 你做完家庭作业了吗？/r/n I like doing my homework./r/n 我喜欢做我的家庭作业。/r/n

word.name: homogeneous
word.mean: a. 同种的,同质的,均质的
word.lx: The state or quality of being homogeneous./r/n 同质同质或相似的性质或状态/r/n A dense, homogeneous rock with constituents so fine that they cannot be seen by the naked eye./r/n 隐晶岩，非显晶岩一种成分细密肉眼不能看到的致密同质岩石/r/n

word.name: homogenous
word.lx: A homogenous solid formed by a repeating, three-dimensional pattern of atoms, ions, or molecules and having fixed distances between constituent parts./r/n 晶体一种由原子、离子或分子作重复和立体型排列而形成的均质固体，在组成部分之间有固定的距离/r/n

word.name: honest
word.lx: Please give me your honest opinion./r/n 请把你的真实想法告诉我。/r/n Her husband is an honest man./r/n 她的丈夫是一个诚实的人。/r/n

word.name: honesty
word.lx: I never doubted his honesty./r/n 我从未怀疑过他的诚实。/r/n I respect you for your honesty./r/n 由於你为人正直, 我对你十分敬重./r/n

word.name: honey
word.mean:
a. 蜂蜜似的
n. 蜂蜜,宝贝
word.lx: Honey, come here and give me your help!/r/n 宝贝，到这来帮帮我！/r/n No bees, no honey; no work, no money./r/n 【谚】无蜂则无密，不劳则无酬。/r/n

word.name: honeymoon
word.mean:
n. 蜜月
vi. 度蜜月
word.lx: I suggest Paris as a good place for a honeymoon./r/n 我提议去巴黎, 那是度蜜月的好去处./r/n The suite is for the honeymoon couple./r/n 这套房是为新婚夫妇设的。/r/n

word.name: honor
word.mean:
n. 荣誉,头衔,信用
v. 尊敬,授予荣誉
word.lx: Please honor our arrangement by exchanging the damaged goods./r/n 请遵守我们的协议，给我们调换损坏的货物。/r/n He won honor for his courage./r/n 他以勇气赢得大家的尊敬。/r/n

word.name: hook
word.mean:
n. 钩子
v. 钩住
word.lx: They took the phone off the hook so no calls would disturb them./r/n 他们摘下电话听筒，以免电话打扰他们。/r/n Please hook the rope over the nail./r/n 请把绳子挂在那根钉子上。/r/n

word.name: hope
word.mean:
希望
abbr.=Health Opportunity for People Everywhere世界健康基金会
word.lx: He is the hope of his school./r/n 他是学校的希望。/r/n I called in the hope of finding her at home./r/n 我希望她能在家才给她打的电话。/r/n

word.name: hopeless
word.mean: a. 没有希望的,绝望的
word.lx: With a hopeless sigh, he turned away./r/n 他发出一声绝望的叹息，转身走开了。/r/n Her room is in a hopeless muddle./r/n 她的房间弄得不堪设想地混乱。/r/n

word.name: hopes
word.mean:
n. 希望
v. 希望
word.lx: After these dry days, everyone hopes for rain./r/n 干燥的天气之后，人人都希望下雨。/r/n The whole edifice of his hopes was destroyed./r/n 他心中的希望整个都毁了。/r/n

word.name: hopper
word.mean: n. 漏斗(槽,斗仓,送卡箱,贮水槽,计量器)

word.name: horizon
word.lx: The sun appeared above the horizon./r/n 太阳出现在地平线上。/r/n The sun sank below the horizon./r/n 太阳已沈入地平线。/r/n

word.name: horizontal
word.mean:
a. 水平的,横的
n. 水平线,水平面
word.lx: First, draw a horizontal line./r/n 首先，画一条水平线。/r/n The sun rises from the horizontal line./r/n 太阳从地平线上升起。/r/n

word.name: horn
word.mean:
n. 喇叭
n.(牛、羊等的)角, 喇叭, 触角
v.装角
word.lx: The driver blew his horn when the child stepped in front of the car./r/n 当小男孩走到汽车前面时，汽车司机按响了喇叭。/r/n He is an agreeable fellow, but likes to blow his own horn./r/n 他是一个随和的人，但就是喜欢自吹自擂。/r/n

word.name: horrible
word.mean: a. 可怕的,令人毛骨悚然的,令人讨厌的
word.lx: Everything is in a horrible muddle./r/n 一切都陷入可怕的混乱。/r/n What horrible weather!/r/n 这天气多讨厌！/r/n

word.name: horrify
word.lx: We were horrified by what we saw./r/n 我们看到後很害怕./r/n

word.name: horror
word.mean:
a. (电影等)意在引起恐怖的
n. 恐怖,战栗
word.lx: The news struck him with horror./r/n 那消息使他震惊。/r/n He was filled with horror at the bad news./r/n 听到这个坏消息，他心里充满恐怖。/r/n

word.name: horse
word.lx: The horses are eating grass on the grassland./r/n 马在草地上吃草。/r/n He saddled up his horse and rode away./r/n 他给马装上鞍子便骑马离去了。/r/n

word.name: hose
word.mean: n. 水管,橡皮软管,长统袜
word.lx: This fire hose is about sixty feet long./r/n 这段消防水管大约有60 英尺长。/r/n The rubber hose is playing out./r/n 卷着的橡皮软管正在放开。/r/n

word.name: hospitable
word.lx: They gave us a hospitable reception on our arrival./r/n 我们到达后他们热情地款待我们。/r/n The hospitable host had his spare room emptied very quickly for the honoured guest./r/n 好客的主人很快为尊贵的客人腾空了闲置着的房间。/r/n

word.name: hospital
word.lx: He is ill and has been in the hospital for a week./r/n 他病了，已住院一星期。/r/n When I left the hospital I was completely cured./r/n 出院时，我已经完全痊愈了。/r/n

word.name: host
word.mean:
n. 主机,主人,主持人,东道主.
v.主持,做东.
word.lx: At the end of the party, we thanked our host and went away./r/n 宴会结束时，我们谢了主人后便回家去了。/r/n Which country will be the host country for the next Olympic Games?/r/n 哪个国家将是下届奥运会的主办国？/r/n

word.name: hostage
word.lx: The company took the cars as hostage./r/n 公司把汽车当做抵押品。/r/n He kept the pilot as a hostage./r/n 他把驾驶员当做人质。/r/n

word.name: hostile
word.lx: The new government was hostile to them./r/n 新政府对他们怀有敌意。/r/n He shielded me from hostile criticism./r/n 他庇护我使我免受怀敌意的批评。/r/n

word.name: hot
word.lx: Strike the iron while it is hot./r/n 趁热打铁。/r/n This dish is a bit hot./r/n 这道菜有些辣。/r/n

word.name: hotel
word.mean: n. 旅馆，宾馆，酒店，饭店
word.lx: We stayed at a small hotel./r/n 我们住在一家小旅馆里。/r/n I have engaged a room at this hotel./r/n 我已经在这个旅馆里预订了一个房间。/r/n

word.name: hound
word.mean:
n. 猎犬
v. 带猎犬狩猎,追捕,激励
word.lx: The police are always hounding me./r/n 警方一直在追捕我。/r/n He has been hounded by his creditors in the past few months./r/n 近几个月来，他一直被债主追债。/r/n

word.name: hour
word.lx: It took him half an hour to finish the work./r/n 他花了半个小时做完这项工作。/r/n The London bus departs every hour on the hour./r/n 伦敦的公共汽车每小时零分开出一趟。/r/n

word.name: hourglass
word.lx: An hourglass design; an hourglass figure./r/n 沙漏状的图案；沙漏形的图形/r/n

word.name: hourly
word.lx: We are expecting news hourly./r/n 我们时刻期待着消息。/r/n The trains leave at hourly intervals./r/n 列车每隔一小时开出一趟。/r/n

word.name: house
word.lx: They are going to move to a new house next week./r/n 下星期他们将迁入新居。/r/n I found your coat after you had left the house./r/n 你离开房子之后，我发现了你的外衣。/r/n

word.name: housekeeper
word.lx: He introduced me to his housekeeper./r/n 他把我介绍给他的女管家。/r/n The housekeeper is a very picky woman./r/n 这个家庭主妇是位特别爱挑剔的人。/r/n

word.name: housewife
word.lx: Many women chose to be a housewife after marriage./r/n 许多妇女选择了在婚后当家庭主妇。/r/n She is a career woman rather than a housewife./r/n 她是职业妇女而不是家庭主妇。/r/n

word.name: housework
word.lx: Housework keeps mother on the fly all day./r/n 家务劳动使母亲整天忙忙碌碌。/r/n We alternate in doing the housework./r/n 我们轮流做家务。/r/n

word.name: housing
word.mean: n. 房屋(外壳,外套,外罩,住宅,卡箍,遮盖物)

word.name: hover
word.lx: The mercury hovered around 35 Celsius degree./r/n 水银温度计停留在摄氏35度左右。/r/n The hawk is hovering overhead./r/n 鹰在头顶上盘旋。/r/n

word.name: huckster
word.mean:
n. 小商人,叫卖的小贩,卑鄙者
v. 贩卖,叫卖,还价

word.name: huddle
word.mean:
n. 杂乱一团,混乱,拥挤
v. 推挤,乱堆,草率了事
word.lx: This novel appeared to have been huddled together./r/n 这部小说看来是草草写成的。/r/n He huddled the children into the automobile./r/n 他急急忙忙地把孩子们推进汽车。/r/n

word.name: hue
word.mean:
n. 色,色彩,叫声
[计算机] 色调
word.lx: The diamond shone with every hue under the sun./r/n 这颗钻石在阳光下显得色彩斑斓。/r/n A neutral hue./r/n 中性色彩/r/n

word.name: hug
word.mean:
n. 紧抱,拥抱
v. 紧抱,固执
word.lx: The child was hugging her doll./r/n 那孩子紧抱着她的洋娃娃。/r/n The president hugged himself with pleasure over the quick withdrawal from the gulf war./r/n 总统为自己能从海湾战争中见好就收感到暗自庆幸。/r/n

word.name: huge
word.lx: He possesses a huge house on the hillside./r/n 他在山上拥有一栋巨宅。/r/n Huge earrings dangled from her ears./r/n 她的耳朵上吊着巨大的耳环。/r/n

word.name: hull
word.mean:
n. 壳,皮,船体
v. 去壳
word.lx: Some fruits and seeds have hulls./r/n 有些水果和种子有外壳。/r/n The hull of a ship loomed up suddenly through the fog./r/n 一条船的船体突然黑压压地在雾中出现。/r/n

word.name: hum
word.mean:
n. 嗡嗡声,哼声,杂声
v. 发低哼声,闭口哼歌,嗡嗡叫
int. 哼,嗯
word.lx: The only sound he heard was the hum of the machine./r/n 他听到的唯一的声音就是那台机器的嗡嗡声。/r/n She continued to hum the song over and over./r/n 她一遍又一遍地不断哼唱那支歌。/r/n

word.name: humane
word.lx: People have found many humane methods of killing animals./r/n 人们已经发明了很多宰杀动物的人道方 法。/r/n A humane society always does well by its old people./r/n 一个仁慈的社会对待老人总是很好。/r/n

word.name: humanism
word.lx: Her book captures the quintessence of Renaissance humanism./r/n 她的书抓住了文艺复兴时期人文主义的精髓./r/n

word.name: humanitarian
word.mean:
n. 人道主义者,博爱者,基督凡人论者
a. 人道主义的,博爱的,相信基督为凡人的

word.name: humanity
word.mean:
n. 人类
人性;人道;慈爱[U]
He treated the prisoners with humanity.
他人道地对待俘虏。
人文学科[the P]
She has a background in humanities and modern languages.
她学过人文学科和现代语言。
word.lx: We should treat people and animals with humanity./r/n 我们应该仁慈地对待人和动物。/r/n Such a man is a stain to humanity./r/n 这种人是人类的耻辱。/r/n

word.name: humble
word.mean:
a. 卑下的,谦逊的,粗陋的
v. 使...卑下,挫,贬抑
word.lx: He is a very humble person./r/n 他是一个非常谦恭的人。/r/n Knowledge makes humble; ignorance make proud./r/n 【谚】知识使人谦虚，无知使人骄傲。/r/n

word.name: humiliate
word.mean: v. 使...丢脸,使...蒙羞,屈辱
word.lx: She was humiliated because her children behaved so badly./r/n 她为她的孩子表现不好而感到羞辱。/r/n He felt humiliated when the teacher scolded him in front of the whole class./r/n 老师在全班同学面前批评他使他感到羞辱。/r/n

word.name: humiliation
word.lx: It is an experience of humiliation./r/n 那是一次不光彩的经历。/r/n I felt humiliation at her remarks./r/n 听到她的话我感到受辱。/r/n

word.name: humor
word.mean:
n. 幽默,诙谐,心情
v. 迎合,牵就,顺应
word.lx: She had no sense of humor./r/n 她毫无幽默感。/r/n Jack was late was in a bad humor./r/n 杰克迟到了，心情不好。/r/n

word.name: humorous
word.lx: Her husband is a humorous man./r/n 她的丈夫是一个幽默的人。/r/n She writes humorous songs when she is in the right vein./r/n 她在心情不好的时候写诙谐的歌曲。/r/n

word.name: humour
word.mean:
n. 幽默
v. 纵容,迁就
word.lx: It is not wise to humour a small child./r/n 纵容一个小孩是不明智的。/r/n A sense of humour is prerequisite to understanding her work./r/n 要理解她的作品就必须具有幽默感。/r/n

word.name: hundred
word.mean:
n. 百,百个东西
a. 百,百个
word.lx: The allied warplanes bombed the country by the hundred./r/n 盟军数以百计的飞机轰炸了那个国家。/r/n There are more than five hundred people on the playground./r/n 运动场上有五百多人。/r/n

word.name: hunger
word.mean:
n. 饥饿,渴望,饥馑
v. 饿,使...饥饿,渴望
word.lx: The student has a hunger for learning./r/n 这个学生有强烈的求知欲。/r/n The beggar fell down in a swoon from sheer hunger./r/n 那个乞丐饿得晕倒了。/r/n

word.name: hunt
word.mean:
n. 狩猎,追捕,搜寻
v. 狩猎,打猎,搜索
word.lx: Winter is the best time for hunting in mountain areas./r/n 冬季是山区狩猎的最佳时间。/r/n The huntsman and I hunt the animals out of the garden./r/n 猎人和我把动物赶出花园。/r/n

word.name: hunter
word.lx: The hunter agreed to take us to go hunting tomorrow./r/n 那位猎人同意明天带我们去打猎。/r/n The fox ran away before the hunter shot it./r/n 那只狐狸在猎人向它射击前跑掉了。/r/n

word.name: hunting
word.lx: The boys went hunting with their falcon./r/n 男孩子们带着猎鹰出去打猎了。/r/n The hunter agreed to take us to go hunting tomorrow./r/n 那位猎人同意明天带我们去打猎。/r/n

word.name: hurrah
word.mean:
n. 欢呼声,骚动,欢乐
v. 欢呼,以欢呼迎接,呼万岁
int. 万岁
word.lx: Hurrah for the Queen!/r/n 女王万岁！/r/n

word.name: hurricane
word.lx: It was blowing gales of hurricane this time yesterday./r/n 昨天的这个时候正刮着狂风。/r/n The hurricane has a speed of 73 miles per hour./r/n 飓风每小时73英里。/r/n

word.name: hurry
word.mean:
n. 匆忙,急忙,急促
v. 催促,匆忙,赶快
word.lx: You make mistakes if you do things in a hurry./r/n 如果你匆匆忙忙地做事，那你就要出差错。/r/n She hurried to the airport./r/n 她匆匆赶往机场。/r/n

word.name: hurt
word.lx: Did he suffer any hurt?/r/n 他有过什么痛苦吗？/r/n She hurt my feelings./r/n 她伤害了我的感情。/r/n

word.name: husband
word.lx: My husband is a kind person./r/n 我丈夫是一个善良的人。/r/n The soldiers husband their strength and their food, waiting for the enemy to attack./r/n 士兵们养精畜锐，节约粮草，以期反击敌人的进攻。/r/n

word.name: hush
word.mean:
n. 肃静,安静,沉默
v. 肃静,安静,缄默
int. 肃静
word.lx: She hushed the baby to sleep./r/n 她使婴儿安静入睡。/r/n There was a sudden hush./r/n 突然肃静下来。/r/n

word.name: hut
word.lx: The hut was shaking in the storm./r/n 茅屋在风雨中摇摆。/r/n We heard the rain spattering down on the roof of the hut./r/n 我们听到雨滴滴答答打在小屋的顶上。/r/n

word.name: hybrid
word.mean:
n. 混血儿,杂种,混合物
a. 混合的,杂种的,混合语的
word.lx: A mule is a hybrid of a donkey and a horse./r/n 骡子是公驴和母马交配而生的杂种。/r/n The hybrid offspring of a coyote and a feral dog./r/n 科伊狗丛林狼和野狗的杂交后代/r/n

word.name: hydraulic
word.lx: The hydraulic lift is over there./r/n 液压升降机在那儿。/r/n The building is made of hydraulic cement./r/n 大楼是用水硬水泥建造的。/r/n

word.name: hydroelectric
word.lx: It is important that we build more hydroelectric power stations./r/n 我们建立更多的水力发电站，这是重要的。/r/n

word.name: hydrogen
word.lx: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen./r/n 水含有氢和氧。/r/n Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen./r/n 水由氢和氧组成。/r/n

word.name: hygiene
word.lx: In the interests of hygiene, please do not smoke in the shop./r/n 为健康着想，请不要在本店吸烟。/r/n People should wash regularly to ensure personal hygiene./r/n 人们应经常洗澡以保证个人卫生。/r/n

word.name: hymn
word.mean:
n. 赞美诗,圣歌
v. 唱赞美歌
word.lx: I can hear the hymn from the nearby church./r/n 我能听到从附近的教堂传来的圣歌。/r/n A Protestant hymn melody./r/n 赞美诗曲调新教赞美诗的曲调/r/n

word.name: hypermarket
word.mean: n. 特大百货商场,特大超级商场

word.name: hyphen
word.mean:
n. 连字号
v. 以连字号连接

word.name: hypothesis
word.lx: All these fact have borne out the hypothesis./r/n 所有这些事实证明了假设的正确性。/r/n Several conclusions flow from this hypothesis./r/n 从这项假设中可以得出几个结论。/r/n

word.name: hypothetical
word.mean: a. 假设的, 假定的,爱猜想的

word.name: hysteria
word.mean: n. 歇斯特里症,不正常的兴奋

word.name: hysteric
word.lx: She had the audience in hysterics./r/n 她把观众逗得捧腹大笑./r/n She went into hysterics./r/n 她歇斯底里大发作./r/n

word.name: hysterical
word.mean: a. 歇斯底里的,异常兴奋的

word.name: I
word.lx: I think he is right./r/n 我认为他是对的。/r/n I see what you mean./r/n 我明白你的意思。/r/n

word.name: IC
word.lx: Getting the manager to accept our new plans in addition to implementing our original ones was really the icing on the cake./r/n 除了执行我们原来的计划，再说服经理接受我们新的计划，那真是锦上添花。/r/n The lake was iced over./r/n 湖面结冰了。/r/n

word.name: ice
word.mean:
n. 冰,矜持
v. 冰冻,结冰
word.lx: His refusal iced our enthusiasm./r/n 他的拒绝浇熄了我们的热情。/r/n In winter the lake is covered with ice./r/n 冬天时湖面上覆盖着冰。/r/n

word.name: Iceland
word.lx: Scandinavia refers to Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Iceland./r/n 斯堪的那维亚是指丹麦、挪威、瑞典和冰岛。/r/n I refuse to put money into some half-baked plan to grow pineapples in Iceland./r/n 我拒绝把钱投到在冰岛种植菠萝的不周全的计划中去。/r/n

word.name: icon
word.mean:
n. 圣像,画像,肖像
n. [计算机] 图标,图符

word.name: icy
word.mean: a. 冰的,冷淡的,滑溜的
word.lx: Icy roads are dangerous./r/n 覆盖着冰的道路很危险。/r/n He felt hurt by their icy welcome./r/n 他们冷淡的欢迎让他觉得受到伤害。/r/n

word.name: ID
word.mean:
n. 身份证
n. 遗传素质,本能冲动

word.name: idea
word.lx: You have no idea how worried I was./r/n 你想像不出来我有多么担心。/r/n He has some pretty strange political ideas./r/n 他有一些很奇怪的政治信念。/r/n

word.name: idealize
word.lx: He tends to idealize his life in the army./r/n 他总想使自己在军队里的生活理想化。/r/n

word.name: identical
word.lx: Your appearance is identical to hers./r/n 你的相貌和她的一模一样。/r/n This is the identical hotel we stayed at last year./r/n 这就是我们去年住过的旅馆。/r/n

word.name: identification
word.mean:
n. 身份的证明
n. 视为同一,证明同一,确认
word.lx: The identification of the accident victims took some time./r/n 验明事故遇难者身分的工作费了不少时间/r/n The study of fingerprints as a method of identification./r/n 指纹学对指纹作为确认身份的一种方法的研究/r/n

word.name: identify
word.lx: Can you identify your umbrella among this lot?/r/n 你能在这些伞中认出你自己的伞吗？/r/n One can not identify happiness with wealth./r/n 幸福和财富不能混为一谈。/r/n

word.name: identity
word.lx: The identity of the murdered man has not yet been established./r/n 那名被害人的身份尚未确定。/r/n The police asked him to show his identity card./r/n 警察让他出示身份证。/r/n

word.name: ideology
word.mean: n. 观念学,空论,意识形态
word.lx: The ideology of the political left./r/n 左派，左翼政治左派的意识形态、观点/r/n An advocate of a particular ideology, especially an official exponent of that ideology./r/n 理论家，倡导者某一理论的提倡者，尤指对此意识形态的正式阐释/r/n

word.name: idiomatic
word.lx: An idiomatic word, phrase, or expression./r/n 习语，成语惯用的词语、短语或表达方式/r/n He speaks idiomatic English./r/n 他说道地的英语。/r/n

word.name: idiot
word.lx: He is an idiot to agree./r/n 他要是同意，就太傻了。/r/n What a stupid idiot!/r/n 真是个愚蠢的白痴!/r/n

word.name: idleness
word.lx: Idleness is the root of all evil./r/n 懒惰乃万恶之源。/r/n The closure of the large factory made many workers live in idleness./r/n 那家大工厂倒闭，使许多工人失业。/r/n

word.name: if
word.mean:
conj. 如果
n. 条件,设想
word.lx: If weather permit, we will go to the park tomorrow./r/n 如果天气好的话，明天我们去公园。/r/n Listen to the tune see if you can remember the words./r/n 请听这曲子－－看你能不能想得起歌词来。/r/n

word.name: ignite
word.mean:
v. 点燃,使燃烧
vi. 着火
vt. 点燃

word.name: ill
word.mean:
a. 坏的,有病的
ad. 坏,不利地
n. 不幸,祸害
v. 生病
word.lx: Did you really feel ill this morning?/r/n 今天早晨你真的感到身体不适吗？/r/n You should not speak ill of your friend./r/n 你不应该说你朋友的坏话。/r/n

word.name: illegal
word.lx: He admitted that he was an illegal immigrant./r/n 他承认他是非法移民。/r/n Their speculative buying of grain is illegal./r/n 他们投机购买谷物是不合法的。/r/n

word.name: illegible
word.lx: Her signature was an illegible scrawl./r/n 她的签字潦草难辩。/r/n The lettering on the gravestone was badly worn and almost illegible./r/n 墓碑上的文字已严重磨损难以辨认./r/n

word.name: illicit
word.mean: a. 不法的,不正的,禁止的

word.name: illiteracy
word.lx: Illiteracy is a major problem in some developing countries./r/n 在一些发展中国家, 文盲是个大问题./r/n Illiteracy, a serious handicap in life./r/n 文盲，生活中的严重障碍/r/n

word.name: illness
word.lx: There was no illness in the village this winter./r/n 今年冬天这村里没什么疾病。/r/n Too much work and too little rest often lead to illness./r/n 过量的工作和过少的休息会引起疾病。/r/n

word.name: illuminate
word.lx: A sudden smile illuminated her face./r/n 突然的微笑使她容光焕发。/r/n The lights that illuminate the audience section of a concert hall, a theater, or an auditorium./r/n 观众席照明灯照亮音乐厅、戏院或报告厅的观众席的灯/r/n

word.name: illumination
word.lx: The illumination in this room is very bad./r/n 这个屋子的照明很不好。/r/n The illumination of the manuscript is delicate./r/n 这个手稿的装饰很精致。/r/n

word.name: illusion
word.mean: n. 幻觉,错觉,错误的信仰(或观念)

word.name: illusive
word.mean: a. 幻影的,错觉的,迷惑人的

word.name: illustrate
word.lx: Our textbook is very well illustrated./r/n 我们的课本插图丰富。/r/n He pointed at the diagram to illustrate his point./r/n 他指着图表来说明他的论点。/r/n

word.name: illustration
word.lx: Children like books filled with illustrations./r/n 孩子们喜欢插图丰富的书。/r/n To give a definition of a word is more difficult than to give an illustration of its use./r/n 给一个词下定义要比举例说明它的用法困难。/r/n

word.name: image
word.mean: n. 图像,影像,肖像,想像
word.lx: How can we improve our image?/r/n 我们该怎样来改善自己的形象呢？/r/n They concentrated on better definition of the optical image./r/n 他们致力於提高该光学影像的鲜明度./r/n

word.name: imaginary
word.lx: All the characters in this book are imaginary./r/n 这本书中的人物都是虚构的。/r/n People still have a general fear for the imaginary infernal powers./r/n 人们对于虚构的地狱中的鬼神仍具有一种普遍的恐惧。/r/n

word.name: imaginative
word.lx: The story is imaginative./r/n 这个故事是虚构的。/r/n He is an imaginative writer./r/n 他是个富有想象力的作家。/r/n

word.name: imagine
word.lx: I imagined she was quite surprised when she heard the truth./r/n 我想她听说真相后一定很惊讶。/r/n You can imagine how surprised I was./r/n 你可以想象我是多么惊讶。/r/n

word.name: imaging
word.lx: Diagnostic imaging in which ultrasound is used to visualize an internal body structure or a developing fetus./r/n 超声波扫描术利用超声波来显示耳体结构或胚胎发育情况的诊断用的成像法/r/n

word.name: imitate
word.mean:
v. 模仿
vt. 仿制,仿造,模仿,仿效
word.lx: He can imitate his teacher perfectly./r/n 他能维妙维肖地模仿他的老师。/r/n You should imitate great and good people./r/n 你应仿效伟大善良的人。/r/n

word.name: immaterial
word.mean: a. 非物质的,无形的,精神的
word.lx: The body is material but the soul is immaterial./r/n 躯体是有形的，而灵魂是无形的。/r/n The doctrine that the material world is an immaterial product of the senses./r/n 物质世界幻觉说认为物质世界是感觉的精神上产物的信仰/r/n

word.name: immature
word.lx: Silly, immature behavior./r/n 愚蠢的，不成熟的行为/r/n Not ripe or matured; immature./r/n 不成熟的未熟或成熟的；不成熟的/r/n

word.name: immediately
word.mean:
ad. 立即
conj. 一...(就)
word.lx: I came here immediately after having my supper./r/n 我一吃完晚饭就来这里了。/r/n The purpose may not be immediately evident./r/n 这种目的不一定显而易见。/r/n

word.name: immerse
word.lx: He immersed himself totally in his work./r/n 他埋头于工作。/r/n Please immerse the plant in water for a few minutes./r/n 把那棵植物在水里浸泡几分钟。/r/n

word.name: immigrant
word.mean:
a. 移民的
n. 移民,侨民
word.lx: California has many immigrants from other states./r/n 加利福尼亚有许多来自其他州的移民。/r/n This country has assimilated immigrants from most of the countries of Europe./r/n 这个国家同化了从欧洲大多数国家迁来的移民。/r/n

word.name: immigration
word.lx: There are strict controls on immigration into this country./r/n 移民到这个国家有严格的限制。/r/n The immigration officer stamped my passport./r/n 移民官员在我的护照上盖了戳。/r/n

word.name: imminent
word.mean: a. 逼近的,即将发生的
word.lx: An announcement of further cuts in government expenditure is imminent./r/n 最近将发布进一步削减政府开支的公告。/r/n No one has given out a warning of the imminent danger./r/n 没有人对即将发生的危险发出警告。/r/n

word.name: immoral
word.lx: Some people still think it is immoral to have sex before marriage./r/n 有些人仍然认为婚前的性行为是不道德的。/r/n An evil, degrading, or immoral practice or habit./r/n 不道德行为，恶习邪恶的、堕落的或者不道德的行为或者习惯/r/n

word.name: immortal
word.mean:
a. 不朽的
n. 不朽的人物
word.lx: The little girl is very interested in the old legend of immortal creatures./r/n 小女孩对有关永生的精灵的古老传奇非常感兴趣。/r/n He left behind an immortal example to all posterity./r/n 他给后世留下了不朽的典范。/r/n

word.name: immune
word.mean:
a. 免除的,免疫的
n. 免疫者
word.lx: He seems to be immune to criticism./r/n 他似乎不受批评的影响。/r/n The criminal was told he would be immune if he helped the police./r/n 这个罪犯被告知，如果他协助警方就可以免于被起诉。/r/n

word.name: immunization
word.lx: German physiologist. He won a1901 Nobel Prize for work on serum immunization against diphtheria and tetanus./r/n 贝林，埃米尔·冯1854－1917德国生理学家，因其在抗白喉与破伤风血清免疫方面的工作获1901年诺贝尔奖/r/n

word.name: immunize
word.mean: v. 使免疫,赋予免疫性
word.lx: Have you been immunized (against smallpox) yet?/r/n 你接种过（抗天花）疫苗没有?/r/n

word.name: impair
word.mean:
v. 损害
[计算机] 损伤

word.name: impartial
word.mean: a. 公平的,不偏不倚的
word.lx: People in the city held the impartial judge in high regard./r/n 这个城市的人们都很尊敬这位公正的法官。/r/n Impartial; just; equitable./r/n 公平的；公正的；无私的/r/n

word.name: impatience
word.lx: She has impatience to wait for the bus./r/n 她没有耐心等公共汽车到来。/r/n The governments showed growing impatience at the unions./r/n 政府对工会表现得越来越不耐烦。/r/n

word.name: impatient
word.lx: He was impatient of any interruption./r/n 他对任何打扰都感到不耐烦。/r/n I am impatient for his arrival./r/n 我渴盼着他的到来。/r/n

word.name: impedance
word.lx: They use a bridge to measure the impedance of the transducer./r/n 他们用电桥来测量传感器的阻抗。/r/n The reciprocal of impedance./r/n 导纳阻抗的对等物/r/n

word.name: impede
word.lx: What impedes you to make progress?/r/n 什么事妨碍你取得进步？/r/n He impedes me to do the job well./r/n 他妨碍我把工作做好。/r/n

word.name: imperative
word.mean:
n. 命令,诫命,需要
a. 命令式的,急需的
word.lx: Prompt action is imperative./r/n 果断的行动是必要的。/r/n Job creation has become an imperative for the government./r/n 创造就业机会是政府必须做的事。/r/n

word.name: imperfect
word.mean: a. 有缺点的,半过去的,未完了时式的
word.lx: We live in an imperfect society./r/n 我们生活在一个不完美的社会中。/r/n Imperfect articles are rejected by our quality control./r/n 我们进行质量检验时，有缺陷的产品均予剔除。/r/n

word.name: imperial
word.lx: The imperial gallon is not the same as the US gallon./r/n 英制的加仑和与美制的容量不同。/r/n The time has come to abandon the romantic view of Imperial history./r/n 现在已经到了抛弃帝国历史的幻想的时候了。/r/n

word.name: imperialist
word.lx: Imperialist powers always tend to gobble up their weaker neighbors./r/n 帝国主义强国总是要想兼并弱小的邻国。/r/n Like other imperialists, they played naked big-power politics./r/n 和别的帝国主义者一样，他们也玩弄赤裸裸的强权政治。/r/n

word.name: implant
word.lx: Milton implanted in his daughters a great fear of, if not respect for, their father./r/n 密尔顿对他女儿们灌输的思想不是尊父，就是惧父。/r/n Implant a pacemaker; implant a drug capsule./r/n 植入一个起搏器；植入一个药物胶囊/r/n

word.name: implement
word.mean:
n. 工具,器具
vt. 实现,执行,使...生效
word.lx: What implements are needed for gardening?/r/n 园艺需要些什么工具？/r/n The government is implementing a new policy to help the unemployed./r/n 政府正在实施一项新的帮助失业者的政策。/r/n

word.name: implementation
word.mean:
n. 安装启用,实行,履行

工具

word.name: implicate
word.mean:
vt. 纠缠(使...绕住,暗示)
n. 包含的东西(暗指的东西)
word.lx: He was deeply implicated (ie involved) in the plot./r/n 他与该阴谋牵涉颇深./r/n His enemies tried to implicate him (in the murder)./r/n 他的仇人竭力想把他牵扯进谋杀案中./r/n

word.name: implicit
word.mean:
a. 暗示的,盲从的
[计算机] 隐式

word.name: implied
word.mean:
v. 意思是(包含)
a. 储蓄的

word.name: implore
word.lx: She implored me to do her a favor./r/n 她恳求我帮她这个忙。/r/n I implore you to go now./r/n 我恳求你现在就走吧。/r/n

word.name: implosion
word.mean: n. 内爆(从外向内的压力作用)

word.name: import
word.mean:
n. 进口
v. 进口,输入
vt. 输入,进口
word.lx: The government has an interest in importing scientific equipment./r/n 政府对引进科学设备非常感兴趣。/r/n The import of cotton goods went up sharply in 1986./r/n 在1986年，棉织品的进口猛增。/r/n

word.name: importance
word.lx: He is a man of great importance./r/n 他是一位非常重要的人物。/r/n We cannot emphasize too much the importance of learning English./r/n 我们再怎样强调学英文的重要性也不为过。/r/n

word.name: impost
word.mean:
n. 拱基,台轮,税款
v. 决定关税,分类课税
word.lx: My company impost general merchandise./r/n 我公司经营杂货进口业务。/r/n Either of the sides of an arch, curving down from the apex to an impost./r/n 梁腋，拱腋拱门上任意一个从拱顶到拱墩间的部分/r/n

word.name: impractical
word.mean: a. 不实用的(不切实际的,不能实行的)

word.name: impress
word.mean:
n. 印象,特徵,印记
v. 使...有印象,影响
word.lx: She impressed me as a scholar./r/n 她给我留下了学者的印象。/r/n My father impressed me with the importance of hard work./r/n 我父亲使我明白了努力工作的重要性。/r/n

word.name: impression
word.lx: What were your first impressions of Beijing?/r/n 你对北京的最初印象如何？/r/n I am surprised you got an unfavorable impression of him./r/n 我很惊讶你对他印象不佳。/r/n

word.name: impromptu
word.mean:
a. 即席的,即兴的
ad. 即兴的(地),无准备的(地)
word.lx: It usually take me more than three weeks to prepare a good impromptu speech./r/n 为了准备一则即席的好讲辞，我通常要三个星期以上。/r/n An impromptu visit broke up the long afternoon./r/n 突然的造访打破了漫长的午后时光/r/n

word.name: improper
word.mean: a. 不合适的,错误的,不道德的
word.lx: Laughing and joking are considered improper behaviors at a funeral./r/n 在葬礼上发笑或开玩笑是失礼的行为。/r/n You will make a mistake by using the improper tool./r/n 你用那种不恰当的工具会犯错误。/r/n

word.name: improve
word.mean: v. 改良,改善,增进,提高
word.lx: I want to improve my English./r/n 我想提高我的英语水平。/r/n I hope the weather will improve before Friday./r/n 我希望星期五之前天气会好转。/r/n

word.name: improvement
word.lx: There is need for improvement in your handwriting./r/n 你的书法需要改进。/r/n We all hope for an improvement in the weather./r/n 我们都希望天气好转。/r/n

word.name: impulse
word.mean:
n. 冲动
v. 推动
word.lx: He bought the house on an impulse./r/n 他凭一时冲动买下了这所房子。/r/n We were seized by a sudden impulse to run./r/n 我们身不由己突然想跑./r/n

word.name: impurity
word.lx: There are some impurities in food./r/n 食物中有一些杂质。/r/n Workers are removing impurities from silver./r/n 工人们正去除银中的杂质。/r/n

word.name: inability
word.lx: His inability to speak French puts him at a disadvantage./r/n 他不会说法语, 这使他很吃亏./r/n The persistent inability to conceive a child./r/n 不孕持续的不能怀孕的能力/r/n

word.name: inaccessible
word.mean: a. 难接近的,难达到的,难达成的

word.name: inaccurate
word.lx: Your information is inaccurate and your conclusion is therefore wrong./r/n 你的信息不准确，所以你的结论是错误的。/r/n

word.name: inadequate
word.mean: a. 不充分的,不适当的
word.lx: His explanation is inadequate./r/n 他的解释不充分。/r/n The plan, brilliant in its conception, failed because of inadequate preparation./r/n 那计划的构想倒是十分宏伟, 但终因准备不足而告吹./r/n

word.name: inapt
word.mean: a. 不适当的,不合适的

word.name: inasmuch
word.lx: He is a Dane inasmuch as he was born in Denmark./r/n 他按出生在丹麦来说是丹麦人。/r/n Inasmuch as; since./r/n 因为；由于/r/n

word.name: inaugural
word.lx: The inaugural session closed at17:10 local./r/n 开幕式在当地时间下午5点10分结束。/r/n

word.name: inaugurate
word.mean: v. 开创,举行...开幕典礼
word.lx: The city library was inaugurated by the mayor./r/n 市长主持了市图书馆的落成仪式。/r/n Mr. Clinton was inaugurated as the President of the U.S.A./r/n 克林顿就职美国总统。/r/n

word.name: inauguration
word.mean: n. 开始(开幕仪式,落成典礼,通车仪式)

word.name: inbound
word.mean:
a. 回内地的,归本国的
[计算机] 入站

word.name: incalculable
word.lx: He is a person of incalculable moods./r/n 他是个喜怒无常的人。/r/n He did incalculable harm to her reputation./r/n 他严重损害了她的声誉。/r/n

word.name: incapable
word.lx: The children seem to be totally incapable of working quietly by themselves./r/n 这些孩子似乎完全不能安静地自己做功课。/r/n That child seems incapable of keeping out of (ie not getting into) mischief./r/n 那个孩子不调皮捣蛋简直就受不了./r/n

word.name: incense
word.mean:
vt. 使...发怒(点香)
n. 香
word.lx: I was incensed at his rudeness./r/n 我对他的粗鲁感到愤怒。/r/n The monk burned a stick of incense in the incense burner./r/n 和尚在香炉里焚上一柱香。/r/n

word.name: inch
word.mean:
n. 英寸
v. 慢慢前进,慢慢移动
word.lx: Prices are inching down./r/n 物价在慢慢下降。/r/n How many inches of rain fell last year?/r/n 去年的雨量是多少英寸？/r/n

word.name: incidence
word.lx: The rate of incidence of a disease./r/n 发病率发生疾病的概率/r/n

word.name: incident
word.mean:
n. 事件
n. 插曲，事变
adj. 难免的，附带的
adj. (物理)入射的

word.name: incipient
word.mean: a. 起初的,发端的,初期的
word.lx: Detecting incipient tumors; an incipient personnel problem./r/n 发现早期肿瘤；刚出现的个人问题/r/n

word.name: incite
word.lx: They incited the workers to violence./r/n 他们煽动工人暴动。/r/n The captain was accused of inciting other officers to mutiny./r/n 该上尉被控煽动军官叛变。/r/n

word.name: inclination
word.lx: You always follow your own inclination instead of thinking of our feelings./r/n 你总是随心所欲而不考虑我们的情感。/r/n She is not free to follow her own inclination in the matter ofmarriage./r/n 她的婚姻不能自主./r/n

word.name: include
word.mean:
v. 包括,包含,连...在内
[计算机] 包括
word.lx: Is service included in the bill?/r/n 帐单中包含服务费吗？/r/n Please include me in the list./r/n 请把我列入名单中。/r/n

word.name: inclusion
word.lx: Inclusion in an insurance policy or protective plan./r/n 保险项目某一保险单或担保方案所包含的内容/r/n

word.name: inclusive
word.mean:
a. 包含...在内的
[计算机] 包括的
word.lx: Reserve double room June fourth to tenth inclusive./r/n 预订双人房间，六月四日至十日，共六晚，望订妥复电。/r/n The monthly rent is$20 inclusive of everything./r/n ＂月房租总共二十美元，包括一切费用在内。＂/r/n

word.name: income
word.lx: My monthly income was just over 200 pounds./r/n 我每月的收入是200多磅。/r/n The senate was censured for income tax evasion./r/n 这名参议员因逃避缴纳所得税而受到指责。/r/n

word.name: incoming
word.mean:
a. 引入的(入射的,增殖的)
n. 进来(来到,收入)

word.name: incompatible
word.mean: a. 不相容的,不能并存的,矛盾的
word.lx: The state or quality of being incompatible./r/n 不相容性不相容的状态或性质/r/n The incompatible offices of prosecutor and judge./r/n 检察官和法官的职位不能由一个人兼任/r/n

word.name: incomplete
word.mean: a. 不完全的,不完整的
word.lx: They only got an incomplete set of results from the experiment./r/n 他们从这次实验中只得到了一组不完整的答案。/r/n Her handbooks are incomplete./r/n 她的手册不完整。/r/n

word.name: incongruous
word.mean: a. 不协调的,不一致的,前后不一的
word.lx: Completely different; incongruous./r/n 异类的完全不同的；不一致的/r/n The state or quality of being incongruous./r/n 不相称自相矛盾的情况或性质/r/n

word.name: inconsistency
word.mean: n. 不一致,不调和,矛盾
word.lx: She noticed several minor inconsistencies in his argument./r/n 她觉察到他的论点有几处略微有些自相矛盾./r/n

word.name: inconsistent
word.lx: His accounts of the event were inconsistent./r/n 他对那件事情的说法前后不一致。/r/n Such behavior is inconsistent with her high-minded principles./r/n 这样的行为与她情操高尚的原则是矛盾的。/r/n

word.name: inconvenience
word.mean:
n. 不便,困难
v. 使...感不便,使...感困难
word.lx: I suffered great inconvenience./r/n 我感到极不方便。/r/n Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience we have caused./r/n 若有不便，敬请原谅。/r/n

word.name: inconvenient
word.lx: Living such a long way from the shops can be very inconvenient./r/n 住得离商店这么远会很不方便。/r/n They arrived at an inconvenient time ---we had just started the meal./r/n 他们来得很不是时候，我们刚开始吃饭。/r/n

word.name: incorporate
word.mean:
a. 合并的,公司组织的,具体化的
v. 合并,组成公司,具体表现
word.lx: The new car design incorporates all the latest safety features./r/n 新的汽车设计具备最新安全措施的一切特点。/r/n We had to incorporate for a company for tax reasons./r/n 鉴于税务原因，我们得组成公司。/r/n

word.name: incorporated
word.mean: 组成公司的,合成一体的

word.name: incorporation
word.mean: n. 结合,编入,团体组织

word.name: incorrect
word.lx: He gave an incorrect answer./r/n 他的答案是错误的。/r/n Not consistent with established truth, fact, or rule; incorrect./r/n 错误的，不正确的与既定真相、事实或原则不一致的；错误的/r/n

word.name: increase
word.mean:
n. 增加,增强,提高
v. 增加,提高
word.lx: They have increased the price of petrol again./r/n 他们又提高了汽油的价格。/r/n There was a steady increase in population./r/n 人口在不断增长中。/r/n

word.name: increasing
word.lx: The increasing unemployment caused social unrest./r/n 不断增加的失业引起了社会骚乱。/r/n She came up with a new idea for increasing sales./r/n 她想出了增加销售量的新主意./r/n

word.name: increasingly
word.lx: Increasingly, farm land is yielding to property development./r/n 地产的发展逐渐占据了农田./r/n Nowadays we rely increasingly on computers for help/to help us./r/n 现今人们越来越依赖计算机协助工作./r/n

word.name: incredulous
word.lx: He looked at me with an incredulous expression./r/n 他怀疑地看着我。/r/n She looked incredulous./r/n 她显出怀疑的样子。/r/n

word.name: increment
word.mean: n. 增加(增加物,增量,余差)
word.lx: Your salary will be 12000 a year, withannual increments of 500./r/n 你的年薪为12000英镑, 每年增加500英镑./r/n A finite increment in a variable./r/n 变量增量变量的有限增量/r/n

word.name: incremental
word.lx: A decrease, especially a small or incremental one./r/n 减少尤指小规模或逐步增加者的减少/r/n

word.name: incur
word.lx: The hunter incurred great danger in killing the wolf./r/n 猎人打狼时承受着巨大的危险。/r/n Incurred substantial losses during the stock market crash./r/n 在股票市场剧跌时蒙受了巨大的物质损失/r/n

word.name: incurable
word.mean:
a. 不能医治的,不能矫正的,无救的
n. 不治的病人,无救的人
word.lx: He was found in incurable disease./r/n 他被查出得了不治之症。/r/n The child has an incurable habit./r/n 那孩子有个无法矫正的习惯。/r/n
