word.name: indebted
word.lx: He was indebted to her for nursing him through pneumonia./r/n 他感激她护理好了他的肺炎。/r/n Owing something, such as gratitude, to another; indebted./r/n 受惠的欠别人东西，如人情；感激的/r/n

word.name: indebtedness
word.mean:
n. 感激
n. 受恩惠, 亏欠,债务
word.lx: Enclosed is a sight draft for￡26.10.5 on Messrs. Robert& Sons, which clears off our indebtedness to you./r/n 兹同函奉上以Robert父子公司为付款人，面额26。15英镑的即期汇票一张，用以清偿所欠贵方债务。/r/n

word.name: indeed
word.lx: A friend in need is a friend indeed./r/n 患难之交才是真朋友。/r/n The future of this firm will be very bleak indeed if we keep losing money./r/n 要是我们继续亏本的话，这家公司的前途会非常黯淡。/r/n

word.name: indefinitely
word.mean: ad. 无限地(在长时期内,无穷地)
word.lx: Pressure was put on them to delay the games indefinitely./r/n 他们受到压力，让他们把运动会无限期推迟下去。/r/n Continuing or lasting for an indefinitely long time./r/n 长期的，长久的继续或保持无限长的时间的/r/n

word.name: indelible
word.mean: a. 不能消除的,不能拭除的,难忘的

word.name: indemnify
word.lx: I will indemnify you for any expenses you may incur on my behalf./r/n 我会偿付你为了我而负担的任何花费。/r/n Everyone should learn to indemnify oneself against harm./r/n 每个人都应当，学会使自己不受伤害。/r/n

word.name: indemnity
word.lx: The victorious nations are demanding huge indemnities from their former enemies./r/n 战胜国要求战败国交付巨额赔款./r/n

word.name: indent
word.mean:
n. 契约,订货单
v. 切割成锯齿状,缩排,定货
[计算机] 缩排,缩进
word.lx: There are long indented coastlines in the South Sea./r/n 在南海有犬牙交错的海岸线。/r/n Please indent the first line of each paragraph./r/n 请于每段第一行缩格书写。/r/n

word.name: indentation
word.mean: n. 刻痕(印压,缩进,曲折岸)
word.lx: Having indentations that extend about halfway to the center, as in certain leaves./r/n 半裂的有锯齿状边缘的，延伸到距中心一半的距离，例如某些叶片/r/n

word.name: independence
word.lx: When a boy leaves college and begins to earn money he can live a life of independence./r/n 男孩子大学毕业后开始赚钱时，便可独立生活了。/r/n The condition or quality of being autonomous; independence./r/n 自主处于自主的状态或性质；独立/r/n

word.name: independent
word.mean:
a. 独立的,自主的
n. 独立派人士,无党派者
word.lx: She is so independent that she refused all pecuniary aid./r/n 她很独立，所以拒绝一切金钱上的资助。/r/n They are a proud and independent people./r/n 他们是独立自主的民族./r/n

word.name: index
word.mean:
n. 索引,指针,指数
v. 编入索引中,指出
word.lx: The book will be indexed in the next edition so as to make it more useful./r/n 为了使它更实用，这本书在下一版本中将编有索引。/r/n Do you know the price index in the city?/r/n 你知道这个城市的物价指数吗？/r/n

word.name: india
word.lx: India is to the south of China./r/n 印度在中国的南边。/r/n India used to be a dependency of Britain./r/n 印度过去是英国的附属地。/r/n

word.name: indian
word.mean:
a. 印度的
n. 印第安人,印度人
word.lx: Some Indians are friendly to us./r/n 有些印第安人对我们很友好。/r/n These Indian guest are familiar with this book./r/n 这些印度客人对这本书很熟悉。/r/n

word.name: indication
word.mean: n. 象征,迹象,指示,表示
word.lx: There are some indications that the prices will rise./r/n 有迹象表明物价将上涨。/r/n Did he give you any indication of his feelings?/r/n 他向你表示过他的感情吗？/r/n

word.name: indicative
word.mean: a. 指示的,象徵的,表示...的
word.lx: Is a large head indicative of high intelligence?/r/n 头大是不是表示智慧高？/r/n Their failure to act is indicative of their lack of interest in the problem./r/n 他们没有采取行动，表明他们对这个问题不感兴趣。/r/n

word.name: indicator
word.mean:
n. 指示器,指示剂
[计算机] 指示符

word.name: indifference
word.mean: n. 不重视,无兴趣,漠不关心

word.name: indigenous
word.mean: a. 该土地所固有的,土著的,国产的
word.lx: The indigenous population was soon displaced by the settlers./r/n 没过多久，外来移民就把当地人赶出了家园。/r/n Indians were the indigenous inhabitants of America./r/n 印第安人是美洲的土著居民。/r/n

word.name: indigestion
word.lx: He suffers from indigestion./r/n 他消化不良。/r/n She had an attack of indigestion yesterday./r/n 她昨天消化不良。/r/n

word.name: indignant
word.mean: a. 愤慨的,愤愤不平的
word.lx: He is indignant at the false accusation./r/n 他对被诬告愤愤不平。/r/n People are indignant by their shooting of innocent civilians./r/n 对于他们枪杀无辜平民，人们感到义愤填膺。/r/n

word.name: indignation
word.lx: I expressed my indignation at being unfairly dismissed./r/n 我对不公平地被解雇表示愤慨。/r/n They felt strong indignation against their teacher./r/n 他们对他们的老师感到强烈愤慨。/r/n

word.name: indirect
word.lx: The accident was the indirect result of the train being late./r/n 引发事故的间接原因是火车晚点。/r/n His indirect way of telling me to leave annoyed me./r/n 他那种不直截了当地让我离开的方式激怒了我。/r/n

word.name: indirectly
word.lx: In a furtive or circumspect manner; indirectly./r/n 行为鬼祟的或谨慎的；谨慎的/r/n I know Linda was only indirectly concerned in what took place./r/n 我知道所发生的事情间接涉及到琳达。/r/n

word.name: indiscriminate
word.mean: a. 无差别的,不分皂白的,杂陈的
word.lx: He was indiscriminate in his choice of friends./r/n 他择友不慎重。/r/n Savage, indiscriminate killing; a massacre./r/n 血洗野蛮的、不加区别的杀戳；大屠杀/r/n

word.name: indispensable
word.lx: Air, food and water are indispensable to life./r/n 空气，食物，水皆为生命不可缺者。/r/n A good dictionary is indispensable for learning a foreign language./r/n 学习外语离不开好的词典。/r/n

word.name: indistinct
word.lx: His indistinct speech made it impossible to understand him./r/n 他口齿不清, 无法听懂他的意思./r/n A low grumble or indistinct utterance./r/n 咕哝低声地嘟哝或者不清楚地说话/r/n

word.name: indoor
word.lx: All roams are equipped with electric heaters to keep indoor temperatures constant at15-2.0./r/n 所有的房间都装备有电炉以保持室内撮氏15－20度的常温。/r/n You stay indoors too much./r/n 你呆在室内的时间太多了。/r/n

word.name: indoors
word.lx: You stay indoors too much./r/n 你呆在室内的时间太多了。/r/n The heavy rain compelled us to stay indoors./r/n 大雨迫使我们呆在户内。/r/n

word.name: induction
word.mean:
n. 感应,感应现象
归纳法
word.lx: The centimeter-gram-second unit of magnetic induction, equal to one maxwell per square centimeter./r/n 高斯电磁感应的厘米－克－秒单位，等于每平方厘米的麦克斯韦尔/r/n

word.name: indulge
word.lx: It pleased me to indulge her wishes./r/n 放手满足她的欲望，使我感到高兴。/r/n He no longer indulged himself in smoking./r/n 他不再过度吸烟了。/r/n

word.name: industrial
word.lx: England is an advanced industrial country./r/n 英国是一个发达的工业国家。/r/n The industrial revolution had taken place in England first./r/n 工业革命首先在英国发生。/r/n

word.name: industrialize
word.lx: Many townships in the coastal area have begin to industrialize./r/n 沿海地区的许多乡镇已开始工业化。/r/n

word.name: industrialized
word.lx: The energy shortage of the world results partly from wasteful use by the industrialized countries./r/n 世界能源的短缺，部分是由于工业化国家挥霍能源而引起的。/r/n

word.name: industrious
word.lx: The Chinese are industrious people./r/n 中国人民是一个勤劳的民族。/r/n He is an industrious worker./r/n 他是一个勤劳的工人。/r/n

word.name: industry
word.mean: n. 工业,产业,勤勉,刻苦
word.lx: The tourist trade has become a real industry./r/n 旅游业已经成为真正的产业。/r/n Success comes with industry./r/n 成功来自勤奋。/r/n

word.name: ineffective
word.lx: One that is disappointingly ineffective or unsuccessful./r/n 无用的人或物的令人失望的无用的或不成功的人或物/r/n

word.name: inert
word.lx: She lay there inert, I thought she must be dead./r/n 她躺在那儿一动不动，我想她一定是死了。/r/n There is an inert management team in our company./r/n 我们公司的管理阶层死气沉沉。/r/n

word.name: inertia
word.lx: The inertia of an entrenched bureaucracy./r/n 平稳的官僚机构内存在的惰性/r/n Because of the sheer inertia of the system many badly needed reform is never introduced./r/n 纯粹是由於制度本身有惰性，很多事急需改革却从未实行。/r/n

word.name: inevitable
word.mean: a. 不可避免的,必然(发生)的

word.name: inevitably
word.lx: Of necessity; inevitably./r/n 必然必需地，不可避免地/r/n Inevitably, a quarrel followed between the two sides./r/n 双方随後不可避免地争吵起来。/r/n

word.name: inexact
word.mean: a. 不正确的,不确实的,不精密的
word.lx: Weather forecasting is an inexact science./r/n 天气预报是一门模糊的科学./r/n An inexact result adequate for a given purpose./r/n 近似值适用于给定目标的不精确结论/r/n

word.name: infancy
word.lx: Our new plan is still only in its infancy./r/n 我们的新计划仍处于摇篮阶段。/r/n Tadpoles are the infancy form of frogs./r/n 蝌蚪是青蛙的幼年形态。/r/n

word.name: infantile
word.mean: a. 婴儿的,幼稚的,初期的
word.lx: Her unconscious looks wander to her husband with infantile dependency./r/n 带著像婴儿般的依赖她不由自主地把目光投向了她的丈夫。/r/n An adult or a young person who behaves in an infantile way./r/n 孩子气的人行为表现出孩子气的成年人或年轻人/r/n

word.name: infantry
word.lx: The infantry are defending well./r/n 步兵防守甚佳。/r/n We have less infantry than the enemy./r/n 我们的步兵比敌军少。/r/n

word.name: infect
word.lx: The young teacher infected the whole class with her enthusiasm./r/n 这位年轻的老师以她的热诚感染了全班。/r/n The open wound soon became infected./r/n 裸露的伤口很快就受到了感染。/r/n

word.name: infected
word.lx: We should not be infected by erroneous ideas./r/n 我们不应该受错误观念的影响。/r/n He was infected with a latent infection./r/n 他被感染了一种潜伏性的传染病。/r/n

word.name: infection
word.lx: We should pay more attention to the infection of young people with dangerous ideologies./r/n 我们应该多注意危险的思想意识对年轻人的影响。/r/n People catch all kinds of infections in the winter./r/n 冬天人们易患多种传染病。/r/n

word.name: infectious
word.lx: He expressed infectious enthusiasm to his voters./r/n 他对他的选民表现出很有感染力的热情。/r/n When you have this anthema, you are still infectious./r/n 身上还有这种疹子就仍然有传染性。/r/n

word.name: infective
word.mean: a. 易传染的,传染性的

word.name: inferiority
word.lx: Some of them developed a great inferiority complex./r/n 他们有些人养成了严重的自卑感。/r/n Most people enjoy the inferiority of their best friend./r/n 大多数人都以他们最好的朋友的自卑感为乐。/r/n

word.name: inferiors
word.lx: Most inferior, as in quality, condition, or effect./r/n 最差的在质量、条件或效果方面最差的/r/n He is gracious to his inferiors./r/n 他待下级和蔼可亲。/r/n

word.name: infinite
word.mean:
a. 无限的,无穷的
n. 无限
word.lx: Teaching little children takes infinite patience./r/n 教幼儿需有极大的耐心。/r/n The number of positive numbers is infinite./r/n 正数的数目是无穷的。/r/n

word.name: infinitely
word.lx: The particles in an atom are infinitely small./r/n 原子里的粒子极小./r/n That was infinitely better than his last film./r/n 这比他上一部电影不知胜过多少倍。/r/n

word.name: infinitive
word.mean:
n. 不定词
a. 不定词的

word.name: infinity
word.lx: Multiply y by infinity./r/n 以无穷数乘y./r/n Can you represent infinity to yourself?/r/n 你能在心想像无限吗？/r/n

word.name: infirmary
word.mean:
n. 虚弱,弱点
治疗室

word.name: inflame
word.lx: He was inflamed with anger./r/n 他满腔怒火。/r/n The setting sun inflames the sky./r/n 落日映红天空。/r/n

word.name: inflammable
word.lx: Petrol is highly inflammable./r/n 汽油是高度易燃的。/r/n

word.name: inflammation
word.lx: He has an inflammation of the lungs./r/n 他得了肺炎。/r/n The discharge that is characteristic of this inflammation./r/n 粘膜液体排出物具有这种炎症特征的排出物/r/n

word.name: inflate
word.mean:
v. 使膨胀,使得意,使通货膨胀
[计算机] 使膨胀
word.lx: With a supply of compressed air the large balloon inflated in a matter of seconds./r/n 大气球注入压缩空气後, 几秒钟就充足了气./r/n

word.name: inflation
word.lx: The government is determined to bring down inflation./r/n 政府决心把通货膨胀率降低。/r/n There appears to be a growing discontent about inflation./r/n 对通货膨胀似乎有一种日渐增长的不满情绪。/r/n

word.name: inflexible
word.mean: a. 不屈曲的,不屈挠的,顽固的
word.lx: Stubbornly prejudiced, narrow-minded, or inflexible./r/n 思想偏狭顽固的、迂腐的或守旧的/r/n Not bending; inflexible./r/n 坚挺的不能弯曲的；坚挺的/r/n

word.name: influence
word.mean:
v. 影响,感化
n. 影响力,感化力,势力,权势
word.lx: He is a man of some influence in the government circles./r/n 他是个在政府内有一定势力的人。/r/n Listening to the music has a calming influence on her./r/n 听音乐对她起了一种镇静的作用。/r/n

word.name: influential
word.mean: a. 有权势的,有影响的

word.name: influenza
word.lx: We all had influenza last night./r/n 我们昨晚都患了流感。/r/n I have an influenza epidemic./r/n 我得了流行性感冒。/r/n

word.name: influx
word.mean:
n. 流入,河口,辐辏
涌进;汇集[C][S1]
an influx of customers
顾客的蜂拥而来
word.lx: Textile workers favoured protection because they feared an influx of cheap cloth./r/n 纺织工人拥护贸易保护措施, 因为他们担心涌入廉价纺织品./r/n

word.name: info
word.lx: Please turn the article info English./r/n 请把这篇文章译成英语。/r/n

word.name: informal
word.lx: We had an informal meeting./r/n 我们做了非正式的会晤。/r/n These words are informal./r/n 这些词是非正式用语。/r/n

word.name: informative
word.mean: a. 情报的,使知道消息的,见闻广博的

word.name: infrared
word.mean:
a. 红外线的
n. 红外线(的)

word.name: infrastructure
word.mean: n. 下部构造,下部组织,基础结构，基础设施
word.lx: Our city offer overseas in vesture fair service for production aside from infrastructure./r/n 我市除了向外国投资者提供基础设施外，还提供良好的生产服务设施。/r/n

word.name: infrequent
word.mean: a. 稀少的,珍贵的,罕见的

word.name: infringe
word.lx: The publishing house infringed his copyright./r/n 出版社侵犯了他的版权。/r/n They infringed on her rights./r/n 他们侵犯了她的权力。/r/n

word.name: infringement
word.lx: That law is an out-and-out infringement of our civil rights./r/n （那项法令完全侵犯了我们的公民权。）/r/n

word.name: ingenious
word.mean: a. 机灵的,精制的,有独创性的
word.lx: This book shows that he is an ingenious author./r/n 这本书表明他是一个有创造力的作家。/r/n I have an ingenious contrivance to get her to sign the document without reading it./r/n 我有一条不经她过目就签署文件的妙计。/r/n

word.name: ingenuity
word.mean: n. 智巧,创造力,精巧的设计

word.name: ingest
word.lx: Material, usually of plant or animal origin, that contains or consists of essential body nutrients, such as carbohydrates, fats, proteins, vitamins, or minerals, and is ingested and assimilated by an organism to produce energy, stimulate growth, and main

word.name: ingredient
word.lx: There is a list of ingredients on the side of the packet./r/n 包装袋的边上印有所含配料表。/r/n A source of nourishment, especially a nourishing ingredient in a food./r/n 营养品，滋养物营养的来源，尤指食物中的营养成分/r/n

word.name: inhabit
word.lx: Only a few people inhabited the island./r/n 只有少数人在这个岛上居住。/r/n Fish inhabit the sea./r/n 鱼栖息于海中。/r/n

word.name: inhabitant
word.lx: He lives in a city with 100000 inhabitants./r/n 他住在一个有十万居民的城市。/r/n A native or inhabitant of Elam./r/n 埃兰人埃兰本地人或居民/r/n

word.name: inhale
word.lx: He inhaled deeply./r/n 他深深地吸了口气。/r/n Follow me please, inhale! exhale!/r/n 跟我做，吸气!呼气!/r/n

word.name: inherent
word.lx: There is an inherent weakness in the design./r/n 这设计本身存在弱点。/r/n Inherent quality of character and temperament./r/n 内在的气质性格、脾气的内在气质/r/n

word.name: inheritance
word.lx: On the maternal side his inheritance was a happy one./r/n 他从母方接受的遗传是良好的。/r/n He was cheated (out) of his rightful inheritance./r/n 他依法应得的遗产被人骗走了./r/n

word.name: inhibit
word.mean:
v. 禁止,抑制
[计算机] 禁止
word.lx: The act of inhibiting or the state of being inhibited./r/n 禁止禁止的动作或被禁止的状态/r/n A chemical substance used to destroy or inhibit the growth of plants, especially weeds./r/n 灭草剂用来摧毁或抑制植物，尤指杂草的生长的化学物质/r/n

word.name: inhibited
word.mean: a. 羞怯的, 内向的

word.name: initialization
word.lx: The initialization of a data medium such that a particular computer system can store data in and subsequently retrieve data from the medium./r/n 数据媒体的初始化，使某一特定计算机系统能将数据存在媒体中，随后又可从该媒体中检索出来。/r/n

word.name: initiate
word.mean:
n. 入会,开始
a. 新加入的
vt. 开始,创始,启蒙

word.name: initiator
word.mean: n. 创始者,首倡者,发起人

word.name: inject
word.lx: His medicine is a drug that can be injected or taken by mouth./r/n 他的药可以注射或口服。/r/n The nurse injected penicillin into her arm./r/n 护士给她的胳膊注射了青霉素。/r/n

word.name: injection
word.lx: The doctor gave her an injection to alleviate the pain./r/n 医生给她注射以减轻疼痛./r/n I had a bad reaction after my typhoid injection./r/n 我注射伤寒针剂後产生了不良反应。/r/n

word.name: injure
word.lx: She was injured badly in the accident./r/n 她在事故中受重伤。/r/n He injured his left hand in a fire./r/n 他在火灾中伤了左手。/r/n

word.name: injury
word.lx: He suffered serious injuries to the arms and legs./r/n 他的双臂和双腿严重受伤。/r/n The injury to their key player could be a decisive factor in the game./r/n 他们主力队员受伤可能是这场比赛胜负的决定性因素。/r/n

word.name: injustice
word.lx: Justice will triumph over injustice./r/n 正义必将战胜非正义。/r/n Wherever there is injustice, we try to help./r/n 凡有不公正的地方, 我们都竭力相助匡正./r/n

word.name: ink
word.lx: The printing ink has been used up./r/n 印刷油墨用光了。/r/n The little boy stained his fingers with ink./r/n 小男孩的手指让墨水给染脏了。/r/n

word.name: inland
word.lx: Beijing is an inland city./r/n 北京是一个内陆城市。/r/n Situated away from the sea; inland./r/n 内河的远离海的；内陆的/r/n

word.name: inn
word.lx: It was raining; they had to stay in the inn the whole day./r/n 下雨了，他们不得不在旅馆里待了一整天。/r/n They put up at an inn for the night./r/n 他们在一家小客栈里过夜./r/n

word.name: inner
word.mean:
a. 内部的,里面的,内心的
n. 里面,内部
word.lx: She went into the inner room to change her dress./r/n 她走进内室去换衣服。/r/n Her artificial gaiety disguised an inner sadness./r/n 她以矫揉造作的快乐掩饰著内心的悲痛./r/n

word.name: innocence
word.mean: n. 无罪,无知,天真无邪
word.lx: Her innocence is only an imitation./r/n 她的天真只是一种伪装。/r/n The accused man proved his innocence of crime./r/n 被告人经证实无罪。/r/n

word.name: innocent
word.mean: a. 无罪的,不懂事的,无知的,无辜的
word.lx: He was charged with murder but found innocent later./r/n 他被控杀人，但后来发现他是无罪的。/r/n She asserted that he was innocent./r/n 她断言，他是无罪的。/r/n

word.name: innovation
word.lx: It was a period of innovation./r/n 这是革新时期。/r/n After being led by him, one innovation after another are showing./r/n 从他领导后，一个又一个革新项目出现了。/r/n

word.name: inquire
word.lx: I inquired of him about their work./r/n 我向他了解他们的工作情况。/r/n We inquired the way of a boy./r/n 我们向一个男孩问路。/r/n

word.name: inquiry
word.mean: n. 打听,询问,调查,查问
word.lx: The police are making inquiries about the crime./r/n 警方正在询问罪案的情况。/r/n The inquiry was critical of her work./r/n 该项调查对她的工作提出了批评。/r/n

word.name: Ins
word.lx: I know all the ins and outs of our school building./r/n 我知道我们教学大楼的一切情况。/r/n The room is 15 feet in length and 10 feet in breadth./r/n 这房间长15英尺，宽10英尺。/r/n

word.name: insane
word.mean: a. 疯狂的,精神错乱的
word.lx: I have an insane desire to finish that thing./r/n 我疯狂地渴望去完成那件事。/r/n That person is insane./r/n 那人精神错乱。/r/n

word.name: inscribing
word.mean: n. 登记,买或卖股票,注册

word.name: insert
word.mean:
n. 插入物
v. 插入
word.lx: She inserted the key into the lock./r/n 她把钥匙插入锁中。/r/n A triangular insert, as in the seam of a garment, for added strength or expansion./r/n 衬料一种三角形的插入物，在衣服的缝合处，为加固或加大衣服而用/r/n

word.name: insertion
word.lx: There are many insertions of advertisement in the newspapers./r/n 报纸上有很多插入的广告。/r/n He put a coin into the insertion slot./r/n 他往投币孔投入一枚硬币。/r/n

word.name: inside
word.mean:
a. 里面的
ad. 在里面
n. 内部
prep. 在...里面
word.lx: This lock can only be opened from the inside./r/n 这把锁只能从里面打开。/r/n We have to play inside because it is raining./r/n 因为天下雨，我们不得不在屋里玩。/r/n

word.name: insider
word.mean: n. 内部的人,会员,知道内情的人

word.name: insignificant
word.mean: a. 无关紧要的,可忽略的
word.lx: His hometown is an insignificant city on the map./r/n 他的家乡只是地图上一个不起眼的小城。/r/n It is a waste of time to listen to his insignificant talk./r/n 听他那些废话纯属浪费时间。/r/n

word.name: insipid
word.lx: Sickening or insipid in taste./r/n （味道上）令人作呕的，淡而无味的/r/n Insipid; weak; wishy-washy./r/n 无味的；缺乏生气的；软弱无力的/r/n

word.name: insist
word.lx: He insisted on paying for the meal./r/n 他坚持要付饭钱。/r/n Since you insist, I must amend the letter of credit./r/n 既然你坚持，我就只好修改信用证。/r/n

word.name: insolent
word.lx: His staff is insolent to our manager./r/n 他的员工对我们的经理很无礼。/r/n You insolent young puppy!/r/n 你这个目中无人的小子!/r/n

word.name: insolvent
word.mean:
a. 无力偿还的,破产的
n. 无力还偿者,破产者

word.name: inspect
word.mean: v. 检查,调查,监查,检阅

word.name: inspection
word.lx: The soldiers lined up for their daily inspection by their officers./r/n 士兵们列队接受长官的日常检阅。/r/n I gave the radio a thorough inspection before buying it./r/n 我把收音机彻底检查了一遍才买了下来。/r/n

word.name: inspector
word.lx: A ticket inspector got on the train./r/n 查票员上了火车。/r/n We had sundry visitations from the Tax Inspector./r/n 税务检查员常来我们这里, 不胜其烦./r/n

word.name: inspiration
word.lx: His wife was a constant inspiration to him./r/n 他的妻子经常鼓励他。/r/n Many poets and artists have drawn their inspiration from nature./r/n 许多诗人和艺术家从大自然中获得他们的灵感。/r/n

word.name: inspire
word.lx: His best music was inspired by the memory of his mother./r/n 他最好的乐曲创作灵感来自怀念他的母亲。/r/n The sight inspired him with nostalgia./r/n 这景象激起了他的怀旧之情。/r/n

word.name: inspired
word.mean: a. 有创见的,有灵感的
word.lx: His best music was inspired by the memory of his mother./r/n 他最好的乐曲创作灵感来自怀念他的母亲。/r/n Never before have they been so inspired and so daring as at present./r/n 从来没有看见他们像现在这样精神振奋，意气风发。/r/n

word.name: inspiring
word.lx: He possesses the quality of inspiring confidence./r/n 他有本事能让别人信任他./r/n The inspiring music acted on the emotions of the students./r/n 那激昂的音乐使学生们情绪激昂。/r/n

word.name: instability
word.mean: n. 不安定,不稳定,基础薄弱
word.lx: Insecurity or instability./r/n 不安全或不稳定/r/n The riot can be considered a symptom of political instability./r/n 这次暴动可看作是政治上不稳定的征兆。/r/n

word.name: install
word.mean:
v. 安装,安置,使...就职
n.[计算机] 安装,DOS命令 : 装入结束且驻留软件
word.lx: The workers are installing a heating system./r/n 工人们正在安装供暖系统。/r/n She installed her air-conditioner without help./r/n 没请别人帮助，她自己安装了空调。/r/n

word.name: installment
word.mean: n. 分期付款(安装,一期)
word.lx: We will pay for houses by monthly installments./r/n 我们将按月分期付款买房。/r/n When will you pay the last installment of the loan?/r/n 你什么时候付清最后一期分期贷款？/r/n

word.name: instalment
word.mean: n. 就职,装设,分期付款
word.lx: We will pay for houses by monthly instalments./r/n 我们将按月分期付款买房。/r/n When will you pay the last instalment of the loan?/r/n 你什么时候付清最后一期分期贷款？/r/n

word.name: instance
word.mean:
n. 例子
v. 举...为例,举例说明
word.lx: This is only one instance out of many./r/n 这不过是许多例子中的一个。/r/n He came at our instance./r/n 他应我们的请求而来。/r/n

word.name: instantaneous
word.mean:
a. 瞬间的,即刻的
ad. 瞬间,霎时
word.lx: Relief was instantaneous./r/n 痛苦的消除是瞬间的事/r/n Death is instantaneous in a fatal accident./r/n 在致命的事故中，死亡是即刻发生的。/r/n

word.name: instead
word.lx: I gave him advice instead of money./r/n 我给了他忠告，而不是钱。/r/n I made this cake specially, with brown sugar instead of white./r/n 我特别地以红糖代替白糖做了这个蛋糕。/r/n

word.name: instinct
word.mean:
a. 充满的
n. 本能,天性,直觉
word.lx: Birds learn to fly by instinct./r/n 鸟类学习飞翔是出于本能。/r/n Instinct is not always a good guide./r/n 凭本能行事不一定都对./r/n

word.name: instinctive
word.lx: Running away is our instinctive reaction when we meet danger./r/n 遇到危险时，我们的本能反应就是跑开。/r/n Set aside for a moment your instinctive dislike of the man./r/n 暂且不要考虑你从直觉上憎恶他这一因素./r/n

word.name: institute
word.mean:
n. 学会,学院,协会
v. 创立,开始,制定
word.lx: He graduated from a famous foreign language institute./r/n 他毕业于一所知名的外语学院。/r/n The police instituted an inquiry into the cause of the accident./r/n 警方开始调查事故的原因。/r/n

word.name: institution
word.lx: Marriage is an institution in most societies./r/n 婚姻是大多数社会早已确立的制度。/r/n A trustee is a member of managing business affairs of an institution./r/n 理事是机构管理班子中的成员。/r/n

word.name: instruct
word.mean:
v. 教,命令,指导
[计算机] 指示
word.lx: His uncle instructed him in French./r/n 他的叔叔教他法语。/r/n I have been instructed by my agent that you still owe me 100 pounds./r/n 我的代理人通知我，你还欠我100磅。/r/n

word.name: instruction
word.mean: n. 说明,须知,指令,教学
word.lx: The teacher gave them instructions to arrive early tomorrow morning./r/n 老师命令他们明天早晨要早到。/r/n The catechism is used for religious instruction./r/n 教义问答法常用于宗教教学。/r/n

word.name: instructor
word.lx: Our driving instructor is very kind./r/n 我们的驾驶教练非常和善。/r/n Our instructor told us to keep the room locked./r/n 我们的教导员告诉我们把那间房锁上。/r/n

word.name: instrument
word.mean: n. 乐器,工具,仪器,器械
word.lx: The hospital imported some surgical instruments./r/n 医院进口了一些外科器械。/r/n The organization he had built up eventually became the instrument of his downfall./r/n 他创建起来的组织到头来却成为促使他倒台的根本原因了。/r/n

word.name: instrumental
word.mean: a. 仪器的,器具的,可做为手段的
word.lx: I was instrumental in catching the criminal./r/n 我曾经协助捉拿这罪犯。/r/n Our artistic director was instrumental in persuading the orchestra to come./r/n 我们的艺术指导帮助请来管弦乐队。/r/n

word.name: instrumentation
word.lx: The instrumentation is particularly fine./r/n 这首器乐曲编得特别细致./r/n

word.name: insulate
word.mean:
v. 使...绝缘,隔离
[计算机] 绝缘
word.lx: It is important to insulate the furnace from any neighbouring woodwork with brick and asbestos./r/n 用砖和石棉把炉子与周围所有的木制品隔开，这很重要。/r/n

word.name: insulation
word.lx: Loss of electric current as a result of faulty insulation./r/n 漏电由于绝缘不好而导致的电流流失/r/n Cork is often used for insulation./r/n 栓皮经常用作绝缘材料./r/n

word.name: insult
word.lx: He shouted insults at the boy who had kicked him./r/n 他大声辱骂那个踢了他的男孩。/r/n He felt deeply insulted./r/n 他觉得受了大辱。/r/n

word.name: insurance
word.lx: He pays out 100 dollars in insurance premiums every year./r/n 他每年付保险费一百美元。/r/n The accident prompted her to renew her insurance./r/n 这一事故促使她为投保续期./r/n

word.name: insure
word.lx: My house is insured against fire./r/n 我的房子保了火险。/r/n I am insured for all risks./r/n 我给自己保了综合险。/r/n

word.name: intact
word.mean: a. 尚未被人碰过的,原封不动的,完整的
word.lx: Few buildings survived the bombing raids intact./r/n 空袭过後幸存的建筑物绝无仅有。/r/n His honor remained intact./r/n 他的名誉完整无损。/r/n

word.name: intake
word.mean: n. 引入口,入口,通风口
word.lx: Our school is gearing up for an increased intake of pupils./r/n 我们学校正在作好准备以接受更多的学生。/r/n An opening providing a means of entrance or intake./r/n 入口公开地提供入场的方式或入口/r/n

word.name: intangible
word.mean: a. 难以明了的,无形的

word.name: integer
word.mean:
n. 完整的事物,整体,整数
[计算机] 整数
word.lx: Designating an integer not divisible by two, such as1, 3, and5./r/n 奇数的不能被2整除的整数，如1，3和5/r/n

word.name: integral
word.mean:
a. 构成整体所必需的,完整的
n. [数学] 积分, 完整, 部分

word.name: integrate
word.mean:
v. 整合,使...成整体
a. 真诚的

word.name: integrated
word.mean:
a. 整合的
v. 整合
vbl. 整合
word.lx: I integrated your suggestion with my plan./r/n 你的建议使我的计划完整了。/r/n I integrated your suggestions into my plans and this has improved them./r/n 我把你的建议采纳到我的计划中，由此改进了我的计划。/r/n

word.name: integrity
word.mean: n. 诚实,正直,完整,完善
word.lx: You can trust him; he is a man of complete integrity./r/n 你可以相信他，他是一个刚正不阿的人。/r/n Our integrity as a nation is threatened by these separatist forces./r/n 我们国家的完整受到了这些分裂主义势力的威胁。/r/n

word.name: intellect
word.mean: n. 智力，思维逻辑领悟力，理解力/nn. 知识份子，智力高的人，才智超群的人
word.lx: Intellect distinguishes humans from other animals./r/n 人类与禽兽之别就在于具有思维能力。/r/n He is a child of great intellect./r/n 他是个极具聪明才智的男孩。/r/n

word.name: intelligence
word.mean:
n. 理解力,智力
n. 情报,情报工作,情报机关
word.lx: His intelligence quotient is very high./r/n 他的智商很高。/r/n You should use your intelligence./r/n 你应该发挥你的聪明才智。/r/n

word.name: intelligent
word.lx: The student gave an intelligent answer./r/n 这个学生给出了一个聪明的回答。/r/n Someone as intelligent as you should go far./r/n 像你这样聪明的人一定很有作为。/r/n

word.name: intelligible
word.mean: a. 可理解的,易理解的,明了的
word.lx: His theory is not intelligible to us./r/n 他的理论我们无法理解。/r/n Readily comprehended or understood; intelligible./r/n 易懂的易于理解或明白的；易懂的/r/n

word.name: intense
word.mean: a. 非常的,强烈的,紧张的,热情的
word.lx: I did not go to the cinema because of the intense cold./r/n 我因为严寒没出去看电影。/r/n Intense heat or glow, as of fire./r/n 灼光强烈的热度或光芒，如火（一般）/r/n

word.name: intensify
word.mean: vt. 增强(强化,加剧,加厚,增高银影密度)
word.lx: The terrorists have intensified their bombing campaign./r/n 恐怖分子增加了炸弹爆炸活动./r/n Her anger intensified./r/n 她更加生气了./r/n

word.name: intensity
word.mean: n. 激烈,强度,强烈,剧烈
word.lx: The pain increased in intensity./r/n 疼痛越来越剧烈。/r/n The poem showed great intensity of feeling./r/n 这首诗表现出强烈的激情。/r/n

word.name: intensive
word.mean: a. 集中的,强化的,精细的,深入的
word.lx: Intensive efforts are being made to resolve the dispute./r/n 现正全力以赴来解决这场纠纷。/r/n This patient requires intensive care./r/n 该病人需要加强护理。/r/n

word.name: intent
word.mean:
n. 意图,目的,意向
a. 专心的,决心的,热心的
word.lx: She behaved foolishly but with good intent./r/n 她的行为很蠢，但却是好意的。/r/n Your intent gaze made her uncomfortable./r/n 你的注目凝视使她感到不自在。/r/n

word.name: intention
word.lx: They have no intention of getting married at present./r/n 他们目前没有结婚的打算。/r/n Have you heard of her intention to resign?/r/n 你听到她打算辞职的传闻了吗？/r/n

word.name: intentional
word.mean: a. 企图的,策划的,故意的

word.name: interact
word.mean: v. 相互作用,相互影响
word.lx: Mother and baby interact in a very complex way./r/n 母亲与婴儿以非常复杂的方式相互影响。/r/n The region occupied by a group of interacting organisms./r/n 共生区由一群相互作用的生物体占据的区域/r/n

word.name: interaction
word.mean: n. 相互作用,相互影响

word.name: intercept
word.mean:
n. 截取,妨碍,截距
v. 拦截,阻止,截取
[计算机] 截断
word.lx: Reporters intercepted him as he tried to leave by the rear entrance./r/n 他想从后门溜走，记者把他截住了。/r/n The police had been intercepting my mails./r/n 警方一直截查我的邮件。/r/n

word.name: intercepting
word.lx: The police had been intercepting my mails./r/n 警方一直截查我的邮件。/r/n Effective defence is a matter of intercepting their missiles before they can reach us./r/n 有效的防卫是不待对方导弹击中我们而先行将其拦截./r/n

word.name: interchange
word.mean:
n. 立体交叉道,互换
v. 交换,互换
[计算机] 互换
word.lx: We should leave the motorway at the next interchange./r/n 我们应该在下一个立体交叉道驶离高速公路。/r/n The chief interchanged the diamond with some pieces of glass./r/n 那首领拿一些玻璃块替换了那些钻石。/r/n

word.name: interconnections
word.mean: n. 相互连接,彼此连系

word.name: intercourse
word.mean: n. 交往,交流,中断期间
word.lx: English is more widespread and more used in international intercourse than German./r/n 英语在国际交往中比德语使用得更为广泛。/r/n A friendly intercourse has been opened between the two countries./r/n 两国已开始了亲密的往来。/r/n

word.name: interest
word.mean:
n. 兴趣,嗜好,利息
v. 使...感兴趣
word.lx: His two great interests in life are music and painting./r/n 音乐和绘画是他生活中的两大嗜好。/r/n Politics has always interested me./r/n 我一直对政治学有兴趣。/r/n

word.name: interesting
word.lx: This book is interesting./r/n 这本书很有趣。/r/n I think these interesting old customs should be preserved./r/n 我认为这些有趣的旧习俗应该保存下去。/r/n

word.name: interface
word.mean:
n. 界面,接触面
[计算机] 界面,接口

word.name: interference
word.mean:
n. 冲突,干涉
[计算机] 于涉
word.lx: I resented his interference in my affairs./r/n 我很不满他干预我的私事。/r/n The television station apologized for the interference, which was due to bad weather conditions./r/n 电视台为出现的干扰表示歉意，那是由于恶劣的天气状况造成的。/r/n

word.name: interlace
word.mean: v. 使交织,使组合,使交错
word.lx: The interlacing branches on the picture look poetic./r/n 图上交错的树枝看起来很有诗意。/r/n Her mother interlaces her hair with ribbons./r/n 母亲用缎带把她的头发扎起来。/r/n

word.name: interleave
word.lx: The exercise book has plain pages interleaved between its lined ones/has lined pages interleaved with plain ones./r/n 横格练习簿的页间已插入空白页./r/n

word.name: interlink
word.lx: Our feelings are interlinked./r/n 我们的感情是相通的。/r/n

word.name: intermediary
word.mean:
n. 仲裁者,调解者,媒介物
a. 中间的,媒介的
[计算机] 媒介
word.lx: They disliked each other too much to meet, so they conducted all their business through an intermediary./r/n 他们彼此交恶不愿相见, 有事均通过中间人处理./r/n

word.name: intermittent
word.mean: a. 间歇的,断断续续的
word.lx: They saw the intermittent flashes from a lighthouse./r/n 他们看见了灯塔发出一闪一灭的光。/r/n He has intermittent bursts of interest./r/n 他的兴趣是一阵阵的。/r/n

word.name: intern
word.lx: I worked as an intern in that firm last summer./r/n 去年夏天我在那家商行实习。/r/n

word.name: internal
word.lx: He worked in internal trade./r/n 他的工作是做国内贸易。/r/n Internal and external use of water as a therapeutic treatment for all forms of disease./r/n 水疗法水的外用和内服，作为各种病症的治疗方法/r/n

word.name: internationalize
word.lx: Should the Suezand Panama Canals be internationalized?/r/n 苏伊士运河和巴拿马运河应归国际共管吗?/r/n

word.name: interplanetary
word.mean: a. 太阳系内的,行星间的

word.name: interpret
word.mean:
v. 解释,演出,翻译
[计算机] 解释
word.lx: Poetry helps to interpret life./r/n 诗有助于阐释人生的意义。/r/n We interpreted his silence as a refusal./r/n 我们认为他的沉默是拒绝的表示。/r/n

word.name: interrelate
word.lx: Many would say that crime and poverty interrelate/are interrelated (with one another)./r/n 很多人都说犯罪与贫穷是密切相关的./r/n

word.name: interrelated
word.lx: Many would say that crime and poverty interrelate/are interrelated (with one another)./r/n 很多人都说犯罪与贫穷是密切相关的./r/n All things are interrelated and interact on each other./r/n 一切事物互相联系并互相作用。/r/n

word.name: interruption
word.mean: n. 打岔,中断,中断之事
word.lx: Numerous interruptions have prevented me from finishing my work./r/n 我屡遭搅扰以致工作未能完成。/r/n The interruption of electricity made us unable to do anything./r/n 电力的中断让我们什么也不能做。/r/n

word.name: intersection
word.mean:
n. 交集,十字路口,交叉点
[计算机] 交集
word.lx: Cut to the left at the next intersection./r/n 在下一个十字路口向左急转/r/n The point of intersection of a driveway and a road, especially in a rural area./r/n 交汇口车行道和街道的交叉点，尤指在农村地区/r/n

word.name: interstitial
word.mean: a. 组织间隙的,间质的

word.name: intervene
word.mean:
v. 插入,调停,干涉
[计算机] 介入
word.lx: I was alone during intervening years./r/n 这期间的若干年里，我一直一个人。/r/n I will come if nothing intervenes./r/n 假若没有别的事，我一定来。/r/n

word.name: interview
word.mean:
n. 面谈,访问,接见
v. 接见,会谈

word.name: intestinal
word.lx: Intestinal obstruction causing colic, vomiting, and constipation./r/n 肠阻塞造成腹绞痛、呕吐和便秘的肠道堵塞/r/n An agent that destroys or causes the expulsion of parasitic intestinal worms./r/n 驱肠虫剂，灭肠虫剂可消灭或驱除肠内寄生虫的药物/r/n

word.name: intestine
word.mean:
a. 国内的,内部的
n. 肠

word.name: intimate
word.mean:
a. 亲密的,私人的,秘密的
v. 暗示,通知,告诉
word.lx: She is my intimate friend./r/n 她是我的密友。/r/n He should listen to his intimate feelings./r/n 人应当倾听自己的内心感觉。/r/n

word.name: intimidate
word.lx: The first strike capacity is intended mainly to intimidate adversary./r/n 第一次攻击的武力主要是用来吓阻敌方的。/r/n

word.name: into
word.lx: They broke into his store./r/n 他们闯入他的店里。/r/n She developed into a beautiful woman./r/n 她长成了一位漂亮的女人。/r/n

word.name: intonation
word.lx: Russian-born American violinist noted for his pure intonation and interpretive sense./r/n 津巴利斯特，埃弗莱姆1889－1985俄裔美国小提琴家，他以纯正的音调和解释的能力而著名/r/n Good intonation./r/n 语调很好。/r/n

word.name: intoxicate
word.lx: He was fined for driving while intoxicated./r/n 他因醉酒开车被罚款。/r/n The businessman was intoxicated by his success./r/n 这个商人因为成功而狂喜。/r/n

word.name: intricate
word.mean: a. 复杂的,错综的,缠结的,难懂的
word.lx: I was unable to find out the intricate windings of the labyrinth./r/n 我无法找出迷宫中扑朔迷离的路线。/r/n This is a novel with an intricate plot./r/n 这是一本情节错综复杂的小说。/r/n

word.name: intrigue
word.mean:
n. 阴谋,复杂的事
v. 密谋,激起...的兴趣,私通
word.lx: She was intriguing with her sister against her mother./r/n 她和妹妹串通捣鬼和母亲作对。/r/n Some of the members had been intriguing to get the secretary dismissed./r/n 有些人一直密谋想让老板把秘书解雇。/r/n

word.name: introduce
word.lx: He introduced a motion to the Congress./r/n 他向国会提交了一份议案。/r/n She introduced me to her friend./r/n 她把我介绍给她的朋友。/r/n

word.name: introduction
word.lx: This book is titled An Introduction to American Literature./r/n 这本书名为《美国文学指南》。/r/n There is an introduction about Norway in this magazine./r/n 这本杂志里有一篇关于挪威的介绍文章。/r/n

word.name: introductory
word.mean: a. 介绍的,引导的,开端的

word.name: intuition
word.lx: My intuitions proved correct./r/n 我的直觉确实是正确的。/r/n The theory that ethical principles are known to be valid and universal through intuition./r/n 直觉主义通过直觉知道道德原则有效性和普遍性的理论/r/n

word.name: inundate
word.lx: When the river burst its banks the fields were inundated./r/n 河岸决堤後, 田地遭洪水淹没./r/n We were inundated with enquiries./r/n 查询的人很多, 我们应接不暇./r/n

word.name: invade
word.lx: The town was invaded by reporters./r/n 这个城市涌进了大批记者。/r/n I object to our privacy being invaded./r/n 我反对我们的隐私权受到侵害。/r/n

word.name: invader
word.lx: The invader will arrive at dawn./r/n 侵略者拂晓就要来了。/r/n The invader wanted to attack our country./r/n 侵略者妄图攻打我们国家。/r/n

word.name: invalid
word.mean:
a. 无效的,伤残的
n. 病人,残疾者

word.name: invalidate
word.lx: The making of false statements could result in the invalidation of the contract./r/n 提供虚假资料可能导致合同失效./r/n

word.name: invaluable
word.lx: Your help is invaluable to us./r/n 你对我们的帮助是非常宝贵的。/r/n He has many invaluable paintings./r/n 他有许多珍品画。/r/n

word.name: invariable
word.mean:
n. 不变的东西,常数
a. 不变的,不易的,常数的
word.lx: He came to see me with the invariable request for a loan./r/n 他来见我时又提出了他那一贯的借钱的要求。/r/n

word.name: invariably
word.mean: ad. 不变化地,一定不变地,常常地
word.lx: Wives say that men are invariably children at heart./r/n 妻子们说男人实际上永远是孩子。/r/n His intuition is invariably correct./r/n 他的直觉常常是正确的。/r/n

word.name: invasion
word.lx: Reading my diary is an inexcusable invasion of privacy./r/n 看我的日记是一种不可原谅的侵犯个人隐私的行为。/r/n The invasion force was annihilated./r/n 侵略军被消灭了。/r/n

word.name: invent
word.mean:
v. 发明
vt. 发明,创造
word.lx: We must invent an excuse for our absence./r/n 我们必须为缺席编造一个藉口。/r/n Can you tell me who invented the telephone?/r/n 你能告诉我是谁发明了电话？/r/n

word.name: invention
word.lx: Necessity is the mother of invention./r/n 需要是发明之母。/r/n Your invention is not practical./r/n 你的发明不实用。/r/n

word.name: inventive
word.mean: a. 善于创造的,发明的
word.lx: Marked by inventive skill and imagination./r/n 灵巧的拥有创造性天才和想象力的/r/n

word.name: inventor
word.lx: Alexander Graham Bell is the inventor of the telephone./r/n 贝尔是电话的发明者。/r/n The machine takes its name from its inventor./r/n 这机器的名字来自其发明者。/r/n

word.name: inventory
word.mean: n. 详细目录,存货清单
word.lx: Hedge can help them offset inventory loss when commodity price fall./r/n 在商品价格下跌时，海琴能够帮助他们抵补存货价跌的损失。/r/n Some stores inventory their stock once a month./r/n 有些商店每月盘货一次。－/r/n

word.name: inverse
word.lx: This is the inverse of his earlier proposition./r/n 这和他早些时候提的建议截然相反./r/n

word.name: invert
word.mean:
a. 转化的
v. 反转,颠倒
[计算机] 反置
word.lx: The chairs were inverted on the table./r/n 椅子被倒置过来放在了桌子上。/r/n

word.name: investigate
word.mean:
v. 调查,研究
[计算机] 研究
word.lx: The police are investigating the murder./r/n 警察正在调查这件谋杀案。/r/n The company hired a detective to investigate the accident./r/n 公司雇佣了一名侦探来调查这次事故。/r/n

word.name: investigation
word.lx: The accident is under investigation./r/n 这一事故正在调查之中。/r/n The government made an investigation of the employment in the public and private sectors./r/n 政府对国营和私营部门的就业情况作了一次调查。/r/n

word.name: investment
word.lx: The government is trying to attract more investment into the shipbuilding industry./r/n 政府正在试图吸引更多资金投资到造船业方面来。/r/n Antiques are a very safe investment./r/n 古玩是一种非常保险的投资对象。/r/n

word.name: invincible
word.mean: a. 不可征服的,难以制服的
word.lx: We have an invincible army./r/n 我们有一支不可战胜的军队。/r/n Our manager has an invincible will./r/n 我们的经理有着坚强的意志。/r/n

word.name: invisible
word.lx: Germs are invisible to the naked eye./r/n 细菌用肉眼看不见。/r/n Some stars are invisible to the naked eye./r/n 有些星体肉眼是看不见的。/r/n

word.name: invite
word.lx: We invited all our relatives to the wedding./r/n 我们邀请了所有的亲戚来参加婚礼。/r/n You are just inviting trouble if you do that./r/n 你那么做就是在自找麻烦。/r/n

word.name: inviting
word.lx: She showed me her gratitude by inviting me to dinner./r/n 她邀请我吃饭以表示她的感激。/r/n You are just inviting trouble if you do that./r/n 你那么做就是在自找麻烦。/r/n

word.name: invoice
word.mean:
n. 发票,发货单,货物
v. 开发票,记清单
word.lx: A signed invoice presumes receipt of the shipment./r/n 经过签字的发票表示货物已经收到。/r/n The invoice was for 35 cif./r/n 发票为到岸价35英镑./r/n

word.name: invoke
word.lx: They invoked help in the desperate situation./r/n 他们在走投无路的情况下恳求援助。/r/n The government has invoked the official secret act in having the book banned./r/n 政府援引国家机密保密法以禁该书。/r/n

word.name: involuntary
word.mean: a. 自然而然的,无意识的,不知不觉的
word.lx: She gave an involuntary smile./r/n 她不由自主地笑了笑。/r/n The involuntary and consistent response of an organism to a given stimulus./r/n 生理反应生物体对所受到的刺激作出的无意识的连贯反应/r/n

word.name: involve
word.mean: v. 包含,含有,使陷入,使卷入,牵涉
word.lx: How should we involve ourselves in school life?/r/n 我们应该怎样投入学校生活？/r/n Painting the room involved moving out the piano./r/n 粉刷房间就要把钢琴搬出去。/r/n

word.name: involved
word.mean:
v. 涉及(包含,遍及,占用,促成,自乘)
a. 所包含的(形式复杂的)
word.lx: The reporter is curious to know whether the official is involved in the case./r/n 这个记者很想知道那位官员是否涉及此案。/r/n She was quite positive about the amount of money involved./r/n 她对所涉及的钱数十分肯定./r/n

word.name: involvement
word.mean: n. 包含(缠绕,混乱,复杂的情况)
word.lx: The police are investigating his possible involvement in the crime./r/n 警方正在调查他卷入那桩罪行的可能性。/r/n Many people were elected to take part in democratic involvement./r/n 很多人被选举参与民主管理。/r/n

word.name: inward
word.mean: a. 内心的,向内的,本来的
word.lx: His shaking hands showed his inward fear./r/n 他颤抖的双手显示出他内心的恐惧。/r/n The door opened inward into the room./r/n 门是朝房间里面开的。/r/n

word.name: inwards
word.lx: Does the window open inwards or outwards?/r/n 这窗户是朝里开的还是朝外开的?/r/n His shaking hands showed his inward fear./r/n 他颤抖的双手显示出他内心的恐惧。/r/n

word.name: iodine
word.lx: A tincture of iodine may be used medically./r/n 碘酒可以作为医药使用。/r/n The doctor painted iodine on the cut./r/n 医生在伤口上涂点碘酒。/r/n

word.name: Ireland
word.lx: Do you know where Ireland is?/r/n 你知道爱尔兰的方位吗？/r/n What is the population of Ireland?/r/n 爱尔兰人口有多少?/r/n

word.name: iris
word.mean: n. 虹膜,鸢尾属植物,彩虹之女神
word.lx: Could you teach me how to adjust the iris of the camera?/r/n 你能教我怎么调照相机的光圈吗？/r/n Shaped like a sword, as the leaf of an iris./r/n 剑形的，如鸢尾属植物的叶子/r/n

word.name: Irish
word.mean:
n. 爱尔兰人,爱尔兰语
a. 爱尔兰的
word.lx: She spoke with an Irish accent./r/n 她说话带有爱尔兰口音。/r/n Many of the Irish went over to America during the famine./r/n 很多爱尔兰人在饥荒期间迁徙到了美国./r/n

word.name: iron
word.mean:
a. 刚强的
n. 铁,熨斗
v. 熨,烫,烫衣服
vt. 熨烫
word.lx: This basin is made of iron./r/n 这个盆子是铁做的。/r/n The problem should have been ironed out months ago./r/n 这个问题几个月前就该解决了。/r/n

word.name: ironic
word.mean: a. 说反话的, 讽刺的
word.lx: Madness, an ironic fate for such a clear thinker./r/n 发疯，对这样一个思维清晰的人莫过于一种带有嘲弄意味的命运/r/n

word.name: irregular
word.mean:
n. 不合规格之物
a. 不规则的,不整齐的,不合法的
word.lx: To go away without telling your father is most irregular./r/n 不跟你父亲打个招呼就走是非常不合适的。/r/n The coastline in this area is quite irregular./r/n 这个地区的海岸线非常不整齐。/r/n

word.name: irregularity
word.lx: An irregularity in the force or rhythm of the heartbeat./r/n 心律失常不规则的心跳强度或节奏/r/n

word.name: irresistible
word.mean: a. 不可抵抗的,不能压制的
word.lx: His arguments were irresistible./r/n 他的论据是无法反驳的。/r/n It is so hot, our desire to swim in the pool is irresistible./r/n 天这么热，我们不禁要下去游泳。/r/n

word.name: irrespective
word.mean: a. 不顾的,无关的,没关系的
word.lx: The laws apply to everyone irrespective of race, color, or creed./r/n 法律对人人都适用，不分种族，肤色或信仰。/r/n The law applies to everyone irrespective of race, religion or color./r/n 这项法律适用于任何人，不管其种族、宗教或肤色。/r/n

word.name: irrevocable
word.mean: a. 不能唤回的,不能取消的,不能变更的

word.name: irrigate
word.mean:
vi. 进行灌溉
vt. 灌溉
word.lx: They are irrigating with water./r/n 他们正用水灌溉土地。/r/n We have irrigated the desert area to make it fertile./r/n 我们已经灌溉了荒芜地区使它肥沃。/r/n

word.name: irrigation
word.lx: Irrigation is needed to make crops grow in dry regions./r/n 干旱地区需要灌溉才能使作物生长。/r/n We used the money to set up an irrigation project./r/n 我们把钱用在兴建灌溉工程上了./r/n

word.name: irritability
word.mean: n. 易怒,过敏性,兴奋性
word.lx: Harshness of manner; ill temper or irritability./r/n 粗暴态度粗暴；脾气暴躁或易怒/r/n

word.name: irritate
word.lx: His letter irritated me a little./r/n 他的信使我有点恼怒。/r/n Wool irritates my skin./r/n 毛织物会使我的皮肤过敏。/r/n

word.name: is
word.lx: Pain past is pleasure./r/n 过去的痛苦即是快乐。/r/n A friend in need is a friend indeed./r/n 患难之交才是真朋友。/r/n

word.name: Islam
word.mean: n. 伊斯兰教,回教,回教徒
word.lx: The people or nations that practice Islam; the Moslem world./r/n 穆斯林国度信奉伊斯兰教的民族或国家；穆斯林世界/r/n The Sunni compose about90 per cent of present-day Islam./r/n 目前回教百分之九十属於正统派。/r/n

word.name: island
word.mean:
a. 岛(国)的
n. 岛
word.lx: She left the small island and became famous in metropolitan France./r/n 她离开小岛而在法国的大都市中成名。/r/n This island is accessible only by boat./r/n 这个小岛只能坐小船去。/r/n

word.name: isle
word.mean:
n. 岛,群岛
v. 使...成为岛屿,放在岛屿上

word.name: isolate
word.mean:
a. 孤立的
v. 隔离,孤立
vt. 使隔离,使孤立
word.lx: Scientists have isolated the virus causing the epidemic./r/n 科学家们已分离出引起这种流行病的病毒。/r/n

word.name: isolation
word.lx: Looked at in isolation, these facts are not encouraging./r/n 孤立地看，这些事实并不乐观。/r/n He examined each piece of evidence in isolation./r/n 他分别审查每一证据。/r/n

word.name: issue
word.mean:
n.发行物,期刊号,争论点
v. 发行,流出,造成...结果
word.lx: Banknotes of this design were first issued 10 years ago./r/n 这种图案的钞票是十年前首次发行的。/r/n Parliament will debate the nationalization issue next week./r/n 议会将在下周辩论国有化议题。/r/n

word.name: Italian
word.mean:
a. 意大利的
n. 意大利人
word.lx: Rome is an Italian city./r/n 罗马是意大利城市。/r/n Our agent in Rome deals with all our Italian business./r/n 我们在罗马的代理人负责我们在意大利的所有业务。/r/n

word.name: italic
word.lx: This sentence is in italic type./r/n 本句是用斜体字印刷的./r/n A line under something, such as a symbol, word, or phrase, used to indicate emphasis or italic type./r/n 下划线划在符号，词或词组下的线，用以表示强调或斜体打印/r/n

word.name: Italy
word.lx: Italy is in the south of Europe./r/n 意大利在欧洲的南部。/r/n They spent a week motoring through Italy./r/n 他们花了一星期，驾车周游意大利。/r/n

word.name: itch
word.mean:
n. 痒,渴望,疥癣
v. 使...痒,渴望
word.lx: The boys were itching for the lesson to end./r/n 那些男孩子们渴望下课。/r/n Are your mosquito bites still itching?/r/n 你被蚊子咬的地方还在痒吗？/r/n

word.name: item
word.lx: Are there any interesting news items in the paper this morning?/r/n 今天早晨报上有什么有趣的新闻吗？/r/n Let us go on to the next item on the agenda./r/n 让我们继续讨论议程上的下一个项目。/r/n

word.name: iterate
word.mean:
v. 重做,反复重申
vt. 反复申说

word.name: itinerary
word.mean:
n. 旅程,旅行指南,游记
a. 巡回的,游历的,旅程的
word.lx: For the details of their itinerary, I am all to seek./r/n 关于他们的具体旅程，我毫无所知。/r/n This itinerary leaves us plenty of leeway./r/n 这个旅行计划给我们留有很多自由活动的余地./r/n

word.name: its
word.lx: The little cat drank its milk and washed its face./r/n 小猫喝了牛奶，又洗了脸。/r/n The baby threw its food on the floor./r/n 那个小孩儿把食物扔到地上了。/r/n

word.name: itself
word.lx: The government made itself unpopular./r/n 这届政府使得自己失去人心。/r/n The snake coiled itself around the tree./r/n 蛇盘绕在树上。/r/n

word.name: ivory
word.mean:
n. 象牙,乳白色
a. 象牙制的,乳白色的
word.lx: Gold, slaves and ivory were sent north./r/n 黄金、奴隶和象牙被运送到北方。/r/n Made of gold and ivory, as certain pieces of sculpture or artwork in ancient Greece./r/n 由黄金和象牙制成的由黄金和象牙制成的，如古希腊某些雕刻或工艺品/r/n

word.name: jack
word.mean:
n. 插座,千斤顶,男人
v. 抬起,提醒,扛举
n. 杰克
word.lx: Jack up the car, please./r/n 请用千斤顶把汽车托起来。/r/n You need a jack to lift the car before repairing it./r/n 修汽车前，你得用千斤顶把汽车抬起来。/r/n

word.name: jacket
word.lx: My brother wants to buy a sport jacket./r/n 我弟弟想买一件运动衫。/r/n She has a red jacket on./r/n 她穿著一件红色的短上衣。/r/n

word.name: jagged
word.mean: a. 有缺口的(参差不齐的)
word.lx: A jagged wound or cut./r/n 锯齿状的伤口或裂口/r/n

word.name: jail
word.mean:
n. 监牢,监狱,拘留所
v. 监禁,下狱

word.name: janitor
word.lx: He is a school janitor./r/n 他是学校的门卫。/r/n The janitor is very conscientious./r/n 那个管理员很认真。/r/n

word.name: January
word.lx: The accident happened on January 8th./r/n 那件事故发生在一月八日。/r/n I was born on January eleventh./r/n 我生于一月十一日。/r/n

word.name: Japan
word.mean: n. 日本漆; 亮漆 日本式漆器 日本式物品
word.lx: Japan lies to the east of China./r/n 日本在中国的东面。/r/n The ship launched in the direction of Japan./r/n 船起航前往日本。/r/n

word.name: Japanese
word.mean:
a. 日本的
n. 日本人,日语
word.lx: We went to the park to see Japanese cherry blossoms./r/n 我们到公园去看日本樱花。/r/n Do you speak Japanese?/r/n 你会说日语吗？/r/n

word.name: jar
word.mean:
n. 广口瓶,震动,刺耳声
v. 震惊,冲突,发刺耳声
word.lx: How much is a jar of peanut butter?/r/n 一瓶花生酱多少钱？/r/n Their opinion jarred with ours./r/n 他们的意见与我们不一致。/r/n

word.name: jaw
word.mean:
n. 颚,颌
v. 喋喋不休,教训
word.lx: On hearing the news, his jaw dropped./r/n 听到这个消息，他惊讶得张口结舌。/r/n My jaw dropped when I saw how much the meal had cost./r/n 我看到那顿饭要花这麽多钱真大吃一惊。/r/n

word.name: jealous
word.lx: They may feel jealous of his success./r/n 他们也许妒嫉他的成功。/r/n She is a wee bit jealous./r/n 她有点儿嫉妒。/r/n

word.name: jealousy
word.lx: His many little jealousies harmed their marriage./r/n 他那许多妒嫉的言行妨害了他们的婚姻生活。/r/n Your remark excited him to jealousy./r/n 你的话引起了他的嫉妒。/r/n

word.name: jean
word.mean:
n. 牛仔裤,牛仔布,斜纹棉布
n. 珍
word.lx: Jean is a blue-eyed girl./r/n 珍是个蓝眼睛的女孩。/r/n I feel rather overdressed in this suit everyone else is wearing jeans!/r/n 我觉得穿这身西服太讲究了--别人全都穿牛仔裤!/r/n

word.name: jeans
word.lx: Both my sister and I like to wear jeans./r/n 我姐姐和我都喜欢穿牛仔裤。/r/n Will denim jeans ever go out of date?/r/n 粗布牛仔裤会过时吗?/r/n

word.name: jeep
word.lx: A jeep is ideal for driving over rough terrain./r/n 吉普车很适合在高低不平的路面上行驶./r/n No sooner had his luggage been loaded than the jeep started off./r/n 他的行李刚一装上车，吉普车就开走了。/r/n

word.name: jeer
word.mean:
n. 嘲笑,讥评,戏弄
v. 嘲弄,揶揄,戏弄
word.lx: He jeered at a defeated opponent./r/n 他嘲弄被击败的对手./r/n They jeered at the speaker./r/n 他们讥笑发言的人。/r/n

word.name: jeopardize
word.mean: v. 危害,使受危困,使陷危地

word.name: jerk
word.mean:
n. (口语)笨蛋,性情古怪的人,急拉,肌肉抽搐
v. 痉挛,急拉,急推,急动
word.lx: The knife was stuck but she pulled it out with a jerk./r/n 那把刀子被卡住了，她猛地一拔，把它拔了出来。/r/n The bus jerked to a stop./r/n 公共汽车猛然刹车停住了。/r/n

word.name: Jesus
word.lx: Jesus was the founder of the Christian religion./r/n 耶稣是基督教的创始人。/r/n They brought the children to Jesus and he blessed them./r/n 他们把孩子们领到耶稣跟前, 耶稣就赐福予他们./r/n

word.name: jet
word.mean:
n. 喷射,喷出,黑玉
v. 射出,迸出,喷射
word.lx: He left on the jet plane./r/n 他坐飞机离开了。/r/n The accident happened as the jet was about to take off./r/n 喷气式飞机正要起飞时出了事故。/r/n

word.name: Jew
word.lx: He is as rich as a Jew./r/n 他是个大财主。/r/n One who is not a Christian, Moslem, or Jew; a heathen./r/n 异教徒基督教、犹太教或伊斯兰教徒以外的人；异教徒/r/n

word.name: jewel
word.mean:
n. 宝石
v. 镶以宝石
word.lx: The book is the jewel of his collection./r/n 这本书是他藏书中最珍贵的一本。/r/n Virtue is a jewel of great price./r/n 【谚】美德是无价之宝。/r/n

word.name: jewelry
word.lx: Jewelry and lace are mostly feminine belongings./r/n 珠宝和蕾丝大多是女性用品。/r/n Platinum is used to make jewelry./r/n 白金常常用来做珠宝饰物。/r/n

word.name: Jewish
word.lx: Here is a local Jewish community./r/n 这是当地犹太人的一个社区。/r/n Jewish culture is famous./r/n 犹太人的文化很著名。/r/n

word.name: jitter
word.mean:
n. 振动(信号的不稳定性)
vt 散开(极为紧张)

word.name: Job
word.lx: The whole job only takes half an hour./r/n 整个工作只需要半个小时。/r/n Raising money is your job./r/n 筹集资金是你的任务。/r/n

word.name: jobless
word.lx: Not having work; jobless./r/n 失业的没有工作的；无工作的/r/n A homeless or jobless person; a vagrant./r/n 流浪汉无家可归的或失业的人；流浪者/r/n

word.name: jog
word.mean:
n. 轻推,轻撞,漫步
v. 轻推,蹒跚行进,慢跑
word.lx: The wagon jogged along on the rough road./r/n 马车沿着崎岖不平的道路颠簸前行。/r/n You jogged my elbow and spoiled what I was drawing./r/n 你撞到了我的手肘，弄坏了我正在画的图画。/r/n

word.name: joggle
word.mean:
v. 轻摇,摇动,摇曳
n. 轻摇,摇动,臼合

word.name: join
word.lx: He joined us in the discussion yesterday./r/n 他昨天参加了我们的讨论。/r/n Can you see the join in the coat?/r/n 你能看到衣服上的接缝吗？/r/n

word.name: joint
word.mean:
a. 联合的,共同的
n. 关节,接合处
v. 连接,贴合
word.lx: The doctor put his bone into the joint again./r/n 医生使他的骨头复位。/r/n The delays put the whole schedule out of joint./r/n 一再的拖延打乱了全部安排。/r/n

word.name: joke
word.mean:
n. 笑话,玩笑
v. 开玩笑
word.lx: It is no joke./r/n 这可不是开玩笑的事。/r/n You must be joking./r/n 你一定是在开玩笑吧。/r/n

word.name: joking
word.mean:
a. 戏谑的,开玩笑的
vbl. 戏谑,开玩笑
word.lx: I knew she was joking because she had a big grin on her face./r/n 我知道她是在开玩笑，因为她脸上堆满笑容。/r/n Laughing and joking are considered improper behaviors at a funeral./r/n 在葬礼上发笑或开玩笑是失礼的行为。/r/n

word.name: jolt
word.mean:
n. 震摇,摇动,颠簸
v. 颠簸而行,震摇
word.lx: The news of the accident gave her an unpleasant jolt./r/n 她听到出事的消息吃了一惊。/r/n The car stopped with a jolt./r/n 汽车停止时震动了一下。/r/n

word.name: journal
word.lx: He subscribed to a journal this year./r/n 今年他订了一份期刊。/r/n The journal is published monthly./r/n 那本杂志是月刊./r/n

word.name: journey
word.mean:
n. 旅程,旅行,行程
v. 旅行
word.lx: She will journey to Latin America from Canada./r/n 她将从加拿大动身去拉丁美洲。/r/n He is going to make a long journey./r/n 他要作一次长途旅行。/r/n

word.name: joy
word.mean:
n. 欢乐,喜悦,乐趣,乐事
v. 欢乐,高兴,乐趣
word.lx: I saw the joy in her smiling face./r/n 从她的笑脸上我看到欢欣。/r/n Joy mingled with surprises./r/n 喜悦和惊异交织在一起。/r/n

word.name: joyful
word.mean: a. 欢喜的,高兴的,令人高兴的
word.lx: Imagine the joyful scene when they were reunited with their lost daughter./r/n 他们与失散的女儿团聚，快乐的情景是可想而知的。/r/n The meeting between the two families was a joyful one./r/n 这两家人的聚会十分愉快./r/n

word.name: judge
word.mean:
n. 法官
v. 裁决,判断,审判
vt. 断定,判断
word.lx: He is an impartial judge./r/n 他是一位公正的法官。/r/n We judge that he is the best candidate./r/n 我们认为他是最佳人选。/r/n

word.name: judgement
word.lx: He passed judgement on the guilty man./r/n 他对那个罪犯做出了裁决。/r/n Politicians should not engage in business affairs that might affect their political judgement./r/n 政治家不应该参与那些可能会影响其政治判断力的商业事务。/r/n

word.name: judgment
word.mean: n. 裁判,宣告,该判决书
word.lx: He passed judgment on the guilty man./r/n 他对那个罪犯做出了裁决。/r/n In my judgment, we should accept their apology./r/n 依我看，我们应该接受他们的道歉。/r/n

word.name: judicial
word.mean: a. 法庭的,公正的,审判上的

word.name: jug
word.lx: She poured some water into the earthenware jug./r/n 她向那个陶罐里倒了些水。/r/n He invited me to eat some jugged hare with him together./r/n 他邀请我和他一块吃些罐焖野兔。/r/n

word.name: juice
word.lx: She juiced an orange for her breakfast./r/n 她用一只橙子榨汁作早餐饮料。/r/n Would you like some tomato juice?/r/n 你想要些番茄汁吗？/r/n

word.name: juicy
word.lx: There are some fresh juicy oranges./r/n 那边有些新鲜多汁的橙子。/r/n Tell me all the juicy details./r/n 把有趣的细节都讲给我听。/r/n

word.name: jukebox
word.lx: The jukebox ground out an incessant stream of pop music./r/n 自动电唱机没完没了地放送流行乐曲。/r/n

word.name: July
word.lx: July is the hottest month in a year in my hometown./r/n 在我的家乡，七月是一年里最热的一月。/r/n The maximum temperature in July may be 36 Celsius degree./r/n 七月份最高温度可能达到36摄氏度。/r/n

word.name: jumble
word.mean:
v. 搀杂,混杂
n. 混杂, 混乱
word.lx: Details of the accident were all jumbled up in his mind./r/n 该事故的详情在他头脑中已混在一起。/r/n There is a jumble of books and papers on the table./r/n 桌子上凌乱地堆着一堆书和报纸。/r/n

word.name: jump
word.mean:
n. 跳跃,跳动,上涨
v. 跳越,跃过,突升
word.lx: The horse cleared all the jumps./r/n 这匹马跳过了所有的障碍物。/r/n He jumped to his feet and ran out of the office./r/n 他一下子跳了起来，跑出了办公室。/r/n

word.name: jumper
word.mean: n. 跳跃者, 跳高运动员, 跳跃的动物, 妇女穿的套头外衣, 海员的上衣, 工作服
word.lx: The child has picked a hole in his new jumper./r/n 孩子的新毛衣上勾了一个洞。/r/n My jumper has gone (ie has worn into holes) at the elbows./r/n 我的毛衣肘部已磨坏./r/n

word.name: jumpy
word.mean: a. 跳跃的,跳动的,神经质的

word.name: June
word.lx: He started work here last June./r/n 他是去年六月开始在这里工作的。/r/n The campaign lasted from June to October./r/n 这次战役从6月进行到10月。/r/n

word.name: junior
word.mean:
n. 年少者,地位较低者,大学三年级学生
a. 年少的,下级的,后进的
word.lx: He is studying at a junior middle school./r/n 他正在上初中。/r/n The president was so young that he was junior to some of his employees./r/n 总裁的年龄甚至是比他的一些雇员还小。/r/n

word.name: junior college
word.lx: I am so happy to get the letter from you saying that I had been admitted to Moraine Valley Junior College./r/n 接到来信，知道我已被莫莱茵谷专科学校录取，真是高兴万分！/r/n

word.name: juniper
word.lx: The juniper is a type of evergreen bush with purple berries./r/n 杜松子是一种生有紫红色浆果的常绿灌木。/r/n

word.name: junk
word.lx: He threw away all the junk in the boot of the car./r/n 他把汽车行李箱中所有废弃的旧物都扔了出去。/r/n Junk is anything that has outlived its usefulness./r/n 破烂货，是一些比它本身的用处还活久了的东西。/r/n

word.name: junk food
word.mean: n. 垃圾食品，无营养食品

word.name: junkyard
word.mean: n. (美)(既为堆放又兼作市场的)废品旧货栈

word.name: junta
word.lx: The action of the ruling junta have been criticized in the press./r/n 掌权的政协委员务会的行为已在报上受到批评。/r/n The military junta is determined to put down all political opposition./r/n 这个军人集团决心镇压政治上的一切反对派。/r/n

word.name: Jupiter
word.lx: The planets of our solar system are Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune./r/n 我们太阳系的行星有水星、金星、地球、火星、木星、土星、天王星、海王星。/r/n How many moons does Jupiter have?/r/n 木星有多少卫星?/r/n

word.name: jurisdiction
word.mean: n. 司法权,审判权,管辖权
word.lx: This affair is within his jurisdiction./r/n 这件事情在他的管辖权限之内。/r/n The court has no jurisdiction over foreign diplomats living in this country./r/n 法院对居住在本国的外交官无裁判权。/r/n

word.name: jury
word.lx: The jury found the prisoner not guilty./r/n 陪审团认定该囚犯无罪。/r/n The appeal jury is made up of 12 people./r/n 陪审团由12人组成。/r/n

word.name: justifiable
word.mean: a. 可辩解的,可证明的,有理的

word.name: justification
word.mean:
n. 辩护,证明正当,释罪
[计算机] 对齐
word.lx: I suppose that, in justification, he could always claim he had a family to support./r/n 我想他反正会以养家为理由来进行辩解。/r/n I can see no justification for dividing the company into smaller units./r/n 我认为没有理由把公司划分为小单位。/r/n

word.name: justify
word.mean:
v. 替...辩护,证明,证明正当
[计算机] 调整
word.lx: The policeman was justified in shooting the criminal in self-defence./r/n 那个警察出于自卫枪击罪犯是正当防卫。/r/n Can you justify your action?/r/n 你能证明你的行为是正当的吗？/r/n

word.name: juvenile
word.mean:
a. 青少年的
n. 青少年
word.lx: He wrote down to the juvenile readers./r/n 他为青少年读者写浅显的作品。/r/n Now she returned to the subject of juvenile delinquency in that country./r/n 现在她又回过来讲那个国家少年犯罪的问题。/r/n

word.name: kangaroo
word.lx: The kangaroo is a native of Australia./r/n 袋鼠是产於澳洲的动物。/r/n An exceptionally swift kangaroo./r/n 行动极其敏捷的袋鼠/r/n

word.name: keen
word.mean: a. 锋利的,敏锐的,强烈的
word.lx: The razor has a very keen edge./r/n 这把剃刀有锋利的口。/r/n That is a keen football match./r/n 那是一场激烈的足球比赛。/r/n

word.name: keeper
word.lx: The keeper is feeding the animals./r/n 饲养员正在喂动物。/r/n A keeper is only a poacher turned outside in, and a poacher a keeper turned inside out./r/n 看守人只不过是把表面翻进去的偷猎者，而偷猎者也不过是把里面翻出来的看守人罢了。/r/n

word.name: keeping
word.lx: The conductor is good at keeping the players together./r/n 乐队指挥善于使表演者奏协调。/r/n His actions are in keeping with his true character./r/n 他的行动和他的真实性格相一致。/r/n

word.name: kernel
word.mean:
n. 核心,中心,精髓
[计算机] 核心
word.lx: I think there is a kernel of truth in these otherwise frivolous comments./r/n 我认为在这些本来是无关紧要的评论中含有一定的真实性。/r/n The edible kernel of a nut./r/n 核仁坚果的可食的仁/r/n

word.name: key
word.mean:
a. 主要的,关键的
n. 钥匙
vt. 键入
word.lx: He is a key witness in this case./r/n 在这个案件中，他是一个主要见证人。/r/n She keyed in all the new data./r/n 她键入了所有的新数据。/r/n

word.name: keyboard
word.mean:
n. 键盘
vt. 用键盘输入(信息)

word.name: keyhole
word.lx: His eyes were glued to the keyhole./r/n 他的眼睛紧贴在钥匙孔上。/r/n He was so narrow-minded he could see through a keyhole with two eyes./r/n 他眼光狭窄，竟然能够用两只眼睛透过一个钥匙孔来看。/r/n

word.name: keynote
word.lx: Unemployment has been the keynote of the conference./r/n 会议的主题是失业问题./r/n The governor will keynote the convention./r/n 州长将发表施政方针的演说。/r/n

word.name: keystroke
word.lx: On a keyboard, the force required to depress a key to ensure positive contact and the action of the keystroke./r/n 在键盘上，为保证按下键时接触可靠及完成一次击键动作所需要的力。/r/n

word.name: kick
word.mean:
n. 踢,反冲,后座力
v. 踢,反抗,反冲
word.lx: He kicked a penalty goal in the football match./r/n 在这场足球赛中，他主罚，踢进了一个球。/r/n That horse kicked me./r/n 那匹马踢了我。/r/n

word.name: kickback
word.lx: I will do it if you kickback a few hundred for my firm./r/n 如果你给我公司几百元回扣我就干。/r/n

word.name: kid
word.mean:
n. 小孩
v. 开玩笑,哄骗,嘲弄
word.lx: You must be kidding!/r/n 你一定是在骗我！/r/n Our kids are playing football./r/n 我们的小孩们在踢足球。/r/n

word.name: kill
word.mean:
n. 杀,杀戮
v. 杀,破坏,消减
word.lx: My back is killing me./r/n 我的背疼得要命。/r/n His wife was killed in a car accident./r/n 他的妻子在车祸中丧生。/r/n

word.name: killer
word.mean: n. 瞄准器(扼杀剂,消光杂质,屠刀,杀人者)

word.name: killing
word.mean:
n. 谋杀,杀戮
a. 杀害的,疲惫的,迷人的
vbl. 杀害,谋杀
word.lx: The indication is that it is an underworld killing./r/n 迹象表明它是下流社会的谋杀。/r/n The court has made a verdict of unlawful killing./r/n 法庭已经做出不合法杀害的裁决。/r/n

word.name: kilo
word.lx: I weighed out half a kilo of flour and added it to the mixture./r/n 我秤了半公斤面粉，加到混合物中。/r/n Still, all in all, I hear he is a kilo fatter today than he was yesterday./r/n 但是最重要的是，我听说他今天比昨天肥了1公斤。/r/n

word.name: kilogram
word.lx: She weighs 50 kilograms./r/n 她的体重有50公斤。/r/n One kilogram equals 1000 grams./r/n 一公斤等于一千克。/r/n

word.name: kilometer
word.lx: The bridge is almost 2 kilometers long./r/n 这座桥差不多有两公里长。/r/n The road is5 kilometer long./r/n 这条马路5公里长。/r/n

word.name: kilowatt
word.lx: A unit of electric power equal to the work done by one kilowatt acting for one hour./r/n 千瓦－小时电功率的单位，等于在一千瓦功率下一小时内消耗的功/r/n

word.name: kin
word.mean:
a. 亲属关系的
n. 家族,亲属
word.lx: We are near of kin./r/n 我们是近亲。/r/n Who is your next of kin?/r/n 谁是你的健在的最近的亲属?/r/n

word.name: kind
word.mean:
a. 仁慈的,友好的
n. 种类
word.lx: We often do this kind of exercise./r/n 我们经常做这类练习。/r/n Taking a blind man across the street is a kind act./r/n 扶盲人过马路是一种善良的行为。/r/n

word.name: kindergarten
word.lx: It is noisy in the kindergarten./r/n 幼儿园里很嘈杂。/r/n There are many children in the kindergarten./r/n 那个幼儿园里的孩子很多。/r/n

word.name: kindle
word.lx: Her eyes kindled with excitement./r/n 她的眼睛里闪耀出激动的神色。/r/n The moon kindled the countryside./r/n 月光照耀着郊外。/r/n

word.name: kindly
word.mean:
a. 和蔼的,温和的,爽快的
ad. 温和地,亲切地
word.lx: She always spoke kindly to the children./r/n 她总是亲切地和孩子们说话。/r/n Will you kindly put that book back?/r/n 请你把那本书放回去好吗？/r/n

word.name: kindness
word.lx: I think it would be a kindness to tell him the bad news straight away./r/n 我认为直截了当地告诉他这个坏消息倒是友好的行为。/r/n Your kindness quite overwhelmed me./r/n 你的好意使我感激难言。/r/n

word.name: kingdom
word.lx: The queen ruled her kingdom wisely./r/n 女王英明地统治着她的王国。/r/n The king is the most important person in a kingdom./r/n 国王是一个王国中最重要的人物。/r/n

word.name: kiosk
word.lx: Soon Mr.Ho will install an iron gate across the side entrance to his10-by-4-foot stall, and then he says he will be able to sleep again. But just as he is saying this, a motorist opens a car door and bangs it against the back of the kiosk and the proprie

word.name: kiss
word.mean:
n. 吻,轻触
v. 吻,接吻,轻拂
word.lx: He kissed his wife and children good-bye./r/n 他吻别他的妻子和孩子。/r/n The wind kissed her hair./r/n 微风轻拂着她的头发。/r/n

word.name: kit
word.mean:
n. 装备,工具箱
v. 装备
word.lx: They marched twenty miles in full kit./r/n 他们带着全副装备行军二十英里。/r/n The nurse has taken a first-aid kit./r/n 护士已经带上了一套急救用品。/r/n

word.name: kitchen
word.lx: They usually eat their breakfast in the kitchen./r/n 他们通常在厨房吃早饭。/r/n I was cooking in the kitchen when the telephone rang./r/n 电话铃响的时候我正在厨房里做饭。/r/n

word.name: kite
word.lx: The children are flying kites./r/n 孩子们在放风筝。/r/n A boy is flying a kite in the piazza./r/n 一个小男孩在阳台上放风筝。/r/n

word.name: knee
word.lx: His left knee was hurt in a traffic accident./r/n 他的左膝在一次交通事故中受伤了。/r/n She fell and bruised her knee./r/n 她摔倒在地，膝盖上起了紫血块。/r/n

word.name: kneel
word.lx: She knelt down to pray./r/n 她跪下祈祷。/r/n Something, such as a stool, cushion, or board, on which to kneel./r/n 跪垫下跪时垫在膝下的东西，如跪凳、跪垫或跪板/r/n

word.name: knife
word.mean:
n. 刀
v. 用刀切割,如刀割般
word.lx: I picked up the knife and threw it out of the window./r/n 我拿起了那把刀，把它扔到了窗外。/r/n His strong voice cut through the hum of conversation like a knife through butter./r/n 他那宏亮有力的声音一下子压倒了嗡嗡的谈话声。/r/n

word.name: knight
word.mean:
n. 骑士,爵士,武士
v. 授以爵位

word.name: knit
word.lx: She often knits while watching TV./r/n 她常常一边看电视一边织毛衣。/r/n I gave her a knitted shawl as a Christmas gift./r/n 我送给她一条编织的披肩作圣诞礼物。/r/n

word.name: knock
word.mean:
n. 敲,敲打,敲门
v. 敲击,互撞,攻击
word.lx: He knocked a big hole in the wall./r/n 他把墙撞出了一个大洞。/r/n Someone is knocking at the door./r/n 有人在敲门。/r/n

word.name: knocker
word.mean: n. 敲击者,敲门者,门环
word.lx: One that raps or strikes, especially a door knocker./r/n 敲击者敲击或打击的人，尤指敲门者/r/n At the rat-a-tat of the knocker her heart fly into her mouth./r/n 听到敲击者咚咚声她的心都悬起来了。/r/n

word.name: knot
word.mean:
n. 结
v. 打结
vt. 把...打成结
word.lx: He knotted a towel about his neck./r/n 他把毛巾系在脖子上。/r/n There is a knot in the board./r/n 这块木板上有个结。/r/n

word.name: know
word.lx: I know what happened./r/n 我知道发生了什么事。/r/n She knows a bargain when she sees one./r/n 她有辨别便宜货的能力。/r/n

word.name: knowledge
word.lx: She has a detailed knowledge of this period./r/n 她对这段时期的情况了解地相当详细。/r/n They did it without my knowledge./r/n 他们是背着我做这件事的。/r/n

word.name: knowledgeable
word.lx: Knowledgeable about or constituting all or many subjects; comprehensively broad./r/n 博学多才的关于或组成所有或许多学科知识的；包罗万象的广阔/r/n I do not respect him because he is knowledgeable./r/n 我并非因为他有学问而尊敬他。/r/n

word.name: label
word.mean:
n. 标签,签条,商标
v. 贴标签于,分类
n.[计算机]标记, DOS命令 : 加上或修改磁盘的标签
word.lx: Have you attached labels to the luggage?/r/n 你给行李系上标签了吗？/r/n The bottle is labeled poison./r/n 瓶上标明有毒。/r/n

word.name: labeled
word.lx: The bottle is labeled poison./r/n 瓶上标明有毒。/r/n It is a very expensive camera. I labeled with my English initials in yellow on the back side of it./r/n 那是一架昂贵的像机。在像机皮套的背面，用黄色标着本人英语姓名的第一个字母。/r/n

word.name: laboratory
word.lx: Our professor usually works in the laboratory doing his research./r/n 我们的教授常常在实验室搞研究。/r/n The students will have an experiment in the laboratory tomorrow./r/n 学生们明天要在实验室里做实验。/r/n

word.name: laborer
word.lx: The farmer paid 3 laborers to gather the crop./r/n 农场主雇佣3名工人收割庄稼。/r/n A laborer on strike./r/n 罢工者在罢工的劳动者/r/n

word.name: laborious
word.lx: He has a laborious style of writing./r/n 他的文笔不流畅。/r/n Laborious study or meditation./r/n 刻苦的学习勤奋的学习或思考/r/n

word.name: lace
word.mean:
n. 饰带,花边,缎带
v. 结带子,饰以花边
word.lx: She wears a dress with delicate lace./r/n 她穿了一件带有精致花边的裙子。/r/n I always have troubles lacing these football boots./r/n 我给足球鞋穿鞋带时总是遇到麻烦。/r/n

word.name: lack
word.mean:
n. 缺乏,无,不足
v. 缺乏,短少,不足
word.lx: He is good at his job but he seems to lack confidence./r/n 他工作不错，但似乎缺乏信心。/r/n The plant died for lack of water./r/n 植物因缺水而枯死了。/r/n

word.name: lackadaisical
word.mean: a. 无精打采的,无兴趣的

word.name: lackey
word.mean:
n. 仆人,侍从,马屁精
v. 服侍,侍候,奉承

word.name: lacquer
word.mean:
n. 瓷漆,漆,漆器
v. 涂漆
word.lx: She lacquered the old table./r/n 她给旧桌子上了层漆。/r/n

word.name: lacrosse
word.lx: The goal in soccer, hockey, and lacrosse./r/n 球门足球、曲棍球和长曲棍球的球门/r/n

word.name: lactic
word.mean: a. 乳的,乳汁的,由乳汁取得的

word.name: lactic acid
word.lx: Now they wear rubber fingers treated with lactic acid./r/n 现在他们戴上了用乳酸处理过的橡皮指套。/r/n

word.name: ladder
word.lx: Hard work is often a ladder to success./r/n 发奋工作常是通向成功的阶梯。/r/n The ladder has eight rungs./r/n 这梯子有八级。/r/n

word.name: lade
word.lx: He gave me the bill of lading before leaving./r/n 走之前，他交给我那张提货单。/r/n The bill of lading should be marked asfreight prepaid"./r/n 提单上应该注明“运费预付”字样。/r/n"

word.name: laden
word.mean:
a. 充满的,负载的
vbl. 装载
word.lx: The traditional picture of an English Christmas a table laden with food and drink./r/n 英国圣诞节的传统图景总有1张餐桌，上面摆满了酒菜。/r/n

word.name: Ladies
word.mean: n. <口>公共女厕所,女盥洗室

word.name: lady
word.lx: She behaved like a lady./r/n 她举止端庄象一个淑女。/r/n The lady appeared with a luxurious fur coat./r/n 那位夫人穿着华贵的毛皮外套来了。/r/n

word.name: lag
word.mean:
n. 落后,滞后
v. 落后
vi. 走得慢,落后
word.lx: The children always lag behind when we go for a walk./r/n 我们出去散步时，孩子们总是落在后面。/r/n There was a long lag in forwarding mail to us./r/n 转寄给我们的邮件晚了很久才拿到。/r/n

word.name: laggard
word.mean:
a. 缓慢的,落后的
n. 落后者

word.name: lagoon
word.mean: n. 泻湖(污泥贮留池,沼)

word.name: Lagos
word.mean: n. 拉各斯(尼日利亚首都)
word.lx: He went straight to Lagos, without stopping in Nairobi./r/n 他径直前往拉各斯, 未在内罗毕停留./r/n The boat put in at Lagos/put into Lagos for repairs./r/n 那船进了拉各斯港进行检修./r/n

word.name: laid
word.lx: After the poor old man died, people found20,000 dollars under his laid by./r/n 这位可怜的老死后，人们在他的床下发现了他一点点儿积攒的20，000美元。/r/n The tables were laid lengthways./r/n 这些餐桌是纵向摆放的。/r/n

word.name: lain
word.lx: I have to warn you that his motives have lain hidden./r/n 我不得不提醒你他的动机还不明。/r/n The dust has lain undisturbed for years. He lay sick in bed./r/n 尘土积在那儿很多年了。他卧病在床/r/n

word.name: laity
word.lx: The new proposals affect both clergy and laity./r/n 新的建议与神职人员和俗人都有关系。/r/n

word.name: lake
word.lx: The river fed into a lake./r/n 这条河流入一个湖泊。/r/n We crossed the lake in a canoe./r/n 我们乘独木舟过河。/r/n

word.name: lamb
word.lx: The sheep are lambing this week./r/n 这个星期绵羊要产羔。/r/n She is gentle like a lamb./r/n 她像只小羊羔一样温柔。/r/n

word.name: lame
word.mean:
a. 跛足的,僵痛的,不完全的
v. 变跛,使...成残废,瘸行
word.lx: He gave a lame excuse for being absent./r/n 他找了个站不住脚的理由来解释缺席的原因。/r/n He is lame in one leg and walks with the help of a crutch./r/n 他的一条腿跛了，走路借助于拐杖。/r/n

word.name: lament
word.mean:
n. 悲叹,悔恨,恸哭
v. 哀悼,悔恨,悲叹
word.lx: He deeply lamented the death of his wife./r/n 他对妻子的去世深感悲痛。/r/n Short pleasure, long lament./r/n 【谚】痛快一时，痛苦一世。/r/n

word.name: lamentable
word.mean: a. 可悲的,哀伤的,可怜的
word.lx: His death is a lamentable loss of our work./r/n 他的死对我们的工作来说是令人悲痛的损失。/r/n The decision they made is a lamentable lack of foresight./r/n 他们做的决定实在缺乏远见。/r/n

word.name: lamentation
word.lx: We could hear her lamentations through the closed door./r/n 我们听见她关着门在哭。/r/n Much lamentation followed the death of the old king./r/n 老国王晏驾, 人们悲恸不已./r/n

word.name: laminated
word.lx: A raised bubble, as on a painted or laminated surface./r/n 浮泡如漆面或层压的表面的气泡/r/n

word.name: lampoon
word.mean:
n. 讽刺文章
v. 讽刺
vt. 嘲讽
word.lx: His cartoons mercilessly lampooned the leading politicians of the day./r/n 他的讽刺漫画无情地挖苦了当今的政界要人./r/n

word.name: lamppost
word.lx: He drove full tilt intothe lamppost./r/n 他车开得飞快, 撞上了路灯柱./r/n The dog was sniffing at the lamppost./r/n 那条狗在灯柱旁嗅来嗅去。/r/n

word.name: lampshade
word.lx: The lampshade will soften the light./r/n 这个灯罩能使光线柔和一些./r/n The oil-lamp needs a new globe, spherical lampshade./r/n 这油灯需配个新的圆灯罩./r/n

word.name: LAN
word.lx: Thank you for the book you sent me through Hu Lan./r/n 谢谢你请胡兰转寄给我的书。/r/n Li Lan seldom goes out by herself./r/n 李兰很少自己单独出门。/r/n

word.name: Lancaster
word.lx: We turned off the motorway at Lancaster./r/n 我们在兰开斯特转弯离开了高速公路./r/n

word.name: lance
word.mean:
n. 枪矛,执矛战士
v. 以枪矛攻击,冲进
word.lx: The horseman aimed his lance at his quarry./r/n 骑手把长矛对准了他的猎物。/r/n Marvelous, Lance from usa have clock10 second to set a new100-meter world record./r/n 好极了，美国的兰斯用10秒的成绩刷新了100米世界纪录。/r/n

word.name: land
word.mean:
n. 陆地,国土,土地
v. 登陆,登岸,卸货
word.lx: We are glad to be on land again./r/n 我们很高兴又踏上陆地了。/r/n The pilot landed the plane safely./r/n 驾驶员使飞机安全降落。/r/n

word.name: landed
word.lx: The pilot landed the plane safely./r/n 驾驶员使飞机安全降落。/r/n I found myself landed with three extra guests for dinner./r/n 我到时候才知道我得多招待三个客人吃饭。/r/n

word.name: landing strip
word.lx: The military aircraft circled over the landing strip for some time before it landed./r/n 这架军用飞机着陆前在着陆跑道上空盘旋了一阵。/r/n

word.name: landlady
word.lx: He likes being mothered by his landlady./r/n 他喜欢女房东无微不至地照顾他./r/n Easy does it, " said the landlady when we moved the sofa upstairs./r/n 当我们把沙发往楼上搬时，女房东说："慢慢来，小心点。"/r/n"

word.name: landless
word.mean: a. 无土地的,无陆地的

word.name: landscape
word.mean:
n. 风景,山水,风景画
v. 美化…的景观,进行造园工程
word.lx: That is an oil painting of a landscape in spring./r/n 那是一幅描绘春天景色的油画。/r/n This landscape is disfigured by a power station./r/n 风景被发电厂破坏了。/r/n

word.name: lane
word.lx: That lane will take you to his house./r/n 你从那条小巷就可以走到他家。/r/n The lane is the boundary of our land./r/n 那条小路就是我们这片地的界线./r/n

word.name: language
word.lx: Chinese is my native language./r/n 汉语是我的母语。/r/n What languages can you speak?/r/n 你会说什么语言？/r/n

word.name: languid
word.mean: a. 疲倦的,无力的,阴沉的
word.lx: He speaks with a languid drawl./r/n 他慢吞吞拉着长调说话。/r/n I was angry with his languid movements./r/n 我被他那懒洋洋的动作激怒了。/r/n

word.name: lantern
word.lx: The Chinese palace lanterns are famous for their delicacy./r/n 中国的宫灯以精巧闻名。/r/n A little lantern blinked in the darkness./r/n 一盏小灯笼在黑暗中微微闪光。/r/n

word.name: lap
word.mean:
n. 膝盖,舐声,一周
v. 重叠,包裹,轻拍
word.lx: The cat lapped up the milk./r/n 猫舔食牛奶。/r/n The waves gently lap against the shore./r/n 海浪轻轻地拍打着海岸。/r/n

word.name: laptop
word.mean: 便携式电脑,膝上型电脑

word.name: large
word.mean: a. 大的,大量的,宽大的
word.lx: Shanghai is a large city./r/n 上海是一个大城市。/r/n The question is discussed at large in my report./r/n 我在报告中对该问题作了详细的探讨。/r/n

word.name: lark
word.lx: He only said it for a lark./r/n 他只是说着玩而已。/r/n She rose with the lark./r/n 她一大早就起床了。/r/n

word.name: lash
word.mean:
n. 鞭子,鞭打,睫毛
v. 鞭打,摆动,扎捆
word.lx: He lashed at his rival for dishonesty./r/n 他严厉斥责对手的欺诈行为。/r/n The cat lashed her tail./r/n 这只猫急速摇动着尾巴。/r/n

word.name: last
word.mean:
a. 最后的,末尾的,最近的,晚了，迟到了

v. 持续,支持,维持
ad. 最后,后来
word.lx: He was the last to arrive./r/n 他到得最晚。/r/n Which line comes last in this poem?/r/n 这首诗的最后一行是什么？/r/n

word.name: lasting
word.mean:
a. 永久的,永恒的
vbl. 持续,维持
word.lx: Having lasting significance or worth; enduring./r/n 历久不衰的，持续的有永久的意义或价值的；持久的/r/n Lasting or living for two years./r/n 持续两年的，生活两年的/r/n

word.name: late
word.mean:
a. 迟的,晚的,已故的
ad. 很晚,很迟,晚
word.lx: We went to bed late./r/n 我们很晚才上床。/r/n The train was 10 minutes late./r/n 火车晚点了10 分钟。/r/n

word.name: latent
word.lx: He was infected with a latent infection./r/n 他被感染了一种潜伏性的传染病。/r/n The manager did not find her latent abilities./r/n 经理没有发现她潜在的才能。/r/n

word.name: later
word.mean:
a. 更迟的,后面的
ad. 稍后,后来

word.name: lathe
word.lx: That lathe is used for shaping pieces of wood./r/n 那个车床是用来加工木材的。/r/n Do you know how to work a lathe?/r/n 你会开车床吗?/r/n

word.name: Latin
word.mean:
n. 拉丁民族的人,拉丁文,拉丁语
a. 拉丁文的,拉丁人的,拉丁语的
word.lx: I know nothing about Latin grammar./r/n 我一点都不懂拉丁语法。/r/n Many languages have Latin as their base./r/n 许多语言都以拉丁语为基础。/r/n

word.name: latitude
word.mean:
n. 纬度
限制，界限
word.lx: The new law allows firms a lot less latitude than before in fixing the price of their goods./r/n 新法律在允许各商行给产品定价的自由上比以前少得多了。/r/n The latitude of the island is 30 degrees north./r/n 这个岛的纬度是北纬三十度。/r/n

word.name: latter
word.mean:
a. 后面的,后者的
pron.&n. 后者
word.lx: Of these two men, the former is dead but the latter is still alive./r/n 这两个人中，前者已死，而后者仍然活着。/r/n Many support the former alternative, but personally I favour the latter (one)./r/n 很多人都赞成前一种办法, 但我个人喜欢後一种./r/n

word.name: lattice
word.mean:
n. 格子,组合格子,格子状的东西
v. 制做格子,使成格子状

word.name: laughter
word.lx: I can hear his laughter even in the next room./r/n 我在隔壁房间都能听到他的笑声。/r/n Laughter filled the room./r/n 房间里充满了笑声。/r/n

word.name: launch
word.mean: n.&v. 下水,发射,开始,升天,汽艇
word.lx: They have launched a man-made satellite successfully./r/n 他们成功地发射了一颗人造卫星。/r/n A new ship is being launched today./r/n 一艘新船下水了。/r/n

word.name: laundry
word.mean: n. 洗衣店,要洗的衣服,洗衣
word.lx: Has the laundry come back yet?/r/n 洗的衣服送回来了吗？/r/n Washing machines take the drudgery out of laundry./r/n 洗衣机把洗衣工作带出了洗衣房。/r/n

word.name: Laurasia
word.mean: n. [地质] 劳亚古大陆(板块学说中包括亚、欧、北美的古大陆)

word.name: laureate
word.mean: n. 月桂树叶(授予竞赛的优胜者)
word.lx: He was awarded the poet laureate by the queen./r/n 他被女王封为桂冠诗人。/r/n We won a laureate cup./r/n 我们赢得了荣誉奖杯。/r/n

word.name: laurel
word.mean:
n. 月桂树,荣誉
v. 戴桂冠,授予荣誉
word.lx: All other laurels wither before hers./r/n 所有荣誉和她获得的相比都黯然失色。/r/n Our team won the regional laurels./r/n 我们的球队赢得了地区冠军。/r/n

word.name: lavender
word.lx: This is a kind of lavender-water./r/n 这是一种熏衣草香水。/r/n I bought some lavender writing paper./r/n 我买了一些淡紫色的信纸。/r/n

word.name: lavish
word.mean:
a. 大方的,丰富的,浪费的
v. 浪费,慷慨给予
word.lx: She lavished kindness on them./r/n 她对他们过份和气。/r/n That is a vast and lavish party./r/n 那是个规模盛大、极其铺张的宴会。/r/n

word.name: lavishly
word.lx: His house is lavishly adorned./r/n 他的家装饰得非常华丽。/r/n Spent lavishly on dinner just for effect./r/n 晚餐吃得很奢侈浪费只是为了面子上好看/r/n

word.name: lawful
word.mean: a. 法律许可的,守法的,合法的
word.lx: It is not lawful to do that./r/n 做那事是不合法的。/r/n She is a lawful citizen./r/n 她是个守法的公民。/r/n

word.name: lawfully
word.mean: ad. 依法地,法定地,合法地

word.name: lawgiver
word.mean: n. 拟定法典者,立法者

word.name: lawn mower
word.lx: The gardener asked me for a rotatory lawn mower./r/n 园丁向我要一台旋转式割草机。/r/n The gardener asked me for a rotary lawn mower./r/n 园丁向我要一台旋转式割草机。/r/n

word.name: Lawrence
word.lx: Excuse me, sir, hold on. Mrs Lawrence will speak to you herself./r/n 请原谅，先生，先别挂电话，劳伦斯太太要亲自与您讲话。/r/n Lawrence fags away for a pittance./r/n 劳伦斯为了一点微薄的收入而辛苦地工作。/r/n

word.name: lawsuit
word.lx: A party engaged in a lawsuit./r/n 诉讼当事人参与诉讼的一个团体/r/n The lawsuit was then pending./r/n 那件讼案因而尚未解决./r/n

word.name: lawyer
word.lx: He is dreaming of becoming a lawyer./r/n 他梦想着成为律师。/r/n The lawyer explained the new law to us./r/n 律师向我们解释了新法律。/r/n

word.name: lax
word.mean:
a. 松的,松懈的,不严的
n. 泻肚

word.name: laxative
word.mean:
a. 通便的,不简洁的
n. 泻药,缓泻药

word.name: lay
word.mean:
v. 放置,铺设,产卵
vbl. 横躺,摆放,说谎
word.lx: He knows the lay of the land here./r/n 他了解这里的地形。/r/n You may lay it on the table./r/n 你可以把它放在桌子上。/r/n

word.name: layer
word.lx: There are several layers of meaning./r/n 有几层不同的含意。/r/n Her husband is a brick layer./r/n 她丈夫是个砌砖匠。/r/n

word.name: layman
word.lx: Layman is not a clergyman or a priest./r/n 普通信徒有别于教士和牧师。/r/n This book is written for professionals and laymen alike./r/n 这本书既可供专业人员阅读，又可供外行人看。/r/n

word.name: layoff
word.mean: n. 临时解雇,操作停止,活动停止期间

word.name: laze
word.lx: Laze around the house./r/n 在屋子周围闲逛/r/n He lazed away in the sun./r/n 他一直懒懒散散地在太阳下逛荡。/r/n

word.name: lazily
word.lx: She reclined lazily on the cushions./r/n 她懒洋洋地靠在靠垫上。/r/n

word.name: laziness
word.lx: One of the frailties of human nature is laziness./r/n 人性的弱点之一是懒惰。/r/n This employee was dismissed for laziness./r/n 这名雇员因为懒惰而被解雇。/r/n

word.name: lazy
word.lx: She is getting lazy./r/n 她渐渐懒惰起来。/r/n He is a very lazy person, sleeping all day./r/n 他非常懒惰，整天睡觉。/r/n

word.name: lazybones
word.mean: n. 懒骨头,懒人(单复数同形)
word.lx: The boy is lazybones through and through./r/n 这个男孩是个彻头彻尾的懒虫。/r/n That lazybones has sponged off his brother for years./r/n 那个懒汉多年来一直靠兄弟养活他。/r/n

word.name: lb
word.mean: n. 救生船(轻型托架,占线,油毡底层,本机电池)
word.lx: These fish vary in weight from 3 lb to 5 lb./r/n 这些鱼的重量从3磅到5磅不等./r/n

word.name: lea
word.lx: The endless lea will purify your thought./r/n 一望无际的草原会净化你的思想。/r/n The advantage of the emotions is that they lea us astray./r/n 情绪的好处在于引我们走入歧途。/r/n

word.name: leach
word.mean:
v. 过滤,萃取,水浸
n. 过滤,过滤器,滤灰槽

word.name: lead
word.mean:
n. 铅,领引,榜样
v. 引导,带领,以铅接合
word.lx: The guide led us to the river./r/n 向导带领我们到河边。/r/n What led you to believe I was ill?/r/n 什么使你相信我病了？/r/n

word.name: leaded
word.mean: a. 加铅的(乙基化的,有引线的)

word.name: leaden
word.mean: a. 沉重的,沉闷的,铅灰色的,深灰色的
word.lx: Drizzle from a leaden sky./r/n 从铅灰色的天空中飘落的雨丝/r/n A leaden conversation./r/n 枯燥无味的谈话/r/n

word.name: leader
word.lx: Which football team is the leader in the football championship?/r/n 现在哪个队在足球锦标赛中领先？/r/n He was elected the leader of the union./r/n 他被选为工会的领导人。/r/n

word.name: leadership
word.lx: She lacks leadership./r/n 她缺乏领导才能。/r/n He was elected to the leadership of the Labour party./r/n 他被选为工党的领导人。/r/n

word.name: leading
word.mean:
n. 领导,疏导,铅板
a. 领导的,主要的,在前的
vbl. 领导,引领,以铅接合
[计算机] 行间空白
word.lx: Have you read the leading story in the newspaper?/r/n 你看了报纸的头条新闻了吗？/r/n She tried to beat up some support for the campaign she was leading./r/n 她力求赢得人们对她所领导的运动的支持。/r/n

word.name: leading edge
word.mean: n. 翼或螺旋桨之前缘, 最先着风之帆缘
word.lx: Even so, younger buyers and others who have been on the leading edge of trends continue to prefer Japanese cars in disproportionate numbers./r/n 尽管如此，年轻的顾客以及走在时代潮流前面的人，仍然宁买日本汽车，其人数之众简直不成比例。/r/n

word.name: leaf
word.mean:
n. 叶,树叶,花瓣
v. 生叶,翻...的页
word.lx: Trees begin to have leaves in spring./r/n 春天，树木开始长叶子了。/r/n This plant has green leaves throughout the year./r/n 这种植物终年常青。/r/n

word.name: leafless
word.lx: Many trees are leafless in winter./r/n 很多树冬天时就掉光了叶子。/r/n

word.name: leaflet
word.lx: I pick up a leaflet about the care of teeth./r/n 我拿起一张宣传保护牙齿的传单。/r/n They distributed leaflets to customers./r/n 他们给客户散发传单。/r/n

word.name: leafy
word.mean: a. 叶茂盛的,多叶的,叶状的
word.lx: I like to eat some leafy vegetables in the summer./r/n 在夏天我喜欢吃一些叶状蔬菜。/r/n There is a leafy forest in our hometown./r/n 在我们的家乡有一片树叶茂密的森林。/r/n

word.name: league
word.lx: Our club is a member of the Football League./r/n 我们的俱乐部是足球联合会的一员。/r/n The police suspected that the bank clerk was in league with the rubbers./r/n 警察怀疑银行职员与强盗有勾结。/r/n

word.name: leak
word.mean:
n. 漏洞
v. 漏,泄漏
vi. 漏,渗
word.lx: There is a leak in the roof./r/n 屋顶有一个漏洞。/r/n Can you smell a gas leak?/r/n 你能闻到煤气漏气吗？/r/n

word.name: leakage
word.lx: The washer for preventing leakage is broken./r/n 那个防漏的垫圈坏了。/r/n

word.name: leaky
word.lx: The plumber went down to the cellar to fix the leaky pipe./r/n 管道工到地下室去修漏水的管子。/r/n Commend me to a leaky house on a rainy day./r/n 雨天我要漏水的房子才怪呢。/r/n

word.name: lean
word.mean:
n. 瘦肉,倾斜,弯曲
a. 瘦的,贫乏的,歉收的
v. 倚靠,倾斜,依赖
word.lx: The trees leant in the wind./r/n 树在风中倾斜。/r/n The little girl only eats lean pork./r/n 这个小女孩只吃瘦肉。/r/n

word.name: leap
word.mean:
n. 跳跃,剧增,急变
v. 跳跃,跃过,猛冲
a. 闰年的
word.lx: His name leapt out at me from the newspaper./r/n 报纸上他的名字一下字跳入我的眼帘。/r/n The thief leaped the wall and ran away./r/n 小偷越墙逃跑了。/r/n

word.name: learned
word.lx: He is a learned doctor./r/n 他是一个医术高明的医生。/r/n Most learned men are modest./r/n 大部分有学问的人都很谦虚。/r/n

word.name: learning
word.mean:
n. 学问,学识,学习
vbl. 学习,获奚,记住
word.lx: A little learning is a dangerous thing./r/n 一知半解，为害不浅。/r/n Her purpose in learning is to be a doctor./r/n 她学习的目的是当医生。/r/n

word.name: leasehold
word.mean:
a. 租(来)的
n. 租赁,租约,租赁期,租赁权

word.name: least
word.mean:
a. 最少的,最小的
n.&ad. 最少,最小
word.lx: The least noise would startle the timid child./r/n 最小的响声也会吓着这个胆小的孩子的。/r/n Mr. Brown talks least./r/n 布朗先生极少说话。/r/n

word.name: leather
word.mean:
a. 皮革制的
n. 皮革
word.lx: I have a pair of leather mittens./r/n 我有一副皮连指手套。/r/n Plastic is sometimes used instead of leather./r/n 塑胶有时可以替代皮革。/r/n

word.name: leaves
word.mean:
n. 树叶,花瓣
v. 离开,出发,留下
word.lx: The leaves have started to colour; it will soon be winter./r/n 树叶已开始变色，很快就是冬天了。/r/n Please bear in mind that the train leaves at midnight./r/n 记住, 火车半夜离开。/r/n

word.name: lecture
word.lx: He lectured to his students on modern writers./r/n 他给学生们讲了关于现代作家的一课。/r/n They could not follow the lecture./r/n 他们听不懂这次演讲。/r/n

word.name: lecturer
word.lx: The lecturer is lecturing on Russian literature./r/n 讲师正在讲俄罗斯文学。/r/n The lecturer is giving a speech./r/n 那个演讲者正在做讲演。/r/n

word.name: LED
word.mean:
lead的过去式(分词)
(light emitting diode)发光二极管

word.name: left
word.mean:
a. 左边的
ad. 向左
n. 左边
vt. 将...留在...
word.lx: His left arm was broken./r/n 他的左臂断了。/r/n Eyes left!/r/n 向左看！/r/n

word.name: left-handed
word.mean: a. 惯用左手的, 用左手的, 笨拙的

word.name: left-hander
word.mean: n. 惯用左手的人,左撇子

word.name: leftover
word.mean:
n. 剩货,残留物,剩饭
a. 残余的
word.lx: She threw the leftovers in the garbage./r/n 她把剩饭倒进垃圾桶。/r/n

word.name: leg
word.lx: This chair has only three legs./r/n 这把椅子只有三条腿。/r/n The doctor inserted a steel plate into his damaged leg./r/n 医生在他受伤的腿中植入了一块钢板。/r/n

word.name: legacy
word.mean: n. 祖先传下来之物,遗赠物
