word.lx: These are the cultural legacies of the Renaissance./r/n 这些是文艺复兴时期的文化遗产。/r/n His weak chest was a legacy of a childhood illness./r/n 他那瘦弱的胸脯是儿时患病的后遗症。/r/n

word.name: legal
word.mean: a. 法律的,合法的,法定的
word.lx: He is the only legal heir of the rich man./r/n 他是这位富翁的唯一法定继承人。/r/n We will introduce legal safeguards against fraud./r/n 我们要采取法律保护措施，制止诈骗活动。/r/n

word.name: legalize
word.mean: v. 法律上认为正当,公认,使合法化
word.lx: Some people want to legalize the possession of cannabis./r/n 有些人想将私有大麻合法化./r/n

word.name: legally
word.mean:
ad. 合法地
n. 合法地,在法律上

word.name: legend
word.lx: The musician made the legend into a beautiful ballad./r/n 这位音乐家把传说编成了一首美丽的民谣。/r/n He is a legend in his lifetime for his scientific discoveries./r/n 他的科学发现使他一生成为传奇人物。/r/n

word.name: legendary
word.lx: Her patience and tact were legendary./r/n 她的耐心和机智是出名的。/r/n One that inspires legends or achieves legendary fame./r/n 传奇人物具有传奇色彩或享有传奇式名誉的人物/r/n

word.name: legible
word.lx: The inscription was still legible./r/n 铭文仍清晰可辨./r/n The sign was no longer legible because much of the lettering had worn away./r/n 这块招牌已看不清楚，因为大部分字已磨掉了。/r/n

word.name: legibly
word.lx: He can write as neatly and legibly as the next person if he takes his time over it./r/n 若他不匆匆忙忙写的话，他能写得和别人一样整洁、清楚。/r/n He writes legibly./r/n 他的字写得很清楚。/r/n

word.name: legion
word.mean: n. 军团,军队,众多的人

word.name: legislation
word.lx: The government will introduce legislation to restrict the sale of firearms./r/n 政府将制定法规限制枪支出售。/r/n Legislation will be difficult and take time./r/n 立法将是困难而又费时的。/r/n

word.name: legislative
word.mean:
n. 立法机构,立法权
a. 立法的,有立法权的
word.lx: Legislative reform is long overdue./r/n 立法方面的改革早该进行。/r/n A legislative assembly is being held./r/n 一个有关立法的会议正在召开。/r/n

word.name: legislator
word.lx: Six legislators were elected by local people./r/n 当地人选举了六名立法委员。/r/n One who makes or enacts laws; a legislator./r/n 立法者制定或颁布法律的人；立法者/r/n

word.name: legislature
word.lx: Do you know what is the legislature in China?/r/n 你知道中国的立法机关是哪个吗？/r/n The legislature has enacted a new liquor law, and he that runs may read./r/n 立法机关颁布了一项新的酒业法，措辞通俗易懂。/r/n

word.name: legitimately
word.mean: ad. 正当地, 合理地

word.name: legitimize
word.mean: vt. 给(孩子)合法地位,使合法,使可接受

word.name: legs
word.lx: Lies have short legs./r/n 谎言总是站不住脚的。/r/n The table legs are screwed to the floor./r/n 这张桌子的腿是用螺丝固定在地板上的。/r/n

word.name: leisure
word.mean:
a. 空闲的
n. 空闲,闲暇
word.lx: Are you at leisure just now?/r/n 你现在有空吗？/r/n Life today is compartmentalized into work and leisure./r/n 现今生活分成工作和闲暇两部分./r/n

word.name: leisurely
word.mean:
a. 悠闲的,从容的
ad. 从容地,悠闲地
word.lx: The group tour the museum at a leisurely pace./r/n 这个旅游团悠闲地参观这个博物馆。/r/n

word.name: lemon
word.lx: There is a lemon tree in our garden./r/n 我们的花园里有一棵柠檬树。/r/n Lemon juice curdles milk./r/n 柠檬汁可使牛奶结成凝乳。/r/n

word.name: lemonade
word.lx: He likes drinking lemonade./r/n 他喜欢喝柠檬汽水。/r/n The lemonade fizzed up./r/n 柠檬水嘶嘶直起泡。/r/n

word.name: lend
word.lx: The banner lent color to the streets./r/n 旗帜给街道增添了色彩。/r/n Can you lend me some money?/r/n 你能借我点钱吗？/r/n

word.name: lender
word.lx: Neither a borrower nor a lender be./r/n 【谚】别借债，莫放债。/r/n

word.name: lending
word.mean:
n. 借贷,借贷物,借来的衣服
a. 借贷的
vbl. 借
word.lx: He beguiled me into lending him my bicycle./r/n 他骗我把自行车借给了他。/r/n What about lending me some money?/r/n 借点钱给我如何？/r/n

word.name: length
word.lx: The room is 15 feet in length and 10 feet in breadth./r/n 这房间长15英尺，宽10英尺。/r/n This car will turn in its own length./r/n 这种汽车可以在自身长度范围内掉头./r/n

word.name: lengthen
word.lx: He lengthened the rope by tying another piece to it./r/n 他又接上一段绳子，把原来的加长了。/r/n The days started to lengthen in March./r/n 白昼在三月里开始变长。/r/n

word.name: lengthwise
word.lx: The tables were laid lengthwise./r/n 这些餐桌是纵向摆放的。/r/n

word.name: lengthy
word.lx: The problem was solved only after several lengthy discussions./r/n 那个问题几经长时间的讨论才得以解决./r/n Being or taking a roundabout, lengthy course./r/n 曲折的，迂回的处于或采用迂回的、冗长的途径/r/n

word.name: lenient
word.lx: Lenient parents; lenient rules./r/n 仁慈的父母；宽松的规章制度/r/n In your case, we are prepared to be lenient./r/n 根据你的情况，我们拟予从宽处理/r/n

word.name: lens
word.lx: The lens is often used to make telescopes./r/n 镜片常被用来做成望远镜。/r/n He uses lens to make things appear clearer./r/n 他用镜片以便看东西更清楚些。/r/n

word.name: lent
word.mean:
lend的过去式(分词)
n. (基督教的)四旬斋
word.lx: He has lent his name to the lofty cause./r/n 他以自己的名义支持这一崇高的事业。/r/n The banner lent color to the streets./r/n 旗帜给街道增添了色彩。/r/n

word.name: Leo
word.lx: A constellation in the Northern Hemisphere near Leo and Gemini./r/n 巨蟹星座北半球狮子座和双子座附近的一个星座/r/n No matter what happens to him. Leo always seems to keep his chin up./r/n 不管利奥发生什么事情，他似乎总是毫不气馁。/r/n

word.name: Leonardo Da Vinci
word.mean: (达)芬奇(1452-1519, 意大利文艺复兴时期伟大画家, 雕刻家, 建筑学家)
word.lx: Leonardo da Vinci is a famous artist in the Italian Renaissance./r/n 利奥纳多·达·芬奇是意大利文艺复兴时期的一位知名画家。/r/n

word.name: leopard
word.lx: He walks slowly and soundlessly like a leopard./r/n 他象一只豹子一样缓慢无声地走着。/r/n The leopard cannot change its spots./r/n 【谚】江山易改，本性难移。/r/n

word.name: leper
word.lx: In the old ages, lepers were often put into fire./r/n 在过去，麻疯病患者经常被扔进大火中烧死。/r/n His unpopular views made him a social leper./r/n 他因观点不受欢迎而见弃于社会。/r/n

word.name: leprosy
word.mean: n. 麻疯病,寒生氏病,腐败
word.lx: There were many people with leprosy around the age of thirty./r/n 在三十年代有很多麻疯病人。/r/n Leprosy is a kind of disease affecting the skin and nerves./r/n 麻疯病是一种影响皮肤和神经的疾病。/r/n

word.name: lesion
word.mean: n. 损害,损伤精神的伤害,障碍

word.name: less
word.mean:
a. 更少的,更小的
ad. 更少地,更小地
word.lx: Work more and dream less, you will be much happier./r/n 多做事少空想，这样你会愉快得多。/r/n He is less tall than she is./r/n 他不如她高。/r/n

word.name: lessee
word.lx: The lessor can evict the lessee for failure to pay rent./r/n 出租人可驱逐不付租金的承租人。/r/n

word.name: lesser
word.mean: a. 较少的,较小的,次要的
word.lx: This is the lesser evil of the two./r/n 这是两种弊病中较轻的。/r/n He is stubborn, and so is she, but to a lesser degree./r/n 他很固执，她也固执，不过程度轻些。/r/n

word.name: lest
word.mean:
conj. 惟恐,以免
prep. 唯恐,以免
word.lx: They spoke in whispers lest they should be heard./r/n 他们低声说话，唯恐被别人听见。/r/n We talked in a low voice lest we should wake the baby up./r/n 我们小声说话以免吵醒婴儿。/r/n

word.name: let
word.mean: v. 让,容许,使得,假设,租给
word.lx: She lets her children play in the garden./r/n 她让孩子们在花园里玩。/r/n He let a week go by before answering the letter./r/n 他一周以后才回信。/r/n

word.name: lethal
word.lx: Pot-holes can be lethal for the unwary cyclist./r/n 路上的坑坑洼洼骑车的人一不小心就有致命危险./r/n In situation like this, she wish she have a gun or some lethal weapon./r/n 在这种情况下，她真希望自己有一把枪或什么致命武器。/r/n

word.name: lethargic
word.mean: a. 迟钝的(不活泼的,冷淡的,困倦的,昏睡的)
word.lx: The hot weather made me feel lethargic./r/n 炎热的天气使我昏昏欲睡。/r/n

word.name: letter
word.lx: This word has five letters./r/n 这个单词有五个字母。/r/n Have you answered her letter?/r/n 你给她回信了吗？/r/n

word.name: letter of credit
word.lx: Since you insist, I must amend the letter of credit./r/n 既然你坚持，我就只好修改信用证。/r/n For overseas deliveries we have to request that you obtain a letter of credit from a bank./r/n 关于对外交货，我方要求贵方应从往来银行获取信用证。/r/n

word.name: letterhead
word.mean: n. 印在信纸上的头衔

word.name: lettering
word.lx: The lettering on the gravestone was badly worn and almost illegible./r/n 墓碑上的文字已严重磨损难以辨认./r/n The sign was no longer legible because much of the lettering had worn away./r/n 这块招牌已看不清楚，因为大部分字已磨掉了。/r/n

word.name: letters
word.lx: I got many letters of consolation when my mother died./r/n 母亲死后，我收到许多安慰信。/r/n We have received many letters on this subject from our readers./r/n 关于这个题目我们收到了很多读者的来信。/r/n

word.name: lettuce
word.lx: I like to eat lettuce in summer, and so does my rabbit./r/n 我喜欢夏天吃莴苣，我的兔子也喜欢。/r/n I like the delicious salad of crisp lettuce and tomatos./r/n 我喜欢这种脆莴苣和番茄做的沙拉，很好吃。/r/n

word.name: levee
word.mean:
n. 堤防(码头)
vt 筑堤

word.name: level
word.mean:
n. 水平,水准,标准
a. 同高的,平坦的,齐平的
v. 弄平,瞄准,对准
word.lx: A football field should be level./r/n 足球场地应该平坦。/r/n The bombing raid practically leveled the town./r/n 空袭几乎把这座城镇夷为平地。/r/n

word.name: lever
word.mean:
n. 杠杆,似杠杆之工具
v. 撬开,使用杠杆
word.lx: Move this lever to change gear./r/n 换档时扳动这根操纵杆。/r/n This latest incident may be the lever needed to change government policy./r/n 最近的事件或许可以作为迫使政府改变政策所需的手段。/r/n

word.name: levy
word.mean:
n. 徵税,召集,课徵
v. 征收,课税,召集
word.lx: The nation levied all able-bodied man for the war./r/n 国家征召所有壮丁参战。/r/n The government levies a fine against the factories for polluting the air with smoke./r/n 政府向以烟尘污染空气的工厂征收罚金。/r/n

word.name: lexicon
word.lx: A lexicon, vocabulary, or dictionary./r/n 字典辞典、词汇或字典/r/n The lexicon of surrealist art./r/n 超现实主义艺术的词汇/r/n

word.name: liabilities
word.lx: The remaining assets of a business after all liabilities have been deducted; net worth./r/n 资产净值一个企业在扣除了所有的债务后所余资产；净值/r/n He summed up his assets and liabilities./r/n 他计算出他的资产和负债总和。/r/n

word.name: liability
word.lx: The judge exempted them from all liability in these matters./r/n 法官免除了他们在这些事上的所有责任和义务。/r/n Taking extra vitamins may reduce your liability to colds./r/n 多吃一些维生素会减少你得感冒的可能性。/r/n

word.name: liar
word.lx: He was a liar./r/n 他是一个说谎者。/r/n The income tax have make more liar out of the american people than gold have./r/n 所得税比黄金把更多的美国人造成了说谎者。/r/n

word.name: liberal
word.mean:
n. 自由主义者
a. 慷慨的,不拘泥的,宽大的
word.lx: He returned from abroad with very liberal ideas./r/n 他带着非常开明的思想从国外回来了。/r/n There was a liberal supply of drinks at the party./r/n 那次宴会上有大量饮料供应。/r/n

word.name: liberate
word.mean:
v. 解放,使获得自由,释出,放出
vt. 解放,使获自由
word.lx: Our army had liberated many occupied areas./r/n 我们的军队解放了许多地区。/r/n The country was liberated in 1966./r/n 这个国家是在1966年解放的。/r/n

word.name: liberation
word.lx: Agriculture in this country has developed greatly after liberation./r/n 解放后这个国家的农业得到了巨大的发展。/r/n The aerospace industry in our country has developed greatly after liberation./r/n 解放后，我国的宇航事业取得了巨大的发展。/r/n

word.name: liberty
word.lx: Those prisoners are dreaming of liberty./r/n 这些囚犯们梦想着获得自由。/r/n I took the liberty of reading the letter, even though it was addressed to you./r/n 尽管这封信是写给你的，但是我冒昧地看过了。/r/n

word.name: librarian
word.lx: The librarian told the student that he should return the book./r/n 图书管理员告诉那个学生他该还书了。/r/n The librarian took a book at random from the shelf./r/n 图书管理员从书架上随便拿了一本书。/r/n

word.name: library
word.lx: I like to study in the library./r/n 我喜欢在图书馆学习。/r/n The town has its own public library and public gardens./r/n 那城市有自己的公用图书馆和公园。/r/n

word.name: licence
word.mean:
n. 执照,许可证,特许
v. 许可,特许,认可
word.lx: When does your driving licence expire?/r/n 你的驾驶执照何时到期?/r/n He is at last the proud possessor of a driving licence./r/n 他终于获得了驾驶执照，这使他颇为得意。/r/n

word.name: license
word.mean:
n. 执照,许可证,特许
v. 许可,特许
word.lx: The license shown by the troops when they entered enemy territory disgusted everyone./r/n 那些部队进入敌人领土所表现出来的放肆令人厌恶。/r/n His license was suspended for six months./r/n 他的执照被吊销6个月。/r/n

word.name: licensed
word.mean:
a. 得到许可的
v. 许可
vbl. 许可
word.lx: The club is licensed to sell beer, wine and spirits./r/n 该俱乐部获得了出售啤酒、葡萄酒和烈性酒的许可。/r/n A licensed practitioner of psychoanalysis./r/n 心理分析医生有开业许可证的心理分析医生/r/n

word.name: lick
word.mean:
n. 舔,少许,打
v. 舔,卷过,鞭打
word.lx: The kitty licked up the milk./r/n 小猫舔光了牛奶。/r/n He licked his fingers./r/n 他舔手指./r/n

word.name: lie
word.mean:
n. 谎言
v. 躺着,说谎,位于
word.lx: Lies have short legs./r/n 谎言总是站不住脚的。/r/n The village lies across the river./r/n 村庄在河对岸。/r/n

word.name: lieutenant
word.mean: n. 中尉,助理人员,副官
word.lx: He was promoted to lieutenant./r/n 他被提升为陆军中尉/海军上尉。/r/n A young lieutenant was named for duty./r/n 一名年轻的中尉被任命担任这项职务。/r/n

word.name: lifelong
word.lx: I believe he will be my lifelong friend./r/n 我相信他会成为我一生的好友。/r/n He chose genetic engineering to be his lifelong career./r/n 他选择了遗传工程学作为终生的事业。/r/n

word.name: lifestyle
word.lx: Accustomed to a position, custom, or lifestyle from or as if from birth./r/n 天生就习惯习惯于一种地位、习俗或生活方式、或天生的或仿佛是天生的/r/n An unsettled lifestyle./r/n 一种变动不居的生活方式/r/n

word.name: lift
word.mean:
n. 举起,帮助,昂扬
n.　电梯
v. 升高,举起,消散
word.lx: He pressed the button to call the lift./r/n 他按键招呼电梯。/r/n The good news lifted my spirits./r/n 这好消息使我精神大振。/r/n

word.name: ligature
word.mean:
n. 绳,索,缚带
v. 缚,捆,结扎

word.name: light bulb
word.lx: The light bulb in the kitchen burnt out./r/n 厨房里的电灯泡烧坏了。/r/n This light bulb has gone./r/n 这灯泡不亮了./r/n

word.name: lighten
word.lx: Her heart lightened when she heard the news./r/n 听到这消息，她轻松了。/r/n A solitary candle lightened the darkness of the room./r/n 一支孤烛使黑暗的房间亮了起来。/r/n

word.name: lighter
word.lx: He asked me if I had a cigarette lighter with me./r/n 他问我身上是否带着打火机。/r/n Scarlet is much lighter than crimson./r/n 绯红色比深红色亮丽得多。/r/n

word.name: lighthearted
word.mean: a. 快乐的, 心情愉快的

word.name: lighthouse
word.lx: The lighthouse flashes signals twice a minute./r/n 灯塔每一分钟发出两次信号。/r/n The lighthouse of the island gleamed in the distance./r/n 远处岛上的灯塔在闪耀着。/r/n

word.name: lighting
word.mean:
n. 照明,光线的明暗,舞台灯光
[计算机] 照明
word.lx: The stage lighting gives the effect of a moonlit scene./r/n 舞台灯光产生月夜景色的效果./r/n The stage lighting give the effect of a moonlit scene./r/n 舞台灯光产生月夜景色的效果。/r/n

word.name: lightning
word.mean:
a. 闪电般的,快速的
n. 闪电
word.lx: There were many flashes of lightning during the storm./r/n 暴雨中出现了好多次闪电。/r/n He moved like lightning./r/n 他行动快如闪电。/r/n

word.name: lights
word.lx: The lights were all full on./r/n 灯火通明。/r/n The lights were blinking on the horizon./r/n 灯光在地平线上闪烁着。/r/n

word.name: lightweight
word.mean: a. 轻的(重量轻的,标准重以下的)
word.lx: A lightweight canoe that is similar in construction./r/n 小艇结构与爱斯基摩划子相似的重量轻的小舟/r/n One of the lightweight circular supports for a hoop skirt./r/n 撑裙箍带裙环女裙中的很轻的环形支撑物/r/n

word.name: light-year
word.lx: Genuine racial equality still seems light-years away./r/n 真正的种族平等似乎仍遥遥无期./r/n

word.name: likable
word.mean: a. 可爱的,值得喜欢的
word.lx: Friendly and agreeable in disposition; good-natured and likable./r/n 温柔的性情友好亲切的；脾气好的，可爱的/r/n Despite his rough corners he was very likable./r/n 尽管他粗里粗气，但却讨人喜欢。/r/n

word.name: like
word.mean:
a. 相似的,同样的
v. 喜欢,愿意,想
prep. 像,如同
word.lx: Do you feel like a walk?/r/n 你想去散散步吗？/r/n We like our work to be justly evaluated./r/n 我们喜欢别人公正的评价我们的工作。/r/n

word.name: likelihood
word.lx: The quality or condition of being probable; likelihood./r/n 可能性，或然性可能的性质或状况；可能性/r/n The likelihood of recovery from a disease./r/n 预后从病中痊愈的可能性/r/n

word.name: like-minded
word.lx: I have complained to my MP, and urge all ,like-minded people to do the same./r/n 我已向议员提出不满的意见, 并努力敦促抱有共识的人采取同样行动./r/n

word.name: liken
word.lx: Life can be likened to a journey with an unknown destination./r/n 生命可以被比作一次不知目的地的旅行。/r/n Someone liken his voice to the croak of a bull-frog./r/n 有人把他的声音比作牛蛙的叫声。/r/n

word.name: likeness
word.lx: He is an enemy in the likeness of a friend./r/n 他是个伪装成朋友的敌人。/r/n There are much likeness between the two cousins./r/n 这两个表姐妹非常相像。/r/n

word.name: liking
word.lx: Personal taste or inclination; liking./r/n 个人的品味和癖好；爱好/r/n Whatever my mother cooks is to my liking./r/n 妈妈做的菜我都喜欢。/r/n

word.name: lilac
word.mean:
n. 紫丁花,丁香花,淡紫色
a. 淡紫色的
word.lx: The lilacs are in flower./r/n 丁香花开了。/r/n I gave her a bunch of lilac./r/n 我送她一束丁香花。/r/n

word.name: lilliputian
word.mean: a. 小人国的,气量小的

word.name: lilt
word.mean:
v. 唱轻快的调子,轻快地动
n. 轻快活泼的调子,轻快的动作
word.lx: She has a faint Irish lilt./r/n 她有点爱尔兰口音./r/n

word.name: lily
word.mean:
a. 纯白的
n. 百合花
word.lx: The pond is dotted with water lilies./r/n 池塘里点缀着睡莲。/r/n Joan and Lily are sisters./r/n 琼和丽丽是姐妹。/r/n

word.name: limb
word.lx: The workers saw off a limb from the tree./r/n 工人从树上锯下了一根大树枝。/r/n The section of the leg or hind limb between the knee and foot; shank./r/n 小腿，胫位于膝盖和脚之间的腿部或后肢的部位；胫/r/n

word.name: limber
word.mean:
a. 柔软的,敏捷的
v. 使柔软,将前车接上
v. 做柔软运动
word.lx: The commander ordered the troops to limber up and move out./r/n 指挥官下令把炮装上牵引车开出去。/r/n Having the ability to move with ease; limber./r/n 敏捷的能活动自如的；灵活的/r/n

word.name: lime
word.lx: He added some water into the lime./r/n 他往石灰里加了些水。/r/n An iced cocktail of rum, lime or lemon juice, and sugar./r/n 代基里酒一种由朗姆酒、莱姆汁或柠檬汁和糖混合的加冰鸡尾酒/r/n

word.name: limelight
word.mean:
n. 石灰光,灰光灯,以灰光灯照射的舞台
v. 使受到注目,使显露头角
word.lx: When I was President, I was always in the limelight there was no privacy./r/n 我当总统时一直为公众瞩目--谈不上私人的生活./r/n She claims she never sought the limelight./r/n 她说她从不爱出风头./r/n

word.name: limitation
word.lx: He knows his limitations./r/n 他知道自己的能力有限。/r/n The government has imposed limitation on imports./r/n 政府已经对进口加以了限制。/r/n

word.name: limitations
word.lx: Aware of their limitations./r/n 认识到他们的局限性/r/n He knows his limitations./r/n 他知道自己的能力有限。/r/n

word.name: limited
word.mean:
a. 有限的
Limited公司(财富500强公司之一，总部所在地美国,主要经营零售)
word.lx: His intelligence is rather limited./r/n 他的智力相当有限。/r/n The edition is limited to 500 copies./r/n 该版限出500本。/r/n

word.name: limitless
word.lx: Limitless authority; the limitless reaches of outer space./r/n 无限的权力；对处外层空间的无限追踪/r/n

word.name: limousine
word.lx: A limousine carried us to the museum./r/n 一辆小型巴士载我们到博物馆。/r/n The hotel has a fleet of limousine to take guest to the airport./r/n 这家饭店拥有一个运送客人去机场的豪华车队。/r/n

word.name: limp
word.mean:
n. 跛行
a. 柔软的,无力的,软弱的
v. 跛行
word.lx: He walks with a limp./r/n 他走路一瘸一拐。/r/n The injury left him with a permanent limp./r/n 他受伤後就一直瘸了./r/n

word.name: limpet
word.lx: The dog clung like a limpet to the thief./r/n 那条狗死死缠住小偷不放。/r/n

word.name: limpid
word.lx: He bathed in many a limpid stream./r/n 他在许多清澈的溪流中沐浴。/r/n The stream is very limpid./r/n 溪流十分清澈。/r/n

word.name: Lincoln
word.lx: President Lincoln was born poor./r/n 林肯总统出身贫寒。/r/n The America Civil War was broken out during the presidency of Lincoln./r/n 在林肯就职其间，美国爆发了内战。/r/n

word.name: Linda
word.lx: Linda is cooking./r/n 琳达在烹饪。/r/n Linda was occupied with the work of redecorating her house./r/n 琳达忙于重新装修她的房子。/r/n

word.name: linden
word.lx: He sat under the linden to take a break./r/n 他坐在菩提树下休息。/r/n

word.name: line
word.mean:
n. 行,线,航线
v. 排成一行,顺...排列,划线于
word.lx: Hang the clothes on the line./r/n 把衣服晾在绳子上。/r/n Their research proceeded along sound lines./r/n 他们的研究沿着正确的方针进行。/r/n

word.name: lineage
word.lx: Direct descent from an ancestor; lineage or pedigree./r/n 家系从一个祖先传下来的直接世系；家系或家族/r/n Of noble lineage./r/n 门第高贵的高贵血统的/r/n

word.name: linear
word.mean: a. 线的,直线的,线状的

word.name: linen
word.mean:
n. 亚麻布,亚麻线,亚麻制品
a. 亚麻布制的,亚麻的
word.lx: I want to buy a new bed linen./r/n 我想买一个新床单。/r/n This skirt is made of linen./r/n 这件裙子是亚麻的。/r/n

word.name: liner
word.lx: Hundreds died when the liner went down./r/n 班轮沉没时，有数百人罹难。/r/n The liner has been refitted from stem to stern./r/n 那艘班轮已经全面整修./r/n

word.name: lines
word.lx: Actors often mutter to themselves when rehearsing their lines./r/n 演员背台词的时候经常自己嘀嘀咕咕。/r/n The maths teacher was furious and gave me 50 lines./r/n 数学老师气坏了, 罚我抄书50行./r/n

word.name: linger
word.lx: The beautiful melody is lingering in my mind./r/n 美妙的音乐在我心中回荡。/r/n He lingered outside the school after everybody else had gone home./r/n 别人回家后，他仍在学校外面徘徊。/r/n

word.name: lingua franca
word.lx: Swahili is the principal lingua franca in East Africa./r/n 东非的主要交际语是斯瓦希里语./r/n

word.name: lingual
word.mean:
a. 舌的,舌音的,语言的
n. 舌音,舌音字

word.name: linguist
word.lx: A good dictionary is the handmaid of the linguist./r/n 一部好字典封语言学家的帮助甚大。/r/n The linguist go to study tribal language in the field./r/n 语言学家们去实地研究部落语言了。/r/n

word.name: linguistic
word.lx: A local linguistic feature./r/n 方言地方语言现象/r/n And their language and linguistic competence should be improved./r/n 他们的语言能力和语言学知识必须得到提高。/r/n

word.name: linguistics
word.lx: Literary studies have been cross-fertilized by new ideas in linguistics./r/n 文学研究从语言学方面的新见解中受益良多./r/n He is engaged in studies in linguistics./r/n 他从事于语言学的研究。/r/n

word.name: liniment
word.lx: A liniment or lotion./r/n 一种涂抹油或洗液/r/n A liniment that burns when first applied./r/n 第一次使用时就感到炽热的擦剂/r/n

word.name: lining
word.lx: He put on a coat with a fur lining./r/n 他穿上一件有毛皮衬里的外衣。/r/n The coat has a detachable lining inside./r/n 这件大衣有活里儿./r/n

word.name: link
word.mean:
n. 环节,联系
v. 连接,联系
word.lx: Is there a link between smoking and lung disease?/r/n 吸烟与肺部疾病之间有关系吗？/r/n The road links all the new towns./r/n 这条路把所有的新城镇都连接起来了。/r/n

word.name: linkup
word.lx: A linkup of two orbiting spacecraft./r/n 轨道上两个太空飞行器的会合/r/n

word.name: linoleum
word.lx: Linoleum is made of canvas coated with linseed./r/n 油毡是由涂有亚麻油的帆布做成的。/r/n

word.name: linotype
word.mean:
n. 自动铸造排字机
v. 以自动排字机排字

word.name: linseed
word.lx: Is linseed oil edible?/r/n 亚麻籽油可以食用吗？/r/n Linoleum is made of canvas coated with linseed./r/n 油毡是由涂有亚麻油的帆布做成的。/r/n

word.name: lion
word.lx: The soldier is as brave as a lion./r/n 这个战士象狮子一样勇猛。/r/n The lion was ravening the prey./r/n 那只狮子在贪婪地吞食着捕获的猎物。/r/n

word.name: lioness
word.lx: The lioness crouched ready to strike./r/n 母狮低伏著身子准备攻击。/r/n The lioness bounded across the plain, hard on the heels of a terrified gazelle./r/n 母狮在平原上跳跃着，紧紧地跟在惊恐的小羚羊后面。/r/n

word.name: lionize
word.lx: Marilyn wanted to be loved, not lionized./r/n 玛里琳要的是爱而不是崇拜。/r/n

word.name: lipid
word.mean: n. 脂质, 油脂[脂肪,乳酪]

word.name: lips
word.lx: He kissed her on the lips./r/n 他吻了她的嘴唇。/r/n The ghost of a smile (ie a very faint smile) played round her lips./r/n 她嘴角上露著一丝微笑./r/n

word.name: lipstick
word.lx: I have several lipsticks in my bag./r/n 我的包里有好几支口红。/r/n Lipstick and hair conditioner are cosmetics./r/n 口红和护发素都是化妆品./r/n

word.name: liquid
word.mean:
a. 液体的,液态的
n. 液体
word.lx: Water is a liquid./r/n 水是液体。/r/n Kate is a pretty girl with large liquid eyes./r/n 凯特是一个有一双水汪汪大眼睛的漂亮姑娘。/r/n

word.name: liquidate
word.mean:
v. 偿付,清算,扫除
v. 清算,整理,破产
word.lx: Hitler tried to liquidate the Jews in Germany./r/n 希特勒试图全部消灭德国的犹太人。/r/n

word.name: liquidation
word.lx: The firm went into voluntary liquidation./r/n 那家商号自动停业清算债务./r/n He lost all he possessed when his company was put into liquidation./r/n 当公司被清算结业时他失去了拥有的一切。/r/n

word.name: liquidity
word.lx: The company has good liquidity./r/n 该公司的资产流动性好./r/n The bank has progressively increased its liquidity./r/n 银行逐渐地增加其流动资产。/r/n

word.name: liquor
word.lx: He appears to have drunk a lot of liquor./r/n 他似乎喝得醉醺醺的。/r/n The liquor is 80% proof./r/n 这种酒为标准度数的80%./r/n

word.name: lisp
word.mean:
n. 口齿不清,咬舌
vi. 发音不清
word.lx: He lisped out his words./r/n 他口齿不清地说出他的话。/r/n The child has a bad lisp./r/n 这孩子的口齿十分不清。/r/n

word.name: lissom
word.mean: a. 柔软的(敏捷的,轻快的)

word.name: lissome
word.mean: a. 柔软的(敏捷的,轻快的)

word.name: list
word.mean:
n. 目录,名单,明细表
v. 列出,列于表上,记入名单内
word.lx: He wrote down his name on the list./r/n 他将他的名字写在清单上。/r/n She complained about the omission of her name from the list./r/n 她抱怨名单上遗漏了她的名字。/r/n

word.name: listen
word.lx: I listened to their conversation./r/n 我倾听他们的谈话。/r/n She is listening to the radio./r/n 她在听收音机。/r/n

word.name: listener
word.lx: Good evening to all our listeners!/r/n 各位听众，晚上好！/r/n She is a good listener at class./r/n 在课堂上，她是个认真听讲的人。/r/n

word.name: listing
word.lx: He wrote down his name on the list./r/n 他将他的名字写在清单上。/r/n The damaged vessel was listing badly./r/n 受损坏的船倾斜得很厉害./r/n

word.name: liter
word.lx: Packing one liter bottle15 bottle per carton./r/n 包装：每瓶一公升，每箱15瓶。/r/n A metric unit of volume equal to one-tenth(10-1) of a liter./r/n 分升容量的公制单位之一，等于1／10（10－1）升/r/n

word.name: literacy
word.lx: Mass literacy was only possible after the invention of printing./r/n 发明了印刷术后文化教育才得以普及。/r/n

word.name: literally
word.mean: ad. 逐字地,按照字面上地,不夸张地
word.lx: Idioms usually cannot be translated literally in another language./r/n 成语通常不能照字面译成另一种语言。/r/n The prediction was literally accomplished./r/n 这个预言确实实现了。/r/n

word.name: literate
word.mean:
n. 学者
a. 精通文学的,受过教育的
word.lx: Every literate person should read this book./r/n 凡有文化的人都该一读此书./r/n Though nearly twenty he was barely literate./r/n 他都快二十了, 还是睁眼瞎子./r/n

word.name: literature
word.lx: Literature is a mirror of its time./r/n 文学是时代的镜子。/r/n The lecturer is lecturing on Russian literature./r/n 讲师正在讲俄罗斯文学。/r/n

word.name: litter
word.mean:
n. 垃圾,杂乱
v. 乱丢垃圾,弄乱
word.lx: Our cat has a litter of four kittens./r/n 我们家的猫一窝养了4只小猫。/r/n He was fined for littering on the sidewalks./r/n 他因在人行横道上乱扔杂物而被罚款。/r/n

word.name: little
word.mean:
a. 小的
ad. 毫不
n. 几乎没有
word.lx: Little does he care whether we live or die./r/n 他一点也不管我们是死是活。/r/n The little that I have seen of his work is satisfactory./r/n 他的工作就我所见的那一小部分而言是令人满意的。/r/n

word.name: live
word.mean:
a. 活的,生动的,精力充沛的,直播的
v. 活,居住,过著
word.lx: Where do you live?/r/n 你住在哪儿？/r/n The cat is playing with a live mouse./r/n 猫在戏弄那只活老鼠。/r/n

word.name: lively
word.mean: 活泼的, 活跃的, 栩栩如生的, 真实的
word.lx: He told a very lively story about his life in Africa./r/n 他非常生动地讲述了他在非洲的生活。/r/n She had a lively sense of humor./r/n 她幽默感很强。/r/n

word.name: living
word.mean:
a. 活着的
n. 生活,生计
word.lx: The quality of urban living has been damaged by excessive noise levels./r/n 城市生活的质量已被过度的噪音所破坏。/r/n What do you do for a living?/r/n 你以什么谋生？/r/n

word.name: load
word.mean:
n. 负荷,重担,装载量
v. 装载,装填,担负,给(枪)装子弹
[计算机] 装入
word.lx: Her grief is a heavy load to bear./r/n 她心情沉重得难以忍受。/r/n Have you finished loading up?/r/n 你装完了没有？/r/n

word.name: loaded
word.mean:
a. 有负载的(装着货的,装有弹药的,加重的)
v. 装载
word.lx: The truck was heavily loaded./r/n 这辆卡车装载很重。/r/n The ship was loaded down with extra cargo./r/n 额外的货物使船装载超重。/r/n

word.name: loading
word.lx: A language processor thatcollects"modules for loading and assigns their relative positions in storage;in a virtual storage system, a collector attempts to place object code in pages/segments in such a way as to minimize virtual storage interrupts during"

word.name: loan
word.mean:
n. 贷款,借出,债权人
v. 借,供应货款,借给
word.lx: She loaned her collection of paintings to the gallery./r/n 她把自己收藏的画借给了美术馆。/r/n She offered me the loan of her car./r/n 她提出把汽车借给我用。/r/n

word.name: loath
word.lx: He seemed somewhat loath to depart./r/n 他似乎不愿离去。/r/n I was loath to go with him./r/n 我不愿和他一起去。/r/n

word.name: loaves
word.mean:
n. 面包(个)
vt 浪费时间
word.lx: Two brown loaves and one large white one, please./r/n 请拿两个黑面包和一个大的白面包./r/n We loafed for hours in the park./r/n 我们在公园里闲逛了几个小时。/r/n

word.name: lobby
word.mean:
n. 大厅,门廊,门厅,休息室,游说议员者
v. 游说
word.lx: The anti-nuclear lobby is becoming stronger./r/n 向议员游说的反核群众声势渐强。/r/n I waited for her in the lobby of theatre yesterday./r/n 昨天我在戏院的大厅等她。/r/n

word.name: lobe
word.mean: n. 圆形突出部,耳朵,裂片

word.name: lobster
word.lx: Lobsters turn scarlet when they are boiled./r/n 龙虾在被煮熟的时候会变红。/r/n Lobster has eight legs and two long claws./r/n 龙虾有八条腿两条爪子。/r/n

word.name: local
word.mean:
a. 地方性的,当地的,局部的
[计算机] 局部的
word.lx: I asked one of the locals which way to go./r/n 我问了一位本地人，该走哪条路。/r/n The express train is an hour faster than the local./r/n 快车比慢车快一小时。/r/n

word.name: locale
word.lx: The director is looking for a suitable locale for his new film./r/n 导演在为新片物色合适的拍摄场地。/r/n

word.name: locality
word.lx: There are several supermarkets in the locality./r/n 这个地区有好几家超市。/r/n The district or locality in which such a group lives./r/n 区域这样一群人住的区域或位置/r/n

word.name: localization
word.mean: n. 局限,地方分权,地方化

word.name: localize
word.mean:
vi. 集中,局部化
vt. 使地方化,使局部化

word.name: locally
word.mean: ad. 地方性地,局部性地,位置上

word.name: located
word.lx: Greece is located in the south of Europe./r/n 希腊位于欧洲南部。/r/n Located in a dismal or remote area./r/n 荒凉的处于荒凉或遥远的地方的/r/n

word.name: location
word.lx: The town is a good location for a young doctor./r/n 这个小镇很适宜于一位青年医生安家。/r/n He indicated the location of the Persian Gulf with a pen on the map./r/n 他用一支笔在地图上标出了波斯湾的位置。/r/n

word.name: lock
word.mean:
n. 锁,刹车,水闸
v. 锁,上锁,拘禁
[计算机] 锁定
word.lx: She locked her jewels in the safe./r/n 她把自己的珠宝首饰都锁在保险箱里。/r/n After the burglary I had all the locks changed./r/n 在遭到盗窃之后，我把所有的锁都换了。/r/n

word.name: locker
word.mean: n. 柜(箱,橱,机架,室,锁夹,锁扣装置)
word.lx: Luggage locker can be rented at the airport./r/n 可在机场租用带锁的行李寄存柜。/r/n The locker room of an athletic team./r/n 更衣室运动队有橱柜的房间/r/n

word.name: loco
word.lx: I stand towards her in loco parentis./r/n 我对她代尽其父母亲的责任./r/n The court is acting in loco parent./r/n 正以家长地位行为的法院。/r/n

word.name: locomotive
word.mean:
n. 火车头,机关车
a. 运转的,火车头的,移动的
word.lx: The steam locomotives were superseded by diesel units./r/n 蒸汽机车已被柴油内燃机车所取代。/r/n He is a locomotive engineer./r/n 他是一名火车司机。/r/n

word.name: locust
word.lx: The locust swarm has destroyed all the crops and vegetables./r/n 蝗虫群毁坏了所有的庄稼和蔬菜。/r/n A locust is a kind of destructive insect./r/n 蝗虫是一种害虫。/r/n

word.name: lodging
word.lx: Where can we find lodgings for the night?/r/n 我们今天在哪找一寄宿处？/r/n Where are you lodging?/r/n 你在哪里寄宿?/r/n

word.name: lofty
word.mean: a. 高的,高超的,傲慢的
word.lx: He has lofty ideals about life./r/n 他对人生抱有崇高的理想。/r/n She hate his lofty manner./r/n 她恨他那傲慢的举止。/r/n

word.name: logging
word.lx: The pilot had logged over 200 hours in the air./r/n 这个飞行员的飞行记录在200小时以上./r/n A logging sled./r/n 滑板中耕机/r/n

word.name: logical
word.mean: a. 符合逻辑的,逻辑上的
word.lx: Is it a logical necessity that higher wages will lead to higher prices?/r/n 工资一高物价就高, 这是不是合乎逻辑的必然规律?/r/n Marked by logical sequence./r/n 连贯的符合逻辑顺序的/r/n

word.name: logo
word.mean:
n. 图形,商标
[计算机] 语标
word.lx: In addition, delphi2.0 make it easy for customer to create application to meet the requirement to get the window95 logo./r/n 另外，为了满足得到Windows95徽标的要求，Delphi2。0使客户创建应用程序更加简便。/r/n

word.name: loneliness
word.lx: Loneliness in a gloomy raining day may be unbearable to him./r/n 对他来说，阴郁的雨天的寂寞是难以忍受的。/r/n Loneliness almost drive her mad./r/n 孤独几乎使她发疯了。/r/n

word.name: lonely
word.mean: a. 孤独的,寂寞的,荒凉的
word.lx: She feels rather lonely in the strange town./r/n 在这座陌生的城市里，她感到很寂寞。/r/n The lonely child is longing for the caress of his mother./r/n 这个孤独的孩子渴望母亲的爱抚。/r/n

word.name: lonesome
word.lx: He spent a lonesome evening at home./r/n 他在家里度过了一个寂寞的夜晚。/r/n He felt lonesome at home alone./r/n 他一个人呆在家里感到寂寞。/r/n

word.name: long
word.mean:
a. 长的,很久的,冗长的
v. 渴望,热望,极想
ad. 长期地
word.lx: She was slender and had long dark hair./r/n 她身材苗条，有一头长长的黑发。/r/n She longed to be back in China./r/n 她渴望回到中国。/r/n

word.name: longer
word.mean:
a. 比较久的
ad. 比较久

word.name: longevity
word.lx: His longevity vexed his heirs./r/n 他的长寿令他的继承人们不快/r/n Proper rest and enough sleep contribute to longevity./r/n 适当的休息和足够的睡眠有益于长寿。/r/n

word.name: longing
word.mean:
n. 渴望,热望,憧憬
a. 渴望的,热望的
vbl. 渴望,渴慕,热望
word.lx: The lonely child is longing for the caress of his mother./r/n 这个孤独的孩子渴望母亲的爱抚。/r/n Having or expressing a wish or longing./r/n 渴望的，急切希望的有或表达希望或渴望的/r/n

word.name: look
word.mean:
n. 看,神色,样子,脸色
v. 看,看,注视
word.lx: He looks nervous./r/n 他看上去很紧张。/r/n They looked forward very much to seeing him again./r/n 他们非常盼望再次见到他。/r/n

word.name: loom
word.mean:
n. 织布机
v. 朦胧地出现,隐约可见,可怖地出现
word.lx: The convention looms as political battle./r/n 这场大会将是一场政治角斗。/r/n The mountainous island loomed on the horizon./r/n 那座巨大的岛屿隐隐约约浮现在地平线上。/r/n

word.name: loop
word.mean:
n. 环,圈,弯曲部份
v. 使...成环,以圈结,以环连结
[计算机] 循环
word.lx: Her wavy hair fell in loose wisps and loops upon her shoulders./r/n 她那一头波浪般的长发一簇簇一圈圈地散垂在肩上。/r/n The news of their marriage knocked me for a loop./r/n 他们结婚的消息使我大吃一惊。/r/n

word.name: loosely
word.mean: ad. 松弛地,宽松地,不紧
word.lx: Loosely, a mathematical or logic operator./r/n 不严格地说，一种数学或逻辑运算符。/r/n His principles sit loosely on him./r/n 他的原则对他没有多大约束力。/r/n

word.name: lorry
word.lx: They use a lorry to carry coals./r/n 他们用卡车运煤。/r/n The maximum load for this lorry is one ton./r/n 这辆卡车最大载重量是一吨。/r/n

word.name: lot
word.mean:
ad. 相当
n. 许多
word.lx: They drew lots to decide which of them should go first./r/n 他们以抓阄来决定谁先去。/r/n You have lots of time to finish the work./r/n 你有充裕的时间来完成这项工作。/r/n

word.name: loth
word.lx: The girls were nothing loth, for the house was splendid, and the welcome kind enough./r/n 姑娘们很愉快，因为房子很是华丽的，而且接待是相当热情。/r/n

word.name: lottery
word.lx: She had the prize-winning lottery ticket./r/n 她抽到了得奖的彩票./r/n He scooped 1000 in the lottery./r/n 他在抽彩中捷足先登赢得1000英镑./r/n

word.name: loudspeaker
word.lx: The police addressed the crowd through a loudspeaker on their car./r/n 警察通过他们汽车上的喇叭向人群喊话。/r/n A loudspeaker designed to reproduce bass frequencies./r/n 低频扬声器设计用来再现低音频率的扬声器/r/n

word.name: lovable
word.lx: She is a very lovable girl./r/n 她是一个非常可爱的女孩。/r/n She is the most lovable among all girls./r/n 所有姑娘中她是最可爱的。/r/n

word.name: love
word.mean:
n. 爱,恋爱,爱情
vt. 爱,热爱,喜欢
word.lx: Her love for him never waved./r/n 她对他的爱从未动摇过。/r/n I love my motherland./r/n 我爱我的祖国。/r/n

word.name: lovely
word.mean: a. 可爱的,令人愉快的
word.lx: She is a lovely girl./r/n 她是一个漂亮的女孩。/r/n The lovely boy has beautiful blonde curls./r/n 这个可爱的小男孩长着漂亮的金黄色卷发。/r/n

word.name: lover
word.lx: They met in May and became lovers soon after./r/n 他们在五月份相遇，不久就成为了情侣。/r/n His lover is a beautiful girl./r/n 他的情人是一个美丽的女孩。/r/n

word.name: low
word.mean:
n. 低点,低价,低
a. 低的,消沉的,低等的
ad. 低下地,谦卑地,低
word.lx: There was a low murmur of conversation in the hall./r/n 大厅里有窃窃私语声。/r/n Judy bent her face low over the notebook./r/n 朱迪把脸凑近笔记本。/r/n

word.name: lower
word.mean:
a. 低的,下级的,下层的
v. 降低,跌落,减弱
word.lx: The deer lowered its head to drink from the pond./r/n 鹿低下头去喝池塘里的水。/r/n Tom was lying on the lower bunk./r/n 汤姆躺在下铺。/r/n

word.name: lowest
word.mean: a. 最低的,最底下的,最小的
word.lx: We got estimates from three different contractors before accepting the lowest./r/n 我们得到三个承包商的报价後, 接受了价钱最低的./r/n The lowest part, as of an embankment or a dam./r/n 坡脚最底下的部分，如堤防或坝的/r/n

word.name: loyal
word.mean:
a. 忠诚的,忠心的
ad. 忠诚地,忠实地
n. 忠贞,忠诚,忠实
word.lx: The soldiers are loyal to their country./r/n 士兵们忠于他们的国家。/r/n I may say in all sincerity that you have been my most loyal friend./r/n 我可以非常真诚地说，你一直是我最忠实的朋友。/r/n

word.name: lubricate
word.lx: If you never bother to lubricate your engine, of course it will seize up./r/n 如果你老是怕麻烦，不给发动机添加润滑油，发动机当然会失灵卡住啦。/r/n

word.name: lucid
word.mean: a. 明白易懂的,清晰的,头脑清楚的
word.lx: I made a lucid explanation to them./r/n 我向他们做了明白的解释。/r/n The style is lucid and lively./r/n 笔调很明快。/r/n

word.name: luck
word.lx: You never know your luck./r/n 你也许会走运的。/r/n He had wonderful luck in all his ventures./r/n 他干任何事情运气都好。/r/n

word.name: lucky
word.lx: You are lucky to be alive after being in that accident./r/n 你真幸运，经过那场车祸还能生还。/r/n You lucky rascal!/r/n 你这个幸运的家伙！/r/n

word.name: lucrative
word.mean: a. 有利益的,获利的,合算的

word.name: ludicrous
word.lx: He made many ludicrous mistakes in his speech./r/n 他的演讲中有许多可笑的错误。/r/n His idea is ludicrous./r/n 他的想法很荒唐。/r/n

word.name: lukewarm
word.lx: Gave only lukewarm support to the incumbent candidate./r/n 给在位的候选人不冷不热的支持/r/n Indifferent or lukewarm especially in matters of religion./r/n 淡漠的漠不关心或不热情的，尤指对宗教事务/r/n

word.name: lull
word.mean:
n. 暂停,间歇,稍息
v. 平息,使...平静,哄
word.lx: During the night the wind lulled./r/n 夜里，风停了。/r/n The mother lulled the baby to sleep./r/n 母亲哄着孩子入睡了。/r/n

word.name: lumber
word.mean:
n. 木材,木料
v. 伐木
vi. 缓慢地移动
vt. 拖累
word.lx: The old car lumbered up the hill./r/n 那辆旧车摇摇晃晃地开上了小山。/r/n He has a lumber-mill./r/n 他有一个锯木厂。/r/n

word.name: luminous
word.lx: There are many luminous road signs along the roads./r/n 沿着路有许多夜光路标。/r/n Giving off light; luminous./r/n 发光的散发光的；明亮的/r/n

word.name: lunar
word.lx: It was reported that there would be a lunar eclipse tomorrow evening./r/n 据报道说，明天晚上有月食。/r/n The astronauts piloted their craft down to the lunar surface./r/n 宇航员驾驶宇宙飞船在月球表面降落./r/n

word.name: lunar month
word.lx: A month, especially a lunar month./r/n 太阴月一个月，尤指阴历的月/r/n

word.name: lunch
word.lx: Have you had your lunch?/r/n 吃过午饭了吗？/r/n We had a very tolerable lunch./r/n 我们吃了顿很不错的午餐。/r/n

word.name: lung
word.lx: That opera singer has good lungs./r/n 那位歌剧演员声音宏亮。/r/n Is there a link between smoking and lung disease?/r/n 吸烟与肺部疾病之间有关系吗？/r/n

word.name: lunge
word.mean:
n. 刺,刺进,跃进
v. 突进,踢,刺出
word.lx: She lunged out with a knife./r/n 她持刀猛冲过去./r/n He lunged wildly at his opponent./r/n 他疯狂地扑向对手./r/n

word.name: lurch
word.mean:
n. 惨败,倾斜,举步蹒跚
v. 突然向一边倾斜
word.lx: The bandit catch Bill, and Tom leave him in the lurch./r/n 歹徒抓住了比尔，而汤姆却把他弃之不顾。/r/n The enemy of human happiness is always lying at lurch./r/n 人类幸福的大敌总是伺机进行破坏的。/r/n

word.name: lure
word.mean:
n. 饵,诱惑
v. 引诱,诱惑
word.lx: He left home because of the lures of the life in the city./r/n 由于受到城市生活的诱或，他离开了家。/r/n The enticement of the big city lure her away from her home./r/n 大城市的种种诱惑吸引了她离家出走。/r/n

word.name: lurid
word.mean: a. 火烧似的,华丽而庸俗的,可怕的
word.lx: The papers gave the lurid details of the murder./r/n ＂报纸上描述了谋杀案的详情，令人毛骨悚然。＂/r/n A lurid, melodramatic, but accurate account of the accident./r/n 关于这事件的一则轰动且耸人听闻但确切的报导/r/n

word.name: lurk
word.mean:
n. 潜伏,潜行
v. 潜藏,潜伏,埋伏
word.lx: The thief lurked in the shadows./r/n 小偷在阴暗处躲着。/r/n Danger lurked in the atmosphere./r/n 氛围中隐藏着危险。/r/n

word.name: luscious
word.mean: a. 甘美的,浓厚的,官能的
word.lx: She is a luscious blonde./r/n 她是个迷人的金发女郎。/r/n I like the luscious taste of ripe peaches./r/n 我喜欢熟桃的香甜味。/r/n

word.name: lust
word.mean:
n. 贪欲,欲望,色欲
v. 贪求,渴望,动淫念
word.lx: She is like a child lusting for toys./r/n 她像一个渴望玩具的小孩。/r/n His lust for power will never be satisfied./r/n 他的权力欲永不能得到满足。/r/n

word.name: luster
word.mean:
n. 光彩,荣誉,光泽
v. 有光泽,发亮,使...发光辉
word.lx: Having a luster resembling that of pearls./r/n 珠母般的具有珍珠般的光泽的/r/n The luster characteristic of a pearl of high quality./r/n 珍珠光泽一种高品质珍珠所特有光泽/r/n

word.name: lustful
word.lx: Inciting lustful feelings; lewd./r/n 猥亵的引起欲望的；淫猥的/r/n Preoccupied with sex and sexual desire; lustful./r/n 放荡的，淫荡的性方面放荡的和充满色情欲望的；贪欲的/r/n

word.name: lustre
word.mean:
n. 光彩, 光泽
vi. 有光泽, 发亮
vt. 使有光泽
word.lx: His deeds add much lustre to his reputation./r/n 他的行为使他声誉大增。/r/n

word.name: lusty
word.mean: a. 健壮的,精力充沛的
word.lx: He has a strong and lusty son./r/n 他有一个体格健壮精力充沛的儿子。/r/n A lusty cry./r/n 强有力的吼叫/r/n

word.name: luxuriant
word.mean: a. 繁茂的,丰富的,肥沃的
word.lx: There is luxuriant tropical vegetation in our country./r/n 我们国家有很多繁茂的热带植物。/r/n Luxuriant forests covered the hills./r/n 山上长满茂密的树林。/r/n

word.name: luxurious
word.lx: The lady appeared with a luxurious fur coat./r/n 那位夫人穿着华贵的毛皮外套来了。/r/n He took a long luxurious hot bath when he came back home./r/n 回家后，他舒适地在热水中泡了很长时间。/r/n

word.name: luxury
word.lx: A long hot bath can be pure luxury./r/n 洗个痛快的热水澡可真是一种至高的享受。/r/n She has lived in luxury all her life./r/n 她一生生活奢侈。/r/n

word.name: lymphoid
word.mean: a. 淋巴的或淋巴样的

word.name: lynch
word.mean:
n. 私刑,私罚
v. 处以私刑,加私刑

word.name: lyre
word.lx: Lyres were played by the ancient Greeks./r/n 古希腊人弹奏七弦琴。/r/n

word.name: lyric
word.mean:
a. 抒情的
n. 抒情诗
word.lx: He wrote a lyric poem./r/n 他写了一首抒情诗。/r/n The anthology reveals a prejudice in favour of lyric poets./r/n 这部选集显示出对抒情诗人有所偏爱./r/n

word.name: lyrical
word.mean: a. 欢欣的,充满愉悦的
word.lx: She started to become/wax lyrical about health food./r/n 她对保健食品极为讲究了./r/n Gave a lyrical description of her experiences in the South Seas./r/n 对她在南太平洋的经历作了热情的描述/r/n

word.name: lyricist
word.lx: Mr Sharp who works out of the country-music tradition, is a gifted lyricist who does something good in every second song./r/n 基于乡村音乐进行创作的夏普先生是一位很有天才的歌词作者，他在许多歌曲中都做出好成绩。/r/n

word.name: M
word.lx: In English, b, p, m and w are bilabials./r/n 英语中的b、p、m、w为双唇音./r/n

word.name: Mabel
word.lx: Her friends egged on Mabel to spend money to show off./r/n 梅布尔的朋友们怂恿她花钱摆阔气。/r/n Old Mabel is still going strong and still working on his farm every day./r/n 老梅布尔依然很健壮，每天还在他的农场里工作。/r/n

word.name: macabre
word.mean: a. 恐怖的, 令人毛骨悚然的, 以死亡为主题的

word.name: macaroni
word.lx: Here you can see two workers who, between them, have just finished cutting three cart-loads of golden brown macaroni stalks./r/n 这里您可以看到两名工人，他们刚刚割好三大马车金黄色的通心粉小麦杆。/r/n

word.name: mace
word.mean: n. 钉头槌,权标,执权标者
word.lx: The mayor has a mace which is held as a sign of authority./r/n 市长的权杖是权威的象征。/r/n She put some mace into the meat./r/n 她往肉里加了一些肉豆蔻干皮。/r/n

word.name: macerate
word.mean: vt. 在水中或苛性钾中浸软

word.name: Mach
word.lx: From the drawer Mr Mach took out a chain, with a bunch of keys dangling at its end./r/n 马赫先生从抽屉里拿出一条链子，链子一头挂着一串钥匙。/r/n For him fame does not count for mach/r/n 在他看来名誉算不了什么。/r/n

word.name: machine
word.mean:
n. 机器,机械装置,机械般工作的人
v. 以机器制造
[计算机] 机器
word.lx: My mother-in-law has a sewing machine./r/n 我婆婆有一台缝纫机。/r/n The edge must be machined to 0.02 millimeters./r/n 这边缘必须切割到0.02毫米的精密度。/r/n

word.name: machine gun
word.lx: Machine guns opened up from a concealed position./r/n 机关枪从隐蔽的阵地开始射击。/r/n At daybreak our machine guns opened up./r/n 黎明时，我们的机枪开火了。/r/n

word.name: machinery
word.lx: We have no machinery for dealing with complaints./r/n 我们没有处理投诉的机构。/r/n Much machinery has been installed./r/n 已经安装了许多新机器。/r/n

word.name: Macintosh
word.mean: n. 苹果机,一种个人电脑

word.name: maculate
word.mean:
vt. 弄脏
a. 有斑点的

word.name: mad
word.mean:
def#adj;maddish


a.发疯的,狂热的,着迷的,生气的
word.lx: She was almost mad with grief when her son died./r/n 她的儿子死去时，她悲伤得几乎疯了。/r/n They are mad about football./r/n 他们对足球很狂热。/r/n

word.name: madame
word.lx: Madame Cartier; Madame Jacqueline Cartier./r/n 卡蒂埃夫人；杰奎琳·卡蒂埃夫人/r/n Madame Song told the children a story yesterday./r/n 宋夫人昨天给孩子们讲了个故事。/r/n

word.name: madden
word.lx: The delays maddened him./r/n 一再的延误让他生气。/r/n It maddens me that she was chosen instead of me./r/n 选中她而未选中我，真把我气死了。/r/n

word.name: maddening
word.mean: a. 使人恼火的,令人气恼的
word.lx: Her oscillations in mood are maddening./r/n 她喜怒无常能把人气疯。/r/n The box has spat forth maddening nine- second sound bite./r/n 电视机已经整整吐放了九秒钟令人疯狂的插播。/r/n

word.name: magazine
word.lx: I bought the magazines on my way home./r/n 在回家的路上，我买了一些杂志。/r/n This magazine has a large circulation./r/n 这本杂志发行量很大。/r/n

word.name: magic
word.mean:
a. 有魔力的
n. 魔法,魔术
word.lx: The magician thrilled his audience with his feats of magic./r/n 魔术师用他的魔术技艺使观众们激动。/r/n The paper turned green as if by magic./r/n 这纸魔术般地变成了绿色。/r/n

word.name: magician
word.lx: I like watching the performance of that magician./r/n 我喜欢看那个魔术师的表演。/r/n The magician displayed his charms and potions./r/n 魔术师展示了咒符和有魔力的饮品。/r/n

word.name: magistrate
word.lx: He worked as a magistrate after graduation./r/n 他毕业后任地方行政长官。/r/n The magistrate refused his bail./r/n 地方法官不准他保释。/r/n

word.name: magnanimous
word.mean: a. 度量大的,宽大的,有雅量的
word.lx: He is a magnanimous person./r/n 他是个宽宏大量的人。/r/n He is a leader who is magnanimous in victory./r/n 他是个在胜利时宽宏大度的领袖。/r/n

word.name: magnet
word.lx: Forbidden City is a great magnet for foreign tourists./r/n 紫禁城对外国旅游者来说是个有巨大吸引力的地方。/r/n Human beings have learned out how to make magnet of cast iron./r/n 人类已经学会如何从生铁制出磁铁。/r/n

word.name: magnetic
word.mean: a. 有磁性的,有吸引力的,催眠术的
word.lx: She has a magnetic personality./r/n 她具有极具吸引力的性格。/r/n The loop becomes magnetic when the current is switched on./r/n 通电时线圈就会有磁性。/r/n

word.name: magnetism
word.lx: He persuaded them to join him by the sheer magnetism of his personality./r/n 他完全是靠个人的魅力，说服他们和他在一起干。/r/n Magnetism produced by electric charge in motion./r/n 电磁性由运动电荷引起的磁性/r/n

word.name: magnification
word.mean:
n. 扩大,夸张,赞美
[计算机] 放大率
word.lx: A photograph requiring magnification for viewing./r/n 微型照片放大后才看得清楚的照片/r/n An image that is too small to be read without magnification./r/n 一种需要经过放大才可阅读的微小图象。/r/n

word.name: magnificent
word.lx: What a magnificent future!/r/n 多么美好的未来啊！/r/n These magnificent palaces impressed the foreigners deeply./r/n 这些宏伟的宫殿给外宾们留下了深刻的印象。/r/n

word.name: magnify
word.lx: The microscope magnified the object 100 times./r/n 这台显微镜将物体放大了100倍。/r/n This lens can magnify 20 diameter./r/n 这个透镜能放大20倍。/r/n

word.name: maid
word.lx: Her maid helped her to dress up for the party./r/n 她的女仆帮助她穿上参加晚会的礼服。/r/n A maid or nurse native to India./r/n 女佣印度本地的侍女或护士/r/n

word.name: maiden
word.mean:
n. 年轻未婚女子,少女,处女
a. 未婚的,处女的,初次的
word.lx: Several maidens were invited to attend her wedding./r/n 好几个少女被邀请去参加她的婚礼。/r/n The ship will start its maiden voyage next Monday./r/n 这艘船将于下周一开始它的处女航。/r/n

word.name: mail
word.mean:
n. 邮件
v. 邮寄
word.lx: I went to the post office to mail the letters./r/n 我去邮局寄信。/r/n I opened my mail and was surprised to see a broken vase./r/n 我打开了邮件，惊讶地发现了一个打碎的花瓶。/r/n

word.name: mailbox
word.lx: The workers sort the mail from the mailbox./r/n 工作人员从邮箱中分拣邮件。/r/n I put the letter in the mailbox./r/n 我把信投入邮箱。/r/n

word.name: mailer
word.lx: A cardboard book mailer./r/n 一个供寄书用的硬纸筒/r/n

word.name: maim
word.mean: v. 使残废,使不能工作,使伤残
word.lx: She survived the accident but she was maimed for life and will never walk again./r/n 她在意外事故中大难不死，但却终身残废，再也不能行走了。/r/n He was maimed in a First World War battle./r/n 他在第一次世界大战的一埸战斗中受伤致残./r/n

word.name: main
word.mean:
a. 主要的
n. 主要部分,干线
word.lx: I turned the gas off at the mains before I went out./r/n 我出门之前，把煤气的总阀关掉了。/r/n The teacher asked me to note down the main points of the speech./r/n 老师要求我把演说的要点记下来。/r/n

word.name: mainland
word.lx: There are many interested animals in the mainland./r/n 在这块大陆上有很多有趣的动物。/r/n Father finally got in touch with his brother in mainland China./r/n 父亲终于与大陆上的弟弟联络上了。/r/n

word.name: mainly
word.lx: His money comes mainly from salary./r/n 他的钱主要来自工资。/r/n People in this shop are mainly tourists./r/n 这家商店里的人们大都是游客。/r/n

word.name: maintain
word.mean: v. 维持,维修,保养,坚持
word.lx: Part of my job is to maintain good relationship with our suppliers./r/n 我的部分工作是同我们的供应商保持良好的关系。/r/n The car has to be constantly maintained./r/n 汽车必须经常保养。/r/n

word.name: maintenance
word.mean: n. 维护,保持,维修,生活费用

word.name: maize
word.lx: Maize is widely planted in the America./r/n 玉米在美洲广泛种植。/r/n Do you care for maize?/r/n 你喜欢吃玉米吗？/r/n

word.name: majestic
word.lx: The majestic Rocky Mountains were covered with snow./r/n 巍峨的落矶山上覆盖着白雪。/r/n Gazing at that majestic painting was for me an almost transcendental experience./r/n 我凝视著那幅气势磅 的画, 一种堪称超凡的感受油然而生./r/n

word.name: majesty
word.mean: n. 最高权威,威严,王权

a. 主要的,较多的,大部份的

word.lx: We have encountered major problems./r/n 我们已遇到重大的问题。/r/n The play was a major success./r/n 这出戏大获成功。/r/n

word.name: majority
word.lx: The majority of people seem to prefer TV to radio./r/n 多数人喜欢电视胜过广播。/r/n She reaches her majority next month./r/n 她下个月就到成年年龄了。/r/n

word.mean:
v. 做,制造,使
n. 牌子,型号
word.lx: The news made her happy./r/n 这消息使她高兴。/r/n Wine is made from grapes./r/n 葡萄酒是用葡萄酿成的。/r/n

word.name: Make hay while the sun shines
makeshift
word.mean:
n. 临时措施
a. 临时的
word.lx: A crude or makeshift dwelling or shelter; a shack./r/n 简陋小屋，茅屋粗糙的临时住房或隐蔽处；棚屋/r/n A crude or makeshift bed./r/n 简易床简陋的或权作使用的床/r/n

word.mean: a. 调节不良的,不能适应环境的

word.name: maladroit
word.lx: His handling of the negotiations was maladroit./r/n 他的谈判技巧十分拙劣./r/n

word.name: malady

word.name: Malaise

word.mean: 词语荒唐误用（指误用发音近似而意义不通的词语）

n. 马来人

word.mean:

word.lx: All the trouble is being caused by a handful of malcontents./r/n 这些是非都是由一小撮不满分子搬弄的./r/n

word.name: malevolent
word.lx: Having or showing malice or ill will; malevolent./r/n 恶意的具有或表现出恶意或不良愿望的；含有恶意的/r/n The quality or state of being malevolent./r/n 恶毒处于邪恶的状态或具有恶毒的特征/r/n

word.mean:
n. 故障
v. 发生故障,不起作用

word.name: malice
word.lx: She certainly bears you no malice./r/n 她对你的确并无恶意。/r/n It seems so absurd to bear malice after all that./r/n 经过这一切之后还抱有怨恨情绪是很荒谬的。/r/n

word.name: malicious
word.lx: He cares nothing about the malicious attack on his reputation./r/n 他对别人对他名声的恶毒攻击置之不理。/r/n To do her justice, she was never malicious./r/n 说句公道话, 她从来没有恶意。/r/n

word.mean:
a. 有害的,恶性的,有恶意的
v. 诽谤,说坏话
word.lx: A malign tumour was found in his stomach./r/n 在他的胃部发现了一个恶性肿瘤。 /r/n She likes to malign innocent persons./r/n 她爱诋毁那些清白的人。/r/n

word.mean: n. 装病以逃避职责的人

word.name: malingering
word.lx: Helen has finally sued her malingering husband for divorce, but I think she did it more in sorrow than in anger./r/n 海伦终于与她那个托病开小差的丈夫打官司要求离婚，不过我觉得，她这样做更多的是悲哀而不是愤恨。/r/n

word.name: mall
word.lx: A parade of strollers on the mall./r/n 在购物中心的一群游逛者/r/n Saw all manner of people at the mall./r/n 在购物中心看到各种各样的人/r/n

word.name: mallard
word.lx: Any of a breed of common domestic ducks descended from and resembling the mallard./r/n 鲁昂鸭一种与绿头鸭相似并是其后代的普通家养鸭/r/n

word.lx: The young are more malleable than the old./r/n 年轻人比老年人容易受影响./r/n The malleable mind of the pragmatist./r/n 实用主义者那适应性很强的思想/r/n

word.lx: A small mallet used by auctioneers./r/n 拍卖锤拍卖者所用的小锤/r/n The drummer was worried because his mallet was missing one minute before the concert./r/n 鼓手很著急，因为他的小音槌在音乐会开始前一分钟不见了。/r/n

word.name: malodorous
word.mean: a. 有臭味的,不合法的

word.name: malpractice

a. 麦芽的,含麦芽的,用麦芽作的
v. 作成麦芽,用麦芽处理
word.lx: Would you like a cup of malt whisky?/r/n 你想喝杯麦芽威士忌吗？/r/n The host took out a bottle of 12-year-old malt whisky to entertain us./r/n 男主人拿出了一瓶12年的优质麦芽威士忌。/r/n

word.name: mama
word.lx: The baby cried for his mama./r/n 孩子哭着要妈妈。/r/n Mama said my illness would go away, but she could be wrong./r/n 妈妈说我的病一定会好的，但她可能说错了。/r/n

word.name: mammal
word.lx: Monkeys and dogs are mammals./r/n 猴子和狗都是哺乳动物。/r/n A whale is no less a mammal than a horse is./r/n 鲸鱼和马一样都是哺乳动物。/r/n

word.name: mammalian
word.lx: The report is on mammalian thermoregulation./r/n 那份报告是有关哺乳动物的体温调节。/r/n

word.name: mammals
word.lx: Monkeys and dogs are mammals./r/n 猴子和狗都是哺乳动物。/r/n A corresponding organ in other mammals./r/n 胸脯其它哺乳动物的相应器官/r/n

word.name: mammoth
word.mean:
n. 长毛象
a. 长毛象似的,巨大的
word.lx: A mammoth is a large hairy type of elephant in ancient times./r/n 猛犸是古代一种身体庞大、长着长毛的大象。/r/n The mammoth fell into an ice crevasse./r/n 猛犸掉进冰河裂缝里了。/r/n

word.name: man
word.mean:
n. 男人,人类,人
v. 为...配备人手
word.lx: Man is mortal./r/n 人都是会死的。/r/n The staff speak as one man on this issue./r/n 在这个问题上全体职员意见一致。/r/n

word.name: manacle
word.mean:
n. 手铐(束缚)
vt 上手铐(束缚)

word.name: manage
word.lx: I finally managed to find the book I was looking for./r/n 我终于找到了一直在找的书。/r/n His wife knows how to manage him when he is angry./r/n 他的妻子知道在他生气时怎么对付他。/r/n

word.name: manageable
word.mean: a. 易办的,易管理的,易控制的
word.lx: We are trying to reduce the problem to manageable proportions./r/n 我们正努力把问题缩小到可以控制的范围内。/r/n Step must be taken to reduce the problem to manageable proportions./r/n 必须采取措施将问题缩小到可控制的范围。/r/n

word.name: management
word.lx: She gets them to accept these changes by tactful management./r/n 她用机智的手段使他们接受了这些改变。/r/n The failure of the scheme was due to bad management./r/n 计划的失败是由于管理不善。/r/n

word.name: manager
word.lx: Our manager is very strict with us./r/n 我们的经理对我们要求很严格。/r/n Our manager is conversant with account system./r/n 我们的经理精通会计制度。/r/n

word.name: managerial
word.lx: Responsible managerial position in human resources./r/n 人力资源方面负责管理的职务。/r/n What they need most is managerial talent./r/n 他们最需要的是管理人才。/r/n

word.name: Manchester
word.lx: Manchester United beat Celtic in a friendly./r/n 曼彻斯特联队在一场友谊比赛中击败了凯尔特队。/r/n Three inches of rain fell in Manchester last night./r/n 曼彻斯特市昨夜降雨三英寸./r/n

word.name: Mandarin
word.mean: n. 中国官话,国语,满清官吏
word.lx: Of course I can speak Mandarin./r/n 中国话我自然会说。/r/n

word.name: mandate
word.mean:
n. 命令,指令,要求
v. 委任统治
word.lx: Our election victory has given us a mandate to reform the economy./r/n 我们在选举获胜, 这就使我们有权进行经济改革./r/n Britain was mandated to govern the former colony of German East Africa./r/n 英国受权代管德国在东非的前殖民地./r/n

word.name: maneuver
word.mean:
n. 演习,调遣,策略
v. 调遣,演习,用计策
word.lx: A maneuver, stratagem, or ploy, especially one used at an initial stage./r/n 策略尤指人在开始阶段所采用的计谋、策略、手法/r/n A maneuver causing someone to stumble or fall./r/n 绊使某人绊倒或跌倒的动作/r/n

word.name: manful
word.lx: He made manful efforts to move the heavy furniture./r/n 他作出勇敢的努力搬动沉重的家具。/r/n

word.name: manganese

word.name: manger
word.lx: He put some grass in the manger./r/n 他在食槽里放了些草。/r/n

word.name: mangle
word.mean:
vt. 碾压(损坏,乱切)
n. 碾压机
word.lx: The symphony was dreadfully mangled./r/n 那首交响乐曲给糟蹋得不成样子。/r/n There are many badly mangled bodies of those killed by the explosion./r/n 那有许多在爆炸中被炸得残缺不全的尸体。/r/n

word.name: manhood
word.lx: His son has grown into manhood./r/n 他的儿子已成年了。/r/n Members of certain tribes perform special ceremonies when they reach manhood./r/n 某些部落的男人在达到成年时要举行特殊的庆祝仪式。/r/n

word.name: maniac
word.lx: A raving maniac./r/n 一个胡言乱语的疯子/r/n He drives like a maniac./r/n 他象疯子似地开车。/r/n

word.name: manifold
word.mean:
n. 复印本,多种
a. 多种的,有许多部份的,多方面的
v. 复写,繁殖,增多
word.lx: The uses of this machine are manifold./r/n 这台机器有多种用途。/r/n His interests are manifold./r/n 他的兴趣广泛。/r/n

word.name: manipulate
word.mean:
v. 操纵,利用,假造
[计算机] 操作

word.name: manly
word.mean: a. 像男人的,强壮的,适于男人的
word.lx: He looks very manly in his uniform./r/n 他穿着制服十分精神。/r/n Football is a manly sport./r/n 足球是一项激烈的体育运动。/r/n

word.name: manoeuvre
word.lx: A rapid manoeuvre by the driver prevented an accident./r/n 司机动作迅速而熟练因此避免了一场事故./r/n These shameful manoeuvreswere aimed at securing his election./r/n 这种可耻的伎俩都是为了能让他当选./r/n

word.name: manpower
word.mean:
n. 人力
Manpower公司(财富500强公司之一，总部所在地美国,主要经营临时帮助)
word.lx: The system puts the firm at a disadvantage because of its overmuch manpower./r/n 由于过剩的人力, 这一体制使公司处境不利。/r/n I doubt whether they really have sufficient manpower./r/n 我怀疑他们是否真有足够的人力。/r/n

word.name: mansion
word.lx: He lives in Victoria Mansions./r/n 他住在维多利亚公寓。/r/n The poor girl was astonished by the sumptuous furnishings of the mansion./r/n 这个贫穷的女孩被大厦里的豪华的陈设惊呆了。/r/n

word.name: mantle
word.mean:
n. 斗篷,覆罩之物,罩子
v. 罩住,覆盖,脸红
word.lx: Snow mantled the hills./r/n 雪覆盖着丘陵。/r/n The mountain was covered with a mantle of snow./r/n 山上覆盖着一层雪。/r/n

word.name: manual
word.mean:
a. 手工的,体力的
n. 手册,指南
word.lx: A maintenance manual gives diagrams and instructions for repairing your car./r/n 维修手册向您提供修理汽车所需的图表和说明。/r/n Work done by machines has replaced manual labour./r/n 机器生产已经代替了手工劳作./r/n

word.name: manufacture
word.mean:
n. 产品,制造,制造业
v. 制造
vt. 制造,加工
word.lx: This firm manufactures cars./r/n 这家公司大量生产汽车。/r/n The manufacture of these small components is expensive./r/n 制造这些小部件是非常昂贵的。/r/n

word.name: manufactured
word.lx: She manufactured a false story to hide the facts./r/n 她编 造瞎话以掩盖事实./r/n A place where drugs and chemicals are manufactured./r/n 药厂用于生产药品和化学物质的地方/r/n

word.name: manufacturer
word.lx: Where is the manufacturer of the machine?/r/n 这台机器的制造商在哪？/r/n They bought the machine directly from the manufacturer./r/n 他们直接从厂商那里购买了这台机器。/r/n

word.name: manufacturing
word.mean:
n. 制造业
a. 制造业的
word.lx: Manufacturing industry was worst affected by the fuel shortage./r/n 由於燃料短缺受到影响, 制造业首当其冲./r/n British manufacturing industry has been running down for years./r/n 英国的制造业多年来一直在走下坡路./r/n

word.name: manure
word.mean:
n. 肥料
v. 施肥
word.lx: You should put some manure on your land./r/n 你应该给地里施些粪肥。/r/n Animal dung may be used as manure./r/n 动物的粪便可以作为肥料使用。/r/n

word.name: manuscript
word.mean:
a. 手抄的
n. 手稿,原稿
word.lx: I read his novel in manuscript./r/n 我看过他小说的手稿。/r/n The earliest extant manuscript of this poem has been kept in the museum./r/n 此诗现存最早的原稿收藏在这座博物馆里。/r/n

word.name: many
word.mean:
n. 许多人,许多
a. 许多的
word.lx: How many students are there in your class?/r/n 你们班有多少个学生？/r/n Many diseases are caused by bacteria./r/n 许多疾病是由细菌引起的。/r/n

word.name: maple
word.lx: The maple leaf is the emblem of Canada./r/n 枫叶是加拿大的象征。/r/n The garden is flanked to the north with large maple trees./r/n 花园的北侧是一些高大的枫树./r/n

word.name: mapping
word.lx: The province boundaries are marked in with a fine mapping pen./r/n 省区界限是用很细的绘图笔加画在地图上的。/r/n The technique of mapping a region or district./r/n 地志学绘制地区地图或行政区地图的技术/r/n

word.name: mar
word.mean:
n. 三月
v. 损毁,损伤,糟塌
word.lx: Age cannot mar her beauty./r/n 岁月无损于她的美貌。/r/n Such a mistake would mar your career./r/n 这种错误会有损你的事业。/r/n

word.name: marathon
word.mean: n. 马拉松,耐力的考验
word.lx: Towards the end of the marathon several runners showed signs of distress./r/n 马拉松赛接近终点时, 有些参赛者显出极难受的样子./r/n He can hardly run a mile, much less the marathon./r/n 他连一哩都跑不了，更不用说马拉松了。/r/n

word.name: marble
word.mean:
a. 大理石的,冷酷的
n. 大理石
vt.使有大理石的花纹

word.mean:
n. 三月
vi. 行军,进军
word.lx: The troops marched on./r/n 部队继续前进。/r/n Science is on the march./r/n 科学正在进步中。/r/n

word.name: margin
word.mean: n. (时间,金钱)富余,利润,页边空白,边缘
word.lx: He beat the other runners by a margin of ten seconds./r/n 他比其他运动员早10秒钟到达终点。/r/n The little boy likes to make notes in the margin of books./r/n 小男孩喜欢在书页空白边上做笔记。/r/n

word.name: marginal
word.lx: The marginal strip of beach; a marginal issue that had no bearing on the election results./r/n 边缘细长的海滩；和选举结果没有多大关系的边缘问题/r/n Barren or marginal farmland./r/n 荒芜或边远的农田/r/n

word.name: mariner
word.lx: There are more than 50 mariners on this ship./r/n 船上有五十多名水手。/r/n He recited the whole of The Ancient Mariner to us off the reel./r/n 他一口气把《古水手吟》从头到尾都背诵出来了。/r/n

word.name: mark
word.mean:
n. 标志,分数,马克
v. 做标记于,留意,打分数
word.lx: The road we should take is marked on the map./r/n 我们要走的路已经标在地图上了。/r/n The wet glass left a mark on the surface of the table./r/n 湿杯子在桌面上留下一个痕迹。/r/n

word.mean: n. 标价商品价格,减价

vbl. 作记号,打分数,表示

word.name: marker
word.mean:
n. 作记号的人,记分员,书签
[计算机] 记号
word.lx: A stone placed over a grave as a marker; a tombstone./r/n 墓碑，墓石置于坟墓上作为记号的石头；墓石/r/n A mound of stones erected as a memorial or marker./r/n 锥形石冢一堆石头，用于表示纪念或标志/r/n

word.name: market
word.mean:
n. 市场,交易,推销地区
v. 在市场上交易,使...上市
word.lx: The sales manager wants to open up new markets in the Far East./r/n 销售经理想在远东开辟新市场。/r/n The market is rather depressed at the moment./r/n 目前的市场相当萧条。/r/n

word.name: marketable
word.mean: a. 可销售的,销路好的,市场的
word.lx: A marketable product; marketable skills./r/n 可出售的产品；市场所需的技术/r/n Suitable for buying and selling; marketable./r/n 适销的适于买卖的；可以销售的/r/n

word.name: marketing
word.mean:
n. 行销,买卖
vbl. 销售,买卖

word.name: marking
word.lx: He accused his teacher of unfair marking./r/n 他指责教师打分不公平。/r/n Two unhappy marriages have left their mark on her./r/n 两次婚姻不幸给她留下了极坏的印象./r/n

word.mean:
v. 使(人)处于孤独无助之境
n.栗色
adj.栗色的

word.lx: He was conferred marquis by the king./r/n 他被国王册封为侯爵。/r/n

word.name: marriage
word.lx: This is his second marriage./r/n 这是他第二次结婚。/r/n Marriage is for life./r/n 婚姻是终身大事。/r/n

word.name: marrow
word.lx: It was so cold that he felt frozen to the marrow./r/n 天气太冷了，他感到寒冷刺骨。/r/n Come by the fire you must be chilled to the marrow!/r/n 到火旁边来吧－－你一定冻坏了。/r/n

word.name: marry
word.lx: She married money./r/n 她嫁给了一个有钱人。/r/n Will you marry me?/r/n 你愿意和我结婚吗？/r/n

word.name: Mars
word.lx: Mars is the fourth planet in order from the sun./r/n 火星是太阳系的第四颗行星。/r/n Scientists are studying the photographs of Mars for signs of life./r/n 科学家们正在研究火星的照片，寻求生命的迹象。/r/n

word.mean:
n. 陆空军高级将官,典礼官,职行官
v. 整顿,配置,汇集
word.lx: He was an Air Marshal before retirement./r/n 他退休前是空军中将。/r/n He sat nervously, marshal his thought./r/n 他紧张地坐着，整理着他的思绪。/r/n

word.mean: n. 药属葵,药属葵蜜饯

word.mean:

a. 袋的,袋状的
word.lx: Pouches are a peculiarity of marsupials./r/n 腹袋是有袋动物的特色。/r/n

word.name: mart
word.lx: New York is an international mart for stocks and shares./r/n 纽约是国际证券与股票的交易中心。/r/n New York and London are two great marts of the world./r/n 纽约和伦敦是世界两大商业中心。/r/n

word.name: martial
word.lx: We should always remember that Japan is a martial nation./r/n 我们应该始终牢记日本是一个好战的国家。/r/n He faced a court martial for disobeying orders./r/n 他因不服从命令受到军法审判./r/n

word.name: martial art
word.lx: Any of12 levels of proficiency at the grade of black belt in martial arts such as judo and karate./r/n 段在东方武术中，黑腰带的级别精通达12级中的任一级，如柔道和空手道/r/n Jack is death on martial arts./r/n 杰克擅长格斗术。/r/n

word.mean: n. 戒严法, 戒严令

word.name: martially
word.mean: ad. 好战地, 勇敢地

word.name: Martin
word.lx: Martin Luther King made many adversaries in his nonviolent quest for equality./r/n 马丁·路德·金在以非暴力手段寻求平等的过程中树立了许多敌人。/r/n Denise and Martin have recently become parents./r/n 丹尼斯和马丁最近当爸爸妈妈了./r/n

word.name: martinet
word.mean: n. 要求严格服从纪律的人

word.name: martyr

n. 烈士,殉道者
vt. 杀害,折磨,牺牲
word.lx: He is a martyr of his country./r/n 他为国捐躯。/r/n She died a martyr for liberty./r/n 她为自由而捐躯。/r/n

word.mean:
n. 奇异的事物,罕见的例子
v. 惊异于,惊异
word.lx: It was a real marvel that the baby was unhurt when he fell from the fifth floor./r/n 那婴儿从五楼摔下来竟没受伤真是一个奇迹。/r/n They marvelled that she would make such a decision./r/n 他们对她做出如此决定感到惊奇。/r/n

word.name: marvellous
word.lx: Their performance was marvellous./r/n 他们的演出太精彩了。/r/n The students did some marvellous impressions of the teachers at the end-of-term party./r/n 在期末联欢会上，学生模仿教师惟妙惟肖令人捧腹。/r/n

word.name: Marxism
word.lx: I believe in Marxism./r/n 我相信马克思主义。/r/n Marxism believes that the world exists outside us and independently of us./r/n 马克思主义认为世界存在于我们之外，而且独立于我们而存在。/r/n

word.name: Mary
word.lx: Have you heard from Mary?/r/n 你收到玛丽的来信吗？/r/n She was baptized Mary./r/n 她受洗礼时被命名为玛利。/r/n

word.name: masculine

n. 阳性,男性
a. 男性的,阳性的,有丈夫气的

word.mean:
n. 碎麦芽,饲料,糊状物

word.lx: He mashed up the potatoes with a spoon./r/n 他用一把勺子把马铃薯捣成糊状。/r/n She loves sausage and mash./r/n 她喜欢香肠和土豆泥。/r/n

word.name: mashed
word.lx: I mashed my hand in the door./r/n 我的手被门压伤。/r/n The car has been badly mashed up in the accident./r/n 这辆汽车在事故中被压碎了。/r/n

word.mean:
n. 口罩,假面具,掩饰
v. 戴面具,掩饰,化装
[计算机] 掩码
word.lx: They did so under the mask of charity./r/n 他们是打着慈善的幌子这么做的。/r/n Her smile masked true feelings./r/n 她的微笑掩饰了她的感情。/r/n

word.name: masked
word.mean: a. 戴面具的,蒙着脸的,隐蔽的
word.lx: The masked man startled the woman out of her wits when she went to her room./r/n 这个女人回到房间时戴面具的人快把她给吓死了。/r/n Her smile masked true feelings./r/n 她的微笑掩饰了她的感情。/r/n

word.name: masking tape
word.mean: （绘画时用以遮盖无需着色部分的）遮护胶带
word.lx: He put masking tape round the edges of the glass while he painted the window frame./r/n 他给窗框上漆时，用遮蔽胶带把玻璃边缘贴住。/r/n

word.name: mason
word.mean:
n. 泥瓦匠,共济会会员
v. 用砖瓦砌成
word.lx: He asked the mason to make him a tombstone./r/n 他要求这个石匠给他做一块墓碑。/r/n Miss Mason bought a beautiful car yesterday and must have spent a bomb thereby./r/n 梅森小姐昨天买了一辆非常漂亮的车，她一定花了一大笔钱。/r/n

word.name: masonry
word.lx: I was hurt by a piece of falling masonry./r/n 我被掉下来的一块建筑用石块砸伤。/r/n The masonry is crumbling./r/n 石屋日渐崩溃。/r/n

word.name: masquerade
word.mean:
n. 化妆舞会
v. 化装
word.lx: We want to join in the masquerade./r/n 我们想去参加化装舞会。/r/n The robbers got into the bank by masquerading as security men./r/n 劫匪假装成保安人员进入银行。/r/n

word.name: mass
word.mean:
n. 块,大多数,质量
a. 群众的,大规模的
v. 使...集合
word.lx: A great mass of rock had fallen from the cliff and now blocked the road./r/n 一大堆岩石从悬崖上掉了下来，堵塞了道路。/r/n Crowds massed along the road where the king would pass./r/n 群众聚集在国王要经过的街道旁。/r/n

word.name: Massachusetts
word.mean: n. 马萨诸塞(美国州名)

word.name: massacre
word.mean:
n. 大屠杀
v. 大屠杀
word.lx: The press has reported the massacre of thousands of people for their religious beliefs./r/n 新闻界报道了那场因宗教信仰原因而对千万人的大屠杀。/r/n The game was a complete massacre; we lost 10-0./r/n 那次比赛真是一次惨败，我们0比10输了。/r/n

word.name: massage
word.mean:
n. 按摩,揉
v. 按摩,揉
word.lx: She is having a facial massage./r/n 她正做脸部按摩。/r/n Medical treatment by mechanical methods, such as massage./r/n 机械疗法用机械方法（如按摩）对疾病进行治疗的方法/r/n

word.name: massive
word.lx: The soldier suffered a massive haemorrhage and died soon after./r/n 那个战士经受了大量出血的痛苦，不久便去世了。/r/n The wedding got massive media coverage./r/n 婚礼得到大众传播媒介的广泛报道。/r/n

word.name: mastermind
word.mean:
n. 聪明人,智多星
vt. (巧妙地)策划
word.lx: The mastermind behind the scheme is executed after a brief trial./r/n 阴谋的幕后策划者经过简短审讯便被处决了。/r/n School has made him into a mastermind./r/n 学校使他变成了一个足智多谋的人。/r/n

word.name: masterpiece
word.lx: This book is his masterpiece./r/n 这本书是他的杰作。/r/n Technicallythe building is a masterpiece, but few people like it./r/n 就技术而言那座建筑物是杰作, 但却没人喜欢./r/n

word.name: mastery
word.lx: Which side will get the mastery?/r/n 哪一方将获得控制权？/r/n He demonstrated a mastery of Arabic./r/n 他显示了对阿拉伯语的精通。/r/n

word.mean:
n. 桅顶,桅顶展望人,发行人栏
v. 升于桅顶,爬到桅顶

word.name: mat
word.mean:

a. 粗糙的
v. 纠缠在一起,铺席于...上,使...无光泽
word.lx: He wiped his dirty boots on the mat before entering the room./r/n 他在进屋前把脏靴子在门垫子上擦了擦。/r/n Will this paint give a gloss or a matt finish?/r/n 这种颜料有无光泽?/r/n

word.name: match
word.mean:
n. 比赛,火柴,对手
v. 使...相配,与...竞争,相配
word.lx: Our team has won the football match./r/n 我们队赢得了足球赛。/r/n The hat and shoes are a perfect match./r/n 这顶帽子和鞋子完全相配。/r/n

word.name: matchless
word.lx: Her matchless beauty is beyond description./r/n 她那旷世无双的美貌无法形容。/r/n

word.name: material
word.mean:
n. 材料,原料,物质;
n. 素材,题材,资料
a. 物质的,实体的
word.lx: The storm did a great deal of material damage./r/n 暴风雨造成了大量物质损失。/r/n He is collecting materials for a book./r/n 他正在为写书搜集素材。/r/n

word.name: materialize
word.mean:
v. 赋与实质,使体现,物质化
v. 成有形,体现,实现
word.lx: The threatened strike never materialized./r/n 扬言要举行罢工, 却从未付诸行动./r/n Our plans did not materialize./r/n 我们的计画未能实现./r/n

word.name: materially
word.mean: ad. 实质上,重大,物质上

word.name: materials
word.lx: The factory is in frequent scarcity of raw materials./r/n 这个工厂经常原料不足。/r/n The high cost of raw materials is keeping prices up./r/n 原料费用昂贵使得产品价格居高不下。/r/n

word.name: materiel
word.mean:
[法语]
n. 军备,物资,装备

word.name: maternal
word.mean: a. 母亲的,母系的,母方的
word.lx: My maternal grandfather is coming./r/n 我的外祖父要来了。/r/n She feels very maternal towards him./r/n 她对他充满母爱。/r/n

word.name: maternity
word.mean:
n. 母性,母道,妇产科医院
a. 为妊产妇的

word.name: math
word.lx: The boy is good at math./r/n 这个男孩数学学的很好。/r/n When new math was introduced into schools, many parents were perplexed by it./r/n 当学校开设新的数学课时，许多家长对此感到迷惑不解。/r/n

word.name: mathematical
word.lx: He is a mathematical genius./r/n 他是一个数学天才。/r/n The students are working on a mathematical problem./r/n 学生们正在解一道数学习题。/r/n

word.name: mathematics
word.lx: I am not good at mathematics./r/n 我的数学不太好。/r/n The elemental mathematics is very easy./r/n 初等数学很简单。/r/n

word.name: maths

word.name: Matisse
word.mean: 马蒂斯（法国画家、雕刻家和版画家）

word.name: matriarchy
word.mean: n. 母权制,妇女统治,女家长制, 女族长制
