word.mean: n. 结婚,婚姻生活,婚礼

word.name: matrix
word.mean:
n. 母体,子宫
细胞
脉石,字母
n.矩阵

word.name: Matterhorn
word.mean: n. 马特霍恩峰 (阿尔卑斯山峰之一)

word.name: matter-of-fact
word.lx: She told us the news in a very ,matter-of-fact way./r/n 她把那消息平铺直叙地告诉了我们./r/n

word.name: maturation
word.lx: Cessation of normal growth, especially of an organ or other body part, prior to full development or maturation./r/n 败育中止正常成长，尤其是在一器官或身体其他部分完全发育或成熟以前/r/n

word.name: mature
word.mean:
a. 成熟的,到期的,充分发育的,考虑周到的
v. 使...成熟,(使)长成,到期
word.lx: She matured her novel by constant revision./r/n 她不断修改自己的小说以使其趋于完善。/r/n His character has greatly matured in the years./r/n 这些年他的性格已大大成熟。/r/n

word.name: maturity
word.mean:
n. 成熟
(支票等的)到期
word.lx: Teenage is the period at which the body reaches maturity./r/n 青少年是身体成熟期。/r/n His experience has a slow maturity./r/n 他的经验缓慢地成熟。/r/n

word.name: maul
word.mean:
n. 大槌
v. 打伤,虐打,粗暴对待
word.lx: Her novel has been badly mauled by the critics./r/n 她的小说横遭评论家抨击。/r/n Stop pulling my arm, you have no right to maul me about like this!/r/n 别拉我的胳膊，你没有权利这样粗暴地对待我！/r/n

word.name: mawkish
word.mean: a. 自作多情的,令人作呕的

word.name: maxim
word.lx: Waste not, want not" is her favorite maxim./r/n “不浪费则不匮乏”是她特别喜爱的格言。/r/n

word.name: maximal
word.lx: She obtained maximal benefit from the course./r/n 她从该课程中获益极大./r/n She will be a maximal help to here./r/n 她到这儿将是个极大的帮助。/r/n

word.name: maximize
word.mean:
v. 取...最大值,最佳化
[计算机] 最大化
word.lx: We must maximize profits./r/n 我们必须尽量增加利润./r/n

word.name: maximum
word.mean:
n. 极点,最大量,极大
a. 最高的,最大极限的
word.lx: The maximum load for this lorry is one ton./r/n 这辆卡车最大载重量是一吨。/r/n This hall holds a maximum of seventy people./r/n 这厅最多容纳七十人。/r/n

word.name: may
word.mean:
n. 五月
aux.可能,可以,祝愿
word.lx: We may come at another time./r/n 我们可以另找个时间来。/r/n He will graduate from the school in May./r/n 他将要在五月份毕业。/r/n

word.name: May Day
word.lx: The celebration of May Day./r/n 五朔节的欢庆活动/r/n The students are going to get up a concert on May Day evening./r/n 在五一节晚上，学生们准备举行一次音乐会。/r/n

word.name: mayday
word.mean: n. 国际遇险无线电呼救信号

word.name: mayhem
word.mean: n. 伤害罪之一种,故意的伤害罪
word.lx: There was absolute mayhem when the cow got into the village hall./r/n 那牛闯进村会议厅, 造成一片混乱./r/n

word.name: mayonnaise
word.lx: Egg mayonnaise is made with mayonnaise and hard-boiled eggs./r/n 鸡蛋美乃滋是用蛋黄酱和煮老的鸡蛋做成的./r/n Light beer; light mayonnaise./r/n 低度啤酒；低脂蛋黄酱/r/n

word.name: mayor
word.lx: The mayor made a speech at the opening./r/n 市长在开幕式上发表了演说。/r/n They protested to the mayor that the taxes were too high./r/n 他们向市长提出抗议说税款过高。/r/n

word.name: maze
word.mean:
n. 迷宫
vt. 使迷惑
word.lx: She was lost in the maze for several hours./r/n 她在迷宫中迷了路，浪费了好几个小时。/r/n We were quite disorientated by the maze of streets./r/n 街道曲曲弯弯的, 把我们弄得迷失了方向./r/n

word.name: me
word.lx: He asked me if I would go fishing with him tomorrow./r/n 他问我明天是否和他一起去钓鱼。/r/n They paid me the princely sum of USD5000./r/n 他们慷慨地给我5000美元。/r/n

word.name: mea culpa
word.mean: n. 我的过失，我应负的责任

word.name: mead
word.mean:
a. (人等)瘦的,(土地)不毛的
n. [诗]草地,蜂蜜酒
word.lx: He drank some mead at supper./r/n 晚饭时他喝了一些蜂蜜酒。/r/n A beverage typically made of fermented honey and water; mead./r/n 蜂蜜酒主要用发酵的蜂蜜和水酿成的酒；蜜酒/r/n

word.name: meadow
word.lx: There are many herds of cattle in the meadow./r/n 牧场上有许多牛群。/r/n The workers are scything in the meadow./r/n 工人们正在草地上割草。/r/n

word.name: meager
word.lx: He had to support his family with his meager income./r/n 他只能靠微薄的收入来养家。/r/n Particulars are too meager to form a decision./r/n 详情不明，难以做出裁夺。/r/n

word.name: meagre
word.mean: a. 瘦的,不足的,贫乏的
word.lx: He had to support his family with his meagre income./r/n 他只能靠微薄的收入来养家。/r/n He was so weak from hunger he could hardly raise his meagre arms./r/n 他饿得虚弱无力，连骨瘦如柴的胳膊都举不起来。/r/n

word.name: meal
word.mean:
n. 膳食,一餐
vi. 进餐
word.lx: My father and I only meet at meals./r/n 我父亲和我只在进餐时间相聚。/r/n My mother usually cooks a hot meal in the evening./r/n 我妈妈通常在晚上煮一顿热饭。/r/n

word.name: meals
word.lx: A group of people, usually soldiers or sailors, who regularly eat meals together./r/n 共餐者，伙食团经常一块用膳的一群人，通常指士兵或水手/r/n Meals are extra./r/n 伙食费另加。/r/n

word.name: meander
word.mean:
n. 河流的曲折,漫步,迂回旅行
v. 缓慢而弯曲地流动,漫谈
word.lx: The discussion meandered (on) for hours./r/n 讨论会漫无边际地进行了几小时./r/n

word.name: meaning
word.lx: Can you explain the meaning of these foreign words?/r/n 你能解释这些外文词的意思吗？/r/n You mistook my meaning entirely./r/n 你完全误解了我的意思。/r/n

word.name: meaningful
word.lx: She felt her works are meaningful when she saw the unaffected delight of the children./r/n 当她看到孩子们自然流露出的喜悦时，她感到自己的工作很有意义。/r/n That statement is not very meaningful./r/n 那项声明没有多大意义。/r/n

word.name: meaningless
word.lx: Inarticulate or meaningless talk or sounds./r/n 含糊不清的声音口齿不清的或无意义的谈话、声音/r/n Irrelevant or meaningless data generated by a computer along with desired data./r/n 无用数据计算机产生的与所需数据不相干或无意义的数据/r/n

word.name: means
word.lx: The quickest means of travel is by plane./r/n 最快的交通工具是飞机。/r/n We express our thought by means of words./r/n 我们用词句来表达思想。/r/n

word.name: meant
word.lx: The racer meant to win the500-mile race at all hazards./r/n 这位竞赛者决心不顾一切危险，赢得这场500英里的车赛。/r/n The racer meant to win the500-meter race at all risks./r/n 这个参赛者下定决心无论如何要赢得500公尺赛跑的胜利。/r/n

word.name: meantime
word.mean:
ad. 与此同时
n. 其时,其间

word.name: meanwhile
word.mean:
ad. 同时
n. 其时,其间
word.lx: Eve was cutting the grass, and meanwhile Adam was planting roses./r/n 夏娃在剪草，亚当种玫瑰。/r/n Meanwhile the minutes kept ticking away./r/n 其时，时间一分一分地过去。/r/n

word.name: measles
word.lx: The child got measles./r/n 那个孩子得了麻疹。/r/n Measles is an infectious disease./r/n 麻疹是种传染病。/r/n

word.name: measly
word.lx: He gave us measly little portions of cake./r/n 他给了我们少得可怜的一点蛋糕./r/n What a measly birthday present!/r/n 多麽小气的生日礼物哇!/r/n

word.name: measurable
word.lx: Measurable by a common standard; commensurable./r/n 可用共同标准测量的；可共同测量的/r/n A measurable figure in literature./r/n 文学界的一个值得注意的人物/r/n

word.name: measure
word.mean:
n. 措施,办法,量度,尺寸
v. 测量,量
word.lx: The government has promised to take measures to help the unemployed./r/n 政府已答应采取措施来帮助失业者。/r/n An hour is a measure of time./r/n 小时是时间的一个量度单位。/r/n

word.name: measured
word.mean:
a. 量过的,慎重的,基于标准的
v. 测量,判断
vbl. 测量,判断
word.lx: The force of the wind is measured on a standard scale of 0-12./r/n 风力是按0-12级标准等级测量的。/r/n We measured the difference(s) in temperature./r/n 我们测量了温度的变化./r/n

word.name: measurement
word.mean: n. 测量,衡量,尺寸,大小
word.lx: When did the first measurement of the speed of sound take?/r/n 第一次测量声速是在什么时候？/r/n The overall measurement of this room is 80 square meters./r/n 这个屋子的面积是80平方米。/r/n

word.name: measures
word.lx: He measures 30 inches round the waist./r/n 他的腰围是30英寸./r/n The room measures 10 metres across./r/n 这房间宽10米./r/n

word.name: mecca
word.mean:
n. 众人渴望去的地方
n. 麦加[沙特阿拉伯]
word.lx: We met many pilgrims on their way to Mecca./r/n 我们遇到许多去麦加朝圣的人。/r/n The Muslim delegation is shortly going on a pilgrimage to Mecca./r/n 这个穆斯林代表团很快就要去麦加朝圣了。/r/n

word.name: mechanical
word.mean: a. 机械的,力学的,呆板的
word.lx: He was asked the same question so many times that the answer became mechanical./r/n 同样的问题人们向他问得太多了，所以他的答案也是千篇一律。/r/n We need a mechanical digger to level the ground./r/n 我们需要一台挖掘机来平整土地。/r/n

word.name: mechanics
word.lx: He has natural ability, but has yet to learn the mechanics of his chosen work./r/n 他很有天分，但对选择的工作该怎样处理，他仍得好好学习。/r/n He failed in the examination of mechanics./r/n 他没通过力学考试。/r/n

word.name: mechanism
word.mean:
n. 机械,机构,结构
机制，原理
word.lx: The soldier told us where the firing mechanism of a rifle is./r/n 那个士兵告诉我们哪儿是步枪的击发装置。/r/n The watch has delicate mechanism./r/n 这块表有精细的机械装置。/r/n

word.name: mechanize
word.mean: v. 机械化,用机械装置,机动化
word.lx: We are mechanizing rapidly./r/n 我们正在迅速机械化./r/n

word.name: mechanized
word.lx: Lying in broad stretches, this land lends itself to mechanized farming./r/n 这些土地都是一大片一大片的，适合机器耕作。/r/n

word.name: meddlesome
word.lx: Get rid of that meddlesome fool!/r/n 让那个爱管闲事的家伙走开。/r/n By this means the meddlesome woman cast in a bone between the wife and the husband./r/n 这爱管闲事的女人就用这种手段挑起他们夫妻这间的不和。/r/n

word.name: media
word.mean: n. 媒体,新闻媒介,传播媒介
word.lx: The media have a lot of power today./r/n 现在大众传播媒介有很大的力量。/r/n The zealous demonstrators were ignored by the media./r/n 热情的示威游行者被新闻媒介忽视了。/r/n

word.name: median
word.mean:
a. 中央的,中间的,正中的
n. 中动脉,中位数,中值

word.name: mediate
word.mean:
a. 居间的,间接的
v. 斡旋,调停
word.lx: He cooled the situation down by offering to mediate between the disputing parties./r/n 他提出愿为争执的双方调停，情况因此缓和下来。/r/n Mediate a labor-management dispute./r/n 调停一劳动管理上的争端/r/n

word.name: mediation
word.lx: Mediation in a dispute./r/n 调停调解争端/r/n

word.name: mediator
word.lx: All proposals were rejected by the mediator./r/n 所有的建议都被仲裁人驳回。/r/n One that acts as a mediator./r/n 调解人充当调解人的人/r/n

word.name: medic
word.mean: n. 医学工作者,医科学生

word.name: medical
word.lx: I have to have a medical examination before going abroad./r/n 出国前我必须进行体格检查。/r/n The rapid spread of the disease is alarming the medical authorities./r/n 这种疾病的迅速蔓延使医疗当局感到忧虑不安。/r/n

word.name: medication
word.mean: n. 药物治疗,药物处理,医药
word.lx: The infection is at last responding to medication./r/n 药物治疗终于开始对感染显出效果。/r/n A treatment or medication that restores health./r/n 恢复健康的治疗，恢复健康的药物/r/n

word.name: medicinal
word.lx: He drinks this medical tea for medicinal purposes./r/n 他为了治病而喝这种冲剂。/r/n Many plants have medicinal properties./r/n 许多植物具有医药性能。/r/n

word.name: medicine
word.lx: The best medicine for you now would be a good holiday./r/n 目前对你来说，过一个愉快的假期就是一剂良药。/r/n There have been great advances in medicine in the last ten years./r/n 在过去十年里，医学取得了巨大的进步。/r/n

word.name: medicine man
word.lx: In times of drought, the members of the tribe would consult the medicine man in the belief he could make it rain./r/n 在干旱季节，那些部落的人们总是请来巫师，相信他会使老天赐雨。/r/n

word.name: medieval
word.lx: Knighthood was an ideal in medieval Europe./r/n 在中世纪的欧洲，骑士是一种风范。/r/n Medieval painting is not his province./r/n 中世纪的绘画不属於他的研究范围./r/n

word.name: mediocre
word.lx: Of limited or average quality; mediocre./r/n 平凡的，普通的有限的或一般的性质的；普通的/r/n A casual or mediocre player of a sport, especially golf./r/n 漫不经心或平庸的运动员，尤指高尔夫球手/r/n

word.name: mediocrity
word.lx: His plays are distinguished only by their stunning mediocrity./r/n 他的戏剧与众不同之处就是平凡得出奇./r/n Caricature is the tribute that mediocrity pays to genius./r/n 笨拙的模仿，是凡人对天才呈献的赞词。/r/n

word.name: meditate
word.lx: He meditates on his past life./r/n 他沉思着过去的生活。/r/n Could you teach me how to meditate?/r/n 你能否教我如何打坐？/r/n

word.name: meditating
word.lx: The act or process of meditating./r/n 沉思，冥想沉思的行动或过程/r/n He sat there meditating upon his misfortunes./r/n 他坐在那里沉思自己的不幸遭遇。/r/n

word.name: meditation
word.lx: He was buried in meditation./r/n 他沉溺于沉思冥想。/r/n Characterized by or prone to meditation./r/n 沉思冥想的以沉思冥想为特点的，爱沉思思冥想的/r/n

word.name: Mediterranean
word.mean:
a. 地中海(的)
n. 地中海
word.lx: The straits of Gibraltar are the gate of the Mediterranean./r/n 直布罗陀海峡是通向地中海的必经之路。/r/n The Suez Canal joins the Mediterranean and the Red Sea./r/n 苏伊士运河连接著地中海和红海./r/n

word.name: medium
word.mean:
n. 媒体,方法,媒介
a. 适中的,中等的
word.lx: Sound travels through the medium of air./r/n 声音通过空气这一媒介传播。/r/n This cloth is of medium quality./r/n 这种布质量平平。/r/n

word.name: medley
word.lx: A usually humorous medley./r/n 幻想曲一段相当幽默的旋律/r/n

word.name: Medusa
word.mean:
a. 水母然
n. 水母
n. 美杜莎(古希腊神话中3位蛇发女怪之一)

word.name: meek
word.lx: She is as meek as a lamb./r/n 她像小羊一样的温顺。/r/n Blessed are the meek./r/n 温顺的人有福了./r/n

word.name: meekly
word.mean: ad. 卑恭屈节地,温顺地
word.lx: One who submits meekly to domination or mistreatment by others./r/n 受气包逆来顺受的可怜虫，受屈辱的受气包/r/n

word.name: meekness
word.lx: Meekness is a virtue he appreciates in his wife./r/n 温顺是他所欣赏的妻子的优点之一。/r/n

word.name: meet
word.mean:
n. 会,集会
a. 适宜的,合适的
v. 遇见,引见,对付
word.lx: I met him in the street./r/n 我在街上遇到他。/r/n The champion and the challenger meet next week./r/n 下星期冠军将迎战挑战者。/r/n

word.name: meeting
word.lx: Our meeting in Beijing was later than I expected./r/n 我们在北京的会面比我们预想的要晚。/r/n We will discuss the proposal at the meeting./r/n 我们将在会议上讨论这项提议。/r/n

word.name: megalith
word.mean: n. 巨石,远古时代的巨石碑

word.name: megalomania
word.lx: The dictator was suffering from megalomania./r/n 那独裁者患有夸大狂./r/n

word.name: melancholy
word.mean:
n. 忧沉,悲哀,愁思
a. 忧沉的,使人悲伤的,愁思的
word.lx: When he left, she sank into melancholy./r/n 当他走后，她陷入沉思。/r/n A funeral is a melancholy occasion./r/n 葬礼是一个令人忧伤的场合。/r/n

word.name: meld
word.lx: After meld mother pulls the tablecloth over the table./r/n 饭后，妈妈把桌布蒙在桌子上。/r/n

word.name: melee
word.lx: There was a scuffle and I lost my hat in the melee./r/n 因发生一场斗殴, 我的帽子也在混乱中丢失了./r/n The rush-hour melee./r/n 上下班高峰时间的混乱情况/r/n

word.name: mellifluous
word.mean: a. 如蜜般的, 流畅的

word.name: mellow
word.mean: a. 成熟的,醇的,熟练的

word.name: melodious
word.mean: a. 旋律美妙的,调子优美的,音乐性的
word.lx: She plays a melodious cello./r/n 她拉着一手悦耳的大提琴。/r/n This piece of music is melodious./r/n 这首音乐音调优美。/r/n

word.name: melodrama
word.mean: n. 音乐剧,通俗剧,戏剧似的事健
word.lx: I love Victorian melodrama(s)./r/n 我喜爱维多利亚时代的情节剧./r/n

word.name: melodramatic
word.mean: a. 通俗剧风格的,戏剧似的,甚为感伤的
word.lx: A lurid, melodramatic, but accurate account of the accident./r/n 关于这事件的一则轰动且耸人听闻但确切的报导/r/n Marked by melodramatic intrigue and often espionage./r/n 间谍的，惊险的以戏剧性的阴谋为特征的，常常指间谍活动/r/n

word.name: melody
word.mean: n. 旋律,曲子,美的音乐,曲调
word.lx: Next the melody is taken up by flutes./r/n 这主调接着由长笛合奏。/r/n The organist played a famous melody./r/n 这位管风琴手演奏了一首著名的曲子。/r/n

word.name: melon
word.lx: He picked a melon from the field./r/n 他从地里摘了一个甜瓜。/r/n If it were him, he would cut the melon with a word./r/n 换了他，一句话就可以把事情定下来。/r/n

word.name: melt
word.mean:
n. 熔化,熔化物
v. 熔化,溶解,渐混
word.lx: His heart melted when he saw the little girl crying./r/n 看到这个小女孩哭起来，他的心软了。/r/n The sun melted the snow./r/n 太阳使雪融化。/r/n

word.name: melting pot
word.mean: 熔炉(借指同化许多种族、人物的国家或都市)

word.name: member
word.lx: He is a member of the Labor Party./r/n 他是一名工党党员。/r/n She is a member of the Royal College of Nursing./r/n 她是皇家护士协会的会员。/r/n

word.name: membership
word.mean: n. 成员资格,会员资格
word.lx: I must renew my membership of the sailing club./r/n 我必须延续我的航海俱乐部会员资格。/r/n We are trying to increase our membership./r/n 我们正准备增收会员。/r/n

word.name: memo
word.lx: Here is the exchange memo./r/n 这是兑换便笺。/r/n Keep this exchange memo for reconversion into foreign currency./r/n 保存好这张兑换水单以便兑换回外币。/r/n

word.name: memoir
word.lx: She wrote a memoir of her stay in France./r/n 她写了一篇旅法记事录./r/n At the end of his career in politics, he retired and wrote his memoirs./r/n 他的从政生涯一结束便隐退写起了自己的回忆录。/r/n

word.name: memorabilia
word.mean: n. 值得纪念的事,大事记

word.name: memorable
word.mean:
n. 值得纪念的事物
a. 值得纪念的
word.lx: It was a memorable experience for me./r/n 对我来说那是一次难忘的经历。/r/n We had a memorable trip last year./r/n 我们去年有一次难忘的旅行。/r/n

word.name: memorial
word.mean:
a. 纪念的,追悼的
n. 纪念碑(堂),纪念仪式
word.lx: He was often seen at funerals and memorials./r/n 人们经常在葬礼和追悼会上见到他。/r/n This memorial commemorates those who died in the war./r/n 这座纪念碑是纪念战争中牺牲者的./r/n

word.name: memorize
word.lx: He memorized all the words on the list./r/n 他把表上的所有单词都记在心里了。/r/n She can memorize facts very quickly./r/n 她能很快记住许多资料./r/n

word.name: memory
word.lx: I have a very poor memory./r/n 我的记性很差。/r/n We first met in New York, if my memory serves me./r/n 如果我没记错的话，我们第一次相遇是在纽约。/r/n

word.name: Memphis
word.lx: For weeks Jack vacillated between a home in Memphis and one in Little Rock./r/n 把家安在孟菲斯还是安在小石城，杰克有好几个星期都拿不定主意。/r/n

word.name: men
word.lx: Men, women and children are all human beings./r/n 男人、女人和孩子都是人。/r/n The men at the party were mostly fairly young./r/n 参加聚会的男子大都非常年轻。/r/n

word.name: menace
word.mean:
n. 威胁,胁迫
v. 威吓,胁迫
word.lx: Your vicious dog is menacing my cat!/r/n 你那条恶狗对我家的猫太凶了！/r/n These weapons are a menace to world peace./r/n 这些武器是对世界和平的威胁。/r/n

word.name: menacing
word.lx: Your vicious dog is menacing my cat!/r/n 你那条恶狗对我家的猫太凶了！/r/n A menacing or defiant wave or flourish./r/n 威胁性或蔑视性的挥动或舞动/r/n

word.name: mendicant
word.mean:
a. 行乞的
n. 乞丐

word.name: menial
word.mean: a. 适合仆人做的,卑微的
word.lx: One who performs menial tasks for another./r/n 仆人替别人做卑贱工作的人/r/n One who does menial work; a drudge./r/n 苦役干杂活的人；苦役/r/n

word.name: menstrual
word.lx: Abnormally heavy or extended menstrual flow./r/n 月经过多异常多或长时间的月经来潮/r/n The first menstrual period, usually occurring during puberty./r/n 月经初期第一次月经期，通常发生于青春期/r/n

word.name: mental
word.lx: We should pay more attention to our mental health./r/n 我们应该更注重心理健康。/r/n His problem is mental, not physical./r/n 他的问题是心理的而不是身体的。/r/n

word.name: mentally
word.mean: ad. 心理上,精神上,用脑筋
word.lx: Emotionally or mentally depressed./r/n 消沉的感情上或精神上受压抑的/r/n Not physically or mentally healthy./r/n 不健康的体格或精神上不健康的/r/n

word.name: mention
word.mean:
n. 提及,说起
v. 提到,谈到
vt. 说起,提到
word.lx: You never mentioned that you are married./r/n 你从没有提起过你已经结了婚了。/r/n He made no mention of having met her./r/n 他不提他曾经和她见面。/r/n

word.name: menu
word.lx: Is fish on the menu today?/r/n 今天的菜单上有鱼吗？/r/n Please show me the menu./r/n 请把菜单给我。/r/n

word.name: mercantile
word.mean:
a. 贸易的,商业的
n. 商品

word.name: mercenary
word.mean:
a. 唯利是图的
n. 雇佣兵
word.lx: His actions are entirely mercenary./r/n 他的行为完全是为了钱。/r/n Those mercenaries were hired to fight./r/n 那些雇佣兵被雇佣来打仗。/r/n

word.name: merchandise
word.mean:
n. 商品,货物
v. 经商
vt. 买卖,经营
word.lx: Their merchandise is of high quality./r/n 他们的货物质量很好。/r/n Among all the merchandise, I was interested in the cotton piece in particular./r/n 在所有商品中, 我对棉布特别感兴趣。/r/n

word.name: merchandising
word.lx: The fabrics are merchandised through a network of dealers./r/n 通过经销网点销售纺织品./r/n

word.name: merchant
word.mean:
n. 商人,店主
a. 商业的
word.lx: He used to be a timber merchant./r/n 他曾是一个木材商。/r/n The merchant decided to use camels to carry his goods across the desert./r/n 商人决定用骆驼载运货物穿过沙漠。/r/n

word.name: merciful
word.lx: The merciful king saved him from death./r/n 仁慈的国王免他一死。/r/n The merciful king saved the young officers from death./r/n 仁慈的国王把两个年青的军官从死神手中救了出来。/r/n

word.name: mercifully
word.lx: The play was very bad, but mercifully it was also short!/r/n 那剧糟透了, 幸好还不算长!/r/n

word.name: merciless
word.mean: a. 无慈悲心的,残忍的
word.lx: His refusal was a merciless blow to us./r/n 他的拒绝对我们是一个无情的打击。/r/n The killer was merciless./r/n 凶手残酷无情。/r/n

word.name: mercurial
word.mean:
a. Mercury 神的,水星的,敏捷的
n. 水银剂,汞剂
word.lx: She has a mercurial turn of conversation./r/n 她谈话善转话锋./r/n A mercurial nature./r/n 反复无常的性格/r/n

word.name: mercury
word.lx: The mercury is rising./r/n 温度正在上升。/r/n He has no mercury in him./r/n 他没有精神。/r/n

word.name: mercy
word.lx: The king showed no mercy and killed all the prisoners./r/n 这个国王没有宽容之心，杀死了所有的犯人。/r/n They were lost at the sea, at the mercy of the wind and weather./r/n 他们在海上迷了路，任凭风和天气的摆布。/r/n

word.name: mercy killing
word.lx: Mr Smith indicted for the mercy killing of his incurable son./r/n 史密斯先生被指控的罪名是他为了结束他那患不治之症的儿子的痛苦把他杀死了。/r/n

word.name: merely
word.lx: I merely suggest you should do it again./r/n 我只是建议你重新做这件事。/r/n She is merely a child./r/n 她只不过是个孩子。/r/n

word.name: meretricious
word.mean: a. 华而不实的,俗艳的

word.name: merge
word.mean:
v. 合并,消失,吞没
[计算机] 合并
word.lx: The bank merged with its major rival./r/n 该银行与其主要对手合并了。/r/n Where does this stream merge into the Rhine?/r/n 这条小河在什么地方与莱茵河合流？/r/n

word.name: merger
word.mean:
n. (企业等的)合并
v. (两个或以上公司的)合并
word.lx: There are rumours of an impending merger./r/n 有谣传说是快要合并了./r/n She was pressurized into agreeing to a merger./r/n 她被迫同意将公司合并./r/n

word.name: meridian
word.mean:
n. 子午线,经线,顶点
a. 子午线的,日中的,顶点的

word.name: merit
word.lx: There is little merit in passing the examination if you cheated./r/n 如果你作弊，考试及格也没什么价值。/r/n Should promotion be through merit or seniority?/r/n 晋升应该凭成绩还是靠年资？/r/n

word.name: mermaid
word.lx: Have you read the story of mermaids?/r/n 你看过关于美人鱼的故事吗？/r/n

word.name: merry
word.lx: Merry Christmas!/r/n 圣诞快乐！/r/n There is a merry smile on her face./r/n 她脸上露出愉快的微笑。/r/n

word.name: mesh
word.mean:
n. 网孔,网丝,陷阱
v. 以网捕捉,啮合,编织
[计算机] 网络
word.lx: He is mending the wire mesh in front of the chicken coop./r/n 他正在鸡笼前面修理铁丝网。/r/n Our future plans have to mesh with the present practices./r/n 我们未来的计划必须与当前的实际相结合。/r/n

word.name: mess
word.mean:
n. 乱七八糟,用膳,不顺遂之事
v. 将...弄糟,使...紊乱,聚餐
word.lx: The local economy is now in a mess./r/n 当地的经济现在很混乱。/r/n Who messed up my papers?/r/n 谁把我的文件搞得乱七八糟？/r/n

word.name: metabolize
word.lx: Our bodies constantly metabolize the food we eat./r/n 我们吃的食物在体内不停分解产生代谢变化./r/n

word.name: metal
word.mean:
n. 金属,质料
a. 金属制的
v. 以金属覆盖
word.lx: Copper and gold are both metals./r/n 铜和金都是金属。/r/n They cut holes on the sheet of metal with a punch press./r/n 他们用冲床在金属板上打孔。/r/n

word.name: metallic
word.lx: This is a kind of metallic paint./r/n 这是一种有金属光泽的涂料。/r/n I heard metallic sounds when I was studying./r/n 在我学习的时候我听到了金属撞击的声音。/r/n

word.name: metaphor
word.lx: She has a striking originality in her use of metaphor./r/n 她在运用隐喻方面有独创性。/r/n In poetry the rose is often a metaphor for love./r/n 玫瑰在诗中通常作为爱的象征。/r/n

word.name: meteor
word.mean: n. 流星,大气现象,一夜成名的人

word.name: meteoric
word.mean: a. 流星的,昙花一现的

word.name: meter
word.mean:
n. 公尺,韵律,计量器
v. 以计量器计量
word.lx: Do you remember the reading on the meter?/r/n 你记得表上的读数吗？/r/n The measured, rhythmical sound of verse; meter./r/n 韵律诗的节奏，韵律；音步/r/n

word.name: method
word.mean:
n. 方法,办法
n. 类函数，类成员函数（计算机）
word.lx: New methods of teaching foreign languages are adopted in this institute./r/n 该学院采用新的外语教学法。/r/n The teaching method marked a now epoch in education./r/n 这种教学方法标志着教育的新时代。/r/n

word.name: methodology
word.lx: The methodology of genetic studies; an opinion poll marred by faulty methodology./r/n 遗传学研究的方法；被错误地损害了效果的观点调查/r/n

word.name: meticulous
word.mean: a. 一丝不苟的,精确的

word.name: metre
word.lx: He cut off a metre of cloth from the roll./r/n 他从那卷布上剪下一米./r/n The metre is a measure of length./r/n 米是长度单位./r/n

word.name: metric
word.mean:
a. 公制的,米制的
b. 度量标准
word.lx: The metric-system is used in most countries over the world./r/n 公制在世界上大多数国家使用。/r/n Most countries adopt metric system./r/n 大多数国家采用米制。/r/n

word.name: metropolitan
word.mean:
n. 大都市的居民,大主教,母国的居民
a. 大都市的,大主教区的,母国的
word.lx: She left the small island and became famous in metropolitan France./r/n 她离开小岛而在法国的大都市中成名。/r/n Metropolitan new york cover200 square mile./r/n 纽约大都市覆盖面积达200平方英里。/r/n

word.name: Mexican
word.mean:
n. 墨西哥人,墨西哥语
a. 墨西哥的

word.name: Mexico
word.lx: Mexico has a large surplus of oil./r/n 墨西哥有大量过剩的石油。/r/n A Pueblo people located north-northeast of Santa Fe, New Mexico./r/n 陶斯人一支居住于美国新墨西哥州圣大菲城东北偏北的普埃布洛印地安人中的成员/r/n

word.name: microcomputer
word.mean:
n. 微电脑
[计算机] 微机计算机

word.name: microcosm
word.mean: n. 小宇宙,小世界,人类
word.lx: Man is a microcosm of the whole of mankind./r/n 人是全人类的缩影./r/n This small island contains the whole of nature in microcosm./r/n 这个小岛包含著小而完整的自然界./r/n

word.name: microphone
word.lx: The lecturer speaks through a microphone./r/n 演讲者通过麦克风说话。/r/n He used a microphone so that everyone could hear him./r/n 他使用扩音器，使人人能听见他的讲话。/r/n

word.name: microprocessor
word.mean:
n.微处理器
[计算机] 微处理器
word.lx: A term indicating machines, microprocessor, programs, or procedures that are designed or set apart for special or continued use./r/n 用于描述为专门的或连续的使用而设计或设置的机器、微处理器、程序或过程。/r/n

word.name: Microsoft
word.mean: 微软(财富500强公司之一，总部所在地美国,主要经营软件数据服务)

word.name: microsurgery
word.mean: n. 显微手术,显微外科
word.lx: They were pioneers in the field of microsurgery./r/n 他们是显微外科学领域的创始人./r/n

word.name: mid
word.lx: Two planes collided in mid air./r/n 两架飞机在半空中相撞。/r/n

word.name: middle
word.mean:
a. 中等的,中间的
n. 中间
word.lx: The man has reached middle age./r/n 这人已到了中年。/r/n He planted roses in the middle of the garden./r/n 他在花园中间种上玫瑰。/r/n

word.name: middleman
word.lx: She wants to buy direct from the manufacturer and cut out the middleman./r/n 她想避开分销商直接自厂家买进货物./r/n He acted as a middleman in discussions between the two companies./r/n 他在两公司的谈判中作中间人./r/n

word.name: middling
word.lx: Fair to middling, thanks./r/n 还可以，谢谢。/r/n How am I feeling today? Oh, fair to middling./r/n 我今天感觉如何？哦，马马虎虎。/r/n

word.name: MIDI
word.lx: Musical Instrument Digital Interface, or MIDI, is a communication interface provided on virtually every synthesizer made today./r/n 音乐设备数字接口，或称MIDI，实际上是为目前制造的各种合成器提供的一种通信接口。/r/n

word.name: midst
word.mean:
n. 中间,当中
prep. (=amidst)在...当中

word.name: might
word.mean:
aux. 可能,也许
n. 力量,威力
v. 或许,可以
word.lx: I thought it might be true./r/n 我曾认为这可能是真的。/r/n The promise of a reward might stiffen their resolve./r/n 答应给他们奖励可以坚定他们的决心。/r/n

word.name: migrant
word.lx: Migrant workers move from city to city in search of work./r/n 流动工人为了寻找工作从一个城市移居到另一个城市。/r/n

word.name: migrate
word.mean:
v. 移动,移往,随季节而移居
[计算机] 迁移
word.lx: Some tribes migrate with their cattle in search of fresh grass./r/n 有些部落为了寻找新鲜的牧草而带着他们的牲畜迁移。/r/n To all appearance, Mr. Li is going to migrate./r/n 李先生显然是要移民了。/r/n

word.name: migration
word.lx: Seabirds will fly from here to another place for migration every year./r/n 海鸟每年都要从一个地方迁徙到另一个地方。/r/n There was a huge migration of people into Europe because of the war./r/n 因为战争，大量的移民涌入欧洲。/r/n

word.name: mild
word.mean: a. (烟、酒)味淡的,轻微的,温柔的,文雅的
word.lx: This cheese is very mild./r/n 这种奶酪味道清淡。/r/n He has a mild nature./r/n 他的性格温和。/r/n

word.name: mildew
word.mean:
n. 霉,面粉病菌,露菌病菌
v. 发霉,生霉
word.lx: Those roses have been ruined by mildew./r/n 那些玫瑰已经霉烂。/r/n Cog liable to mildew damage effect ins acidly./r/n 货物可能会发霉，请予以投保。/r/n

word.name: miles
word.lx: Sebastian became captain in place of Miles who had broken his leg./r/n 迈尔斯的腿骨折了，塞巴斯蒂安代替他当了船长。/r/n Miles turned white with fear./r/n 迈尔斯吓得脸色苍白。/r/n

word.name: militant
word.mean: a. 好战的,积极从事或支持使用武力的

word.name: militia
word.mean: n. 义勇军,自卫队,国民军

word.name: milk
word.mean:
n. 奶,乳状物
v. 挤乳,产乳
word.lx: Would you like a glass of milk?/r/n 想喝杯牛奶吗？/r/n The farmer whistled as he milked./r/n 农夫一边挤奶一边吹口哨。/r/n

word.name: milkmaid
word.lx: She was hired as a milkmaid in that farm./r/n 她被雇佣为那个农场的挤奶女工。/r/n All the cows died in the fire because they were barred in by the milkmaids./r/n 由于被挤奶女工关了起来，奶牛在这次火灾中全被烧死了。/r/n

word.name: milkman
word.lx: The dog snarled at the milkman./r/n 那条狗对著送牛奶的人低声吠叫./r/n She went off with the milkman./r/n 她与送牛奶的人私奔了./r/n

word.name: milky
word.mean: a. 乳状的,乳白色的,柔和的
word.lx: I like my coffee milky./r/n 我喜欢喝有牛奶的咖啡。/r/n There may be millions of worlds in the Milky Way Galaxy./r/n 银河系中也许有几百万个世界。/r/n

word.name: mill
word.mean:
n. 磨粉机,磨坊,制造厂
v. 磨细,乱转,打
word.lx: He used a miller to mill the grain into flour./r/n 他用碾磨机把谷物磨成面粉。/r/n The logs are drifted downstream to the mill./r/n 那些原木沿河顺水漂到工厂./r/n

word.name: miller
word.lx: The town miller was famous for his excellent flour./r/n 镇上的面粉场主以优质面粉著称。/r/n He used a miller to mill the grain into flour./r/n 他用碾磨机把谷物磨成面粉。/r/n

word.name: million
word.mean:
n. 百万
a. 百万
word.lx: There were millions of people in the square./r/n 广场上有好多好多人。/r/n The record was a big hit and sold a million copies./r/n 这张唱片非常成功，卖了一百万张。/r/n

word.name: millionaire
word.mean:
n. 百万富翁
v. 沉淀,存款,定金

word.name: mind
word.mean:
n. 思想,主意,心意
v. 介意,照顾,留心
word.lx: Would you mind if I smoke here?/r/n 我在这吸烟，你介意吗？/r/n Mind your head!/r/n 小心别碰了头!/r/n

word.name: minded
word.mean: a. 有意的,有心的,具有意志的
word.lx: He could do it if he were so minded./r/n 假如他想做，他就能做。/r/n She has become very food-minded since her holiday in France./r/n 她自法国度假回来, 对食物就很讲究了./r/n

word.name: mindful
word.mean: a. 深切注意的,留神的,留心的

word.name: mindless
word.mean: a. 不小心的,不留神的,不顾虑的

word.name: mindset
word.mean:
n. 意向,精神状态
心态

word.name: mine
word.mean:
n. 地雷,矿,矿山
pron. 我的
v. 采掘,开矿
word.lx: That book is mine./r/n 那本书是我的。/r/n The cruiser was mined, and sank in five minutes./r/n 这艘巡洋舰触雷，五分钟后沉没了。/r/n

word.name: minefield
word.lx: International law is a minefield for anyone not familiar with its complexity./r/n 国际法这一领域, 不熟悉其复杂性则寸步难行./r/n

word.name: miner
word.lx: I think it is dangerous to be a miner./r/n 我认为当矿工是很危险的。/r/n The boarding-house keeper drew his pistol upon the miner who owed him, and said,Down with the dust! "/r/n 寄宿公寓的管理员拔出手枪对欠他房租的矿工说，“把钱交出来！”/r/n"

word.name: mineral
word.mean:
a. 矿物的
n. 矿物,矿石
word.lx: Coal is a mineral./r/n 煤是一种矿物。/r/n This shop sells minerals./r/n 这家商店卖矿泉水。/r/n

word.name: mingle
word.lx: She accepted the money with mingled feelings./r/n 她悲喜交集地收下了这笔钱。/r/n He mingled in the crowd and lost in sight./r/n 他混入人群，看不见了。/r/n

word.name: mini
word.mean: n. 缩型(缩影,小型计算机)
word.lx: The basic design of the Mini has held good for more than twenty-five years./r/n 微型汽车的基本设计已经适用了25年以上。/r/n

word.name: miniature
word.mean:
n. 缩图,小画像
a. 小规模的,纤小的
word.lx: He showed me the miniature of the mansion./r/n 他给我显示了大厦的模型。/r/n She is just like her mother in miniature./r/n 她简直是她母亲的缩影。/r/n

word.name: minimal
word.mean: a. 最低限度的,最小的

word.name: minimize
word.mean:
v. 将...减到最少
[计算机] 最小化

word.name: minimum
word.mean:
a. 最低的,最小的
n. 最小量,最低限度
word.lx: Repairing your car will cost a minimum of 100 dollars./r/n 修理你的汽车最低限度要100美元。/r/n The class needs a minimum of 6 pupils to continue./r/n 这个班最低限度要六个学生才可以继续办下去。/r/n

word.name: mining
word.lx: This area depends on the mining industry./r/n 这个地区以采矿业为经济基础./r/n He went heels over head into buying mining stock./r/n 他购买了矿业股票，做事真鲁莽。/r/n

word.name: minion
word.lx: They are the dictator and his minions./r/n 他们就是那个独裁者和他的奴仆。/r/n Can you send one of your minions to collect this file?/r/n 你能不能派个助手来取这份档案？/r/n

word.name: minister
word.mean:
n. 部长,大臣
v. 伺候
vi. 照顾,给予帮助
word.lx: He was elected Minister of Education./r/n 他被选为教育部长。/r/n The Chancellor of the Exchequer is the minister in charge of finance in Britain./r/n 英国财政大臣是负责财政的大臣。/r/n

word.name: ministerial
word.mean: a. 部长的,内阁的,执政的
word.lx: They carried the ministerial veto./r/n 他们行使了内阁否决权。/r/n

word.name: mink
word.lx: Picked up a mink coat on sale./r/n 拍卖时随手买了一件貂皮大衣/r/n She wheedled him into buying her a mink coat./r/n 她用甜言蜜语诱他买貂皮大衣给她。/r/n

word.name: minnow
word.lx: These criminals arrested by the police are only minnows, their leader has escaped./r/n 这些被警察抓住的犯罪分子只是些小鱼，他们的头子却跑掉了。/r/n

word.name: minor
word.mean:
n. 未成年人,副修科目
a. 次要的,较小的,二流的,未成年的
v. 辅修
[音乐] 小调
word.lx: She acted as a minor role in the play./r/n 她在剧中扮演了一个次要的角色。/r/n I made minor alterations to the article./r/n 我对这篇文章作了小规模的修改。/r/n

word.name: minority
word.lx: A small minority voted against the motion./r/n 投票反对该提议的人占少数。/r/n There are 55 minorities in our country./r/n 我国有55个少数民族。/r/n

word.name: mint
word.mean:
n. 薄荷,造币厂,巨额
v. 铸造,铸币,伪造
word.lx: The poet minted several words that cannot be found in any dictionary./r/n 诗人造了几个词典里找不到的词。/r/n Many people like to chew mint gum in the summer./r/n 许多人喜欢在夏天嚼薄荷口香糖。/r/n

word.name: minuet
word.lx: A French peasant dance resembling the minuet./r/n 加伏特舞一种法国农民的舞蹈，类似于小步舞/r/n The music for or in the rhythm of the minuet./r/n 米奴哀舞曲为米奴哀舞而写的舞曲或米奴哀舞节奏的舞蹈/r/n

word.name: minus
word.mean:
a. 负的,减去的
n. 减号,负号
prep. 减去
word.lx: I got B minus in the test./r/n 我在考试中得了个B-。/r/n Seven minus three equals four./r/n 七减三等于四。/r/n

word.name: minuscule
word.mean:
n. 草写小字,小写字
a. 草写小字的,小写字的

word.name: minute
word.mean:
a. 微小的
n. 分钟
word.lx: I had remembered in minute detail everything that had happened./r/n 我对发生的每件事的细枝末节都记得清清楚楚。/r/n The park is only five minutes from downtown./r/n 这个花园离市中心只有五分钟的路程。/r/n

word.name: minutes
word.lx: The minutes of the last meeting were approved./r/n 上次会议记录已获得通过./r/n Boil the vegetables for 20 minutes and then drain off the water./r/n 把蔬菜煮上20分钟，然后把水沥掉。/r/n

word.name: miracle
word.lx: Her life was saved by a miracle./r/n 她的生命是靠奇迹救活的。/r/n This cathedral was regarded as a miracle in architectural history./r/n 这座大教堂被认为是建筑史上的奇迹。/r/n

word.name: mirage
word.lx: A mirage is an optical illusion./r/n 海市蜃楼是一种视错觉./r/n The heat reflected from the white sand formed a mirage./r/n 热气经白色的沙面反射形成了蜃景./r/n

word.name: mire
word.mean:
n. 泥沼,泥泞
v. 使...陷于泥泞,使...陷入困境
word.lx: The most brilliant person may be mired in detail and confusion./r/n 即使是最聪明的人也会陷入琐事与混乱之中。/r/n My car was mired./r/n 我的车上溅满污泥。/r/n

word.name: mirror
word.mean:
n. 镜子
v. 反映,反射
word.lx: She stared at herself in the mirror./r/n 她凝视着镜中的自己。/r/n The clear water mirrored the blue sky./r/n 清澈的水中映出蔚蓝的天空。/r/n

word.name: mirroring
word.lx: His figure looks very funny in the concave mirror./r/n 他的样子在凹镜里显得非常可笑。/r/n The mirror is oval./r/n 镜子是椭圆的。/r/n

word.name: mirth
word.lx: Christmas is a time of mirth, especially for children./r/n 圣诞节是个快乐的日子，尤其是对孩子们。/r/n When I told them what had happened to me, they all chortled with mirth./r/n 我把我的事告诉他们以後, 他们咯咯地笑起来了./r/n

word.name: misadventure
word.lx: Their holiday was ruined by a whole series of misadventures./r/n 一连串的不幸事故把他们的假日全毁了./r/n The court returned a verdict of death by misadventure./r/n 法院裁定意外致死或意外事故死亡。/r/n

word.name: misanthrope
word.mean: n. 厌恶人类的人,不愿与人来往者

word.name: misapprehension
word.lx: I thought you wanted to see me but I was clearly under a complete misapprehension./r/n 我以为你想见我, 显然完全是我误解了./r/n

word.name: misbehave
word.mean: v. 行为无礼貌,行为不端,作弊

word.name: miscarriage
word.lx: By a miscarriage of justice the wrong man was condemned./r/n 由于法庭的错误判决，一个无辜的人被定了罪。/r/n Sending an innocent man to prison is a clear miscarriage of justice./r/n 把无辜的人投入监狱显然是审判不公./r/n

word.name: miscarry
word.mean: vt. 流产(失败,产生错误)
word.lx: The parcel must have miscarry, for she never receive it./r/n 邮包一定投递错了，因为她一直没有收到。/r/n

word.name: miscellaneous
word.mean:
a. 各种的,多方面的
[计算机] 杂的
n. [合同法律用语]其他约定
word.lx: He likes to have miscellaneous collection./r/n 他喜欢多种多样的收集。/r/n The miscellaneous expenses of import are so much!/r/n 进口货物的杂费太多了！/r/n

word.name: miscellany
word.lx: The show was a miscellany of song and dance./r/n 那场演出是又有歌曲又有舞蹈的混合表演./r/n

word.name: mischance
word.lx: I lost your file by pure mischance./r/n 我把你的文件丢了，纯粹是碰上倒霉事了。/r/n A series of mischance happened./r/n 一连串不幸的事发生了。/r/n

word.name: mischief
word.lx: The wind played mischief with my papers./r/n 风把我的文章吹得乱七八糟。/r/n I try to keep the boy out of mischief./r/n 我尽量不让这个男孩胡闹。/r/n

word.name: mischievous
word.lx: One expects active children to be mischievous at times./r/n 活泼的孩子有时是会淘气的。/r/n Mischievous, teasing, or annoying./r/n 有害的、调皮的或打搅/r/n

word.name: misconceive
word.lx: The housing needs of our inner cities have been misconceived from the start./r/n 我们旧城区的住房需求一开始就受到误解./r/n

word.name: misconception
word.lx: That a doctor shall be able to physic any disease is a misconception./r/n 认为医生应该能医治任何疾病的观念是错误的。/r/n

word.name: misconduct
word.mean:
n. 处理不当(胡作非为)
vt 处理不当(胡作非为)
word.lx: That doctor has been accused of professional misconduct./r/n 那位医生被指控违反医德。/r/n The company only dismisses its employees in cases of gross misconduct./r/n 公司仅在雇员严重失职的情形下才予以解雇./r/n

word.name: misconstrue
word.lx: You have completely misconstrued me/my words/what I said./r/n 你完全误解了我[我的话/我的意思]了./r/n

word.name: miscreant
word.mean:
a. 极恶的,协道的,异端的
n. 罪大恶极的人,恶棍,异端

word.name: miserable
word.lx: The play was a miserable failure./r/n 这出戏演砸了。/r/n There are still many people whose living conditions are miserable./r/n 仍有许多人的生活条件是很艰苦的。/r/n

word.name: miserably
word.lx: She failed miserably./r/n 她失败得很惨。/r/n Suffering from poverty; miserably poor./r/n 贫困的穷困潦倒的；悲惨的/r/n

word.name: misery
word.lx: I am ill with misery./r/n 我病得难受。/r/n Virtue and vice are two different things: the former/that/the one leads to peace, the latter/this/the other to misery./r/n 美德与邪恶是不同的，前者带来和平，后者导致痛苦。/r/n

word.name: misfire
word.lx: The engine is misfiring badly on one cylinder./r/n 发动机有一个汽缸严重失灵./r/n The joke misfired completely./r/n 这个笑话讲得完全不成功./r/n

word.name: misfit
word.mean: n. 不能适应社会或工作环境的人
word.lx: He always feel a bit of a misfit in the business world./r/n 他总觉得自己在商业界有些不适应。/r/n The argument misfits the case./r/n 这论椐不适用于这一事件。/r/n

word.name: misfortune
word.lx: He had the misfortune to fall ill on the day of the examination./r/n 他很倒霉，在考试当天生病了。/r/n One misfortune followed another./r/n 不幸的事情一件接著一件./r/n

word.name: misgive
word.mean:
v. 怀疑,恐惧
vt. 使担心

word.name: misgiving
word.lx: His heart is full of misgivings./r/n 他心中疑虑重重。/r/n I have many misgivings about taking the job./r/n 我对是否接受那项工作顾虑重重。/r/n

word.name: misgivings
word.lx: His heart is full of misgivings./r/n 他心中疑虑重重。/r/n I have many misgivings about taking the job./r/n 我对是否接受那项工作顾虑重重。/r/n

word.name: misguide
word.mean: v. 给予错误的消息或指导,使误入歧途

word.name: misguided
word.lx: The thief made a misguided attempt to rob a policewoman./r/n 那个贼不识好歹竟要抢劫一个女警察。/r/n I was misguided into trusting him./r/n 我得到错误印象而信任了他。/r/n

word.name: misinform
word.lx: I regret to say you have been misinformed (about that)./r/n 很遗憾, （关於那事）你听到的情况不确./r/n

word.name: misinterpret
word.lx: I feel I must qualify my earlier remarks in case they are misinterpret./r/n 我觉得我得把我说的话改得具体些，以免产生误解。/r/n The rioter misinterpret the instructions of the police./r/n 暴徒们错误地解释了警察的指示。/r/n

word.name: misjudgment
word.mean: n. 估计错误,判断不公

word.name: mislay
word.mean:
v. 遗失...,把...放错地方
vt. 放错位置,遗失
word.lx: I seem to have mislaid my passport have you seen it?/r/n 我好像把护照放在什麽地方找不到了--你看见了吗?/r/n I have mislaid my key to the door./r/n 我不知道把门钥匙放到哪里了。/r/n

word.name: mislead
word.lx: He misled me into thinking he was rich./r/n 他使我误以为他很有钱。/r/n We were misled by the guide./r/n 向导给我们引错了路。/r/n

word.name: mismanagement
word.mean: n. 管理不善,处理不当
word.lx: And who brought us to such a pass? You did, by sheer mismanagement./r/n 谁使我们陷入这样的困境？就是你，纯粹由于你管理不善。/r/n By sheer mismanagement you brought us to such a pass./r/n 完全是你处理不当，才把事情弄得这样糟。/r/n

word.name: mismatch
word.lx: Their marriage was a mismatch they had little in common./r/n 他们的婚姻不般配--两人几无共同之处./r/n

word.name: misrepresent
word.mean: vt. 误称(把...颠倒黑白,错误表现)

word.name: miss
word.mean:
n. 小姐
vt. 想念
vt. 漏掉,错过
word.lx: That was a lucky miss./r/n 幸免于难。/r/n May I help you, miss?/r/n 要我帮忙吗，小姐？/r/n

word.name: misshapen
word.mean: a. 造型不佳的,残缺的,畸形的
word.lx: Distorted in form; misshapen./r/n 变形的形状上被扭曲的；畸形的/r/n

word.name: missile
word.lx: The huge ship was sunk by a homing missile./r/n 这只巨大的军舰被一枚自动寻的导弹击中。/r/n Demonstrators attacked the police, using sticks and assorted missiles./r/n 示威者用棍棒和各种投掷物攻击警察。/r/n

word.name: missing
word.lx: The child had been missing for a week./r/n 那个孩子已经下落不明一个星期了。/r/n The book had two pages missing./r/n 那本书缺两页。/r/n

word.name: mission
word.mean:
n. 任务,代表团,使命
[计算机] 使命
word.lx: He has been on confidential missions to Berlin./r/n 他前往柏林执行秘密任务。/r/n The doctor works at the mission./r/n 那医生在贫民教区工作。/r/n

word.name: missionary
word.mean:
n. 传教士,负有任务者,工作人员
a. 传教的,负有使命的

word.name: Mississippi
word.lx: He has a large farm in the Mississippi Valley./r/n 他在密西西比河流域拥有一个大农场。/r/n The region of the United States west of the Mississippi River./r/n 西部地区美国密西西比河以西的地区/r/n

word.name: Mississippi River
word.lx: Mark used to be a pilot on the Mississippi River./r/n 马克曾在密西西比河上当过领航员。/r/n The region of the United States west of the Mississippi River./r/n 西部地区美国密西西比河以西的地区/r/n

word.name: missive
word.mean:
n. 公文,书信
a. 送出的

word.name: mist
word.mean:
n. 雾,迷蒙,朦胧不清
v. 使...模糊,下雾
word.lx: She could hardly recognize her son through the mist of tears that filled her eyes./r/n 她泪眼蒙蒙，几乎不能认出自己的儿子。/r/n Our breath is misting up the car windows./r/n 我们呼出的气渐渐给汽车的窗户上蒙上一层水蒸气。/r/n

word.name: mistakenly
word.mean: ad. 错误地, 曲解地
word.lx: A king of Thebes who was mistakenly killed by his own son, Oedipus./r/n 拉伊俄斯底比斯国王，被他自己的儿子俄底浦斯误杀/r/n

word.name: mistletoe
word.mean: n. 槲寄生(一种常用作圣诞节室内悬挂的植物)
word.lx: The mistletoe plant is a parasite on trees./r/n 槲寄生是寄生在树上的植物。/r/n

word.name: mistress
word.lx: The dog ran alongside his mistress./r/n 狗在女主人的身边奔跑。/r/n The poet addressed many poems to his mistress, praising her beauty./r/n 这位诗人为他心爱的女子写了许多诗，歌颂她的美丽。/r/n

word.name: mistrust
word.mean:
n. 不信任,疑惑
v. 不信任,疑惑
word.lx: He keeps his money at home because he has a great mistrust of banks./r/n 他把自己的钱放在家里，因为他很不信任银行。/r/n Everything you say seems to be pervaded with a mistrust of the human race./r/n 你说的一切似乎都渗透了对人类的不信任。/r/n

word.name: mistrustful
word.lx: He is mistrustful of my ability./r/n 他不信任我的才干。/r/n

word.name: mists
word.lx: The mists was fleeing before the rising sun./r/n 太阳慢慢升起，薄雾渐渐消失。/r/n We watched the mists ascending from the valley below./r/n 我们看著薄雾从下面的山谷中升起./r/n

word.name: misty
word.mean: a. 有雾的,模糊的,含糊的
word.lx: It was a misty morning, but not very cold./r/n 这是一个多雾的清晨，但不太冷。/r/n A misty rain; a misty night./r/n 似雾的雨，雾朦朦的夜晚/r/n

word.name: misunderstand
word.lx: They pretend to misunderstand my complaint./r/n 他们假装误解了我的投诉。/r/n He wrote her a letter for fear she misunderstand him./r/n 他给她写了封信，免得她误会。/r/n

word.name: misuse
word.lx: Because of misuse of power, he was dismissed./r/n 因为滥用权力，他被开除了。/r/n The manufacturers disclaim all responsibility for the damage caused by misuse./r/n 因使用不当造成的损坏，生产厂家不负任何责任。/r/n

word.name: mite
word.lx: I offer a mite of comfort to him./r/n 我给了他一点安慰。/r/n Poor little mite!/r/n 可怜的小家伙！/r/n

word.name: mitigate
word.mean:
v. 镇静,缓和,减轻
v. 缓和
word.lx: The government is trying to mitigate the effects of inflation./r/n 政府正试图缓和通货膨胀的影响。/r/n Her words mitigated my suffering./r/n 她的话减轻了我的痛苦。/r/n

word.name: mitt
word.lx: Take your mitts off me!/r/n 别碰我!/r/n I gave him a baseball mitt for his birthday./r/n 为祝贺他的生日，我送给他一只棒球手套。/r/n

word.name: mitten
word.mean: n. 连指手套,露指手套
word.lx: In winter she wears mittens./r/n 冬天时她戴连指手套。/r/n The part of a glove or mitten that covers the palm of the hand./r/n （手套的）掌份覆盖手掌的物体或手套的一部分/r/n

word.name: mixed
word.mean:
a. 混合的,形形色色的,弄糊涂的
v. 使...混合,交际
vbl. 混合,弄混
word.lx: The workers mixed the asphalt with sand and gravel together./r/n 工人们把沥青和沙子、石块混合在一起。/r/n She put the sugar into the coffee and mixed them up with a spoon./r/n 她把糖放进咖啡里，用勺子把它们混合起来。/r/n

word.name: mixed-up
word.mean: a. 头脑不清楚的,迷惑不解
word.lx: She feels very mixed-up about life since her divorce./r/n 自离婚后，她对人生感到很迷茫。/r/n

word.name: mixture
word.lx: Air is a mixture of gases./r/n 空气是气体的混合物。/r/n The ball is filled with gaseous mixture./r/n 那个球被充满了气体混合物。/r/n

word.name: mm

word.lx: What is he moaning about?/r/n 他在发什么牢骚？/r/n He moaned about his misfortunes to anyone who would listen./r/n 他向每一个愿意听的人抱怨他的不幸。/r/n

word.name: moccasin

word.mean: n. 方式,样式,时尚，时兴

v. 节制,使...稳定,使...缓和
word.lx: He usually drives at a moderate speed./r/n 他通常中速驾驶。/r/n The wind was strong all day, but it moderated after sunset./r/n 风猛烈地刮了一整天后，日落后变小了。/r/n

word.name: moderately
word.mean: ad. 适当地,适度地,中庸地

word.name: modernization
word.lx: International competition was a spur to modernization./r/n 国际竞争是实现现代化的动力。/r/n The modernization of the industry was phased over a 20-year period./r/n 工业现代化分20年逐步实现./r/n

word.name: modest
word.mean: a. 谦虚的；适度的；端庄的

word.mean: ad. 谨慎地, 适当地
word.lx: Be youngster, we sit modestly at the back, never daring to speak./r/n 我们是些年轻人，都谦恭地坐在後面，始终不敢发言。/r/n

word.name: modesty
word.lx: His modesty [air of joviality] was all put on./r/n 他的谦逊[愉快的样子]都是装出来的。/r/n Modesty is not his long suit./r/n 谦虚可不是他的长处./r/n

word.mean:

word.lx: The policy was agreed by the committee, but only in a modified form./r/n 那项政策经修改后才获得委员会同意。/r/n Easily altered or modified to fit conditions; adaptable./r/n 能适应的容易改动或修改来适应情况的；能适应的/r/n

word.name: monument

word.mean: a. 纪念碑的,做为纪念的,不朽的

word.name: moon

word.name: moonlit

word.name: mordant
word.mean:
a. 尖酸的,辛辣的,有腐蚀性的
n. 金属腐蚀剂,金箔粘著剂
v. 用媒染剂处理

word.name: more
word.mean:
n. 更多
a. 多的,程度较大的,更大的
ad. 多,更多,进一步
n.[计算机] DOS命令 : 使DOS每次显示一屏信息, 以取代连续卷动
word.lx: His illness was more serious than the doctor first thought./r/n 他的病较医生原来以为的更严重。/r/n There are more cars on the road in the summer than in the winter./r/n 夏天路上的车子比冬天多。/r/n

word.name: mores
word.mean: n. 风俗, 习惯, 民德, 道德观念
word.lx: There are more than 5,000 adjectives in that dictionary./r/n 那本词典中有5000多个形容词。/r/n Pupils with 90% or more are awarded Grade A./r/n 满90分的学生评为甲等./r/n

word.name: moribund
word.lx: Moribund customs; a moribund way of life./r/n 过时的风俗；过时的生活方式/r/n

word.name: morn
word.lx: Life is poetically compared to the morning dew./r/n 在诗歌中，人生被比喻为朝露。/r/n The following morning, I should again greet the dawn, anxious to discover new delights./r/n 接下来这一天的早上，我再次迎接黎明，迫切地要发现新的愉快。/r/n

word.name: Morocco
word.lx: Morocco and California are bits of the Earth in very similar latitudes./r/n 摩洛哥和加利福尼亚是地球上几乎同纬度的两小块地方。/r/n

word.name: morose
word.mean: a. 郁闷的, 乖僻的
word.lx: One easy, although unkind, way of dealing with two morose teenagers is to play one off against the other./r/n 有一个简单然而有点冷酷的方法来对付这两个难处的青年——记他们互相争斗你从中得利。/r/n

word.name: morphine
word.lx: The morphine was administered by injection./r/n 那吗啡是注射进去的./r/n

word.name: morphology
word.mean: n. 形态学,语形论,形态论

word.name: Morse code
word.lx: The spoken representation of a dash in Morse code./r/n 长划莫尔斯电码中，以短断音代表口语表达/r/n

word.name: mortal
word.mean:
a. 人世间的,致命的,终有一死的
n. 凡人

word.name: mortality
word.mean: n. 必死的命运,死亡数目,死亡率

word.name: mortar
word.mean:
n. 臼,研钵,灰泥
v. 用灰泥涂抹,用灰泥结合
word.lx: The army was fired by mortars./r/n 军队被迫击炮攻击。/r/n Put your money into bricks and mortar./r/n 用你的钱去买房子吧。/r/n

word.name: mortgage
word.lx: He will have to mortgage his land for a loan./r/n 他不得不将土地抵押来申请贷款。/r/n Paying my mortgage was an enormous weight off my mind!/r/n 我还了抵押借款, 如释重负!/r/n

word.name: mortify
word.lx: He felt mortified for his mistake./r/n 他对他的错深感羞愧./r/n The knowledge of future evils mortified the present felicities./r/n 对未来苦难的了解压抑了目前的喜悦。/r/n

word.name: mortise
word.mean:
n. 榫眼
v. 用榫接合
word.lx: The cross-piece is mortised into the upright post./r/n 横梁和立柱是用榫眼接合一起的./r/n

word.name: Moscow
word.mean: n. 莫斯科(俄罗斯首都)
word.lx: Moscow is the capital of Russia./r/n 莫斯科是俄罗斯的首都。/r/n He lives in Moscow./r/n 他生活在莫斯科。/r/n

word.name: Moses
word.mean: n. 摩西,领导者,立法者
word.lx: Moses led the Israelites out of their bondage in Egypt./r/n 摩西率领以色列人脱离在埃及的奴隶生涯。/r/n Moses led the children of Israel out of the Egypt./r/n 摩西率领以色列的子民离开了埃及。/r/n

word.name: Moslem
word.mean:
n. 回教徒,穆罕默德信徒
a. 回教徒的,回教的
word.lx: Most Moslem women wear veils in public places./r/n 大多数穆斯林妇女在公共场所都戴着面纱。/r/n A porter or bearer in certain Moslem countries./r/n 搬运工在某些穆斯林国家的搬运工/r/n

word.name: mosque
word.lx: They went to the mosque to pray./r/n 他们去清真寺做祷告。/r/n The devout were all hurrying to the mosque./r/n 信徒们都赶往清真寺。/r/n

word.name: mosquito
word.lx: I hate mosquitoes./r/n 我讨厌蚊子。/r/n Mosquitoes like to suck the blood of people and animals./r/n 蚊子喜好吸人和动物的血。/r/n

word.name: moss
word.lx: A rolling stone gathers no moss./r/n 滚石不生苔；转业不聚财。/r/n The protective cap or hood covering the spore case of a moss or related plant./r/n 藓帽盖在苔藓或相关植物芽孢体上的保护帽或盖子/r/n

word.name: mossy
word.lx: He stepped on the mossy front steps and looked into the house./r/n 他站在长满苔藓的前门的台阶上向里张望。/r/n

word.name: most
word.mean:
n. 最多,最大
a. 大多数的,几乎全部的,最多的
ad. 最,最多,极其
word.lx: It was one of the most important discoveries ever made./r/n 这是所做出的最重大的发现之一。/r/n Most students passed the examination./r/n 大多数学生通过了考试。/r/n

word.name: mostly
word.lx: The work is mostly done./r/n 这工作已基本完成。/r/n The men at the party were mostly fairly young./r/n 参加聚会的男子大都非常年轻。/r/n

word.name: motel
word.lx: He stayed one night in a motel and went on travelling./r/n 他在一家汽车旅馆呆了一晚上，就又接着旅行了。/r/n The motel business went to pot when the new highway was built./r/n 这条新公路建成后，汽车旅馆的生意冷落了下来。/r/n

word.name: moth
word.lx: This piece of cloth was eaten by a moth./r/n 这块布被蠹虫蛀坏了。/r/n The moth quivered its wings./r/n 蛾子抖动著翅膀./r/n

word.name: mother
word.mean:
a. 出生地的
n. 母亲
v. 产生
word.lx: My mother is a housewife./r/n 我妈妈是个家庭妇女。/r/n It happened that my mother was out that day./r/n 我母亲恰巧那天出去了。/r/n

word.name: mother tongue
word.lx: English is her mother tongue./r/n 英语是她的母语。/r/n His mother tongue is Spanish./r/n 他的母语是西班牙语。/r/n

word.name: motherhood
word.lx: She finds motherhood very rewarding./r/n 她认为做母亲得偿所愿。/r/n The state of being a mother; motherhood./r/n 母亲身份；母道作为母亲的状态；母道/r/n

word.name: motherland
word.lx: The soldiers swore allegiance to their motherland./r/n 士兵们宣誓效忠于他们的祖国。/r/n Her motherland is in the tropical region./r/n 她的祖国位于热带地区。/r/n

word.name: motif
word.lx: A motif in art, literature, or music./r/n 主题艺术、文学或者音乐的主题/r/n A rectangular column with a capital and base, set into a wall as an ornamental motif./r/n 壁柱，半露柱有柱顶和底座的长方形柱子，作为装饰图案置入墙内/r/n

word.name: motile
word.mean: a. 能动的,有自动力的

word.name: motion
word.mean:
n. 打手势,示意,移动,动作,提议
v. 运动,向...打手势
word.lx: He opened the door and motioned me to come in./r/n 他打开了门，招手让我进去。/r/n The motion was put to the assemblage./r/n 这项提议已提交大会了。/r/n

word.name: motion picture
word.lx: The company entered into motion picture production in1897./r/n 这个公司在1897年就开始电影制作工作了。/r/n A subtitle in a motion picture./r/n 字幕电影里的对话译文/r/n

word.name: motionless
word.lx: The cat remained motionless, waiting for the mouse to come out of its hole./r/n 猫一动不动地等着老鼠出洞。/r/n She stood there (being) motionless./r/n 她站在那儿，一动也不动。/r/n

word.name: motivate
word.mean: v. 给与动机,刺激,提高...的学习欲望

word.name: motivated
word.lx: They are motivated by the twin goads of punishment and reward./r/n 他们受赏与罚的双重因素所激励。/r/n Motivated by a spiritual force or genius; inspired./r/n 产生灵感的被神圣的力量或神灵激励的；受鼓舞的/r/n

word.name: motivation
word.lx: Attribution of human motivation, characteristics, or behavior to inanimate objects, animals, or natural phenomena./r/n 拟人论，拟人观赋予无生命的物体，动物或自然现象以人的动机，特征或行动/r/n

word.name: motive
word.mean:
a. 发动的,运动的
n. 动机,目的
word.lx: His sole motive is to make more money./r/n 他唯一的动机就是多赚钱。/r/n The police have excluded robbery as a motive for the murder./r/n 警方已排除该谋杀案中有抢劫的动机./r/n

word.name: motley
word.mean:
a. 杂色的l斑杂的,杂多的,混杂的
n. 杂色,杂色衣服,混杂
word.lx: They are wearing a motley collection of old clothes./r/n 他们穿着各式各样的旧衣服。/r/n They were a motley crew./r/n 这帮人成份混杂。/r/n

word.name: motor
word.mean:
a. 机动的,汽车的
n. 发动机,马达
word.lx: The machines are driven by electric motors./r/n 这些机器都是由电动机驱动的。/r/n They spent a week motoring through Italy./r/n 他们花了一星期，驾车周游意大利。/r/n

word.name: motorcar
word.lx: Every time I got my motorcar started the engine cut out./r/n ＂每次我一启动我的摩托车，发动机就熄火了。＂/r/n Aside from motorcars, the factory turns out bicycles./r/n 除了汽车之外, 这家工厂还生产自行车。/r/n

word.name: motorcycle
word.lx: Mr. Lin will wash his motorcycle tomorrow morning./r/n 林先生明天早晨将擦洗他的摩托车。/r/n The motorcycle race is not worth seeing/r/n 这次摩托车比赛不值一看。/r/n

word.name: motoring
word.lx: Motoring organizations are urging drivers not to travel by road if possible./r/n 机动车协会劝告开车的人暂时不要使用公路。/r/n They spent a pleasant afternoon motoring through the countryside./r/n 他们一下午都在郊野开著汽车, 十分愉快./r/n

word.name: motorist
word.mean: n. 乘汽车者,常坐汽车的人
word.lx: The policeman ordered the motorist to stop./r/n 警察指示让那开车的人停车/r/n The dropped plate flew into pieces. The motorist flew into a rage./r/n 掉在地上的盘子摔成了碎片；驾车的人大发雷霆/r/n

word.name: motorway
word.lx: We should leave the motorway at the next interchange./r/n 我们应该在下一个立体交叉道驶离高速公路。/r/n This road is a continuation of the motorway./r/n 这条公路是高速公路的延伸。/r/n

word.name: mottled
word.lx: Iron utensils with a mottled enamel resembling granite./r/n 单涂搪瓷器皿表面涂以搪瓷使外观象花岗岩的铁制品/r/n

word.name: motto
word.lx: Think before you act" is my motto./r/n “三思而后行”是我的座右铭。/r/n

word.name: mould
word.mean:
n. 模子(样板,形状,霉菌,土,类型)
vt 模压(铸造,发霉,形成,轮廓相符合)
word.lx: Bread tends to mould in damp weather./r/n 气候潮湿时，面包容易长霉。/r/n The car body is moulded in the factory./r/n 汽车车身是在这家工厂里模压成型的。/r/n

word.name: moulding
word.lx: The car body is moulded in the factory./r/n 汽车车身是在这家工厂里模压成型的。/r/n Bread tends to mould in damp weather./r/n 气候潮湿时，面包容易长霉。/r/n

word.name: mound
word.mean:
n. 土墩,堤,小山
v. 筑堤,用土堆防卫
word.lx: There is a mound of papers on my desk./r/n 我的办公桌上放了一大堆文件。/r/n He lay in his bunk under a mound of blankets./r/n 他躺在铺上，身上盖了一大堆毯子。/r/n

word.name: mount
word.mean:
n. 山峰,乘用马,框,衬纸
v. 增长,装上,爬上,乘马
word.lx: Mount Jolmo Lungma is the highest mountain in the world./r/n 珠穆朗玛峰是世界上最高的山峰。/r/n He mounted the horse and rode off./r/n 他骑上马走了。/r/n

word.name: mountain
word.lx: He looks down from the top of the mountain to the valley far below./r/n 他从山顶向下眺望下面幽深的山谷。/r/n The mountain is 3500 meters high./r/n 这座山有3500米高。/r/n

word.name: mountain range
word.lx: An area of land formed or lying at the foot of a mountain or mountain range./r/n 山麓地区，山脚地区形成或位于山脚下或山区的陆地地区/r/n A spur of a mountain range or hills./r/n 山的支脉一列山或丘的横岭/r/n

word.name: mountaineer
word.mean:
n. 登山家,山地人
v. 登山
word.lx: The mountaineer has many stories of expeditions./r/n 这个登山家有很多探险故事。/r/n Many mountaineers have reached that mountain peak./r/n 许多登山家都登上过那座大山的顶峰。/r/n

word.name: mountaineering
word.lx: From about1880 to1903 was truly the golden age of mountaineering./r/n 从大约1880年到1903年，确实是登山运动的黄金时期。/r/n Mountaineering was introduced here in1955./r/n 登山运动是1955年在这里开始开展的。/r/n

word.name: mountainous
word.lx: It seemed that the mountainous waves would turn the ship over./r/n 排山倒海的巨浪似乎要把船掀翻。/r/n Our country is very mountainous./r/n 我国是一个多山的国家。/r/n

word.name: mountainside
word.lx: As the rock rolled down the mountainside, it gathered momentum./r/n 石头滚下山时，它的动量增加。/r/n The flow of melted snow cascaded down the mountainside and into the river./r/n 溶化的雪水如瀑布般沿着山崖边泻入河里。/r/n

word.name: mounting
word.lx: He managed to subdue his mounting anger./r/n 他设法克制住了阵阵愤怒。/r/n The mounting economic crisis is already eating into every part in the structure of that country./r/n 日益增剧的经济危机正侵袭着那个国家机构的各个部门。/r/n

word.name: mourn
word.lx: The old woman still mourns for her son./r/n 这位老太太还在为儿子的死伤心。/r/n People wore crapes to mourn our leader./r/n 人们戴着黑纱哀悼我们的领导。/r/n

word.name: mourner
word.mean: n. 悲伤者,哀悼者,送葬者
word.lx: The mourners were all in black./r/n 送葬者都穿着黑衣服。/r/n The mourners were dressed in black./r/n 哀悼者穿黑服./r/n

word.name: mournful
word.mean: a. 悲恸的,悲哀的,令人惋惜的
word.lx: He looks mournful./r/n 他看上去神色悲哀。/r/n He took a mournful view on human affairs./r/n 他对人世持悲观的态度。/r/n

word.name: mourning
word.lx: They all mourned his passing./r/n 大家都对他的逝世表示悲痛./r/n The governor decreed a day of mourning./r/n 地方长官发布哀悼一日的命令./r/n

word.name: mouse
word.lx: I guess there are mice in the kitchen./r/n 我猜想厨房里有老鼠。/r/n The cat is playing with a live mouse./r/n 猫在戏弄那只活老鼠。/r/n

word.name: moussaka
word.mean: 茄合(希腊的一道菜名, 盖以白酱汁和干酪然后烤熟)

word.name: moustache
word.lx: His moustache is very long./r/n 他的胡子很长。/r/n When he was twenty years old, he began to have a moustache./r/n 当他二十岁的时候，他长了胡子。/r/n

word.name: mouth
word.mean:
n. 嘴,开口
v. 装腔作势说话, 高声地说话
word.lx: The news spread from mouth to mouth./r/n 这消息广为流传。/r/n These people live from hand to mouth on berries and roots./r/n 这些人靠浆果和根茎勉强度日。/r/n

word.name: mouthful
word.lx: An amount of food taken into the mouth at one time; a mouthful./r/n 一口食物；一口，少量一次吞入口的食物量；一口的量/r/n He took a mouthful of sweet country air./r/n 他吸一口清香的乡村空气。/r/n

word.name: mouthpiece
word.mean: n. 发话筒,电话筒对嘴的一端

word.name: mouthwash
word.lx: She gargle with an antiseptic mouthwash./r/n 她用具有消毒灭菌作用的漱口剂来清洁口腔。/r/n A cosmetic or medicinal liquid, such as a mouthwash./r/n 洗药，液体化妆品化妆用的或药用的液体，如漱口剂/r/n

word.name: movable
word.mean:
n. 家具,动产
a. 可动的,动产的,不定的
word.lx: This dresser is movable; we can take it to our new flat./r/n 这个梳妆台是可移动的，我们可以把它带到新公寓去。/r/n I bought a toy soldier with movable arms and legs for my son./r/n 我给我儿子买了一个胳膊腿可移动的玩具兵。/r/n

word.name: move
word.mean:
n. 移动,迁居,步骤,动作
v. 移动,搬家,使...感动,(有时也意译为跳槽")

word.name: mover
word.mean: n. 搬家公司,搬运工人,提出动议者
word.lx: He was the prime mover in the revolt against the government./r/n 他是这场反政府叛乱的煽动者./r/n He is the prime mover in the whole matter./r/n 他是整个事件的发起者。/r/n

word.name: movie
word.lx: The conclusion of the movie was anticlimactic./r/n 电影的结局真没劲。/r/n The movie was over shortly before six./r/n 电影在六点钟不到就结束了。/r/n

word.name: movies
word.lx: Many movies deal with commonplace themes./r/n 许多电影的主题很平庸。/r/n Mary Pickford was a famous star of the silent movies./r/n 玛丽·碧克馥是无声电影的明星。/r/n

word.name: moving
word.lx: Then along comes a rapidly moving cold front./r/n 然后来了一股迅速移动的冷锋。/r/n At last I succeeded in getting my car moving slowly./r/n 最后，我终于成功地让我的车子慢慢移动。/r/n

word.name: mow
word.mean:
n. 草堆,皱眉
v. 割草,扫射,收入干草棚
word.lx: The soldiers were mown down by enemy gunfire./r/n 士兵大批大批地被敌军炮火打死。/r/n Early sow, early mow./r/n 【谚】早种早收。/r/n

word.name: mower
word.lx: I borrowed a mower from my neighbor to cut grass in my garden./r/n 我从邻居那借了割草机来割花园里的草。/r/n The gardener asked me for a rotatory lawn mower./r/n 园丁向我要一台旋转式割草机。/r/n

word.name: Mozart
word.lx: Mozart is a colossus among composers./r/n 莫札特是作曲家中的巨匠./r/n Mozart is dead but his music lives on./r/n 莫扎特人已作古，但他的音乐作品却万世流传。/r/n

word.name: mph
word.mean:
(=mile per hour)每小时英里数,英里/小时
Master of Public Health 公共健康硕士
word.lx: He went belting up/down the motorway at 90 mph./r/n 他在高速公路上以每小时90英里的速度疾驶./r/n The speed limit on this road is 70 mph./r/n 这条路的车速限制是每小时70英里./r/n

word.name: Mr
word.lx: Mr. Smith is our teacher./r/n 史密斯先生是我们的老师。/r/n Mr. Green had to appear before the committee to explain his behavior ./r/n 格林先生必须在委员会上出面解释他的行为。/r/n

word.name: ms
word.lx: Ms. Brown is active in the party./r/n 布朗女士在晚会上很活跃。/r/n Ms X has been named for the directorship/named as the new director./r/n 某女士已被提名任董事职务[任命为新董事]./r/n

word.name: much
word.mean:
a. 许多的
ad. 很,非常
pron.&n. 许多
word.lx: I think we may learn much from it./r/n 我想我们能从中学到许多。/r/n The patient is much the same this morning./r/n 今晨病人情况几无变化。/r/n

word.name: muck
word.mean:
n. 垃圾,肥料
v. 施肥,弄脏,弄糟
word.lx: He fell down and came home with his clothes all mucked up./r/n 他摔倒了，结果回家时衣服上全是泥。/r/n There was muck everywhere./r/n 到处都是淤泥。/r/n

word.name: mucous
word.lx: My coat was dirty with mucous things./r/n 我的衣服被粘的东西弄脏了。/r/n Oil is mucous./r/n 油是粘的。/r/n

word.name: mud
word.mean:
n. 泥,泥浆
v. 弄脏,使沾污泥
word.lx: Rain turns dust into mud./r/n 雨把尘土变成了软泥。/r/n The boy churned the earth into mud./r/n 这男孩把泥土拌成泥浆。/r/n

word.name: muddle
word.mean:
v. 混合,使微醉,使咬字不清晰
n. 困惑,混浊状态
word.lx: I muddled (up) the dates and arrived three days late./r/n 我把日期弄乱了, 所以迟到了三天./r/n You must be muddling me up with my twin brother./r/n 你一定是把我看成我的孪生兄弟了./r/n

word.name: muddy
word.mean:
a. 泥泞的,污的,肮脏的
v. 使...污浊,使...泥污
word.lx: They walked along a muddy road./r/n 他们沿着一条泥泞的道路走着。/r/n Labourers plodded home through the muddy fields./r/n 工人们穿过泥泞的田地走回家去。/r/n

word.name: muff
word.mean:
n. 笨拙的人
v. 弄糟
word.lx: That muff broke all of my dishes./r/n 那个笨蛋打碎了我所有的盘子。/r/n I had a chance to impress her with my efficiency and I muffed it up./r/n 我本来有机会使她了解我的办事效率，但是我错过了这个机会。/r/n

word.name: muffin
word.lx: Muffin is usually toasted and eaten hot with butter./r/n 松饼通常烤热加黄油吃。/r/n A type of muffin./r/n 一种小松糕/r/n

word.name: muffle
word.mean:
n. 低沉的声音,消音器,上唇
v. 围裹,抑制,发低沉的声音
word.lx: We muffled the oars to stop them splashing noisily./r/n 我们裹住船浆以减小溅水声。/r/n He walked out into the snow, heavily muffled up in a thick scarf and warm overcoat./r/n 他雪天出门，裹着厚厚的围巾，穿着暖和的大衣。/r/n

word.name: muffled
word.mean: a. (指声音)听不清的(因有物体相隔)
word.lx: Her voice sounded muffled up./r/n 她的声音听起来像是很压抑。/r/n The baby is well muffled up./r/n 婴儿给裹得好好的。/r/n

word.name: muffler
word.mean: n. 围巾,头巾,厚手套,消声器

word.name: mufti
word.lx: Soldiers wear mufti on leave, not uniform./r/n 士兵度假时穿便服, 不穿制服./r/n

word.name: mug
word.mean:
n. 杯,脸,苦读者
v. 扮鬼脸,攻击,苦读
word.lx: He asked me to make him a mug of coffee./r/n 他要我给他弄杯咖啡。/r/n This mug has a chip in it./r/n 这个缸子上有个缺口./r/n

word.name: mug shot
word.mean: n. 面部照片, 嫌疑犯照片

word.name: mugger
word.lx: The mugger thrust at his victim with a knife./r/n 抢劫者用刀子向受害人刺去。/r/n She fought up against the mugger and seized back her handbag./r/n 她勇敢地同行凶抢劫的歹徒搏斗，夺回了手袋。/r/n

word.name: mugwump
word.mean: 不拥护本党候选人之人

word.name: mulberry
word.lx: I like to eat purple mulberries./r/n 我喜欢吃紫色的桑葚。/r/n

word.name: mulct
word.lx: John was mulcted in￡500 by the court./r/n 约翰被法庭罚款500英镑。/r/n

word.name: mule
word.lx: Mules are a cross between a horse and an ass./r/n 骡子是马和驴的杂种。/r/n A mule is a hybrid of a donkey and a horse./r/n 骡子是公驴和母马交配而生的杂种。/r/n

word.name: mulish
word.mean: a. 骡的,执拗的,杂种的

word.name: multi
word.lx: In data communications, a method of controlling terminals on a multi drop or clustered data network where each terminal is interrogated in turn by the computer to determine whether it is ready to receive or transmit data. Data transmission is only initia

word.name: multicultural
word.mean: a. (融合或具有)多种文化的

word.name: multifarious
word.mean: a. 多种的,各式各样的

word.name: multilateral
word.mean: a. 多边的,多国参加的

word.name: multilingual
word.lx: India is a ,multilingual country./r/n 印度是使用多语种的国家./r/n

word.name: multinational
word.mean:
a. 多国的,多种国籍的
n. 多国籍公司,跨国公司
word.lx: Some people believe that the multinationals have too much power./r/n 有人认为跨国公司的权力太大了./r/n

word.name: multiple
word.mean:
a. 多样的,多重的
n. 倍数
word.lx: He is the person with multiple injuries./r/n 他就是那个多处受伤的人。/r/n A multiple crash can often be seen on that motorway./r/n 那条公路上的联环撞车事故很多。/r/n

word.name: multiplication
word.mean:
n. 乘法,增加,乘法表
[计算机] 乘法
word.lx: My son began to study multiplication when he was six./r/n 我儿子六岁的时候开始学习乘法。/r/n Our teacher used to drum our multiplication tables into us./r/n 我们老师过去老是让我们反覆背诵乘法表./r/n

word.name: multiply
word.mean:
/`mRltiplai/`mRltipli(adv)/
v. 繁殖,乘,增加
ad.多样地,多倍地,多重地.
word.lx: Rabbits multiply quickly./r/n 兔子繁殖很快。/r/n Four multiplied by seven is twenty-eight./r/n 7乘4等于28。/r/n

word.name: multiprocessor
word.lx: Simultaneous execution of two or more sequences of instructions by a multiprocessor./r/n 由一个多处理机系统同时执行两个或多个指令序列。/r/n

word.name: multitude
word.lx: The multitude may laugh at his music, but we know better./r/n 一般人也许会嘲笑他的音乐，但我们更了解它。/r/n A multitude of people gathered at the gate of the exhibition hall./r/n 大群人聚集在展览大厅的门口。/r/n

word.name: mumps
word.lx: I was told not go near Charles. He is sickening for mumps./r/n 别人告诉我不要走近查尔斯，他染上了流行性腮腺炎。/r/n Get the flu; got the mumps./r/n 患了流感；得了腮腺炎/r/n

word.name: mundane
word.mean: a. 现世的,世俗的,宇宙的

word.name: municipal
word.lx: I study in a municipal college./r/n 我在一所市立大学上学。/r/n She works in a municipal library./r/n 她在一所市立的图书馆工作。/r/n

word.name: murder
word.mean:
v.&n. 谋杀,凶杀
vt. 谋杀
word.lx: War is mass murder./r/n 战争是一场大屠杀。/r/n There have been several murders this year./r/n 今年发生了好几起谋杀案。/r/n

word.name: murderer
word.lx: The murderer was sentenced to death./r/n 杀人犯被判处死刑。/r/n The police have caught the murderer./r/n 警察已经抓获杀人凶手。/r/n

word.name: murmur
word.mean:
n. 低语,低声的怨言
v. 低语,低声而言
word.lx: There was a low murmur of conversation in the hall./r/n 大厅里有窃窃私语声。/r/n The murmur swelled into a roar./r/n 窃窃私语的声音变大形成一片喧哗。/r/n

word.name: muscle
word.lx: Some of my friends develop their arm muscles by playing tennis./r/n 我的一些朋友通过打网球锻炼他们胳膊的肌肉。/r/n The contraction of muscle is a reaction of the body./r/n 肌肉的收缩是人体的一种反应。/r/n

word.name: musculature
word.mean: n. 肌肉系统,肌肉组织

word.name: muse
word.mean: n. 创作灵感,缪斯(希腊神话中司文艺的女神)
word.lx: The young girl was lost in a muse./r/n 这女孩陷入了沉思。/r/n She lay musing for a while./r/n 她躺着沉思了一会儿。/r/n

word.name: museum
word.lx: He works in a history museum./r/n 他在历史博物馆工作。/r/n The museum displays the specimen of ancient Chinese porcelain./r/n 这个博物馆展出中国古瓷器标本。/r/n

word.name: mushroom
word.mean:
n. 草,蘑菇,暴发户
v. 迅速生长,迅速增加,采蘑菇
word.lx: Some mushrooms are poisonous./r/n 有些蘑菇有毒。/r/n I gathered many mushrooms after rain./r/n 雨后我采了很多蘑菇。/r/n

word.name: mushrooms
word.lx: Some mushrooms are poisonous./r/n 有些蘑菇有毒。/r/n Mildew and mushrooms are fungi./r/n 霉和蘑菇都是真菌。/r/n

word.name: music
word.lx: Men have been making music for thousands of years./r/n 人类创作音乐已有数千年历史。/r/n Now that I am free, I can enjoy music for a while./r/n 既然有空，我可以享受一下音乐。/r/n

word.name: musical
word.mean:
a. 音乐的
n. 音乐片
word.lx: The mother found that her son had a musical talent./r/n 母亲发现儿子有音乐天赋。/r/n A musical bell softly sounded somewhere in the passageway./r/n 走廊的某处响起轻柔悦耳的铃声。/r/n

word.name: musician
word.lx: That musician is very famous./r/n 那位音乐家非常有名。/r/n The musician made the legend into a beautiful ballad./r/n 这位音乐家把传说编成了一首美丽的民谣。/r/n

word.name: must
word.mean:
n. 必须,未发酵葡萄汁,绝对必要的事物
conj. 必须
word.lx: In England traffic must keep to the left./r/n 在英国，车辆必须靠左行驶。/r/n Something must be done about it./r/n 必须得想个办法。/r/n

word.name: mustard
word.mean: n. 芥末,芥菜,强烈的兴趣
word.lx: He put some mustard into the dish./r/n 他向菜里放了些芥末。/r/n This meat should be seasoned with salt and mustard./r/n 这肉里应该加些盐和芥末。/r/n

word.name: muster
word.mean:
n. 召集,集合,点阅
v. 召集,集合,应召
word.lx: The troops mustered on the hill./r/n 部队在小山上集合。/r/n He mustered all his courage to take part in the game./r/n 他鼓起全部的勇气参加比赛。/r/n

word.name: mutate
word.lx: The process by which some microbes differentiate or mutate./r/n 离异，分离变异一些微生物变异或经历突变的过程/r/n

word.name: mutation
word.mean: n. 变化,转变,母音变化
word.lx: Our teacher has mutation of sounds suddenly./r/n 我们的老师突然语音发生了变化。/r/n The mutations in plants caused by radiation have been found in experiments./r/n 放射线引起植物变异已在实验中被证实。/r/n

word.name: mutter
word.mean:
n. 喃喃低语
v. 喃喃自语,作低沉声,出怨言
word.lx: Actors often mutter to themselves when rehearsing their lines./r/n 演员背台词的时候经常自己嘀嘀咕咕。/r/n She kept on muttering to herself./r/n 她老是一个人嘀嘀咕咕。/r/n

word.name: mutton
word.lx: People like to have mutton in the winter./r/n 冬天人们喜欢吃羊肉。/r/n A leg of mutton, lamb, or veal for cooking./r/n 羊腿做烹调用的羊肉、小羊或小牛的一只腿/r/n

word.name: my
word.lx: My job is teaching English./r/n 我的职业是教英语。/r/n Please accept my apology./r/n 请接受我的道歉。/r/n

word.name: myriad
word.mean:
a. 无数的
n. 极大数量
word.lx: A myriad of thoughts passed through her mind./r/n 无数想法划过她的心头。/r/n The myriad fish in the ocean./r/n 海洋中数不胜数的鱼/r/n

word.name: myrtle
word.lx: The white flowers in the myrtle smell sweet./r/n 桃金娘上的白花闻起来很香。/r/n

word.name: myself
word.lx: I told myself to calm down./r/n 我告诫自己要冷静下来。/r/n They were waiting with assurance for me to discover the truth for myself./r/n 他们自信地等待我自己发现事实真相。/r/n

word.name: mysteries
word.mean: a. 古代的秘密宗教仪式
word.lx: We begin to plumb the mysteries of the universe./r/n 我们开始探索宇宙的奥秘。/r/n They spend their time philosophizingabout the mysteries of life./r/n 他们用很多时间探讨生命的奥秘./r/n

word.name: mysterious
word.lx: We must pay special attention to the mysterious stranger./r/n 我们必须对那个神秘的陌生人严加注意。/r/n There are many mysterious stories about the Egyptian pyramids./r/n 关于埃及金字塔有许多神秘的故事。/r/n

word.name: mysteriously
word.mean: ad. 神秘地,故弄玄虚地
word.lx: Mysteriously, there was no answer when I rang./r/n 真怪，我按了铃，但没人应。/r/n

word.name: mystery
word.lx: Why he went there is a mystery to me./r/n 他为什么到那里去，这对我来说是个谜。/r/n The place continues to fascinate visitors, cloaked in its mystery./r/n 这个地方笼罩在神秘气氛下，继续使游览者着迷。/r/n

word.name: mystification
word.mean: n. 故弄玄虚,迷惑,神秘化

word.name: myth
word.lx: A being in folklore or myth similar to one of these beings./r/n 巨人民间传说或神话中与以上的人种相似的人/r/n The rich uncle of whom he boasts is only a myth./r/n 他吹嘘的那个有钱的叔叔只是个乌有翁。/r/n

word.name: mythologist
word.mean: n. 神话学家,神话作家

word.name: mythology
word.lx: It is a mythology about the king./r/n 这是个关于国王的神话。/r/n The book is about the mythologies of primitive races./r/n 这本书是原始民族神话集。/r/n

word.name: myxomatosis
word.lx: The greater part of the rabbit population of Britain went under to the disease of myxomatosis./r/n 繁殖在不列颠的兔子，曾经由于粘液瘤病而死去一大半。/r/n

word.name: n
word.lx: He fought in the N African campaign during the last war./r/n 在上次战争中他在北非战役参战./r/n

word.name: nab
word.mean:
v. 逮捕,攫取
vt. 抓,获取,抓住,逮捕
word.lx: He was nabbed (by the police) for speeding./r/n 他超速行车被（警察）逮住了./r/n The thief was nabbed by the police./r/n 小偷被警察抓住了。/r/n

word.name: Nairobi
word.lx: He went straight to Lagos, without stopping in Nairobi./r/n 他径直前往拉各斯, 未在内罗毕停留./r/n

word.name: naive
word.lx: The politician made a naive decision./r/n 这个政治家做了一个幼稚的决定。/r/n He derides her naive attitude./r/n 他嘲弄她天真的态度。/r/n

word.name: naively
word.lx: Naively idealistic in the support of philanthropic or humanitarian causes./r/n 社会改良空想家的在支持善心或博爱事件方面幼稚的、理想化的/r/n

word.name: naked
word.mean: a. 裸体的,无装饰的,明白的
word.lx: These little boys swim naked in the river./r/n 这些小孩光着身子在河里游泳。/r/n Bacteria are too small to see with the naked eye./r/n 细菌太小，肉眼看不见。/r/n

word.name: naked eye
word.lx: Germs are invisible to the naked eye./r/n 细菌用肉眼看不见。/r/n Bacteria are too small to see with the naked eye./r/n 细菌太小，肉眼看不见。/r/n

word.name: name
word.mean:
n. 名字,名称,姓名
v. 命名,称呼,任命
[计算机] 名称
word.lx: She was named after her grandmother./r/n 她是根据她祖母的名字命名的。/r/n He is an artist of great name./r/n 他是个大名鼎鼎的艺术家。/r/n

word.name: named
word.mean:
v. 命名,称呼,任命
vbl. 命名,称呼,任命
word.lx: She was named after her grandmother./r/n 她是根据她祖母的名字命名的。/r/n Ms X has been named for the directorship/named as the new director./r/n 某女士已被提名任董事职务[任命为新董事]./r/n

word.name: name-drop
word.mean: v. 借名流权贵来抬高自己

word.name: nameless
word.mean: a. 无名的,匿名的,不可名状的
word.lx: He discovered some new and nameless plants./r/n 他发现了一些新的未命名的植物。/r/n He had received information from a nameless source in the government./r/n 他从政府中一未透露姓名者那里得到了消息./r/n

word.name: namely
word.lx: Only one person can do the job, namely you./r/n 只有一个人能做这项工作，那就是你。/r/n That is to say; namely./r/n 也就是说；就是/r/n

word.name: naming
word.lx: The act of naming./r/n 命名命名的行为/r/n An error in naming a person or place./r/n 叫错名称在叫某人名字或某一地名时犯的错误/r/n

word.name: Nancy
word.mean:
n. Ann 的昵称,女性化的男人
a. 女性化的,同性恋的
word.lx: Nancy gave birth to a baby boy last night./r/n 昨晚南希生了一个男孩。/r/n Nancy tried to get her report over however difficult it might be./r/n 这份报告再怎么难, 南希还是试着去完成。/r/n

word.name: nanny
word.lx: They both go out to work and have a nanny living in./r/n 他们俩都外出工作, 雇了个保姆看家./r/n Pearl had to choose between giving up her job or hiring a nanny./r/n 珀尔不得不在放弃工作和雇保姆之间作出选择。/r/n

word.name: nap
word.mean:
n. 小睡,打盹,细毛
v. 小睡,疏忽
word.lx: Father always takes a nap in the afternoon./r/n 父亲下午总要睡个午觉。/r/n The nap is worn./r/n 细毛磨损了。/r/n

word.name: Naples
word.lx: Does the steamer call at Naples?/r/n 这艘轮船在那不勒斯停吗？/r/n See Naples and die./r/n 看过那不勒斯死也瞑目。/r/n

word.name: Napoleon
word.mean: n. 拿破仑,一种法国金币
word.lx: Napoleon called himself Emperor of the French./r/n 拿破仑自称为法国皇帝。/r/n Napoleon was a great general./r/n 拿破仑是一位伟大的将领。/r/n

word.name: narcissism
word.mean: n. 自我陶醉, 自恋

word.name: narcissus
word.lx: She was like a narcissus trembling in the wind./r/n 她像一株在风中摇动的水仙。/r/n

word.name: narcotic
word.mean:
n. 麻醉药,镇静剂
a. 麻醉的,催眠的
word.lx: Narcotics are a major threat to health./r/n 毒品是危害健康的大敌。/r/n Stupor induced by a narcotic./r/n 麻醉性昏睡麻醉药引起的昏迷状态/r/n

word.name: narrate
word.mean:
v. 叙述
vt. 叙述(故事),描述
word.lx: Shall I narrate a strange experience of mine?/r/n 我把我的一次奇遇叙述一下好吗？/r/n

word.name: narration
word.lx: A very detailed account or report of something; a narration./r/n 描述对某事物极某详细的述说或报道；叙述/r/n

word.name: narrative
word.mean:
n. 叙述,故事
a. 叙述的,叙事的,故事体的
word.lx: Narrative makes up most of the book./r/n 这本书的大部分篇幅都是叙述性的。/r/n The writer had great skill in narrative./r/n 这位作家极擅长叙述。/r/n

word.name: narrator
word.mean: n. 叙述者(讲解员,播音员)
word.lx: He listens and waits for the narrator to explain more./r/n 他听著，等待讲的人进一步解释/r/n

word.name: narrow
word.mean:
n. 狭窄部份,海峡,隘路
a. 狭窄的,精密的,有限的
v. 变窄,使...狭窄
word.lx: The gate is too narrow for a car./r/n 大门太窄，汽车进不去。/r/n They planed to narrow the gap between imports and exports./r/n 他们计划缩小进出口的差额。/r/n

word.name: narrowly
word.mean: ad. 狭窄地(勉强地,严密地)
word.lx: The ball narrowly shaved his off stump./r/n 那个球紧贴著他的三柱门的外柱掠过。/r/n An arrow went past his car, narrowly missing his head./r/n 一支箭从他耳边掠过，差一点射中头部。/r/n

word.name: narrow-minded
word.mean: a. 气量小的, 小心眼的

word.name: narwhal
word.mean: n. (=narwal)一角鲸,独角鲸(一种齿鲸,雄性有一长牙)

word.name: NASA
word.mean: n. 美国国家航空和航天管理局

word.name: nasal
word.mean:
a. 鼻的,鼻声的,护鼻的
n. 鼻音,鼻音字
word.lx: He sprayed some nasal spray into the nose to make breathing easier./r/n 他往鼻子里喷了些鼻雾喷剂，让呼吸畅通些。/r/n He talked to me with a nasal voice./r/n 他带着鼻音和我说话。/r/n

word.name: nascent
word.mean: a. 发生中的,开始存在的,初期的

word.name: nasty
word.mean: a. 污秽的,下流的,险恶的,(气味等)另人作呕的,脾气不好的,恶意的,
word.lx: He is a person with a nasty mind./r/n 他是个思想肮脏的人。/r/n What a nasty man!/r/n 这个恶人!/r/n

word.name: nation
word.lx: Australia is an English speaking nation./r/n 澳大利亚是一个讲英语的国家。/r/n The nation was kept in subjection./r/n 这个民族已经沦为附庸。/r/n

word.name: national
word.mean:
a. 国家的,民族的
n. 国民
word.lx: Foreign nationals were asked to leave the country./r/n 外国侨民被要求离开该国。/r/n Our newspaper is a national newspaper./r/n 我们的报纸是全国性的报纸。/r/n

word.name: nationalism
word.mean: n. 民族主义,民族之特性
word.lx: Extreme nationalism, especially when opposed to international cooperation./r/n 极端民族主义，尤其是反对国际间合作时候/r/n Nationalism is a silly cock crowing on its own dunghill./r/n 民族主义，是在自己的小天地里自鸣得意的笨雄鸡。/r/n

word.name: nationalist
word.mean: n. 国家主义者,民族主义者
word.lx: A principality of the United Kingdom on the western peninsula of the island of Great Britain. Incorporated with England since the Act of Union(1536), Wales has maintained its own distinct culture and a strong nationalist sentiment. Cardiff is the capital

word.name: nationality
word.lx: There were diplomats of all nationalities in Geneva./r/n 日内瓦有世界各国的外交官。/r/n There are two main nationalities in our village./r/n 我们村子有两大民族。/r/n

word.name: nationalize
word.lx: Nationalize the steel industry./r/n 使钢铁工业国有化/r/n Our government will not nationalize or requisition investment any property of investor./r/n 我国政府不会把投资者的资金和财产收归国有或征用。/r/n

word.name: nationally
word.mean: ad. 以国民立场,举国一致,全国性

word.name: native
word.mean:
a. 本国的,本土的
n. 本地人
word.lx: He is a Beijing native./r/n 他是土生土长的北京人。/r/n This house was built of native stones./r/n 这间屋子是用当地的石头建的。/r/n

word.name: natural law
word.lx: We must follow the natural law./r/n 我们必须遵守自然法则。/r/n In violation of a natural law./r/n 不自然的违反一条自然规律的/r/n

word.name: natural selection
word.mean: n. [生]自然选择,物竞天择说

word.name: naturalism
word.lx: One who believes in and follows the tenets of naturalism./r/n 自然主义者信仰和追随自然主义信条的人/r/n

word.name: naturalist
word.mean: n. 自然主义者,博物学者
word.lx: He is a naturalist who studies animals and plants./r/n 他是个研究动植物的博物学家。/r/n The naturalist told us many stories about birds./r/n 博物学家给我们讲述了许多有关鸟儿的故事。/r/n

word.name: naturalistic
word.mean: a. 自然的,自然主义的,博物学的

word.name: naturalize
word.mean: vt. 使(外国人)入籍,归化
word.lx: English sporting terms have been naturalized in many languages./r/n 英语的运动术语已被多种语言采用./r/n

word.name: naught
word.lx: All his work came to naught when the fire destroyed the house he was building./r/n 大火烧毁了他正在建的房子，他的一切成绩化为乌有。/r/n His crime has gained him naught./r/n 他既犯了罪又一无所获./r/n

word.name: nausea
word.mean: n. 反胃,晕船,极度的不快
word.lx: Experiencing nausea; nauseated./r/n 感到反胃的；恶心的/r/n A feeling of unease or mild nausea caused especially by fearful anticipation./r/n 因害怕而发抖特别是由于可怕的预感而引起的不适感觉或轻度的恶心呕吐/r/n

word.name: nauseate
word.mean: v. 作呕,产生恶感,厌恶
word.lx: The idea of eating raw shellfish nauseates me./r/n 我一想到吃生贝就恶心./r/n

word.name: nauseous
word.lx: She felt/was nauseous during the sea crossing./r/n 她渡海时觉得恶心./r/n I feel a bit nauseous./r/n 我感到有点恶心。/r/n

word.name: nautical
word.mean: a. 海上的,航海的,船员的

word.name: Navajo
word.mean: n. 纳瓦霍人(美国最大的印第安部落)
word.lx: A usually earth-covered Navajo dwelling traditionally built with the entrance facing east./r/n 泥盖木屋那瓦和人居住的通常用泥土抹盖的房子，传统入口朝东/r/n

word.name: naval
word.lx: The naval officer asked him to stay away from the base./r/n 那位海军军官让他离开基地。/r/n In naval parlance, the left side of a ship is the port side."/r/n ＂用海军的用语来说，船的左边称为左舷。＂/r/n"

word.name: nave
word.mean: n. 本堂,中央部,车轮的中心部
word.lx: People gathered in the nave of the house./r/n 人们聚拢在房子的中间。/r/n If I made big money, you would nave a cut of the cake./r/n 我要是赚了大钱的话，少不了有你的一份。/r/n

word.name: navigable
word.mean:
a. 可航行的,可通船的,适于航行的
a. 容易环绕的.
word.lx: The canal is navigable all the year./r/n 这条运河全年可通航。/r/n With its engine broken, this great ship was not navigable./r/n 这条大船的马达坏了，无法再航行了。/r/n

word.name: navigation
word.lx: Navigation is difficult on this river because of the hidden rocks./r/n 因为河上有暗礁，所以在这条河上航行很困难。/r/n The compass is an instrument of navigation./r/n 罗盘是航行仪器。/r/n

word.name: navigational
word.lx: Not having proper navigational aids the pilot had been unaware of the changing conditions and had flown the plane right into the eye of the tropical storm./r/n 由于没有适当的导航援助，飞行员不了解周围气候的变化情况，将飞机直接飞入了热带飓风眼内。/r/n

word.name: navigator
word.lx: The man is a sixteenth Spanish navigator./r/n 那个人是十六世纪的航海家。/r/n They were a group of early navigators./r/n 他们是一群早期的航海家。/r/n

word.name: navy
word.lx: Britain has always had a large navy, called the Royal Navy./r/n 英国一直有一支强大的海军，称为皇家海军。/r/n The army, navy and airforce are all controlled by the Ministry of Defense./r/n 陆海空军皆由国防部控制。/r/n

word.name: naysayer
word.mean: n. 否定者,怀疑主义者

word.name: Nazi
word.mean:
n. 纳粹党人
a. 纳粹党的

word.name: nazism
word.lx: In Nazism, a Caucasian Gentile, especially of Nordic type./r/n 北欧人在纳粹用语中，指非犹太教徒的白种人，尤指北欧人/r/n

word.name: NBA
word.mean:
=Narrow-Band Allocation 窄带分配
美国职业篮球联赛

word.name: near
word.mean:
a. 近的,近亲的,近似的
ad. 接近,亲近,节俭
prep. 靠近,近乎
word.lx: Can you tell me the nearest way to the railway station?/r/n 你能告诉我去火车站最近的路吗？/r/n The job is at last nearing completion./r/n 这项工作终於快要完成了。/r/n

word.name: nearby
word.mean:
a. 附近的
ad. 在附近
prep. 在...附近
word.lx: He roped his horse on a nearby tree./r/n 他把马拴到附近的一棵树上。/r/n We/Our ears are becoming attuned to the noise of the new factory nearby./r/n 我们[我们的耳朵]逐渐适应了附近新工厂的噪声./r/n

word.name: nearly
word.lx: The train was nearly full./r/n 火车差不多满座了。/r/n The matter concerns him nearly./r/n 这事与他有密切关系。/r/n

word.name: nearsighted
word.lx: No doubt the committee will wave aside his nearsighted view./r/n 毫无疑问委员会对他的肤浅之见会置之不理的。/r/n

word.name: neat
word.mean: a. 整洁的,巧妙的,端正的
word.lx: He keeps his office neat and tidy./r/n 他保持办公室清洁整齐。/r/n The naughty boy played a neat trick./r/n 这个淘气的小男孩玩了一个巧妙的花招。/r/n

word.name: neatly
word.lx: He added up the list of figures and ruled it off neatly./r/n 他将那一栏数字加起来，之后很整洁地在下面划了一条直线。/r/n Rule out neatly any words which you do not wish the examiner to read./r/n 整洁地划上直线删除你不希望主考人批阅的任何话。/r/n

word.name: neatness
word.lx: Your room is a marvel of neatness and order./r/n 你的房间整洁得出奇./r/n My sister has been preaching at me again about my lack of neatness./r/n 我姐姐再次教训我，说我不知道整洁。/r/n

word.name: nebula
word.lx: You can see nebulae in the clear summer sky./r/n 在晴朗的夏夜可以看到天上的星云。/r/n

word.name: nebulae
word.lx: You can see nebulae in the clear summer sky./r/n 在晴朗的夏夜可以看到天上的星云。/r/n

word.name: nebulous
word.mean: a. 星云的,星云状的,朦胧的
word.lx: Nebulous assurances of future cooperation./r/n 对未来合作的含糊的保证/r/n

word.name: necessaries
word.lx: Give us the luxuries of life and we will dispense with necessaries./r/n 请赐给我们以人生的奢侈品吧，我们将会扔掉一切必需品的。/r/n Our income allows only the necessaries of life./r/n 我们的收入只能购买最起码的生活必需品。/r/n

word.name: necessarily
word.lx: Necessarily or demonstrably true; incontrovertible./r/n 必然真实的，可明确论证的；无可置疑的/r/n The constitution of a primitive society is not necessarily simple./r/n 原始社会的结构并不一定就是简单的。/r/n

word.name: necessary
word.mean:
a. 必需的,必要的
n. [pl.]必需品
word.lx: Is it necessary for me to attend the meeting?/r/n 我真的必须参加这个会议吗？/r/n The necessary outcome of a war is a fall in production./r/n 战争带来的必然结果就是生产力下降。/r/n

word.name: necessity
word.lx: The doctor asked us to call him during the night except in case of necessity./r/n 医生吩咐我们，除非必须，否则不要在夜里叫他。/r/n Necessity is the mother of invention./r/n 需要是发明之母。/r/n

word.name: neck
word.lx: The fans of the actress craned their necks to catch a glimpse of their idol./r/n 那位女演员的崇拜者们伸长了脖子想看一看他们崇拜的偶像。/r/n The two of them were necking on a park bench./r/n 他们俩在公园的长凳上拥抱亲吻。/r/n

word.name: necklace
word.lx: I lost my crystal necklace at the party./r/n 我在晚会上丢失了水晶项链。/r/n She wears a pearl necklace today./r/n 今天她戴了一条珍珠项链。/r/n

word.name: necktie
word.lx: Their boss told them that they must wear neckties in the company./r/n 他们的老板告诉他们在公司里必须打领带。/r/n A wide road; a wide necktie./r/n 宽阔的道路；宽大的领带/r/n

word.name: needle
word.mean:
n. 针
v. 用针缝
word.lx: The road looks beautiful covered by golden pine needles./r/n 这条路上铺满了金黄色的松针，看上去美极了。/r/n She tried to needle me into losing my temper./r/n 她想方设法惹我发脾气。/r/n

word.name: needles
word.lx: The road was covered with fir needles./r/n 这条路上铺满了冷杉针叶。/r/n The road looks beautiful covered by golden pine needles./r/n 这条路上铺满了金黄色的松针，看上去美极了。/r/n

word.name: needless
word.lx: Needless to say, he kept his promise./r/n 不用说，他信守了他的诺言。/r/n Needless to say, learning without thinking is useless./r/n 不用说，学而不思则罔。/r/n

word.name: needlessly
word.lx: You are fretting yourself needlessly./r/n 你是在不必要地折磨自己。/r/n New and often needlessly novel./r/n 新但无价值的新的但常是不必要的新奇的/r/n

word.name: needlework
word.lx: She is good at needlework./r/n 她擅长刺绣。/r/n This schoolgirl likes to do some needlework./r/n 这个女学生喜欢做针线活。/r/n

word.name: needs
word.mean:
n. 需要
v. 需要,必须
ad. 必须地,一定地
word.lx: The brain needs a continuous supply of blood./r/n 大脑需要不断地供血。/r/n A juggler needs great dexterity./r/n 玩杂耍的人必须手指非常灵巧。/r/n

word.name: needy
word.mean: a. 贫穷的,贫困的,生活艰苦的
