word.lx: The rich man gave much food to needy people./r/n 那位富翁给了穷人很多食物。/r/n There are many needy families in our village./r/n 我们村子有很多贫困家庭。/r/n

word.name: negate
word.lx: These facts negate your theory./r/n 这些事实否定了你的理论./r/n How can you negate God?/r/n 你怎麽能否定上帝的存在?/r/n

word.name: negation
word.lx: This theory is a negation of all traditional beliefs./r/n 这理论否定了一切传统信念./r/n Shaking the head is a sign of negation./r/n 摇头表示否认./r/n

word.name: negative
word.mean:
a. 否定的,负的,消极的
n. 底片,负数
vt. 否定

word.name: negligence
word.lx: The accident was due to her negligence./r/n 这次事故是因她疏忽所致。/r/n His negligence was nothing less than criminal./r/n 他的粗心大意无异於犯罪./r/n

word.name: negligent
word.mean: a. 疏忽的,粗心的,不在意的
word.lx: She was taxed with negligence/with having been negligent./r/n 她被指控疏忽职守./r/n I was negligent, I admit it./r/n 我太疏忽大意，这一点我承认。/r/n

word.name: negligible
word.mean: a. 可以忽略的,微不足道的
word.lx: The risks were represented as negligible./r/n 把这麽冒险的事说得微不足道./r/n The damage to my car is negligible./r/n 我的汽车的损坏是极轻微的。/r/n

word.name: negotiable
word.mean: a. 可磋商的,可转让的,可通行的
word.lx: The road is only negotiable in the dry season./r/n 这条道只有在旱季才能通行。/r/n He says his claim is not negotiable./r/n 他说他的要求是不容讨价还价的。/r/n

word.name: negotiation
word.lx: Negotiation of the slippery road was not easy./r/n 通过这条很滑的路并不容易。/r/n The contract is still under negotiation./r/n 这项合同仍在商谈之中。/r/n

word.name: negotiator
word.mean: n. 磋商者,交涉者,议定者
word.lx: The negotiator produce a new set of figures./r/n 谈判者们提出了一组新数字。/r/n A tough negotiator who had a number of cards up his sleeve./r/n 一个拥有很多锦囊妙计的难以对付的谈判者/r/n

word.name: Nehru
word.mean: n. (印度前总理,独立运动领袖)尼赫鲁

word.name: neighboring
word.mean: a. 附近的,邻近的,邻接的
word.lx: The Zulus conquered all the neighboring tribes./r/n 祖鲁人征服了所有邻近的部落。/r/n The country agreed to confederate with the neighboring country for mutual safety./r/n 这个国家同意为了共同的安全而与邻国结盟。/r/n

word.name: Neil
word.lx: Neil went in advance to say that we were coming./r/n 尼尔先走一步去告诉我们就来。/r/n Neil was convicted of fraud and is serving time in Wormwood Scrubs./r/n 尼尔被判有欺诈罪，现在温华华德·斯克监狱服刑。/r/n

word.name: neither
word.mean:
a. 皆不,两不
int. 两者都不
conj. 既非,既不
word.lx: Neither of my sisters drinks coffee./r/n 我的两个姐妹都不喝咖啡。/r/n Neither chair is comfortable./r/n 两把椅子坐起来都不舒服。/r/n

word.name: nemesis
word.mean: n. 报应,给与惩罚的人,天罚

word.name: neolithic
word.lx: A stone implement of the Neolithic Period./r/n 新石器新石器时代的石头器具/r/n

word.name: neophyte
word.lx: A neophyte at politics./r/n 初涉政界的人/r/n

word.name: nerveless
word.mean: a. 无力的,无力气的,松懈的
word.lx: The knife fell from her nerveless fingers./r/n 刀子从她那无力的手中落下./r/n

word.name: nerves
word.mean:
n. 神经紧张
vt. 鼓起勇气

word.name: nervous
word.lx: Are you nervous in the dark?/r/n 你在黑暗中感到害怕吗？/r/n The quality or state of being nervous./r/n 神经质神经紧张的性质或状态/r/n

word.name: nervous system
word.lx: The doctors shall operate on his central nervous system./r/n 医生们将要对他的中枢神经系统动手术。/r/n It is reported that this disease attacks the central nervous system./r/n 据报道说这种疾病破坏中枢神经系统。/r/n

word.name: nervously
word.mean:
ad. 神经质地
焦急地
word.lx: She was gnawing her nails nervously./r/n 她正在神经质地咬指甲。/r/n The surgeon was operating on my wife. I had to wait it out nervously sitting outside./r/n 医生正在给我妻子动手术，我不得不焦急地坐在外面等结果。/r/n

word.name: nervousness
word.mean: n. 神经紧张,情绪不安
word.lx: He laughed to cover (ie hide) his nervousness./r/n 他哈哈大笑以遮掩紧张的心情./r/n An outward show of confidence concealed his nervousness./r/n 他表现出很有信心的样子以掩盖内心的紧张./r/n

word.name: nervy
word.lx: But why is it doctor that I am always so nervy, tense and ready to jump on anybody.../r/n 可是大夫，为什么我总是感到神经质、紧张、爱发脾气……/r/n

word.name: nest
word.mean:
n. 巢,窝
v. 筑巢；嵌入
word.lx: The bird is building a nest of straw and twigs./r/n 这只鸟在用稻草和小树枝筑巢。/r/n The swallows nested under the eaves./r/n 燕子在屋檐下筑巢。/r/n

word.name: nested
word.lx: The redbreasts nested in the trees in our garden./r/n 知更鸟在我们庭院里的树上做巢。/r/n The swallows nested under the eaves./r/n 燕子在屋檐下筑巢。/r/n

word.name: nestle
word.mean: v. 舒适地坐定,挨靠,安置
word.lx: I nestled down on the big sofa and began to read novels./r/n 我舒适地靠在大沙发上，开始看小说。/r/n The egg nestled in the long grass./r/n 蛋隐藏在高草中./r/n

word.name: nestling
word.lx: The little girl is nestling closely up to her mother./r/n 小女孩紧紧地偎依在她妈妈身边。/r/n I nestled down on the big sofa and began to read novels./r/n 我舒适地靠在大沙发上，开始看小说。/r/n

word.name: net
word.mean:
n. 网,净利,实价
a. 净余的,纯粹的
v. 用网捕,撒网,净赚
word.lx: They netted the fruit trees to protect them from birds./r/n 他们用网覆盖住果树以使其免遭鸟害。/r/n The net weight of this jar of coffee is 180 grams./r/n 这瓶咖啡净重180克。/r/n

word.name: nether
word.mean: a. 下面的,下方的,下界的
word.lx: Her nether lip trembled./r/n 她的下唇颤抖着。/r/n

word.name: nettle
word.mean:
n. 荨麻
v. 以荨麻刺,激怒
word.lx: Nettle is a kind of common wild plant./r/n 荨麻是一种普通的野生植物。/r/n It was clear that my remarks nettled her./r/n 显然，我的言语激怒了她。/r/n

word.name: network
word.mean:
n. 网络
vt. 联络,交流
word.lx: Do you know the three USA television networks?/r/n 你知道美国的三大电视网吗？/r/n The company has a network of shops all over the country./r/n 这家公司有着遍布全国的商店网。/r/n

word.name: networking
word.mean: n. 一种互助性的网络体系,计算机网络的设计
word.lx: The company has a network of shops all over the country./r/n 这家公司有着遍布全国的商店网。/r/n Do you know the three USA television networks?/r/n 你知道美国的三大电视网吗？/r/n

word.name: neurosis
word.mean: n. 神经症,神经衰弱症

word.name: neurotic
word.mean:
a. 神经病的,神经过敏的
n. 神经病患者
word.lx: He is a bit neurotic, but his wife is a very stable person./r/n 他有点神经质，但他的妻子是一个非常稳重的人。/r/n Neurotic about punctuality./r/n 过敏性的神经官能症的/r/n

word.name: neutral
word.mean:
a. 中立的,中性的
n. 中立者
word.lx: When you start the engine, be sure the car is in neutral./r/n 你在发动引擎时，一定要让汽车处于空档。/r/n That country remained neutral in the war./r/n 那个国家在那场战争中保持中立。/r/n

word.name: neutrality
word.lx: Italy declared for neutrality in this war./r/n 在这次战争中意大利宣布中立。/r/n The ship was prized for violating neutrality./r/n 那艘船因违犯中立而被捕获。/r/n

word.name: neutralize
word.mean: v. 使中立,使成中立地带,中和

word.name: never
word.lx: I will never forget your kindness./r/n 我永远忘不了你的好意。/r/n We never flinch from difficulties./r/n 在困难面前我们决不退缩。/r/n

word.name: new
word.mean:
a. 新的
n. 新的东西
word.lx: She is new to this country./r/n 她对这个国家还不熟悉。/r/n They sell new and used furniture./r/n 他们出售新旧家具。/r/n

word.name: newborn
word.lx: She gazed at the newborn infant and smiled./r/n 她望着这个初生的婴儿笑了。/r/n The newborn is lovely./r/n 那个婴儿很可爱。/r/n

word.name: newly
word.mean: ad. 崭新,新改,以新方法

word.name: newsletter
word.mean: n. 时事通讯,时事分析,时事传报
word.lx: Company policy; a company newsletter./r/n 公司政策；公司业务通讯/r/n

word.name: newspaper
word.lx: I learned this piece of news from the newspaper this morning./r/n 我是今天早晨从报纸上知道这条消息的。/r/n We have subscribed to an evening newspaper./r/n 我们已经订阅了一份晚报。/r/n

word.name: nibble
word.mean:
n. 轻咬,啃
v. 一点点地咬,慢慢啃
vt. 咬
word.lx: Food and rent nibbled away at the money they had saved./r/n 花在食物和房租上的钱把他们的积蓄一点一点耗掉了。/r/n The mice have nibbled a hole in the cheese./r/n 老鼠在奶酪上啃出了一个洞。/r/n

word.name: nicely
word.mean: ad. 漂亮地,爽快地,恰好地
word.lx: This sport jacket will match those pants nicely./r/n 这件运动衫和那条短裤很相配。/r/n The beef is roasting nicely on the spit./r/n 这块牛肉在烤肉叉上烤得很好。/r/n

word.name: nicety
word.lx: He judged the distance to a nicety./r/n 他判断距离很正确。/r/n The manner in which she received him was calculated to a nicety to seem cool without being uncivil./r/n 她接待他时始终准确地把握好分寸，看似冷淡，却不失礼。/r/n

word.name: niche
word.mean:
n. 壁龛(适当的位置)
vt 放在适当的位置

word.name: nickel
word.mean:
n. 镍,镍币,五分镍币
v. 镀镍于
word.lx: Can you give me a dime for two nickels?/r/n 你能不能用两个五分镍币给我换一个一毛的镍币？/r/n Rick found a sure-enough nickel./r/n 里克发现一个纯正的镍币。/r/n

word.name: nickname
word.mean:
n. 绰号,昵称
v. 给...取绰号,叫错名字
word.lx: Jess is just my nickname - my real name is Jessica./r/n 杰西只是我的昵称，我的真名是杰西卡。/r/n They nicknamed him Lofty" because he was so tall./r/n 他们给他起了个绰号叫“高个儿”， 因为他身材很高。/r/n"

word.name: nicotine
word.lx: Smokers who inhale are likely to become addicted to nicotine./r/n 吸烟的人容易对尼古丁上瘾./r/n

word.name: niece
word.lx: My niece always clings to me whenever she is at my home./r/n 我侄女只要一到我家里就缠着我不放。/r/n You should take care of your niece for the sake of your sister./r/n 看在姐妹的份上, 你应该照顾你的侄女。/r/n

word.name: niggardly
word.mean: a. 吝啬的, 小气的
word.lx: Giving or spending money grudgingly; niggardly./r/n 吝啬的给予或花钱吝啬的；小气的/r/n

word.name: nigger
word.mean: n. 黑鬼(对黑人的蔑称)

word.name: niggling
word.lx: Stop niggling about every penny we spend./r/n 别再为我们花的每个小钱费心思了./r/n A pointless dispute over niggling details./r/n 在琐碎小事上的一次无礼争吵/r/n

word.name: nigh
word.mean:
a. 在附近的
ad. 在附近地
prep. 近于
word.lx: The time is drawn nigh./r/n 时间已近。/r/n The nigh horse./r/n 左边的那匹马/r/n

word.name: nightclub
word.lx: She earned her living by singing in a nightclub./r/n 她靠在夜总会唱歌谋生./r/n A restaurant or nightclub providing short programs of live entertainment./r/n 卡巴莱酒馆提供临时表演和短小节目的餐馆或夜总会/r/n

word.name: nightingale
word.lx: The nightingale sings sweetly at night./r/n 这只夜莺夜里唱得很好听。/r/n

word.name: nightly
word.mean:
a. 每夜的,夜间的
ad. 每夜
word.lx: My husband and I watch the nightly news broadcast everyday./r/n 我丈夫和我每天都看晚间新闻。/r/n Has appeared in two plays; appears on the nightly news./r/n 在两部戏中出场；在晚间新闻节目中露面/r/n

word.name: nightmare
word.lx: I have nightmares about falling off a cliff./r/n 我常做恶梦梦见从悬崖上摔下来。/r/n The nightmare gave her the creeps./r/n 那场恶梦使她不寒而栗。/r/n

word.name: nihilism
word.mean: n. 虚无主义,无政府主义

word.name: nil
word.lx: We can win the rubber 2 games to nil or 2-1./r/n 我们可以以2比零或2比1赢得这三局两胜的比赛./r/n The effect was nil./r/n 效果为零，效果全无。/r/n

word.name: Nile
word.lx: She go up the Nile as far as the first crocodile./r/n 她溯尼罗河之源而上，直至遇上第一条鳄鱼。/r/n The nile flood the field and deposit mud on them./r/n 尼罗河泛滥，在田野上淤积一层泥。/r/n

word.name: nimble
word.mean: a. 敏捷的,伶俐的,精明的
word.lx: She knitted a pair of mittens for me with her nimble fingers./r/n 她用灵巧的双手为我织了一副手套。/r/n Characterized by quickness, lightness, and ease of movement; nimble./r/n 敏捷的，灵活的具有迅速、轻巧和易动特点的；灵活的/r/n

word.name: nineteen
word.lx: There are nineteen students in my class./r/n 我班里有十九个学生。/r/n He was born in the nineties of the nineteen century./r/n 他生于十九世纪九十年代。/r/n

word.name: ninety
word.lx: He was born in the nineties of the nineteen century./r/n 他生于十九世纪九十年代。/r/n He must be going on for ninety./r/n 他准有九十岁了./r/n

word.name: nip
word.mean:
n. 捏,挟,小饮
v. 捏,冻伤,小饮
word.lx: I nipped my finger in the door./r/n 我的手指被门夹了一下。/r/n The dog nipped the postman on the leg./r/n 那只狗咬了邮递员的腿。/r/n

word.name: nipping
word.lx: The cold wind nipped at her face./r/n 刺骨的寒风吹在她的脸上。/r/n The dog was nipping at her ankles./r/n 那狗咬著她的脚腕子了./r/n

word.name: nipple
word.mean: n. 牛奶瓶的奶嘴,乳头

word.name: nippy
word.mean: a. 刺骨的,冷冽的,锐利的
word.lx: A nippy fall day./r/n 寒冷的秋天/r/n An exuberant, nippy puppy./r/n 一只精力旺盛，受咬人的小狗/r/n

word.name: nitinol
word.mean: n. [冶]镍钛诺(镍和钛的非磁性合金)

word.name: nitpicking
word.mean: a. 挑剔的,吹毛求疵的

word.name: nitrate
word.lx: The soil is enriched with nitrates./r/n 土壤里施了硝酸盐肥料。/r/n A cellulose nitrate used as a component of smokeless powder./r/n 火纤维素硝酸纤维素，用于无烟的炸药的组成物质/r/n

word.name: nitrous
word.lx: A gaseous anesthetic, such as nitrous oxide./r/n 气体麻醉剂一种气态的麻醉剂，如二氧化氮/r/n

word.name: nitrous oxide
word.lx: A gaseous anesthetic, such as nitrous oxide./r/n 气体麻醉剂一种气态的麻醉剂，如二氧化氮/r/n

word.name: no
word.mean:
n. 不,拒绝,否决票
a. 没有,不是,绝非
ad. 不
word.lx: No smoking./r/n 禁止吸烟。/r/n He has no money./r/n 他没有钱。/r/n

word.name: nobility
word.mean: n. 贵族,高尚,贵族阶级
word.lx: He is remembered for the nobility of his character./r/n 他因品质高尚而被人怀念。/r/n The nobility usually resist social changes./r/n 贵族通常反对社会变革。/r/n

word.name: noble
word.mean:
a. 高尚的,宏伟的,贵族的,高贵的
n. 贵族
word.lx: He is a man of noble birth./r/n 他出身贵族。/r/n The castle or house of a medieval monarch or noble./r/n 宅邸中世纪王公、贵族的城堡或房宇/r/n

word.name: nod
word.mean:
n. 点头,打盹,摆动
v. 点头,打盹,使...摆动
word.lx: She greeted us with a nod of the head./r/n 她向我们点点头打招呼。/r/n He nodded in agreement with me./r/n 他点头表示同意我的意见。/r/n

word.name: node
word.mean:
n. 节,结节,瘤
[计算机] 节点
word.lx: In a network, a route between any two nodes./r/n 网络中任意两个网点之间的一段路由。/r/n

word.name: nomenclature
word.mean: n. 命名法,专门语,术语

word.name: nominal
word.mean: a. 名义上的,有名无实的
word.lx: The chairman is only the nominal ruler of the country./r/n 主席只是那个国家名义上的统治者。/r/n She charged only a nominal fee for her work./r/n 她为所做的工作只收取象征性的费用。/r/n

word.name: nominate
word.lx: I nominate her to present us at the meeting./r/n 我推荐她代表我们出席会议。/r/n She had been nominated as candidate for the presidency./r/n 她已被提名为总统候选人。/r/n

word.name: nomination
word.lx: His nomination as chief executive was approved by the board./r/n 他被提名为行政总裁的事被董事会批准了。/r/n Who will get the nomination for president?/r/n 谁将获得总统提名？/r/n

word.name: nominee
word.mean: n. 被提名的人,名义人

word.name: none
word.mean:
ad. 一点也不
prep. 没人,毫无
pron. 没有人,没有任何东西
word.lx: None of the money is mine./r/n 这些钱中没有一文是我的。/r/n My car is none the worse for the accident./r/n 我的汽车遇到事故，但毫无损坏。/r/n

word.name: nonetheless
word.mean:
ad. 尽管如此(仍然)
conj. 尽管如此(仍然)

word.name: nonsense
word.mean: n. 无意义的事,荒谬的言行,荒唐
word.lx: What he said is nonsense./r/n 他的话纯粹是胡说。/r/n It was sheer nonsense to trust them./r/n 相信他们纯粹是胡闹。/r/n

word.name: noodle
word.lx: Chinese food is often served with rice or noodles./r/n 中餐常有米饭或面条./r/n He went to the piano and noodle around until the tune came back to him./r/n 他走到钢琴边随意弹奏起来，一直到他想起那曲子。/r/n

word.name: noon
word.lx: The visitor left a little before noon./r/n 来访者在中午前一会儿离开了。/r/n We reckon to arrive in Delhi at noon./r/n 我们估计正午抵达德里./r/n

word.name: nor
word.mean:
conj.&ad. 也不,也没有
或非"

word.name: norm
word.lx: Holding the view that the ego is the center, object, and norm of all experience./r/n 自我中心的认为自我是所有的中心、对象和经验的标准的/r/n Criminal behaviour seem to be the norm in this neighbourhood./r/n 犯罪行为似乎是这一带的正常现象。/r/n

word.name: normal
word.mean:
a. 正常的,正规的
n. 正常状态
word.lx: Everything is absolutely normal./r/n 一切完全正常。/r/n The collapse of the strike enabled the company to resume normal bus services./r/n 罢工的失败使公司恢复了正常的公共汽车营业。/r/n

word.name: normalization
word.mean: n. 常态化,正常化,正规化

word.name: north
word.mean:
a. 北,北方(的)
ad. 向北方
n. 北,北方

word.name: northeast
word.mean:
n. 东北
a. 东北的,向东北的,来自东北的
ad. 向东北,来自东北
word.lx: The northeast wind was blowing hard at that time./r/n 那时候东北风刮得正紧。/r/n His house is in the northeast of this city./r/n 他的家在这个城市的东北部。/r/n

word.name: northern
word.lx: In the northern hemisphere, spring is in March and April./r/n 在北半球，春季是三月和四月。/r/n The Confederacy was defeated by the northern states./r/n 南部邦联被北方打败了。/r/n

word.name: northward
word.mean:
n. 北方,北
a. 向北的
ad. 向北的

word.name: northwards
word.mean:
a. 向北的
ad. 向北
word.lx: The coast sweeps (away) northwards in a wide curve./r/n 海岸呈一大弧形向北伸展./r/n The escapee ran quickly northward and cut back to the original place./r/n 逃犯迅速向北跑去，然后又突然回到原地。/r/n

word.name: northwest
word.mean:
n. 西北,西北方
a. 西北的,在西北的,来自西北的
ad. 向西北
word.lx: The city is located in the northwest part of Canada./r/n 这座城市位于加拿大的西北部。/r/n The tourists drove northwest./r/n 游客们开车向西北而去。/r/n

word.name: Norwegian
word.mean:
n. 挪威人,挪威语
a. 挪威的,挪威人的,挪威语的
word.lx: The Norwegians live in a comparatively cold zone./r/n 挪威人生活在比较寒冷的地区。/r/n Do you know Norwegian?/r/n 你懂挪威语吗？/r/n

word.name: nose
word.mean:
n. 鼻子,突出部分,嗅觉
v. 嗅到
word.lx: Many dogs have a good nose./r/n 多数狗嗅觉都很灵。/r/n The horse won by a nose./r/n 那匹马以微弱优势险胜。/r/n

word.name: nostalgia
word.mean: n. 乡愁,向往过去,怀旧之情
word.lx: Her work is pervaded by nostalgia for a past age./r/n 她的作品充满了怀旧之情。/r/n The sight inspired him with nostalgia./r/n 这景象激起了他的怀旧之情。/r/n

word.name: nostril
word.lx: He dislikes his wide nostrils./r/n 他不喜欢自己的宽大的鼻孔。/r/n

word.name: not
word.lx: Not everyone likes this book./r/n 并不是每个人都喜欢这本书。/r/n They will not agree./r/n 他们不会同意。/r/n

word.name: notable
word.mean:
a. 显著的,著名的
n. 名人
word.lx: He is a notable artist./r/n 他是一位著名的艺术家。/r/n The difference contrast is notable./r/n 差别对比是显著的。/r/n

word.name: notably
word.mean: ad. 显著地(著名地,值得注意地,格外,特别是)

word.name: notation
word.mean:
n. 记号法,表示法,注释
[计算机] 记法

word.name: notch
word.mean:
n. 刻痕,等级,峡谷
v. 刻凹痕,用刻痕计算,得分
word.lx: I cut a notch in a stick./r/n 我在一根棍子上刻了一个V字形。/r/n With this performance, she has notched up her third championship title./r/n 她因这一成绩而获得第三个冠军称号。/r/n

word.name: note
word.mean:
n. 笔记,注解,备忘录
v. 记录,注解,注意
n. 票据,便条,纸币
word.lx: Let me note down your address and telephone number./r/n 让我记下你的地址和电话号码。/r/n Please note my words./r/n 请注意我的话。/r/n

word.name: notebook
word.lx: Judy bent her face low over the notebook./r/n 朱迪把脸凑近笔记本。/r/n She extracted a small notebook from her handbag./r/n 她从手提包里取出了一个小笔记本。/r/n

word.name: noted
word.lx: This city is noted for its various bridges./r/n 这个城市因为各种桥梁而著称。/r/n Your suggestion has been duly noted./r/n 你的建议已受到注意。/r/n

word.name: notes
word.mean: Lotus公司出品的群件系列软件
word.lx: He pulled a wad of 10 notes out of his pocket./r/n 他从衣袋里掏出一沓面额10英镑的钱./r/n The speaker had a sheaf of notes on the desk in front of him./r/n 演讲者在他面前的桌子上放着一叠笔记。/r/n

word.name: nothing
word.mean:
ad. 毫不
n. 微不足道的人或事
pron. 什么也没有
word.lx: Nothing ever happens in this town./r/n 这小镇上什么事也没发生过。/r/n It has nothing to do with you./r/n 这与你无关。/r/n

word.name: notice
word.mean:
n. 注意,布告,通知
v. 注意,通知,留心
word.lx: Her appearance attracted my notice./r/n 她的外表引起了我的注意。/r/n Did you notice anything peculiar?/r/n 你注意到有什么异常的事吗？/r/n

word.name: notification
word.mean:
n. 通知,通告,告示
[计算机] 通知
word.lx: There have been no more notifications of cholera cases in the last week./r/n 上星期已没有霍乱病例的报告./r/n

word.name: notorious
word.lx: Hitler is a notorious killer./r/n 希特勒是一个臭名昭著的刽子手。/r/n The notorious thief will be put up for trial next week./r/n 那个臭名昭著的偷窃犯将于下周出庭受审。/r/n

word.name: notwithstanding
word.mean:
ad. 虽然,尽管
prep. 纵使
conj. 虽然
word.lx: He tried to prevent the marriage but it still took place notwithstanding./r/n 虽然他竭力阻止这桩婚姻，但还是成了事实。/r/n Notwithstanding her naughtiness, I love my little girl./r/n 尽管我的小姑娘很淘气，我还是很爱她。/r/n

word.name: nought
word.lx: Put two noughts after a seven to make seven hundred./r/n 在7后面加两个零成为700。/r/n The Greeks did nought, but play the fools and lie./r/n 希腊人一事无成，仅仅在愚弄和欺骗。/r/n

word.name: noun
word.lx: There are many nouns in a dictionary./r/n 字典里有很多名词。/r/n The function of an adjective is to describe or add to the meaning of a noun./r/n 形容词的作用是描述或增加名词的意思。/r/n

word.name: nourish
word.lx: Milk is all we need to nourish a small baby./r/n 我们供给婴儿营养只需喂奶就够了。/r/n She have nourish the dream of becoming a movie star./r/n 她曾怀有成为电影明星的梦想。/r/n

word.name: nourishment
word.lx: The patient took no nourishment all day until dinner./r/n 这个病人晚饭前什么东西都没吃。/r/n A source of nourishment, especially a nourishing ingredient in a food./r/n 营养品，滋养物营养的来源，尤指食物中的营养成分/r/n

word.name: novel
word.mean:
a. 新奇的
n. 小说
word.lx: We are supposed to dress up as movie characters for the party, what a novel idea!/r/n 我们在晚会上要装扮得像电影中的角色，这是一个多么新奇的主意啊！/r/n I like reading novels in my spare time./r/n 我喜欢闲暇时读小说。/r/n

word.name: novelist
word.lx: I dreamed of becoming a novelist./r/n 我梦想成为一个小说家。/r/n The novelist had issued many saga novels./r/n 那个小说家已经发表了很多长篇小说。/r/n

word.name: novelty
word.mean: n. 新奇,新鲜,新奇的事物
word.lx: The novelty of his surroundings soon wore off./r/n 他对环境的新奇感不久就淡薄了。/r/n The author seems to strain after novelty./r/n 作者似乎在力图标新立异。/r/n

word.name: November
word.lx: This office will open in November./r/n 这个事务所将在十一月开业。/r/n He conked out in November with pleurisy./r/n 他患肋膜炎于十一月份死去。/r/n

word.name: now
word.mean:
n. 现在,此刻
ad. 现在,立刻
conj. 既然
=National Organization of Women 全国妇女组织
word.lx: He was at home just now./r/n 他刚才在家。/r/n He is writing a letter now./r/n 他现在正在写信。/r/n

word.name: nowadays
word.mean:
ad. 现今,现在
n. 现今,当今
word.lx: Nowadays, the poor student has become a rich man./r/n 如今，那个穷学生成了富人。/r/n Phonograph is no longer used nowadays./r/n 留声机现在已不再使用了。/r/n

word.name: nowhere
word.mean:
ad. 任何地方都不
n. 不知道的地方,无处
word.lx: That kind of talk will get you nowhere./r/n 说那种话对你没好处。/r/n The book was nowhere to be found./r/n 这本书无处可寻。/r/n

word.name: noxious
word.lx: Noxious chemical wastes./r/n 有毒化学废弃物/r/n Chemicals that produce a noxious vapor when mixed./r/n 化学物质混合后会放出有毒气体/r/n

word.name: nuance
word.mean: n. 配色,色调,细微差别
word.lx: A rich artistic performance, full of nuance./r/n 一场意味深长的艺术表演充满了微妙之处/r/n

word.name: nuclear
word.mean: a. 原子核的,原子能的

word.name: nuisance
word.mean: n. 讨厌的东西,讨厌的人
word.lx: You are a confounded nuisance; stop pestering me./r/n 你这个可恶的东西，别再缠着我了。/r/n The noise was so loud that it was a nuisance to the neighbors./r/n 那声音大得让邻居讨厌。/r/n

word.name: null
word.mean:
a. 无效力的,无效的,无价值的
n. 零
[计算机] 空

word.name: numb
word.mean:
a. 麻木的,失去知觉的
v. 使...麻木,使...昏迷,使...失去知觉
word.lx: The shock left me numb./r/n 我惊呆了。/r/n His leg was numbed by the intense pain./r/n 他的腿因剧痛而麻木。/r/n

word.name: number
word.mean:
n. 号码,数字
v. 编号,加号码,总计
vi. 总计
vt. 编号
word.lx: The students of our department numbered in the hundreds./r/n 我们系的学生总共有几百人。/r/n The number of your finger is ten./r/n 你双手手指的总数是10。/r/n

word.name: numeral
word.mean:
n. 数字,数
a. 数字的,表示数字的
word.lx: I asked a little boy, how many numerals can you count?"/r/n 我问一个小孩：“你能数多少个数字?”/r/n

word.name: numerical
word.mean: a. 数字的,用数字表示的

word.name: numerous
word.lx: That kind of bird has become more numerous around here lately./r/n 近来在附近一带那种鸟越来越多了。/r/n The Oxford has received numerous endowments./r/n 牛津获得了许多捐款。/r/n

word.name: nun
word.lx: The nuns live in the convent./r/n 修女们住在修道院。/r/n Any woman in the world, even a nun, would rather lose her virtue than her reputation./r/n 世间的女性，甚至尼姑，都情愿失掉贞操也不愿失掉声誉。/r/n

word.name: nurse
word.mean:
n. 护士,褓姆,奶妈
v. 看护,照顾,栽培
word.lx: My daughter is a nurse./r/n 我女儿是一名护士。/r/n She spends her spare time nursing her old mother./r/n 她的业余时间都花在照顾她年老的母亲上。/r/n

word.name: nurture
word.mean:
n. 养育,养成,教育
v. 养育,给与营养物,教养
word.lx: He wants to take the nurture of that delicate child./r/n 他想去照料那个纤弱的孩子。/r/n The child got his nurture from his loving parents./r/n 这个孩子的教育来自他慈爱的双亲。/r/n

word.name: nut
word.mean:
n. 坚果,螺母, 螺帽,难对付的人(事)
vi. 采坚果
word.lx: I am a Clark Gable nut: I have seen all his films./r/n 我是克拉克·盖博的影迷，我看过他演的所有影片。/r/n Cashew nuts and walnuts are both nuts./r/n 腰果和核桃都是坚果。/r/n

word.name: nutrient
word.mean:
a. 营养的,滋养的
n. 营养物,营养品
word.lx: Plants absorb minerals and other nutrients from the soil./r/n 植物从泥土中吸收矿物质和其他养料。/r/n Maybe these nutrients are helpful to your health./r/n 或许这些营养品对你的健康有帮助。/r/n

word.name: nutrition
word.lx: This food provides all the nutrition your dog needs./r/n 本食品含有狗所必须的一切营养。/r/n Our bodies need adequate nutrition./r/n 我们的身体需要充足的营养。/r/n

word.name: nylon
word.lx: This coat is made of nylon./r/n 这件衣服是尼龙的。/r/n Is this garment made of pure wool, or of wool mixed with nylon?/r/n 这件衣服是纯羊毛的，还是羊毛与尼龙混纺的 ？/r/n

word.name: oak
word.mean:
n. 橡树,橡木
a. 橡木制的
word.lx: The door is made of oak./r/n 这门是橡木做的。/r/n There are many acorns on the oak tree./r/n 这棵橡树上有很多橡子。/r/n

word.name: oar
word.mean:
n. 桨,橹
v. 划(行)
word.lx: Many people tried to get their oars in./r/n 许多人都想插一手。/r/n The blade of an oar or paddle./r/n 桨面桨或橹的叶片/r/n

word.name: oasis
word.lx: The caravan stopped for the night at an oasis./r/n 旅行队在沙漠中的绿洲停下来过夜。/r/n Her bedroom is an oasis of calm in the noisy house./r/n 她的卧室是这座嘈杂房屋中一个难得的安静之处。/r/n

word.name: oath
word.lx: Repeat the oath after me./r/n 请跟着我宣誓。/r/n The judge reminded the witness that she was under oath./r/n 法官提醒那个证人她已经宣过誓了。/r/n

word.name: obedience
word.lx: Obedience to order is very important in an army./r/n 服从命令在军队中是很重要的。/r/n The sergeant expects obedience from his men/that his men will obey him/his men to obey him./r/n 中士要士兵服从他的命令./r/n

word.name: obesity
word.lx: Obesity is a problem for many people in western countries./r/n 西方国家很多人都有过度肥胖的问题./r/n The branch of medicine that deals with the causes, prevention, and treatment of obesity./r/n 肥胖症学研究肥胖的原因、预防和治疗的医学的分支/r/n

word.name: obey
word.lx: Soldiers are expected to obey their orders without question./r/n 军人应当绝对服从命令。/r/n We should obey the law./r/n 我们应当遵守法律。/r/n

word.name: object
word.mean:
n. 物,物体,目标,宾语
v. 反对
word.lx: Some people objected that the new tax law was unfair./r/n 一些人反对说，新税法不公平。/r/n Various objects were on the table./r/n 桌子上摆着各种各样的物体。/r/n

word.name: objection
word.lx: There is no objection to your opening the window./r/n 你开窗没有什么不可以的。/r/n The chief objection to this book is its great length./r/n 这本书的主要缺点是过于冗长。/r/n

word.name: objective
word.mean:
a. 客观的
n. 目标,目的
word.lx: Try to be more objective about it./r/n 尽量更客观地对待此事吧。/r/n We have succeeded in our main objectives./r/n 我们已经成功地达到了主要目标。/r/n

word.name: obligation
word.lx: The company has to fulfill the terms of its obligation./r/n 这个公司必须履行合同条款。/r/n Damaging the goods puts you under an obligation to buy them./r/n 你损坏了这些商品，你就得都买下来。/r/n

word.name: obligatory
word.mean: a. 义不容辞的,义务的,必须的
word.lx: Be not a visit to Mr. George obligatory?/r/n 是不是必须我拜访乔治先生？/r/n It is obligatory upon us to protect the world from nuclear war./r/n 保护世界免於核子战争是我们的义务。/r/n

word.name: oblique
word.mean:
a. 间接的,斜的
vi. 倾斜
word.lx: He drew an oblique line on paper./r/n 他在纸上划了一条斜线。/r/n The tendency to grow at an oblique or horizontal angle. Used of roots, stems, or branches./r/n 斜向性向倾斜或与水平成角度的方向生长的倾向。用于植物的根、茎或枝/r/n

word.name: obliterate
word.lx: The criminal obliterated all fingerprints./r/n 罪犯擦掉全部指印。/r/n The view was obliterated by the fog./r/n 景色被浓雾遮住了。/r/n

word.name: oblong
word.mean:
n. 长方形(椭圆形)
a. 长方形的(椭圆形的)

word.name: obnoxious
word.mean: a. 可憎的,不愉快的,讨厌的
word.lx: I hate his obnoxious behavior./r/n 我恨他那讨厌的品行。/r/n He is the most obnoxious man I know./r/n 他是我认识的最可憎的人。/r/n

word.name: obscene
word.mean: a. 淫秽的, 猥亵的
word.lx: She got an obscene phone call yesterday./r/n 她昨天接到一个下流的电话。/r/n There are much obscene languages in this book./r/n 这本书中有很多淫秽的语言。/r/n

word.name: obscure
word.mean:
a. 微暗的,难解的,不著名的
v. 使...阴暗,隐藏,使...含糊
word.lx: The path grew more obscure in the fading light./r/n 小径在渐渐消失的光线下变得更暗了。/r/n The poem is obscure to those unlearned in the classics./r/n 这首诗在不懂古典诗作的人看来是费解的。/r/n

word.name: observance
word.lx: The worker was praised for his observance of the rules./r/n 这个工人因为严格遵守规则而受到了表扬。/r/n An act of religious observance or prayer, especially when private./r/n 祈祷宗教仪式的活动或祷告的行为，尤指秘密的进行的/r/n

word.name: observation
word.lx: The thief escaped observation./r/n 小偷未被人注意。/r/n He was taken into hospital for observation./r/n 他被送进医院观察。/r/n

word.name: observatory
word.mean: n. 天文台,气象台,了望台

word.name: observe
word.lx: I observed him entering the bank with a gun./r/n 我看到他带着枪进了银行。/r/n The police have been observing his movements./r/n 警方一直监视着他的一举一动。/r/n

word.name: observer
word.lx: They sent her there as an observer./r/n 他们派她去那做观察员。/r/n The driver is a poor observer of speed restrictions./r/n 这个司机是个不遵守速度限制的人。/r/n

word.name: obsess
word.lx: The fear of death obsessed her throughout her old age./r/n 她晚年一直受著死亡恐惧的困扰./r/n

word.name: obsession
word.mean:
n.[U]痴迷；困扰,成见
[C]使人痴迷的的人（或物）
word.lx: Her commitment to a great cause degenerated from a crusade into an obsession./r/n 她致力於一伟大事业, 但其崇高的奋斗精神已变质成为偏执的狂热./r/n Caused or conditioned by compulsion or obsession./r/n 强迫的由强迫或压制所引起或制约的/r/n

word.name: obsessive
word.mean: a. 强迫性的, 分神的

word.name: obsolete
word.lx: An obsolete locomotive./r/n 一个过时的火车机车/r/n The army plans to phase out the equipment as it becomes obsolete./r/n 军队计划淘汰这些设备，因为它们已经报废了。/r/n

word.name: obstetrician
word.lx: Her obstetrician could not be present at the birth./r/n 产科医生不能前来为她接生./r/n The obstetrician delivered the child./r/n 产科医生替这个孩子接生。/r/n

word.name: obstetrics
word.lx: The science of childbirth; midwifery or obstetrics./r/n 产科学分娩的科学；助产学或产科学/r/n A physician who specializes in obstetrics./r/n 产科医生一个专攻产科医学的医生/r/n

word.name: obstinacy
word.lx: Sheer obstinacy prevented her from apologizing./r/n 她固执得就是不道歉。/r/n His obstinacy was irritating./r/n 他那顽固的劲真气人。/r/n

word.name: obstruct
word.lx: Tall trees obstructed his view of the road./r/n 有大树遮挡着，他看不见道路。/r/n He was charged obstructing the highway./r/n 他因阻碍公路交通而受控告。/r/n

word.name: obstruction
word.lx: Your car is causing an obstruction./r/n 你的汽车挡道了。/r/n He was found guilty of obstruction./r/n 他被判阻挡犯规。/r/n

word.name: obtain
word.mean:
vt. 获得,得到
vi. 通用,流行,存在
word.lx: Further information can be obtained from our head office./r/n 详细的资料可从我们的总部得到。/r/n These conditions no longer obtain./r/n 这些条件已不复存在了。/r/n

word.name: obtainable
word.mean: a. 能获得的(可得到的,能达到的)
word.lx: Are his records still obtainable?/r/n 他的唱片还能买到吗?/r/n The flowers are no longer obtainable./r/n 那花再也得不到了。/r/n

word.name: obvious
word.mean: a. 明显的,显而易见的
word.lx: The reformation of criminals has produced an obvious result./r/n 对罪犯的改造有了明显的效果。/r/n The merits of the scheme are quite obvious./r/n 该计画的可取之处是相当明显的./r/n

word.name: obviously
word.lx: Obviously, she needs help./r/n 她显然需要帮助。/r/n He was obviously drunk./r/n 他显然是醉了。/r/n

word.name: occasion
word.mean:
n. 场合,机会,理由
v. 致使,惹起,引起
word.lx: I only wear a tie on special occasions./r/n 我只在特殊场合才打领带。/r/n There was no occasion to be so rude./r/n 没有理由这样粗鲁。/r/n

word.name: occasional
word.lx: I only smoke an occasional cigar./r/n 我只是偶然抽一支雪茄。/r/n He is only an occasional workman./r/n 他只是个临时雇工。/r/n

word.name: occidental
word.mean:
n. 西洋人,西方人
a. 西洋的,西方的
word.lx: The characteristic traits or customs of Occidental peoples./r/n 西洋风味西方人习惯或品质性格特征/r/n A native or inhabitant of an Occidental country; a westerner./r/n 西方人在西方国家居住的当地人或居住者/r/n

word.name: occlude
word.mean: v. 使闭塞,封闭,关闭,逐出

word.name: occupy
word.lx: Reading occupies most of my free time./r/n 阅读占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。/r/n The enemy occupied the town./r/n 敌人占据了这个城镇。/r/n

word.name: occurrence
word.lx: An unforeseen event that disrupts the normal course of things; an inopportune occurrence./r/n 意外扰乱事物正常进程的意外事件；不凑巧发生之事/r/n It is more a made-up story than a real occurrence./r/n 那是杜撰的故事，而不是真实发生的事情。/r/n

word.name: OCR
word.mean: 光字符阅读器,光字符识别

word.name: October
word.lx: October first is the National Day of China./r/n 十月一日是中国的国庆节。/r/n The hot weather extended into October./r/n 炎热天气一直持续到十月。/r/n

word.name: odor
word.lx: My room is filled with the odor of roses./r/n 我的房间里充满了玫瑰花的香味。/r/n What he had done put him in better odor./r/n 他的所作所为使他的名声得到改善。/r/n

word.name: odour
word.lx: What he had done put him in better odour./r/n 他的所作所为使他的名声得到改善。/r/n My room is filled with the odour of roses./r/n 我的房间里充满了玫瑰花的香味。/r/n

word.name: odyssey
word.lx: A drug mentioned in the Odyssey as a remedy for grief./r/n 忘忧药奥德赛中提到的一种药，作为一种医治忧愁的药剂/r/n

word.name: of
word.lx: Many of the students came from other countries./r/n 学生中许多人来自其他国家。/r/n I have heard of him./r/n 我听说过他。/r/n

word.name: off
word.mean:
a. 远的,休假的,空闲的
ad. 走开,出发,隔断
prep. 离开,脱落,在...之外
word.lx: Please turn the light off before leaving the room./r/n 离开房间前，请把灯关掉。/r/n We went to the station to see her off./r/n 我们去车站为她送行。/r/n

word.name: offence
word.mean: n. 过错(攻击,令人讨厌的事物)
word.lx: One cannot hear such a remark without taking offence./r/n 听了这样的话，谁都会生气的。/r/n They were arrested for drug offences./r/n 他们因吸毒罪而被逮捕。/r/n

word.name: offense
word.lx: The best defense is offense./r/n 先下手为强/以攻为守。/r/n A pecuniary offense./r/n 需处以罚金的犯罪行为/r/n

word.name: offensive
word.mean: a. 令人不快的,侮辱的,攻击用的
word.lx: I found him extremely offensive./r/n 我发现他非常令人讨厌。/r/n You will find it difficult to explain away your use of such offensive language./r/n 你使用这样无礼的语言是很难说得过去的./r/n

word.name: offer
word.mean:
n. 出价,提议
v. 提供,出价,企图
word.lx: He offered his seat to me./r/n 他把座位让给了我。/r/n There is little work on offer./r/n 几乎没有什么工作可找。/r/n

word.name: offering
word.mean:
n. 提供,奉献物,牲礼
vbl. 提供,出价,奉献

word.name: office
word.lx: On the wall of his office was a large map./r/n 在他办公室的墙上是一幅大地图。/r/n There is a rose bush in front of the office./r/n 办公室前有一丛玫瑰。/r/n

word.name: officer
word.lx: His father is a customs officer./r/n 他父亲是一位海关官员。/r/n The immigration officer stamped my passport./r/n 移民官员在我的护照上盖了戳。/r/n

word.name: official
word.mean:
a. 官方的,正式的
n. 官员
word.lx: An official of the local government called to see him./r/n 当地政府一位官员来看他。/r/n She received several official letters this morning./r/n 她今天早晨收到了几封公函。/r/n

word.name: officially
word.mean: ad. 作为公务员,职务上,官方地，正式地
word.lx: This new library was officially opened last week./r/n 这家新图书馆上星期正式落成起用。/r/n The new procedures have been officially christened, so to speak./r/n 新措施可以说已经正式实施了./r/n

word.name: offset
word.mean:
n. 抵销,支派,平版印刷
v. 弥补,抵销,用平版印刷
[计算机] 偏移
word.lx: Higher mortgage rates are partly offset by increased tax allowances./r/n 抵押款提高了，其中一部分可由免税额增加而抵消。/r/n He raised his prices to offset the increased cost of materials./r/n 他提高售价以补偿材料增加的成本。/r/n

word.name: offshore
word.mean:
a. 海面的,吹向海面的
ad. 向海面
word.lx: A ship that ran aground; a ship aground offshore./r/n 搁浅的轮船；在岸边搁浅的轮船/r/n A small boat used to peddle provisions to ships anchored offshore./r/n 小卖艇向在岸边抛锚的船只兜售货物的小船/r/n

word.name: offspring
word.lx: How do parents pass genes on to their offspring?/r/n 父母是怎样把基因遗传给自己的子女的？/r/n The atom bomb is the offspring of the 20th century physics./r/n 原子弹是20世纪物理学的产物。/r/n

word.name: often
word.lx: How often do you go there?/r/n 你多长时间去一次那里？/r/n American girls are often very pretty./r/n 美国女孩多很漂亮。/r/n

word.name: oh
word.lx: Oh, what a lie!/r/n 啊，真是弥天大谎！/r/n Oh, how nice!/r/n 哦，太好了!/r/n

word.name: oil
word.mean:
n. 油,油画颜料
v. 涂油,溶化,加油
word.lx: The price of oil has gone up./r/n 石油的价格已经上涨了。/r/n You should oil the sewing machine to stop the squeaking./r/n 你应该给缝纫机上点油，以免发出轧轧声。/r/n

word.name: OK
word.mean:
a. 好,不错,可以
ad. 好,不错,可以
word.lx: Is that OK?/r/n 这样可以吗？/r/n OK, thanks./r/n 还不错，谢谢。/r/n

word.name: okay
word.mean: ad. <表示同意或允许>好的,可以,行
word.lx: Have they given you their OK?/r/n 他们同意你了吗？/r/n He made an okay decision./r/n 他做出同意的决定。/r/n

word.name: olive
word.mean:
n. 橄榄,橄榄树,橄榄色
a. 黄绿色的,黄褐色的,橄榄色的
word.lx: The olive branch is the emblem of peace./r/n 橄榄枝是和平的象征。/r/n She was sitting in the shade of a big olive tree./r/n 她正坐在一棵大橄榄树的树荫下。/r/n

word.name: Olympics
word.lx: Which events is he going in for at the Olympics?/r/n 他参加奥林匹克运动会的什麽项目?/r/n The United States was the host country for the Olympics in 1984./r/n 美国是1984年奥运会的东道国。/r/n

word.name: ominous
word.lx: Those black clouds look a bit ominous./r/n 乌云压顶，来势不妙。/r/n That evening has an ominous silence./r/n 那晚有着不祥的寂静。/r/n

word.name: omission
word.lx: She complained about the omission of her name from the list./r/n 她抱怨名单上遗漏了她的名字。/r/n The mark X denotes an omission./r/n 增补号（X）表示有脱漏./r/n

word.name: on
word.mean:
prep. 在...之上
[计算机] 开
word.lx: He went on with his work./r/n 他继续他的工作。/r/n The war was on then./r/n 那时正在打仗。/r/n

word.name: once
word.mean:
ad. 一次,曾经
conj. 一旦
n. 一次
word.lx: He stopped playing the piano at once./r/n 他立刻停止了弹钢琴。/r/n Once you begin, you must continue./r/n 一旦开始，就必须继续。/r/n

word.name: oncoming
word.mean:
a. 接近的,此次的
n. 接近
word.lx: Located in or facing the path of an oncoming glacier. Used of a geologic formation./r/n 冰川运动路线的位于或面对冰川运动路线的。用于地质构造/r/n The fishermen were forewarned of the oncoming of the storm./r/n 渔民预先得到了暴风雨来临的警告。/r/n

word.name: one
word.mean:
n. 一
int. 一,任何人
a. 一,一个
word.lx: If only problems would come one at a time!/r/n 要是问题一次只发生一个该多好！/r/n A person has one head and one neck./r/n 每人都有一个头，一个脖子。/r/n

word.name: ongoing
word.mean:
a. 前进的,进行的
n. 前进,举止,行为
word.lx: He interrupted the ongoing discussion and announced a notice./r/n 他打断正在进行的讨论，宣读了一项通知。/r/n

word.name: onlooker
word.lx: By the time the ambulance had arrived, a crowd of onlookers had gathered./r/n 救护车赶到时, 围观的人已经很多了./r/n He fell into the water, much to the entertainment of the onlookers./r/n 他跌进水中，旁观者大乐。/r/n

word.name: onset
word.lx: He met many difficulties at the first onset./r/n 在一开始时，他遇到了许多困难。/r/n The attainment or onset of puberty./r/n 到达青春期或青春期开始/r/n

word.name: onto
word.lx: He jumped onto the table./r/n 他跳上了桌子。/r/n I reached the gate that opened onto the lake./r/n 我走到临湖而开的那扇门前。/r/n

word.name: onwards
word.lx: The ship sailed onward./r/n 船向前航行。/r/n The shop is open from this day onwards./r/n 该店从今天起开始营业。/r/n

word.name: opal
word.lx: Opals are milky gems./r/n 蛋白石是乳白色的宝石./r/n

word.name: opaque
word.lx: I felt his report was deliberately opaque./r/n 我觉得他的报告故意含糊其词。/r/n This is an opaque cup./r/n 这是一个不透明的杯子。/r/n

word.name: open
word.mean:
n. 公开,户外,空旷
a. 开著的,开放的,公开的
v. 打开,公开,开放
word.lx: You may open a current account at a bank./r/n 你可以在银行开立一个活期帐户。/r/n He has an open mind in this matter./r/n 他在这个问题上虚怀若谷。/r/n

word.name: opening
word.mean:
n. 开始,口,揭幕,空缺的职务
vbl. 打开,开放,开始
word.lx: There is an opening in the hedge./r/n 这篱笆上有个洞。/r/n His opening remarks are applauded by the audience./r/n 他的开场白受到听众的鼓掌欢迎。/r/n

word.name: opera
word.lx: They planned to go to the opera this Sunday./r/n 他们计划这个星期天去看歌剧演出。/r/n The opera was quite stupendous./r/n 这部歌剧很精彩。/r/n

word.name: operate
word.lx: The surgeon operated on her for appendicitis./r/n 外科医生为她做阑尾切除手术。/r/n The new law operates to destroy our advantages./r/n 这项新法律损害我们的利益。/r/n

word.name: operating
word.lx: Consisting of or operating several devices of one kind at the same time./r/n 同时操作的同时操作某类部件或由某一类部件组成的/r/n The patient was sent to the operating room./r/n 这个病人被送进了手术室。/r/n

word.name: operation
word.mean: n. 手术, 行动，活动, 操作
word.lx: The surgeon is performing a delicate operation./r/n 那位外科医生正在做一个很精细的手术。/r/n When does the new law come into operation?/r/n 这项新法律何时生效？/r/n

word.name: operative
word.mean:
a. 动作的,运转的,生产有关的
n. 职员,刑警,侦探
word.lx: The station will be operative again in January./r/n 该车站将於一月份恢复使用./r/n The oil rig is now fully operative./r/n 石油钻塔现全面开工./r/n

word.name: opiate
word.mean:
n. 鸦片剂(麻醉剂)
a. 安眠的(麻醉的)

word.name: opponent
word.mean:
n. 对手,敌手,反对者
a. 敌对的,反对的
word.lx: His opponent did not stand a chance./r/n 他的对手毫无取胜的机会。/r/n She is one of the strongest opponents of tax reform./r/n 她是税收改革最强烈的反对者之一。/r/n

word.name: opportunist
word.mean: n. 机会主义者,投机者

word.name: opposable
word.mean: a. 可相对的,与其他手指相对的
word.lx: Having four feet with opposable first digits, as primates other than human beings./r/n 四足如手的有四足和与其他脚趾相对的第一个足趾的；如除人类以外的灵长类动物/r/n

word.name: opposed
word.mean:
a. 反对的,敌对的,对抗的
v. 反对
vbl. 反对
word.lx: I am here on business as opposed to a holiday./r/n 我在这里是办公事而不是度假。/r/n The populace at large are opposed to sudden change./r/n 人民群众普遍反对突然实行的变革。/r/n

word.name: opposing
word.mean: 反作用的, 反向的, 相反的, 对立的

word.name: opposite
word.mean:
a. 相对的,相反的,对面的
prep. 对面
word.lx: Black and white are opposites./r/n 黑和白相反。/r/n Have you seen the house opposite the railway station?/r/n 你看到火车站对面的房子了吗？/r/n

word.name: opposition
word.lx: We found ourselves in opposition to our friends on this question./r/n 我们发现在这个问题上我们与我们的朋友立场相 反。/r/n The opposition dismissed the report as a whitewash./r/n 反对党认为这份报告过于修饰而不予理会。/r/n

word.name: oppress
word.mean:
v. 使(心情等)沉重,使烦恼,压迫,压制某人
vt. 压迫,压制
word.lx: The king oppressed his people with terrible taxes and punishments./r/n 国王以苛捐杂税和严刑来压迫人民。/r/n Cares oppressed his spirits./r/n 虑使他心情抑郁。/r/n

word.name: oppression
word.mean: n. 压抑,沉闷,压迫手段
word.lx: The low ceiling of the room gave me a feeling of oppression./r/n 低矮的屋顶给我一种压抑的感觉。/r/n They did not crouch under the oppression./r/n 他们受压迫而不屈服。/r/n

word.name: oppressor
word.lx: Our people are suffering at the hands of an oppressor./r/n 我们的人民正在暴君的统治下受苦。/r/n They showed violent opposition to the oppressor./r/n 他们对压迫者表现出强烈的不满。/r/n

word.name: opprobrious
word.mean: a. 嘴不干净的,无礼的,粗野的

word.name: opt
word.lx: He opted to go to Paris rather than London./r/n 他决定去巴黎, 不去伦敦./r/n Most people opt for buying their own homes rather than renting them./r/n 大多数人愿意买房子而不愿意租房子./r/n

word.name: optic
word.mean:
n. 镜片
a. 光的(视觉的)
word.lx: His optic nerve was hurt in an accident./r/n 他的视神经在一次事故中受到损伤。/r/n

word.name: optical
word.mean: a. 眼睛的,视觉的,光学的
word.lx: Microscopes and telescopes are optical instruments./r/n 望远镜和显微镜是光学仪器。/r/n The optical system of the eye stimulate cell of the retina./r/n 眼睛的视觉系统刺激视网膜内的细胞。/r/n

word.name: optician
word.mean: n. 光学仪器商,眼镜商,光学仪器制造厂
word.lx: The optician said I needed new glasses./r/n 验光师说我需要配新眼镜./r/n

word.name: optics
word.lx: He is well versed in the science of optics./r/n 他精通光学。/r/n The optic theory originated with Einstein./r/n 光学理论是爱因斯坦首创的。/r/n

word.name: optimal
word.lx: The ergonomics of the new office were felt to be optimal./r/n 新办公室工效设计因素感觉十分理想/r/n

word.name: optimism
word.lx: Pessimism, when you get used to it, is just as agreeable as optimism./r/n 悲观主义者，当你习惯它之后，就和乐观主义者一样令人惬意了。/r/n They professed optimism about the outcome./r/n 他们对结果表示乐观./r/n

word.name: optimistic
word.mean: a. 乐观的,乐观主义的
word.lx: A person regarded as being foolishly or blindly optimistic./r/n 过分乐观者，盲目乐观者被视为愚蠢地或盲目地乐观的人/r/n We are still optimistic, whatever the result (may be)./r/n 我们仍然乐观，不论结果如何。/r/n

word.name: optimize
word.mean:
v. 使...完美,乐观,使...完善
v.优化

word.name: optimum
word.mean:
n. 最适宜
a. 最适宜的
word.lx: Most favorable or desirable; optimum./r/n 最理想的最适宜的，最令人满意的，最优的/r/n The market offer optimum condition for sale./r/n 市场为销售提供了最佳条件。/r/n

word.name: optional
word.mean: a. 可以任选的,非强制的
word.lx: The insurance cover is optional./r/n 保险范围可以随意选择。/r/n A4-speed automatic transmission is optional./r/n 四段自动变速器是可自由选择的。/r/n

word.name: oral
word.mean:
a. 口头的
n. 口试
word.lx: He will take an oral examination./r/n 他将接受口试。/r/n The old man told us a story passed on by oral tradition./r/n 老人给我们讲述了一个口头流传的故事。/r/n

word.name: orange
word.mean:
a. 橙色的
n. 橘子
word.lx: There are some oranges on the table./r/n 桌子上有几个橘子。/r/n The burning coals started to flame yellow and orange./r/n 燃烧著的煤开始发出了黄色与橙色的火焰./r/n

word.name: orbit
word.mean:
n. 轨道,常轨,眼眶
v. 绕轨道而行,进入轨道,盘旋
word.lx: The spacecraft is in orbit around the moon./r/n 该航天器在绕月球轨道运行。/r/n How many spacecrafts are orbiting the moon?/r/n 有多少航天器绕月球轨道飞行？/r/n

word.name: orchard
word.lx: My uncle has an apple orchard./r/n 我叔叔拥有一个苹果园。/r/n She ran hither and thither in the orchard./r/n 她在果园里到处跑。/r/n

word.name: orchestra
word.lx: An orchestra usually plays classical music./r/n 管弦乐队通常演奏古典音乐。/r/n Our artistic director was instrumental in persuading the orchestra to come./r/n 我们的艺术指导帮助请来管弦乐队。/r/n

word.name: ordeal
word.mean: n. 严酷的考验,痛苦的经验
word.lx: His courage was severely tried by his ordeal./r/n 他的勇气在艰难困苦中经受了严峻的考验。/r/n She maintained her equanimity throughout her long ordeal./r/n 她在长期的苦难中心情一直都很平静./r/n

word.name: order
word.mean:
n.订单,命令
n. 顺序,整齐,勋章,阶级,决议
vt.命令,调整,定购
word.lx: The items are listed in order of importance./r/n 这些项目是根据其重要性排列的。/r/n The boss ordered that the work should be done on time./r/n 老板吩咐工作必须按时完成。/r/n

word.name: orderly
word.mean:
a. 有秩序的,整齐的
ad. 依次地,顺序地
n. 勤务兵

word.name: ordinal
word.mean:
n. 序数
a. 顺序的
[计算机] 序号
word.lx: The ordinal number matching the number15 in a series./r/n 第十五在一系列中排在第十五的序数/r/n The ordinal number matching the number14 in a series./r/n 第十四一序数词，一系列数中的第十四个/r/n

word.name: ordinary
word.lx: Our ordinary workday is eight hours./r/n 我们正常的工作日是8小时。/r/n She is likeable enough, but very ordinary./r/n 她还算可爱，但是并不标致。/r/n

word.name: ore
word.lx: This is an area rich in ore./r/n 这里是个矿产丰富的地区。/r/n After chemical assay, we have known the composition of the ore./r/n 经过化学分析，我们知道了矿石的构成。/r/n

word.name: organ
word.lx: The heart is a vital organ./r/n 心脏是维持生命必须的器官。/r/n Parliament is an organ of government./r/n 议会是政府的一个机构。/r/n

word.name: organic
word.mean: a. 器官的,有机的,根本的,接近自然的
word.lx: I am not good at organic chemistry./r/n 我的有机化学学得不好。/r/n The music is organic to the story./r/n 这首乐曲是这个故事必不可少的组成部分。/r/n

word.name: organism
word.lx: Germs may invade the organism./r/n 细菌会侵入有机体。/r/n The army is an extremely complex organism./r/n 军队是极其复杂的组织。/r/n

word.name: organization
word.lx: The organization of such a large-scale party takes a lot of time and energy./r/n 组织这样大规模的聚会要花费许多时间和精力。/r/n They have established a student organization./r/n 他们建立了一个学生组织。/r/n

word.name: orient
word.mean:
a. [诗]东方的
n. 东方,亚洲
word.lx: In the market, I breathed the smells of the Orient./r/n 在集市上，我闻到了东方的气息。/r/n Ian is a dab hand at the orient art./r/n 伊恩是东方艺术的行家。/r/n

word.name: oriental
word.lx: This oriental legend is fascinating./r/n 这个东方传说很吸引人。/r/n China is an oriental country with a long history./r/n 中国是一个有着悠久历史的东方国家。/r/n

word.name: orientate
word.mean: vt. 定向(确定地址,使...向东,查明真相)
word.lx: The mountaineers found it difficult to orientate themselves in the fog./r/n 登山的人在浓雾中难以确定自己的方位./r/n Try to orientate your students towards the science subjects./r/n 把学生的兴趣尽力引导到理科方面./r/n

word.name: orientation
word.mean:
n. 定位,适应,情况介绍
[计算机] 定向

word.name: origin
word.lx: He is a Dane by origin./r/n 他原籍丹麦。/r/n The illness is organic in origin./r/n 该病起初是器质性疾患./r/n

word.name: original
word.mean:
a. 最初的,原始的,有独创性的,原版的
n. 起源,原件,原稿
word.lx: The original owner of the house moved out./r/n 房子原先的主人搬出去了。/r/n The original picture is in the British Museum./r/n 这幅画的原作在大英博物馆内。/r/n

word.name: originality
word.lx: The work lacks originality./r/n 那作品缺乏创造性。/r/n Her designs have great originality./r/n 她的设计十分新颖。/r/n

word.name: originally
word.mean:
ad. 本来,原来,最初
重要的
word.lx: The idea originally emanated from his brother./r/n 这个主意最初是他哥哥出的./r/n He originally need not buy such big house./r/n 他本来不必买这样一所大房子。/r/n

word.name: originate
word.mean:
v. 开始,发明,发起
[计算机] 起始
word.lx: The quarrel originated in rivalry between the two families./r/n 这次争吵是两家不和引起的。/r/n Who originated the concept of stereo sound?/r/n 立体声是谁发明的？/r/n

word.name: ornament
word.mean:
n. 装饰(物)
v. 装饰
word.lx: We bought some ornaments for the Christmas tree./r/n 我们买了一些装饰品来点缀圣诞树。/r/n I ornamented my room with flowers./r/n 我用鲜花装饰房间。/r/n

word.name: orphan
word.mean:
n. 孤儿
a. 无双亲的,孤儿的
v. 成孤儿
word.lx: She was orphaned at the age of ten./r/n 她在十岁时成为孤儿。/r/n My cousin is an orphan; her parents died when she was young./r/n 我的表姐是孤儿，她的父母在她小时候就去世了。/r/n

word.name: oscillate
word.mean:
v. 振动,彷徨,犹豫
v. 使振动,使动摇
word.lx: He oscillates between political extremes./r/n 他的政治观点在两个极端之间摇摆不定./r/n Manic depressives oscillate between depression and elation./r/n 躁狂抑郁症患者抑郁与躁狂交替发作./r/n

word.name: oscillation
word.mean: n. 振动,动摇,变动彷徨
word.lx: Her oscillations in mood are maddening./r/n 她喜怒无常能把人气疯。/r/n

word.name: ostensible
word.lx: Seeming or professed; ostensible./r/n 假装的表面上的或自称的；貌似真实的/r/n An ostensible or professed purpose; an excuse./r/n 借口，托词表面的目的；理由/r/n

word.name: ostentation
word.mean: n. 虚饰,虚有其表,卖弄
word.lx: Exhibiting no pretensions, boastfulness, or ostentation; modest./r/n 不装腔作势的不装腔作势的，不夸耀的；不铺张招摇的；谦逊/r/n

word.name: other
word.mean:
a. 别的,其他的
pron. 另一个人(或事)
word.lx: She is more clever than the other girls in her class./r/n 她比班上其他任何女孩子都聪明。/r/n The other students in my class are from Italy./r/n 我班其余同学都是意大利人。/r/n

word.name: ought
word.lx: You ought to be more careful, you know./r/n 你应该小心一点，知道吗？/r/n He ought to/should be here in time he started early enough./r/n 他该[应]按时到这里--他出发得够早的./r/n

word.name: ounce
word.lx: He tried to open the door by using every ounce of his strength./r/n 他用尽全部力气想把门打开。/r/n How many calories can an ounce of sugar supply?/r/n 一盎司糖可以供给多少卡热量？/r/n

word.name: ours
word.lx: Your house is much bigger than ours./r/n 你们的房子比我们的大多了。/r/n Their opinion jarred with ours./r/n 他们的意见与我们不一致。/r/n

word.name: ourselves
word.lx: We finished the job all by ourselves./r/n 我们全靠自己完成了这项工作。/r/n We built ourselves a new surgery./r/n 我们给自己建了一间新的外科手术室。/r/n

word.name: oust
word.lx: The umpire ousted the arguing player from the game./r/n 裁判员将那位不服判决的运动员罚下场。/r/n Fox was ousted from office but he had nothing to say for himself./r/n 福克斯被赶下台，但是他没有什么可特别为自己辨护的。/r/n

word.name: out
word.mean:
a. 外面的,下台的, 出局的
ad. 在外,熄减,出现
prep. 出外,离去,向
word.lx: He took out a book from the case./r/n 他从箱子里拿出一本书。/r/n The fire has gone out./r/n 火已熄灭。/r/n

word.name: outbreak
word.lx: There has been an outbreak of typhoid./r/n 那儿正爆发伤寒。/r/n The outbreak of riot caused many people to die./r/n 暴乱的发生使很多人丧生。/r/n

word.name: outcast
word.mean:
a. 被逐出的,被遗弃的,无家可归的
n. 被驱逐的人,流浪人,无赖
word.lx: He was treated as an outcast./r/n 他遭到被人赶出似的对待。/r/n The outcast boy was brought up by the government./r/n 这个被遗弃的孩子是由政府抚养大的。/r/n

word.name: outcome
word.lx: What was the outcome of your meeting?/r/n 你们会晤的结果如何?/r/n The necessary outcome of a war is a fall in production./r/n 战争带来的必然结果就是生产力下降。/r/n

word.name: outcry
word.mean: n. 尖叫,倒彩,强烈抗议
word.lx: There was a great outcry about the construction of the new airport./r/n 公众强烈反对修建该机场。/r/n The government hushed the affair up to avoid a public outcry./r/n 当局对此事秘而不宣, 以免引起公众抗议./r/n

word.name: outdated
word.mean:
a. 旧式的,落伍的,过时的
v. 使时
vbl. 过时

word.name: outdo
word.lx: She outdid all her classmates./r/n 她超过她的所有同班同学。/r/n He has outdone all his rivals in skill./r/n 他在技巧方面胜过所有的对手。/r/n

word.name: outer
word.lx: These creatures were believed to have come from outer space./r/n 据信这种生物来自外太空。/r/n The outer walls of the building were painted blue./r/n 这座建筑的外墙被漆成了蓝色。/r/n

word.name: outermost
word.mean: a. 最外方的(最远的,最高头的)

word.name: outfit
word.mean:
n. 用具,配备,机构
v. 配备,供应
word.lx: The company will provide the sports outfits for all the players./r/n 这家公司将为所有运动员提供全套运动服装。/r/n Such an outfit would be a useful addition to my wardrobe./r/n 在我的服装中添置这一套会有用的./r/n

word.name: outlandish
word.lx: How Harry came into the possession of this outlandish stuff makes an interesting story which he is fond of relating./r/n 哈里如何得到这种稀奇古怪的东西，是一个他津津乐道的有趣的故事。/r/n

word.name: outlaw
word.mean:
n. 被剥夺法律保护的人,罪犯
v. 使...失去法律保护,将...逐出社会,宣告非法
word.lx: Bands of outlaws lived in the desolate mountains after breaking the laws./r/n 成群的歹徒犯法后栖身于荒山中。/r/n Bad man, the accidental, noble outlaw./r/n 有坏人啦，出人意料的逃。/r/n

word.name: outlay
word.mean:
n. 费用,经费,支出
v. 花费
word.lx: The act or process of expending; outlay./r/n 支出支付的行为或过程；花费/r/n Economy is one powerful motive for camping, since after the initial outlay upon equipment./r/n 想省钱是露营的一个主要动机。因为在开初支付了装备的费用后。/r/n

word.name: outlet
word.mean: n. 出口,出路,通风口,批发商店
word.lx: They found some new outlets for their products./r/n 他们为自己的产品找到了一些新的市场。/r/n Children need an outlet for their energy./r/n 儿童的精力需要发泄出来./r/n

word.name: outline
word.mean:
n. 大纲,轮廓,概要
v. 描画轮廓,描述要点
word.lx: He saw the outline of a building against the sky./r/n 他看到天边一幢建筑物的轮廓。/r/n The flower was clearly outlined in the light of the lamp./r/n 花朵在阳光下清晰地显现出轮廓。/r/n

word.name: outlines
word.lx: The first lecture introduces new students to the broad outlines of the subject./r/n 第一堂课是让新同学概括地了解这一科目./r/n Angular forms, outlines, or corners./r/n 角形角形，角的轮廓或棱角/r/n

word.name: outlook
word.mean: n. 观点,见解,展望,前景

word.name: outlying
word.mean: a. 远离中心的,偏僻的
word.lx: They live on the outskirts (ie in an outlying district) of Paris./r/n 他们住在巴黎市郊./r/n

word.name: outnumber
word.lx: We were completely outnumbered by the enemy./r/n 在数量上我们完全被敌人压倒。/r/n Men outnumber women here in the ratio of three to one./r/n 此地男子数量以三比一超过女子。/r/n

word.name: outperform
word.mean:
n. 成绩优于
v. 超额完成,过度执行

word.name: output
word.mean:
n. 产量,输出,输出功率
vt. 输出(信息等)
word.lx: The average output of the factory is 20 cars a day./r/n 该工厂的平均产量是每天20辆汽车。/r/n We must increase our output to meet demand./r/n 我们必须提高产量满足需求。/r/n

word.name: outrage
word.mean:
n. 暴行,侮辱,愤怒
v. 凌辱,虐待,触犯
word.lx: We should never forget the outrage committed by the Japanese invaders./r/n 我们永远都不应该忘记日本侵略者犯下的暴行。/r/n The Government has been dilatory in condemning the outrage./r/n 政府迟迟才谴责是次暴行./r/n

word.name: outrageous
word.mean:
a. 暴虐的,极无礼的,可恶的
惊人的,肆无忌惮的,毫无节制的
word.lx: His treatment of his wife is outrageous./r/n 他对待妻子十分蛮横。/r/n The price is outrageous./r/n 价钱高得吓人。/r/n

word.name: outright
word.mean:
a. 率直的,完全的,总共的
ad. 率直地,立刻地,一直向前
word.lx: I bought a house outright./r/n 我以一次付款方式买了一栋房子。/r/n She was the outright winner./r/n 毫无疑问她是优胜者。/r/n

word.name: outset
word.lx: The start or initial stage; the outset./r/n 开始，开端开始或初始阶段/r/n The teacher laid emphasis on the precision of the translation from the outset./r/n 老师从一开始就强调翻译准确性。/r/n

word.name: outside
word.mean:
ad. 在外面
n.&a. 外部
prep. 在...外
pron. 在...外边
word.lx: He has a rough outside, but a good heart./r/n 他外表粗鲁，心地善良。/r/n The house was painted green outside./r/n 这房子外部漆成绿色。/r/n

word.name: outsider
word.mean: n. 外行(旁观者,没有关系的人)

word.name: outspoken
word.mean: a. 直言无讳的,坦率的,坦白无隐的
word.lx: Hans got in bad with some of his friends because of his outspoken opposition to the war./r/n 汉斯因为坦率地反对这场战争，使得他的一些朋友不再喜欢他了。/r/n

word.name: outstrip
word.mean:
v. 超过,跑过
vt. 胜过,超过
word.lx: Demand is outstripping current production./r/n 现在需求逐渐超过了生产能力./r/n We soon outstripped the slower runners./r/n 我们很快就超过那些跑得慢的人./r/n

word.name: outward
word.mean:
a. 向外的,表面的,外服的
ad. 向外,在外,表面
word.lx: The two things are the same in outward form but different in essence./r/n 那两样东西在外表上相同，但在本质上不同。/r/n He was to all outward appearances dead./r/n 他显然已经死了./r/n

word.name: outwards
word.lx: The door opened outwards./r/n 这门是朝外开的。/r/n Does the window open inwards or outwards?/r/n 这窗户是朝里开的还是朝外开的?/r/n

word.name: outweigh
word.mean: v. 比...为重,比...重要,比...有价值
word.lx: The advantages far outweigh the disadvantages in this case./r/n 这件事上，利远大于弊。/r/n This outweighs all other considerations./r/n 这一点是首要考虑的。/r/n

word.name: oval
word.mean:
n. 椭圆形
a. 卵形的,椭圆形的
word.lx: The playing field is a large oval./r/n 球场很大，呈椭圆形。/r/n The mirror is oval./r/n 镜子是椭圆的。/r/n

word.name: ovation
word.mean: n. 热烈欢迎,大喝采,大受欢迎

word.name: oven
word.lx: It is like an oven in here; please open the window./r/n 这里热得象火炉，请把窗户打开。/r/n The bread is baking in the oven./r/n 烤箱里正在烤面包。/r/n

word.name: overcharge
word.mean:
v. 讨价过高,装药过多,过度充电
n. 超载,装药过多,过度充电
word.lx: We were overcharged for the eggs./r/n 我们的鸡蛋买贵了./r/n That grocer never overcharges./r/n 那杂货商从不多要价./r/n

word.name: overcome
word.mean:
a. 充满了的,占据了的
v. 战胜,克服
word.lx: Can you overcome your shortcomings?/r/n 你可以克服你的缺点吗？/r/n We need a spirit of enterprise if we are to overcome our difficulties./r/n 如果我们要克服困难，我们就要有进取精神。/r/n

word.name: overdraw
word.mean:
v. 拉过度,夸大,夸张
v. 透支
word.lx: Overdraw a bow./r/n 把弓拉得过紧/r/n

word.name: overdue
word.mean: a. 过期的,未兑的,迟到的
word.lx: Please let us have your check for the$60 now past overdue./r/n 迟付的60美元，请速予寄下为荷。/r/n Legislative reform is long overdue./r/n 立法方面的改革早该进行。/r/n

word.name: overextend
word.mean: v. 使...承担过多的义务
word.lx: Any users of credit may overextend themselves./r/n 每个贷款使用者都有可能作出不自量力的事。/r/n

word.name: overflow
word.mean:
n. 溢值,超值,泛滥
v. 泛滥,溢出,充溢
[计算机] 溢出
word.lx: Overflow patients lay on the floors and in the corridors./r/n 容纳不下的病人躺在地上和走廊里。/r/n The crowd overflowed the auditorium./r/n 人群挤得礼堂无法容纳。/r/n

word.name: overhaul
word.mean:
v. 分解检查,翻修,精细检查； 超车、赶上

n. 分解检查,精细检查
word.lx: The engine is due for an overhaul./r/n 那台发动机该大修了./r/n The fast cruiser soon overhauled the old cargo boat./r/n 快速巡逻艇迅即赶上那艘旧货船./r/n

word.name: overhead
word.mean:
n. 经常开支,普通用费
a. 在头上的,高架的
ad. 在头顶上,在空中,在高处
[计算机] 总开销
word.lx: Their office is in central Beijing, so their overhead is very high./r/n 他们的办事处设在北京市中心，所以他们的日常开支很大。/r/n Seagulls were circling overhead./r/n 海鸥在头顶山盘旋。/r/n

word.name: overhear
word.lx: I overheard some cruel remarks about him./r/n 我无意中听到了一些议论他的粗鲁的话。/r/n I overheard them saying they were unhappy./r/n 我偶然听到他们说，他们很不快乐。/r/n

word.name: overheat
word.lx: Fill your radiator with water, or your engine will overheat./r/n 给你的散热器充水，否则引擎会过热。/r/n

word.name: overlap
word.mean:
n. 重叠,重复
v. 重叠,重复
[计算机] 重叠

word.name: overload
word.mean:
v. 超载,过载,超过负荷
n. 超载,负荷过多
[计算机] 过载

word.name: overlook
word.mean: v. 俯看,远眺,没注意到
word.lx: They overlooked the enormous risks involved./r/n 他们忽略了暗含的巨大危险。/r/n My room overlooked the garden./r/n 我的房间俯瞰花园。/r/n

word.name: overproduction
word.mean: n. 生产过剩,过量生产

word.name: override
word.mean:
v. 弃绝,渺视
[计算机] 废除
word.lx: The president vetoed the bill, but congress override his veto./r/n 总统否决了议案，但国会将它推翻。/r/n The appeal court override the decision of the lower court./r/n 上诉法院推翻了下级法院的裁决。/r/n

word.name: overrun
word.mean:
v. 蔓延,泛滥
vt. 否决,驳回
word.lx: The lecturer overran by ten minutes./r/n 演讲人超过规定时间十分钟。/r/n The news programme overran the allotted time./r/n 新闻节目超出了规定的时间。/r/n

word.name: oversea
word.mean:
a. 海外的
ad. 在海外
word.lx: The overseas trade has become the main project./r/n 海外贸易成为主要的项目。/r/n She is an overseas student in Britain./r/n 她是个在英国的外国留学生。/r/n

word.name: overseas
word.mean:
a. 海外的
ad. 在海外
word.lx: He was happy to return home after living overseas for two years./r/n 生活在海外两年后回到了家他感到愉快。/r/n The company had succeed best on the overseas market./r/n 该公司在海外市场获得巨大成功。/r/n

word.name: oversee
word.lx: You must employ someone to oversee the project./r/n 你得雇个人监督这一工程./r/n

word.name: oversight
word.lx: Through an unfortunate oversight your letter was left unanswered./r/n 由于令人遗憾的疏忽，未能给你回信。/r/n Many errors are caused by oversight./r/n 有很多错误是由疏忽造成的。/r/n

word.name: overt
word.mean: a. 公开的,明显的,公然的
word.lx: Overt hostility; overt intelligence gathering./r/n 公然的敌意；公众智慧的结晶/r/n Acts of war; overt warfare./r/n 战争行为；公开战争/r/n

word.name: overtake
word.mean: v. 赶上,突然来袭,压倒
word.lx: The murderer was overtaken in his crime./r/n 杀人犯当场被捕。/r/n A car overtook me although I was going fast./r/n 我虽然开得很快，还是被一辆车超过了。/r/n

word.name: overthrow
word.mean:
n. 推翻,瓦解,倾覆
v. 打倒,推翻,倾覆
word.lx: The overthrow of that lawful regime has resulted in a series of riot./r/n 合法政权的被推翻导致一连串的暴乱。/r/n The rebels have overthrown the government./r/n 反叛者已推翻了政府。/r/n

word.name: overtime
word.mean:
n. 加班时间(加班加点费)
ad. 在规定时间之外(超出时间地)
word.lx: He was cruel to make them work overtime./r/n 他要他们加班工作, 真是残酷。/r/n This new order will mean (us) working overtime./r/n 这一新定单意味著（我们）得加班加点./r/n

word.name: overture
word.mean: n. 提议,提案,初步交涉,序曲
word.lx: The audience must be in their seats before the overture./r/n 观众必须于序曲演奏前入座。/r/n

word.name: overweight
word.lx: The baggage is two kilos overweight./r/n 那件行李超重两公斤。/r/n Be my luggage overweight?/r/n 我的行李超重了吗？/r/n

word.name: overwhelm
word.lx: Your kindness quite overwhelmed me./r/n 你的好意使我感激难言。/r/n The village was overwhelmed when the floods came./r/n 这个村庄在洪水泛滥时被淹没了。/r/n

word.name: overwhelming
word.mean: a. 势不可挡的,压倒的
word.lx: Our football team has won an overwhelming victory./r/n 我们的足球队取得了压倒性的胜利。/r/n The scenic splendors of the Rocky Mountains are overwhelming./r/n 落基山脉的壮丽景色使人赞叹不已。/r/n

word.name: overwork
word.mean:
n. 过度操劳,过度工作
v. 工作过度
word.lx: His illness grew out of his tendency to overwork./r/n 他的病是由于工作过度所致。/r/n Self- make men are very apt to usurp the prerogative of the almighty and overwork themselves./r/n 全凭一己奋斗而成功的人，大有篡夺上帝的大权之势而过度工作。/r/n

word.name: overwrite
word.lx: Send or receiving a new snapshot overwrite the previous image./r/n 发送或接收一幅新的快照会覆盖前面的图象。/r/n

word.name: owe
word.mean:
v. 欠
vi. 欠钱
vt. 欠(债等),归功于,应感谢
word.lx: I owe a lot to my wife and children./r/n 我很感激我的妻子和孩子。/r/n He owes his success more to luck than to ability./r/n 他认为他的成功是靠运气而不是因为自己有能力。/r/n

word.name: owing
word.lx: Owing to the rain, the match was cancelled./r/n 由于下雨，取消了比赛。/r/n There is still 2 dollars owing./r/n 还欠着2美元。/r/n

word.name: owl
word.lx: I can hear an owl hooting./r/n 我能听到一只猫头鹰在叫。/r/n The owl swooped down on the mouse./r/n 那只猫头鹰向著老鼠猛扑下来./r/n

word.name: own
word.mean:
a. 自己的
pron. 特有的
v. 有,拥有
vi. 承认
vt. 拥有
word.lx: He owns he was wrong./r/n 他承认他错了。/r/n Your life is your own affair./r/n 你的生活是你自己的事。/r/n

word.name: owner
word.lx: I am the owner of this house./r/n 我是这所房子的主人。/r/n The property revert to its original owner in1998./r/n 财产于1998年将归还原所有人。/r/n

word.name: ownership
word.lx: Ownership of property involves great expense./r/n 拥有房地产要有很大的开销。/r/n The two brothers have dispute over the ownership of the land./r/n 这兄弟俩对土地的所有权有争议。/r/n

word.name: ox
word.lx: The flesh of a slaughtered full-grown steer, bull, ox, or cow./r/n 牛肉宰杀了的完全成长的阉牛、未阉割的牛、公牛或母牛的肉/r/n He goaded the ox on./r/n 他用刺棒驱牛。/r/n

word.name: oxidize
word.mean:
v. 氧化,生锈
vt.&ad. 使氧化
word.lx: Iron is easily oxidized./r/n 铁很容易氧化。/r/n The carbon14 atoms oxidize to carbon dioxide which gets blown about and mixed up with lower atmosphere./r/n 碳14原子氧化生成二氧化碳，向四周散去并与低空的大气混合。/r/n

word.name: oxygen
word.lx: She died from lack of oxygen./r/n 她因缺氧而死。/r/n There was a shortage of oxygen at the top of the mountain./r/n 山顶上缺氧。/r/n

word.name: oyster
word.lx: The man is as dumb as an oyster./r/n 那人极少说话。/r/n That oyster closed up its valves./r/n 那个牡蛎把壳合拢起来。/r/n

word.name: ozone
word.lx: The pollution had destroyed ozone layer and caused many changes in weather./r/n 污染破坏了臭氧层，并引起了许多天气变化。/r/n Just breathe in that ozone!/r/n 吸吸那种新鲜空气吧!/r/n

word.name: pace
word.mean:
n. 速度,步调,步法
v. 踱步,缓慢的走,引导
word.lx: The film director put the new actor through his paces./r/n 电影导演测试了一下那位新演员的演技。/r/n The lion paced the floor of his cage restlessly./r/n 狮子烦躁地在兽笼里走来走去。/r/n

word.name: pacemaker
word.lx: Implant a pacemaker; implant a drug capsule./r/n 植入一个起搏器；植入一个药物胶囊/r/n

word.name: pacific
word.mean:
a. 太平洋的
n. 太平洋
word.lx: The night was pacific./r/n 黑夜静悄悄的。/r/n These creatures live in the depth of the Pacific Ocean./r/n 这些生物生活在太平洋的海底。/r/n

word.name: pacify
word.lx: In spite of my efforts to pacify it the baby continued to cry/continued crying./r/n 尽管我已尽力哄这婴儿, 可是他还是哭个不停./r/n He tried to pacify the protesters with promise of reform./r/n 他试图以改革的承诺安抚抗议者。/r/n

word.name: package
word.mean:
n. 包裹,套装软件,包
v. 包装
word.lx: He packaged up his old clothes and put them in the cupboard./r/n 他把旧衣服包成一包放在橱里。/r/n The postman brought me a large package./r/n 邮递员给我送来一个大包裹。/r/n

word.name: packet
word.mean:
n. 储存器,讯息封,小包
v. 打包,装进小包
word.lx: I bought him a packet of sugar./r/n 我给他买了一袋糖果。/r/n There is a list of ingredients on the side of the packet./r/n 包装袋的边上印有所含配料表。/r/n

word.name: pad
word.mean:
n. 填补,衬垫,印色盒,信笺簿
v. 填补,徒步,夸大
word.lx: The nurse put a clean pad of cotton over his wound./r/n 护士在他的伤口上敷了一块干净的纱布垫。/r/n He jotted down a note on the pad by the telephone./r/n 他在电话机旁的便笺本草草记下一个通知。/r/n

word.name: paddle
word.mean:
n. 桨,划桨,明轮翼
v. 划桨,戏水,抚弄
word.lx: She lay at the side of the pool and paddled in the water with her fingers./r/n 她躺在池子边上，用手指玩水。/r/n They tried to row the small boat off with a paddle./r/n 他们试图用桨把小船划开。/r/n

word.name: page
word.mean:
n. 页
v. (给...)当听差
vt. (通过扩音器、传呼机等)呼叫
word.lx: Paging Grey Wood, would you go to reception please?/r/n 格林伍德先生，请到服务台去一下。/r/n There is a page missing in this book./r/n 这本书缺了一页。/r/n

word.name: pageant
word.lx: We are all invited to take part in the pageant./r/n 我们全都被邀请参加这次盛典。/r/n A public celebration or spectacular pageant./r/n 盛典公共庆祝活动或热闹的游行/r/n

word.name: paging
word.lx: Paging Grey Wood, would you go to reception please?/r/n 格林伍德先生，请到服务台去一下。/r/n I was paging through a magazine when he came in./r/n 他进来时我在翻阅一本杂志。/r/n

word.name: pail
word.lx: Will you carry a pail of water out of the well?/r/n 你愿意从井里打桶水吗？/r/n I want a pail of milk./r/n 我想要一桶牛奶。/r/n

word.name: painful
word.mean:
a. 痛苦的
vt. 使疼痛
word.lx: It was painful to admit that I was wrong./r/n 要我承认错了，是很费力的。/r/n The operation was very painful./r/n 手术很痛。/r/n

word.name: pains
word.lx: No gains without pains./r/n st. 不劳无获./r/n He spares no pains to study English./r/n 他不辞劳苦地学习英语。/r/n

word.name: painstaking
word.mean:
n. 辛苦,苦心,工夫
a. 辛苦的,勤勉的,小心的
word.lx: Planned or executed with painstaking attention to numerous parts or details./r/n 精心制作的对众多部分或细节给予精心注意的计划或制作的/r/n

word.name: paint
word.mean:
n. 油漆,颜料,绘画作品
v. 油漆,绘画
word.lx: Who painted this picture?/r/n 这幅画是谁画的？/r/n The wall requires a new coat of paint./r/n 这墙需要再涂一层新油漆。/r/n

word.name: paintbrush
word.lx: Hand the paintbrush up to Father on the ladder./r/n 把漆刷递上去交给梯子上的父亲。/r/n

word.name: painter
word.lx: He is a portrait painter./r/n 他是一个肖像画家。/r/n The painter stretched the canvas on a frame./r/n 画家把油画布紧绷在画框上。/r/n

word.name: painting
word.lx: There are three paintings on the wall./r/n 墙上有三幅画。/r/n That is an oil painting of a landscape in spring./r/n 那是一幅描绘春天景色的油画。/r/n

word.name: pair
word.mean:
n. 双,对,副
v. 使...成对
word.lx: The teacher paired us off for the purpose of the exercise./r/n 为了做练习，老师把我们分成一对一对。/r/n This pair of trousers is too tight for me./r/n 这条裤子我穿太紧了。/r/n

word.name: pairs
word.lx: Cuff-links are only sold in pairs./r/n 袖扣论对卖./r/n The number of electron pairs an atom can share with other atoms./r/n 共用电子对数，共价一个原子与其他原子共用的电子的对数/r/n

word.name: Pakistani
word.mean:
a. 巴基斯坦的
n. 巴基斯坦人

word.name: palatable
word.lx: The truth is not always very palatable./r/n 事实真相并非尽如人意./r/n

word.name: pale
word.mean:
n. 尖木桩(前哨)
a. 苍白的
v. 使苍白
vi. 变得苍白,变得暗淡
word.lx: She paled at the sight of the blood./r/n 她一看到血就脸色苍白。/r/n All other anxieties paled into insignificance besides the possibility of war./r/n 和可能打仗相比，所有其他忧虑都变得微不足道了。/r/n

word.name: palette
word.lx: Developer can install ole control onto the palette or choose from among the ole control include in delphi2.0./r/n 开发者们可以把OLE控制安装到调色板上或从包括在Delphi2。0中的OLE控制中选择。/r/n A limited palette./r/n 有限的色调/r/n

word.name: palm
word.mean:
n. 手掌
n. 棕榈树
vt. 把...藏于手中
word.lx: The goalkeeper just managed to palm the ball over the crossbar./r/n 守门员用手掌将球托出了球门的横木。/r/n He knew the passage like the palm of his hand./r/n 他对这条航线了如指掌。/r/n

word.name: pamper
word.mean: v. 放纵,使吃饱,使过量
word.lx: They pamper themselves after a hard day at work./r/n 他们劳累工作一日之后放纵自己。/r/n The pampered cat refused to eat food without meat./r/n 这只被娇惯的猫拒绝吃没有肉的饭。/r/n

word.name: pamphlet
word.lx: He gave me a pamphlet for my call numbers./r/n 他给了我一个小册子记录电话号码。/r/n The pamphlet contains information of political opinion./r/n 这本小册子含有关于政治主张的资料。/r/n

word.name: pancreas
word.lx: The pancreas can produce substances which help in the digestion of food./r/n 胰脏能产生助消化的物质。/r/n

word.name: pane
word.mean:
n. 窗玻璃,方框,方格
v. 嵌窗玻璃
word.lx: The pane of glass was broken by a football./r/n 一块玻璃被足球打碎了。/r/n A strip of wood or metal separating and holding panes of glass in a window./r/n 窗格条窗户上用来隔开和固定窗玻璃片的木条或者金属条/r/n

word.name: panel
word.mean:
n. 面板,嵌板,仪表盘,座谈小组
v. 嵌镶
专门问题小组
word.lx: This ceiling has a carved panel./r/n 这块天花板带有刻花镶板。/r/n The panel was chosen to take part in discussion./r/n 那个专门小组被选中参加讨论。/r/n

word.name: panorama
word.mean:
a. 全景的,全貌的
n. 全景

word.name: pant
word.mean:
n. 喘息,悸动
v. 喘息,渴望
word.lx: We began to pant before we reached the top of hill./r/n 我们在到达山顶之前已经在喘气了。/r/n He panted out the message./r/n 他上气不接下气地说出此事。/r/n

word.name: panther
word.lx: A panther was killed./r/n 一头美洲狮被杀了。/r/n

word.name: pantry
word.lx: He wanted to find some wine in the pantry./r/n 他想在餐具室里找到一些酒。/r/n No food is left in the pantry except some bread./r/n 食品柜里除了一些面包其它什麽也不剩。/r/n

word.name: pants
word.lx: She wears the pants in her family./r/n 她是家里掌权的人。/r/n This sport jacket will match those pants nicely./r/n 这件运动衫和那条短裤很相配。/r/n

word.name: paper money
word.lx: Because large sum of metal money is heaved and inconvenient to handle, government issue paper money./r/n 因为大量金属货币使用起来笨重不方便，政府便发行了纸币。/r/n

word.name: paperback
word.mean: n. 纸封面本(普及本,平装书)

word.name: par
word.mean:
n. 标准,票面价值,平均数量
a. 票面的,平常的,标准的
word.lx: As a writer she was on a par with the great novelists./r/n 她是与伟大小说家齐名的作家。/r/n He is the elder statesman par excellence./r/n 他是最优秀的年长的国务活动家./r/n

word.name: parachute
word.mean:
n. 降落伞
v. 跳伞
word.lx: When his parachute failed he thought he was a goner./r/n 他的降落伞打不开了, 他想他算完了./r/n Our first parachute jump was an exhilarating experience./r/n 我们第一次跳伞感到兴奋莫名./r/n

word.name: parade
word.mean:
n. 游行
v. 检阅,游行
word.lx: The strikers paraded through the city center./r/n 罢工队伍游行穿过市中心。/r/n The Olympic Games begin with a parade of all the competing nations./r/n 奥运会以参赛各国的列队行进开始。/r/n

word.name: paradox
word.mean: n. 似非而是的隽语,自相矛盾的话
word.lx: It is a paradox that such a rich country should have so many poor people living in it./r/n 如此富足的国家竟有如此多的穷人, 这是个矛盾的现实./r/n Paradox and irony are characteristics of her style./r/n 她善於运用似非而是的隽语和反语./r/n

word.name: paragraph
word.mean:
n. 段落
vt. 将...分段
word.lx: Look at the second paragraph on page fifteen./r/n 请看第十五页的第二段。/r/n The editor struck out the whole paragraph./r/n 编辑把整段全删掉了./r/n

word.name: parallel
word.mean:
a. 平行的
ad. 平行地
n. 平行线
vt. 与...平行
word.lx: My experience in this matter is parallel to yours./r/n 在这件事情上，我的经验和你的类似。/r/n The railway lines run parallel to the road./r/n 铁路线和那条道路平行。/r/n

word.name: paralyse
word.lx: The electricity failure paralysed the water supply./r/n 停电使水供应陷于瘫痪。/r/n She is paralysed in both arms./r/n 她的两只胳膊麻痹。/r/n

word.name: paralysis
word.lx: A person affected with paralysis./r/n 瘫痪病者，麻痹患者患麻痹症的人/r/n The disease results in creeping paralysis./r/n 这种病可发展成脊髓痨./r/n

word.name: paralyze
word.lx: The electricity failure paralyzed the water supply./r/n 停电使水供应陷于瘫痪。/r/n The accident left her paralyzed in both legs./r/n 事故后她的腰部以下瘫痪了。/r/n

word.name: parameter
word.lx: We have to work within the parameters of time and budget./r/n 我们工作受时间和财力所限./r/n Spend by each department have to fall within certain parameter./r/n 每个部门的开支必须属于确定的系数之内。/r/n

word.name: paramount
word.mean:
派拉蒙(美电影公司)
极为重要的
word.lx: The reduction of unemployment should be paramount./r/n 降低失业率应是头等大事。/r/n This matter is of paramount importance./r/n 此事至关重要。/r/n

word.name: paraphernalia
word.lx: All my fishing paraphernalia is in the car./r/n 我的鱼具都在汽车里./r/n He has all the music paraphernalia you can buy./r/n 你能买到的音乐相关产品，他全都有。/r/n

word.name: paraphrase
word.mean:
n. 释义,解述,改写
v. 改写,解述
word.lx: Paraphrase the following passage into two paragraphs./r/n 把下面这一节文章意译成两段。/r/n

word.name: parcel
word.mean:
n. 包裹
v. 打包,捆扎
vt. 打包
word.lx: He parceled up the books./r/n 他把书打成了包。/r/n She sent me the present by parcel post./r/n 她用邮包把礼物寄给了我。/r/n

word.name: pardon
word.mean:
n. 原谅,赦免
v. 宽恕,原谅
word.lx: I beg your pardon./r/n 对不起；请原谅。/r/n If I have offended you, I ask your pardon./r/n 如有冒犯之处，请多多原谅。/r/n

word.name: parent
word.lx: My parents have gone to Hangzhou for holiday./r/n 我父母已经去杭州度假了。/r/n Being a parent can be hard work./r/n 当父母可是件辛苦的事。/r/n

word.name: parenthesis
word.lx: The statistics were given in parenthesis./r/n 统计数字在括号里./r/n One have to dismount from an idea and get into saddle again at every parenthesis./r/n 每当遇上一个括号，就叫人不得不从一种想法下马，然后再次骑上马鞍。/r/n

word.name: Paris
word.lx: Paris is the capital of France./r/n 巴黎是法国的首都。/r/n First prize in the raffle is a holiday for two in Paris./r/n 抽奖销售的头奖是两个人到巴黎度假旅游。/r/n

word.name: park
word.mean:
n. 公园,停车处
v. 停车,置于,停车
word.lx: I often take my children to play in the park./r/n 我经常带我的孩子们去公园玩。/r/n You are not allowed to park here./r/n 此处不准停车。/r/n

word.name: parliament
word.lx: The Conservative Party won 230 seats in Parliament./r/n 保守党在议会获得了230 个席位。/r/n The President announced the dissolution of Parliament./r/n 总统宣布了议会解散。/r/n

word.name: parlor
word.lx: My sister goes to a beauty parlor once a week./r/n 我妹妹每周去一次美容院。/r/n Rock music blasted full from the parlor./r/n 摇滚乐声震屋宇，从客厅传来。/r/n

word.name: parody
word.mean:
n. 打油诗文,诙谐的改编诗文,拙劣的模仿
v. 拙劣模仿,作模仿诗文
word.lx: The trial was a parody of justice./r/n 这次审判是对公正的一次拙劣的模拟/r/n An exaggerated or grotesque imitation, such as a parody of a literary work./r/n 模仿一种夸张或怪诞的模仿，如对一个文学作品的滑稽模仿/r/n

word.name: parrot
word.mean:
n. 鹦鹉
v. 学舌
word.lx: He talks like a parrot and just repeats what he heard./r/n 他只是鹦鹉学舌，拾人牙慧罢了。/r/n This parrot is an amazing mimic./r/n 这只鹦鹉很会学舌。/r/n

word.name: part
word.mean:
n. 部份,零件,角色
v. 分开,分离,分配
ad. 部份地,有几分
word.lx: I hope we can part as friends./r/n 我希望我们和和气气地分手。/r/n This piece of glass seems to be part of a lamp./r/n 这片玻璃似乎是一盏灯的一部分。/r/n

word.name: partake
word.lx: His manner partakes of insolence./r/n 他的态度带有几分傲慢。/r/n Will you partake of a drink with us?/r/n 和我们一同喝一杯好吗？/r/n

word.name: partially
word.mean: ad. 部份地,一部份地,不公平地
word.lx: He was only partially to blame for the accident./r/n 他对事故只应负部分责任。/r/n The maneuvering of an aircraft partially into a crosswind to compensate for drift./r/n 飞机侧航部分操纵飞行器使之进入逆风以抵消滑行/r/n

word.name: participant
word.mean:
a. 参与的
n. 参加者,参与者
word.lx: Select the place where you want to point the camera(each participant, whiteboard, etc.)./r/n 选择想要瞄准的摄像机位置（每一位参加者，白板等）。/r/n A participant in a feud./r/n 结下世仇的人结下世仇的参与者/r/n

word.name: participation
word.lx: We win the game because of his participation./r/n 由于他的参与，我们赢了比赛。/r/n His participation is not welcomed./r/n 他的参与不受欢迎。/r/n

word.name: participator
word.mean:
a. 参加的
n. 参加者

word.name: particularize
word.mean: v. 详细说明,列举,大书特书

word.name: particulate
word.lx: Pulverized particulate matter ejected by volcanic eruption./r/n 火山灰火山爆发喷射出来的粉末状颗粒物质/r/n

word.name: parting
word.mean:
n. 分别,分歧处
a. 离别的,逝去的
vbl. 分开,分配
word.lx: He remembered her parting kiss in the following years./r/n 在以后的岁月中，他一直记着她临别时的一吻。/r/n They exchanged a final kiss before parting./r/n 他们最後相互亲吻而分离./r/n

word.name: partisan
word.mean:
n. 党羽,同党的人,游击队员
a. 效忠的,献身的,盲目推崇的

word.name: partition
word.mean:
n. 分割,隔离物,隔墙
v. 区分,隔开,分割

word.name: partly
word.lx: What you say is partly true./r/n 你说的有几分是真实的。/r/n We are all partly to blame./r/n 我们都必须负一部分责任。/r/n

word.name: partner
word.mean:
n. 合作者,搭档
v. 同...合作,做...的搭档
word.lx: Are you sure you want him to be your partner?/r/n 你肯定你想要他作你的终身伴侣吗？/r/n The business is owned by two partners./r/n 这家商行为两名合伙人所拥有。/r/n

word.name: partnership
word.lx: I enter into partnership with him to do export business./r/n 我与他合伙做出口生意。/r/n She worked in partnership with her sister./r/n 她和妹妹合股经营。/r/n

word.name: partridge
word.lx: There is a dish of partridge at supper./r/n 晚饭时有一盘鹧鸪做的菜。/r/n

word.name: part-time
word.mean:
a. 兼职的, 部分时间的
ad. 部分时间, 兼职地

word.name: party
word.lx: He was admitted to the Party last year./r/n 他去年入党了。/r/n When does the birthday party take place?/r/n 生日庆祝会什么时候举行？/r/n

word.name: parvenu
word.lx: The parvenu invited guests but they all hung off./r/n 这个暴发户邀请了客人，但是他们都不愿意去。/r/n

word.name: pass
word.mean:
n. 途径,通行,及格
v. 经过,消逝,传递
word.lx: I passed the store on my way to the library./r/n 我在去图书馆的路上经过了那家商店。/r/n Please show me your monthly bus pass./r/n 请出示公共汽车月票。/r/n

word.name: passable
word.lx: Fairly good; passable./r/n 尚好的，较好的；过得去的/r/n Quality barely passable but price unattractive/r/n 质量尚可但价格并不便宜。/r/n

word.name: passage
word.mean: n. 通道,走廊,一段文章
word.lx: The bridge is not strong enough to allow the passage of vehicles./r/n 这座桥不够牢固，车辆不能通行。/r/n The police kept a clear passage for the traffic./r/n 警方使来往车辆畅通无阻。/r/n

word.name: passenger
word.lx: The train carries many passengers./r/n 火车载着许多旅客。/r/n This is a large passenger airliner./r/n 这是一架大型客机。/r/n

word.name: passerby
word.lx: Her queer way of dressing attracted the attention of the passerby./r/n 她古怪的着装方式引起了过路人的注意。/r/n The passerby was very grateful to us for directing him when he mistook his way./r/n 这个过路人非常感激我们在他迷路时给他指了路。/r/n

word.name: passion
word.lx: The poet expressed his burning passion for the woman he loved./r/n 诗人表达了他对所爱的女子火一般的激情。/r/n He has a passion for photography./r/n 他对摄影有强烈的爱好。/r/n

word.name: passionate
word.mean: a. 热情的,热烈的,易怒的
word.lx: His passionate speech had an effect on our emotions./r/n 他的热情的演讲打动了我们的感情。/r/n The novelist characterizes his heroine as capricious and passionate./r/n 这位小说家把女主人公刻画成反覆无常而又多情的人./r/n

word.name: passionately
word.lx: He is passionately opposed to racial discrimination./r/n 他极端反对种族歧视./r/n She is passionately fond of tennis./r/n 她热爱网球./r/n

word.name: passive
word.mean:
a. 被动的,消极的
n. 被动性
word.lx: He played a passive role in the marriage./r/n 他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。/r/n Passive character, attitude, quality, or behavior./r/n 消极主义消极被动的性格、态度、品质或行为/r/n

word.name: passivity
word.mean: n. 被动性（尤指无行动,迟钝,顺从）

word.name: passport
word.lx: I hold a French passport./r/n 我持有法国护照。/r/n The only passport to success is hard work./r/n 通往成功的唯一途径是努力奋斗。/r/n

word.name: past
word.mean:
a. 过去的
ad. 过
n. 过去
prep. 过,经过
word.lx: Our country has a glorious past./r/n 我们的国家有一段光辉的历史。/r/n We drove past the house./r/n 我们开车经过那座房子。/r/n

word.name: pasta
word.mean: n. 生面团。意大利通心粉。
word.lx: Medium-sized tubular pasta./r/n 意大利通心粉中等大小的管状面食/r/n Large-sized tubes of pasta stuffed with meat or cheese and baked in a tomato or cream sauce./r/n 烤空心粉塞肉或干酪并加番茄或奶油汁烘烤而成的大空心粉条/r/n

word.name: paste
word.mean:
n. 糊,浆糊
v. 粘,贴
word.lx: Would you like some tomato paste?/r/n 你要西红柿酱吗？/r/n He pasted up a notice on the wall./r/n 他把一张布告贴在墙上。/r/n

word.name: pastel
word.mean: n. 粉蜡笔,粉蜡笔画,漫笔作画
word.lx: She works in (ie uses) pastels./r/n 她用彩色粉笔作画./r/n Pastel colours are restful to the eye./r/n 清淡柔和的颜色可以养目。/r/n

word.name: pastiche
word.mean: n. 混成曲, 模仿画
word.lx: He has a gift for pastiche./r/n 他有模仿他人作品的天赋./r/n

word.name: pastime
word.lx: My favorite pastime is reading./r/n 我最喜爱的消遣是读书。/r/n Writing is a solitary pastime./r/n 写作是独自一人的消遣./r/n

word.name: pastor
word.lx: A governing body of pastors and elders in certain Reformed churches, having jurisdiction over local churches./r/n 长老监督会一些改革派教会的由牧师和长老组成的管理机构，有对地区教会的裁决权/r/n

word.name: pastoral
word.mean:
n. 牧歌,田园诗
a. 牧人的,田园生活的,牧师的
word.lx: The picture showed a charming pastoral scene of cows drinking from a stream./r/n 这幅画表现了牛在溪边饮水的迷人的田园风光。/r/n The priest makes pastoral visits every Tuesday./r/n 牧师每星期二作履行神职的访问。/r/n

word.name: pastry
word.lx: You eat too much pastry./r/n 你吃的点心太多了。/r/n She can make Danish pastry./r/n 她会做丹麦点心。/r/n

word.name: pat
word.mean:
n. 轻拍
v. 轻拍,拍
ad. 适时,正好,恰好
word.lx: Snowflakes were patting against the window./r/n 雪花轻轻拍打着窗户。/r/n The government stood pat in its policy./r/n 政府坚持自己的政策。/r/n

word.name: patchwork
word.mean: n. 修补工作(拼凑的东西,混杂物)
word.lx: A small piece of cloth used for patchwork./r/n 补钉一小片用来修补用的布/r/n

word.name: patchy
word.mean: a. 斑驳的,不调和的,不完整的,拼凑的
word.lx: A horse with patchy markings of white and another color./r/n 杂色马，花马一匹有白色或另外一种色斑的马/r/n My knowledge of science is patchy./r/n 我的科学知识只是一鳞半爪。/r/n

word.name: pate
word.lx: He has a shiny bald pate./r/n 他是个亮光光的秃顶。/r/n Professor Pate, the famous phrenologist./r/n 著名的颅相学家佩特师傅./r/n

word.name: patent
word.mean:
n. 专利权,执照,专利品
a. 专利的,显著的,新奇的
v. 取得...的专利权,请准专利
word.lx: He got a patent for this invention./r/n 他获得了这项发明的专利权。/r/n The patent runs out in three years time./r/n 这项专利期限为3年。/r/n

word.name: paternalism
word.mean: n. 家长式管理,家长式领导

word.name: paternity
word.lx: Paternity case; paternity suit./r/n 父亲血缘案例；父亲血缘诉讼案/r/n

word.name: path
word.mean: n. 路线,轨道,路程,小路,小径
word.lx: Their daily trips through the jungle have made a path in the thick undergrowth./r/n 他们每天往返穿过丛林，已在茂密的矮丛中踩出了一条小路。/r/n The path grew more obscure in the fading light./r/n 小径在渐渐消失的光线下变得更暗了。/r/n

word.name: pathetic
word.mean: a. 悲哀的,可怜的,感伤的
word.lx: His tears were pathetic to witness./r/n 他的眼泪引起在场人的怜悯。/r/n We saw the pathetic sight of starving children./r/n 我们看到挨饿的儿童悲惨可怜的样子。/r/n

word.name: pathogen
word.lx: Inherited, acquired, or induced resistance to infection by a specific pathogen./r/n 免疫力遗传的、后天的或诱发的对特定的病原感染的抵抗能力/r/n

word.name: pathological
word.lx: A localized pathological change in a bodily organ or tissue./r/n 机能障碍，器官损害身体内器官或组织局部的病理转变/r/n The pathological condition in which such painful masses occur./r/n 痔疾这些令人疼痛的病块出现的病理状态/r/n

word.name: pathos
word.lx: The play is notable for the pathos of its final scene./r/n 该剧以最后一场的哀婉动人而著称。/r/n

word.name: pathway
word.lx: The pathway was rough and covered with little stones./r/n 这条路高低不平，铺满了小石头。/r/n

word.name: patience
word.lx: His rudeness was beyond my patience./r/n 他的粗暴使我无法忍受。/r/n I must tell you that his patience has its limit./r/n 我必须告诉你，他的耐心是有限的。/r/n

word.name: patient
word.mean:
a. 有耐心的,能忍耐的
n. 病人
word.lx: I think I am quite a patient person./r/n 我认为我是一个相当有耐心的人。/r/n The patient finally died from cancer./r/n 那位病人最终死于癌症。/r/n

word.name: patiently
word.lx: The children waited patiently in expectation of (ie expecting) the magician./r/n 孩子们耐心地等待著魔术师./r/n He was angry, nevertheless he listened patiently./r/n 他生气了，但他还是耐心地听我说。/r/n

word.name: patio
word.lx: A veranda or roofed patio./r/n 门廊走廊或有顶棚的天井/r/n An open, often paved area adjacent to a house serving as an outdoor living space; a patio./r/n 内院，庭院紧邻房间的一块开阔、通常铺过的区域，作为室外活动场所；庭院/r/n

word.name: patois
word.lx: He speaks the local patois./r/n 他会说当地方言./r/n

word.name: patriarch
word.lx: Her patriarch is strict with her./r/n 她的家长对她要求很严。/r/n The patriarch of the herd./r/n 群众里年高德劭的人/r/n

word.name: patriarchal
word.mean: a. 家长的,族长的,由族长统治的

word.name: patrician
word.mean:
a. 贵族的,显贵的
n. 贵族

word.name: patrimony
word.mean: n. 祖传的财物, <喻>继承物, 遗产

word.name: patriot
word.lx: She is a patriot to her country./r/n 她热爱她的祖国。/r/n He was anxious to show himself patriot./r/n 他急于表明自己是个爱国者。/r/n

word.name: patriotic
word.lx: His patriotic action raised our admiration./r/n 他的爱国行为激起了我们的敬佩。/r/n A Japanese battle cry or patriotic cheer./r/n 万岁日本人在进攻时的呐喊或爱国的欢呼；/r/n

word.name: patriotism
word.lx: We are all deeply moved by his patriotism./r/n 我们都被他的爱国精神深深感动了。/r/n They criticize their opponents under the cover of patriotism./r/n 他们借口爱国来抨击反对者。/r/n

word.name: patron
word.lx: This store has many patrons./r/n 这家商店有许多老顾客。/r/n Modern artists have difficulty in finding patrons./r/n 现代艺术家们很难找到赞助人。/r/n

word.name: patronage
word.lx: We thank you for your patronage./r/n 我们谢谢您的惠顾。/r/n The theatre is under the patronage of the Arts Council./r/n 那家剧院得到了艺术委员会的赞助。/r/n

word.name: patronize
