word.lx: The restaurant is patronized by politicians and journalists./r/n 这家饭馆常有政治家和记者光顾./r/n He resented the way she patronized him./r/n 她待他那种屈尊纡贵的样子, 他十分愤恨./r/n

word.name: patter
word.mean:
n. 急速拍打声,轻快脚步声,行话
v. 急速地念,滴答地响,发出急速轻拍声
word.lx: The falling leaves pattered against the windowpanes./r/n 落叶嗒塔地打在玻璃窗上。/r/n They will soon be hearing the patter of tiny feet./r/n 他们很快就会有个小宝宝了。/r/n

word.name: pattern
word.mean:
n. 图案,式样,典范
v. 仿造,模仿
word.lx: This cloth has a pattern of blue and white squares./r/n 这种布有蓝白格子的图案。/r/n He patterned himself upon a man he admired./r/n 他模仿一个他钦佩的人。/r/n

word.name: patty
word.lx: I made some patties for them./r/n 我给他们做了一些小馅饼。/r/n Patty dawdled away four years in college./r/n 帕蒂在大学里混了四年。/r/n

word.name: Paul
word.lx: His Holiness Pope John Paul II was welcomed by the crowd./r/n 尊敬的保罗教皇陛下受到人群的欢迎。/r/n Peter sat next to Paul on the sofa./r/n 彼得挨著保罗坐在沙发上。/r/n

word.name: Paula
word.lx: Paula turned everything in the house upside-down when she was trying to find her missing necklace./r/n 波拉在寻找她丢失的项链时，把屋子里的所有东西翻得乱七八糟。/r/n

word.name: paunch
word.mean:
n. 腹,胃,大肚子
v. 剖腹,取出内脏

word.name: pauper
word.mean: n. 贫民,被救济者,穷人
word.lx: An impoverished person; a pauper./r/n 穷人贫困的人；贫民/r/n He was degraded in their eyes; he had lost caste and station before the very paupers./r/n 他在他们的眼光里是坍台了；他在贫民前面丢了体面和地位。/r/n

word.name: pave
word.lx: This agreement will pave the way for a lasting peace./r/n 这个协议将为持久和平铺路。/r/n The road was paved with cobblestones./r/n 那条路是用鹅卵石铺成的。/r/n

word.name: pavement
word.lx: No parking on the pavement./r/n 人行道/路面上不许停车。/r/n Several pedestrians had come to grief on the icy pavement./r/n 几个行人在结冰的人行道上滑倒了./r/n

word.name: pavilion
word.mean:
n. 大帐蓬,观众席,楼阁
v. 搭帐蓬
word.lx: The reception was held in a pavilion on the lawn./r/n 招待会在草地中的亭子里举行。/r/n Look, the pavilion is high in the sky./r/n 噍，那亭子高高地立在空中呢。/r/n

word.name: paw
word.mean:
n. 手掌,手爪
v. 以蹄扒地,笨拙地使用,费力地前进
word.lx: The kitten has very soft paws./r/n 小猫的爪子很软。/r/n The dog was howling its paw was hurt./r/n 那条狗在嗥叫--它的爪子受伤了./r/n

word.name: pawn
word.mean:
n. 典当,抵押物,人质
v. 当掉,以发誓
word.lx: The painter had to pawn his watch to pay for a meal./r/n 这位画家不得不把表当掉买顿饭吃。/r/n We are mere pawns in the struggle for power./r/n 在权力斗争中我们只是一批小卒。/r/n

word.name: pawnbroker
word.lx: Having paid off the pawnbroker, I now had my watch out of hock./r/n 偿还了当铺老板的债，我赎回了自己的手表。/r/n The shop of a pawnbroker./r/n 当铺开当铺者的店/r/n

word.name: payable
word.mean: a. 可付的,应付的,有利益的
word.lx: L/c is payable against your draft./r/n 信用证凭汇票付款。/r/n The payment of the goods is payable in instalments./r/n 货款可以分期支付。/r/n

word.name: payer
word.lx: The government should have increased family allowances and clawed it back from rich tax payers./r/n 政府本来应该增加家庭津贴并向富有的纳税人收回这笔支出。/r/n

word.name: payment
word.lx: They demand prompt payment./r/n 他们要求立即付款。/r/n The payment of the goods is payable in instalments./r/n 货款可以分期支付。/r/n

word.name: payoff
word.mean:
n. 清算(成果,发工资,放线装置)
a. 得出结果的

word.name: payout
word.lx: The company only exists on payouts from the government./r/n 这个公司仅靠政府救济补贴生存。/r/n

word.name: PC
word.lx: Maintenance of PC is in my element./r/n 我对电脑的维修保养很在行。/r/n

word.name: pea
word.lx: The sisters are as alike as two peas./r/n 两姐妹长得一模一样。/r/n This kind of pea has a long pod./r/n 这种豌豆长着长豆荚。/r/n

word.name: peaceable
word.lx: I was pleased to see how peaceable the horse had become./r/n 我很高兴地看到这匹马变得这么温顺。/r/n

word.name: peaceful
word.lx: China is a peaceful country./r/n 中国是一个爱好和平的国家。/r/n This area is peaceful except for a few skirmishes in the distance./r/n 除了远处的零星的小冲突之外，这个地区是和平的。/r/n

word.name: peacefully
word.mean: ad. 宁静地,安祥地,爱好和平地,喜安静地
word.lx: The baby was slumbering peacefully./r/n 孩子睡得正香./r/n Now it is generally accepted that the countries with different social systems can coexist peacefully./r/n ＂现在一般都承认，不同社会制度的国家可以和平共处。＂/r/n

word.name: peach
word.mean:
n. 桃子
v. 揭发,检举
word.lx: The beauty of the peach blossom is beyond description./r/n 桃花的美丽难以形容。/r/n The fuzz on a peach./r/n 桃子上的绒毛/r/n

word.name: peacock
word.lx: Peacocks are more beautiful than peahens./r/n 雄孔雀要比雌孔雀漂亮。/r/n The sparrow is sorry for the peacock at the burden of its tail./r/n 麻雀看见孔雀负担着它的翎尾，替它担忧。/r/n

word.name: peahen
word.lx: Peacocks are more beautiful than peahens./r/n 雄孔雀要比雌孔雀漂亮。/r/n

word.name: peak
word.mean:
n. 山顶,顶点,帽舌
v. 到达高点,消瘦,竖起
word.lx: Tourism is at its peak in August./r/n 旅游业在八月份达到高峰。/r/n The mountain peaks are covered with snow all year./r/n 山顶上终年积雪。/r/n

word.name: peal
word.lx: They burst into peals of laughter./r/n 他们爆发出阵阵笑声。/r/n Oh, the108 peal of the temple bell have start./r/n 哦，除夕的钟声开始响了。/r/n

word.name: peanut
word.lx: He pays his workers peanuts./r/n 他付给他的工人极少的工资。/r/n He likes to eat peanut jam./r/n 他喜欢吃花生酱。/r/n

word.name: peanuts
word.lx: He tossed the peanuts into his mouth one at a time./r/n 他每次将一粒花生扔进嘴里。/r/n Peanuts do well in this area./r/n 这一带花生长得很好。/r/n

word.name: pear
word.lx: Would you like a pear?/r/n 想吃梨吗？/r/n This salad is made of apple, pear, potato and celery./r/n 这份色拉是由苹果、梨、土豆和芹菜做成的。/r/n

word.name: pearl
word.mean:
n. 珍珠
v. 用珍珠装饰
word.lx: She wears a pearl necklace today./r/n 今天她戴了一条珍珠项链。/r/n A pearl or mineral that has been cut and polished for use as an ornament./r/n 宝石，珍珠珍珠或矿石，已被切割或抛光而作为装饰品/r/n

word.name: Pearl Harbor
word.lx: The attack on Pearl Harbor was a crushing calamity./r/n 偷袭珍珠港（对美军来说）是一场毁灭性的灾难。/r/n

word.name: pearly
word.lx: I like pearly ornament./r/n 我喜欢珍珠饰物。/r/n The pearly sheen absorbed many people./r/n 珍珠的光泽吸引了很多人。/r/n

word.name: peasant
word.mean:
n. 农民
n. 民工
word.lx: The local lords often treated the peasants badly./r/n 当地地主常常虐待农民。/r/n The failure of their crops spelt disaster for the peasant farmers./r/n 作物歉收农民就要受灾./r/n

word.name: peat
word.lx: Root the cuttings in peat./r/n 把插枝扦插泥炭中./r/n A broad area of open land, often high but poorly drained, with patches of heath and peat bogs./r/n 沼泽一片大面积的开阔地，通常很高但排水不好，有成片的荒野和泥炭田/r/n

word.name: peat bog
word.lx: A broad area of open land, often high but poorly drained, with patches of heath and peat bogs./r/n 沼泽一片大面积的开阔地，通常很高但排水不好，有成片的荒野和泥炭田/r/n

word.name: pebble
word.mean:
n. 鹅卵石
v. (用卵石)铺
word.lx: There are many pebbles on the riverbed./r/n 河床上有很多卵石。/r/n He dropped a pebble from the bridge and waited for the plop./r/n 他从桥上扔下一颗卵石, 然後等著听那扑通的一声./r/n

word.name: pecan
word.lx: A confection made of nut kernels, especially almonds or pecans, stirred in boiling sugar syrup until crisp and brown./r/n 干果糖用干果仁，尤指杏仁或山核桃仁在沸腾的糖浆里搅拌直至发焦变脆而制成的蜜饯/r/n

word.name: peck
word.mean:
n. 啄痕,啄食
v. 以喙啄,啄食,吹毛求疵
word.lx: That bird tried to peck me./r/n 那只鸟想啄我。/r/n The boy started pecking at the keys of the piano./r/n 男孩开始在钢琴上乱弹一气。/r/n

word.name: peculation
word.lx: He became manager but was put down from the office fur peculation./r/n 他成了一位经理，但由于盗用公款而被降职了。/r/n

word.name: peculiar
word.mean: a. 奇怪的,古怪的,特殊的,独特的
word.lx: The food has a peculiar taste./r/n 这食物有种怪味道。/r/n This style of cooking is peculiar to the country./r/n 这种烹调方法是那个国家的特色。/r/n

word.name: peculiarity
word.lx: These small spiced cakes are a peculiarity of the region./r/n 这些别有风味的小蛋糕是该地的特产。/r/n She has peculiarities on diet./r/n 她有饮食方面的怪癖。/r/n

word.name: peculiarly
word.lx: Hunting foxes is a peculiarly English sport./r/n 猎狐是英国特有的运动./r/n

word.name: pedagogue
word.mean: n. 教师,教育者,爱假装博学者

word.name: pedagogy
word.mean: n. 教育学,教授法,教育
word.lx: Instruction; teaching; pedagogy./r/n 指导；教学；教学法/r/n

word.name: pedal
word.mean:
n. 踏板
a. 脚的,踏脚的
v. 用脚踏动,踩踏板
word.lx: The pedal of a cycle is attached to a crank./r/n 自行车的踏板与曲柄相连。/r/n He pushed hard on the brake pedal to avoid a collision./r/n 他使劲踩下煞车踏板以避免撞车。/r/n

word.name: pedant
word.mean: n. 炫学者,自夸学者的人,空谈家

word.name: pedantic
word.mean: a. 卖弄学问的,假装学者的,吹毛求疵的,钻牛角尖的
word.lx: Pedantic attention to detail or rules./r/n 拘泥形式，墨守陈规过于拘泥于细节或规则/r/n A dull, pedantic speaker or writer./r/n 学究枯燥而迂腐的讲话人或作者/r/n

word.name: pedantry
word.mean: n. 假装学者,卖弄学问,炫学

word.name: peddle
word.mean: v. 挑卖,沿街叫卖,散播

word.name: peddler
word.lx: The peddler tried to sell me some small articles./r/n 那个小贩试图卖给我一些小东西。/r/n A peddler or dealer of cheap goods./r/n 小贩卖廉价货的小贩或商人/r/n

word.name: pedestal
word.mean:
n. 基架,座,基础
v. 加座,搁在台上,支持
word.lx: The workers put the statue on its pedestal./r/n 工人们把雕像放到基座上。/r/n The statue reposes on a pedestal./r/n 塑像安放在台座上。/r/n

word.name: pedestrian
word.mean:
a. 徒步的,缺乏想像的
n. 行人
word.lx: The driver was slanging a pedestrian who had got in his way./r/n 那司机破口大骂挡他的路的行人./r/n Being a good pedestrian is just as important as being a good driver./r/n 做一个好的行人就像做一个好的司机一样重要。/r/n

word.name: pediatrics
word.lx: The branch of pediatrics that deals with the diseases and care of newborn infants./r/n 新生儿学儿科学的一个分支，研究新生儿疾病和护理/r/n

word.name: pedicure
word.mean: n. 修脚趾甲,足部治疗

word.name: pedigree
word.mean:
n. 家谱
a. 纯种的
word.lx: He was proud of his impeccable pedigree./r/n 他为他出身于名门望族而骄傲。/r/n Direct descent from an ancestor; lineage or pedigree./r/n 家系从一个祖先传下来的直接世系；家系或家族/r/n

word.name: pedlar
word.lx: The pedlar tried to sell me some small articles./r/n 那个小贩试图卖给我一些小东西。/r/n My grandmother dickered with the pedlar over the price of apples./r/n 我祖母为苹果的价格与小贩讨价还价。/r/n

word.name: peel
word.mean:
n. 皮
v. 削...皮,剥落,脱皮
word.lx: Would you peel me an orange?/r/n 你给我剥一个橘子好吗？/r/n The paint was peeling./r/n 油漆正在剥落。/r/n

word.name: peeling
word.lx: Something, such as a skin or peel, that has been pared off./r/n 削皮，剥皮，削下物如皮肤或果皮等削下来的东西/r/n The paint was peeling./r/n 油漆正在剥落。/r/n

word.name: peep
word.mean:
n. 瞥见,偷看,初现
v. 窥视,慢慢露出,吱吱叫
word.lx: The flowers are beginning to peep through the soil./r/n 花正开始破土而出。/r/n I caught him peeping at my paper./r/n 他偷看我的论文时，我当场抓住了他。/r/n

word.name: peeper
word.lx: Acid rain is harmful to amphibians such as salamanders, spring peepers, and frogs./r/n 酸雨是有害于两栖的动物，例如鲵、春天里唧唧叫的小动物和青蛙。/r/n

word.name: peerless
word.mean: a. 无比的,出类的,无双的
word.lx: To be a peerless man is very difficult./r/n 做一个出类拔萃的人是很不容易的。/r/n His Chinese kung fu is peerless./r/n 他的中国功夫是无敌的。/r/n

word.name: peeve
word.lx: It peeves me to be ordered out of my own house./r/n 命令我从自己的家中出去, 真太气人了./r/n

word.name: peevish
word.mean: a. 易怒的,暴躁的,撒娇的
word.lx: Inclined to be vexed or troubled; peevish./r/n 烦躁的易被激怒或困扰的；易怒的/r/n A peevish child is unhappy and makes others unhappy./r/n 一个脾气暴躁的孩子自己不高兴也使别人不高兴。/r/n

word.name: peg
word.mean:
n. 钉,椿,藉口
v. 钉木椿,用椿
word.lx: First hammer the tent pegs into the ground, then tie the ropes onto them./r/n 先把系帐篷的桩子打进地里，再把绳子系在桩子上。/r/n Their pride in their achievements has come down a peg./r/n 他们对自己的成就不再觉得那么了不起了。/r/n

word.name: pejorative
word.mean:
a. 退化的,轻蔑的
n. 轻蔑语

word.name: pelagic
word.lx: The ship is engaged in pelagic fishery./r/n 这艘船从事远洋渔业。/r/n

word.name: pellet
word.lx: A hard pellet of snow and ice./r/n 雹块一种坚硬的冰雪团/r/n A small pill or pellet./r/n 小药丸，小糖丸/r/n

word.name: pell-mell
word.mean:
ad. 乱七八糟地, 混乱地
a. 杂乱的, 混乱的
n. 乱七八糟, 混乱, 杂乱
word.lx: The children rushed pell-mell down the stairs./r/n 孩子们乱哄哄地冲下楼去./r/n The books were scattered pell-mell over the floor./r/n 书本凌乱地散置在地上./r/n

word.name: pellucid
word.mean: a. 透明的,澄清的,明了的

word.name: pelt
word.mean:
n. 投掷,疾行,毛皮
v. 投掷,急降,攻击
word.lx: The rain was pelting down./r/n 大雨倾盆。/r/n The crowds pelted bad eggs at the speaker./r/n 群众纷纷向演讲人扔臭鸡蛋。/r/n

word.name: pen
word.mean:
n. 钢笔
v. 圈进
word.lx: May I borrow your pen?/r/n 我可以借用你的钢笔吗？/r/n She fumbled about in her handbag for a pen./r/n 她在手提袋中搜寻钢笔。/r/n

word.name: penal
word.lx: Deportation to a penal colony./r/n 流放放逐到一个流刑地/r/n

word.name: penalize
word.mean: v. 处刑,宣告有罪,使不利
word.lx: The new law penalizes the poorest members of society./r/n 新法规对社会中最贫困者不 利./r/n People who drive when they are drunk should be heavily penalized./r/n 对酒醉开车者应予重罚./r/n

word.name: penalty
word.lx: She has paid the penalty for her crimes with five years in prison./r/n 她因犯罪受到惩罚被判刑五年。/r/n One of the penalties of fame is that people point at you on the street./r/n 当了名人的麻烦之一是在街上被人指指点点。/r/n

word.name: penance
word.lx: He had done penance for his sins; we should forgive him./r/n 他已经为赎罪自我惩罚了，我们应该原谅他。/r/n

word.name: pence
word.lx: Potatoes are 20 pence a pound./r/n 土豆每磅20便士./r/n The shares are currently being quoted at 54 pence a share./r/n 该股票现在的报价是每股54便士.*/r/n

word.name: penchant
word.lx: She has a penchant for Indian food./r/n 她爱吃印度食物./r/n

word.name: pencil
word.mean:
n. 铅笔
v. 用铅笔写
word.lx: I noted down his telephone number with a pencil near the telephone./r/n 我用电话旁的一根铅笔记下了他的电话号码。/r/n My pencil is blunt, could you lend me a knife to sharpen it?/r/n 我的铅笔钝了，你能借我把刀子削一削吗？/r/n

word.name: pendent
word.mean: a. 下垂的,悬而未决的,即将来临的
word.lx: When will the pendent problem be solved?/r/n 这个悬而未决的问题什么时候能解决呢？/r/n

word.name: pending
word.mean:
a. 未决定的,待决的
prep. 直到,当...的时候,在...期间
word.lx: The lawsuit was then pending./r/n 那件讼案因而尚未解决./r/n A decision on this matter is pending./r/n 此事即将作出决定./r/n

word.name: pendulous
word.mean: a. 下垂的,摇摆的,摇摆不定的

word.name: pendulum
word.lx: The pendulum of the clock in my room is a bear./r/n 我房间的钟摆是小熊形状的。/r/n A pendulum oscillates./r/n 摆锤能摆动./r/n

word.name: penetrate
word.lx: The headlamps penetrated the fog./r/n 车的前灯的光射进雾中。/r/n Nothing we say penetrates his thick skull!/r/n 无论我们说什麽他都不懂。/r/n

word.name: penetrating
word.lx: The penetrating odor of garlic soon filled the entire apartment./r/n 大蒜刺鼻的气味很快就弥散了整个屋子/r/n

word.name: penetration
word.lx: Resistant to penetration by water but not entirely waterproof./r/n 抗水的能抵抗水的渗透但不完全防水的/r/n He writes with penetration./r/n 他写的文章尖锐深刻。/r/n

word.name: penguin
word.lx: The birth of a baby penguin in the zoo was widely reported./r/n 动物园里小企鹅的出生受到了广泛的报道。/r/n The penguin is a flightless bird./r/n 企鹅是一种不会飞的鸟。/r/n

word.name: penicillin
word.lx: The nurse injected penicillin into her arm./r/n 护士给她的胳膊注射了青霉素。/r/n Allergic children; highly allergic to penicillin./r/n 过敏的儿童；对青霉素高度过敏/r/n

word.name: penitentiary
word.mean:
n. 听悔僧,教诲师,赎免局
a. 改过的,感化的,惩罚的
word.lx: A place where persons convicted or accused of crimes are confined; a penitentiary or a jail./r/n 监狱，拘留所监禁被指控或认定有罪的人的地方；拘留所或监狱/r/n

word.name: pennant
word.mean: n. 三角小旗(信号旗,奖旗)
word.lx: A pennant lolling from the mast./r/n 信号旗松散地从桅杆上垂下来/r/n

word.name: penny
word.lx: I only have a few pennies with me./r/n 我身上只有几个便士。/r/n Penny wise, pound foolish./r/n 【谚】小事聪明，大事糊涂；抓了芝麻，丢了西瓜。/r/n

word.name: pennyworth
word.mean: n. 一辨士的价钱,价值一辨士之物,少额
word.lx: Got my pennyworth at that price./r/n 我以低廉的价格成交了这笔买卖/r/n

word.name: pens
word.lx: There are two pens on the table./r/n 桌上有二枝钢笔。/r/n The students went into the examination room, armed to the teeth with pens, pencils, rulers, computers and so on./r/n 同学们带着钢笔，铅笔，尺子，计算器走进考场，他们个个装备齐全。/r/n

word.name: pension
word.mean:
n. 退休金,年金,抚恤金
v. 发给退休金
word.lx: He retired on a company pension./r/n 他退休时得到公司的退休金。/r/n Size of pension depends on length of service with the company./r/n 养老金的多少取决於为公司服务年限的长短./r/n

word.name: pensioner
word.lx: They are all old-age pensioners./r/n 他们都是领养老金的人。/r/n The tax threshold for a single pensioner is 450 dollars./r/n 单身养老金领取者的征税起点是450美元。/r/n

word.name: pensive
word.mean: a. 沉思的,愁眉苦脸的
word.lx: The painting can inspire a pensive mood./r/n 这幅画能引人沉思。/r/n The woman in this painting has a pensive smile./r/n 这幅画上的女人脸上露出忧郁的微笑。/r/n

word.name: penthouse
word.lx: The family have booked the penthouse suite for two weeks./r/n 这个家庭已预定了两周的楼顶公寓套房。/r/n

word.name: penultimate
word.lx: November is the penultimate month of the year./r/n 十一月份是一年中倒数的第二个月。/r/n

word.name: penurious
word.mean: a. 吝啬的, 缺乏的

word.name: penury
word.lx: Laid-off workers fall into penury./r/n 下岗职工陷入贫困。/r/n Peoples in Africa are living in penury./r/n 非洲的人民过着贫穷的生活。/r/n

word.name: peon
word.mean: n. 被强制劳役以还债的工人,工人

word.name: peony
word.lx: The peonies are in full bloom now./r/n 现在牡丹花正盛开。/r/n I like the carpets patterned with peonies./r/n 我喜欢印有牡丹花图案的地毯。/r/n

word.name: pepper
word.lx: Please pass me the pepper pot./r/n 请把胡椒瓶递给我。/r/n Please pass me the pepper./r/n 请把胡椒粉递给我。/r/n

word.name: peppered
word.lx: The wall had been peppered with bullets./r/n 墙上有密集的子弹痕迹./r/n The speaker was peppered with awkward questions./r/n 发言人被尴尬的问题所围困。/r/n

word.name: peppermint
word.mean: n. 薄荷,薄荷糖,薄荷味

word.name: peppery
word.lx: A peppery sales clerk./r/n 一个脾气暴躁的销售员/r/n

word.name: peptic
word.mean:
a. 有助消化的,胃液素的
n. 健胃剂,消化器官

word.name: per
word.lx: These apples cost five yuan per kilogram./r/n 这些苹果每公斤五元。/r/n The hurricane has a speed of 73 miles per hour./r/n 飓风每小时73英里。/r/n

word.name: perceivable
word.lx: Knowable or perceivable./r/n 可认知的可知的或可觉察的/r/n

word.name: perceive
word.mean: v. 察觉,感觉,认知,理解
word.lx: We perceived that we were unwelcome and left./r/n 我们发觉自己不受欢迎，因此便离开了。/r/n We had already perceived how the temperature fluctuated./r/n 我们已注意到温度的波动情形./r/n

word.name: percent
word.mean:
a. 百分之一,(与基数词连用)百分之...的
n. 百分之...
word.lx: I am a hundred percent in agreement with you./r/n 我百分之百同意你的看法。/r/n The covering of forestry in our town is 60 percent./r/n 我们镇的森林覆盖率是百分之六十。/r/n

word.name: percentage
word.lx: What percentage of the earth is covered by oceans?/r/n 地球上百分之多少被海水覆盖着？/r/n We have only a small percentage of foreign books./r/n 我们只有一少部分外文书。/r/n

word.name: perceptive
word.mean: a. 知觉的,有知觉力,感知的
word.lx: Knowledge gained by the use of this faculty; a perceptive insight./r/n 直觉知道运用这种能力而获得的知识；敏锐的洞察力/r/n Mentally responsive and perceptive; quick./r/n 思维敏捷的思维反应迅速且感觉灵敏的；快速敏捷的/r/n

word.name: perch
word.mean:
n. 栖木,高位,杆
v. 栖息,就位,位于
word.lx: From our perch up there on top of the cliff we can see the whole town./r/n 我们从悬崖顶上的高处能看到城市的全景。/r/n The small village perched on a hill./r/n 这个小村庄位于山上。/r/n

word.name: perchance
word.lx: He discovered the painting perchance./r/n 他偶然发现了这幅画。/r/n A passenger perchance ride on the wagon prevent a fatal accident./r/n 一个偶然坐车的旅客使这辆大车免遭了一场大祸。/r/n

word.name: percussion
word.mean: n. 撞击(碰撞,振动,击发,叩诊)

word.name: percussive
word.mean: a. 冲击的,由于冲击的,叩诊

word.name: perdition
word.lx: He was damned to perdition./r/n 他万劫不复。/r/n The man trembled whenever he thought of the perdition./r/n 这个人一想起死后的永久惩罚就颤抖不已。/r/n

word.name: peremptory
word.mean: a. 专横的,不容反抗的
word.lx: He made a peremptory order./r/n 他下达了一个必须服从的命令。/r/n The teacher spoke in a peremptory tone./r/n 老师以命令的口吻说话/r/n

word.name: perennial
word.mean: a. 四季不断的,继续多年的
word.lx: A perennial woody plant having a main trunk and usually a distinct crown./r/n 树一种多年生木质植物，生有一个主干且常有一个很明显的树冠/r/n

word.name: perestroika
word.lx: Any solution [to Soviet economic malaise], however, is hostage to the crisis of authority, creating a catch-22 stalemate between perestroika and glasnost, between economics and politics: any measure to shore up the economy only fans public anger and redu

word.name: perfect
word.mean:
a. 完美的,全然的,理想的
v. 使...完美,使...完善,使...熟练
word.lx: The weather during our holiday was perfect./r/n 我们度假时的天气好极了。/r/n The project is far from perfect./r/n 这项企划很不完美。/r/n

word.name: perfection
word.lx: She sings to perfection./r/n 她唱得好极了。/r/n If a thing is not done to perfection, it is unacceptable./r/n 做得不完美的事是无法接受的。/r/n

word.name: perfectionist
word.mean: n. 十全十美主义者, [哲]至善论者
word.lx: The innkeeper is a notoriously hard driving, whip-cracking perfectionist./r/n 这个酒馆的老板出名地凶狠，不准手下人犯一点错误。/r/n

word.name: perfidious
word.mean: a. 不忠的,背信弃义的

word.name: perform
word.lx: The surgeon has performed the operation./r/n 外科医生做了手术。/r/n Their football team performed very well in the match yesterday./r/n 他们的足球队在昨天的比赛中表现突出。/r/n

word.name: perfume
word.mean:
n. 香水,香气
v. 洒香水于,薰香
word.lx: The roses perfumed the air./r/n 玫瑰花的芳香四溢。/r/n Can you smell the perfume of the roses?/r/n 你能闻到玫瑰花的香味吗？/r/n

word.name: perfunctorily
word.mean: ad. 敷衍地,潦草地,表面地

word.name: perhaps
word.lx: Perhaps I am wrong, but I think she is near forty./r/n 也许我错了，但是我想她快四十岁了。/r/n Such a mistake would perhaps lead to disastrous consequences./r/n 这样一种错误可能导致灾难性的后果。/r/n

word.name: peril
word.mean:
n. 危险,冒险
v. 置...于险境,冒险
word.lx: The ship was in imminent peril of being wrecked./r/n 那条船马上就有失事的危险。/r/n You had better not invest so much money at your peril./r/n 你最好不要冒险投资这么多。/r/n

word.name: perimeter
word.lx: The plane stalled, flipped over onto its back and crashed near the perimeter./r/n 飞机失速了，翻了一个跟头，坠毁在机场环形围栏附近。/r/n The barbed wire fence round the perimeter discouraged intruders./r/n 周围有铁丝网阻止了外人闯入./r/n

word.name: period
word.mean: n. 学时,课时,一段时间,时期,周期,句点
word.lx: We have three periods of chemistry a week./r/n 我们一星期三节化学课。/r/n Which period of history are you studying?/r/n 你正在学哪一段历史？/r/n

word.name: periodical
word.mean:
n. 期刊
a. 周期的,定期的
word.lx: The periodical is obtainable on the very first day of every month./r/n 这本杂志每月一号出版。/r/n I should be glad if you could insert this article into your periodical./r/n 如果能把这篇文章登在你的期刊上我将很高兴。/r/n

word.name: periodically
word.lx: New strains of viruses appear periodically./r/n 新菌系的细菌周期性地产生/r/n A device that periodically and automatically opens and closes an electric circuit, producing pulses./r/n 断续器一种阶段性的能自动打开及关闭电路并产生脉冲的仪器/r/n

word.name: periodicity
word.mean: n. 定期性,周期性,周期数

word.name: peripatetic
word.lx: Peripatetic music teachers visit the school regularly./r/n 兼职音乐教师定期到校授课./r/n

word.name: peripheral
word.lx: An interface unit or circuitry that converts data to and from the representation used by a particular peripheral device or class of peripheral devices; for example, a device that converts between bit serial and bit parallel and resolves differences in tr

word.name: periphery
word.mean: n. 周边(边缘,圆周,圆柱体表面)

word.name: perish
word.lx: Almost a hundred people perished in the hotel fire last night./r/n 近百人在昨夜旅馆的大火中丧生。/r/n The lumbermen were perished with cold./r/n 伐木工人冻僵了。/r/n

word.name: perishable
word.mean:
a. 易腐坏的,会枯萎的,会死的
n. 易腐坏的
word.lx: Perishable food should be stored in a refrigerator./r/n 易腐的食物应储存在冰箱里./r/n Keep perishable foods under refrigeration./r/n 把容易变质的食物冷藏起来./r/n

word.name: perjure
word.mean: v. 使伪誓,使破坏誓言
word.lx: Several witnesses at the trial were clearly prepared to perjure themselves in order to protect the accused./r/n 在审判时几个证人显然已准备好为袒护被告而作伪证./r/n

word.name: perk
word.mean:
vi. 动作灵敏(振作,详细调查,过滤)
n.（意外的）好处
word.lx: One of the perks is the use of the official car park./r/n 其中一项好处是可以使用公家的停车场。/r/n The horse perked up its head when I shouted./r/n 我吆喝时那马扬起了头./r/n

word.name: perm
word.lx: Her hair has been permed./r/n 她的头发烫过了./r/n Do you want a perm like you have last time?/r/n 您要不要？上次一样烫头发？/r/n

word.name: permanence
word.lx: Nothing threatens the permanence of the system./r/n 该体系的永恒性不受任何事物的影响./r/n

word.name: permanent
word.lx: Have you any permanent address?/r/n 你有固定地址吗?/r/n They established their permanent abode here./r/n 他们在此建立了永久居所。/r/n

word.name: permeate
word.lx: The smell of cooking permeates (through) the flat./r/n 整套房间都弥漫著做菜的气味./r/n Water has permeated (through) the soil./r/n 水已渗遍那片土壤./r/n

word.name: permissible
word.mean: a. 可允许的,可容许程度的
word.lx: Delay is not permissible, even for a single day./r/n 不得延误, 即使一日亦不可./r/n Her request is permissible./r/n 她的要求是许可的。/r/n

word.name: permissive
word.mean: a. 许可的,获准的,自由的

word.name: pernicious
word.lx: This event had a pernicious influence on society./r/n 这件事情对社会造成了有害的影响。/r/n Pollution of the water supply reached a level pernicious to the health of the population./r/n 水源污染已经达到危及居民健康的程度。/r/n

word.name: peroration
word.lx: We had to listen to a peroration on the evils of drink!/r/n 我们得听一个关於酗酒害处的冗长报告!/r/n

word.name: perpendicular
word.mean:
n. 垂直线,垂直的位置
a. 垂直的,直立的
word.lx: There are many perpendicular marble columns in Greek temples./r/n 希腊庙宇有很多垂直的大理石柱。/r/n The wall is a little out of the perpendicular./r/n 那墙有点斜。/r/n

word.name: perpetrate
word.lx: Who perpetrated that dreadful extension to the front of the building?/r/n 谁在那楼房正面加盖了那麽一截讨厌的建筑物?/r/n

word.name: perpetually
word.mean: ad. 持久地,没完没了地
word.lx: The condition of an estate that is limited so as to be inalienable either perpetually or longer than the period determined by law./r/n 永久所有权，永久不得转让权房地产被限制以致于可永久地或比法律规定时间长的不得转让的状态/r/n

word.name: perpetuate
word.lx: They decided to perpetuate the memory of their leader by erecting a statue./r/n 他们为永远纪念那位领袖决定建一座雕像。/r/n These measures will perpetuate the hostility between the two groups./r/n 采取这些措施势必使那两集团永远对立。/r/n

word.name: perpetuity
word.lx: The site of the memorial is granted in perpetuity to Canada./r/n 纪念馆址已选定在加拿大作为永久的纪念./r/n These lands were granted to our family in perpetuity./r/n 这些土地依法永远归我们家族所有./r/n

word.name: perplex
word.mean: v. 使...困惑,使...更复杂,使...为难
word.lx: Faced with that dilemma, he was perplexed./r/n 他面对进退两难的局面，不知如何是好。/r/n When new math was introduced into schools, many parents were perplexed by it./r/n 当学校开设新的数学课时，许多家长对此感到迷惑不解。/r/n

word.name: perplexed
word.mean:
a. 困惑的,不知所措的
v. 困惑了,使...更复杂了
word.lx: When new math was introduced into schools, many parents were perplexed by it./r/n 当学校开设新的数学课时，许多家长对此感到迷惑不解。/r/n The question perplexed me./r/n 那问题把我难住了./r/n

word.name: perplexing
word.mean: a. 令人费解的,使人困惑的
word.lx: The whole affair is very perplexing./r/n 整件事令人感到莫名其妙./r/n An awkward or perplexing situation; a predicament./r/n 困境令人难堪或困窘的形势；窘境/r/n

word.name: perquisite
word.mean: n. 额外补贴,临时津贴
word.lx: Politics in Britain used to be the perquisite of the property-owning classes./r/n 英国的政治以往是有产阶级的特权./r/n Perquisites include the use of the company car./r/n 福利包括可以使用公司的汽车./r/n

word.name: persecute
word.lx: He persecuted me with various delicate questions./r/n 他用种种微妙的问题把我难倒了。/r/n They came to America after being persecuted for their religious beliefs./r/n 他们是在他们因宗教信仰而受到迫害之后来到美洲的。/r/n

word.name: perseverance
word.mean: n. 毅力,忍耐,不屈不挠
word.lx: He is slow to learn, but shows great perseverance./r/n 他学得慢，但是他表现出不屈不挠的毅力。/r/n You need perseverance to win in politics and I doubt if he can go the distance./r/n 在政治上, 需要矢志不移才能取胜, 我怀疑他能否坚持到底./r/n

word.name: persevering
word.lx: A few persevering climbers finally reached the top./r/n 少数几个攀登者坚忍不拔，终於登上了顶峰。/r/n Refusing to give up or let go; persevering obstinately./r/n 坚持不懈的，执意的拒绝放弃或听任的；顽固坚持的/r/n

word.name: Persia
word.lx: This carpet was made in Persia./r/n 这块地毯是波斯制造的。/r/n Greek culture penetrated Persia through the medium of the Syrians./r/n 通过叙利亚人作媒介，希腊文化渗透到波斯。/r/n

word.name: Persian
word.mean:
a. 波斯的(波斯人的)
n. 波斯(波斯人)

word.name: persist
word.lx: The cold weather will persist for the rest of the week./r/n 这种寒冷的天气将持续到本周末。/r/n If you persist in breaking the law you will go to prison./r/n 如果你再继续违法的话，你会坐牢的。/r/n

word.name: persistent
word.lx: Despite persistent denials, the rumor continued to spread./r/n 尽管一再否认，谣言还是不胫而走。/r/n She eventually married the most persistent one of her admirers./r/n 她终于嫁给了最执着追求她的人。/r/n

word.name: persistently
word.lx: One that clings persistently./r/n 牢牢地抓住某物的人/r/n By persistently remaining single, a man converts himself into a permanent public temptation./r/n 坚持独身，就会使一个男人把自己化为永远吸引大众的人物。/r/n

word.name: person
word.lx: You are just the person I want to see./r/n 你正是我要见的人。/r/n The firm has an important asset in the person of the director of research./r/n 公司有一巨大财富，就是研究部主任这个人。/r/n

word.name: personable
word.mean: a. 风度好的,优雅的,貌美的
word.lx: The salesman was a very personable young man./r/n 推销员是个风度翩翩的年轻人./r/n

word.name: personage
word.mean: n. 重要人士,显要,名士
word.lx: She is stately in personage./r/n 她仪容端庄。/r/n He played the personage of Hamlet in the play./r/n 他在这个剧中扮演哈姆雷特。/r/n

word.name: personal
word.mean:
a. 私人的,个人的
n. 私人信息启示
word.lx: I have something personal to discuss with you./r/n 我有点私事和你商量。/r/n Personal cleanliness is important to health as well as to appearance./r/n 个人清洁对于健康和仪表同样重要。/r/n

word.name: personal computer
word.lx: His latest toy is a personal computer./r/n 他的最新玩物是个人计算机./r/n Be careful how you start the personal computer./r/n 要注意怎样起动个人计算机。/r/n

word.name: personality
word.lx: She is quite a personality./r/n 她相当有个性。/r/n He has a dynamic personality./r/n 他是个性活跃的人。/r/n

word.name: personification
word.lx: He looked the personification of misery./r/n 他那副样子可谓是苦难的典型。/r/n Although she is poor, she is the personification of generosity./r/n 她虽然贫穷，却是慷慨大方的化身。/r/n

word.name: personify
word.mean:
v. 拟人化
vt. 拟人,使人格化,是...的典型,表现
word.lx: He personifies the worship of money./r/n 他是拜金的化身./r/n The sun and the moon are often personified in poetry./r/n 诗歌中常把日、 月拟人化./r/n

word.name: perspicacious
word.mean: a. 颖悟的,聪明的,有洞察力的
word.lx: It is very perspicacious of you to find the cause of the trouble so quickly./r/n 你真是明察秋毫，问题的原因这麽快就找出来了。/r/n

word.name: perspiration
word.lx: She burst out in perspiration./r/n 她突然出了一身汗。/r/n Genius is one per cent inspiration and ninety- nine per cent perspiration./r/n 天才的百分之一是灵感，百分之九十九是血汗。/r/n

word.name: persuade
word.mean:
a. 空闲的,有闲的
v. 说服
vt. 劝说,说服
word.lx: How can I persuade you of my sincerity?/r/n 我如何能够让你相信我的诚意？/r/n Can you persuade her out of her foolish plans?/r/n 你能劝她放弃她那些愚蠢的计划吗？/r/n

word.name: persuasive
word.mean:
a. 有说服力的
n. 动机(诱因)
word.lx: Your argument seemed not very persuasive./r/n 你的论据不太有说服力。/r/n He talked to her with persuasive manner./r/n 他以晓之以礼的态度劝说她。/r/n

word.name: pert
word.lx: She is wearing a pert little hat./r/n 她头戴一顶小巧别致的帽子。/r/n She is a pert child./r/n 她是一个冒失的孩子。/r/n

word.name: pertain
word.lx: This letter does not pertain to politics./r/n 这封信的内容与政治无关。/r/n It does not pertain to the young to instruct their elders./r/n 年轻人不应该对老年人发号施令。/r/n

word.name: Perth
word.mean: n. 佩思(澳大利亚城市)

word.name: pertinacious
word.mean: a. 执拗的,顽固的,顽强的

word.name: pertinent
word.mean: a. 相关的,中肯的,切题的

word.name: perturb
word.mean: v. 扰乱,使混乱,使心慌
word.lx: The state of being perturbed; agitation./r/n 搅乱，混乱处于不安的状态；动荡/r/n King Herod was greatly perturbed when he heard this;and so was the whole of Jerusalem./r/n 希律王听后异常惊恐，耶路撒冷的全城居民也感到非常不安。/r/n

word.name: perturbation
word.mean: n. 扰动(微扰,波动,破坏,摄动)

word.name: peruse
word.lx: Have you perused this article?/r/n 你细读了这篇文章了吗？/r/n After breakfast he perused the newspapers./r/n 早饭后，他读了各种报纸。/r/n

word.name: Peruvian
word.mean:
a. 秘鲁的,秘鲁人的
n. 秘鲁人

word.name: pervade
word.lx: Her work is pervaded by nostalgia for a past age./r/n 她的作品充满了怀旧之情。/r/n The smell of baked apple pies pervaded the house./r/n 房子里弥漫着烤苹果馅饼的香味。/r/n

word.name: pervasive
word.mean: a. 普遍的,蔓延的,渗透的

word.name: perverse
word.mean: a. 乖张的,倔强的,错误的

word.name: perversion
word.mean: n. 误用(曲解,倒错,颠倒,反常)
word.lx: Her account was a perversion of the truth./r/n 她所讲的歪曲了事实./r/n

word.name: pervert
word.mean:
vt. 误用(歪曲,曲解,败坏,使...反常)
n. 变态，色狼
word.lx: Do pornographic books pervert those who read them?/r/n 看色情书刊能诱人堕落吗？/r/n Scientific knowledge was perverted to help cause destruction and war./r/n 科学知识被滥用于破坏和战争。/r/n

word.name: pesky
word.lx: A pesky mosquito./r/n 讨厌的蚊子/r/n

word.name: pessimism
word.lx: Pessimism, when you get used to it, is just as agreeable as optimism./r/n 悲观主义者，当你习惯它之后，就和乐观主义者一样令人惬意了。/r/n He never gave himself up to pessimism in spite of difficulties./r/n 尽管遇到困难他从没有消极悲观过。/r/n

word.name: pest
word.lx: Stores of grain are frequently attacked by pests./r/n 储存的谷物经常受到害虫的破坏。/r/n That child is an absolute pest!/r/n 那孩子讨厌极了！/r/n

word.name: pester
word.lx: He pestered her with requests for help./r/n 他缠著她要她帮忙./r/n The horses in the meadow were being pestered by flies./r/n 牧场上的马不断受马蝇滋扰./r/n

word.name: petal
word.lx: There are numerous petals under the tree./r/n 树下有数不清的花瓣。/r/n A petal fluttered to the ground./r/n 一片花瓣飘落到地上。/r/n

word.name: Pete
word.mean:
n. 皮特(Peter 的昵称)(m.)
n. <美俚>保险箱,银箱

word.name: Peter
word.mean:
彼得(人名)
v.慢慢消失，耗尽
word.lx: His interest in learning Japanese has petered out./r/n 他学习日语的兴趣逐渐消失了。/r/n The road became narrower and rougher and eventually petered out./r/n 这条路越来越窄，越来越难走，最后终于消失了。/r/n

word.name: petition
word.mean:
n. 请愿,祈求,请愿书
v. 请愿,祈求
vt. 向...请愿
word.lx: She filed a petition for divorce./r/n 她提出了离婚申请。/r/n She petitioned her neighbor to turn down the radio./r/n 她请求邻居把收音机关小点声。/r/n

word.name: petitioner
word.lx: The petitioner ask for a variation in her maintenance order./r/n 上诉人要求对她生活费的命令的条件进行变更。/r/n

word.name: petrify
word.mean: vt. 硬化(使...石质化,使...发呆)

word.name: petrol
word.lx: Petrol is volatile./r/n 汽油容易挥发。/r/n The petrol is running out./r/n 汽油快要耗尽了。/r/n

word.name: petroleum
word.lx: Petroleum can be used to produce various chemical products./r/n 石油可用于生产多种化学产品。/r/n Taiwan seems to contain no petroleum./r/n 台湾恐怕没有蕴藏石油吧！/r/n

word.name: pets
word.lx: I breed some chicks for pets./r/n 我养了一些小鸡当宠物。/r/n Pets can be a tie when you want to go away on holiday./r/n 要想外出度假时, 宠物会成为牵累./r/n

word.name: petticoat
word.mean:
a. 女性的
n. 裙子
word.lx: Her petticoat was too long./r/n 她的衬裙太长了。/r/n A petticoat made of this fabric./r/n 硬衬布衬裙用这种织物做成的衬裙/r/n

word.name: petty
word.mean: a. 琐碎的,小规模的,小气的
word.lx: She is very petty at times./r/n 她有时很小心眼。/r/n The party split into petty factions./r/n 该党分裂成若干小派系。/r/n

word.name: petulant
word.mean: a. 暴躁的,易生气的,难以取悦的

word.name: Peugeot
word.mean: 标致(财富500强公司之一，总部所在地法国,主要经营汽车)

word.name: pew
word.mean: n. 会众,教堂长凳,座位
word.lx: People sat on the pew and listened to the priest./r/n 人们坐在长凳上听牧师讲话。/r/n The remark make me want to climb under the pew./r/n 这句话使我真想藏在座位下面去。/r/n

word.name: phagocytosis
word.mean: n. 噬菌作用,吞噬作用

word.name: phalanx
word.mean: n. 方阵, 密集队, 密集人群, [解]指骨, 趾骨

word.name: phantasmal
word.mean: a. 幻影的,幽灵一样的

word.name: phantom
word.mean:
n. 幻影,虚位,幽灵
a. 错觉的,幻影的,幽灵的

word.name: pharmaceutical
word.mean:
a. 药物的(医药的)
n. 药品(成药)

word.name: pharmacist
word.lx: My father is a pharmacist./r/n 我的父亲是药剂师。/r/n Technicians and pharmacists are paramedical personnel./r/n 技术员和药剂师都是医事辅助人员。/r/n

word.name: pharmacological
word.mean: a. 药物学的,药理学的

word.name: pharmacology
word.lx: The branch of pharmacology that deals with drugs in their crude or natural state./r/n 生药学药理学的一个分支，研究处于天然或原始状态的药物/r/n

word.name: pharmacy
word.lx: Readily available in pharmacies; not requiring special preparation./r/n 药房常备的不需特殊准备的；药房常预备的/r/n

word.name: phase
word.mean:
n. 相, 相位,时期,局面,阶段
v. 逐步执行,实行,按计划进行
word.lx: The child is going through a difficult phase./r/n 那孩子正经历困难的阶段。/r/n The two sets of traffic lights were out of phase./r/n 那两组交通灯不同步。/r/n

word.name: pheasant
word.lx: Pheasants have long tails./r/n 野鸡长着长尾巴。/r/n The dog flushed a pheasant from the bushes./r/n 那只狗于雉从灌木丛中惊起。/r/n

word.name: phenomenal
word.mean: a. 现象的,能知觉的,异常的

word.name: phenomenon
word.lx: Magnetism is a natural phenomenon./r/n 磁力是一种自然现象。/r/n International terrorism is not just a recent phenomenon./r/n 国际恐怖主义并不是近年才有的现象。/r/n

word.name: phial
word.mean: n. 管形瓶(小药瓶,小玻玻瓶)

word.name: Philadelphia
word.lx: Here is a letter adapted from DEAR ABBY, Philadelphia Bulletin, March9,1973./r/n 这里摘登一封＇亲爱的爱毕＇的回信，刊登在一九七三年三月九日的＇费城公报＇上。/r/n

word.name: philander
word.lx: He spent his time philandering with the girls in the village./r/n 他把时间花在和村子里的姑娘们调情上了./r/n He spent his time philander with the girls in the village./r/n 他把时间花在和村子里的姑娘们调情上了。/r/n

word.name: philanthropist
word.mean: n. 博爱的人,博爱主义者,慈善家

word.name: philanthropy
word.mean: n. 博爱主义,慈善事业,善心
word.lx: She committed herself to philanthropy./r/n 她专心从事慈善事业。/r/n Philanthropy is the refuge of people who wish to annoy their fellow creature./r/n 博爱主义，是那些存心和自己的同类过不去的人的避难所。/r/n

word.name: Philippine
word.mean:
a. 菲律宾的,菲律宾人的,菲律宾群岛
n. 菲律宾人
word.lx: A Philippine dish of marinated vegetables and meat or fish seasoned with garlic, soy sauce, and spices and served with rice./r/n 阿都波一种由海菜及肉或鱼做成的菲律宾菜肴，用咖喱、酱油和香料作调料，佐以米饭/r/n

word.name: philistine
word.mean:
a. 市侩的
n. 腓力斯人
word.lx: He accused those who criticized his work of being philistines./r/n 他指责那些批评他的作品的人是对艺术一窍不通./r/n The philistine attitude of the public resulted in the work being abandoned./r/n 由於公众对艺术不感兴趣, 那个作品备受冷遇./r/n

word.name: philosopher
word.lx: The boy wants to become a philosopher in the future./r/n 这个男孩想在将来成为一名哲学家。/r/n According to some philosopher, everything in existence is reasonable./r/n 某位哲学家认为, 存在的事物都是合理的。/r/n

word.name: philosophical
word.mean: a. 哲学的,冷静的,哲学上的
word.lx: He devoted himself in philosophical study./r/n 他致力于哲学研究。/r/n She seemed fairly philosophical about the loss./r/n 她对所受损失似乎很看得开。/r/n

word.name: philosophy
word.lx: I cannot understand his conflicting philosophy./r/n 我不能理解他那互相矛盾的思想体系。/r/n The philosophy of the prisoners during their worst sufferings impressed even their captors./r/n 俘虏们在最困苦时仍处之泰然，连捉住他们的人都深有感触。/r/n

word.name: phlegmatic
word.lx: Commuting in the rush-hour requires a phlegmatic temperament./r/n 在上下班交通高峰期间乘坐通勤车要有安之若素的心境./r/n The British character is often said to be phlegmatic./r/n 英国人的性格常说成是冷漠的./r/n

word.name: phoebe
word.lx: Phoebe announces four programs a week./r/n 菲碧一星期担任四个节目的播音员。/r/n

word.name: Phoenician
word.mean:
a. 腓尼基语的
n. 腓尼基语,腓尼基人
word.lx: The ancient Syrian and Phoenician goddess of sexual love and fertility./r/n 阿什托雷思古代叙利亚和腓尼基人的性爱与繁殖女神/r/n The dialect of Phoenician spoken in ancient Carthage./r/n 古迦太基语古迦太基人所说的腓尼基方言/r/n

word.name: phoenix
word.mean:
n. 凤凰,长生(不死)鸟
引申为重生

word.name: phonetic
word.lx: Phonetic symbols represent sounds./r/n 语音符号是标音的符号./r/n Agreeable sound, especially in the phonetic quality of words./r/n 谐音，声音的和谐谐音或悦耳的声音，尤指词的音质/r/n

word.name: phonograph
word.mean:
n. 留声机,电唱机,蜡管留声机
v. 灌入留声机
word.lx: Phonograph is no longer used nowadays./r/n 留声机现在已不再使用了。/r/n A paper or thin cardboard envelope for a phonograph record./r/n 唱片套子留声机唱片的纸套或薄纸板封套/r/n

word.name: phony
word.lx: The phony glamour of night club soon become stale and boring./r/n 夜总会那种虚假的荣华不久便失去了新意而使人生厌。/r/n

word.name: phosphor
word.lx: In cathode ray tube display, the continuation of light emission from phosphor after excitation by the electron beam./r/n 在阴极射线管显示器中，用电子束激励后荧光物质光发射的持续现象。/r/n

word.name: phosphoric
word.lx: There are many phosphoric stones on the hill./r/n 那座山上有很多含磷的石头。/r/n

word.name: photo
word.lx: I have a few photos./r/n 我有几张照片。/r/n The photo lacks definition./r/n 这张照片不够清晰。/r/n

word.name: photocopier
word.lx: Our photocopier is in continual need of running repairs./r/n 我们的复印机经常需要检修./r/n The photocopier has been busy all morning./r/n 影印机一上午都用著./r/n

word.name: photocopy
word.mean:
n. 影印
v. 影印
word.lx: She photocopy the contract./r/n 她影印了这份合同。/r/n A powdery ink used dry or suspended in a liquid to produce a photocopy./r/n 色粉一种粉状颜料，在液体中变干或凝结，从而产生照片底片/r/n

word.name: photograph
word.mean:
n. 相片
v. 照相,摄影
word.lx: Have you seen my photograph in the newspaper?/r/n 你看到我在报纸上的照片了吗？/r/n Try not to jerk the camera when taking a photograph./r/n 拍照时照相机不要晃./r/n

word.name: photographer
word.lx: The photographer took a photo of a herd of elephants./r/n 这位摄影师拍了一张象群的照片。/r/n Her silken long hair attracted the attention of a photographer./r/n 她的光滑柔软的长发吸引了一位摄影师的注意。/r/n

word.name: photographic
word.lx: My little brother has a photographic memory./r/n 我的小弟弟有着惊人的记忆力。/r/n The equipment of the photographic studio was expensive./r/n 装备摄影室的开支很大./r/n

word.name: photography
word.lx: Photography is one of his hobbies./r/n 摄影是他的爱好之一。/r/n There was some marvellous wildlife photography in the documentary./r/n 这部记录片里有些绝妙的野生动物镜头。/r/n

word.name: photometer
word.mean: n. 光度表,光度测定器

word.name: phrase
word.mean:
n. 短语,习语
vt. 表达,叙述
word.lx: He is fond of high-sounding phrases./r/n 他爱用夸大的词句。/r/n This passage is concisely phrased./r/n 这段话措辞简练。/r/n

word.name: Physical Education
word.lx: A school course in physical education./r/n 体操课学校体育教育中的一门课程/r/n

word.name: physically
word.lx: The male is physically stronger than the female./r/n 男性在身体上要比女性强壮。/r/n Woman is physically but not mentally weaker than man./r/n 女子在体力上而不是智力上比男子弱。/r/n

word.name: physiologically
word.mean: ad. 生理上,在生理学上

word.name: physique
word.lx: Having a heavy, muscular physique./r/n 公牛般的有健壮的、肌肉发达的体格的/r/n Practicing gongfu strengthens the physique./r/n 武术可以锻炼筋骨。/r/n

word.name: pianist
word.lx: I hope his dream of becoming a pianist will come true./r/n 我希望他成为钢琴家的梦想可以成真。/r/n The pianist forgot his music and had to improvise (the accompaniment)./r/n 弹钢琴的人把乐谱忘了, 只好即兴伴奏./r/n

word.name: piano
word.lx: She is learning to play the piano./r/n 她在学弹钢琴。/r/n The singer was accompanied by her sister at the piano./r/n 这位歌唱家由她妹妹担任钢琴伴奏。/r/n

word.name: piazza
word.lx: A boy is flying a kite in the piazza./r/n 一个小男孩在阳台上放风筝。/r/n

word.name: Picasso
word.lx: She paints in the fashion of Picasso./r/n 她模仿毕加索的绘画风格/r/n Have you seen the Picasso exhibition?/r/n 你参观过毕加索的画展吗?/r/n

word.name: Piccadilly
word.lx: The expensive shops in a famous arcade near Piccadilly were just opening./r/n 皮卡迪利大街附近的一著名的拱廊街道上，几家高挡商店刚刚开门。/r/n

word.name: pick
word.mean:
n. 精选,鹤嘴锄
v. 摘,挑选,挑惕,剔除;
挑衅 pick a fight 向人挑战
word.lx: Which one of the books is your pick?/r/n 你选哪本书？/r/n He picked the watch up from the carpet./r/n 他从地毯上把表捡起来。/r/n

word.name: pickaxe
word.mean:
n. 鹤嘴锄(手镐)
vt 用鹤嘴锄掘
word.lx: He pecked at the hard ground with a pickaxe./r/n 他用鹤嘴锄掘坚硬的土地。/r/n Bob pecked at the hard ground with a pickaxe./r/n 鲍勃用鹤嘴锄在坚硬的地面上挖掘。/r/n

word.name: picket
word.mean:
n. 尖木桩(前哨)
vt 用桩围住(设置警戒哨)
word.lx: Some of the union members did not want to picket./r/n 工会的一些会员不想担任罢工纠察员./r/n Five pickets were injured in the scuffle./r/n 在混战中有五名罢工纠察队员受伤./r/n

word.name: pickle
word.mean:
n. 腌汁,泡菜
v. 腌,泡
word.lx: He had some mixed pickles and rice for supper./r/n 他晚饭吃了一些什锦泡菜和米饭。/r/n The dish was accompanied by a variety of pickles./r/n 这盘菜配有什锦泡菜./r/n

word.name: pickpocket
word.mean:
n. 扒手
v. 扒窃

word.name: pickup
word.mean:
n. 拾(拾音器,传感器)
a. 现成的(挑选的)
word.lx: A pickup orchestra; a pickup baseball game./r/n 临时性管弦乐队；临时拼凑的棒球比赛/r/n That lucky guy is a choice pickup for the girls./r/n 那位幸运的男孩是女孩子们想把上的人。/r/n

word.name: picky
word.lx: The housekeeper is a very picky woman./r/n 这个家庭主妇是位特别爱挑剔的人。/r/n She is picky about what she eats because she is on a diet./r/n 她正在节食，所以挑食挑得厉害。/r/n

word.name: picnic
word.lx: We had a lot of fun at the picnic on the beach./r/n 我们在海滩上野餐，趣味无穷。/r/n Their family often picnics in the woods./r/n 他们一家常在树林里野餐。/r/n

word.name: picogram
word.mean:
皮(可)克
微微克(10的-12次方克)

word.name: pictograph
word.mean: n. 象形文字(统计图表)

word.name: pictorial
word.mean:
a. 绘画的
n. 画报

word.name: picture
word.mean:
n. 图画,照片,景色
v. 画,描写,想像
word.lx: May I take a picture of you?/r/n 我可以给你照相吗？/r/n This book gives a good picture of life in China 100 hundred years ago./r/n 这本书形象地描写了一百年前的中国生活。/r/n

word.name: pictures
word.lx: He made some pictures of the divinities of Hinduism./r/n 他画了几幅印度教中的神像。/r/n These pictures will be on show next week./r/n 下周将公开展出这些画。/r/n

word.name: picturesque
word.mean: a. 生动的,如画的,独特的
word.lx: He painted the picturesque fishing village in the bay./r/n 他画了海湾里一个风景如画的渔村。/r/n The place is remarkable for its picturesque scenery./r/n 这个地方以它的如画的景色著称。/r/n

word.name: pie
word.mean: n.饼图 n.派,馅饼,杂乱,喜鹊,爱说话的人 vt.弄乱
word.lx: Would you like some more apple pies?/r/n 再来点苹果馅饼好吗？/r/n She had two generous helpings of pie./r/n 她吃了两客分量很足的馅饼。/r/n

word.name: piebald
word.mean:
a. 花斑的
n. 花马

word.name: piece
word.mean:
n. 块,片,篇
v. 修补,结合
word.lx: Would you please give me a piece of paper?/r/n 能给我一张纸吗？/r/n He went to pieces when they told him the tragic news./r/n 人们告诉他那悲惨的消息後，他已六神无主了。/r/n

word.name: pieces
word.lx: The huge waves battered the wrecked ship to pieces./r/n 巨浪将那艘失事的船只冲击得支离破碎./r/n The poster had been ripped to pieces./r/n 那张广告画已被撕得粉碎。/r/n

word.name: pied
word.mean: a. 斑驳的,杂色的,花衣服的
word.lx: The Pied piper had all the children of Hamlin on his heels./r/n 穿彩衣的吹笛人使得汉姆林镇所有的孩子都跟着他走。/r/n I am cooking apple pies with my newly bought frying pan./r/n 我正在用我新买的煎锅做苹果馅饼。/r/n

word.name: pier
word.lx: The ship lies at the pier./r/n 船在码头停着。/r/n A pier running out into the sea./r/n 突伸到海中的码头。/r/n

word.name: piercing
word.mean: a. 刺骨的,刺穿的,讽刺的

word.name: Pierre
word.mean: 皮埃尔(男子名, Peter 的异体)

word.name: piety
word.lx: The old man has great piety towards God./r/n 这位老人对上帝非常虔诚。/r/n Often a convert is zealous not through piety, but because of the novelty of his experience./r/n 改变信仰者之所以常常显得热情，并非出自虔诚，而是由于他的体验新鲜之故。/r/n

word.name: pig
word.lx: He made a real pig of himself at the restaurant./r/n 他在餐厅里大吃大喝，真丢脸。/r/n The farmer keeps hundreds of pigs on his farm./r/n 那个农场主在他的农场里养了几百头猪。/r/n

word.name: pigeonhole
word.lx: Rebecca is a pigeon with no pigeonhole./r/n 丽贝卡是一位难以形容的漂亮姑娘。/r/n

word.name: piggyback
word.mean: ad.&a. 在肩(背)上,骑在肩(背)上地
word.lx: The act of transporting piggyback./r/n 背负式运输，驮运联运/r/n

word.name: pigment
word.mean:
n. 色素,颜料
v. 把...加颜色,变色
word.lx: They used only natural pigments to dye the wool./r/n 他们只用天然颜料染毛织品。/r/n I have mixed pigment with oil./r/n 我已经把颜料和油混合起来了。/r/n

word.name: pigsty
word.lx: He makes a pigsty of the kitchen whenever he does the cooking./r/n 他一做饭就把厨房弄得很脏./r/n He laid big stones at his house and began to build a pigsty./r/n 他把大石块堆在房子前开始垒猪圈。/r/n

word.name: pike
word.mean:
n. 矛,梭子鱼,通行费
v. 用矛刺杀,刺
word.lx: Soldiers in ancient time usually fight with pikes and shields./r/n 古代的战士们通常用长矛和盾牌战斗。/r/n Some freshwater fish such as pike can withstand levels of acidity./r/n 一些诸如梭鱼等淡水鱼可以抵御相当程度的酸性。/r/n

word.name: pile
word.mean:
n. 堆
v. 堆,堆积,拥挤进(入)
vt. 堆积
word.lx: We put the books in piles on the floor./r/n 我们把书在地板上堆起来。/r/n The cart is piled high with fruit and vegetables./r/n 马车上堆满了水果和蔬菜。/r/n

word.name: pilfer
word.lx: He was caught pilfering./r/n 他行窃当场被抓住./r/n She had been pilfering from the petty cash for months./r/n 她多月来一直从零用现金中偷钱./r/n

word.name: pilferage
word.lx: Pilferage in the warehouse reduces profitability by about two per cent./r/n 仓库中的失窃使利润损失了百分之二./r/n

word.name: pilgrim
word.lx: We met many pilgrims on their way to Mecca./r/n 我们遇到许多去麦加朝圣的人。/r/n At length the pilgrim could shake the dust off his feet at Heidelberg./r/n 那个朝圣者终于可以在海德堡停下来了。/r/n

word.name: pilgrimage
word.mean:
n. 朝圣之旅
v. 朝拜
word.lx: The Muslim delegation is shortly going on a pilgrimage to Mecca./r/n 这个穆斯林代表团很快就要去麦加朝圣了。/r/n A pilgrimage to Mecca made by the faithful./r/n 教徒前往麦加朝圣的旅途/r/n

word.name: pill
word.lx: Occasionally she had to take sleeping pills./r/n 她偶尔不得不吃安眠药。/r/n The pill is sugared./r/n 这药丸加上了糖衣。/r/n

word.name: pillage
word.mean:
n. 掠夺,抢劫,掠夺物
v. 掠夺,抢劫
word.lx: The town was pillaged by the invading army./r/n 入侵的军队将该城镇掠夺一空。/r/n Her handbag was pillaged on her way home./r/n 在回家的路上，她的手提包被抢劫了。/r/n

word.name: pillar
word.mean:
n. 柱子
vt. 用柱支持
word.lx: The enemy was hurried from pillar to post./r/n 敌人被赶得东逃西窜走投无路。/r/n He has been a pillar of the Church all his life./r/n 他一生都是教会的热心支持者。/r/n

word.name: pillory
word.lx: She was pilloried in the press for her extravagant parties./r/n 她的聚会十分铺张，新闻界对她大加嘲弄。/r/n

word.name: pilot
word.mean:
n. 飞行员,领航员,引航员
v. 领航,驾驶,向导
word.lx: Mark used to be a pilot on the Mississippi River./r/n 马克曾在密西西比河上当过领航员。/r/n We are doing a pilot study to see if the new product will sell well./r/n 我们正在为这种新产品做试销调查，看它的销路好不好。/r/n

word.name: pimp
word.mean:
n. <美俚>男妓, 皮条客
vi. 拉皮条

word.name: pimple
word.lx: The pimple came to a head before bursting./r/n 丘疹长成脓包後才破裂./r/n The tip of an abscess, a boil, or a pimple, in which pus forms./r/n 脓头中间有脓液的脓疮、疖或丘疹的顶端/r/n

word.name: pinch
word.mean:
n. 捏,撮,困苦
v. 掐,使...困苦,节俭
word.lx: The new shoes pinched my toes./r/n 这双新鞋紧得夹脚趾。/r/n The door pinched my finger as it shut./r/n 门关上时夹了我的手指。/r/n

word.name: pine
word.mean:
n. 松树
v. 消瘦,憔悴,渴望
word.lx: There is a pine forest near our house./r/n 我们家附近有片松树林。/r/n They were pining for their homeland in Asia./r/n 他们思念着在亚洲的故乡。/r/n

word.name: pineapple
word.lx: I bought some tinned pineapples to visit her./r/n 我买了一些菠萝罐头去看她。/r/n Tom likes to eat pineapple very much./r/n 汤姆非常喜欢吃菠萝。/r/n

word.name: pineapples
word.lx: I bought some tinned pineapples to visit her./r/n 我买了一些菠萝罐头去看她。/r/n I refuse to put money into some half-baked plan to grow pineapples in Iceland./r/n 我拒绝把钱投到在冰岛种植菠萝的不周全的计划中去。/r/n

word.name: pinhead
word.mean: n. 针头,小东西,无用的东西
word.lx: Every library shall try to be complete on something, if it is only the history of pinhead./r/n 每一个图书馆都应该努力使某一方面（的图书）齐全，哪怕只是针头[俚语亦有“笨蛋”之意]的历史也好。/r/n

word.name: pinion
word.mean:
n. 鸟翼,小齿轮
v. 剪断翼尖,绑住...两臂
word.lx: He was held with his arms pinioned together behind his back./r/n 他被捉住反绑着双臂。/r/n They were pinioned against the wall by the lorry./r/n 那辆卡车把他们挤到墙根动弹不得。/r/n

word.name: pink
word.mean:
a. 粉红色的
n. 粉红色
word.lx: Pink is her favorite color./r/n 粉红色是她最喜欢的颜色。/r/n I like pink roses./r/n 我喜欢粉色的玫瑰。/r/n

word.name: pinnacle
word.mean:
n. 小尖塔,尖峰,高峰
v. 造小尖塔,放置高处
word.lx: I can see the small pinnacle from here./r/n 我能从这儿看到那个小尖塔。/r/n He has reached the pinnacle of his career./r/n 他已经登上事业的顶峰。/r/n

word.name: pinpoint
word.mean:
n. 极小之物
v. 精确地找到,准确地轰炸

word.name: pint
word.lx: I bought a pint of milk in the store./r/n 我在这家商店里买了一品脱牛奶。/r/n He is quaffing his beer by the pint./r/n 他论品脱地大喝啤酒。/r/n

word.name: pioneer
word.mean:
n. 先锋,拓荒者,开劈者
v. 提倡,作先驱,开劈
word.lx: He was a pioneer in the use of X-rays./r/n 他是最早使用X光的人。/r/n The history of public education in the United States dates from the society of the early pioneers./r/n 美国的公共教育史起源于早期拓荒者的社会。/r/n

word.name: pious
word.lx: He is a pious Christian./r/n 他是一名虔诚的基督教徒。/r/n Having great reverence for God; pious./r/n 虔诚的敬神的；虔诚的/r/n

word.name: piously
word.lx: She practices her religion piously./r/n 她是一个虔诚的宗教信奉者/r/n

word.name: pip
word.mean: n. 永久内部极化(预示的弹着点,生产执行规划)
word.lx: His disgusting jokes gave everybody the pip./r/n 他那些令人作呕的笑话弄得大家都不痛快./r/n She gives me the pip./r/n 她老让我生气./r/n

word.name: pipe
word.mean:
n. 管,烟斗,笛
v. 以管输送,吹哨子,吹笛
尖声说话 pipe up
word.lx: The workers are laying pipes under the road./r/n 工人们正在道路下面铺设管道。/r/n He filled and lit his pipe./r/n 他给烟斗装上烟，然后点着。/r/n

word.name: pipeline
word.lx: New laws to deal with this abuse are in the pipeline./r/n 正在制定处理这种弊端的新法令。/r/n Recently they have laid an underground pipeline./r/n 最近他们铺设了一条地下管道。/r/n

word.name: piper
word.lx: He told me the story about a piper and the lost children./r/n 他给我讲了一个关于吹笛者和丢失的孩子的故事。/r/n The piper dress in traditional scottish costume give us a warm welcome./r/n 身穿传统苏格兰服装的风笛手们对我们表示热烈欢迎。/r/n

word.name: piping
word.lx: The oil company will ship out piping and heavy equipment./r/n 这家石油公司将用船运出输油管道和重型设备。/r/n Now come, Mr Smith, just help yourself. The roast duck has to be eaten piping hot./r/n 来吧，史密斯先生，别客气。烤鸭是要趁热吃的。/r/n

word.name: piquant
word.mean: a. 辛辣的,活泼的,痛快的
word.lx: Bland vegetables are often served with a piquant sauce./r/n 清淡的蔬菜常以辛辣的沙司调味./r/n

word.name: pique
word.mean:
n. 生气,愤怒
v. 伤害...自尊心,激怒
word.lx: She seemed rather piqued./r/n 她似乎很生气。/r/n When he realized nobody was listening to him, he left the room in a fit of pique./r/n 他发觉谁也没有听他讲话，一气之下就走了。/r/n

word.name: piracy
word.mean: n. 海盗行为,剽窃,著作权侵害

word.name: pirate
word.mean:
n. 海盗,盗印者,侵犯专利权者
v. 盗印,掠夺,翻印
word.lx: The sailor suddenly saw a pirate jumping onto the deck./r/n 那水手忽然看到一名海盗跳上了甲板。/r/n The design for the new dress collection is pirate in the far east./r/n 新式服装的系列设计在远东被非法翻印（剽窃）。/r/n

word.name: Pisa
word.lx: The famous tower of Pisa leans at an angle./r/n 有名的比萨塔是斜的./r/n Pisa is to the west (of Florence)./r/n 比萨在（佛罗伦萨的）西边./r/n

word.name: piss
word.mean:
n. 尿,小便
v. 撒尿
word.lx: Stop pissing about and get on with your work./r/n 别再胡闹了, 干你的事去吧./r/n We were pissed around for hours before they finally gave us the right form./r/n 他们浪费了我们好几个小时, 最後才把那份表格给我们./r/n

word.name: pistil
word.lx: Pistil is the seed-producing part of the flower./r/n 雌蕊是花结种的一部分。/r/n

word.name: pistol
word.mean:
n. 手枪
vt. 用手枪射击
word.lx: The runners were called back because one of them beat the pistol./r/n 赛跑运动员们被叫回来，因为他们中有一人抢跑了。/r/n A pistol shot rang out./r/n 响起了手枪的声音./r/n

word.name: piston
word.lx: Get lathe No.9 set to turn the new piston./r/n 把九号车床调好来车这个新活塞。/r/n The piston seems ok. Maybe something else is wrong./r/n 活塞似乎没问题。可能别的什么东西坏了。/r/n

word.name: pit
word.mean:
n. 深坑,核,矿井,陷阱,(英国剧场的)正厅后排
v. 使...有伤痕,去...之核,使...竞争
word.lx: The children were playing in the sand pit./r/n 孩子们在沙坑中玩耍。/r/n The ground was pitted by the heavy rain./r/n 大雨使场地变得坑坑洼洼。/r/n

word.name: pitch
word.mean:
n. 程度,投掷,音高
v. 投,向前倾跌,扎牢,定调,用沥青覆盖
word.lx: Touch pitch, and you will be defiled./r/n 近朱者赤，近墨者黑。/r/n We planned to pitch our camps in the mountains./r/n 我们计划在山里扎营。/r/n

word.name: pitcher
word.lx: Pitchers have ears./r/n （谚）隔墙有耳。/r/n Every morning I make a pitcher of ice tea./r/n 每天早晨我做一罐冰茶。/r/n

word.name: pitfall
word.lx: The road to the conquest of cancer is long and full of pitfall./r/n 战胜癌症的征途是漫长的，而且布满意想不到的困难。/r/n A concealed hole in the ground used as a trap; a pitfall./r/n 陷阱地上用做陷阱的隐藏的洞；陷阱/r/n

word.name: pith
word.lx: The pith of that theory is serving for people./r/n 那个理论的精髓是为人民服务。/r/n That was the pith of his argument./r/n 那就是他论据的要点。/r/n

word.name: pithy
word.mean: a. 有髓的,有力的,含蓄的
word.lx: A pithy comment./r/n 简练有力的一刻/r/n

word.name: pitiable
word.mean: a. 引人怜悯的,可怜的

word.name: pitiless
word.mean: a. 无情的,冷酷的,无怜悯心的
word.lx: The pitiless north wind blew for weeks./r/n 凛冽的北风一连刮了几个星期。/r/n This ruler is a pitiless tyrant./r/n 这个统治者是一个冷酷的暴君。/r/n

word.name: pittance
word.mean: n. 配给的食物,施舍少量的钱,少量
word.lx: Lawrence fags away for a pittance./r/n 劳伦斯为了一点微薄的收入而辛苦地工作。/r/n The peasant laboured for a mere pittance./r/n 农民仅仅是为了微不足道的收入而辛苦地劳作。/r/n

word.name: pity
word.mean:
n. 遗憾,同情,可惜
v. 同情,怜悯
word.lx: I pity anyone who has to feed a family on such a low income./r/n 我同情任何需要以如此微薄的收入养活全家的人。/r/n We took pity on the homeless girl and took her into our house./r/n 我们同情这个无家可归的女孩，让她住进了我们的屋子里。/r/n

word.name: pivot
word.mean:
n. 枢(旋转,中枢,基准)
a. 在枢轴上转动的
word.lx: That is the pivot of the whole argument./r/n 这是整个论据的关键。/r/n The whole discussion pivots on this one point./r/n 整个讨论内容均以此为中心。/r/n

word.name: pivotal
word.mean: a. 枢轴的,中枢的,关键的
word.lx: The capital and largest city of Algeria, in the north on the Bay of Algiers, an arm of the Mediterranean Sea. An ancient North African port, Algiers was captured by French forces in1830 and was later a pivotal center of the struggle for Algerian independ

word.name: placenta
word.lx: Formation of a placenta in the uterus./r/n 胎盘形成胎盘在子宫中的形成过程/r/n

word.name: placid
word.lx: The child had a placid disposition./r/n 这个孩子性情温和。/r/n His normally placid dog turned on him and bit him in the leg./r/n 他那条狗平日很温顺, 这次突然发作咬了他的腿./r/n

word.name: plagiarize
word.lx: He has plagiarized most of the book from earlier studies of the period./r/n 他那本书大部分都是从研究那个时期的著作中剽窃的内容./r/n Whole passages of the work are plagiarized./r/n 那作品整段整段都是剽窃的./r/n

word.name: plague
word.mean:
n. 瘟疫,麻烦,灾祸
v. 折磨,使...苦恼
word.lx: A great plague was then raging in the city./r/n 那时一场大瘟疫正在该城肆虐。/r/n The plague has broken out./r/n 突然发生了鼠疫。/r/n

word.name: plaid
word.mean: n. 格子花呢披肩,格子花呢
word.lx: She made a long plaid skirt./r/n 她做了一条格子花呢的长裙。/r/n

word.name: plainly
word.mean: ad. 平坦地, 明白地
word.lx: That is plainly wrong./r/n 那显然不对./r/n The mountain tops are plainly visible from the village./r/n 自该村望去, 群山之巅清晰可见./r/n

word.name: plains
word.lx: Such trees can be found in the plains./r/n 这种树木可见于平原。/r/n The coastal areas have mild winters, but by contrast the central plains become extremely cold./r/n 沿海地区的冬天天气暖和，可是相比之下中部平原却异常寒冷。/r/n

word.name: plainspoken
word.mean: a. 老实说的,直言无隐的,率直的

word.name: plaintive
word.lx: The song has plaintive melody./r/n 这首歌曲的曲调悲伤。/r/n I heard a plaintive cry./r/n 我听到一声悲伤的哭泣。/r/n

word.name: plait
word.lx: Her mother helped her to plait her hair./r/n 她的母亲帮她编辫子。/r/n She wore her hair in plaits./r/n 她把头发编成辫子。/r/n

word.name: plan
word.mean:
n. 计划,策略,方法
v. 计划,设计,意欲
word.lx: The police worked out a plan to catch the thief./r/n 警察订下了计划捉贼。/r/n Where do you plan to spend your holiday?/r/n 你计划去哪里度假？/r/n

word.name: planes
word.lx: Two planes collided in mid air./r/n 两架飞机在半空中相撞。/r/n The radar scanned the sky for enemy planes./r/n 雷达密切监视天空，搜索敌机。/r/n

word.name: planet
word.lx: The Earth is a planet./r/n 地球是一颗行星。/r/n The planets of our solar system are Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune./r/n 我们太阳系的行星有水星、金星、地球、火星、木星、土星、天王星、海王星。/r/n

word.name: planning
word.mean:
n. 计划(分配)
v. 计划(分配)
word.lx: This program gives managers a valuable planning tool./r/n 这套程序是经理人员制订计划的可贵的工具。/r/n They are planning to visit Palestine in September./r/n 他们正计划九月份访问巴勒斯坦。/r/n

word.name: plantation
word.lx: There were hundreds of slaves in the plantation./r/n 这个种植园里有数百名奴隶。/r/n The plantation owners would rather plough their cotton in than sell it at a lower price./r/n 种植园主宁可把棉花犁入土中，也不愿以低价出售。/r/n

word.name: planter
word.mean: n. 种植者,耕作者,殖民者
word.lx: His brother is a tea planter./r/n 他的哥哥是一个茶园主。/r/n

word.name: plaque
word.lx: A plate or plaque, as on an office door, inscribed with a name./r/n 名牌记有名字的牌或匾，如挂在办公室门上/r/n A small card or plaque, such as a nameplate on a door./r/n 小牌一种小卡片或牌，如门上的姓名牌/r/n

word.name: plasma
word.mean: n. 等离子体(血浆,深绿玉髓)

word.name: plaster
word.mean:
n. 石膏,灰泥,膏药
v. 涂以灰泥,敷以膏药,使...平
word.lx: The doctor had to hold his broken arm with a plaster cast./r/n 医生不得不用石膏绷带来固定他断了的胳膊。/r/n The man looks like a cartoon character with a plaster on his temple./r/n 那人太阳穴上贴了一块膏药，看上去像个卡通人物。/r/n

word.name: plaster cast
word.lx: The doctor had to hold his broken arm with a plaster cast./r/n 医生不得不用石膏绷带来固定他断了的胳膊。/r/n

word.name: plastic
word.mean:
a. 塑料的
n. 塑料,(外科)整形的
word.lx: Many items in daily use are made of plastic./r/n 很多日常生活用品是用塑料制成的。/r/n Plastic is sometimes used instead of leather./r/n 塑胶有时可以替代皮革。/r/n

word.name: plasticity
word.mean: n. 可塑性,适应性,柔软性
word.lx: It is their plasticity at certain temperatures that gives plastics their main advantage over many other materials./r/n 正是在一定温度下塑料所具有的塑性使它比其他许多材料更优越。/r/n

word.name: plastics
word.mean: n. 整形外科, 外科修补术
word.lx: He is a plastic surgery specialist./r/n 他是个整形外科医生。/r/n Plastics are often used today./r/n 塑料是现今常用的材料。/r/n

word.name: plate
word.mean:
n. 碟,盘,金属板,板块
v. 镀金,电镀
word.lx: The doctor inserted a steel plate into his damaged leg./r/n 医生在他受伤的腿中植入了一块钢板。/r/n His plate was piled high with rice./r/n 他的盘子里盛满了米饭。/r/n

word.name: plateau
word.mean: n. 高原;平稳;稳定状态
word.lx: Sales have now reached a plateau./r/n 销售现已开始停滞不前。/r/n After a period of rapid inflation, price have now reach a plateau./r/n 经急剧通货膨胀之後物价现已趋於平稳。/r/n

word.name: platinum
word.lx: Platinum is used to make jewelry./r/n 白金常常用来做珠宝饰物。/r/n Originally Edison used platinum alloys for the filament, in the belief that carbon was impracticable./r/n 爱迪生不相信碳可作灯丝用，所以一开始就用铂合金作灯丝。/r/n

word.name: platonic
word.mean: a. 柏拉图哲学的, 柏拉图主义的, 理想的, 不切实际的

word.name: platoon
word.lx: The sergeant bellowed orders at the platoon./r/n 士官向全排士兵大声地发出命令./r/n Platoon, halt!/r/n 全排注意, 立定!/r/n

word.name: platter
word.lx: She put the grapes onto the platter./r/n 她把葡萄放到一个大盘子上。/r/n Always got what they wanted on a platter./r/n 总是毫不费力地得到他们想要的东西/r/n

word.name: plaudit
word.lx: She won plaudits for the way she presented her case./r/n 她妙语陈情博得众口交赞./r/n A new play that opened to the plaudits of the critics./r/n 受到评论家们喝彩的一出新戏剧/r/n

word.name: plausible
word.mean: a. 似真实的,似合理的,说得蛮像回事的

word.name: play
word.mean:
n. 游戏,游玩,剧本,比赛
v. 玩,进行比赛,演奏,播放
word.lx: The boys were playing with balls./r/n 男孩子们正在玩球。/r/n They played a joke on me./r/n 他们开我的玩笑。/r/n

word.name: playboy
word.lx: He has been given a label of playboy" by his friends./r/n 他的朋友给他起了一个“花花公子”的绰号。/r/n"

word.name: player
word.lx: There are eleven players in the game./r/n 这场比赛中有11名选手。/r/n This tennis player ranked third in the world./r/n 这位网球运动员排名世界第三。/r/n

word.name: playful
word.mean: a. 爱打趣的,多趣的,嬉戏的
word.lx: He gave me a playful slap on the hand./r/n 他闹着玩地打了一下我的手。/r/n She has a playful mood./r/n 她有着快活的心情。/r/n

word.name: playground
word.lx: The students are playing on the playground./r/n 学生们正在操场上玩。/r/n There are more than five hundred people on the playground./r/n 运动场上有五百多人。/r/n

word.name: playing card
word.lx: A playing card bearing the figure of a queen, ranking above the jack and below the king./r/n 王后画有王后人像的一张纸牌，比杰克大但比国王小/r/n A playing card marked with nine pips./r/n 标有九点的一张扑克牌/r/n

word.name: playmate
word.lx: He was my playmate in childhood./r/n 他是我童年时的玩伴。/r/n She has been the playmate of every boy on the football team./r/n 她曾经是足球队上每个人的性伴侣。/r/n

word.name: playoff
word.mean: n. （双方得分相等时的）最后决赛
word.lx: The team manager fell in for the major share of the blame when his team lost the playoffs./r/n 球队的经理在他的球队失去决赛权时，首当其冲受到许多谴责。/r/n

word.name: plaything
word.lx: He treated the silly girl as a plaything./r/n 他把那个愚蠢的女孩当作一个玩物。/r/n I used to get them new plaything to keep them quiet./r/n 我过去总是给他们买新玩具来使他们安静。/r/n

word.name: playtime
word.mean: n. 游戏时间,娱乐时间,开幕时刻
word.lx: The children are outside during playtime./r/n 在娱乐时间学生都在室外活动。/r/n The children have three playtimes during the day./r/n 那些学生一天有三次游戏时间./r/n

word.name: plea
word.mean:
n. 请求,恳求
v. 借口,恳求,请求
word.lx: The accused entered a plea of not guilty"./r/n 被告作了“无罪”的抗辩。/r/n

word.name: pleasant
word.mean:
a. 令人愉快的,舒适的
vi. 满意,喜欢
vt. 使高兴
word.lx: She seems a pleasant woman./r/n 她似乎是一个友善的女人。/r/n We are living in pleasant surroundings./r/n 我们生活在舒适的环境中。/r/n

word.name: pleasantly
word.mean: ad. 友好地,亲切地,客气地
word.lx: The noise of the stream had a pleasantly somnolent effect./r/n 小河潺潺的流水声有宜人的催眠效果./r/n The day went pleasantly enough until I received your call./r/n 接到你的电话前，我过了愉快的一天/r/n

word.name: please
word.lx: Take as many as you please./r/n 你要多少就拿多少。/r/n Please come with me./r/n 请跟我来。/r/n

word.name: pleased
word.lx: They were all very pleased with the news./r/n 他们听到那消息都很高兴。/r/n I am only too pleased to do business with you./r/n 我能和你做生意，太高兴了。/r/n

word.name: pleasing
word.mean:
a. 令人喜爱的,愉快的,舒适的
vbl. 取悦,期望,请
word.lx: We have made pleasing progress in our talks./r/n 我们的会谈已经取得了令人满意的进展。/r/n This wine is most pleasing to the taste./r/n 这种酒的味道美极了。/r/n

word.name: pleasurable
word.mean: a. 令人愉快的,使人快乐的
word.lx: The pleasurable sensation that accompanies the use of a drug; a rush./r/n 幻觉使用麻醉毒品而产生的一种愉悦的感觉；激情/r/n

word.name: pleasure
word.lx: He listened with pleasure to the beautiful music./r/n 他陶醉在美妙的音乐中。/r/n She took no pleasure in her work./r/n 她觉得自己的工作毫无乐趣。/r/n

word.name: pleat
word.mean:
n. 褶,褶状物
v. 打褶
word.lx: Press the pleats flat./r/n 把褶子熨平./r/n Accordion pleats; accordion blinds./r/n 褶状的裙边；褶状的遮阳物/r/n

word.name: plebeian
word.mean:
n. 平民,庶民,大众
a. 平民的,一般的,普通的
word.lx: This book has plebeian tastes./r/n 这本书有庸俗的味道。/r/n He was born of plebeian origins./r/n 他出身平民。/r/n

word.name: plebiscite
word.lx: A plebiscite was held to decide the fate of the country./r/n 举行了公民投票以决定国家的命运./r/n The question of which state the minority group should belong to was decided by (a) plebiscite./r/n 该少数民族应归属哪一州的问题已由公民投票表决./r/n

word.name: pledge
word.mean:
n. 保证,誓言,抵押,抵押品
v. 保证,誓言,举杯祝...健康
word.lx: Take this ring as a pledge of our friendship./r/n 请接受这个戒指作为我们友谊的信物。/r/n She pledged her support to us./r/n 她保证支持我们。/r/n

word.name: plenary
word.mean: a. 充分的(全体出席的)
word.lx: A diplomat with plenary powers./r/n 具有极权的外交家/r/n

word.name: plentiful
word.lx: The camp has a plentiful supply of food./r/n 营地有充足的食品供应。/r/n Marked by abundance; plentiful./r/n 表现为丰富的；大量的/r/n

word.name: plethora
word.lx: The report contained a plethora of detail./r/n 报告中细节过多./r/n

word.name: pliable
word.mean: a. 易曲折的,柔软的,圆滑的
word.lx: Pliable or impressionable./r/n 顺从的或易受影响的/r/n Capable of being bent or flexed; pliable./r/n 柔软的可弯曲或扭曲的；柔韧的/r/n

word.name: pliant
word.mean: a. 易受影响的,易弯的

word.name: plight
word.mean:
n. 境况,誓约,情形
v. 宣誓,保证,约定
word.lx: The poor girl was in a terrible plight./r/n 这个可怜的女孩处境极其恶劣。/r/n She plighted herself to him./r/n 她和他订婚了。/r/n

word.name: plod
word.mean:
n. 沉重的步伐,辛勤工作
v. 沉重地走,辛勤工作,孜孜从事
word.lx: We plodded on through the rain for several hours./r/n 我们在雨中跋涉了几个小时。/r/n Labourers plodded home through the muddy fields./r/n 工人们穿过泥泞的田地走回家去。/r/n

word.name: plot
word.mean:
n. 图,阴谋,情节
v. 绘图,密谋,计划
word.lx: I grow potatoes on my little plot of land./r/n 我在那一小块地上种土豆。/r/n They are plotting how to murder him./r/n 他们在密谋如何杀害他。/r/n

word.name: plotter
word.lx: Plots recoil upon the plotters./r/n 耍阴谋诡计的人终将自作自受。/r/n

word.name: plough
word.mean:
n. 犁,耕地
v. 用犁耕田,耕犁
word.lx: The ship ploughed across the ocean./r/n 轮船在大海上破浪前进。/r/n The ground was ploughed and planted with corn./r/n 地翻耕后种上了玉米。/r/n

word.name: plow
word.mean:
n. 犁,耕地,耕作
v. 用犁耕田,耕犁,耕种
word.lx: The ship plowed across the ocean./r/n 轮船在大海上破浪前进。/r/n The farmer is at the plow./r/n 那个农民在种田。/r/n

word.name: ploy
word.lx: A maneuver, stratagem, or ploy, especially one used at an initial stage./r/n 策略尤指人在开始阶段所采用的计谋、策略、手法/r/n His ploy is to pretend to be ill./r/n 他的手法就是装病。/r/n

word.name: pluck
word.mean:
n. 勇气,猛拉,动物内脏
v. 摘,猛拉,拔
word.lx: He plucked a rose for his lover./r/n 他为情人摘了一朵玫瑰花。/r/n She showed a lot of pluck in dealing with the intruders./r/n 她对付那些闯入的歹徒表现得十分勇敢。/r/n

word.name: plug
word.mean:
n. 塞子,消防拴,电插头
v. 插入,塞住,接插头
word.lx: The TV compere gave her new record a plug./r/n 电视节目主持人极力推荐她的新唱片。/r/n You can plug into the national computer network./r/n 你可以接通全国计算机网络。/r/n

word.name: plum
word.lx: His new job is a fine plum./r/n 他的新工作是件美差。/r/n He ate the plum, and threw the core away./r/n 他吃掉了李子，并扔掉了果核。/r/n

word.name: plumage
word.lx: Some plumage dropped from the bird./r/n 从鸟身上掉下来几根羽毛。/r/n Have you seen the brightly-coloured plumage of tropical birds?/r/n 你见过热带鸟类色彩斑斓的羽毛吗？/r/n

word.name: plumb
word.mean:
n. 测水锤,垂直
a. 垂直的
v. 探测,了解
word.lx: We begin to plumb the mysteries of the universe./r/n 我们开始探索宇宙的奥秘。/r/n He is just plumb crazy./r/n 他真是疯了。/r/n

word.name: plumber
word.lx: He is an apprentice plumber./r/n 他是个见习水管工人。/r/n The plumber stowed all his gear in a canvas bag./r/n 管子工把他所有的工具都装进一只帆布袋里。/r/n

word.name: plumbing
word.mean:
n. 铅工业,铅管品制造
vbl. 使...成垂直

word.name: plume
word.mean:
n. 羽毛
v. 整理羽毛,骚首弄姿
vt. 用羽毛装饰
word.lx: He does not plume himself on these achievements./r/n 他并不因这些成就而自夸。/r/n Resembling a feather or plume./r/n 似羽毛的类似羽毛或大羽的/r/n

word.name: plummet
word.mean:
n. 铅锤
vt 垂直落下
word.lx: House prices have plummeted in this area./r/n 此地房价大跌./r/n Share price plummet or plunge on the news of the devaluation./r/n 一有贬值的消息，股票价格就暴跌了。/r/n

word.name: plump
word.mean:
a. 圆胖的,丰满的,直接的
v. 突然放下,支持,使劲坐下
word.lx: The ducklings plumped into the water./r/n 小鸭们突然跳进水中。/r/n He switched on the light and plumped up the cushions./r/n 他打开了灯，拍松了靠垫。/r/n

word.name: plunder
word.mean:
n. 抢夺,掠夺品,战利品
v. 掠夺,抢劫,抢夺
word.lx: He escaped with his plunder./r/n 他带着赃物逃跑了。/r/n The enemy plundered the village./r/n 敌人抢劫村庄。/r/n

word.name: plunge
word.mean:
n. 钻进,跳进,跳水
v. 投入,跳进,使...陷入
word.lx: The car stopped suddenly and he plunged forward./r/n 汽车突然停下，他的身子朝前一冲。/r/n She plunged her hands into her coat pockets./r/n 她把两手插在上衣口袋里。/r/n

word.name: plural
word.mean:
a. 复数的
n. 复数
word.lx: The verb should be in the plural./r/n 这个动词应用复数形式。/r/n The plural form of child" is "children"./r/n child的复数形式是children。/r/n"

word.name: plurality
word.mean: n. 复数性(较大数,大多数,许多)
word.lx: Mr Smith breezed in with an election plurality of200, 000./r/n 史密斯先生以20万张的多数票轻易当选了。/r/n

word.name: plus
word.mean:
a. 正的
conj. 并且
n. 加号,正号
prep. 加
word.lx: Two plus five is seven./r/n 二加五等于七。/r/n The bill was USD10, plus USD1 for postage./r/n 帐款是10美元，再加上一美元邮费。/r/n

word.name: plush
word.mean:
a. 豪华的
n. 长毛绒
word.lx: Made of or covered with plush./r/n 丝绒制的由长毛绒制成的或覆盖的/r/n

word.name: Pluto
word.lx: Pluto has an elliptic orbit./r/n 冥王星的轨道是椭圆形的。/r/n

word.name: ply
word.mean:
n. 厚度,板层,褶
v. 使用,辛勤工作,往返
word.lx: I plied him with questions about his novel./r/n 我就他的小说向他提问。/r/n This ship plies between London and Australia./r/n 这艘船定期往返于伦敦和澳大利亚之间。/r/n

word.name: Plymouth
word.mean: n. 普利茅斯[英国港市]
word.lx: One of the English Separatists who founded the colony of Plymouth in New England in1620./r/n 清教徒前辈移民1620年，在新英格兰建立普利茅斯殖民地的英国主张脱离国教者/r/n The Pilgrim Fathers settled Plymouth./r/n 清教徒殖民于普里茅斯。/r/n

word.name: PM
word.lx: Is the match on at 2 pm or 3 pm?/r/n 比赛是下午2时还是3时开始?/r/n She holds her surgery on Fridays at 6 pm./r/n 她星期五下午6时接待选民./r/n

word.name: pneumatic
word.mean:
a. 气动的(有空气的,气体学的)
n. 气胎

word.name: pneumonia
word.lx: Take care of getting pneumonia./r/n 小心得肺炎。/r/n He was indebted to her for nursing him through pneumonia./r/n 他感激她护理好了他的肺炎。/r/n

word.name: poach
word.mean: vt. (侵入他人地界)偷猎(或捕鱼),水煮
word.lx: A new political party usually poaches ideas from its rivals./r/n 新政党往往把敌对政党的思想攫为己有。/r/n A rival firm poached our best computer programmers./r/n 我公司的竞争对手把我们最好的计算机程序编制员挖走了./r/n

word.name: pocket
word.mean:
n. 口袋,钱,袋
v. 装...在口袋里,隐藏,私吞
word.lx: He pocketed his wallet and car keys./r/n 他把钱包和汽车钥匙放进了衣袋里。/r/n She quickly pocketed the note without reading it./r/n 她很快把通知放进口袋里，连看都没看。/r/n

word.name: pocket calculator
word.lx: I find a surplus store and buy a pocket calculator./r/n 我找到一家出售剩余物品的商店，买了一台袖珍计算机。/r/n

word.name: pocketbook
word.mean: n. 财力,皮夹子,袖珍本
word.lx: Prices to fit your pocketbook./r/n 与你的财力相称的价格/r/n

word.name: pod
word.mean:
n. 豆荚
v. 剥掉(豆荚)
word.lx: This kind of pea has a long pod./r/n 这种豌豆长着长豆荚。/r/n He is podding peas./r/n 他正在剥豌豆。/r/n

word.name: podium
word.mean: n. 矮墙,腰墙,突出的座席
word.lx: The speaker has to ad- lib his speech when his papers suddenly blow off the podium./r/n 当演讲稿突然掉下台时，演讲者不得不现编词。/r/n Blacked out at the podium./r/n 在指挥台上晕倒/r/n

word.name: poem
word.lx: Their lives are a poem./r/n 他们的生活就是一首诗。/r/n The girl repeated the poem after I had read it twice./r/n 我读了两遍这首诗，这个小女孩就会背诵了。/r/n

word.name: poet
word.lx: The poet has written many poems for her./r/n 那位诗人为她写了许多诗。/r/n The poet expressed his burning passion for the woman he loved./r/n 诗人表达了他对所爱的女子火一般的激情。/r/n

word.name: poetic
word.mean: a. 诗的,诗意的,诗人的
word.lx: The dancer moved with poetic grace./r/n 这位舞蹈演员的舞姿如诗一般优美。/r/n I appreciate his poetic utterances./r/n 我欣赏他那富有诗意的话语。/r/n

word.name: poetical
word.lx: I like to recite his poetical works./r/n 我喜欢背诵他的诗。/r/n Poetical works; poetry./r/n 诗歌作品；诗歌/r/n

word.name: poetry
word.lx: His poetry was published last year./r/n 他的诗集去年发表了。/r/n Such poets as Keats and Shelley wrote Romantic poetry./r/n 有些诗人，如济慈和雪莱，写的是浪漫主义的诗歌。/r/n

word.name: poignant
word.mean: a. 悲伤的,严厉的,尖锐的,剧烈的

word.name: poikilothermic
word.mean: a. [动]变温的,冷血的,冷血动物的

word.name: pointed
word.mean:
a. 尖的,锐利的,率直的
v. 指出,指,瞄准
vbl. 指出,指,瞄准
word.lx: He pointed at the diagram to illustrate his point./r/n 他指着图表来说明他的论点。/r/n I pointed out the shortcomings of the scheme, but he countered that the plans were not yet finished./r/n 我指出那方案的缺点, 但他申辩说各项计划尚未完成./r/n

word.name: pointedly
word.mean: ad. 尖锐地, 指向地

word.name: pointer
word.mean: n. 指示的人,教鞭,暗示
word.lx: The pointer flickered./r/n 指示针来回摆动。/r/n A graduated surface or face on which a measurement, such as speed, is indicated by a moving needle or pointer./r/n 标度盘有刻度的表面或面，在上面由活动的指针或指示器表示度量衡，比如温度/r/n

word.name: pointless
word.mean: a. 不尖的,钝的,不得要领的

word.name: poise
word.mean:
n. 平衡,姿势,镇静
v. 使...平衡,保持平衡,保持...姿势
word.lx: He poised the glass on the shelf./r/n 他把玻璃杯稳稳地放在架子上。/r/n We admired the graceful poise of the dancer./r/n 我们很欣赏那位舞蹈演员的优美舞姿。/r/n

word.name: poised
word.mean: a. 摆好姿势不动的，稳重的，坦然自若的
word.lx: He poised the glass on the shelf./r/n 他把玻璃杯稳稳地放在架子上。/r/n The eagle poised in mid-air ready to swoop on its prey./r/n 那鹰在半空中盘旋准备扑向猎物./r/n

word.name: poison
word.mean:
n. 毒药,败坏道德之事,毒害
v. 毒害,摧毁,中毒
word.lx: Someone tried to poison our dog./r/n 有人想毒杀我们的狗。/r/n Gases from cars are poisoning the air of our cities./r/n 汽车放出的废气在污染我们城市的空气。/r/n

word.name: poisoning
word.lx: Food poisoning can cause death./r/n 食物中毒可导致死亡./r/n The chemical companies are poisoning our rivers with effluent./r/n 这些化学公司排出废水污染著我们的河流。/r/n

word.name: poisonous
word.lx: She gave him a poisonous look./r/n 她恶狠狠地瞪了他一眼。/r/n Some plants have poisonous berries./r/n 有些植物的浆果有毒。/r/n

word.name: poke
word.mean:
n. 刺,戳,袋
v. 拨开,刺,探索
word.lx: He is poking the fire with a poker./r/n 他正用通条捅火。/r/n She poked her finger into the hole./r/n 她把手指插入孔中。/r/n

word.name: poker
word.mean:
n. 扑克
vt. 烙制

word.name: Poland
word.lx: He was born in Poland./r/n 他出生在波兰。/r/n Wales were trounced 5-0 by Poland./r/n 威尔士队让波兰队以5比0打得一败涂地./r/n

word.name: polar
word.mean: a. 两极的,南辕北辙的,极地的
word.lx: The two systems of government are polar opposites./r/n 这两种政体正好相反。/r/n Are there any animals in the polar circles?/r/n 南极圈和北极圈内有动物存在吗？/r/n

word.name: polar bear
word.lx: In spite of vigilance a polar bear escape from the zoo./r/n 尽管警戒很严，北极熊还是逃出了动物园。/r/n Although they can swim, the polar bears are terrestrial animals./r/n 北极熊虽然会游泳，但也是陆栖动物。/r/n

word.name: polarity
word.mean:
n. 有两极,磁性引力,极性
n. 两极分化,极端性

word.name: polarization
word.lx: An instrument used to measure the rotation of the plane of polarization of polarized light passing through an optical structure or sample./r/n 偏振计；旋光计用来测量经过光学结构或样品的极化光的偏振平面旋转的一种仪器/r/n

word.name: polarize
word.mean: vt. 极化(使...偏振化,使...两极分化)
word.lx: Public opinion has polarized on this issue./r/n 在这个问题上公众的意见已两极分化./r/n

word.name: Polaroid
word.mean: n. 人造偏光板,其商标名

word.name: pole
word.mean:
n. 极(点)
v. 跳,支撑
word.lx: Our opinions on this subject are at opposite poles./r/n 我们对这一问题的看法截然相反。/r/n The hut was made of poles covered with grass mats./r/n 茅屋用木杆搭成，上面以草席覆盖。/r/n

word.name: pole vault
word.mean:
n. 撑杆跳
vt. 撑杆跳高
word.lx: Our school won first place for the pole vault./r/n 我们学校赢得了撑杆跳第一名。/r/n

word.name: polemical
word.mean: a. 辩论法, 辩论术, 好辩的, 挑起争端的,引起论战的

word.name: polestar
word.mean: n. 北极星,指导者,指导原理

word.name: police
word.mean:
a. 警察的
n. 警察,警方
v. 管辖
word.lx: The police have caught the murderer./r/n 警察已经抓获杀人凶手。/r/n Our neighbourhood police are very friendly./r/n 我们邻近的警察非常友善。/r/n

word.name: police station
word.lx: Terrorists bombed the police station in revenge for the arrests./r/n 恐怖分子用炸弹袭击了警察局报复逮捕行动./r/n At the police station, he was formally charged with murder./r/n 在警察局他被正式控告犯谋杀罪。/r/n

word.name: policeman
word.lx: The policeman ordered him to stop the car./r/n 警察命令他停车。/r/n The policeman was justified in shooting the criminal in self-defence./r/n 那个警察出于自卫枪击罪犯是正当防卫。/r/n

word.name: policemen
word.lx: The sheriff ordered the policemen to gather./r/n 警察局长命令警察集合。/r/n The Queen was flanked by a retinue of bodyguards and policemen./r/n 女王左右有保镖和警察护卫着。/r/n

word.name: policewoman
word.lx: The thief made a misguided attempt to rob a policewoman./r/n 那个贼不识好歹竟要抢劫一个女警察。/r/n She was strongly committed to her job, a policewoman by eminence./r/n 她非常忠于职守，一位典型的（卓越的）女警察。/r/n

word.name: policy
word.lx: Honesty is the best policy./r/n 诚实是最明智的。/r/n This latest incident may be the lever needed to change government policy./r/n 最近的事件或许可以作为迫使政府改变政策所需的手段。/r/n

word.name: polio
word.mean: n. ［医］脊髓灰质炎,小儿麻痹症

word.name: polish
word.mean:
n. 光泽,优雅,精良
v. 擦亮,磨光,推敲
word.lx: I polished my buttons with a handkerchief./r/n 我用手帕把钮扣擦亮。/r/n With this polish you can give a good high gloss to the wood./r/n 使用这种上光蜡可使木器表面极为光亮平滑。/r/n

word.name: polite
word.lx: This boy is polite to everyone./r/n 这个男孩对所有人都很礼貌。/r/n He moved aside for her with a polite bow./r/n 他礼貌地鞠躬，退避一旁让她过去。/r/n

word.name: politely
word.lx: He stood up politely when the lady entered the room./r/n 这位女士走进房间的时候，他有礼貌地站了起来。/r/n They try to deal politely with angry customers./r/n 他们尽量对发怒的顾客彬彬有礼./r/n

word.name: politeness
word.lx: He was noted for his politeness./r/n 大家都知道他很有礼貌。/r/n Politeness is an attribute of a gentleman./r/n 彬彬有礼是绅士的本色。/r/n

word.name: politic
word.mean: a. 精明的,圆滑的,慎重的
word.lx: A politic man tries not to offend people./r/n 精明的人尽量不得罪人。/r/n A politic decision./r/n 一个明智的决定/r/n

word.name: political
word.lx: These are political rather than social matters./r/n 这是政治问题而不是社会问题。/r/n One suspects he was dismissed for political reasons./r/n 有人怀疑他是由於人事上的原因而被解职的。/r/n

word.name: politician
word.lx: You need to be a bit of a politician to succeed in this company./r/n 要想在这家公司步步登高，就需要耍点手腕。/r/n The politician made a naive decision./r/n 这个政治家做了一个幼稚的决定。/r/n

word.name: politics
word.lx: What are your politics?/r/n 你的政见是什么？/r/n He is not interested in politics./r/n 他不喜欢政治。/r/n

word.name: Pollard
word.lx: The willows need to be pollarded./r/n 这些柳树需截去树梢./r/n

word.name: pollen
word.mean:
n. 花粉
v. 授粉给
word.lx: There is a high pollen count in the air./r/n 空气中有很高的花粉计数。/r/n Anther is a part of a flower that contains the pollen./r/n 花药是花的雄蕊上带花粉的部分。/r/n

word.name: pollinate
word.mean:
v. 给...授粉
vt. 授以花粉

word.name: pollster
word.mean: n. 民意测验专家,整理民意测验结果的人

word.name: pollutant
word.lx: Discharge pipe take pollutant away from the coastal area into the sea./r/n 排泄管道将污染性物质由沿海岸区排入大海。/r/n

word.name: pollute
word.mean:
v. 弄脏,污染
vt. 污染
word.lx: The river has been polluted by waste products from the factory./r/n 这条河已经受到工厂排放的废料的污染。/r/n Many things pollute water, such as tires, trash, and plastic bags./r/n 很多东西使水污染，例如轮胎、垃圾和塑胶袋。/r/n

word.name: polluted
word.lx: Polluted air hangs over the city./r/n 城市上空被污染的空气所笼罩。/r/n The tanker sank and the oil polluted the sea./r/n 油轮沉没了，石油污染了海面。/r/n

word.name: pollution
word.lx: Many young people could not resist the spiritual pollution./r/n 很多年轻人不能抵制精神污染。/r/n We are sad about the pollution of our beaches with oil./r/n 我们很痛心石油对我们海滩的污染。/r/n

word.name: polo
word.lx: He can play polo very well./r/n 他打马球打得很好。/r/n One of the periods of play, lasting 7 1/2 minutes, in a polo match./r/n 一局在马球赛中比赛的一段时间，长七分三十秒/r/n

word.name: polyatomic
word.mean: a. 多原子的(多碱的,多酸的)

word.name: polygamy
word.mean: n. 一夫多妻制,多配偶制

word.name: polyglot
word.mean:
a. 通数国语言,数国语言的
n. 通数国语文的人,用数国语文记载的书
word.lx: Mr.Gorbachev and his reformist Kremlin allies are prepared to tolerate, even encourage, moderate nationalists who challenge central control and demand autonomy. But Moscow rightly feels that, in a polyglot country with102 different nationalities, ethnic

word.name: polygon
word.lx: A polygon with ten angles and ten sides./r/n 十边形有十个角和十条边的多边形/r/n A polygon whose angles are equal./r/n 等角多边形各角都相等的多边形/r/n

word.name: polymer
word.lx: An apparatus for determining the order of constituents in a biological polymer./r/n 顺序分析仪确定生物学的聚合体中成份顺序的仪器/r/n A molecule that can combine with others to form a polymer./r/n 单体可以与其他分子结合形成聚合物的分子/r/n

word.name: Polynesian
word.mean: a. 波利尼西亚(中太平洋之一群岛)的

word.name: polystyrene
word.lx: A small piece, as of polystyrene, used in quantity to protect items during packaging and shipment./r/n 保护物品的小片大量用于包装及运输中保护物品的一种小片，如聚苯乙烯/r/n

word.name: polytechnic
word.mean:
a. 各种工艺的,综合技术的
n. 工艺学校
word.lx: Polytechnics present golden opportunities to bright young men./r/n 工艺学为大有作为的年轻人提供了绝好的机会。/r/n

word.name: pomp
word.lx: The king was crowned with great pomp./r/n 国王加冕，典礼极为壮观。/r/n Give me health a day, and I will make the pomp of emperor ridiculous./r/n 只要给我一天的健康，我会使皇帝的荣华变得荒谬可笑。/r/n

word.name: Pompeii
word.lx: Behind the city of Pompeii stood the4000-feet Mount Vesuvius./r/n 庞培城的后面矗立着4000英尺高的维苏维火山。/r/n

word.name: pompous
word.mean: a. 傲慢的,自大的,夸大的
word.lx: We should be modest, not be pompous./r/n 我们应该谦虚，不应该自大。/r/n He is a pompous official./r/n 他是个自命不凡的官员。/r/n

word.name: pond
word.lx: The farm has a pond from which the cattle can drink./r/n 农场有一个供牛饮水的池塘。/r/n The deer lowered its head to drink from the pond./r/n 鹿低下头去喝池塘里的水。/r/n

word.name: ponder
word.lx: He pondered for some minutes before giving an answer./r/n 他思考了几分钟才作答复。/r/n They are pondering moving their offices outside London./r/n 他们正在考虑把办事处搬出伦敦。/r/n

word.name: ponderable
word.mean: a. 可秤的,有重量的,有价值的

word.name: pontifical
word.mean: a. 自以为是的,武断的

word.name: pontificate
word.mean: v. 自大武断地做,装模作样的说话
word.lx: He sat there pontificating about the legal system although it was clear that he knew very little about it./r/n 他坐在那儿发表他对法制的高论, 虽然他对此一窍不通./r/n

word.name: pony
word.mean:
a. 小型的
n. 小马
word.lx: Rhett bought his daughter a pony to ride on./r/n 瑞德给他的女儿买了一匹小马来骑。/r/n Where do you stable your pony?/r/n 你那匹矮种马养在哪儿?/r/n

word.name: poodle
word.mean:
n. 狮子狗
v. 剪毛

word.name: pool
word.lx: There is a swimming pool in the park./r/n 公园里有一个游泳池。/r/n The children ducked each other in the swimming pool./r/n 孩子们在游泳池里互相把对方按入水中。/r/n

word.name: pools
word.lx: After the rainstorm, there were pools on the roads./r/n 暴雨过後路上有许多水洼儿./r/n She mopped up the pools of water on the bathroom floor./r/n 她擦 去浴室地面上一滩滩的水./r/n

word.name: poor
word.lx: He was too poor to buy a new coat./r/n 他穷得无法买新衣。/r/n Some people may regard radio as the poor relation of broadcasting./r/n 有些人可能认为无线电广播在广播事业中稍逊一筹。/r/n

word.name: poorly
word.mean:
ad. 贫穷地,不充份地,贫乏地
a. 身体不舒服的,心情恶劣的
word.lx: These streets are very poorly lit./r/n 这些街道的照明很差./r/n No one will buy a book which (that) is poorly written./r/n 没有人会买一本写得很烂的书。/r/n

word.name: pop
word.mean:
n. 取出,砰然声,流行乐曲
a. 流行的,热门的,通俗的
v. 取出,发出爆裂声,突然伸出
word.lx: I have no interest in pop music./r/n 我对流行音乐不感兴趣。/r/n The rabbits popped out as soon as we opened the hutch./r/n 我们一打开兔箱，兔子就突然跑出来了。/r/n

word.name: popcorn
word.lx: I but a cup of coke and some popcorn./r/n 我买一杯可口可乐和一爆米花。/r/n A container or pan for making popcorn./r/n 爆玉米花团之容器或长柄锅/r/n

word.name: poplar
word.lx: There are some poplars in the garden./r/n 庭院里有几棵杨树。/r/n I eulogize the tall and straight trunk of the white poplar./r/n 我赞美白杨树那挺拔的株干。/r/n

word.name: poppy
