word.lx: Poppies are not allowed to be planted in most countries./r/n 在大多数国家，罂粟被禁止种植。/r/n Any of several similar or related plants, such as the California poppy./r/n 罂粟几种相似于罂粟或与其有关的植物一种，如加利福尼亚花菱草/r/n

word.name: populace
word.lx: He had the support of large sections of the populace./r/n 他获得大多数民众的支持。/r/n The populace at large are opposed to sudden change./r/n 人民群众普遍反对突然实行的变革。/r/n

word.name: popular
word.mean: a. 大众的,流行的,有销路的
word.lx: This is a very popular name for a girl./r/n 这是一个非常普通的女孩名字。/r/n Do you like popular music?/r/n 你喜欢流行音乐吗？/r/n

word.name: popularity
word.lx: His popularity among working people remains as strong as ever./r/n 他在劳动人民中一如既往声望很高。/r/n Her books have been in popularity recently./r/n 她的书近来大受欢迎。/r/n

word.name: popularly
word.mean: ad. 一般地,通俗地,平易地

word.name: populate
word.lx: The islands were gradually populated by settlers from Europe./r/n 岛上逐渐迁入很多欧洲移民./r/n

word.name: populated
word.lx: The wasteland of the north is scarcely populated./r/n 北方的大荒原地广人稀。/r/n The islands were gradually populated by settlers from Europe./r/n 岛上逐渐迁入很多欧洲移民./r/n

word.name: population
word.lx: What is the population of this country?/r/n 这个国家的人口是多少？/r/n There has been a steady decrease in population in this city./r/n 这个城市的人口在持续下降。/r/n

word.name: populist
word.mean: n. 平民主义者,平民论者
word.lx: A populist aversion to business monopolies./r/n 人民党主义对商业垄断的反对/r/n

word.name: populous
word.mean: a. 人口多的,人口稠密的
word.lx: We live in a populous area near the coast./r/n 我们生活在沿海人口稠密的地区。/r/n

word.name: porcelain
word.mean:
n. 瓷器,瓷
adj. 瓷制的, 精美的, 脆的
word.lx: There is a porcelain figure on the table./r/n 桌子上有一个瓷像。/r/n The museum displays the specimen of ancient Chinese porcelain./r/n 这个博物馆展出中国古瓷器标本。/r/n

word.name: porch
word.lx: I met that person at the porch of the church./r/n 我是在教堂的门廊处遇到那个人的。/r/n A pigeon perched on our porch railing./r/n 一只鸽子栖息在我们门廊的栏杆上。/r/n

word.name: porcupine
word.lx: The hunter seized a porcupine./r/n 猎人捕获了一只豪猪。/r/n

word.name: pore
word.mean:
n. 毛孔,小孔
v. 熟读,熟视,细想
word.lx: He had spent several hours in the library poring over those musty documents./r/n 他一连好几个小时呆在图书馆里仔细翻阅那些发霉味的文献资料。/r/n Sweat exudes through the pores./r/n 汗从毛孔中渗出./r/n

word.name: pork
word.lx: We made some dishes with pork and vegetables./r/n 我们用猪肉和蔬菜做了几盘菜。/r/n The grease from pork can be used for frying./r/n 猪肉炼出的油可用来煎炸食物./r/n

word.name: porn
word.mean: n. <口>(=pornography)色情文学, 色情描写

word.name: pornographic
word.mean: a. 春宫画的,黄色文学的
word.lx: Do pornographic books pervert those who read them?/r/n 看色情书刊能诱人堕落吗？/r/n Some people are sexually excited by pornographic magazines./r/n 有的人看到色情杂志能激发起性欲。/r/n

word.name: pornography
word.mean: n. 色情文学, 色情描写
word.lx: In Britain pornography was once sold under the counter./r/n 在英国, 色情书画曾一度在暗地里出售./r/n He thinks pornography is poison to young minds./r/n 他认为色情会腐蚀年轻人的心灵。/r/n

word.name: porous
word.lx: In hot weather cloths made of a porous material like cotton are best./r/n 热天穿棉布之类有渗透性的材料制成的衣服最为适宜。/r/n He added sand to the soil to make it more porous./r/n 他往土里掺了些沙子以提高渗水性能。/r/n

word.name: porpoise
word.lx: As the turtle swims across the oceanarium, the first porpoise swoops down from above and butts his shell with his belly./r/n 当海龟游过水族馆时，第一只海豚从上方猛扑下去，并用腹部撞击龟壳。/r/n

word.name: porridge
word.lx: I had a bowl of porridge for breakfast./r/n 我早餐吃了一碗麦片粥。/r/n Porridge is good for digestion./r/n 粥有益于消化。/r/n

word.name: port
word.mean:
n. 港口,（计算机）端口
v. 移植, 传输
word.lx: It cost us a lot of money to get the goods from the port to our factory./r/n 把货物从港口运到我们工厂花了一大笔钱。/r/n The ship embarked passengers and food at a Spanish port./r/n 这艘船在西班牙的一个港口装载了乘客和食品。/r/n

word.name: portable
word.mean:
a. 轻便的,手提式的
n. 手提打字机
word.lx: Portable telephones are very popular nowadays./r/n 现今，移动电话非常普及。/r/n The new portable computers are going like hot cakes./r/n 新的便携式计算机卖得很快./r/n

word.name: portal
word.lx: I think they are standing at the portals of happiness now./r/n 我认为他们现在是站在通向幸福的路口了。/r/n The portal of the mansion looks magnificent./r/n 这座大厦的正门看上去富丽堂皇。/r/n

word.name: portend
word.mean: v. 成为...的前兆,预知,给与...的警告
word.lx: His silence portends trouble./r/n 他沉默不语不是好兆头。/r/n It portends we are in danger./r/n 这预示我们陷入危险。/r/n

word.name: portent
word.mean: n. 前兆,预示,异常之物
word.lx: A sign of a future happening; a portent./r/n 前兆表明将来要发生的事情的现象；预兆/r/n Signs full of portent./r/n 充满凶兆的现象/r/n

word.name: portentous
word.mean: a. 前兆的,不吉的,可惊的
word.lx: I see a portentous thing to come./r/n 我预感不祥的事情要来到了。/r/n

word.name: porter
word.mean: n. 搬运工人, 守门人，门房
word.lx: The porter will carry your luggage to your room./r/n 搬运工会把你的行李搬到你的房间去的。/r/n Did you remember to tip the porter?/r/n 你记得给搬运工小费了吗？/r/n

word.name: portfolio
word.mean: n. 文件夹,证券投资组合

word.name: portion
word.mean:
n. 部分,份,命运
v. 将...分配,分配
word.lx: The driver must bear a portion of the blame for the accident./r/n 司机应该对这场车祸负部分责任。/r/n You may find the information you need in the first portion of the book./r/n 你可以在这本书的第一部分找到你要的资料。/r/n

word.name: portrait
word.lx: She had her portrait painted./r/n 她让人给自己画了像。/r/n He finished the portrait in a few minutes./r/n 他几分钟就完成了一副肖像画./r/n

word.name: portraiture
word.mean: n. 肖像画家,肖像画,人物描写

word.name: portray
word.mean: v. 描写,描写...的肖像,逼真地描写
word.lx: The book portrays the life of an actor./r/n 这本书描述了一个演员的一生。/r/n The picture portrays a beautiful sunset./r/n 这幅画描绘了落日美景。/r/n

word.name: Portuguese
word.mean:
n. 葡萄牙人,葡萄牙语
a. 葡萄牙的,葡萄牙人的,葡萄牙语的

word.name: pose
word.mean:
n. 姿势,姿态,装模作样
v. 摆姿势,装模作样,提出...讨论
word.lx: All the subjects are well posed./r/n 所有的东西都摆好了位置。/r/n The artist posed his model carefully./r/n 这个艺术家仔细地把他的模型放好。/r/n

word.name: poseur
word.lx: Some people admired him greatly while others considered him a poseur./r/n 有的人对他佩服得五体投地, 而有的人则认为他装腔作势./r/n

word.name: posh
word.lx: Depending on who he is talking to, Harry can flip over from a cockney accent to a posh cultured one./r/n 根据说话的对像，哈里可以从说伦敦方言突然转为说优雅而有教养的语言。/r/n

word.name: position
word.mean:
n. 位置,职位,状态
v. 安置,决定...的位置
word.lx: Before the debate, both sides made their positions clear./r/n 辩论之前，双方都把自己的观点说清楚。/r/n She carefully positioned the cup on the edge of the shelf./r/n 她把杯子小心地放在架子边。/r/n

word.name: positive
word.mean:
a. 肯定的,积极的,绝对的
a. 正面的,正数的,阳性的
word.lx: There is positive proof that he did it./r/n 有确切的证据证明他做了此事。/r/n This charge is a positive charge./r/n 这个电荷是正电荷。/r/n

word.name: positively
word.mean: ad. 必定(确定,确实地,断然,绝对,积极地)
word.lx: Their daughter is quite plump but their son is positively elephantine./r/n 他们的女儿很胖; 可是儿子呢, 简直像大象./r/n The weather in September was positively autumnal./r/n 九月的天气确实像秋天了。/r/n

word.name: posse
word.mean: n. (为追捕罪犯而组成的)民防团

word.name: possessed
word.lx: In1909 Russia possessed over41000 miles of railway./r/n 1909年俄国有41000多英里的铁路。/r/n The police asked me if I possessed a gun./r/n 警察问我是否有枪。/r/n

word.name: possession
word.lx: According to facts in my possession he can not possibly be guilty./r/n 根据我所掌握的事实，他是不可能有罪的。/r/n The people had to gather up their few possessions and escaped abroad./r/n 人们不得不收拾起仅有的一点财物逃到国外去。/r/n

word.name: possessive
word.mean:
n. 所有格
a. 所有的
word.lx: It is often used with a possessive adjective./r/n 这一词常与所有格的形容词连用。/r/n My son is very possessive about his mother./r/n 我的儿子想独占他的母亲。/r/n

word.name: possibility
word.lx: I see great possibilities in the scheme./r/n 我看这计划很可能成功。/r/n We must accept the possibility that we might be wrong./r/n 我们必须承认，我们有可能搞错了。/r/n

word.name: possibly
word.lx: Could you possibly lend me 10 dollars?/r/n 你能借给我十美元吗？/r/n She was possibly the greatest writer of her generation./r/n 她也许是她那时代最伟大的作家。/r/n

word.name: post
word.mean:
n. 邮件,标竿,职位
v. 邮递,公布,布置
word.lx: Has the morning post arrived?/r/n 早晨的邮件来了吗？/r/n The names of the members of the team will be posted up today./r/n 队员名单将于今天公布。/r/n

word.name: post card
word.lx: A post card and three eight- cent stamp, please./r/n 请给我买一张明信片和三张8分邮票。/r/n

word.name: post office
word.lx: The terrorists planted a bomb in the post office./r/n 恐怖分子在邮局安放了一枚炸弹。/r/n I went to the post office to mail the letters./r/n 我去邮局寄信。/r/n

word.name: postage
word.lx: What is the postage for an air letter?/r/n 寄一封航空信的邮费要多少？/r/n How much is the postage for an airmail letter to Canada?/r/n 寄往加拿大的航空信要多少邮费？/r/n

word.name: postal order
word.lx: Can you cash this postal order for me now?/r/n 你现在能帮我兑现这张邮政汇票吗？/r/n Can you cash this postal order for me?/r/n 你能替我兑现这张邮政汇票吗？/r/n

word.name: postal service
word.lx: The postal service here is very unreliable./r/n 这里的邮政服务很不可靠。/r/n

word.name: postcard
word.lx: The front of the postcard shows a picture of our hotel./r/n 明信片正面是我们旅馆的图片。/r/n She scrawled a few words on the postcard./r/n 她在明信片上草草地写了几个字。/r/n

word.name: postdoctoral
word.mean: a. 博士学位取得后的

word.name: posted
word.lx: The names of the members of the team will be posted up today./r/n 队员名单将于今天公布。/r/n We posted several lookouts./r/n 我们部署了几个岗哨。/r/n

word.name: poster
word.mean:
n. 海报,招贴,脚夫
v. 贴海报于
word.lx: He put up a poster advertising the circus./r/n 他贴了一张宣传马戏团的海报。/r/n The poster only stayed up a few hours, before it was stolen./r/n 那张海报贴上去没几个小时就让人给偷走了。/r/n

word.name: posterior
word.lx: It is a posterior view of the skull./r/n 这是颅骨背视图。/r/n The condition of being posterior in location or time./r/n 在后在位置上或时间上较靠后的状况/r/n

word.name: posterity
word.lx: He left behind an immortal example to all posterity./r/n 他给后世留下了不朽的典范。/r/n He will be greater to posterity if he have be willing to be less great./r/n 如果他不自命不凡，那么对子孙后代来说，他就会更加伟大。/r/n

word.name: postgraduate
word.mean:
n. 研究生
a. 大学毕业后的

word.name: posthumous
word.lx: Dead men hear no tales; posthumous fame is an Irish bull./r/n 死人无耳，死后的名声等于风马牛。/r/n

word.name: postman
word.lx: The postman was bitten by a fierce dog./r/n 那个邮递员被一只恶狗咬了。/r/n The dog nipped the postman on the leg./r/n 那只狗咬了邮递员的腿。/r/n

word.name: postmark
word.mean:
n. 邮戳
v. 盖邮戳
word.lx: I see from the postmark that this postcard was mailed from New York./r/n 从邮戳上可以看出，这张明信片是从纽约寄来的。/r/n The parcel was postmarked Brighton./r/n 这邮包盖着布赖顿的邮戳。/r/n

word.name: postmortem
word.mean:
a. 死后的
n. 尸体检查,验尸,检视

word.name: postscript
word.lx: He added a brief postscript to his speech, giving the latest figures./r/n 他演讲完又补充说了一些最新数字。/r/n As a postscript to his letter he added that he loved her./r/n 他在信中加上附言, 写上了他爱她./r/n

word.name: postulate
word.mean:
n. 假定,基本条件
v. 要求,假定

word.name: posture
word.mean:
n. 姿势,态度,情形
v. 作...姿势,作姿势
word.lx: The government adopted an uncompromising posture on the issue of independence./r/n 政府在独立的问题上采取了毫不妥协的态度。/r/n She has very good posture./r/n 她举止很优雅。/r/n

word.name: pot
word.mean:
n. 罐,壶
v. 把...装罐
word.lx: Will you help me to wash up all these pots and pans?/r/n 帮我洗洗这些锅碗瓢盆好吗？/r/n They decide to go potting at rabbits in the field tomorrow./r/n 他们决定明天去田野里打野兔。/r/n

word.name: potassium
word.lx: Potassium is necessary to the existence of all living things./r/n 钾是所有生物生存必须的。/r/n No potassium did we find in this mineral./r/n 在这种矿石中我们没有发现钾。/r/n

word.name: potato
word.lx: Would you like more mashed potato?/r/n 在来点马铃薯泥好吗？/r/n I like to cook dishes with potatoes./r/n 我喜欢用马铃薯炒菜。/r/n

word.name: potency
word.lx: One wonders also why Nature, with some snakes concocted poison of such extreme potency./r/n 人们也不知道大自然为何在一些蛇身上调制出这样高效的毒液来。/r/n

word.name: potent
word.lx: I was convinced by his potent arguments./r/n 他那有力的论据把我说服了。/r/n Potent liquor; a potent toxin./r/n 有效力的酒；有效力的毒素/r/n

word.name: potentate
word.mean: n. 有权的人,有势力的人,统治者
word.lx: People rose up against the despotic rule of their potentate./r/n 人们起来反抗君主的专制统治。/r/n

word.name: potential
word.mean:
a. 可能的,潜在的
n. 潜力,潜能
n. 电位，电势
word.lx: Education develops potential abilities./r/n 教育能开发人的潜能。/r/n The most perceptive of the three, she was the first to realize the potential danger of their situation./r/n 她在他们三人中最敏感, 首先意识到他们处境的潜在危险./r/n

word.name: potentiality
word.mean: n. 可能力,潜在力,可能性

word.name: potentially
word.lx: Something that separates potentially antagonistic entities, as an area between two rival powers that serves to lessen the danger of conflict./r/n 缓冲物，缓冲地带可用来隔离潜在的对抗性因来的东西，如面敌对势力用来减轻冲突危险的地带/r/n

word.name: potentiate
word.mean:
n. 统治者,当权者
v. 赋与力量,加强

word.name: potion
word.lx: The magician displayed his charms and potions./r/n 魔术师展示了咒符和有魔力的饮品。/r/n

word.name: potpourri
word.mean: n. 混合香料(混合物,杂录)

word.name: potter
word.lx: A potter is making pottery by hand./r/n 陶器匠正用手做陶器./r/n We spent the weekend pottering around (in) the house./r/n 我们周末做一些琐碎的家务事./r/n

word.name: pottery
word.lx: Modern pottery is usually ornamental./r/n 现代陶器通常用作装饰品。/r/n The archaeologists found gold coins and pottery in the lowest level of the site./r/n 考古学家在发掘地最下层找到一些金币和陶器./r/n

word.name: potting
word.lx: Burn clay pots in a kiln./r/n 在窑里烧制陶器/r/n They decide to go potting at rabbits in the field tomorrow./r/n 他们决定明天去田野里打野兔。/r/n

word.name: pouch
word.mean:
n. 小袋,小包,眼袋
v. 装...入袋中,成袋状
word.lx: The kangaroos carry their babies in the pouch./r/n 袋鼠把小袋鼠放在育儿袋里。/r/n The drunk man lost his pouch in the bar./r/n 那个喝醉了的人在酒吧里丢失了钱袋。/r/n

word.name: pouched
word.lx: Each tool should be pouched so that it can be readily reached./r/n 每把刀具应摆好，以便能很快地拿到手。/r/n The kangaroos carry their babies in the pouch./r/n 袋鼠把小袋鼠放在育儿袋里。/r/n

word.name: poultice
word.mean: n. 敷于伤处缓痛的膏药

word.name: poultry
word.lx: Poultry is rather cheap now./r/n 现在的禽肉相当便宜。/r/n The poultry are being fed./r/n 家禽正在吃饲料。/r/n

word.name: pounce
word.mean:
n. 猛扑
v. 猛扑,突然袭击,欣然同意
word.lx: We hid behind the bushes, ready to pounce on the intruder./r/n 我们藏在灌木丛后，准备向来犯者发起突然袭击。/r/n We saw the tiger pouncing on the goat./r/n 我们看见老虎向那只山羊扑过去。/r/n

word.name: pound
word.mean:
n. 磅,英镑
v. (连续)猛击,捣碎
vt. 猛击,敲打,跳动
word.lx: I lost several pounds last month./r/n 我上个月瘦了好几磅。/r/n He pounded the table angrily./r/n 他生气地猛拍桌子。/r/n

word.name: pound sterling
word.lx: Whither the pound sterling?/r/n 英镑的前途可能会怎样？/r/n

word.name: pounding
word.lx: The horses came pounding along the track./r/n 马都在沿著跑道奔驰./r/n A pounding or clanking noise made by an engine, often as a result of faulty fuel combustion./r/n 爆震声发动机发出的震动或撞击的声音，通常是由于燃料燃烧不足引起/r/n

word.name: pour
word.mean:
n. 流出,倾泻,骤雨
v. 倒,倾泻,蜂涌而来
word.lx: Can I pour you another cup of tea?/r/n 再给你倒杯茶好吗？/r/n The rain is really pouring down./r/n 雨下得真大。/r/n

word.name: pout
word.mean:
n. 噘嘴
v. 噘嘴,绷脸
word.lx: Tell that child to stop pouting./r/n 叫那孩子别撅嘴撒娇。/r/n She pouted to show off her new lipstick./r/n 她撅嘴炫耀她的新口红。/r/n

word.name: poverty
word.lx: The man lived in poverty after his unemployment./r/n 这人失业后就生活在贫困之中。/r/n The old man has been soured by poverty./r/n 那老人因贫困而变得乖戾了。/r/n

word.name: powder
word.mean:
n. 粉,粉末
v. 洒粉于
word.lx: I know the smell of powder./r/n 我上过战场。/r/n He took a powder every morning./r/n 他每天服用药粉。/r/n

word.name: powdered
word.mean: a. 弄成粉末状的(研成粉末的)

word.name: power
word.mean:
n. 力量,势力,动力
v. 使...有力量,供以动力,激励
word.lx: Sitting out here, you really can feel the power of the sun./r/n 坐在这里，你可以感到太阳的力量。/r/n The powers of the police need to be clearly defined./r/n 必须对警方的权限作出明确的规定。/r/n

word.name: power plant
word.lx: The soldiers blew up the enemy power plant./r/n 士兵们炸毁了敌人的发电厂。/r/n The excitement about the new power plant was merely town talk./r/n 关于新发电厂的纷纷议论只不过是桩传闻。/r/n

word.name: power station
word.lx: The power station is serviced (ie Fuel is delivered to it) by road transport./r/n 这座发电站的燃料是通过公路运送的./r/n The new power station has already come into operation./r/n 这个新的发电站已经开始运转。/r/n

word.name: powerful
word.lx: This defeat was a powerful blow to the enemy./r/n 这次失败是对敌人的有力的打击。/r/n The elephant grinds its food with/between its powerful molars./r/n 象用其强有力的臼齿嚼碎食物./r/n

word.name: powerless
word.mean: a. 无力的,无权的,无效能的
word.lx: They were powerless to resist./r/n 他们无力反抗。/r/n I am powerless to intervene in the matter./r/n 我对调停此事无能为力。/r/n

word.name: pox
word.lx: Chicken pox is a common childhood sickness./r/n 水痘是一种常见的儿童期疾病。/r/n

word.name: practicable
word.mean: a. 可实行的,可做的,可用的
word.lx: That suggestion sounds practicable./r/n 那条建议听起来可行。/r/n The mountain route is practicable only in summer./r/n 只有在夏季那条山路才可以通行。/r/n

word.name: practical
word.lx: Your invention is not practical./r/n 你的发明不实用。/r/n She is very practical./r/n 她很现实。/r/n

word.name: practicality
word.mean: n. 实际,实用,实用性,实际的事情

word.name: practically
word.mean:
a. 实际地,几乎
ad. 几乎,简直,实际上
word.lx: He knew practically no English./r/n 他实际上不懂英语。/r/n She solved the problem very practically./r/n 她很实事求是地解决了这个问题。/r/n

word.name: Practice makes perfect
word.lx: Practice makes perfect./r/n st. 熟能生巧./r/n

word.name: practiced
word.mean: a. 熟练的, 老练的

word.name: practitioner
word.lx: A skilled practitioner; an expert./r/n 行家技术熟练的行业者；专家/r/n A licensed practitioner of psychoanalysis./r/n 心理分析医生有开业许可证的心理分析医生/r/n

word.name: pragmatic
word.mean: a. 实际的,实用主义的

word.name: pragmatics
word.lx: A pragmatic theory that ideas are instruments that function as guides of action, their validity being determined by the success of the action./r/n 工具主义一种实用主义理论，认为思想是指导行为的工具，行为的成功证明其手段合理/r/n

word.name: pragmatist
word.mean: n. 实用主义者,爱管闲事的人
word.lx: The malleable mind of the pragmatist./r/n 实用主义者那适应性很强的思想/r/n

word.name: prairie
word.lx: Have you been to the prairies in North America?/r/n 你去过北美洲的大草原吗？/r/n A view of the prairie faded in./r/n 一个草原的景象渐显。/r/n

word.name: praise
word.mean:
n. 赞美,称赞,崇拜
v. 称赞,归荣誉于,赞美
word.lx: Let us give praise to God./r/n 让我们来赞扬上帝吧。/r/n The teacher praised her for her courage./r/n 老师赞扬了她的勇气。/r/n

word.name: praiseworthy
word.lx: Deserving commendation; praiseworthy./r/n 值得称赞的；值得赞美的/r/n As for his moral character, he is also praiseworthy./r/n 至于他的品德，也是值得称赞的。/r/n

word.name: pram
word.mean: n. 婴儿车,送牛奶用的手推车
word.lx: The baby had been snatched from its pram./r/n 那婴儿被人从婴儿车中劫走了./r/n

word.name: prance
word.mean:
n. (马)后足立地腾跃, 昂首阔步
vi. 腾跃, 欢跃, 昂首阔步
vt. 使腾跃
word.lx: The children were prancing about with delight./r/n 孩子们高兴得蹦蹦跳跳。/r/n That cheeky new secretary just pranced up to me and asked if I worked here!/r/n 那个冒失的新秘书兴冲冲地蹦跳到我跟前，问我是否在这里工作。/r/n

word.name: prank
word.mean:
n. 开玩笑,恶作剧,戏谑
v. 盛装,装饰,打扮
word.lx: Those schoolboys like to play pranks on their teachers./r/n 那些小学生们喜欢作弄他们的老师。/r/n A playful or amusing act; a prank./r/n 诙谐开玩笑或滑稽的动作；开玩笑/r/n

word.name: prattle
word.mean:
v. 小孩般说话,说半截话,闲聊
n. 半截话,无聊话
word.lx: The baby is prattling away happily in her cot./r/n 那幼儿在小床上呀呀自语，快活得很。/r/n She prattles on about the village gossip./r/n 她闲扯些村里的事。/r/n

word.name: pray
word.mean: v. 祈祷,祈求,请求,恳求
word.lx: They went to the mosque to pray./r/n 他们去清真寺做祷告。/r/n They prayed that their enemies might be defeated./r/n 他们祈求上苍让敌人失败。/r/n

word.name: prayer
word.mean:
n. 祈祷,祷告,祷文
v. 祷告,祷文
word.lx: Her prayer answered and her son came home safely./r/n 她的祈祷应验了，儿子平安地回到了家。/r/n The congregation in the church knelt in prayer./r/n 教堂的会众跪下来祈祷。/r/n

word.name: preach
word.lx: The priest preached a sermon on the need of charity./r/n 牧师在布道会上宣讲慈爱的必要。/r/n Those people go around preaching revolution./r/n 那些人到处宣扬革命。/r/n

word.name: preacher
word.mean: n. 传道者,讲道者,牧师
word.lx: Do you believe in what the preacher said?/r/n 你相信这个传道者的话吗？/r/n Preacher say, do as I say, not as I do./r/n 说教者言：照我所说的去做，但不要做我所做的。/r/n

word.name: preaching
word.mean:
a. 说教的
n. 说教
word.lx: I am weary of his preaching./r/n 我听腻了他的说教。/r/n Those people go around preaching revolution./r/n 那些人到处宣扬革命。/r/n

word.name: preamble
word.lx: He launched into his statement without any preamble./r/n 他开门见山地发表言论./r/n He spoke without preamble./r/n 他没有开场白地讲起来。/r/n

word.name: prearrange
word.mean: v. 预先安排,预先协定,预定

word.name: precarious
word.lx: She makes a rather precarious living as a novelist./r/n 作为小说家，她过着不太稳定的生活./r/n He was unable to get down from his precarious position on the rocks./r/n 他无法从岩石危险的位置上下来。/r/n

word.name: precariously
word.lx: He balanced precariously on the narrow window-ledge./r/n 他在狭窄的窗台上很难保持平衡./r/n

word.name: precaution
word.lx: I took the precaution of locking everything in the safe./r/n 我把一切东西都锁在保险箱里以防万一。/r/n You should take an umbrella just as a precaution./r/n 你该带把伞，有备无患。/r/n

word.name: precautionary
word.mean: a. 预先警戒的,预防的,留心的

word.name: precede
word.mean: v. 在...之前,优于,较...优先
word.lx: He came in, preceded by his wife./r/n 他和他的妻子一前一后地走了进来。/r/n He preceded his speech with a few words of welcome the special guests./r/n 他在演讲之前先说了几句对特邀来宾表示欢迎的话。/r/n

word.name: precedence
word.lx: The needs of the community must take precedence over (ie must be met before) individual requirements./r/n 公众的利益高於个人的利益./r/n The longest-serving officer always takes precedence./r/n 任职时间最长的官员事事优先./r/n

word.name: precedent
word.mean:
a. 在前的,在先的
n. 先例,前例

word.name: preciosity
word.mean: n. 过于讲究,矫揉造作

word.name: precious
word.lx: My time is precious; I can only give you a few minutes./r/n 我的时间很宝贵，我只能见你几分钟。/r/n That old book is my most precious possession./r/n 那本旧书是我最珍贵的财产。/r/n

word.name: precious stone
word.lx: A flat facet cut across the top of a precious stone./r/n 切平面在一颗宝石的顶部切出的平面/r/n The dealer was slavering over some precious stones./r/n 那商人对一些宝石垂涎欲滴./r/n

word.name: precipice
word.lx: In 1939 everyone felt Europe was on the edge of the precipice./r/n 在1939年，当时人人都感到欧洲处于极度危险的境地。/r/n Do not seat your love upon a precipice because it is high./r/n 不要因为峭壁是高的，便让你的爱情坐在峭壁上。/r/n

word.name: precipitate
word.mean:
n. 沉淀物
v. 使...陷入,促成,使...沉淀
word.lx: Fears about the solvency of the banks precipitated the great economic crash./r/n 对银行偿付能力出现恐慌更加速了经济的崩溃。/r/n They acted with precipitate haste./r/n 他们鲁莽仓促地采取了行动。/r/n

word.name: precipitation
word.mean: n. 坠落,沉淀,凝结;冰雹

word.name: precipitous
word.mean: a. 险峻的(突然的,急躁的)
word.lx: We have a precipitous climb to the peak./r/n 我们向着陡峭山顶攀登。/r/n A precipitous path led down the mountainside./r/n 沿着山腰下来有一条陡峭的山路。/r/n

word.name: precise
word.lx: At the precise moment that I put my foot on the step, the bus started./r/n 恰恰就在我登上公共汽车踏板的时候，车子开动了。/r/n The state or quality of being precise; exactness./r/n 精确精确的状态或性质；准确性/r/n

word.name: precisely
word.lx: That answers precisely to our need./r/n 那恰好符合我们的需要。/r/n My own view precisely./r/n 我正是这样看的。/r/n

word.name: precision
word.mean:
a. 精确的
n. 精确,精密度
word.lx: The diagram had been copied with great precision./r/n 该图表的复印件很精确。/r/n Your report lacks precision./r/n 你的报告不够准确。/r/n

word.name: preclude
word.lx: That will preclude him from escaping./r/n 那将阻止他逃走，那将使他无法逃走。/r/n My present finances preclude the possibility of buying a car./r/n 按我目前的财务状况我是不可能买车的。/r/n

word.name: precocious
word.lx: His son is a precocious child who could play the piano at the age of three./r/n 他的儿子是一个三岁就能弹奏钢琴的早慧儿童。/r/n That child is far too precocious./r/n 孩子过于老成。/r/n

word.name: preconceived
word.mean: a. (思想、观点等)事先形成的

word.name: preconception
word.mean: n. 预想(先入之见,偏见)
word.lx: Common preconceptions about life in this district are increasingly being challenged./r/n 原先普遍存在著对那一地区生活的成见越来越站不住脚了./r/n

word.name: precondition
word.mean:
v. 事先具备条件,事先训练
n. 先决条件

word.name: precursor
word.mean: n. 先驱者,前导,先进者

word.name: predatory
word.mean: a. 掠夺的,进行掠夺的,捕食生物的

word.name: predecessor
word.lx: Our new doctor is much younger than his predecessor./r/n 我们新来的医生比他的前任年轻许多。/r/n He undid most of the good work of his predecessor./r/n 他把前任的大部分业绩毁掉了。/r/n

word.name: predestination
word.lx: Believing in or based on the doctrine of predestination./r/n 信仰宿命论的，依据宿命论的相信宿命论教义的或以宿命论教义为基础的/r/n

word.name: predestine
word.lx: It seemed that his failure was predestined./r/n 他的失败似乎是命中注定的./r/n She was obviously predestined to succeed./r/n 她显然注定了能成功./r/n

word.name: predicament
word.lx: Your refusal puts me in an awkward predicament./r/n 你的拒绝让我感到十分为难。/r/n A loan of money would help me out of my predicament./r/n 只需一笔贷款就能帮我摆脱困境。/r/n

word.name: predicate
word.mean:
n. 述语
a. 述语的
v. 断定为,意味

word.name: predict
word.lx: The economists predicted an increase in the rate of inflation./r/n 经济学家预言通货膨胀率将会增长。/r/n The fortune-teller predicted that I would marry a doctor./r/n 算命先生预言我会同一位医生结婚。/r/n

word.name: predictably
word.lx: Predictably, he left his umbrella in the train./r/n 如所预料，他把雨伞遗留在火车上。/r/n I asked the boss for a rise and his reply was predictably short and sweet!/r/n 我要求老板增加我的工资，他的回答如预料的一样简单明了！/r/n

word.name: prediction
word.lx: Do you take seriously his prediction of a government defeat?/r/n 他预计政府要受挫折，你认为这话靠得住吗？/r/n We all believed in her prediction./r/n 我们都相信她的预言。/r/n

word.name: predilection
word.lx: A strong predilection for anything French./r/n 法国狂偏爱一切法国事物的强烈偏见/r/n

word.name: predisposition
word.mean:
n. 易患病的体质
倾向;素质
word.lx: An antibody found in the blood of individuals having a genetic predisposition to allergies such as asthma and hay fever./r/n 反应素个体血液中的一种抗体，可以对诸如气喘病和光粉热这些变态反应产生预先的基因处理/r/n

word.name: predominance
word.lx: The policy is designed to prevent the predominance of one group over another./r/n 该政策旨在防止一些人压制另一些人./r/n

word.name: predominant
word.mean: a. 优越的,卓越的,有力的
word.lx: Her predominant characteristic is honesty./r/n 她最为突出的特点是诚实。/r/n Which country is the predominant member of the alliance?/r/n 哪个国家在联盟中居于支配地位？/r/n

word.name: predominantly
word.mean: ad. 优越地,卓越地,主要地

word.name: predominate
word.mean: v. 掌握,控制,成为主流
word.lx: Red and white predominate in these flowers./r/n 这些花中大部分是红色和白色的。/r/n Life is made up of sob, sniffle, and smile, with sniffle predominate./r/n 人生是以哭、泣、笑三者构成的，尤以泣为最。/r/n

word.name: preeminence
word.lx: No one doubted his preeminence in financial matters./r/n 没有人怀疑他在金融事务中的卓越成就。/r/n

word.name: preeminent
word.mean: a. 优秀的,超群的,卓越的

word.name: preempt
word.lx: The council found that their traffic plans had been preempted by a government decision./r/n 市议会发现他们的交通规划已因政府先行作了决定而无法推行。/r/n

word.name: preemptive
word.lx: I say this jump is preemptive./r/n 我说这样跳是先发制人的。/r/n

word.name: preface
word.mean:
n. 序文,绪言,前言
v. 作序,写前言,以...开始
word.lx: She prefaced her remarks with a few words of welcome to the guest./r/n 她先讲了几句对客人表示欢迎的话作为开场白。/r/n The preface of this diary recounted her life./r/n 这本日记的前言叙述了她的生活。/r/n

word.name: prefer
word.lx: I much prefer cats to dogs./r/n 猫和狗之中我更喜欢猫。/r/n Which one do you prefer, an apple or an orange?/r/n 你想要哪个，苹果还是橘子？/r/n

word.name: preferable
word.lx: Cold food would be preferable in this heat./r/n 在这样的热天吃冷食更好。/r/n He finds country life preferable to that of living in the city./r/n 他感到在乡村生活比在城市更好。/r/n

word.name: preferably
word.lx: She wanteda cake, preferably one with chocolate icing./r/n 她想吃蛋糕, 最好是有巧克力糖衣的./r/n They want to buy a new house, near the sea preferably./r/n 他们要购买一所新房子, 最好在海边./r/n

word.name: preferred
word.lx: In politics Britain has preferred evolution to revolution./r/n 在政治上，英国喜欢渐进而不喜欢革命。/r/n She had had many proposals (of marriage) but preferred to remain single./r/n 许多人向她求过婚, 但她愿过独身生活./r/n

word.name: prefix
word.mean:
n. 前缀
vt. 加...作为前缀,置于前面
word.lx: Put before; prefixed./r/n 前置的，前缀的/r/n He prefixed a paragraph to the book./r/n 他在书前面加上一段引言。/r/n

word.name: pregnancy
word.lx: You are advised not to smoke during pregnancy./r/n 怀孕期间你最好不要吸烟。/r/n This is her first pregnancy./r/n 这是她第一次怀孕。/r/n

word.name: pregnant
word.mean:
a. 怀孕的
vt. 怀孕
word.lx: His words were followed by a pregnant pause./r/n 他说完话，接着是一段意味深长的停顿。/r/n She got pregnant and was turned out of the house by her parents./r/n 她怀孕了, 父母把她赶出了家门./r/n

word.name: prehistoric
word.lx: The study of the forms of life existing in prehistoric or geologic times, as represented by the fossils of plants, animals, and other organisms./r/n 古生物学对出现在史前或地质时代的生命的形成的研究，体现在植物、动物和其它有机体的化石上/r/n

word.name: prejudice
word.mean:
n. 偏见,成见,伤害
v. 使...存偏见,使...有成见,伤害
word.lx: A new law has been brought in to discourage racial prejudice./r/n 一项反对种族歧视的新法律已被提出。/r/n They accused him of having a prejudice against his women employees./r/n 他们指责他歧视女雇员。/r/n

word.name: prejudiced
word.lx: She regarded her critics as ignorant and prejudiced./r/n 她认为那些批评她的人既无知又存有偏见。/r/n Since I am his mother, my opinion of him is naturally a prejudiced one./r/n 因为我是他的母亲，对他的看法自然是带有偏向的。/r/n

word.name: prejudicial
word.mean: a. 存有偏见的,偏心的,有害的
word.lx: A trial that becomes invalid because of basic prejudicial error in procedure./r/n 无效审判由于审判过程中根本性的偏见性错误而变得无效的审判/r/n

word.name: preliminary
word.mean:
n. 初步行动,准备,初步措施
a. 初步的,开始的,预备的
word.lx: Our team got beaten in the preliminary rounds of the competition./r/n 我们队在这次比赛的预赛中遭淘汰。/r/n There are a lot of preliminaries to be gone through before you can visit a foreign country./r/n 在出访外国之前要做好许多准备工作。/r/n

word.name: preliterate
word.mean: a. 无文字记录的,文字以前的

word.name: prelude
word.lx: The lines form a prelude to his long narrative poem./r/n 这几行诗是他那长篇叙事诗的序诗./r/n The bankruptcy of several small firms was the prelude to general economic collapse./r/n 几家小商行倒闭了, 随之而来的是经济大萧条./r/n

word.name: premature
word.mean:
a. 早熟的,过早的,不按时的
n. 早产儿,早发
word.lx: The baby was five weeks premature./r/n 这个孩子是提早五周生下来的。/r/n A fire in the gallery caused the premature closing of the exhibition./r/n 在美术陈列室里发生的火灾迫使展览会提前结束。/r/n

word.name: prematurely
word.mean: ad. 过早地, 早熟地
word.lx: Worry and illness had made him prematurely old./r/n 他心事重重、 疾病缠身, 落得个未老先衰./r/n

word.name: premeditated
word.mean: a. 预先想过的,预谋的,有计划的
word.lx: A premeditated crime./r/n 有预谋的犯罪/r/n The crime was premeditated./r/n 犯罪是预谋好的。/r/n

word.name: premier
word.mean:
n. 总理,首相
a. 第一的,首位的,最初的
word.lx: His work on the cause of the diseases is of premier importance to the whole world./r/n 他的病理研究工作对全世界至关重要。/r/n The premiers of the two countries met in Geneva yesterday./r/n 两国首相昨天在日内瓦会晤。/r/n

word.name: premiere
word.mean: v. 初次公演,初演主角
word.lx: We went to the premiere of their new presentation./r/n 我们去观看了他们的新剧目的首场演出。/r/n A galaxy of film stars attended the premiere./r/n 一群影星参加了首次公演。/r/n

word.name: premises
word.mean:
n. 前提
v. 立前提
word.lx: Alcohol may not be consumed on the premises./r/n （指公债和股票）超过正常或市面的价值；溢价。/r/n Keep off the premises./r/n 请勿入内。/r/n

word.name: premium
word.mean: n. 额外费用,奖金,保险费
word.lx: The annual premium on my policy is 3000 yuan./r/n 我的保险单每年的保险费是三千元。/r/n The examiners put a premium on rational argument./r/n 评委们对以理服人的论据给以高度评价。/r/n

word.name: premonition
word.lx: The day before her accident, she had a premonition of danger./r/n 在发生事故的前一天，她有一种会发生危险的预感。/r/n

word.name: prenatal
word.lx: Prenatal medical care./r/n 出生前的医学护理/r/n

word.name: prenuptial
word.mean: 结婚前的, 婚礼前的

word.name: preoccupation
word.mean: n. 先取,先入成见,偏见
word.lx: She found his preoccupation with money irritating./r/n 她发觉他心里只有钱, 感到很生气./r/n His main preoccupation at that time was getting enough to eat./r/n 他那时盘算的是如何填饱肚子./r/n

word.name: preoccupied
word.mean: a. 心事重重的,出神的

word.name: preoccupy
word.lx: She seemed preoccupied all the time I was talking to her./r/n 我跟她讲话时她始终显得心事重重./r/n He answered me in a rather preoccupied manner./r/n 他心不在焉地回答我./r/n

word.name: prep
word.lx: Prep a surface for painting./r/n 准备一个平面来作画/r/n Four years of prep school should polish those children./r/n 四年的预科学习应该让这些孩子变得温文尔雅/r/n

word.name: preparatory
word.mean: a. 预备的,准备的,初步的
word.lx: They finished the preparatory training./r/n 他们完成了预备训练。/r/n What are your preparatory measures?/r/n 你的初步措施是什么？/r/n

word.name: prepare
word.lx: He is preparing his speech for the meeting tomorrow./r/n 他正准备明天集会的演说。/r/n Early experiments with military rockets prepared the ground for space travel./r/n 早年对军用火箭进行的实验为发展航天技术奠定了基础。/r/n

word.name: prepared
word.mean:
a. 有准备的(特别处理过的)
v. 准备
word.lx: They prepared rice, flour and sundry other items of food for the poor./r/n 他们为穷人准备了米，面及其它各种食物。/r/n I have prepared everything for the trip./r/n 我做好了旅行的所有准备。/r/n

word.name: prepay
word.lx: The telegram was sent reply prepaid./r/n 电报已发出并已预付复电费用。/r/n I use a prepaid envelope./r/n 我用了一个邮资已付的信封。/r/n

word.name: preponderant
word.mean: a. 以重胜的,优势的,压倒性的
word.lx: Melancholy is the preponderant mood of the poem./r/n 忧郁的感情是该诗的基调./r/n

word.name: preponderate
word.mean: v. 以重量胜过,占优势,胜过
word.lx: Christians preponderate in the population of that part of the country./r/n 基督教徒在该国那一地区的人口中居多./r/n

word.name: preposition
word.lx: Preposition is abbreviated as prep" in this dictionary./r/n 介词在词典中略作 “prep”。/r/n"

word.name: prepossessing
word.mean: a. 讨人欢喜的,有魅力的,给人好感的

word.name: preposterous
word.lx: They are asking a preposterous price for the work./r/n 他们为该作品漫天要价。/r/n The result is preposterous./r/n 结果很可笑。/r/n

word.name: preprint
word.mean:
n. 出版前的非正式样本
v. 预先印好

word.name: prerequisite
word.lx: A sense of humour is prerequisite to understanding her work./r/n 要理解她的作品就必须具有幽默感。/r/n Good muscles are one of the prerequisites of physical fitness./r/n 肌肉发达是身体健康的一个必备条件./r/n

word.name: presage
word.mean:
n. 预感,预兆,预知
v. 成为...的前兆,预示,预言
word.lx: The clouds presage a storm./r/n 乌云预示着暴风雨的到来。/r/n Suddenly he had a presage about the near danger./r/n 他突然对即将到来的危险有了一种预感。/r/n

word.name: preschool
word.mean:
a. 未满学龄的,就学前的
n. 育幼院,幼稚园

word.name: prescribe
word.lx: Regulations prescribe that a lawyer draw up the paper./r/n 条文规定必须由律师拟定此公文。/r/n What medicine did the doctor prescribe for your illness?/r/n 医生开了什么药来治你的病？/r/n

word.name: presence
word.lx: She was so quiet that her presence was hardly noticed./r/n 她那么安静，几乎没有人注意到她在这里。/r/n Since she joined the team last season she has made her presence felt./r/n 自从上个赛季加入这个队以来，她就使人感到她是个举足轻重的队员。/r/n

word.name: presence of mind
word.lx: The child showed great presence of mind by grabbing the falling baby./r/n 那孩子毫不慌张一把抓住了摔下的婴儿./r/n

word.name: present
word.mean:
n. 礼物,现在
a. 现在的,出席的,当面的
v. 赠送,提出,呈现
word.lx: We learn from the past, experience the present and hope for success in the future./r/n 我们从过去中学习，体验现在，展望未来的成功。/r/n He presented her with a bunch of flowers./r/n 他献给她一束花。/r/n

word.name: presentation
word.mean:
n. 陈述,介绍,赠与
n. [美]讲课,报告
word.lx: They are preparing for the presentation of a new musical./r/n 他们正准备上演新的歌舞喜剧。/r/n We went to the premiere of their new presentation./r/n 我们去观看了他们的新剧目的首场演出。/r/n

word.name: presenter
word.mean: n. 赠送的,呈献者,提出者

word.name: presentiment
word.lx: A feeling or an intuition of what is going to occur; a presentiment./r/n 预感，预知对将要发生的事的感觉或直觉；预感/r/n A presentiment of the future; a foreboding./r/n 对未来的不祥预感；预兆/r/n

word.name: presently
word.mean: ad. 不久,一会儿,现在,目前
word.lx: The professor is presently writing a book./r/n 这位教授目前正在写一本书。/r/n The doctor will be here presently./r/n 医生一会儿就到。/r/n

word.name: preservation
word.lx: The aim of the policy is the preservation of peace./r/n 这一政策旨在维护和平。/r/n The paintings were in an excellent state of preservation./r/n 这些画保存的非常好。/r/n

word.name: preservative
word.mean:
a. 保存的,有保存力的,防腐的
n. 预防法,预防药,防腐剂
word.lx: For the first, the best preservative to keep the mind in health, is the faithful admonition of a friend./r/n 说到第一种，最能保人心神之健康的预防药就是朋友的忠言规谏。/r/n Salt is a common food preservative./r/n 盐是一种常用的食物防腐剂。/r/n

word.name: preset
word.lx: The menu will expand to show four preset positions and preset1 will automatically be highlighted./r/n 此菜单会展开显示四个预置位置，Preset1将自动变后。/r/n Preset a microwave oven./r/n 预先调节好微波炉/r/n

word.name: presidency
word.mean: n. 总统职位,总裁职位,主席职位
word.lx: He was elected to a second presidency./r/n 他获选连任总统。/r/n She hopes to win the presidency./r/n 她希望争取到总统职位。/r/n

word.name: president
word.mean: n. (国家)总统,(公司)总裁,总经理,社长(日本)
word.lx: President Lincoln was born poor./r/n 林肯总统出身贫寒。/r/n The president is strongly desirous that you should attend the meeting./r/n 董事长极希望你能参加会议。/r/n

word.name: presidential
word.lx: Next year is a presidential year./r/n 明年是总统选举年。/r/n That politician won the presidential election campaign and became the President./r/n 那位政治家赢得了总统选举，成为了总统。/r/n

word.name: press
word.mean:
n. 新闻界,压力
v. 按,压
word.lx: Press this button to start the engine./r/n 按这个按钮开动引擎。/r/n The child pressed her nose against the window./r/n 那小女孩把鼻子贴在窗户上。/r/n

word.name: press conference
word.lx: You will see him at the press conference./r/n 你会在记者招待会上见到他的。/r/n The spokesman was bombarded with questions on the press conference./r/n 新闻发布会上那位发言人遭到了连珠炮般的发问。/r/n

word.name: pressing
word.mean:
a. 紧迫的,紧急的,切实的
vbl. 压迫

word.name: pressure
word.lx: It took a bit of pressure to make the lid close./r/n 要稍按一下才能把盖子盖紧。/r/n It was done under the pressure of the necessity./r/n 这件事是在迫切需要的情况下而做的。/r/n

word.name: pressurize
word.lx: He felt that he was being pressurized to resign./r/n 他感到有压力逼他辞职./r/n She was pressurized into agreeing to a merger./r/n 她被迫同意将公司合并./r/n

word.name: prestigious
word.mean: a. 享有声望的,声望很高的

word.name: presto
word.mean:
ad.&a. 急速的（地）
n. (音乐)快拍,急速
word.lx: I just turn the piece of wire in the lock and hey presto, the door open./r/n 我把金属丝伸到锁孔里一拧，嘿，那门就开了。/r/n

word.name: Preston
word.lx: Oh, is not that preston Jack? So sorry./r/n 噢，不是普雷斯顿杰克吗？对不起。/r/n

word.name: presumable
word.mean: a. 可推测的,可能有的,似真的
word.lx: The presumable result is an election defeat./r/n 推测结果是竞选可能会失败。/r/n

word.name: presumably
word.mean: ad. 推测上,假定上,大概
word.lx: He will presumably resign in view of the complete failure of his policy./r/n 由於他所推行的政策彻底失败了, 他很可能辞职./r/n She is aware of the difficulties, presumably?/r/n 她对这些困难大概了解吧?/r/n

word.name: presume
word.lx: A signed invoice presumes receipt of the shipment./r/n 经过签字的发票表示货物已经收到。/r/n The law presumes innocence until guilt is proved./r/n 在罪状未证实前，法律假定被告无罪。/r/n

word.name: presumptuous
word.mean: a. 放肆的,冒昧的,冒失的
word.lx: I dislike that presumptuous young man./r/n 我不喜欢那个自以为是的年轻人。/r/n Having or showing excessive and arrogant self-confidence; presumptuous./r/n 冒昧的，放肆的拥有或显示过分的或傲慢的自信的；自行其事的/r/n

word.name: presupposition
word.lx: Bail was refused on the presupposition of his guilt./r/n 已料到他罪名成立而不准保释./r/n You have made several unjustified presuppositions./r/n 你作了一些毫无根据的假设./r/n

word.name: pretend
word.lx: She pretends that she likes them so that she can get their help./r/n 她假装很喜欢他们，借以获得他们的帮助。/r/n The young actor pretended to be Hamlet./r/n 那个年轻演员扮演哈姆雷特。/r/n

word.name: pretended
word.lx: He is nothing but a hypocrite, pretending that he knows nothing about it./r/n 他是一个虚伪的人，假装对那件事一无所知。/r/n The young actor pretended to be Hamlet./r/n 那个年轻演员扮演哈姆雷特。/r/n

word.name: pretense
word.lx: It is merely a pretense./r/n 这只是托词而已。/r/n The act of inventing such a creation or pretense./r/n 虚构，捏造虚构作品或捏造借口的行为/r/n

word.name: pretension
word.mean: n. 借口, 要求, 主张, 自负, 骄傲, 权力, 资格, 预紧,预伸,预拉
word.lx: He has no pretensions to being an expert on the subject./r/n 他并不以这方面专家自居。/r/n His social pretensions make him appear ridiculous./r/n 他冒充上流社会人士而出尽洋相。/r/n

word.name: pretentious
word.mean: a. 自负的,自命不凡的
word.lx: One who is insincere or pretentious./r/n 伪君子虚伪或自负的人/r/n Striving to be modern in appearance or style but lacking taste or refinement; pretentious./r/n 做作地追求现代的力求具有现代样式或外观但不雅观或缺少品味的；自命不凡的/r/n

word.name: prettily
word.lx: She decorated the room very prettily./r/n 她把房间装饰得漂亮极了。/r/n She smiled prettily as she accepted the flowers./r/n 她在接受鲜花时, 笑得真迷人./r/n

word.name: pretty
word.mean:
a. 漂亮的
ad. 相当地
word.lx: The little girl is pretty./r/n 这个小女孩很漂亮。/r/n What a pretty little garden!/r/n 多么漂亮的小花园！/r/n

word.name: prevail
word.lx: Misty weather prevails in this part of the country./r/n 该国的这一地区天气多雾。/r/n Sadness prevailed in our mind./r/n 我们的心中充满悲痛，/r/n

word.name: prevailing
word.mean:
a. 盛行很广的,一般的,最普通的
vbl. 获胜,盛行,流行
word.lx: Product buy- back is a prevailing payment term at present./r/n 产品回购是目前流行的一种付款方式。/r/n Being in or conforming to the prevailing or current fashion; stylish./r/n 流行的符合流行的或现时的式样的；时髦的/r/n

word.name: prevalent
word.lx: Eye diseases are prevalent in some tropical countries./r/n 在一些热带国家，眼疾很流行。/r/n The prevalent opinion is in favour of reform./r/n 一般舆论都支持改革./r/n

word.name: prevent
word.lx: What can we do to prevent the disease spreading?/r/n 我们能做什么来防止这种疾病蔓延呢？/r/n These regulations are intended to prevent accidents./r/n 这些规章制度旨在防止事故发生。/r/n

word.name: prevention
word.lx: Prevention is better than cure./r/n 预防胜于治疗（治病不如防病）。/r/n They have begun to do the prevention of crime./r/n 他们已经开始防止犯罪行为。/r/n

word.name: preventive
word.mean:
a. 预防的
n. 预防法
word.lx: Please take some preventive medicine now./r/n 请吃些预防药吧。/r/n We had to take preventive measures./r/n 我们不得不采取预防措施。/r/n

word.name: preview
word.mean:
n. 事先查看,查阅
v. 事先查看,查阅

word.name: previous
word.mean: a. 在...之前,先,前,以前的
word.lx: Previous to the conference we had discussed the matter among ourselves./r/n 在会议之前，我们讨论了这个问题。/r/n Have you had previous career experience?/r/n 你过去有过工作经验吗？/r/n

word.name: previous to
word.lx: Previous to the conference we had discussed the matter among ourselves./r/n 在会议之前，我们讨论了这个问题。/r/n

word.name: previously
word.lx: Who previously held the record?/r/n 这个纪录原先由谁保持？/r/n The star of the film is a previously unknown actor./r/n 这部电影里的明星以前是个默默无闻的演员./r/n

word.name: prey
word.mean:
n. 被掠食者,牺牲者
v. 捕食,掠夺,使...苦恼
word.lx: Cares preyed upon her health./r/n 忧虑损害了她的健康。/r/n The lion seized its prey and ate it./r/n 狮子抓住猎物，把它吃了。/r/n

word.name: price
word.mean:
n. 价格,代价,价值
v. 定...的价格,标价
word.lx: The dresses in the shop are priced high./r/n 这家商店的衣服定价很高。/r/n What is the price of the suit?/r/n 这套西装多少钱？/r/n

word.name: priceless
word.lx: In its spacious halls are displayed over8000 priceless relics./r/n 在它宽敞的大厅里，展出了8000多件珍贵文物。/r/n A maniac had gouged several holes in the priceless painting./r/n 有个狂徒在那幅价值连城的画上乱凿了几个洞./r/n

word.name: pricey
word.mean: a. 昂贵的,过分昂贵的
word.lx: This restaurant is a bit pricey for me./r/n 这家饭馆的价钱对我来说贵了些./r/n Houses are pricey in this area of the city./r/n 城里这个地区的住房价格很高。/r/n

word.name: pricing
word.lx: The separate pricing of goods and services./r/n 分别处理商品和服务的价格/r/n The new law allows firms a lot less latitude than before in fixing the price of their goods./r/n 新法律在允许各商行给产品定价的自由上比以前少得多了。/r/n

word.name: prick
word.mean:
v. 刺,穿,受责备
n. 扎,逗点,锥
word.lx: She pricked herself on a needle./r/n 她被针扎了一下。/r/n He felt a sharp prick when he stepped on a upturned nail./r/n 他一脚踩在一枚尖头朝上的钉子上，感到一阵剧痛。/r/n

word.name: prickle
word.mean:
n. (动物或植物上的)刺,棘
v. 刺痛
word.lx: The woollen cloth prickles (my skin)./r/n 穿毛料衣服（使我的皮肤）有被扎的感觉./r/n My scalp began to prickle as I realized the horrible truth./r/n 我了解到了那令人恐惧的事实, 顿时感到不寒而栗./r/n

word.name: pride
word.mean:
n. 自傲,自豪,自尊
v. 以...自豪
word.lx: Pride was his downfall./r/n 骄傲是他垮台的原因。/r/n I think you hurt his pride by laughing at the way he speaks English./r/n 我觉得你嘲笑他说英语的方式刺伤了他的自尊心。/r/n

word.name: priest
word.lx: The priest persuaded him to give up his bad habit./r/n 牧师劝他放弃坏习惯。/r/n The priest is a regular caller./r/n 这位神父经常来访。/r/n

word.name: primarily
word.lx: This building was primarily intended to be a dinning hall./r/n 这座建筑原来是打算用作餐厅的。/r/n Most linguists would say they were concerned primarily with the structure of languages./r/n 大多数语言学家都会说，他们主要研究各种语言的结构。/r/n

word.name: primary
word.mean:
n. 最主要者
a. 主要的,初期的,根本的
word.lx: Love and hatred are primary emotions./r/n 爱和恨是基本的情感。/r/n The disease is still in its primary stage./r/n 这疾病仍然在初发阶段。/r/n

word.name: primary school
word.lx: The little boy left primary school at eleven./r/n 这个小男孩十一岁时小学毕业。/r/n Sure. We are friends since primary school./r/n 当然，我们从小学就是朋友了。/r/n

word.name: primate
word.lx: The office, rank, or province of primate./r/n 首席主教（或都主教，大主教）的职责，阶层或教区/r/n The human being is a primate./r/n 人类是灵长类动物/r/n

word.name: primavera
word.mean: n. 白桃花心木(中美洲出产的一种树木或其木材)

word.name: prime
word.mean:
a. 首要的,最好的
n. 青春,壮年,全盛时期
word.lx: He makes it his prime care./r/n 他极为重视这件事。/r/n What was said was of prime importance./r/n 说过的那件事是很重要的。/r/n

word.name: prime minister
word.lx: Mr. Heath is the former Prime Minister of Britain./r/n 希思先生是英国前任首相。/r/n The Prime Minister was dethroned by the President./r/n 总理被总统废黜了。/r/n

word.name: primer
word.lx: A coat of primer should be made over the bare surface before the main painting./r/n 在喷涂主漆前，应在物品的表面刷一层底漆。/r/n Children learn knowledge from primers./r/n 孩子们从启蒙书上学习知识。/r/n

word.name: primeval
word.mean: a. 原始的,早期的,远古的
word.lx: The primeval chaos out of which it was believed that the earth and sky were formed./r/n 混沌，洪荒原始的混沌状态，据信地球和天空由此形成/r/n Being first in time; original; primeval./r/n 最初的，原始的；远古的/r/n

word.name: primitive
word.mean:
a. 原始的
n. 原始人
word.lx: Primitive man made himself primitive tools from sharp stones and animal bones./r/n 原始人用尖石块和兽骨为自己制作原始的工具。/r/n Small seashells were often used as a primitive kind of money./r/n 小贝壳常被用作简单的货币。/r/n

word.name: primogeniture
word.lx: He inherited his father by right of his primogeniture./r/n 他凭着长子继承权，继承了他父亲的财产。/r/n

word.name: primrose
word.mean:
n. 樱草类,樱草花,樱草色
a. 樱草的,樱草色的,华美的
word.lx: They walked along the primrose bank chatting./r/n 他们沿着报春花盛开的河岸边走边聊。/r/n Oil of evening primrose is used as a herbal medicine./r/n 月见草油可用作草药./r/n

word.name: prince
word.lx: Prince Charles will be the next king of England./r/n 查尔斯王子将是英国的下一位国王。/r/n The prince lived in a large and beautiful castle./r/n 王子住在一个美丽的大城堡里。/r/n

word.name: princess
word.lx: Princess Anne is the daughter of Queen Elizabeth./r/n 安妮公主是伊丽莎白女王的女儿。/r/n She performs the duties of a princess with great aplomb./r/n 她泰然自若地履行王妃的职责./r/n

word.name: Princeton
word.lx: Professor Green, lately of Princeton, is now head of the department at California./r/n 格林教授不久前在普林斯顿任教，现在是加州大学的系主任。/r/n

word.name: principal
word.mean:
a. 主要的
n. 负责人,校长,资本
word.lx: Our principal problem is lack of time./r/n 我们的主要问题就是缺少时间。/r/n The agent spoke on behalf of his principal./r/n 代理人代表他的委托人说话。/r/n

word.name: principally
word.lx: The dialect is spoken principally in the rural areas./r/n 这种方言主要在农村地区使用。/r/n The money is invested principally in government stock./r/n 这笔钱主要投资于政府公债上。/r/n

word.name: principle
word.mean: n. 原则,原理,主义,信念
word.lx: We adhere to the principle that everyone should be treated fairly./r/n 我们必须坚持人人都应该被平等对待这一原则。/r/n The system works on the principle that heat rises./r/n 该项装置是按照热力上升的原理运转的。/r/n

word.name: print head
word.lx: A pin in the print head of a computer printer./r/n 撞针计算机打印机的印刷头上的撞针/r/n

word.name: printable
word.lx: His comment when he heard the news was not printable! ie was too rude to be printed./r/n 他在得知这消息时所发的议论不宜见诸报端（语言粗俗难登大雅之堂）./r/n The article is too badly written to be printable./r/n 这篇文章写得很糟糕, 不宜发表./r/n

word.name: printed matter
word.lx: Printed matter of passing interest./r/n 只具有极短吸引力的印刷品/r/n Spaces or a space, as in printed matter./r/n 字距空隙或空白，如印刷品中/r/n

word.name: printer
word.lx: This error is made by printer./r/n 这个错误是由印刷工造成的。/r/n Do you have enough money to buy a new printer?/r/n 你有足够的钱买一台新的打印机吗？/r/n

word.name: printing
word.mean:
n. 印刷,印刷术
vbl. 印刷
word.lx: The old printing press will have to be pensioned off./r/n 那个旧印刷机得报销了./r/n The firm specializes in printing advertisements./r/n 这家公司专印广告./r/n

word.name: printing ink
word.lx: The printing ink has been used up./r/n 印刷油墨用光了。/r/n

word.name: printout
word.lx: Get me a printout of the statistics./r/n 给我一份打印出的统计资料./r/n A printout of a program or data set./r/n 清单打印出的程序或数据组/r/n

word.name: prior
word.mean:
a. 更重要的,较早的,在先的
ad. 居先
word.lx: All the arrangements should have been completed prior to our departure./r/n 全部安排都应该在我们出发之前完成。/r/n I was unable to attend the meeting because of a prior engagement./r/n 我因有约在先，所以未能参加这个会。/r/n

word.name: priority
word.mean: n. 优先权,优先顺序,优先
word.lx: I have priority over you in my claim./r/n 我的请求比你的优先。/r/n Rebuilding the area is a (top) priority./r/n 重建这一地区是当务之急./r/n

word.name: prism
word.lx: The sunlight will break into different colors through a prism./r/n 阳光穿过棱镜时将分解成各种颜色。/r/n A prism decomposes light./r/n 棱镜可以分解光线。/r/n

word.name: prissy
word.mean: a. 谨小慎微的,神经质的,为小事挂虑的

word.name: pristine
word.mean: a. 原来的,古时的,原始的
word.lx: Pristine mountain snow./r/n 山上洁白的雪/r/n

word.name: privacy
word.lx: Everyone has his own privacy./r/n 每个人都有自己的隐私。/r/n In this place privacy is impossible./r/n 在这种地方保密是不可能的。/r/n

word.name: private enterprise
word.mean: n. 私人企业, 民营企业
word.lx: He works in a private enterprise./r/n 他在一家私人企业工作。/r/n Conservativegovernments in Britain favour private enterprise rather than nationalization./r/n 英国的保守党政府赞成私人经营而反对国有化./r/n

word.name: privilege
word.mean:
n. 特权,特别恩典,基本人权
v. 给与...特权
word.lx: It was a privilege to work with him./r/n 和他在一起工作是一项殊荣。/r/n She had led a life of luxury and privilege./r/n 她过著养尊处优的生活。/r/n

word.name: privy
word.mean:
a. 个人的
n. 厕所(有利害关系的人)
word.lx: I was not privy to the discussion, so I cannot tell you what was decided./r/n 我并不了解讨论的情况，所以无法告诉你做了什么决定。/r/n A latrine; a privy./r/n 厕所旧式厕所；茅坑/r/n

word.name: pro
word.mean:
n. 能手(赞成)
ad. 正面地
word.lx: This arrangement will have to do pro tem./r/n 暂时只好这样安排./r/n Much has been written on the subject pro and con./r/n 对那问题已有很多赞成和反对的文章。/r/n

word.name: probability
word.mean: n. 可能性,或然率,机率
word.lx: There is a little probability of his success./r/n 他不大可能成功。/r/n The probability of a peace agreement being reached is zero./r/n 达成和平协定的概率是零。/r/n

word.name: probability theory
word.lx: French mathematician who formulated modern number theory and probability theory./r/n 费马，皮尔·德1601－1665法国数学家，他有系统地阐述了现代数理论和概率论/r/n

word.name: probe
word.mean:
n. 探针,调查,探测针
v. 用探针测,详细调查

word.name: probing
word.lx: The journalist was probing into several financial scandals./r/n 那记者正在调查几起财务丑闻。/r/n He was asking probing questions./r/n 他提出了一些盘根究底的问题。/r/n

word.name: probity
word.lx: Nobility of mind; probity./r/n 心灵的高贵；正直/r/n

word.name: problematic
word.mean: a. 问题的, 有疑问的
word.lx: Open to doubt or challenge; problematic./r/n 可疑的易于受到怀疑或挑战的；有疑问的/r/n

word.name: problematical
word.mean: a. 成问题的,有疑问的

word.name: procedural
word.lx: The business of the committee was delayed by procedural difficulties./r/n 委员会的事务因程序上有困难而耽搁了./r/n A police procedural./r/n 警方程序上的/r/n

word.name: proceed
word.mean: v. 著手进行,继续进行
word.lx: The work is proceeding according to plan./r/n 工作正按计划进行。/r/n He paused to consult his notes, and then proceeded with his questions./r/n 他停下来看了看笔记，然后继续提问。/r/n

word.name: proceeding
word.mean:
n. 进行,行动,诉讼程序
vbl. 著手进行,继续进行,肇始
word.lx: The work is proceeding according to plan./r/n 工作正按计划进行。/r/n The entire course of a judicial proceeding./r/n 诉讼程序司法程序的全过程/r/n

word.name: proceedings
word.mean: n. 公报,进程,过程,议程,诉讼(程序)
word.lx: The proceedings will begin with a speech to welcome the guests./r/n 大会议程首先 是向来宾致欢迎辞./r/n The proceedings were interrupted by the fire alarm./r/n 会议的进程被火灾警报打断了./r/n

word.name: proceeds
word.lx: Proceeds from the concert will go to charity./r/n 音乐会的收入将捐赠给慈善事业./r/n Most people sell their souls and live with a good conscience on the proceeds./r/n 大多数的人在出卖了自己的灵魂之后，就凭那收入过其心安理得的日子。/r/n

word.name: process
word.mean:
n. 过程
v. 加工
vi. 列队前进
vt. 加工,处理
word.lx: Producing a dictionary is a slow process./r/n 编成一本字典是一个缓慢的过程。/r/n It may take a few weeks for your application to be processed./r/n 审查你的申请书也许要等几个星期。/r/n

word.name: processing
word.mean: n. 数据处理(整理,配制,工艺设计)

word.name: procession
word.mean:
n. 队伍,行列
v. 列队行进
word.lx: The troops walked in procession through the street./r/n 军队排成队伍走过街道。/r/n There was a bomb scare during the procession./r/n 在列队行进时因怀疑有炸弹而引起恐慌./r/n

word.name: processor
word.lx: John and Liz shared the prize money between them John used his half to buy a word processor./r/n 约翰和利兹二人把奖金分了--约翰用他分到的那一半奖金购买了文字处理机./r/n Put the food processor together./r/n 把食品处理器组装起来/r/n

word.name: proclaim
word.lx: His accent proclaimed that he was an American./r/n 他的口音表明他是一个美国人。/r/n The act of proclaiming or the condition of being proclaimed./r/n 公布，宣布公布的行为或被公布的状况/r/n

word.name: proclamation
word.lx: There is a royal proclamation of the birth of the prince./r/n 那有一张王室的公告，宣告王子诞生了。/r/n An official or authoritarian declaration; a proclamation or an edict./r/n 宣言，公告官方或权威性的宣布；公告或法令/r/n

word.name: procrastinate
word.lx: He procrastinated until it was too late to do anything at all./r/n 他因循坐误, 一事无成./r/n

word.name: procrastination
word.lx: Procrastination is the thief of time./r/n 因循拖延是时间的大敌；拖延就是浪费时间。/r/n

word.name: procreate
word.mean:
vt.生(儿,女), 生殖, 产生
vi.生殖, 生育

word.name: procure
word.lx: Can you procure the rare old book for me?/r/n 你能为我觅到那本罕见的古书吗？/r/n The book is out of print and difficult to procure./r/n 那书已绝版, 很难弄到手./r/n

word.name: procurement
word.mean: n. 取得(征购,斡旋,促成)

word.name: prod
word.mean:
n. 刺针,刺棒,签子
v. 戳,刺,刺激
word.lx: She gave the man a prod with her umbrella./r/n 她用伞捅了那男子一下。/r/n I shall have to prod him to pay me what he owes./r/n 我将不得不催促他把欠我的钱还给我。/r/n

word.name: prodigal
word.mean:
a. 挥霍的
n. 挥霍者
word.lx: I hate the prodigal administration./r/n 我痛恨铺张浪费的行政机关。/r/n Those prodigals were put into prison./r/n 那些挥霍者被关进监狱。/r/n

word.name: prodigious
word.mean:
a. 巨大的,奇异的
n. 奇迹
word.lx: We are all overwhelmed by his prodigious memory./r/n 我们都被他那惊人的记忆力折服了。/r/n That boxer is a prodigious feed./r/n 那个拳击家是个大肚汉。/r/n

word.name: prodigy
word.mean: n. 惊人的事物,不凡的人,神童
word.lx: A child prodigy./r/n 神童，少年天才/r/n Something amazing or marvelous; a prodigy./r/n 异常的人或事；奇异的事/r/n

word.name: produce
word.mean:
n. 产品,农产品
v. 产生,生产,提出
word.lx: She can produce delicious meal from very simple ingredients./r/n 她能用简单配料烹调出美味的饭菜。/r/n Female sheep produce one or two lambs at a time./r/n 母羊一次生一到两只羊羔。/r/n

word.name: producer
word.lx: The conflicting interests of producers and consumers will be everlasting./r/n 生产者与消费者之间的利益冲突将永远存在。/r/n The radios producers could not find a market for them./r/n 这些收音机制造厂的产品打不开销路。/r/n

word.name: production
word.mean: n. 生产,产品, 作品,成果
word.lx: They tried to increase production by using better methods and tools./r/n 他们试图利用更好的方法和工具来增加生产力。/r/n The system will have to be tested before it goes into production./r/n 这套装置必须经过试验之后才能投产。/r/n

word.name: productive
word.mean: a. 能生产的,有生产价值的,多产的
word.lx: They work hard, but their efforts are not very productive./r/n 他们很努力，但效率不太高。/r/n She was elected a productive worker./r/n 她被选为劳动能手。/r/n

word.name: productivity
word.lx: The workers are trying their best to increase productivity./r/n 工人们正竭尽全力提高生产力。/r/n The new system has had a disastrous effect on productivity./r/n 新制度已对生产力造成了灾难性的影响。/r/n

word.name: profane
word.mean:
a. 世俗的,不敬神的,亵渎的
v. 亵渎,玷污
word.lx: His profane language annoyed us./r/n 他亵渎的言语激怒了我们。/r/n The soldiers profaned the church./r/n 士兵们玷污了教堂。/r/n

word.name: profanity
word.mean: n. 沾污神圣不敬,亵渎,该受惩罚的言语
word.lx: He uttered a stream of profanities./r/n 他说出了一连串下流话./r/n

word.name: profess
word.lx: He professed himself to be a poet./r/n 他自称是诗人。/r/n He professed to know nothing about the matter./r/n 他声称对此事一无所知。/r/n

word.name: professional
word.mean:
a. 职业的,专业的
n. 专业人员
word.lx: She is a real professional./r/n 她是个真正的专家。/r/n That doctor has been accused of professional misconduct./r/n 那位医生被指控违反医德。/r/n

word.name: professionally
word.lx: The plans had been drawn professionally./r/n 那计画是由专家制定的。/r/n Her voice should be professionally trained./r/n 她在运嗓上应接受专业训练。/r/n

word.name: professor
word.lx: He is a professor of history./r/n 他是为历史学教授。/r/n Professor Green, lately of Princeton, is now head of the department at California./r/n 格林教授不久前在普林斯顿任教，现在是加州大学的系主任。/r/n

word.name: proffer
word.mean:
v. 提供
n. 提供,提出,提供物
word.lx: She proffered him her resignation./r/n 她向他递交了辞呈。/r/n I gave her a proffer of help./r/n 我给了她一个援助性的建议。/r/n

word.name: proficiency
word.lx: Any of12 levels of proficiency at the grade of black belt in martial arts such as judo and karate./r/n 段在东方武术中，黑腰带的级别精通达12级中的任一级，如柔道和空手道/r/n

word.name: proficient
word.mean:
a. 熟练的,精通的
n. 能手,专家
word.lx: The state or quality of being proficient; competence./r/n 熟练，精通熟练的性质或状态；内行/r/n After reading this book, you will be proficient in writing./r/n 读完这本书, 你会精于写作。/r/n

word.name: profile
word.mean:
n. 侧面,轮廓,人物素描
v. 描绘...轮廓,评论人物
n. 概要,人物简介
word.lx: The government is trying to keep a low profile on this issue./r/n 政府力图在这个问题上保持低姿态。/r/n The huge trees were profiled against the night sky./r/n 在夜空的映衬下显出大树的轮廓。/r/n

word.name: profiling
word.lx: The huge trees were profiled against the night sky./r/n 在夜空的映衬下显出大树的轮廓。/r/n

word.name: profit
word.mean:
n. 利润,赢利,利益
v. 有益,获利,赚钱
word.lx: There is very little profit in selling newspapers at present./r/n 现在卖报纸利润很少。/r/n You can profit by my mistakes and avoid them yourself./r/n 你可以从我的错误中得到教训，避免犯同样错误。/r/n

word.name: profitable
word.lx: It is profitable to import food./r/n 进口食品可赚钱。/r/n Producing results; profitable./r/n 产生结果的；有益的/r/n

word.name: profiteer
word.mean:
n. 获暴利的人,奸商
v. 获暴利,赚大钱
word.lx: Rent controls were introduced to prevent profiteering./r/n 为了防止牟取暴利而 实行了租金管制./r/n

word.name: profitless
word.lx: Revising the procedure was an entirely profitless exercise./r/n 对程序进行修改是徒劳无功的./r/n

word.name: profligate
word.mean:
a. 放荡的,不检点的,浪费的
n. 放荡者,享乐者
word.lx: One who wastes, especially one who wastes money; a profligate./r/n 浪费者浪费之人，尤指浪费钱财的人；败家子/r/n

word.name: profound
word.mean: a. 极深的,深奥的,深厚的
word.lx: They listened to the speaker with profound interest./r/n 他们怀着浓厚的兴趣聆听着演讲者。/r/n Strange creatures live in the profound depths of the ocean./r/n 大洋深处生活着奇异的生物。/r/n

word.name: profoundly
word.mean:
a. 深深地,深远地,非常地
ad. 深深地
word.lx: His feeling has been harmed profoundly./r/n 他的感情被深深地伤害了。/r/n The news moved her profoundly. She immediately asked to go to the front./r/n 这消息使她深受感动，她立即要求到前线去。/r/n

word.name: profundity
word.lx: He impressed his audience by the profundity of his knowledge./r/n 他知识渊博给听众留下了深刻的印象./r/n He impress his audience by the profundity of his knowledge./r/n 他知识渊博给听众留下了深刻的印象。/r/n

word.name: profuse
word.mean: a. 很多的,丰富的,浪费的
word.lx: There are profuse blossoms./r/n 那儿有很多花朵。/r/n He made profuse apologies./r/n 他再三道歉。/r/n

word.name: profusion
word.lx: Hundreds of flowers are blooming in profusion./r/n 百花怒放。/r/n The weeds grew in wanton profusion./r/n 遍地野草丛生./r/n

word.name: progenitor
word.lx: Marx is the progenitor of Communism./r/n 马克思是共产主义的创始人./r/n It is said that our progenitors are monkeys./r/n 据说我们的祖先是猴子。/r/n

word.name: progeny
word.mean: n. 子孙(结果,次级粒子)
word.lx: He appeared, surrounded by his numerous progeny./r/n 他出现时，子女前呼后拥不计其数。/r/n

word.name: prognosis
word.lx: The prognosis for the future of the electronics industry is encouraging./r/n 预测电子工业的前途一片大好./r/n

word.name: programmer
word.mean: n. 程序员,程序规划员

word.name: programming
word.mean:
n. 规画,设计
vbl. 规画,设计

word.name: progress
word.mean:
n. 进步,发展,前进
v. 促进,进步,进行
word.lx: The ship made slow progress through the rough sea./r/n 船只在汹涌的大海中缓慢前进。/r/n The student is showing rapid progress in his studies./r/n 这个学生学习上进步很快。/r/n

word.name: progressive
word.mean:
a. 进步的,前进的
n. 进步人士
word.lx: That famous progressive thinker was asked to deliver a speech at the meeting./r/n 那位著名的进步思想家被邀请在会议上发表演讲。/r/n She is the most progressive writer of the time./r/n 她是那个时代最进步的作家。/r/n

word.name: progressively
word.lx: The bank has progressively increased its liquidity./r/n 银行逐渐地增加其流动资产。/r/n Moment by moment; progressively./r/n 时时刻刻地；不停地/r/n

word.name: prohibit
word.mean:
v. 禁止,阻止
vt. 禁止
word.lx: I fear that a prior engagement will prohibit me from joining you in dinner./r/n 有约在先，我恐怕不能与你共进晚餐。/r/n Rainy weather and fog prohibited flying./r/n 雨天和大雾妨碍了飞行。/r/n

word.name: prohibition
word.lx: The prohibition against smoking on school grounds is strictly enforced./r/n 校园内严禁吸烟。/r/n Prohibition was laid on the export of coal./r/n 禁止煤炭输出。/r/n

word.name: prohibitive
word.mean: a. 禁止的,禁制的,类同禁止的
word.lx: The prohibitive favorite to win the nomination./r/n 得到绝大多数投票获得提名/r/n The cost of travel to the far east is prohibitive./r/n 到远东旅游的费用高的令人不敢问津。/r/n

word.name: project
word.mean:
n. 工程,项目,计划,事业
v. 计划,设计,表达
v. 投射,放映,凸出
word.lx: A missile was projected into space./r/n 导弹被发射升空。/r/n Their project to establish a new national park will be completed next year./r/n 他们建造一个新的国家公园的工程将于明年完工。/r/n

word.name: projectile
word.mean:
n. 发射体,抛射物
a. 发射的,投射的
word.lx: A whistling sound, as of an animal or a projectile./r/n 啭鸣声尖厉高音，如动物或发射物而发出的声音/r/n Such a projectile in a metal casing; a cartridge./r/n 弹药（筒）装在金属盒中的射弹。弹药/r/n

word.name: projection
word.mean: n. 发射,计画,突出部分
word.lx: The projection on the picture is our building./r/n 那张照片上的突出物是我们的大楼。/r/n Relating to or made by projection./r/n 投影的由投影制作的或与其有关的/r/n

word.name: projector
word.mean: n. 放映机(探照灯,发射装置,设计者,制图投射线)
word.lx: How long will it take to set up the projector?/r/n 把这个放映机安放好需要多长时间?/r/n The film flew off the spool and wound itself round the projector./r/n 电影胶片从卷轴滑出缠绕在放映机上了./r/n

word.name: proletarian
word.mean:
a. 普罗阶级的,无产阶级的
n. 普罗,无产者
word.lx: Our friend ship is built on proletarian, internationalism./r/n 我们的友谊是建立在无产阶级国际主义之上的。/r/n Proletarian revolutionaries always cleave to Marxist-Leninist principles./r/n 无产阶级革命者永远忠于马列主义的原则。/r/n

word.name: proliferate
word.mean: vt. 增殖(增生,使...激增,使...扩散,迅速扩大)

word.name: prologue
word.mean:
n. 开场白,序言,序幕
v. 说开场的,加上...前言
word.lx: He began his prologue by saying good night"./r/n 他以“晚上好”开始了他的开场白。/r/n

word.name: prolonged
word.mean: a. 持续很久的(长时期的,长时间的)
word.lx: After prolonged questioning, she finally confessed./r/n 她受到长时间的盘问之後，终於承认了。/r/n The crowd burst into prolonged cheering./r/n 人群中爆发出长时间的欢呼声。/r/n

word.name: prom
word.mean: n. 可编程序的只读存储器(程序可控只读存储器)
word.lx: Juliet and Susan were talking about the prom, and Joan threw in that she was going with Fred./r/n 朱丽叶与苏珊正谈论舞会，琼插嘴说她要跟弗雷德一起去。/r/n The junior class; the junior prom./r/n 三年级生的班级；大学三年级生举办的舞会/r/n

word.name: promenade
word.mean:
n. 散步,骑马,舞会
v. 漫步,骑马
word.lx: He promenaded along the beach with his wife./r/n 他和妻子沿着海滩散步。/r/n She promenaded the children along the sea front after lunch./r/n 她午饭後领著孩子们沿著海滨区散步。/r/n

word.name: prominent
word.mean: a. 杰出的,显著的,突出的
word.lx: Einstein was a prominent scientist./r/n 爱因斯坦是一位卓越的科学家。/r/n The house is in a prominent position on the village green./r/n 这间屋子在村子的中心草地上，处于引人注目的位置。/r/n

word.name: prominently
word.lx: He figured prominently in the discussion./r/n 他参与了这次讨论，并引起了人们的注意。/r/n

word.name: promiscuous
word.mean:
a. 杂乱的,混杂的,混淆的
ad. 偶然地,胡乱地
word.lx: A person regarded as promiscuous./r/n 淫棍被认为性关系混乱的人/r/n A promiscuous man; a philanderer./r/n 好色者好色的男人；玩弄女性的男人/r/n

word.name: promise
word.mean:
n. 诺言,约定,希望
v. 允诺,约定,预示
word.lx: John promises well as an actor./r/n 约翰有希望成为演员。/r/n The new sales policy promises well./r/n 新的销售办法可望取得良好效果。/r/n

word.name: Promised Land
word.mean:
上帝允许给亚伯拉罕的地方
乐土
福地
希望之乡
word.lx: Nobody can bring us swiftly, painlessly into the promised land./r/n 无人能够把我们迅速地、毫无痛苦地带进理想之园。/r/n

word.name: promises
word.mean:
n. 承诺
v. 允诺
word.lx: Their promises are not worth a damn./r/n 他们的承诺分文不值./r/n Many voters know that the promises of different parties before an election are all just pie in the sky./r/n 许多选民都知道各党派在选举前的承诺只不过是空头支票，不会兑现的。/r/n

word.name: promising
word.mean: a. 有希望的,有前途的
word.lx: The newspapers described her as a promising young singer./r/n 报纸上将她称为大有前途的青年歌手。/r/n The coach is bringing on some promising youngsters in the reserve team./r/n 教练正在帮助後备队中有前途的年轻人提高技术./r/n

word.name: promissory
word.lx: A promissory note./r/n 借据保证性的证据/r/n

word.name: promissory note
word.lx: A promissory note./r/n 借据保证性的证据/r/n

word.name: promontory
word.lx: A promontory of southeast Newfoundland, Canada, on the coast of the Avalon Peninsula./r/n 莱思角加拿大纽芬兰省东南部一海角，位于亚法隆半岛沿岸/r/n

word.name: promote
word.mean: v. 促进,提升,升迁,促销
word.lx: After this win, Manchester United was promoted to the First Division./r/n 这次踢赢之后，曼彻斯特联队升入了甲级。/r/n The young army officer was promoted to the rank of captain./r/n 这个年轻军官被提升为上尉。/r/n

word.name: promoter
word.lx: The promoters matched the young boxer with a more skillful fighter./r/n 发起人安排这位年轻的拳击选手同一位更老练的拳击手比赛。/r/n

word.name: prompting
word.lx: He did it without any prompting from me./r/n 他做这事完全不用我督促。/r/n The act of prompting or giving a cue./r/n 提醒，暗示提醒或给予暗示的行为/r/n

word.name: promulgate
word.lx: The king promulgate a decree./r/n 国王颁布了一项命令。/r/n

word.name: prone
word.mean: a. 俯卧的,易于...的,有...倾向的
word.lx: They stepped over his prone body./r/n 他们从他俯卧的身体上踩过去。/r/n People are more prone to make mistakes when they are tired./r/n 人们疲劳时更容易出差错。/r/n

word.name: pronoun
word.lx: Please make a sentence with this pronoun./r/n 请用这个代词造一个句子。/r/n That" is a demonstrative pronoun./r/n that是一个指示代词。/r/n"

word.name: pronounced
word.mean:
a. 显著的,断然的,明白的
vbl. 发音,宣告,断言

word.name: pronunciation
word.lx: You should look up the right pronunciation of this word in the dictionary./r/n 你应该查字典找出这个单词的正确读音。/r/n Your faults of pronunciation can be remedied./r/n 你的发音毛病是可以纠正的。/r/n

word.name: proofreader
word.lx: His mistake got by the editor but was caught by the proofreader./r/n 他的错误被编辑忽视了但被校对员发现了/r/n

word.name: propaganda
word.lx: The anti-British propaganda gave (ie caused) much offence./r/n 反英宣传触犯了众怒./r/n Art may be used as a vehicle for propaganda./r/n 艺术可用作宣传工具./r/n

word.name: propagandist
word.lx: One who attempts to persuade or convert others to a particular program, doctrine, or set of principles; a propagandist./r/n 倡导者试图劝说或改变他人的观念使其相信某一特定项目，道理或原则的人；鼓吹者/r/n

word.name: propagate
word.lx: Most plants propagate by seed./r/n 大多数植物靠种子繁殖。/r/n They started a newspaper to propagate their ideas./r/n 他们办了一份报纸来宣传他们的主张。/r/n

word.name: propel
word.lx: His addiction to drugs propelled him towards a life of crime./r/n 他吸毒成瘾使他走上了犯罪的道路。/r/n We are propelled to go forward./r/n 我们被推着向前走。/r/n

word.name: prophecy
word.lx: His prophecy was fulfilled./r/n 他的预言应验了。/r/n The god of prophecy, music, medicine, and poetry, sometimes identified with the sun./r/n 阿波罗司预言、音乐、医药、诗歌之神，有时等同于太阳神/r/n

word.name: prophesy
word.lx: He prophesied that war would break out./r/n 他预言说战争将要爆发。/r/n He prophesied of strange things to come./r/n 他预言将有怪事发生。/r/n

word.name: prophet
word.mean: n. 预言者,先知,提倡者

word.name: prophetic
word.mean: a. 预言的,先知的,预示的
word.lx: His prophetic remarks frightened us./r/n 他那预言性的话吓着了我们。/r/n Prophetic significance or meaning./r/n 预示预言性的意义或意思/r/n

word.name: prophylactic
word.lx: A prophylactic agent, device, or measure, such as a vaccine or drug./r/n 预防剂预防性的物质、器具或措施，比如疫苗或药物/r/n

word.name: propinquity
word.lx: The neighbours lived in close propinquity toeach other./r/n 这些邻居住得很近./r/n

word.name: propitiate
word.lx: They offered sacrifices to propitiate the gods./r/n 他们供奉祭品以求神息怒./r/n

word.name: propitious
word.mean: a. 顺利的,适合的,吉祥的
word.lx: It was not a propitious time to start a new business./r/n 这个时候开张不吉利。/r/n The circumstances were not propitious for further expansion of the company./r/n 这些情况不利于公司的进一步发展。/r/n

word.name: proponent
word.lx: A closet proponent of a tax increase; a closet alcoholic./r/n 增加税收的私下倡议者；私下酗酒者/r/n One who originates or is the chief proponent of a heresy or heretical movement./r/n 异端创始或领导人异端邪说或运动的发起者或主要倡导者/r/n

word.name: proportion
word.lx: This painting lacks proportion./r/n 这幅画比例失调。/r/n We are trying to reduce the problem to manageable proportions./r/n 我们正努力把问题缩小到可以控制的范围内。/r/n

word.name: proportional
word.mean:
a. 成比例的,相称的
n. [数]比例项

word.name: proportional representation
word.mean: n. (按得票的比例获得议员席位的)比例代表制

word.name: proportionally
word.mean: ad. 按比例(配合着,相应地,比较地)

word.name: proportionately
word.mean: ad. 相称地, 成比例地

word.name: proposal
word.lx: Have you accepted his proposal?/r/n 你答应他的求婚了吗？/r/n Some members of the committee expressed reservations about the proposal./r/n 委员会一些成员对这项提议持保留态度。/r/n

word.name: propose
word.lx: Did he propose to you?/r/n 他向你求婚了吗？/r/n He proposed that a change should be made./r/n 他建议做一些改变。/r/n

word.name: proposition
word.mean:
n. 建议,命题,主张
v. 向...提议,向...调情
word.lx: Tunnelling under the English Channel is a big proposition./r/n 在英吉利海峡海底凿隧道是一个大问题。/r/n She was propositioned by her boss./r/n 她的老板向她提出非分的要求。/r/n

word.name: propound
word.mean:
v. 提出(问题)
vt. 提议

word.name: proprietary
word.mean:
a. 专利的(所有的)
n. 所有权(所有人)
word.lx: One granted ownership of a proprietary colony./r/n 领主独占某殖民地所有权的人/r/n A proprietary hospital./r/n 一家私人医院/r/n

word.name: propriety
word.mean:
a. 适当
n. 礼节,适当
word.lx: The way these tourists dress offends local standards of propriety./r/n 这些游客的穿着在当地人的眼中简直不成体统。/r/n We should observe the proprieties./r/n 我们应该遵守礼节。/r/n

word.name: propulsive
word.mean: a. 推进的,有推进力的

word.name: prosaic
word.lx: A quality or style that is prosaic./r/n 平淡无奇平凡的特点或风格/r/n The office seems so dull and prosaic after Pine Ridge./r/n 从松岭回来后，办公室似乎变得枯燥无味了。/r/n

word.name: proscenium
word.mean: n. 舞台前部(幕前部分)

word.name: proscribe
word.mean: vt. 不予法律保护(排斥)
word.lx: The sale of narcotics is proscribed by law./r/n 法律禁止贩卖毒品./r/n

word.name: proscription
word.mean: n. 剥夺人权,处罚的宣告,放逐

word.name: prosecute
word.lx: He was prosecuted for exceeding the speed limit./r/n 他被告发超速行驶。/r/n Trespassers will be prosecuted./r/n 闲人免进，违者必究。/r/n

word.name: prosecution
word.lx: In the prosecution of his duties, he had to interview people of all classes./r/n 在履行职责的时候，他得会见各个阶级的人。/r/n The prosecution based their case on the evidence of two witnesses./r/n 原告方面以两名证人所提供的证据提起诉讼。/r/n

word.name: prosecutor
word.mean: n. 实行者,追诉者,告发者
word.lx: The prosecutor brought an accusation of theft against him./r/n 检察官指控他偷窃。/r/n The incompatible offices of prosecutor and judge./r/n 检察官和法官的职位不能由一个人兼任/r/n

word.name: proselyte
word.mean: n. 皈依者,改变宗教信仰者

word.name: prosody
word.mean: n. 诗体论,韵律学,作诗法

word.name: prospect
word.mean:
n. 景色,希望,展望
v. 探勘,寻找
word.lx: This experience opened a new prospect in his mind./r/n 这一经验为他的思想开阔了新的视野。/r/n A rich harvest is in prospect./r/n 丰收在望。/r/n

word.name: prospecting
word.lx: The prospect of another war appalled us./r/n 想到有可能发生另一场战争，我们不寒而栗。/r/n This experience opened a new prospect in his mind./r/n 这一经验为他的思想开阔了新的视野。/r/n

word.name: prospective
word.lx: Tom is the prospective buyer of my house./r/n 汤姆是可能购买我的房屋的人。/r/n She is his prospective mother-in-law./r/n 她是他未来的岳母。/r/n

word.name: prospects
word.mean: n. 希望,前途(恒为复数)
word.lx: He ruined his prospects by carelessness./r/n 他因疏忽大意而断送了前途。/r/n The new job is not a promotion as such but it brings good prospects for the future./r/n 这一新的工作, 严格说来并不算提升, 不过以後很有发展前途./r/n

word.name: prospectus
word.mean: n. 创立计划书,内容说明书,样张
word.lx: The company was bogus, the prospectus was all got up./r/n 那公司全属子虚乌有，所谓的创办计划是胡编乱造出来的。/r/n

word.name: prosper
word.lx: The farm prospered through good management./r/n 由于管理有方，农场兴旺发达。/r/n Is your son prospering?/r/n 你儿子凡事顺遂吗？/r/n

word.name: prosperous
word.lx: His business is prosperous./r/n 他的事业兴旺发达。/r/n The city at one time must have been prosperous, for It enjoyed a high level of civilization./r/n 这座古城在一个时期准是很繁荣的，因为它曾享有高度文明。/r/n

word.name: prostate
word.lx: A small vestigial blind pouch of the prostate gland./r/n 前列腺囊前列腺的一个小的发育不全的囊/r/n Inflammation of the prostate gland./r/n 前列腺炎前列腺的炎症/r/n

word.name: prostitute
word.lx: She prostituted herself in order to support her children./r/n 她为养活子女而操皮肉生涯./r/n One, especially a robber or prostitute, who walks the streets at night./r/n 夜间游荡的人夜间在街上游荡的人，尤指拦路抢劫者或妓女/r/n

word.name: prostitution
word.lx: He refused the job, saying it would be (a) prostitution of his talents./r/n 他拒不做那工作, 说那是大材小用./r/n Prostitution is on the increase in the city./r/n 城里卖淫活动越来越多./r/n

word.name: prostrate
word.mean:
a. 拜倒的,降伏的,伏地的
v. 弄倒,使...屈服,俯伏
word.lx: They prostrated themselves before the king./r/n 他们拜倒在国王的脚下。/r/n She was prostrate with grief./r/n 她因悲痛而一蹶不振。/r/n

word.name: protagonist
word.lx: The principal character in opposition to the protagonist or hero of a narrative or drama./r/n 反面主角叙事文学或戏剧中与主人公或英雄相对立的主要人物/r/n

word.name: protean
word.mean: a. Proteus 的,千变万化的,变化不定的

word.name: protect
word.lx: He raised his arm to protect his child from hurt./r/n 他伸出手去，保护他的孩子免受伤害。/r/n These rare tigers are protected by special laws./r/n 这些珍贵的老虎受到专门法律的保护。/r/n

word.name: protected
word.lx: The shield protected him from the blows of his enemy./r/n 这盾牌保护他免受敌人的打击。/r/n These rare tigers are protected by special laws./r/n 这些珍贵的老虎受到专门法律的保护。/r/n

word.name: protection
word.lx: She put on dark glasses as a protection against the strong light./r/n 她戴上墨镜以防强光的照射。/r/n The ships required the protection of naval and air power./r/n 船只本身需要海军和空军的保护。/r/n

word.name: protectionism
word.lx: The classical argument between free trade and protectionism./r/n 自由贸易和保护主义之间永久的争论/r/n

word.name: protective
word.lx: The government decided to impose a protective tariff on foreign cars./r/n 政府决定对进口汽车征收保护税。/r/n A mother naturally feels protective towards her children./r/n 母亲对自己的孩子自然会悉心保护。/r/n

word.name: protector
word.mean: n. 保护者,保护物,保护装置
word.lx: Mothers are protectors of their babies./r/n 母亲是孩子的保护者。/r/n One that serves as a guardian or protector./r/n 守护人的，保护者作为守护人或保护者的人/r/n

word.name: protein
word.mean:
a. 蛋白质的
n. 蛋白质
word.lx: You should eat more high-protein diet./r/n 你应该多吃些高蛋白食物。/r/n Pulses are a good source of protein for vegetarians./r/n 对於素食者来说, 豆类食物是蛋白质的理想来源./r/n

word.name: protest
word.mean:
n. 抗议,反对
v. 反对,抗议,断言
word.lx: He protested his innocence./r/n 他声言自己无罪。/r/n They protested to the mayor that the taxes were too high./r/n 他们向市长提出抗议说税款过高。/r/n

word.name: protestant
word.mean:
n. 新教,新教徒
a. 新教的
word.lx: A Protestant delivered a speech to the crowd./r/n 一名新教徒向人群发表了演说。/r/n The Protestant denominations include the Methodists, the Presbyterians and the Baptists./r/n 新教派别包括卫理公会派、 长老会派、 浸礼派./r/n

word.name: protocol
word.mean:
n. 草案, 协议,礼仪
vt 拟定议定书

word.name: prototype
word.lx: No matter how many prototype we make, we just can not get it right./r/n 不管做多少次样品，我们都无法获得满意的。/r/n An early form; a prototype./r/n 原形早期的形式；原形/r/n

word.name: protractor
word.mean: n. 分度器,伸肌,伤处异物摘出器

word.name: protrude
word.lx: He managed to hang on to a piece of rock protruding from the cliff./r/n 他设法抓住了悬崖上向外伸出的岩石。/r/n Tending to protrude; protruding./r/n 突出的趋于伸出的；伸出的/r/n

word.name: protrusion
word.mean: n. 隆起物,突出,伸出,突起部
word.lx: Thumb-sucking can cause protrusion of the teeth./r/n 经常吮吸拇指能使牙齿向外突出./r/n

word.name: protuberance
word.lx: A knob, knot, protuberance, or swelling./r/n 节，结，瘤球状物、结、节疤或肿瘤/r/n A rounded protuberance formed by the bones in a joint./r/n （屈指时）指节膨出部关节中由骨头形成的圆形突出物/r/n

word.name: proud
word.lx: Tom is very proud of his new car./r/n 汤姆非常满意自己的新车。/r/n They are poor but proud; they never borrow money or ask for help./r/n 他们虽穷但很自重，他们从不向人借钱或求助。/r/n

word.name: proudly
word.mean: ad. 傲慢地,自大地,得意洋洋地
word.lx: She cast her eyes up proudly./r/n 她傲慢地把两眼朝上。/r/n He proudly pointed out the biggest sheep, which already weighed50 kilograms./r/n 他骄傲地把最大的一只羊指给我们看，它已经有50公斤重了。/r/n

word.name: prove
word.lx: Perhaps this book will prove to be of some use to you in your studies./r/n 也许这本书会对你的研究有用处。/r/n The old methods proved best after all./r/n 采用老方法结果反而是某事物最好。/r/n

word.name: provenance
word.lx: The act of attributing, especially of establishing a particular person, place, or time as the creator, provenance, or era of a work of art./r/n 归属指归属的行为，尤指将一艺术作品的创作者、地域或时代归属为一特定人物、地点或时间/r/n

word.name: proverb
word.lx: He likes to quote proverbs in his compositions./r/n 他喜欢在作文中引用谚语。/r/n The proverb tells us to emulate the industry of the ant./r/n 这格言告诉我们要效法蚂蚁的勤勉。/r/n

word.name: proverbial
word.mean: a. 谚语的,如同谚语的

word.name: provide
word.mean:
vi. 供给,提供
vt. 提供
word.lx: The hotel provides a reservation of tickets for its residents./r/n 这家旅馆为旅客提供订票服务。/r/n These books will provide us with all the information we need./r/n 这本书将为我们提供所需要的全部信息。/r/n

word.name: provided
word.lx: Provided that circumstances permit, we shall hold the meeting next week./r/n 只要情况允许，我们下周将举行会议。/r/n I will come provided that I am well enough./r/n 只要我身体好一定来。/r/n

word.name: providence
word.lx: We admired his intellectual providence to acquire vast stores of dry information./r/n 我们钦佩他收集大量原始资料的远见卓识。/r/n It seemed like providence that they had survived the plane crash./r/n 他们幸免于空难似乎是天意。/r/n

word.name: provident
word.mean: a. 有先见之明的,有远虑的,节俭的
word.lx: Some of the farmers had been provident in the good years but others were ruined by the bad harvests./r/n 有些农民在丰年节衣缩食有备无患, 但也有些农民由於歉收而陷入绝境./r/n

word.name: providential
word.lx: Their departure just before the floods was providential./r/n 他们恰在发洪水之前离开, 走得真是时候./r/n

word.name: provincial
word.mean:
n. 乡下人,地方人民
a. 省的,地方的,偏狭的
word.lx: His articles are published on the provincial newspaper./r/n 他的文章在省报上发表了。/r/n The man displayed provincial attitudes towards the theatre./r/n 这个人显示出对戏剧界的守旧态度。/r/n

word.name: provincialism
word.mean: n. 乡下习气,地方风格,土腔

word.name: provisional
word.mean: a. 暂时的,暂定的,临时的

word.name: provisions
word.lx: We set out with enough provisions./r/n 我们带上足够的食品出发了。/r/n Both sides should act according to the provisions of the agreement./r/n 双方都应按协议条款办事。/r/n

word.name: proviso
word.lx: Depending on a proviso; conditional./r/n 有附带条件的依赖于限制性条文的；条件性的/r/n

word.name: provisory
word.mean: a. 有附文的,有附带条件的,暂时的

word.name: provocation
word.lx: They attacked our border guards without the slightest provocation./r/n 在事先未发生任何挑衅的情况下，他们便袭击我们的边防哨兵。/r/n A provocation to action; a stimulus./r/n 激励，刺激某种行动的刺激；激励/r/n

word.name: provoke
word.lx: He tried to provoke them into fighting./r/n 他企图挑拨他们打架。/r/n Such a questionable assertion is sure to provoke criticism./r/n 这种有问题的主张肯定会招致非议。/r/n

word.name: provoking
word.mean: a. 激怒人的,刺激人的
word.lx: It is very provoking of her to be so late./r/n 她到得这麽晚真叫人生气。/r/n The act of provoking or inciting./r/n 激怒挑衅或煽动的行动/r/n

word.name: prow
word.lx: He stands on the prow looking at the sea./r/n 他站在船首看着大海。/r/n A carved figure on the prow of a ship./r/n 船头雕饰在船头的雕刻图象/r/n

word.name: prowl
word.mean:
n. 潜行,徘徊,悄悄踱步
v. 潜行以觅食,窥伺,逡巡于
word.lx: He saw a hungry wolf on the prowl with his telescope./r/n 他通过望远镜看到了一头四处觅食的饿狼。/r/n I saw someone prowling around among the trees./r/n 我见有人在树林里鬼鬼祟祟地走动。/r/n

word.name: proxy
word.mean: n. 代理,代理人,取代物
word.lx: The proxy firewall maintain context more easily than the packet filter firewall./r/n 代理防火墙比包过滤器防火墙易于保持更多的上下文/r/n

word.name: prudence
word.mean: n. 审慎,慎重,精心明辨
word.lx: His prudence saved his life./r/n 他的谨慎救了他一命。/r/n Arising from or characterized by prudence./r/n 审慎的由于谨慎的，或以谨慎为特征的/r/n

word.name: prudent
word.lx: He is a prudent businessman./r/n 他是个精明的商人。/r/n We should be modest and prudent./r/n 我们应该谦虚谨慎。/r/n

word.name: Prudhoe Bay
word.mean: 普拉德霍湾(美国阿拉斯加州北部)

word.name: prudish
word.mean: a. 装淑女样子的,装规矩的,过份规矩的
word.lx: An instance of prudish behavior or talk./r/n 假正经过分拘谨的行为或言谈的一个事例/r/n The state or quality of being prudish./r/n 过分拘谨过分拘谨的状态或品质/r/n

word.name: pruning
word.lx: I found him pruning his roses./r/n 我看到他正在给玫瑰修剪枝条。/r/n She scratched herself badly while pruning the roses./r/n 她修剪玫瑰花时把自己划伤了一大片./r/n

word.name: Prussian
word.mean:
a. 普鲁士的,普鲁士语的,普鲁士式的
n. 普鲁士人,普鲁士语

word.name: PS
word.mean: n. 客轮(马力,计划研究,转辙器尖,极化音响器)

word.name: pseudo
word.lx: This apparent interest of his in modern music is completely pseudo./r/n 他对现代音乐显露出的雅兴纯属自欺欺人./r/n

word.name: pseudonym
word.lx: George Eliot was the pseudonym of Mary Ann Evans./r/n 乔治·艾略特是玛丽·安·埃文斯的笔名./r/n She writes under a pseudonym./r/n 她用笔名发表作品./r/n

word.name: psychedelic
word.mean:
a. 引起幻觉的
n. 迷幻药
word.lx: Mescalin and LSD are psychedelic drugs./r/n 仙人球毒 和麦角酸二乙基 胺都是迷幻药./r/n The subculture associated with psychedelic drugs./r/n 迷幻世界与迷幻药有关的亚文化/r/n

word.name: psychiatrist
word.mean: n. 精神病医师,精神病学家
word.lx: The Home Secretary asked a consultant psychiatrist to determine whether she ought to be released(or transferred to hospital) on health grounds./r/n 内务大臣叫精神病顾问医生决定是否应该由于健康原因将她释放（或转移到医院）。/r/n

word.name: psychic
word.mean:
a. 灵魂的,精神的,心灵的,对超自然力敏感的;通灵的

n. 巫师,灵媒,心灵研究

word.name: psycho
word.mean:
a. 心理学上的
n. 心理学

word.name: psychoanalysis
word.lx: A licensed practitioner of psychoanalysis./r/n 心理分析医生有开业许可证的心理分析医生/r/n In psychoanalysis, the conscious./r/n 觉察力在精神分析中所指的觉察力/r/n

word.name: psychological
word.lx: There could be some psychological explanation for his bad health./r/n 他的健康不佳可能有心理上的原因。/r/n Inhibition of natural impulses may cause psychological problems./r/n 压抑自然的冲动可能会引起心理上的问题。/r/n

word.name: psychology
word.lx: I am always interested in psychology./r/n 我一直对心理学感兴趣。/r/n We need some male subjects for a psychology experiment./r/n 我们需要几个男子作心理学实验对象./r/n

word.name: psychosis
word.mean: n. 精神病,精神不正常,精神状态

word.name: psychosomatic
word.mean: a. 受心理影响的,经神身体相关的

word.name: psychotherapy
word.mean: n. 心理疗法,精神疗法

word.name: Ptolemy
word.mean: 托勒密(公元2世纪的古希腊天文学家、地理学家、数学家,地心说的创立者)

word.name: pub
word.lx: We ate our meal at a roadside pub./r/n 我们是在路旁的一家小酒馆里吃的饭。/r/n They were chucked out of the pub for being too rowdy./r/n 他们因为太吵闹被撵出酒馆./r/n

word.name: public
word.mean:
a. 公共的,公众的
n. 公众,民众
word.lx: The town has its own public library and public gardens./r/n 那城市有自己的公用图书馆和公园。/r/n The town gardens are open to the public from sunrise to the sunset daily./r/n 市立公园每天从早到晚对公众开放。/r/n

word.name: public housing
word.mean: 政府为低收入者所建的住房

word.name: public opinion
word.lx: Public opinion was moving strongly in favor of disarmament./r/n 公众舆论正在强烈支持裁军。/r/n Public opinion is against him./r/n 舆论对他不利。/r/n

word.name: public relations
word.lx: She has shown a flair for public relations from the beginnings./r/n 他从一开始就已经显露出从事公共关系工作的天赋。/r/n A public relation firm handle all our publicity./r/n 一家公共关系公司负责处理我们的全部广告宣传工作。/r/n

word.name: public school
word.mean:
公立学校
n. 公学

word.name: publican
word.mean: n. 收税员, 酒馆老板
