word.lx: Performance is less important than reliability in a car./r/n 汽车的可靠性比其机械性能更重要./r/n An experiment was made to check up on the reliability of certain criteria./r/n 已经进行了一项实验以检查某些标准的可靠性。/r/n

word.name: relic
word.mean: n. 神圣的遗物,遗迹,纪念物
word.lx: This stone axe is a relic of ancient times./r/n 这把石斧是古代的遗物。/r/n This ruined bridge is a relic of the Civil War./r/n 这座毁坏的桥是南北战争时的遗迹。/r/n

word.name: relics
word.lx: In its spacious halls are displayed over8000 priceless relics./r/n 在它宽敞的大厅里，展出了8000多件珍贵文物。/r/n The museum has many immemorial cultural relics./r/n 该博物馆收藏了很多极其古老的文物。/r/n

word.name: relief
word.mean: n. 减轻,解除 救济
word.lx: It was a great relief to find that my family was all safe./r/n 看到我的家人安然无恙，我感到极大的欣慰。/r/n The coach was full so a relief was put on./r/n 长途汽车已满员，所以增开了一辆。/r/n

word.name: relieve
word.lx: The general was relieved of his command./r/n 将军被解除了指挥权。/r/n He was relieved of his watch./r/n 他的表被偷走了。/r/n

word.name: relieved
word.lx: The general was relieved of his command./r/n 将军被解除了指挥权。/r/n He was relieved of his watch./r/n 他的表被偷走了。/r/n

word.name: religion
word.lx: Politics and religion are daily topics of conversation./r/n 政治和宗教是人们平常交谈的主要话题。/r/n There are many religions in the world./r/n 世界上有许多种宗教信仰。/r/n

word.name: religious
word.lx: She is very religious and goes to church three times a week./r/n 她非常虔诚，每周去教堂三次。/r/n These two countries had three religious wars in twenty years./r/n 这两个国家在20年里发生过三次宗教上的冲突。/r/n

word.name: relinquish
word.lx: She relinquished possession of the house to her sister./r/n 她把房子的所有权让给了她妹妹。/r/n I had relinquished all hope that she was alive./r/n 我已经放弃了她还活着的一切希望。/r/n

word.name: relocate
word.mean: v. 重新装置,再配置,放在新地方
word.lx: The management decided to relocate the factory in Bristol./r/n 资方决定将工厂建在布瑞斯托尔。/r/n The board decide to relocate the company in scotland./r/n 董事会决定将公司迁至英格兰。/r/n

word.name: reluctance
word.lx: She showed the utmost reluctance./r/n 她显得极其勉强。/r/n Refusal or reluctance to believe./r/n 不信，怀疑拒绝或不愿相信/r/n

word.name: reluctant
word.lx: They were very reluctant to help./r/n 他们不大愿意帮忙。/r/n He gave a reluctant promise./r/n 他勉强答应下来了。/r/n

word.name: reluctantly
word.mean: ad. 不情愿地, 嫌恶地

word.name: REM
word.mean: n.[计算机] DOS命令 : 指定由 DOS 忽略的命令行

word.name: remain
word.mean:
v. 保持,依然,剩余,留下，逗留
n.遗迹，剩余物，残骸
word.lx: When the others had gone, Mary remained and put back the furniture./r/n 当其他人走了之后，玛丽留下来，将家具放回原处。/r/n He remained poor all his life./r/n 他终生贫穷。/r/n

word.name: remainder
word.mean:
n. 剩余物,其他的人,残余
v. 廉价出售
word.lx: He spent the remainder of his life in the country./r/n 他在乡村度过余生。/r/n Nine people came in and the reminder stayed outside./r/n 9个人进来，余下的人留在外面。/r/n

word.name: remaining
word.lx: Guests were crowded into the few remaining rooms./r/n 把客人都挤在剩余的几个房间里了。/r/n You have the alternative of marrying or remaining a bachelor./r/n 你可以结婚也可以仍做单身汉, 任你选择./r/n

word.name: remains
word.mean: n. 残余(余物,遗物,化石)
word.lx: The remains of the supper were taken away./r/n 晚餐吃剩的东西被收去了。/r/n The girls screamed when the grisly remains of the half-eaten corpses on the screen were shown./r/n 当屏幕上显示出尸体被吃掉一半的恐怖残骸时，女孩子们尖叫起来。/r/n

word.name: remark
word.mean:
n. 备注,评论,注意
v. 评论,注意,述及
word.lx: They made rude remarks about her appearance./r/n 他们对她的外表横加粗暴的评论。/r/n The editor remarked that article was well written./r/n 编者评论说那篇文章写得很好。/r/n

word.name: remarkable
word.mean: a. 显著的,异常的,非凡的,值得注意的
word.lx: The child is remarkable for his cleverness./r/n 这孩子聪明得惊人。/r/n He showed remarkable courage when he faced the danger./r/n 他在面对危险的时候表现出非凡的勇气。/r/n

word.name: remediable
word.mean: a. 可纠正的,可治疗的

word.name: remedial
word.mean: a. 治疗的,补救的,矫正的

word.name: remedy
word.mean:
n. 药物,治疗法,补救
v. 治疗,补救,矫正
word.lx: Her illness is beyond remedy./r/n 她的病不可救药。/r/n Your faults of pronunciation can be remedied./r/n 你的发音毛病是可以纠正的。/r/n

word.name: remembrance
word.lx: Something given as a token of love, affection, or remembrance./r/n 信物，纪念品作为爱、喜爱或纪念的一种标志/r/n In remembrance of the battle, we set up a museum./r/n 为纪念那次战役, 我们建立了一座博物馆。/r/n

word.name: remind
word.mean:
v. 提醒
vt. 使想起,提醒
word.lx: This story reminds me of my childhood./r/n 这个故事让我想起了我的童年。/r/n Please remind me to write to my mother tomorrow./r/n 请提醒我明天给我母亲写信。/r/n

word.name: reminder
word.lx: These ruins are an eloquent reminder of the horrors of war./r/n 这些废墟形象地提醒人们不要忘记战争的恐怖。/r/n The letter was an uncomfortable reminder of my debts./r/n 那封信是催促还债的通知, 让我很不痛快./r/n

word.name: reminisce
word.lx: Old friends like to reminisce about thegood old days"./r/n 老朋友们总喜欢谈论那“美好的往昔”。/r/n"

word.name: reminiscence
word.lx: He entertained us with reminiscence of his childhood./r/n 他追述他的童年时代，从而使我们高兴起来。/r/n

word.name: remiss
word.mean: a. 怠慢的,不小心的,迟缓的

word.name: remission
word.mean:
n.缓解，减轻，弛张：疾病症状的减退，亦指发生这一减退的期间，即缓解期...
饶恕; 宽恕; (负债、处分等的)豁免, 赦免...
word.lx: The company gained remission from tax payments./r/n 这家公司获准免税。/r/n He got a remission of six months./r/n 他获减刑六个月。/r/n

word.name: remit
word.lx: The storm has been remitted./r/n 暴风雨开始减弱了。/r/n He remitted some money to his mother./r/n 他给他母亲寄了一些钱。/r/n

word.name: remittance
word.lx: He has returned the completed form with your remittance./r/n 他已经把填好的表格连同你的汇款一并寄回了。/r/n Sorry, your remittance have not reach us yet./r/n 对不起，您的汇款还没有到我们这儿。/r/n

word.name: remittent
word.mean: a. (病)间歇性的,忽好忽坏的

word.name: remnant
word.mean:
a. 剩余的
n. 残(剩)余
word.lx: The beautiful curtain is made of remnant materials./r/n 这个漂亮的窗帘是用零头布做的。/r/n I will sell this remnant to you, at cost./r/n 我愿将此剩货照成本卖给你。/r/n

word.name: remonstrance
word.lx: I made remonstrance against his rudeness./r/n 我对他的粗暴提出抗议。/r/n

word.name: remonstrate
word.mean: v. 表示异议,抗议,责备
word.lx: I remonstrated with him about his rudeness./r/n 他粗暴无礼, 我给他提了意见./r/n

word.name: remorse
word.lx: He was filled with remorse after hitting the child./r/n 他打过孩子后感到悔恨不已。/r/n He was in an agony of remorse./r/n 他处于悔恨的海洋中。/r/n

word.name: remorseful
word.lx: He represented to the court that the accused was very remorseful./r/n 他代被告向法庭陈情说被告十分懊悔./r/n

word.name: remote
word.mean: a. 偏僻的,遥远的,远程的
word.lx: The connection between these ideas is very remote./r/n 这两种看法之间的距离很大。/r/n Mail comes to this remote village only once a week./r/n 邮车每周只到这个偏僻的村庄一次。/r/n

word.name: remote control
word.lx: The bomb was exploded by remote control./r/n 这颗炸弹是遥控引爆的。/r/n The here/there button on the remote control which side camera you are controlling./r/n 遥控器上的Here／There按钮可以控制任何一端的摄像机。/r/n

word.name: removable
word.mean: a. 可除去的,可解职的,可移动的

word.name: remove
word.mean:
n. 距离
v. 除去,迁移,开除
word.lx: Our office has removed to Shanghai from Beijing./r/n 我们的办公室已从北京迁到上海。/r/n That officer must be removed./r/n 那位官员必须免职。/r/n

word.name: removed
word.mean:
a. 离开的,间隔的,远视的
v. 移动,移开
vbl. 移动,移开
word.lx: Superficial scratches can be easily removed./r/n 表面的划痕很容易擦掉。/r/n That officer must be removed./r/n 那位官员必须免职。/r/n

word.name: remunerate
word.mean: v. 给与报酬,赔偿,酬劳

word.name: remunerative
word.mean: a. 有报酬的,有利的,合算的
word.lx: He is in a very remunerative job./r/n 他有个报酬高的工作。/r/n

word.name: renaissance
word.lx: Leonardo da Vinci is a famous artist in the Italian Renaissance./r/n 利奥纳多·达·芬奇是意大利文艺复兴时期的一位知名画家。/r/n These are the cultural legacies of the Renaissance./r/n 这些是文艺复兴时期的文化遗产。/r/n

word.name: renal
word.lx: People with renal diseases have to eat salt-free foods./r/n 患有肾脏疾病的人只能吃不含盐的食物。/r/n

word.name: rename
word.mean:
v. 重新命名,再命名,改名
n.[计算机] DOS命令 : 更改文件名

word.name: rendition
word.lx: A pale rendition of the aria./r/n 独唱曲的无力表演/r/n A gifted rendition of the aria./r/n 极富天赋的咏叹调的演唱/r/n

word.name: renegade
word.mean:
n. 背教者,变节者,脱党者
a. 背弃的,脱离的,叛徒的
v. 背叛,背弃,脱离

word.name: renew
word.lx: He renewed the book for another two months./r/n 这本书他又续借了两个月。/r/n Spring renews the earth./r/n 春天使大地复苏。/r/n

word.name: renewable
word.mean: a. 可更新的(可继续的,可更换的,可展期的)
word.lx: Is the permit renewable?/r/n 这个许可证可以延期吗？/r/n If I can rephrase what I had just said, I think our resource is not renewable./r/n 如果我可以把我刚说的话重新措辞一下，我变为我们的资源是不能再生的。/r/n

word.name: renin
word.mean: n. [生化]肾素,高血压蛋白原酶,血管紧张肽原酶

word.name: renounce
word.lx: He renounced his religion and became a Muslim./r/n 他宣布脱离他原来的宗教而成为了一名穆斯林教徒。/r/n He renounced his claim to the property./r/n 他放弃了对财产的要求。/r/n

word.name: renovation
word.lx: The costly renovation of the old college building was criticized by most teachers./r/n 花费很大的旧校舍的修复工程受到大多数老师的批评。/r/n The entire fabric of the church needs renovation./r/n 这座教堂的全部结构需要维修翻新./r/n

word.name: renown
word.mean:
n. 名望,声誉
vt. 使有名望
word.lx: He won renown as a pianist./r/n 他赢得钢琴家的声誉。/r/n Something conferring honor or renown./r/n 荣耀的事授予荣誉或声誉的事/r/n

word.name: renowned
word.lx: The French are renowned for their cooking./r/n 法国人擅长烹饪./r/n A man of renowned power or authority./r/n 王握有权柄或有权威的男子/r/n

word.name: rent
word.mean:
n. 租金
v. 租
vi. 出租
vt. 出租,租用
word.lx: I rent a room from her./r/n 我向她租了一个房间。/r/n She rents out rooms to students./r/n 她出租房间给学生住。/r/n

word.name: rented
word.lx: Frank rented out his gas station./r/n 弗兰克把他的加油站租了出去。/r/n The good video is always rented out./r/n 好看的录像带总是被借走。/r/n

word.name: reoccur
word.mean: vi. 重新出现，重新发生

word.name: reopen
word.lx: School reopens next week./r/n 下周学校复课。/r/n The murder trial was reopened./r/n 这件谋杀案的审讯重新开始了。/r/n

word.name: reorganization
word.lx: A plan of reorganization is reported to be now in the works./r/n 据报道一项改组计划正在拟定之中。/r/n All their efforts are pushing towards a reorganization of the prison system./r/n 他们正尽一切努力，以重建一套新的监狱体制。/r/n

word.name: rep
word.mean: n. 距离公算偏差(代表性)
word.lx: Arrive Beijing rep pleasant./r/n 已到北京，旅途愉快。/r/n

word.name: repackage
word.mean: vt. 重新装配(重新包装)

word.name: repaid
word.mean:
v. 偿还,报答
vbl. 偿还,报答
word.lx: He repaid me only with ingratitude./r/n 他给我的报答只是忘恩负义。/r/n The firm repaid her hard work with a bonus./r/n 公司发给她奖金以酬谢她工作努力。/r/n

word.name: repair
word.mean:
n. 修理,补救
v. 修理,补救,补偿
word.lx: How can I repair the wrong I have done her?/r/n 我冤枉了她，怎样才能补救呢？/r/n The brickwork in this house is in need of repair./r/n 这所房子的砖造部分需要修理。/r/n

word.name: repairs
word.lx: Now ordinary repairs can be handled in our plant./r/n 现在一般的修理工作都可在我们厂进行了。/r/n The repairs to the school will be financed by the educational department./r/n 学校的修缮将由教育部门出资。/r/n

word.name: reparable
word.mean: a. 能补救的,可挽回的

word.name: repast
word.mean:
n. 餐
vi. 就餐,设宴
word.lx: The guests partook of a luxurious repast in the banqueting hall./r/n 贵宾们在大餐厅参加一个宴会。/r/n

word.name: repatriate
word.mean:
n. 被遣返回国者
vt 把...遣返回国

word.name: repay
word.lx: How can I ever repay you for your kindness?/r/n 我该怎样才能报答你的好意呢？/r/n The firm repaid her hard work with a bonus./r/n 公司发给她奖金以酬谢她工作努力。/r/n

word.name: repeal
word.mean:
n. 废止,撤消
v. 废止,撤消
word.lx: The Congress decided to repeal the law./r/n 议会决定废除那项法令。/r/n Mps are pressing for the repeal of the immigration act./r/n 下院议员正在施加压力使移民法得以废止。/r/n

word.name: repeat
word.mean:
n. 重复,反复
v. 重复,复述,复诵
word.lx: Repeat the oath after me./r/n 请跟着我宣誓。/r/n He repeated several times that he was busy./r/n 他一再说他很忙。/r/n

word.name: repeated
word.mean:
a. 重复的,再之的
v. 重复,复述
vbl. 重复,复述
word.lx: The prisoner repeated denials of the charges against him./r/n 囚犯对被控罪名再三否认。/r/n He repeated her statement word for word./r/n 他一字不差地重复她的话。/r/n

word.name: repel
word.lx: She was repelled by the dirty room./r/n 肮脏的房间使她厌恶。/r/n The crew repelled the attack./r/n 船员击退了进攻。/r/n

word.name: repellent
word.mean:
a. 排斥的(防水的,弹回的)
n. 排斥力(防水布,防护剂)
word.lx: Rub some of this mosquito-repellent on your legs./r/n 你在腿上搽点驱蚊剂吧./r/n Disgusting, loathsome, or repellent./r/n 令人生厌的，令人反感的，引起厌恶的/r/n

word.name: repent
word.lx: He repented what he has done./r/n 他懊悔他的所作所为。/r/n Have you nothing to repent of?/r/n 你没有可懊悔的事吗？/r/n

word.name: repentance
word.lx: We finally forgave him when he expressed his repentance with tears./r/n 当他流着泪表达他的悔恨时，我们终于原谅了他。/r/n Sudden friendship, sure repentance./r/n 仓促结友谊，肯定悔莫及。/r/n

word.name: repentant
word.lx: He is repentant of his folly./r/n 他对自己的愚蠢行为而懊恼。/r/n The church is always willing to welcome repentant sinners back to the fold./r/n 教会总是乐意欢迎忏悔的罪人回到信徒的行列中来。/r/n

word.name: repertory
word.mean: n. 仓库(积贮,全部剧目)
word.lx: Jane weighed down her repertory with these plays./r/n 简加上这几出戏，使她的演出剧目得到了加强。/r/n She acted with a repertory company for three years./r/n 她在一个轮演剧目剧团里演出三年。/r/n

word.name: rephrase
word.mean: vt. 重新措辞,改用别的话表示
word.lx: If I can rephrase what I had just said, I think our resource is not renewable./r/n 如果我可以把我刚说的话重新措辞一下，我变为我们的资源是不能再生的。/r/n

word.name: repine
word.lx: He repined against his unhappy lot./r/n 他自叹命运多舛。/r/n

word.name: replaceable
word.lx: A person, unlike a machine, is not replaceable./r/n 人和机器不同，是不可替代的。/r/n A replaceable printed circuit board./r/n 一种可替换的印制电路板。/r/n

word.name: replenish
word.mean:
v. 补充,再装满
vt. 补充
word.lx: We need to replenish our stocks of coal./r/n 我们需要再次补充煤的储备。/r/n

word.name: replete
word.lx: His story was replete with falsehood./r/n 他的报导充满了虚伪。/r/n

word.name: replica
word.lx: I had a replica in little of Independence Hall./r/n 我有一件独立纪念堂的小型复制品。/r/n

word.name: reply
word.lx: He gave me no chance to reply to his question./r/n 他没有给我回答他问题的机会。/r/n What a sage reply you gave!/r/n 多聪明的回答啊！/r/n

word.name: report
word.mean:
n. 报告,报导,成绩单
v. 报告,报导,记录
word.lx: The press in China widely reported the event./r/n 中国报界广泛报道了此事。/r/n You should have reported them to the police./r/n 你应当向警方控告他们的。/r/n

word.name: report card
word.lx: A disastrous report card./r/n 极糟的成绩报告单/r/n

word.name: reportage
word.mean: n. 新闻报道(通讯文学)

word.name: reportedly
word.lx: The star is reportedly very ill./r/n 据说该明星病重./r/n The attack was reportedly planned to the last detail./r/n 据说这次进攻每一个细节都做了周密的计划。/r/n

word.name: reporter
word.lx: The witness is an on-the-spot reporter./r/n 证人是一名在现场的记者。/r/n He is a reporter from Xinhua agency./r/n 他是一名新华社记者。/r/n

word.name: repository
word.mean: n. 贮藏室(博物馆,资源丰富地区)
word.lx: My father is a repository of interesting facts./r/n 我父亲有说不完的趣事./r/n Object repository support for creating shared, reusable form and data module./r/n 用于创建共享、可重用窗体和数据模块的对象储存库支持。/r/n

word.name: reprehend
word.mean:
v. 谴责,责难
vt. 指责

word.name: reprehensible
word.mean: a. 应斥责的,应该谴责的
word.lx: Your conduct/attitude is most reprehensible./r/n 你的行为[态度]的确应该受到批评./r/n Morally reprehensible; bad./r/n 道德败坏的道德上应受指责的；坏的/r/n

word.name: represent
word.mean:
vt. 表现,表示,描绘,代表
vi. 提出异议
word.lx: This essay represents a considerable improvement on your recent work./r/n 这篇论文说明你最近的工作取得了相当大的改进。/r/n She represented her fellow-workers at the union meeting./r/n 她在工会会议上代表她的同事。/r/n

word.name: representation
word.mean: n. 表示法,表现,陈述，答辩
word.lx: They demanded political representation./r/n 他们要求建立政治代表制。/r/n This painting is a representation of a storm at sea./r/n 这幅画表现的是海上风暴。/r/n

word.name: representative
word.mean:
n. 代表,众议员,典型
a. 代表性的,代议制的,典型的
word.lx: The tiger is a representative of the cat family./r/n 老虎是猫科动物的典型。/r/n Are your opinions representative of the other students?/r/n 你的意见是否代表其他学生的意见？/r/n

word.name: repress
word.lx: His childhood was repressed and solitary./r/n 他的童年是压抑而孤独的。/r/n All protests are brutally repressed by the government as illegal./r/n 所有的抗议活动都遭到当局的野蛮镇压，并被宣布为非法。/r/n

word.name: repressed
word.mean: a. 被压抑的,被抑制的

word.name: repressive
word.mean: a. 压抑的,抑制的,镇压的
word.lx: The people are held down by a vicious and repressive military regime./r/n 人民受著凶恶而专制的军政权的压迫./r/n

word.name: reprieve
word.mean:
n. 缓刑,缓刑令,暂减
v. 暂缓处刑,暂时得救
word.lx: The prisoner won a last-minute reprieve./r/n 那囚犯在临刑前获得了缓刑。/r/n A temporary immunity or exemption; a reprieve./r/n 宽恕；赦免临时性的豁免或免除；缓期，暂减/r/n

word.name: reprimand
word.mean:
v.&n. 训诫,谴责
vt. 责难

word.name: reprisal
word.mean: n. 报复,报仇,报复性劫掠
word.lx: In those days, objections would only invite reprisals./r/n 在那时候，提出反对意见只会引起报复。/r/n

word.name: reproach
word.mean:
n. 责备,耻辱
v. 责备,申斥
word.lx: His reply sounded to me like a reproach./r/n 他的回答在我听来象是责备。/r/n She reproached her husband for having forgotten their wedding anniversary./r/n 她责怪丈夫忘了他们的结婚周年纪念日。/r/n

word.name: reprobate
word.mean:
n. 堕落的人,恶棍,被神遗弃的人
a. 堕落的,邪恶的
v. 斥责,非难

word.name: reproduce
word.lx: Most fish reproduce themselves by laying eggs./r/n 大多数鱼产卵繁殖。/r/n The photograph of the painting reproduces the colors of the original extremely well./r/n 这幅画的照片绝妙地再现了原作的色彩。/r/n

word.name: reprogram
word.mean: vt. 改编...的编码指令序列,为...重编程序

word.name: reproof
word.lx: You can scarcely expect to escape reproof for such irresponsible behavior./r/n 你这样不负责任的行为，不能不受到责备。/r/n Impatient of reproof, he left his parents and went away./r/n 忍受不了责难，他离开父母出走了。/r/n

word.name: reprove
word.lx: She reproved him for telling lies./r/n 她骂他说谎。/r/n I stand corrected and reprove myself./r/n 我承认有错并予自责。/r/n

word.name: reptile
word.mean:
a. 爬虫类的
n. 爬行动物
word.lx: Snakes and crocodiles are reptiles./r/n 蛇和鹗鱼都是爬行动物。/r/n

word.name: republican
word.mean:
a. 共和政体的
n. 共和党人
word.lx: The United States shall guarantee to every state in this union a republican form of government./r/n 美利坚合众国保证合众国各州实行共和政体。/r/n Charles is a dyed-in-the-wool Republican./r/n 查尔斯是个彻头彻尾的共和党人。/r/n

word.name: repugnance
word.lx: I cannot overcome my repugnance to eating snails./r/n 吃蜗牛真恶心，我可受不了。/r/n Feeling repugnance or loathing./r/n 感到厌恶的，感到憎恨的/r/n

word.name: repugnant
word.mean: a. 讨厌的,不愉快的,厌恶的
word.lx: The idea of accepting a bribe was repugnant to me./r/n 我一想到受贿这种事就非常反感./r/n I find his racist views totally repugnant./r/n 我十分厌恶他的种族主义观点./r/n

word.name: repulse
word.mean:
n. 击退,拒绝
v. 逐退,击退,拒绝
word.lx: I repulsed her kindness./r/n 我拒绝了她的好意。/r/n She repulsed his proposal./r/n 她拒绝了他的求婚。/r/n

word.name: repulsive
word.mean: a. 逐退的,辞退的,冷淡的,恶心的
word.lx: You repulsive little toad!/r/n 你这个讨厌的癞蛤蟆!/r/n

word.name: reputation
word.lx: This store has an excellent reputation for fair dealing./r/n 这家商店因公平交易而获好名声。/r/n He earned a high reputation for his learning./r/n 他在学识方面享有很高的声誉。/r/n

word.name: repute
word.mean:
n. 名望,名气,声望
v. 认为,以为
word.lx: He is held in high repute./r/n 他名声很好。/r/n The condition of having lost honor or good repute./r/n 耻辱，羞辱失去荣誉或好名声的状态/r/n

word.name: reputed
word.mean: a. 名誉好的,被称为...的,有...名气的
word.lx: He is reputed as/to be the best surgeon in Paris./r/n 他是公认的巴黎最好的外科医生./r/n She is reputed to be rich./r/n 据说她很有钱。/r/n

word.name: request
word.mean:
n. 要求,请求
vt. 请求,要求
word.lx: Full details will be sent on request./r/n 有详细材料备索。/r/n Your presence is requested at the meeting./r/n 请你务必出席会议。/r/n

word.name: requested
word.lx: Your presence is requested at the meeting./r/n 请你务必出席会议。/r/n It is requested that all members be present at the party./r/n 全体会员都被要求出席这次晚会。/r/n

word.name: require
word.lx: The floor requires washing./r/n 这地板该洗了。/r/n All passengers are required to show their tickets./r/n 所有乘客都必须出示车票。/r/n

word.name: requisite
word.mean:
a. 必要的,需要的
n. 必需品
word.lx: I must buy some toilet requisites./r/n 我必须买些卫生间必需品。/r/n She expect to achieve the requisite two-thirds majority for nomination./r/n 她期望得到获得提名所必需的三分之二多数。/r/n

word.name: requisition
word.mean:
n. 请求,强求,命令
v. 强制使用,徵用,命令徵用
word.lx: The town hall was requisitioned as army headquarters./r/n 市政厅徵用作了军队的指挥部。/r/n The army requisition all the truck to carry supplies./r/n 军队征用了所有卡车，目的是为了运输车需品。/r/n

word.name: rescind
word.mean:
n. (rescission)
a. 退还,取消
v. 废除,取消

word.name: rescue
word.mean:
n. 援救,解救,营救
v. 援救,救出,营救
word.lx: The government has rescued the firm from bankruptcy by giving them a grant./r/n 政府拨款给这家公司使其免于破产。/r/n Had Jim not dived in to rescue him, the boy would have drowned./r/n 如果不是吉姆跳下水去救，那小孩早就淹死了。/r/n

word.name: research
word.mean:
调查,研究
v. 调查,研究
word.lx: He is busy with research work./r/n 他专心于研究工作。/r/n Research workers are examining the problem./r/n 研究人员正在研究那个问题。/r/n

word.name: resemblance
word.lx: There is a degree of resemblance between the two boys./r/n 这两个男孩有某些相似之处。/r/n Your story shows little resemblance to the facts./r/n 你说的与事实相去甚远。/r/n

word.name: resemble
word.lx: The situation closely resembles that of Europe in 1940./r/n 这种形势与1940年的欧洲十分相似。/r/n She resembles her sister in appearance but not in character./r/n 她和她姐姐外貌相似，但性格不同。/r/n

word.name: resend
word.lx: I resent having to get his permission for everything I do./r/n 我讨厌做每件事都要得到他的许可。/r/n I bitterly resent his attempts to interfere in my work./r/n 我非常讨厌他企图干涉我的工作。/r/n

word.name: resent
word.lx: I resent having to get his permission for everything I do./r/n 我讨厌做每件事都要得到他的许可。/r/n I bitterly resent his attempts to interfere in my work./r/n 我非常讨厌他企图干涉我的工作。/r/n

word.name: resentful
word.lx: Resentful and rebellious, especially against authority./r/n 不满的，造反的，尤反对政府当局/r/n He is resentful at the way he has been treated./r/n 他对所受的待遇感到忿恨。/r/n

word.name: resentment
word.lx: He has a deep-seated resentment at the way he has been treated./r/n 他因受到如此对待而深怀怨恨。/r/n The resentment festered in his mind./r/n 他心中的愤恨有增无减。/r/n

word.name: reservation
word.lx: Some members of the committee expressed reservations about the proposal./r/n 委员会一些成员对这项提议持保留态度。/r/n His family are living in an Indian reservation./r/n 他全家都住在一个印第安居留地里。/r/n

word.name: reserve
word.mean:
n. 预备品,贮存,预备舍
vt. 保留,预订,延期
word.lx: He still reserved his opinion on some points./r/n 在一些问题上，他仍然保留自己的意见。/r/n Please reserve a seat for me./r/n 请为我预定一个座位。/r/n

word.name: reserved
word.mean:
v. 保留(预定,推迟)
a. 保留的(预订的,冷淡的,缄默)
word.lx: He still reserved his opinion on some points./r/n 在一些问题上，他仍然保留自己的意见。/r/n She is not usually so reserved./r/n 她通常不如此缄默。/r/n

word.name: reservoir
word.lx: The show is a veritable reservoir of new talent./r/n 这个演出真是新秀集萃。/r/n They open the sluice gates of reservoir./r/n 他们打开水库的闸门。/r/n

word.name: reset
word.mean:
n. 重新设定,重新组合
v. 重新设定,重新放置,重新组合

word.name: reshape
word.mean: v. 改造,使成新的形状,打开新局面

word.name: reshuffle
word.mean:
v. 再洗牌,改组
vt. 改组

word.name: reside
word.lx: Memory has been shown to reside in some metals./r/n 已经证实，记忆存在于某些金属中。/r/n This family has resided in this city for 60 years./r/n 这个家族住在本城已有60 年了。/r/n

word.name: residence
word.lx: He married an English woman and took up his residence in London./r/n 他与一名英国女子结婚并且定居在伦敦。/r/n They have a summer residence in the countryside./r/n 他们在乡间有夏季住宅。/r/n

word.name: residency
word.mean: n. (美)高级专科住院实习(期)

word.name: resident
word.mean:
a. 居住的
n. 居民
word.lx: The residents of the town are proud of its new library./r/n 该镇的居民都为镇上新建的图书馆感到自豪。/r/n I have been resident in this hotel for two weeks./r/n 我已经在这家旅馆里住了两个星期了。/r/n

word.name: residential
word.mean: a. 住宅的,与居住有关的

word.name: residue
word.lx: The residue of estate belongs to his son./r/n 剩余财产属于他的儿子。/r/n The residue after an ore or other material has been washed./r/n 洗后的渣矿物或其他物质洗后剩下的渣滓/r/n

word.name: resign
word.mean:
vi. 辞职
vt. 辞职,放弃,使顺从
word.lx: He decided to resign his claim to the copyright./r/n 他决定放弃对版权的要求。/r/n She resigned her children to the care of a neighbor./r/n 她委托邻居照顾她的孩子。/r/n

word.name: resigned
word.mean: a. 认命的,服从的,听任的

word.name: resilience
word.mean: n. 跳回(回弹,弹力,弹性变形,冲击值)
word.lx: Her natural resilience helped her overcome the crisis./r/n 她生性乐观有助於她渡过难关。/r/n Rubber has more resilience than wood./r/n 橡胶有比木头更大的弹性。/r/n

word.name: resilient
word.mean: a. 弹回的,有弹力的,愉快的

word.name: resin
word.mean:
n. 树脂(松香,树脂状沉淀物,树脂制品)
vt 涂树脂(有树脂处理)
word.lx: The basin is made of synthetic resin./r/n 这个盆是用合成树脂做的。/r/n Coated with wax or resin./r/n 涂蜡的，涂树脂的/r/n

word.name: resist
word.lx: I can never resist an ice cream./r/n 我一见到冰淇淋就忍不住想吃。/r/n They are determined to resist invasion./r/n 他们决定抵抗入侵。/r/n

word.name: resistance
word.mean: n. 抵抗力,反抗,反抗行动;阻力,电阻;反对
word.lx: The aircraft is streamlined to cut down wind resistance./r/n 飞机设计成流线型以减少风的阻力。/r/n There has been a lot of resistance to this new law./r/n 反对这项新法律的人很多。/r/n

word.name: resistant
word.lx: This new type of infection is resistant to antibiotics./r/n 这种新的传染病对抗菌素有抗药性。/r/n Resistant to penetration by water but not entirely waterproof./r/n 抗水的能抵抗水的渗透但不完全防水的/r/n

word.name: resolute
word.lx: We should be true in word and resolute in deed./r/n 我们应该言必信，行必果。/r/n He was resolute in carrying out his plan./r/n 他执行计划是坚决的。/r/n

word.name: resolutely
word.mean:
a. 坚决地,果断地
ad. 果断地,坚决地
word.lx: Provided they fight resolutely, the enemy can never break in./r/n 只要他们坚决地打，敌人就打不进来。/r/n Our troops stood out resolutely against the long siege of the enemy./r/n 我们的部队顽强地顶住了敌人长时间的围困。/r/n

word.name: resolution
word.mean: n. 坚定,决心,决议,决定,果断,刚毅,消退：病理状态的减退,分辨率,清晰度
word.lx: She always makes good resolutions but never carries them out./r/n 她总是决心很大，却从不见付诸行动。/r/n He moved a resolution in the meeting./r/n 他在会议上提出了一个决议。/r/n

word.name: resolve
word.mean:
n. 决定之事,决心,坚决
v. 决定,解决,决心
word.lx: He resolved that nothing should hold him back./r/n 他下决心不让任何事情阻挡他。/r/n The discussion resolved itself into a pleasant chat./r/n 讨论变成了愉快的闲聊。/r/n

word.name: resolved
word.mean:
a. 下定决心的,断然的
v. 决定,解决,决心
vbl. 决定,解决,决心

word.name: resonance
word.lx: Resonance would occur again, but not so strong as before./r/n 共振会再次发生，但不如先前那么强。/r/n

word.name: resonant
word.lx: A loud, resonant, metallic sound./r/n 铿锵声大而洪亮的金属般的声音/r/n A deep resonant sound, as of an explosion./r/n 隆隆声低沉而有回响的声音，比如爆炸声/r/n

word.name: resort
word.mean:
n. 渡假胜地,手段,凭藉
v. 诉诸,常去,滞留
word.lx: If other means fail we shall resort to force./r/n 如果其他手段均告失败，我们将诉之武力。/r/n You should have resorts to your parents./r/n 你应该求助于你的父母。/r/n

word.name: resounding
word.lx: A forceful, resounding blow./r/n 重击有力而声音响亮的重击/r/n His fame resounded all over the world./r/n 他名扬全球。/r/n

word.name: resource
word.lx: The job called for all my resources of energy and patience./r/n 这项工作需要我拿出自己的全部精力和耐性。/r/n Resources management is an important business skill./r/n 资源管理是一项重要的经营技能。/r/n

word.name: resourceful
word.mean: a. 资源(人力、物力)丰富的; 有机智的; 多策略的,足智多谋的

word.name: resources
word.lx: People should read the related regulations before they exploit natural resources./r/n 在开发自然资源前，人们应该先了解相关的规定。/r/n The government tried to prevent the diminution of resources./r/n 政府试图阻止资源的减少。/r/n

word.name: respectability
word.lx: Lacking respectability, as in character, behavior, or appearance./r/n 邋遢的，不名誉的不体面的，名声不好的，如在品质、行为或外貌上/r/n

word.name: respecter
word.mean: n. 趋炎附势者,尊敬者
word.lx: Death is no respecter of persons./r/n 死亡是不分贫富贵贱的。/r/n The teacher is no respecter of his students./r/n 这位老师不偏袒任何学生。/r/n

word.name: respectful
word.mean: a. 表示尊敬的,有礼貌的,谦恭的
word.lx: I hope you would be more respectful to your father./r/n 我希望你对父亲有礼貌些。/r/n He behaved in a respectful way./r/n 他的举止彬彬有礼。/r/n

word.name: respective
word.lx: The three men were given work according to their respective abilities./r/n 这三个人根据各自的能力被分配了工作。/r/n Product name is trademark or registered trademark of their respective owner./r/n 产品名称为它们各自所有者的商标或注册商标。/r/n

word.name: respectively
word.lx: My husband and I got pay rises of 8% and 10% respectively./r/n 我丈夫和我分别加薪8%和10%。/r/n German and Italian courses are held in munich and rome respectively./r/n 德语和意大利语课程分别设於慕尼黑和罗马。/r/n

word.name: respirator
word.lx: A device, such as a respirator or an inhaler, by which a gas, vapor, or air is drawn in./r/n 吸入器用来吸入气体，蒸汽或空气的仪器，如呼吸器或吸气器/r/n

word.name: respiratory
word.lx: The lungs are respiratory organs./r/n 肺是呼吸器官。/r/n A medicine for relieving disorders of the chest or respiratory tract./r/n 祛痰药，舒胸药一种用于缓解胸部或呼吸道不适的药物/r/n

word.name: resplendent
word.lx: We are enjoying the resplendent colors of the New England woods in the autumn./r/n 我们欣赏着秋天里新英格兰树林的瑰丽色彩。/r/n The princess arrived, resplendent in a new white dress./r/n 公主光彩照人地穿着一身雪白的新礼服来了。/r/n

word.name: respond
word.lx: He failed to respond to the medicine./r/n 他服了这药未见起色。/r/n I invited her to dinner but she did not respond./r/n 我请她吃晚饭，但她未作回答。/r/n

word.name: respondent
word.mean:
a. 回答的,应答的,感应的
n. 应答者,被告
word.lx: Formal reply to an allegation make in court, especially defence make by a respondent to a divorce petition/r/n 答辩状，对在法庭所作断言的答复，尤指被告对离婚起诉的抗辩。/r/n

word.name: response
word.lx: His idea received an enthusiastic response./r/n 他的想法获得热烈的响应。/r/n She made no response to my letter./r/n 她没有回我的信。/r/n

word.name: responsive
word.mean: a. 回答的,应答的,易感应的
word.lx: Highly aware of and responsive to what is fashionable and up-to-date./r/n 赶时髦的，新潮的对于流行的和时新的东西很敏感的并且积极响应的/r/n Not responsive, as to treatment or stimuli./r/n 无感应的对治疗或刺激没有反应的/r/n

word.name: rest
word.mean:
a. 其余的
v.&n. 休息
vi. 搁(在),休息
vt. 使休息
word.lx: Sunday is my rest day./r/n 星期日是我休息的日子。/r/n I always rest for an hour after dinner./r/n 晚饭后，我总要休息一小时。/r/n

word.name: restaurant
word.lx: I had my breakfast in the small restaurant./r/n 我在一家小饭馆里吃了早饭。/r/n The prices in that restaurant are absolutely ruinous./r/n 那家餐馆的价格贵得能把人坑死。/r/n

word.name: restaurateur
word.mean: n. 餐馆老板, 饭店主人

word.name: restful
word.mean: a. 给人休息的,平安的,安静的
word.lx: A room painted in restful colors./r/n 房间漆有宁静的颜色/r/n Pastel colours are restful to the eye./r/n 清淡柔和的颜色可以养目。/r/n

word.name: restive
word.mean: a. 不愿向前走的,倔强的,难驾御的
word.lx: Another hour passed and the crowd grew/became restive./r/n 又过了一个小时, 人们有些不耐烦了./r/n

word.name: restless
word.lx: The boy was restless from hunger./r/n 男孩因饥饿而变得焦躁不安。/r/n The children grew restless with the long wait./r/n 孩子们等了很久便著急了./r/n

word.name: restlessly
word.mean: ad. 不安地, 慌张地
word.lx: The lion paced the floor of his cage restlessly./r/n 狮子烦躁地在兽笼里走来走去。/r/n

word.name: restorative
word.mean: a. 恢复健康的,恢复的
word.lx: An invigorating, refreshing, or restorative agent or influence./r/n 增强物增加活力、精神或帮助恢复的物品或影响/r/n Nature has an exhilarative and restorative effect./r/n 大自然具有使人畅快并恢复体力的效果。/r/n

word.name: restore
word.lx: The stolen property must be restored to its owner./r/n 赃物必须物归原主。/r/n I feel quite restored to health after my holiday./r/n 假期过后，我觉得健康恢复得相当不错。/r/n

word.name: restrained
word.mean: a. 克制的,自制的,受约束的
word.lx: Formal, refined, and restrained in style./r/n 拘谨的，精炼的风格正式、精致和克制的/r/n Some children must be restrained in their own interests./r/n 有些孩子必须约束一下，这对他们有好处。/r/n

word.name: restraint
word.lx: His rage was beyond restraint./r/n 他怒不可遏。/r/n Restraint in artistic expression./r/n 束缚艺术表达的限制/r/n

word.name: restrict
word.mean:
n. 限制、限定、约束
v. 限制,约束
word.lx: You are restricted to eight liters of duty-free wine./r/n 携带的免税酒不得超过八升。/r/n Fog restricted visibility./r/n 雾天能见度很低。/r/n

word.name: restricted
word.mean:
v. 限制(节流)
a. 限制的(受限制的,有限的,保密的)
word.lx: Membership in this club is restricted to man under 30./r/n 俱乐部的成员限定在三十岁以下。/r/n You are restricted to eight liters of duty-free wine./r/n 携带的免税酒不得超过八升。/r/n

word.name: restriction
word.mean:
n. 限制,约束
vi. 结果,(作为结果)发生
word.lx: There are currency restrictions on the sums allowed for foreign travel./r/n 到国外旅行允许携带的款额有所限制。/r/n The sale of firearms is subject to many legal restrictions./r/n 出售枪支受到许多法律限制。/r/n

word.name: restrictive
word.mean:
a. 限制的,拘束的,限定的
n. 限定辞
word.lx: A forceful emergence from a restrictive condition or situation./r/n 爆发从受限制的条件或情形下突然涌现/r/n A category, especially an overly restrictive one./r/n 分类，类别分类，尤指受过度限制分类/r/n

word.name: restroom
word.mean: [美](在酒店、饭店内的)公共厕所
word.lx: I can hear him in the restroom, heaving his heart up./r/n 我听得见他在洗手间吐得很厉害。/r/n

word.name: restructure
word.mean: v. 更改结构,重健构造

word.name: resultant
word.mean:
a. 合成的(有结果的)
n. 合成矢量(结果,产物,终结式)

word.name: resume
word.mean:
v. 再继续,重新开始
n. 简历,履历
word.lx: Please send a detailed resume to our company./r/n 请给我们公司寄一份详细的简历。/r/n The collapse of the strike enabled the company to resume normal bus services./r/n 罢工的失败使公司恢复了正常的公共汽车营业。/r/n

word.name: resurrect
word.mean: vt. 复活(复露,使...再现,使...再受注意)
word.lx: That noise is enough to resurrect the dead!/r/n 那噪音都能把死人吵活!/r/n

word.name: resurrection
word.lx: He had a resurrection of hope./r/n 他的希望复苏了。/r/n His resurrection frightened us./r/n 他的复活吓坏了我们。/r/n

word.name: retail
word.mean:
n. 零售
v. 零售,转述
word.lx: Who is responsible for retailing these rumors about him?/r/n 是谁散布这些有关他的流言蜚语的？/r/n I bought the milk retail./r/n 我以零售方式买来这些牛奶。/r/n

word.name: retailer
word.lx: The retailer has to absorb the cost of wastage./r/n 零售商须承受耗损的费用./r/n The retailer accepted the shipment on consignment./r/n 零售商接受了运来的寄售物品/r/n

word.name: retain
word.lx: I will retain my right./r/n 我将保留我的权力。/r/n He retained the best lawyer in the state to defend his case./r/n 他为他的案子聘了该州最好的律师。/r/n

word.name: retake
word.mean: v.&n. 夺回,取回,再取,重摄,补拍

word.name: retaliate
word.lx: If we impose import duties, other countries may retaliate against us./r/n 我们若徵收进口税, 别的国家就可能报复我们./r/n He slapped his sister, who retaliated by kicking him./r/n 他打了妹妹一巴掌, 他妹妹回敬他一脚./r/n

word.name: retard
word.mean:
n. 阻止,迟延
v. 妨碍,迟延,迟缓
word.lx: Lack of sun retards plant growth./r/n 光照不足则植物生长缓慢./r/n Cold weather retards the growth of the crops./r/n 寒冷的天气妨碍了庄稼生长。/r/n

word.name: retardation
word.mean: n. 智力迟钝,精神发育迟缓
word.lx: A person of profound mental retardation having a mental age below three years and generally being unable to learn connected speech or guard against common dangers. The term belongs to a classification system no longer in use and is now considered offensi

word.name: retarded
word.mean: a. 智力迟钝的, 发展迟缓的
word.lx: Lack of sun retards plant growth./r/n 光照不足则植物生长缓慢./r/n A substance that retards or arrests a chemical reaction./r/n 反催化剂延缓或阻碍化学反应的物质/r/n

word.name: retell
word.mean:
v. 复述
vt. 复述,再讲
word.lx: The teacher asked the students to retell the story they just read./r/n 老师要求学生们复述他们刚读的故事。/r/n

word.name: retention
word.mean: n. 保存(保持力,包装牢固,记忆力,保留物)

word.name: retentive
word.mean: a. 保持的,有保持力的,记性好的

word.name: reticent
word.mean: a. 无言的,沉默的,谨慎的
word.lx: He seems unduly reticent on the subject of his past./r/n 他似乎对他过去的事情讳莫如深。/r/n

word.name: reticulum
word.mean: n. 网状质,网状组织,蜂巢胃

word.name: retinue
word.lx: She is a retinue of doctor./r/n 她是医生的助手。/r/n The Queen was flanked by a retinue of bodyguards and policemen./r/n 女王左右有保镖和警察护卫着。/r/n

word.name: retire
word.mean:
n. 退休,退职
v. 退休
word.lx: Our armies have retired to regroup for a fresh attack./r/n 我们的部队已经退下来重新整编，以便发动新的进攻。/r/n The boxer retired from the contest with eye injuries./r/n 该拳击手因眼部受伤而退出比赛。/r/n

word.name: retired
word.mean: a. 隐退的,退休的,退役的
word.lx: The retired film star sequestered herself from the world./r/n 这位退休的影星过着隐居的生活。/r/n I put him down as a retired naval officer./r/n 我看他是个退役的海军军官./r/n

word.name: retirement
word.lx: There have been several retirements in my office lately./r/n 最近我那办公室里有几个人退休了。/r/n The manager urged older staff to take up early retirement./r/n 经理敦促年纪较大的职员提前退休。/r/n

word.name: retiring
word.mean: a. 隐居的,不喜社交的
word.lx: Joanna had a gentle retiring disposition./r/n 乔安娜性格温柔而腼腆。/r/n Retiring early from his job freed him to join several local clubs./r/n 他早早退休, 摆脱了工作的羁绊而加入了当地的几个俱乐部./r/n

word.name: retouch
word.lx: Retouch is made to the goods the cases of which get wet by the tidal water./r/n 被潮水浸湿的箱子中的货物正在进行整修。/r/n

word.name: retrace
word.lx: He often retraces the happy time during his young age./r/n 他经常回忆起年轻时代的幸福时光。/r/n The police retraced the movements of the murder victim./r/n 警方追溯了被谋杀者当时的动作。/r/n

word.name: retract
word.mean:
vt. 缩进(拉回,退回,取消)
n. 收缩核
word.lx: The undercarriage on light aircraft does not always retract in flight./r/n 轻型飞机飞行时起落架不一定缩回./r/n The accused refused to retract (his statement)./r/n 那被告拒不撤消（其供述）./r/n

word.name: retractable
word.mean: a. 可缩回的,伸缩自如的,可取消的

word.name: retracted
word.lx: The undercarriage on light aircraft does not always retract in flight./r/n 轻型飞机飞行时起落架不一定缩回./r/n The accused refused to retract (his statement)./r/n 那被告拒不撤消（其供述）./r/n

word.name: retrench
word.lx: Inflation has forced us to retrench./r/n 因通货膨胀我们不得不紧缩开支./r/n

word.name: retribution
word.lx: The president promised swift and effective retribution against the terrorists./r/n 总统答应会迅速有效地惩罚恐怖分子。/r/n Retribution is at hand./r/n 惩罚就要到来/r/n

word.name: retrieve
word.mean:
v. 取回,恢复,补偿
n. 取回,恢复的希望
word.lx: The company is fighting to retrieve its market share./r/n 这个公司正在为恢复其市场份额（占有率）而奋斗。/r/n I should like to retrieve my umbrella which I left in the car./r/n 我想取回我留在车上忘记带走的雨伞。/r/n

word.name: retroactive
word.mean: a. 反动的,追溯的,有追溯力的

word.name: retrograde
word.mean:
a. 后退的,倒退的,退步的
v. 倒退,退步,逆行

word.name: retrospective
word.mean: a. 回顾的,怀旧的,在后面的
word.lx: The legislation was made retrospective./r/n 该项法规具有追溯效力。/r/n

word.name: retry
word.lx: There are calls for the case to be retried./r/n 该案有必要重审./r/n

word.name: returns
word.lx: On his return he report his findings to the committee./r/n 他一回来就向委员会报告调查结果。/r/n I asked him to bring me some raisins when he returns from Xinjiang./r/n 我请求他从新疆回来时给我带些葡萄干。/r/n

word.name: reunite
word.mean: vt. 再结合(统一,使...重聚)
word.lx: Parents were reunited with their lost children./r/n 父母与失散的孩子们团圆了。/r/n She hopes reuniting with her family./r/n 她希望与家人团聚。/r/n

word.name: reunited
word.mean: v. (使)团聚,(使)再结合,(使)重聚
word.lx: Imagine the joyful scene when they were reunited with their lost daughter./r/n 他们与失散的女儿团聚，快乐的情景是可想而知的。/r/n She hopes reuniting with her family./r/n 她希望与家人团聚。/r/n

word.name: reuse
word.mean:
v. 再使用
vt. 重新使用

word.name: revamp
word.mean:
v. 翻新,修改
vi. 修订,重建,改良

word.name: reveal
word.lx: I promise never to reveal his secret./r/n 我答应决不泄漏他的秘密。/r/n These few words fully revealed her noble quality./r/n 这寥寥数语充分显示了她的高贵品质。/r/n

word.name: revealing
word.lx: By firing a few shots we can surprise them into revealing their positions./r/n 我们冷不防打几枪就能让他们暴露他们的位置。/r/n The act or process of revealing or uncovering./r/n 揭露，泄露；公开揭露或揭发的行为或过程/r/n

word.name: revel
word.mean:
n. 作乐,狂欢
v. 狂欢作乐,深爱
word.lx: Christmas revels with feasting and dancing were common in England./r/n 圣诞节盛宴歌舞的狂欢在英国是很常见的。/r/n The actress revels in all the attention she gets from the media./r/n 这位女演员陶醉于传媒对她的吹捧。/r/n

word.name: revelry
word.lx: The revelries went on all the night./r/n 狂欢活动通宵达旦。/r/n It seems sounds of drunken revelry./r/n 那似乎是酗酒作乐的吵闹声。/r/n

word.name: reverberate
word.lx: The roar of the train reverberated in the tunnel./r/n 火车的轰隆声在隧道里回荡./r/n The room reverberated with the noise of the shot./r/n 房间里回响著枪声./r/n

word.name: revere
word.mean:
v. 尊敬, 敬畏, 崇敬
里维尔(美国马萨诸塞州城市,避暑胜地)
word.lx: People came to the memorial to revere the memory of the great leader./r/n 人们来到纪念馆崇敬地纪念这位伟大的领袖。/r/n I revere him greatly./r/n 我很尊敬他./r/n

word.name: reverence
word.lx: These students have reverence for their teacher./r/n 这些学生很尊敬他们的老师。/r/n Feeling reverence, dread, or awe./r/n 敬畏的感到尊敬，害怕或崇拜的/r/n

word.name: Reverend
word.mean:
n. 教士,神职人员,牧师
a. 应受尊敬的,牧师的
word.lx: A reverend gentleman is here to see you, sir!/r/n 这里有位教士要见你，先生。/r/n The Very Reverend Jane Smith./r/n 受人尊敬的简·史密斯/r/n

word.name: reverent
word.lx: They all maintained a reverent silence./r/n 他们都保持肃静。/r/n The reverent love and devotion accorded a deity, an idol, or a sacred object./r/n 崇拜对神、偶像或神圣物体带有敬畏或惊异的热爱与热诚/r/n

word.name: reverie
word.lx: He is indulging in reveries about the future./r/n 他正沉浸于对未来的幻想之中。/r/n She fell into a reverie about her childhood./r/n 她沉浸在对童年往事的遐想中。/r/n

word.name: reversal
word.lx: A sharp reversal of direction, as of a ball carrier in football./r/n 急转向相反方向急转，如橄榄球比赛中的持球球员的反切动作/r/n A reversal, as in policy; an about-face./r/n 向后转转向反面，如在政策上；大转变/r/n

word.name: reverse
word.mean:
n. 相反,背面,失败
a. 反面的,相反的,颠倒的
v. 颠倒,逆转,倒退
word.lx: These financial reverses will prevent my taking a holiday./r/n 这些经济上的挫折使我不能去度假了。/r/n The 50p coin has a crowned lion on its reverse./r/n 50便士硬币反面的图案是个戴皇冠的狮子./r/n

word.name: reverse discrimination
word.mean: 逆向歧视,反其道而行之的歧视

word.name: reversion
word.mean: n. 返回(原状,旧习惯),逆转

word.name: revert
word.lx: The fields have reverted to moorland./r/n 那片田地又变成了荒地。/r/n After her divorce she reverted to her maiden name./r/n 她离婚后又重新使用娘家的姓。/r/n

word.name: review
word.mean:
n. 检讨,复习,回顾,评审
v. 温习,检讨,评论
word.lx: All prices are subject to review./r/n 一切商品的价格都有可能调整。/r/n The play was very well reviewed./r/n 这出戏得到很好的评价。/r/n

word.name: reviewer
word.mean: n. 评论者(书评作者,报刊评论员)

word.name: revile
word.lx: Their much reviled system in fact works far better than many highly praised ones elsewhere./r/n 他们那套遭到许多非难的设备操纵起来实际上要比别的地方许多备受赞扬的设备好得多。/r/n

word.name: revise
word.mean:
n. 校订,修正,再校稿
v. 校订,修正,校正
word.lx: He revised the manuscript of his book before sending it to the publisher./r/n 他对自己那本书的手稿先进行校订，然后才把它交给出版社。/r/n You should revise your idea about him./r/n 你应该修改对他的看法。/r/n

word.name: revision
word.mean:
n. 校订,修正,修订本
n. 复习,重温
word.lx: Our budget needs drastic revision./r/n 我们的预算需作重大修改。/r/n The catalogue is under revision./r/n 目录正在修订之中。/r/n

word.name: revitalization
word.mean: n. 新生(复活,恢复元气)

word.name: revitalize
word.mean:
v. 使复活,使重新充满活力
vt. 使复兴,使苏醒,使复活,使恢复
word.lx: I think we have to revitalize our society./r/n 我觉得我们的社会需要新生。/r/n

word.name: revival
word.mean: n. 复兴,复活,恢复精神
word.lx: Our economy is undergoing a revival./r/n 我们的经济正处于复苏阶段。/r/n The patient had a speedy revival after her operation./r/n 那个女病人在手术后迅速康复。/r/n

word.name: revive
word.mean: v. 使...生醒,复生,恢复精神
word.lx: The flowers will revive in water./r/n 这些花在水中会再活。/r/n Interest in classic music has revived recently./r/n 近来对古典音乐的兴趣又浓厚起来。/r/n

word.name: revoke
word.mean:
vt. 撤回(回想)
n. 取消(回想)
word.lx: The unreasonable rules were revoked./r/n 不合理的规则被废除了。/r/n His driving licence was revoked after the crash./r/n 他撞车后驾驶执照被吊销了。/r/n

word.name: revolt
word.mean:
n. 叛乱,反抗,反感
v. 叛乱,起反感,使...恶心
word.lx: Human nature revolts at such a crime./r/n 人性厌恶这样的罪行。/r/n The colonists revolted against their British ruler./r/n 殖民地人民反抗他们的英国统治者。/r/n

word.name: revolting
word.mean: a. 背叛的,叛乱的,讨厌的
word.lx: His feet smelt revolting./r/n 他双脚散发的气味让人恶心./r/n He was the prime mover in the revolt against the government./r/n 他是这场反政府叛乱的煽动者./r/n

word.name: revoltingly
word.mean: ad. 令人作呕地,使人反感地

word.name: revolution
word.lx: Most countries have had revolutions aganist the government./r/n 大多数国家发生过反对政府的革命。/r/n The act of turning or the condition of being turned; rotation or revolution./r/n 转动，旋转转动的动作或被转动的状况；转动或旋转/r/n

word.name: revolutionary
word.mean:
a. 革命的
n. 革命者
word.lx: He suffered for his revolutionary principles./r/n 他为了自己的革命原则而蒙受苦难。/r/n The revolutionaries are attacking the palace./r/n 革命分子在攻打王宫。/r/n

word.name: revolutionize
word.mean: v. 鼓吹革命,大事改革
word.lx: Computers have revolutionizedbanking./r/n 计算机的运用彻底改变了银行业务运作./r/n

word.name: revolve
word.lx: The moon revolves around the earth./r/n 月球绕地球运行。/r/n The earth revolves round the sun./r/n 地球环绕太阳运行。/r/n

word.name: revolver
word.lx: He killed the man with a revolver./r/n 他用左轮手枪把那个人杀死了。/r/n The man produced a revolver from his pocket./r/n 那人从衣袋里掏出一支左轮手枪。/r/n

word.name: revolving
word.lx: The revolving sign was spinning round and round in the wind./r/n 旋转的标志牌在风中打著旋儿./r/n A revolving cylindrical sieve used for screening or sizing rock and ore./r/n 滚筒筛一种圆筒形的可旋转的筛，用于岩石和矿石的筛分或大小测量/r/n

word.name: revulsion
word.mean: n. 剧变,非常的厌恶,剧烈的反应

word.name: reward
word.mean:
n. 报酬,酬谢,赏金
v. 奖赏,酬谢
word.lx: They rewarded the winners with gifts of fruits and flowers./r/n 他们奖给优胜者一些水果和鲜花。/r/n He got a reward for helping them./r/n 他因帮助他们而拿到一笔酬金。/r/n

word.name: rewarding
word.mean: a. 有益的,有所得的,有报酬的
word.lx: Gardening is a very rewarding pastime./r/n 园艺劳动是非常有益的消遣。/r/n She finds motherhood very rewarding./r/n 她认为做母亲得偿所愿。/r/n

word.name: rewrite
word.mean:
n. 重写,改写
vt. 改写,重写
word.lx: I rewrote the article because it do not according with our policy./r/n 由于该文与我们的政策不符，我重新写了一遍。/r/n

word.name: RFD
word.mean: rural free delivery:邮件乡村地区免费递送

word.name: rhapsody
word.lx: The guests went into rhapsodies over the food./r/n 宾客对食物交口称赞./r/n

word.name: rhetoric
word.mean: n. 修辞,华丽虚饰的语言,修辞学
word.lx: The sentence contains impassioned rhetoric./r/n 这个句子含有富有表现力的修辞。/r/n I am tired of the empty rhetoric of politicians./r/n 我讨厌政客们的花言巧语。/r/n

word.name: rhetorical
word.mean: a. 修辞学的,符合修辞学的,修辞的

word.name: rhetorical question
word.mean: 不必回答,只为加强语气及效果的反问

word.name: rheumatism
word.lx: The patient is suffering from the rheumatism./r/n 这个病人受到风湿病的折磨。/r/n She is afflicted with rheumatism./r/n 她为风湿症所苦。/r/n

word.name: Rhine
word.lx: A region and former duchy of central Germany north and east of the Main and Rhine rivers. The region became a duchy in1806 and was absorbed by Prussia in1866. Members of the original dynasty subsequently ruled Luxembourg and the Netherlands(as the house

word.name: rhinestone
word.mean: n. 水晶之一种,人造钻石
word.lx: A small, glittering ornament, such as a rhinestone or a sequin, applied to fabric or a garment./r/n 亮片一种用于织物或服装上的闪闪发光的小饰物，比如像水晶或金属闪光片/r/n

word.name: rhino
word.mean:
n. 犀牛
n. <俚> 钱, 现金

word.name: rhinoceros
word.mean:
n. 犀牛
n. (对受攻击、批评、侮辱等）麻木不仁
word.lx: The rhinoceros has one horn on its nose./r/n 犀牛鼻子上有一个角。/r/n The game wardens tranquillized the rhinoceros with a drugged dart./r/n 猎物保护区管理员用麻醉射器让犀牛静了下来./r/n

word.name: rhythm
word.lx: He is trying to play the same tune in a different rhythm./r/n 他正试图用不同节奏演奏同一个曲子。/r/n Stress and rhythm are important in speaking English./r/n 说英语时, 重音和节奏是很重要的./r/n

word.name: rhythmical
word.mean: a. 有节奏的,有韵律的
word.lx: A monotonous rhythmical drumbeat or similar sound./r/n 单调鼓声一种单调的有节奏的敲鼓声或类似的声音/r/n The measured, rhythmical sound of verse; meter./r/n 韵律诗的节奏，韵律；音步/r/n

word.name: ribald
word.mean: a. 说话猥亵的,下流的,卑贱的

word.name: ribbed
word.mean: a. 呈肋状的,有罗纹的
word.lx: A soft, ribbed cloth of wool or a wool blend, usually used for dresses./r/n 罗纹织物一种羊毛的或羊毛混纺的柔软的、有罗纹的织物，一般用来制作女装/r/n She was constantly ribbed about her accent./r/n 人家总拿她的口音开玩笑./r/n

word.name: ribbon
word.mean:
n. 缎带,色带,带状物
v. 用丝带装饰,撕碎
word.lx: Her hair was tied back with a black ribbon./r/n 她的头发用黑缎带扎在后面。/r/n The old man wore an eyeglass attached to a piece of ribbon./r/n 那老人戴著单片眼镜，上面连结著一条丝带。/r/n

word.name: rice
word.lx: He had some rice for supper./r/n 晚饭时他吃了一些米饭。/r/n The peasants are harvesting rice in the field./r/n 农民们正在田野里收割稻子。/r/n

word.name: rich
word.mean: a. 富有的,浓厚的,贵重的
word.lx: He is a rich man./r/n 他是一个富有的人。/r/n The country is rich in oil and coal./r/n 这个国家石油和煤的资源丰富。/r/n

word.name: riches
word.lx: All his riches are of no good to him if he is so ill./r/n 如果他身体这么糟，那么他的所有财富对他毫无用处。/r/n The more riches a fool hath, the greater fool he is./r/n 【谚】傻瓜越富越蠢。/r/n

word.name: richly
word.lx: He richly deserved the punishment he received./r/n 他受到的处罚是罪有应得。/r/n Richly ornamented clothing; finery./r/n 华饰装饰华丽的衣物；华服/r/n

word.name: richness
word.lx: Thrift is the basement of richness./r/n 节约是富裕的基础。/r/n The richness of the soil favored the growth of crops./r/n 土地的肥沃有利于运动员的生长。/r/n

word.name: Rick
word.mean:
n. 干草堆
v. 堆成小屋形
n. 瑞克
word.lx: Rick often watched the boats returning to port in the late afternoon./r/n 瑞克常常看到小船在傍晚正回到港口。/r/n Rick found a sure-enough nickel./r/n 里克发现一个纯正的镍币。/r/n

word.name: rickets
word.mean: n. 软骨病,英吉利病,驼背

word.name: rickety
word.mean: a. 患软骨病的,驼背的,摇摆的

word.name: rid
word.mean: v. 免除,清除,使...获自由
word.lx: We will be glad to get rid of him./r/n 摆脱他，我们将很高兴。/r/n The man rid himself of debt./r/n 他还清了债。/r/n

word.name: ridden
word.lx: Having ridden for some time, he put the horse about and headed for home./r/n 他骑了一段时间以后，掉转马头回家去了。/r/n He is ridden by doubts./r/n 他为怀疑而苦恼。/r/n

word.name: riddle
word.mean:
n. 谜,谜语
v. 解谜,出谜题
word.lx: The door was riddled with shots./r/n 门被子弹打得尽是窟窿。/r/n He could not solve the riddle./r/n 他猜不出这个谜。/r/n

word.name: ride
word.mean:
n. 乘坐,乘车,搭便车
v. 骑,乘坐,克服
word.lx: Can you ride a bicycle?/r/n 你会骑自行车吗？/r/n The luxury model gives a smoother ride./r/n 坐这种豪华型汽车感觉很平稳。/r/n

word.name: rider
word.lx: She is no rider./r/n 她不会骑马。/r/n The rider forced his horse on through the storm./r/n 骑士迫使他的马在暴风雨中前进。/r/n

word.name: ridge
word.lx: His forehead was ridged with anxiety./r/n 他的前额因焦虑而布满了皱纹。/r/n The floor of the atlantic ridge in the middle from north to south./r/n 大西洋洋底在中部形成由北向南的海脊。/r/n

word.name: ridicule
word.mean:
n. 嘲笑,愚弄,笑柄
v. 嘲笑,嘲弄,愚弄
word.lx: To choose such a line of work is to invite ridicule./r/n 选择从事这个行业会惹人嘲笑。/r/n Scornfully contemptuous ridicule; derision./r/n 嘲讽责备地鄙视可笑之事；嘲笑/r/n

word.name: ridiculous
word.lx: What a ridiculous suggestion!/r/n 多么荒唐的建议！/r/n That fat woman looked ridiculous in her tight golden dress./r/n 那位胖妇人穿着金色的紧身礼服，显得滑稽可笑。/r/n

word.name: riding
word.lx: Riding is her favorite occupation./r/n 骑马是她最喜欢的消遣。/r/n Every Saturday Jean went riding on the village common./r/n 每周六琴在村里的公用草地上骑马。/r/n

word.name: rife
word.mean: a. 流行的,盛传的,非常多的
word.lx: Fraud, violence, war at home and abroad were rife./r/n 欺诈、暴力、对内对外的战争四处猖獗。/r/n His thesis is rife with errors./r/n 他的学位论文错误连篇。/r/n

word.name: rifle
word.mean:
n. 步枪
v. 洗劫,抢劫
word.lx: He was appointed captain of a company of rifles./r/n 他被任命为步枪连连长。/r/n The soldier told us where the firing mechanism of a rifle is./r/n 那个士兵告诉我们哪儿是步枪的击发装置。/r/n

word.name: rift
word.mean:
n. 裂口,隙缝,切口
v. 裂开,割开
word.lx: Healed the rift between us./r/n 弥补我们之间的裂痕/r/n

word.name: rig
word.mean:
n. 装备,帆具,服装
v. 装配,装扮,垄断
word.lx: He looked rather out of place when he turned up in full ceremonial rig./r/n 当他穿着全套大礼服露面的时候，显得和整个场合很不协调。/r/n They rigged the little boy out as a sailor./r/n 他们把小男孩打扮成水手模样。/r/n

word.name: right
word.mean:
a. 对的,正确的
ad. 对
int. 好
n. 权利,右
vt. 纠正
adv.恰恰,正好
word.lx: I have the right to ask for an explanation./r/n 我有权要求一个解释。/r/n The Normans ruled England by right of conquest./r/n 诺曼人征服了英格兰成了统治者。/r/n

word.name: right away
word.lx: Did you get dressed right away?/r/n 你马上就穿衣服了吗？/r/n The storm will blow over right away./r/n 暴风雨很快就会平息。/r/n

word.name: right off
word.lx: All that talk about abattoirs turned me right off!/r/n 关於屠宰场的那些话让我十分恶心!/r/n I go to bed at about eleven, and go right off to sleep./r/n 我大约在十一点上床，躺下就睡着了。/r/n

word.name: righteous
word.mean: a. 公正的,公义的,当然的
word.lx: He is a righteous young man./r/n 他是一个正直的年轻人。/r/n The abode of righteous souls after death; heaven./r/n 善人灵魂安息的乐园正直的灵魂死后所住的地方；天堂/r/n

word.name: rightful
word.mean: a. 合法的,正直的,当然的
word.lx: What he said is a rightful claim./r/n 他所说的是正当的要求。/r/n I am the rightful owner of this car./r/n 我是这辆新车的合法主人。/r/n

word.name: right-hand
word.mean: a. 右手的, 得力的

word.name: right-handed
word.mean: a. 用右手的, 向右旋地

word.name: rightly
word.mean: ad. 端正地,正当地,正确地

word.name: rights
word.lx: People have the rights of assembly and expression./r/n 人们有集会和发表言论的权利。/r/n Rights are inseparable from duties./r/n 权利和职责是分不开的./r/n

word.name: rigid
word.mean: a. 僵硬的,刻板的,严格的
word.lx: She was rigid with fear./r/n 她害怕得全身僵住了。/r/n The caste refers to social system based on rigid distinctions of birth, rank, wealth, etc./r/n 社会等级是指按照血统，阶级，财富等严格区分的社会制度。/r/n

word.name: rigidly
word.lx: He maintains a rigidly right-wing political stance./r/n 他坚持僵硬的右派政治立场./r/n An automobile designed to look like a convertible but having a rigidly fixed, hard top./r/n 金属顶盖式汽车具有看似篷式汽车但却有固定的顶篷设计的汽车/r/n

word.name: rigor
word.lx: He deserves to be punished with the full rigor of the law./r/n 他应该受到法律最严厉的惩罚。/r/n The expedition suffered all the rigors of a Canadian winter./r/n 这支探险队饱受了加拿大严冬的折磨。/r/n

word.name: rill
word.mean:
n. 小河
vi. 小河般地流
word.lx: The water in this rill is very clean./r/n 这条小溪里的水非常清澈。/r/n

word.name: rim
word.mean:
n. 边,轮缘,框
v. 镶边,为...之边
word.lx: She put a flower on the rim of the hat./r/n 她在帽子边上放了一朵花。/r/n She opened the door, and the yellow light from inside rimmed about her./r/n 她打开门，里面射出的灯光在她的身影四周镶了一圈黄色的边。/r/n

word.name: rind
word.mean:
n. 皮,壳,外表
v. 削皮,剥壳
word.lx: Those apple rinds are green./r/n 那些苹果的皮是绿的。/r/n Please help me to cut off the rinds of lemons./r/n 请帮我去掉柠檬的皮。/r/n

word.name: ring
word.mean:
n. 环,戒指,铃声
v. 响,鸣,回响
word.lx: I wonder when mother will ring?/r/n 我不知道母亲什么时候会打电话来？/r/n The telephone is ringing./r/n 电话响了。/r/n

word.name: ringed
word.lx: A high fence ringed the prison camp./r/n 有一道高高的铁丝网围著战俘营/r/n The lake is ringed with willows./r/n 该湖四周柳树环绕。/r/n

word.name: rings
word.lx: That rings a bell./r/n 我总算想起来了。/r/n The popular song rings far and near./r/n 这首流行歌曲到处流传。/r/n

word.name: rink
word.lx: The playing field in ice hockey; the rink./r/n 溜冰场冰球的场地；冰球场/r/n

word.name: rinse
word.mean:
n. 清洗,润丝,洗刷
v. 以清水冲洗,灌进
word.lx: You may use hot water to rinse the congealed fat off the dinner plates./r/n 你可以用热水把菜盘上凝结的油污冲洗掉。/r/n Rinse the clothes./r/n 把衣服涮一涮。/r/n

word.name: Rio de Janeiro
word.lx: Eleven hours out of Paris, the Air France plane let down into Rio de Janeiro./r/n 法国航空公司的飞机在飞离巴黎11个小时之后，在里约热内卢减速下降。/r/n A native or inhabitant of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil./r/n 巴西里约热内卢人或里约热内卢的居民/r/n

word.name: riot
word.mean:
v.&n. 骚乱,闹事
vi. 闹事,骚乱
word.lx: The football supporters ran riot through the town after the defeat of their team./r/n 足球队输球后球迷们在街上聚众闹事。/r/n The police stopped several riots on election night./r/n 警方在竞选之夜制止了几处骚乱。/r/n

word.name: riotous
word.mean: a. 引起骚扰的,暴动的,放荡的
word.lx: We spent a riotous night at Christmas./r/n 圣诞节我们度过了一个狂欢之夜。/r/n He was charged with riotous behaviour./r/n 他被控聚众闹事。/r/n

word.name: rip
word.mean:
n. 裂痕,破绽,拉裂
v. 拉开,划开,裂开
word.lx: I ripped my stocking on a nail./r/n 一个钉子挂破了我的袜子。/r/n The poster had been ripped to pieces./r/n 那张广告画已被撕得粉碎。/r/n

word.name: riparian
word.mean:
a. 河岸的,生于河岸的
n. 河岸的土地所有人
word.lx: Fishing and other riparian rights belong to owners of riparian land./r/n 捕鱼和其他河岸权属于该河两岸土地的所有者。/r/n

word.name: ripe
word.lx: The time was ripe for a challenge to the power of the government./r/n 时机已经成熟，可以向政府权力提出挑战了。/r/n These apples are not ripe; they are sour./r/n 这些苹果不熟，是酸的。/r/n

word.name: ripen
word.lx: Time had ripened his life and mellowed its fruits./r/n 时间使他的生命成熟，结出硕果。/r/n Fruit sweetens as it ripens./r/n 水果成熟後就好吃了./r/n

word.name: riposte
word.mean: n. .机敏的反驳或应答,剑术上的挡后回刺

word.name: ripple
word.mean:
n. 涟波,涟漪,波纹
v. 使...起涟漪,起微波,起潺潺声
word.lx: The wheat rippled in the breeze./r/n 小麦在微风中起伏波动。/r/n The breeze rippled the quiet water./r/n 微风吹皱了平静的水面。/r/n

word.name: rise
word.mean:
n. 上升,增加,小山
v. 升起,起身,上升,(日、月、星)升起
word.lx: I am reading a book about the rise and fall of the Roman Empire./r/n 我正在看一本关于罗马帝国兴衰的书。/r/n The sun rises in the east./r/n 太阳从东方升起。/r/n

word.name: risen
word.lx: Many people got rich by hoarding up gold until the price had risen more than ten times./r/n 许多人通过储存黄金待其涨价至10倍以上而发了财。/r/n The river has risen (by) several metres./r/n 河水上涨了好几米./r/n

word.name: risible
word.mean: a. 可笑的,引人发笑的
word.lx: The entire proposal is risible: it will never be accepted./r/n 这个建议完全是荒唐可笑的, 根本不可能采纳./r/n

word.name: rising
word.mean:
n. 上升,造反,叛乱
a. 上升的,高涨的,晋升的
vbl. 升起,起身,上升
word.lx: The mercury is rising./r/n 温度正在上升。/r/n The mists was fleeing before the rising sun./r/n 太阳慢慢升起，薄雾渐渐消失。/r/n

word.name: risk
word.mean:
n. 风险,危险
v. 冒...的危险
word.lx: Anyone swimming in this lake does so at his own risk./r/n 任何人在此湖中冒险游泳，其后果自负。/r/n He saved my life at the risk of his own./r/n 他冒着自己的生命危险救了我的命。/r/n

word.name: risky
word.mean: a. 危险的(冒险的,大胆的)

word.name: risque
word.mean: a. <法> (作品等)淫秽的, 败坏风俗的

word.name: rite
word.lx: Did you go to their marriage rites?/r/n 你参加他们的婚礼了吗？/r/n The sacrament or rite of ordination./r/n 神职仪式神职的任命或神职任命仪式/r/n

word.name: ritual
word.mean:
n. 仪式,典礼,宗教仪式,固定程序
a. 仪式的,依仪式而行的，老规矩的，惯常的

word.name: river
word.lx: The Changjiang River is one of the longest rivers in the world./r/n 长江是世界上最长的河流之一。/r/n The guide led us to the river./r/n 向导带领我们到河边。/r/n

word.name: riverfront
word.mean: n. (城镇的)河边地区,河边陆地

word.name: rivet
word.mean:
n. 铆钉
v. 用铆钉固定,敲进去,注目
word.lx: We stood riveted to the spot./r/n 我们寸步不移的站在那儿。/r/n I was absolutely riveted by her story./r/n 她的故事完全把我吸引住了。/r/n

word.name: riveting
word.lx: Only by riveting her attention on her word could she forget her worries./r/n 只有全身心投入到工作上她才能忘记烦恼。/r/n Can I fasten these metal plates with rivets?/r/n 我可以用铆钉把这些金属板固定在一起吗？/r/n

word.name: RNA
word.lx: Any of a group of red dyes used as a biological stain, especially to detect the presence of RNA./r/n 焦宁；二苯氧芑胶染料用作生物染色剂的一组红色染料中的任一种，尤指用来探测核糖核酸的存在/r/n

word.name: road
word.lx: All roads lead to Rome./r/n 条条大道通罗马。/r/n The road was blocked by a huge rock./r/n 道路被一块大石头堵住了。/r/n

word.name: roadside
word.lx: We ate our meal at a roadside pub./r/n 我们是在路旁的一家小酒馆里吃的饭。/r/n We ate our meal by the roadside./r/n 我们是在公路旁吃的饭。/r/n

word.name: roadway
word.lx: A mound of earth or stone built to hold back water or to support a roadway./r/n 堤用以阻挡水或支持公路而建造的土堆或石堆/r/n A raised roadway, as across water or marshland./r/n 堤道加高的行道，如穿过水洼或沼泽的道路/r/n

word.name: roam
word.lx: He settled down after years of roaming./r/n 漂泊数年后，他定居了下来。/r/n Bison used to roam through the American great plains, but most of them are slaughter by hunter./r/n 从前野牛在美国大平原上漫游，但是大多数都被猎人屠杀了。/r/n

word.name: roaming
word.lx: He settled down after years of roaming./r/n 漂泊数年后，他定居了下来。/r/n He spent much of his spare time roaming about the streets./r/n 他把大部分的闲暇时间用来逛街。/r/n

word.name: roan
word.mean:
a. 菊花青色的
n. 菊花青色的马,柔软的羊皮
word.lx: Jump in, there is roan for one more person in the car./r/n 快进来，汽车里还可以坐1个人。/r/n

word.name: roar
word.mean:
n. 吼,咆哮,轰鸣
v. 吼,大声说出,叫喊
word.lx: He roared with pain./r/n 他疼得大叫起来。/r/n The football crowd roared./r/n 足球观众大喊起来。/r/n

word.name: roaring
word.mean:
n. 吼声,咆哮,怒吼
a. 风哮雨嚎的,喧哗的,兴胜的
word.lx: The place was a blazing, raging, roaring, etc inferno./r/n 那地方是一片熊熊的、 滚滚的、 咆哮的...火海./r/n The news was greeted with roaring cheers among the workers./r/n 工人们听到这消息时都欢声雷动。/r/n

word.name: roasted
word.lx: The critics roasted her new play./r/n 评论家狠狠挖苦她 的新剧./r/n The benefit party at$100 a ticket promises to be a real fine donkey roast./r/n 这个募捐晚会，票价定为100美元1张，保证开成一个盛会。/r/n

word.name: rob
word.mean:
v. 抢劫
vi. 抢劫,盗窃
vt. 非法剥夺,使丧失,抢劫
word.lx: They knocked him down and robbed him of his briefcase./r/n 他们把他打倒在地，抢走了他的公文包。/r/n The silly ending robs the plot of any credibility./r/n 这愚蠢的结尾使得整个情节变得一点都不可信。/r/n

word.name: robber
word.lx: The robbers escaped before the police arrived./r/n 强盗们在警察到来之前逃走了。/r/n They kept a wary eye on the robber./r/n 他们密切注意那个强盗。/r/n

word.name: robbery
word.lx: He had committed several robberies in the neighborhood./r/n 他已在附近犯下了好几起抢劫案。/r/n The police have excluded robbery as a motive for the murder./r/n 警方已排除该谋杀案中有抢劫的动机./r/n

word.name: robe
word.mean:
n. 长袍
v. (使)穿上长袍等
word.lx: You should put a robe on if you go out in a cold day./r/n 冷天出门时要披上披肩。/r/n He robes himself in moonlight./r/n 他沐浴在月光下。/r/n

word.name: Robert
word.lx: The film co-starred Robert Redford (and Paul Newman)./r/n 这部影片由罗伯特·雷德福（和保罗·纽曼）联合主演./r/n A slip of the tongue made me say Robert instead of Richard./r/n 我说走了嘴把理查德说成了罗伯特./r/n

word.name: Robinson Crusoe
word.mean: 鲁滨孙·克鲁索(《鲁滨孙漂流记》主人公)

word.name: robot
word.lx: Japanese industry is making increasing use of robots./r/n 日本工业越来越多地使用机器人。/r/n The toy robot moved forward with quick jerky steps./r/n 玩具机器人一颠一颠地走得很快./r/n

word.name: robust
word.lx: Being in robust and sturdy good health./r/n 强壮的，健康的强壮的和身体健康的/r/n The old veteran could lay flat the most robust sportsman./r/n 这位沙场院老将能把最强壮的运动员拖得筋疲力尽。/r/n

word.name: rocker
word.lx: You must be off your rocker!/r/n 你简直疯了!/r/n A punk rocker./r/n 庞克摇滚乐师/r/n

word.name: rocket
word.mean:
n. 火箭,烟火
v. 发射火箭,猛涨
word.lx: The price of oil has suddenly rocketed up./r/n 石油价格突然飞涨。/r/n They sent a distress rocket./r/n 他们发出了一枚呼救信号火箭。/r/n

word.name: rocking
word.lx: The teenagers were rocking about./r/n 那群少年正合着摇摆音乐的节拍跳舞。/r/n He rocked back and forth in his rocking chair./r/n 他坐在摇椅里前后摇晃着。/r/n

word.name: rocking chair
word.lx: He rocked back and forth in his rocking chair./r/n 他坐在摇椅里前后摇晃着。/r/n

word.name: Rocky Mountains
word.lx: North American Indians, formerly living east of the Rocky Mountains/r/n 从前居住在落基山脉以东的三个北美印第安人部落的成员。/r/n

word.name: rococo
word.mean:
n. 洛可可
a. 洛可可式的,旧式的

word.name: rod
word.lx: The concrete walls are reinforced with steel rods./r/n 混凝土墙是用钢筋加固的。/r/n Spare the rod and spoil the child./r/n st. 不打不成器./r/n

word.name: rode
word.lx: He rode off at a gallop./r/n 他骑马疾驰而去。/r/n The ladies rode in the carriage and we ran along beside./r/n 女士们乘坐马车，我们则跟在车旁跑。/r/n

word.name: rodeo
word.mean: n. 将牛、马驱集在一起;竞技表演 【经】 牛市场

word.name: roguish
word.lx: He gave her a roguish look./r/n 他调皮地看了她一眼./r/n

word.name: roister
word.mean: v. 摆架子, 喝酒喧嚣

word.name: role
word.lx: The role of the railways declined in the transport system./r/n 在运输系统中，铁路的重要性逐渐下降。/r/n The key role of the teacher in the learning process should not be neglected./r/n 教师在学习中的关键作用是不该忽视的。/r/n

word.name: roll
word.mean:
n. 卷,滚动,名单
v. 滚,使...转动,摇摆
word.lx: The dog rolled on the floor./r/n 狗在地板上打滚。/r/n The slow steady roll of the ship made him sick./r/n 轮船不停地缓慢摇晃使他感到不适。/r/n

word.name: roller
word.lx: May I borrow your roller skates?/r/n 我可以借你的滚轴溜冰鞋吗？/r/n A road roller is used in making and repairing roads./r/n 压路机是用来修筑道路的。/r/n

word.name: roller-skate
word.lx: She roller-skated across rather unsteadily./r/n 她穿著旱冰鞋晃晃悠悠地滑了过去./r/n

word.name: rolling
word.mean:
a. 旋转的,波动的,起伏的
n. 旋转,轰响,动摇
word.lx: The rolling hills fall gently toward the coast./r/n 起伏的山丘逐渐向海岸缓降/r/n The city is girdled about with gently rolling hills./r/n 该市为平缓起伏的丘陵所围绕着。/r/n

word.name: Roman
word.mean:
a. 罗马的
n. 罗马人
word.lx: Here is a book about Roman history./r/n 这是一本关于古罗马历史的书。/r/n The above definition is set in roman; this example is in italics./r/n 上面的定义用的是正体字排印的，本例句用的是斜体。/r/n

word.name: romance
word.mean: n. 冒险故事,浪漫史,传奇文学
word.lx: French and Portuguese are Romance languages./r/n 法语和葡萄牙语都是罗曼语。/r/n He told us a romance about a prince who married a poor girl./r/n 他给我们讲了一位王子娶了一个穷人家女孩的传奇故事。/r/n

word.name: romantic
word.mean:
a. 浪漫的
n. 浪漫的人
word.lx: The old abbey ruins look very romantic in the moonlight./r/n 古修道院的废墟在月光下显得颇有浪漫气息。/r/n He is a very romantic person./r/n 他是个非常浪漫的人。/r/n

word.name: romanticism
word.mean: n. 浪漫精神,浪漫主义
word.lx: British poet considered a precursor of romanticism. His best-known work, The Task(1785), praises rural life and leisure./r/n 科伯，威廉1731－1800英国诗人，被认为是浪漫主义的先锋。他的最杰出的作品任务赞美了农村生活和休闲/r/n

word.name: Rome
word.lx: He first met his wife in Rome./r/n 他最初是在罗马碰到他的妻子的。/r/n Rome is an Italian city./r/n 罗马是意大利城市。/r/n

word.name: romp
word.mean:
n. 好玩的游戏,欢闹,嬉戏
v. 嬉闹玩耍
vi. 嬉闹玩笑
word.lx: The liberal candidate romped through with thousands of votes to spare./r/n 自由党候选人轻易获胜，超出选票数以千计。/r/n We can see the puppies romping around in the garden./r/n 我们可以看到在园子里跑来跑去的小狗。/r/n

word.name: rook
word.mean:
n. 白嘴鸦,赌棍
vt. 骗
word.lx: They rooked him of 100./r/n 他们在纸牌戏中骗走他100英镑./r/n That hotel really rooked us./r/n 那家旅馆可真敲了我们竹杠./r/n

word.name: room
word.lx: I want a double room with a view./r/n 我要一间能看到风景的双人房间。/r/n There is not so much room for these books./r/n 没有这么大的地方来放这些书。/r/n

word.name: roommate
word.lx: I have seven roommates in my university./r/n 上大学时，我有七个室友。/r/n Kenny tried to chum up with his new roommate but was only partially successful./r/n 肯尼想和他的新室友拉交情，但只取得了几分成功。/r/n

word.name: roomy
word.mean: a. 广阔的,宽敞的,宽大的
word.lx: Providing ample range; roomy./r/n 宽敞的提供巨大范围的；空间大的/r/n Capable of containing a large quantity; spacious or roomy./r/n 宽敞的能够容纳很大数量的；宽敞的或宽松的/r/n

word.name: roost
word.mean:
n. 栖木,鸟窝,休息所
v. 栖息,安歇
word.lx: Curse, like chicken, come home to roost./r/n 诅咒像鸡雏，必回栖息木。/r/n Her selfishness will come home to roost someday./r/n 她的自私总有一天会得到报应。/r/n

word.name: root
word.mean:
n. 根,根源
v. 生根,扎根
word.lx: Do you think the new rosebush has taken root?/r/n 你看新栽的玫瑰长根了吗？/r/n Unhappiness is the root cause of his illness./r/n 不开心是他生病的根源。/r/n

word.name: rope
word.mean:
n. 绳,索
v. 捆,绑
vt. 绳子
word.lx: He roped his horse on a nearby tree./r/n 他把马拴到附近的一棵树上。/r/n They tied their prisoner up with a piece of rope./r/n 他们用绳索把犯人捆起来。/r/n

word.name: rose
word.mean:
n. 玫瑰,蔷薇
v. (rise的过去式) 起立,上升,升起
word.lx: I found him pruning his roses./r/n 我看到他正在给玫瑰修剪枝条。/r/n We did not start until the sun rose in the east./r/n 直到太阳从东方升起，我们才出发。/r/n

word.name: rosebush
word.lx: Do you think the new rosebush has taken root?/r/n 你看新栽的玫瑰长根了吗？/r/n There is a rosebush near the fence and it is very beautiful./r/n 篱笆附近有一丛玫瑰，长得非常美丽。/r/n

word.name: rosette
word.lx: An ornament, such as a decorative knot, resembling a rose in form; a rosette./r/n 玫瑰花饰一种形似玫瑰花的装饰品，如装饰结；玫瑰花结/r/n

word.name: rostrum
word.mean: n. 演坛,演说家,船嘴讲坛
word.lx: It grasps its victim in its forelegs and pierce it with its rostrum./r/n 它用前腿抓住牺牲品，把喙刺入对方身体。/r/n

word.name: rot
word.mean:
n. 腐烂,腐蚀,败坏
v. 腐烂,使...枯朽,衰弱
word.lx: Too much television rots your brain./r/n 多看电视会使你的头脑退化。/r/n He thinks that the rot set in when the country was opened up to tourists./r/n 他认为自从国家向旅游者开放之时起，腐败就开始了。/r/n

word.name: rotary
word.mean:
a. 旋转的
n. 运行的机器

word.name: rotate
word.lx: The post of chairman rotates among members of the committee./r/n 主席一职由委员会的成员轮流担任。/r/n He rotates the handle gently./r/n 他轻轻地转动手柄。/r/n

word.name: rotation
word.lx: The rotation of crops keeps the soil healthy and fertile./r/n 谷物轮种使土壤保持了肥力和高质。/r/n The seasons follow each other in rotation./r/n 四季循环交替。/r/n

word.name: rote
word.mean: n. 死记硬背, 机械的做法, 生搬硬套
word.lx: He used to learn everything by rote./r/n 他过去总是死记硬背。/r/n He can say the whole of the English Bible by rote./r/n 他能把整本英语《圣经》硬背出来。/r/n

word.name: rotten
word.lx: The wood was so rotten that you could put your finger through it./r/n 这木料腐烂透了，你可以用手指戳穿它。/r/n They have a rotten deal./r/n 他们受到不公平的待遇。/r/n

word.name: Rotterdam
word.lx: Rotterdam is a major port./r/n 鹿特丹是个重要的港口城市./r/n The ship will berth at rotterdam on Wednesday./r/n 该轮将于星期三停泊在鹿特丹港。/r/n

word.name: rotunda
word.mean: n. 圆形建筑,圆形大厅

word.name: rouge
word.mean:
n. 口红,胭脂
v. 擦口红
word.lx: The girl put some rouge on her cheeks./r/n 女孩在两颊上擦了点胭脂。/r/n That evening the children wore lipstick and rouge, they looked like dolls./r/n 这天晚上，孩子们都涂胭脂口红，看起来就像洋娃娃。/r/n

word.name: rough
word.mean:
a. 粗糙的,粗略的,大致的,粗野的,粗暴的
ad. 粗暴地
vt. 殴打,草拟
word.lx: The rough road made the car vibrate./r/n 崎岖不平的道路使车颠簸得很厉害。/r/n They complained rough handling by the police./r/n 他们抱怨受到警察粗野的对待。/r/n

word.name: roughly
word.lx: The speaker was roughly handled by the mob./r/n 演说者受到暴民的粗暴对待。/r/n Roughly speaking, I would say that about100 people attended the exhibit./r/n 粗略地说来，我想大约有100人参观了展览。/r/n

word.name: round
word.mean:
n. 圆,范围,巡回
a. 圆的,肥胖的,完全的
v. 弄圆,绕行,使...完全
word.lx: Cut the bread into small rounds and give me two./r/n 把面包切成小片，然后给我两片。/r/n The earth moves round the sun./r/n 地球绕着太阳运转。/r/n

word.name: roundabout
word.mean:
a. 绕道的
n. 远路
环状交叉路口
word.lx: We drove home by a roundabout route./r/n 我们绕远道驾车回家。/r/n At the roundabout, take the third exit./r/n 在环状交叉路口，从第三条出路驶出。/r/n

word.name: rounded
word.lx: A charge of 1.90 will be rounded up to 2, and one of 3.10 rounded down to 3./r/n 把 1.90 英镑的费用上调为整数 2 英镑, 把 3.10 英镑下调为整数 3 英镑./r/n The police rounded up those rogues./r/n 警察逮捕了那些恶棍。/r/n

word.name: rounding
word.lx: A rounding up and driving of cattle to new pastures or to market./r/n 驱赶牛群圈集并驱赶牛群到新的牧场或市场/r/n The bill should have been$29.54 so I round it up to$30./r/n 账单本来应该是92。54美元，我凑个整数把它调高到了30美元。/r/n

word.name: roundsman
word.lx: Ask your roundsman for extra milk over Christmas./r/n 请贵店送货员在圣诞节多送些牛奶来./r/n

word.name: roundup
word.mean: n. 集拢,围捕,综述,摘要

word.name: rouse
word.mean:
n. 觉醒,奋起
v. 唤醒,鼓舞,激动
word.lx: The dog roused a deer from the bushes./r/n 狗惊起了丛林中的一只鹿。/r/n The news roused great indignation./r/n 这条消息引起了极大的愤慨。/r/n

word.name: rout
word.mean:
n. 彻底溃败,凑热闹的人,大败
v. 使...溃败,使...败逃
word.lx: They routed the enemy./r/n 他们打败并赶走了敌人。/r/n Our party was routed at the election./r/n 我们党在竞选中被彻底击败了。/r/n

word.name: route
word.mean:
n. 航线,路线
vt. 按路线发送
word.lx: We drove home by a roundabout route./r/n 我们绕远道驾车回家。/r/n The flight is routed to Chicago via New York./r/n 这个航班被安排经纽约飞往芝加哥。/r/n

word.name: routine
word.mean:
a. 常规的,例行的
n. 例行公事,常规
word.lx: It was a rather routine performance./r/n 那是很一般的演出。/r/n She found it difficult to establish a new routine after retirement./r/n 她发觉退休后很难建立起新的生活规律。/r/n

word.name: rove
word.mean:
n. 徘徊,粗纺线,流浪
v. 漂泊于,漫游于,飘忽不定
word.lx: He rove about his student./r/n 他扫了他的学生一眼。/r/n His eyes roved around the room./r/n 他的眼睛扫视着房间的每个角落。/r/n

word.name: rover
word.lx: The rover finally returned home./r/n 这个流浪者终于回家了。/r/n Their dog Rover lives in a kennel in the back garden./r/n 他们的小狗罗佛的窝在后花园。/r/n

word.name: row
word.mean:
n. 排,船游,吵闹
v. 划,划船,责骂
word.lx: Students stand hand in hand in a row./r/n 学生们手牵手站成一排。/r/n They are rowing again./r/n 他们又吵起来了。/r/n

word.name: rowdy
word.lx: They were chucked out of the pub for being too rowdy./r/n 他们因为太吵闹被撵出酒馆./r/n I have to sit on the class when they get too rowdy./r/n 班上学生太闹时，我就得管一管。/r/n

word.name: rower
word.lx: A man who rows, especially an expert in rowing; a rower./r/n 桨手划桨者，尤指划桨能手；桨手/r/n

word.name: rowing
word.lx: In dragon boat rowing each person has one oar./r/n 划龙舟时每个人都拿着一枝桨。/r/n Will you join us in rowing?/r/n 你愿意和我们一起划船吗?/r/n

word.name: royal
word.mean:
a. 王室的,皇家的
n. 王室或皇族之一员
word.lx: The papers are full of stories about the royals./r/n 报纸上尽是些关于王室成员趣闻逸事的报道。/r/n The new law has received the royal assent./r/n 新的法规已得到国王的批准。/r/n

word.name: royalty
word.mean:
n. 皇家,皇族
n. 版税
word.lx: The writer gets a 10% royalty on each copy sold of his book./r/n 作者从每本卖出的书中可得10%的版税。/r/n The flag is only raised when royalty are present./r/n 只有在王室成员在场的时候才升起这面旗帜。/r/n

word.name: rub
word.mean:
n. 摩擦,困难,障碍
v. 擦,搓,摩擦
word.lx: I rubbed the window with a cloth./r/n 我用一块布擦窗子。/r/n He rubbed his hands to keep them warm./r/n 他揉搓着双手来取暖。/r/n

word.name: rubber
word.mean:
a. 橡胶的
n. 合成橡胶,橡胶
word.lx: My classmate borrowed my rubber and forgot to return it./r/n 我的同学借了我的橡皮忘了还。/r/n Rubber boots are impervious to water./r/n 橡胶鞋是防水的。/r/n

word.name: rubber band
word.lx: She used a rubber band to tie her hair./r/n 她用一根橡皮筋扎头发。/r/n He stretched the rubber band till it snapped./r/n 他把橡皮筋啪的一声拉断了./r/n

word.name: rubbery
word.lx: A mild, white Italian cheese that has a rubbery texture and is often eaten melted, as on pizza./r/n 白干酪一种味淡的、白色的并有弹性的意大利奶酪，通常融化放在比萨饼上吃/r/n

word.name: rubbish
word.mean:
a. 毫无价值的
n. 废话,垃圾,废物
word.lx: The dustman comes once a week to collect the rubbish./r/n 垃圾工每周来收一次垃圾。/r/n That new TV show is absolutely rubbish./r/n 那个新的电视节目一点儿价值都没有。/r/n

word.name: rubble
word.mean: n. 粗石,破碎的砖,粗石堆
word.lx: Rubble covered the pavement./r/n 人行道上铺了碎石块./r/n The ceiling collapsed and rubble poured into the room./r/n 天花板坍塌了, 碎砖破瓦掉落到了屋里./r/n

word.name: ruby
word.mean:
a. 红宝石色
n. 红宝石
word.lx: Her ruby necklace brightened her face./r/n 红宝石项链照亮了她的脸庞。/r/n The ruby sets off the diamond./r/n 红宝石把钻石衬托得更美丽。/r/n

word.name: ruck
word.mean: n. 皱褶,普通群众,大量
word.lx: Thesheets on my bed have rucked up./r/n 我床上的床单有褶子了./r/n He was eager to get out of the (common) ruck and distinguish himself in some way./r/n 他渴望出人头地, 在某方面与众不同./r/n

word.name: rucksack
word.lx: She shouldered her rucksack and set off along the road./r/n 她背起帆布背包就上路了./r/n She swung the rucksack (up) onto her back./r/n 她把帆布背包转到身後./r/n

word.name: rudely
word.mean: ad. 无礼地,粗鲁地,粗陋地

word.name: rudeness
word.lx: His rudeness provoked me to strike him./r/n 他的粗鲁惹得我揍了他。/r/n Your rudeness had offended many people./r/n 你的粗鲁已激怒了很多人。/r/n

word.name: rudiment
word.lx: I have mastered the rudiments of economics./r/n 我已精通经济学的基本原理。/r/n

word.name: rudimentary
word.mean: a. 基本的(初步的,起码的,根本的)

word.name: rudiments
word.lx: I have mastered the rudiments of economics./r/n 我已精通经济学的基本原理。/r/n

word.name: rueful
word.mean: a. 悲伤的,怜悯的,可怜的
word.lx: He thought of her with a rueful smile./r/n 他苦笑着回想她。/r/n He was rueful for joining the army./r/n 他感到后悔去参军。/r/n

word.name: ruffian
word.mean:
n. 恶棍,无赖
a. 儿恶的,残忍的,残暴的
word.lx: A hired ruffian; a thug./r/n 打手一个被雇的恶棍；暴徒/r/n He is one of the greatest ruffians who ever cheated the gallows./r/n 他是一个曾经逃过绞刑的最坏的恶棍。/r/n

word.name: ruffle
word.mean:
n. 绉褶,波纹,生气
v. 弄绉,起绉,发脾气
word.lx: The bird ruffled up its feathers./r/n 鸟儿惊恐地竖起了羽毛。/r/n A flag ruffled in the breeze./r/n 旗帜迎风飘扬。/r/n

word.name: rug
word.lx: He is vacuuming a rug in the sitting room./r/n 他在起居室里用吸尘器打扫地毯。/r/n She put a rug over the sleeping child./r/n 她给睡著的孩子盖上了毯子./r/n

word.name: ruin
word.mean:
n. (pl.)废墟,毁灭
v. 毁坏,破坏
vi. (使)破产,毁灭
vt. 毁坏,毁灭
word.lx: The castle now lies in ruins./r/n 那城堡现在已成了一片废墟了。/r/n The rain ruined my painting./r/n 这场雨把我的画给毁了。/r/n

word.name: ruined
word.lx: This ruined bridge is a relic of the Civil War./r/n 这座毁坏的桥是南北战争时的遗迹。/r/n The vessel was ruined by a submarine./r/n 那艘船是被潜水艇毁坏的。/r/n

word.name: ruinous
word.mean: a. 破坏性的,招致毁减的,零落的
word.lx: The prices in that restaurant are absolutely ruinous./r/n 那家餐馆的价格贵得能把人坑死。/r/n They took a ruinous expenditure on the house./r/n 他们为了那所房子倾家荡产。/r/n

word.name: rule of thumb
word.mean: n. 经验法则(靠经验估计)

word.name: ruler
word.mean:
n. 尺子
n. 统治者
word.lx: He reminded me not to forget to bring my ruler./r/n 他提醒我别忘了带尺子。/r/n Sultan is sovereign ruler of certain Muslim countries./r/n 苏丹是某些穆斯林国家的最高统治者。/r/n

word.name: rum
word.mean:
n. 甜酒
a. 古怪的,奇特的
word.lx: Rum is an alcoholic drink distilled from sugar-cane juice./r/n 郎姆酒是用甘蔗汁蒸馏制成的。/r/n The rum is 30% below proof./r/n 朗姆酒低於标准度数30%./r/n

word.name: rumble
word.mean:
n. 隆隆声,辘辘声
v. 发隆隆声,辘辘响
word.lx: The heavy cart rumbled down the street./r/n 笨重的马车辘辘地在街上走过。/r/n The thunder rumbled in the distance./r/n 远处雷声隆隆。/r/n

word.name: ruminant
word.lx: Leather made from the hide of the African and Asian ruminant./r/n 羚皮革非洲、亚洲的羚羊皮做的皮革/r/n

word.name: ruminate
word.lx: He is ruminating on recent events./r/n 他正在思考最近发生的事。/r/n The cow began to ruminate after eating up grass./r/n 牛吃完草后开始反刍。/r/n

word.name: rummage
word.mean:
v. 到处翻寻,搜出,检查
n. 翻箱倒柜的寻找,临检,碎屑

word.name: rumor
word.mean:
n. 谣言,传闻
v. 谣传
word.lx: He is rumored to have escaped to Dublin./r/n 据说他已逃往都柏林。/r/n There is a rumor that there will be a General Election in the autumn./r/n 据传闻今秋将举行普选。/r/n

word.name: rump
word.lx: After the election the party was reduced to a rump./r/n 选举之后，该党的党员所剩无几了。/r/n He ordered a juicy rump steak./r/n 他要了一份多汁的后腿肉牛排。/r/n

word.name: rumple
word.mean:
n. 皱纹,皱褶
v. 弄皱,弄乱

word.name: rumpus
word.lx: I was still there when I heard the rumpus. I came out into the hall and ran hell for leather to see what was the matter./r/n 当我听到那吵嚷声时，我还在那里，我立刻从房里来到过道里，飞快地跑出去看看是怎么回事。/r/n

word.name: run
word.mean:
n. 奔跑,路程,趋向
v. 跑,运转,进行,运转,经营,褪色
vbl. 跑,进行,延续
word.lx: The little boy ran off to get his brother./r/n 这个小男孩跑去找他的哥哥。/r/n The petrol is running out./r/n 汽油快要耗尽了。/r/n

word.name: runaway
word.mean:
n. 逃走的人,逃亡,亡命者
a. 逃亡的,逃走的
word.lx: The runaway of the traffic accident is wanted by the police./r/n 警方正在通缉交通事故的逃逸者。/r/n The runaway horse was cornered in a field./r/n 那匹跑掉的马在田地里被圈住了./r/n

word.name: rundown
word.lx: He will flatter a person to his face, and then rundown behind his back./r/n 他会当面吹捧一个人，背后又说他坏话。/r/n I missed the meeting. Can you give me the rundown?/r/n 我没能叁加会议，你能告诉我会议的概要吗？/r/n

word.name: rung
word.mean: n. 脚蹬横木,横档,车辐
word.lx: The director made his son start on the bottom rung of the ladder as an office boy./r/n 董事让他的儿子从最低级的职员做起。/r/n A bell rung as a call to recite this prayer./r/n 天使经钟用来号召进行这种祈祷的钟声/r/n

word.name: runner
word.lx: There are eight runners in the final race./r/n 最后的赛程中有八匹马参加。/r/n The runner shot ahead (of the rest)./r/n 那个赛跑的人向前飞奔而去（把其他人抛在後面）./r/n

word.name: running
word.mean:
n. 赛跑,流出,运转
a. 流动的,跑著的,连续的
vbl. 跑,运转,经营
word.lx: Mike is rather timid with women, so Sue has to make all the running in their relationship./r/n 迈克在女子面前很 腆，所以苏珊只好对迈克主动一些。/r/n The boy avoided punishment by running away./r/n 那个男孩逃跑来逃避惩罚。/r/n

word.name: runoff
word.mean: n. 径流量(流出,流放口,出轨,决赛)

word.name: runway
word.mean: n. 跑道(悬索道,河床,滑沟)
word.lx: I repeat: the runway is not clear for take-off./r/n 我再说一遍: 跑道尚未畅通, 不能起飞./r/n The plane taxied/was taxiing along the runway./r/n 飞机在跑道上滑行./r/n

word.name: rural
word.lx: The rural scenery was so beautiful that he decided to stay one more week./r/n 乡村风光太美了，以致于他决定再多呆一星期。/r/n Resembling or having the characteristics of country life; rural./r/n 农村的象农村生活的，具有农村生活特点的；乡下的/r/n

word.name: ruse
word.lx: A ruse; a trick./r/n 诈术；诡计/r/n

word.name: rush
word.mean:
n. 匆促,冲进,急流
v. 冲进,匆促行事,催
word.lx: He did not like us to rush him./r/n 他不喜欢我们催他。/r/n They rushed up the stairs./r/n 他们冲到楼上。/r/n

word.name: Russia
word.lx: Russia used to be a very powerful country./r/n 俄国曾是一个非常强大的国家。/r/n Some teachers went to Russia to be educated in fine arts./r/n 有些老师去俄罗斯接受美术教育。/r/n

word.name: Russian
word.mean:
a. 俄国的
n. 俄国人,俄语
word.lx: This carpet is of Russian style./r/n 这块地毯是俄国风格的。/r/n Do you speak Russian?/r/n 你会说俄语吗？/r/n

word.name: rust
word.mean:
n. 锈
v. 生锈
vt. 生锈,使...生锈
word.lx: How can I remove the rust from the iron door?/r/n 我怎样才能把铁门上的锈除掉呢？/r/n The metal has corroded (away) because of rust./r/n 该金属已锈蚀./r/n

word.name: rustic
word.mean:
n. 乡下人,村夫,农民
a. 乡村的,纯朴的,手工粗糙的
word.lx: His rage was soon calmed down by the rustic peace./r/n 乡村的宁静很快就使他的怒气平静下来。/r/n His rustic speech and ways made him uncomfortable in the city school./r/n 他土里土气的语言和生活方式使他在城里的中学感到不舒服。/r/n

word.name: rusty
word.lx: My oral English is pretty rusty./r/n 我的英语口语全荒废了。/r/n The bottom of the boat was rusty./r/n 船底生锈了。/r/n

word.name: rut
word.lx: The lane was rutted with tyre tracks./r/n 这小巷有车胎轧出的凹痕./r/n My bike bumped over the ruts./r/n 我的自行车在凹凸不平的车辙道上颠颠簸簸./r/n

word.name: Ruth
word.lx: Ruth likes to show people up in public./r/n 露丝喜欢使别人当众出丑。/r/n Ruth is always truthful and anything she says will be accredited./r/n 露丝总是诚实的，所以她所说的任何话都会被人相信。/r/n

word.name: rye
word.lx: The poor man has only one rye bread to eat./r/n 这个可怜的人只有一只黑面包吃。/r/n Any of a class of simple proteins found in the seeds of wheat, rye, and other grains./r/n 醇溶谷蛋白在小麦，黑麦和其它谷类的种子中发现的简单蛋白类的一种/r/n

word.name: Sabbath
word.lx: A Christian should not break the Sabbath./r/n 基督徒应守安息日。/r/n That Sabbath day was a high day./r/n 那个安息日是一个宗教节日。/r/n

word.name: saber
word.mean:
n. 军刀
vt. 用马刀砍
word.lx: I use a heavy saber in fencing./r/n 我在击剑时用的是把重剑。/r/n

word.name: sable
word.mean:
n. 黑貂,黑貂皮,丧服
a. 黑貂皮的,黑的,昏暗的
word.lx: She wore her sable stole./r/n 她戴着带有貂皮的披肩/r/n Down the sable flood they glided./r/n 他们在黑黝黝的洪水中随波逐流。/r/n

word.name: sabotage
word.mean:
n. 怠工,破坏活动,破坏
v. 从事破坏活动,妨害,破坏

word.name: sabre
word.lx: I use a heavy sabre in fencing./r/n 我在击剑时用的是把重剑。/r/n

word.name: saccharine
word.mean:
n. <美>糖精
a. 糖质的, 含糖的

word.name: sack
word.mean:
n. 袋子
v. 解雇
word.lx: If you are late again the boss will give you the sack./r/n 如果你再迟到，老板就会把你解雇。/r/n There is a sack of potatoes at the corner of the room./r/n 屋子一角有一袋马铃薯。/r/n

word.name: sacrament
word.lx: She received the sacrament./r/n 她领了圣餐。/r/n The sacrament or rite of ordination./r/n 神职仪式神职的任命或神职任命仪式/r/n

word.name: sacred
word.lx: Nothing is sacred to these wild youths./r/n 这些狂野的年轻人什么都不尊重。/r/n This area was hallowed by sacred memories./r/n 这个地区由于宗教上的纪念意义而被视为圣地。/r/n

word.name: sacrifice
word.mean:
n. 牺牲,供俸,祭品
v. 牺牲,祭祀,贱卖

word.name: sacrilege
word.mean: n. 亵渎圣物,冒渎,悖理逆天的行为
word.lx: It is (a) sacrilege to steal a crucifix from an altar./r/n 从圣坛窃取耶稣受难像是亵渎神灵的行为./r/n Putting water in brandy is sacrilege./r/n 在白兰地中掺水是可恶的事。/r/n

word.name: sadden
word.lx: The bad news saddened us./r/n 那个坏消息使我们很难过。/r/n He was saddened at the memory of her death./r/n 他想到她已死去就很难过。/r/n

word.name: saddle
word.mean:
n. 鞍,车座,拖具
v. 装以马鞍,使负担,课以
word.lx: He saddled up his horse and rode away./r/n 他给马装上鞍子便骑马离去了。/r/n The boss saddled her with all the most difficult customers./r/n 老板把那些最难应付的顾客全推给她了。/r/n

word.name: sadistic
word.mean: a. 虐待性变态症的,残酷成性的

word.name: sadly
word.mean: ad. 悲痛地,悲惨地,悲伤地

word.name: sadness
word.lx: When their grandfather died a great sadness filled their lives./r/n 当他们的祖父去世时，巨大的悲伤笼罩了他们的生活。/r/n To know happness one must first experience sadness./r/n 只有经历过悲痛的人才能了解幸福的滋味。/r/n

word.name: safari
word.mean: n. 旅行,旅行队,奢侈的旅行
word.lx: A team of African bearers came with us on safari./r/n 有一队非洲脚夫和我们一起进行狩猎旅行./r/n A team of african bearer come with us on safari./r/n 有一队非洲脚夫和我们一起进行狩猎旅行。/r/n

word.name: safe
word.mean:
a. 安全的
n. 保险箱
word.lx: The train is a safe means of transportation./r/n 火车是一种安全的交通工具。/r/n The rescuers brought the climbers back safe and sound./r/n 救援人员把登山的人都平安地救了回来。/r/n

word.name: safeguard
word.mean:
n. 保卫,保护措施或条款
v. 保卫,保护
word.lx: We will introduce legal safeguards against fraud./r/n 我们要采取法律保护措施，制止诈骗活动。/r/n We make copies of our computer disks as a safeguard against accidents./r/n 我们复制了计算机磁盘以防意外。/r/n

word.name: safely
word.lx: My trusty old car will get us home safely./r/n 我那辆可靠的旧车会把我们安全地送回家的。/r/n The pilot landed the plane safely./r/n 驾驶员使飞机安全降落。/r/n

word.name: safety belt
word.lx: She refused to sit in the car till her husband promised to wear his safety belt./r/n 她拒绝上车, 除非她丈夫答应系好安全带。/r/n Thanks to I had tied then the safety belt./r/n 幸亏我当时系上了安全带。/r/n

word.name: saffron
word.mean:
a. 橘黄色的
n. 藏红花粉(用作染料或调味香料),橙黄色
word.lx: Saffron is very bright yellow./r/n 金黄色是很亮的黄色。/r/n

word.name: saga
word.mean: n. 传说,英雄事迹,冒险故事
word.lx: This new novel is an absorbing family saga./r/n 这部新小说是一部引人入胜的家世小说。/r/n The novelist had issued many saga novels./r/n 那个小说家已经发表了很多长篇小说。/r/n

word.name: sagacious
word.lx: The leader made a sagacious decision./r/n 领导做了英明的决定。/r/n He is a sagacious person./r/n 他是个精明的人。/r/n

word.name: sagacity
word.lx: Sagacity, unlike cleverness, may increase with age./r/n 睿智与机灵不同，前者可随着年龄增加。/r/n The judge has excellent sagacity./r/n 那个法官有敏锐的洞察力。/r/n
