word.name: sage
word.mean:
n. 圣人,哲人
a. 贤明的,明智的
word.lx: What a sage reply you gave!/r/n 多聪明的回答啊！/r/n Confucius is considered the greatest of the ancient Chinese sages./r/n 孔子被认为是中国古代最伟大的圣贤。/r/n

word.name: said
word.mean:
v. 说,讲
vbl. 说,讲
word.lx: Easier said than done./r/n 说来容易做来难.(谚语)/r/n You said it./r/n 你算说对了。/r/n

word.name: sail
word.lx: Can you sail a boat?/r/n 你会驾驶船只吗？/r/n This ship sails for New York on Monday./r/n 这船将于星期一开往纽约。/r/n

word.name: sailboat
word.lx: The sailboat canted over in the storm./r/n 帆船在暴风雨中倾覆了。/r/n Our sailboat turned turtle during the squall./r/n 在风暴中我们的帆船翻了个底朝天/r/n

word.name: sailing
word.lx: The soldier are sailing for old Blighty tomorrow./r/n 士兵明日将启航返英国本土。/r/n I felt comfortable sailing on the smoothness of the sea./r/n 在平静的海面上航行我感到很舒服。/r/n

word.name: sailor
word.lx: The sailors are asked to take their positions by their captain./r/n 船长要求水手们各就各位。/r/n The sailor shook out a sail./r/n 海员扬起一面帆。/r/n

word.name: saint
word.lx: Joan of Arc was made a saint in 1920./r/n 1920年，贞德被追封为圣女。/r/n You need the patience of a saint for this job./r/n 做这种工作，你得有圣人般的好耐性。/r/n

word.name: salable
word.mean: a. 适于销售的,价格适当的,畅销的

word.name: salad
word.lx: Would you like some fruit salad?/r/n 要水果色拉吗？/r/n This salad is made of apple, pear, potato and celery./r/n 这份色拉是由苹果、梨、土豆和芹菜做成的。/r/n

word.name: salaried
word.mean: a. 拿薪水的,领工资的
word.lx: The company had250 salaried staffs./r/n 公司有250名拿工资的职员。/r/n Are you a wage-earner or salaried?/r/n 你是工人还是职员？/r/n

word.name: sale
word.lx: The law forbids the sale of alcohol to people under 18./r/n 法律禁止向18岁以下的人出售含有酒精的饮料。/r/n The latest model of this washer is now on sale in your shops./r/n 这种最新型号的洗衣机目前正在你们的商店中出售。/r/n

word.name: sales
word.mean: a. 销售的，有关销售的

word.name: salesgirl
word.lx: The salesgirl asked me if I had the exact sum, since the shop had no change./r/n 女售货员问我有没有正好的钱，因为商店没有零钱。/r/n The customer was angry with the salesgirl for her impolite answer./r/n 那位顾客对女店员不客气的回答感到忿怒。/r/n

word.name: salesman
word.lx: The salesman tried to persuade her to buy his goods./r/n 那个推销员试图说服她买他的东西。/r/n The salesman had already wrapped up a couple of deals by lunch-time./r/n 那个售货员在午饭前已经做完了几笔生意./r/n

word.name: salespeople
word.lx: Salespeople visiting their accounts./r/n 推销员拜访了他们的客户/r/n

word.name: salesperson
word.lx: The plausible talk of a crafty salesperson./r/n 诡计多端的推销员的花言巧语/r/n A salesperson courting a potential customer./r/n 一位正在说服有可能与之成交的顾客的推销员/r/n

word.name: salient
word.mean:
a. 突出的,显著的
n. 突出部分
word.lx: The salient point of his plan is summed up in this report./r/n 他的计划的要点在这个报告中酌此概括。/r/n

word.name: saline
word.lx: The nurse diluted the drug with saline water./r/n 护士用生理盐水把药加以稀释。/r/n A plant that grows in saline soil./r/n 盐生植物一种生长在盐分土壤上的植物/r/n

word.name: Salisbury
word.mean: 索尔兹伯里(津巴布韦[原罗得西亚]首都)
word.lx: James ordered a Salisbury steak for lunch./r/n 詹姆士叫了一客混有蛋、牛乳、面包粉的合成牛肉饼。/r/n

word.name: saliva
word.lx: Saliva helps one chew and digest food./r/n 唾液能帮助咀嚼和消化食物。/r/n Saliva is secretion of the salivary glands./r/n 唾液是唾液腺的分泌物。/r/n

word.name: salivary
word.lx: Saliva is secretion of the salivary glands./r/n 唾液是唾液腺的分泌物。/r/n

word.name: salivary gland
word.lx: Saliva is secretion of the salivary glands./r/n 唾液是唾液腺的分泌物。/r/n

word.name: sallow
word.mean:
a. 淡黄色的,苍白的,气色不好的
v. 使成苍白色
n. 柳属植物,此种植物的树枝
word.lx: She is ill with a sallow face./r/n 她病了，面色发黄。/r/n

word.name: Sally
word.mean: vi.&n. 出击,突围,萨莉(人名)
word.lx: The soldiers made a successful sally./r/n 士兵们进行了一次成功的突围。/r/n Sally and Michael seem to be cut out for each other./r/n 萨莉和迈克尔看起来很相配./r/n

word.name: salmon
word.mean:
a. 橙红色的
n. 鲑,大马哈鱼
word.lx: He planed to go fishing for salmon on Sunday./r/n 他计划星期天去钓鲑鱼。/r/n We dined on smoked salmon./r/n 我们晚餐吃的是熏鲑鱼./r/n

word.name: salmonella
word.lx: Five people are taken to hospital with Salmonella poisoning./r/n 有五个人由于得了沙门氏菌中毒症而被送进了医院。/r/n

word.name: salon
word.mean: n. 大会客室(美术展览馆)
word.lx: Be there a beauty salon?/r/n 旅馆内有美容院吗？/r/n

word.name: saloon
word.lx: The first drink Thursday was on the house in the leading saloon./r/n 一些有名气的酒吧，星期四的头一杯酒从前是免费的。/r/n The company is introducing a new family saloon this year./r/n 公司准备今年推出一种新型家庭轿车。/r/n

word.name: salt
word.mean:
n. 盐,刺激
a. 含盐的,辛辣的
v. 加盐于,用盐腌
abbr. =Strategic Arms Limitation Talks 限制战略武器会谈
word.lx: They salted down most of the meat for their later use./r/n 他们将大部分肉用盐腌起来，以备日后用。/r/n The vegetables need more salt./r/n 这些蔬菜需要加些盐。/r/n

word.name: salutary
word.mean: a. 有益的,有用的,有益健康的
word.lx: The accident is a salutary reminder of the danger of climbing./r/n 这一事故有益的一面是提醒了我们攀登活动是有许多危险的。/r/n

word.name: salutation
word.lx: He raised his hat in salutation./r/n 他举起帽子致意。/r/n We usually begin a letter with a salutation./r/n 我们通常用称呼作为一封信的开头。/r/n

word.name: salute
word.lx: They saluted each other by raising their hats./r/n 他们举起帽子互相致意。/r/n They saluted the Queen by firing ten guns./r/n 他们鸣礼炮十响向女王致敬。/r/n

word.name: salvage
word.mean:
n. 救捞(抢修,废物利用,废弃品,救难费)
vt 救捞(抢修,废物利用)
word.lx: The government tried to salvage several business companies from bankruptcy./r/n 政府设法把这几个商业公司从破产境地中拯救出来。/r/n Salvage of the wreck is made difficult by bad weather./r/n 船遇难後因天气恶劣救援工作十分困难。/r/n

word.name: salve
word.mean:
n. 药膏
v. 涂油膏
word.lx: She paid the repair bill as a salve to her conscience./r/n 她付了维修费以减轻内疚感。/r/n This kind of salve is used on wounds./r/n 这种药膏是用在伤口处。/r/n

word.name: salvo
word.mean:
n. 礼炮齐鸣，枪弹齐射； 齐声喝彩
n. 精神上的有所保留状态； 安慰良心不安或情感受伤之物、挽留面子或保护名誉之物、缓和物
v. 齐射、齐发

word.name: Sam
word.lx: Thanks, Sam, bye./r/n 谢谢，山姆，再见。/r/n Sam, what are you doing?/r/n 山姆，你要干吗？/r/n

word.name: samba
word.mean: n. 桑巴舞(一种源自非洲的巴西交谊舞)
word.lx: A dance similar to the samba./r/n 卡里奥克舞一种类似桑巴舞的舞蹈/r/n

word.name: same
word.mean:
a. 同样的
ad. 同样地
pron. 同样的人或事
word.lx: Father sits in the same chair every evening./r/n 父亲每晚都坐在同一张椅子上，/r/n Twins look the same as each other./r/n 双胞胎看上去长得一样。/r/n

word.name: sameness
word.lx: The tedious sameness of winter days indoors/r/n 冬天室内那种漫长而又单调乏味的生活。/r/n Sameness or dull repetition in sound, style, manner, or color./r/n 单调声音、文体、风格和色彩的同样性或单调的重复/r/n

word.name: sample
word.mean:
n. 样品,标本
v. 抽取样品
word.lx: The nurse took a sample of my blood for tests./r/n 护士抽了我的血样去化验。/r/n We sampled the stuff and found it satisfactory./r/n 我们抽验了这批材料，认为满意。/r/n

word.name: sampler
word.mean: n. 样板(取样器,样品检查员)

word.name: sampling
word.mean:
n. 抽样(脉冲调制,连续选择)
a. 抽样的(脉冲调制的,连续选择的)

word.name: San Diego
word.lx: The Powell structural research lab at the university of California at San Diego tests new bridge materials such as carbon and fiberglass polymers./r/n 位于圣地亚哥的加州大学鲍威尔建筑实验室试制出了新的桥梁建筑材料，如碳和玻璃纤维聚合体。/r/n

word.name: San Francisco
word.mean: n. 旧金山(美国加利福尼亚西部港市)

word.name: sanctify
word.mean: v. 使神圣,奉献给神,使成为神圣之物
word.lx: This is sanctified ground, and we may not tread upon it./r/n 这是圣地，我们不可践踏。/r/n God blessed the seventh day and sanctified it./r/n 上帝祝福第七天并且使它成为神圣的日子。/r/n

word.name: sanction
word.mean:
n. 核准,处罚,约束力
v. 制定制裁规则,认许,核准
word.lx: The minister can only act in this matter with the sanction of Parliament./r/n 部长只有得到国会批准才能就此事采取行动。/r/n Western nations imposed tough sanctions on the country./r/n 西方各国对这个国家实行了严厉制裁。/r/n

word.name: sanctity
word.lx: She gives us a living example of sanctity./r/n 她给我们树立了一个圣洁的活榜样。/r/n We should respect the sanctity of marriage./r/n 我们应该尊重婚姻的神圣。/r/n

word.name: sanctuary
word.mean: n. 圣所,耶路撒冷的神殿,至圣所

word.name: sanctum
word.lx: I was allowed once into his inner sanctum./r/n 我有一次获准进入他的内室./r/n

word.name: sand
word.mean:
n. 砂,沙滩
v. 撒沙,以沙掩盖
word.lx: His company was built on the sand./r/n 他的公司根基不稳固。/r/n The roads were sanded after the snowstorm./r/n 道路在暴风雪之后铺上了沙子。/r/n

word.name: sandal
word.lx: She wears sandals every day in summer./r/n 夏天她每天都穿凉鞋。/r/n

word.name: sands
word.lx: The sands are running out: we must have the money by tomorrow./r/n 剩下的时间不多了: 我们明天得弄到这笔钱./r/n The wind blew from the desert and covered everything with sand./r/n 沙漠那边吹来的风把所有的东西都蒙上了一层沙子./r/n

word.name: sandstone
word.lx: Sandstone cuts easily./r/n 砂岩容易切割./r/n

word.name: sandstorm
word.lx: A sandstorm kicked up while we drove through the desert./r/n 我们在沙漠里行驶时，沙暴加强了/r/n

word.name: sandwich
word.mean:
n. 三明治
v. 插入,夹入
word.lx: He made a ham sandwich./r/n 他做了一个火腿三明治。/r/n He was sandwiched between two fat women./r/n 他被夹在两个胖女人中间。/r/n

word.name: sandy
word.mean: a. 沙的,沙地的,多沙的
word.lx: Most of the shore is rocky, but there is a sandy beach./r/n 沿海大部分为岩石，但也有一部分沙滩。/r/n I prefer a sandy beach to a shingle one./r/n 我喜欢沙滩，不喜欢遍布小石子的海滩./r/n

word.name: sang
word.mean: v. sing的过去式,唱,唱歌,鸣唱
word.lx: The soldiers sang a song of victory, describing their prowess in battle./r/n 战士们唱起了歌颂他们英勇战斗的凯歌。/r/n She sang an incomparable song./r/n 她唱了一首无与伦比的歌。/r/n

word.name: sanguinary
word.mean: a. 流血的,血腥的,嗜血的

word.name: sanguine
word.mean:
a. 乐天的,自信的
n. 血红色
word.lx: He is not very sanguine about our chances of success./r/n 他对我们成功的机会不太乐观。/r/n We are sanguine that we shall be succeeding./r/n 我们自信会成功。/r/n

word.name: sanitation
word.mean: n. 环境卫生(卫生设备,下水道设备)
word.lx: The people lived in that city can keep sanitation clean./r/n 住在那个城市的人们能保持公共卫生的清洁。/r/n

word.name: sanity
word.mean: n. 神智健全,头脑清楚,健全
word.lx: His strange remarks planted doubts in our minds about his sanity./r/n 他那些怪话使我们心中生疑，不知他精神是否正常。/r/n

word.name: sank
word.lx: The ship sank 10 miles out of Stockholm./r/n 船在离斯德哥尔摩10英里处沉没了./r/n The ship sank beneath the waves./r/n 轮船沉没于波涛下面。/r/n

word.name: sapience
word.mean: n. 煞像有学识,装聪明,智慧

word.name: sapient
word.mean: a. 装聪明样的,聪明的,伶俐的

word.name: Sapporo
word.mean: 札幌（日本北海道西部城市）
word.lx: At what time shall we arrive at sapporo if we take this plane./r/n 如果我们坐这架飞机，我们将在几点到达札幌。/r/n

word.name: Sara
word.lx: Judy goes to the movies as often as Sara does./r/n 朱迪像莎拉一样时常去看电影。/r/n Sara was excited to see the rock band./r/n 莎拉看到摇滚乐团很兴奋。/r/n

word.name: sarcastic
word.lx: She talked with him with sarcastic tones./r/n 她用挖苦的语调和他说话。/r/n He could feel their sarcastic tone about his poor work./r/n 他能感觉到他们对他拙劣作品的讽刺语调。/r/n

word.name: sardine
word.lx: The ten of us were squashed together like sardines in the tin./r/n 我们十几个人像沙丁鱼罐头一样挤成一团。/r/n The ten of us were squashed together like sardines in the lift./r/n 我们十个人在电梯里拥成一团./r/n

word.name: sardonic
word.mean: a. 嘲笑的,冷笑的,讥讽的

word.name: Sargasso Sea
word.mean: 马尾藻海(在西印度群岛东北)

word.name: sartorial
word.mean: a. 裁缝匠的,缝工的,裁缝的

word.name: sash
word.mean:
n. 饰带,肩带,腰带
v. 装以窗框
word.lx: Our windows have double-pane sashes./r/n 我们的窗户有双层的玻璃窗框。/r/n The officer wears sashes on his shoulders./r/n 这名军官的肩上佩戴着肩带。/r/n

word.name: sat
word.mean:
v. sit的过去式,过去分词,坐
vbl. 坐
word.lx: She sat gazing out of the window./r/n 她坐着凝视着窗外。/r/n We sat on the chairs chatting in his living room./r/n 我们坐在他起居室的椅子上聊天。/r/n

word.name: satanic
word.mean: a. 恶魔的, 魔鬼的

word.name: satellite
word.lx: They have launched a man-made satellite successfully./r/n 他们成功地发射了一颗人造卫星。/r/n Television stations around the world are linked by satellite./r/n 全世界的电视台通过卫星联系一起。/r/n

word.name: satiate
word.mean:
v. 使饱足,生腻
vt. 使过饱
word.lx: She pushed her chair back from the table, satiated./r/n 她把椅子从餐桌向后挪了挪，再也吃不下了。/r/n He was satiated with pleasure./r/n 他厌倦了享乐。/r/n

word.name: satin
word.mean:
a. 缎子做(的)
n. 缎子
word.lx: The little girl wore satin ribbons in her hair./r/n 小女孩在头发上戴了缎带。/r/n The satin feels smooth./r/n 这缎子摸起来很滑溜。/r/n

word.name: satirist
word.mean: n. 讽刺诗作者,讽刺家,爱挖苦别人的人
word.lx: Roman satirist whose works denounced the corruption and extravagance of the privileged classes in Rome./r/n 尤维纳利斯古罗马讽刺作家，其作品谴责了古罗马特权阶级的腐化和奢侈/r/n

word.name: satirize
word.lx: Politicians are often satirized on TV and radio./r/n 政客常遭到电视与无线电广播的讥讽./r/n

word.name: satisfaction
word.lx: The store owner received satisfaction for the damage./r/n 店主收到了对损坏的赔偿。/r/n She felt satisfaction at having her ability recognized./r/n 她因自己的才能得到赏识而满足。/r/n

word.name: satisfactory
word.lx: The answer was not quite satisfactory to him./r/n 这项答复未能使他完全满意。/r/n Everything was turning out most satisfactory./r/n 一切都非常趁心如意。/r/n

word.name: satisfied
word.mean:
a. 感到满意的
vbl. 使...满意
word.lx: The quiet contentment of a well-fed child satisfied the tired mother./r/n 孩子喂饱后不哭不闹的满足状使疲惫的母亲很满意。/r/n We are satisfied with the smoothness of the negotiation./r/n 我们对谈判的顺利进行很满意。/r/n

word.name: satisfy
word.lx: Just to satisfy my curiosity, how much did you pay for your car?/r/n 我只是出于好奇，请问你买这辆车花了多少钱？/r/n Some people are very hard to satisfy./r/n 有些人是很难使其满意的。/r/n

word.name: satisfying
word.mean: a. 满意的,充份的,足可相信的
word.lx: That is a satisfying book./r/n 那是一本令人满意的书。/r/n Let me reassure you( that) your service is quite satisfying./r/n 让我向您保证，您的服务是很令人满意的。/r/n

word.name: saturate
word.mean:
v. 使渗透,浸,使饱和
a. 浸透的,饱度高的,深颜色的
word.lx: We lay on the beach, saturated in sunshine./r/n 我们躺在沙滩上, 沐浴在阳光里./r/n

word.name: saturated
word.mean: a. 饱和的,渗透的,深颜色的
word.lx: We lay on the beach, saturated in sunshine./r/n 我们躺在沙滩上, 沐浴在阳光里./r/n The Water has been saturated with a special chemical./r/n 水已被一种特殊化合物质吸收了。/r/n

word.name: saturation
word.mean: n. 饱和(浸透,磁性饱和,色度学章度)

word.name: Saturday
word.lx: She goes swimming on Saturdays./r/n 她每个星期六都游泳。/r/n We will go to the cinema on Saturday morning./r/n 我们将于星期六早晨去看电影。/r/n

word.name: Saturn
word.lx: Saturn is the planet sixth in order from the sun./r/n 土星是依次离太阳的第六颗行星。/r/n Saturn has several moons./r/n 土星有好几颗卫星。/r/n

word.name: Saturnian
word.mean: a. 农神的, 土星的

word.name: saturnine
word.mean: a. 沉默寡言的,忧沉的,感染铅毒的

word.name: satyr
word.mean: n. (希腊及罗马神话)半人半兽的森林之神, 好色之徒, 性欲极强的男人
word.lx: A satyr is half man and half goat in Greek and Roman mythology./r/n 在希腊和罗马神话中，森林之神是半人半羊的样子。/r/n

word.name: sauce
word.lx: Hunger is the best sauce./r/n 饥不择食。/r/n What sauces go best with fish?/r/n 吃鱼用什么沙司最好？/r/n

word.name: saucer
word.lx: He put the cup on the saucer./r/n 他把茶杯放在茶托上。/r/n The tea slopped (over) into the saucer./r/n 茶溢出流到茶托里了./r/n

word.name: saucy
word.mean: a. 傲慢的,莽撞的,活泼的
word.lx: His daughter is a saucy tomboy./r/n 他女儿是一个调皮的假小子。/r/n You saucy little jade!/r/n 你这个糟女人!/r/n

word.name: Saudi
word.mean:
a. 沙特阿拉伯(人或语)的
n. 沙特阿拉伯人
word.lx: A unit of currency in Saudi Arabia./r/n 库什沙特阿拉伯的一种货币单位/r/n A coin of Saudi Arabia worth!/100 of a riyal./r/n 哈拉拉一种沙特阿拉伯硬币，合！／100里亚尔/r/n

word.name: Saudi Arabia
word.lx: A unit of currency in Saudi Arabia./r/n 库什沙特阿拉伯的一种货币单位/r/n A coin of Saudi Arabia worth!/100 of a riyal./r/n 哈拉拉一种沙特阿拉伯硬币，合！／100里亚尔/r/n

word.name: saunter
word.mean:
v. 闲逛,漫步
n. 闲逛,漫步

word.name: savage
word.mean: 野性的；凶猛的；粗鲁的；荒野的；

word.name: savagely
word.mean: ad. 野蛮地, 残酷地
word.lx: For several days, they savagely suppressed the demonstrations./r/n 有好几天，他们野蛮地镇压示威游行。/r/n The master tied me to a pillar and whipped me savagely./r/n 主人把我捆在柱子上，用鞭子死命地抽我。/r/n

word.name: save
word.mean:
n. 救援,救球,节约
v. 解救,保存,节省
prep. 除...之外
word.lx: The doctor managed to save his life./r/n 医生救了他的命。/r/n Children should learn to save./r/n 孩子们应学会储蓄。/r/n

word.name: saver
word.lx: Good news for all savers a rise in interest rates!/r/n 储蓄者的好消息－－利率提高了。/r/n

word.name: savings
word.lx: The old man kept his savings in the bank./r/n 老人把他的储蓄存在银行里。/r/n My savings amount to $2000./r/n 我的储蓄共达2000美元。/r/n

word.name: savings account
word.lx: My savings account is low./r/n 我的存款几乎用完了/r/n My savings account draws5 per cent interest./r/n 我的储蓄存款有五厘利息。/r/n

word.name: savior
word.mean: n. 救助者,救世主,救主
word.lx: To Christians, Jesus Christ is the Savior./r/n 对基督徒来说，主耶稣是他们的救世主。/r/n Jesus Christ is styled the Savior./r/n 耶稣基督被称为救世主。/r/n

word.name: saviour
word.lx: To Christians, Jesus Christ is the Saviour./r/n 对基督徒来说，主耶稣是他们的救世主。/r/n

word.name: savor
word.mean:
n. 滋味, 气味, 食欲, 特定的味道或气味, 一种有特色的性质
vi. 有...的滋味, 有...气味
vt. 加调味品于, 使有风味, 尝到或闻到, 尽情享受
word.lx: He drank the wine slowly, savoring every drop./r/n 他慢慢地喝着酒，细细品尝着每滴酒的滋味。/r/n Life seems to have lost most of its savor for him./r/n 对他来说，生活似乎已失去了一切乐趣。/r/n

word.name: savour
word.mean:
n. 味道(滋味)
vt 具有...味道(具有...性质)
word.lx: Life seems to have lost most of its savour for him./r/n 对他来说，生活似乎已失去了一切乐趣。/r/n He drank the wine slowly, savouring every drop./r/n 他慢慢地喝着酒，细细品尝着每滴酒的滋味。/r/n

word.name: saw
word.mean:
n. 锯子
v. see的过去式,看见,了解,会面
word.lx: May I borrow your saw?/r/n 我可以借你的锯子吗？/r/n They are sawing a log into planks./r/n 他们把原木锯成一块块厚板。/r/n

word.name: sawdust
word.lx: The loveliest doll in the last analysis is merely sawdust./r/n 说到底，最可爱的布娃娃也只不过是锯末做成的。/r/n A thin mattress filled with straw or sawdust./r/n 木屑床垫填满草杆或木屑的一床薄垫子/r/n

word.name: sawmill
word.lx: There are many sawyers in that sawmill./r/n 那家锯木厂有很多锯木工。/r/n

word.name: Saxon
word.lx: The Saxon once settled in England in early times./r/n 撒克逊人早期曾定居英格兰。/r/n

word.name: saying
word.mean:
n. 叙述,话,说
vbl. 说,说话
word.lx: More haste, less speed", as the saying goes./r/n 常言道，“欲速则不达”。/r/n

word.name: sb
word.mean: n. 检修报告(边带,联播,编包线,固体)
word.lx: I thought I heard sb calling./r/n 我好像听见有人喊叫./r/n We must appoint sb to act as secretary./r/n 我们得指定一个人当秘书./r/n

word.name: scab
word.mean: n. 创口中所结的疤,痂

word.name: scabbard
word.lx: He made a very beautiful scabbard for his knife./r/n 他为他的刀做了一个漂亮的鞘。/r/n The scabbard is content to be dull when it protects the keenness of the sword./r/n 刀鞘保护刀的锋利，它自己则满足于它的迟钝。/r/n

word.name: scabrous
word.lx: Her scabrous novels shocked the public./r/n 她的小说淫秽不堪, 公众十分震惊./r/n

word.name: scaffold
word.mean: n. 鹰架,绞刑台,脚手架
word.lx: The worker fell down from the scaffold./r/n 那个工人从脚手架掉了下来。/r/n The brick-layer at the top of the scaffold is calling for more mortar./r/n 脚手架顶上的砌砖工人喊着要人再送些灰浆上去。/r/n

word.name: scald
word.mean:
n. 烫(烫伤,用沸水烫,用蒸汽烫)
vt 烫(烫伤,用沸水烫,用蒸汽烫)
word.lx: She was scalded when the boiler exploded./r/n 锅炉爆炸时她被烫伤了。/r/n This is an ointment for burns and scalds./r/n 这是治疗烧伤和烫伤的药膏。/r/n

word.name: scale
word.mean:
n. 鳞,刻度,衡量,数值范围
v. 依比例决定,攀登
word.lx: Scale the fish before cooking them./r/n 烧鱼之前先去掉鱼鳞。/r/n We are seeing unemployment on an unprecedented scale./r/n 我们现在正经历规模空前的失业现象。/r/n

word.name: scaling
word.lx: The act of scaling a fortified wall or rampart./r/n 攀登，爬云梯攀登设防的高墙或城垣的行为/r/n The paint is scaling off./r/n 油漆正在脱落。/r/n

word.name: scallop
word.mean:
n. 扇贝壳
v. 拾扇贝
word.lx: Some people like to eat scallop./r/n 有些人喜欢吃干贝。/r/n She wears a dress with scallops around the neck./r/n 她穿着一件领口有扇形皱褶的衣裙。 /r/n

word.name: scalpel
word.mean: n. 外科手术刀,解剖刀
word.lx: The doctor finished the operation, but his success depended on the backroom boys who had invented the new laser scalpel./r/n 医生做完了手术，但他的成功有赖于那些发明了新型激光手术刀的研究人员。/r/n

word.name: scaly
word.lx: A congenital, often hereditary skin disease characterized by dry, thickened, scaly skin./r/n 鳞癣，干皮病一种先天的，经常是遗传性的皮肤病，表现为皮肤干燥、变厚并出现鳞状屑片/r/n

word.name: scamper
word.mean:
n. 蹦跳
v. 奔跑,快跑
vi. 涉猎,浏览
word.lx: Giggling, the children scampered back into the house./r/n 孩子们咯咯笑着，蹦蹦跳跳地跑回屋里。/r/n The children were scampering around the garden./r/n 孩子们在花园里嬉戏奔跑。/r/n

word.name: scan
word.mean:
n. 扫描,押韵,细查
v. 扫描,详细调查,分析韵律
word.lx: The radar scanned the sky for enemy planes./r/n 雷达密切监视天空，搜索敌机。/r/n I scanned the newspaper when I was waiting for the bus./r/n 等公共汽车的时候，我匆匆浏览了一下报纸。/r/n

word.name: scandalous
word.mean: a. 不体面的,可耻的,可恶的
word.lx: We are surprised by his scandalous behaviour./r/n 我们很震惊他那令人反感的举止。/r/n The book contains scandalous text./r/n 该书含有诽谤性的内容。/r/n

word.name: Scandinavia
word.lx: Scandinavia refers to Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Iceland./r/n 斯堪的那维亚是指丹麦、挪威、瑞典和冰岛。/r/n The people of Scandinavia; the Scandinavians./r/n 斯堪的纳维亚民族；斯堪的纳维亚人/r/n

word.name: scanner
word.mean: n. 扫描机,扫描盘,光电子扫描装置

word.name: scanty
word.mean: a. 缺乏的,仅有的,不够的
word.lx: He is scanty with words./r/n 他沉默寡言。/r/n The beggar shivered in his scanty clothes./r/n 乞丐穿着单薄，冻得发抖。/r/n

word.name: scapegoat
word.mean: n. 替罪的羔羊,替人顶罪者,替身
word.lx: The accused was used as a scapegoat./r/n 被告成为别人的替罪羊。/r/n The old curmudgeon found a new scapegoat and that let me out./r/n 那个老守财奴找到一个新的替罪羊，这样我就脱身了。/r/n

word.name: scar
word.mean:
n. 疤痕,伤痕,断崖
v. 结疤,使...有伤痕,痊愈
word.lx: The wound gradually scarred over./r/n 伤口渐渐愈合。/r/n He had a scar on his arm from an accident./r/n 他的手臂上因为事故留下了一个伤疤。/r/n

word.name: scarce
word.mean: a. 缺乏的,不足的,稀少的,罕见的
word.lx: Good fruit is scarce in winter and costs a lot./r/n 好的水果冬天难得见到，而且价格昂贵。/r/n I could scarce believe my eyes./r/n 我几乎不敢相信自己的眼睛。/r/n

word.name: scarcely
word.mean: ad. 几乎不,简直没有,勉强
word.lx: Scarcely had he arrived when he had to leave again./r/n 他刚刚到达就不得不又离开。/r/n He spoke scarcely a word of English./r/n 他几乎连一个英文单词都不会说。/r/n

word.name: scarcity
word.lx: The scarcity of food forced prices up./r/n 食物短缺促使物价上涨。/r/n The factory is in frequent scarcity of raw materials./r/n 这个工厂经常原料不足。/r/n

word.name: scare
word.mean:
vt. 惊吓(惊恐,惊慌)
n. 惊吓(惊恐,惊慌)
word.lx: The child was scared of the fierce looking dog./r/n 这孩子害怕那条外表凶恶的狗。/r/n You did give me a scare./r/n 你真吓了我一跳。/r/n

word.name: scared
word.lx: The child was scared of the fierce looking dog./r/n 这孩子害怕那条外表凶恶的狗。/r/n The dog scared the thief away./r/n 狗把小偷吓走了。/r/n

word.name: scarf
word.lx: She wore a woolen scarf around her neck./r/n 她脖子上戴了一条羊毛围巾。/r/n She threw a scarf over her shoulders./r/n 她在肩上披上一块肩巾。/r/n

word.name: scarlet
word.mean:
n. 深红色,斐红色,红衣
a. 肥斐色的,深红色的
word.lx: Scarlet is much lighter than crimson./r/n 绯红色比深红色亮丽得多。/r/n The girl planted some scarlet sage in her garden./r/n 女孩在她的花园里种了些一串红。/r/n

word.name: scarlet fever
word.lx: Scarlet fever is highly contagious./r/n 猩红热传染性很强。/r/n James was quarantined for three weeks when he had scarlet fever./r/n 詹姆士患猩红热后被隔离了三个星期。/r/n

word.name: scars
word.lx: The boat has scars from hitting the reefs./r/n 船只因撞在暗礁上而留下了疤痕。/r/n The scars on his body lent colour to his claim that he had been tortured./r/n 他说他受过折磨拷打, 从他身上的伤疤看来倒也可信./r/n

word.name: scathe
word.mean:
n. 危害,损伤,损害
v. 损伤,伤害

word.name: scathing
word.lx: The report is scathing about the lack of safety precaution./r/n 该报道对缺乏安全预防措施一事严加指责。/r/n The scathing editorial simply boils down to an exercise in partisan politics./r/n 措词强烈的社论可以简单地归结为政党政治的纲领/r/n

word.name: scatter
word.mean:
n. 散播之物,散布
v. 散开,散布,散播
word.lx: The farmers were scattering seed on the fields./r/n 农夫把种子撒在田里。/r/n The birds scattered at the sound of the gun./r/n 鸟群一听到枪声就四处飞散了。/r/n

word.name: scatterbrain
word.mean: n. 注意力不集中的人

word.name: scattered
word.lx: Scattered showers are expected this afternoon./r/n 预料今天下午有零星阵雨。/r/n Tartar hordes scattered on the plain./r/n 鞑靼人的游牧部落散布在这片平原上。/r/n

word.name: scavenge
word.mean: v. 打扫,排除废气,到处觅食

word.name: scavenger
word.mean: n. 清除剂(清道工,选池,基接受体)

word.name: scene
word.lx: And now the scene shifts to the warehouse, where the murderer is lying in wait./r/n 现在场景转到仓库，行凶者正埋伏在那里伺机行动。/r/n Our reporter was the first person on the scene./r/n 我们的记者是最先到达出事地点的。/r/n

word.name: scenery
word.lx: We passed through some beautiful scenery on our journey through this district./r/n 我们在穿越这个地区的旅途中，看到了不少美丽的景色。/r/n The scenery was beautiful beyond expression./r/n 那风景美丽得无法形容。/r/n

word.name: scenic
word.mean: a. 风景好的,戏剧性的
word.lx: The scenic splendors of the Rocky Mountains are overwhelming./r/n 落基山脉的壮丽景色使人赞叹不已。/r/n There is a scenic route across the Alps./r/n 穿越阿尔卑斯山有一条风景优美的路径。/r/n

word.name: scent
word.mean:
n. 气味,香味,痕迹
v. 闻出,循著遗臭追踪,发觉
word.lx: The police are on the scent of the thieves./r/n 警察发现了小偷的线索。/r/n There is a lavender scent and rosemary scent in the air./r/n 空气中有熏衣草和迷迭香花的味道。/r/n

word.name: scepter
word.mean: n. 君主节杖v. 拥登王位,授与王权

word.name: sceptic
word.mean: n. 怀疑(论)者,多疑的人
word.lx: The government must still convince the sceptics that its policy will work./r/n 政府仍须使持怀疑态度的人相信其政策可行./r/n The government must still convince the sceptic that its policy will work./r/n 政府仍须使持怀疑态度的人相信其政策可行。/r/n

word.name: sceptre
word.lx: Sceptres are carried by kings as a sign of power./r/n 国王所持的权杖是权力的象征。/r/n The sceptre is an attribute of kingly power./r/n 节杖是国王权力的象徵./r/n

word.name: scheduled
word.mean:
a. 预定的
v. 预定,编制目录
vbl. 预定,编制目录
word.lx: The train is due (in) (ie scheduled to arrive) in five minutes./r/n 火车预定在5分钟後到达./r/n The building is scheduled for completion in May./r/n 该大楼预定或计划于5月份完工。/r/n

word.name: scheme
word.mean:
n. 方案,计划,阴谋
v. 计画,设计,体系，结构,图谋
word.lx: He examined the wiring scheme carefully./r/n 他仔细检查线路图。/r/n She saw the possibilities of the scheme from the beginning./r/n 她从一开始就预见到这计画可能成功。/r/n

word.name: scheming
word.lx: A scheming person./r/n 诡计多端者/r/n The committee decided to make a withdrawal of financial support for his scheme./r/n 委员会决定取消对他那项计划的资助。/r/n

word.name: schism
word.mean: n. 分裂,分立,宗派分立罪
word.lx: A person claiming to be or elected pope in opposition to the one chosen by church law, as during a schism./r/n 伪教皇在教会分立中宣称教皇或被选为教皇的人，与教会律法选出的教皇对立/r/n

word.name: scholar
word.lx: He ranks high as a scholar./r/n 他是第一流的学者。/r/n We all listened to the venerable scholar with awe./r/n 我们都怀着敬畏之心倾听着这位德高望重的学者的讲话。/r/n

word.name: scholarly
word.mean: a. 学究气的(学者派头的)

word.name: scholarship
word.lx: He won a scholarship to Cambridge./r/n 他获得一份到剑桥大学读书的奖学金。/r/n The teacher had both extensive knowledge and profound scholarship./r/n 先生的学问博大精深。/r/n

word.name: school
word.lx: She studies in a high school./r/n 她在一所中学学习。/r/n He was schooled by life itself./r/n 他受了生活本身的熏陶。/r/n

word.name: school board
word.mean: (地方政府的)联合校董会,教育委员会

word.name: school day
word.lx: May your future be as success flu as your school day had been./r/n 祝你将如同过去在学校一样事事成功。/r/n He went to the badminton club at times during his school days./r/n 他上学时有时到羽毛球俱乐部去。/r/n

word.name: school year
word.lx: The coach checked the football uniforms at the end of the school year./r/n 教练在每个学年末都把足球运动服收回登记。/r/n An examination given in the middle of a school year./r/n 学年中期考试一学年中期进行的考试/r/n

word.name: schoolboy
word.lx: These schoolboys decided to go outing./r/n 这些男学生决定去野游。/r/n Even a schoolboy could manage (ie write) a better story than that./r/n 连小学生写的故事都比那个好./r/n

word.name: schoolgirl
word.lx: This schoolgirl likes to do some needlework./r/n 这个女学生喜欢做针线活。/r/n The ratio of schoolboys to schoolgirls is 2 to 1./r/n 男学生和女学生的比例是2比1。/r/n

word.name: schoolhouse
word.lx: The roof of the schoolhouse is covered with snow./r/n 校舍的屋顶上覆盖着积雪。/r/n

word.name: schoolmaster
word.lx: What did the schoolmaster say?/r/n 校长说了些什么？/r/n A male teacher, schoolmaster, or tutor./r/n 男老师、校长或家庭教师/r/n

word.name: schoolmate
word.lx: Does she help her schoolmate to have known his mistake?/r/n 她是否帮助她的同学认识了他的错误？/r/n

word.name: schoolroom
word.lx: How many schoolrooms are there in this college?/r/n 这所大学里有多少教室？/r/n

word.name: schoolwork
word.mean: n. (包括课堂作业和家庭作业)作业

word.name: schoolyard
word.lx: I thought he was making fun of me and ran faster than ever reaching the schoolyard quite out of breath./r/n 我以为他在取笑我，就越发跑得快起来，到达学校时我都上气不接下气了。/r/n

word.name: schooner
word.lx: He drank a schooner of beer and became drunken./r/n 他喝了一大酒杯啤酒后醉倒了。/r/n

word.name: science
word.lx: I like to read science fiction./r/n 我喜欢读科幻小说。/r/n The college graduated 50 students from the science department last year./r/n 这所学院去年有50名理科毕业生./r/n

word.name: science fiction
word.lx: I like to read science fiction./r/n 我喜欢读科幻小说。/r/n The science fiction film had some marvellous special effects./r/n 这部科幻电影有些特殊效果美妙绝伦./r/n

word.name: scientific
word.lx: We all support his scientific research./r/n 我们都支持他的科学研究。/r/n She has a very scientific method of dealing with political problems./r/n 她处理政治问题的方法很科学。/r/n

word.name: scientifically
word.mean: ad. 合乎科学地,学问上,有系统地

word.name: scintilla
word.mean: n. 火花,闪烁,些微的痕迹

word.name: scoff
word.mean:
n. 嘲笑,嘲弄,愚弄
v. 嘲笑,嘲弄,愚弄
word.lx: I told them my ideas but they scoffed at them./r/n 我把自己的想法告诉他们，但他们嗤之以鼻。/r/n Who has scoffed all the pastries down?/r/n 谁把点心全吃完了？/r/n

word.name: scoop
word.mean:
n. 铲子,舀取,独家新闻
v. 汲取,舀取,抢先登出
word.lx: There are several scoops in my kitchen./r/n 我的厨房里有好几个勺子。/r/n She scooped all the national newspapers to get the story./r/n 她抢在全国各报之前发表了这一消息。/r/n

word.name: scooter
word.mean: n. 小轮摩托车，小孩滑板车
word.lx: For sale: small motor scooter. Enquire within./r/n 待售：小型摩托车，请进内询问。/r/n

word.name: scope
word.lx: Your question is beyond the scope of this book./r/n 你所问的问题已超出了这本书的范围。/r/n It is within my scope./r/n 那是在我的范围之内。/r/n

word.name: score
word.mean:
n. 得分,刻痕,二十;背景音乐
v. 刻划,划线,得分
word.lx: The score was five-nil with five minute left in the game./r/n 比赛离终场还有五分钟时，双方比分为五比零。/r/n Arsenal scored in the final minute of the game./r/n 阿森纳队在比赛的最后一分钟进了一球。/r/n

word.name: scoring
word.lx: Scoring ability or potential./r/n 得分率得分的能力或潜力/r/n A hard rubber disk used in ice hockey as the playing and scoring medium./r/n 冰球冰球比赛中用于击打和得分的硬橡皮盘状物/r/n

word.name: scorn
word.mean:
n. 轻蔑,被叱责的人
v. 轻蔑,不屑做
word.lx: He poured scorn on my suggestion./r/n 他对我的建议表示轻蔑。/r/n She scorned our offers of help./r/n 她不屑接受我们的帮助。/r/n

word.name: scornful
word.lx: He gave a scornful laugh at my proposal./r/n 他对我的建议轻蔑地一笑。/r/n We are scornful of the forces of convention./r/n 我们藐视习惯势力。/r/n

word.name: scornfully
word.lx: Scornfully contemptuous ridicule; derision./r/n 嘲讽责备地鄙视可笑之事；嘲笑/r/n

word.name: scorpion
word.mean: n. 蝎子,心黑的人,蝎子鞭
word.lx: A scorpion has a poisonous sting in its long jointed tail./r/n 蝎子的长尾巴上长着一个有毒的蛰针。/r/n The sting of a scorpion is in its tail./r/n 蝎子的毒钩在其尾部./r/n

word.name: Scot
word.mean: n. 估定的款项,税金,苏格兰人
word.lx: She married a Scot./r/n 她嫁给了一个苏格兰人。/r/n His accent proclaimed him a Scot/that he was a Scot./r/n 他的口音表明他是苏格兰人./r/n

word.name: Scotch
word.mean:
n. 苏格兰人,苏格兰语,伤口,刻痕
a. 苏格兰人的,苏格兰语的
vt. 弄伤,制止(车轮)转动,镇压,扑灭
word.lx: The doctor scotched her false story./r/n 医生戳穿了她的骗局。/r/n Anyway, there never was any one more Scotch in this wide world./r/n 不管怎样，普天之下没有人比他更像一个苏格兰人了。/r/n

word.name: Scotland
word.lx: These two tourists came from Scotland./r/n 这两名游客来自苏格兰。/r/n Cold northerlies will bring rain to Scotland this week./r/n 寒冷的北风本星期将给苏格兰带来雨水。/r/n

word.name: Scots
word.lx: The Scots have distilled whisky for centuries./r/n 苏格兰人用蒸馏法制威士忌酒已有数百年历史./r/n Mary, Queen of Scots, was put to death in1587./r/n 苏格兰王后玛丽于1587年被处死。/r/n

word.name: Scotsman
word.lx: What does a Scotsman wear underneath his kilt?/r/n 苏格兰男子在短裙下面穿著什麽?/r/n

word.name: scoundrel
word.lx: The scoundrel was arrested and put into prison./r/n 这个恶棍被逮捕并被投进了监狱。/r/n An unscrupulous, dishonest person; a scoundrel./r/n 流氓，无赖不守法，不诚实之人；恶棍/r/n

word.name: scour
word.mean:
vt. 擦洗(疏浚,腐蚀,搜索,飞快地跑过)
n. 摩擦(冲洗)
word.lx: The police scoured the area looking for the lost child./r/n 警方搜遍这个地区寻找这个走失的孩子。/r/n He scoured off the dirt from the floor./r/n 他擦去地板上的污垢。/r/n

word.name: scourge
word.mean:
n. 惩罚(灾难,祸患)
vt 折磨(使...痛苦,严惩)
word.lx: The old man is scourged by a guilty conscience./r/n 这个老人受到负罪感的折磨。/r/n After the scourge of war came the scourge of disease./r/n 战乱之后瘟疫又接踵而来。/r/n

word.name: scout
word.mean:
n. 童子军,侦察员
v. 侦察,搜索
vi. 侦察
word.lx: He scouted around to see what he could find./r/n 他四处寻找，看看能找到些什么。/r/n They scouted around for some antiques to furnish their new apartment./r/n 他们到处搜罗一些古董来装饰新居。/r/n

word.name: scrap
word.mean:
n. 小片,残余物,废料
v. 扔弃,互相殴打
word.lx: You ought to scrap the old bike and buy a new one./r/n 你应该扔掉这辆旧自行车，买一辆新的。/r/n There is not a scrap of truth in what he says./r/n 他说的话没有半点是真的。/r/n

word.name: scrapbook
word.lx: She pasted the pictures into a scrapbook./r/n 她把图片贴在剪贴簿上。/r/n

word.name: scrape
word.mean:
n. 刮掉,擦掉
v. 刮掉,擦掉
word.lx: He suffered a few cuts and scrapes./r/n 他割破和擦伤了几个地方。/r/n Scrape your shoes on the door mat before you come in./r/n 进屋前先在门口擦鞋垫上擦一擦鞋子。/r/n

word.name: scraping
word.lx: The lorry shaved the barrier, scraping its side./r/n 那辆卡车掠过路障，刮坏了车身。/r/n The waiter showed us to our table with much bowing and scraping./r/n 服务员一个劲儿地点头哈腰领我们就座./r/n

word.name: scrappy
word.mean: a. 好斗的,生气勃勃的
word.lx: A scrappy litigator./r/n 爱吵好斗的人。/r/n It was a scrappy, rambling speech./r/n 那篇讲话杂乱无章，毫无条理。/r/n

word.name: scratch
word.mean:
n. 抓痕,抓的声音,乱写
v. 搔痒,抓,抹掉
word.lx: The recording was spoiled by scratches./r/n 录音被沙沙声破坏了。/r/n Somebody has scratched his name off the list./r/n 有人已经把他的名字从名单上划去了。/r/n

word.name: scrawl
word.mean:
vt. 乱涂
n. 瞎画
word.lx: She scrawled a few words on the postcard./r/n 她在明信片上草草地写了几个字。/r/n Her signature was an illegible scrawl./r/n 她的签字潦草难辩。/r/n

word.name: scream
word.mean:
n. 尖叫声
v. 尖叫,大笑
word.lx: The boy was screaming with pain./r/n 这男孩痛得尖叫起来。/r/n She screamed herself hoarse./r/n 她把嗓子喊哑了。/r/n

word.name: screamer
word.mean: n. 尖声叫喊的人, <美俚>(报刊上的)惊人的标题

word.name: screaming
word.mean: a. 尖声的,发出尖叫声的
word.lx: The boy was screaming with pain./r/n 这男孩痛得尖叫起来。/r/n Those cats have been screaming for hours./r/n 那些猫叫了半天了./r/n

word.name: screech
word.mean:
n. 尖声喊叫,尖叫声,急煞车时车子的煞车声
v. 尖著声音讲,发出尖锐的声音
word.lx: The gate screeched as it opened./r/n 大门打开时发出刺耳的声音。/r/n He heard a screech of brakes and then fell down./r/n 他听到汽车刹车发出的尖锐的声音，然后就摔倒了。/r/n

word.name: screed
word.mean: n. 冗长的句子,泥水匠用的匀泥尺

word.name: screening
word.mean: n. 遮蔽(屏蔽,筛,防波,筛屑)
word.lx: A screening against light or heat./r/n 遮蔽光或热的遮挡物/r/n A revolving cylindrical sieve used for screening or sizing rock and ore./r/n 滚筒筛一种圆筒形的可旋转的筛，用于岩石和矿石的筛分或大小测量/r/n

word.name: screenwriter
word.mean: n. 电影剧本作家,编剧家

word.name: screw
word.mean:
n. 螺丝钉,吝啬鬼,压迫
v. 扭紧,压榨
word.lx: The table legs are screwed to the floor./r/n 这张桌子的腿是用螺丝固定在地板上的。/r/n One of the screws is loose./r/n 一只螺丝松了。/r/n

word.name: screwdriver
word.lx: This screwdriver has been magnetized./r/n 这把改锥已经磁化了./r/n A screwdriver and a hammer are the only tools you need./r/n 你需用的工具只是改锥和锤子./r/n

word.name: scribble
word.mean:
n. 潦草的写法,潦草写成的东西,杂文
v. 潦草地书写,乱写,滥写
word.lx: The child is scribbling all over a book./r/n 这孩子正在本子上到处乱画。/r/n Do not scribble on the wall!/r/n 不要在墙上乱涂！/r/n

word.name: scripture
word.mean: n. 圣经,圣经的一节,圣经的一句
word.lx: He reads the Holy Scripture everyday./r/n 他每天都读《圣经》。/r/n This is the canon of Scripture./r/n 这是圣经的真经。/r/n

word.name: scrivener
word.mean: 代理人,放债人,公证人,文书

word.name: scroll
word.mean:
n. 卷轴,目录
v. 卷动

word.name: scrub
word.mean:
n. 用力擦洗,矮树,渺小之物
v. 用力擦洗
word.lx: Although she scrubbed the old pot thoroughly, she could not make it look completely clean./r/n 虽然她彻底地用力擦洗那只旧壶，但她无法把它完全洗干净。/r/n Give that floor a good hard scrub./r/n 使劲擦洗一下那地板。/r/n

word.name: scrum
word.mean: n. (橄榄球赛中)双方球员争球
word.lx: Shoppers got into a scrum round the bargain counter./r/n 顾客在廉价品柜台周围你争我夺./r/n

word.name: scrumptious
word.lx: What a scrumptious meal!/r/n 多香的饭菜!/r/n

word.name: scrunch
word.mean:
vt. 碾碎, 使弯曲
vi. 嘎吱嘎吱地作响, 蜷缩
n. 嘎吱嘎吱的响声

word.name: scrupulously
word.mean: ad. 小心翼翼地, 多顾虑地

word.name: scrutable
word.mean: a. 通过细看和细查可以理解的

word.name: scrutinize
word.mean:
n. 详细检查,细读
v. 仔细检查
vt. 细察

word.name: scud
word.mean:
n. 黄铁矿(疾飞,飞云)
vt 飞跑(刮面)
word.lx: The yacht was scudding along before the wind./r/n 那只帆船正乘风笔直疾驶./r/n

word.name: scuffle
word.mean:
v. 混战
n. 混战
word.lx: They scuffled with reporters./r/n 他们与记者撕打起来。/r/n The police scuffled with the demonstrators./r/n 警察和示威群众混战起来。/r/n

word.name: scullion
word.mean: n. 在厨房工作的仆人

word.name: sculpt
word.mean:
n. 雕刻,雕塑,雕刻品,雕塑品
v. 雕刻

word.name: sculptor
word.lx: The sculptor is working on a sculpture of Venus./r/n 那个雕刻家正在雕一个维纳斯雕像。/r/n The sculptor chiselled the lump of marble into a fine statue./r/n 雕刻家把大理石块凿成优美的雕像./r/n

word.name: sculpture
word.mean:
n. 雕塑
v. 雕刻,雕塑
word.lx: The water had sculptured the rocks into strange shapes./r/n 水把岩石侵袭得奇形怪状。/r/n She studied sculpture at art school./r/n 她在美术学校学习雕刻。/r/n

word.name: scurrilous
word.mean: a. 说话粗鄙恶劣的,嘴损的,下流的
word.lx: She is often quite scurrilous in her reference to me./r/n 她一提起我，常常骂骂咧咧的。/r/n

word.name: scurry
word.mean:
vt. 快跑(飞散)
n. 快跑(飞散)
word.lx: The beetle scuttled away when I lifted the stone./r/n 我把石头搬起来时，那只甲虫跑了。/r/n They scurried in out of the cold./r/n 他们冻得很快跑进来了。/r/n

word.name: scuttle
word.mean:
n. 煤斗(天窗)
vt 凿沉(奔跑)
word.lx: The beetle scuttled away when I lifted the stone./r/n 我把石头搬起来时，那只甲虫跑了。/r/n The spectators scuttled for shelter when it began to rain./r/n 一下起雨来，观众就纷纷找地方躲避。/r/n

word.name: scythe
word.mean:
n. 长柄的大镰刀,战车镰
v. 以大镰刀割
word.lx: The workers are scything in the meadow./r/n 工人们正在草地上割草。/r/n I use a scythe for cutting grass./r/n 我用大镰刀割草。/r/n

word.name: sea floor
word.lx: A large elevated area of a sea floor./r/n 海底斜坡大面积倾斜的海底/r/n

word.name: sea level
word.lx: This mountain is 1,400 meters above sea level./r/n 这座山海拔1,400米。/r/n The top of this mountain is three kilometers above the sea level./r/n 这座山的山顶海拔三千米高。/r/n

word.name: seaboard
word.mean:
n. 海岸,沿海地带
a. 海边的

word.name: seacoast
word.lx: Our language goes current along the seacoast./r/n 我们的语言通用于沿海一带。/r/n Occurring, living, or working along a seacoast./r/n 发生、生活或工作在海岸边的/r/n

word.name: seafaring
word.mean: a. 航海的,跟航海有关的

word.name: seagull
word.lx: A seagull skims the water./r/n 海鸥掠过水面。/r/n Seagulls were circling overhead./r/n 海鸥在头顶山盘旋。/r/n

word.name: seal
word.mean:
n. 印章,封条,海豹
v. 盖印,封闭,猎海豹
word.lx: The envelope was firmly sealed./r/n 这个信封封得很严实。/r/n The seal on this bottle is broken./r/n 这个瓶上的密封纸破开了。/r/n

word.name: seam
word.mean:
n. 缝,接缝
v. 线缝,接缝
word.lx: His face is seamed with age./r/n 他因年老而满脸皱纹。/r/n The seam of her skirt ripped./r/n 她的裙子的接缝裂开了。/r/n

word.name: seaman
word.lx: We have many skilled seamen on our ship./r/n 我们船上有很多有经验的水手。/r/n The dying seaman made a nuncupation in favor of his mother./r/n 那位即将死亡的海员立了一份囗头遗嘱给他母亲。/r/n

word.name: seamstress
word.lx: The seamstress ornamented the dress with lace./r/n 女裁缝用花边来装饰衣服。/r/n The seamstress gathered in the cloth./r/n 女裁缝把布收拾起来。/r/n

word.name: seamy
word.lx: The seamy side of life includes crime and other evils./r/n 生活的阴暗面包括犯罪和其它邪恶事情。/r/n

word.name: seaport
word.lx: He came from a large seaport./r/n 他来自于一个大型海港城市。/r/n

word.name: sear
word.mean:
a. 枯萎的,烤焦的
v. 烤焦,使枯萎
word.lx: The terrible experience is seared into my memory./r/n 那次可怕的经历铭刻在我的记忆中。/r/n The novel is a searing indictment of urban poverty./r/n 这部小说是对城市贫困的震撼心灵的控诉。/r/n

word.name: search
word.mean:
n. 搜寻,探究
v. 搜寻,探求,调查
word.lx: We did a computer search for all the hyphenated words./r/n 我们用电脑查找所有用连字符连接的词。/r/n They searched the woods for the little boy./r/n 他们在森林中搜寻到了那个小男孩。/r/n

word.name: searching
word.lx: She gave me a searching look and asked if I was lying./r/n 她用锐利的目光看著我，问我是否说谎了。/r/n Scientists are still searching for a cure to the common cold./r/n 科学家仍在寻求治疗感冒的方法。/r/n

word.name: searchlight
word.lx: The police shone a searchlight on the house./r/n 警察用探照灯照射这所房子./r/n The beam of the searchlight pierced the darkness./r/n 探照灯的光柱射入黑暗中./r/n

word.name: seashell
word.lx: Small seashells were often used as a primitive kind of money./r/n 小贝壳常被用作简单的货币。/r/n

word.name: seashore
word.lx: I like to walk along the seashore./r/n 我喜欢沿着海滨散步。/r/n We have a long seashore in our country./r/n 我们国家的海岸线很长。/r/n

word.name: seaside
word.mean:
a. 海边(的),海滨(的)
n. 海边
word.lx: I stayed two weeks at the seaside./r/n 我在海边呆了两个星期。/r/n She owns a house at the seaside./r/n 她在海滨拥有自己的房子。/r/n

word.name: season
word.mean:
n. 季节,时期
v. 调味,使...适用
word.lx: Winter is the low season at seaside hotels./r/n 冬季是海滨旅馆业的淡季。/r/n Applicants will be notified of our decision in good season./r/n 我们会把决定及早通知申请者。/r/n

word.name: seasonal
word.mean: a. 季节的,依照季节的,周期性的
word.lx: Overcoats are seasonal goods./r/n 大衣是季节性商品。/r/n The area is subject to devastating seasonal winds./r/n 这个地区常遭破坏性季风的袭击。/r/n

word.name: seasonally
word.lx: A wind system that influences large climatic regions and reverses direction seasonally./r/n 季风影响大面积地区的气候并随季节而改变风向的风/r/n

word.name: seasoned
word.lx: This meat should be seasoned with salt and mustard./r/n 这肉里应该加些盐和芥末。/r/n Seasoned timber does not warp./r/n 经干燥处理的木材不会翘曲。/r/n

word.name: seasoning
word.mean:
n. 风干(时效,调质,贮放,涂光,不稳定性)
n. 调料
word.lx: A solid food prepared from the pressed curd of milk, often seasoned and aged./r/n 奶酪从经压缩过的牛奶凝聚物制成的固体食物，经常是风干的并且是陈年的/r/n The leaves of this plant, used as a seasoning./r/n 这种植物的叶子，可用作调料/r/n

word.name: seasons
word.lx: How many seasons are there in a year? There are four seasons in a year./r/n 一年有几个季节？ 一年有四季。/r/n The seasons follow each other in rotation./r/n 四季循环交替。/r/n

word.name: seated
word.lx: Be seated! This court is now in session./r/n 请坐下！本庭现在开庭。/r/n The delegates have to be seated according to protocol./r/n 代表们须按礼仪要求就座./r/n

word.name: seating
word.lx: The rear seating compartment of an early type of automobile./r/n 后部座位部分一种早期汽车具有的车身后部分的座位/r/n Ballpark lights; ballpark seating./r/n 运动场用灯；运动场座位/r/n

word.name: seawater
word.lx: They painted a coat of paint to prevent the oxidation of the ship by seawater./r/n 他们刷了一层油漆以防止船只被海水氧化。/r/n

word.name: seaweed
word.lx: The smell of seaweed took him back to his childhood./r/n 海草的气味使他回想起童年时代./r/n The ship ran a foul of the floating seaweed./r/n 船和漂流的海藻纠缠在一起。/r/n

word.name: sec
word.mean: n. 第二的(次的,摄象管,秘书)

word.name: secede
word.mean:
v. 正式脱离或退出(组织)
vi. 退出,脱离

word.name: secession
word.mean: n. 脱离,分离,南部11州的脱离
word.lx: The secession of some southern states from the USA in the 1860s led to the civil war./r/n 由于南部某些州于十九世纪六十年代脱离美国而导致了南北战争。/r/n

word.name: secluded
word.mean: a. 隐退的, 隐蔽的
word.lx: Hidden from view; secluded./r/n 隐退的隐藏不让看见的；隐退的/r/n A secluded structure, such as a bower, in a garden./r/n 凉亭一种在花园中建造的隐蔽性建筑物，如凉亭/r/n

word.name: seclusion
word.lx: The Hindu or Moslem system of sex segregation, practiced especially by keeping women in seclusion./r/n 深闺制度尤指使妇女处于隔离状态的印度或穆斯林的性隔离系统/r/n She lives in seclusion apart from her friend./r/n 她远离朋友，过隐居生活。/r/n

word.name: second
word.mean:
n. 秒
a. 第二的,其次的,多余的
a. 第二
word.lx: He was seconded in his offer of help by several other friends./r/n 他得到数位朋友的支持，和他一起伸出援手。/r/n The train will leave in a second./r/n 列车马上要开了。/r/n

word.name: second class
word.lx: Second class is cheaper./r/n 二等邮件较便宜./r/n One single, second class, to winchester, please./r/n 买一张去温撤斯特单程二等票。/r/n

word.name: secondary
word.mean: a. 中级的,中等的,次要的
word.lx: All other considerations are secondary to his safety./r/n 现在首先要考虑的是他的安全，其他事都是次要的。/r/n He works in a secondary school./r/n 他在一所中学工作。/r/n

word.name: secondary school
word.lx: He works in a secondary school./r/n 他在一所中学工作。/r/n In secondary school, students get more advanced knowledge./r/n 在中学里，学生获得更深一些的知识。/r/n

word.name: secondhand
word.mean:
a. 间接获得的,古旧的,做旧货买卖的
ad. 间接地,间接听来,以旧货

word.name: secondly
word.mean:
a. 第二(点),其次
ad. 第二,其次

word.name: second-rate
word.mean: a. 二流的, 二等的, 二级的, 不是优秀的

word.name: secrecy
word.lx: He has been sworn to secrecy about this./r/n 他已经发誓对这件事保密。/r/n Their negotiations were cloaked in secrecy./r/n 他们的谈判在秘密进行。/r/n

word.name: secretarial
word.lx: Can you fix me up with a secretarial job?/r/n 你能不能给我安排一个秘书工作？/r/n She is taking a secretarial course./r/n 她正在上文秘课程。/r/n

word.name: secretariat
word.lx: Mr. Smith, late of the UN Secretariat./r/n 以前在联合国秘书处服务过的史密斯先生。/r/n After the congress, the secretariat moved from Shanghai to Beijing./r/n 代表大会召开之后，书记处由上海迁到了北京。/r/n

word.name: secretary
word.mean: n. 秘书,部长,大臣,书记

word.name: secrete
word.mean:
v. 隐秘,隐藏,隐匿
v. 分泌
word.lx: He found the money secreted in a drawer./r/n 他找到了藏在抽屉里的钱。/r/n The kidneys secrete urine./r/n 肾脏是分泌尿液的器官。/r/n

word.name: secretin
word.mean: n. 分泌活素,分泌激素

word.name: secretion
word.mean: n. 分泌,分泌物,分泌液
word.lx: The secretion of bile is useful for our bodies./r/n 胆汁的分泌对我们的身体很有用处。/r/n Saliva is secretion of the salivary glands./r/n 唾液是唾液腺的分泌物。/r/n

word.name: secretly
word.lx: Not in public; secretly or confidentially./r/n 秘密地非公开地；秘密地或在私下地/r/n The boy slipped out of the room and headed for the swimming pool secretly./r/n 这孩子偷偷摸摸地溜出了屋子, 走向游泳池。/r/n

word.name: sect
word.lx: The break-away sect was contemned by other religious groups./r/n 这个分裂出去的派别受到其他宗教团体的蔑视。/r/n Each religious sect in the town have its own church./r/n 该城每一个宗教教派都有自己的教堂。/r/n

word.name: sectarian
word.mean:
a. 宗派的,党派心强的,偏狭的
n. 属于宗派的人,宗派心强的人

word.name: section
word.mean:
n. 部分,章节,部门,路段
断面,剖面,截面
v. 划分 [同]divide
word.lx: Signals control each section of the railway track./r/n 各种信号控制着铁路轨道的每个部分。/r/n First the surgeon performed the section of the blood vessel./r/n 外科医生首先切开血管。/r/n

word.name: sectional
word.mean: a. 各部分组成的,各阶层或不同部分的

word.name: sections
word.lx: He had the support of large sections of the populace./r/n 他获得大多数民众的支持。/r/n White lines divide the playing area into sections./r/n 这些白线把赛区分成各个部分./r/n

word.name: sector
word.mean:
n. 扇形,扇区
n. 部门,区域
word.lx: The government made an investigation of the employment in the public and private sectors./r/n 政府对国营和私营部门的就业情况作了一次调查。/r/n There are several sectors unusable in this disk./r/n 这张磁盘有几个扇区坏了。/r/n

word.name: secular
word.mean:
n. 牧师
a. 世俗的,现世的,不朽的
word.lx: Secular music refers to music which is not religious./r/n 世俗音乐是指非宗教的音乐。/r/n A secular law, rule, or code of law./r/n 世俗法规世俗的法律、制度或法典/r/n

word.name: secure
word.mean:
a. 无虑的,安心的,安全的
v. 固定,获得,使...安全
word.lx: He secured the release of the hostages./r/n 他已经设法使人质获释。/r/n The little boy felt secure near his parents./r/n 那小男孩在父母身边感到安心。/r/n

word.name: security
word.mean:
n. 安全
n. 保证金,抵押品,债券,证券
word.lx: What I need now is the security of a happy home./r/n 我现在需要的是一个幸福家庭所给予的安全感。/r/n He uses his house as security to borrow the money./r/n 他用房子作借钱的抵押。/r/n

word.name: sedan
word.lx: No problem. Right this way. Here we have a great red two-door to sedan./r/n 看这边。这儿有一辆很棒的红色双门轿车。/r/n The black sedan suddenly drew out into the traffic./r/n 黑色轿车突然开动，驶进了车流。/r/n

word.name: sedate
word.lx: Prim and sedate./r/n 严肃沉闷的/r/n

word.name: sedentary
word.mean: a. 久坐的,固定不动的
word.lx: He leads a sedentary life./r/n 他过着久坐不动的生活。/r/n The scribe is a sedentary worker./r/n 作家工作时需要久坐。/r/n

word.name: sediment
word.lx: You should not drink the wine with a gritty sediment./r/n 不要喝有沙粒状沉淀物的葡萄酒。/r/n He emptied out the water barrel to clear it of sediment./r/n 他把水桶倒空以清掉桶底的沉淀物。/r/n

word.name: sedition
word.mean: n. 煽动骚乱,妨害治安,骚动

word.name: seduce
word.lx: He was seduced into leaving the company by the offer of higher pay elsewhere./r/n 其他地方更优厚的薪金待遇诱使他离开了公司。/r/n The warm weather seduced me away from my studies./r/n 暖和的天气诱使我放下了学习。/r/n

word.name: seduction
word.mean: n. 勾引,引诱,诱惑,诱奸
word.lx: Seduction from morality, allegiance, or duty./r/n 道德败坏；不忠；玩忽职守/r/n

word.name: sedulous
word.mean: a. 勤勉的,勤苦工作的,聚精凝神的

word.name: seed
word.mean:
n. 种子
vi. (植物)结实,播种
vt. 播种
word.lx: Part of every crop is saved for seed./r/n 每一种庄稼都留一部分作种子。/r/n The farmers were scattering seed on the fields./r/n 农夫把种子撒在田里。/r/n

word.name: seedling
word.lx: The seedling was frozen to death./r/n 幼苗被冻死了。/r/n The seedling have shrivel up a bit in the hot sun./r/n 在炎热的太阳光下，幼苗已有一点乾枯。/r/n

word.name: seedy
word.mean: a. 褴褛的,破旧的,不体面的
word.lx: The grapes are delicious but very seedy./r/n 葡萄好吃是好吃, 就是子儿太多./r/n

word.name: Seeing is believing
word.lx: Seeing is believing./r/n 眼见为实。/r/n Words are but wind, but seeing is believing./r/n 【谚】耳听为虚，眼见为实。/r/n

word.name: seek
word.mean:
n. 找寻
v. 寻求,寻找,搜索
word.lx: You should seek advice from your lawyer on this matter./r/n 这件事情你应该请教你的律师。/r/n We sought her out to tell her of her success./r/n 我们找到她，告诉她她成功了。/r/n

word.name: seeker
word.lx: President James A. Garfield was shot by a disappointed office seeker on July2, 1881./r/n 1881年7月2日，詹姆斯·A·加菲尔德总统被一个失望的谋求官职者枪击/r/n

word.name: seem
word.lx: He seems an energetic person./r/n 他似乎是一个精力充沛的人。/r/n He seems to know everything./r/n 他似乎什么都懂。/r/n

word.name: seeming
word.mean:
a. 表面上的
n. 外观
word.lx: Seeming or professed; ostensible./r/n 假装的表面上的或自称的；貌似真实的/r/n Seeming to be coolly unconcerned or indifferent./r/n 漠不关心的，冷淡的看上去漠不关心的或冷淡的/r/n

word.name: seemly
word.mean: a. 适当的,恰当的,合式的
word.lx: Chewing gum on a train is not seemly in a lady./r/n 淑女在火车上嚼囗香糖不太雅观。/r/n

word.name: seep
word.mean:
v. 渗出,渗流,漏
n. 水陆两用的吉普车

word.name: seesaw
word.mean: n. 秋千,上下往复的运动,跷跷板

word.name: seethe
word.lx: She was seething with rage at his remarks./r/n 他的评论把她气得火冒三丈。/r/n They fell into the seething waters of the rapids./r/n 他们跌进了汹涌的急流中。/r/n

word.name: segment
word.mean:
n. 部分
v. 部分,段,分割
vt. 分割
word.lx: The company dominates this segment of the market./r/n 这家公司控制了这一部分市场。/r/n The waiter brought us a dish of orange segments./r/n 服务员给我们端来一盘掰开的橘子瓣。/r/n

word.name: segmented
word.lx: The company dominates this segment of the market./r/n 这家公司控制了这一部分市场。/r/n The waiter brought us a dish of orange segments./r/n 服务员给我们端来一盘掰开的橘子瓣。/r/n

word.name: segregate
word.mean:
a. 分离的,被隔离的
v. 分离,隔离,分凝
word.lx: Why should the handicappedbe segregated from the able-bodied?/r/n 为什麽要把伤残人士和身体健康的人分开?/r/n

word.name: segregation
word.mean: n. 隔离； 种族隔离

word.name: seine
word.mean: 塞纳河(法国北部河流,流经巴黎)

word.name: seizure
word.lx: The seizure of contraband is made by customs./r/n 那些走私品是被海关没收的。/r/n Do you know the impressive seizures of drugs?/r/n 你知道那件轰动一时的毒品扣押案吗？/r/n

word.name: seldom
word.lx: He seldom eats breakfast./r/n 他很少吃早餐。/r/n The apple tree is seldom fruitful./r/n 这棵苹果树很少结果。/r/n

word.name: select
word.mean:
a. 精选的
n. 被挑选出来的人或物
v. 选择
vi. 选择,挑选,选拔
vt. 选择,挑选
word.lx: A select group were invited to the wedding reception./r/n 一群经过挑选的人士被邀请参加婚宴。/r/n This is a very select area; you have to be rich to live here./r/n 这是高级住宅区，你必须有钱才能住在这里。/r/n

word.name: selected
word.lx: The milkman selected the spotted cows, from among a herd of two hundred./r/n 牛奶商从一群200头牛中选出有斑点的牛。/r/n He was selected as the district attorney./r/n 他被选为地方检察官。/r/n

word.name: selection
word.lx: That shop has a fine selection of cakes./r/n 那家商店有各种精美的糕点供我们选择。/r/n That store has a good selection of furniture./r/n 那家店有很多家具可供挑选。/r/n

word.name: selective
word.lx: She is selective in the dresses she wears./r/n 她对于自己穿的衣服精挑细选。/r/n Not selective; indiscriminate./r/n 不选择的没有进行选择的；不加选择地/r/n

word.name: selenium
word.mean: n. [化] 硒 (非金属元素,符号 Se,原子序34)

word.name: self-centered
word.mean: a. 以自我为中心的,自私的

word.name: self-contained
word.mean: a. 沉默寡言的,自足的,完备的

word.name: self-determination
word.mean: n. 自主, 自我决定

word.name: self-directed
word.mean: a. 自我为中心的,自我指导的,自主的

word.name: self-discipline
word.mean: n. 自我训练, 自我修养, 自律, 自我约束

word.name: self-esteem
word.mean: n. 自尊, 自负, 自大, 自尊心

word.name: self-evident
word.mean: a. 不证自明的,本身很明显的

word.name: self-explanatory
word.mean: a. 自明的, 不需加以说明的
word.lx: The diagram is self-explanatory./r/n 该图表本身即很清楚./r/n

word.name: self-fulfilling
word.mean: a. （预言等）本身自然会实现的

word.name: self-governing
word.mean: a. 自治的, 自己管理自己的

word.name: self-help
word.lx: Self-help is an important element in therapy for the handicapped./r/n 伤残人士在治疗中, 自助自立是个重要因素./r/n

word.name: self-importance
word.mean: n. 自尊, 自负, 自大

word.name: self-improvement
word.mean: n. 自我改善, 自我修养

word.name: selfish
word.lx: A selfish person always thinks about himself./r/n 一个自私的人总是想着自己。/r/n The two brothers often quarrel with each other; one is stubborn, and the other (is) selfish./r/n 这两兄弟经常吵架；一个很固执，另一个则很自私。/r/n

word.name: selfishness
word.lx: His selfishness caused him to refuse my solicitation./r/n 他的自私让他拒绝了我的请求。/r/n This behaviour illustrates your selfishness./r/n 你的行为说明你很自私./r/n

word.name: self-knowledge
word.mean: n. 自知之明, 自觉

word.name: selfless
word.mean: a. 无私的,不考虑自己的
word.lx: He trained them to be bold selfless fighters for the interests of the people./r/n 他培养他们成为为人民利益奋斗的勇敢无私的战士。/r/n

word.name: self-realization
word.mean: n. 自我实现, 自我完成

word.name: self-reliance
word.mean: n. 依靠自己,自力更生

word.name: self-sacrifice
word.lx: Her self-sacrifice saved our lives./r/n 她以自我牺牲精神救了我们的性命./r/n

word.name: selfsame
word.mean: a. 完全一样的,同一的
word.lx: They were both born on that selfsame day./r/n 他们俩都是那一天出生的./r/n She said the selfsame thing to me./r/n 她对我讲的是完全一样的事情./r/n

word.name: self-service
word.mean: a. 自选的,顾客自理的

word.name: self-serving
word.mean: a. 自私的, 自私自利的

word.name: semblance
word.lx: There are piles of papers all over the desk with no semblance of order./r/n 桌子上堆满了一堆堆杂乱无章的文件。/r/n Outward appearance or aspect; semblance./r/n 外表外在的容貌或样子；外貌/r/n

word.name: semester
word.lx: This semester will be my last one in this university./r/n 这个学期将是我在这所大学的最后一学期了。/r/n How many subjects are you studying this semester?/r/n 这学期你选了几门课程？/r/n

word.name: semi
word.mean:
a.一半的,部分的,不完全的
n. 二轮半拖车(挂车,双轮拖车)

word.name: semidetached
word.mean: a. 半分离的,双拼式的
word.lx: In the first act the curtain goes up on a typical sitting-room of a small English semidetached house./r/n 第一幕，幕启。展现在观众眼前的一是栋英式半独立的小屋里的一间典型的起居室。/r/n

word.name: semiliterate
word.mean: n. 半文盲, 有初等文化者

word.name: seminal
word.mean: a. 精液的,种子的,生殖的

word.name: Semitic
word.mean:
a. 闪米特人的
n. 闪含语系闪语族的语言

word.name: semitropical
word.mean: a. 副热带的,亚热带的

word.name: semolina
word.mean: n. (做布丁、通心粉等用的)粗面粉

word.name: senator
word.lx: The senator voted to support the president./r/n 这位参议员投票支持总统。/r/n We are very privileged to have Senator Dobbs with us this evening./r/n 今晚有多布斯参议员光临, 我们感到十分荣幸./r/n

word.name: send
word.lx: Radio Beijing sends the news all over the world./r/n 北京广播电台向全世界播送新闻。/r/n The music of this song sent her carefree and joyous./r/n 这支歌的乐曲使她心旷神怡。/r/n

word.name: sender
word.mean: n. 寄件人,发报机,发话机
word.lx: The parcel was returned to the sender because the directions were incorrect./r/n 包裹因姓名地址有误而退给了寄件人./r/n A batch of mail dispatched at one time by a sender./r/n 由邮递员同时分送的一批邮件/r/n

word.name: senior
word.mean:
n. 年长者,上司,毕业班学生
a. 年长的,高级的,资深的
word.lx: He is senior to me, though he is younger./r/n 他地位比我高，虽然他比我年轻。/r/n He is my senior by two years./r/n 他比我大两岁。/r/n

word.name: seniority
word.mean: n. 长辈,前任者的特权,老资格
word.lx: Should promotion be through merit or seniority?/r/n 晋升应该凭成绩还是靠年资？/r/n Does seniority give one the right to command?/r/n 难道年长资深就有权发号施令吗?/r/n

word.name: sensation
word.lx: The new discovery caused a great sensation./r/n 这项新发现很轰动。/r/n I knew the train had stopped, but I had the sensation that it was moving backwards./r/n 我知道火车已经停了，但我觉得火车在倒退。/r/n

word.name: sensational
word.mean: a. 使人感动的,非常好的,轰动的，耸人听闻的
word.lx: What a sensational story! It has all the elements of a soap opera./r/n 多麽耸人听闻的事! 具备连续剧的一切要素./r/n The newspapers played up sensational social news./r/n 各报大肆渲染耸人听闻的社会新闻。/r/n

word.name: sensationalism
word.mean: n. 追求轰动效应, 感觉论
word.lx: Avoid sensationalism in reporting crime./r/n 报道罪案时要避免使用耸动视听的手段./r/n

word.name: sense
word.mean:
n. 侦测,感应,感觉
v. 感觉,了解
word.lx: The horse sensed danger and stopped./r/n 马感觉到了危险，于是停了下来。/r/n I lost my sense of taste./r/n 我丧失了味觉。/r/n

word.name: sensitivity
word.mean: n. 敏感,多愁善感,感受性

word.name: sensor
word.lx: Smoke sensors warned us of the fire./r/n 烟雾探测器已向我们发出火警警报./r/n

word.name: sensory
word.mean: a. 知觉的,感觉的,知觉器官的

word.name: sensual
word.mean: a. 肉欲的, 色情的, 世俗的, 感觉的, 感觉论的
word.lx: He lived a life devoted entirely to sensual pleasure./r/n 他一生耽于肉欲。/r/n Sensual gratification or indulgence./r/n （感官的）享乐感官的满足或沉溺/r/n

word.name: sensuality
word.lx: A city or place of great luxury, sensuality, and often vice and corruption./r/n 巴比伦式的城市指奢华糜烂的城市或地区，经常是罪恶和腐败的/r/n

word.name: sensuous
word.mean: a. 感觉上的,依五官的,诉诸美感的
word.lx: A devotee to sensuous and luxurious living; an epicure./r/n 享乐主义者喜爱豪华奢侈生活的人；享乐主义者/r/n The flower that wreathe his parlor stifle him with their sensuous perfume./r/n 包围著客厅的花以其刺激人的香味使他窒息。/r/n

word.name: sent
word.mean:
v. 送,寄出
vbl. 送,寄出
word.lx: Relief was quickly sent to the sufferers from the great fire./r/n 救济品很快被送到遭受火灾的灾民手中。/r/n The passengers were sent to the cutters as the ship was sinking./r/n 大船要沉没了，乘客们被送到驳船上。/r/n

word.name: sentence
word.mean:
n. 句子,意见,宣判
v. 宣判,判决
word.lx: Please fill in the blanks in the sentence./r/n 请做这个句子的填空。/r/n The bench read the sentence to the criminal./r/n 法官向罪犯宣读了判决。/r/n

word.name: sententious
word.mean: a. 简洁的,警句的,富于格言的

word.name: sentiment
word.mean: n. 感情,情绪；意见，观点
word.lx: There is no place for sentiment in business./r/n 做生意不能感情用事。/r/n What are his sentiments on this issue?/r/n 他对这个问题持什么观点？/r/n

word.name: sentimentalism
word.mean: n. 感情主义, 沉于情感

word.name: sentimentality
word.lx: Culture or civilization in a degraded state of sentimentality and vulgarity./r/n 庸俗文化处于感伤和粗俗的退化状态的文化或文明/r/n

word.name: sentinel
word.mean:
n. 哨兵(标记,传送)
vt 放哨(守卫)
word.lx: The press is a sentinel of our liberty./r/n 新闻界是捍卫我们自由的卫兵。/r/n One who protects, keeps watch, or acts as a sentinel./r/n 警卫象哨兵一样工作的人，守护，看守的人/r/n

word.name: sentry
word.lx: The sentry challenged the stranger at the gates./r/n 哨兵查问在门口的陌生人./r/n An assigned position or station, as of a guard or sentry./r/n 哨站，岗位如卫兵或哨兵的指派的站岗位置/r/n

word.name: sepal
word.lx: The sepals under the flower wilted./r/n 花朵下面的萼片枯萎了。/r/n

word.name: separable
word.lx: Search of knowledge and love of study are in separable./r/n 追求知识与爱好学习是不可分割的。/r/n One of the small sections of a separable bulb, as that of garlic./r/n 小鳞茎一种可分离鳞茎的一小部分，如大蒜的一瓣/r/n

word.name: separate
word.mean:
n. 分开,抽印本
a. 分开的,各自的,单独的
v. 分开,隔开,分居
word.lx: This word has three separate meanings./r/n 这个词有三个不同的意思。/r/n The war separated many families./r/n 战争使许多家庭妻离子散。/r/n

word.name: separated
word.lx: The war separated many families./r/n 战争使许多家庭妻离子散。/r/n The boys set to and had to be separated by a teacher./r/n 那些男生大打出手，来个老师才把他们拉开。/r/n

word.name: separately
word.mean: ad. 分别地(各别地,独立地,借助外力地)
word.lx: We saw the play separately and compared notes afterwards./r/n 我们各自看了那出戏, 後来交换了意见./r/n Living separately from parents after marriage is all the mode today./r/n 婚后与父母分开住非常流行。/r/n

word.name: separatist
word.mean: n. 分离主义者,独立派
word.lx: Our integrity as a nation is threatened by these separatist forces./r/n 我们国家的完整受到了这些分裂主义势力的威胁。/r/n The separatist is demanding full autonomy for their state./r/n 分裂主义者在要求他们的州完全自治。/r/n

word.name: September
word.lx: This term will begin on September 7th./r/n 这个学期将于九月七号开始。/r/n They are planning to visit Palestine in September./r/n 他们正计划九月份访问巴勒斯坦。/r/n

word.name: septic
word.mean:
a. 腐败的
n. 腐败物

word.name: sepulcher
word.mean:
n. 坟墓,埋葬所
v. 埋葬
word.lx: The scene shifted to a sepulcher./r/n 镜头转换到一座坟墓。/r/n

word.name: sepulchral
word.lx: He looks quite sepulchral./r/n 他看上去阴沉沉的。/r/n He spoke in sepulchral tones./r/n 他用低沉的语调说话。/r/n

word.name: sequacious
word.mean: a. 好跟随在别人后头走的,卑贱的,合于逻辑的

word.name: sequel
word.mean: n. 结局,后果,续集,续篇
word.lx: Famine is often the sequel to war or drought./r/n 饥荒往往是战争或干旱造成的。/r/n He is writing a sequel to his latest best seller./r/n 他正在写他的最新畅销书的续集。/r/n

word.name: sequela
word.mean: n. 后继者, 后遗症

word.name: sequence
word.mean: n. 序列,继起的事,顺序
word.lx: A sequence of murders had prompted the police to actions./r/n 一连串的谋杀迫使警方不得不采取行动。/r/n We will deal with events in historical sequence./r/n 我们将按照历史上的先后顺序研究这些事件。/r/n

word.name: sequencing
word.lx: The detection and recording of the sequencing of instructions in computer programs, for example, as used in monitors and debugging routines./r/n 对计算机程序中的指令序列的检测和记录，例如在监控程序和调试程序中使用的情况。/r/n

word.name: sequester
word.mean: vt. 使...隔绝(扣押,多价螯合)
word.lx: The retired film star sequestered herself from the world./r/n 这位退休的影星过着隐居的生活。/r/n

word.name: sequestrate
word.mean: vt. 扣押(查封,没收,多价螯合)

word.name: seraph
word.lx: Seraph is of the highest rank of angels in the Bible./r/n 六翼天使是圣经中级别最高的天使。/r/n

word.name: serenade
word.mean:
n. 夜曲,小夜曲
vt. 为...弹奏或歌唱小夜曲

word.name: serendipity
word.mean: n. 善于发掘新奇事物的天赋

word.name: serene
word.mean: a. 安详的,宁静的,平静的
word.lx: His serene smile calmed all of us down./r/n 他脸上安详的微笑使我们都冷静下来。/r/n The story took place in a serene summer night./r/n 故事发生在一个宁静的夏夜。/r/n

word.name: serenely
word.mean: ad. 安详地,宁静地,平静地

word.name: serf
word.lx: The serfs were liberated after abolishing serfdom./r/n 废除农奴制度后，农奴们获得了解放。/r/n Many serfs were forced to work hard./r/n 许多农奴被迫拼命工作。/r/n

word.name: serge
word.lx: He dresses in a blue serge suit./r/n 他穿着兰色的毛哔叽套服。/r/n

word.name: sergeant
word.lx: A sergeant asked the stranger to show his pass./r/n 警官要求这个陌生人出示通行证。/r/n The sergeant gave his men the commandAt ease!"/r/n 警官命令战士们“稍息！”/r/n"

word.name: serial
word.mean:
n. 序列,串列
a. 连续的,一连串的

word.name: serialize
word.mean: v. 写成连载长篇而刊登

word.name: series
word.lx: After a series of unsuccessful attempts, he has finally passed the driving test./r/n 经过连续几次的失败，他最后终于通过了驾驶考试。/r/n The theory is based on a series of wrong assumptions./r/n 这一理论是以一系列错误的设想为依据的。/r/n

word.name: serious
word.mean: a.严肃的,庄重的,严重的,危急的,认真的
word.lx: This company was in serious financial difficulties./r/n 这家公司陷入严重的财政困难。/r/n Do you think he is serious about leaving the company?/r/n 你认为他当真要离开公司吗？/r/n

word.name: seriously
word.mean: ad. 认真地,严肃地,严重地
word.lx: He was seriously injured in the traffic accident./r/n 他在车祸中受了重伤。/r/n Seriously damaged, the bridge is no longer in use./r/n 因受到严重损坏，这座桥不再使用了。/r/n

word.name: sermon
word.lx: The boy got a sermon from his father./r/n 这男孩受到他父亲的训斥。/r/n The priest preached a sermon on the need of charity./r/n 牧师在布道会上宣讲慈爱的必要。/r/n

word.name: serpent
word.mean: n. 蛇,蛇一般的人,狡猾的人
word.lx: Never cherish a serpent in your bosom./r/n 永远不要施恩于忘恩负义之人。/r/n The serpent fascinated its prey./r/n 蛇用目光吓住了它的猎物。/r/n

word.name: serpentine
word.mean:
a. 蛇的,层层卷绕的,阴险的
n. 蛇纹石,古时候大炮的一种,S字曲线
v. 缓慢地流
word.lx: Any of various green rocks, such as serpentine./r/n 蛇纹石一种绿色岩石，如蛇纹大理岩/r/n

word.name: serrated
word.mean: a. 锯齿状的, 有锯齿的

word.name: serried
word.mean: a. 密集的,林立的,重重叠叠罗列的

word.name: servant
word.lx: There were many servants in his house when he was young./r/n 他年轻的时候，家里有许多佣人。/r/n A politician should be a servant of the people./r/n 政治家应是人民的公仆。/r/n

word.name: serve
word.lx: She has served the family faithfully for thirty years./r/n 她为这个家忠心耿耿地操劳了30年。/r/n We are well served with gas in this town./r/n 这个城镇煤气供应得很好。/r/n

word.name: server
word.mean: n. 服伺者,服勤者,伺候者
word.lx: Servers stand there waiting for customs./r/n 服务员正站在那儿等顾客。/r/n Can you see the file on NT server?/r/n 你能在NT 服务器上看这个文件吗？/r/n

word.name: service
word.mean:
n. 服务,公务部门,服役
vt. 维护,保养
word.lx: The postal service here is very unreliable./r/n 这里的邮政服务很不可靠。/r/n You may need the services of a lawyer./r/n 你也许需要律师的帮助。/r/n

word.name: serviceable
word.lx: The tyres are worn but still serviceable./r/n 这些轮胎已磨损, 但尚可用./r/n He stated that in six weeks rush work would be required to repair the boilers to make them serviceable./r/n 他说，修理这这些锅炉，使之可以使用，需要六周的紧张工作。/r/n

word.name: servile
word.lx: His servile expression of praise for his employer was disgusting to me./r/n 他奉承雇主的那副奴颜婢膝的嘴脸令我恶心。/r/n An honest judge cannot be servile to public opinion./r/n 一个正直的法官不能一味顺从舆论。/r/n

word.name: servitude
word.lx: They spent their lives in servitude./r/n 他们在奴役下生活。/r/n Such a worker bound in servitude to a landlord creditor./r/n 雇农因欠地主债当雇工者，抵债苦工/r/n

word.name: set back
word.lx: The cold weather set back the planting by two weeks./r/n 寒冷的天气使插秧推迟两个星期。/r/n The heavy rain set back the building of the road by two weeks./r/n 这场大雨使道路的修建延缓了两星期。/r/n

word.name: settee
word.lx: The old settee will have to go./r/n 那个长靠椅该扔掉了./r/n

word.name: setter
word.mean: n. 安装者; 嵌镶工人; 排字工人; 作曲者;安置者,给定器,给定装置;长毛猎犬
word.lx: My wife is fond of chocolates; She has a very setter tooth./r/n 我的妻子喜欢巧克力，好吃甜食。/r/n

word.name: setting
word.mean: n. 安装,放置,周围,环境
word.lx: The cooker has several temperature settings./r/n 这个炉具有几个温度定位挡。/r/n The setting of the story is a hotel in paris during the war./r/n 故事发生在战时巴黎的一家旅馆里。/r/n

word.name: settle
word.mean:
n. 有背的长凳
v. 安放,安顿,定居,解决
word.lx: The two companies settled out of court./r/n 两家公司在法院外了结了争端。/r/n They moved the local people and settle them in another place./r/n 他们把当地人迁移到别处定居。/r/n

word.name: settlement
word.mean: 沉降, 解决, 结算,殖民(地), 租界; 居留地; 新建区; 住宅区
word.lx: The strikers have reached a settlement with the employers./r/n 罢工者与雇主已达成协议。/r/n The terms of the settlement seem just./r/n 和解的条件似乎还公道。/r/n

word.name: settler
word.lx: The settlers were soon acclimated./r/n 移居者很快就适应了。/r/n It is said that the first settlers of this country are prisoners./r/n 据说第一批到达这个国家的移民是囚犯。/r/n

word.name: seven
word.lx: Everything is at sixes and sevens in the house./r/n 家里现在乱七八糟。/r/n Two plus five is seven./r/n 二加五等于七。/r/n

word.name: sevenfold
word.mean:
a. 七倍的
ad. 七倍地

word.name: seventeenth
word.lx: I came in seventeenth place in the games./r/n 我获得了那项比赛的第十七名。/r/n Girls used to put their hair up on their seventeenth birthdays./r/n 过去姑娘们总是在17岁生日那天将头发向上扎起。/r/n

word.name: seventh
word.mean:
n. 七分之一
num.&a. 第七
word.lx: The child was in his seventh heaven with his new toys./r/n 那小孩玩着新玩具真是快乐极了。/r/n It has just entered the seventh edition./r/n 它刚出版了第七版。/r/n

word.name: seventy
word.lx: His grandfather is nearly seventy./r/n 他爷爷快七十岁了。/r/n The temperature today is seventy degrees Fahrenheit./r/n 今天气温是华氏七十度。/r/n

word.name: sever
word.lx: The rope severed under the strain./r/n 绳子拉紧后崩断了。/r/n The two countries have severed their relations./r/n 这两个国家已经断绝关系。/r/n

word.name: several
word.mean:
a. 几个,若干
pron. 几个
word.lx: I bought several books yesterday./r/n 我昨天买了好几本书。/r/n Several of the apples are bad./r/n 苹果中好几个烂了。/r/n

word.name: severely
word.mean: ad. 严重地(艰难地,紧凑地,纯朴地)
word.lx: Dangerous driving should be severely punished./r/n 危险驾驶应受严惩。/r/n These scum who fight at the football matches must be severely dealt with!/r/n 必须对那些专在足球比赛时打架的社会渣滓严加惩处！/r/n

word.name: sew
word.lx: Would you sew this button onto my shirt?/r/n 请你把这颗纽扣缝到我的衬衫上好吗？/r/n We should have the whole deal sewn up by the end of this week./r/n 到本周末，我们应该可以把整个交易谈妥。/r/n

word.name: sewage
word.lx: The grave problem of public hygiene is connected with the inefficient sewage system of the city./r/n 公共卫生方面的严重问题与该城低效率的污水处理系统有关。/r/n A pipe for carrying off water or sewage./r/n 排水管排水或污水的管子/r/n

word.name: sewer
word.mean: n. 下水道,阴沟,裁缝师
word.lx: The sewer in the toilet was blocked./r/n 卫生间的下水道堵住了。/r/n The place where a sewer, drain, or stream discharges./r/n 出水口阴沟、下水道或河流排水的地方/r/n

word.name: sewing
word.lx: You should oil the sewing machine to stop the squeaking./r/n 你应该给缝纫机上点油，以免发出轧轧声。/r/n Who has scrambled up my sewing things?/r/n 谁把我的针线活儿弄乱了?/r/n

word.name: sewing machine
word.lx: My mother-in-law has a sewing machine./r/n 我婆婆有一台缝纫机。/r/n You should oil the sewing machine to stop the squeaking./r/n 你应该给缝纫机上点油，以免发出轧轧声。/r/n

word.name: sextant
word.mean: n. 六分仪(航海定向仪器)
word.lx: A medieval instrument, now replaced by the sextant, that was once used to determine the altitude of the sun or other celestial bodies./r/n 星盘一种中世纪的仪器，曾用来测量太阳或其它天体的高度，现在已被六分仪取代/r/n

word.name: sexton
word.mean: n. 寺庙里的杂役,教堂司事
word.lx: The sexton is an old man./r/n 教堂司事是位老人。/r/n

word.name: sexual intercourse
word.lx: An evil spirit believed to descend upon and have sexual intercourse with women as they sleep./r/n 阴库巴斯恶鬼，梦淫妖据说会趁女人熟睡压而在女人身上并与其交配的恶鬼/r/n

word.name: sexuality
word.mean: n. 性别,性方面的事情,性欲

word.name: sexually
word.mean: ad. 性别地, 两性之间地
word.lx: Six women have been sexually assaulted in the area recently./r/n 最近这一带有六个女子遭受强奸猥亵。/r/n Some people are sexually excited by pornographic magazines./r/n 有的人看到色情杂志能激发起性欲。/r/n

word.name: shabby
word.lx: You look rather shabby in those clothes./r/n 你穿那种衣服显得很蹩脚。/r/n He is a tramp in shabby old clothes./r/n 他是个衣衫褴褛的流浪者。/r/n

word.name: shack
word.lx: The boy makes a shack out of the old board in the backyard./r/n 男孩们在後院用旧木板盖起一间小木屋。/r/n He was looking for a dame to shack up with when the police picked him up./r/n 他正在找女人鬼混的时候，警察把他逮住了。/r/n

word.name: shackle
word.mean:
n. 桎梏,束缚物
v. 加桎梏,加枷锁,束缚
word.lx: The prisoner was fastened by a shackle./r/n 那个犯人被手铐铐着。/r/n Nowadays, people have shaken off the shackles of some conventions./r/n 今天，人们已经摆脱了一些习俗的束缚。/r/n

word.name: shade
word.mean:
n. 色度,荫凉处,稍微
v. 渐变,遮蔽,微减
word.lx: This seat is shaded by a tree./r/n 这个座位有一棵树遮荫。/r/n There are no trees or bushes to give shade./r/n 没有树木或灌木丛可以遮荫。/r/n

word.name: shaded
word.lx: This seat is shaded by a tree./r/n 这个座位有一棵树遮荫。/r/n She shaded her eyes (from the sun) with her hand./r/n 她把手放在眼睛上方挡住阳光./r/n

word.name: shadow
word.mean:
n. 影像,阴暗,预兆
v. 遮蔽,使...忧沉,预示
word.lx: He walked along in the shadows hoping no one would recognize him./r/n 他走在暗处，希望没有人认出他来。/r/n The tree cast its shadow on the wall./r/n 树影映在墙上。/r/n

word.name: shadowy
word.mean: a. 有影的,暗黑的,朦胧的
word.lx: They dare not walk into the shadowy depths of the forest./r/n 他们不敢走入森林中阴暗的深处。/r/n Her face was dark in the shadowy place./r/n 在这阴暗的地方她脸色黝黑。/r/n

word.name: shady
word.mean: a. 荫凉的,成荫的,暗的
word.lx: He found a shady place where he could eat his lunch./r/n 他找了一处阴凉的地方吃了午饭。/r/n Thank you very much for those four wonderful days at Shady Acres!/r/n 我在荫园度过了四天美好的时光，非常感谢。/r/n

word.name: shaft
word.lx: The candidates exchanged shafts in the debate./r/n 候选人在辩论中唇枪舌箭。/r/n The archers sent their shafts through the air./r/n 弓箭手向空中射出利箭。/r/n

word.name: shaggy
word.mean: a. 毛发蓬松的,长浓而粗的,表面粗糙的
word.lx: He cleaned the mud off his shoes on the shaggy mat in front of the door./r/n 他在门前的粗糙的垫子上把鞋上的泥蹭掉。/r/n Her pet is a shaggy dog./r/n 她的宠物是一只毛粗而蓬松的狗。/r/n

word.name: shake
word.mean:
n. 摇动,震动
v. 摇动,动摇
word.lx: He shook his head in disapproval./r/n 他摇了摇头表示反对。/r/n His voice shook with fear./r/n 他害怕得声音发抖。/r/n

word.name: shaker
word.mean: n. 摇动器(振荡器,振打器,摇筛器,搅拌器,振动机)

word.name: Shakespeare
word.lx: Shakespeare is a giant among writers./r/n 莎士比亚是作家中的大文豪。/r/n I bought my son an adaptation for children of a play by Shakespeare./r/n 我给我儿子买了为儿童改编的莎士比亚剧本。/r/n

word.name: shaking
word.lx: The house shook./r/n 这房子摇动了。/r/n The man shook his fist angrily./r/n 他愤怒地挥动着拳头。/r/n

word.name: shaky
word.lx: Having a feeble or unsteady gait; shaky./r/n 不稳的，虚弱的；摇晃的/r/n Their marriage got off to rather a shaky start./r/n 他们的婚姻一开始就有些不稳固./r/n

word.name: shale
word.lx: Most of the rock in this mountain is shale./r/n 这座山上大部分的岩石都是页岩。/r/n The new process extracts oil from shale./r/n 这一新方法用于从页岩油里提炼出石油。/r/n

word.name: shall
word.lx: Shall I shut the door?/r/n 我关上门好吗？/r/n That was a moment that I shall never forget./r/n 那个时刻我永远不会忘记。/r/n

word.name: shallow
word.mean:
a. 浅的
n. (pl.)浅滩,浅处
word.lx: That dish is too shallow to serve soup in./r/n 那只盘子太浅了，不能盛汤。/r/n She has a rather shallow personality./r/n 她的个性相当浅薄。/r/n

word.name: shamble
word.mean:
v. 蹒跚地走,摇摇晃晃地走,摇晃不稳
n. 蹒跚,摇晃的脚步

word.name: shambles
word.mean: n. 混乱之处,凌乱的地点
word.lx: Your room is (in) a shambles. Tidy it up!/r/n 你的房间乱七八糟. 把它整理一下吧!/r/n It was a shambles that the fire left the building./r/n 这场火灾使这座建筑物留下的是一片废墟。/r/n

word.name: shame
word.mean:
n. 羞愧,遗憾的事
v. 使羞愧
word.lx: She was full of shame at her bad behavior./r/n 她对自己的不良行为感到羞耻。/r/n Such an act of cowardice by an officer shames his whole regiment./r/n 一个军官作出如此胆怯的行为使整个团都蒙受羞辱。/r/n

word.name: shameful
word.lx: It was shameful of them to surrender./r/n 他们投降是可耻的。/r/n These shameful manoeuvreswere aimed at securing his election./r/n 这种可耻的伎俩都是为了能让他当选./r/n

word.name: shamelessly
word.mean: ad. 不知羞耻地,不谦虚地

word.name: shampoo
word.mean:
n. 洗头(洗发剂)
vt 洗发
word.lx: A shampoo and set costs 8./r/n 洗头、 做头发共8英镑./r/n This shampoo will cure your dandruff./r/n 这种洗发水可除掉头皮屑./r/n

word.name: Shanghai
word.lx: Shanghai is a large city./r/n 上海是一个大城市。/r/n Our office has removed to Shanghai from Beijing./r/n 我们的办公室已从北京迁到上海。/r/n

word.name: shape
word.mean:
n. 形状,定形,身材
v. 定形,使...成形,塑造
word.lx: It was the Greeks who shaped the thinking of Western man./r/n 正是希腊人影响了西方人的思维。/r/n This island is triangular in shape./r/n 这个岛的外形呈三角形。/r/n

word.name: shapeless
word.mean: a. 无形状的(不象样的)
word.lx: Air is shapeless./r/n 空气是没有定形的。/r/n The apprehension she had felt had been shapeless./r/n 她感到一种难以名状的恐惧。/r/n

word.name: shaper
word.mean: n. 整形器(牛头刨床,脉冲形成电路,造型者)

word.name: shareholder
word.lx: He resigned in the face of mounting pressure from the shareholder./r/n 面临来自股东们日益增长的压力，他辞职了。/r/n The principal shareholder ask for a meeting./r/n 主要股东们要求召开会议。/r/n

word.name: shark
word.lx: That shark lent me money at very high interest rate./r/n 那个贪婪狡猾的人以很高的利率借给我钱。/r/n The shark is dangerous to swimmers./r/n 鲨鱼对游泳的人来说很危险。/r/n

word.name: sharp
word.mean:
a. 刺耳的,锋利的,急剧的
ad. [时刻]正,准
夏普(财富500强公司之一，总部所在地日本,主要经营电子电气)
word.lx: It was very sharp of you to have noticed that./r/n 你注意到了这一点是够机灵的。/r/n That woman has a very sharp tongue./r/n 那个女人说话非常尖刻。/r/n

word.name: sharpen
word.lx: Generations of urban living sharpened their wits./r/n 世代居住在城市里使他们磨练了才智。/r/n The soldiers sharpened up their knives./r/n 战士们把刀磨得锋利。/r/n

word.name: sharpener
word.mean: n. 研磨者,削的人,研磨工具

word.name: sharp-eyed
word.lx: A ,sharp-eyed police officer spotted the stolen car./r/n 那个目光敏锐的警察发现了那辆被盗的汽车./r/n

word.name: sharply
word.mean: ad. 锐利地,严厉地,厉害地

word.name: sharpness
word.lx: As he calmed down, the sharpness went out of his speech./r/n 他冷静下来，说话时火气也就减退了。/r/n Something resembling a nail in shape, sharpness, or use./r/n 钉状物在形状、锋利度或应用上类似指甲的东西/r/n

word.name: shatter
word.mean:
n. 碎片,乱七八糟的状态
v. 打碎,破掉
word.lx: My dreams have been shattered./r/n 我的梦想已经破灭了。/r/n The glass shattered./r/n 这杯子碎了。/r/n

word.name: shave
word.mean:
n. 修面,刮胡子,惊险的免脱
v. 修面,剃,掠过
word.lx: He had a shave and a bath./r/n 他刮了脸，又洗了澡。/r/n We could shave prices a little./r/n 我们可以稍微削减点价格。/r/n

word.name: shaving
word.lx: His shaving mirror was covered with condensation./r/n 他的剃须镜上有一层小水珠./r/n He cut himself/his face shaving./r/n 他刮胡须时割破了脸./r/n

word.name: Shaw
word.lx: George Bernard Shaw was well-known by his initials GBS./r/n 人们对萧伯纳姓名的首字母GBS非常熟悉./r/n Shaw was an artist with a difference./r/n 萧是个与众不同的艺术家啊。/r/n

word.name: shawl
word.lx: I gave her a knitted shawl as a Christmas gift./r/n 我送给她一条编织的披肩作圣诞礼物。/r/n She gathered the shawl round her/round her shoulders./r/n 她用披肩把自己[肩头]裹紧./r/n

word.name: she
word.lx: She is my sister./r/n 她是我姐姐。/r/n She can speak Japanese as well as English./r/n 她会说日语和英语。/r/n

word.name: sheaf
word.lx: The speaker had a sheaf of notes on the desk in front of him./r/n 演讲者在他面前的桌子上放着一叠笔记。/r/n

word.name: shear
word.mean:
n. 修剪,剪下的东西,羊的一岁
v. 修剪,割,剥夺
word.lx: All her curls have been shorn off./r/n 她的一头卷发被剪得精光。/r/n With a few quick snips of the shears he pruned the bush./r/n 他用大剪刀几下子就把灌木给修剪好了./r/n

word.name: shears
word.lx: He is cutting the branches with a pair of shears./r/n 他正用一把大剪刀剪树枝。/r/n One that cuts, shears, or clips./r/n 修剪工切、剪或削的人/r/n

word.name: sheathe
word.mean:
v. 包,插入鞘,覆
vt. 包,盖
word.lx: He sheathed his sword./r/n 他把剑插进鞘里./r/n The two opponents decided at last to sheathe the sword and met at a dinner given by their friend./r/n 这两个对手终于决定讲和，在朋友举行的晚宴上会面了。/r/n

word.name: sheen
word.mean:
n. 光辉,光彩,光泽
a. 光辉的,发光的,有光泽的
word.lx: Her face glowed with a healthy red sheen./r/n 她的脸上闪着健康的红光。/r/n The pearly sheen absorbed many people./r/n 珍珠的光泽吸引了很多人。/r/n

word.name: sheep
word.lx: He is as timid as a sheep./r/n 他象绵羊一样怯懦。/r/n Will the hedge keep the sheep out of the field?/r/n 这篱笆能将羊群挡在田地外面吗？/r/n

word.name: sheet
word.mean:
n. 床单,张,片
v. 盖上被单,遍布
word.lx: They wrapped fish and chips in a sheet of newspaper./r/n 他们把鱼和马铃薯片用一张报纸包起来。/r/n The rain was coming down in sheets./r/n 大雨滂沱而下。/r/n

word.name: sheets
word.lx: Give the sheets a good boil to get them white./r/n 把被单好好煮一煮，好让它们白一些。/r/n The child had been sleeping face down. His mother turned him up and tucked up the sheets./r/n 那孩子趴着睡觉，她母亲把他翻过身，然后塞好被单。/r/n

word.name: sheik
word.mean: n. (阿拉伯人的)家长,族长,酋长

word.name: sheila
word.lx: Sheila was the first to arrive./r/n 希拉是第一个到达的./r/n Sheila is very clever but rather backward in expressing her ideas./r/n 希拉很聪明, 然而在表达思想时却有些腼腆./r/n

word.name: shelf
word.lx: There were a lot of books on the shelves along the walls./r/n 靠墙的书架上有许多书。/r/n This shelf was made of synthetic resin./r/n 这个架子是合成树脂做的。/r/n

word.name: shell
word.mean:
n. 贝壳,壳,外形
v. 去壳,脱落
n.[计算机] DOS命令 : 安装备用的COMMAND.COM文件, 并改变环境尺寸
word.lx: She was shelling peas./r/n 她在剥豌豆荚。/r/n There is an ornament made of shells on the wall./r/n 墙上有一个贝壳做成的装饰品。/r/n

word.name: shellfish
word.lx: The idea of eating raw shellfish nauseates me./r/n 我一想到吃生贝就恶心./r/n A rich, creamy soup made from meat, fish, or shellfish./r/n 虾味奶油浓汤一种由肉、鱼或贝壳制成的含大量奶油的浓汤/r/n

word.name: shelter
word.mean:
n. 庇护所,避难所,庇护
v. 庇护,保护,隐匿
word.lx: In the storm I took shelter under the tree./r/n 暴风雨时，我正在树下躲避。/r/n These plants must be sheltered from direct sunlight./r/n 这种植物必须遮起来，免受阳光直射。/r/n

word.name: sheltered
word.mean: a. 受保护的；受庇护的

word.name: shelve
word.lx: Those rare books are shelved in the East Library./r/n 那些珍贵的书籍都放在图书馆东馆的架子上。/r/n They had to shelve their holiday plans because their son was ill./r/n 他们不得不把度假计划搁置，因为他们的儿子病了。/r/n

word.name: shelves
word.lx: He chose a book at a venture from the shelves./r/n 他从书架上随便挑了一本书。/r/n The river-bottom shelves here./r/n 河底从这里呈缓坡倾斜./r/n

word.name: shepherd
word.mean:
n. 牧羊者,牧师,指导者
v. 看守,领导,指导
word.lx: The teacher was shepherding the group of children into the bus./r/n 老师照管着一群孩子上公共汽车。/r/n The poor boy was hired as a shepherd when he was only ten./r/n 这个贫穷的小男孩在他十岁的时候就被雇为羊倌。/r/n

word.name: Sherpa
word.mean: n. 夏尔巴人(西藏的一个种族)

word.name: shield
word.mean:
n. 盾,防卫物
v. 保护,遮蔽
word.lx: The shield protected him from the blows of his enemy./r/n 这盾牌保护他免受敌人的打击。/r/n Motorcyclists must wear helmets to shield them from injury./r/n 摩托车手必须戴头盔保护自己免受伤害。/r/n

word.name: shielding
word.mean:
n. 防护(防护层)
a. 屏蔽的(防护的)
word.lx: The shield protected him from the blows of his enemy./r/n 这盾牌保护他免受敌人的打击。/r/n Motorcyclists must wear helmets to shield them from injury./r/n 摩托车手必须戴头盔保护自己免受伤害。/r/n

word.name: shift
word.mean:
n. 变化,移动,接班
v. 改变,移转
word.lx: A sudden shift in the wind warned of the coming storm./r/n 风向的突然转变预示着暴风雨即将来临。/r/n The Left is shifting its ground./r/n 左派正在改变立场。/r/n

word.name: shiftless
word.mean: a. 无计谋的,不中用的,无能的
word.lx: A lazy or shiftless person, especially one who seeks to live solely by the support of others./r/n 懒鬼，游手好闲的人一个懒惰或得过且过的人，尤指靠别人施舍过生活的人/r/n

word.name: shifty
word.lx: A shifty, dishonest person; a trickster./r/n 骗子惯耍花招的、不诚实的人；骗子/r/n

word.name: shilling
word.lx: Twenty shillings were equal to one pound before 1971./r/n 1971年前，二十先令等于一英镑。/r/n A gold coin issued in England from1663 to1813 and worth one pound and one shilling./r/n 畿尼1663年到1813年之间英国发行的金币，价值相当于一磅一先令/r/n

word.name: shimmer
word.mean:
n. 微光,闪光
v. 发闪烁之光
word.lx: The hot pavement sent up shimmers./r/n 晒热的道路浮起热气晃动的景象。/r/n

word.name: shin
word.lx: I got kicked on the shin./r/n 我的胫骨被踢了一脚。/r/n His elbow was poking through his torn shin sleeve./r/n 他的肘从衬衫的破袖子中露出。/r/n

word.name: shine
word.mean:
n. 光泽,阳光
v. 使发光,发亮
word.lx: The curtain was suddenly drawn and a bright light shone in./r/n 突然窗帘拉了开来，一道强光照了进来。/r/n Would you put a good shine on these boots?/r/n 你把这些靴子好好擦一下好吗？/r/n

word.name: shingle
word.mean:
n. 木瓦(小圆石)
vt 盖以木瓦(挤压,锻铁)
word.lx: I prefer a sandy beach to a shingle one./r/n 我喜欢沙滩，不喜欢遍布小石子的海滩./r/n The roof of our house is covered by shingles./r/n 我家的屋顶是用木瓦铺的。/r/n

word.name: shiny
word.mean: a. 有光泽的,发光的,辉煌的
word.lx: He puts grease on his hair to make it shiny./r/n 他给头发擦上发油使它发亮。/r/n He has a shiny bald pate./r/n 他是个亮光光的秃顶。/r/n

word.name: ship
word.mean:
n. 船,舰
v. 以船运送,乘船,运送
word.lx: The oil company will ship out piping and heavy equipment./r/n 这家石油公司将用船运出输油管道和重型设备。/r/n The ship was due to sail the following morning./r/n 这艘船定于第二天启航。/r/n

word.name: shipment
word.lx: The merchant had received a shipment of tea./r/n 这个商人收到了一船茶叶。/r/n The goods were inspected by the China Commodity Inspection Bureau before shipment./r/n 这批货在装船前由中国商品检验局进行过检验。/r/n

word.name: shipping
word.mean: n. 船运(发货,运输,乘船)
word.lx: We agree to postpone the shipping date, considering (that) there is no steamer recently./r/n 由于（考虑到）最近无船，我们同意推迟装期。/r/n A box for shipping fruit or vegetables./r/n 果箱，蔬菜箱用来运输水果或蔬菜的包装箱/r/n

word.name: shipshape
word.mean: a. 整洁的,井然有序的

word.name: shipwreck
word.mean:
n. 遇难船,海难
v. 遇海难,破减
word.lx: The shipwrecked sailors were rescued by helicopter./r/n 遭遇海难的水手已经被直升机救起。/r/n The news of shipwreck soon spread out widely./r/n 船只失事的消息很快就广泛地传开了。/r/n

word.name: shipyard
word.lx: A new-type ocean-going freighter is being laid down at that shipyard./r/n 一艘新型的远洋货轮正在那家船厂建造。/r/n Two hundred redundancies were announced in the shipyards./r/n 造船厂公布削减二百名工人./r/n

word.name: shire
word.lx: The tory party is very strong in the shire./r/n 保守党在农村各郡势力很强。/r/n I can wear a red tie with a pink shire if I want to. What of it?/r/n 我愿意的话，我可以扎红色领带，穿粉红色衬衫，那又有什么不行呢？/r/n

word.name: Shirley
word.lx: Shirley will try out for the lead in the play./r/n 雪莉将参加该剧主角的选拔演出。/r/n Shirley had to make over her dress because it was too big./r/n 那件衣服太大了，雪莉只好把它改一下。/r/n

word.name: shirt
word.lx: My husband has several shirts of different colors./r/n 我丈夫有好几件颜色不同的衬衫。/r/n Would you sew this button onto my shirt?/r/n 请你把这颗纽扣缝到我的衬衫上好吗？/r/n

word.name: shiver
word.mean:
vt. 颤动(碎裂)
n. 冷颤(碎块)
word.lx: The child shivered from the cold./r/n 这孩子冷得发抖。/r/n I could not repress a shiver whenever I thought of him./r/n 我一想到他就忍不住颤抖。/r/n

word.name: shivery
word.lx: I feel shivery and I have gotten a sore throat./r/n 我觉得怕冷发抖，而且喉咙疼痛。/r/n

word.name: shoal
word.mean:
a. 浅的
n. 鱼群
v. 浅滩
word.lx: Shoals of tourists come here in the summer./r/n 这里夏季常有大批游客。/r/n The boat struck a shoal and fetched up all standing./r/n 那艘船撞上浅滩突然停了下来。/r/n

word.name: shock
word.mean:
n. 震动,冲突,震惊
v. 震动,冲突,使...受电击
