word.lx: Anyone touching that wire could get badly shocked./r/n 任何人碰到那根电线都会遭到严重的电击。/r/n His death was a great shock to us all./r/n 他的死使我们大家都大为震惊。/r/n

word.name: shocked
word.lx: His behavior was, in a word, shocking./r/n 总之，他的行为是令人震惊的。/r/n Anyone touching that wire could get badly shocked./r/n 任何人碰到那根电线都会遭到严重的电击。/r/n

word.name: shocking
word.lx: Causing shock or horror; gruesome./r/n 可怕的导致惊吓或恐惧的；可憎的/r/n What a shocking state of affairs!/r/n 局势真惊人哪!/r/n

word.name: shoddy
word.mean:
n. 次品
a. 劣质的

word.name: shoemaker
word.lx: Adam Smith is a famous shoemaker in town./r/n 亚当·史密斯是镇上有名的鞋匠。/r/n

word.name: shoes
word.lx: The shoes are a perfect fit./r/n 这双鞋子穿着非常合脚。/r/n Her shoes chafed the skin on her feet./r/n 鞋子擦破了她脚上的皮肤。/r/n

word.name: shoestring
word.mean:
a. 小本经营的
n. 零星资本,小额资本

word.name: shone
word.lx: The moonlight shone on the calm sea./r/n 月光映在平静的海面上。/r/n The curtain was suddenly drawn and a bright light shone in./r/n 突然窗帘拉了开来，一道强光照了进来。/r/n

word.name: shook
word.lx: He shook his head in disapproval./r/n 他摇了摇头表示反对。/r/n They shook hands with each other and then sat down./r/n 他们握了握手, 然后坐了下来。/r/n

word.name: shoot
word.mean:
n. 射击,芽,发射
v. 射击,发出,发芽
word.lx: He invited us to his country estate for a weekend shoot./r/n 他邀请我们到他乡下的庄园去过一次打猎的周末。/r/n The film was shot in black and white./r/n 这部电影拍成了黑白片。/r/n

word.name: shooter
word.lx: A large playing marble, often used as the shooter./r/n 大弹子经常用来击打其它弹子的大理石弹子/r/n

word.name: shooting star
word.lx: Do you wish when you see a shooting star?/r/n 你看见流星时提出愿望吗？/r/n

word.name: shoots
word.lx: New buildings sprang up like bamboo shoots after a spring rain./r/n 新的建筑物如雨后春笋般大批出现。/r/n The trees send out new shoots in spring./r/n 春天绿树发新芽。/r/n

word.name: shop
word.mean:
n. 商店
v. 购物
word.lx: The local dress shop is having a sale./r/n 附近的时装店正在大拍卖。/r/n I usually go shopping on Sundays./r/n 我通常星期天购物。/r/n

word.name: shoplifter
word.mean: n. 在商店中行窃的小偷

word.name: shopper
word.lx: An indiscriminate shopper; indiscriminate taste in music./r/n 无选择的购物者；在音乐上无特殊品味的/r/n The shopper is showered with broken glass from the explosion./r/n 炸碎的玻璃劈头盖脸地落到购物顾客的身上。/r/n

word.name: shopping
word.lx: I went out on a shopping spree./r/n 我出去疯狂地购物。/r/n You may go grass skiing, bicycle riding, or shopping on the weekend./r/n 周末你可以去滑草，骑脚踏车，或购物。/r/n

word.name: shore
word.mean:
n. 岸,滨
vt. (up)支撑,支持
word.lx: We found many beautiful shells on the shore./r/n 我们在岸边找到了好多美丽的贝壳。/r/n The villagers shored up sagging huts./r/n 村民们撑起摇摇欲坠的茅棚。/r/n

word.name: shorn
word.lx: The room looked bare, shorn of its rich furnishings./r/n 这个房间除去了豪华的家具以後, 看上去光秃秃的./r/n He was shorn of his privileges./r/n 他的特权被剥夺了。/r/n

word.name: short
word.mean:
a. 短的,矮的
n. 短裤
adv. 短暂地；突然地,急地
word.lx: The driver stopped short when the children ran into the street./r/n 小孩跑进街道时，司机猛然煞车。/r/n He seems much shorter without his shoes on./r/n 他没穿鞋，看上去矮多了。/r/n

word.name: short-circuit
word.mean:
v. 使...不工作
vt. 使简短

word.name: shortcoming
word.lx: No matter who point out our shortcoming, we will correct them./r/n 不管谁指出我们的缺点，我们都改正。/r/n Donna is sensible of his shortcoming./r/n 唐纳知道他自己的缺点。/r/n

word.name: shorten
word.lx: She shortened the shirt by an inch./r/n 她把衬衫截短了一英寸。/r/n My teacher asked me to shorten the report to one page./r/n 老师让我把报告缩短为一页。/r/n

word.name: shorthand
word.lx: You know how I loathe typing and shorthand./r/n 你知道我多么讨厌打字和速记。/r/n His farewell speech was transcribed from shorthand notes./r/n 他的告别演说是由速记转译而成的。/r/n

word.name: short-lived
word.mean: a. 短命的, 短暂的, 短期的, 无常的

word.name: shortly
word.lx: The movie was over shortly before six./r/n 电影在六点钟不到就结束了。/r/n She died in an accident shortly afterwards./r/n 不久以后，她就在一次事故中丧生。/r/n

word.name: shorts
word.lx: This pair of pant was converted into shorts./r/n 这条裤子被改成了短裤。/r/n Pants, such as blue jeans, made into shorts by cutting off part of the legs./r/n 毛边短裤长裤，如蓝布牛仔裤，通过截去裤腿的一部分而制成的短裤/r/n

word.name: shortsighted
word.lx: He was too shortsighted to focus on the object./r/n 他由於近视过深而无法把视力焦点对准在该物体上。/r/n He is shortsighted./r/n 他是近视眼。/r/n

word.name: shot
word.mean:
n. 炮弹,射击,射手
v. 射击,发出,发芽
vbl. 射击,发出,发芽
word.lx: I heard a shot in his room./r/n 我听到他的房间内一声枪响。/r/n He won the golf match by two shots./r/n 他以两杆的成绩赢得了这场高尔夫球赛。/r/n

word.name: shot put
word.mean: n. [体]推铅球, 铅球的一次投射

word.name: should
word.lx: I knew if I kept at it I should succeed./r/n 我知道如果我坚持下去就会成功。/r/n You really ought to/should do something about that cough!/r/n 你咳嗽那麽厉害, 真得治一治了!/r/n

word.name: shoulder
word.mean:
n. 肩膀
v. 肩负,承担
vt. 承担,肩负
word.lx: The soldiers shouldered their kit and moved on./r/n 士兵们背起行装，继续前进。/r/n The boy had a parrot on his right shoulder./r/n 男孩把一只鹦鹉放在右肩上。/r/n

word.name: shoulders
word.lx: Her wavy hair fell in loose wisps and loops upon her shoulders./r/n 她那一头波浪般的长发一簇簇一圈圈地散垂在肩上。/r/n The officer wears sashes on his shoulders./r/n 这名军官的肩上佩戴着肩带。/r/n

word.name: shout
word.mean:
n. 呼喊,突发的大笑
v. 呼喊,高声谈笑,玩乐
word.lx: His news was greeted with shouts of joy./r/n 大家都对他的消息报以欢呼。/r/n The children on the sand were shouting with excitement./r/n 沙滩上的孩子们兴奋得大喊大叫。/r/n

word.name: shovel
word.mean:
n. 铲(挖斗机,一铲的量)
vt 铲(挖,舀)
word.lx: He put a shovel of coal on to the fire./r/n 他往火炉里加了一铲煤。/r/n They were shoveling food into their mouths./r/n 他们正大口大口地往嘴里塞食物。/r/n

word.name: show
word.mean:
n. 显示,表现,表演
v. 表示,显现,展现
word.lx: One evening the school showed a cowboy film./r/n 有天晚上学校放映了一部西部片。/r/n The leader rarely shows herself in public./r/n 这位领导她很少在公众场合露面。/r/n

word.name: show business
word.lx: For this old trouper there is still no business like show business./r/n 对这位老剧团演员来说仍然是娱乐性行业最好。/r/n

word.name: shower
word.mean:
n. 阵雨,淋浴
v. 淋浴,淋湿,下骤雨
word.lx: Dates showered down when we shook the tree./r/n 我们摇树时，枣子纷纷落下。/r/n The dancer was showered with praise./r/n 那个跳舞的人备受称赞。/r/n

word.name: showing
word.lx: Possessing or showing knowledge or intelligence; perceptive and well-informed./r/n 有见识的，知识渊博的掌握或显示出知识或智力的；有洞察力的而且见识广的/r/n Stop showing off in front of everybody./r/n 别再在大伙跟前卖弄了。/r/n

word.name: showman
word.mean: n. 马戏团的老板,玩杂耍的

word.name: shown
word.lx: In his youth, he had shown great promise./r/n 他在青少年时代就显得很有出息。/r/n The girls screamed when the grisly remains of the half-eaten corpses on the screen were shown./r/n 当屏幕上显示出尸体被吃掉一半的恐怖残骸时，女孩子们尖叫起来。/r/n

word.name: showpiece
word.mean: n. 展览品(供展览的样品)

word.name: showroom
word.lx: Police restored the stolen jewels to the showroom./r/n 警方将被盗的珠宝交还给了陈列室./r/n Our entire range of cars is now on view at your local showroom./r/n 我们各种型号的汽车现正在贵区陈列室里展出。/r/n

word.name: showy
word.lx: A bauble is a showy ornament of little value./r/n 廉价珠宝是华而不实的装饰品。/r/n A showy manner or display./r/n 炫耀炫耀的态度或展示/r/n

word.name: shrank
word.lx: As he moved threateningly forward she shrank (back) from him./r/n 他步步逼近, 把她吓得直（向後）退缩./r/n The dough shrank slowly in the cold air./r/n 面团在冷空气中慢慢收缩了./r/n

word.name: shred
word.mean:
n. 碎布条,细片,些少
v. 撕成碎片,变成碎片
word.lx: I was shredding top-secret documents at that time./r/n 我当时正把机密文件切碎。/r/n The jacket was torn to shreds by the barbed wire./r/n 那件夹克让铁丝网给戳破了。/r/n

word.name: shrew
word.lx: People called her shrew./r/n 人们叫她泼妇。/r/n

word.name: shrewd
word.lx: He is a shrewd and sometimes ruthless adversary./r/n 他是个精明的、有时候冷酷无情的对手。/r/n It was a shrewd assessment and probably pretty close to the truth./r/n 这个评估很有道理，可能相当正确。/r/n

word.name: shriek
word.mean:
n. 尖叫,叫喊
v. 尖叫
word.lx: My sister gave a shriek of delight./r/n 我妹妹高兴地尖叫起来。/r/n She shrieked in alarm./r/n 她惊恐地尖叫起来。/r/n

word.name: shrill
word.mean:
n. 尖锐的声音
a. 尖锐的,刺耳的
v. 用尖锐的声音说,发出刺耳声
word.lx: Shrill protests about the new taxes filled the air./r/n 广播中充斥着对新税法的尖锐抗议。/r/n The boys broke into shrill, excited cheering./r/n 男孩子们突然迸发出刺耳的兴奋的欢呼声。/r/n

word.name: shrilly
word.lx: The monkeys cry (out) shrilly when they see danger./r/n 猴子遇到危险时尖声大叫./r/n

word.name: shrimp
word.lx: Jumbo shrimp; a jumbo jet./r/n 大虾；巨型喷气式飞机/r/n Fruit cocktail; shrimp cocktail./r/n 水果鸡尾酒；河虾鸡尾酒/r/n

word.name: shrine
word.mean:
n. 圣地,神龛,庙
v. 将...置于神龛内

word.name: shrink
word.mean:
n. 收缩,萎缩
v. 收缩,退缩,萎缩
word.lx: He had a tendency to shrink up whenever attention was focused on him./r/n 当别人注意他时，他就会退缩一旁。/r/n The economy is shrinking instead of growing./r/n 经济正在萎缩而不是在增长中。/r/n

word.name: shrivel
word.mean:
v. 枯萎,皱缩
vi. 枯萎,干枯
word.lx: The leaves shriveled up in the sun./r/n 叶子在阳光下都蔫了。/r/n The dry air shrivels the leather./r/n 因空气干燥皮子都皱了。/r/n

word.name: shroud
word.mean:
n. 寿衣,覆盖物,船之横桅索
v. 包以尸衣,遮蔽,隐藏
word.lx: The doctor wanted us to use the sheet for a shroud./r/n 医生想让我们用床单当裹尸布。/r/n The whole jail was shrouded in darkness./r/n 整座监狱笼罩在黑暗之中。/r/n

word.name: shrub
word.lx: The naughty boy hid the books in the shrub./r/n 这个淘气的孩子把书藏在了灌木丛里。/r/n Resembling a shrub, especially in having woody stems and branches./r/n 灌木状的类似灌木的，尤指有木质树干或树枝/r/n

word.name: shrubbery
word.lx: A secluded mansion, islanded by shrubbery and fences./r/n 用灌木丛和篱笆隔开的一座幽独的大宅/r/n

word.name: shrug
word.mean:
n. 耸肩
v. 耸肩
word.lx: She gave a shrug and walked away./r/n 她耸了耸肩就离开了。/r/n I really admire the way she is able to shrug off unfair criticism./r/n 我很佩服她能对错误的批评意见不予理会。/r/n

word.name: shrunken
word.mean:
v. 使...收缩
a. 缩拢的

word.name: shudder
word.mean:
n. 战悚,发抖
v. 战悚,发抖
word.lx: She shuddered at the sight of the dead body./r/n 她一看到死尸就战栗起来。/r/n He shuddered with cold./r/n 他冷得发抖。/r/n

word.name: shun
word.lx: This recluse shunned all company./r/n 这位隐士不与任何人来往。/r/n His friends shunned him./r/n 他的朋友都避开他。/r/n

word.name: shunt
word.mean:
vt. 分路(调车,推给别人,拖延)
n. 分路(转辙器,调轨)
word.lx: She tried to shunt the blame onto Miss Williams./r/n 她试图把责任推至威廉姆斯小姐身上。/r/n Can we shunt the talks onto a new topic?/r/n 我们谈话换个新话题好吧？/r/n

word.name: shut
word.mean:
a. 关闭的,合拢的,围绕的
v. 关上,闭起,幽禁
vbl. 关上,闭起,幽禁
word.lx: He shut himself away for a month to catch up on his academic work./r/n 他与世隔绝一个月，力图把功课赶上去。/r/n He shut his eyes to her faults./r/n 他对她的缺点视而不见。/r/n

word.name: shutter
word.mean:
n. 百叶窗,遮门,快门
v. 装以遮门,以百叶窗遮闭
word.lx: He adjusted the shutter before taking a photo./r/n 在照相前，他调整了快门。/r/n The shop-front is fitted with rolling shutters./r/n 那商店的店面装有卷动门帘./r/n

word.name: shuttle
word.mean:
n. 穿梭,往返移动之物
v. 使...穿梭移动
word.lx: We shuttled the passengers to the city center by helicopter./r/n 我们来来回回地用直升机把旅客运送到市中心。/r/n There is a shuttle service between the city center and the air station./r/n 在市中心和飞机场之间有往返的穿梭运行班车。/r/n

word.name: shuttlecock
word.mean:
n. 羽毛球,玩毽子,打羽毛球
v. 互相授受,这儿那儿移动

word.name: shy
word.mean:
a. 害羞的
vi. 惊退,畏缩
word.lx: He was too shy to talk to anyone at the party./r/n 在晚会上他很腼腆，没有和任何人讲话。/r/n We are still a little shy of our quota./r/n 我们离完成定额还差一点点。/r/n

word.name: Shylock
word.mean: 夏洛克, 狠毒无情的放高利贷者(原为莎士比亚剧作《威尼斯商人》中的犹太放高利贷者)
word.lx: Jacob was at his best in the role of Shylock; he did not merely act; he lived the part./r/n 雅各布最擅长扮演夏洛克这个角色，他不仅是在演戏，而是把角色演活了。/r/n Shylock has an itch for money./r/n 夏洛克渴望发财。/r/n

word.name: shyly
word.lx: She glanced shyly at him and then lowered her eyes./r/n 她羞怯地偷看了他一下, 随即垂下眼帘./r/n She cast her eyes down shyly./r/n 她羞怯地垂下目光。/r/n

word.name: siamang
word.mean: n. [动]合趾猴( 产于马来半岛及苏门答腊)

word.name: Siberia
word.lx: Cold, dry winds from Siberia prevail over the mainland from December to February./r/n 从12月到2月，西伯利亚来的干燥冷风控制大陆。/r/n The cold air masses are moving from Siberia towards Inner Mongolia./r/n 冷空气团正由西伯利亚向内蒙古移动。/r/n

word.name: Siberian
word.lx: For long stretch of the try- siberian railway, all you see are trees./r/n 横跨西伯利亚的铁路沿线的景色是一望无际的树林。/r/n

word.name: sibling
word.lx: I have two brothers and a sister: three siblings in all./r/n 我有两个哥哥和一个妹妹: 共有三个兄妹./r/n Inferior craft; felt inferior to his older sibling./r/n 低等的手工艺品；感到比他的兄妹们低一等/r/n

word.name: sibylline
word.mean: a. sibyl 的,sibyl 性的,预言性的

word.name: Sicily
word.lx: A peninsula of northeast Tunisia extending into the Mediterranean Sea across from Sicily./r/n 波恩角突尼斯东北部延伸入地中海的一个半岛，在西西里岛对面/r/n

word.name: sick leave
word.lx: He has been on sick leave for some weeks, and so he has to work hard to catch us all up./r/n 他因为请了几个星期的病假，因此不得不加紧工作来赶上我们大家。/r/n

word.name: sicken
word.lx: The dog began to sicken and soon died./r/n 这只狗开始生病并且很快就死了。/r/n Cruelty sickens most of us./r/n 我们大多数人都对残暴行为十分愤慨./r/n

word.name: sickening
word.lx: The car hit the child with a sickening thud./r/n 汽车把那个孩子撞了, 发出一声可怕的闷响./r/n Sickening or insipid in taste./r/n （味道上）令人作呕的，淡而无味的/r/n

word.name: sickle
word.lx: There is a picture of the sickle on the flag./r/n 旗帜上有镰刀的图案。/r/n

word.name: sickly
word.mean:
a. 病弱的,阴沉的,无精打采的
v. 成苍白色
word.lx: His face was a sickly yellow./r/n 他的脸色是一种病态的黄。/r/n Her cheeks have a sickly pallor./r/n 她面色苍白带有病容./r/n

word.name: sickness
word.lx: Chicken pox is a common childhood sickness./r/n 水痘是一种常见的儿童期疾病。/r/n Some people develop altitude sickness when climbing high mountains./r/n 有些人在爬高山时会发生高山反应。/r/n

word.name: side
word.mean:
n. 旁边,侧,方面
a. 旁的,侧的
v. 偏袒
word.lx: A square has four sides but a circle has no sides./r/n 正方形有四条边，而圆形没有边。/r/n The thief slipped away down a side street./r/n 小偷悄悄从一条小马路溜走了。/r/n

word.name: sideboard
word.lx: She put some plates in the sideboard./r/n 她往餐具柜里放了些盘子。/r/n We keep the silver in this sideboard./r/n 我们把金属餐具放在这个餐具柜里./r/n

word.name: sidewalk
word.lx: I happened to meet him on the sidewalk./r/n 我碰巧在人行道上碰到他。/r/n A hedge of spectators along the sidewalk./r/n 沿着人行道形成了一道观众障碍/r/n

word.name: sideways
word.mean:
ad. 向傍边,斜地里,向侧面地
a. 傍边的,向侧面的

word.name: siege
word.lx: The army has laid siege to the city several months./r/n 部队包围了这城市好几个月。/r/n Joan of Arc led a large army to raise the siege of Orleans in1429./r/n 贞德在1429年率大军解除了英军对奥尔良的围攻。/r/n

word.name: sieve
word.mean:
n. 筛子,粗篮,说话轻率不能保密的人
v. 筛,滤
word.lx: She is sieving the rice in order to sieve out the stones./r/n 她正在把米过筛，好把石头筛出。/r/n We can separate the stones out with a sieve./r/n 我们可以用一个筛子把石头分离出来。/r/n

word.name: sift
word.lx: Sift the flour before making the cake./r/n 做蛋糕前先把面粉筛一下。/r/n Snow sifted through the crack in the roof into the room./r/n 雪从屋顶上的裂缝飘进屋里。/r/n

word.name: sigh
word.mean:
n. 叹息
v. 叹息之声,渴望
word.lx: She looked out of the window, sighing for her lost youth./r/n 她看着窗外，为她失去的青春而惋惜。/r/n We all heaved a sigh of relief when we heard that they were safe./r/n 当我们听说他们平安无事时，都松了一口气。/r/n

word.name: sight
word.mean:
n. 景观,视力,眼界
v. 看见,瞄准,观看
word.lx: The train is still in sight./r/n 火车仍在视线内。/r/n We laughed at the sight of his strange clothes./r/n 一看到他古怪的穿着，我们就笑了。/r/n

word.name: sighting
word.lx: They reported sighting the plane./r/n 他们宣称看见了那架飞机./r/n He drove straight by sighting along the center line./r/n 他注视着中央线，驾车径直向前驶去。/r/n

word.name: sights
word.lx: Come and see the sights of London./r/n 来看看伦敦的名胜./r/n The sights of the city never fail to impress foreign tourists./r/n 外国游客无一不对该市留有深刻印象./r/n

word.name: sightseeing
word.lx: They embarked on an orgy of sightseeing./r/n 他们开始尽情地观光游览。/r/n Good morning, Mr.Smith. Sightseeing is our agenda today./r/n 早上好，史密斯先生。我们今天的日程安排是游览。/r/n

word.name: sign
word.mean:
n. 符号,正负号,手势,迹象,招牌
v. 签，做手势，做标记
word.lx: Dark clouds are a sign of rain or snow./r/n 乌云是雨或雪将至的预兆。/r/n The football team has signed two new players./r/n 该足球队已签约聘用了两名新队员。/r/n

word.name: sign language
word.lx: The speech was interpreted in sign language for the hearing-impaired./r/n 这次讲话因那些听力受损者而译成了手语/r/n

word.name: signal
word.mean:
n. 信号,导火线,动机
v. 向...作信号
word.lx: A red lamp is often a danger signal./r/n 红灯常常是危险的信号。/r/n The police signalled the traffic to move forward slowly./r/n 警察向来往车辆打信号，示意缓慢前行。/r/n

word.name: signer
word.mean:
签名人
(用手势) 示意者
[Signer ]美国独立宣言署名人

word.name: signing
word.lx: Make sure you read all the small print before signing./r/n 一定要先看清小号字体印刷部分再签字./r/n The workers were railroaded into signing the agreement./r/n 工人们被逼着匆忙地签订了这个协议。/r/n

word.name: signor
word.lx: Shylock [To Antonio] Rest you fair, good signor; Your worship was the last man in our mouths./r/n 夏洛克：［向安冬尼奥］您好，好先生：是哪一阵好风把尊驾吹了来啦？/r/n

word.name: signpost
word.mean: n. 招牌柱,广告柱,路标
word.lx: Is the road well signposted?/r/n 这条路的路标清楚吗？/r/n The signpost indicates the right way to go./r/n 路标标示正确的前进路线。/r/n

word.name: silent
word.mean: a. 安静的,不吵闹的,沉默的,无言的
word.lx: If you are arrested you have the right to remain silent./r/n 如果你被捕，你有权保持沉默。/r/n The old house was quite silent./r/n 这所旧房子非常寂静。/r/n

word.name: silhouette
word.mean:
n. 黑色半身侧面影,影子,轮廓
v. 描绘成侧面影,照出影子来,仅仅显出轮廓
word.lx: The outline, form, or silhouette of a thing./r/n 外形，轮廓某物的外廓、外形或轮廓/r/n He saw the building in silhouette./r/n 他看到了那幢建筑的轮廓。/r/n

word.name: silicon
word.lx: The entire content of a book will be located on a single silicon chip./r/n 整本书的内容只用一片硅芯片就可以装下。/r/n An alloy of iron and silicon used in the production of carbon steel./r/n 硅铁一种用于生产碳素钢的铁和硅的合金/r/n

word.name: silk
word.mean:
a. 丝的
n. 丝,绸
word.lx: She is wearing a silk scarf./r/n 她佩戴着一条丝绸围巾。/r/n Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton./r/n 他们的主要出口货物是纺织品，特别是丝绸和棉布。/r/n

word.name: silken
word.mean: a. 绸的,绸制的,柔软的
word.lx: She put on her silken gown before going to bed./r/n 睡觉前，她穿上丝质的睡衣。/r/n Her silken long hair attracted the attention of a photographer./r/n 她的光滑柔软的长发吸引了一位摄影师的注意。/r/n

word.name: silkworm
word.lx: Silkworms spin cocoons./r/n 蚕作茧。/r/n Silkworms make cocoons./r/n 蚕做茧。/r/n

word.name: silt
word.lx: The harbor is being up with silt./r/n 那海港被淤泥阻塞了。/r/n A concrete wall is built to stop silt from leaking to the conservation land./r/n 一道水泥墙修筑起来，用以防止泥沙流进保留地。/r/n

word.name: silver
word.mean:
a. 银色的
n. 银
v. 镀银
word.lx: She was born with a silver spoon in her mouth./r/n 她生来富贵。/r/n The years have silvered her hair./r/n 岁月已使她的青丝似雪。/r/n

word.name: silverware
word.lx: They had much silverware at that time./r/n 那时他们拥有很多银器。/r/n

word.name: silvery
word.mean: a. 像银的,银色的,银铃一样的
word.lx: The girl has a silvery voice./r/n 这个女孩的声音象银铃一样清亮悦耳。/r/n Aluminum is a kind of light silvery metal./r/n 铝是一种轻薄并呈银色的金属。/r/n

word.name: simian
word.mean:
a. 猿的,类人猿的,猴子一般的
n. 猴子,类人猿

word.name: similar
word.mean: a. 相似的,类似的,相同,一样
word.lx: We have similar opinions./r/n 我们的看法相同。/r/n Gold is similar in color to brass./r/n 金和铜颜色相仿。/r/n

word.name: simile
word.lx: Her style is rich in simile./r/n 她的文体中用很多比喻。/r/n There are many daring similes in this book./r/n 这本书中使用了很多明喻。/r/n

word.name: similitude
word.lx: He likes to talk in similitude./r/n 他喜欢在说话中用比喻。/r/n

word.name: simmer
word.mean:
v. 慢慢地煮沸,使哗哗做响,拼命忍住
n. 即将沸腾的状态,满腔怒火即将发作
word.lx: Things have simmered down since the riots last week./r/n 自上周骚动以来, 事态已平静下来了./r/n She simmered for a minute or two, then began shouting uncontrollably./r/n 她强忍了一两分钟, 然後情不自禁地大叫起来./r/n

word.name: simple-minded
word.mean: a. 愚蠢的，头脑简单的

word.name: simplicity
word.lx: The simplicity of the book makes it suitable for children./r/n 这本书简单易懂，适合儿童。/r/n Simplicity is the essence of good taste./r/n 纯朴是情趣高尚的主要因素。/r/n

word.name: simplification
word.lx: What she said was a useful simplification of the theory./r/n 她把这一理论讲得深入浅出./r/n

word.name: simplified
word.mean: a. 精简了的,简化了的
word.lx: She simplified the instructions so that the children could understand them./r/n 她简化了指令以便于儿童理解。/r/n That will simplify my task./r/n 那可简化了我的工作。/r/n

word.name: simplify
word.mean:
v. 简化,使单纯
vt. 简化
word.lx: She simplified the instructions so that the children could understand them./r/n 她简化了指令以便于儿童理解。/r/n That will simplify my task./r/n 那可简化了我的工作。/r/n

word.name: simply
word.lx: I bought the house simply because it was large./r/n 我购买了这房子，只是因为它面积大。/r/n You may open the tin simply by pulling the puller./r/n 你只要拉这个拉出器，就可以很容易地把罐头打开。/r/n

word.name: simulate
word.mean: v. 假装,冒充,模仿,模拟

word.name: sincere
word.lx: Please give my sincere regards to all the members of your family./r/n 请向你全家转达我真挚的问候。/r/n Sincere congratulations on your son wedding please convey our best wish./r/n 令郎喜结良缘谨此致以诚挚的祝贺并请转达最美好的祝愿。/r/n

word.name: sincerely
word.lx: I sincerely hope that he can accept the criticism of others./r/n 我真诚地希望他能接受别人的批评。/r/n Deeply or sincerely felt; earnest./r/n 衷心的深切或真诚地感受到的；诚挚的/r/n

word.name: sincerity
word.mean: n. 诚实,真实,诚心诚意
word.lx: I may say in all sincerity that you have been my most loyal friend./r/n 我可以非常真诚地说，你一直是我最忠实的朋友。/r/n Having a face that seems to exhibit honesty and sincerity./r/n 相貌老实的，坦率的看起来相貌坦率诚实的/r/n

word.name: sine
word.lx: Patience is a sine qua non for a good teacher./r/n 做个优秀教师必不可少的条件是要有耐心./r/n The hearing is adjourned sine die./r/n 审讯被无限期地推迟。/r/n

word.name: sinewy
word.mean: a. 多腱的,强壮有力的
word.lx: The man has sinewy muscles./r/n 那男子有着强壮有力的肌肉。/r/n I admire her sinewy prose style./r/n 我钦佩她那强劲有力的散文风格。/r/n

word.name: sinful
word.lx: His father scolded him for his sinful waste of time./r/n 他的父亲责备他极不应该浪费时间。/r/n All of us are sinful./r/n 我们所有人都是有罪的。/r/n

word.name: sing
word.lx: Birds sing loudest in the early morning./r/n 鸟儿在清晨高声歌唱。/r/n She was singing a lullaby to her child./r/n 她正在给孩子唱摇篮曲。/r/n

word.name: Singapore
word.lx: The volatile political situation in Singapore upset the people./r/n 动荡不定的新加坡政局使人民感到不安。/r/n Singapore is near the equator./r/n 新加坡位于赤道附近。/r/n

word.name: singer
word.lx: The singer refused to sing in the sitting-room./r/n 这位歌唱家拒绝在起居室里演唱。/r/n He is a very popular folk singer./r/n 他是一位很受欢迎的民歌手。/r/n

word.name: singing
word.mean:
n. 歌唱,歌声
vbl. 唱,唱歌
word.lx: I enjoy singing, much more listening to music./r/n 我喜欢唱歌，更不用说听音乐了。/r/n We bicycled along, singing loudly./r/n 我们骑着脚踏车前进，大声歌唱着。/r/n

word.name: single
word.mean: a. 单身的,单纯的,单一的
word.lx: The letter was written on a single sheet of paper./r/n 这封信只用一张纸写成。/r/n The entire content of a book will be located on a single silicon chip./r/n 整本书的内容只用一片硅芯片就可以装下。/r/n

word.name: single-handed
word.mean: a. 单独一人的, 无助的

word.name: singular
word.mean:
a. 单数的,独一的,唯一的,非凡的
n. 单数

word.name: singularly
word.mean: ad. 不可思议地,少见地

word.name: sinister
word.mean: a. 不吉利的,凶恶的,左边的
word.lx: He showed his sinister motive at last./r/n 他终于露出了他那邪恶的用心。/r/n His sinister look frightened them./r/n 他那阴险的神情吓坏了他们。/r/n

word.name: sink
word.mean:
n. 接收端,沟渠,污水槽
v. 下沉,使...低落,陷于
word.lx: The dirty dishes are in the sink./r/n 那些脏盘子在洗涤槽内。/r/n The ship was sunk by an enemy torpedo./r/n 这艘船被敌人的鱼雷击沉了。/r/n

word.name: sinner
word.lx: One who is guilty of a trespass or sin; a sinner./r/n 罪人犯有过失和罪过的人；罪人/r/n Sinner down, Kelly, no point of argue with him./r/n 冷静些凯利，没有必要同他争论。/r/n

word.name: sinuous
word.mean: a. 弯弯曲曲的,迂回的,乖僻的
word.lx: A sinuous path, line, or marking./r/n 弯弯曲曲的道路、线条或记号/r/n Marked by or moving in a wavelike form or motion; sinuous./r/n 波状的或以波浪式运动的；起伏不平的/r/n

word.name: sip
word.mean:
n. 啜饮
v. 啜饮,啜
word.lx: Bees sip honey from flowers and hum their thanks when they leave./r/n 蜜蜂从花中啜蜜，离开时营营地道谢。/r/n I sipped at the coffee./r/n 我啜饮咖啡。/r/n

word.name: sire
word.mean:
n. (古用法)陛下
vt. 产生,创作
word.lx: A sire should be respected./r/n 父辈应当被尊重。/r/n The old man has sire a boy child at the age of seventy./r/n 那位老人在七十岁时得子做了父亲。/r/n

word.name: siren
word.lx: An ambulance was racing along with its sirens wailing./r/n 救护车响着警报急驰而过。/r/n We all heard the air-raid siren./r/n 我们都听到了空袭警报器的声音。/r/n

word.name: sirocco
word.mean: n. 热风(从非洲向南欧)

word.name: sister
word.lx: Joan and Lily are sisters./r/n 琼和丽丽是姐妹。/r/n You should take care of your niece for the sake of your sister./r/n 看在姐妹的份上, 你应该照顾你的侄女。/r/n

word.name: sit
word.lx: He sat at his desk working./r/n 他坐在桌子旁边工作。/r/n The farm sits on the side of the hill./r/n 农场位于山坡上。/r/n

word.name: sitcom
word.lx: This sitcom is produced in cooperation with Hong Kong TV./r/n 这部连续剧是同香港电视台联合制作的。/r/n

word.name: site
word.mean:
n. 位置,场所
v. 使...位于,使...放置
word.lx: Is it safe to site the power station here?/r/n 在这建造发电厂安全吗？/r/n The site is being developed by a London property company./r/n 这块地正在由伦敦的一家地产公司开发利用./r/n

word.name: sit-in
word.mean: n. 室内静坐抗议, 室内静坐罢工

word.name: sitter
word.lx: The purse in her handbag was a sitter for any thief./r/n 她手提袋里的钱包小偷很容易偷走./r/n

word.name: sitting
word.mean: n. (...的)一段时间,(分批开饭的)一批
word.lx: Sitting out here, you really can feel the power of the sun./r/n 坐在这里，你可以感到太阳的力量。/r/n I was sitting in the garden enjoying the sunshine./r/n 我坐在庭院里享受明媚的阳光。/r/n

word.name: sitting room
word.lx: A part of the sitting room was curtained off./r/n 起居室的一部分被帘子隔开了。/r/n This is more of a sitting room than a kitchen./r/n 与其说这是一个厨房还不如说这是一个起居室。/r/n

word.name: situate
word.lx: The village is situated in a valley./r/n 那个村子在山谷里./r/n The company wants to situate its headquarters in the north./r/n 公司想把总部设在北方./r/n

word.name: situated
word.mean: a. 位于,被置于境遇,处于...的立场
word.lx: The school is situated just outside the town./r/n 学校就位于镇子的外面。/r/n Situated in the back or at the side./r/n 后门的，边门的位于后面的或旁边的/r/n

word.name: situation
word.mean: n. 位置,形势,局面,处境,状况,职位
word.lx: What a precarious situation we were in when the avalanche started!/r/n 雪崩发生的时候我们的处境多么危险啊！/r/n The company is in a poor financial situation./r/n 该公司经济状况艰难。/r/n

word.name: six
word.lx: The child will be six./r/n 那孩子将满六岁了。/r/n The heifer is only six months old./r/n 这只小母牛只有六个月大。/r/n

word.name: sixpence
word.lx: The book costs sixpence./r/n 这本书价值六便士./r/n Wages were sixpence a week within living memory./r/n 周工资为六便士的年代, 人们记忆犹新./r/n

word.name: sixteenth
word.lx: My new house is on the sixteenth floor./r/n 我的新家在第十六层。/r/n Tom is one of the seers in the sixteenth century./r/n 汤姆是十六世纪的先知。/r/n

word.name: sixth
word.mean:
n. 六分之一
num.&a. 第六
word.lx: My new house is on the sixth floor./r/n 我的新房子在六楼。/r/n The youngest children are in the first form, the oldest in the sixth form./r/n 最小的儿童上一年级, 最大的上六年级./r/n

word.name: sixty
word.lx: My father is sixty years old./r/n 我父亲六十岁了。/r/n This fire hose is about sixty feet long./r/n 这段消防水管大约有60 英尺长。/r/n

word.name: size
word.mean:
n. 尺寸,大小
v. 按大小排列或分类
vt. 按大小排列(或分类)
word.lx: The company doubled its size in nine years./r/n 9年来这家公司的规模扩大了一倍。/r/n Would you like to try this jacket on for size, sir?/r/n 先生，你要不要试穿一下这件夹克衫，看看尺寸是否合适？/r/n

word.name: sizzle
word.mean: vi. (油煎食物时)发出咝咝声

word.name: sizzler
word.lx: Whew! What a sizzler!/r/n 唷! 多热的天哪!/r/n

word.name: skate
word.mean:
n. 冰鞋
v. 滑冰
vi. 溜冰,滑冰
word.lx: My brother skates well./r/n 我弟弟滑冰滑得好。/r/n I can move very fast across the ice on skates./r/n 我穿着冰鞋在冰上滑得很快。/r/n

word.name: skateboard
word.mean: n. 溜冰板(一种装有滑轮的椭圆形滑板)
word.lx: Skateboards are the latest craze./r/n 滑板运动是目前最时兴的玩意儿./r/n

word.name: skater
word.lx: The figure skater glided gracefully over the ice./r/n 花样滑冰者在冰上优雅地滑行。/r/n The skater executed a perfect set of figures./r/n 那个滑冰的人做出了一套完美的花样动作。/r/n

word.name: skates
word.lx: I can move very fast across the ice on skates./r/n 我穿着冰鞋在冰上滑得很快。/r/n May I borrow your roller skates?/r/n 我可以借你的滚轴溜冰鞋吗？/r/n

word.name: skating
word.lx: The boy is crazy about skating./r/n 那孩子溜冰着了迷。/r/n The girls are skating and the boys (are) watching./r/n 这些女孩在溜冰，而这些男孩在观看。/r/n

word.name: skein
word.lx: She passed me a skein of wool./r/n 她递给我一绞毛线。/r/n

word.name: skeleton
word.mean: n. (建筑物、计划的)骨架,纲要,骨骼

word.name: skeptic
word.mean: n. 怀疑者,怀疑论者,无神论者

word.name: skeptical
word.lx: The leader had the gift of being able to infuse enthusiasm into the most skeptical member of the group./r/n 那位领导人很有天赋，能使团体中最持怀疑态度的人都充满热情。/r/n

word.name: skepticism
word.mean: n. 怀疑论,怀疑态度,怀疑主义

word.name: sketch
word.mean:
n. 素描,草图
v. 描绘略图,写生

word.name: sketchy
word.mean: a. 写生的,写生风格的,概略的
word.lx: Your essay gives a rather sketchy treatment of the problem./r/n 你的文章只粗略地涉及到这个问题./r/n Information about the crisis was sketchy and hard to get./r/n 关於这次危机的消息所知甚少并且很难获得./r/n

word.name: skew
word.mean:
a. 斜交的(不对称的,误解的)
n. 斜交(歪斜,歪轮,斜砌石)
word.lx: The picture is a bit skew./r/n 这幅画有点歪./r/n

word.name: skewer
word.mean:
n. (烤肉用的)串肉杆
v. 用杆串好
word.lx: He skewered his foot on a nail./r/n 他的脚踩在钉子上了./r/n

word.name: ski
word.mean:
a. 滑雪（用）的
n. 雪橇
v. 滑雪
word.lx: They often go skiing in December./r/n 他们经常在十二月份去滑雪。/r/n The girl asked her father to buy a pair of skis for her./r/n 那个女孩请求她的父亲给她买一副滑雪板。/r/n

word.name: ski lift
word.mean: n. (运送滑雪者等的)上山吊椅

word.name: skid
word.mean:
n. 滑动(滑道,刹车,制件缺陷,走下坡路)
vt 打滑刹车(制件缺陷,走下坡路)
word.lx: Even as he shouted the warning the car skidded./r/n 就在他高喊注意的时候，汽车滑动了。/r/n The brakes locked, causing the car to skid./r/n 汽车因车轮刹住而打滑。/r/n

word.name: skiing
word.lx: They often go skiing in December./r/n 他们经常在十二月份去滑雪。/r/n I like skiing and in the meantime, I know it is very dangerous./r/n 我喜欢滑雪, 同时也知道这非常危险。/r/n

word.name: skilful
word.mean: a. 巧妙的, 技术好的

word.name: skill
word.lx: It takes skill to tune a piano./r/n 为钢琴调音需要专门技能。/r/n The point is there is a difference between an interest and a skill./r/n 这就是兴趣与技能是有区别的。/r/n

word.name: skilled
word.lx: I am skilled in operating a computer./r/n 我能够熟练操作计算机。/r/n Skilled mechanics can quickly be brought to the assistance of motorists./r/n 熟练的机械师可迅速地被派去救援汽车驾驶人。/r/n

word.name: skillet
word.lx: Rub up the skillet please./r/n 请把长柄锅擦亮。/r/n

word.name: skillful
word.lx: He is a skillful teacher./r/n 他擅长教学。/r/n Skillful in the use of the hands./r/n 灵巧的手的使用熟练的/r/n

word.name: skillfully
word.mean: ad. 巧妙地, 技术好地

word.name: skim
word.mean: v. 略读, 掠过, 滑过
word.lx: It took me an hour to skim the book./r/n 我花了一小时把这本书浏览了一遍。/r/n The hovercraft is able to skim over the water./r/n 气垫船能掠过水面飞速行驶。/r/n

word.name: skimmer
word.mean: n. 撇取浮皮的器具,大略阅读的人,网杓

word.name: skimming
word.lx: It took me an hour to skim the book./r/n 我花了一小时把这本书浏览了一遍。/r/n A seagull skims the water./r/n 海鸥掠过水面。/r/n

word.name: skin
word.mean:
n. 皮肤,外皮
v. 剥皮,长皮
word.lx: He skinned his knee when he fell./r/n 他摔跤时把膝盖擦破了。/r/n He had brown skin./r/n 他的皮肤是棕色的/r/n

word.name: skin-deep
word.lx: His political commitment is only skin-deep./r/n 他政治上的承诺只是表面文章。/r/n

word.name: skinhead
word.mean: n. (尤指英国)短发,行为暴戾的青少年

word.name: skip
word.mean:
n. 跳跃,跳读
v. 跳越,蹦跳,略过,跳过
word.lx: Children are fond of skipping./r/n 孩子们喜欢跳绳。/r/n Lambs skipped in the field./r/n 小羊在田野里跳跃。/r/n

word.name: skipper
word.lx: The skipper knows where every storm is./r/n 船长知道每一个风暴在什么地方。/r/n

word.name: skipping
word.mean: 暂时把货物腾空(以便称量皮重)
word.lx: Children are fond of skipping./r/n 孩子们喜欢跳绳。/r/n I read the whole book without skipping (a page)./r/n 我一页不漏地读完了全书./r/n

word.name: skirmish
word.mean:
n. 前哨战,小争斗,小冲突
v. 从事小争斗
word.lx: This area is peaceful except for a few skirmishes in the distance./r/n 除了远处的零星的小冲突之外，这个地区是和平的。/r/n The skirmish grew into a major battle./r/n 小冲突扩大形成大战斗。/r/n

word.name: skirt
word.mean:
n. 裙子
v. 位于...边缘,装边于,回避
vt. 绕开,位于...的边缘
word.lx: How many skirts do you have?/r/n 你有多少条裙子？/r/n We decided to skirt round the town center./r/n 我们决心绕过市中心。/r/n

word.name: skittish
word.mean: a. 易激动的, 轻佻的
word.lx: She gets very skittish when her boy-friend is around./r/n 她男朋友在场时, 她就显得格外轻佻./r/n

word.name: skunk
word.mean:
n. 臭鼬鼠,其皮毛,讨厌鬼
v. 使惨败,给对方吃零鸭蛋
word.lx: Did she also take the skunk to her bosom?/r/n 她把臭鼬也抱在怀里吗？/r/n Exclusiveness is a characteristic of recent riches, high society, and the skunk./r/n 排他主义，是为了近来的有钱人家、上流阶级以及臭鼬等的特色。/r/n

word.name: sky
word.lx: The sky turned dark as the storm came near./r/n 暴风雨来临时，天空转暗。/r/n The sky slowly changed from blue to red./r/n 天空慢慢由蓝色变为红色。/r/n

word.name: skyline
word.mean: n. 天涯,地平线,以天空为背景的轮廓

word.name: skyrocket
word.mean:
n. 烟火(高空探测火箭)
vt 使...上升
word.lx: Prices skyrocketed./r/n 物价飞涨。/r/n

word.name: skyscraper
word.lx: The skyscraper was wrapped in fog./r/n 摩天大楼笼罩在云雾之中。/r/n A new skyscraper has been put up downtown./r/n 市中心又建起了一座摩天大厦。/r/n

word.name: slab
word.mean:
n. 平板,厚的切片
v. 切成厚板,以平板盖上
word.lx: The top of the table was formed by a stone slab./r/n 桌面是一块石板。/r/n A slab of stone laid flat over a grave./r/n 平放在墓上的纪念碑石/r/n

word.name: slack
word.mean:
n. 松弛,家常裤
a. 松弛的,不流畅的
v. 使松弛,松弛
word.lx: Winter is the slack season at most hotels./r/n 冬天是大多数旅馆的淡季。/r/n Business is slack just now./r/n 目前生意萧条不振。/r/n

word.name: slacken
word.lx: Please slacken the tent rope before it rains./r/n 下雨前，请将帐篷的绳索放松。/r/n The train slackened speed as we approached the station./r/n 当我们快到车站时，火车减慢了速度。/r/n

word.name: slag
word.mean:
n. 熔渣,铁屑,矿渣
v. 使变成熔渣,变熔渣

word.name: slain
word.lx: Two visitors were brutally slain yesterday./r/n 昨天有两名游客惨遭杀害。/r/n A living creature slain and offered as a sacrifice during a religious rite./r/n 祭品在宗教仪式中的屠杀并奉为牺牲品的活的动物/r/n

word.name: slam
word.mean:
n. 砰然声,猛然
v. 猛然关上,砰地关上
word.lx: He slammed the papers down on my desk and angrily walked out./r/n 他把文件使劲扔在我的桌子上便怒气冲冲地走了出去。/r/n He closed the door with a slam./r/n 他砰的一声关上门。/r/n

word.name: slander
word.mean:
n. 中伤,毁谤
v. 中伤,毁谤
word.lx: Her company is suing her for slander because of her remarks about their safety record./r/n 由于她发表了关于公司安全记录的言论，该公司正以诽谤罪起诉她。/r/n He claims he was slandered at the meeting./r/n 他声称在会上受人诋毁。/r/n

word.name: slang
word.mean:
a. 俚语(的)
n. 俚语
vt. 辱骂,漫骂
word.lx: Grass" is a criminal slang for "informer"./r/n grass 是罪犯用的俚语，意思是“告密的人”。/r/n

word.name: slant
word.mean:
n. 倾斜,斜面
a. 倾斜的
v. 使倾斜,倾斜
word.lx: Most handwriting slants to the right./r/n 大多数手写体都向右斜。/r/n We slanted across the river./r/n 我们斜渡过河。/r/n

word.name: slap
word.mean:
n. 掴,侮辱,拍击声
v. 拍击,侮辱,申斥
ad. 正面地,直接地,突然地
word.lx: He slapped me on the back on my way home./r/n 在我回家的路上，他在我背上拍了一下。/r/n His decision was a slap in the face to those who had tried to change his mind./r/n 他的决定对于那些试图要说服他的人不啻是一记耳光。/r/n

word.name: slapstick
word.mean: n. 打闹剧(演员用击板相互追打发出声响得名)

word.name: slash
word.mean:
vt. 深砍(螺纹滚,削减,湿地)
n. 深砍(螺纹滚,削减,湿地)，斜线/""
word.lx: He is slashing wildly at his opponent with a sword./r/n 他正用剑疯狂地朝对手乱砍。/r/n The government promises to slash taxes./r/n 政府许诺大幅减税。/r/n

word.name: slat
word.lx: The oil paintings are backed up with slats./r/n 这些油画是用细木条做背衬的。/r/n Gales uprooted trees and whipped the slats off roofs./r/n 大风把树木连根拔起，并掀掉了屋顶的石板瓦。/r/n

word.name: slaughter
word.mean:
n. 残杀,屠杀,大量杀戮
v. 残杀,屠杀
word.lx: Millions of cattle are slaughtered every day./r/n 每天有数百万头牛被屠杀。/r/n Bison used to roam through the American great plains, but most of them are slaughter by hunter./r/n 从前野牛在美国大平原上漫游，但是大多数都被猎人屠杀了。/r/n

word.name: slave
word.mean:
n. 奴隶,附件,卑鄙的人
v. 拼命工作
word.lx: He treats his wife like a slave./r/n 他把妻子当作奴隶看待。/r/n The slave has never experienced the sweetness of freedom./r/n 这个奴隶从未体验过自由的快乐。/r/n

word.name: slave trade
word.lx: The book only touches on the causes of the war and does not do justice to the influence of the slave trade./r/n 这本书只稍稍涉及了一下战争的原因，并没有公正评价奴隶贸易的影响。/r/n

word.name: slaver
word.mean:
n. 奴隶商人,奴隶贩卖船,口水
v. 垂涎,淌口水,淌口水弄脏
word.lx: The dealer was slavering over some precious stones./r/n 那商人对一些宝石垂涎欲滴./r/n Stop slavering over thatbaby!/r/n 别总看著人家的孩子了!/r/n

word.name: slavery
word.lx: Abraham Lincoln abolished slavery in the United States./r/n 亚伯拉罕·林肯在美国废除了奴隶制。/r/n The abolition of slavery had been exercised in many countries./r/n 奴隶制在许多国家已经被废除。/r/n

word.name: slay
word.lx: Your jokes slay me./r/n 你的笑话笑死我了。/r/n Two visitors were brutally slain yesterday./r/n 昨天有两名游客惨遭杀害。/r/n

word.name: sleazy
word.mean: a. 质地薄的,没有内容的,廉价的

word.name: sled
word.mean:
n. 雪撬,小雪撬
v. 用撬搬运,座撬前往,乘撬
word.lx: The man attached a strong rope to his sled./r/n 那人将一条结实的绳子系在他的雪撬上。/r/n Jack dug his sled out of the cellar./r/n 杰克在地窑里找到了他的雪橇。/r/n

word.name: sledding
word.mean: n. 雪撬的使用,适于使用雪撬的状态,进行状况
word.lx: Kathy had hard sledding in her math course because she was poorly prepared./r/n 凯西的数学很难进步，因为她的基础太差。/r/n

word.name: sledge
word.mean:
n. 雪橇,大锤
v. 用雪橇搬运,坐雪橇往
word.lx: The sledge gained momentum as it ran down the hill./r/n 雪橇从山上下冲时动量越来越大./r/n A frame or sledge on which condemned persons were dragged to execution./r/n 囚笼，囚车一种架子或雪橇，遭指控者被拖到其上施刑/r/n

word.name: sledgehammer
word.lx: Printing business cards on a thirty-inch press is using a sledgehammer to crack a nut./r/n 在30英寸印刷机上印刷名片简直是大材小用，得不偿失。/r/n

word.name: sleeper
word.lx: I am a bad sleeper./r/n 我总睡不好。/r/n That movie is the sleeper of the year: suddenly everyone has to see it./r/n 那部电影爆出冷门，成了今年的最佳影片。突然间，每一个人都不得不一睹为快/r/n

word.name: sleeping
word.lx: The baby was sleeping quietly in his crib./r/n 婴儿在他的小床里静静地睡着。/r/n Occasionally she had to take sleeping pills./r/n 她偶尔不得不吃安眠药。/r/n

word.name: sleeping pill
word.lx: I need some sleeping pill./r/n 我需要一些安眠药片。/r/n The sleeping pills soon put her off to sleep./r/n 安眠药片不久就使她睡着了。/r/n

word.name: sleepless
word.mean: a. 不睡眠的,睡不著的,不休息的
word.lx: Her irresponsible behaviour cost her father many sleepless nights./r/n 她那不负责任的行为使她父亲许多夜不得安眠。/r/n She looked pale and drawn after weeks of sleepless nights./r/n 她经历了数周不眠之夜, 看上去脸色苍白, 形容憔悴./r/n

word.name: sleet
word.mean:
n. 雨雪
v. 下雨雪,下冰雹

word.name: sleeves
word.lx: My mother tacked the sleeves on before sewing them./r/n 我妈妈在把袖子缝好之前，先用大针脚把它缝好。/r/n He rolled up his sleeves and got to work in the garden./r/n 他卷起了袖子，在花园里干起活来。/r/n

word.name: sleigh
word.mean:
n. 雪橇
vi. 坐雪橇
word.lx: My feet were cold as stone when I got out of the sleigh./r/n 我从雪橇上下来时，两只脚冻得像石头一样。/r/n My feet were cold as a stone when I got out of the sleigh./r/n 我从雪橇上下来时，两脚冻得像石头一样。/r/n

word.name: sleight
word.lx: Manual skill and dexterity in the execution of tricks; sleight of hand./r/n 手法敏捷变戏法时手法的熟练和敏捷；戏法/r/n

word.name: slender
word.lx: All girls want to be slender./r/n 所有女孩都希望苗条。/r/n The birch has smooth bark and slender branches./r/n 桦树有光滑的皮和细长的枝。/r/n

word.name: slew
word.mean:
n. 沼地,极多,回转
v. 使转,扭转,转
word.lx: The car slewed round on the icy road./r/n 车在结冰的路上打滑了。/r/n The captain could not slew the ship round in time to avoid an accident./r/n 船长没能及时地掉转船头避免事故发生。/r/n

word.name: slick
word.mean:
a. 光滑的(巧妙的,完全的,老一套的,第一流的)
ad. 滑溜地(直接地)
word.lx: The hurricane carried away the roof as slick as a whistle./r/n 飓风把屋顶不费吹灰之力地刮掉了。/r/n I advised them to watch out for slick spots on the sidewalk./r/n 我叫他们当心人行道上路滑的地方。/r/n

word.name: slid
word.lx: The book slid off my knee./r/n 书从我膝上滑落。/r/n The thief slid into the room./r/n 小偷溜进房间。/r/n

word.name: slide
word.mean:
n. 滑,幻灯片,雪崩
v. 使滑,滑,跌落
word.lx: The book slid off my knee./r/n 书从我膝上滑落。/r/n The thief slid into the room./r/n 小偷溜进房间。/r/n

word.name: slider
word.lx: Select it to activate the slider bar on the right, then use the leave and right arrows to adjust the volume./r/n 使用时先选择该项，激活右边的滑动条，然后用左箭头或右箭头来进行音量调整。/r/n

word.name: slightly
word.lx: My interest in music has languished slightly./r/n 我对音乐的兴趣有点减退。/r/n The union has been forced to slightly modify its position./r/n 工会被迫稍稍改变立场。/r/n

word.name: slime
word.mean:
n. 烂泥
v. 涂上泥
word.lx: There was a coating of slime on the unwashed sink./r/n 未刷洗的水槽上有一层污垢./r/n Soft mud or slime./r/n 软泥或粘泥/r/n

word.name: slimy
word.lx: He slipped on the slimy steps./r/n 他在泥泞的台阶上摔倒了。/r/n You slimy little creep!/r/n 你这个卑鄙无耻的奴才！/r/n

word.name: sling
word.mean:
n. 投石器,抛掷,吊物机
v. 用投石器投掷,用吊钩钓上
word.lx: A basket, an enclosure, or an instrument sling suspended from and carried aloft by a balloon./r/n 气球吊篮悬在空中吊在气球下的篮子，封闭舱或仪器舱/r/n The line of flags was slung up between two trees./r/n 一排旗帜悬挂在两棵树之间。/r/n

word.name: slink
word.lx: The thief slunk down the dark alley./r/n 那个贼偷偷钻进黑胡同里./r/n The dog slunk out when I shouted at him./r/n 我向那条狗一喊, 它就溜出去了./r/n

word.name: slip
word.mean:
n. 滑,错误,下跌
v. 滑倒,犯错,减退
word.lx: The soap slipped out of my hand./r/n 肥皂从我手上滑落了。/r/n You are not going to let a wonderful chance like that slip through your fingers, are you?/r/n 你不会错过那样的好机会，对吗？/r/n

word.name: slipper
word.lx: She has pretty dancing slippers and comfortable bedroom slippers./r/n 她有漂亮的舞鞋和舒适的卧室拖鞋。/r/n A slipper with a soft sole resembling this boot./r/n 爱斯基摩式靴类似这种靴子的一种有软后跟的拖鞋/r/n

word.name: slipshod
word.mean: a. 粗枝大叶的(随便的,潦草的,不整洁的)

word.name: slither
word.mean: vt. 使....不稳地滑动(使...蜿蜒地滑行)

word.name: sliver
word.mean:
n. 裂片,细片,梳毛
v. 纵切,切成长片,剖开
word.lx: The glass slivered when it fell./r/n 玻璃杯掉在地上摔碎了./r/n A sliver of citrus peel twisted over or dropped into a beverage for flavoring./r/n 橘子皮放入或加入饮料中调味的一小块橘子皮/r/n

word.name: slob
word.lx: Get out of bed, you idle slob!/r/n 快起来, 你这懒虫!/r/n

word.name: slobber
word.mean:
n. 口水
v. 流口水,粗俗地表示
word.lx: Baby has slobbered his bib./r/n 婴儿已经把围兜弄湿了。/r/n

word.name: slog
word.lx: Slog away at your studies./r/n 不断地努力学习。/r/n School is a hard slog./r/n 念书是共事。/r/n

word.name: slogan
word.lx: The advertising slogan was a play on words./r/n 那条广告口号是双关语./r/n I wish the exclamation mark had not been painted out, it would have made the slogan more forceful./r/n 我想那个惊叹号要是没有被涂掉就好了，它会使标语更加有为。/r/n

word.name: sloop
word.lx: An enemy frigate bore down on the sloop./r/n 一艘敌驱逐舰向这只护航舰逼过来。/r/n

word.name: slop
word.lx: The tea slopped (over) into the saucer./r/n 茶溢出流到茶托里了./r/n I dropped the bucket, and water slopped out (of it)./r/n 我把桶掉在地上, 水都洒了出来./r/n

word.name: slope
word.mean:
n. 倾斜,斜坡
v. 倾斜
word.lx: The floor slopes badly here./r/n 地板在这里倾斜得很厉害。/r/n His cottage is on the gentle slope of the hill./r/n 他的小屋在山的缓坡上。/r/n

word.name: sloth
word.lx: Sloths live in trees and move very slowly./r/n 树獭生活在树上而且行动缓慢。/r/n He has kept sloth out./r/n 他已经克服了懒惰。/r/n

word.name: slothful
word.mean: a. 怠惰的,懒惰的,迟钝的

word.name: slotting
word.lx: He put a coin into the insertion slot./r/n 他往投币孔投入一枚硬币。/r/n The bolt slotted smoothly into place./r/n 插销很容易就插上了./r/n

word.name: slough
word.mean:
n. (蛇等)蜕皮,蜕壳
v. 蜕皮
vt. 蜕去
word.lx: Every spring this snake sloughs off its skin, as it has grown too big for it./r/n 每年春天这条蛇都要蜕去旧皮，因为它身体长大，旧皮不适用了。/r/n The name of the slough was Despond./r/n 这个深渊名叫绝望。/r/n

word.name: slovenly
word.mean:
a. 马虎的(潦草的)
ad. 马虎地(潦草地)

word.name: slow
word.mean:
a. 慢的
ad. 慢慢地
v. 放慢,减速
word.lx: My watch is five minutes slow./r/n 我的表慢五分钟。/r/n This student is slow in learning English./r/n 这个学生学英语很笨。/r/n

word.name: slow motion
word.lx: Parts of the film were shown again in slow motion./r/n 影片的一些部分以慢动作重放。/r/n The empty car rolled down the hill in slow motion and nobody could do anything to stop it./r/n 这辆空车极其缓慢地从山丘上滑下来，但没有人能阻止住它。/r/n

word.name: slower
word.lx: Could you speak slower?/r/n 你能说得慢一点吗？/r/n The captain decided to take Jeff off and try a slower bowler./r/n 队长决定把杰夫换下来，换上一个慢一点的投球手。/r/n

word.name: slowly
word.mean:
a. 慢慢地
ad. 缓慢地
word.lx: Slowly but surely the great ship glided into the water./r/n 那艘巨轮缓慢而平稳地下水了。/r/n Tears distilled slowly from her eyes./r/n 泪水从她的眼睛里慢慢地滴下来。/r/n

word.name: slug
word.lx: My daughter screamed when she saw a slug./r/n 我的女儿看见了一条鼻涕虫，尖叫了起来。/r/n

word.name: sluggard
word.mean: n. 偷懒者,游手好闲的人,懒鬼

word.name: sluggish
word.mean: a. 偷懒的,懒惰的,迟钝的
word.lx: There is a sluggish stream./r/n 那有一条流速缓慢的溪流。/r/n These tablets make me feel rather sluggish./r/n 我吃了这些药片感到困倦无力。/r/n

word.name: sluice
word.mean:
n. 水闸(闸沟,斜槽,蓄水,口)
vt 冲洗(流出,开水闸放水,溜槽提金)
word.lx: Water sluiced out of the hole./r/n 水从洞口流出。/r/n The stables were sluiced out with water from a hose./r/n 马厩已经用水管子冲洗过了。/r/n

word.name: slum
word.lx: The bar in the slum is a den of iniquity./r/n 这个贫民窟里的小酒吧是一个充满罪恶的场所。/r/n They have demolished the slum district./r/n 贫民区已被拆除。/r/n

word.name: slumber
word.mean:
n. 睡眠,休止状态
v. 熟睡,打盹,睡著渡过
word.lx: The volcano had slumbered for years./r/n 这火山已经很多年不活动了。/r/n The baby slumbered in his cradle./r/n 婴儿安睡在摇篮里。/r/n

word.name: slump
word.mean:
n. 暴跌,意气消沉
v. 猛然掉落
word.lx: The slump hit his business hard./r/n 物价暴跌使他的生意大受打击。/r/n The current economic slump is an earnest of the major recession to come./r/n 当前的经济滑坡预示着一次大的衰退即将来临。/r/n

word.name: slur
word.mean:
n. 连音符,诽谤,耻辱
v. 草率地看过,忽略,含糊地念
word.lx: She slurred over the high cost of her plan./r/n 她避而不提她这一计画费用之巨./r/n A curved line indicating such a phrase; a slur./r/n 连线表示这个乐句的弧线；连线/r/n

word.name: slurp
word.mean:
v.&n. 啜食
vt. 饮食出声
word.lx: He was slurping (down) his soup./r/n 他喝汤时嘴唇发出啧啧的声音./r/n Stop slurping!/r/n 吃喝时别发出这麽大的声音!/r/n

word.name: slush fund
word.lx: Nixon used a slush fund to finance spy on the democrats./r/n 尼克森用行贿基金支付监视民主党活动的款项。/r/n

word.name: sly
word.lx: He is a sly dog./r/n 他是个狡猾的家伙。/r/n She must have been having lessons on the sly./r/n 她准是暗地里一直在上课。/r/n

word.name: smack
word.mean:
n滋味, 风味, 少量, 拍击
v. 带有...风味, 用掌击, 拍打
word.lx: The book hit the floor with a smack./r/n 书啪的一声掉在地板上。/r/n He smacked the book angrily on the table./r/n 他生气地把书啪的一声丢在桌子上。/r/n

word.name: small
word.lx: This coat is too small for me./r/n 这件上衣对我来说太小了。/r/n The penalty clause was hidden in the small print./r/n 惩罚条款印在不起眼的小号字体部分。/r/n

word.name: smallpox
word.lx: Many people died from the smallpox epidemic./r/n 很多人死于天花流行病。/r/n Smallpox has almost been eradicated./r/n 天花几乎已经被消灭了。/r/n

word.name: small-scale
word.mean: a. 小比例尺的,小规模的

word.name: smarmy
word.mean: a. 令人厌烦的,爱说奉承话的

word.name: smart
word.mean:
a. 聪明的,漂亮的
v. 刺痛
a. 时髦的，巧妙的
word.lx: He is a smart boy./r/n 他是一个聪明的男孩。/r/n The smart of his wound kept him awake./r/n 伤痛使他无法入睡。/r/n

word.name: smart-ass
word.mean: a. 自作聪明的,自以为是的

word.name: smash
word.mean:
n. 破碎,大败,冲突
a. 非常的,了不起的
v. 粉碎,溃裂,使破产
[羽]扣球
word.lx: We are determined to smash terrorism./r/n 我们一定要消灭恐怖主义。/r/n The lock was rusty, so we had to smash the door open./r/n 锁锈住了，我们得把门砸开。/r/n

word.name: smashing
word.mean: a. 猛烈的,兴旺的,了不起的

word.name: smear
word.mean:
v. 涂,擦上,抹擦使变模糊
n.油迹，污点；诋毁，诽谤；（医）涂片标本
word.lx: We smeared cream on our faces./r/n 我们在脸上搽雪花膏。/r/n This accusation of bribery is a vile smear on an honorable citizen./r/n 这项有关贿赂的指控是对一个正直公民的无耻诽谤。/r/n

word.name: smell
word.mean:
n. 味道,气味,嗅
v. 闻,探出,发臭
word.lx: These dogs have a marvelous sense of smell./r/n 这些狗有非常敏锐的嗅觉。/r/n I could smell that the milk was not fresh./r/n 我闻得出牛奶不新鲜。/r/n

word.name: smelt
word.lx: The ore is smelted in this large factory./r/n 这个大型工厂里熔炼矿石。/r/n The newly ploughed fields smelt sweet./r/n 新犁过的土地散发着芳香。/r/n

word.name: smile
word.mean:
n. 微笑,喜色
v. 微笑,喜色
word.lx: She smiled at me./r/n 她向我微笑。/r/n Her smile makes her even more beautiful./r/n 她的微笑使她更美丽了。/r/n

word.name: smirch
word.mean:
n. 污点
v. 玷污

word.name: smirk
word.lx: A guilty smirk; a guilty secret./r/n 罪恶的假笑；罪恶的秘密/r/n Come on, professor, does not smirk at me like that./r/n 拜托！老师，你不要那样对着我假笑。/r/n

word.name: smithy
word.mean: n. 锻冶匠的工作场所

word.name: smock
word.lx: The man put on his smock and went out./r/n 那人穿上罩衫，然后走了出去。/r/n A loose smock worn by laborers./r/n 工作服工人穿的宽松工作服/r/n

word.name: smoke
word.mean:
n. 烟,无常的事物,抽烟
v. 吸烟,以烟熏,冒烟
word.lx: Peter smokes several cigars everyday./r/n 彼得每天抽好几支雪茄。/r/n The smoke of the burning house could be seen many blocks away./r/n 着火的房子的冒出的烟在几个街区外都能看到。/r/n

word.name: smokeless
word.lx: A cellulose nitrate used as a component of smokeless powder./r/n 火纤维素硝酸纤维素，用于无烟的炸药的组成物质/r/n

word.name: smoker
word.lx: Shall we sit in a smoker or a non-smoker?/r/n 我们坐吸烟车厢还是非吸烟车厢？/r/n Non-smokers often disapprove of smoking in public./r/n 不吸烟的人往往不赞成别人在公共场合吸烟。/r/n

word.name: smoking
word.lx: Smoking is not allowed here./r/n 这里不许吸烟。/r/n Smoking is not good for your health./r/n 吸烟对你的健康没有好处。/r/n

word.name: smoky
word.mean: a. 冒烟的,熏著的,呛人的

word.name: smolder
word.mean: v. 无火焰地闷烧,压抑

word.name: smooth
word.mean:
a. 平稳的,流畅的,安祥的
v. 使...光滑,变平滑
word.lx: Her skin is as smooth as silk./r/n 她的皮肤像丝绸一样光滑。/r/n The birch has smooth bark and slender branches./r/n 桦树有光滑的皮和细长的枝。/r/n

word.name: smoothing
word.lx: Affairs are smoothing down./r/n 事态正在缓和下来。/r/n A trowel-shaped tool for smoothing the surface of clay, sand, or plaster in a mold./r/n （瓦工的）镘用以刮光模子中泥土、沙粒或灰泥的表面的铲型工具/r/n

word.name: smoothly
word.mean: ad. 平滑地,流畅地,流利地
word.lx: The rope ran out smoothly./r/n 绳子顺顺当当地拉出来了。/r/n I heard a car engine purring smoothly./r/n 我听到一辆汽车发动机发出平稳的轰隆声。/r/n

word.name: smoulder
word.mean: vi. (情绪)郁积,闷在心里,熏烧
word.lx: It took hours for the ruins to smoulder out./r/n 废虚燃了几个小时才烧尽。/r/n Her eyes smoulder with jealousy./r/n 她的眼睛露出嫉妒的目光。/r/n

word.name: smug
word.mean:
a. 自以为是的,满漂亮的,俏皮的
n. 书呆子,难以交往的家伙

word.name: smuggle
word.lx: They smuggled Swiss watches into China./r/n 他们走私瑞士表进中国。/r/n He was arrested for smuggling out currency./r/n 他因携带货币出境而被捕。/r/n

word.name: smuggler
word.lx: We caught the smuggler on the spot./r/n 我们当场抓到那个走私犯。/r/n The smuggler is still at large./r/n 那个走私贩仍逍遥法外。/r/n

word.name: snag
word.mean:
n. 暗礁(隐患)
vt 清除困难(清铲,粗加工,绊住)

word.name: snake
word.mean:
n. 蛇
v. 蜿蜒,弯弯曲曲行进
word.lx: I have a fear of snakes./r/n 我害怕蛇。/r/n The snake coiled itself around the tree./r/n 蛇盘绕在树上。/r/n

word.name: snaky
word.mean: a. 似蛇的,弯曲的,阴险的

word.name: snap
word.mean:
n. 啪地移动,突然断掉
v. 猛咬,咬断,谩骂,砰然关上
word.lx: Most pine snaps as it burns./r/n 大多数松木燃烧时都发出断裂声。/r/n The shark snapped its jaws shut./r/n 鲨鱼啪嗒一声把嘴合上了。/r/n

word.name: snappy
word.mean: a. 精力充沛的,潇洒的
word.lx: She was wearing a snappy little red number./r/n 她身著一款时髦的红色连衣裙./r/n Pack your bags and make it snappy; we leave in five minutes./r/n 赶快把东西装进你们的包里，5分钟后我们就走。/r/n

word.name: snare
word.mean:
n. 陷阱,诱惑
v. 以陷阱捕获,诱惑
word.lx: He fell into a snare laid by his enemy./r/n 他落入敌人设的圈套。/r/n A snare or trap for game./r/n 狩猎用的陷阱或圈套/r/n

word.name: snarl
word.lx: Traffic was badly snarled up near the accident./r/n 车祸现场附近交通极为混乱。/r/n The dog snarled at the milkman./r/n 那条狗对著送牛奶的人低声吠叫./r/n

word.name: snarled
word.lx: Traffic was badly snarled up near the accident./r/n 车祸现场附近交通极为混乱。/r/n The machine snarled the material up./r/n 机器把材料搅在一起了./r/n

word.name: snatch
word.mean:
n. 抢夺,碎片,一阵
v. 夺取,想抢走,侥幸获得
word.lx: The hawk snatched the chicken and flew away./r/n 老鹰抓住小鸡飞走了。/r/n He snatched up his gun and fired./r/n 他突然拿起枪来射击。/r/n

word.name: snazzy
word.mean: a. 时髦的,华丽而俗气的
word.lx: The boss set his mistress up in a snazzy love nest./r/n 老板把情妇安排在一个华丽而俗气的爱之窝。/r/n

word.name: sneak
word.mean:
vt. 潜行(隐藏,填石缝)
n. 潜行
word.lx: He sneaked a chocolate from the box./r/n 他从盒子里偷拿了一块巧克力。/r/n The cat ate the food and sneaked off./r/n 猫吃完食物就偷偷跑了。/r/n

word.name: sneaker
word.mean: n. 鬼鬼祟祟做事的人,卑鄙者,运动鞋

word.name: sneakers
word.lx: He wore old jeans and a pair of sneakers./r/n 他穿著旧牛仔裤和胶底运动鞋。/r/n

word.name: sneaking
word.lx: James loves sneaking up on his sister to frighten her./r/n 詹姆斯喜欢溜到妹妹身後吓她一大跳。/r/n James love sneaking up on his sister to frighten her./r/n 詹姆斯喜欢溜到妹妹身后吓她一大跳。/r/n

word.name: sneeze
word.mean:
n. 喷嚏
v. 打喷嚏
word.lx: The dust made him sneeze./r/n 灰尘使他打了个喷嚏。/r/n The pepper in the food caused me to/made me sneeze./r/n 这食物中的胡椒味儿呛得我直打喷嚏./r/n

word.name: sneezing
word.lx: Her husband started sneezing violently.God bless you! " she said automatically./r/n 她的丈夫开始一个劲儿地打喷嚏。“大吉大利！”她脱口而出地说道。/r/n

word.name: snide
word.mean: a. 讽刺的,含沙射影的

word.name: sniff
word.mean:
n. 以鼻吸气,吸入的东西,气味
v. 嗅,发觉
word.lx: The dog was sniffing at the lamppost./r/n 那条狗在灯柱旁嗅来嗅去。/r/n His generous offer is not to be sniffed at./r/n 对他的慷慨厚意不可嗤之以鼻。/r/n

word.name: snip
word.mean:
n. 便宜货,廉价货
v. 剪,剪断
word.lx: He snipped off the corner of the milk carton./r/n 他剪掉牛奶袋的边角。/r/n He snipped the string and untied the parcel./r/n 他剪断绳子，解开包裹。/r/n

word.name: sniper
word.lx: The sniper snapped off six rapid shots./r/n 狙击手迅速地连放了六枪。/r/n Snipers and irregulars fell on the hapless patrol./r/n 狙击兵和非正规军袭击了巡逻队/r/n

word.name: snob
word.lx: He is not a snob and therein lay his downfall./r/n 他不是个势利小人，而他失败的原因正在于此。/r/n This part of the town has a lot of snob appeal./r/n 该城的这一区很能吸引自视甚高的人./r/n

word.name: snobbery
word.mean: n. 充绅士气派,俗不可耐的性格
word.lx: Is his distance a result of snobbery or shyness?/r/n 他态度冷淡是因为他势利眼呢，还是因为他腼腆？/r/n Her novel is a satire on social snobbery./r/n 她的小说是描写势利小人的讽刺作品./r/n

word.name: snooker
word.mean: vt. 挫败(阻挠,把...置于困境)

word.name: snoop
word.mean:
n. 窥探者
v. 窥伺,打听

word.name: Snoopy
word.mean: a. 爱窥探者,爱管闲事者
word.lx: Given to prying into the affairs of others; snoopy./r/n 好管闲事的刺探别人事务的；爱探听的/r/n

word.name: snorkel
word.mean:
n. 液压起重机(通气管)
vt 用通气管潜航

word.name: snort
word.mean:
v. 喷著气弄响鼻子,哼著鼻子,嘶嘶响著排气
n. 鼻息,满杯
word.lx: The horse snorted and stamped its hoof impatiently./r/n 这匹马呼哧呼哧地喘着气，不耐烦地跺着蹄子。/r/n He snorted out a reply./r/n 他气呼呼地回答。/r/n

word.name: snout
word.mean: n. 鼻口部,鼻子,蛇管的前端

word.name: snow
word.lx: It was snowing heavily./r/n 天正在下大雪。/r/n He watched his woods filled up with snow./r/n 他眼看着他的树林渐渐被雪覆盖。/r/n

word.name: snowdrift
word.lx: The dad-blamed car got stuck in a snowdrift./r/n 该死的汽车陷在雪堆里了。/r/n In the severe winter of1947, farmers had to dig their livestock out of huge snowdrifts./r/n 在1947年严峻的冬天，农民们不得不挖开大雪堆把他们的家畜救出来。/r/n

word.name: snowfall
word.lx: Such a snowfall is few and for between in our province./r/n 这样大的雪在我们省里是少有的。/r/n A heavy snowfall block the main road./r/n 一次严重的降雪阻塞了主要公路。/r/n

word.name: snowflake
word.lx: Snowflakes are melting as they reached the ground./r/n 雪花触地便融化了。/r/n

word.name: snowman
word.lx: The Abominable Snowman who haunts the imagination of climbers in the Himalayas is hardly more elusive./r/n 常使喜马拉雅山的攀登者浮想联翩的雪人也不比此更难以捉摸。/r/n

word.name: snowshoe
word.mean:
n. 雪鞋
vi. 穿着雪鞋走

word.name: snowstorm
word.lx: Because of the snowstorm, the churchgoer did not go to church./r/n 因为暴风雪，经常去做礼拜的人没有去教堂。/r/n The roads were sanded after the snowstorm./r/n 道路在暴风雪之后铺上了沙子。/r/n

word.name: snowy
word.mean: a. 多雪的,被雪所覆盖著的,下雪的
word.lx: He looks kind with snowy hair./r/n 雪白的头发使他看上去很和善。/r/n I like to go for a walk in the snowy streets./r/n 我喜欢去雪中的街道上散步。/r/n

word.name: snub
word.mean:
a. (鼻子等)短平而上翘
v. 冷落,不理睬

word.name: snuff
word.mean:
n. 烛花(鼻烟)
vt 剪烛花(嗅)

word.name: snuffle
word.lx: The dog was snuffling around the roots of a tree./r/n 那条狗在树根处嗅来嗅去./r/n

word.name: snuffling
word.mean: a. 抽着鼻子的, 假装虔诚的
word.lx: The dog was snuffling around the roots of a tree./r/n 那条狗在树根处嗅来嗅去./r/n

word.name: snug
word.mean:
a. 舒适的,合身的
v. 使整洁干净
word.lx: He sat in a snug little room./r/n 他坐在一个舒适的小房间里。/r/n Snug, comfortable, and warm./r/n 舒适的、惬意的和温暖的/r/n

word.name: snuggle
word.lx: They snuggled up (together) in bed./r/n 他们依偎著躺在床上./r/n The child snuggled up to her mother./r/n 那孩子紧贴在母亲身边./r/n

word.name: snugly
word.lx: He fitted the map snugly into the bag./r/n 他把地图整齐地塞进包里。/r/n Plane one side of the panel down until it fits snugly into place./r/n 把板条的一侧刨一刨，使它放在这儿刚好合适。/r/n

word.name: so
word.mean:
ad. 如此,如是,如...那样
conj. 所以,因此,所以
word.lx: It was snowing, and so I could not go out./r/n 天在下雪，所以我无法外出。/r/n You have pride and so have I./r/n 你有自尊心，我也有。/r/n

word.name: so long
word.lx: So long!/r/n 再见！/r/n My wife is expecting me at home. I must be off now. So long!/r/n 我妻子正在家等着我呢。我必须要走了。再见！/r/n

word.name: so much
word.lx: She turned away in horror at the sight of so much blood./r/n 看到这么多的血, 她害怕地将脸扭向了一边。/r/n Success lies not so much as in luck as in hard work./r/n 与其说成功在于运气不如说是辛勤努力。/r/n

word.name: soaked
word.lx: The rain had soaked through his coat./r/n 雨把他的大衣淋透了./r/n The blood soaked through his shirt and stained his jacket./r/n 他的血透过衬衫染污了上衣./r/n

word.name: soaking
word.lx: Are you in favour of soaking the rich?/r/n 你赞成向富人多徵税吗？/r/n The dirty clothes are soaking in soapy water./r/n 脏衣服都在肥皂水里泡著呢./r/n

word.name: soap
word.lx: He washed his hands with a toilet soap./r/n 他用香皂洗手。/r/n The soap slipped out of my hand./r/n 肥皂从我手上滑落了。/r/n

word.name: soap opera
word.lx: No soap opera fan can complain that the Senate Judiciary Committee hearings that usurped the network tales of sex and power could not deliver their daily emotional fix. It was an astounding day for television viewers, right up there with Watergate./r/n

word.name: soapy
word.mean: a. 像肥皂样的(肥皂质的,泖有肥皂的,滑腻的)
word.lx: The dirty clothes are soaking in soapy water./r/n 脏衣服都在肥皂水里泡著呢./r/n Soapy was tossed into prison without trial./r/n 苏比未经审叛就被投进了监狱。/r/n

word.name: soar
word.mean:
n. 高扬
v. 往上飞舞,高耸

word.name: soaring
word.lx: Inflation has sent food costs soaring./r/n 通货膨胀于食物价格飞涨。/r/n The glider was soaring above the valley./r/n 那架滑翔机在山谷上空滑翔。/r/n

word.name: sober
word.mean:
a. 清醒的,稳重的
v. 使沉著,从醉里醒来
word.lx: He sobered up quickly when he heard the terrible news./r/n 他听到这个坏消息，马上就清醒过来了。/r/n The bad news had a sobering effect on all of us./r/n 对我们大家来说，这个坏消息是发人深省的。/r/n

word.name: soccer
word.lx: People love to play soccer./r/n 人们喜欢踢足球。/r/n The boy who is speaking to Helen enjoys playing soccer./r/n 正在跟海伦谈话的那男孩喜爱踢足球。/r/n

word.name: sociable
word.lx: Her sociable manner is really a mask for a very shy nature./r/n 她那好交际的作风，实际上是她腼腆天性的伪装。/r/n Shunning the society of others; not sociable./r/n 厌恶社交的避免与别人交往的；不爱社交的/r/n

word.name: sociably
word.mean: ad. 和蔼可亲地,善于应酬地

word.name: social
word.lx: Man is a social being./r/n 人是社会性的动物。/r/n We are invited to a small social gathering./r/n 我们被邀请参加一个小型社交聚会。/r/n

word.name: social climber
word.mean: 追求更高社会地位的人,向上爬的人
word.lx: Mrs Brown is known as a social climber./r/n 布朗太太是有名的趋炎附势的人。/r/n

word.name: socialism
word.lx: Who is the founder of the scientific socialism?/r/n 谁是科学社会主义的奠基人？/r/n Some say that capitalism and socialism will eventually converge./r/n 有人说资本主义和社会主义最终会合而为一。/r/n

word.name: socialistic
word.lx: Some of her views are rather socialistic./r/n 她的观点颇有一些社会主义倾向./r/n That socialistic nation pay homage to the previous premier./r/n 那个社会主义国家向前任首相表达敬意。/r/n

word.name: sociality
word.mean: n. 社交, 交际, 社会性

word.name: socialize
word.mean:
vt. 使...社会化(使...社会主义化,使...公有)
v. 交际

word.name: socially
word.mean: ad. 在社会上,在社交上,亲切地

word.name: society
word.lx: Society has a right to expect people to obey the law./r/n 社会有权要求人们守法。/r/n She joined the university art society./r/n 她加入了大学里的艺术协会。/r/n

word.name: socioeconomic
word.lx: A host of compelling socioeconomic problems./r/n 许多令人不得不接受的社会经济问题/r/n

word.name: socket
word.lx: His eyes nearly jumped from their sockets in surprise./r/n 他惊讶得眼珠子差一点跳出来。/r/n This type of bulb screws into the socket./r/n 这种灯是拧到灯座上的./r/n

word.name: socks
word.lx: She rolled the socks into a ball./r/n 她把袜子卷成一团。/r/n These socks retail at 1 dollar a pair./r/n 这些袜子零卖一美圆一双。/r/n

word.name: Socrates
word.lx: Many ancient Greeks were followers of Socrates./r/n 许多古希腊人都是苏格拉底的追随者。/r/n Socrates laid the foundations of logic./r/n 苏格拉底奠定了逻辑学的基础。/r/n

word.name: Socratic
word.mean: a. 苏格拉底问答法的

word.name: sod
word.lx: You stupid sod!/r/n 你这个蠢蛋!/r/n The new boss is a mean sod!/r/n 新来的上司是个大坏蛋!/r/n

word.name: soda
word.lx: He ordered two lime sodas./r/n 他要了两杯酸橙苏打汽水。/r/n Two brandies and soda, please./r/n 劳驾，来两杯白兰地加苏打水。/r/n

word.name: soda fountain
word.lx: A soda fountain drink made by blending carbonated water with flavored syrup./r/n 磷酸果汁汽水将碳化水和调味果汁混合而成的一种苏打冷饮饮料/r/n

word.name: sodden
word.mean:
a. 浑身湿透的,不成样子的,浸过酒的
v. 拿水浸,变柔软,腐败
word.lx: My shoes are sodden from walking in the rain./r/n 我在雨里这么一跑，鞋都湿了。/r/n

word.name: sodium
word.lx: Sodium and water react (together)./r/n 钠和水能起反应./r/n Common salt is a compound of sodium and chlorine./r/n 食盐是钠和氯的化合物./r/n

word.name: sofa
word.lx: The old man is dropping away in the sofa./r/n 这位老人在沙发上打起瞌睡来。/r/n I nestled down on the big sofa and began to read novels./r/n 我舒适地靠在大沙发上，开始看小说。/r/n

word.name: softball
word.mean: n. 垒球(与棒球相似,但球场较小,球大而软)
word.lx: I like to play softball./r/n 我喜欢玩垒球。/r/n

word.name: soften
word.mean: v. 使...变柔软,变柔和,减轻
word.lx: He was softened into tears./r/n 他被感动得流下了眼泪。/r/n The more you soften a request, the more polite it becomes./r/n 你愈使请求柔婉，请求就愈变为客气。/r/n

word.name: softener
word.mean: n. 起软化作用的东西,软化剂,柔软剂

word.name: softly
word.mean: ad. 柔和地,静静地,温柔地
word.lx: A passage to be played softly or quietly./r/n 轻声演奏的乐段要轻轻或静静地演奏的段落/r/n Speak softly and carry a big stick./r/n 说话要温和，但手里要拿着大棒。/r/n

word.name: softness
word.lx: The softness of his reply calmed her down./r/n 他温和的回答使她冷静下来。/r/n The softness of the breeze made him feel sleepy./r/n 柔和的微风使他昏昏欲睡。/r/n

word.name: software
word.lx: There are many sorts of software in my computer./r/n 我的计算机里有很多软件。/r/n Our English software is an interactive educational software./r/n 我们的英语软件是一种交互式教育软件。/r/n

word.name: soil
word.mean:
n. 土地,土壤
v. 弄脏,(使)变脏
vi. 变脏
vt. 弄脏
word.lx: She makes her living from the soil./r/n 她以务农为生。/r/n What shall we grow in this alkaline soil?/r/n 我们应该在碱性土壤里种什么？/r/n

word.name: sojourn
word.mean:
vt. 旅居(逗留)
n. 旅居(逗留)
word.lx: He sojourned with a friend in Wales for two weeks./r/n 他在威尔士一个朋友那儿住了两个星期./r/n

word.name: sojourner
word.lx: The sojourner has been in Wales for two weeks./r/n 那个寄居者在威尔士已经逗留了两个星期。/r/n I am a sojourner of that village./r/n 我是那个小村庄的逗留者。/r/n

word.name: solace
word.mean:
n. 安慰
v. 使快乐
vt. 安慰(物),缓和
word.lx: I found solace from troubles in listening to music./r/n 我听音乐，以便在烦恼时得到安慰。/r/n The sick man found solace in music./r/n 那男病人从音乐中获得了安慰./r/n

word.name: solar
word.lx: We can use solar energy to do many things today./r/n 如今，我们可以利用太阳能做很多事情。/r/n The solar cell can convert the energy of sunlight into electric energy./r/n 太阳能电池能把阳光的能量转化为电能。/r/n

word.name: sold
word.mean:
v. 卖,背叛,销售
vbl. 卖,背叛,销售
word.lx: The record was a big hit and sold a million copies./r/n 这张唱片非常成功，卖了一百万张。/r/n The painting was sold at a profit./r/n 这幅图画可获利销售。/r/n

word.name: solder
word.mean:
n. 焊接剂,接合物,羁绊
v. 施以焊接,接合,补修
word.lx: He soldered the wire back on./r/n 他把金属丝重新焊上去了。/r/n

word.name: soldier
word.lx: The trade of the soldier is war./r/n 士兵的职业是打仗。/r/n The soldier saw a gun jutting out from a bush./r/n 那士兵看见一支枪从矮树丛伸出来。/r/n

word.name: solecism
word.mean: n. 语法错误, 谬误, 失礼

word.name: solely
word.lx: He was actuated solely by greed./r/n 他完全是受了贪欲的驱使./r/n I did it solely for his sake./r/n 我完全为了他才做那件事。/r/n

word.name: solemn
word.mean: a. 庄严的,严肃的,隆重的
word.lx: He looked at her with a solemn expression./r/n 他表情严肃地望着她。/r/n The hollies in the garden make it look solemn./r/n 冬青树使园子看上去很肃穆。/r/n

word.name: solemnity
word.lx: The judge took up the gavel with solemnity./r/n 法官严肃地拿起了小木槌。/r/n Solemnity is a trick of the body to hide the faults of the mind./r/n 一本正经的态度，是肉体为了掩饰精神上的缺陷而作出的一手花招。/r/n

word.name: solicitation
word.lx: I accepted the gifts at her solicitation./r/n 在她的恳求之下，我接受了礼物。/r/n His selfishness caused him to refuse my solicitation./r/n 他的自私让他拒绝了我的请求。/r/n

word.name: solicitor
word.lx: The solicitor is preparing a case in the court tomorrow./r/n 这位律师正在为明天法庭审理的案件做准备。/r/n Her solicitor drew up her last will and testament./r/n 她的律师拟就了她的遗嘱。/r/n

word.name: solicitous
word.mean: a. 热心的,热切想要...的,热切期望
word.lx: She is so solicitous and persistent that she virtually kills you with kindness./r/n 她非常关心而固执，以致她的善意实际上反而使人感到尴尬。/r/n I am solicitous of his help./r/n 我渴得到他的帮助。/r/n

word.name: solicitude
word.lx: Her letter showed deep solicitude for your welfare./r/n 她的来信表示对您的安康甚为挂念。/r/n The solicitude of the caring husband for his wife made her feel unhappy./r/n 那位体贴的丈夫对妻子的关怀使她感觉很不高兴。/r/n

word.name: solid
word.mean:
a. 固体的,结实的,可靠的,实心的
n. 固体
word.lx: Water becomes solid when it freezes./r/n 水结冰时便变成固体。/r/n They were glad to leave the boat and put their feet on the solid ground./r/n 他们很高兴能离开海船，回到坚实的陆地上。/r/n

word.name: solidly
word.mean: ad. 坚硬地, 稳固地
word.lx: We are solidly united on this issue./r/n 我们在这个问题上是团结一致的./r/n It rained solidly for three hours./r/n 雨不停地下了三个小时./r/n

word.name: solitaire
word.lx: The lonely old lady filled up the time between supper and retiring with solitaire./r/n 那孤独的老妇人晚饭后至睡觉前以玩单人纸牌消磨时间。/r/n The game solitaire./r/n 单人纸牌戏/r/n

word.name: solitary
word.mean:
a. 孤独的,唯一的
n. 隐士
word.lx: A solitary rider was seen in the distance./r/n 远处有个孤零零的骑马的人。/r/n The trapper leads a solitary life in the mountains./r/n 那个设陷阱捕猎的人孤独地生活在山里。/r/n

word.name: solitude
word.mean:
n. 孤独
独居,荒僻之地,幽静的地方
word.lx: I am not fond of solitude./r/n 我不喜欢孤独。/r/n The scientist has spent six months in the solitudes of the Antarctic./r/n 这位科学家已经在人迹罕至的南极待了六个月了。/r/n

word.name: solo
word.mean:
n. 独奏,独唱
a. 单独的
v. 放单飞
word.lx: The piano solo was well rendered./r/n 那支钢琴独奏曲弹得真好。/r/n The concert began with a piano solo./r/n 音乐会以钢琴独奏曲拉开序幕。/r/n

word.name: soloist
word.lx: The tenor soloist is unable to appear tonight because of illness./r/n 男高音独唱者因病今晚不能演出./r/n He often appears as a soloist./r/n 他经常作为独奏者上台演出。/r/n

word.name: Solomon
word.mean: 所罗门 (男子名) 所罗门(古以色列国王大卫之子, 以智慧著称); [喻]圣人; 聪明人; 贤人

word.name: soluble
word.lx: This kind of tablet is soluble in water./r/n 这种药片能溶于水。/r/n These problems are not readily soluble./r/n 这些问题不容易解决。/r/n

word.name: solution
word.mean: n. 解答,解决办法,溶解,溶液
word.lx: What color is copper sulfate solution?/r/n 硫酸铜溶液是什么颜色？/r/n It seems (to me) (to be) the best solution./r/n （依我看）这似乎是最好的解决办法./r/n

word.name: solvency
word.lx: Fears about the solvency of the banks precipitated the great economic crash./r/n 对银行偿付能力出现恐慌更加速了经济的崩溃。/r/n

word.name: solvent
word.mean:
n. 溶剂
a. 有偿付能力的,有溶解力的

word.name: somatic
word.mean: a. 身体的,肉体的,身体的

word.name: somber
word.mean: a. 微暗的,阴天的,阴森的
word.lx: She looked up staring at the somber December sky./r/n 她抬起头来，凝望着十二月份阴沉沉的天空。/r/n A funeral is a somber occasion./r/n 葬礼是个忧郁的场合。/r/n

word.name: sombre
word.mean: a. 昏暗的,忧郁的,悲观的
word.lx: She looked up staring at the sombre December sky./r/n 她抬起头来，凝望着十二月份阴沉沉的天空。/r/n A funeral is a sombre occasion./r/n 葬礼是个忧郁的场合。/r/n

word.name: some
word.mean:
a. 一些,少许,某一
int. 一些,一部份,若干
word.lx: Some man at the door is asking to see you./r/n 门口有个男人要求见你。/r/n There is some ice in the bush./r/n 树丛里有些冰。/r/n

word.name: somebody
word.mean:
n. 重要人物
pron. 某人,有人
word.lx: He thinks himself to be somebody, while actually he is nobody./r/n 他自以为是个人物，其实他算不了什么。/r/n He mistook me for somebody else./r/n 他把我错认为别人了。/r/n

word.name: someone
word.lx: Someone has to lock up the house./r/n 总要有人把房子锁起来。/r/n Someone in the audience began to laugh./r/n 观众中有人开始笑起来。/r/n

word.name: somersault
word.lx: A gymnast on the trampoline was turning (ie performing) somersaults./r/n 有个体操运动员正在蹦床上做空翻./r/n The child somersaulted across the gymnasium./r/n 那孩子翻著跟头从体育馆这头翻到那头./r/n

word.name: something
word.lx: I think I dropped something./r/n 我想我掉了东西。/r/n I want something to eat./r/n 我想吃点东西。/r/n

word.name: sometime
word.mean:
a. 以前的,某一时间
ad. 改天,来日
word.lx: He is my sometime boss./r/n 他是我从前的上司。/r/n I hope to see you again sometime next year./r/n 我希望明年某一时候再见到你。/r/n

word.name: sometimes
word.lx: Sometimes the patient cried for the pain./r/n 有时这个病人疼得哭起来。/r/n The vowels in the English alphabet are a,e,i,o,u, and, sometimes, y./r/n 英语的元音字母有a，e，i，o，u，有时也包括y。/r/n

word.name: somewhere
word.mean:
ad. 在某处
n. (在)某处
word.lx: He lives somewhere in the neighborhood./r/n 他住在附近某处。/r/n You will find the text somewhere in the Bible./r/n 你会在圣经里找到这段文章。/r/n

word.name: somnolent
word.lx: The noise of the stream had a pleasantly somnolent effect./r/n 小河潺潺的流水声有宜人的催眠效果./r/n

word.name: son
word.lx: His wife born him a son./r/n 他妻子给他生了一个儿子。/r/n The people in Christendom believe that the Christ was the Son of God./r/n 在基督教界人们相信基督是上帝之子。/r/n

word.name: sonata
word.lx: Her recital led off/She led off her recital with a Haydn sonata./r/n 她在独奏会上首先演出的是海顿的奏鸣曲./r/n The first part of a composition in sonata form that introduces the themes./r/n 呈示部奏呜曲式音乐作品中表现主旋律的第一部分/r/n

word.name: song
word.lx: She is humming a popular song./r/n 她在哼一支流行歌曲。/r/n This song is often ascribed to Bach./r/n 这首歌曲常被说成是巴赫做的。/r/n

word.name: songwriter
word.mean: n. 歌曲作家，歌曲作者

word.name: sonic
word.lx: Sonic booms can break windows./r/n 音爆可以震破窗户。/r/n A trademark used for a sonic depth finder./r/n 回音测深仪一种声音测深仪的商标/r/n

word.name: sonnet
word.lx: Our teacher told us to recite this sonnet written by Shakespeare./r/n 老师要求我们背诵莎士比亚的这首十四行诗。/r/n He read us a sonnet that celebrates love./r/n 他给我们读了一首歌颂爱情的十四行诗。/r/n

word.name: sonorous
word.mean: n. 宏亮的,响亮的,堂堂的
word.lx: There is a sonorous bell in the tower./r/n 塔里有一口洪亮的钟。/r/n The sonorous voice of the priest resounded in the church./r/n 教士那圆润低沉的声音在教堂里回响。/r/n

word.name: sooner
word.mean: [美](在政府开放西部前)抢先取得占有权的人, 用不正当手段先下手的人
word.lx: A good name is sooner lost than won./r/n 【谚】美名易失，不易得。/r/n The sooner the better./r/n st. 越快越好./r/n

word.name: sooth
word.lx: Sooth to say, I got up late./r/n 说实话，我起来晚了。/r/n Her tenderness soothed my anger./r/n 她的亲切平息了我的怒气。/r/n

word.name: soothe
word.lx: A bit of embrocation will soothe your bruised knee./r/n 用一点搽剂可使你那青肿的膝部消肿./r/n A nice cup of tea will soothe your nerves./r/n 一杯好茶可以使你的心绪平静下来。/r/n

word.name: soothing
word.lx: Her words had a soothing effect./r/n 她的话起了安慰的作用。/r/n Having the quality or fragrance of balm; soothing./r/n 香味的，安慰的有香膏、香油、香脂的品质或香味的；安慰的/r/n

word.name: sop
word.mean: n. 车间超载部件(标准操作程序,测量点操作计划)

word.name: Sophia
word.lx: Sophia has it all over Olivia in looks and charm./r/n 索菲娅的长相和魅力都胜过奥利维亚。/r/n Sophia said that she understood but this was not the case./r/n 索菲娅说她懂了，但事实并非如此。/r/n

word.name: sophist
word.lx: Many politicians are cunning sophists./r/n 许多政客都是狡猾的诡辩家./r/n

word.name: sophisticated
word.mean: a. 诡辩的,久经世故的
word.lx: As far as defense is concerned, we need to buy more sophisticated weapons./r/n 就防御的观点来说，我们需要购买更多精密的武器。/r/n The electronics aboard the new aircraft are very sophisticated./r/n 安装在新飞行器上的电子器件非常复杂/r/n

word.name: sophistication
word.mean: n. 诡辩,强词夺理,混合
word.lx: Lacking sophistication or worldly experience; naive./r/n 幼稚的，天真的不世故的，天真的/r/n The avionics on this spacecraft represent a new generation of sophistication./r/n 这架航天飞机上的电子设备代表了新一代的复杂水平/r/n

word.name: sophistry
word.lx: He won the argument by sophistry./r/n 他靠诡辩赢了那场争论./r/n Deception by trickery or sophistry./r/n 圈套通过诡计或诡辩进行的欺骗/r/n

word.name: sophomore
word.mean: n. 大学二年级生(在企业中工作第二年的人)
word.lx: Lily is a Sophomore now./r/n 莉莉现在大学二年级。/r/n

word.name: soporific
word.mean:
a. 催眠的,想睡的
n. 催眠剂
word.lx: Inducing sleep or sedation; soporific./r/n 安神的，麻醉的，镇静的/r/n Inducing sleep; soporific./r/n 睡眠的产生睡眠的，引起酣睡的/r/n

word.name: sorcerer
word.mean: n. 男巫士, 魔术师
word.lx: This story is about sorcerers in traditional fairy-tales./r/n 这个故事是关于传统童话中的魔术师 的。/r/n

word.name: sorcery
word.lx: The house was disappeared by sorcery./r/n 这座房子被魔法变没了。/r/n At that time most people believe in sorcery and witchcraft./r/n 那时候大多数人相信巫术和魔法。/r/n

word.name: sordid
word.mean: a. 肮脏的,不干净的,心一脏的
word.lx: He lived in a sordid slum./r/n 他生活在一个污秽的贫民窟。/r/n He has sordid motives on us./r/n 他对我们有卑鄙的动机。/r/n

word.name: sore
word.mean:
a. 疼痛的,痛心的
n. 痛处,疮口
word.lx: My legs are sore from all that running yesterday./r/n 我的腿因为昨天跑步而感到酸痛。/r/n The poor dog was covered with sores./r/n 这只可怜的狗满身全是伤。/r/n

word.name: sorghum
word.lx: An early-growing, usually drought-resistant grain sorghum resembling millet./r/n 蜀黍与黍相似的一种种植期早，通常抗旱的黍蜀属谷物/r/n

word.name: sorrow
word.mean:
n. 悲伤,哀惜,不幸
v. 悲伤,悲叹
word.lx: Life has many joys and sorrows./r/n 人生有许多欢乐和悲伤。/r/n Sympathy and sorrow aroused by the misfortune or suffering of another./r/n 同情，怜悯对他人所受的不幸或遭遇产生的同情和悲哀/r/n

word.name: sorry
word.mean:
a. 对不起的, 抱歉的
int. 对不起
word.lx: I was sorry to hear that your cat had died./r/n 听说你的猫死了，我觉得很难过。/r/n He was sorry for her and tried to cheer her up./r/n 他为她感到难过，并试图使她振作起来。/r/n

word.name: sort
word.mean:
n. 种类,样子,态度
v. 分类,整理,排序
n.[计算机] DOS命令 : 在字符型文件中进行数据排序, 或者将DOS命令的输出进行排序
word.lx: Sort these eggs by size./r/n 将这些蛋按大小分好。/r/n What sort of book do you want?/r/n 你要哪一类的书？/r/n

word.name: sorter
word.lx: Many workers in the sorting office lost their jobs when an automatic sorter was introduced./r/n 拣信室安装了自动拣信机之後, 许多拣信员都失业了./r/n

word.name: sorting
word.lx: He was sorting his foreign stamps (into piles)./r/n 他正在整理外国邮票（, 都分成一摞一摞的）./r/n Before sorting stamps, any paper sticking to the backs must be removed./r/n 在把邮票分类之前，任何粘在后面的别的纸都得去掉。/r/n

word.name: sought
word.mean:
v. 寻找
vbl. 寻找,搜索

word.name: soul
word.mean:
n. 灵魂,精神
v. 灵魂,心灵
word.lx: What good does it do a man if he gains the whole world but loses his soul?/r/n 如果一个人得到全世界而丧失了灵魂，这对他有何益处呢？/r/n The soul is immortal./r/n 灵魂不灭./r/n

word.name: soulless
word.mean: a. 没有精神的,没有灵魂的,泄气的

word.name: sound
word.mean:
n. 声音,吵闹,海峡
a. 健全的,可靠的,合理的
v. 听,发出声音,测量
word.lx: They have got home safe and sound./r/n 他们已平安到家。/r/n I caught a curious sound in the neighboring room./r/n 我听到隔壁房间里有奇怪的响声。/r/n

word.name: sounding
word.mean:
n. 音响(探测,水的深度,试探)
a. 发声的(夸大的)
word.lx: The studio is being wired for sound./r/n 这个播音室正在安装音响设备用的电线./r/n The sound effects of the fight were very good in that radio play./r/n 广播剧中那场战斗的音响效果很好./r/n

word.name: soundly
word.mean: ad. 完全地,健全地,坚牢地
word.lx: The child was soundly thrashed./r/n 这个孩子被痛打了一顿。/r/n He has been soundly defeated at chess./r/n 他在国际象棋比赛中一败涂地./r/n

word.name: soundtrack
word.lx: A device used to combine and adjust sounds from a variety of sources in order to create a final recorded audio product, such as the soundtrack of a movie./r/n 混频器用来混合和调整不同来源的声音以创造出最终被录的音频产品的装置，如一部电影的音道/r/n

word.name: soup
word.lx: We had some chicken soup./r/n 我们喝了一些鸡汤。/r/n This soup tastes great./r/n 这个汤非常美味。/r/n

word.name: sour
word.mean:
a. 酸的,抑沉的,刻薄的
v. 变酸,变乖戾,变坏
word.lx: The old man has been soured by poverty./r/n 那老人因贫困而变得乖戾了。/r/n The hot weather has soured the milk./r/n 炎热的天气使牛奶变酸了。/r/n

word.name: source
word.lx: The news comes from a reliable source./r/n 这消息来自可靠的来源。/r/n Where is the source of the Rhine?/r/n 莱茵河发源于何处？/r/n

word.name: souse
word.lx: After lying on the street for two hours the souse sober up and walk home./r/n 在街上躺了两个小时後，酒鬼醒了过来走回家去。/r/n Souse fish used to be one of her favorite dish./r/n 腌鱼曾经是她最喜欢吃的菜之一。/r/n

word.name: south
word.mean:
a. 南方的
ad. 在南方
n. 南,南方
word.lx: The wind is in the south./r/n 风向向南。/r/n A humid wind blew from the south./r/n 湿润的风从南方吹来。/r/n

word.name: South Africa
word.lx: Swallows from England go as far as South Africa./r/n 英国来的燕子飞到南非那样远的地方。/r/n The Dutch settled in South Africa./r/n 荷兰人在南非殖民./r/n

word.name: Southampton
word.mean: n. 南安普敦(英国港市)
word.lx: We embarked at Southampton, and disembarked in New York a week later."/r/n ＂我们在南安普敦上船，一星期后到达纽约下船。＂/r/n

word.name: southeast
word.mean:
n. 东南,东南地区
a. 东南的,向东南的,来自东南的
ad. 往东南,来自东南
word.lx: Taiwan is southeast of China./r/n 台湾在中国的东南。/r/n The wind is in the southeast./r/n 东南部有风。/r/n

word.name: southeastern
word.lx: The southeastern wind is strong./r/n 东南风很强。/r/n

word.name: southward
word.mean:
n. 南方
a. 在南方的,往南方的
ad. 往南

word.name: southwest
word.mean:
n. 西南,西南风,西南地区
a. 西南的,来自西南方的
ad. 往西南,来自西南
word.lx: This river flowed southwest to the Atlantic Ocean./r/n 这条河流向西南，汇入大西洋。/r/n Wales is in the southwest of the British Island./r/n 威尔士在大不列颠岛的西南部。/r/n

word.name: southwestern
word.lx: The news is from the southwestern country./r/n 这个消息来自西南方向的村子。/r/n

word.name: souvenir
word.lx: I have no idea what will be a good souvenir from a ski trip./r/n 滑雪之旅回来时，买什么纪念品好，我一点主意也没有。/r/n I bought this bag as a souvenir of my visit to London./r/n 我买了这个袋子作为访问伦敦的纪念品。/r/n

word.name: sovereign
word.mean:
n. 元首,独立国
a. 具有主权的,至高无上的
word.lx: When did it become a sovereign country?/r/n 这个国家是什么时候成为主权国的？/r/n Character is of sovereign importance./r/n 人品最为重要。/r/n

word.name: Soviet
word.mean:
a. 苏联的,苏维埃的
n. 苏维埃

word.name: sow
word.mean:
n. 母猪
v. 播种,散布
word.lx: These seeds should be sown in April./r/n 这些种子应在四月播种。/r/n His words had sowed the seeds of suspicion in their minds./r/n 他的话已在他们心中播下怀疑的种子。/r/n

word.name: soybean
word.lx: The field was laid up in twenty-nine-inch rows for soybeans./r/n 这块地被犁成二十九英寸宽的垄条，准备种大豆。/r/n Please pound up the soybeans./r/n 请把黄豆捣成粉。/r/n

word.name: spa
word.lx: The spa was built in Roman times around hot mineral springs./r/n 该温泉是在罗马时代在热矿泉附近修建起来的。/r/n

word.name: space
word.mean:
n. 位置,空间,距离
v. 隔开,分隔
word.lx: Our earth moves through space./r/n 我们的地球在太空中运行。/r/n There is plenty of space here to move about./r/n 这里有很大的活动空间。/r/n

word.name: space flight
word.lx: The space flight had to be aborted because of the difficulties with the computer./r/n 这次太空飞行因电脑出了故障不得不予以取消。/r/n The science and technology of space flight./r/n 航天学，宇宙航行学研究宇宙飞行的科学及技术/r/n

word.name: spacecraft
word.lx: The spacecraft is orbiting the moon./r/n 宇宙飞船正绕月球飞行。/r/n The scientists calculated when the spacecraft would reach the moon./r/n 科学家推算出宇宙飞船抵达月球的时间。/r/n

word.name: spaceship
word.lx: The spaceship traveled smoothly in the universe./r/n 太空船在宇宙里平稳地飞行。/r/n There are five spacemen in the spaceship./r/n 宇宙飞船里有五个飞行员。/r/n

word.name: spacing
word.mean: n. 留间隔,空隙,排字法
word.lx: Spaces or a space, as in printed matter./r/n 字距空隙或空白，如印刷品中/r/n In typewriters, spacing of10 characters to the inch./r/n 在打字机中，一英寸十个字符的间隔。/r/n

word.name: spacious
word.lx: In its spacious halls are displayed over8000 priceless relics./r/n 在它宽敞的大厅里，展出了8000多件珍贵文物。/r/n The systematic arrangement of chairs makes the hall look spacious./r/n 座椅按照顺序排列，这使得礼堂里显得很宽敞。/r/n

word.name: spade
word.mean:
n. 铲子,铁锹
v. 铲
vt. (用铲子)铲
word.lx: Orders came that we should spade the trench in an hour./r/n 有命令要我们必须在一小时内挖好战壕。/r/n We dig some pits with a spade before planting the trees./r/n 种树前，我们先用铁锹挖了些坑。/r/n

word.name: spaghetti
word.lx: Pasta made in long strands thinner than spaghetti./r/n 细面条，线面做成长条形，比意大利式细面条更细的意大利面食/r/n Spaghetti is one of my favorite foods./r/n 义大利式细面条是我喜欢的食品之一。/r/n

word.name: Spain
word.lx: I was told that Spain is a romantic nation./r/n 有人告诉我说，西班牙是个浪漫的国家。/r/n Spain used to be famous for its strong armada./r/n 西班牙曾以其强大的舰队而著称./r/n

word.name: span
word.mean:
n. 跨度,跨距,范围
v. 持续,贯穿,跨越
word.lx: Can you span an octave on the piano?/r/n 乍能按到钢琴的八个键吗？/r/n They always keep their kitchen spick and span./r/n 他们的厨房总是很整洁./r/n

word.name: spangle
word.mean:
n. 镶金属小片
vt 使...闪烁

word.name: spank
word.mean:
vt. 拍击(疾驶)
n. 拍击(疾驶)
word.lx: The boy got a sound spanking./r/n 那男孩的屁股著实挨了一顿巴掌./r/n

word.name: spanking
word.mean:
a. 疾驰的(劲吹的,第一流的)
ad. 显著地
word.lx: The boy got a sound spanking./r/n 那男孩的屁股著实挨了一顿巴掌./r/n The ship is spanking along./r/n 船在平稳前进。/r/n

word.name: spark
word.mean:
n. 火花,朝气
v. 闪烁,闪光,使拿出朝气
word.lx: There was a wild spark in his eyes./r/n 他的两眼炯炯发光。/r/n The vital spark in him makes him an artist./r/n 他的生气勃勃的活力使他成为一个艺术家。/r/n

word.name: sparkle
word.mean:
n. 闪耀,火花
v. 闪耀,冒火花
word.lx: The wet grass sparkles in the sun./r/n 太阳使湿草闪闪发光。/r/n I like the sparkles in her eyes./r/n 我喜欢她眼睛的光彩。/r/n

word.name: sparks
word.mean: n. 船上无线电报务员
word.lx: The exhaust pipe shot sparks./r/n 排气管中射出了火星。/r/n The promotion of Russell instead of Sarah really made the sparks fly./r/n 因为提升了拉塞尔没提升萨拉, 这件事竟惹起了轩然大波./r/n

word.name: sparrow
word.lx: The sparrow is a common bird in our city./r/n 麻雀在我们这个城市里是一种常见的鸟。/r/n The sparrow alighted on a nearby branch./r/n 那支麻雀飞落在附近的树枝上./r/n

word.name: sparse
word.lx: He has a sparse beard./r/n 他长着稀疏的胡子。/r/n The television coverage of the event was rather sparse./r/n 电视上对这件事报道很少。/r/n

word.name: spartan
word.mean:
n. 斯巴达人, 刚毅之人
a. 斯巴达的

word.name: spasmodic
word.lx: The abnormal, spasmodic swallowing of air, especially as a symptom of hysteria./r/n 吞气症异常的痉挛性吞气，特指歇斯底里的症状/r/n A sudden reflexive or spasmodic muscular movement./r/n 抽搐，痉挛突然反射或痉挛的肌肉运动/r/n

word.name: spat
word.mean:
n. 贝卵,蚝卵,蚝仔
v. 一巴掌打去
word.lx: There is only a spat between the brother and sister./r/n 那只是兄妹间的小吵小闹。/r/n Her parents always have spats./r/n 她的父母经常有些小的口角。/r/n

word.name: spate
word.lx: After the storm all the rivers were in spate./r/n 暴雨过後河水都上涨了./r/n

word.name: spatter
word.lx: We heard the rain spattering down on the roof of the hut./r/n 我们听到雨滴滴答答打在小屋的顶上。/r/n As the bus passed, it spattered mud on my clothes./r/n 公共汽车开过时溅了我一身泥。/r/n

word.name: spatula
word.mean: n. 匙状小竹板,压舌片,炒菜铲
word.lx: He scraped the mixture out of the bowl with a plastic spatula./r/n 他用塑料铲把盆里的混合料刮了出来./r/n She levelled the surface of the cake mixture with a metal spatula./r/n 她用金属铲抹平了蛋糕配料./r/n

word.name: spawn
word.mean:
n. 卵(子,产物,菌丝)
vt 产卵
word.lx: The computer industry has spawned a lot of new companies./r/n 由于电脑工业的发展，许多新公司纷纷成立。/r/n I found a mass of spawn in the fish before cooking./r/n 烧鱼前，我发现鱼里有很多鱼籽。/r/n

word.name: speak
word.lx: Do you speak English?/r/n 你会说英语吗？/r/n The patient is too weak to speak./r/n 病人太衰弱了，不能说话。/r/n

word.name: speaker
word.mean: n. 说话者,发言者,说某种语言者,扬声器
word.lx: He is an excellent speaker of French./r/n 他法语说得非常好。/r/n The speaker was rather hesitant and had to be prompted occasionally by the chairman./r/n 那发言者讲话结结巴巴的, 有时得由主席提示./r/n

word.name: spear
word.mean:
n. 矛(正负电子对撞机)
vt 用矛刺
word.lx: The fisher used a spear as his weapon./r/n 渔夫用矛作为武器。/r/n The spear curved through the air./r/n 标枪在空中沿曲线运动./r/n

word.name: special
word.mean:
n. 专辑,专车,特色菜,特价,特刊
a. 特别的,专门的
word.lx: She is a special friend of mine./r/n 她是我一个特别亲密的朋友。/r/n Take special care tonight because the road is icy./r/n 路面结冰了，今晚要格外小心。/r/n

word.name: special delivery
word.lx: If you want the letter to arrive tomorrow send it (by) special delivery./r/n 要让这封信明天到, 就得用专递服务./r/n

word.name: specialist
word.lx: Her mother is an eye specialist./r/n 她母亲是眼科专家。/r/n The provision of specialist teachers is being increased./r/n 配备专业教员的人数有所增加./r/n

word.name: speciality
word.lx: His speciality is barbecued steaks./r/n 烤牛排是他的拿手好菜./r/n Wood-carvings are a speciality of this village./r/n 木雕是这个村的特殊工艺品./r/n

word.name: specialization
word.mean: n. 特别化,特殊化,专门化

word.name: specialize
word.lx: This shop specializes in chocolates./r/n 这个商店专门出售巧克力。/r/n He specializes in oriental history./r/n 他专门研究东方史。/r/n

word.name: specially
word.lx: I made this cake specially, with brown sugar instead of white./r/n 我特别地以红糖代替白糖做了这个蛋糕。/r/n These goats are specially bred for their wool./r/n 这些山羊是专为剪取羊毛而饲养的./r/n

word.name: species
word.lx: This rare bird has become an endangered species./r/n 这种珍禽已成为濒临灭绝的物种。/r/n An animal or plant species that establishes itself in a previously barren environment./r/n 先驱生物能在不毛之地生存的某种动物或植物种类/r/n

word.name: specific
word.mean:
n. 特效药,特性,详情
a. 特殊的,明确的,具有特效的
