word.lx: There is a specific tool for each job./r/n 各工种配备特定的工具。/r/n He gave us very specific instructions./r/n 他给我们做了非常明确的指示。/r/n

word.name: specification
word.mean: n. 规格,详述,详细说明书
word.lx: Have you got a product of this specification?/r/n 不知你们有没有这种规格的？/r/n In case of need we can offer you some other brand of the same specification./r/n 万一有需要，我们可供应同样规格的其它牌号货品。/r/n

word.name: specifics
word.lx: It also incorporate new optimization specific to particular server and local database format./r/n 它也把新的优化细节合并到特殊服务器与本地数据库格式中。/r/n He gave us very specific instructions./r/n 他给我们做了非常明确的指示。/r/n

word.name: specify
word.mean: v. 明确说明,叙述,指定,详细说明

word.name: specimen
word.lx: The museum displays the specimen of ancient Chinese porcelain./r/n 这个博物馆展出中国古瓷器标本。/r/n He is still a fine specimen of health./r/n 他仍是健康的典范。/r/n

word.name: speciosity
word.mean: n. 似是而非,外表美观

word.name: specious
word.mean: a. 似是而非的,华而不实的

word.name: speckle
word.mean:
n. 小斑点
vt. 点缀

word.name: spectacles
word.lx: The old man put on his spectacles and started reading./r/n 老人戴上眼镜开始看书。/r/n I fumbled about trying to find my spectacles in the dark./r/n 我在黑暗中摸索试着找我的眼镜。/r/n

word.name: spectacular
word.mean: a. 公开展示的,惊人的
word.lx: The new play was a spectacular success./r/n 这出新戏获得了巨大的成功。/r/n The goalkeeper made a spectacular dive to save the goal./r/n 守门员做了一个精彩的鱼跃动作救回一球./r/n

word.name: spectacularly
word.mean:
a. 壮观的,华丽的
ad. 令人吃惊地,引人注目地

word.name: spectator
word.lx: Football is our most popular spectator sport./r/n 足球是最受我们欢迎、最能吸引观众的一项运动。/r/n One that looks on; a spectator./r/n 旁观者一旁观望者，一位观众/r/n

word.name: spectators
word.lx: The spectators scuttled for shelter when it began to rain./r/n 一下起雨来，观众就纷纷找地方躲避。/r/n The spectators all booed the teams./r/n 全体观众都向两队喝倒彩./r/n

word.name: specter
word.mean: n. 幽灵,妖怪,恐布的根源
word.lx: The specter of unemployment hunted the country./r/n 失业的幽灵在这个国家作祟。/r/n A supernatural being; a ghost or specter./r/n 下凡的神仙超自然力的灵魂；鬼魂或幽灵/r/n

word.name: speculation
word.lx: He makes some unprofitable speculations./r/n 他在做些无利可图的投机生意。/r/n They have much speculation over the cause of the air crash./r/n 他们对飞机坠毁原因有多方推测。/r/n

word.name: speculative
word.mean: a. 思索性的,暝想性的,推理的
word.lx: Their speculative buying of grain is illegal./r/n 他们投机购买谷物是不合法的。/r/n His conclusions are purely speculative./r/n 他的结论完全是推测而来的。/r/n

word.name: speculator
word.mean: n. 投机者,投机商人,思索家

word.name: sped
word.lx: The holidays simply sped by./r/n 假期简直是一晃而过。/r/n The taxi sped off at full speed./r/n 那辆出租车飞快地开走了。/r/n

word.name: speech
word.lx: Only human beings are capable of speech./r/n 只有人类才具有说话的能力。/r/n I had to give a speech to the press club./r/n 我得向记者俱乐部发表演说。/r/n

word.name: speechless
word.mean: a. 不会说话的(说有出话的,无言的,非言语能表达的)
word.lx: I was speechless with surprise./r/n 我惊讶得说不出话来。/r/n Speechless or confused in expression, as from shyness, embarrassment, or astonishment./r/n 张口结舌的由于害羞、尴尬或震惊而无法说话或说话不清的/r/n

word.name: speed
word.mean:
n. 速度,迅速,超速
v. 加速,超速,推进
word.lx: The holidays simply sped by./r/n 假期简直是一晃而过。/r/n The police are advising motorists to reduce speed because of the fog./r/n 由于有雾，警察告诫驾车者减慢速度。/r/n

word.name: speed limit
word.lx: She was driving at well over the speed limit./r/n 她开车的速度远远超过了速度限制。/r/n He was prosecuted for exceeding the speed limit./r/n 他被告发超速行驶。/r/n

word.name: speeder
word.mean: n. 调节速度的装置,以超过规定的速度行车者

word.name: speedily
word.lx: He rarely spoke unless personally appealed to, and speedily went into his shell again./r/n 他很少讲话，除非他本人十分感兴趣时。即使如此，也会很快地恢复沉默。/r/n The squall speedily blew over./r/n 风暴很快平息下来了。/r/n

word.name: speedometer
word.lx: The speedometer was indicating 95 mph./r/n 速度计指示著每小时95英里./r/n The speedometer needle touched100./r/n 速度计的指针转到一百哩。/r/n

word.name: spell
word.mean:
n. 一段时间,符咒,魅力
v. (spelt,spelt) 拼,拼写,拼成
word.lx: After a short spell in hospital she was soon back at work./r/n 她在医院住了一段时间后，很快又回来上班了。/r/n The Americans spell some words differently from the British./r/n 美国人拼写某些单词不同于英国人。/r/n

word.name: spelling
word.lx: He is poor at spelling./r/n 他不善于拼写。/r/n The composition is a not well written, and moreover, there are many spelling mistakes in it./r/n 这篇作文写得不好，而且，还有许多拼写错误。/r/n

word.name: spelunker
word.mean: n. 爱好探索洞穴的人

word.name: spencer
word.lx: He buy a block of share in mark and spencer./r/n 他购买了“麦克斯和斯潘塞百货联销店”的大宗股份。/r/n

word.name: spend
word.lx: Come and spend the weekend with us./r/n 来和我们一起度周末吧。/r/n We spent many hours in a pleasant conversation./r/n 我们畅谈了好几个小时。/r/n

word.name: spendthrift
word.mean:
n. 浪费的人
a. 浪费的,挥霍无度的

word.name: spent
word.mean:
v. 花费,度过,浪费
vbl. 花费,度过,浪费
word.lx: Spent lavishly on dinner just for effect./r/n 晚餐吃得很奢侈浪费只是为了面子上好看/r/n A large amount of money is spent on advertisements every year./r/n 每年都要花费大量金钱在广告上。/r/n

word.name: sperm
word.lx: He has a low sperm count./r/n 他的精液中精子含量少。/r/n The male sperm fertilizes the female egg./r/n 雄性的精子使雌性的卵子受精./r/n

word.name: spew
word.mean:
v. (使)喷出,涌出,呕吐,吐出
vt. 喷出
word.lx: The volcano spewed molten lava./r/n 火山喷出了熔岩./r/n Water spewed out of the hole./r/n 水从孔中射出./r/n

word.name: sphere
word.mean:
a. 球体的
n. 范围,领域,球,球体
word.lx: The scientist is distinguished in many spheres of knowledge./r/n 这位科学家在许多知识领域中都是杰出的。/r/n The earth, sun and moon are spheres./r/n 地球、太阳和月亮都是天体。/r/n

word.name: spherical
word.mean: a. 球的,球面的,球状的
word.lx: The oil-lamp needs a new globe, spherical lampshade./r/n 这油灯需配个新的圆灯罩./r/n

word.name: spheroidal
word.mean: a. 球状的(扁球体的,椭球体,球状的)

word.name: spice
word.lx: Please add more spices to the cake./r/n 请给蛋糕多加点香料。/r/n Variety is the spice of life./r/n 变化是生活的调味品。/r/n

word.name: spiced
word.lx: These small spiced cakes are a peculiarity of the region./r/n 这些别有风味的小蛋糕是该地的特产。/r/n His conversation is spiced with humor./r/n 他的谈话有风趣。/r/n

word.name: spicery
word.mean: n. [总称]香料,调味品,香气,香味

word.name: spicy
word.lx: Do you like spicy food?/r/n 你喜欢吃辣的食物吗？/r/n Spicy food disagrees with me./r/n 我不能吃辛辣食品。/r/n

word.name: spider
word.lx: The little girl thinks spiders are terrible creatures./r/n 小女孩认为蜘蛛是一种可怕的生物。/r/n The spider can catch insects by cobweb./r/n 蜘蛛能用蜘蛛网抓住昆虫。/r/n

word.name: spidery
word.mean: a. 蜘蛛一般的,细长足,蜘蛛网一般的

word.name: spike
word.mean:
n. 长钉,钉鞋
v. 以大钉钉牢,使...失效
word.lx: There are many sharp spikes on the railings in the park./r/n 公园的栏杆上有很多尖头。/r/n A pointed tool, such as a spike or chisel, used for breaking rock or ore./r/n 钢楔一种如尖铁或凿子等有尖的，用于劈裂岩石或砂石的工具/r/n

word.name: spiky
word.mean: a. 道钉一般的,尖的,钉满钉子的
word.lx: Your hairbrush is too spiky for me./r/n 你的发刷我觉得太尖了./r/n The hedgehog rolled up into a spiky ball./r/n 刺 卷起身子成了一个刺球./r/n

word.name: spilt
word.lx: The spilt milk made a terrible mess on the carpet./r/n 牛奶洒在地毯上弄得一塌糊涂./r/n She sopped up the spilt milk with a cloth./r/n 她用一块布抹去溢出的牛奶。/r/n

word.name: spin
word.mean:
n. 旋转,疾驰
v. 纺织,旋转,拉长
word.lx: Silkworms spin cocoons./r/n 蚕作茧。/r/n The pitcher gave a spin to the ball./r/n 投手使球旋转。/r/n

word.name: spinach
word.lx: You should eat such vegetables as carrot, celery and spinach./r/n 你应该吃胡萝卜、芹菜和菠菜这类的蔬菜。/r/n Prepared, cooked, or served with spinach./r/n 用菠菜做菜用菠菜准备、烹饪或招待/r/n

word.name: spinal
word.mean:
a. 针的,尖刺的,尖刺状突起的
a. 脊骨的，脊髓的
word.lx: He had a spinal injury in that accident./r/n 他在那次事故中脊柱受了伤。/r/n A membrane, especially one of the three membranes enclosing the brain and spinal cord in vertebrates./r/n 脑膜一种膜，尤指覆盖脑子和脊椎中脊髓的三种细胞膜之一/r/n

word.name: spindle
word.mean:
n. 纱锭,纺锤,轴
v. 变细长

word.name: spinet
word.mean: n. 古时的小型竖琴,小型立式钢琴

word.name: spinner
word.lx: One of the three Fates, the spinner of the thread of destiny./r/n 克洛索三命运神之一，命运之线的纺织者/r/n In the west province the money spinner is cocoa./r/n 在西部省份，赚钱的产品是可可。/r/n

word.name: spinning
word.mean:
a. 纺织品的
n. 纺织
word.lx: The motorcycles were spinning along at full speed./r/n 摩托车正全速疾驰。/r/n She is unbred to spinning./r/n 她未受纺织之训练。/r/n

word.name: spinster
word.lx: The spinster is very sad./r/n 那个老处女很悲伤。/r/n In America law and custom alike is based upon the dream of spinster./r/n 在美国，法律与风俗习惯一样，是把基础置于老处女的梦想之上。/r/n

word.name: spiny
word.mean: a. 多针的,尽是尖刺的,尖刺状的

word.name: spire
word.mean:
n. 尖塔,尖顶,旋涡
v. 突出,耸立
word.lx: We could see the spire of the church in the distance./r/n 我们可以看到远处教堂的尖塔。/r/n The spires of churches are to be seen pricking up through the greenery./r/n 透过葱翠的树林可以看见那耸立着的教堂的塔尖。/r/n

word.name: spirit
word.lx: He is in low spirit./r/n 他意气消沉。/r/n The priest says that the human spirit never dies./r/n 牧师说，人的灵魂永远不死。/r/n

word.name: spirited
word.mean: a. 精神饱满的,活泼的,英勇的
word.lx: The broad or spirited humor characteristic of such works./r/n 喜剧性的风格这类戏剧形式夸张和活泼的幽默风格/r/n Spirited; lively; gay./r/n 活泼的，轻快的；愉快的/r/n

word.name: spirits
word.lx: The good news lifted my spirits./r/n 这好消息使我精神大振。/r/n Mettle or spirit in horses./r/n 马的精力或勇气/r/n

word.name: spiritual
word.mean:
a. 精神的,心灵的
n. (尤指美国南部黑人的)圣歌
word.lx: I care more about the spiritual life than the substantial life./r/n 和物质生活相比，我更注重精神生活。/r/n They seem to exist on a different spiritual plane./r/n 他们似乎生活在不同的精神境界./r/n

word.name: spiritually
word.lx: Spiritually impoverished or alienated./r/n 精神上颓丧；无寄托的/r/n Not spiritually renewed or reformed; not repentant./r/n 不悔改的未在精神上自新或改良的；不惭愧的/r/n

word.name: spiteful
word.lx: He made a spiteful comment./r/n 他发表了恶意的评论。/r/n It was spiteful of her to do that./r/n 她那样做是怀有恶意的。/r/n

word.name: splash
word.mean:
n. 飞浅的水,污点,卖弄
v. 溅湿,溅开
word.lx: The story was splashed across the front page of the newspaper./r/n 这篇报道刊登在报纸头版显著位置。/r/n She splashed out on a new pair of shoes./r/n 她心血来潮买了一双新鞋。/r/n

word.name: splashy
word.mean: a. 大而显眼的,引人注目的

word.name: spleen
word.lx: When I get frustrated and angry, I have to vent my spleen on someone./r/n 我受尽挫折，怒火冲天时，禁不住想找谁发一顿脾气。/r/n Some men give their blood to their country; others their spleen./r/n 既有人为国捐躯，亦有人捐坏脾气（怀恨）。/r/n

word.name: splendid
word.lx: We had a splendid holiday./r/n 我们度过了一个极好的假期。/r/n Their weeding was a splendid affair./r/n 他们的婚礼富丽堂皇。/r/n

word.name: splendidly
word.mean: ad. 辉煌地(壮丽地,华丽地)
word.lx: Proper advantage is not being taken of this splendidly equipped sports hall./r/n 这座设施豪华的体育馆没有被充分地利用起来。/r/n

word.name: splendour
word.mean: n. 光彩,显赫,辉煌,壮丽,华丽
word.lx: Down came my wife dressed out in all her former splendour./r/n 我妻子如往日一般身着盛装从楼上走了下来。/r/n He had never before gazed on such splendour./r/n 他生平从未见过如此壮观的场面。/r/n

word.name: splenetic
word.mean:
a. 脾脏的,容易发怒的,坏心眼的
n. 脾脏病患者,坏心眼的人,脾脏病的药

word.name: splinter
word.mean:
n. 碎片,刺
v. 劈开,破裂
word.lx: Some splinters of glass had got into his feet./r/n 他的脚上扎了一些碎玻璃屑。/r/n I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes./r/n 我在搬箱子的时候手指头上扎了一根刺。/r/n

word.name: split second
word.mean: a. 极快的,一刹那的,极精确的
word.lx: The plan depends on ,split-second timing./r/n 这计画要想成功就得分秒不差./r/n It all happened in a split second./r/n 这一切都是在顷刻间发生的。/r/n

word.name: splurge
word.mean:
n. 炫耀,摆阔
v. 挥霍,乱花
word.lx: I had a splurge and bought two new suits./r/n 我大手大脚花了一笔钱买了两套新衣服./r/n She won 100 and then splurged it all on new clothes./r/n 她赢了100英镑, 都挥霍在买新衣服上了./r/n

word.name: splutter
word.mean: n. 杂乱而仓促的话, 杂乱的声音
word.lx: She dived into the water and came up coughing and spluttering./r/n 她扎入水中, 浮上来时呛得连咳嗽带喷水./r/n The candle gave a few faint splutters and then went out./r/n 蜡烛发出轻轻的毕剥声後就熄灭了./r/n

word.name: spoil
word.mean:
n. 战利品,奖品
v. 宠坏,溺爱,破坏,腐坏
word.lx: The child was spoilt by his grandfather./r/n 这个孩子被他的爷爷给惯坏了。/r/n He had spoiled the soup by putting in too much salt./r/n 他往汤里放盐太多，把汤给糟蹋了。/r/n

word.name: spoilage
word.mean: n. 掠夺,糟蹋,弄坏或变成无用之物

word.name: spoilt
word.lx: Only children are sometimes spoilt./r/n 独生子女有时被宠坏了./r/n The child was spoilt by his grandfather./r/n 这个孩子被他的爷爷给惯坏了。/r/n

word.name: spoke
word.lx: He spoke to the class about the dangers of smoking./r/n 他给班上学生讲了吸烟的危害性。/r/n She always spoke kindly to the children./r/n 她总是亲切地和孩子们说话。/r/n

word.name: spokesman
word.lx: He is the spokesman of the council./r/n 他是国务院的发言人。/r/n The palace (ie A spokesman for the king, queen, etc) has just issued a statement./r/n 王宫发言人刚宣布了一项声明./r/n

word.name: spokeswoman
word.lx: The chief spokeswoman of a movement or cause./r/n 女代言人运动或事业的女性主要发言人/r/n

word.name: spongy
word.mean: a. 像海绵的,不坚实的
word.lx: There grows some spongy moss on the stone./r/n 石头上长着一些柔软的苔藓。/r/n Drank the fresh air; spongy earth that drank up the rain./r/n 呼吸新鲜空气；饱浸雨水的绵软泥土/r/n

word.name: sponsor
word.mean:
n. 保证人,赞助者
v. 发起,赞助
word.lx: A wealthy sponsor came to our rescue with a generous donation./r/n 有个富有的赞助人慷慨捐赠来解救我们./r/n Mr. Robert Brown was announced as the sponsor./r/n 罗勃特。布朗先生被宣布为赞助人。/r/n

word.name: sponsorship
word.mean: n. 发起(主办,倡议,赞助)
word.lx: This establishment opened under the sponsorship of a large corporation./r/n 这一机构是在一家大企业倡导下开办的。/r/n The club has made an approach to a local business firm for sponsorship./r/n 俱乐部已试探向本地一家公司寻求资助./r/n

word.name: spontaneity
word.mean: n. 自然发生,自生,自发

word.name: spontaneous
word.mean: a. 自发的,自然产生的
word.lx: She shows a spontaneous gaiety of manner./r/n 她露出天真愉快的神态。/r/n Spontaneous fellowship and sympathy among a number of people./r/n 本能的友情一群人自然产生的友谊和同情/r/n

word.name: spontaneously
word.mean: ad. 自发地(自生地,自然产生地,自然地,天然地)
word.lx: Spontaneously igniting in air./r/n 自燃的在空气中自发地燃烧的/r/n I had never been spontaneously approached by a publisher and such condescension rather turned my head./r/n 还从没有一个出版商主动来与我接洽，这种屈尊有点让我受宠若惊。/r/n

word.name: spool
word.mean:
n. 线轴,缠线用的框
v. 缠绕在线轴上
word.lx: I need one more spool of thread before finishing the embroidery./r/n 再来一轴线我就可以完成这幅刺绣了。/r/n The film flew off the spool and wound itself round the projector./r/n 电影胶片从卷轴滑出缠绕在放映机上了./r/n

word.name: spoon
word.mean:
n. 匙,匙形的铲子
v. 以匙舀起,调情
word.lx: His soup spoon dropped onto the ground./r/n 他的汤勺掉到了地上。/r/n Two spoons of sugar, please./r/n 请来两勺糖。/r/n

word.name: spoonful
word.lx: She put a spoonful of milk in each of the two cup./r/n 她在这两个杯子里各放了一匙牛奶。/r/n Sprinkle a spoonful of bran onto the stew to increase the fibre content./r/n 往炖煮的食物上加一匙麦麸，以增加其纤维含量。/r/n

word.name: sporadic
word.mean: a. 不定时发生的,零星的
word.lx: Despite the sporadic disturbances the dictator was still riding high./r/n 虽不时有骚动事件，该独裁者仍能控制局势。/r/n

word.name: sporadically
word.mean: ad. 偶发地, 零星地

word.name: sport
word.mean:
n. 运动,游戏,娱乐
a. 运动的,户外穿戴的
v. 游戏,戏弄,炫耀
word.lx: Football is my favorite sport./r/n 足球是我最喜欢的运动。/r/n Sport is being debased by commercialism./r/n 体育运动的价值受商业化的影响而逐渐下降。/r/n

word.name: sporting
word.mean: a. 喜好运动的,运动用的,冒险性的
word.lx: The cup final is an important date in the sporting calendar./r/n 足总杯决赛在运动日程表中是个重要日子。/r/n Illness has curtailed her sporting activities./r/n 她因病而减少了体育活动。/r/n

word.name: sports
word.lx: He is a sports buff./r/n 他是一个体育运动爱好者。/r/n The new sports model achieved 100 miles an hour in road tests./r/n 这种新型号赛车於道路测试中时速达100英里./r/n

word.name: sports car
word.lx: Were I rich enough, I would buy a sports car./r/n 如果我有足够的钱，我就买一辆赛车了。/r/n The company is bringing out a new sports car./r/n 公司正在生产一种新跑车./r/n

word.name: sportswoman
word.lx: She was designated sportswoman of the year./r/n 她被指定为本年度的体坛明星。/r/n

word.name: spot
word.mean:
n. 污点,地点,斑点
a. 当场的,现实买卖的
v. 污点,认出,用灯光照射
word.lx: Spain is our favorite holiday spot./r/n 西班牙是我们喜欢的度假地点。/r/n They were spotted by police as they were entering the bank./r/n 他们走进银行时被警察认出来了。/r/n

word.name: spotless
word.mean: a. 无脏污的,无缺点的,无可挑剔的
word.lx: He keeps his house spotless./r/n 他把家收拾得很整洁。/r/n She keeps a spotless reputation./r/n 她保持着清白的名声。/r/n

word.name: spotlight
word.mean:
n. 照明灯,车头灯
公众注意中心
word.lx: This footballer is a sportsman who likes to be in the spotlight./r/n 这个足球运动员是个爱出风头的运动员。/r/n There are many spotlights on the stage./r/n 舞台上有很多聚光灯。/r/n

word.name: spots
word.lx: The leopard cannot change its spots./r/n 【谚】江山易改，本性难移。/r/n Did you feel a few spots of rain?/r/n 下了几滴雨，你感觉到了吗？/r/n

word.name: spotted
word.mean: a. 有斑点的,斑纹的,弄污了的
word.lx: He spotted his reputation by lying repeatedly./r/n 他因反复说谎而败坏了自己的名声。/r/n They were spotted by police as they were entering the bank./r/n 他们走进银行时被警察认出来了。/r/n

word.name: spotty
word.mean: a. 遍处斑点的,遍处污点的,发疹的

word.name: spouse
word.mean:
n. 配偶
vt. 和...结婚

word.name: spout
word.mean:
n. 喷口
v. 喷出,装腔作势说出,典押
word.lx: Water is spouting out of the pipe./r/n 水正从管子里喷出来。/r/n The spout of the teapot is jammed by tea./r/n 茶壶的壶口被茶叶堵住了。/r/n

word.name: sprain
word.lx: The doctor ordered the man who had sprained his ankle to keep quiet a few days./r/n 医生命令那扭伤足踝的人静养几天。/r/n My sprained ankle has been acting up badly all week./r/n 我的脚扭伤了, 整整难受了一个星期./r/n

word.name: sprang
word.lx: New buildings sprang up like bamboo shoots after a spring rain./r/n 新的建筑物如雨后春笋般大批出现。/r/n The soldier sprang at the enemy./r/n 士兵猛扑向敌人。/r/n

word.name: sprawl
word.mean:
vi. 躺卧(蔓延)
n. 躺卧(蔓延)
word.lx: He lay in a sprawl over the desk./r/n 他手脚摊开趴在书桌上。/r/n They were sprawled out in front of the fire./r/n 他们摊开手脚烤火。/r/n

word.name: spray
word.mean:
n. 水沫,喷雾器
v. 喷雾,扫射,喷射
word.lx: He sprayed paint on the wall./r/n 他把漆喷在墙上。/r/n The gangsters sprayed the car with machinegun bullets./r/n 匪徒们用机枪狂扫汽车。/r/n

word.name: spread
word.mean:
n. 传布,伸展
a. 扩延的
v. 传布,推广,伸出
word.lx: We spread butter on bread./r/n 我们把奶油涂到面包上。/r/n A wide stretch of land spread in front of us./r/n 展现在我们面前的是一片广阔的土地。/r/n

word.name: spreading
word.lx: What can we do to prevent the disease spreading?/r/n 我们能做什么来防止这种疾病蔓延呢？/r/n Television has become an important vehicle for spreading political ideas./r/n 电视已成为传播政治思想的重要媒介。/r/n

word.name: sprig
word.mean:
n. 小树枝,图钉
v. 折取小树枝,用钉子钉上
word.lx: He decorated the chicken with sprigs of parsley./r/n 他用欧芹的嫩枝点缀在鸡上。/r/n

word.name: spring
word.mean:
n. 春天,弹簧,跳跃,泉水
a. 春天的
v. 弹起，弹出,跳,裂开
word.lx: The cat made a spring at the mouse./r/n 猫向老鼠扑去。/r/n A suspicion sprang up in his mind./r/n 他的脑中突然产生了一些疑问。/r/n

word.name: springtime
word.lx: I like springtime best of all./r/n 我最喜欢春天。/r/n The springtime of life; youth./r/n 人生的初期；青春/r/n

word.name: springy
word.lx: A light springy jump or leap, especially on one foot./r/n （犹指单脚）轻快地一蹦或一跳/r/n The turf felt springy under their feet./r/n 他们走在草皮上，觉得很松软。/r/n

word.name: sprinkle
word.lx: It sprinkled that evening./r/n 那天晚上下了小雨。/r/n We covered the cakes with chocolate sprinkles./r/n 我们给蛋糕洒上巧克力末。/r/n

word.name: sprinkling
word.lx: A container with small holes in the top for sprinkling ground pepper./r/n 胡椒瓶一种顶部有很多倒胡椒粉小孔的容器/r/n The ceremony of sprinkling the altar, clergy, and congregation with holy water./r/n 洒圣水礼用圣水泼洒圣坛、教士及教众的仪式/r/n

word.name: sprout
word.mean:
n. 芽,萌芽
v. 使发芽,长芽
word.lx: Leaves began to sprout from the trees./r/n 树上开始长叶子了。/r/n These potatoes have begun to sprout./r/n 这些马铃薯开始发芽了。/r/n

word.name: spruce
word.mean:
n. 虎尾枞属的植物,赤松
a. 颇为干净的,俏的,时髦的
v. 使显干净,装样子
word.lx: Spruce and pine are evergreen trees./r/n 云杉和松树都是常绿树木。/r/n They all spruced up for the party./r/n 他们打扮得漂漂亮亮去参加聚会。/r/n

word.name: sprung
word.lx: He is sprung from noble ancestors./r/n 他出身名门。/r/n Something rather odd has sprung up./r/n 发生了一桩相当奇怪的事。/r/n

word.name: spun
word.lx: Dancers spun in a swirl of skirts./r/n 跳舞的人旋转著, 裙子也不停地打转./r/n The little paper boat was caught in an eddy and spun round and round in the water./r/n 小纸船卷进了漩涡中，在水中直打转。/r/n

word.name: spunk
word.lx: Spunk up before the public at least./r/n 至少你要在公众面前打起精神来。·/r/n Spunk up, everything will be all right./r/n 别恢心，一切都会好起来的。/r/n

word.name: spur
word.mean:
n. 马刺
v. 刺激,激励
word.lx: He dug in his spurs./r/n 他用靴刺踢马。/r/n What spurred her to do that?/r/n 是什么促使她那么干的？/r/n

word.name: spurious
word.lx: Characterized by adulteration; spurious./r/n 掺假的以掺假为特征的；伪造的/r/n Spurious writings, especially writings falsely attributed to biblical characters or times./r/n 伪经伪造的经文，尤指假托圣经人物或圣经时代所写的经文/r/n

word.name: spurn
word.mean:
v. 拒绝,摈弃
vt. 轻蔑地拒绝,唾弃
word.lx: I spurn your offer./r/n 我拒绝你的提议。/r/n Carl had been from his childhood a ball of fortune to spurn at./r/n 自从童年时起卡尔就一直是一个被命运跑踢来踢去的球，饱经沧桑。/r/n

word.name: spurt
word.mean:
vt. 喷出(短促突然的爆发,短时间)
n. 喷出(短促突然的爆发,短时间)
word.lx: The wound was spurting blood./r/n 伤口淌著血./r/n The volcano spurted (out) molten lava./r/n 火山喷出了熔岩./r/n

word.name: sputnik
word.mean: n. 前苏联人造地球卫星

word.name: sputter
word.mean: v. 喷溅，发出噼啪声，语无伦次地说

word.name: squabble
word.mean:
vt. 争论(搞乱)
n. 争论(搞乱)
word.lx: I hate to squabble with my wife about money./r/n 我厌恶为钱的事兴太太争吵。/r/n No man will squabble over a nickel./r/n 没有人会为了五分钱而吵架。/r/n

word.name: squad
word.lx: At two the squad fell out./r/n 两点钟时这个班解散了。/r/n A short, rehearsed jingle or phrase, shouted in unison by a squad of cheerleaders./r/n 欢呼一小队啦啦队员齐声喊的短促、反复的音韵或短语/r/n

word.name: squadron
word.mean: n. 骑兵营,分遣队,小舰队
word.lx: The young soldier was appointed squadron leader./r/n 这位年轻的士兵被任命为骑兵队的队长。/r/n The squadron flew a reconnaissance mission./r/n 该空军中队执行一侦察任务./r/n

word.name: squalid
word.lx: A cheap or squalid theater./r/n 跳蚤窝低劣的或肮脏的剧院/r/n A squalid or filthy condition./r/n 肮脏污秽或肮脏的状态/r/n

word.name: squall
word.mean:
n. 狂风,暴风雪,哇哇器声
v. 狂风吹袭,哇哇地叫嚷
word.lx: It is said that the squall will come tomorrow./r/n 据说暴风雪明天就要来了。/r/n The squall speedily blew over./r/n 风暴很快平息下来了。/r/n

word.name: squalor
word.lx: There is indescribable squalor in those books./r/n 那些书简直污秽不堪。/r/n

word.name: square
word.mean:
n. 正方形,街区,平方
a. 正方形的,正直的,公正的
v. 一致,符合,使...成方形
n. 广场
word.lx: The little girl drew a square on the paper./r/n 小女孩在纸上画了一个正方形。/r/n The teams are all square at one match each./r/n 这些队在各自参加了一场比赛后不分胜负。/r/n

word.name: square dance
word.lx: The music for a square dance./r/n 四对男女跳的方形舞曲/r/n

word.name: squarely
word.mean:
ad. 成方形地,正直地
ad.直接了当的、不含糊的、诚实的
word.lx: He faced me squarely across the table./r/n 他在桌子那边正对著我。/r/n This recent tragedy has put the manufacturersof the drug squarely in the dock./r/n 新近发生的这一悲惨事件使药品厂商受到指控./r/n

word.name: squarish
word.mean: a. 似方形的,有点方的

word.name: squash
word.mean:
n. 壁球,摺皱不堪,拥挤嘈杂的人群
v. 压扁,变扁,压制
n. 南瓜
word.lx: He sat on his hat and squashed it flat./r/n 他坐在自己的帽子上，把它压扁了。/r/n The cat got run over by the lorry and squashed./r/n 那只猫被卡车碾死了。/r/n

word.name: squat
word.mean:
n. 蹲
a. 蹲著的,矮胖胖的
v. 蹲下,坐
word.lx: Can you find somewhere to squat?/r/n 你找个地方坐下好吗?/r/n The old man squatted down by the fire./r/n 老人蹲在炉火旁。/r/n

word.name: squeal
word.mean:
v.&n. 长而尖的叫声
vi. 发出长声尖叫
word.lx: He squealed like a pig./r/n 他像猪似的号叫著./r/n The pigs were squealing./r/n 猪在尖叫./r/n

word.name: squeeze
word.mean:
n. 压榨,挤
v. 紧握,挤

word.name: squelch
word.mean:
vi. 压扁(发出格喳格喳声)
n. 格喳格喳声(静噪电路)
word.lx: The army get bogged down in the thick squelch mud./r/n 军队都陷入泥沼中，行进时烂泥扑哧作声。/r/n She squelched along the muddy path./r/n 她沿着泥泞小径格吱格吱地走。/r/n

word.name: squint
word.mean:
n. 斜视眼,斜著
a. 斜视的
v. 使变斜视眼,斜视
word.lx: The bottle-top has been screwed on squint./r/n 瓶盖没拧正。/r/n He squinted in the bright sunlight./r/n 他在很亮的阳光下眯起了眼睛。/r/n

word.name: squire
word.lx: What the squire said is absolutely nonsense!/r/n 这个乡绅的话纯属一派胡言！/r/n The living is in the gift of the squire./r/n 地主有安排牧师奉禄之权。/r/n

word.name: squirrel
word.lx: The squirrel is a lovely small animal./r/n 松鼠是一种可爱的小动物。/r/n The squirrel hoards up nuts for the winter./r/n 松鼠储藏坚果以防冬天。/r/n

word.name: stab
word.mean:
v.&n. 刺,戳
vt. 刺(伤)
word.lx: She stabbed him in the leg with a kitchen knife./r/n 她拿菜刀捅伤了他的腿./r/n The killer stabbed him with a knife/stabbed a knife into him./r/n 凶手用刀刺他./r/n

word.name: stabilize
word.lx: He can now ride his bike without stabilizers./r/n 他现在骑自行车不需要平衡器了./r/n His condition has now stabilized./r/n 他的情况稳定下来了./r/n

word.name: staccato
word.mean:
a. 断续的
ad. 不连贯地

word.name: stack
word.mean:
n. 堆叠,堆
v. 堆积,做牌,选派
word.lx: There is a stack of dishes to be washed in the kitchen./r/n 厨房里还有一大堆盘子要洗。/r/n Traffic was stacked up for miles because of the accident./r/n 车祸引起了交通堵塞，车辆排起的长龙有好几里长。/r/n

word.name: stadium
word.lx: We will go to the stadium to watch a football match./r/n 我们将去体育场观看足球比赛。/r/n Keep on past the church; the stadium is about half a mile further on./r/n 一直向前走过了教堂，约莫半英里就是体育场。/r/n

word.name: staff
word.mean:
n. 全体人员,同事
n. 杆,棒
vt. 配备员工
word.lx: Most of our offices are staffed by volunteers./r/n 在我们大多数办公室任职的是志愿人员。/r/n When climbing a mountain I advise beginners to use a staff./r/n 我建议刚开始爬山的人使用拐杖。/r/n

word.name: stag
word.mean:
a. 只准男子参加的
n. 牡鹿
word.lx: Because my husband has gone to a stag dinner, I have to stay at home alone./r/n 因为我丈夫去参加一个只许男人参加的宴会，我只好独自待在家里。/r/n The hounds will soon hunt down the stag./r/n 猎狗不要多久就会追到那头牡鹿。/r/n

word.name: stage
word.mean:
n. 阶段,舞台,驿站
v. 上演,表演,乘驿车旅行
word.lx: She stood alone on the enormous stage./r/n 她孤零零地站在巨大的舞台上。/r/n The disease is still in its primary stage./r/n 这疾病仍然在初发阶段。/r/n

word.name: stagger
word.mean:
n. 蹒跚,踌躇
v. 蹒跚,使...摇摆,踌躇
word.lx: The unexpected blow did not stagger his resolution./r/n 这个意外的打击并没有动摇他的决心。/r/n The drunk man staggered across the room./r/n 那个醉汉摇摇晃晃地穿过房间。/r/n

word.name: staggering
word.mean: a. 摇晃欲倒的,犹豫的,惊人的
word.lx: The soldier receive no staggering wind from any of the three shot./r/n 三枪中的任何一枪都没使这个士兵受到什麽惊人的枪伤。/r/n He was staggering across the room and had obviously had a few./r/n 他在房间里摇摇晃晃地走着，很显然他已喝醉了。/r/n

word.name: stagnant
word.mean: a. 不流动的,不景气的
word.lx: Due to low investment, our industrial output has remained stagnant./r/n 由于投资少，我们的工业生产一直停滞不前。/r/n Business was stagnant last month./r/n 上个月生意萧条./r/n

word.name: stagy
word.mean: a. 不自然的,演戏一般的
word.lx: The room was decorated with stagy opulence./r/n 那房间装饰得富丽堂皇, 像戏台似的./r/n

word.name: staid
word.lx: I always thought of him as a rather staid old gentleman./r/n 我一直以为他是个相当古板的绅士。/r/n They showed a staid mood in that accident./r/n 那次事件中他们的情绪很稳定。/r/n

word.name: stain
word.mean:
n. 污染,污点,著色
v. 沾染,染污,著色
word.lx: He stained the family honor./r/n 他玷污了家族的荣誉。/r/n Such a man is a stain to humanity./r/n 这种人是人类的耻辱。/r/n

word.name: stainless
word.lx: These appliances are made of stainless iron./r/n 这些器具是用不锈钢制成的。/r/n This cup is made of stainless steel./r/n 这只杯子是不锈钢做的。/r/n

word.name: stair
word.lx: He ran down the stairs./r/n 他跑下楼梯。/r/n She sat on the bottom stairs./r/n 她坐在楼梯最下面的一级上。/r/n

word.name: staircase
word.lx: We heard his heavy tread on the staircase./r/n 我们听到了他走在楼梯上沉重的脚步声。/r/n You can go up the staircase on the right./r/n 你可以从右边楼梯上去。/r/n

word.name: stairs
word.lx: The old woman fell down a flight of stairs./r/n 那位老太太从一段楼梯上摔了下来。/r/n Could you help me up the stairs?/r/n 你能扶我上楼梯吗？/r/n

word.name: stale
word.lx: The beer is stale./r/n 啤酒走了气了。/r/n They had nothing to eat but stale bread./r/n 除了陈面包外，他们没有别的东西可吃。/r/n

word.name: stalemate
word.mean:
n. 僵持状态,陷于困境,胶著状况
v. 使无法动棋子,使停顿,使陷入困境

word.name: stalk
word.mean:
n. 茎,追踪,高视阔步
v. 悄悄靠近,蔓延,高视阔步
word.lx: The infatuated fan stalked the celebrity./r/n 那位着了迷的崇拜者追踪这位名人。/r/n He cut off the flowers at the stalk with a pair of scissors./r/n 他用剪子连花带茎都剪下来。/r/n

word.name: stall
word.mean:
n. 货摊,托辞
v. 停顿,推托,使...陷于泥中
word.lx: Never buy food from a market stall./r/n 千万别在小摊上买食物。/r/n The plane stalled suddenly./r/n 那飞机突然失控下降。/r/n

word.name: stallion
word.lx: An astronaut can send out a robot which will work on the unknown planet, putting up a permanent observation stallion on it./r/n 宇航员可派出一个在未知星球上工作的机器人，并在上面建立一个永久观察站。/r/n

word.name: stalls
word.mean: n. pl.(剧场的)正厅前排座位,正厅前座区
word.lx: Every time I ask her to set the date she stalls./r/n 我每次请她定一个时间，她总是借故拖延。/r/n The ground floor of a theater behind the stalls./r/n 正厅后座，正厅后座观众剧院前座观众后的底层/r/n

word.name: stalwart
word.mean:
n. 顽强的人
a. 高大结实的,顽强的

word.name: stamen
word.lx: Stamen is in the middle of a flower and may produce pollen./r/n 雄蕊长在花的中央，能产生花粉。/r/n

word.name: stammer
word.mean:
n. 结巴,口吃
v. 口吃,结巴
vi. 结结巴巴地说话,口吃
vt. 结结巴巴地说
word.lx: He stammered his thanks./r/n 他结结巴巴地道了谢。/r/n The boy dare not answer the questions because of his stammer./r/n 这个小男孩因为结巴不敢回答老师的问题。/r/n

word.name: stamp
word.mean:
n. 印,邮票,打印器
v. 捺印,顿足,贴上邮票
word.lx: My husband is a stamp collector./r/n 我丈夫是个集邮者。/r/n The immigration officer stamped my passport./r/n 移民官员在我的护照上盖了戳。/r/n

word.name: stance
word.mean: n. 准备击球姿势,踏脚处,位置
word.lx: He maintains a rigidly right-wing political stance./r/n 他坚持僵硬的右派政治立场./r/n What is your stance on corporal punishment?/r/n 你对体罚持什麽态度?/r/n

word.name: stanch
word.mean:
v. 止住,止血
a. 坚固的,坚强的,忠实的

word.name: stand
word.mean:
n. 站立,停顿,楼台,货摊
v. 站立,忍受,位于,坐落
word.lx: Let me stand you a dinner./r/n 让我请你一顿饭。/r/n This work will hardly stand close examination./r/n 这种作品很难经得起认真的检验。/r/n

word.name: standard
word.mean:
a. 标准的
n. 标准
word.lx: The teacher sets high standard for his pupils./r/n 这位老师给他的学生们定下高标准。/r/n This is one of the standard books on the subject./r/n 这是有关这个问题的权威著作之一。/r/n

word.name: standard-bearer
word.mean: n. 领导人(尤指政治上的旗手)

word.name: standardization
word.mean: n. 标准化(用标准校验)
word.lx: Pertaining to a degree of standardization of computer system components to allow for combinations and large variety of compatible units./r/n 修饰或说明计算机系统部件的标准化的程度，模块化设计允许部件组合和出现很多种类的兼容部件。/r/n

word.name: standardize
word.mean: v. 标准化,使合于标准

word.name: standby
word.lx: A special team of police were kept on standby during the time of violence./r/n 在发生暴乱期间，经常有一支警察特别小分队处于整装待命状态。/r/n

word.name: standing
word.mean:
n. 起立,持续,身份
a. 立著的,不动的,经常的
vbl. 站立,忍耐
word.lx: His meanness has become something of a standing joke./r/n 他的小气已成了经常引人发笑的笑料。/r/n The singer got a ten-minute standing ovation./r/n 观众起立向那位歌手鼓掌达十分钟./r/n

word.name: standing room
word.lx: Standing room only!/r/n 只有站票！/r/n It is so crowded, there is not even stand room./r/n 挤得几乎没有站立的地方。/r/n

word.name: standoffish
word.mean: a. 有点不友好的,冷淡的

word.name: standout
word.mean: n. 杰出的人(不随大流者)

word.name: stapler
word.lx: Have you get a stapler?/r/n 你有订书机吗？/r/n He wants a stapler, but she have not get one./r/n 他想要一个订书机，但她没有。/r/n

word.name: star
word.mean:
n. 星,明星
v. 以星状物装饰,变成演员
word.lx: In his last film he starred as a cowboy./r/n 他在最近的一部影片中主演一位牛仔。/r/n We can see the stars at night./r/n 夜晚我们可以看见星群。/r/n

word.name: starboard
word.lx: The ship gave a lurch to starboard./r/n 船突然向右侧倾斜./r/n Sighted land off the starboard beam./r/n 转向右舷方向便望见了陆地/r/n

word.name: starch
word.mean:
n. 淀粉
vt. 给...上浆
word.lx: You eat too much starch./r/n 你吃的含淀粉的食物太多了。/r/n Sugar and starch are broken down in the stomach./r/n 糖和淀粉在胃里被分解./r/n

word.name: starchy
word.lx: The starchy root of any of these plants, used in the tropics as food./r/n 山药，甘薯这些植物的含淀粉根，在热带用作食物/r/n He eat too much starchy food./r/n 他贪吃含淀粉多的食物。/r/n

word.name: stardust
word.lx: Get the stardust out of your eyes and face reality./r/n 抛弃天真的想法而面对现实。/r/n

word.name: stare
word.lx: She gave him a long cool stare./r/n 她冷冷地久久凝视他。/r/n They all stared with astonishment./r/n 他们全都惊讶地瞪着眼。/r/n

word.name: stargazer
word.mean: n. 看星星的人,占星师,天文学家

word.name: stark
word.mean:
a. 变硬了的,完全的
ad. 实在,简直,全然
word.lx: The landscape was grey and stark./r/n 景色灰暗荒凉。/r/n The film vividly shows the stark realities of life for the poor and hungry./r/n 这部影片生动地揭示了贫穷和饥饿的人们赤裸裸的生活现实。/r/n

word.name: starring
word.mean: n. 纯锑表面呈星状花纹

word.name: starry
word.mean: a. 星光照耀的,闪亮的

word.name: start
word.mean:
n. 起点
v. 开始,起身,出发
word.lx: We must make a new start./r/n 我们必须重新开始。/r/n We are just about to start./r/n 我们正要出发。/r/n

word.name: starter
word.mean: n. 起动机(发射架,发起者,调度员)
word.lx: What would you like as a starter?/r/n 您第一道菜想来点什麽?/r/n Of the five starters in the race only three finished./r/n 起跑时有五 个, 只有三个跑完全程./r/n

word.name: starters
word.lx: Of the five starters in the race only three finished./r/n 起跑时有五 个, 只有三个跑完全程./r/n What would you like as a starter?/r/n 您第一道菜想来点什麽?/r/n

word.name: starting
word.lx: I have to buy some kitchen utensils before starting cooking./r/n 开始做饭前，我还得去买些厨房用具。/r/n Who is to blame for starting the fire?/r/n 这场火灾应该追究谁的责任?/r/n

word.name: starting line
word.lx: The runners got into position on the starting line./r/n 赛跑运动员已进入起跑线上的位置。/r/n Runners bunching up at the starting line./r/n 起跑线上聚在一起的赛跑者/r/n

word.name: startle
word.mean:
n. 惊愕,惊恐
v. 吃惊,使...惊愕
word.lx: He gave me a startle./r/n 他吓了我一跳。/r/n He was startled by the news./r/n 这消息使他大吃一惊。/r/n

word.name: startling
word.lx: That is a startling disclosure of police brutality./r/n 那是一个揭发警察暴行的惊人消息。/r/n He describes the scene with startling reality./r/n 他对那景象的描述逼真得令人惊讶。/r/n

word.name: starts
word.lx: After several false starts, she became a successful journalist./r/n 她开始时遇到几次挫折，後来才成为能干的记者/r/n The film starts at 7.30 and lasts two hours./r/n 影片7点30分开演, 演两个小时./r/n

word.name: starve
word.lx: They tried to starve him into submission./r/n 他们试图用饥饿来使他就范。/r/n The plant was starved of light and died./r/n 这株植物因为极度缺乏光照而死了。/r/n

word.name: starving
word.lx: The politician found the piteous cries of the starving children unbearable./r/n 这个政治家发现饥饿的孩子们可怜的哭声让人不忍心听下去。/r/n We saw the pathetic sight of starving children./r/n 我们看到挨饿的儿童悲惨可怜的样子。/r/n

word.name: state
word.mean:
n. 州,国,情形
a. 国家的,正式的
v. 说,陈述,声明,规定
word.lx: State your name and address./r/n 请说出你的姓名和地址。/r/n His general state of health is fairly satisfactory./r/n 他总的健康状况相当令人满意。/r/n

word.name: stated
word.mean:
a. 决定了的,一定的,定期的
v. 陈述,说明
vbl. 陈述,说明

word.name: stately
word.lx: There are many strong and stately towers in Beijing./r/n 北京有很多坚固而雄伟的城楼。/r/n The organ rolled out a stately melody./r/n 风琴奏出庄严的乐曲。/r/n

word.name: statement
word.lx: Clearness of statement is more important than beauty of language./r/n 叙述清楚比语言优美更重要。/r/n This statement was important insomuch as it revealed the extent of their knowledge./r/n 这一陈述显示了他们了解的情况之多，因而十分重要。/r/n

word.name: statesman
word.mean: n. 政治家,国务活动家
word.lx: The statesman is respected by people./r/n 这位政治家为人们所敬重。/r/n He is the elder statesman par excellence./r/n 他是最优秀的年长的国务活动家./r/n

word.name: static
word.mean:
n. 静电,静电干扰
a. 静态的,静电的
word.lx: Her hair was full of static./r/n 她的头发上静电很强./r/n There was too much static to hear their message clearly./r/n 天电干扰太大, 听不清他们的电讯./r/n

word.name: station
word.mean:
n. 车站,站,位置
v. 安置,配置
word.lx: Can you tell me the way to the railway station?/r/n 你能告诉我往火车站的路怎么走吗？/r/n Guards were stationed around the prison./r/n 卫兵派驻在监狱四周。/r/n

word.name: station wagon
word.lx: Neither the truck nor the station wagon will be there./r/n 卡车和旅行汽车都不会停在那儿。/r/n

word.name: stationary
word.mean:
a. 不动的(稳定的)
n. 固定物(驻军)
word.lx: A stationary target is easiest to aim at./r/n 静止的目标是最容易瞄准的。/r/n The dead center, being a stationary bearing point, must be lubricated./r/n 由于是固定的支承点，死顶尖必须润滑。/r/n

word.name: stationery
word.lx: My stationery cupboard is full of paper./r/n 我的文具柜塞满了纸。/r/n That shop does not stock stationery./r/n 那家商店不卖文具。/r/n

word.name: statistic
word.mean:
n. 统计数值
a. 统计的,统计学的
word.lx: These are some indigestible statistics./r/n 这是些很难理解的统计资料。/r/n Have you any statistics that would enforce your argument?/r/n 你有任何统计资料可以加强你的论点吗？/r/n

word.name: statistically
word.mean: ad. 统计地(统计上地,统计学地)

word.name: statistics
word.mean: n. 统计,统计数字,统计学
word.lx: I happen to have the official statistics with me./r/n 我碰巧身边有官方的统计数字。/r/n The official prefixed an explanatory note to the list of statistics./r/n 那官员在统计表前加了一段说明文字./r/n

word.name: stature
word.lx: A man short in stature./r/n 侏儒身材矮的人/r/n Stature, especially of the human body./r/n 身高身长，尤指人类身体/r/n

word.name: statute
word.lx: We must obey the statutes in this country./r/n 我们必须遵守这个国家的法规。/r/n A heading that names a document, statute, or proceeding./r/n 名称命名一份文件、法令或诉讼程序的名字/r/n

word.name: statutory
word.mean: a. 法令的,法定的,触犯法令的

word.name: staunch
word.mean:
v. 止住,止血
a. 坚固的,坚强的,忠实
word.lx: They are staunch soldiers./r/n 他们是忠诚的战士。/r/n I helped her staunch cut./r/n 我帮助她止住了伤口的血。/r/n

word.name: stay
word.mean:
n. 停留,停止,依靠
v. 停留,留宿,制止
word.lx: The temperature has stayed hot this week./r/n 本周气温一直都很热。/r/n I stayed late at the party last night./r/n 昨晚我在晚会上呆到很晚。/r/n

word.name: stead
word.lx: His anorak has stood him in good stead this winter./r/n 他这件带兜帽的夹克在今年冬天对他很有用。/r/n His knowledge of the subject stood him in good stead./r/n 他的这门学科的知识对他很有好处。/r/n

word.name: steadfastly
word.mean: ad. 固定地(坚定地,不变地,不动摇地)

word.name: steadily
word.lx: His health is getting steadily worse./r/n 他的健康正逐渐恶化。/r/n The number of people going to the cinema seems to dwindle steadily./r/n 看电影的人数似乎在逐渐下降。/r/n

word.name: steady
word.mean:
a. 稳定的,稳固的
ad. 平稳地,稳固地
v. (使)稳固, (使)稳定
word.lx: The hunter steadied his rifle and fired./r/n 猎人端稳了猎枪，然后开了火。/r/n The old man is not steady on his legs./r/n 这位老人站不稳。/r/n

word.name: steak
word.lx: How do you want your steak?/r/n 你的牛排要几分熟？/r/n The steak pie is off today./r/n 今日牛肉饼停止供应./r/n

word.name: steal
word.lx: He stole out of the house without anyone seeing him./r/n 他悄悄地溜出了房子，没有人看见他。/r/n He was sent into prison for stealing./r/n 他由于偷窃被送入监狱。/r/n

word.name: stealth
word.mean: n. 秘密行动,秘密,鬼祟
word.lx: Tracking wild animals requires great stealth./r/n 跟踪野生动物必须悄然无声。/r/n The burglars had entered the house by stealth./r/n 窃贼偷偷进入那所房子。/r/n

word.name: stealthily
word.lx: In secret; stealthily./r/n 秘密地；偷偷地/r/n

word.name: steam
word.mean:
n. 蒸气,精力
a. 蒸气的
v. 蒸发
word.lx: The engines are driven by steam./r/n 这些发动机是由蒸汽驱动的。/r/n The ship steamed into the harbor./r/n 船驶入了港湾。/r/n

word.name: steamboat
word.lx: They traveled on the steamboat along the coast./r/n 他们坐着小汽船沿着海岸旅行。/r/n Some passengers are sitting on the deck of the large steamboat chatting./r/n 有些旅客正坐在这只大轮船的甲板上聊天。/r/n

word.name: steamed
word.lx: He steamed the stamp off the envelope./r/n 他用蒸汽把信封上的邮票揭下来。/r/n The ship steamed into the harbor./r/n 船驶入了港湾。/r/n

word.name: steep
word.mean:
a. 险峻的,陡峭的
v. 浸泡,浸透
vt. 浸,泡
word.lx: She steeped the stained cloth in bleach overnight./r/n 她把有污迹的衣服在洗衣粉里浸了一夜。/r/n This hill is too steep to ride up on a bicycle./r/n 这山太陡了，骑自行车可上不去。/r/n

word.name: steepen
word.lx: The path steepens as you climb the hillside./r/n 沿著山坡往上爬时, 那条小径越来越陡./r/n

word.name: steeple
word.lx: Orthodox Christian churches often have elaborate steeples./r/n 传统的基督教堂都有精致的尖塔。/r/n Now they are ready for the steeple chase./r/n 现在他们已准备好进行障碍赛跑。/r/n

word.name: steer
word.lx: He steered the car skillfully through the narrow streets./r/n 他熟练地驾驶着汽车穿过狭窄的街道。/r/n The drift of a ship or an aircraft to leeward of the course being steered./r/n 偏航，漂移船只或航空器航行过程中向背风面而作的漂移/r/n

word.name: steering
word.mean: n. (汽车或船等的)转向装置
word.lx: Turn the wheel to the right to correct the steering./r/n 把方向盘往右边转转, 好修正驾驶上的偏差./r/n They found her slumped over the steering wheel./r/n 他们发现她倒伏在方向盘上./r/n

word.name: steering wheel
word.mean: n. 舵轮(转向盘,驾驶盘,驾驶轮,操向轮)

word.name: stele
word.mean: n. 刻有碑文的石柱,石碑,匾额

word.name: stem
word.mean:
n. 茎,干,船首
v. 堵住,阻止,起源于
word.lx: Our ship stemmed on against the current./r/n 我们的船逆流而上。/r/n She bought some roses with long stems./r/n 她买了一些枝干很长的玫瑰花。/r/n

word.name: stencil
word.mean:
n. 模版(文字,蜡纸)
vt 用模版印刷

word.name: stenographer
word.lx: She was elected a stenographer of that meeting./r/n 她被选为那次会议的速记员。/r/n

word.name: stenography
word.mean:
n. 速记,速记法
v. 速记

word.name: step
word.mean:
n. 步骤,步,踏级
v. 踏,以步测量
word.lx: She stepped on a loose stone and twisted her ankle./r/n 她踩到一块松动的石头上，扭伤了脚踝。/r/n We should take steps to prevent war./r/n 我们应当采取措施制止战争。/r/n

word.name: stepmother
word.lx: His stepmother is kind to her./r/n 他的继母对她很和善。/r/n The judge said that nothing could mitigate the cruelty with which the stepmother had treated the girl./r/n 法官说没有任何理由可以把那个继母残忍虐待女孩的罪责减轻。/r/n

word.name: stepped-up
word.mean: a. 加速的, 加强的

word.name: stepsister
word.mean: n. 同父异母(或同母异父)的姐姐或妹妹

word.name: step-up
word.mean: a. 把电压升高的, 递升的

word.name: stereotyped
word.mean:
v. 定型(浇铅版,对...产生成见)
a. 用铅版印的(老一套的)
word.lx: She has a stereotyped view of teachers, believing that they are all as bad as hers were./r/n 她对于教师有种一成不变的观念，认为他们都与她以前那些教师一样差。/r/n

word.name: sterile
word.mean: a. 不毛的,不孕的,无菌的
word.lx: Medical tests showed that he was sterile./r/n 医学检查表明他没有生育能力。/r/n The high risk of infection put a premium on the use of sterile needle./r/n 由於受感染的风险很大，无菌注射针的使用受到了重视。/r/n

word.name: sterilization
word.lx: A strong, pressurized, steam-heated vessel, as for laboratory experiments, sterilization, or cooking./r/n 高压灭菌器，高压锅一种用于实验室实验、灭菌或烧煮的高压加热蒸气作用的容器/r/n

word.name: sterilize
word.mean: v. 使成不毛,断种,杀菌
word.lx: The doctor performs operations with sterilized surgical instruments./r/n 医生用消过毒的外科手术器械做手术。/r/n After her fourth child she decided to have herself sterilized./r/n 她生了第四个孩子后决定做绝育手术。/r/n

word.name: sterling
word.mean:
a. 英币的(纯粹的,货真价实的)
n. 英国货币(英镑)
word.lx: You can pay in sterling./r/n 你可以支付英镑。/r/n They have some sterling silver cutlery./r/n 他们有一些标准纯银餐具。/r/n

word.name: stern
word.mean:
n. 尾部,船尾
a. 严厉的,坚决的,可怖的
word.lx: She seated herself in the stern./r/n 她坐进了船尾。/r/n Stern as he is, he is full of sympathy./r/n 虽然他严格，却富有同情心。/r/n

word.name: sternly
word.mean: ad. 严格地,严肃地,严厉地
word.lx: He has very sternly admonished student./r/n 他十分严厉地训诫了学生。/r/n

word.name: stethoscope
word.lx: I take it you know what a stethoscope is./r/n 我想你知道听诊器是个什么东西。/r/n The stethoscope is a medical instrument./r/n 听诊器是一种医疗器械。/r/n

word.name: stevedore
word.mean:
n. 装卸工人,码头工人,脚夫
v. 装载货物
word.lx: Shipment cannot execute within period owing stevedore shortage/r/n 因装卸工人不足，故无法在限定期间内完成装船。/r/n

word.name: stew
word.mean:
n. 炖汤,焖,烦恼
v. 炖汤,焖,忧虑
word.lx: There is no need to get into a stew; everything will be all right./r/n 没有必要烦恼，一切都会好起来的。/r/n Do you like stewed beef?/r/n 你喜欢吃炖牛肉吗？/r/n

word.name: steward
word.lx: His neighbor is a chief steward./r/n 他的邻居是一个乘务员领班。/r/n The stewards will inspect the course to see if racing is possible./r/n 那些干事将检视赛马场看是否适宜比赛。/r/n

word.name: stewardess
word.mean: n. 空中小姐,女管理人,女管家
word.lx: An air stewardess came and asked him if he would like some drink./r/n 一位空中小姐走过来，问他是否想要些饮料。/r/n The stewardess will get you some water from the galley./r/n 空中小姐会从厨房给你拿些水来。/r/n

word.name: stick
word.mean:
n. 枝,杆,手杖
v. 插于,刺入,竖起
v. 钉住,粘贴,坚持
word.lx: The old man could not walk without a stick./r/n 这老人没有手杖就走不了路。/r/n Someone has sticked a label on the crate./r/n 有人在板条箱上贴了标签。/r/n

word.name: sticker
word.mean: n. 尖刀(粘着剂,背面有粘胶的标签,张贴物,滞销物,难题)
word.lx: A paper sticker./r/n 纸制粘贴物/r/n A decorative sticker./r/n 贴花纸一种装饰用的胶粘物/r/n

word.name: sticking
word.mean:
a. 粘的
n. 粘,贴,粘胶
word.lx: Before sorting stamps, any paper sticking to the backs must be removed./r/n 在把邮票分类之前，任何粘在后面的别的纸都得去掉。/r/n Sticking to but not fused with a part or an organ of the same kind./r/n 附着的与同类的部分或组织粘着但不融合的/r/n

word.name: stiff
word.mean:
a. 坚硬的,严厉的,呆板的
ad. 僵硬地,彻底地
word.lx: Shoes are often stiff when they are new./r/n 新鞋刚穿起来常常都是硬邦邦的。/r/n That was a shock I need a stiff drink!/r/n 这可真吓人－－我得喝点烈酒了。/r/n

word.name: stiffen
word.mean: v. 使...坚硬,变为浓粘,变为猛烈
word.lx: He stiffened at the insult./r/n 他听到这些侮辱的话，态度强硬起来。/r/n The promise of a reward might stiffen their resolve./r/n 答应给他们奖励可以坚定他们的决心。/r/n

word.name: stiffly
word.lx: Please call me Virginia." Virginia said for the tenth time. Mrs. Allen bowed stiffly and continued to call her Miss Martin./r/n "请叫我弗吉尼亚。"弗吉尼亚已经说过10遍了。可是艾伦太太很不自然地点点头，仍然称她马丁小姐。/r/n"

word.name: stiffness
word.lx: As I got about, the stiffness in my left leg gradually worked off./r/n 我走动走动，左腿渐渐地不再僵直了。/r/n

word.name: stifle
word.mean: v. 使不能呼吸,窒息,抑制
word.lx: Our ideas were stifled./r/n 我们的意见被压了下来。/r/n The gas stifled them./r/n 他们被煤气熏得透不过气来。/r/n

word.name: stigma
word.mean:
n. 耻辱,污名
n. 柱头
word.lx: There is less stigma attached to illegitimacy now than there used to be./r/n 私生子女已经不象过去那样见不得人了。/r/n There should be no stigma attached to being poor./r/n 贫穷不应该与耻辱扯上任何关系。/r/n

word.name: still life
word.lx: I prefer landscape to still life./r/n 我喜欢风景画，不喜欢静物画。/r/n Drew a map of the area; drawing landscapes and still lifes./r/n 绘制该地区的地图；描绘风景与静物/r/n

word.name: stillness
word.lx: The stillness was rent by thunderous applause./r/n 雷鸣般的掌声打破了寂静。/r/n

word.name: stilt
word.lx: He walked along on stilts./r/n 他踩着高跷走过去。/r/n They built a house on stilts./r/n 他们建了一栋用桩子支撑的房子。/r/n

word.name: stilted
word.mean: a. 踩高跷的, 虚饰的
word.lx: He walked along on stilts./r/n 他踩着高跷走过去。/r/n They built a house on stilts./r/n 他们建了一栋用桩子支撑的房子。/r/n

word.name: stimulant
word.mean:
a. 兴奋性的,激励的,鼓舞的
n. 兴奋剂,酒精性饮料
word.lx: It is hoped that the tax cuts will act as a stimulant to further economic growth./r/n 希望降低税率这一措施能刺激经济进一步增长。/r/n Coffee and tea are mild stimulants./r/n 咖啡和茶都是温和的兴奋剂。/r/n

word.name: stimulate
word.lx: I hoped my warning would stimulate her to greater efforts./r/n 我希望我的告诫会促使她作出更大的努力。/r/n Light stimulates plant growth./r/n 光会刺激植物生长。/r/n

word.name: stimulating
word.mean: a. 刺激的,有刺激性的
word.lx: He looks sharp. Working with him shall be stimulating./r/n 他看起来精明。和他一起工作应该够刺激的。/r/n They use television advertising as a device for stimulating demand./r/n 他们利用电视广告作为刺激需求的方法。/r/n

word.name: stimuli
word.mean: n. 刺激(刺激物,刺激源,激励,激源,促进因素,色质)
word.lx: The capacity to respond to stimuli./r/n 反应力对刺激的反应能力/r/n Less than the normal ability to respond to stimuli./r/n 敏感减轻对刺激反应能力低于正常水平/r/n

word.name: stimulus
word.lx: The nutrient in the soil acts as a stimulus to growth./r/n 土壤中的养分能促进植物生长。/r/n Her words of praise were a stimulus for people to work harder./r/n 她赞扬的话鼓舞人们工作更努力。/r/n

word.name: sting
word.mean:
n. 刺,讽刺
v. 刺,长著刺,使苦恼
word.lx: His flattery carries a sting./r/n 他的奉承话中带刺。/r/n Her ingratitude stung him./r/n 她的忘恩负义使他痛心。/r/n

word.name: stingy
word.lx: The quality or state of being selfish or stingy./r/n 自私，吝啬自私或吝啬的品质或状况/r/n A stingy person; a miser./r/n 吝啬吝啬小气的人；守财奴/r/n

word.name: stink
word.mean:
n. 臭味,臭气
v. 发臭味,使...发臭
坏透,招人讨厌
word.lx: There is a stink of cats in the room./r/n 屋子里有猫的臭味。/r/n This whole affair really stinks./r/n 整件事情都让人讨厌。/r/n

word.name: stipend
word.mean: n. 薪水(薪金,定期生活津贴)
word.lx: Hopes to be awarded a stipend for further research./r/n 希望能被给予进一步研究的费用。/r/n

word.name: stir
word.mean:
n. 搅动,惹起
v. 激起,惹起,搅和
word.lx: The story stirred her sympathy./r/n 这故事激起了她的同情心。/r/n She stirred the sugar into her coffee./r/n 她把糖搅和到咖啡里。/r/n

word.name: stirrup
word.lx: She tried to put her foot into the stirrup./r/n 她试图把脚放进马镫里。/r/n The stirrup leathers rubbed raw patches on his legs./r/n 马蹬皮带把他腿上的皮肤擦伤引起疼痛./r/n

word.name: stitch
word.lx: The doctor put three stitches in my head./r/n 医生在我头上缝了三针。/r/n Will you stitch a button on this shirt?/r/n 请你在这件衬衫上钉一颗钮扣好吗？/r/n

word.name: stock exchange
word.lx: The London Stock Exchange is in turmoil today./r/n 今天伦敦证券市场一片混乱。/r/n The New York stock exchange crashed in1929./r/n 纽约股票交易所于一九二九年大崩溃。/r/n

word.name: stockade
word.lx: The lambs were kept in the stockade./r/n 小羊羔被放在围栏里养着。/r/n The sheep were surrounded by stockade./r/n 羊被栅栏圈着。/r/n

word.name: stockbroker
word.lx: He rang( up) his stockbroker./r/n 他给他的股票经纪人打了个电话。/r/n The stockbroker has placed the money in industrial stock./r/n 证券经纪人已用那笔钱购入了工业股票。/r/n

word.name: stocking
word.lx: The boy is one meter tall in his stocking feet./r/n 这个小男孩不穿鞋的身高是一米。/r/n An embroidered or woven decoration on the side of a stocking or sock./r/n 绣花边花，袜子侧边的织花位于长袜或短袜一侧的刺绣或编织的装饰图案/r/n

word.name: stockjobber
word.mean: n. 股票投机商,证券批发商

word.name: stockpile
word.mean:
n. 囤储物资
vt. 储备,储存
word.lx: Get a hustle on to stockpile these essential material./r/n 赶快把这些重要材料贮放起来。/r/n

word.name: stocktaking
word.lx: The boss always gets in a lather during stocktaking time./r/n 每当存货盘点时，老板总是心神不定。/r/n

word.name: stocky
word.mean: a. 矮胖的,健壮结实的
word.lx: A strong, stocky horse./r/n 强壮、结实的马/r/n

word.name: stodge
word.mean: n. 乏味的食物,乏味的作品

word.name: stodgy
word.mean: a. 塞满的(平凡的,式样难看的)

word.name: stoic
word.mean: n. 斯多葛学派哲学家

word.name: stoke
word.mean:
v. 添加燃料,司炉,激起
vt. 给(炉子)添燃料,烧(火)
word.lx: You should stoke up now you may not get another meal today./r/n 你现在得吃得饱饱的--你今天可能再没饭吃了./r/n The caretaker stokes up twice a day./r/n 管理员每天往火里加两次煤./r/n

word.name: stole
word.mean:
steal 的过去式
n. (女用)披肩
vt. steal过去式
word.lx: She wore her sable stole./r/n 她戴着带有貂皮的披肩/r/n A coat, stole, or hat made of the fur of this animal./r/n 用貂皮制成的大衣、披肩或帽子/r/n

word.name: stolen
word.lx: A 1000 reward has been offered for the return of the stolen painting./r/n 悬赏1000英镑寻找失窃的画./r/n The police recovered the stolen jewellery./r/n 警察找回了被盗的珠宝。/r/n

word.name: stolid
word.mean: a. 迟钝的,神经麻木的
word.lx: He conceals his feelings behind a rather stolid manner./r/n 他装作无动於衷的样子以掩盖自己的感情./r/n

word.name: stomachache
word.mean:
n. 胃痛
vi. 肚子痛
word.lx: The medicine did his stomachache a power of good./r/n 这种药对他的胃痛疗效显著。/r/n Quota, quotas...I have had it up to here! I feel like I have got a stomachache./r/n 定额，定额。。。。。我真是受够了！觉得胃都痛了。/r/n

word.name: stomp
word.lx: He looked funny stomping round the dance floor./r/n 他在舞池里跺著舞步, 样子很可笑./r/n

word.name: stone
word.mean:
a. 石制的
n. 石头
vt. 向...扔石头
word.lx: The criminal was stoned to death./r/n 罪犯被人们用石头砸死。/r/n The stone just missed the boy./r/n 那块石头差点儿砸到男孩。/r/n

word.name: Stone Age
word.lx: Since then, organic materials ranging from Egyptian mummy hair to Stone Age sandals have been dated./r/n 自那时起，从埃及的木乃伊头发到石器时代的檀香木等有机物质的年代都已被确定。/r/n

word.name: stoned
word.mean: a. 有核的,除去核的,醉酒的

word.name: stony
word.lx: The old bus rattled along the stony road./r/n 那辆旧公共汽车格登格登地沿碎石路行驶./r/n Two of the tyres punctured on the stony road./r/n 有两个车胎在碎石路上扎破了./r/n

word.name: stood
word.mean:
v. 站立,忍受
vbl. 站立,忍受
word.lx: He stood with his hands on his hips./r/n 他两手叉腰站立著./r/n They stood in silent homage round her grave./r/n 他们站立在她的墓的周围向她默哀./r/n

word.name: stoop
word.mean:
n. 佝偻,屈服
v. 弯下,弯下上身,屈服
word.lx: The old woman walked with a stoop./r/n 老太太伛偻而行。/r/n She stooped low to look under the bed./r/n 她弯下腰看床底下。/r/n

word.name: stop
word.mean:
n. 停止,车站,滞留
v. 停止,停止,制止
word.lx: They stopped to talk when they met on the street./r/n 他们在街上相遇时，停下来聊了几句。/r/n They would stop the rich from robbing the poor./r/n 他们要制止富人掠夺穷人。/r/n

word.name: stoplight
word.mean: n. 停止行进号志,红色尾灯
word.lx: The house is about a mile past the first stoplight. They walked past the memorial in silence./r/n 这座房子在第一个交通指示灯大约一英里以外的地方。他们静静地走过纪念碑/r/n

word.name: stopover
word.lx: A round the world ticket allow several stopover./r/n 环球飞机票可允许乘客在途经的几地方稍做逗留。/r/n The ticket allow you two stopover between london and tokyo./r/n 该票允许你在伦敦和东京之间作两次停留。/r/n

word.name: stoppage
word.lx: The stoppage of bleeding or hemorrhage./r/n 止血阻止流血或大出血/r/n A choking or stoppage of the breath or voice./r/n 哽噎呼吸或声音的哽塞或阻塞/r/n

word.name: stopper
word.mean: n. (瓶子等的)塞子,阻塞物,妨碍物
word.lx: The stopper may blow out./r/n 塞子会被冲出来。/r/n An object, such as a cork or a wad of cloth, used to fill a hole tightly; a stopper./r/n 塞子；栓子用来填紧洞孔的物体，如软木塞或一团布；塞子/r/n

word.name: stopwatch
word.mean:
n. 记秒表,跑表
vt. 用秒表测定时间

word.name: storage
word.lx: His furniture is in storage while he finds a new house./r/n 他在找新房子时把家具存放在仓库里。/r/n The management accept full responsibility for loss of goods in storage./r/n 管理部门接受仓库中货物损失的全部责任。/r/n

word.name: store
word.mean:
n. 商店,贮藏,仓库
v. 储存,贮藏,供给
word.lx: There is a large store in the village./r/n 村里有家大百货店。/r/n He stored foods in his cupboard./r/n 他把食品存放在碗橱里。/r/n

word.name: storehouse
word.lx: This book is a storehouse of useful information./r/n 这本书里汇集了大量有用的资料。/r/n Contraband goods were found in the storehouse of the hotel./r/n 在旅馆的储藏室里发现了走私货。/r/n

word.name: storekeeper
word.lx: The storekeeper is very kind./r/n 那个零售店主非常和善。 /r/n The gang forced all the storekeepers on the block to kick over$5 a week./r/n 那伙流氓强迫在该街区开店的老板每周各捐出5美元来。/r/n

word.name: storm
word.mean:
n. 暴风雨
v. 猛攻,捣毁,起风暴
vi. 起风暴,强攻
vt. 猛攻,捣毁
word.lx: The clouds threatened a big storm./r/n 乌云预示着暴风雨即将来临。/r/n He stormed about the house, breaking things./r/n 他在房子里暴跳如雷，乱摔东西。/r/n

word.name: stormy
word.lx: His speech was frequently interrupted by stormy applause./r/n 他的演说不时被暴风雨般的掌声打断。/r/n The scouts started off on their mission on a stormy night./r/n 侦察兵们在一个雷雨之夜出发去执行任务。/r/n

word.name: story
word.lx: That is a house of six stories./r/n 那是一栋六层楼的房子。/r/n This magazine published excellent stories./r/n 这本杂志登载优秀的小说。/r/n

word.name: storybook
word.lx: He is reading a storybook on the deities of ancient Greece./r/n 他正在读一本关于古希腊诸神的故事书。/r/n He wrote a storybook about ancient Romans./r/n 他写了一本关于古罗马人的故事集。/r/n

word.name: stoutly
word.lx: The Chief of Police stoutly denied the accusation./r/n 警察局长坚决否认这个指控。/r/n

word.name: stow
word.mean: v. 收藏起来,装填,装满
word.lx: The cabin was stowed with supplies for the trip./r/n 舱里装满了航行用的必需品。/r/n Have you seen the amount of foods those lads can stow away at one meal?/r/n 你可曾见过那些小伙子一餐的食量有多大？/r/n

word.name: straddle
word.mean:
n. 跨坐
v. 跨坐,把两腿叉开
word.lx: An option to buy or sell a stock, including put, call, spread, and straddle./r/n 优先购买权买卖股票的选择权，包括投资、交货、买卖差额和买空卖空/r/n So as to straddle or bridge; astride./r/n 跨着以便跨过或横过；横跨/r/n

word.name: straggle
word.mean: vt. 分散(零零落落,落后)
word.lx: Vines are straggling over the fences./r/n 藤蔓在篱笆上爬着。 /r/n A few young children are straggling along behind their parents./r/n 几个孩子跟不上父母的步子，落在后面。/r/n

word.name: straight
word.mean:
a. 直的,正直的,坦率的
ad. 直接
word.lx: He drew a straight line on the paper./r/n 他在纸上画了一条直线。/r/n Come straight away after school./r/n 放学后直接回家。/r/n

word.name: straight off
word.lx: I told him straight off what I thought about the matter./r/n 我立刻告诉了他我对此事的看法。/r/n

word.name: straighten
word.lx: Straighten up your ideas!/r/n 要改进你的观念！/r/n You should straighten up your room before going out./r/n 出门前你应该把房间收拾整齐。/r/n

word.name: straightforward
word.lx: Frank; straightforward; blunt./r/n 坦率；直接的；毫不含糊的/r/n His straightforward, modest manner took into camp everybody he knew./r/n 他爽直而谦虚的态度使所有认识他的人都上了当。/r/n

word.name: strain
word.mean:
n. 紧张,拉紧,血统
v. 劳累,拉紧,过份使用
word.lx: Too heavy a load will strain the rope to its breaking point./r/n 负载过重会把绳子拉紧到崩断的地步。/r/n The author seems to strain after novelty./r/n 作者似乎在力图标新立异。/r/n

word.name: strained
word.mean: a. 紧张的,装作的,矫饰的
word.lx: Struggling to achieve effect; strained and contrived./r/n 紧张的；不自然的努力取得效果的；紧张的，不自然的/r/n He strained every nerve to get the post, but was unsuccessful./r/n 他竭尽全力想得到那份工作，但是没有成功。/r/n

word.name: strait
word.mean:
a. 困境的,窘境的
n. 海峡
word.lx: The door is rather strait./r/n 这门相当窄。/r/n I hear you are in poor financial straits./r/n 我听说你处于经济困难之中。/r/n

word.name: straits
word.lx: I hear you are in poor financial straits./r/n 我听说你处于经济困难之中。/r/n The straits of Gibraltar are the gate of the Mediterranean./r/n 直布罗陀海峡是通向地中海的必经之路。/r/n

word.name: stranded
word.mean: a. 搁浅的,进退两难的
word.lx: The stranded hulk of a severely damaged ship./r/n 遇难船的残骸严重毁坏而搁浅的船体/r/n A crab was left stranded on the beach when the tide ebbed./r/n 退潮时，一只蟹被困留在沙滩上。/r/n

word.name: strangely
word.mean: ad. 奇妙地,奇怪地,不可思议地
word.lx: The whole evening seems strangely unreal./r/n 整个晚上的事似乎如梦幻般令人惊奇。/r/n On certain important details the report remains strangely silent./r/n 这份报告在某些重要的细节问题上只字未提，莫名其妙。/r/n

word.name: stranger
word.lx: They taught the little boy not to talk to strangers./r/n 他们教育小男孩不要和陌生人说话。/r/n She is no stranger to misfortune./r/n 她对不幸的经历并不陌生。/r/n

word.name: strangle
word.lx: The hooligan strangled her with a piece of string./r/n 那流氓用一根绳子把她勒死了。/r/n She strangled before she was taken to hospital./r/n 她在被送往医院之前便窒息而死。/r/n

word.name: strap
word.mean:
n. 绳,皮带
v. 用绳索捆扎
word.lx: The slave was strapped to death./r/n 这个奴隶被鞭打死。/r/n The child was given the strap./r/n 这个孩子被鞭打了一顿。/r/n

word.name: strata
word.mean: n. 层(地层,岩歧,阶层,薄片)

word.name: stratagem
word.lx: They have worked out the stratagem to attack the enemy./r/n 他们已经想出了攻击敌人的策略。/r/n The practice or use of tricks; deception by stratagem./r/n 欺骗，哄骗用诡计进行欺诈；用计谋进行的欺骗/r/n

word.name: strategist
word.mean: n. 战略家,军事家,策士

word.name: strategy
word.lx: I think we should work out a strategy to deal with this situation./r/n 我想我们应该制订出一项行动计划，用来对付这种情况。/r/n The essence of all good strategy is simplicity./r/n 一切优秀战略的精髓是简单。/r/n

word.name: straw
word.lx: She was drinking juice through a straw./r/n 她正在用吸管喝果汁。/r/n The farmers compressed straw into blocks for burning./r/n 农民们将干草压成块用来烧火。/r/n

word.name: strawberry
word.lx: They grew strawberries in their garden./r/n 他们在园中种了草莓。/r/n We have different pies, such as apple, cherry, and strawberry pies./r/n 我们有不同的派，例如苹果、樱桃和草莓派。/r/n

word.name: stray
word.mean:
n. 走失的家畜,浪子
a. 迷途的,偶然的
v. 迷路,彷徨
word.lx: Our cat strayed from home./r/n 我们的猫从家中走失了。/r/n The stray cat was picked up by a kind girl./r/n 走失的猫被一个善良的姑娘收留了。/r/n

word.name: streak
word.mean:
n. 条理,斑纹,倾向
v. 加条纹,变成条纹
word.lx: He disappeared round the corner like a streak of lightning./r/n 他快如闪电般地从拐角处消失。/r/n The cat streaked across the road with a dog behind it./r/n 有只狗在后面，这只猫飞快地越过马路。/r/n

word.name: stream
word.mean:
n. 流,水流,人潮
v. 使流出,流动
word.lx: Visitors to the exhibition came in an endless stream./r/n 参观展览会的人络绎不绝。/r/n They streamed out of the cinema./r/n 他们涌出电影院。/r/n

word.name: streamer
word.mean: n. 燕尾旗,饰带,彩色纸带

word.name: streaming
word.lx: People were streaming out of the station./r/n 人们涌出了车站./r/n A spring that is the source or head of a stream./r/n 源头，源泉一条溪流的源头或源泉/r/n

word.name: streamline
word.mean:
n. 流线,流线型
v. 使...成流线型,使...合理化
word.lx: We must streamline our production procedures./r/n 我们必须精简生产程序以提高效率./r/n He aim to streamline the office./r/n 他的目标是提高办公室的工作效率。/r/n

word.name: streamlined
word.mean:
v. 使...流线化(层流,革新)
a. 流线型的(现代化的)

word.name: street
word.lx: They crossed the street and went into the shop./r/n 他们穿过街道，进了商店。/r/n I bought this loaf of bread in the chain store opposite the street./r/n 我在街道对面的连锁商店里买了这只面包。/r/n

word.name: strength
word.mean: n. 力量,力气,长处,强度
word.lx: I have hardly enough strength left to move my feet./r/n 我连移动双脚的力气都几乎没有了。/r/n Union is strength./r/n 【谚】团结就是力量。/r/n

word.name: strengthen
word.lx: The wind strengthened during the night./r/n 风在夜间刮得更猛了。/r/n The soldiers strengthened their defenses./r/n 士兵们加强了他们的防御工事。/r/n

word.name: strenuous
word.mean: a. 奋发的,热心的,有奋斗之必要的

word.name: stressful
word.lx: She finds her new teaching job very stressful./r/n 她觉得新的教学工作非常紧张./r/n A lot of job and stressful, and do not you once tell me you thrive on pressure?/r/n 许多工作都有压力。你不是说过你在压力下茁壮成长吗？/r/n

word.name: stretch
word.mean:
n. 伸展,张开
a. 可伸缩的
v. 伸展,张开,延伸
word.lx: The painter stretched the canvas on a frame./r/n 画家把油画布紧绷在画框上。/r/n I got out of the bed and had a good stretch./r/n 我起床后舒服地伸了个懒腰。/r/n

word.name: stretcher
word.lx: An ambulance officer brought a stretcher for the injured woman./r/n 救护车工作人员带来了一副担架抢救那位受伤的女子。/r/n The injured were carried away on stretchers./r/n 用担架把受伤的人抬走了。/r/n

word.name: strew
word.lx: There are papers strewn all over the floor./r/n 地板上到处撒满了纸。/r/n They strewed seeds over the earth./r/n 他们把种子撒在地里。/r/n

word.name: strewn
word.lx: There are papers strewn all over the floor./r/n 地板上到处撒满了纸。/r/n There was litter strewn all over the pavement./r/n 人行道上到处都是扔的垃圾。/r/n

word.name: stricken
word.mean: a. 被打中的,被击伤的,受灾的,受侵袭的
word.lx: Medical supplies are being dropped to the stricken area./r/n 目前正将医药用品空投到灾区./r/n The stricken tanker began to break up on the rocks./r/n 受伤的油轮向礁石撞到，毁了。/r/n

word.name: strict
word.lx: The teacher is very strict with his students./r/n 老师对他的学生非常严格。/r/n There are strict controls on immigration into this country./r/n 移民到这个国家有严格的限制。/r/n

word.name: stride
word.mean:
n. 大步,一跨步
v. 迈大步走,跨过
word.lx: China is striding ahead in her economic construction./r/n 中国正在经济建设方面大步前进。/r/n In a few strides he crossed the room./r/n 他几大步就穿过了房间。/r/n

word.name: strident
word.mean: a. 刺耳的,吱吱尖叫的,尖锐的
word.lx: A loud, strident noise./r/n 大而刺耳的声音/r/n

word.name: strife
word.lx: These firms are at strife./r/n 这几家商行彼此不和。/r/n Fighting, especially armed battle; strife./r/n 战斗，尤指武器战斗；斗争/r/n

word.name: striker
word.mean: n. 大铁锤(撞针,罢工者)
word.lx: A striker was substituted for a midfield player in the last half-hour of play./r/n 在比赛的最后30分钟里，一个中场运动员被一个强攻手替换了下去。/r/n The strikers have reached a settlement with the employers./r/n 罢工者与雇主已达成协议。/r/n

word.name: striking
word.mean: a. 引人注目的,显著的
word.lx: I was attracted by the striking idea./r/n 我被这个惊人的想法吸引住了。/r/n The striking office workers have occupied the whole building./r/n 罢工的办公室人员占据了整座建筑物。/r/n

word.name: strikingly
word.mean: ad. 显著地(突出地,惊人地,引人注目地)
word.lx: Fine clothes added to his strikingly handsome appearance./r/n 华丽的服装使他那极其英俊的外貌更为增色./r/n Strikingly appropriate and relevant./r/n 适当的，恰当的极为贴切合适的/r/n

word.name: string
word.mean:
n. 线,一串,字串
v. 串起,成串,收紧
word.lx: We have had a string of complaints about the program./r/n 我们已经收到了对该节目的一连串投诉。/r/n Puppets are worked by strings./r/n 木偶是用线来操纵的。/r/n

word.name: stripe
word.lx: Tigers have orange fur with black stripes./r/n 老虎的皮毛是橘黄色的，带有黑色条纹。/r/n Which do you want for your new dress, a stripe or a check?/r/n 你要哪种料子来做新连衣裙, 条子的还是方格的?/r/n

word.name: striped
word.lx: He was wearing striped pajamas./r/n 他穿着带条纹的睡衣裤。/r/n Any of several African or tropical American trees having striped wood./r/n 牛栓藤一种非洲或美洲热带地区的有条纹的树木/r/n

word.name: stripling
word.lx: He is a young man, hardly more than a stripling./r/n 他是个小伙子，尚不及而立之年。/r/n The stripling helped the old man across the road./r/n 年轻的男子帮助那老人过马路。/r/n

word.name: stripy
word.mean: a. 条纹状的,有条纹的

word.name: strive
word.lx: He strove for recognition as an artist./r/n 他为获得艺术家的声誉而奋斗。/r/n The scientists strive for a breakthrough in cancer research./r/n 科学家们力争在癌症研究方面有个突破。/r/n

word.name: strode
word.lx: He strode over the stream./r/n 他大步跨过溪流。/r/n In a few strides he crossed the room./r/n 他几大步就穿过了房间。/r/n

word.name: stroll
word.mean:
n. 闲逛,漫步
v. 闲逛,漫步
word.lx: My sister and I strolled through the streets after supper./r/n 晚饭后，我妹妹和我在街上散步。/r/n The act or an instance of wandering; a stroll./r/n 闲逛徘徊的行为或事例；闲逛/r/n

word.name: stroller
word.mean: n. 散步者, 流浪者
word.lx: A parade of strollers on the mall./r/n 在购物中心的一群游逛者/r/n

word.name: strolling
word.lx: I often see them strolling happily arm in arm./r/n 我经常看到他们幸福地挽臂散步。/r/n I often see my grandparents strolling happily arm in arm./r/n 我常常看见我的爷爷奶奶臂挽着臂愉快地散步。/r/n

word.name: strong
word.lx: She is not strong in English./r/n 她英语不好。/r/n He is a strong man./r/n 他是个健壮的人。/r/n

word.name: strongest
word.mean: a. 最强壮的(为strong的最高级)
word.lx: The strongest man does not necessarily live the longest./r/n 最强壮的人未必活得最久。/r/n The current is strongest in the middle of the river./r/n 河中央的水流最急。/r/n

word.name: strongly
word.mean: ad. 坚固地,坚强地,激烈地

word.name: strove
word.lx: He strove for recognition as an artist./r/n 他为获得艺术家的声誉而奋斗。/r/n My grandmother at all price strove to get her son through college./r/n 我祖母不惜花费地让她儿子念完了大学。/r/n

word.name: struck
word.lx: The boss struck off 100 dollars from the salary of the employee as fine./r/n 老板从这个雇员的工资里扣除100美元作为罚款。/r/n The ten-year-old girl struck off a poem for the occasion./r/n 那个10岁的小女孩即席作诗应景。/r/n

word.name: structural
word.lx: The building is structurally sound./r/n 这座建筑物结构很坚固。/r/n There is a structural alteration to the building./r/n 这座建筑物在这有一处结构上的改变。/r/n

word.name: structure
word.mean:
n. 结构,构造,建筑物
v. 构成,建立,建造
word.lx: You need to structure your arguments more carefully./r/n 你需要更为仔细地组织自己的论点。/r/n Can you analyze the structure of the sentence for me?/r/n 你能给我分析一下这个句子的结构吗？/r/n

word.name: structured
word.mean: a. 有组织的,有结构的,有安排的

word.name: struggle
word.mean:
n. 竞争,努力,奋斗
v. 努力,奋斗,挣扎
word.lx: He struggled with his assailants and eventually drove them off./r/n 他同攻击他的人进行搏斗，最后把他们赶走了。/r/n Several people were hurt in the struggle./r/n 在打斗中，有几个人受伤。/r/n

word.name: strum
word.lx: He sat there strumming a guitar./r/n 他坐在那儿漫不经心地弹吉他。/r/n Mary can come home from any musical show and strum every tune on the piano./r/n 玛丽每听过一次音乐会，回到家里都能在钢琴上随意弹出其中的每一首曲子。/r/n

word.name: strut
word.mean:
n. 高视阔步,支柱,抗压材
v. 趾高气扬地走,用支柱支撑
word.lx: Beyond the river, supported on struts, rose the flat-topped house./r/n 河对岸那间平顶屋耸立在几根柱子上。/r/n He strutted in front of me like a peacock./r/n 他像一只骄傲的孔雀一样在我前面趾高气扬地走着。/r/n

word.name: stubble
word.lx: Farmers often burn the stubble after they have cut the corn./r/n 农民们在收割完庄稼后常烧茬子。/r/n The farmers are burning off the stubble from the fields./r/n 农民们正在把田里的庄稼残茬烧掉。/r/n

word.name: stubbornly
word.lx: Stubbornly or perversely persistent./r/n 顽固的顽固地或刚愎地坚持的/r/n Stubbornly resisting change or clinging to a seemingly hopeless or outdated cause./r/n 顽固地固执地坚持改变或抱定一看起来无希望或旧的理由/r/n

word.name: stucco
word.lx: The house is red brick without a covering of stucco./r/n 那房子是红砖砌的，没有用灰泥粉刷。/r/n

word.name: stud
word.mean:
n. 图钉,装饰钮扣,
立柱,板墙筋,壁骨
v. 镶嵌,点缀
word.lx: I saw diamond studs in her ears./r/n 我看见她耳朵上戴着的钻石耳钉。/r/n He knows it very well because he have stud it up in a book./r/n 他对这个问题很了解，因为他为此曾在一本书中查阅过。/r/n

word.name: student
word.lx: How many students are there in your class?/r/n 你们班有多少个学生？/r/n Such a good student is he that we all like him./r/n 他是个这么好的学生，所以我们都喜欢他。/r/n

word.name: studio
word.mean:
n. 工作场所,画室
n. 照相室，制片厂．
word.lx: She must be in the television studio at the moment./r/n 她现在一定在电视演播室。/r/n The equipment of the photographic studio was expensive./r/n 装备摄影室的开支很大./r/n

word.name: studio apartment
word.mean: n. 一个房间的小公寓住宅

word.name: study
word.mean:
v.&n. 学习,研究
vi. 读书
vt. 细看,学习,研究
word.lx: Scientists are studying the photographs of Mars for signs of life./r/n 科学家们正在研究火星的照片，寻求生命的迹象。/r/n His years of study were useful in his job./r/n 他多年的学习有助于他的工作。/r/n

word.name: stuff
word.mean:
n. 材料,原料,东西
v. 填满,塞满
word.lx: He stuffed the apples into the bag./r/n 他把苹果塞进袋子里。/r/n This book is really boring stuff./r/n 这本书真是枯燥无味./r/n

word.name: stuffy
word.mean: a. 不通气的(固步自封的)
word.lx: Our office is really stuffy./r/n 我们的办公室很闷。/r/n The atmosphere is very stuffy in here can we open a window?/r/n 这 的空气很闷--咱们能把窗户打开吗?/r/n

word.name: stultify
word.mean: vt. 使...显得荒谬可笑(使...无价值,使...无效)
word.lx: Their unhelpfulness has stultified our efforts to improve things./r/n 他们不管事, 我们为改进工作的用心也就白费了./r/n

word.name: stumble
word.mean:
n. 绊倒,失策
v. 使绊倒,失策
word.lx: I stumbled over a tree root./r/n 我在一个树根上绊了一跤。/r/n The child stumbled through a piece by Chopin./r/n 那孩子费劲地奏完一支肖邦的曲子。/r/n

word.name: stump
word.mean:
n. 残株,烟蒂,讲演台
v. 砍断,蹒跚而走
word.lx: He stumped angrily out of the room./r/n 他气愤地跺着脚走出了房间。/r/n He used the stump as a table./r/n 他把树桩当桌子用。/r/n

word.name: stun
word.lx: She sat stunned for a while, until she recovered./r/n 她一时昏迷，坐下呆了一会儿才醒过来。/r/n The punch stunned me for a moment./r/n 那一拳把我打得昏了一阵。/r/n

word.name: stung
word.lx: Her ingratitude stung him./r/n 她的忘恩负义使他痛心。/r/n Their taunts stung him to action/into fighting./r/n 他们冷嘲热讽惹得他采取了行动[打了起来]./r/n

word.name: stunning
word.mean: a. 足以使人晕倒的,极好的

word.name: stunningly
word.mean: ad. 惊人地,令人目瞪口呆地

word.name: stupefy
word.lx: I was stupefied by what I read./r/n 我读到的内容把我惊呆了./r/n Exhilarated or stupefied by or as if by alcohol; intoxicated./r/n 醉的，陶醉的因（仿佛）喝酒类饮料而兴奋或木然的；醉的/r/n

word.name: stupendous
word.lx: The opera was quite stupendous./r/n 这部歌剧很精彩。/r/n He made a stupendous mistake./r/n 他犯了一个极大的错误。/r/n

word.name: stupidity
word.lx: Your stupidity will drive me to (ie make me feel) despair./r/n 你愚蠢得使我寒心./r/n Extreme folly or stupidity./r/n 白痴极其错误或愚蠢/r/n

word.name: stupor
word.lx: Stupor induced by a narcotic./r/n 麻醉性昏睡麻醉药引起的昏迷状态/r/n He was in an alcoholic stupor./r/n 他醉得不省人事。/r/n

word.name: sturdy
word.lx: A sturdy cylindrical container for storing liquids; a barrel./r/n 桶贮存液体的坚固的圆筒状容器；桶/r/n Being in robust and sturdy good health./r/n 强壮的，健康的强壮的和身体健康的/r/n

word.name: stutter
word.mean:
n. 口吃
v. 口吃

word.name: Stygian
word.mean: a. 地狱的,阴暗的,阴黑的,幽暗的

word.name: stylish
word.mean: a. 现代风格的,流行的,潇洒的
word.lx: Conforming to the current style; stylish./r/n 时髦的符合流行式样的；流行的/r/n Being in or conforming to the prevailing or current fashion; stylish./r/n 流行的符合流行的或现时的式样的；时髦的/r/n

word.name: stylist
word.lx: The stylist did a real job on my hair./r/n 发型师把我的头发剪糟了/r/n I am a stylist, and the most beautiful sentence I have ever heard is, Have one on the house."/r/n 我是文体批评家，而迄今听过的最佳句子是：“请进一杯，免费的。”/r/n"

word.name: stylized
word.mean:
v. 仿效(因袭)
a. 程式化的

word.name: stymie
word.mean:
n. 困难境地
vt 使...处于困难境地
word.lx: I was completely stymied by her refusal to help./r/n 由於她拒不相助, 我完全陷入了困境./r/n

word.name: styptic
word.mean:
a. 止血的
n. 止血剂

word.name: suave
word.mean: a. 柔和的,温和的,娴雅的

word.name: sub
word.mean:
n. 地铁,潜艇,替补队员
vi. (for)替代
word.lx: I had to sub for the referee, who was sick./r/n 裁判病了, 我得代为裁判./r/n

word.name: subaltern
word.lx: He found in India that subalterns were two a penny and invited nowhere./r/n 在印度，中尉和少尉军官多得不值钱，在哪儿也不会成为座上客。/r/n

word.name: subarctic
word.mean: a. 靠近北极的,亚北极的

word.name: subatomic
word.mean: a. 亚原子的(次原子的,原子内的,比原子更小的)

word.name: subconscious
word.mean: a. 潜在意识,模糊的意识

word.name: subconsciously
word.mean: ad. 下意识地,潜意识地

word.name: subcontract
word.mean: n. 对象,分契,转包合同

word.name: subculture
word.lx: The subculture associated with psychedelic drugs./r/n 迷幻世界与迷幻药有关的亚文化/r/n

word.name: subdivide
word.mean: vt. 细分(细区分,再划分,重分,叠分,分小类)
word.lx: Part of the building has been subdivided into offices./r/n 这座大楼的一部分隔开用作办公室了./r/n

word.name: subdue
word.lx: He managed to subdue his mounting anger./r/n 他设法克制住了阵阵愤怒。/r/n

word.name: subject
word.mean:
n. 科目,主题
a. 服从的,易患的
word.lx: How many subjects are you studying this semester?/r/n 这学期你选了几门课程？/r/n I am French by birth and a British subject by marriage./r/n 我按出生是法国人，因结婚而成为英国公民。/r/n

word.name: sublet
word.lx: There is a clause in the contract forbidding tenants to sublet./r/n 合同中有一条款禁止承租人转租房屋。/r/n Under the terms of the lease you had no right to sublet the property./r/n 根据租约规定, 你无权转租物业./r/n

word.name: sublimate
word.mean:
v. 使升华,升华,纯化
a. 纯净化的,理想化的,气质高贵的
n. 升华物

word.name: sublimation
word.mean: n. 升华,升华物,高尚化

word.name: sublime
word.mean:
a. 壮观的,卓越的
v. 提高,变高尚

word.name: subliminal
word.mean: a. 下意识的,识阈的,潜在意识的

word.name: submarine
word.mean:
a. 水底的,海底的
n. 潜水艇
word.lx: They are building a submarine cable tunnel./r/n 他们正在建设一条海底电缆隧道。/r/n The vessel was ruined by a submarine./r/n 那艘船是被潜水艇毁坏的。/r/n

word.name: submerge
word.mean: v. 使浸水,潜入水中,使陷入
word.lx: At the first sign of danger the submarine will submerge./r/n 一有危险迹象，潜艇就会潜入水中。/r/n Such feelings tend to remain submerge beneath a mask of social politeness./r/n 在社交礼貌的掩盖下，这样的情感往往不会显露出来。/r/n

word.name: submerged
word.lx: Her happiness at seeing him submerged her former worries./r/n 她看到他非常高兴，顿时完全忘记了先前的烦恼。/r/n The submarine submerged to avoid enemy ships./r/n 该潜艇潜入水下以躲避敌舰./r/n

word.name: submicroscopic
word.mean: a. 用普通显微镜看不出的

word.name: submission
word.lx: Tomorrow is the last date for submission of entries for the competition./r/n 明天是提交参赛表格的最后期限。/r/n In my submission these proposals are completely unworkable./r/n 在我看来，这些建议完全不可行。/r/n

word.name: submissive
word.mean: a. 服从的,顺从的,柔顺的

word.name: submit
word.mean:
vt.呈送,递交,主张
vt. 使服从,屈服
word.lx: We should submit our plans to the council for approval./r/n 我们应该向理事会提交计划以求批准。/r/n Counsel for the defence submitted that his client was clearly innocent./r/n 被告的律师辩称其委托人显然是无辜的。/r/n

word.name: subordinate
word.mean:
n. 属下,附属物
a. 下级的,次要的,附属的
v. 使...居下位,使...服从
word.lx: He subordinated his wishes to the general good of the group./r/n 他使自己的愿望服从于集体的利益。/r/n He was always friendly to his subordinates./r/n 他对下级一向和蔼可亲。/r/n

word.name: subordination
word.mean: n. 放置在下级,使隶属,看不起

word.name: subpoena
word.mean:
n. 传票
v. 传审,唤审
word.lx: Failure of a witness or party to appear in response to a subpoena or notice./r/n 不出庭证人或当事人接到传票或通知后未出现/r/n

word.name: subroutine
word.lx: A subroutine or set of data contained sequentially within another./r/n 子程序包含在其它程序中的程序或一组连续数/r/n An instruction to go to a subroutine./r/n 一种转移到子程序去的指令。/r/n

word.name: subscribe
word.lx: We subscribe to an animal protection society./r/n 我们定期捐款给一个动物保护基金会。/r/n I subscribed to several magazines./r/n 我订阅了几份杂志。/r/n

word.name: subscription
word.lx: Have you handed in your subscription?/r/n 你交订阅费了吗？/r/n My subscription ran out last month./r/n 我的订阅期到上个月为止。/r/n

word.name: subsection
word.mean: n. 小部份,小单位,细分

word.name: subsequence
word.mean: n. 随后,随后发生的事,结果

word.name: subservient
word.mean: a. 有帮助的,有用的,奉承的
word.lx: People should not be regarded as subservient to the economic system./r/n 不应把人的因素看成是经济体制的附庸./r/n People shall not be regarded as subservient to the economic system./r/n 不应把人的因素看成是经济体制的附庸。/r/n

word.name: subside
word.lx: The flood gradually subsided./r/n 洪水正逐渐退去。/r/n The storm began to subside./r/n 风暴渐渐平息了。/r/n

word.name: subsidiary
word.mean:
a. 辅助的,附属的
n. 子公司,附属机构
word.lx: Most of the group profit is contributed by the subsidiary in the far east./r/n 集团的大部分利润是由远东的子公司缴纳。/r/n A lack of corporate interest has made the subsidiary an orphan./r/n 因缺乏共同利益，使得这家子公司无人照管/r/n

word.name: subsidize
word.mean: v. 给与补助金,给与奖助金,贿赂

word.name: subsist
word.mean: v. 供给食物,活下去,生存
word.lx: He subsisted mainly on vegetables and fruit./r/n 他主要靠蔬菜和水果维持生命。/r/n The living thing on the earth can not subsist on mars./r/n 地球上的生物不可能在火星上生存。/r/n

word.name: substance
word.mean: n. 物质,实质,基本内容
word.lx: There is not anything of real substance in their book./r/n 他们的书中没有什么实质性的内容。/r/n The substance is irritable to sensitive skin./r/n 这种物质对敏感的皮肤有刺激性。/r/n

word.name: substandard
word.mean: a. 标准以下的,不合规格的

word.name: substantial
word.mean:
n. 重要部份,本质
a. 大量的,实质上的,有内容的
word.lx: We are in substantial agreement./r/n 我们实际上意见一致。/r/n They want to see substantial changes./r/n 他们想看到实质性的变化。/r/n

word.name: substantially
word.mean: ad. 实质上,本质上,大体上
word.lx: The part of a charge or an accusation that weighs most substantially against the accused./r/n 控诉，申诉指控或控告的一部分，针对被控方起着极重要的作用/r/n His criticism is substantially correct./r/n 他的批评大体上是正确的。/r/n

word.name: substantiate
word.lx: Can you substantiateyour accusations against him?/r/n 你指责他, 能提出事实根据吗?/r/n

word.name: substantive
word.mean:
a. 表示实在的；本质的、实质性的；独立的；
n. 实词,实名词；独立存在的实体
word.lx: A noun or substantive that receives or is affected by the action of a verb within a sentence./r/n 宾语一个句子中接受动词的动作或受之影响的名词或名词性词组/r/n

word.name: substitute
word.mean:
n. 代替者,代用品
v. 代替
vi. (for)代替
vt. 用...代替,代以
word.lx: We substituted a red ball for blue to see if the baby would notice./r/n 我们用红皮球换下了蓝皮球，看这婴儿会不会发觉。/r/n Water is not a proper substitute for wine./r/n 水不是酒的适当代用品。/r/n

word.name: substitution
word.lx: Two substitutions (ie of players) were made during the match./r/n 在比赛中换了两次人./r/n

word.name: substrate
word.mean:
n. 基片(基层,真晶格,基质)
n. 衬底

word.name: substratum
word.mean: n. 基础,根据,下层,底层

word.name: subsume
word.mean:
v. 包含,包容
vt. 包含
word.lx: This creature can be subsumed in the class of reptiles./r/n 这种生物可以归入爬行动物一类./r/n

word.name: subtitle
word.mean: n. 副题(书本中的),说明或对白的字幕

word.name: subtle
word.mean: a. 微妙的,敏感的,精细的,狡猾的
word.lx: She has a subtle charm./r/n 她有难以形容的魅力。/r/n There were subtle hints in his letter./r/n 他的信中有些微妙的暗示。/r/n

word.name: subtly
word.mean: ad. 敏锐地,巧妙地,精细地

word.name: subtopic
word.mean: n. 小标题,副标题,要点

word.name: subtraction
word.lx: Two from five is a simple subtraction./r/n 五减二是简单的减法./r/n

word.name: subtractive
word.mean: a. 减去的,有负号的,负的

word.name: subtropical
word.lx: This country has a subtropical climate./r/n 这个国家属于亚热带气候。/r/n

word.name: suburban
word.lx: I like to breathe the fresh air in suburban places./r/n 我喜欢在郊外呼吸新鲜空气。/r/n The curtain goes up on (ie is raised to show) a suburban living-room./r/n 幕布升起, 展现的是市郊住宅的起居室./r/n

word.name: subversive
word.mean:
a. 从事颠覆的,破坏性的
n. 破坏份子,危险份子
word.lx: They are contaminating the minds of our young people with these subversive ideas./r/n 他们这些颠覆性的思想是对我们年轻人的精神污染。/r/n The new party has subversive ideas./r/n 新政党有颠覆的意图。/r/n

word.name: subvert
word.lx: A plot or scheme intended to subvert another plot./r/n 反计策意在破坏另一计谋的计策或计划/r/n

word.name: subway
word.lx: I want to get there by subway./r/n 我想乘地铁去那儿。/r/n Use the subway to cross the road./r/n 请走地下通道穿越马路。/r/n

word.name: succeed
word.lx: If you work hard you will succeed./r/n 如果你努力工作，你就会成功。/r/n When the duke dies, his eldest son will succeed to the title./r/n 公爵去世之后，他的长子将继承他的爵位。/r/n

word.name: successful
word.lx: They are highly successful in business./r/n 他们经商非常成功。/r/n There is no doubt that we will be successful./r/n 毫无疑问我们会成功的。/r/n

word.name: successfully
word.lx: At last he successfully solved the problem./r/n 最后他终于成功地解决了这个问题。/r/n They have launched a man-made satellite successfully./r/n 他们成功地发射了一颗人造卫星。/r/n

word.name: succession
word.lx: There are a succession of rainy days here./r/n 这里一连好几天都是雨天。/r/n He retrieved his losses by betting on a succession of winners./r/n 他下的赌注连续获胜才挽回了损失./r/n

word.name: successive
word.mean: a. 接连的,连续的,接二连三的

word.name: successor
word.lx: His successor as the chairman will be at the conference./r/n 接替他担任主席的人将参加本次会议。/r/n The chairman has designated that boy as his successor./r/n 主席已经指定那个男孩作他的继承人。/r/n

word.name: succinct
word.lx: A short, succinct statement./r/n 简短，扼要的陈述/r/n

word.name: succulent
word.mean: a. 多汁的,多水份的,多汁性的

word.name: succumb
word.lx: Several children have measles, and the others are bound to succumb (to it)./r/n 有几个孩子患了麻疹, 其他孩子也必然传染上./r/n The driver has succumbed to (ie died of) his injuries./r/n 司机已受伤不治./r/n

word.name: such
word.lx: Such people can help you a lot./r/n 这样的人对你大有帮助。/r/n Such poets as Keats and Shelley wrote Romantic poetry./r/n 有些诗人，如济慈和雪莱，写的是浪漫主义的诗歌。/r/n

word.name: suckle
word.lx: She suckles her baby hardly./r/n 她艰难地哺育孩子。/r/n

word.name: sucrose
word.lx: A sucrose infusion./r/n 蔗糖输入液/r/n

word.name: Sudan
word.lx: A unit of currency in Egypt, Lebanon, Sudan, and Syria./r/n 皮阿斯特埃及、黎巴嫩、苏丹和叙利亚的一种货币单位/r/n

word.name: sudd
word.mean: n. (白尼罗河上游的)大块漂浮植物

word.name: sudden
word.mean:
n. 突然,忽然
a. 突然的,快速的
word.lx: His sudden death upset everybody./r/n 他的突然去世使大家深感悲伤。/r/n The boy began crying all of a sudden./r/n 那男孩忽然哭了起来。/r/n

word.name: sudorific
word.mean:
a. 使发汗的,促使发汗的
n. 发汗药

word.name: sue
word.mean: VI 要求、请求；控告 VT控告、起诉

word.name: Suez Canal
word.lx: The Suez Canal joins the Mediterranean and the Red Sea./r/n 苏伊士运河连接著地中海和红海./r/n In July,1956, Egypt had seized the Suez Canal./r/n 一九五六年七月，埃及占领了苏伊士运河。/r/n

word.name: sufferer
word.mean: n. 受难者,被害者,患者
word.lx: Relief was quickly sent to the sufferers from the great fire./r/n 救济品很快被送到遭受火灾的灾民手中。/r/n There are many malaria sufferers in hospital./r/n 医院里有很多疟疾病人。/r/n

word.name: suffering
word.mean:
n. 苦楚,受难
vbl. 蒙受,受苦
word.lx: She bore her sufferings bravely./r/n 她勇敢地承受艰难困苦。/r/n The suffering of innocent people caused by the war cannot be compensated for by money./r/n 战争给无辜的人民带来的痛苦不是金钱可以补偿的。/r/n

word.name: suffice
word.lx: An hour should suffice for the journey./r/n 这点路程一小时足够了。/r/n The rations will suffice until next week./r/n 这些口粮足够吃到下星期。/r/n

word.name: suffix
word.lx: A diminutive suffix, word, or name./r/n 微小表微小的后缀、单词或名称/r/n A verbal suffix./r/n 用于构成动词的后缀/r/n

word.name: suffrage
word.mean: n. 投票,选举权,参政权
word.lx: When was universal suffrage introduced in your country?/r/n 贵国是什么时候实行普选权的？/r/n The question of woman suffrage sets them at variance./r/n 妇女参政的问题使他们发生争执。/r/n

word.name: suffuse
word.lx: A blush suffused his cheeks./r/n 他瞬间满脸通红./r/n The evening sky was suffused with crimson./r/n 黄昏时分天空红霞灿灿./r/n

word.name: sugar
word.mean:
n. 糖
v. 加糖于
word.lx: He put some sugar into his coffee./r/n 他往咖啡里加了些糖。/r/n The pill is sugared./r/n 这药丸加上了糖衣。/r/n

word.name: suggest
word.lx: His pale face suggests bad health./r/n 他面色苍白，说明他身体不好。/r/n I suggested going for a walk./r/n 我建议去散步。/r/n

word.name: suggested
word.lx: I suggested putting the matter to a vote, but the chairman demurred to it./r/n 我建议对此事投票表决，但主席表示反对。/r/n The article struck a pessimistic note; it suggested there would be no improvement./r/n 那篇文章不甚乐观, 暗示将无改进./r/n

word.name: suggestion
word.lx: Can you give me any suggestion on this matter?/r/n 关于这件事，你能给我一些建议吗？/r/n What a ridiculous suggestion!/r/n 多么荒唐的建议！/r/n

word.name: suggestive
word.mean: a. 提示性的,影射的,暗示的
word.lx: There is an aroma suggestive of spring flowers in the room./r/n 这房间里有一种香气，使人想起春天的花朵。/r/n He gave her a suggestive glance./r/n 他用挑逗的目光看了她一眼。/r/n

word.name: suicide
word.mean:
a. 自杀(者)(的)
v.&n. 自杀
word.lx: She tried to commit suicide, but we saved her life by chance./r/n 她试图自杀，但我们碰巧救了她。/r/n This article discussed the events that led to her suicide./r/n 这篇文章讨论了导致她自杀的一系列事件。/r/n

word.name: suitable
word.lx: What time is suitable for us to meet?/r/n 我们什么时候会面合适？/r/n She is suitable for the job./r/n 她适合做这项工作。/r/n

word.name: suitably
word.lx: Components must suitably packed for delivery to site./r/n 部件必须适应包装以便运送到目的地。/r/n

word.name: suite
word.lx: He brought a three-piece suite./r/n 他买了三件一套的家具。/r/n The suite is for the honeymoon couple./r/n 这套房是为新婚夫妇设的。/r/n

word.name: suited
word.lx: He is better suited to a job with older pupils./r/n 他较适合教小学高年级学生。/r/n The girl is quite suited for the position [work]./r/n 这姑娘很适合担任这个职务[这个工作]。/r/n

word.name: suitor
word.mean: n. 起诉者,请愿者,求婚者

word.name: sulfa
word.mean:
a. 磺胺的
n. 磺胺类药物

word.name: sulfate
word.lx: What color is copper sulfate solution?/r/n 硫酸铜溶液是什么颜色？/r/n Barium sulfate is a radiopaque substance./r/n 钡硫酸盐是一种辐射光不能穿透的状之。/r/n

word.name: sulfur
word.lx: Sulfur can be used to make gunpowder./r/n 硫磺可以用来制造火药。/r/n A sulfide compound containing at least two sulfur atoms per molecule./r/n 多硫化物每个分子中至少含有两个硫原子的一种硫化物/r/n

word.name: sullen
word.mean: a. 愠怒的,沉沉不乐的,阴沉的
