word.lx: She never laughed and became very sullen./r/n 她再也没有笑过，变得郁郁寡欢。/r/n Susan is sullen in the morning because she had not sleep well./r/n 苏珊今天早上郁闷不乐，因为昨晚没睡好。/r/n

word.name: Sullivan
word.lx: Before Anne Sullivan came to our house, one or two people had told my mother that I was an idiot./r/n 在安妮·莎莉文来到我们家之前，有些人曾对我母亲说过我是个白痴。/r/n

word.name: sulphur
word.lx: Sulphur can be used to make gunpowder./r/n 硫磺可以用来制造火药。/r/n Sulphur was not identified as an element until1810./r/n 1810年以前还没有认出硫是一种元素。/r/n

word.name: sultan
word.mean: n. 回教君主,土耳其皇帝,鸡
word.lx: Sultan is sovereign ruler of certain Muslim countries./r/n 苏丹是某些穆斯林国家的最高统治者。/r/n

word.name: sultry
word.lx: She is a sultry western beauty./r/n 她是位性感的西方美人。/r/n I met her in a sultry summer afternoon./r/n 我在夏天一个闷热的下午遇见了她。/r/n

word.name: sum
word.mean:
n. 总数,全部,概略
v. 总计,概括,合计
word.lx: I had to spend a large sum of money to get it back./r/n 我得花一大笔钱才把它弄回来。/r/n The sum of 5 and 3 is 8./r/n 五加三的总和是八。/r/n

word.name: summary
word.mean:
n. 摘要,概要
a. 摘要的,简略的
word.lx: Such an offence will lead to a summary fine./r/n 这类过错要当场予以罚款。/r/n Your summary will need fleshing out before you present it./r/n 你的总结需要增加一些具体材料再交出./r/n

word.name: summer
word.mean:
a. 夏季(的)
n. 夏季,夏天
word.lx: That was the high summer of English literature./r/n 当时是英国文学的全盛时期。/r/n This city has a music festival every summer./r/n 本市每年举行一次夏季音乐节。/r/n

word.name: summit
word.mean:
n. 顶点
n.最高官阶;最高级会议
word.lx: The Hungarian view is magnificent from the summit of the mountains./r/n 从群山之颠看到的匈牙利景色非常壮丽。/r/n It was a warm climb to the summit./r/n 向顶峰攀登时身上都热起来了。/r/n

word.name: summon
word.lx: He summoned his soldiers to fight./r/n 他号召部下战斗。/r/n The shareholders were summoned to a general meeting./r/n 那些股东被召集去叁加股东大会。/r/n

word.name: summons
word.mean:
n. 召唤,传唤,召集
v. 传唤到法院,唤出,传到
word.lx: The shareholders were summoned to a general meeting./r/n 那些股东被召集去叁加股东大会。/r/n The debtor was summoned (to appear before the magistrates)./r/n （地方法官）已传唤债务人出庭./r/n

word.name: sumptuous
word.lx: The poor girl was astonished by the sumptuous furnishings of the mansion./r/n 这个贫穷的女孩被大厦里的豪华的陈设惊呆了。/r/n Of a sumptuous, costly, or rich variety./r/n 特等的豪华的、昂贵的或多种多样的/r/n

word.name: sun
word.mean:
n. 太阳
vt. 晒太阳
word.lx: The sun shines brightly./r/n 阳光灿烂。/r/n He sat in a deck-chair sunning himself./r/n 他坐在帆布躺椅上晒太阳./r/n

word.name: sunbathe
word.lx: He have a habit of sunbathe for two hours a day./r/n 他习惯每天做两小时日光浴。/r/n The pool is surrounded by sunbathe./r/n 水池四周都是进行日光浴的人。/r/n

word.name: sunbeam
word.lx: My son is really a sunbeam./r/n 我儿子真是一个快乐的人。/r/n We can see many molecules flying in the air when a sunbeam penetrated the dark room./r/n 当一束光线穿进暗淡的房间时，我们可以看到空气中有许多小颗粒在飞舞。/r/n

word.name: sunburn
word.mean:
n. 日灼,晒伤
v. 晒黑
word.lx: Browned by the sun; sunburned./r/n 晒黑的被太阳晒成棕色的；晒黑的/r/n Can you give me something for sunburn?/r/n 能否给我治太阳炙伤的药？/r/n

word.name: sunburnt
word.lx: His hard hands and sinewy sunburnt limbs told of labor and endurance./r/n 他粗糙的双手，被太阳哂得发黑的健壮四肢，均表明他十分辛勤，非常耐劳。/r/n

word.name: Sunday
word.lx: Christians go to church on Sundays./r/n 基督教徒每个星期日到教堂去做礼拜。/r/n Sunday is my rest day./r/n 星期日是我休息的日子。/r/n

word.name: sunder
word.lx: The boat was sundered by the rock./r/n 船被岩石撞碎了。/r/n

word.name: sundown
word.lx: It is getting along toward sundown./r/n 快到日落的时候了。/r/n

word.name: sundries
word.lx: My expenses claim includes 15 for sundries./r/n 我的报销申请中包括 15 英镑杂项支出./r/n She invited all and sundry to her party./r/n 她邀请所有的人都来参加聚会./r/n

word.name: sundry
word.lx: They prepared rice, flour and sundry other items of food for the poor./r/n 他们为穷人准备了米，面及其它各种食物。/r/n We can see the rich man on sundry occasions./r/n 我们能在各种场合见到那个富豪。/r/n

word.name: sunflower
word.lx: Sunflowers are large flowers with yellow petals./r/n 向日葵是长着黄色花瓣的大花。/r/n The bird pecked seeds out of the sunflower./r/n 那只鸟用喙从向日葵中啄出种的。/r/n

word.name: sung
word.lx: The last verse will be sung in unison./r/n 歌词的最后部分要齐唱。/r/n Have you heard the opera sung in French?/r/n 你听过用法语唱的这场歌剧吗？/r/n

word.name: sunken
word.mean: v. 使...下沉(降,挖,打进,丧失,不重视)

word.name: sunlit
word.mean: a. 被日光照射了的,阳光照射的

word.name: sunny
word.mean: a. 阳光充足的,睛朗的,明媚的
word.lx: It is sunny today./r/n 今天天气晴朗。/r/n Sunny weather alternated with rain./r/n 天气晴雨相间。/r/n

word.name: sunrise
word.lx: The beauty of the sunrise is beyond description./r/n 日出的美景难以描述。/r/n The town came to life after sunrise./r/n 日出之后，这个市镇变得充满生气。/r/n

word.name: sunroof
word.mean: n. 汽车顶蓬上可开合以透空气与光的孔

word.name: sunset
word.lx: The sunset is gorgeous./r/n 落日辉煌。/r/n The wind was strong all day, but it moderated after sunset./r/n 风猛烈地刮了一整天后，日落后变小了。/r/n

word.name: sunshine
word.lx: I was sitting in the garden enjoying the sunshine./r/n 我坐在庭院里享受明媚的阳光。/r/n The baby has brought some sunshine into their life./r/n 孩子给他们的生活带来了几分快乐。/r/n

word.name: sup
word.mean:
v. 啜,尝
vi. 供给晚饭
word.lx: They supped on bread and cheese./r/n 他们吃面包和奶酪当晚餐。/r/n Come on, sup up your tea./r/n 来, 把茶喝了吧./r/n

word.name: superannuated
word.lx: Are you still riding that superannuated old bike?/r/n 你还骑那辆老掉牙的自行车吗?/r/n

word.name: supercilious
word.mean: a. 目中无人的,高傲的

word.name: superficial
word.lx: He is too superficial to appreciate great literature like this./r/n 他太肤浅，无法欣赏这类文学巨著。/r/n Superficial scratches can be easily removed./r/n 表面的划痕很容易擦掉。/r/n

word.name: superfluous
word.lx: He has already been told, so our comments are superfluous./r/n 早就有人同他说过，所以我们的意见是多余的。/r/n A superfluous word or phrase./r/n 冗词多余的词或短语/r/n

word.name: superhighway
word.lx: A superhighway will be constructed next year./r/n 明年将要修建一条超级高速公路。/r/n Streams of cars were belting along the superhighway./r/n 川流不息的车辆在高速公路上飞驰。/r/n

word.name: superior
word.mean:
n. 长者,高手
a. 上好的,出众的,高傲的
word.lx: He smiled a superior smile as he drove past in his expensive new car./r/n 他开着那辆豪华的新车驶过时，傲慢的微微一笑。/r/n He always does what his superiors tell him./r/n 他惟上级之命是从。/r/n

word.name: superlative
word.mean:
a. 最上的,无比的,过度的
n. 最高级的言辞,极致,完璧

word.name: supermarket
word.lx: The supermarket sells goods of all descriptions./r/n 超级市场销售各种货物。/r/n The supermarket rejected all spotted apples./r/n 超级市场丢弃了所有的烂苹果。/r/n

word.name: supernumerary
word.mean: n. 多余的人或物,冗员

word.name: superorganism
word.mean: n. [生]超个体(指群居昆虫等的群体)

word.name: superpower
word.lx: The superpowers are unlikely to disarm completely./r/n 超级大国不太可能彻底裁军./r/n The superpowers are putting the arms race into reverse./r/n 超级大国正在把军备竞赛转换成相继裁军。/r/n

word.name: supersede
word.lx: Motorways have largely superseded ordinary roads for long-distance travel./r/n 高速公路多已取代了普通公路./r/n Will factory workers be entirely superseded by machines one day?/r/n 工人将来能完全由机器取代吗?/r/n

word.name: supersonic
word.lx: Have you taken supersonic aircraft?/r/n 你坐过超音速飞机吗?/r/n The physics of supersonic flight./r/n 超音速飞行的物理性质/r/n

word.name: superstar
word.lx: The newspaper puff up that new athlete into a superstar/r/n 报界把那个新运动员吹捧成为超级明星。/r/n That superstar wrestling really turn me on./r/n 那种摔跤超级明星赛我的确很感兴趣。/r/n

word.name: superstructure
word.mean: n. 上部构造,建筑物,上层构造
word.lx: The frame or body of a ship, exclusive of masts, engines, or superstructure./r/n 船壳，船体船的框架或主体，不包括桅杆、发动机和上层建筑/r/n A superstructure at the stern of a ship./r/n 船楼，艉位于船尾部的上层结构/r/n

word.name: supervise
word.lx: The chief clerk supervises the work of the department./r/n 文书组长负责监督该部门的工作./r/n I supervised the workers loading the lorry./r/n 我监督工人把货物装上卡车./r/n

word.name: supervision
word.lx: Children should not be left to play without supervision./r/n 孩子玩的时候不能无人照看。/r/n This drug should only be taken under the supervision of a doctor./r/n 此药须遵医嘱服用。/r/n

word.name: supervisor
word.mean: n. 监督人, 管理人, 检查员, 督学, 主管人,导师
word.lx: The university students handed in their essays to their supervisor./r/n 大学生们把文章交给导师审阅。/r/n The supervisor always start his new employee on the lobster shift./r/n 领导总是让刚开始工作的新职员值夜班。/r/n

word.name: supervisory
word.lx: In telephony, the use of tones to transmit supervisory, address and alerting signals over a circuit./r/n 在电话技术中，利用音调在电路中传送监控、地址和报警信号的做法。/r/n

word.name: supine
word.mean: a. 仰卧的(掌心向上的,因循的)

word.name: supper
word.lx: Have you had your supper?/r/n 你吃过晚饭了吗？/r/n We had a buffet supper last evening./r/n 昨天晚上，我们吃了一次自助晚餐。/r/n

word.name: supplant
word.mean:
v. 排挤,取代
vt. (用策略等)替换
word.lx: She has been supplanted by another in his affections./r/n 他爱上了另一个人，不再爱她了。/r/n The party leader has been supplanted by his rival./r/n 那位政党领导已被他的对手取而代之了。/r/n

word.name: supple
word.mean: a. 柔软的,逢迎的,顺从的
word.lx: Exercise keeps you supple./r/n 经常锻炼可使身体灵活。/r/n She has a supple mind./r/n 她头脑灵活。/r/n

word.name: supplement
word.mean:
n. 补充物,增刊
v. 补充,增补
word.lx: I supplement my scholarship by working in the evening./r/n 我除了享受奖学金外还打夜工以增加收入。/r/n The money I got was a useful supplement to my ordinary income./r/n 我得到的那笔钱是很管用的外快。/r/n

word.name: suppliant
word.lx: He asked for help in a suppliant attitude./r/n 他以恳求的态度要我帮忙。/r/n He knelt as a suppliant at the altar./r/n 他跪在祭坛前祈祷。/r/n

word.name: supplicate
word.lx: He supplicates me to help./r/n 他向我求助。/r/n She supplicated for pardon./r/n 她恳求原谅。/r/n

word.name: supplier
word.mean: n. 供给的人,供给国,承制厂商

word.name: supplies
word.lx: At any rate, the medical supplies will reach you within a week./r/n 无论如何, 医疗物资会在一周内到达。/r/n The merchant supplies goods to them./r/n 商人向他们供应货物。/r/n

word.name: supply
word.mean:
n. 补给,供给
v. 补给,供给
word.lx: The merchant supplies goods to them./r/n 商人向他们供应货物。/r/n The supply ships travelled in convoy./r/n 补给船结队航行./r/n

word.name: support
word.mean:
n. 支持,援助,供养
vt. 支援,帮助,支持
word.lx: He needs a high income to support such a large family./r/n 他需要有高收入才能供养得起这样一个大家庭。/r/n Which football team do you support?/r/n 你支持哪个足球队？/r/n

word.name: supportive
word.lx: She has been very supportive during my illness./r/n 我患病期间她帮了我很大忙。/r/n The author dedicated her new book to her supportive family./r/n 这位作家将她的新书献给支持她的家庭。/r/n

word.name: suppose
word.mean:
v. 推想,假设,以为,认为
应该,获准(be suppose to),让(虚拟语气)
word.lx: We suppose that the situation will improve./r/n 我们认为形势会好转。/r/n Creation supposes a creator./r/n 有了创造者，才能有创造。/r/n

word.name: supposed
word.mean:
v. 假定(必须以...为条件)
a. 想象上的

word.name: supposing
word.lx: Supposing we sign the contract tomorrow./r/n 让我们明天就签约吧。/r/n Supposing that there is no pure water; what shall we drink?/r/n 假如没有纯净的水，人们喝什么？/r/n

word.name: supposition
word.lx: We must not condemn her on pure supposition./r/n 我们不能单凭猜测就谴责她。/r/n Our suppositions were fully confirmed./r/n 我们猜测的事实已全部证实。/r/n

word.name: suppress
word.lx: All these movements were suppressed by the warlord government./r/n 所有这些运动都受到军阀政府的镇压。/r/n The revolt was suppressed in a matter of hours./r/n 叛乱在几小时之内就镇压下去了。/r/n

word.name: supreme
word.lx: It was the supreme moment in his life./r/n 那是他一生中最重要的时刻。/r/n The general was girded with the supreme power./r/n 将军被授予最高权力。/r/n

word.name: supremely
word.mean: ad. 无上地, 崇高地

word.name: sure
word.mean:
a. 确信,必然的,必定的
ad. 当然,确实地,无疑地
word.lx: She is sure to pass the examination./r/n 她一定会通过考试。/r/n He is clever, to be sure, but not very hard-working./r/n 他聪明是聪明，但是不怎么勤奋。/r/n

word.name: surefire
word.mean: a. 一定会发生的,定成功的

word.name: sureness
word.lx: Sureness of occurrence or result; inevitability./r/n 必然发生或结局的确定性；必然性/r/n

word.name: surface
word.mean:
n. 表面,平面
a. 表面的,肤浅的
v. 使...成平面,被露出来,在表面工作
word.lx: Beneath that apparently calm surface is a man of fierce temper./r/n 文静的外表掩盖着的是一个火暴脾气的人。/r/n The surface of the lake is quite still./r/n 湖面相当平静。/r/n

word.name: surfeit
word.mean:
n. 过食
v. 使腻,吃过份
word.lx: A surfeit of rich food is bad for you./r/n 多吃油腻食物对身体有害。/r/n There has been a surfeit of plays about divorce on the TV recently./r/n 最近有关离婚的电视剧太多了。/r/n

word.name: surge
word.mean:
n. 巨涌,汹涌,澎湃
v. 汹涌,澎湃
word.lx: Anger surged up within him./r/n 怒火在他心中燃烧。/r/n The crowd surged past him./r/n 人们从他身边涌过。/r/n

word.name: surgeon
word.lx: The surgeon asked him if he felt nervous./r/n 外科医生问他是否感到紧张。/r/n The surgeon is performing a delicate operation./r/n 那位外科医生正在做一个很精细的手术。/r/n

word.name: surgery
word.lx: He underwent open-heart surgery./r/n 他接受了体外循环心脏手术。/r/n We built ourselves a new surgery./r/n 我们给自己建了一间新的外科手术室。/r/n

word.name: surgical
word.mean: a. 外科的,外科医生的,手术上的
word.lx: The doctor performs operations with sterilized surgical instruments./r/n 医生用消过毒的外科手术器械做手术。/r/n The hospital imported some surgical instruments./r/n 医院进口了一些外科器械。/r/n

word.name: surmise
word.mean:
n. 推测
v. 推测,臆测
word.lx: Your first surmise was right./r/n 你第一次猜得对。/r/n We surmised that he must have had an accident./r/n 我们猜想他一定出事了。/r/n

word.name: surmount
word.lx: I think most of these obstacles can be surmounted./r/n 我认为这些障碍大多数都是可以克服的。/r/n Hard to traverse, climb, or surmount./r/n 难攀登的，陡峭的难以通过、攀登或克服的/r/n

word.name: surname
word.lx: What is your surname?/r/n 你的姓是什么？/r/n Just call me by my surname, cut out the Mr./r/n 就叫我的姓吧，去掉先生二字。/r/n

word.name: surpass
word.lx: Men surpass women in strength./r/n 男人比女人力气大。/r/n Effort or ambition to equal or surpass another./r/n 竞争，好胜心争取赶上或超过另一个的努力或野心/r/n

word.name: surplus
word.mean:
a. 多余的,过剩的
n. 过剩,剩余物,盈余,顺差
word.lx: We are giving away all our surplus apples./r/n 我们准备把多余的苹果全部送人。/r/n Mexico has a large surplus of oil./r/n 墨西哥有大量过剩的石油。/r/n

word.name: surprise
word.mean:
n. 惊奇
v. 使惊奇
word.lx: It was a pleasant surprise to learn of her marriage./r/n 得知她结婚是件令人惊喜的事。/r/n The news greatly surprised them./r/n 这消息使他们大为吃惊。/r/n

word.name: surreal
word.mean: a. 不现实的,梦幻的,怪异的,可怕的
word.lx: Meeting you here like this is positively surreal!/r/n 像这样与你在此相逢真好比一场梦!/r/n Under the influence of the drug my mind was filled with surreal images./r/n 我受了麻醉药的刺激, 头脑里充满了稀奇古怪的幻觉./r/n

word.name: surrealist
word.lx: The lexicon of surrealist art./r/n 超现实主义艺术的词汇/r/n

word.name: surrender
word.lx: They surrendered to the enemy./r/n 他们向敌人投降了。/r/n We would rather die than surrender./r/n 我们宁死而不投降。/r/n

word.name: surreptitious
word.mean: a. 鬼鬼祟祟的,保密的
word.lx: Characterized by stealth; surreptitious./r/n 秘密的偷偷摸摸的；鬼鬼祟祟的/r/n His surreptitious behaviour naturally aroused suspicion./r/n 他那鬼鬼祟祟的行为自然引起了旁人的怀疑。/r/n

word.name: surrey
word.mean: n. <美>(四轮双座通常有篷的)萨里式游览马车
word.lx: The girl went to the museum by a surrey./r/n 那个女孩坐着一辆四轮双座轻便马车去博物馆了。/r/n Surrey scored only200 runs and had to follow on./r/n 萨里只得了200分，只好继续击球。/r/n

word.name: surrogate
word.mean: n. 代理,代理人,代用品
word.lx: Fiction is a poor surrogate for real experience./r/n 小说中的事远逊於实际体验./r/n

word.name: surround
word.mean:
n. 环绕物
v. 包围,环绕
word.lx: We are surrounded by dangers./r/n 我们的处境危机四伏。/r/n Trees surround the pond./r/n 树木围绕著池塘./r/n

word.name: surrounding
word.mean:
a. 周围的
n. 环境,周围的事物
word.lx: The surrounding villages have been absorbed by/into the growing city./r/n 周围的村庄已经并入了那不断扩展的城市./r/n Gradually the surrounding farmland turned residential./r/n 周围的农田渐渐变成了住宅区。/r/n

word.name: surroundings
word.lx: Animals in zoos are not in their natural surroundings./r/n 动物园里的动物不是生活在自然环境中。/r/n We are living in pleasant surroundings./r/n 我们生活在舒适的环境中。/r/n

word.name: surveillance
word.lx: The act of observing closely or the condition of being closely observed; surveillance./r/n 密切注视密切注视的行为或被密切注视的状态；监视/r/n The act or a period of observing; surveillance./r/n 观察；警戒观察或监视的行为或时间/r/n

word.name: survey
word.mean:
n. 纵览,视察,测量
v. 审视,视察,通盘考虑,调查
word.lx: We stood on the top of the mountain and surveyed the countryside./r/n 我们站在山顶上，眺望乡村。/r/n This survey is the work of a real professional./r/n 这份调查是真正内行人做的./r/n

word.name: survival
word.lx: That fashion is a survival from the 1930s./r/n 那种时装是三十年代的遗风。/r/n The miraculous survival of some people in the air crash was widely reported by the press./r/n 空难事件中有些人大难不死被新闻界广泛报导。/r/n

word.name: survive
word.lx: The human race cannot survive./r/n 人类不能继续生存。/r/n In the jungle, they were driven to extremes in order to survive./r/n 在丛林中, 他们为了生存被迫采取极端行动./r/n

word.name: survivor
word.lx: He is the only survivor of the plane crash./r/n 他是那次飞机失事唯一的幸存者。/r/n The sole survivor of the crash was a little boy./r/n 这次撞车事故的唯一幸存者是一个小男孩。/r/n

word.name: Susan
word.lx: Susan is in a thoughtful mood./r/n 苏珊心事重重。/r/n Susan seems very quiet, but make no mistake (about it), she has a terrible temper!/r/n 苏珊样子很文静, 可别产生误会, 她脾气坏极了!/r/n

word.name: suspect
word.mean:
n. 嫌疑犯
a. 令人怀疑的,不可信的
v. 怀疑,猜想
word.lx: She has more intelligence than we suspected her to possess./r/n 她的智慧比我们猜想的要高。/r/n They suspected an ambush./r/n 他们怀疑有埋伏。/r/n

word.name: suspend
word.mean:
v. 推迟,悬(浮),挂,暂停,取消
vi. 吊,悬浮
vt. 悬,挂,吊,暂停,中止

word.name: suspender
word.mean: n. 吊的人,袜吊,吊裤带
word.lx: Some boys wear suspenders to keep their trousers up./r/n 有些孩子使用背带来吊住裤子。/r/n

word.name: suspension
word.lx: The headmaster has made a decision of suspension of a pupil from school./r/n 校长已经做出对一名学生停学处分的决定。/r/n She appealed against her suspension./r/n 她对被停职一事已经上诉。/r/n

word.name: suspension bridge
word.lx: And the suspension bridge from hanging vines./r/n 悬索桥受到了悬挂着的藤的启发。/r/n

word.name: suspicion
word.lx: The talks have resulted in a lessening of suspicion./r/n 谈话消减了彼此的怀疑。/r/n They had an uneasy suspicion that all was not well./r/n 他们有一种令人不安的猜疑，所有的事都不太妙。/r/n

word.name: suspicious
word.lx: His strange behavior made the police suspicious./r/n 他不寻常的举止引起了警察的怀疑。/r/n Two suspicious characters were brought in./r/n 逮捕了两名嫌疑犯./r/n

word.name: suspiciously
word.lx: The customs officer inspected my passport suspiciously./r/n 海关官员颇为怀疑地检查了我的护照./r/n The aforementioned (person/persons) was/were acting suspiciously./r/n 前面所述的人行动可疑./r/n

word.name: sustain
word.mean: v. 承受,支持,经受,维持
word.lx: The foundations were not strong enough to sustain the weight of the house./r/n 这地基不够牢固，无法承受房屋的重量。/r/n Hope alone sustained him in his struggle./r/n 在奋斗中，只有希望支持着他。/r/n

word.name: sustained
word.mean: a. 持久的,经久不衰的

word.name: suture
word.mean:
n. 缝合,缝合处,缝合用的线
v. 缝合

word.name: svelte
word.mean: a. 苗条的, 体态娇美的

word.name: swab
word.lx: Little Tom swabbed up the gravy with crusty bread./r/n 小汤姆用硬面包把肉汁抹得干干净净。/r/n

word.name: swag
word.mean:
n. 摇动(松垂,挠度,洼地)
vt 摇动(松垂,挠度,洼地)

word.name: swain
word.mean: n. 情郎,乡下的年轻人

word.name: swallow
word.mean:
n. 燕子
vt. 吞下,咽下,忍受
vi. 咽口水
word.lx: She was swallowed up by the crowd and we lost sight of her./r/n 她淹没在人群之中，我们看不到她了。/r/n There are many swallows flying in the sky./r/n 天空中有许多燕子。/r/n

word.name: swam
word.lx: As he swam, he thrashed the water with his hand./r/n 他游泳时用手拍打水。/r/n Swam downriver; a downriver canoe race./r/n 向下游游泳；顺流独木舟赛/r/n

word.name: swamp
word.mean:
n. 沼泽,湿地
v. 淹没,陷于沼泽
word.lx: The heavy rain has turned the small garden into a swamp./r/n 大雨使这小花园变成了一块沼泽地。/r/n In the swamp we were beset by mosquitoes./r/n 我们在沼泽地受到蚊子的围攻。/r/n

word.name: swampy
word.mean: a. 沼泽的,沼泽多的,湿地的
word.lx: Full of or resembling mire; swampy./r/n 沼泽般的充满了淤泥的或似沼泽的；泥沼的/r/n Low, flat, swampy land; a bog or marsh./r/n 沼泽低平的沼泽地；泥塘或湿地/r/n

word.name: swan
word.mean:
n. 天鹅
vi. 闲荡,游荡
word.lx: A black swan is rare./r/n 黑天鹅很稀有。/r/n The swan sings when death comes./r/n 死期来到，天鹅歌声美妙。/r/n

word.name: Swansea
word.mean: 斯旺西[英国威尔士南部港市](西格拉摩根郡首府)

word.name: swap
word.mean:
v.&n. 交换
vt. 交换,用...作交易
word.lx: As you like my dress and I like yours, shall we do a swap?/r/n 既然你喜欢我的连衣裙而我也喜欢你的，咱们交换好吗？/r/n They swapped (ie told each other) stories about their army days./r/n 他们互相讲述了他们在军队中的经历./r/n

word.name: swarm
word.mean:
n. 蜂窝
v. 云集、充满
word.lx: He has received a swarm of letters./r/n 他已经收到了一大批信件。/r/n The crowd swarmed out of the cinema after the film ended./r/n 电影结束后，人们从电影院蜂拥而出。/r/n

word.name: swarming
word.mean:
分蜂群
群飞
分蜂
群居
word.lx: The crowd was swarming out through the gates./r/n 人群一窝蜂地从出口涌出./r/n The beach was swarming with bathers./r/n 海滩上挤满了游泳的人./r/n

word.name: swarthy
word.lx: She has a swarthy complexion./r/n 她的肤色黝黑。/r/n

word.name: swathe
word.lx: The farmer cut a swathe in the field with his scythe./r/n 农夫用镰刀在地里刈出一条路来。/r/n

word.name: sway
word.mean:
n. 摇,影响力,支配
v. 使摇动,支配
word.lx: His power sways the world./r/n 他称霸天下。/r/n The branches of the trees were swaying in the wind./r/n 树枝在风中摇晃。/r/n

word.name: swear
word.lx: They swore an oath to carry out their duties faithfully./r/n 他们发誓要忠实履行自己的职责。/r/n I swore her to secrecy about what I had told her./r/n 我要她起誓对我告诉她的事保守秘密。/r/n

word.name: sweat
word.lx: I really sweated over my last essay./r/n 我的确下功夫写了上次那篇文章。/r/n I am sweating all over./r/n 我浑身上下大汗淋漓。/r/n

word.name: sweatband
word.mean: n. (运动时系在额上或手腕上的)吸汗巾

word.name: sweater
word.lx: I had to put on a sweater since it was raining hard outside./r/n 外面在下雨，我不得不套上一件厚运动衫。/r/n This sweater washes well./r/n 这件套头毛衣耐洗./r/n

word.name: sweatshop
word.mean: n. 血汗工厂(工作条件恶劣而工资低的)

word.name: sweaty
word.mean: a. 汗流浃背的,热得令人发汗的

word.name: Swede
word.mean:
n. 瑞典人
n. 瑞典甘蓝，一种黄色大头菜
word.lx: He is a Swede./r/n 他是瑞典人。/r/n The Swede would answer with pride: Both, sir! " For many days this practice continued./r/n 瑞典人会骄傲地答道：“两次，长官。”这样的练习进行了好多天。/r/n"

word.name: Sweden
word.lx: He was born in Sweden./r/n 他出生于瑞典。/r/n Sweden has frontiers with Norway and Finland./r/n 瑞典与挪威和芬兰接壤。/r/n

word.name: Swedish
word.mean:
n. 瑞典人,瑞典语
a. 瑞典的,瑞典人的,瑞典语的

word.name: sweep
word.mean:
n. 扫除,席卷,范围
v. 扫除,用手指弹,掠过
word.lx: She swept the floor clean./r/n 她把地板打扫干净。/r/n This floor needs a good sweep./r/n 这地板需要好好清扫一下。/r/n

word.name: sweeper
word.lx: I want to buy a carpet sweeper./r/n 我想买一台地毯清扫器。/r/n She is a pavement sweeper./r/n 她是一个打扫人行道的清扫工人。/r/n

word.name: sweeping
word.mean:
n. 扫除,废屑
a. 一扫而去的,凶猛的,广泛的
vbl. 扫除,打扫
word.lx: The streets have been swept free of leaves./r/n 街上的落叶已打扫乾净./r/n Such evil practice cannot be swept away at once./r/n 这种坏事不是一下能扫除干净的。/r/n

word.name: sweet
word.mean:
a. 甜的,可爱的,悦耳的
n. 糖果,甜点
word.lx: The dish tastes a bit sweet./r/n 这菜有点儿甜味。/r/n The dentist told the boy not to eat too many sweets./r/n 牙医告诫这男孩不要吃太多糖果。/r/n

word.name: sweeten
word.lx: Shall I sweeten your coffee?/r/n 我给你的咖啡加点糖好吗？/r/n A good meal sweetened his temper./r/n 吃了一顿好饭，他的脾气变得好多了。/r/n

word.name: sweetener
word.mean: n. 使变甜的东西,甜味剂
word.lx: The firm offers her a generous bonus as a sweetener./r/n 公司提出给她一笔可观的花红藉以拉拢她。/r/n Love and scandal is the best sweetener of tea./r/n 恋爱与丑闻，是喝茶的最佳甜点心。/r/n

word.name: sweetening
word.lx: Containing, full of, or sweetened with honey./r/n 多蜜液的含有蜜的，充满了蜜或因蜜变甜的/r/n Shall I sweeten your coffee?/r/n 我给你的咖啡加点糖好吗？/r/n

word.name: sweetheart
word.mean:
n. 情人,爱人
v. 爱慕,求爱
word.lx: His sweetheart is a pretty girl./r/n 他的情人是一个可爱的女孩。/r/n A favored female companion or sweetheart./r/n 女朋友最喜欢的女性同伴或爱人/r/n

word.name: sweetly
word.lx: The nightingale sings sweetly at night./r/n 这只夜莺夜里唱得很好听。/r/n The choir sang sweetly, and none more so than the Welsh boy./r/n 唱诗班唱得很悦耳，尤其是没人比得上那个威尔士男孩儿。/r/n

word.name: sweets
word.lx: The dentist told the boy not to eat too many sweets./r/n 牙医告诫这男孩不要吃太多糖果。/r/n The bag of sweets on the table was too strong a temptation for the child to resist./r/n 桌上那包糖果对那孩子是个难以抗拒的诱惑./r/n

word.name: swell
word.mean:
n. 增大,隆起的部分,巨浪
a. 优秀的,上流的
v. 增大,使...膨胀,积聚
word.lx: The wind swelled out the sail./r/n 风吹得船帆鼓了起来。/r/n Her ankle swelled up after the fall./r/n 她跌倒后脚踝肿了起来。/r/n

word.name: swelling
word.mean:
v. 膨胀(泡胀)
a. 膨胀的(增大的)
word.lx: Wood often swells when wet./r/n 木材潮湿後往往会膨胀./r/n The swelling on her finger was caused by a foreign body in it./r/n 她的手指肿胀是手指内有异物引起的。/r/n

word.name: swerve
word.mean:
vi.
1. 突然转向;转弯;偏离方向 2. 背离[(+from)]
vt.1. 使突然转向;使转弯 2. 使背离[(+from)]
n.[C]1. 转向;偏离方向 2. 偏离的程度
word.lx: I will never swerve from my declared policy on this matter./r/n 我决不背离我已经宣布的在这个问题上的政策。/r/n The car swerved to the right./r/n 汽车突然向右转。/r/n

word.name: swiftness
word.lx: We condemned the violence in swiftness./r/n 我们立即谴责了那种暴行。/r/n His reaction of swiftness surprised us./r/n 他迅速的反应让我们吃了一惊。/r/n

word.name: swill
word.lx: The rugby players were swilling mugs of beer at the bar./r/n 橄榄球运动员正在酒吧间痛饮啤酒。/r/n Make sure the garage is well swilled out./r/n 请务必将车库里里外外都冲洗干净。/r/n

word.name: swimmer
word.lx: The swimmer got cramp in his legs and had to be helped out of the water./r/n 游泳者两腿抽筋，不得不由他人救助出水。/r/n The swimmer emerged from the lake./r/n 游泳者从湖中出来./r/n

word.name: swimming
word.lx: I have two pairs of swimming trunks./r/n 我有两条游泳裤。/r/n Swimming is a good form of exercise./r/n 游泳是一种很好的运动。/r/n

word.name: swimming pool
word.lx: There is a swimming pool in the park./r/n 公园里有一个游泳池。/r/n The children ducked each other in the swimming pool./r/n 孩子们在游泳池里互相把对方按入水中。/r/n

word.name: swine
word.lx: With this customer, he felt himself, as it were, casting pearls before swine./r/n 面对这个客商，他感到好像是在对牛弹琴。/r/n A swine over fat is the cause of his own bane./r/n 猪死都因身过肥；象以齿焚。/r/n

word.name: swing
word.mean:
n. 摇摆,改变,冲力
v. 摇摆,使...旋转,动摇
word.lx: He took a swing at the tree with his axe./r/n 他挥斧砍树。/r/n The children were swinging on a rope./r/n 孩子们抓着绳子荡来荡去。/r/n

word.name: swinger
word.mean: 乱搞男女关系的人；赶时髦的人
word.lx: That guy is a real swinger./r/n 这个人可真是个时髦人物。/r/n

word.name: swirl
word.mean:
n. 漩涡,涡状形
v. 使成漩涡,头晕
word.lx: Dancers spun in a swirl of skirts./r/n 跳舞的人旋转著, 裙子也不停地打转./r/n A trademark used for a whirlpool bath or a device that swirls water in a bath./r/n 佳骨肌泡沫浴装置一种用于涡流式沐浴或用于在浴池中产生漩涡的装置的商标/r/n

word.name: swirling
word.lx: Do not swim in where the water is swirling around; there are dangerous currents./r/n 不要在有漩涡的水域游泳，那里有危险的暗流。/r/n Dancers spun in a swirl of skirts./r/n 跳舞的人旋转著, 裙子也不停地打转./r/n

word.name: swish
word.lx: Her skirts gave a swish./r/n 她衣服的下摆发出沙沙声./r/n The horse swished its tail (about)./r/n 那匹马刷刷地挥动尾巴./r/n

word.name: Swiss
word.mean:
a. 瑞士的
n. 瑞士人

word.name: switch
word.mean:
n. 开关,转换,接通或切断…电流,转动
v. 转变,切换,摆动
word.lx: Our glasses have been switched this is mine./r/n 咱们的玻璃杯对调了－－这个是我的。/r/n Long lectures really switch me off./r/n 我觉得冗长的演讲很烦人。/r/n

word.name: Switzerland
word.lx: Switzerland is famous for its watchmaking and beautiful scenery./r/n 瑞士以制表业和美丽的风景而闻名。/r/n Switzerland swept the board in the skiing competition./r/n 瑞士在滑雪比赛中囊括了所有的奖项./r/n

word.name: swivel
word.lx: He swivelled (round) in his chair to face us./r/n 他把坐著的转椅转过来面向著我们./r/n She swivelled the telescope (round)./r/n 她用望远镜向四周看./r/n

word.name: swollen
word.mean:
a. 肿大的,水涨的
vbl. 使变大,肿胀
word.lx: She is suffering from swollen glands./r/n 她正患腺体肿胀病。/r/n Swollen or distended beyond normal size by fluid or gaseous material./r/n 肿胀的液体或气体材料超过正常尺寸的肿胀或膨胀/r/n

word.name: swoon
word.lx: The young girls swooned when they saw their favorite pop singer./r/n 年轻的女孩子们一看见她们最喜欢的流行歌星就神魂颠倒起来。/r/n The beggar fell down in a swoon from sheer hunger./r/n 那个乞丐饿得晕倒了。/r/n

word.name: swoop
word.mean:
n. 俯冲,攫取
v. 抓取,突然袭击
word.lx: Police made a dawn swoop./r/n 警方於拂晓时发动了突袭./r/n The robber swooped up the banknotes./r/n 劫匪把钞票一把抢走了./r/n

word.name: sword
word.lx: He came into the room with a sword in his hand./r/n 他手里拿着剑走进了房间。/r/n That knight ran his sword through his opponent./r/n 那个骑士用刀刺穿他的对手。/r/n

word.name: swore
word.lx: The President swore to uphold the constitution./r/n 总统宣誓维护宪法。/r/n The soldiers swore to fight for the hearth and the altar./r/n 战士们宣誓为保卫家庭和宗教而战。/r/n

word.name: sworn
word.lx: On October, 1st, John was sworn in as Treasury Secretary./r/n 10月1日约翰宣誓就任财政部长。/r/n They have sworn (an oath of) allegiance to the crown./r/n 他们宣誓效忠君主./r/n

word.name: swot
word.mean:
n. 刻苦学习的人
v. 苦读
word.lx: I shall have to swot the skill up before I can teach it./r/n 我得先将这门技能刻苦仔细地学到手，然后才能教授它。/r/n

word.name: swung
word.lx: A company of guardsmen swung past./r/n 一队卫兵整齐地跑过去。/r/n The hinges grated as the gate swung back./r/n 大门自动关上时, 合叶发出吱嘎的响声./r/n

word.name: sybarite
word.mean: (C)(文语)沉于奢侈逸乐者,爱奢侈享乐的人

word.name: Sybil
word.mean: n. 女巫, 女相命家

word.name: sycamore
word.lx: They planted some sycamores in the garden./r/n 他们在花园里种了一些美国梧桐。/r/n

word.name: sycophantic
word.mean: a. 说奉承话的,阿谀的

word.name: syllabary
word.mean: n. 音节表,(日语的)假名表

word.name: syllogism
word.mean: n. 三段论法,推论法,演绎

word.name: sylvan
word.lx: The tourists are sitting on a sylvan glade./r/n 游客们坐在森林中的一块空地上。/r/n

word.name: symbol
word.lx: The Cross is the symbol of Christianity./r/n 十字架是基督教的象征。/r/n The dove is the symbol of peace./r/n 鸽子是和平的象征。/r/n

word.name: symbolic
word.mean:
n. 代号
a. 象征的,符号的

word.name: symbolical
word.lx: The power of the monarchy in britain today is more symbolical than real./r/n 今日英国君主的权力多为象征性的，无甚实际意义。/r/n

word.name: symbolize
word.lx: The poet has symbolized his lover with a flower./r/n 那诗人用花象徵他的爱人./r/n

word.name: symmetric
word.lx: The plan of the ground floor is completely symmetrical./r/n 一楼的平面图是完全对称的。/r/n

word.name: symmetrical
word.lx: The plan of the ground floor is completely symmetrical./r/n 一楼的平面图是完全对称的。/r/n He introduced to us the symmetrical arrangement of the garden./r/n 他为我们介绍了花园中对称的布局。/r/n

word.name: symmetrically
word.lx: Developing symmetrically about a central point./r/n 对称发展的在一个中心点周围对称发展的/r/n The trees, flower-beds and lamp posts are symmetrically placed./r/n 树木、花圃和灯柱的位置都是对称的。/r/n

word.name: sympathize
word.lx: I know you feel angry, and I sympathize./r/n 我知道你感到愤怒，我也有同感。/r/n We have long sympathized with the aims of the Green Party./r/n 我们长期以来一直支持绿党保护生态环境的目标./r/n

word.name: sympathizer
word.mean: n. 同情者,同感者,同意者

word.name: sympathy
word.lx: I felt much sympathy for the blind./r/n 我对盲人深感同情。/r/n The story stirred her sympathy./r/n 这故事激起了她的同情心。/r/n

word.name: symphonic
word.mean: a. 交响乐的,交响性的,交响乐的
word.lx: In symphonic writing he is the master craftsman./r/n 在交响乐曲的创作上，他堪称技艺大师。/r/n

word.name: symphony
word.lx: The symphony orchestra will be coming./r/n 交响乐团要来了。/r/n The symphony was dreadfully mangled./r/n 那首交响乐曲给糟蹋得不成样子。/r/n

word.name: symposium
word.mean: n. 讨论会(论文集,洒会)

word.name: symptomatic
word.mean: a. 具有征候的,征候的,根据征候的
word.lx: Is inflation symptomatic of economic decline?/r/n 通货膨胀是经济衰退的征兆吗？/r/n Chest pains may be symptomatic of heart disease./r/n 胸痛可能是心脏病的症状。/r/n

word.name: synchronize
word.lx: The wheels must synchronize as they revolve./r/n 这些轮子须同速转动./r/n The sound on a film must synchronize with the action./r/n 影片中的声音必须与动作配合一致./r/n

word.name: synchronous
word.lx: The periodic variation in speed of a synchronous motor with respect to the current./r/n （同步电动机的）速度偏差同步电机运行速度的周期性变化/r/n

word.name: synchronously
word.mean: ad. 同时地, 同步地

word.name: synchrotron
word.mean: n. 同步加速器(同步回旋加速器)

word.name: syncopate
word.lx: The song has a syncopated rhythm in the jazz version./r/n 这首歌曲改编为爵士乐後采用了切分音节奏./r/n The song have a syncopate rhythm in the jazz version./r/n 这首歌曲改编为爵士乐後采用了切分音节奏。/r/n

word.name: syndicate
word.mean:
n. 企业联合
v. 联合组织
word.lx: The head of a branch of an organized crime syndicate./r/n 黑社会老大，头目有组织的犯罪辛迪加的一个部门头领/r/n A syndicate of local businessmen is bidding for the contract./r/n 一个当地企业家的联合组织在向这一合同投标。/r/n

word.name: syndrome
word.lx: The combination of factors, symptoms, or signs of a disease or disorder that forms a syndrome./r/n 综合症状形成综合病症的全部因素、病症、或疾病或失调外在表象的综合特征/r/n

word.name: synergy
word.mean: n. 增效作用,协同作用

word.name: synopsis
word.lx: An abbreviated list, as of contents; a synopsis./r/n 简表一个扼要的（如内容的）条目；大纲/r/n

word.name: synoptic
word.mean: a. 摘要的,高瞻远瞩的

word.name: synthetic
word.mean:
a. 合成的,人造的
n. 人工制品

word.name: synthetics
word.lx: A soft woven cloth of wool or a blend of wool and cotton or synthetics./r/n 法兰绒用羊毛、羊毛与棉纱或化纤的混合物织成的一种柔软的布/r/n This shelf was made of synthetic resin./r/n 这个架子是合成树脂做的。/r/n

word.name: Syrian
word.lx: The ancient Syrian and Phoenician goddess of sexual love and fertility./r/n 阿什托雷思古代叙利亚和腓尼基人的性爱与繁殖女神/r/n Greek culture penetrated Persia through the medium of the Syrians./r/n 通过叙利亚人作媒介，希腊文化渗透到波斯。/r/n

word.name: syrup
word.lx: Take one dose of this cough syrup three times a day./r/n 每天服三次这种止咳糖浆，每次服一剂量。/r/n She dosed up the children with cough syrup./r/n 她把止咳糖浆给孩子们吃了。/r/n

word.name: system
word.mean: n. 系统,体系,制度,体制
word.lx: What are the difference between the American and British systems of government?/r/n 英美两国的政府体制有什么不同？/r/n She just blames it all on the system./r/n 她把这全归咎于制度。/r/n

word.name: systematically
word.mean: ad. 有系统地,有组织地,有条理地

word.name: systematize
word.lx: We must try to systematize the way we do the accounts./r/n 我们必须力求把记帐方法制度化./r/n

word.name: systemic
word.lx: The main trunk of the systemic arteries, carrying blood from the left side of the heart to the arteries of all limbs and organs except the lungs./r/n 主动脉系统血管的主干道，将血液由心脏左侧输送到除肺部以外的所有肢体及器官的动脉里/r/n

word.name: tabernacle
word.lx: He was forbidden to walk into the tabernacle./r/n 他被禁止走进礼拜堂。/r/n

word.name: table
word.mean:
n. 桌子, 餐桌, 工作台, 平地层, 石板, 表格
adj.
桌子的, 台子的
vt.
搁置, 嵌合, 制表
word.lx: The table legs are screwed to the floor./r/n 这张桌子的腿是用螺丝固定在地板上的。/r/n He drummed on the table with his fingers./r/n 他用手指咚咚地敲打着桌子。/r/n

word.name: tableau
word.mean: n. 画面,活人画(舞台上活人扮的静态画面)

word.name: tablecloth
word.lx: She smoothed out wrinkles out of the tablecloth./r/n 她把桌布上的皱褶弄平。/r/n The tablecloth was edged with lace./r/n 台布四周镶有花边。/r/n

word.name: tablespoon
word.lx: Add one level (ie not heaped) tablespoon of sugar./r/n 加一平餐匙糖./r/n

word.name: tablet
word.lx: The doctor told him to take two tablets of aspirin before every meal./r/n 医生告诉他每天饭前吃两片阿斯匹林。/r/n Fill a glass with water and dissolve this tablet in it./r/n 倒杯水把药片放进去溶解了./r/n

word.name: tabloid
word.mean:
n. 小型报,小型画报,药片
a. 扼要的
word.lx: I never read the tabloids./r/n 我从来不看小报。/r/n The tabloid papers are full of smut./r/n 这些小报充斥著下流的东西./r/n

word.name: tabular
word.lx: An annual publication including calendars with weather forecasts, astronomical information, tide tables, and other related tabular information./r/n 年历；历书一种年度出版物，包括含天气预报、天文信息、潮汐图表和其它相关表格信息的日历/r/n

word.name: tabulate
word.mean:
v. 作成表,作成一览表,使成平面
a. 平板状的,平面的
word.lx: Please tabulate the numbers in order./r/n 请把那些数字按顺序制成表。/r/n

word.name: tacitly
word.mean: ad. 肃静地, 沉默地

word.name: tack
word.mean:
n. 大头钉,行动方针
v. 以大头针钉住,附加,跟随
word.lx: My mother tacked the sleeves on before sewing them./r/n 我妈妈在把袖子缝好之前，先用大针脚把它缝好。/r/n The speaker suddenly changed tack and left us all rather confused./r/n 演讲人突然改变了论调，把我们都搞糊涂了。/r/n

word.name: tacky
word.mean: a. 发粘的,胶粘的,寒酸的
word.lx: Apply solution to the tube and allow to become tacky./r/n 在内胎上涂抹胶水并让它发粘。/r/n

word.name: tact
word.lx: Tact consists in knowing how far we may go too far./r/n 机智在于知道自己可以过分到什么程度。/r/n Her patience and tact were legendary./r/n 她的耐心和机智是出名的。/r/n

word.name: tactful
word.lx: She gets them to accept these changes by tactful management./r/n 她用机智的手段使他们接受了这些改变。/r/n Not tactful or diplomatic./r/n 不老练的；不机敏的/r/n

word.name: tactfully
word.lx: You dealt with an awkward situation very tactfully./r/n 你很巧妙地处理了一个困难的局面./r/n She put it very tactfully./r/n 她说得很有技巧./r/n

word.name: tactic
word.lx: A fair tactic./r/n 合宜的策略/r/n An instance of the use of this delaying tactic./r/n 阻挠议事的情形应用这种拖延策略的实例/r/n

word.name: tactical
word.mean: a. 战术上的,战术性的,足智多谋的

word.name: tactics
word.lx: These tactics are unlikely to be helpful to you./r/n 这种方法对你未必有用。/r/n The Russian team entered a protest against the tactics of American side./r/n 俄罗斯队提出正式抗议，反对美国队的战术。/r/n

word.name: tactile
word.mean: a. 触觉的,有触觉的,能触知的

word.name: tactless
word.mean: a. 无机智的,不机敏的,不得体的
word.lx: Lacking in consideration for the feelings of others; tactless./r/n 不体贴的不考虑他人感情的；不得体的/r/n It was out of order for him to make such a tactless remark./r/n 他说出这种不策略的话是得不得体的。/r/n

word.name: tadpole
word.lx: Tadpoles are the infancy form of frogs./r/n 蝌蚪是青蛙的幼年形态。/r/n A tadpole has a tail./r/n 蝌蚪有尾巴。/r/n

word.name: Tahiti
word.mean: n. 塔希提岛(南太平洋)

word.name: tailed
word.mean: [通常构成复合词]有...(状)尾的, 如：bob-tailed 截尾的, long-tailed 长尾的

word.name: tailor
word.mean:
n. 裁缝师,成衣匠
v. 缝制,做裁缝,使...适应
word.lx: He wears a beautifully tailored suit./r/n 他穿了一套定做的漂亮西装。/r/n We can tailor the insurance policy according to your special needs./r/n 我们可以根据你的特殊需要设计保险单。/r/n

word.name: tailor-made
word.lx: He seems tailor-made for the job./r/n 他好像很适合这项工作。/r/n

word.name: Taipei
word.lx: It rains a lot in Taipei./r/n 在台北下很多的雨。/r/n The climate here is like that of Taipei./r/n 这儿的气候和台北非常相似。/r/n

word.name: Taiwan
word.lx: He is said to have been the richest man in Taiwan./r/n 据说他以前是台湾最有钱的人。/r/n Taiwan is southeast of China./r/n 台湾在中国的东南。/r/n

word.name: take
word.mean:
v. (took,taken) 拿,取
v. 修(课程),花费,记录,认为,搭乘
word.lx: I passed him the rope and he took it./r/n 我递给他绳子，他接住了。/r/n The machine takes its name from its inventor./r/n 这机器的名字来自其发明者。/r/n

word.name: takeaway
word.mean:
卖出外吃的
外卖饭菜的

word.name: taken
word.lx: After being taken back 200 years, we were suddenly returned to the present day./r/n 我们刚才还处在200年前的历史场景之中, 一下子又回到了现在./r/n The criminal was taken into custody./r/n 这个罪犯已被监禁。/r/n

word.name: takeout
word.mean: a. 供顾客带出外吃的,外卖的食物

word.name: taking
word.mean:
n. 取得,捕获,售得金额
a. 迷人的,可爱的,会传染的
vbl. 拿,捕捉,夺取
word.lx: He criticized my taking risks./r/n 他批评了我的冒险活动。/r/n The act or practice of offering, giving, or taking a bribe./r/n 行贿，受贿提供、给予或取得贿赂的行为或实践/r/n

word.name: talent
word.lx: His talent was largely self-developed./r/n 他的才能主要是自己培养的。/r/n What they need most is managerial talent./r/n 他们最需要的是管理人才。/r/n

word.name: talk
word.mean:
n. 谈话,会谈,讲话
v. 说话,谈话,讨论
word.lx: I had a long talk with her./r/n 我和她长谈了一次。/r/n The talks between the two premiers will be held next month./r/n 两国总理的会谈将于下月举行。/r/n

word.name: talk show
word.mean:
n. 谈话节目
现场访谈

word.name: talkative
word.mean: a. 喜欢说话的,饶舌的,多嘴的
word.lx: Giddy and talkative; foolish./r/n 饶舌的轻率和多言的；愚蠢的/r/n An over talkative person; a chatterbox./r/n 过分多嘴的人；喋喋不休的人/r/n

word.name: tall
word.lx: He is a tall boy./r/n 他是一个高大的男孩。/r/n The boy is 150 centimetres tall./r/n 这个男孩有150厘米高。/r/n

word.name: tallow
word.lx: Tallow can be used for making soap./r/n 动物脂可以用来做香皂。/r/n

word.name: tally
word.mean:
n. 标签(手执计数器,对应物)
vt 计算(记录)
word.lx: His account of the accident tallies with yours./r/n 他对该故事的说法和你一样。/r/n The two lists do not tally./r/n 这两张单子不相符。/r/n

word.name: talon
word.mean: n. 爪,猛抓的手,鸽胸雕花

word.name: tame
word.mean:
a. 驯服的,柔顺的,乏味的
v. 驯养,使...驯服
word.lx: She is too tame./r/n 她太柔顺了。/r/n Many kinds of squirrels are easy to tame./r/n 很多种类的松鼠都很容易驯养。/r/n

word.name: tamer
word.lx: He cowed them with his hard eyes like a tamer among beasts./r/n 他以严厉的眼光吓他们，活象兽群中间的驯兽师。/r/n

word.name: tamp
word.mean:
v. 捣实,砸实
vt. 夯实
word.lx: He tamped down the tobacco in his pipe./r/n 他把烟丝紧紧摁实在烟斗里。/r/n

word.name: tamper
word.lx: Someone has been tampering with the lock./r/n 有人乱动过这把锁./r/n The records of the meeting had been tampered with./r/n 会议记录已被人擅自改动./r/n

word.name: tampering
word.lx: Someone has been tampering with the lock./r/n 有人乱动过这把锁./r/n The records of the meeting had been tampered with./r/n 会议记录已被人擅自改动./r/n

word.name: tan
word.mean:
n. 鞣制革,黄褐色
a. 黄褐色的
v. 晒黑
word.lx: It took me all summer to get this tan./r/n 我花了整个夏天才晒出这样的棕褐色。/r/n Jane tanned quickly in the sun./r/n 简在太阳下很快就晒黑了。/r/n

word.name: tandem
word.lx: The Dow Jones industrials, ahead10 points early in tandem with further improvement in bond prices, ended off13.59 at1, 944.63./r/n 道·琼斯工业股早先随着公债价格提升而上涨10点，最后以1944。63收盘，下降13。59。/r/n

word.name: tangent
word.mean:
a. 接触的,切线的,相切的
n. 切线,正切

word.name: tangential
word.mean: a. 切线的,相切的,正接的

word.name: tangerine
word.lx: Hand me of a the ripest tangerine please./r/n 请递给我一个最熟的橘子。/r/n

word.name: tangibility
word.mean: n. 确实性,确切性,真实性
word.lx: The lovely baby in her dream somehow have no tangibility./r/n 她梦中的那个可爱的婴儿不知为什麽不可触知。/r/n

word.name: tangible
word.mean:
n. 有形资产
a. 实体的,明白的
word.lx: The prize is a tangible testimony that she has gotten a germ of write ability./r/n 这个奖是一个具体的证明，说明她具有创作才能。/r/n

word.name: tangle
word.mean:
n. 缠结,混乱,海澡类
v. 使缠结,纠纷
word.lx: The wind tangled her hair./r/n 风吹乱了她的头发。/r/n The wool got in a fearful tangle./r/n 毛线乱成了一团。/r/n

word.name: tango
word.mean:
n. 探戈舞,其舞曲
v. 跳探戈舞

word.name: tank
word.mean:
n. 水槽,池塘,战车
v. 储于槽中
word.lx: Is there any water left in the water tank?/r/n 水箱里还有水剩下吗？/r/n The tank (got) bogged down in the mud./r/n 坦克陷入泥沼之中./r/n

word.name: tanker
word.lx: The tanker sank and the oil polluted the sea./r/n 油轮沉没了，石油污染了海面。/r/n The liner is reported to have been in collision with an oil tanker./r/n 据报道，这艘客轮与一艘油轮相撞。/r/n

word.name: tanner
word.lx: The tanner is said to be reluctant to quote firm price because of a rising and uncertain raw material market./r/n 据说由于原材料市场上升且捉摸不定，制革商们不愿报出实盘。/r/n

word.name: tantalizing
word.lx: The sight is most tantalizing./r/n 这光景真使人干急。/r/n

word.name: tantrum
word.lx: She regularly throws tantrums./r/n 她经常大发脾气./r/n

word.name: tap
word.mean:
n. 轻打,水龙头
v. 轻打,轻敲,装上嘴子
word.lx: My phone is being tapped./r/n 有人在窃听我的电话。/r/n That girl tapped her fingers on the desk impatiently./r/n 那个女孩不耐烦地用手指轻扣桌面。/r/n

word.name: tape recorder
word.mean:
磁带录音机
n. 录音机
word.lx: We needed someone to fix the tape recorder./r/n 我们需要有人来修理录音机。/r/n He showed me how to use the tape recorder./r/n 他教我如何使用这台卡式录音机。/r/n

word.name: taper
word.mean:
n. 小蜡烛,尖细,渐弱
a. 尖细的
v. 逐渐变小
word.lx: Financial aids generally taper off after the first year of college./r/n 助学金通常在大学一年级之后逐渐减少。/r/n Taper the plug off a bit with the chisel so that it will fit into the hole./r/n 用凿子把塞子的一头削掉一点，使它能塞进洞里。/r/n

word.name: tarantula
word.mean: n. 一种大而有毒的蜘蛛

word.name: tardiness
word.lx: He arrived late and excused his tardiness in a flimsy manner./r/n 他来晚了，而且还以薄弱的借口来辩解他的迟到/r/n

word.name: tardy
word.lx: He was tardy for the meeting./r/n 那次开会他迟到了。/r/n His boss was dissatisfied with his tardy progress./r/n 老板对他缓慢的进度不满意。/r/n

word.name: tare
word.mean:
n. 野碗豆,毒麦,害毒

word.name: target
word.mean:
n. 靶,目标
vt. 把...作为目标
塔吉特(财富500强公司之一，总部所在地美国,主要经营零售)
word.lx: The company has met their export target./r/n 该公司已经实现了它们的出口目标。/r/n The embassy is an obvious target for terrorist attacks./r/n 大使馆是恐怖分子攻击的明显目标。/r/n

word.name: tariff
word.lx: The tariff at the hotel ranges from 20 dollars to 50 dollars a day for a single room./r/n 旅馆的单人房间的价钱每天从20美元到50美元不等。/r/n There is a very high tariff on jewelry./r/n 宝石的税率很高。/r/n

word.name: taro
word.lx: Taro finally came to the conclusion that he should be aggressive in order to survive in the American society./r/n 塔罗终于得出结论，他要在美国社会生存下去就必须有股冲劲。/r/n

word.name: tarpaulin
word.mean: n. 涂焦油防水布,防水衣,防水帽

word.mean:
v. 耽搁,延迟
vi. 踌躇,耽搁,等候
word.lx: He tarried for a few days in my house./r/n 他在我家里小住了几天。/r/n Tarry awhile at this charming country inn./r/n 在这个可爱的乡村小酒馆里呆一会儿吧./r/n

word.name: tart
word.mean:
a. 酸的,锋利的
n. 水果蛋糕,果馅饼
word.lx: Her tart reply offended me./r/n 她的刻薄的回答激怒了我。/r/n He ate some tart in the morning before going out./r/n 早上出门前，他吃了一些果酱点心。/r/n

word.name: Tasmania
word.lx: Tasmania was named after its discoverer, A. J. Tasman./r/n 塔斯曼尼亚岛是以其发现者塔斯曼的名字命名的./r/n

word.name: tassel
word.mean:
n. 流苏
v. 加缨,摘下...穗须
word.lx: There are blue tassels on my curtains./r/n 我的窗帘上有蓝色的流苏。/r/n

word.name: tasteful
word.lx: Characterized by or exhibiting refined, tasteful beauty of manner, form, or style./r/n 优美的，文雅的，雅致的以举止，形状或文体的高雅优美为特征的或显示高雅优美的/r/n

word.name: tasty
word.lx: These pancakes made by my mother are really tasty./r/n 我妈妈做的这些煎饼非常好吃。/r/n Mix the ingredient, chill, and voila a light, tasty dessert./r/n 把材料拌在一起，冰凉，瞧！那就是一道清淡可口的甜点。/r/n

word.name: tatami
word.mean: n. <日>榻榻米(日本人铺在室内地板上的稻草垫)

word.name: tattered
word.mean: a. 破烂的,穿破烂衣的

word.name: tattoo
word.mean: n. & vt. （在皮肤上）刺图案，纹身
word.lx: Distinctive tribal tattoos./r/n 一部落与他部落相区别的纹身/r/n He have tattoo the namemarlene" on his upper arm./r/n 他将＂玛琳＂这个名字刺在臂的上方。/r/n"

word.name: taught
word.mean:
v. 教,教授
vbl. 教,教授
word.lx: I taught her to ride a bicycle./r/n 我教她骑自行车。/r/n They taught the little boy not to talk to strangers./r/n 他们教育小男孩不要和陌生人说话。/r/n

word.name: taut
word.mean: a. 拉紧的,整洁的,紧张的

word.name: tautology
word.mean:
n. 无谓的重复
n.恒真

word.name: tavern
word.lx: The knights met in the tavern to discuss their plan./r/n 骑士们在小酒店里会合，讨论他们的计划。/r/n After singing all night in the tavern, I had a frog in the throat next morning./r/n 在酒馆里唱了一整夜歌，第二天早晨我的嗓子有点嘶哑了。/r/n

word.name: tawdry
word.mean:
a. 廉价而俗丽的,非常华丽的
n. 廉价而俗丽之物
word.lx: A woman regarded as gaudy or tawdry./r/n 娼妓被认为是媚俗或低俗的女人/r/n

word.name: tawny
word.mean:
a. 黄褐色的,茶色的
n. 黄褐色
word.lx: A lion has tawny mane./r/n 狮子长着黄褐色棕毛。/r/n

word.name: tax
word.mean:
n. 税,租税,重负
v. 课以税,使...负重荷,斥责
word.lx: Tobacco and alcoholic drinks are taxed heavily in their country./r/n 烟酒在他们的国家都被课以重税。/r/n He was taxed with neglecting the safety regulations./r/n 他由于忽视安全操作规程而受到责备。/r/n

word.name: taxation
word.lx: We must increase taxation if we are to spend more on education./r/n 我们如果要增加教育经费就必须加税。/r/n A new system of taxation will be brought into effect next year./r/n 新的税收制度将于明年实行。/r/n

word.name: taxicab
word.lx: A minicar used as a taxicab, especially in England./r/n 微型出租汽车一种用作出租汽车的微型车，尤指在英国/r/n The taxicab swung out into traffic./r/n 那部计程车转向驶入车流之中。/r/n

word.name: taxing
word.lx: The tax threshold for a single pensioner is 450 dollars./r/n 单身养老金领取者的征税起点是450美元。/r/n The tax authorities averaged his profit out at 3000 a year over 5 years./r/n 税务局算出他5年的平均利润为每年3000英镑./r/n

word.name: Taylor
word.lx: I am not entirely a back number, Taylor./r/n 泰勒，我还不是一个毫无力量的人。/r/n Taylor, the capitalist, used to play down to most of his employees./r/n 资本家泰勒对他的大部分雇员经常故意装得态度谦逊，企图赢得他们的好感。/r/n

word.name: tea party
word.lx: Since you have no time, you need not attend the tea party./r/n 既然你没有工夫，你就不必参加茶会了。/r/n

word.name: teacher
word.lx: My mother is a teacher./r/n 我母亲是一位教师。/r/n The maths teacher was furious and gave me 50 lines./r/n 数学老师气坏了, 罚我抄书50行./r/n

word.name: teaching
word.mean:
n. 教学,教义
vbl. 教
word.lx: The mission of a university is teaching and research./r/n 大学的任务是教学和科研。/r/n Teaching is a demanding profession./r/n 教学工作是个要求很高的工作。/r/n

word.name: teachings
word.lx: Apostles were sent out by Christ to spread his teachings./r/n 基督派基督十二使徒之一宣传他的教义。/r/n Those who dissented from Anglican teachings could be heavily fined./r/n 反对英国国教教义的人在过去可判巨额罚款./r/n

word.name: teacup
word.lx: She has seen empty glass and teacup, and has known that has been three men inside the room./r/n 她看到了空玻璃杯和茶杯，知道房间里来过三个人。/r/n Mary: Can you make the teacup, John?/r/n 玛丽：你会做茶杯吗，约翰？/r/n

word.name: teahouse
word.lx: A man in the teahouse was laying the law down on politics./r/n 茶馆里有个人在非常自负地侃政治。/r/n The Teahouse" is playing at the Capital Theater./r/n 《茶馆》正在首都剧场上演。/r/n"

word.name: team
word.mean:
n. 队,组
v. 协同工作
word.lx: Volleyball is a team game./r/n 排球是一项要求全队默契配合的运动。/r/n I teamed up with him to do the work./r/n 我和他合作做这项工作。/r/n

word.name: teamwork
word.lx: In football teamwork is even more important than individual skill./r/n 在橄榄球比赛中，全队的配合比个人技术甚至更加重要。/r/n

word.name: tear
word.mean:
n. 眼泪,撕破
v. 流泪,撕破
word.lx: She tore her skirt on the nail./r/n 钉子勾破了她的裙子。/r/n My wife burst into tears when she heard the bad news./r/n 我太太听到这个坏消息就哭了起来。/r/n

word.name: tears
word.mean:
眼泪
泪液
泪水
word.lx: Tears distilled slowly from her eyes./r/n 泪水从她的眼睛里慢慢地滴下来。/r/n She wiped her tears away./r/n 她擦掉了眼泪。/r/n

word.name: teaspoon
word.lx: She mixed the sugar into the coffee with a teaspoon./r/n 她用茶匙把糖在咖啡里搅拌开。/r/n Add a teaspoon of salt./r/n 加一小匙盐。/r/n

word.name: teat
word.lx: A baby drinks milk from teats./r/n 婴儿用奶嘴喝牛奶。/r/n

word.name: technical
word.lx: The flight was delayed owing to technical reasons./r/n 这次飞行由于技术的原因而被推迟。/r/n This book is too technical for me./r/n 对我来说，这本书太专业了。/r/n

word.mean: n. 技术细节,技术性,术语,专门事项
word.lx: The book is full of scientific technicalities./r/n 这本书里尽是科学术语./r/n The lawyer explained the legal technicalities to his client./r/n 律师给委托人解释法律上的要点./r/n

word.name: technically
word.mean: ad. 技术上,学术上,专门地

word.name: technician
word.lx: They need one laboratory technician./r/n 他们需要一名实验室技术员。/r/n That technician is highly skilled./r/n 那位技师技术很好。/r/n

word.name: technique
word.lx: He displayed a flawless technique in the competition./r/n 他在竞赛中显示出了精湛的技艺。/r/n The technique is still at the experimental stage./r/n 这项技术正处于实验阶段。/r/n

word.name: technocracy
word.lx: Is Britain becoming a technocracy?/r/n 英国是否要成为实行专家政治的国家?/r/n

word.name: technocrat
word.mean: n. 技术人员,技术统治

word.name: tectonic
word.mean: a. 筑造的,建筑的,构造的

word.name: tectonics
word.mean: n. 筑造学,构造学,构造地质学

word.name: teddy
word.mean: n. 妇女连衫裤, 泰迪(熊)

word.name: tedious
word.mean: a. 沉闷的, 单调乏味的
word.lx: He told me a tedious story./r/n 他给我讲了一个冗长乏味的故事。/r/n He is an exceedingly tedious fellow./r/n 他是一个非常令人生厌的家伙。/r/n

word.name: tee shirt
word.mean: n. 短袖圆领运动衫, T恤

word.name: teem
word.lx: The rain teemed down for hours./r/n 大雨一直下了好几个小时。/r/n The river teems with all kinds of fish in summer./r/n 夏天这条河里各种各样的鱼多得很。/r/n

word.name: teeming
word.lx: The river was teeming with fish./r/n 河里的鱼很多./r/n His mind was still teeming with various projects./r/n 他的脑子里依然塞满了各式各样的计划。/r/n

word.name: teenage
word.mean: a. 青少年的(十三到十九岁的)
word.lx: Teenage is the period at which the body reaches maturity./r/n 青少年是身体成熟期。/r/n This clothing sells well to the teenage market./r/n 这种衣服在青少年中间很畅销./r/n

word.name: teenager
word.lx: It is not easy to educate teenagers./r/n 教育青少年不是件容易的事。/r/n That teenager singer is really dynamite!/r/n 那个少年歌手真是轰动一时！/r/n

word.name: teens
word.mean: n. 青少年(十多岁,少年)

word.name: teeny
word.lx: The store owner smiled and whistled and out of the kennel came Lady, who ran down the aisle of his store followed by five teeny tiny balls of fur./r/n 店主笑了，吹了一声口哨，从窝里出来一只母狗，它沿着小店的过道跑过来，后面跟着5个小毛球。/r/n

word.name: teeter
word.mean: a. 摇摆,摇摇欲坠,踌躇,犹豫不决
word.lx: She was teetering along/about/around in very high-heeled shoes./r/n 她穿著高跟鞋摇摇晃晃地走著[四处走]./r/n The drunken man teeteredon the edge of the pavement./r/n 那醉汉在人行道边上东倒西歪的./r/n

word.name: teeth
word.lx: The dog bared its teeth./r/n 狗露出了牙齿。/r/n I pick up a leaflet about the care of teeth./r/n 我拿起一张宣传保护牙齿的传单。/r/n

word.name: telecommunications
word.lx: Distance is no problem with modern telecommunications./r/n 在电信发达的今天, 相距遥远已不再是什麽问题了./r/n

word.name: telecommute
word.mean: vi. (在家里通过使用与工作单位连接的计算机终端)远距离工作

word.name: teleconference
word.mean: n. (通过电话、电视等的)电讯会议

word.name: telegram
word.mean:
n. 电报
vt 用电报发送(打电报)
word.lx: I sent a telegram to my mother saying that I had arrived safely./r/n 我给母亲发电报说我已安全抵达。/r/n The telegram was sent reply prepaid./r/n 电报已发出并已预付复电费用。/r/n

word.name: telegraph
word.mean:
n. 电报,电报机
v. 打电报,显示
word.lx: She went to the telegraph office in a hurry./r/n 她匆匆忙忙向电报局去了。/r/n Telegraph her to come at once./r/n 打电报通知她马上来。/r/n

word.name: telemarketing
word.mean: n. 电话销售,电话推销

word.name: telepathy
word.mean: n. 心灵感应,精神感应

word.name: telephone
word.lx: I have to make a telephone call./r/n 我必须打个电话。/r/n I telephoned to thank her./r/n 我打电话向她道谢。/r/n

word.name: telephone book
word.lx: He looks up the number of the company in the telephone book./r/n 他从电话簿中查到该公司的电话号码。/r/n

word.name: telephone booth
word.lx: There is a telephone booth near the cinema./r/n 电影院附近有一个电话亭。/r/n It happened that there was a telephone booth nearby./r/n 碰巧在附近有个公用电话亭。/r/n

word.name: telephotography
word.mean: n. 远距离照相术,传真电报术

word.name: telescope
word.mean:
n. 望远镜
v. 缩短,压缩
word.lx: I saw them through telescopes from the top of the building./r/n 我从大楼的顶端用望远镜看到了他们。/r/n The first two carriages of the train telescoped in the crash./r/n 火车撞车时前两节车厢叠嵌在一起了。/r/n

word.name: teletype
word.mean: 电传打字机,电报交换机

word.name: television
word.lx: His first film was shown on television this weekend./r/n 他的第一部电影本周末在电视上播放。/r/n The television audience aggregated 30 millions./r/n 电视观众合计达3000万人./r/n

word.name: telex
word.mean:
n. 电传
v. 发电传
word.lx: We have authenticated it by telex./r/n 我们已经用电传证实了它。/r/n Several telexes arrived this morning./r/n 今天上午收到了几份电传。/r/n

word.name: teller
word.mean: n. 讲话著,告诉的人,出纳员
word.lx: She worked as a teller in our bank./r/n 她在我们的银行里当出纳员。/r/n As soon as I complete my training, I am going to be a bank teller./r/n 一旦我结束训练，我会成为一名银行出纳。/r/n

word.name: telltale
word.lx: I can see from the telltale look in her eyes that she love him./r/n 我从她那无法掩饰的眼神里可以看出她爱他。/r/n

word.name: temper
word.mean:
n. 脾气,调剂,趋向
v. 锻练,调剂,缓和
word.lx: They are of congenial temper./r/n 他们的性情相投。/r/n She coaxed him out of his bad temper./r/n 她循循善诱地劝他改掉坏脾气。/r/n

word.name: tempera
word.mean: n. 涂料混上蛋白或其他物质的画法

word.name: temperance
word.mean: a. 温暖的,温和的,有节制的
word.lx: The patient had to practice temperance in eating and drinking./r/n 这个病人不得不节制饮食。/r/n I would like some temperance drinks./r/n 我想要一些没有酒精的饮料。/r/n

word.name: temperate
word.mean: a. 温和的,适度的,有节制的
word.lx: Be more temperate in your language, please./r/n 言词上请节制一点儿。/r/n Britain has a temperate climate./r/n 英国气候温和。/r/n

word.name: temperature
word.lx: The food should be kept at low temperature./r/n 这种食品应低温保存。/r/n There is an imperceptible change in temperature./r/n 温度有细微的变化。/r/n

word.name: tempest
word.lx: It was a marvelous night with a tempest to rouse the gods./r/n 真是个美妙的夜晚，暴风雨惊天动地。/r/n The scandal caused tempests in the newspaper./r/n 那件丑闻在报纸上引起阵阵风波。/r/n

word.name: tempestuous
word.mean: a. 有暴风雨的,暴乱的
word.lx: Their ship was sailing dangerously in the tempestuous sea./r/n 他们的船在浪急风高的海上危险地航行着。/r/n

word.name: template
word.lx: Save the active document or template with its current name./r/n 以其目前的名字保存当前的文件或模板。/r/n

word.name: temple
word.mean:
n. 庙宇,寺院
n.太阳穴
word.lx: Have you been to the Temple of Heaven in Beijing?/r/n 你去过北京的天坛吗？/r/n The man looks like a cartoon character with a plaster on his temple./r/n 那人太阳穴上贴了一块膏药，看上去像个卡通人物。/r/n

word.name: tempo
word.lx: Your tempo is too slow./r/n 你演奏的速度太慢了./r/n All this was comparatively slow until, with the coming of science, the tempo was suddenly raised./r/n 所有这些发展都比较缓慢，直到出现了科学，其速度才突然加快。/r/n

word.name: temporal
word.mean: a. 当时的,暂时的,现世的
word.lx: The Pope has no temporal power in modern society./r/n 教皇在当代社会没有世俗方面的权利。/r/n The word is a temporal conjunction./r/n 该词是表示时间的连词。/r/n

word.name: temporarily
word.mean:
a. 临时的
ad. 暂时地,临时地
word.lx: The daily flight to the city has been temporarily suspended because of the earthquake./r/n 因为地震，每天飞往这个城市的航班暂停了。/r/n The condition of being temporarily set aside; suspension./r/n 中止，搁置，保留暂时地搁置一边的状态；延缓/r/n

word.name: temporary
word.mean:
a. 暂时的,临时的
n. 临时工
word.lx: The boss hired some temporary workers./r/n 老板雇佣了一些临时工。/r/n A temporary stop; a pause./r/n 停顿暂时的停顿；暂停/r/n

word.name: temporize
word.mean: vt. 投机(因循,拖延,应付,妥协,迎合潮流)
word.lx: He is always temporize and be dislike by his classmate./r/n 他总是见风使舵，因而不受同学喜欢。/r/n

word.name: tempt
word.lx: He was tempted into making a false step./r/n 他被引诱做了一件傻事。/r/n They tried to tempt her (into staying) with offers of promotion./r/n 他们提出给她晋级来劝说她（留下）./r/n

word.name: temptation
word.mean:
n. 诱惑,引诱
v. 引,诱
word.lx: He was surrounded by temptations./r/n 他受到各种诱惑的包围。/r/n I should congratulate you that you resisted the temptation./r/n 我应向你祝贺，你抗住了这种引诱。/r/n

word.name: tempting
word.mean:
a. 诱惑人的
vbl. 诱惑
word.lx: Eve tempted Adam and he fell./r/n 夏娃诱惑亚当, 结果他犯了罪./r/n The Devil tempted Adam and Eve./r/n 魔鬼诱惑了亚当和夏娃./r/n

word.name: ten
word.lx: I got up at ten last Sunday./r/n 上星期天我十点钟起床。/r/n Ten to one it will rain tomorrow./r/n 明天十有八九会下雨。/r/n

word.name: tenable
word.mean: a. 站得住脚的,无懈可击的
word.lx: The lectureship is tenable for a period of three years./r/n 讲师这一职位任期三年./r/n How long is the post tenable for?/r/n 这个职位任期多长？/r/n

word.name: tenacious
word.mean: a. 紧粘不放的,固执的,不屈不挠的
word.lx: The eagle seized its prey in a tenacious grip./r/n 鹰将捕获物紧紧抓住./r/n He hold on to my arm with a tenacious grip./r/n 他紧紧抓住我的手臂不放。/r/n

word.name: tenaciously
word.mean: ad. 坚韧不拔地,执着地

word.name: tenacity
word.mean: n. 固执,不屈不挠,顽固

word.name: tenant
word.lx: The tenant was evicted for non-payment of rent./r/n 这个房客因为没有交房租而被赶出去了。/r/n Are you an owner-occupier or a tenant?/r/n 你住自己的房子还是租房住？/r/n

word.name: tend
word.mean: v. 有某种的倾向,易于,移向
word.lx: Weeds tend to displace other plants./r/n 杂草越来越多，有取代其他植物之势。/r/n Does he tend to lose?/r/n 他常常输吗?/r/n

word.name: tendentious
word.mean: a. 有支持某种立场的倾向,宣传性的
word.lx: Such tendentious statements are likely to provoke strong opposition./r/n 这种有倾向性 的说法可能招致强烈的反对./r/n

word.name: tenderness
word.lx: Her tenderness soothed my anger./r/n 她的亲切平息了我的怒气。/r/n I dare not touch the flower for its tenderness./r/n 这花太娇嫩了，我不敢碰它。/r/n

word.name: tenement
word.lx: He lives in a tenement block./r/n 他住在一家廉价公寓楼里。/r/n

word.name: tenet
word.mean: n. 教义, 信条; 原则, 宗旨.
word.lx: One who believes in and follows the tenets of naturalism./r/n 自然主义者信仰和追随自然主义信条的人/r/n

word.name: Tennessee
word.lx: Finn claims they still miss the hills and streams of Tennessee. But Las Vegas is where the action is and his wife accepted his way of life./r/n 芬恩声称他们仍然怀念田纳西州的山山水水，拉斯维加斯却是热闹的娱乐中心。他的妻子也这样认为。/r/n

word.name: tennis
word.lx: Do you play tennis?/r/n 你打网球吗？/r/n They were adversaries in the tennis match./r/n 在网球赛中，他们是对手。/r/n

word.name: tenor
word.mean:
n. 行程,路程,要旨
a. 男高音的
n.[语]本体
word.lx: I understood the tenor of their conversation but not the details./r/n 我听懂了他们谈话的大意，但没有听懂其中的细节。/r/n The tenor soloist is unable to appear tonight because of illness./r/n 男高音独唱者因病今晚不能演出./r/n

word.name: tension
word.lx: Tension mounted as we waited for the exam results to be published./r/n 我们在等待公布考试结果时气氛越来越紧张。/r/n This wire will take 50 pounds tension before breaking./r/n 这根金属线在断裂之前能承受五十磅的张力。/r/n

word.name: tent
word.mean:
n. 帐篷
v. (住)帐篷,宿营
word.lx: There are rows of tents at the foot of the mountain./r/n 山脚下有几排帐篷。/r/n The tent flaps should be tightly fastened./r/n 帐篷的帘布应紧紧系住./r/n

word.name: tentative
word.mean:
n. 试验,假设
a. 试验性质的,暂时的,犹豫不决的
word.lx: Could is used to make more tentative suggestions./r/n 可用以提出较试探性的建议。/r/n

word.name: tentatively
word.lx: Tentatively it can be suggested that this is the main influence upon those who urge the abolition of capital punishment./r/n 可以这样探讨性地提出，那些竭力主张废除死刑的人们主要是受怜悯的影响。/r/n

word.name: tenuous
word.mean:
a. 稀薄的,微细的
贫乏的;平淡的;脆弱的,无力的
word.lx: Sheer, light, delicate, or tenuous./r/n 轻而薄的；薄弱的；虚无漂缈的/r/n

word.name: tenure
word.lx: The rank, appointment, authority, or tenure of a general./r/n 将军的任职或任期一个将军的官衔、委任权力或保存权/r/n The tenure by which such an estate is held./r/n 不动产的终身保有权保有这种不动产的权利/r/n

word.name: tepee
word.mean: n. 美国印地安人的圆锥形帐篷

word.name: terminal
word.mean:
n. 终端机,终点,末端
a. 终点的,按期的,致死的
word.lx: Please wait for me at the bus terminal./r/n 请在公共汽车终点站等我。/r/n That terminal is live./r/n 那个接头有电./r/n

word.name: terminate
word.mean:
a. 有结尾的,有限的
v. 结束,终止,满期
word.lx: The next train terminates here./r/n 这是下一班火车的终点站。/r/n Your contract has been terminated./r/n 你的合同已经被终止。/r/n

word.name: terminating
word.lx: A limb terminating in such a structure./r/n 末端有这种构造的肢体/r/n

word.name: terms
word.lx: The company has to fulfill the terms of its obligation./r/n 这个公司必须履行合同条款。/r/n The terms of the contract are subject to review./r/n 合同的条款有待复查决定./r/n

word.name: tern
word.mean:
n. 三个一套
a. 三个一套的
word.lx: I want to complain in the strong tern about the delay./r/n 我要以最强烈的措词抗议这次耽误。/r/n

word.name: terra cotta
word.mean:
a. 赤褐色的
n. 赤土制成的陶器

word.name: terrace
word.mean:
n. 平台,阳台,梯田
v. 使成阶地,使成梯田
vt. 使成梯田
word.lx: In China hill farmers grow rice on terraces./r/n 在中国，山区农民在梯田上种水稻。/r/n He walked out onto the terrace./r/n 他漫步走到外面的平台上。/r/n

word.name: terrain
word.lx: The commander made a detailed study of the terrain./r/n 司令员对地形作了仔细研究。/r/n Bumped along slowly over the rocky terrain./r/n 在多石地带缓慢地颠簸前进/r/n

word.name: terrarium
word.mean: n. 陆地动物饲养所,玻璃容器

word.name: terrestrial
word.mean:
n. 地球上的人
a. 地球的,地上的
word.lx: Although they can swim, the polar bears are terrestrial animals./r/n 北极熊虽然会游泳，但也是陆栖动物。/r/n A terrestrial globe is one that represents the earth./r/n 地球仪是表现地球的器具。/r/n

word.name: terrier
word.lx: I have a fox terrier./r/n 我养了一只猎狐狗。/r/n

word.name: terrific
word.mean: a. 极好的,非常的,极度的
word.lx: The view was terrific./r/n 景色美极了。/r/n He is driving at a terrific speed./r/n 他以极高的速度驾驶。/r/n

word.name: terrified
word.mean: a. 恐惧的, 受惊吓的
word.lx: Causing great horror; terrifying./r/n 让人恐惧的；令人毛骨悚然的/r/n It terrified me to contemplate the consequence of your action./r/n 想到你行动的后果，我就感到害怕。/r/n

word.name: terrify
word.lx: It terrified me to contemplate the consequence of your action./r/n 想到你行动的后果，我就感到害怕。/r/n Rats terrify me./r/n 老鼠使我害怕。/r/n

word.name: terrifying
word.lx: The most terrifying aspect of nuclear bombing is radiation./r/n 核弹轰炸最可怕的一面是辐射。/r/n The tidal wave formed a terrifying wall of water./r/n 海啸形成一堵骇人的水墙./r/n

word.name: territorial
word.mean:
a. 领土的,土地的,地方的
n. 地方自卫队的士兵

word.name: territory
word.mean: n. 领土,版图,领域,范围
word.lx: How much territory does he travel over?/r/n 他旅行的地方有多大？/r/n They ceded territory to a neighboring state./r/n 他们把领土割让给邻国。/r/n

word.name: terror
word.lx: I have a terror of worms./r/n 我害怕爬虫。/r/n The resistance movement started a campaign of terror against the colonial rulers./r/n 抵抗运动开展了一场反对殖民统治者的恐怖活动。/r/n

word.name: terrorism
word.mean: n. 恐怖统治,恐怖行动
word.lx: The government is determined to combat international terrorism./r/n 政府决定同国际恐怖主义作斗争。/r/n International terrorism is not just a recent phenomenon./r/n 国际恐怖主义并不是近年才有的现象。/r/n

word.name: terry
word.lx: Terry has been going out with Sharon for six weeks./r/n 特里和沙伦相恋有六个星期了。/r/n Terry made it with Sharon on the back seat of his car./r/n 特里在他的汽车後排座位上和沙伦发生关系了./r/n

word.name: terse
word.lx: A terse, witty, instructive saying; a maxim./r/n 格言，箴言，警句简洁、机智、有教导性的话；警句/r/n

word.name: tertiary
word.mean:
a. 第三的,第三位的,第三世纪的
n. 臂翼,第三重音,第三会员

word.name: tessellation
word.mean: n. 镶嵌装饰,棋盘形布置,镶嵌式铺装

word.name: test
word.mean:
n. 测试,试验
v. 测试,试验,接受测验
word.lx: The new aircraft is undergoing safety tests./r/n 这种新飞机正在接受安全性能检验。/r/n Listening to his continuous stream of empty chatter really tested my patience./r/n 听他那没完没了的连篇空话对我的耐心真是一大考验。/r/n

word.name: test paper
word.lx: He is answering the test paper busily./r/n 他正忙着答考试卷。/r/n He erased pencil marks form the test paper and handed to the teacher./r/n 他擦去试卷上的铅笔笔迹然后递给了老师。/r/n

word.name: test tube
word.lx: He held the test tube in his hand thoughtfully./r/n 他沉思地把试管拿在手里。/r/n He demonstrated the principles with chemicals and test tubes./r/n 他借助化学药品和试管讲解了这些原理。/r/n

word.name: testator
word.lx: One that makes a will; a testator./r/n 遗赠人，立遗嘱者设立遗嘱的人；立遗嘱者/r/n A will needs the signature of the testator and two witness./r/n 一份遗嘱需要立遗嘱人和两个证人的签字。/r/n

word.name: testify
word.lx: All kinds of human experience testify to the close link between love and fear./r/n 人类的种种经验都证明了爱与怕之间的紧密联系。/r/n He agreed to testify on behalf of the accused man./r/n 他同意为被告作证。/r/n

word.name: testimony
word.lx: Several men were called for testimony./r/n 好几个人被传来作证。/r/n The witness is giving false testimony./r/n 那个证人在作伪证。/r/n

word.name: testing
word.mean:
n. 测试
a. 吃力的,试验的
vbl. 尝试,测验
word.lx: We are testing the efficacy of a new drug./r/n 我们正在测试新药的功效。/r/n Imitation or representation, as of a potential situation or in experimental testing./r/n 模拟模仿或演习可能发生的情况或在试验性的测试中进行模仿和演习/r/n

word.name: testosterone
word.mean: n. 男性荷尔蒙的一种

word.name: tetanus
word.lx: German physiologist. He won a1901 Nobel Prize for work on serum immunization against diphtheria and tetanus./r/n 贝林，埃米尔·冯1854－1917德国生理学家，因其在抗白喉与破伤风血清免疫方面的工作获1901年诺贝尔奖/r/n

word.name: tether
word.mean:
n. 系绳,系链,界限
v. 练栓,拘束
word.lx: He tethered his horse to a tree./r/n 他用绳子把马拴在树上。/r/n The animals were fastened by tether./r/n 那群牲畜被绳子拴着。/r/n

word.name: tetrahydrocannabinol
word.mean: n. [化]四氢大麻醇,四氢大麻酚(大麻树脂的主要成分,麻醉用)

word.name: Texas
word.mean: n. 德克萨斯州,(美国州名)

word.name: textbook
word.lx: Our textbook is very well illustrated./r/n 我们的课本插图丰富。/r/n This is the standard textbook on the subject./r/n 这是这一科的权威性课本./r/n

word.name: textile
word.mean:
a. 纺织的
n. 纺织品
word.lx: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton./r/n 他们的主要出口货物是纺织品，特别是丝绸和棉布。/r/n I got a job in a textile factory./r/n 我在一家纺织厂找到一份工作。/r/n

word.name: textual
word.lx: Textual analysis identified the author as Shakespeare./r/n 对原文的分析研究鉴定出作者是莎士比亚./r/n Mail permits network users to send textual messages to each other./r/n 电子邮件允许网络用户彼此传送文本消息。/r/n

word.name: texture
word.lx: This kind of cloth has a close texture./r/n 这种布质地很紧密。/r/n The cake has a nice light texture./r/n 这蛋糕松软可口。/r/n

word.name: Thai
word.lx: It is Thais the whore who gave this answer to her lover when he asked: Am I very worthy of your thanks?Very, nay, incredibly so! "/r/n 她便是妓女塞绮斯，当她的情人间她“你十分感谢我吗？”的时候，她回答说：“哎呀，感谢极了。”/r/n"

word.name: Thailand
word.lx: My friend took a trip to Thailand./r/n 我的朋友去泰国旅行了一次。/r/n Thailand is on the west of Laos./r/n 泰国在老挝的西面。/r/n

word.name: Thames
word.lx: The Thames rises in the Cotswold Hills./r/n 泰晤士河发源於科茨沃尔德丘陵./r/n The river Thames is spanned by many bridges./r/n 泰晤士河上有很多桥./r/n

word.name: than
word.mean:
conj. 比
prep. 比(用于两者之间的比较)
word.lx: He has no friend other than you./r/n 他除你之外就没有别的朋友了。/r/n There are more than 5,000 adjectives in that dictionary./r/n 那本词典中有5000多个形容词。/r/n

word.name: thankfulness
word.lx: Send you our everlasting feeling of gratefulness and thankfulness on this special day./r/n 在这特别的日子谨向您致以我们永恒的感激之情。/r/n At that moment my heart is full of joy and thankfulness./r/n 此时，我的心充满了欢乐与感激。/r/n

word.name: thanks
word.mean:
int. 谢谢
n. 谢谢(只用复数)
word.lx: Thanks to the bad weather, the match had been cancelled./r/n 多亏这个倒霉天气，挺好的比赛取消了。/r/n Thanks for the warning./r/n 谢谢你的提醒。/r/n

word.name: Thanksgiving
word.lx: We invite her to have Thanksgiving dinner with us./r/n 我们邀请她和我们一起吃感恩节晚餐。/r/n Thanksgiving is a movable holiday./r/n 感恩节的日期每年不同。/r/n

word.name: Thanksgiving Day
word.mean: n. 感恩节(美国是11月的第四个星期四,加拿大是10月的第二个星期一)

word.name: that
word.mean:
pron. 那
a. pron. 那,那个
conj. 引导宾语从句
word.lx: I reached the gate that opened onto the lake./r/n 我走到临湖而开的那扇门前。/r/n That pie tastes good./r/n 那个馅饼味道不错。/r/n

word.name: thatch
word.mean:
n. 盖屋顶的材料,用草盖的屋顶,浓密的头发
v. 茸

word.name: thaw
word.mean:
n. 融雪
v. 使融解,暖和
word.lx: Just give me a minute to thaw out in front of the fire, then we can talk./r/n 先让我烤烤火暖和一下，然后我们开始谈话。/r/n The ground has thawed out./r/n 地上的冰雪已经融化了。/r/n

word.name: the
word.mean:
ad. [用于比较级,最高级前]
art. 这(那),这(那)些
word.lx: The more he has, the more he wants./r/n 他得到越多，想要的也越多。/r/n Turn to the left and you will find the post./r/n 向左转，你会找到邮局的。/r/n

word.name: theater
word.lx: Do you enjoy the theater?/r/n 你喜欢看戏吗？/r/n She is been in the theater all her life./r/n 她一辈子搞戏剧。/r/n

word.name: theatre
word.lx: She is been in the theatre all her life./r/n 她一辈子搞戏剧。/r/n There is a ban on smoking in the theatre./r/n 这剧院内禁止吸烟。/r/n

word.name: theatrical
word.lx: She works in a theatrical company./r/n 她在剧团工作。/r/n The expert is writing a theatrical review./r/n 专家正在写戏剧评论。/r/n

word.name: theatricals
word.lx: His success in amateur theatricals led him on to think he could tread the boards for a living./r/n 他业余演戏很成功，他因此觉得自己可以以演戏为生。/r/n The expert is writing a theatrical review./r/n 专家正在写戏剧评论。/r/n

word.name: thee
word.lx: The lord anointed thee King of Israel./r/n (圣经)耶和华膏你作以色列的王。/r/n And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt./r/n 法老对约瑟夫说，我已任命你为全埃及的统治者。/r/n

word.name: theft
word.lx: The building has been insured against fire and theft./r/n 这座大楼保了火险和失窃险。/r/n The defendant is accused of theft./r/n 被告被控偷窃。/r/n

word.name: their
word.mean:
a. 他们的,它们的
pron. 他(她,它)们的
word.lx: They washed their faces./r/n 他们洗了脸。/r/n We have no idea how the birds find their way./r/n 我们不知道这些鸟如何找到它们的路。/r/n

word.name: theirs
word.lx: It was his fault, not theirs./r/n 这是他的过错，不是他们的。/r/n Theirs are blue./r/n 他们的是蓝色的。/r/n

word.name: them
word.lx: He offered them a new contract./r/n 他向他们提出一份新合同。/r/n This comedy has had them rolling in the aisles for two weeks./r/n 这出喜剧让观众们连续两个星期乐得前仰后合。/r/n

word.name: thematic
word.mean: a. 题目的,主题的,主旋律的

word.name: themselves
word.lx: They finished the work by themselves./r/n 他们自己完成了这项工作。/r/n The emancipation of women depends on themselves./r/n 妇女的解放依靠她们自己。/r/n

word.name: then
word.mean:
ad. 那么
当时，然后，于是
word.lx: We lived in the country then./r/n 我们那时住在乡下。/r/n He took his hat and then left./r/n 他拿起帽子，随即离开了。/r/n

word.name: thence
word.lx: He hitched south towards Italy, and thence into France./r/n 他搭乘便车往南去意大利，然后从那里进入法国。/r/n They travelled by rail to the coast and thence by boat to America./r/n 他们乘火车到海岸, 再从那里乘船去美国./r/n

word.name: theocracy
word.mean: n. 神权政体,神政,神治国

word.name: theological
word.lx: He is studying in the theological college./r/n 他在那所神学院学习。/r/n They are having a theological argument./r/n 他们正争论神学上的问题。/r/n

word.name: theology
word.lx: He believes in theology./r/n 他信仰宗教。/r/n In the Middle Ages, philosophy and theology were inextricable./r/n 在中世纪, 哲学与神学是不分的./r/n

word.name: theoretically
word.lx: Frankly speaking, Andy is more of an angler theoretically than practically./r/n 老实说，安迪是个理论胜於实际的垂钓者。/r/n

word.name: theorize
word.mean: vt. 推理(建立理论,理论化)

word.name: theory
word.lx: It is so in theory./r/n 理论上是如此。/r/n Do you agree to the wave theory of light?/r/n 你同意光的波动理论吗？/r/n

word.name: therapist
word.lx: Launders,27, said she has spent most of the yearlike a basket case" despite seeing a therapist once a week./r/n 27岁的朗黛丝说，尽管她每周去理疗一次，她今年过的大半日子“像个四肢不全的废人。”/r/n"

word.name: therapy
word.lx: She was in therapy./r/n 她正在接受治疗。/r/n The local or general use of low temperatures in medical therapy./r/n 冷疗法一种在医疗中局部或全部使用低温的方法/r/n

word.name: there
word.lx: There are numerous items to choose from./r/n 有许许多多可选择的项目。/r/n Here and there in the garden little flowers had grown up./r/n 花园里各处开着小黄花。/r/n

word.name: thereby
word.lx: Thereby hangs a tale./r/n 其中必有文章。/r/n He became a citizen, thereby gaining the right to vote./r/n 他成为公民，并因此获得了选举权。/r/n

word.name: therefor
word.lx: Your information is inaccurate and your conclusion is therefore wrong./r/n 你的信息不准确，所以你的结论是错误的。/r/n We have a growing population and therefore we need more food./r/n 我们的人口在增长，因此我们需要更多的食物。/r/n

word.name: therefore
word.lx: Your information is inaccurate and your conclusion is therefore wrong./r/n 你的信息不准确，所以你的结论是错误的。/r/n We have a growing population and therefore we need more food./r/n 我们的人口在增长，因此我们需要更多的食物。/r/n

word.name: therefrom
word.lx: Failing this, they will be held responsible for all the consequences arising therefrom./r/n 要是做不到这一点，他们必须对由此产生的后果负责。/r/n Most Chinese think he will be therefrom unwelcome./r/n 大多数中国人认为他将从此不受欢迎。/r/n

word.name: therein
word.mean: ad. 在其中,在那里,在那一点上
word.lx: He is not a snob and therein lay his downfall./r/n 他不是个势利小人，而他失败的原因正在于此。/r/n Therein lies the crux of the matter./r/n 问题的关键就在那里./r/n

word.name: thereupon
word.mean:
ad. 因此,于是
conj. 因此,随即
word.lx: He thereupon asked her to marry him./r/n 他随即向她求婚。/r/n Russia thereupon declared war upon Turkey./r/n 俄国于是对土耳其宣战。/r/n

word.name: thermal
word.mean:
a. 热的,热量的
n. 上升的热气流

word.name: thermometer
word.lx: The thermometer reads 27 degrees./r/n 温度计的读数是27度。/r/n The readings on my thermometer last month were well above the average./r/n 我的温度计上个月的读数远远超过平均温度。/r/n

word.name: thermos
word.lx: She poured hot water from the thermos./r/n 她从热水瓶倒出热水。/r/n

word.name: thermoset
word.mean:
a. 热固性的(热凝成形的,加热成型后即硬化的)
n. 热凝(热固性,热变定法)

word.name: thermostat
word.lx: The thermostat is based on the fact that different metals have different coefficients of expansion./r/n 恒温器是以不同的金属有不同的膨胀系数这一事实为根据的。/r/n A high-temperature thermostat./r/n 高温恒温度，高温调节器/r/n

word.name: thesaurus
word.mean: n. 辞典,宝库,知识宝库
word.lx: A thesaurus is something like a dictionary./r/n 类语词典与普通词典相仿./r/n

word.name: these
word.lx: We have been working hard these days./r/n 这些天来，我们一直在努力工作。/r/n The meeting will deal with these problems./r/n 本次会议将就这些问题作出处理。/r/n

word.name: thesis
word.lx: Developed her thesis in a series of articles./r/n 用一系列文章逐渐阐明她的论文/r/n Key decisions; the key element of the thesis./r/n 意义重大的结论；论文的中心成分/r/n

word.name: thespian
word.mean:
a. 悲剧的,戏剧的,悲剧性的
n. 演员,悲剧演员

word.name: they
word.lx: I have a dog and a cat, but they fight all the time./r/n 我养了一只猫和一只狗，但它们老是打架。/r/n They are going to move to a new house next week./r/n 下星期他们将迁入新居。/r/n

word.name: thick
word.mean:
a. 厚的
ad. 厚,浓,密
word.lx: He put on a thick sweater since it was cold in the morning./r/n 早晨很冷，他穿上了一件厚毛衣。/r/n Last winter the snow lay thick on the ground./r/n 去年冬天，地上积雪很厚。/r/n

word.name: thicken
word.mean: v. 变浓,使...厚,变为复杂
word.lx: The plot thickens./r/n 情节复杂起来了。/r/n It is coming in foggy; we had better get home before it thickens./r/n 现在开始起雾了，我们最好赶在雾浓前回家。/r/n

word.name: thicket
word.lx: The fox hid in the thicket where the dog could not reach it./r/n 狐狸躲在猎狗抓不到它的灌木丛中。/r/n A fox dart out of the midst of the thicket./r/n 一只狐狸从灌木丛中窜了出来。/r/n

word.name: thickly
word.lx: Spread the bread thickly with butter./r/n 把面包抹上厚厚的黄油吧。/r/n The trees branch thickly over the path./r/n 此树生枝极多，遮挡小路。/r/n

word.name: thickness
word.mean: n. 厚度,一层,含混不清
word.lx: The beam has a thickness of 3 inches./r/n 这根梁厚3英寸。/r/n As a result, nacre thickness is sometimes just a cosmetic layer that can wear thin over time./r/n 所以真珠质的厚度就像脸上化妆品，不久就会磨薄了。/r/n

word.name: thief
word.lx: The thief was caught red-handed./r/n 小偷被当场抓住了。/r/n The thief was confined in a prison./r/n 窃贼被关押在监狱里。/r/n

word.name: thieves
word.lx: The police tracked the thieves to their den./r/n 警察跟踪小偷，直到他们的老窝。/r/n The police are on the scent of the thieves./r/n 警察发现了小偷的线索。/r/n

word.name: thigh
word.lx: I walked the last six miles in water up to my thighs./r/n 我在深及大腿的水中走完了最后6英里。/r/n The pain runs from the small of my back right down my left thigh, " he told the doctor./r/n 他告诉医生说："从后腰一直到左大腿都疼得很。"/r/n"

word.name: thimble
word.mean: n. 顶针,嵌环,套管,[计]转筒
word.lx: She put a thimble over the finger when sewing./r/n 缝纫时，她在手上戴一枚顶针。/r/n

word.name: thing
word.lx: Be calm and take things as they come./r/n 冷静点，既来之则安之吧。/r/n He is only interested in things and not people./r/n 他只对物而不对人感兴趣。/r/n

word.name: thinker
word.lx: He is a bold thinker, with lots of original ideas./r/n 他是个敢于思考的人，富有创新观点。/r/n That famous progressive thinker was asked to deliver a speech at the meeting./r/n 那位著名的进步思想家被邀请在会议上发表演讲。/r/n

word.name: thinking
word.mean:
n. 思考,思想
a. 思考的,有理性的
vbl. 想,思考
word.lx: What are you thinking about?/r/n 你在想什么?/r/n Thinking correctly is important./r/n 思考正确是重要的。/r/n

word.name: thinly
word.lx: Spread the butter thinly./r/n 薄薄涂一层黄油。/r/n A fine or thinly spun thread, fiber, or wire./r/n 细丝细小或薄的丝线、纤维或电线/r/n

word.name: third
word.mean:
a. 第三(的)
n. 三分之一
num. 第三
word.lx: He will come to see you on the third of April./r/n 他将于四月三日来看你。/r/n With this performance, she has notched up her third championship title./r/n 她因这一成绩而获得第三个冠军称号。/r/n

word.name: thirst
word.mean:
v. 渴望,渴求
vi. (for)渴望,渴求
vt.&n. 渴,渴望
word.lx: I satisfied my thirst with a glass of water./r/n 我喝了一杯水解渴。/r/n Many boys have a thirst for adventure./r/n 许多男孩都渴望冒险。/r/n

word.name: thirsty
word.lx: The travellers in the desert felt thirsty./r/n 沙漠中的旅行者感到口干舌燥。/r/n He was thirsty for power./r/n 他渴望拥有权力。/r/n

word.name: thirtieth
word.lx: Please hand in your paper before June thirtieth./r/n 请在六月三十日前交论文。/r/n

word.name: this
word.lx: Please look at this box here./r/n 请看这里的这个盒子。/r/n We have had two world wars in this century./r/n 本世纪我们已经经历了两次世界大战。/r/n

word.name: thistle
word.lx: The man made up his mind to grasp the thistle firmly./r/n 这个人痛下决心，毅然处理困难局面。/r/n The thistle is the emblem of Scotland./r/n 蓟是苏格兰的标志./r/n

word.name: thither
word.mean:
a. 对岸的,那边的
ad. 到那处,向那方
word.lx: Butterflies flit hither and thither./r/n 蝴蝶到处飞来飞去。/r/n She ran hither and thither in the orchard./r/n 她在果园里到处跑。/r/n

word.name: Thomas
word.mean: n. 男子名,耶稣十二门徒之一
word.lx: Thomas Atkins, sometime vicar of this parish/r/n 托马斯·阿特金斯, 本牧区从前的牧师./r/n Thomas, commonly known as Tom./r/n 托马斯, 通常称为汤姆./r/n

word.name: Thompson
word.lx: Thompson turned in a superb performance to win the decathlon./r/n 汤普森在十项全能比赛中表现十分出色./r/n Goodbye, Mrs. Thompson."/r/n ＂再见，汤普森太太。＂/r/n"

word.name: thong
word.mean:
v. 装皮带,用皮带打
n. 皮带,皮条
word.lx: He fastened the dog to the post with a thong./r/n 他用一根皮带把狗拴到柱子上。/r/n A thong or whip of hide or leather./r/n 皮带，皮鞭皮或皮革制成的皮带或鞭子/r/n

word.name: thorn
word.lx: His sister is a thorn in his flesh./r/n 他的妹妹使他伤透脑筋。/r/n He stepped on a sharp thorn./r/n 他踩到一根尖刺。/r/n

word.name: thoroughbred
word.mean: n.&a. 优良种(动物,尤指马的)

word.name: those
word.lx: Those trees have very beautiful white bark./r/n 那些树长着非常漂亮的白色树皮。/r/n Those schoolboys like to play pranks on their teachers./r/n 那些小学生们喜欢作弄他们的老师。/r/n

word.name: thou
word.lx: Whither goest thou?/r/n 汝欲何往?/r/n But wilt thou accept not the worship the heart lifts above./r/n 难道你竟然会摈弃我呈上的虔诚崇拜。/r/n

word.name: thoughtful
word.lx: It was thoughtful of you to warn me of your arrival./r/n 你来之前先通知我，真是考虑得很周到。/r/n You are very thoughtful./r/n 您想得真周到。/r/n

word.name: thoughtfully
word.mean: ad. 考虑周到的(思索的)
word.lx: She regarded him thoughtfully./r/n 她若有所思地看着他。/r/n He drew thoughtfully on his pipe./r/n 他抽著烟斗，若有所思。/r/n

word.name: thoughtfulness
word.lx: Suggestive or expressive of melancholy thoughtfulness./r/n 忧心忡忡的，郁郁寡欢的让人联想起或表达忧郁的沉思的/r/n

word.name: thousandfold
word.mean:
a. 千倍的
ad. 千倍地,成千倍

word.name: thousands
word.lx: Men have been making music for thousands of years./r/n 人类创作音乐已有数千年历史。/r/n Thousands died in the disaster./r/n 数千人死於这场灾祸./r/n

word.name: thrall
word.lx: Her beauty held him in thrall./r/n 她的美貌征服了他。/r/n

word.name: threadbare
word.lx: Pride may lurk under a threadbare cloak./r/n 骄傲可能会潜藏在穿旧的斗篷下。/r/n

word.name: threat
word.mean: n. 威胁,恐吓,凶兆,征兆
word.lx: The threat of an economic depression hangs over the world./r/n 经济衰退的威胁笼罩着世界。/r/n There was a threat of typhoon./r/n 有刮台风的征兆。/r/n

word.name: threaten
word.mean:
vi. 构成威胁
vt. 威胁
word.lx: The black clouds threatened rain./r/n 乌云密布预示着将要下雨。/r/n While danger threatens we must all be on guard./r/n 危险正逼近，我们必须保持警惕。/r/n

word.name: threatening
word.lx: They are threatening to impose a blockade on the country./r/n 他们威胁说要对该国实行封锁。/r/n The terrorists are threatening to blow up the hijacked airliner./r/n 恐怖分子扬言要炸毁劫持的客机。/r/n

word.name: three
word.mean:
num. 三
pron.&a. 三(个,只...)
word.lx: He is only a child of three./r/n 他只是一个三岁的孩子。/r/n Three of the chickens hatched today./r/n 今天有三只小鸡出壳。/r/n

word.name: three-dimensional
word.mean: a. 三维的,三度的,立体的

word.name: thresh
word.mean:
v. 打(庄稼)
vt. 打谷
word.lx: They are separating the grains from wheat with a threshing machine./r/n 他们正在用打谷机给小麦脱粒。/r/n If we put our heads together we can probably thresh out a workable scheme./r/n 如果我们集思广益，也许能琢磨出一个切实可行的方案。/r/n

word.name: threshold
word.mean: n. 极限,门槛,入口,开端
word.lx: The treaty will be the threshold of lasting peace./r/n 这个条约将成为持久和平的开端。/r/n The cabin has a flat stone for a threshold./r/n 这间小屋用一条扁平的石头做门槛。/r/n

word.name: threw
word.lx: His motion threw the meeting into an uproar./r/n 他的建议在会上引起了一片吵嚷。/r/n I threw a life buoy to him when I saw his struggling./r/n 看到他在挣扎，我给他扔了一个救生圈过去。/r/n

word.name: thrice
word.lx: My husband earns thrice the amount I earn./r/n 我丈夫挣的钱是我的三倍。/r/n He flung off his opponent thrice./r/n 他把对手摔倒三次。/r/n

word.name: thrift
word.mean:
a. 节约,节俭
n. 节俭,节约
word.lx: Thrift is the basement of richness./r/n 节约是富裕的基础。/r/n

word.name: thrifty
word.lx: Her mother is a thrifty housewife./r/n 她妈妈是一个节俭的主妇。/r/n Only very thrifty children manage to fill up a money-box./r/n 只有非常节俭的儿童才会设法填满一个储蓄罐。/r/n

word.name: thrilling
word.mean: a. 毛骨悚然的,令人兴奋的
word.lx: It was a real thrill to meet the Queen./r/n 能见到女王的确是令人兴奋的事./r/n The film works up to a thrilling climax./r/n 这电影逐渐发展到令人惊悚的高潮/r/n

word.name: thrive
word.lx: Few plants or animals thrive in the desert./r/n 很少植物或动物能在沙漠中很好地生长。/r/n A business cannot thrive without good management./r/n 没有良好的经营管理，事业就不会兴旺发达。/r/n

word.name: thriving
word.lx: Growing or thriving in water./r/n 水生（植物）的水中生长或繁殖的/r/n Every trade is thriving./r/n 各行各业都欣欣向荣。/r/n

word.name: throb
word.mean:
n. 悸动,脉搏
v. 悸动
word.lx: His head throbbed with pain./r/n 他的头一阵阵地痛。/r/n Her heart was throbbing with excitement./r/n 她兴奋得心直跳。/r/n

word.name: throbbing
word.lx: Her heart was throbbing with excitement./r/n 她兴奋得心直跳。/r/n His heart was throbbing away, we had to send him to the hospital./r/n 他的心一阵阵痛，我们不得不把他送到医院。/r/n

word.name: throne
word.lx: He was only eight when he ascended the throne./r/n 他登上王位时才八岁。/r/n Who is first in succession to the throne?/r/n 谁是王位的第一继承人?/r/n

word.name: throng
word.mean:
n. 群众,众多
a. 拥挤的,忙的
v. 群集,挤入,挤满
word.lx: A patient throng was waiting in silence./r/n 一大群人耐心地静候着。/r/n Passengers thronged the station waiting for their trains./r/n 乘客们拥挤在火车站上等候乘车。/r/n

word.name: throttle
word.mean:
n. 节流阀,节气阀,喉咙
v. 扼喉咙,使窒息,压

word.name: through
word.mean:
ad. 穿越,完全
prep. 经过,穿过,凭借
word.lx: The river flows through the city from east to west./r/n 这条河从东到西贯穿这座城市。/r/n He walked home in the rain and was wet through./r/n 他冒雨步行回家，淋得浑身湿透。/r/n

word.name: throughout
word.mean:
ad. 到处,自始至终
prep. 遍及,贯穿
word.lx: The disease spread throughout the country./r/n 这种疾病蔓延全国。/r/n It snowed throughout the night./r/n 雪整整下了一夜。/r/n

word.name: throw
word.mean:
n. 投,掷,抛
v. 丢,掷,抛
word.lx: Many women throw all of their energies into a career./r/n 许多妇女把她们的全部精力投入到职业中。/r/n He threw the stone in the air./r/n 他把石头抛向空中。/r/n

word.name: throwaway
word.mean: a. 用后即扔的,浪费的

word.name: thrown
